reviews.text: Such a cute neighborhood natural market. They have an awesome breakfast and lunch menu. Lots of grocery options, mostly locally sourced - an extra bonus. Definitely stop by!

I knew I would be a returning customer the moment I stepped inside! There is a nice variety of refrigerated and dry goods as well as plants! I did not try anything from their food menu this time (Next time for sure - I did say I would be a returning customer) as I just had coffee from the Cornell Brothers Coffee located inside the market (soon to be followed by a juice bar as well I believe). There was great seating and the girl at the counter was so nice - she made my day with her sweet comment to me and my friend.

Try the market sandwich as soon as you can, it's life changing!! My husband and I order often and each time I try to work out all the layers of salt and heat and yum. They offer gluten free bread and coffee is sooo good. 

Flowers! If you're looking to grab a little extra love for a friend or family member, definitely pick up a bouquet of their fresh cut flowers (when available). I recently gifted a bouquet to my mother in law and we both marveled over the variety of sophisticate and whimsy blooms.

This is seriously the best place around-- I just went for the first time and was impressed not just with the unpretentious, wholesome environment full of local farms' products and plants, but also with the owner and the food. I had the chipotle turkey avocado melt (divine) and the tomato soup (smoky and the perfect compliment-- possibly the best tomato soup I've had). It was the PERFECT healthy, satisfying comfort food. It reminds me of herban market but I actually like the food better (and it's cheaper). I don't rave super often on these sites, but this place deserves local support and attention. Totally recommend.

Update: it only gets better

Had heard about this place, but just tried finally abt a month ago for lunch. Really good and clean. Cute gift shop of local stuff, both food and non food related. Also picked up some GF pastries to take home to my GF daughter. (I was really excited to see they had GF options avail for take home bakery). Will def be back.

This is seriously the best place around-- I just went for the first time and was impressed not just with the unpretentious, wholesome environment full of local farms' products and plants, but also with the owner and the food. I had the chipotle turkey avocado melt (divine) and the tomato soup (smoky and the perfect compliment-- possibly the best tomato soup I've had). It was the PERFECT healthy, satisfying comfort food. It reminds me of herban market but I actually like the food better (and it's cheaper). I don't rave super often on these sites, but this place deserves local support and attention. Totally recommend.
I just tried their sandwiches and they are delicious.  Had the club sandwich and can't beat it.  Lots of good stuff with southern hospitality!  Fresh flowers are locally grown and super nice.

Love this store! I went in for the first time today WITH my three children ages three, two, and five month. The ladies working there were kind and welcoming despite the potential little tornadoes that I brought in with me! Haha. Anyway, we bought some beef bone broth, peppermint handmade soap, local salad greens, 2 chocolate muffins, and their soup and sandwich lunch special which was a ham and cheese grilled cheese and butternut squash soup. My 3 year old said she really loved the lunch, and I loved it too. It tasted homemade and fresh. I will definitely be back again! It gave me the farmer's market feeling, and I am so excited about their convenient location. Can't wait to see what their lunch is tomorrow! Thanks, Oh My Chives!

Oh My Chives is a little natural market in Nolensville with food, a juice bar and a coffee shop. I really like the coffee shop and always have great service there. The last several times I've gone to Oh My Chives for items they've listed on Facebook, they're always sold out. I called this week for a question about a particular dog food they have and had the worst customer service, it was such a turnoff.

Amazing and healthy biscuits on Friday and Saturday morning! Decent selection of organic food, drink, and products. Good lunch sandwiches too and they had a local entertainer playing music on a sat morn, overall good place. Only complaint I had was that very few items are priced in the store which is sort of frustrating and you don't buy anything unless you are just doing to try it or know you love it!
We stopped in while on vacation & ordered the veggie sandwich! It was so good & devoured it before I could get a picture!

I love this little store. It feels like home.

Oh My Chives sells most of the staples one might need including organic home items (laundry detergent, cleaning supplies), personal care items, milk, meat, salads, fresh bread, local flowers, produce, etc., but they also have grab and go items. My favorite is the daily lunch sandwich.

Angela posts her daily sandwich/soup combo on Facebook/Insta and serves it until 2pm. She also makes smoothies and hot drinks which I've not tried, but the sandwiches are insane. Thus far, I've tried the turkey with cranberry sauce and the turkey and avocado. Both were amazing! 

I highly recommend running by OMCs to pick up speciality and healthy grocery items and grabbing a sandwich while you're at it. Bonus: the bakery items are also pretty tasty and she often has gluten free and vegan options.

This was a neat little spot for healthier breakfast. It has 3 separate businesses inside. A market that also serves food, a coffee joint, and a juice bar. I loved that jalapeño bagel with cream cheese and that breakfast sandwich was melt in your mouth delicious

Adorable little market on the southern tail of Nolensville Road. Stopped here to grab a sandwich for lunch and ended up picking up lots of fun treats - a strawberry shortcake vegan donut, a peach vegan donut, a cortado from Cornell Brothers coffee, and a key lime ice cream sandwich from nightingale. There is a counter to order food, a small market area, an espresso bar (Cornell Brothers) and now a juice/smoothie bar (Lokales). My veggie sandwich was made fresh to order and was reasonably priced and delicious (the honey drizzle was the perfect addition to the classic veggie sandwich) and the market has some unique/high-quality items like spices from SpiceWalla (hooray for not having to pay for shipping of spices I already love!) There is indoor seating, if you want to eat here. A great little find for meeting up with a friend for coffee/juice/breakfast/lunch!

I'm in LVE..... Warm & Cozy atmosphere, Good Vibes!! 
There is a Juice Bar and Coffee Bar, I fell in love and crave it daily is their Chocolate Cake... Oh My God Good and their sandwiches melts. 
I surprised my friend I was visiting from Vegas her daughter owns the place, who I remember as a. Hold and now they are touching the world through their tasty food!! 
Also check out their natural candles, they are loved too!! You will love this place, I'm guaranteed! Enjoy

Love this place, they have great and wholesome food for both breakfast and lunch. 

They are best known as a type of Whole Foods market, but they also make sandwiches, bagels, salads, and some other yummy munchies.

They share space with a coffee bar and  a third tenant, a Juice bar. Check them out

I love this place! Such a great neighborhood feel- I stop here to pick up natural snacks for myself and my kids quite often. I also frequently get lunch here. The turkey chipotle sandwich is my favorite- but I love everything I've tried! Also try the coffee- it will not disappoint!

TACO BELL eat there ~   I LOVE TACO BELL!!!  let me say the 5 stars are for the food.  I LOVE TACO BELL!!!  I am a huge fan of the new Dorito taco.  I hope they continue to have this on their menu!!!  Their employees are always helpful
I love the fact that they offer Pepsi products!!!

Eating there is my favorite because,,,they always get the order right.

They however do not get 5 starts when it comes to getting the order right for me the drive thru customer.  If I go there 10 times they get the order right 6 or 7 times.

I normally don't review fast food places, but I just really didn't care for this location. 

The food was okay, but the service was incredibly slow. I understand you being slow if you're busy. If you have a total of two groups of dine-in customers (six total, four with food) and sporadic drive-thru guests (two in twenty minutes), I really don't understand what your ~eight employees are doing that makes them look so busy/prevents them from helping those guests efficiently. 

Also, completely unrelated, the seating here is weird. It's not as updated or something as most Taco Bells.

Pros: being a Taco Bell
Neutral: heat (very warm for a cold day, almost too much)
Cons: service, layout

I usually go through the drive-thru here, but ate inside recently. The employee, I think her name was Diane, was beyond nice. She was really friendly and she even upgraded my drink for free. I know it may seem like a small thing but it put a nice spin on my day!  As far as the food, it's always pretty speedy here, the only times they get my order wrong is during breakfast hours...other than that, I really like this location.

For me, Taco Bell is either a hit or a miss. 
When you go into their restaurant, expect ok to excellent service, depending on the staff and management inside the restaurant. However, go through the drive thru, expect mediocre to crappy customer service. 
Sometimes their drive thru is jam packed with cars, and the line hardly ever moves. That is particularly annoying, since my experience in a fast food environment dictates that each customer should be served in 45 seconds or less. 
I do enjoy having their free Wi-Fi in the restaurant and access to their unlimited soda fountain to feed my diet mountain dew addiction, but this restaurant doesn't warrant a 5 star. If they can get their drive thru working more smoothly, maybe my reviews will be more stellar.
Probably the best taco bell in the area. They've never messed up an order and everything seems to be made the same way every time you order it.

So, yes before i get hate mail about reviewing fast foods i want to prefice this by saying i am only doing this to tell you of my craptastic day.

So, imagine that i was hungry for lunch having been running around getting things for easter and wanted something quick. So i went there and took the food home. This is where things do downhill... quickly.

Not more then 45 minutes later started my descent into hell. Apparently, im going to say it was either the cheese double beef burrito or the chicken quesadillas that were apparently bad. So, now about 8 hours later i am trying to drag myself away from my bed to write this review.


Me thinks from now on, i will take my business elsewhere and avoid this place like the plague.

I've been to this location many times for a quick lunch or late night after the game. 

Service is always very slow going through the drive thru window. 
It also seems like this Taco Bell cannot make anything consistently. It usually order the same thing every time, and it's ALWAYS different in terms of quality when I open my food up. 

Most of the time Taco Bell is hit or miss and more often this one misses which leaves you regretting your decision after the fact.

Slowest Taco Bell you will ever go through. Time and time again it's always the same speed. Just when you think you've given it enough time to get better, you sit in line again for a half hour and remember why you don't come here. Btw I'm writing this in line because I'm still waiting and there was only 5 people in line.... hopefully I will someday reach the window. Pray for me.

Slowest Taco Bell ever. They also have higher prices than other Taco Bells in the area. They have messed up simple orders several times, I will drive past this location to go to a different Taco Bell when my daughter asks for Taco Bell next. The workers are nice but that doesn't make up for incompetence.

um, I just went through the drive thru with my dog in the backseat, who was whining because he gets excited to see people. and the girl working told my dog he needed to shut the f up. I'm completely dumbfounded at how rude some people can be.

I just went inside to get a few tacos for my kids to take home.  The place was extremely clean and the man who took my order was very kind.  He offered me a water while I waited and although I wasn't thirsty the gesture was nice.  I wish I had caught his name but he was nice to anyone in there.  Food was also good! A+++ service!
This place takes 45 minutes to even order lol. No sense of urgency and expect $15/hr for the service....

I had my order messed up theee times and the third time there was a fucking black hair in my gordita. i'm a very light blonde. so ik it wasn't mine and it was all the way in the middle. i pulled it out of my taco like it was a string. i'm disgusted. the manager was standing in the lobby staring at the TV during a very busy rush and employees were cussing behind the counter. i will not be coming here. even though this is the closest taco bell to my house, i will drive the extra mile to go to a better one. i'm not even gonna finish my food because i've done lost my appetite.

best taco bell experience of my life. the line was a little long when we arrived, but the employees were very kind, respectful, and attentive. our items were all wrapped perfectly and not a single bean was out of place. our gatorade was superb. if you were working at this taco bell on 10/29/21 at approximately 11:00pm, give yourself a pat on the back. i love you. you spin my world right round right round baby.

Great Deli, clean and everything is organized. This place is own by a small family and they are lovely. The one thing I love the most is their hours, I can conveniently come here early morning to grab a breakfast sandwich and come here after work to get dinner. Great service and highly recommend if anyone is looking for a deli with varieties of food!

Nicest people, I haven't tasted my food yet. I'm just in awe of the friendly staff  But you'd be surprised how far a hello and have a nice day can go for people. I'll get back to you on my food. An excellent addition to the community

A nice little deli with a very big menu.  We got the mushroom cheesesteak.  It was a good little Cheesesteak especially for $7.95.  The roll was good but a little chewy.  The meat was good but needed more.  The mushrooms were plentiful but I wish they had spent more time on the grill.  A nice couple running the place.  We took it to Philadelphia Brewing company and Carole did her best Amigo Dan impersonation.  I am still curious about the sushi burrito.

In my opinion:
They really try but fell short  but on the lighter side nice people...that should be in a different career.

Great little corner store that has your basic needs. In addition to breakfast sandwiches and hoagies, they also offer a small menu of Asian foods like sushi burritos and cucumber and kani salad. The folks who run the place are also extremely nice.
Delicious chicken, delicious boba! All tasty & fresh! I love the cups they use for their milk/fruit teas & smoothies! Definitely recommend!
Loved their chicken! So happy that there's a Korean fried chicken place that opened on Marlton!!! I've gotten the honey garlic and the original!

Yum!!

My friend and I were shopping around here and got hungry for lunch. We saw Frozen Boba on the map and went to find it. We saw that it was inside of this place so we went in to check it out.

We looked at the menu and decided to get food and boba. We ordered an order of honey garlic boneless. They had wings and boneless option which was great! They also had a great assortment of sauces and some sides.

I thought it was a bit pricey at first ($11) but it was a HUGE order! Never have I been given such large nuggets or so many. Great portion size!!

Nuggets were delicious!! Chicken was perfect, skin was so amazingly crispy, and the sauce was perfect. A great portion that kept us full. I will 100% be back to this little hidden gem.

Bonus points for being combined with a boba place!!
Canceled my order after waiting for delivery for 40 minutes.  Don't know about the food, but no way to treat a customer.  Cancel in 10 minutes or make the food!!

One of my FAVOURITE Korean fried chicken chains!!!!! The wings here are SOO FLAVORFUL, SO CRISPY and SO SOFT all at the same time. 

I believe they also have a store within Ten Asian Food Hall near the mall by Kung Fu Tea. However, this one opened near my house and I was VERY excited to see that was the case. 

This specific bb.q chicken spot joined forces with the previous bubble tea shop that existed in that space. I've never tried the bubble tea, but I haven't heard great things. 

The chicken, on the other hand, IMPECCABLE. We ordered out last time and got the spicy, the honey garlic, and the original. All of them were delicious, but i'd say the spicy one was my favorite. 

The only minor issue I had was that the radishes on the side tasted really old, but again, not a huge issue. 

I will say that if in terms of pricing, they are well worth it. However, if you're expecting 50 cent papa john's wings, look elsewhere. These wings are hefty, delicious, and will fill you up fast - so they definitely are priced a bit above regular American wings.

Literally the crunchiest chicken I ever had! Came her just for the boba but my fiancé and I couldn't help but order some wings bc of the awesome smell coming out the kitchen. We ordered a small order of the honey garlic boneless wings and didn't expect the order to be so large! Highly highly recommend coming here for some tasty chicken! Definitely a 10 out of 10!

Had the hot spicy chicken. Order taker warned me it would be spicy, which is typically nonsense as spice is subjective. She was right. Great spice and hotness. May have even had a sweaty brow upon finishing. Cooked to perfection. Chicken was still juicy. Will be back.

Fried chicken, it should just be my middle name at this point in my life. Saw this spot on my way home and being hungry seemed like a no brainer. 

Lots of people were coming in for drinks, lots of choices. Since the chicken is cooked to order i got myself a white peach green tea. Delicious and refreshing. 

Wings are good but I'm a huge drumstick fan so I went with original, half order. Lots of chicken, juicy and flavorless unfortunately. Good crunch on the skin. It was actually pretty spicy too so not sure if some seasoning got mixed up together. Maybe it was an off day,  maybe I should try the wings flavored.. 

Very friendly & polite staff, quick and easy service.

Fast delivery and the food was packaged neatly. I ordered the Boneless Soy Garlic Chicken and it was delicious. The batter was thin and crispy fried to perfection. The sauce wasn't overwhelming, it coated every piece nicely and wasn't oily at all. The pickled radish was a great addition to the meal as it also cleansed the palate. I was glad that they also have Bubble Tea on the menu. Now I can order my favorite cravings in one place. I no longer need to go to Philadelphia to get Korean Fried Chicken.
Chicken was very good also the boba tea was great only thing that was a draw back was there customer service needs a little help seem to be kind of upset every time we went in there

I've been to many bb.q Chickens now that they're popping up everywhere in the Philly and Jersey area. This one was by far the worst franchised location. 

The sizing portions were weird for wings -- 9 pieces for a medium and 18 for a large. We weren't able to do 2 flavors if we ordered a large (e.g. half soy garlic and half secret spicy sauce), so the only option would be to order 2 medium orders (making it more expensive overall). 

The wings were also not as crispy as other locations. 

Although the service was nice and the space was clean, I would not return.

Ordered the boneless wings and they were outstanding.  A chunk of white meat that had a very light breading, enough to hold the sauce.  They provided 10 and my wife and I could only finish 8. The chicken was fresh, cooked to order and the boneless chicken chucks were huge. We will be returning.

This place needs more hype! The chicken is so tender with the perfect crisp on the outside. Honey garlic flavor is A+. Boba is also great -- lots of fun options on the menu. Price is worth the portion size and quality. Note: The chicken is made to order and takes ~15, so don't be in a rush!

First time here for chicken, we have come for the rolled ice cream and love it.

Tried the Gangnam style wings and loved the flavor! List it's hotness rating at one chili pepper, which was barely any spice at all. But the flavor was our favorite of everything we tried.

Also had the Secret Spicy boneless wings. We thought they were also "one" chili pepper rating, but looking again that is only for the wings. Flavor was decent, we like spicy wings and since it was more sweet than spice it didn't fit our taste.

Customer service was ok, not overly friendly but fast. Our order took just under 20 minutes to be ready for take out.

We will come back and try the "Triple" chili pepper spicy wings!
The chicken here is to die for!! It's made fresh when you order and packaged so cute. Not cheap but worth every penny!!!
Very crunchy and flavorful. Compared to ten asian hall who also serve BBQ chicken. This location has more flavors such as the gangnam style.
The chicken is amazing here! They have the best wings and they are so fresh! Highly recommend this place.

"Korean fried chicken" is actually a lesser known aspect of the Korean food scene; so I love that bb.q chicken is making it known in South Jersey.  If you know, you know.  If you don't, learn about it!

In short, Korean fried chicken is all about the sweet-heat in the sauce.  The spiciness comes from the peppers and the garlic, and the variety of sauces basically comes down to a different balance between the two.   Pro tip: make sure you have gum or mints on you (or better yet, Listerine strips...wait...do they still sell these?) because that garlic-y spice can really linger.   Otherwise, enjoy the deliciousness as long as you like.

If you don't feel like getting your hands dirty, go the sandwich route!  They are super generous with the sauce, but the crunchiness still holds up.  You can feel, taste, and even hear each bite.  The cut of chicken itself is surprisingly large for a sandwich; winner winner chicken dinner.  Order it with sweet potato fries, and then thank me later.

Another pro tip: Since everything is made to order, it could take a while sometimes.  If you can't really afford sitting and waiting, the easy workaround is to order over the phone and then pick it up when it's ready.
Best chicken in the area. Secret Spicey sauce is so flavorful!  Love, love, looove this place!!

Delicious freshly made chicken.  The boba's are good as well.  My only suggestion is that they should put the heat on for those who dine-in.  You do have to wait a bit for the chicken but that just means that the chicken is made to order.  I would rather wait for fresh food.

If you want a piece of meat, this is where it's at. The Prime Rib is a beast and for that alone I would give it 5 stars. The problem is the sides and veggies. The mashed potatoes taste like instant taters and the veggies taste like the boiled frozen kind. Good thing the Prime Rib is so big and filling. The onion petals are yummy though!

I went for the for the AYCE wings. Small bar area, rather spacious floor, and a good sized dining room on the second floor. It is a smoking bar, so the smell did hit us pretty hard in the beginning. We were in on a Monday night, so it was pretty slow, but service was not too slow and we were waited on pretty quickly.

We each got an order of wings, and were told that we could continue to order more until we were full. We got the honey hot and the mild buffalo wings, and waited about 10-15 minutes for the order to come out.

Now, I've had my fair share of wings around area, so it definitely came as a surprise when the wings from this small local bar were unbelievably tasty. The honey hot was glazed in an amazing layer of sweet honey with a hint of hot sauce underneath, and the mild buffalo had this touch of buttery taste and did not reek of vinegar or hit so hard that you have to take a step back before the next bite. We got 2 or 3 more orders of wings, and were pretty satisfied with our order, from the delicious, plump, and crispy wings to the crunchy celery and creamy blue cheese.

For the two of us, it came out to be about $30, which was not a bad deal at all. 

Our waitress was a very sweet woman that made sure that we had everything we needed and was very attentive. The atmosphere was different from what I've experienced before, but with people singing in the background and just enjoying conversations with friends, I could not have asked for anywhere better to enjoy some pub wings.

It's a local pub. I got what a local pub could offer, and could not ask for more. I'm sold!

I wouldn't give it any stars if I could. Place is a dump, and the bartender steals from you by not giving correct change, and hoping you won't notice and/or by charging you for a drink you didn't order. 
To add insult to injury when I finally got to speak to the manager (two days later) he says," No you did not give her a $20, in fact her drawer came up short". YES because she is STEALING
Wouldn't go back if you paid me.

The hubby and I used to go to the original Richie's on County Line Rd and we went to this one because we had a coupon. The prime rib is their main staple and it is big, delicious, the most tender meat you'll ever have. The princess cut (smallest) is HUGE. It comes with two sides and soup/salad. I mean really, for about $20 or so, you get a whole lot of food. The dining room is up the stairs and it's fairly spacious compared to the original Richie's. It is nothing fancy but we go for the food so the standard accommodation doesn't really matter. The chef even kindly gave us a complimentary seafood appetizer to try, which was delicious! Our waitress was kind and attentive. We had a coupon for our check, but we made sure we gave 30% on tips. Overall, if you want affordable, quality prime rib dinner, this is the place to go. Now I know that all those times we go to fancy steakhouses in the city and paying loads of money, we were really paying for the scenery and tiny portions of food. Not anymore!

this place is known for prime rib. the ppl in my group who ordered that were extremely pleased. the waiteress was very attentive. that being said, the other food is pretty bad. the lettuce on the side of my quesadilla was browning. and the sour cream on the side came in a little container. the presentation was just cheap. some ppl dont mind that. and it works for some restaurants...but here the whole feel is just uncomfortably cheap.
Best prime rib for the price . Nothing fancy just good people and good food. Plenty room for parking.

Definitely has changed, needs a complete redo
Last prime rib dinner asked for med. Rare, came out well done. TWICE 
Bye bye
Ordered a large cheese pizza for pickup. It was ready on time, had a nice crust and good flavors. Will be ordering again!

thinnish crust.... owner is wonderful old italian woman.  good sauce which is very tastey - home made!

delivery can be sluggish - not always but sometimes.
The food here is fantastic and very cheap. This spot is absolutely underrated. I've had quick and friendly service every time I've ordered, also have never been told they're out of pizza.
This pizza shop is a staple in Germantown history I've been coming here since I was a little boy ! It's always on my before I go on a diet list!! You can't go wrong great food

Pizza arrived at my house with the following major problems:
Cold, thin, and undercooked crust
Toppings on the side, instead of on the pizza (raw green peppers and olives were in a little container) 

Honestly, my god. 
You really put my toppings on the side?

I ordered food and went to pick it up past the time they said it would be ready...guess what??? They forgot to make it... you want me to wait even longer like It's not cold as heck in this place??? game over!!! horrible service!!! I selected 1 star because I had to in order to post...

I've walked in on four different occasions to buy a slice of pizza. Each time, they were all out. I've given up trying. It doesn't seem to matter whether I come in at noon or in the evening, they can't seem to honor their sign in the front offering single slices.

If you think free hotel breakfasts are awesome, you'll love the buffet, except here you'll pay $8.99 for it. Powdered eggs, dried out potatoes, sausage and ham sitting in a 1/2" deep pan of oil, undercooked pancakes and mediocre biscuits and gravy. The ice tea was good. The service was decent and the price is cheap. We won't be back for breakfast. I'm leery to try the regular menu for dinner but we'll likely give it a shot to see if it's any better.

I checked in but we did not stay for dinner 
This used to be Bootsies which had huge difficulties and closed.
When it reopened under the new name we decided to give it another shot.
After being seated.. no one even acknowledged us for a drink order.  We noticed the menu was the exact same as before with high prices.
We left without anyone noticing except the Hostess.
I have heard again about the food not being up to par and service being mediocre. 
The Bakery still looks nice so if you want pies or sweets I would be willing to try that section.
I hate giving bad reviews but I really hope this place turns it around.  They have invested alot of $$$ into the building. 
Good luck!!

Stop here!!!  Drive out of the way!!  You will not be disappointed!!

I will be honest this was not our original destination plan, however I'm so glad we stopped here. 
The place is super inviting when you come in the door. A bakery to your left and a "country store" to your right. 
The hostesses are super nice and inviting. 
We were immediately seated on a Saturday evening and our waitress, Monica, got our drink order super quick. 
You are given rolls and a regular butter and a strawberry butter (yum!!).
I ordered the special which was a 12oz sirloin with baked potato and a side salad. The side salad was a basic side salad BUT it was not bagged lettuce which is hard to find now a days.  It came with croutons, tomatoes and shredded mozzarella cheese. I got ranch dressing which I could tell was house made (yum!!). 
My medium cooked steak was perfect and the au jou was so tasty. Best steak I've had in a long time. 
Baked potato was typical but what else can you really do to a baked potato? ;)
Husband had the pork chop. About an inch and a half cut pork chop cooked with cinnamon apples on it. HOLY COW (pig) (yum!!). Hubby would only share 1 bite cause he liked it so much. His came with a Yukon gold potato hash which was also unique, but tasty. 
When we were leaving the manager thanked us for coming in and the hostesses stopped us to ask if we knew they had a breakfast and lunch/dinner buffet on Sunday AND they gave us a paper menu with the details. 
We will drive from Collinsville to be back!  
A very nice enjoyable dinner. Next time I'm bringing the in-laws!

This is a welcome return to this location. It was originally called "Bootsie's".  I'm not sure if the same family owns and runs the new restaurant, but several staff look familiar. We had omelets for breakfast here, and they were both very good. There is a nice variety of sides. They have a bakery here, as well, for pastries to go, and special occasions. The front part of the restaurant includes a "country store", and a variety of things to purchase-postcards, toys, clothing, etc. We are glad they opened something in this location. I'm sure we'll be back to try their lunch salad bar and Sunday Brunch Buffet!

We returned for the first time with parents after going only twice to the previous location and having subpar food.  Wow, very pleasantly surprised!  Our service was great and our waitress was a true firecracker - a joy to have (Rochelle) - and the food was very tasty and perfectly cooked, quite the departure from times past.  We had read they have a chef and hopefully he/she/they stick around and folks support them.  The way the thick pork chop was moist and delicious, the chicken was the same and sides hit the right notes, I will not hesitate to order the steak the next time.  I can't speak to dessert but they fo offer sufficient variety.   The store items out front are nice but unnecessary.  I think it's a missed opportunity to have a high top seating maybe sports area but get that it's more of a family feel.  Looking forward to going back... which feels odd to say but good!  Waterloo needs a good non-chain family style restaurant.  So glad this is finally living up to what we hoped it would be when originally built.

Pleasant atmosphere and good food.   The service by the waitress was very attentive.   If you are looking for some good normal food, the Tin Rooster is the place for you.   The wife had country fried steak and said it was very tasty.  I had the cod fillets  , which were fried perfectly.   The homemade mash potatoes were excellent.  Certainly if we lived in this area, it would be a place that we would frequent.

We ordered online which I will say was relatively easy however it did take longer than just calling up there. My main issue is that they charged my credit card an extra $3. I'm not sure why or how but my receipt says one amount and my credit card says $3 more so watch out for that. My other complaint is that the pizza wasn't all the way done. We just ordered the same order from a different Pizza Hut and it was amazing so even though I will avoid this location I won't hold it against all Pizza Huts.

After eating PH, PJ's, and IMO's for years with the kids we've all finally realized that PH, especially this location, is the best. They have good deals/promos, drivers are nice, and the food is always top notch. We had people over last weekend and they said it was the best PH they'd ever eaten. Keep up the good work.

Pizza delivery on time and pizza quality on par with, well, Pizza Hut. The problem is, on delivery, they don't bring cheese and crushed pepper, a universally recognized pizza delivery staple. 

When asked, on multiple occasions, the dopey driver will say oh u need to ask for that. So I do. Still no peppers n cheese. What kind of whack franchise ownership can't spend the penny on condiments? If I get a burger, I expect ketchup, same concept.

Ordered online. Waited over an hour. Finally decided to check the status, and even though the pizza was supposed to arrive 10 minutes prior, according to their email, the tracker online said it was still being made. So I called up the store and they said it would update when it leaves the store. LEAVES THE STORE?!?! It was already, at this point, 15 minutes past when it was supposed to have arrived and still haven't left the store! Called up, and they didn't really have an answer. Told them to cancel it and I'll just drive to McDonald's, since my kids were hungry. I asked for confirmation that it was cancelled and voided and the person on the phone said she wasn't sure if she could confirm that payment was cancelled. Typical service from this place.

Very disappointed in last 2 orders! But last night not only was the pizza unacceptable, the $13 special jumped to $18 without adding any additional ingredients AND the delivery guy didn't offer change so took a $9 tip when he knew I was dissatified with the increased price.

Crappy crappy. Ordered online. Pizza was ready in 15 minutes when I got there but wings weren't. Forgot to "drop them". Twice. Sat in that nasty pickup area for 20 more minutes. What a joke. Papa Johns wins back my business again.

Best stuffed crust pizza around! Love the crust D aloe options as well as the drizzle. The breaded bone in wings are horrible. Hardly any chicken, mostly breeding and fat. The boneless however, are pretty tasty.

I wish I could go lower than one. Ordered my pizza for delivery and waited for over an hour and half. I had to call them just so that they can tell me that they don't deliver to where I was at. I was literally 3 miles away. They told me if I wanted it I should go pick it up. I drive a big semi truck so there's no way I can move through those little streets. What pissed me off was that when she took my address she could've told me they couldn't deliver. Had me wait almost 2 hours. Very unprofessional

Driver almost killed a few Trick-or-treaters tonight.  Almost plowed down an adult that went to confront them.  White SUV, the driver flashed a handheld spotlight in people's eyes so they couldn't ID them I guess?  Unacceptable.

I don't order often from here but thought I'd give them a shot and boy did they disappoint. First of all the calls go to a call center not the store. Second they said my order would be delivered in 25-30 minutes after an hour I called and the call center connected me to the store and the manager said the driver just left. So an hour and 15 minutes after my order my pizza finally shows up. The pizza was ice cold bread sticks hard as a rock and totally inedible. I of course call the damn call center again and this guy says he's going to con me to the store again to complain but I just sat on hold for over 15 minutes before I gave up and threw the pizza in trash.
 The only decent experience about this was the delivery driver was friendly, but in the end I'm out $30 with tip. 
Never buying Pizza Hut again.

Ordered on line, gave them a $5.19 gratuity tip even tho I was picking the order up.  Got home and it was not correct.  Missing an entire pizza.  Called-We will remake.  Can't deliver- only one driver.  Well Pizza Hut this is our last Putt putt to the Pizza Hut.  It  is every time .  Shortage of people to work -pshhhhhh

I just ordered the new "Detroit-style" pizza for delivery. I used the app and tipped generously($6). The contactless delivery was up to par. My concern is the price of this pizza. There were eight pieces of pepperoni on an eight-slice pizza. My other toppings were green pepper, Italian sausage and Roma tomatoes. My bill was $26.92 with tip. Is this what Covid has done to pizza??? 
Oh and there was no receipt with my order?!

We got takeout from here and half of the order was wrong. They gave us thick instead of thin crust. When they didn't offer anything, I asked if I could either be compensated for the wrong pizza or given a free pizza in the future. They eventually offered up the free pizza. They forgot the breadstick sauce, so I had to go back in for it. The sauce was awful. It tasted like it had been watered down. One of our pizzas kept tearing apart at the crust, like when they rolled the dough, they had holes all over and just put the topping on top anyway and baked it. We won't be back.

First it is important to know that the Bop Shop is inside of PokeOno. We had trouble finding the restaurant and walked past it.  Also I was very happy to see ALL of the staff were wearing masks correctly.  I really appreciate when a restaurant takes the pandemic seriously.  

We ordered online and I was disappointed to see that the Korean popcorn chicken wasn't an option. I ordered a Korean BBQ brown rice bowl with spicy cucumber, edamame, sesame seeds, and bop sauce.  I have to say it really needed the bop sauce to bring it all together. I really enjoyed it and the presentation was beautiful. My fiance ordered the same but with spicy pork. He LOVED it.  We shared the fried mandoo (pork dumplings) and also really enjoyed it.  The dumplings were perfect and they came with tangy soy sauce.  The dipping sauce was a highlight for me. 

My fiance and I agree that this restaurant is going to become one of our go too spots for dinner.
Nice place to get a quick bite and healthy too! If you're craving Korean food to go this is the spot.

I am hesitant to try any food establishments these days due to COVID, but the cleaniness of this place has me feeling very safe. 
The food is authentic as it gets to korean food (I know bc I'm korean)! 
Very fresh ingredients and great flavor!

We just finished our meal - it was excellent! We created 2 bowls - one with Korean BBQ chicken and one with bulgogi beef. The Bop Shop has over a dozen yummy toppings - from cucumbers and avocado to pickled radish and kimchi. I loved the seaweed salad on mine. We also ordered the popcorn chicken and dumplings - so good! Can't wait to make more bowl creations.

Needed a takeout spot along 476 to grab dinner on our way home recently, and The Bop Shop fit the bill. What a fun concept --- love the idea of creating your own Korean rice bowl!

Ordering online was quick and easy. You can choose a base of brown rice, white rice, or mixed greens --- BF and I both ordered brown rice, and neither of us could resist flavorful Bulgogi beef. From there, you can add up to 5 toppings for free, and unlimited toppings for an additional charge. We both added an assortment of veggies, but definitely do not skip out on the Bop Sauce for a pop of flavor and spice! We had to drive home 40 min before eating, but the bowls seemed to travel well and warmed up easily. 

We also tried the Korean Popcorn Chicken, which was delicious --- flavorful and perfectly crispy. We did warm it back up in the air fryer to avoid making it soggy, and it was delightful. The Vegetable Dumplings were just okay for me, but admittedly, they may have been better fresh. 

I appreciated that they used a lot of paper-based takeout containers --- yay for protecting our environment! They also seem to be following COVID precautions appropriately.

Wish we lived closer, but would absolutely go again if we are in the area!

Seriously, I love trying out new Korean spots and The Bop Shop is now going to be one of my top to go places for something quick and delicious. The staff was nice and patient as I tried to figure out what combo to get. I went for the spicy pork as my protein and my husband got the bulgogi. Yum! There are just tons of flavor and the veggies really complement the whole bowl. I also got the honey ginger tea. I think I'm obsessed with this tea. It's a great palate cleanser and I love that ginger kick.

Simply not good.  As ok as ok gets.

The employees here were very pleasant.

They cannot do orders over the phone for whatever reason- only through the app.

The food itself was not worth the price.  Tons if better options nearby.  No seasonings!

Popped in here a few months ago and like everyone said, this is a ghost kitchen inside another shop.  I didn't know that at first and when I wanted to order something, they said I had to order online.  That was weird and didn't make sense at the time, but does now.  I didn't get to try the food because they didn't have much left and when I asked about an item, they peeked inside several steam table pots and told me what they had remaining.  I didn't see any cooks around and the food being in steam table containers was very unappealing.

Solid spot to pick up a quick but quality meal. There aren't any other Korean spots in the immediate area so this definitely stands out. Whether you're looking for something to add to your go-to rotation or just looking for a nice take-out meal, you should definitely check this place out. Believe it one of those "ghost kitchens" that is operating out of Poke Ono.

Their bowls are great and filling. You should definitely try the different protein and toping options until you find your favorite. For me, I think the bulgogi and spicy pork are the best. Not saying this is the best bulgogi, but for fast casual food it does a great job. Also recommend adding the kimchi and Bop sauce (gochujang).

The Korean Popcorn Chicken is really addicting and always hits the spot. They're nice a big pieces that keep their crunch even with the gochujang-like sauce on them. The mandoo dumplings have a nice crispy outside. The vegetable ones are just OK but I enjoyed the chicken ones more.

I ordered delivery from this place for a late lunch.  Delivery was fine, wish I could say the same for the food.  Never before have I had Koreab BBQ chicken that was so dry and nearly tasteless. Even  the pickled cucumber on my bowl was limp and pallid.  The bean sprouts and carrots were OK, but the only vegetable with any real taste was the kimchi radish. Very disappointing.
I've been here a few times now and this place is good. The fried chicken is my favorite. The staff is friendly and it's fast.

Finally a korean restaurant for the conshohocken neighborhood ! You can make your own rice bowls- chicken, beef, or spicy pork with pick your own toppings. So good. They also have a special side sauce called "the bop sauce" and I'm obsessed. It services out of PokeOno (another local favorite of mine). Order online and pick up.

This is a "ghost kitchen" out of Poke Ono in Conshy.  The food is delicious and they are very quick with turnaround once you order.  I've tried many of the apps and also done the make your own Bop Bowl and it's all been delicious.  It has become a def go-to.  

They also went above and beyond customer service-wise.   I was about to order online from a delivery service and then it disappeared so I called them to confirm they were open.  They were but had run out of an item  and were in the process of reconfiguring the menu so it wasn't an option.  They'd be back online in a few minutes.  I decided to wait a few minutes and meanwhile realized I could order directly on their website which I did.  Out of no where they called me back (didn't have my name or anything  just hit redial) to let me know they weren't able to remove the item so couldn't go back online but would open it up very briefly just for me to order since they told me they were going to open and wanted to know which platform I was trying to order on.  I was blown away, they would risk getting other orders that may be problematic just to keep their word to let me order.

The sandwiches were typical Subway and were good, but the help was terrible. An older lady and two teenage gals were working and it was pretty obvious that the two younger ones could have cared less about being there. No smile, no greeting, just bad attitudes. I had planned on eating there, but wound up taking it out. Terrible customer service.

My friend wanted only white bread with nothing on it and they couldn't do that because they can't price the item well my friend has ordered this before from the same location so it's the persons working the registers fault. I would not recommend you coming here.

My Mercedes mechanic just happens to be right down the street from here, JR German Tech. I was drawn to this place for some strange reason. It could be because there wasn't really a whole lot to choose from being that I was in Millstadt, IL or maybe it had something to do with the constant reverb of $5 footlong on a constant loop over and over again I'm my head. Nothing subliminal or fishy with that marketing campaign Subway.
This place was clean, friendly and if you're up for $5 sub because there really isn't a whole lot of other choices. I recommend you stop by here and you'll be greeted by friendly faces. On a side note I think the sandwiches are closer to 11.5 inches inches. I measured using a less than scientific method. I'm almost positive it's less than 12 inches. Although it could also be because I'm half Asian and maybe that could explain the difference of 1/2 inches. 
This Subway gets 3.5 stars. I don't mind paying $5 for a sandwich when I can make one myself but sometimes when you hear that repetitive ad going in your head you just can't help yourself.

Don't even bother attempting to eat in at this subway if it's less than 45 minutes before closing time.  While checking out at 7:21 (8:00 closing time), we were asked in a very rude manner "you guys are eating here?" After we said yes and received nothing but eye rolls and dirty looks from the younger girl that didn't even know how to make a sandwich yet, I decided to take the sandwich on a 25 minute drive home. Didn't really feel like getting the stink eye from someone, who clearly doesn't belong in customer service, while I eat.

Went there on the evening of June 4 2020 no chocolate chip cookies. The gal lied saying she just sold out. Asked about how long to make some, she didn't know. Went up this morning to get biscuits and gravy and still no chocolate chip cookies. The kid said it would be 30 minutes before they'd be ready.  Got home had to take the biscuits and gravy back , he melted the biscuits to the plastic container. Went back three hours later and still no chocolate chip cookies. He said they had been busy, but three employees standing around. Guess Subway lost another customer. Wonder how much longer they'll last.

I went to the subway in millstadt Illinois. I walked in she said ill be right with u in a rude way and proceeded to make her sandwich infront of me before making mine. She said she hadn't eaten all day and kept making her sandwich. Other worker took it from her and continued with my order. Then said not everyday is a good day and she needed to eat before the millions of school kids came in!!! The other worker said u want extra cheese right...and still didn't give it to me. She asked if I wanted any cookies but didn't mention that they were free. I read the sign. I wanted to walk out but made a review instead!! Worst experience I've ever had oh and the rude was was named Meghan. I will not go back.

its closed! Health Department violations.  Does not look like it's going to reopen.
Gone-Goodbye

Food here is great. Staff is amazing, friendly, and attentive. We have been here with and without the kid and both were great experiences. If you are on the early side, great place for parents with smaller kids.

This place has deteriorated so quickly .
When was initially opened as Flying Fish Crafthouse. It was so good. Creative, great menu with amazing staff
Then unfortunately seemed like for whatever reason the crowd wasn't coming.
Then after the rebranding it all went south.
Mediocre food. Went from spotless with cool vibe to kinda dirty and not well maintained 
So much promise. Just a shame.!!

A very poor example of a local Philadelphia bar. We thought there was hope then the owner said they were closed at 9:05PM for a celebration eagles Super Bowl beer. No respect!!!!!! Fly Eagles fly!!! We will find "that"Brewerytown spot!
Revisited since the takeover and had a pleasant dining experience. The tangy wings were on point as well as the stuffed cabbage special and the brisket sandwich with tots. Will def be back!

I wanted so much to like this place from the start as I am a huge fan of their former beer partner. It just didn't work.  So after the transformation, I was hoping for a positive change. Unfortunately, the place is still unimpressive. Not worth it.

Honestly in fairness I think this spot needs a new Yelp page.  

Yes, under the old management, there were some flaws, but now the service is great, they're doing the bar food very well, and the space itself is amazing.  

I hosted my 2-year old's birthday party here and timed it to transition into the Eagles game.  It was a huge hit.  The event planner and manager were extremely accommodating throughout.  Food came out perfect.  Staff were more than courteous, particularly in the face of our chaotic mob of toddlers and obnoxious football fans.  

Highly recommend for events/large parties.

Wanted to try something new decided we'd go here for brunch. I ordered chicken and waffles my fiancé ordered an omelet with pork roll. I couldn't stomach eating the chicken it was burnt and the meat was tough and fatty also had no flavor. My fiancé omelet was also meh, the pork roll inside was gross and tasted like poor quality meat. The biscuit was like eating a cracker. Sadly the best part of this meal was the potatoes that probably came out of a bag. If you want to survive in the Philadelphia bar scene I'd recommended getting a new chef ASAP....otherwise the bar beer selection were solid.

No food on a Sunday after 8pm? Wow.. the straw that broke the camels back for this place. Poor service, shocking wait time when you order food. I would certainly stay away on a Saturday night Incase they're hosting a wedding lol there's a reason they never get busy. Cheers

Always a great time at this local spot. Great service & bartenders, awesome menu with great bar food. Was here for the Super Bowl and the atmosphere was awesome! Will continue to stop in and bring my out of town friends for drinks and food!

I agree with several other recent reviews-- the Brewerytown Taproom is significantly different compared to last year and its start as "Flying Fish Crafthouse." 

The decor and industrial feel is still there, but the beer and food menu has been upgraded and tweaked (for the better). Now, rather than just Flying Fish and a few can options, the beer selection is huge with both local breweries and larger more generic beers. This new beer menu far outweighs the previous menu both in price and selection. 

The food was never an issue (at least for me). Yes, they could have a few more healthy options, but for both brunch and dinner I have yet to have a bad meal. My wife and I went for brunch on Sunday (and although we were the only customers in there around noon), we had great service, friendly wait staff and enjoyable conversation. It did become more crowded as the meal continued! Brewerytown Taproom is and will be a great destination once new developments around the neighborhood are completed. They are trying hard to beat their initial reviews and hopefully continue to get better! I will certainly be back.

Came here for dinner on a quiet night. Looked closed until I walked into the door. No greeting but I walked up to the bar and was served. They have the standard bar food. Burgers, nachos, calamari etc. Was a bit pricey for the quantity served but it's a nice spot if you have a group. They had 4 large flat screen tvs going which if you're watching a game would be great bc yu can see one no matter which way you're facing. If this wasn't a convenient walk from my house it would've had a two star rating.

Great Find!!! Will definitely go there again. Just like home cooking. The shrimp wrap hit my mouth with different flavors of awesomeness. Hot wings was flavored with just the right spice. I never had romein like that and will absolutely get more. 

Love it!!!!!!!

Food was incredible!! Everything was good. Everything! The stuffed burger was so good. The meat is seasoned and then stuffed with goodness. It came dressed with tomatoes and I don't even eat tomatoes but I ate them that day. Burger was that good! Fried fish was seasoned and flavorful. And the batter doesn't come off like it does at some other places. Even the fries were great. They're kinda garlicky and delicious. The crab rice was delicious as well. Now it is a little warm inside and a fairly small space so I recommend getting your food to go. I'll definitely be back. My new favorite food spot!

Giving this place 3 stars! The gumbo was delicious full of flavor & seafood. The grill cheese on the other hand was burnt and wasn't great. Service was a bit slow. But it's new so I guess it'll suffice for now. Also I didn't know anyone that was working around my food had hairnets or any type of hair covering to protect the food from hair. Will I return? IDK maybe Maynot. We'll see the next time I'm in the city.

Would not go back!!! I ordered two items which took me an hour to receive. I walked in at 4:44 didn't leave out until 5:49 . The location was not packed wall to wall for this kind of service. Upon me waiting they ran out of multiple food items such as sides . They also ran out of chicken wings, at one point of my wait I saw a man going to the back with to go containers,my gosh they done ran out of plates too . For the long wait the food did not live up to par . The sides that they had left available were  very bland , salmon was over cooked and fried shrimp were salty.
Delicious shrimp wrap!!! They even have other different wraps options! I inquired about a spinach or whole wheat option and was presented with a delicious to go wrap thank you!

Good people even better food. First time eating here and I must ask myself why have I waited so long. It closes at 7 so you better get there early. I would recommend the Rasta pasta it has a spice to it with the fried catfish. Only disappointment I had was the shrimp plate....it came with 6 small shrimp. Other then that The food was really delicious.

Haven't been here in awhile but I love the new location it is beautiful.  Very inviting and the staff greets you as you enter. They really make you feel welcome. 
Will definitely be back.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while now and let me say I was a lil disappointed when I did. I visited on a Saturday and it was HOT! No AC/ no ceiling fans  blowing. I decided to wait it out and eat my food in the car but after ordering 2 lobster plates with crab rice, broccoli, and corn at 2:59 pm and not getting the food until 3:55, I was too tired and hungry to wait so decided to eat there. By this time the crowd had left so it wasn't as hot as before. I had a sprite and large pineapple lemonade on the order. The sprite was room temp so I asked for a cup of ice that I never received. I went back three times for the ice and my pineapple lemonade. Each time the young later at the register assured me it was coming. Needless to say I finished my food and no ice and no lemonade ever came. I asked for a refund of the lemonade and the young later and a gentleman that I presume to be the owner just gave me my $4.00 without an explanation of why I never received the lemonade or ice for that matter. If they were out of ice and pineapple lemonade they should have just communicated that at some point and gave me the option of another drink. Now on to the food, it was ok. Nothing spectacular. The lobster tail was real meaty. It could've had more seasoning. The crab rice was just okay as well. The corn was seasoned well. I was unable to eat the broccoli because it was too soggy. Ticket was $63 but sad to say it wasn't worth it. I suggest anyone trying it out to place an order over the phone. That might be a better experience.

This restaurant is one of my all-time favorites it's owned by black young brothers. Pra_lees has been holding it down since to Saint Bernard location, the food is hot and fresh to order in the chefs are friendly and welcoming. I will recommend anyone that's coming to New Orleans to visit the small family business. By the way the shrimp wraps are to die for.

I had the Chicken Quesadillas and my daughter had the Buffalo Wings. Service was great. Food was good. My daughter's just wished the wings were spicier. I wish my fries were seasoned. I think I you have to request it. Definitely going back.

First time trying Pra_LEES, and I'm pretty impressed. We ordered the special (fried salmon, crawfish Mac, and corn) and a Shrimp Salad. The special plate was perfect. When I got the salad it was no a shrimp salad, but a salmon salad. It was unexpected but still very good.

Don't let IG pictures and likes fool cloud your judgment. Let's get the pricing out the bag first, they're super over priced. A loads of rice on a plate isn't worth $45. I hate to say this but I'm highly disappointed! This was a surprise visit for me and I saw the IG pics like you did and my eyes where like . The food was dry but it had flavor. It seemed like they over cooked my food two times. Great customer service and they're willing to help you with the menu options. Parking! What parking...it's like 2-3 parking spaces (it's New Orleans). The location is what it is. Google it but the street it's on can knock you wheel alignment off.

The food was amazing. Big props to the chefs in the back. They make top tier food. My only suggestions is the floor was pretty sticky. Minor thing but for a small establishment that's really making moves in the city I'd suggest keeping the restaurant to top notch quality. They also got my fiancée's order incorrect. We ordered a grilled shrimp salad and they gave her a fried salmon salad. I mean technically, she ended up getting a deal I guess because the salmon costs more than the shrimp but she was really looking forward to the shrimp salad. I got the main entree of my choice of protein (I chose fried salmon), side dish (I chose crawfish Mac and cheese) and vegetables (I got a double serving of corn). It was amazing. The crawfish Mac and cheese is elite and the fried salmon was outstanding. They advertise lobster as an option for the entree but ran out when we got there. I will say the menu is a bit confusing because they don't show the entree special on their main menu and they do have it on their magic marker board menu but they don't classify the price nor the price differential in protein (for instance, the fried catfish entree special is much cheaper than the lobster entree special). Having that classified would be helpful. The place is popular and rightfully so, so the order area can fill up pretty quick. There's a big dining area but I believe it was closed off when we went. I will definitely come back for the food as it is top tier. Support black businesses!

First time here and babyyy let me tell you !! We will definitely be back ! Ordered salmon tacos, crawfish mac and cheese, catfish on a bun with fries and the pineapple lemonade. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING ! The owner was there and greeted everyone and the chief 'chicken grease' really put in that work

My mom and I were looking to get a lunch takeout to enjoy the beautiful weather. And because we are from the neighborhood we decided to try Pra_Lees. OMG... we made the best choice. This restaurant is black owned and has the coziest atmosphere. The walls are decorated with New Orleans Art Culture. It's a small area but there is a seating area in the back. Beautifully decorated furniture. There is a big Screen TV that will definitely make you feel at home. I ordered a Red Beans and rice, with a side of corn, and a fillet of Catfish. The Red Beans were cooked to perfection with big chunks of smoke sausage, creamy and seasoned very well. The Catfish was seasoned and fried crispy. The corn was buttery and tasty. My mom ordered a side of Regular wings. Remind you the wings come in different flavors. And she ordered a side of French fries and a couple of drinks to wash it down. Hands down it was the best damn Red Beans I've had in a long time. I ate it all. The host that greeted us and took our order was absolutely attentive and very professional. He made us feel important, and Kept us updated on the process of our order. He was wonderful. We really enjoyed the atmosphere, the customer service and definitely the food. We will be back again.
I love the food but lately it has been extremely greasy, but what I've noticed and rude. The cashier asked why I didn't have a mask on and see several others with their mask off. I was very offended.
Great customer service & the restaurant has a great vibe. Clean & niice seating area.

This whole dining area / experience is cool. You can order from any of the restaurants in here and sit wherever you want. We got sushi from this Horu Sushi Kitchen and it did not disappoint! Highly recommend. They were a little busy, as most good places are, but this one is worth the wait!
Fun atmosphere and good food! Tuna tower wasn't as satisfying as there was not enough tuna. Rolls were food though!

Wasn't sure how the sushi would be with such a small set up that they have for the sushi counter in the Assembly Food Hall but they absolutely delivered. I ordered the Hurricane Shrimp Roll and subbed Crab for the Spicy Tuna and it was delicious. Super fresh and the Spicy Mayo is on point (has a good kick, but not super hot). Will absolutely be back.
Stopped by the Assembly Food Hall and checked out this sushi place! We ordered a roll with shrimp, crab and both eel and spicy mayo sauce. so yummy

The Horu roll was quite impressive. It comes at a price - $17 I believe, but the combination of ingredients and their freshness is worth it. This was definitely one of the more memorable sushi rolls that I've had recently. And it stays true to the freshness and taste of sushi - not some Nashville hot chicken sushi (I would not be surprised if there is a place that you can find this). The eel roll I had was good, but not anything close to the Horu roll. Glad I was craving sushi that day. I was surprised to find something of this quality in a tourist trap area!

So so so good. Such delicious and fresh sushi rolls. Obviously a little pricey but for a healthy option the assembly food hall makes it a good choice. Recommend highly the salmon truffle roll. Oh my so good!

Salmon and tuna tower were fresh and delicious. Order was quick- less then 10 min. The seatings were a little cramp due to lay out and the restaurant being up front. Overall it was delicious and staff was friendly.

Located in Assembly Food Hall, I've passed this place many times! I finally decided to try it this past month and now I keep coming back. The spicy tuna crispy rice and truffle salmon roll are some of the best I've had in Nashville. Also, the seaweed salad is gluten free which is a rare find! They are very accommodating with altering my rolls to ensure they are gluten free. Sushi on broadway was an unexpected find, but I definitely recommend trying this place- so yummy!

Always friendly, always convenient!  Anyone that knows me, knows I'm a QuikTrip fanatic!  Their Black Mango tea is amazing!

I knocked my review down a star because this location always seems to have dirty soda machines.  I mentioned it to them once and for shoulder shrugs......and I also notice that it never got any cleaner.  So I'll stick to my tea and avoid the soda.....better for me anyway, I guess.  :)
Super friendly employees, nice and clean, and fair prices.  Oh...and their sweet tea is REALLY good!

What can you say - QT does just about everything right. I had quit going when they started offering 91 octane for premium and two of my cars require 93. However, they started offering the higher octane now and I come back from time to time. Try getting a cup of coffee here (at the E'ville location) during morning rush time and they are busier than the local Starbucks! I'm a fan of their spicy sausage roll for breakfast. Totally wrong but so tasty. Staff is efficient and friendly. Place is always very clean. Plenty of pumps so you won't have to wait in line very often. If every gas station was run like a QT what a wonderful world it would be!
Like Kara, I am a fountain soda junkie. My family and I frequent this location so much we know the staff by name ( hi Tiffany! Hi Cory!). Always quick and courteous.... And clean!

My name is Kara and I am an addict. 

(everyone with me now... Hiiiii Kara) 

I...love....fountain soda. 

I know. I know. It's awful for me. 

But, I really really love it. I crave it. I know the ins and outs, who has the best and how to create the perfect ice to soda ratio. In my very humble soda opinion, QT takes the cake. Cheap prices.... that awesome little cylinder shaped crushed ice....vanilla and cherry flavors.... and the most delicious darn Diet Mountain Dew and Diet Dr. Pepper around. 

There are other things I love about QT but they don't even matter and pale in comparison to how much I love me a big ol' QT fountain soda. 

QT workers always say, "see ya next time" when anyone checks out. With me? They mean it. 

They'll see me tomorrow, and the next day, to get my fix.

First time reviewing any gas station. This was my first and last time ever stopping at this gas station. On a trip to STL to Springfield, we stopped at this gas station  and filled up and parked at the front of the gas station to take a 30 min nap and to grab coffee before heading on the journey. The police was called by the manager to only have the best police apologize for inconvenience. You will not be getting our money in the future. Please do better.

Most everyone knows the availability and reliability of their local Quick Trip. From their assortment of fountain soda and coffee to grab and run delicious snacks. However, I want to add what might be a little less known. I am a Seeder. (sunflower seed eater). Its a helpless addition a close friend of mine got me hooked on while he was quiting smoking. It worked for him and now I'm hooked.... Anyway, Quick Trip locations are currently the only gas stations/convenient stores that carry HIDDEN VALLEY RANCH Seeds.. They are without a doubt the best seeds available that my hound dog of a nose has sniffed out.. 
I Hope You Find You Find A Bag And Enjoy,.,.,.,.
You'll soon be a Seeder as well.

We come here almost daily. Also clean and professional service.

The prices are also good. 

What makes this QuikTrip location especially good is that, unlike some others, it manages to keep the ice supply filled such that when securing a soda, one can have as much as one wants. A small detail in the grand scheme of running the store, but it seems all details are paid attention to the same way.

To be fair, I rarely get gas.  My hubby does all the driving.  He says this quick trip is good and it always seems to be clean and have good prices.  The location sucks however.  It's hard to get out of with all the traffic.

This location is very clean and the staff always seems very friendly! They always have food ready to go and their kitchen makes some delicious things too! I recommend stopping here for a quick bite and gas fill up anytime!

I'm as loyal to QT as Saint is to Shadow in Brenda Woods' "Saint Louis Armstrong Beach." Why? Because QT stays loyal to me. 

I've been a reg at Cutie since day one because this place is the apex of gas stations. It's the cleanest gas station in town (great place to go #2) and the speed of their cashier service is incomparable. These people could be part of a NASCAR pit crew. 

I luv QT

We sat at the bar, had drinks. Beer and Margarita, standard margarita, White sangria was delicious! They served chips salsa, was good. I had the Canteen-a bowl with beef,  was delicious, Monterey beef tacos , was delicious. Ambiance was nice. Seating outside is plenty but too hot. Place is very nice. Servers wore mask but I noticed they don't wipe down the plastic menus between patroons.
Such an awesome atmosphere, inside or out.  Service was excellent.  Food was very authentic and the watermelon margarita is too good!  So glad to have such a great addition like this to downtown PH.

I remember this place was being built still a few months ago and found out it has just opened so I was exported to try it. I love Mexican food and there are not too many good Mexican places around. I love chips and salsa and their salsa was delish! There were two kinds given and both were very good. I feel like salsa can make or break a Mexican place. I got the shredded beef tacos and they were stuffed with meat and filling. The flavor was very good and the tortillas were nice and soft and tasted homemade. Our server, Casey, was so great! She had a wonderful personality and you could tell she really enjoyed working at the restaurant. I will def be back.

It's a new place, will give it another try. Had some apps , drinks, and dinner. Drinks were large and okay. Street corn was a little soggy. The tacos and bowl were very disappointing. Some of the most bland food I have had minus the guy Harvey restaurant. For a place with salty in the name, they lacked. The chips were home made and tasted great.

This place is amazing. Nick our server was awesome, fast and on top of great food recommendations. The fajitas were fresh. Seasoning and just tasted amazing. This place is just on point for fresh Mexican style cantina food. The street corn just melts in your mouth. 

It's great to have a place this fresh near us. You don't feel tired after all the great food. 

Give it a try. Ask for Nick and he will take care of you.

We just ate there for the first time and are planning on making it back there weekly! Chips and salsa was great! Watermelon Margarita and sangria was great! Great atmosphere and service was awesome! We moved here from Dallas and are excited to try the other dishes on the menu. Highly recommend!

This was literally the best meal I've had in a long time. This is my new favorite sit-down Mexican restaurant in the area. Everything was great, the chips and queso, the enchiladas, and the churros were amazing! Also, the ambiance is really nice. I highly recommend going here.
So blown away at what a great place this is!!!  Wonderful food, great drinks,and fantastic service:). Tamales were awesome and the  queso was amazing!!!!

A great Mexican restaurant!   Come for the margaritas, but stay for the food.  We ordered a flight of margaritas - and the glasses were full sized.  Plenty of refreshment for one person - or can easily be shared with two others.  The single margarita will require two hands.  

Complimentary chips and two kinds of salsa (spicy and mild).  We ordered the con queso and it was very good as well.  We asked our server to delay our order a bit, to allow us time to enjoy our margaritas.  Our meals were served hot; the portions were plentiful; and the food was very tasty.  

The service was very good and a shout out to Eryn our server.  She did an excellent job ensuring we had chips, water and beverages before our meal was served.  And, she did a great job holding our order while we enjoyed our flights of margarita.    

Get there early on Sunday, as they fill up fast.

I really wanted to love this place... the line out the door seemed positive but really fell flat. Our very honest server complained about her awful tables while her mask slipped down her face. Our food had no real flavor, no heat... tasted like bland chicken and veggies on a skillet. Tortilla shells were bland and fell apart easily. We watched tables stay dirty for 15-20 min while guest patiently waited outside to eat.

Tried this place on the way back from the beach in Tarpon and had a great experience! Our waiter Cameron has to be the more happiest waiter to ever to have you sitting at his table! Makes you excited just to be there yourself! LOL. Dining out should be a happy and exciting experience and he gives you all that! The Margaritas a great! My duck quesadilla was fantastic and I am eager to try other items on the menu on my next visit which will be soon!

Love the colors and decor of the place.  I always bring guests here.  The place is always clean, staff is always welcoming and the service is always on point.  The serving sizes are huge, and food never disappoints.  The margaritas are the biggest and best I've ever had.  I just love it here

Cute little restaurant in the palm harbor downtown district

Food is pretty good drinks are also very good but the pricing on the drinks is crazy for some of them and they don't warn you about it.

Went there with friends Saturday night. The food was incredible. We ordered the empanadas and a flight of 4 salsas to start. All were incredible. We ordered the enchiladas which was a huge delicious dish.  My friend ordered the lobster tacos and they were awesome.  I ordered The best strawberry marguerita ever!!!  Will go back very soon. For the first weekend opening they handled the crowds well.  Great edition to palm harbor.
I'm going to give 5 stars. Drew and Tempest were excellent bartenders/servers and to top it off the food was great too. Will come back.
Our new favorite (or at least tied) Mexican restaurant. Friendly staff, clean place. Home Run!

Tried doing takeout from the Salty Lime Cantina three times. Every time was a disaster including late food, cold food, and given the wrong order to take home. Shared these bad experiences with the restaurant via its website five days ago and have yet to get a response. Their take out menu is now in the trash and we will move on to other, better functioning and more responsive dining options.
This place is aaaaamazing, the costumer services was amazing, the food delicious, I was here for my birthday and the waiter was charming and kind, the staff make me feel happy. Absolutely recommend.
Really enjoyed our stop here. Service was top notch by Kappy. Entire staff welcoming and attentive. Food was over the top delicious. We will go here again when in town.  Loved the ambiance.

Tried for the first time with the family and everything was great! The accommodations for covid-19 were not quite up to standards, but our server Tre made us comfortable! The street corn was my favorite!
Best Mexican restaurant I've eaten at! Delicious jalapeño poppers, fajitas, pineapple jalapeño margarita, and fried ice cream! I will definitely be coming back!!!

The food was fantastic!  Try the desert nachos!!!  Was plenty to split amongst the four of us.  First class service all the way.  While I am on vacation, I can say whenever I return to Florida, I will be coming here!

First time here. Staff was on top of it.  Constantly (but not to point of annoying) checking to see how we are doing. Alex was great.  Attentive, personable.  Had the fajitas.   large portions with great flavor.  Margaritas are large.  They use fresh ingredients in the margarita,  not a mix.  We will be back!!!!!
I have always liked Mexican food. This is one of my favorite places now. Food was so flesh and delicious. Highly recommend!!!

This has to be the dirtiest restaurant I've ever been in. I didn't even order food because of the state of the restaurant. We ordered margaritas and the brought us chips and salsa. There was hair in the salsa. 
There was trash, dirty napkins, dirty plates everywhere. No one seemed to care to clean the place up. The bar tenders ran out of glasses. It was just an overall mess

We ordered take-out.  It did not start out well.  The person taking my order was so rude I almost hung up.  It improved from there.  The chips and salsa were very good.  The empanadas were excellent.  The Don Chorizo tacos were excellent.  The Don Carnitas tacos were fine but the carnitas were a little bland - I will order something different next time.  Also I like my carnitas to have those fried brown crispy bits and these definitely did not.  My husband ordered the duck quesadilla.  The menu said it would be "crispy duck" but it was rare to medium rare duck that was red inside and soft on the outside.  Overall everything was very flavorful and we will definitely be ordering from them again.  When we picked up the order it was crowded inside.  They did not seem to be practicing social distancing.

The Palm Harbor area NEEDED a Latin-fusion restaurant and this is the best possible solution. The food was unique and flavorful, the service was SO kind and efficient, and the atmosphere was fun and inviting!!! Do yourself a favor and try this place next time you need a taco or a good margarita... you won't regret it.

Our first visit tonight and WOW!!! Wow in the best way possible. A beautifully designed restaurant with a creative menu and unexpectedly GREAT service. I was impressed with how the restaurant seems to be running so smoothly after only recently opening even amidst a pandemic. Kudos to management for a well trained staff.
