From the hostess to the bartenders, bus boy, food runner and servers...every single person we interacted with was helpful, cordial and efficient. Even though the hostess was extremely busy(Saturday night rush), she was professional and kind to us and every person I observed. We sat near the hostess stand and were greeted quickly by a server who brought us drinks and chips/salsa so fast. The wait appeared to be pretty long so I periodically checked inside and finally lucked out with two seats open at the bar. A server, Allycia, noticed I needed to get my husbands attention from outside (I didn't have my phone) and she actually retrieved him and our drinks/chips/salsa from our outside seats. She wasn't even our server and I didn't even ask for help, she just took action which ended up helping me to save the bar seats and get off the wait list for a table. Next, the bartenders...these three were margarita making machines. Quickly helping bar guests while keeping up with the restaurant demands as well. The guy bartender was the most efficient bartender I've ever witnessed and his drinks were ON POINT! I feel bad I can't remember his name.
The food was YUMMY! We loved the chicken empanadas, crunchy on the outside, softer on the inside with a yummy sauce on the side. The enchiladas were good. Not my absolute fave ever but still noteworthy due to the broiled cheese and portion size. I think more enchilada sauce and using corn tortillas would have been more to my liking. My husbands quesadillas were right on point and also another great portion. All in all, a great addition to the Palm Harbor area. Please keep up the amazing work!
Some things to note: 
1. EVERY staff member was respectfully wearing a mask. 
2. The bar area can be a bit loud but what do ya expect on a Saturday night.  
3. You can(and should) call ahead to be added to the wait list. 
4. The hostess stand seems a bit chaotic, would probably make more sense to move it further out from the entrance/exit.

Went for dinner with a friend and I side had a wait but we were able to sit outside in the shade which was great!  Had chips guacamole and salsa which was great and fresh!  Had the chorizo tacos and those were awesome!  Had the churros to end the meal and it was so yummy!  Service was great for being a new restaurant!!!!. Will be back for sure!
Love the fish  tacos!! Great huge margaritas! Very nice and bigger then it looks from the outside. Also always request Faith if you want the best server ever!!

We were so excited to try this restaurant because of all the phenomenal reviews, and my review is based on what took place between us and a waitress and does not reflect the quality of the food.

My husband has asthma and is being extra cautious during Covid. He is also a physician. We called ahead for outside seating, and were promptly sat outside. The hostess and others were wearing masks. 

Our waitress came over without wearing a mask. My husband politely asked her to put her mask on. She gave us the dirtiest look like we were asking her to do something outrageous, put on a flimsy bandana without covering her nose, and grumbled something about it only protecting herself. When she walked away, she made a point of bringing it back down.

We immediately left, my husband called the manager who was respectful and agreed with our position, but why in the middle of a pandemic with cases back on the rise is the mask ordinance not being enforced? We went elsewhere and did not have a problem. Will not go back.

Wow! What a place. I came here randomly with some friends that were visiting and honestly lucked out! Faith helped us out the entire time!! Made our experience amazing. Would totally recommend the spot!

Awful place.  Long waits, poor service, filthy everything, inadequate bathrooms, blatant rip-off prices, bad management...  It's in a cool location and looks like it should be an enjoyable place to go, but trust me, it sucks.  Spend your time and money elsewhere.
Sat outside. The food was great. The service was even better. The drinks were large and good. Best food in Palm Harbor.

So I tried out this place with my brother and omg it was so good. Everything is made fresh to order. Chips and salsa to start with. The ambiance is out of this world you feel like you're on vacation. The drinks are delicious and boozy, I had the cantina cocktail, blueberry margarita, and brother had jalapeño margarita with frozen watermelon margarita with a floater. 

The chicken tortilla soup again on point fresh AF. We had already ordered guacamole and the Caribbean salsa/jalapeño crema again fresh AF  like delicious  

And then my entree came out the two to tango shredded beef enchiladas my brother pounded them down even though he was stuffed I on the other hand saved them for later (they were still great reheated via microwave). 

But honestly the food and ambiance didn't compare to the waitresses demeanor Cappy, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu choices. She was fast efficient, thorough and can't say enough she was awesome. Cappy made it happy.

We waited for this place to be finished for months. Decided to check it out.  Salty Lime is at a prime spot in the Palm Harbor historic district. The decor is rustic Mexican Cantina with suitable music to set the mood. 
     We opted to sit outside.  Large floor fans kept the air moving.  Now on to the food and drinks. 
A huge bowl of warm chips and two delicious salsas greeted us.  Wife had Chicken Tinga and I opted for the Gringo tacos. Wife reported her tacos lacked any flavor. Adding salsa didn't help. She also got a House Margarita. Her immediate comment; They forgot the Tequila. It was large, but lacked any punch.
     My Gringo tacos were fine.  Spiced right.  Rice was good too.  I must say, our Server, Trevor, was perfect. I should have spoke up about the Margarita and flavor issue when a Manager spoke to us.  
     I want to go back. Wife; not so much.

Won't be back. Got to go and we finished nothing! Street tacos, combo enchiladas,4 sauces
 Wasted 50 bucks that's for sure. Oh yeas and my at corn was dark brown at the husk

The staff all did a fantastic job!  They knew the menu well, were attentive and very nice.  They were fairly busy, which was awesome to see in this time of COVID, and we only had to wait for a few minutes because they were turning tables over quickly.  

We were a group of 3, it was our first visit and we had food, drinks from the bar and dessert.   Everything was okay-- nothing outstanding but nothing bad either.  One of us had tacos, one had enchiladas and one had a burrito.   It was all kind of bland and the black beans on the side were runny.  The best thing on the table tonight was honestly the pico and chips-- both were good!

We'll give them another shot someday, but there's nothing that any of us will crave.  I'd still choose Casa Tinas or Rocco's Tacos the next time I really want good Mexican food, but I do hope this place makes it and wish them good luck!

My first time at Salty Like Cantina met my expectations!  Upon sitting down we were instantly greeted by chips and 2 types of salsa already on the table...which is fantastic when you are HANGRY! 

The restaurant uses a lot of the limited outdoor space and adheres to the 6feet social distancing rule! The outdoor space was nicely accommodated by fans to keep it nice and cool why you were in the Florida sun.

As far as the food, it was yummy! The Mahi tacos were tasty, the rice and beans good as well. The chicken fajitas were made with huge chunks of chicken! 

All in all it's a great place. I wasn't super impressed by the sangria, but I definitely will be back to try out the margaritas!
Absolutely amazing!!!! The freshest, most delicious food!! My new favorite place! Will definitely be back as often as possible!!! Delicious margaritas too!!!

Came in on a Sunday night, stopped by the host stand for a table outside and she disappeared and never returned after she said she was cleaning a table off for us. Since she had been gone for awhile we went inside to be helped and no one helped for a few minutes. Restaurant was not busy either. Took another ten minutes for anyone to clean off a table. 

Service was slow, food was okay. Black beans were sweet so that was weird. Server tried to upsell us on everything. My MIL ended up with a $20 margarita without being notified of the charges/upsell. 

Won't be back. There was no reason it should have taken a table to get cleaned off or service.

We came here on the 1st week it opened, and came back the very next day.  Chips and salsa were fine. Enchiladas, ropa vieja tacos, empanadas were great. Margaritas were a little watered down.  We will definitely be going back to try more things.
A excellent restaurant for Mexican cuisine and very large margaritas. The service and food was great

Our party of 3 came in for dinner on a Friday night. They were slammed! Our server was very friendly and attentive but the service from the bar and the kitchen was terribly off. We ordered two margaritas and one beer which came well after our food came out but our server threw in a delicious free dessert to make up for it. The food was amazing but the timing from the kitchen was way off. They brought my mom's toppings, rice, beans & tortillas for her fajitas but no meat/veggies. Then about 7 minutes later they brought my tacos out. Then 10 min after that they brought  my dad's enchiladas out. Then when we were finishing our meals they finally brought my moms meat/veggies for her fajitas. Overall the food was delicious and our server did they best she could but def need some improvement in the kitchen.

We have been wanting to try this place for weeks and every time it has been packed. Decided to give it a go and wait on Friday night.....An hour and a half later we were called for our table. Our Server was fantastic....Margartias were fantastic....The food not so much. I wouldn't even call it Tex Mex. Clearly the owners have never had real Mexican food. Definitely not worth the hour and a half wait.

Every one seemed nice and the food was delicious for the most part.The drinks were wonderful.My server was very chatty when I asked what came in the taco the sever talk for a whole min about how the chicken was made and not what was in the taco but the chicken was very good just not the onions I didn't know that was in there.

Giant. Fresh-squeezed. Margaritas! 
Need I say more? 

We slid in on a busy weekend night, starving and craving some Mexican comfort food. Salty Lime did not disappoint. 

Free chips and salsa, the cheesiest enchiladas in Pinellas County, and a Margarita that could double as a fish bowl. These are all reasons why we will be back. 

Great atmosphere too, with outdoor seating out front and on the side. This little historic district in Palm Harbor is really shaping up to be something great. You could start here, begin your bar hop and see where the night takes you!
Yum yum yum ! Huge portions I split with my husband! Very well done! Chicken enchiladas were amazing! All fresh and delicious! We will be back!

Salty Lime Cantina was amazing! We will definitely be back. The cherry salsa was out of this world! Mojito was delicious, enchilada meal was more than enough for one person. Best Mexican restaurant in the area!

First time here and very impressed. Started with a tequila flight from their excellent selection. Chips and two kinds of salsa, both delicious. Margaritas are amazing! I had my with Altos Anejo, super tasty. Our server Nick was very attentive and our food came out quickly. I had the Ahi Tuna tacos and my girl had the pork belly tacos. Both were excellent! Definitely a great place if you appreciate good tequila and great food!

Geeat food, great service. A coworker recommended this restaurant and it did not disapoint. Steak fajitas were delicious and flautas are my son's new favorita mexican dish. Morgan our host greeted us with a smile and made sure evething was to our like. Definetly we will be back

My wife and I returned to this location once again.  It was as hood as usual.  Our waiter, Dillon was very knowledgeable and courteous.  He offered excellent service.  The food was prepared to order.  Chips and salsa were fresh.  Queso was delicious.  The location in downtown Palm Harbor is quaint and pleasant.  One again it was a great experience.

A good find for dinner. 
The waiter was sweet as pie and attentive for being a teen. The salsa was a little spicy but on the good side. Mix the salsa and the Pico de gallo and it's yummy! I had the chicken tacos OMG. The other two I ordered, pork and beef weren't as good. My sister and MIL ordered a bunch of appetizers and were happy. We also ordered empanadas and they weren't exactly 100%....

For being a restaurant run and most likely cooked by not Latin people it was pretty good. Though it was funny when we pronounced the food in Spanish and the kids eyes went wide and didn't know what we were talking

My husband had actually found this new restaurant on Facebook. He was away one evening so I decided to give it a try. Truly a good experience!!

Not sure when it opened but the staff were friendly and efficient. Management stopped by my table to make sure I was having a good experience. I ordered the DIY burrito where you can add toppings you want to the base burrito. Really tasty! The chips and salsa were also good. They delivered two types to my table - mild and hot. Mild was perfect. Spicy was good but too spicy for my taste.  The food was really good. This will definitely be a place to return to.  Bill came to a little over $18 for the burrito and a soda.

Austin was everything we could ask for in a server, attentive, quick, and nice! The food was incredible as always. They were out of guac but Austin recommended a great alternative we will always be getting in the future! The margaritas were fantastic! Highly recommend this great restaurant!

This is the new restaurant next to Thirsty marlin. We came in to finally give it a try. We were greeted outside the front door immediately. There's indoor and a cute outdoor patio for seating. 
Our server (I want to say his name was brad) was amazing ! He was super attentive, gave us tons of suggestions, he was great. The complimentary chips and salsa were really good.
We ordered the dipping flight as an appetizer. You choose four; we chose classic guacamole, Venezuelan guacamole, white queso, and the cherry salsa. 
GET THE CHERRY SALSA! Our server suggested it and it didn't typically sound like my type of salsa, but it was the BEST !
My boyfriend and I got two taco meals to split and try different ones. 
The portobello steak tacos were really good. You get two and it comes with a big portion of rice and beans. The tacos with the chicken and pineapple (can't recall the name) were also great. 
I would definitely come back here.

After reading many many recommendations for Salty Lime in the Pinellas County Foodies group, my husband and I decided to finally give them a try.

I'm saddened to say I'm not sure what everyone sees in them. We had a pretty wide range of dishes to get the true experience and I can't say we loved any of it. Nothing had much flavor at all and everything needed a healthy amount of salt. 

We started with the queso fundido which you think would be packed with flavor but somehow was not at all and the warm tortillas they were served with were just gross - wet, starchy and flavorless. We used the chips instead but the queso was still lacking. They we shared the Green Monterrey Enchiladas and a steak and chicken Cantina Bowl. The rice served with both was flavorless and clumpy. The meat was dry and all around everything needed so much salt, like someone forgot to salt anything that day. 

Our teas to drink were also really bad, nearly un-drinkable. 

The only thing I can think of is most people come here to drink? I saw huge margs on every table so maybe that is what keeps everyone coming back? Either that or they were truly just having a bad day which I understand can happen.

Ok listen. You're in literally anywhere within a 10 mile radius and you think to yourself, "Food, I want that, where do I go?" HERE, you go here. The service was impeccable. The chips, oh so good. We had a sangria, top notch. And those steak tacos? Don't even talk to me, absolutely incredible. We live nearby so we will ABSOLUTELY be back. No disappointments, y'all are awesome- keep it up!

Friendly staff , Our waiter David C.was awesome ! 
Food is bland , & drowning in cheese on the Enchiladas and no sauce on it , restaurant is small but cutely decorated was our second time here & same conclusion the Mexican food not that great .

We thought we would try this place for a change.
Very disappointed. Waitress was in training but we didn't hear her say that but figured it out with another staff member following her. It felt very weird.
The nacho with ground beef was our late afternoon snack. It was suppose to come with corn, black beans, jalapenos. I saw very few black beans and corn and zero jalapeno. More plain chips than anything else. Cheese and cream sauce mostly.
The salsa and chips complimentary as custom with Mexican restaurants. We asked for more salsa to go with our nachos and was told the first one is complementary. I didn't want to pay $3 for more, not worth it for sure. The older waitress took our salsa dish that had a chip and another bite. I asked for it back and she slapped it back on the table.

The water container was a nice touch but the short plastic cups were disgusting,not sure if clean. We could not use them.
We were telling the new waitress about this, thinking we were being helpful and she rudely walked away from our table.
We were not being rude.

Visited this establishment last week after being inside for 8 months , we chose outdoor seating , everyone wore masks , we felt very safe there . The food was delicious , we had chicken tacos and an order of duck tacos . They serve complimentary chips and salsa which were delicious and  they serve you water at the table for everyone out of the cutest vases . The service was out of this world , our waiter was attentive and funny wish we got his name he was great ! Their sangrias are delicious ! Will for sure return !

We loved it and will be back soon! Great food, atmosphere and service. We usually like to give restaurants a week or two to settle in before trying them out, but even with a packed house and Covid restrictions it all seemed to be running seamlessly. Large menu, everything we had was delicious. The jalapeño basil margarita, the strawberry mandarin rosé sangria and the mojito were impressive as well. The Mexican fried ice cream was a great finish. We can't wait to go back and try more things.

Best Mexican food in Pinellas County! Drinks are amazing. Try the blueberry margarita and viejo quesadillas! Fabulous! Server, Trae Taylor knows all the menu items and gave excellent recommendations! He is such a Sweetheart! Thanks for a great dinner!
If you're in the area you have to go here! The food was amazing, and everyone was super friendly and helpful. Great vibes and delicious mixed drinks!

I would just rate them as ok.  Very pricey and the enchiladas are really burritos because they don't use corn shells as described in the menu.  Also very little chicken in them but used a pound of cheese.  I like melted cheese but this was too much. We went with friends and were given on small salsa to share.  I asked for more and was told there would be a charge.  When the bill came the extra charge was $5.00.  Seems a little excessive.  Glad we went.  Neat looking place. But won't go back.

Absolutely fun and fantastic food and service! Five stars all the way! 
Thank you Chad Santucci!

Brand new location in Palm Harbor that was much needed!!! I was just talking about how we need more places like this! 

Is it good? I have been there twice already and they haven't even been open for 2 weeks yet. So I would say YES! 

My first visit was with girlfriends so we have a ton of different items, tortilla and pollo soup (soooo good), quesadilla, one of the rice bowls, two variations of the tacos, plantains, margaritas that are huge, sangria and to end the meal, a flight of Tequila! Yes, I said flight! The 2nd visit to bring someone different to try them out, guacamole, the "Norm" burrito and beef tacos with Mexican street corn. Each time I have had to bring home half of my food because the sizes are very generous! 

From previous posts, there have been many mentions of how well they were running for being brand new...I'll let you in on a little secret. This isn't their first restaurant so years of experience and they are BUSY. Saturday they opened at 3pm and we thought we would wait a few minutes before going, I got there at 3:15pm and there was already a 45 minute wait unless we wanted to sit outside (it was too hot) so we choose to sit at the bar. But the crew has it down and I noticed the quick service going on at the other tables as well. Everyone has been super friendly. 

The menu has a lot of items, so there are still tons of things I want to try and will be back!

I went this Sat at 6:00 they sat my friend and I at a large picnic table outside on the side  in the nice shade. They brought over chips and two kinds of salsa which were good. Water in a carafe was on the table. Our waiter explained the drink menu came back to take our order allowing time to look over the menu. I had the fried avocado shrimp salad, my friend had the Hippie Quesadilla. I really was surprised how much I liked my dish it was filled with avocado and the shrimp salad was good with chopped onion Mayo really good flavor. It was enough for a meal and an appetizer if you shared it. The Hippie Quesadilla had a good variety  of veggies and cheese, a side of rice and beans and she had to take some home it was a large portion. Our waiter checked up on us several times. I will be coming back for sure.

A new hot spot in Downtown Palm Harbor. It's either hit or miss here, and they definitely hit it. Expect to wait because the place is small and quaint, and very popular at the moment. They are very good food, the margaritas could use a little bit more tequila so that it's size comes with the benefit of a buzz, but that's the only con. Parking is scant but typical for all the restaurants in this area. Service is very very good, super attentive. Overall, we will be back... hopefully to stronger margaritas
Great service awesome bartender love the atmosphere. A great addition to Palm Harbor! Margaritas were perfect. Empanadas were on points.

Our first time going last night to celebrate a friends birthday. We sat at the bar while waiting for a table due to covid guidelines. The wait was long Ofcourse but this is obvious due to social distancing. Our server was incredible , quick and informative about the menu options. I think there was literally a magician in the kitchen because our food came out in literally 5 seconds after ordering which was awesome! We had quest and guac as an appetizer and I would recommend both! I got the cantina bowl with steak and my goodness , the best chorizo soft steak I've ever had! The margaritas were the size of our heads and strong! My friend got a mix up with his order but they let us keep it on the table and brought out the correct item in a split second. Hands down 5 stars. Server did a great job up selling too I'll give him that! Haha. Can't wait to go back for dessert only because the food was very filling !

The food here is incredible. Staff is extra friendly especially with all the food suggestions and modifications they would typically do for themselves with entrees. Taylor was an awesome server! Had a great time!!!

We have been going here since the opening weeks and usually the food and service has been great! This evening we called for take out at 5:25 pm due to health issues for me. The server really did not pay attention to what was being ordered. When my husband got home my order was totally wrong. When I called to tell the restaurant, the girl who answered seemed flustered. When asked about the order, She went to the server, who told he rang it in as a kid's meal. Ok, but there is NO kids meal on the menu, and we asked for a side of salsa, and he included chips , charged $2.50 each ( which is always on the table n/c) and then added $2.00 for 2 small containers of sour cream. If they are going to nickel and dime us, we can go elsewhere
Great fish tacos and service. Would recommend to a friend. Great chips and salsa also

Some of the best nachos I have had.
1/2 Hamburger in a soft taco...delicious 
Excellent drinks and service is great!

My husband and I had the most fun dinner at Salty Lime Cantina. I ordered a coconut flavored Margarita and it was huge and hit the right spot! Also, I would recommend the tamales. Made just right! Awesome service, got seated right away on a Friday night at 6 pm. Atmoshpere is festive,  had live music and lots of great energy. We sat inside but there is lots of outdoor seatiing, too. I will definitely be back!
The food was very good. But there was no social distancing and our server keep  pulling down his mask as did several other servers

Love the food here! We've been several times and even when it's packed - the service and food are impressive. I love the 2 salsas that are served right away with the fresh chips but the real star is the tacos. You can't go wrong. Definitely give this place a try even if it's busy!

Best spot in Palm Harbor for a legit margarita and some fajitas. Complimentary chips and salsa too! All staff are friendly and when management is around they always stop by your table, which most restaurants should do but don't. 5 stars here for me

Excellent service from Faith.  The margaritas were huge and delicious. Food was hot and tasted exactly like I hoped. The portion sizes were large and the chips are fresh and warm. The salsa, both hot and mild or fresh and delicious. They adhere to the COVID-19 restrictions with social distancing and mask requirements. They have both outside and inside seating.They have a large tables for large groups and small tables or smaller groups.. Overall I had a great experience at this restaurant.

Home run!

All the food is good. Not a huge fan of Mexican food, but I enjoyed the extra creativity of the menu. There's gotta be 20 different types of tacos. And the Altas Margarita reposado was perfect. 

Why not 5 estrellas? The sangrita (sangria & margarita) was bitter... more like a big glass of wine and a tasteless version of a margarita slush. Stick to the margaritas on the rocks. 

Will be back soon!

I don't post often but when I do it's for a reason. This dinner was outstanding!! We had the salsa flight which came with 4 sauces which was a nice surprise, all were fantastic! I got the  enchiladas which had hugh depth of flavor. My gf got the chicken tacos (no slaw bc shes a picky eater). The chicken had a great smokiness and the creme was drinkable. Already planning our next visit. Prob do empanadas and fajitas next time. Once again outstanding!!!
I finally made it to Salty Lime.  Food and service was outstanding, and the margaritas were delicious too!!

First time visitor on cinco de Mayo. Short wait and very busy. Abby was our server and she was awesome. Great Margeritas and great food. Empanadas were excellent. Will definitely be back. My new favorite for Mexican food.

Definitely not the best Mexican food that I've had. It's mediocre at best and I think they forget to put any tequila in their Marguaritas. I'm willing to give them a second chance but they need to up their game. Sorry but this is my accurate review.

Pros: Food was excellent. Well prepared with fresh ingredients and interesting menu. Came out via food runner so it arrived quickly and wasn't affected by service levels (see below).

Cons: Smaller space so often a wait. Not much outdoor space although it looks like they added tables in the dark alley space on the side? Service was poor all three times we were there. The one server we had walked past us inside and out ten times without looking over, as if intentionally trying not to be available, after our food came out but we didn't have silverware. It was really weird. Something was missing on an order and it was twenty minutes until we could literally shout to grab his attention as he walked past. I don't know where he was going, maybe back and forth to thirsty marlin (same owners)? That night the busser dropped an overloaded tray of dirty dishes and a bunch shattered and a table next to it got dirty food on them and shattered glass that no one attempted to clean up for like twenty minutes. Accidents happen but clean up the broken glass. Another time we went and such poor service that the manager comped out drinks. 

What we've learned to do in order to go there: order a pitcher of margaritas and your food asap since you likely won't see a server again for 45 minutes. Runners will bring food out so server absence won't be as big an issue.

Super good food and drinks! 
The margaritas come in many flavors and are huge!
Usually a pretty busy place so expect a wait but it's worth it!

We ordered the street tacos. I think $4 for a street taco is a bit high but ok. We ordered 4 steak street tacos. The menu did say there was an "up charge for steak". How much could it be? The answer was TWENTY DOLLARS!!! Yeah, the $16 order of 4 STREET tacos (VERY tiny amount of meat) ended up costing $36 for 4 street tacos. Unbelievable that an "up charge" is more than the cost of the taco itself, 125% of the cost of the taco to be exact; it more than doubled the cost of the plate. We asked to speak to the manager who was annoyed by our question and did not take the charge off the bill but did begrudgingly agreed to only charge us a ten dollar up charge. Still WAY too much. Beware of price gouging here. Shameful.

This place does not disappoint!  What an awesome addition to downtown Palm Harbor.  The giant margaritas were awesome, the complementary chips and salsa were so good!  All the food had was wonderful!   The staff were very friendly and helpful.  I'd give it 10 stars if I could!    We will be regulars for sure!

Newer place in downtown Palm Harbor. Outdoor dining with nice large fans. Wasn't sure what to order so asked for recommendations. Brad (our server) asked some questions to gauge our preferences and was spot on with recommending drinks, dips, and main dishes. He was right on with everything he said. He knew every part of the menu and was even able to recommend extras to go with each tequila on our flight (which tequilas go with salt and lime and which pair well with pineapple and cinnamon).  We had a great time. Food and service were top notch.

Little Caesar good Pizza but worse management, I was there twice havenot got pizza both time, it's kinda bad service, at my first visit I was told they were down on system so cannot take any order and on my second visit they were out of Pizza dough what a fk

This place is DISGUSTING! The manager was on meth (no lie). Two other customers were with me in line. We waited for over 30 minutes. They were making pizzas without gloves, wiping sweat off their forehead then back to making pizzas. DISGUSTING! One customer waited 45 minutes for 5 pizzas. Where is the district manager? Ridiculous!

Received complete wrong order. Called the store, was given nothing, told me I'd have to 'contact Door Dash'. Terrible customer service both on the little Caesars & Door Dash side. No way to get my refund. This happens 1/3 times from this store.

The service here was HORRIBLE.  There were a bunch of teenage kids working and were very loud and rude.  I heard lots of cussing and was embarrassed for the mom with young kids sitting next to me.  I was told it would be a 10 minute wait for my order but it was actually 30 minutes.  There were 2 nice girls working (1 on the register and 1 in the back) and 3 boys running in and out basically doing nothing.  This was a Friday night at 5 pm and the waiting area was full of customers as these kids clowned around.  It was a huge waste of my time for mediocre pizza.

I've given this LC WAY too many chances... by FAR the WORST LC you can go to. You will wait a MINIMUM 30 minutes if you walk in for a "hot n ready" pizza. Order through the pizza portal you say? THINK AGAIN! Your order will be WRONG! Don't bother upgrading to the "Extra most-bestest" pizza for $1 more. You're SUPPOSED to see a difference but they literally just give you the same $5 pizza and mentally say "fuck the customer they ain't gonna know". You ask for Parmesan cheese - They ain't got it. Red peppers? They get mad like you asked for the fucking register then say they ain't got it. But the funniest thing of all is this shit... the picture I have attached to this review... I mean c'mon guys for real? I could've been you're own flesh and blood and you gonna short me like this, without even knowing me, but why? Like this sauce comes out of your paycheck? Why would you only fill up a sauce cup half way if anything you should be generous because it's NOT coming out of your pocket. What a damn joke. There's a REASON y'alls DUMBASS make pizza for a living  literal BOYS for real.

Was under the impression that little caesars were supposed to be 
 "hot n ready" 

Bake more pizzas than you do already through out the day and keep someone permanently at the register.
I ordered 5 pizzas but they all look like they were made 40 mins ago. One of the worst looking pizzas and employees are the worst. Never go to this place

If there was a option for - stars this place would be getting that. They have the worst customer service I have every seen as well as the worst management on the planet. I have also never seen an employee be doing absolutely nothing sitting at the front counter with a line of people like I saw. Once I got to the front I asked why she wasn't helping anyone she said she was on break..... what customer service based company makes their employees take a break at the front counter! I will never go back to this place it sound be shut down and totally re staffed.

I'm pretty sure the sauce they gave me has mold in it. It smelled really bad and looked fuzzy. Definitely not eating that. Maybe the sauce should be stored in a fridge or something. Saw it getting pulled out from under the counter so I'm not really sure what's going on down there. But ya check what you're giving your customers. Kinda nasty

This is the worst Little Caesars in Middle Tennessee. The food is always undercooked and doesn't even taste like food from other Little Caesars locations. It tastes like they are using cheaper or old ingredients. It is common for them to have the Crazy Bread sauce just sitting out on the front counter instead of inside the heated display along with the Crazy Bread. I don't understand how Little Caesars can allow one of their franchisees to be this bad.

Pizza was good but the service wasn't very friendly.  I had to wait, to be waited on for about 10 minutes also the guy making pizzas just looked at me as I came in and continued working.  Never said be with you in a minute or anything and other two guys just carrying on a conversation....WOW

I'm really just giving 5 stars instead of 3 or 4 because I completely disagree with the previous one star review and I want to balance their rating to what it should really be. This Little Caesars is just as delicious all the others-and I know because I eat A LOT of Little Caesars! They can't take coupons at this location though. :(  same yummy pizza and breadsticks as the rest!  :)

This is the worst Little Caesars in Middle Tennessee. The food is always undercooked and doesn't even taste like food from other Little Caesars locations. It tastes like they are using cheaper or old ingredients. I don't understand how Little Caesars can allow one of their franchisees to be this bad.

I ordered two stuffed crust deep dish pizzas and what I got is personal pan pizzas with the wrong toppings on them. I tried to call the store to get the mistake rectified and no one answered. Very poor customer service.
This place sucks major. Never go here. Ever. Their employees are rude and suck so Mr. Owner. You yeah want to get on that.

This is Bridgeport's solid local Chinese takeout place.  Been going here for years.  Friendly staff and they always have my food ready within 10 minutes.  There's some bogus reviewer from Austin, TX that left a bad review saying it wasn't authentic like when they visited China.  If you can see through that nonsense and recognize you're in Bridgeport you'll find a fine takeout establishment.

China Star is my go to take out spot when I'm at work. The staff is friendly and the restaurant does a swift business. Tonight I ordered the shrimp and broccoli combination platter. I enjoyed the pork fried rice which was full of diced pork, onion, carrot and peas. The shrimp were large and cooked perfectly. I was pleased to find five of them packed into the container. The broccoli was lightly cooked and still had a crispness when bitten. The sauce was light and not overpowering. The egg roll was fine I've seen larger (that's what she said). It was fried lightly and the cabbage inside was crisp. The portion size was huge almost enough food for two. And I got a free can of soda.

China Star was the first restaurant I tried when I moved to Bridgeport 2 years ago. I expected the usual, mediocre Chinese delivery. 

First of all, they knocked on my door 10 minutes after I ordered. Secondly, the food was hot and the driver was very polite. I don't know about you, but that does matter to me! 

The won-ton soup is the best I've had and the egg rolls are heavenly. I'm lukewarm about the lo mein, but I'm not a huge fan anyway. Sometimes I just want a change. The veggies are always crisp, not soggy and my kids can't get enough of the crab rangoon. 

If you want a very cheap meal that is totally delicious then this is your place!

Tried this on a whim one night. They didn't sound or look busy, so I was a little worried. Food was really good. I got Sesame Chicken and a spring roll. Both really good and the pork fried rice was excellent! Will definitely go back.

China Star is my go to chinese place because of their location and portions. Their general tso's is better then some of the other places I have tried in the KOP area. China Star is a pretty standard chinese take-out restaurant with a short wait and fair prices.

My sister was visiting from NC and we were exhausted from a long travel with a hunger in our bellies that only Chinese can cure. Cue China Star. 

The food met expectations and delivered the sweet, salty, fried, sauced goodness we craved after hours of stale car air. The chicken lo mein my sister ordered was tasty and not drenched in soy or oversalted like some places. My General Tso's was all I expected. I've had better, but this was on par with most. The crab rangoons had a decent amount of cheese/faux crab mix in the pouches, and my spouse's sweet and sour chicken was sweet, not sour. Their pork fried rice was worthy of note, with fresh veggies and dime-sized hunks of pork. Service was friendly and prompt. 

All in all, a-okay.

Pleased ! Looks like this will be our go to Chinese take out spot. 

My bf and I just moved to this area and of course we needed to find a good Chinese take out place. This place is right down the street so we gave it a shot. We were not disappointed. 

The food was very tasty and reasonably priced. We'll definitely be ordering from here again.

Fast and Friendly service all the way

I ordered pepper steak with no white rice because I ordered beef lo and when I called to explain what happened, the rudeness was indescribable. This is why I cook what I want. Pic is included with a half pot of rice Will not be returning. Can spend my 45.00 somewhere else.
Shrimp rolls cooked in old oil. Pork lo mein was very sub par. Not worth the price for the stomach ache

Not the "best" Chinese food I've ever had, but gets the job done. Pretty run of the mill and has the usual 10 minute wait time. General Tso's wasn't bad and rice was average. Portion was also on par with the norm.

Bottom line; Run of the mill.

Great place for Chinese Takeout, being only couple minutes away from KOP mall, they take credit cards(Even Amex and discover) as soon as it's over 8$, otherwise there would be a 50¢surcharge.

Vegetables are fresh, no extra charge for shrimp over other protein options. During weekdays they even provide a lunch menu(Try no.32)for less than 8$ with a free soda and fried rice, the portion is about 1Pt.

I love their Curry shrimp, they only make it in Qt. though!

I really like this place, they're very friendly and speak English fairly well. The food is above average and doesn't make my tummy hurt (which is usually common for Chinese food) so I say good job. Prices are pretty standard and competitive for the area. Let me also just mention, this is by far one of the cleanest  kitchens for a Chinese place I've seen around. (Stay away from Norristown Chinese , yuck)
The food here has always been good but today I found a black hair in my food. I will not order from here ever again. So disgusting. Everyone should be wearing hair nets.

If you are in the Bridgeport/KOP area and are craving some Chinese, this is a great spot. They are quick, inexpensive and yummy. If you are looking for something fancy, this isnt for you, but for some good greasy salty Chinese takeout, this is definitely the spot. My only wish is that they had fortune cookies. Other than that it's decent comfort food that's super convenient if you live in bport

When reviewing a business you have to take into consideration their core business. China Star is a take-out and delivery Chinese business in the USA. To give them a bad review because it didn't compare to the "authentic" food you just had while visiting China is unreasonable. If you want that go to Pin Wei but I warn you it is the real deal and most can't stomach the real deal.

China Star offers and cooks the same menu items that 95% of the Chinese takeout joints in the U.S. offer. The food is always good, fresh and, hot.

I like the seafood and pan noodles a lot (real lobster tail.) I also like the spare ribs as a quick treat. The kids love the chicken or shrimp. The soups are good too.

Again this is not a Michelin rated restaurant and nor would you want it to be. You ordered take-out remember. (They deliver in Bridgeport and King of Prussia only)

Just about everything is under $10.00 and most is $5.00 or less. Grab a cold can of Sunkist orange soda on the way out and enjoy your awesome fast food.

On a side note is also a hoot listening to the kitchen workers. They always seem to be having a ball back there.

I went to China for a month in 2009 and had the best Chinese food ever.  

All I've got to say about this place is Yuckie!!!  This is why I try to stay away from Chinese food in the US....cause it tastes like this.

I ordered from here and I got the smallest wings with pieces missing. When I called to tell them about this, they said it was fine and would make me a new order. I made my dad go out of his way to take me to pick up the order and then they were charging me for it. This isn't fair because I only got half of my food in the first order and both of the people there were extremely rude and giving us horrible looks.
Great Chinese food!  I was pleasantly surprised to find this place close to my work.  Hot, fresh and great service.
The food was delicious and reasonably priced. We got an appetizer platter and entrée platter and they were just right for four people. We also brought a bottle of wine and had a lovely time.

My boyfriend and I decided to order from here since it's new and town and we both love Turkish food. While the menu looked amazing, the prices were a bit daunting. Still, we decided to order the mixed pide, beyti sarma, and iskander kebab. Oh man - they were all AMAZING! Even the bulgur served as the side with my beyti sarma was incredibly flavorful. The portion sizes were also huge, making the price well worth it. Overall, I'm super glad we ordered, and highly suggest ordering from here as a nice way to treat yourself or have a date night in.

We were driving up Route 130 and remembered the Ebru Bakery in this location. We saw this replacement and stopped to pick some delicious snacks: excellent lentil soup served with crusty fresh Turkish bread, two types of pide (thick dough filled with various things, similar to pizza,) and lamahcun. The special pide probably had sausage, eggs and cheese, very tasty. The potato one was also very good. A small plain salad came too: very good food.
Pricey, loud music, slow service. Server does not seem knows how to waiter. Waited long time to get my check. I am not going back again.

I always check the reviews on Yelp before going first time any restaurant. I did same routine again yesterday before going to 'On the Grill'. Be honest, I had concerns after reading reviews. My friend recommended this restaurant and we went there together. 

It was lunch time and only 1 table was available. We ordered Turkish style mix pizza (karisik pide). It was absolutely fabulous and very very delicious. I ordered one more to go because I just loved it. 

Our waitress was very kind. The prices was also very reasonable. I gave this restaurant 5 star because the food was so good and clean. My other reason is I feel very comfortable with the social distance in this restaurant. Many restaurants doesn't care social distance, they just care about to put extra tables outside.  

Next time I'm going to try some other foods there and hopefully I can stop myself not to order again 'pide'. Stay healthy and keeping social distance, please.

I love this restaurant. It's been my go-to spot for lahmacun for a long time; since it was called "ebru bakery" I've been going there. I tell all my friends who love lahmacun about this spot too. The food is authentic and delicious, and the staff is friendly. 5/5 stars! If you love Turkish food, do yourself a favor and check this spot out!
This spot is a hidden gem. Both for its delicious food and friendly service. The Tavuk Sote was the best I've had!

Overall nice experience. Tasty food, highly recommend Adana kebab and salad. There was something playing on the TV that was not very family friendly so didn't really appreciate that, maybe they can be more careful about it moving forward. However, excited to go back and try more dishes.

I got the rice pudding and the berek I believe... it has ground beef and was yummy! Heated up well in the microwave! A nice change of food. Love it

The rice pudding wasn't that great

Great place, everything home made .so testy and great Turkish pastries.i always go for pickup and I drive 45min and I still get it home hot . The lahmajoun is amazingly testy ,the pide is good as well .honestly all I tried there was not a disappointment . Worth the drive

I really like this little place. I bought bread here when it was a bakery but now they serve food; soups (lentil) and have lamejun and boreks and Turkish pizza. There is another turnover type dish called gozleme that can be prepared with meat or potato or feta or mozzarella cheese or a combination of the four which I have ordered to go. The lentil soup came with toasted bread and I lingered over it blissfully with Turkish tea in a beautiful glass with a tiny spoon. The lamejun came with a small salad. They also have a counter with rice puddings and other treats. This is a nice little spot and the cooks/waitstaff were busy with walk-ins and take-out orders. I hope they increase their offerings. I don't live nearby but they might be able to compete with Star Manti (in the same strip mall) which has become very expensive.

Hair came up in their food which was freaking disgusting. It literally destroyed my digesting system not a place that I could recommend anyone. They have a hygiene problem. Food MUST be clean and healthy.

I was in the area yesterday. I was originally coming here to go to the Brazilian restaurant. But I saw this and became intrigued. 

I went for the lahmacun and the gozleme. The lahmacun was decent. But that gozleme was sinfully good. Next time I come here I'm just ordering three of those instead. 

The rice pudding was decent. A little thin texture for my tastes. But that's just me. 

Service was very friendly. I'm already dreaming of the gozleme.
I've never had a worse pizza in my life. Three notches short of Midwest gas station pizza. Don't do it.

Zero stars. Don't even bother with this place. After two phone calls to check on our order it still took literally two hours. The estimated delivery time was 30-45 minutes. My boyfriends $16 bruschetta chicken was fettuccine with marinara and a grilled piece of chicken. None of the other handful of ingredients listed on the menu description were apart of it. The salad came without dressing... Cool thanks guys? Now for dessert.... Well the chocolate torte is really just a piece of cake that looks like it was purchased from Walmart. And they totally forgot to put in the other dessert we ordered and paid for. Never again. I'll stick with Dolce Vita for late night delivery.

I ordered delivery through their website (the cheaper option as delivery apps add their own fees) and have a very happy belly now! My pizza arrived on schedule (expected delivery was between 30-45 minutes and it came in about 35) and exactly as I'd ordered it. Most importantly, it was delicious: fresh and flavorful ingredients on a perfect crust (soft with just the right crunch). I've yet to visit in person, but I'm grateful to have a local option for pizza delivery (rather than a chain) and I love their late hours...5am!

Placed an order online for one of their gluten free pizzas. I was excited because there's not many in the area that offer this. Got a phone call 10 minutes later telling me they don't actually have the gluten free dough available anymore. Don't list it on your website if you don't have it. Completely unacceptable.

Absolutely terrible. Everything they serve has been frozen to long before they pulled it out of deep freeze to send out via order up, because no one would go to this terrible restaurant by choice, which you wouldn't think by looking at the prices, which indicate it's a good restaurant. Don't get tricked. It's terrible.

I would rate this place less if I could. I ordered from GrubHub and it took them THREE hours to get me my food. Despite the fact that my place of employment is literally less than five minutes from them. I called them after an hour and a half and they said he had just left and would be there soon. I called after two and a half and they gave me the same response. They said there was traffic. No chance that traffic was so bad it delayed them that much. They didn't even apologize or offer me a discount and, after waiting three hours for it, the food was very subpar.

It was honestly the worst food I've had since college cafeteria food. 

1st: I ordered Bruschetta as an appetizer. The tomatoes were sour. The sauce was bitter. And there was no hint of garlic & onion flavorings. The bread looked and tasted like someone torched the sides of the bread with a lighter and threw it in the microwave for 30 seconds. Just terrible.  

2nd: I ordered the Italian Chicken for the entree. I had high hopes that this was going to taste like everything Italian Chicken dish should take like: soft & bold flavor in the sauce, lightly sautéed vegetables, thin slices of juicy chicken on a bed of thin airy noodles. No, it was the opposite. The sauce tasted like hot water with old chicken juice. The chicken was rubbery and had absolutely no flavor. The vegetables were not sautéed together and looked like they were out of a can, especially the mushrooms. The noodles were dense and sticky. It was just terrible!! 

Seriously, I was more shocked than upset. Nashville has great food selections so I am just confused about how this happened...

Ordered delivery.  It estimated 55 minutes as max and arrived 45 late.  Arrived cold.  The food wasn't bad. I'm sure if it had arrived in a timely manner and warm it would have been ok. We ordered the smoked panini and calamari.  It was ok.

The food was pretty good! Cheeseburger was alright, fries were good, chips were regular chips. The mozzarella sticks were nothing new but the marinara sauce was delicious. Ordered off GrubHub and it was 30-40 min later than their estimated 55 minutes. So that wasn't cool. There was nothing stellar about the order, if you're looking for regular food, it's fine.

DO NOT ORDER FROM THEM!!! THEY TAKE TWO HOURS JUST TO DELIVER FOOD 15 minutes away. I don't know what their system is but I know never to order food from them. I paid $14 for manicotti with spinach and a pink sauce.  I don't see any spinach and no pink sauce it is salty white sauce. I placed it through order up which makes the company look bad. I was looking forward to a yummy dinner. Very disappointed.

Bummed .. Ordered food from 12 S bistro thru grub hub .. never again.. Grub hub sent over wrong order.. N big mess to get the correct one.. Do NOT use grub hub.. Not reliable .. 2.5 hours to get correct order .. Salmon tasted like jerky..

Best Greek food I have eaten. Can't wait to dine in and get the full experience. Great location. Gyro was fulfilling and full of flavor. Doing a great job getting the food out under the current circumstances we are going through.

Food was fantastic. My husband and I both had bowls. Everything was amazing. I dont think I've ever been to a Greek place that Wowed me before this place. The man that served us was fantastic and helpful too!

WOWWWW this place is absolutely amazing. I haven't been to the location as I ordered through doordash but my food was the bomb. I ordered the BYO bowl & a soup. The bowl was totally enough for 2 servings and the falafel was so soft and delicious. All the toppings and sauces were so fresh too. The soup was sadly out of stock but I Instead got hummus and pita and it was a blessing in disguise because that was the best hummus and pita I've ever had. This is my new go to spot!

Went there after reading reviews . I live 3 blocks from the restaurant .  Tried it out .  While there are fresh ingredients to pick from I did a wrap with gyro meat , tomato, onion , feta , and sauce .  Umm .. 3 pieces of meat ?  Really ?  I then asked for a side of gyro meat and I received a big container of that . More that was on the original sandwich . ..  sure it was tasty .,but....3 pieces of meat in my wrap ??  Skimpy .....

I just ordered takeout for me and my neighbors. Got 2 orders of the Greek Family pack and 2 gyro pitas. It was an unbelievable amount of food and it was all good. Each Family pack was $40 and came with two meats, hummus, pita, salad, green beans and rice. I have a family of 6 and my neighbors have 6 and we had plenty of food leftover. Gyro Chicken and traditional were both on point. Food was fresh. Place was clean. Great family friendly, quick, clean, affordable, delicious and healthy. If that's what you are looking for then this is your place.
I am a little surprised this restaurant has received 5 stars . Although everything IS fresh , I received only 3 pieces of the meat on the gyro . Probably won't be back.

I am sorry I waited so long to try Simple Greek after they opened. OMG this is by far the most delicious build-your-own place yet. The concept of doing it with Greek food is brilliant. I started my bowl with half rice pilaf and half lentils as the base, then added gyro, grilled green beans, tomatoes, olives, cucumbers and feta with tzatziki to finish. It was DELICIOUS and so fresh. I also got a side of the spicy roasted red pepper sauce, and yeah I could eat a bucket of that. 

The second time I went I got the spanakopita, falafel, and a "side" of gyro which was huge. AGAIN, OMG!!! I eat Mediterranean/ Greek/ Middle Eastern all the time and love it from everywhere (except Hallal Guys, good riddance) and the spanakopita and falafel here were the best I've ever had, hands down. Thank you to whoever decided New Orleans needed one of these restaurants in our life because we most certainly did. 

And it is an affordable CBD meal, too! I am just blown away, I didn't expect it to be great, and I've never been so happily surprised. If you work downtown, you must try it. The online ordering is so simple and makes picking up a breeze and contactless. I can't wait to be able to sit in there and enjoy my food once social distancing is over.

Stopped in for something different in the Crescent city. I do love Greek food! Interesting how this place has a build your own pita and bowl. Order standard gyro meat on a pita. I got a kick out of the young girl who thought I was crazy to request fries on my gyro. Found they tend to eat them that way in numerous places in Greece. Overall, good food. Definitely will go back.

Wow! Great place, that is actually open downtown right now, and it's super fresh! Second time this week ordering, seamlessly online too! I tried the protein bowl with fresh mixed greens, gyro chicken and lots of other fresh toppings! Also had the hummus and some fresh pita! It was delicious both times! I highly recommend giving them a try. Prices are very reasonable. This will definitely be a new place on my lunch radar!

I ordered, the lemonis potatoes, a gyro with a kalamata salad. Spanakopita and the lemon soup. 
Spent about $25 and it well with it!
Their entire menu is GREAT and takes mcteer baaaaaack tip the ol school recipes! The portions are 2nds and 3rds.  The staff is superb! Let's not forget, they also are doing work With the community, making drop off meals. 
Bless Hellas!

Stopped in for a quick lunch, it was our first time and we were pretty pleased overall. Customer service was attentive and hospitable, establishment clean, and food delicious. We will be back! Thank you for the nice experience.

Awful!!  We walked in and were immediately jumped on with "a bowl" or "a pita". We had never been here before and had no idea what they were talking about. Instead of explaining the process and how it works, after I said I want a salad (apparently a bowl) she grabbed a handful of lettuce, quickly moved over to the second section of the serving area and grunted what else, rushing me to select stuff without even getting a chance to look at the options.  Then when I asked for bread, it seemed like my request was ridiculous, like who has pita bread with salad, right?  My husband was up next and it was just as bad. His server was just as rude, unhelpful and short.  He also said his protein (gyro) was cold and tasted like it was made 2 days ago. To top it off, neither server was wearing a face mask.  Stay as far away from this place as you can.  It's awful with terrible customer service.

Looking for a break from Creole/Cajun cuisine?  Now I know NOLA is a culinary paradise but fresh veggies and Mediterranean were much needed on our fourth night in town.  We discovered that this shop was walking distance from our hotel.  We were able to build our lunches so we opted for bowls that included delicious falafel, tzatziki, and lots of fresh veggies.  We did share a slice of baklava as Greek festivals haven't yet made their post pandemic return in our neck of the woods.

According to my DoorDash account, this restaurant was the one I ordered from most frequently in 2020, and I already knew that! 

This place is great! If you're a broke college student trying to eat something healthier, yet affordable, then look no further! 

I always get the Pita Bowl, and it's always so so so FRESH! Their French fries are also homemade, and the spanakopita is always on point. 

Support this local place and keep them busy! :-)

I unfortunately came to NOLA the week the mayor placed a city ban on eating in any restaurant unless you provide proof of being vaccinated or provided proof you had a negative PCR test within the last 72 hours. As an unknowing visitor, this is very frustrating. This restaurant allowed me to order food (just had my mask on) and didn't invade my rights to order a $12 meal.  Three other restaurants I visited asked me to leave (I actually have a negative test but it's outside the 72 hour window. Mine was 6 days ago). Thank you to this restaurant. Food was great and employees were nice and respectful.

DELICIOUS!!!!!  Made the mistake of getting the gyro (which was delicious) but my son got the bowl with rice which was even better!  The bowl comes with a half a pita. The feta was delicious and the Greek fries were amazing!  Will definitely be back.

An excellent addition to the CBD restaurant scene.  Best Greek food in all of New Orleans.  All the ingredients are super fresh and the portions are BIG.  Friendly staff helps explain your options and answer any questions.  Hope they expand into Metarie so I can enjoy their excellent food more often.  Definitely check this place out.  You will be glad you did.

Happy to be reviewing about this brand new greek restaurant. The food was superb, cleanliness was on point, and the customer service was spectacular. I was very impressed on how knowledgeable the staff was and how excited they were to start there buisness! It's so simple! Like subway but with Greek food! Fast, kind, proficient, and good vibes! Please stop by down Carondelet street and give them a try!

I placed my order online. A few minutes later a received a call from the restaurant. The person who called said that they were having an issue with the kitchen and couldn't complete my order. She said it never happens and she was very sorry. I understand that things happen and it was no big deal. She said my credit card would be refunded and it was partially. They did not refund the money I added for the tip. They actually kept it!  And then they sent me an email requesting a review! I don't know if the food is great or not and will never know because of that experience.

This restaurant is one of our favorites! The staff is very friendly, including the chef who comes out to speak with us almost every time to get feedback. The food is very creative and flavorful, and the portions are perfect. We are so happy to have them in the neighborhood!

Brick and mortar of your favorite Asian fusion food truck! Staff is very friendly. Food is fantastic. We ordered a nice spread to be sure to taste a nice variety. Everything is fresh and delicious. The crab Rangoon are even made with real crab! When was the last time you saw that?! The house made spicy sauce with the udon is so damn good. Osaka was good but too heavy for me. Perfect for sharing with 4-6 people. The only slight miss for me was orange ginger cheesecake. It wasn't flavorful enough. I was really  hoping for that ginger bite but I couldn't find it.

If they happen to have the pork belly bites you MUST get them. Crispy crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The soy vinegar sauce cuts down on the fat perfectly. Posting this review in hopes they'll add permanently to the menu

We never tried the food truck - but let me tell you, this restaurant is a must-try. Small menu but packed with flavor. Sometimes they run out of items - so make sure to ask ahead before looking at the menu. It's a new business, so give them time to adjust. Completely worth it!!

Really bad food. I had a few of their dishes and the food was soggy and cold. Dooriban is so much better or Matjoa. Also location is in middle of nowhere and very hard to find. Don't recommend this place unless you want soggy unflavorful food
Cool place! Great casual atmosphere and the staff is excellent. Food is really good. Got the BOP bowl and Noods. Will definitely be making this a regular joint. Great family atmosphere too!

Looking to do a progressive dinner at some new spots in St Pete. This place has tapas and sounded really good. 

Nice place. Sat ourselves and service was right on point. Had the pork belly bao buns and egg rolls. Both were amazing. Awesome flavors in the bao and a nice slow heat.  

Decent beer selection that goes really well with the food. 

We will be back here.
Fantastic find and very very delicious food. I can't wait to come back and try more of their menu.

This is Korean food made by white people and it shows, all the flavors were off and to cover up the blandness they COVERED our bowls in gross hot sauce, also for that price I was extremely disappointed. I felt physically sick afterwards and would not recommend. Service was ok tho.

My boyfriend and I came on a Saturday night and it wasn't busy at all, probably because of the location. We started with the pork belly baos and they were AMAZING! Flavorful with the perfect amount of heat. For entrees, he got the KFC and I got the K-pop bites (both with the soy garlic sauce). We both enjoyed our food! I would say the sauce was a little heavy on my entree so I probably wouldn't order it again. Our server Nikki was very nice and attentive. I would definitely go back!
Cool little place and really enjoyed the Pork Belly Bao. This is a great spot along 16th ST in St Pete. Can't wait to try something new next time.

Amazing Korean spot right on 16th with super friendly service. We got the bap bowl which was a huge portion and delicious. It's served in a hot cast iron which mimics the dolsot bibimbap experience (IYKYK). Also got the KFC (Korean fried chicken) which was perfectly crispy. The st pete heat sauce creeps up on you in spice but it's the best kind of burn! 

They also have a great draft selection with beers from local breweries. Definitely a chill place to grab a drink and enjoy a great meal.

We love the Brick & Marter place. We came her off of Yelp review. We had the Crab Rangoons. They were a bit small but you can tell they were fresh & with real crab. The Panko fried pork belly was amazing (with Garlic Sauce). The KFC was my favorite dish as it was Korean fried wings. We had the Kimchi Tater tots and I wasn't a big fan only cause I don't like Kimchi. But I would go back there again anytime. DO IT!
First time here. The KFC wings were awesome! Wish I had time to try more items on the menu. Cozy atmosphere and very nice & friendly staff! Craft beer on tap.

KFC - we got the non-spicy ones and they were SOOO CRISPY AND GOOD. Bap Bowl - probably my FAVORITE. So flavorful and good. Hot Noods - the perfect amount of heat and so freaking good.
I wish I was more of a drinker - but this was perfect food to share and watch a fight.

This place is awesome.  Food is delicious. They are always innovating new things.  Love the bimpab bowl.  The fried cauliflower is  so good and the bao are wonderful. My husband the noods dish. Thick spulicy noodles your choice of protein.

In our search for Korean food in the Tampa
We Came here today for lunch after our beach day
Arrived as they opened at noon 
We were the only ones here 
The server was nice but was talking to us from the other side of the bar a lot so had call out our orders to him

For starters we got fries and fried pork belly 
The seasoning on the fries were a bit much for me but Hubz and baby loved it 
The pork belly was great just a tad bit greasy for my liking 
The sauce they give with it is awesome, kept dipping my fries into it

Entree I got the bap bowl with beef bulgogi and asked to made spicy, loved it

The K pop (fried boneless chicken) soy garlic were kind of similar to the pork belly both had the same flavors 

We couldn't get the spicy flavor because it has crushed peanuts and I have an allergy (which I didn't get because if it's fried fresh and tossed in the sauce then they should be able to opt the crushed peanuts right?!)

Here is what made me give them 3 stars 
We had left overs 
Especially the fries and I asked the server if we can get the sauce that was served with the pork belly on the side to go 
He asked if I wanted one or two
I said two would be great thanks

He walks over with the sauce n swaps out our check! They CHARGED us for the sauce!
Why didn't you mention that?! And why would you charge for it? If I took the pork belly home it came with the sauce, I was just upset by that! 
Inform your customer please

Overall not bad but we weren't wowed! 

Will not be coming back

Amazing and delicious food! Came here for Taco Tuesday and it was so good    
The owner and staff were so thoughtful. Additionally, the GM Russ checked in on me.

We found these folks at the National Fried Chicken Fest.   Hands down the longest line at the fest.   The chicken sandwich, spicy level 2, was perfect.   The chicken tacos were on point, and the street corn was awesome!    Couldn't go wrong with these folks!
The best chicken sandwich I've ever had and miss so much during this covid-29   Can't wait time enjoy again

I had the Nashville hot fried chicken sandwich (heat level- Rick James spicy) at the Arts Festival this weekend and it was tasty. The chicken was crispy. Only minus it that it was greasy even for fried chicken although it had good flavor. Service was friendly. I would try them again.

I first had Southerns at Fried Chicken Festival a few years ago and have been addicted since. They're at Second Line Brewing every Friday so it's super easy to call ahead, order and go pick up our food. They have a couple specials that they rotate through (fish sandwiches, adobo cracklins, and a delicious oyster dish to name a few) but the star of the show is their chicken sandwich.

My go to order is the Otis Redding (not too spicy, not too mild), fries and their Phuket sauce. Y'all. The Phuket sauce. If I wouldn't get a weird look ordering like 5 of them I would. The containers are tiny but are so flavorful and delicious. Do yourself a favor and give them a try!
Amazing!  These guys have perfected their craft!  This will be my first stop next time I'm in town!

We ordered 2 Rick James spicy chicken sandwiches to-go. They had set aside 25 sandwiches for service industry as well, which is amazing of them to do in this time. They are easily one of my favorite chicken sandwiches in New Orleans! The chicken thigh had just the right level of spice and heat, and the pickles and slaw added a great crunch. 

Southerns has been popping up at Lots-a-Luck Tavern in Lakeview for COVID-19, but they are normally often found at Urban South and Miel Brewery! Make sure to order early, since they often sell out quick.

OMG I tried one of the best fried Chicken Sandwiches last night, I'm so glad I got 6. I got there just in time to get the last 7 sandwiches, hallelujah! Southerns does pop-ups around the city and they sell out fast, I can see why, the hype is REAL!! I'm a fan for life! 

Perfectly fried boneless chicken thigh, so crispy with a great batter tossed in the spicy Otis Redding seasoning, served with housemade pickles, slaw, and a yuzu aioli on a grilled buttered sesame seed bun. I took my first bite, I remember saying mmmmmm and didn't come up for air until it had been devoured.

Had the fried chicken sandwich (Otis Redding) medium spicy at the Fried Chicken Festival and it is the best chicken out here. I am sold on this place. Most of the time, festival food is not that great but this place is the real deal. As a local, I hate that I am just now finding this place but I guess...better late than never. Do your taste buds a favor and try this place.

Talk about the best chicken sandwich...  custom made, it has a great taste of tender chicken with just the right amount of spices. The bun and condiments add to the tasty, perfect temperature. The Lionel Richie is the only sandwich I have tried.

First off this is my first time ever reviewing on Yelp, I actually the a few minutes to sign up just for this. The Chicken Sandwiches were amazing! I had them at the fried chicken festival in New Orleans. The Chicken tacos were good, nothing special and the. Iran was Great!!! Best Chicken Sandwiches hands down!  Better than Popeyes!!!!!

I caught the Southerns truck on a Friday afternoon at Second Line Brewing, and it was the perfect atmosphere to enjoy their food while chilling with a beer. Their Nashville Hot chicken sandwich is simple, classic, and so delicious. The bread is amazingly soft and buttery and the chicken is flavorful and crispy. The french fries were also great, and paired amazingly with their aioli. Plus, everyone on the truck is so nice and friendly (I scored my fries on the house!). Great experience, will be back for more soon!

I've had my eye on this place for a while now! A nice Popeye's chicken sandwich usually satisfies my craving, but I wanted something a little more this Thursday evening. Quick, nice experience as they were located across from the Broad Theatre. I picked the spicy chicken sandwich with aioli fries. Upon the first bite, I was immediately floored. The flavor of this sandwich was glorious. It would have made me feel better if it were bigger, but it was still good! The fries were well seasoned too, although I wished I had asked for extra aioli. Overall, I think it's definitely worth a try!

Southern's is the best friend chicken in the city. Hands down. Over the Summer there was a "war" between restaurants on who had the best fried chicken sandwich and I ate my way through the city to seek out the best and THIS is it. Popeyes is a close second but umm the restaurant that is known for selling fried CHICKEN has sold out indefinitely of fried chicken. If that isn't irony, I don't know what is. I also had the Chick fil A spicy chicken sandwich, as well as Company Burger, Blue Oaks Tues chicken sandwich, Freret Beer Room's version and the fried chicken sliders at District Donuts. They were all good, but pale in comparison to Southern's.
Anyway, so Southern's is a pop up and is a challenge to get to but it is totally worth it. Recently they won Best Use of Fried Chicken at the 2019 Fried Chicken Fest, so I am hoping to see alot more of them around now. They usually pop up on Thursdays and Saturdays at Festivals, Food and Arts Markets and at Second Line Brew in City Park. I tried their Nashville style sandwich at the Palmer Arts Market. They sell three different levels of heat: The regular which is the Lionel Richie; the spicy, known as the Otis Redding; and super freakin' hot known as the Rick James. I have had both the regular and the spicy and really liked them both but preferred the spice of the Otis one. I think the spices and the batter is what does it for me. 

I took my first bite of this sandwich and did not even get any chicken, that is how thick the batter is on this sandwich. I took a second bite and had their juicy perfectly seasoned chicken and before I knew, I inhaled the whole thing. I almost bought a second one but decided to save room for dessert around the corner at Insomnia Cookie. I recently sought them out again at the Freret Street Market and I ordered 4 sandwiches for my family and everyone raved about it. They thought it came from Willie Mae's. I said this chicken is way better than Willie Mae's. 

The batter is thick, the bun is grilled slightly to give it a smoked and crisp flavor, the sauce ties it all together, but spices they use to create this absolutely perfect fried chicken sandwich is why it is THE BEST fried chicken sandwich in nola.

Southerns has the BEST chicken sandwiches! You can order them non-spicy, mild, spicy, or super hot.  The aioli fries were also very good and had a tangy sauce that came with them. Definitely follow them on instagram to see where they pop up next & give them a try!

I've never written a food review before but I felt compelled in this case - Southerns chicken sandwiches may be my favorite bite of food ever - the twist they put on Nashville hot chicken is truly unique - first off using a chicken thigh instead of a breast is brilliant - it makes the sandwich juicy and manageable instead of dry and overwhelming by size and their incredible spice mixes that they offer blend superbly with their light and delicious breading - add in the homemade toppings of slaw and pickles with a buttery, toasted bun and you may as well call it perfection!  But they don't stop there - Anthony, Gene and the crew are constantly coming out with new and innovative dishes as specials to accompany their staple sandwiches - adobo cracklins, Phuket fish, the Sweet Prince, the Seoul Sister oysters, and the latest and greatest, their seasonal meat pies - Southerns never fails to impress with their knowledge of how to blend american traditional with just a hint of Asian fusion, and I'm looking forward to many years of exciting new dishes from them.
     Besides the terrific food, the Southerns staff are incredibly warm and friendly and really care about the product they're putting out as well as the community they serve.  They're really involved with doing co-ops with other small businesses as a way of cross promotion to help bring all their products into the light.
     So if you want a sandwich that will literally change your life like it did mine, I strongly suggest you look up and follow Southerns - you will never be disappointed!

Outstanding chicken!  So tender, moist, and flavorful.  I'm not a real aioli kind of guy but their aioli-based Phuket sauce was terrific.

I don't even drink but I will visit any brewery where these guys are parked!

This was probably the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. I make a mean chicken sandwich myself but it's a lot of work and can be pretty messy to prepare, so if I can't prepare my own, I'm for sure looking for Southerns. Thank you for for your awesome food and service.

I got the Otis Redding. Big piece of chicken, fried perfectly, the coleslaw compliments the sandwich so well. If your local and looking for a SPICY chicken sandwich, I'd go for the Rick James; the Otis was very good, but not "Nola spicy"

Omg omg omg.

A fried chicken sandwich that was phenomenal and most importantly available on a Sunday. Every bite was fresh and the thickness of the chicken, "breading" ratio, and the sandwich itself was everything.

I went to Zony Mash which was near my friends house and had seen on social media they'd be there. I grabbed a few sandwiches and some fries and damn this was a legit meal.

Since it's a food truck it's quite easy for them to follow COVID-19 practices.

You should totally give them a try!

This place brings the flavor. They make everything from scratch down to the pickles and you can taste the love they put into it. They are known for their award winning Nashville spicy chicken sandwiches. These are delicious. But the owner Anthony works hard to bring out different specials which are equally amazing. The food isn't the only thing that's going to win you over. This company cares about the community. They donate to Bridge House, and have been serving not only the community but the front line workers endlessly during this pandemic.
Best chicken sandwich hands down!  These guys bring the heat on anything they put their minds to. A must try if you're lucky enough to catch them not sold out when they pop up!
Dude this chicken sandwich and cracklin's blew my socks off. Best chicken Sando in the city. I highly recommend

Easily the best fried chicken sandwich you can get in New Orleans. There's a reason they won at the fried chicken festival. 

They are frequently at wrong iron and second line brewery, which is extremely convenient as it is in my hood. I typically stick with the middle of the road Otis Redding option. It is more than spice enough for me and I'm nervous to try rick James. Also, don't skip on the aioli fries pairs perfectly with that crunchy juicy chicken sandwich.
