In this review I'd like to personally nominate Southerns to join the fried chicken sandwich wars and I know they'd come out on top. 

Side note, I'm kind of glad they pop around from place to place because if they had one stand alone location I'd eat there way too much and turn into a fried chicken sandwich.

I loved Southerns when I first found them at a festival at the old mint. Since that time they have grown from a tent with a frier to a full food truck but unfortunately with that growth the quality has gone down. Going from a huge chicken breast that was three times larger than the bun to a puny cheap chicken thigh that barely seen from the bun was troubling. Latest sandwich after I took a break from them no longer even had the spicy flavors like they were once famous for. Its amazing how places change when they become popular. $12 with tax and tip for a small chicken thigh sandwich is pretty much the end for me. Ill go back to the Popeyes line.

Previously known for their chicken sandwiches, Southerns has a new breakout hit and that's their viet Pinoy Cajun crawfish. Don't skip over these mud bugs. Honestly the best batch I've had all season. This take on traditional crawfish adds Vietnamese spices to send your taste buds on fire but in the best way possible. The flavor is incredible and reminds me of my fav Vietnamese dish. 22$ is def worth it for those crawdads. The chicken sandwich also sent me over the moon. Cooked to perfection this sandwich has the right amount of crunch balanced with smooth aioli sauce. I'll def be back to their next pop up I'm for sure hooked

This food truck was a real let down. The crawfish is $9/pound. That may fly with tourists but locals know that is crazy expensive. Crawfish are typically $5-$6/pound. So that was a drag. We ordered chicken sandwiches. Both were really greasy and even though we ordered mild - they were very spicy. I don't dig on spice so mild is how I always go and this was hot. That being said, I understand that heat is relative and I guess I should have ordered the "no seasoning" at all. That doesn't make up for the incredible amount of grease. In the end, four of us had sandwiches and four of us got sick - vomiting sick. I gave 'em two stars for the cracklins but those were just okay. Maybe it was an off night for the sandwiches. The cost of the crawfish was unforgivable.

I've eaten the sandwich multiple times and I think the first time was the best. Buuuut the rest weren't bad I think the chicken was thicker at the beginning of time for Southerns. Demand is hot so I completely understand. Staff is VERY nice and gets your order out in the fastest way possible. The sandwich is HOT temperature wise all the time which just ensures me that it's made fresh. Definitely ordering it everytime but I'm needing to try the wings or the sweet spicy version as well!

These guys are doing it by keeping things simple and delicious. 

The Adobo Cracklings will get you hooked in seconds. Perfectly fried and a good balance of meat and fat only thing missing were a few slices of lime. 

Now the show stopper Is the Chicken Sandwich. Seriously the best one I've ever had. Juicy, crunchy, packed with flavor and balanced well with then coleslaw my only regret was getting the Spicy and not SUPER FREAKIN' HOT but will next time. 

Follow them, find them and eat it all!

I picked up the Rick James (b*tch) at Palmer Park today and it was seriously THE BEST chicken sandwich I've ever eaten! If you ever have the opportunity to eat their food, DO IT!! Crunchy and juicy and so tasty!

Was a bit excited to try this place given the reviews. Welp I hunted them down and waited in line for a fresh hot sandwich to be made. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich (minus the slaw) with French fries. My sandwich was tasty not as spicy and I thought it would be but still good. I'm not in a rush to eat it again but I would try it maybe a bit more spicier next time.
Best fried chicken sandwich in New Orleans. They have varying levels of heat, my favorite it the Otis Redding. There fries are absolutely amazing. I will be back often.

BEST fried chicken sammy in nola! Comes in different heat flavors, each named after a diff musical artist.  They also have the sweet heat sandwich which is awesome as well.  Great flavor and crunch.  They only do pop-ups so you have to follow them on social media to see where they're at.

After seeing this pop-up win awards at the Po-boy Festival and the Fried Chicken Festival, I decided that I needed to try them.  Are they good?  Yes.  Are they great?  Meh.  I got the Otis Redding.

Pros: Well-seasoned, generous chunk of chicken, not dried out, coleslaw topping.

Cons: Greasy, advertised as "spicy" but not spicy at all.

They do have a "super spicy" option on the menu, so that might be a better option for locals wanting a spicy sandwich.  

Overall I'd say Southerns is good, but I had to make a special trip to try them and they're just not good enough to make me do so again.  Especially since Bonafried - which I think is just as good - sometimes parks near my office.

Mmm mmm mmm this was so delicious. The chicken is so moist and tender and freshly cooked. I wanted to get a second one so bad but you see the way my arteries are set up....

The crinkle cut fries were good too. The aioli sauce was pretty good, tasted like regular Mayo after the first few dips but it's a suitable replacement for not having ketchup. I didn't ask for ketchup though so I don't know if they offer it. 

I definitely plan on being back.

I happened to be at Wrong Iron when this place had a pop up.  I always enjoy a good Hot Chicken ever since I had some in  Nashville.  They offered 3 varieties of spice.  The chicken was nice and crispy.  I saw they offer Aioli fries as well.  Solid Hot Chicken sandwich that I would get again.  Price was reasonable.  It'll run you about $9.

I am a huge pastrami fan and this place does it right. Even half a sandwich should be enough to fill most people but if you have a big appetite the full sandwich will surely quench your hunger. The staff has been there for ages and are quite comfortable at doing their job well. Seating is always available except during the world cup when the place is just filled with excited soccer fans.

I would suggest staying away from the pizza's however, their sandwiches are tried and true and they are qutie good.

Pretty good chicken gyro plate, although the tsatsiki was a little creamier and not as cucumbery as I would have liked it to be.  Plenty of seating in the back, good place to go for lunch when on State STreet

wait..this is the greek italian deli... and there closed... that sucks... i cant even explain how good the food was... the hot pastrami was unmatched!!! it was a family run spot since the beginning...and everyone was friendly as fuck!!!

on a cloudy, cool SB day, nothing warms ya up better than the chicken soup at this deli.  i'm salivating at the thought of it right now.

this deli has great a la carte items as well as sandwiches.  whatever you're in the mood for, you can get here.  staff is friendly and service is fast.  great way to refuel so you can continue your day walking state street!

The pastrami sandwich is well, the best I've ever had.  It's all warmly scrumptious and peppery and toasty and goo-ily provoloney and has pickles and pepperoncinis and is totally EPIC in its proportions (must be the Greek side of things). Mmmm....Even Carnegie Deli doesn't do it as well as these guys-different part of the country, but still... 

Killer Greek Salad (dolmas anyone?), various marinated olive selection in their case, and major bonus points for deviled egg option as well. The meatball sando hits the spot. But it's the GYRO that makes my tastebuds gyrate (I've never tried the cluck, but the lamb/beef dynamic option is fantastic). This is just about the best lunch in town, and you're home free with a big ol' Pellegrino and chips for less than 10 bucks. One of my favorite spots for sure. A fun stop on Farmer's Market Tuesday evenings!

Sadly, the Italian and Greek deli has closed its doors forever as of April 14, 2007. I was there myself, picking up a meatball sub soon after they'd opened for business. If it's any testament to their popularity, I saw the lunch queue 30 people deep the Thursday before they closed, and the shop had about 50 people in it within 5 minutes of opening on their last Saturday.  My meatball sub was delicious.
This store was open for business for 36 years, my mother recalls this was the only place she could buy phyllo pastry way back when. For me, I liked the shop because it was the first in Santa Barbara to carry halloumi cheese. 
Quelle bummer to lose the Italian and Greek deli! But life goes on.
The food came extremely fast via uber eats. It was hot and delicious.  Steak was cooked to perfection, baked potato was so hot. So

Well, I'll first start off saying I do not like SPICY! Even though I'm black, I don't mess with HOTT, spicy foods. So I was turned off from this place. The reviews were GREAT, that's the only reason I tried them. 

Salmon - dry and tasteless. I'm not sure what they're seasoning their food with, but it's not not style. 

Brussels Sprouts- tasteless again and hard, but it leaves a spicy after taste. 

BBQ RIBS & Wings - The ribs fell off the bones, however the taste was of pepper and more pepper,  I thought it was the sauce so I rinsed them off and it still had that gross pepper taste. Even my eyes started to water. 

Mac & cheese was pretty tasty per my son 

Potato salad was DELICIOUS, my FAVORITE!! 

Baked beans were EXCELLENT ALSO. Finally a sweet flavor that wasn't spicy and it felt like the beans melted in your mouth, they were so GOOOOD. 

I wanted to like this place, but oh well ‍. 

The two stars are for the potato salad and the baked beans, everything else was a disappointment. 

Maybe you guys should do a smoked sweet flavor. But to have it smoked AND peppery was not cool, I choked...BUT that's just me ‍

Really good chicken wings. We tried the sweet heat and the bbq wings and fries. The fries were ok nothing to write home about but the chicken was very well doused with a baked on sauce. They only offer 4 flavors of wings bbq, sweet heat, lemon pepper and plain but they will hit the spot during a last minute craving.
I'm writing this review as I eat and I must say this is delicious,well packaged,and black owned
The best food you could possibly eat. The way that this food hits your soul is absolutely amazing. I would recommend this 100%. Please don't miss out on a once in a life time experience.

I LOVE THE SMOKE BOOTH. 
There truly just aren't enough words. Their food is consistent and arrives hot and just always AMAZING. 
It's literally my fav delivery spot. 

Trust me. Do the salmon, philly cheese, steak, or any flavor of their wings. 

10/10.
I was pleasantly surprised with this business. The food was fresh and delicious. I will definitely order here again. Another black owned gem to supply in New Orleans East

I just ordered today from "Tha Smoke Booth" I will admit I can be a little picky when it comes to food. I ordered "Tha Smoke Booth Cheesesteak"  meat tender with a nice slight heat. Friends also ordered wings, and brisket. (we were all very happy) Definitely recommend them. We will be ordering again very soon!

Finally!!! Someone hit it out of the park! Visiting from VA and although we have been dining out and ordering delivery almost every night, we find ourselves constantly chasing that food high ...you know, that food that makes you dance while you chew. I had the ribs and the smoke on those ribs was perfection. The bbq sauce was one of my all time favorites but beware, is does pack a little heat. The baked beans were a perfect compliment and the Mac-n-cheese had a buttery yummy taste. We also ordered wings (Lemmon pepper) and wow...they were zingy:) Don't judge but we also ordered the charbroiled oysters and although they were delivered (DoorDash) they were still hot, fresh and perfectly done.

This was my experience with a residential home restaurant. I loved it. The family is kind and thoughtful, and the food is delicious and plated/packaged professionally. I got the salmon salad and the lemon pepper wings n fries combo. The salmon was smoked/baked to perfection, with a great seasoning base, with the skin side left on and crisp, all the flavorful fats have fully cooked so the flesh slides off easily if that skin is not your thing. Salad is as pictured: cherry tomatoes, a single boiled egg split in two, shredded mild cheddar, slices baby cucumbers and small croutons. Shredded romaine. The lemon pepper wings were delicious, smoked to a crispy perfection, and the seasoning blend has a sweet note that pairs well with what tasted like applewood smoke so you're having the smoked and seasoned skin crunching into a juicy lemon peppery chicken wing, it was just right. The wings are so good I can't remember how many pieces there were, maybe 6-8? The fries are McDonald shaped, seasoned with Cajun seasoning/Tony's. All in all a good experience. If you decide to pick up, you just park on the street, residential neighborhood, there's a small sign on the mailbox which I didn't see at first, the driveway may or may not have a car parked but the waist high iron gate has a white doorbell button that I didn't need because the family has a set up mother in law suite looks like attached to a longer garage/smokehouse, anyway they can see you clearly if you're standing, everyone was wearing protective gear and their face mask (which just recently was no longer mandated so I wouldn't trip, just wear your own) and asked who you were picking up for. The receipt says prepaid or not so no funny business. I think if you order over the phone by calling in they keep the need for giving change to a minimum, so come with easy cash to minimize friction. I'm definitely going back and spreading the word. This is the wave of the future for those with an entrepreneurial spirit!

This guy knows what he's doing, and is always super cool. Tried most every bbq spot around town, and he is consistently my favorite. It's simple, but delicious. Killer bbq sauce. Not cheap, not too bad though... but that's literally his motto. "Good food ain't cheap; cheap food ain't good". He floats between a few locations depending on the day

Visited tonite at the Dog Bar in St. Pete . Ordered 2 racks of ribs , Mac n cheese , yellow rice and baked beans . Food was phenomenal ! Service friendly and quick . Spoke with the "Boss" Tim and he was super nice and so thankful we stopped . We drove from downtown Tampa and we will drive back there again to try some Jerk Chcken, sausage and pulled pork!

Jeff and Sharyn
Tampa , FL

Tim's Ribs are heavenly!! He catered a pool party for us for about 85 people. Ribs, Brisket, Chicken, rice, green beans, roasted sweet corn, boiled corn and others items. However the ribs are amazing. Meat you can dream about. Tim provide large coolers for us and when he picked them up, I got some more ribs!! Also the roasted sweet corn was a must!

Such a delicious culinary experience from a food truck! The service was great, and the food was so flavorful! I had the chance to enjoy the surf & turf bowl and ribs! Can't wait to spot them again!! Keep up the great work, Boss!!

Man, my Favorite race day food at #GPStPete EVERY YEAR!! Outstanding chopped pork; bbq sauce is dialed in perfectly. 
The Update-had the RIBS today and they are meaty, juicy, perfectly flavored with caramelized chunks near the ends..!!! Incredible! Love the regular sauce so much but must try the hot bbq sauce tomorrow. Thanks Tim-dialed in indeed!! 
Great employees, great food. Try them ASAP

I have only been to Amy's one time, so far. It was kind of late the other night and it hit the spot. 

My son ordered a really basic dog with just the bacon, ham, and cheese. I had all the toppings except the jalapenos. Basically, the dogs are wrapped in bacon and then there are several toppings that make them even more unique. 

I cannot remember how much they cost. I do remember, though, that it was a bit pricey for hot dogs, but not too pricey as long as you are not buying several. If I remember correctly, it was a little over $14 for the 2 hot dogs and one coke.

Amy (I am assuming was the one serving us) was wonderful! Really nice and great customer service. Amy, as well as the more unique take on hot dogs, will be why I return.

I'm not a hot dog person but when it comes to Amy's, we get down! Been looking for them for a while, they used to be located on Oddie but moved a while ago. I Happened to be driving home the other day and spotted them setting up on Pyramid, took a note and went there for a bite last night.

They're pretty popular so be ready to wait at least 20 minutes for your order, especially if they're busy which they seem to be around the clock. The wait is worth it though! Their service, as always, great and friendly! The food itself, so full of flavor and interestingly enough, you taste a bit of everything in every single bite.

If you're kosher, this place isn't for you. All they serve are hot dogs wrapped in ham and bacon (such a delicious combo). If you don't like spicy, be sure to let them know as they add a green sauce, jalapeños and a "serrano toreado" (grilled serrano pepper) on top.
Amy's hot dogs are delicious and tasty. The toppings are great. However, my only request is for All BEEF hot dogs. Please! I will pay the extra $2-$3! I can taste the difference m!

20min wait for a dinky little dog swimming in ketchup and mayo that falls apart on the first bite.  For 7$ they could of at least used the big Costco dogs. Hot dogs should be hot and ready to bun the second you order 2 min wait tops
These hot dogs are delicious! Authentic Mexican hot dogs. They are wrapped in bacon and come with grilled onions, jalapeños, avocado salsa, and cheese. Highly recommend them! I'll be back!
Best Mexican hot dogs in town :D the lady and her husband are very friendly and make me feel extremely welcomed. We will continue to eat here at least once a week

Oh my goodness best Mexican hotdogs we've had since our stay in Mexico! Very traditional in taste, and absolutely flavorful that will melt in your mouth! There's always a line which is a huge indicator that the food is worth the small wait. Even if you forget your cash, they have the Square that makes purchasing so much easier and you pay after you eat- just Incase you want more! Such a warm and welcoming establishment! We definitely loved the food and will be back soon!

Definitely a go-to for those late night cravings. 

Amy's hot dogs are one of the best hotdogs I've had. They give a different twist to your average hotdog with ketchup, mustard, and relish. They add grilled, caramelized onions, ham and cheese, and wrap the sausage in bacon. All the flavors mixed together is heaven in your mouth! 

After speaking with the owners who are also husband and wife, I was really impressed by their story. They've been selling these hotdogs for 12 years now and it's always the two of them working. You can tell that they actually enjoy doing this by the satisfaction they get when they know their customers leave happy. 

Their hours are Thursday-Sunday 6pm-9:30pm and they are parked right outside Big O Tires on Pyramid Way. 

Highly recommend trying these out for yourself!

Wow these guys are really doing it up and working extremely hard in the process .. kudos to them .. two workers .. woman taking the orders and a man cooking up the dogs.. come check this out this is not ordinary hot dogs.. they have bacon ham tomatoes onion jalapeños a guacamole sauce etc etc I'm sure I missed some.  Crazy!  They smell soooo good and taste doesn't disappoint!  $6 for a hot dog with more fixings than you can imagine.  Come support these people busting their behinds on these hot summer nights!!

I ordered 20 hot wings wich came dry, burned, old and hard. They sent a second order wich came dripping sauce all over my steps and the bag busted dripping juice everywhere. I spent 10 minutes clean my walk way,  steps and the trail from my front door to my kitchen.  I called to speak with the manager and give him my experience and just brushed me off. This is the worsed experience of my life in ordering take out or as a delivery driver. I well never order from this place again.
I ordered pizza and a couple of additional items. The food was good and the delivery was quick! One thing I found convenient is the fact they stay open late, overall good experience

Got delivery of some cheesy fries and a milkshake from Sorrento. As it was late at night, this was one of the only places open. Overall, average quality ingredients and alright mega fries. Was wary since other reviews were lower, but for average pizza shop stuff late at night, it's pretty alright
The WORST customer service I have ever experienced. Pizza was over an hour late and the employee told me to "just wait" and then hung up on me.  Never recommend this place.

Margarita pizza was something out of Kitchen Nightmares but I wasn't expecting much. 

Quesadilla was alright.
My pizza never arrived.... I waited for 2 hours before calling Grubhub. Avoid at all costs.
Food came 2 hours later, chicken fingers half cooked & forgot my whole pizza.. Left the food on the wrong step. Customer service is at the floor
I just love the pretzel dogs. A hot dog with cheese wrapped in a pretzel; life does not get any better than that.

Very dissatisfied with the customer service.   Let me start by saying that there is a lot of pretzel competition out there.  I will never buy 1 pretzel from this company again, after I went in there with a 3 day expired living social voucher and they would not honor it!!   I am in a customer service position and honor these if only as a good will gesture!

I get all soft and twisted out of shape when I get one of my cravings coming on, be it for world peace or a warm soft salted pretzel right out of the oven. Luckily I live in an area that is abundant when it comes to filling those soft pretzel cravings and even though I much prefer the salty and savory treats, the warm cinnamon and sugar dusted pretzels are a nice reward, especially when spread with cream cheese.
 
The soft pretzel has come a long way, some saying the Mayflower actually brought over the recipe, wouldn't the pilgrims be surprised to watch us dunk our pretzels in cheese sauce or lather them with mustard, although who knows, maybe they spread them with something even better, like a goose, duck or whitefish pate' or wrapped in bacon. hmmm...
 
What I know they didn't have, for sure were hot dogs, sausages and cheesesteaks wrapped in soft pretzel dough! They also did not have men selling dusty cold salted soft pretzels from the medial strip of a busy eight lane highway, which I was foolish enough to do when we first moved to the burbs of Philly. There are way too many locations around now with hot ovens and pretzels in many shapes and sizes, some coated in garlic, I'll bet that would be good dipped in butter.
 
But they also didn't have world peace during the early 17th century. I'm still working on that craving, think I'll buy a soft pretzel or two and work on that a bit more. I wonder how apple butter would be on a cinnamon and sugar soft pretzel?
3 months later, no response or rebuttal. That should tell you something.
Love this location. Always fresh, perfect pretzels and add ons. I'm a sucker for the pretzel hot dog. The owners are amazing and the staff is always friendly. My favorite pretzel spot ever.

Ordered a party tray on Thursday for a Saturday 3pm pickup. My wife was in the area at 2:30 so she popped in to see if they were ready, which they weren't. She offered to wait the 10 minutes while they were prepared but was told no, we had to pick them up at 3pm. I understand that there is probably a timing issue and it was also a Saturday so lots of orders to fill but when the owner is RUDE about it and there is a case FULL of rivets, it's weird. 

Jump ahead 30 minutes and I go back to pick up my 3pm order, promptly at 3pm, to not be reprimanded. When I ordered my tray on Thursday, I ordered 3 dipping sauces. 2 cheese and 1 cinnamon. I bring home the tray to 10 excited 9 and 10 year olds and I open up the sauces. 1 spicy mustard, 1 honey mustard, and 1 chocolate (who puts chocolate on pretzels)?

Extremely disappointed with the attitude my wife received from the manager (she is assuming it was the manager) when she showed up a little early to pick up the order. More disappointed with the inaccuracy of the order.
Asshole gave me a small bag for 10 pretzels, mustard, cheese and 2 sodas. Cheap ass pieces of crap.

This place is terrible. So my wife goes in yesterday at 4:15 and orders 3 pretzel dogs and some cinnamon rivets. The girl at the counter had zero personality or manners. My wife said thank you several times and received not one you're welcome. Their was also another customer with his 4 year old son in the store. They were blasting Eminem on the stereo with profanity including the F bomb. So I call this morning to speak with Larry the manager. I asked Larry if he was working yesterday at 4:15 and he said he was. When I explained the situation to him, he said he was in the back office. How convenient! Guess Eminem's voice doesn't travel that far. I was stunned to hear the manager was working while this was going on. I requested to speak with the owner Jason who won't be in til Friday morning. Looking forward to that conversation!

This store is terrible. I stopped in once last year and the guy behind the counter gave me crap because I ordered 6 pretzels and he said it would be 10-15 minutes and I wasn't gonna wait.  I work on the road and was just looking for a quick grab.  Well I found myself in the area yesterday 4-1-19 at a little after 3. Hadn't eaten all day but was a little behind so I figured I'd stop in and grab something quick.  The door was propped open and you could hear the country music blaring from outside. The counter was full of sodas they were selling for half price because they were expired. There were 2 pretzel dogs that were charred black. No one in the store!  I waited a few minutes and even called out hello a few times.  No one ever showed so I left.  NEVER again will I waste my time or money in this store.

Under new management makes such a huge difference!!!! Wont go anywhere else for a real pretzel.  New owners are amazing and working hard to bring the real Philly Pretzel back to Richboro.  Friendly customers service.  Love the place

Stopped in at 9 am on a Sunday morning for a nice fresh soft pretzel. Was given 2 cold, hard, stale tasting pretzels on which most of the salt was melted away (" old"). How is this possible? Almost drove the 15 minutes back from my house to the store just to make THEM throw this garbage out.
Great place and great staff! Pretzels are always fresh and staff is always polite. A pleasure to do Buisness with

This store is terrible. I stopped in once last year and the guy behind the counter gave me crap because I ordered 6 pretzels and he said it would be 10-15 minutes and I wasn't gonna wait.  I work on the road and was just looking for a quick grab.  Well I found myself in the area yesterday 4-1-19 at a little after 3. Hadn't eaten all day but was a little behind so I figured I'd stop in and grab something quick.  The door was propped open and you could hear the country music blaring from outside. The counter was full of sodas they were selling for half price because they were expired. There were 2 pretzel dogs that were charred black. No one in the store!  I waited a few minutes and even called out hello a few times.  No one ever showed so I left.  NEVER again will I waste my time or money in this store.
It's funny....a few days after I post my review, 2 people "update" their review saying how great the store and management are.  Shady as hell!  You can see why this place is so bad!
The best!  Always a favorite stop for fresh, soft & warm pretzels even during this COVID mess.  Happy to support them and appreciate the quality and cleanliness!
Best place to have ramen and rice bowls in Wesley Chapel! Ordered three dishes to go and service was great too.
Hope I can give 0 star.  Too  sweet boba tea，I throw it away，and too bad noodles，I will never try next time.
The ramen is delicious. Milk tea from Kung fu tea is always good. I'm so excited it opens at wiregrass mall

Token Ramen & Tea (Kung Fu Tea) opened two days ago at The Shops at Wiregrass!

They are located right in the main entrance between Grillsmith and Cantina Laredo. The interior is nicely decorated with ample amount of seating on the inside and they have four tables on the patio for outside dining.

We got our food to go:
- Ninja Chicken Nuggets
- Takoyaki
- Black Garlic Ramen
- Mega Pork Ramen
- Honey Oolong Tea with Boba
- Passionfruit Green Tea with Boba

Overall the food is really good even with just take out instead of dine in. We are glad that their food and drinks are consistent with other Token Ramen locations!

The Mega Pork Ramen was really good: the broth is super milky but a tiny bit salty in my opinion. However, you can taste the different flavors of the pork chashu slices from the Pulled Pork Chashu and the Mega Pork Chashu. The eggs are perfectly seasoned as well. 

The broth in the Black Garlic Ramen is definitely smells garlicky and looks on point, but I expected more of the black garlic taste in the ramen. It is still good overall but I had high expectations lol

I'm going to get a little technical with drinks because I have a family member who works at KFT in SoFlo:

The drinks are made perfectly just we ordered:
- Honey Oolong Tea with no milk, no ice, boba, and 100% sugar 
- Passionfruit Green Tea with no ice, boba, 30% sugar (less sweet)

The two girls at the front making the bobas were very consistent and well versed in their orders: they poured all of the drinks over ice first before capping them off. Overall I am super appreciative of the bobaristas because not every place gets our order correctly and usually leaves something out. 

Here are a couple of tips to keep in mind before you visit:

- You will need to fight the mall parking because they are inside wiregrass. So be prepared to drive around to find parking!

- They just opened two days ago (on Friday) so  they are very overwhelmed in the kitchen so BE PREPARED to wait for your food! 
The drinks are not an issue and come out within 5-8 minutes max, but the food took over 40 min for it to come out. You will need to order first before you can sit down at a table so the cashier will tell you that the food will take about 40min wait. The service is super nice and friendly and they are very apologetic about the delay.

- You might be able to order ahead (if you are lucky) because they are super busy and sometimes they don't pick up the phones. We tried calling them a few times and we decided to just head over there and order in person instead.

Overall we are super glad that this place opened up and now we get our boba within 5 min from our house! We will definitely return again for the food in a few weeks when they have adjusted to their routines.

Great new place for boba on the go. It's hard to find good boba with good options. Boba menu can be a little confusing with all the options, additions, different teas similar flavor profile. 

Food is pretty good too, perfect for lunch on the go, servings are pretty large too.

I come here at least weekly. Flavors are consistent and they don't over charge for a good quality Ramen. The only downfall is they don't have a loyalty program for the Ramen but even then, it's still worth going specially for their weekday lunch specials!

Their boba is the best I've had in the Wesley Chapel area! I love how you can customize the ice and sugar amount. I ordered the pork buns and they were good, very fresh. Can't wait to keep trying more items off their menu.
Delicious! So excited to get this chain boba down here, only seen them in bigger cities!

The food here is either too sweet or too salty. Especially the braised pork and egg bowl, it was extremely salty and we couldn't even eat it. We talked to the waitress and tried to get a new dish, she made us pay for both. Won't come back here for sure.

I ordered the Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen. BY FAR the worst Ramen I've ever had. Tonkotsu is normally very flavorful but this one was as bland as can be. No flavor at all. Not spicy at all so idk why it's labeled that. Very disappointing. I'm used to pork broth having a good amount of oil but this was excessive. It had a huge layer of oil. The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the passion fruit green tea punch was good.
Great boba tea and food. We got tue mega pork ramen and fried chicken ( it like Taiwan fried chicken).

Was really happy they opened this location at Wiregrass since the one by usf was a little bit of a drive. We have only eaten there once, usually we do pick up via DoorDash. My only wish was that they had all their Milk teas listed on door dash bc they only have a few.

The food and drinks are delicious. The orders are also made fast and stay hot for a long time. I always had Togo and even when I got home, my order was still very warm. The entire soups is so flavorful and filling. Everything is absolutely delicious.
Nice staff! they will make your drink to your liking. The manager Cindy is really sweet. Love this place.The art on the inside is beautiful.

This may be third ramen place near New Tampa and Wesley Chapel. It is great to see the mall has this chain in working. More choices to people of the area. The only thing I would said, they need to work on the quantity of the food for the price paid. 

We started with the two drink. My wife have the cocoa slush with boba. It is good. But I like my Caramel Macchiato Slush better. Rich in flavor. 

Our appetizers is the ninja nuggets. This Taiwanese street food is delicious. My wife have Mega Pork Ramen. There are charshu pork and charshu pulled pork. This may be the best value. The broth is pork bone base. I have the grilled shrimp ramen. It come with 8 pieces pan seared grilled shrimp. Both our broth is added black garlic. Extra $1 for black garlic to be added. 

Food is great. Measure the price to value and quantity is 4 stars.

4.5 stars

After giving this place another try, I decided to bump up my rating. This time I got the spicy tonkotsu ramen to-go and it was excellent. The broth was unreal! At almost $14, it is a little small (at least the to-go portion), but it was definitely worth it. The noodles, mushrooms, egg, etc. were also great. Perfectly balanced flavors!

Still going to stay away from the pork buns, but will return for the ramen.

I am very particular about Ramen...I wasn't expecting much from Token Ramen as Ive never heard about it before but they put one at the Wiregrass Mall. So I decided to give it a try. I did take my food to go...and even with that I was actually surprised. It was not the most delicious ramen I've had but it wasn't bad either. It had all of the key components and was flavored well.

I also had a pork bun and the bun had the right consistency and stickiness I am accustomed to, the meat was a little underwhelming but again not bad either.

What really made the meal is in the name of the restaurant...the Kung Fu Tea. The team really is BOMB! The first sip I was like wow...so much flavor and so refreshing. 

I've eaten twice at Token Ramen...each time, I kind of had some after effects that happened...but if in a pinch and I really want some Ramen...I know I have something that is decent nearby that I can go to and just be prepared to use the restroom after.

Im not sure if it was just an off night for literally all 6 young ladies behind the counter, but this was THE worst experience I've ever had in a counter order restaurant. I'd never been there before. I told the girl taking our order that. I spent $115 dollars on 4 bowls of ramen, 4 appetizers, and 3 drinks. I tipped, which turned out to not phase those girls in the slightest towards giving us any service. We sat.  Our appetizers came out. She gave us no napkins or silverware, or side plates to eat off of. One of our appetizers never even came to the table. After our ramen was delivered I returned to the counter to say we don't need the other appetizers that didn't come. She didn't offer me a refund. The shrimp in my ramen was very over cooked. It tasted okay, but I was so put off by the terrible service that I'd Never go back.
We went to Token Ramen again today for lunch and they were amazing! Food comes out within 10 minutes of order and everything was so good! Thank you Token for stepping it up!

To keep it short and sweet, it's good not great. They're skimpy on the meat for their rice bowl, but the flavor was good. The ramen isn't made from scratch, so don't expect the same level of authenticity you'll find at some more traditional restaurants. However, to put something positive, the taste of their spicy ramen broth was delicious and brought back nostalgic memories for me (Oakland/SF kid). All in all, I would come back and recommend to those craving a ramen lunch/dinner.
King Fu Tea - same company as the one in LA / OC. This has to be the best / most legit boba in Tampa. 626 approved

We were excited to try this ramen spot. We entered the restaurant today at approximately 2:24 pm and we weren't greeted. However we overlooked that and proceeded to look at the menu. We figured out what we wanted and stood at the register as the girl standing there kneeled down while she was on her phone. Still know one has acknowledged us. After standing there for a few minutes, I asked if she was taking orders since she was standing at the register. She said no and turned her back. That's when we decided this place clearly doesn't want our business, and after the encounter we definitely don't want to give it them. Headed to MICHI RAMEN DOWN THE ROAD

Finally a good ramen place in town. It's really good.
Better than Ichicoro which is overrated.

They weren't busy, took 20+ minutes to get the food out and they delivered the wrong tea for my wife. Food is not good quality, we didn't even finish the meals.

Do not recommend.

Being that I don't eat pork, I don't have many options when I check out ramen spots, and usually don't like their chicken or veggie ramen bowls, but Token has a wonderful chicken ramen! The broth was a chicken broth and very flavorful. The chicken was wonderfully seasoned and delicious on its own. 

I went with my husband and brother so we each ordered something different and shared.
My husband got the grilled shrimp ramen, which was basically my ramen but with shrimp. My brother got the tender beef and onion rice bowl and it was DELICIOUS too. I will probably get that rice bowl next time we go if I'm not craving ramen again. 

Boba we ordered from left to right: Peach Oolong Punch Tea w/ Lychee Jelly, Red Bean Wow Milk w/ Boba, and Taro Milk Tea w/ Boba

Takes a few minutes to get the orders ready, but we were okay with that. Service is friendly as well. Nice to have a nearby ramen spot now.

Dishes were expensive and quite bland. The rice bowls we had the pineapple chicken and grilled chicken which were ok nothing special much 

For the cost of 5 for takeout I could have had a full service sit down dinner nearby.

Normally the cost is not an issue ... if the food was out of this world I wouldn't have mentioned but it was really much of anything unique we were expecting

First time here and was not disappointed! Restaurant was a bit messy when I arrived but nothing too serious, I love the setup of the place, it's cozy and inviting. I got the Thai Milk tea which I loved, the only bad thing I would comment on is their wait times, it took me about 15 minutes just to receive my two drinks. Staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. If you're in the area I'd come in and try them out!

It's great that there's a ramen place In Wesley chapel. however, it's pretty mediocre. Not authentic and quite pricey for a medium bowl of ramen. The pork bun was okay. Great bun, but the pork was flavorless. There are a lot of better ramen places in Tampa that are well worth the drive.

Really, really pricey for a bunch of filler. I ordered a beef/broccoli rice bowl and most of it was rice. Like, more than reasonably expected. I could literally count the strips of beef in it and the broccoli was near to mush, if not shriveled. Their ramen is okay. I'd say the best thing here is their boba but there's still definitely better around for price.

So, I was going to write a poor review while I was in the restaurant waiting for the food. Before I even tasted it for the first time. I am glad I waited.  Granted with the employment issues across the country, the wait time from order to getting our food was over 20mins. 

I did observe a gentleman who showed up in running shorts and a t-shit, come in and quickly began helping in the kitchen. This may have been a supported manger or dedicated owner. His help appeared to have sped things up. 

I must say, while we are an part Asian family who have dined in many Asian joints across the US; this place is really really good! The meats are perfect and so are the noodles. It tastes like some back type family restaurant in CA or NY. 

Give this place a try, be patient since perfection is not rushed! Glad that we did. 

Oh, and I love the Daren Lin art.....
Nice place to get a cool boba tea! Had the rosehip milk with regular boba, light ice, great menu with lots of variety.
Excelente lugar para comer Ramen, ameno y agradable. No probamos los te, será para la próxima oportunidad

What originally attracted us to this place was for the ramen and not so much for the boba teas... The drinks here are good and very consistent but I'm personally not a huge fan of boba drinks so I don't crave them as much, not that I would ever turn one down though.

The Ramen here is good and the closest you can find in the Wesley Chapel area.  But I think their under appreciated food item is there rice bowl.  Their rice bowls are very flavorful and well made, it's my favorite item on the menu...

3.5 stars

Pretty good ramen! Not the best, but still good. The pork buns were not great and pretty pricy for the size - will not be getting those again. I will be back for ramen and to try their teas, unless I find a better place by the time I'm craving it again.
I'm always pleased with Kung Fu Tea. My favorites are the green milk tea and yogurt tea!

This place is a solid 2.5 star. If you have a Ramen itch then this will hold you over till you find a better place.  

Pork Bao Buns were bland and uninspired. Literally just a piece of lettuce and sliced pork. Like zero thought was put into this item. 

Ramen was ok. I'd put this up as a glorified home ramen from the 10¢ bags. Mind you I've gone to some nice restaurants and had legit ramen, Bao buns, Pho, well you name it.  So my pallet might be a little more refined then some.  But this is Jones just an ok place.  You will not get that "mmmmm" factor if that's what your looking for.  Or the first bite, closed eyes, and drift into flavor highway.  The food is bland and leaves you lacking.  

Not a engineer of words here so excuse my grammar and word play. Just trying to convey that if you want good ramen or food in general you need to keep walking by.

The spring rolls were good, the pork baboons were good but that one piece of mini cucumber did not give the crunch factor. The pork chashu ramen was a lukewarm, tepid broth. I'm not sure what the red strands were in the broth but by golly they were bitter.  I asked for spicy chili oil on the side....$1.50 extra...I didn't know I paid extra until I looked at the receipt! It's not the money but the principle
Large potions, fair prices, & friendly staff at a place full of authentic decor and meals!

So... we cannot order Margaritas yet, due to alcohol license application. BUT... its worth trip for the food. WHEN we can order marg's the fifth star will be awarded. We have been here twice and tonites new entree was Pollo Fundido. Which was crispy marinated chicken like flauta rice and I added jalapeños for zinger. Ole!!!

We tried a New Mexican restaurant in Whitestown. They also have a restaurant at 64th and Keystone which we have not tried. We tried the Texas Margarita chimichanga. It was good. I also got the Texas Margarita with Grand Marnier, it was also good. One waitress seemed to be serving the whole restaurant at 5 on a Tuesday. She was doing a great job, very attentive! Others workers came in as we were leaving. We will definitely give it a few more tries as we look for a favorite Mexican restaurant!

This is my go to restaurant lately. Let's start with their Margaritas - oooh, it's strong and only one is enough (and I do drink a lot). I liked the Texas Margarita as it's just right for my taste to have a little buzz but not too much to be losing focus on ongoing conversation /family time. Silver Patron Margarita is stronger to my taste, my husband loved it though. Food is good and portion is huge for the price you pay- Shrimp Fajitas is my favorite and Quesadilla is my husband's favorite here. Service is great and do listen to their recommendations- they are very honest and you won't regret going with their suggestions. Dessert - I haven't had such good flan in the area anywhere. Oh and a plus point, they make you feel special on your birthday by singing Happy Birthday, playing music, making you wear a hat and wrapping up with a free shot of tequila (if you are of age otherwise some dessert), only for you!
Without a doubt the best Mexican food I've had in Indy.  Service was great and fast.  Will definitely be back here!

They have Marg's and they are healthy pours with great mix. I had Gold Texas Margarita, and I usually opt for Sauza, but opted for Cuervo Gold and it was tasty. We have had great dinners both times... now with drinks, we plan to make this our primary haunt. Decor alone, is like going on vacation.

This spot is probably my next go-to Mexican Restaurant!!  I think due to Covid, they are still waiting on their liquor license to serve alcohol, but honestly the food made up for it so I didn't even care.

The chips and salsa was above average; the queso with grilled jalepenos on the side was very solid - not watered down at all!

Wife and I got enchiladas and fajitas and mine were actually sizzling for minutes after I received them.  Will go back many many times.  

Service, speed, quality, and atmosphere was great!

I really like this place! The margaritas are made from fresh ingredients and the do not skimp on the tequila.The food is also fresh and very tasty and the staff is always friendly. This has quickly become our Friday night spot.
A lot of competition for Mexican food in our area now. This has become our go to place! Chicken soup is enough for 2-3 people. They will make your guacamole to your taste. Excellent! Go!

Saturday 16,2021 they have a sign posted masks required, but 9 people came in 4 at one table 5 at the other and not one person hand a mask on!  They sat right next to us about 3 feet away!  This is not a safe food establishment for Face covering and Social Distancing for us, we will not be returning!

This new Mexican restaurant was FANTASTIC! I ordered take out at 6pm and food was ready within 10 minutes.  I ordered the chicken fajita taco salad and would absolutely order again. It even came with generous portion of a side of chips and salsa. The hard taco shell  of the taco salad kept its structure even with the take out order. Very impressed with the quality of food and quick service and will be back again! Definitely a must try!
I had the steak burrito and found the flavor was bland . Even know the service was good I would still give it another chance I feel that they work on the flavors but again still a keeper
Just a another Mexican joint nothing really set it apart from anywhere else . The drinks are good . The wait staff was awesome

I'm always a little worried about ordering seafood in a place that's 1,000 miles from the nearest major body of water. Against my better judgment, I still decided to order the seafood fajitas. At first, it seemed promising. I saw several waitresses walk by with sizzling plates of fajitas that looked delicious. Alas, I was to be disappointed. To say they were overcooked would be polite. To say they tasted like licking an ashtray would be an understatement. A more appropriate analogy would be that they tasted something like eating your last meal as a pyroclastic flow raged down Mt. Vesuvius right as the sulfuric cloud envelopes Pompeii. 

The service was also exceptionally poor. They were having issues with their card reader, and they asked to re-run my card. I pulled up my bank account on my phone and showed them the charge was already pending. They still said the needed to run it again. Naturally, I ended up with two charges on my account. I spoke with the manager, who was gloriously incompetent, and proved to be no help whatsoever.

The one bright side: the margaritas are pretty good. Perhaps you can drown your sorrows about the terrible food and worse service in your drink. But imagine this was Pompeii and this was the last meal you'd get to eat - wouldn't you want to do better?

This place is sooo good! Bonus points for recyclable containers!  Plus it was so much food, I love having enough for leftovers. I think these might have been the best beans I ever had. Not pictured: chips and salsa.

Food and service is good... but social distancing and limits on occupancy reduce rating to the point we had to leave.  We enjoyed our spontaneous takeout at home, but it's not same. I can appreciate need to stay in black for new business... but not at risk of patrons.

This little Mexican joint has really grown in the past couple years!! I love coming here, I feel like I always discover a new piece of artwork. You could do a whole review of the art decor. 

On to the food! Always so good!! And very affordable as well. The service that goes with it is also amazing. Definitely bring friends and family in here. 

I feel like I should have more to say, but it's just a nice place to come into. Just the right lighting, tons of colorful art, drinks (some non-alcoholic) and tasty, affordable food. You can't ask for more! Salut!!

My husband and I tried this spot out for the first time last night. It was great! We really enjoyed their chips, margarita, and the price was great! Our server was Douglas and he was super attentive and funny. This will be our new go-to Mexican food restaurant in Whitestown!

Hello Texas Margarita's!  Everyone loves a little Mexican food right!  And my go to dish is chicken fajitas!  I have had them from here twice, once carry out and once dine in and they are yummy!  I think they have taken over my number one ranking in the chicken fajitas rating scale.

When we dined in, the service was incredibly slow.  We waited on every aspect.  Getting our drink order, getting the drinks, getting chips and salsa, getting more chips and salsa because we were staving, getting the food.

But again, the chicken fajitas were so very good!

While we were there they seated a large party right next to our table.  So close in fact if I wanted to I could have reached out my arm and rested my hand on their back.  It made me super uncomfortable in the time of COVID, but luckily we were almost done with our meal and we could rush out.
Outside seating in Main Gate Square, friendly service, and good food. A great place for a relaxing breakfast. FYI: its BYOB
Owners changed and now the food is awful. The cook literally can't even cook an egg and the owner is very rude. I'm dissapointed

If I could give a negative rating, I would. Ordered delivered by grub hub and when we opened our food we found a long hair in the food. I called the owner who was very rude and said the chef doesn't have hair. After a few minutes of this lady being very rude, she tells me she will give me a credit for next time I eat there. I will not be eating there every again and the rest of the food was awful. Highly recommend not eating here. They have no customer service skills at all.

Absolute Idiots working here. Instead of homefries they give you french fries. Ordered two large pancakes and instead got 3 baby panakes. Food was cold. Avoid this place like the plague. When we called to try to rectify our order, the girl answering I don't think had a brain and then transferred to us to her dad who was also was extremely rude. Do yourself a favor and avoid a giant headache.
This place is terrible absolutely do not go I highly recommend somewhere else, the owner is also not a very nice person and does not care about potential customers
so good u need to come here !! my fav breakfast spot!!! everything is so good and service is amazing! always seating available

I went to this place and got some of the worst service I've ever had!! This elderly Indian woman was very brash and impatient when I was looking at the order. My coffee seemed a day old at least and had clumps at the bottom. VERY UNIMPRESSED!!!

i wrote the super good review but now can't stand it! roommate threw up twice. took 30 minutes to have them FIX OUR BILL because theywssed it up. brought us an extra side of hash browns and then charged us for it.  roommate found a hair in her food. when she told them they said oh. took 45 minutes for toast and what was supposed to be scrambled eggs. it was a weird omelet thing with nothing in it. they got mad at us for them messing up our order. three of us had to send our food back. roommate has thrown up three times. i am about to throw up. so are our friends. please do yourself a favor and do not go here.

I'm pretty sure this place changed owners and I was extremely disappointed. I ordered the ultimate Benedict and my eggs were over cooked and the spinach was drenched in oil. My eggs came with extremely soggy and full of oil hash browns. Seemed like they were cooked 6 hours before serving them on my plate - not fresh at all. The latte was amazing, but after i wanted more coffee and i got regular coffee and the mug was dirty with a ring of old coffee. I sent the coffee back and they gave me a clean cup with new coffee which i appreciated. Overall, not the greatest experience. I don't think i would go back. I would advise others to really think about spending money at this restaurant.
Great breakfast right on University! Super cute place, very quiet, workers are extremely nice!! Food was amazing!

Best breakfast in Tucson! 
And also the owner was so kind and welling to offer anything to be happy!
Excellent restaurant right by university of arizona. Good portion, decent pricing. We had a very sweet server. Fresh juices that you can choose from. I had a breakfast burrito that was soooooo good.
I didn't know what this restaurant was before. But after I tried it, I'm never going anywhere else. Best hash browns I've ever had

If you enjoy sausage breakfast burritos with hot dogs in them, this is your spot. If you enjoy long waits and ketchup bottles that say "Katchup", then you'll love it. Also, if you enjoy really bad breakfast, then you will absolutely love this place.

Do not recommend. I only ate a 1/5th of my meal and even though I was so thirsty I didn't want to drink the water.

I got the meat breakfast burrito and I should've read the description better because it was not good. It was like eating a burrito full of chopped hotdogs. The hash browns were not good either. 

The part that disappointed me the most was the water. I was so thirsty but the water tasted so bad that I really didn't want to drink it. I've been to restaurants where they give you tap water, but this water had such an odd and unpleasant taste.

The restaurant isn't the cleanest or the most pleasant setting.

Overall the food was well cooked, but the flavors were horribly executed. Instead of using a hotdog for sausage a ground sausage would be much better.

This is a great spot to chill and catch the game.  The food is really good and I can't believe what a great job they have done upgrading the interior.  I think they just opened Dec '15. This is my new favorite spot and sometimes they even  have some live entertainment.  Pretty sweet!
The food was excellent but they need an additional person. They had the same person, serving food, working the bar and cashing out customers which caused long wait times.

Well I think I found one of the best kept secrets in town. what a great little grill right on 580. beer icy cold. I got the Swiss mushroom burger and the bun was excellent and meat juicy tender. my boyfriend got the Philly steak and he loved it. neighbors got the Reuben and chicken Caesar salad. Again no complaints.  service very friendly an atmosphere was great also. Music selection great and to our liking. The only thing I would suggest is just turn the light slightly down. Definitely be back. Suggest you all give this place a try. Won't be disappointed

An excellent choice and a great surprise!  Cozy, warm and spotless. Ordered a burger - couldn't ask for a better burger!  Cooked just right, not frozen and very juicy. Fries were extra crispy just as I had requested. Service was quick and with a smile!  Definitely will be back and will recommend.

Very dark and unfriendly   Server has no personality and is not nice
Takes way to long to get food
Do not plan to return they will be closed by end summer

Went for lunch with my husband , I had the Bison burger with arugula and Brie it was so good and juice I can not take it off my mine . It was the first time I had bison . My husband had the 580 house burger and he loved it. 
The place is very clean and very friendly, the Sevice was excellent the selection of beers was great and good prices . 
I will definitely go back, this is my new favorite place.
Laid back place. Went here in the first couple weeks of opening. Wings  Philly Cheesesteak was not. Bunch of Tys and drink specials for NFL Sunday!

Good place to go for a pint. 

Pros: 
Multiple televisions around the place with a projector in the corner. 

Food was excellent. Just had some wings but better than what you'll find at Hooters. 

Staff was friendly and service was excellent.

Cons:
Atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired. Other than the brick behind the bar the walls don't really belong in a sports bar and have a lot of empty blank spaces that could be put to better use with decor. Feels like the owner or owners aren't really fans of sports and didn't know how to style their bar accordingly.

While we do live in Florida we do have chilly days and nights in the winter months. If you come during one of these days be sure to bring a jacket as having the heat on doesn't seem to be a concern to the employees. Several people around the bar mentioned the cold of the restaurant and the bartender turned the temp up a bit, but it was still cold.

All in all a good local place to go with good food and a friendly staff.

This place was a failed restaurant before this name popped up.  We went with a coupon.  It seems more like a bar than a restaurant. There is no view and the interior is dark.  Food was good. Server was friendly, but she had to spilt her time between the bar and us.  We were not "wowed" by the place so I think a return trip is not in the cards. There are some fine places near me but this is not one of them.
The food was great. The beer is ice cold. The place is clean. I just wish it was a full bar. I'm more of a bourbon guy than beer.

Phenomenal little joint!
Airy, clean, very friendly. Fair prices. 

Multiple seating areas, including a cozy street facing bar area with large windows and some outdoor tables with umbrellas. See pic. 

Menu very simple but it's a specialty eatery so that's perfect. Seems to be made with love. 

Ordered for the family and everyone was happy. 

The falafel pita and bowl were awesome. Fresh and tasty. The shwarma fries, mmm! 

Also had a tahini shake. Did not expect it to taste well but it was really good. They very cordially offered a sample as I was nervous ordering it first time. Also, nice attention to detail with the extra thick straw.

New, very small spot located right off the Main Street in Haddonfield! The staff was very friendly, and the service was fast. The falafel sandwich was filled with Israeli salad, which included onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and pickles. The tahini shake was very creamy and smooth. Definitely should try for an exciting new flavor! Be warned that they are totally kosher and close early on Fridays and are closed on Saturday's. Limited seating inside but there are a few tables outside as well!

What a wonderful addition to Haddonfield. Falafel, pita, veg, hummus is fresh and perfect for the hot summer. Service is friendly and fast. We phoned in order and picked up easily but there are a few tables inside and out that were filled. Will definitely be back.

Had hummus and falafel bowl and it was delicious! The pita was soft and fresh. Husband had falafel and hummus sandwich and really liked it too. 
The service was prompt and place was very clean. 
We will be back!

We loved everything we had.  The Falafel Bowl. Was very filling, vey  fresh and excellent. Came with a nice thick pita bread. Tried the Fries. So tasty. The end treat was the Tahini Milkshake. A yummy ending for the meal. And I love a family business.

We arrived on Sunday and were greeted by the family. Wonderful service and real Falafel. We ordered one Falafel Pita and one Falafel Plate. Both are wonderful (the Pita bread is the real deal). The Shawarma Fries is amazing (don't skip it).

Small spot in Haddonfield across from Starbucks.  There aren't many spots that have [good] falafel... falafel that isn't cooked in the same oil as meat... so yay.  Mia's is 100% vegan... again yay.  The falafel pita ($10) was amazing and I ordered falafel balls ($5) to go.  This will be my new spot in Haddonfield.  What a great addition and I'm sorry but I find the prices quite reasonable for the quality of food though a falafel pita/fries platter would be welcome!  (no photos as I inhaled my meal)
This kosher vegan restaurant is a great new addition to downtown Haddonfield.  I had the falafel pita and it was delicious.  Fast service too.

I really wanted to like this place and I want to support family run businesses. The falafel is very good.

But it's absurdly overpriced, with small portions. I got a falafel pita sandwich (in a small pita pocket), a water, and a very small side of fries - all served casually, in plastic - for $17!!! Yes, you read that right. $17. This is because everything is ala carte and the prices are already high. 

I won't return unless they change their prices. No way am I spending $17 on what should have been an inexpensive light lunch. $10 or $12 at most is what I should have paid for a small sandwich, small fries, and water. Even $12 would have been overpriced for what I got. It's a shame because the place is in a terrific location and they should be getting lots of traffic.
Phenomenal falafel. Shawarma fries! Also try the tahini smoothie. It's really excellent.

If you're looking for good falafel, you won't find it here.  It was slow in the restaurant, so precooked falafel balls and French fries sitting under a heat lamp should have been a red flag.  The lukewarm ball were bland and has a crunch inside like that of uncooked cornmeal.  The pita was very good, and they kept them in a cooler to stay warm and soft.  The tzatziki sauce was bland as well, and I don't get the abundance of dill pickle chips in the sandwich.

A nice addition to downtown. Love the simple menu, clean ingredients. A little pricey. 

I look forward to when the counter staff is more comfortable in their jobs, more welcoming and personable. A week or so after opening they are still nearly silent when you enter. Both times I visited I had to ask if they wanted/were ready for my order--and I was the only customer in the place. 

I wish them the best. Happy it's not another pizza place. Happy I can get my falafel fix without a trip to a cart in the city.

Terrific food! We went here on Sunday (today). The falafel sandwich was a well balanced blend of crisp falafel, cool salad and creamy garlic sesame paste. The tahini shake was a real treat in the summer sun. The shawarma fries were covered with a spicy mix that provided a depth of flavor

 We'll be back (again and again)!

Had lunch at this wonderful falafel shop today.  The falafel sandwich and falafel salad were both delicious. Everything is made fresh. The falafel was crispy and hot.  The pita and hummus were excellent .Reminded me of the falafel that I had in Israel . Would highly recommend Mia's meals.

Excellent, very high quality food. Only have had the scnhitzel and the manichewitz and pomegranate braised beef and both very good.  Interesting to see schnitzel on the menu, but we liked it, the sauce it comes with was super tasty

Beware that at least at this time pita is sold separately for the hummus which wasnt obvious on the menu when we ordered

Keshet Kitchen is a cozy and casual restaurant with surprising spins on comfort food. I ordered the baked chicken shawarma entree which consists of a generously sized chicken breast and two sides. By Abe's recommendation I went with mashed potatos and maple glazed carrots. The chicken breast was surprisingly juicy and flavorful - I say this as someone who is consistently disappointed by chicken unless I am having the fattier parts like wings, drums, or thighs. I actually ordered the shawarma out of reflex, not realizing it was a chicken breast (no I didn't read the description on the menu) so for a brief moment I was petrified when I saw a chicken breast on my plate (yes I hate chicken breasts that much). Since they marinate the chicken breast, I was pleased upon first bite and quickly finished it. I usually don't eat carrots but these were good. The sweetness of the maple really brought out the flavor of the carrots. I loved the mashed potatos - they were perfectly garlicky. 

The honey roasted brussel sprouts were a love affair - I try to eat these things at home but can't get them to taste good without drowning them. These brussel sprouts tasted sweet and a little spicy - they  had an Asian fusion influence I wouldn't have expected from a Middle Eastern restaurant - but doesn't that make this even more interesting? I am a huge sucker for honey, garlic, and sesame seeds. I wasn't disappointed.

Finally, let's talk about their fruit compotes. I had the pomegranate compote which was flavorful, a little sweet, and refreshing. 

I am looking forward to my next visit to try other things!
I've been meaning to try this place for a while. I was pleasantly surprised by the flavors of everything. Hummus was excellent and the chicken was perfectly cooked too. I'll be ordering again soon
The food and house made drinks were delicious! We ordered a falafel entree to share between two people, and it was perfect. The staff were very welcoming and helpful as well.
Get the chicken tenders with spicy mango sauce! Absolutely phenomenal. I'm not a big fan of this cuisine in general, but Im still thinking about those chicken tenders weeks later!

Amazing, just fantastic. Wings were very juicy and fried perfectly. Sauces (mango and date) were bright and interesting. Chicken shawarma was deep in flavor. Side pickles were excellent. The woman that took my order was extremely nice. Total experience was an A plus. I'll go back often

The wings were excellent!! Got the harissa buffalo and 
Habanero apricot both were so good but honestly the wings were amazing even without the sauces (not sure what spices are on them to begin with but almost tasted Indian). 


The shawarma was a bit dry. Will definitely be back to my new favorite spot for wings in the area
I waited all week for the chicken falafel waffles (work in the city on Sundays) and my god was it worth the wait 15/10 worth it, absolutely worth it
Ah so excited for this! The chicken shawarma once you added the sauce and mixed together was great. The green beans were delicious but the star of the show was the Mac and cheese, seriously amazing!

I really wanted to like Keshet Kitchen; but, wow, talk about a hit or miss. Not only does the menu keep changing, sometimes the chicken is dry and sometimes it's not. Sometimes you get adult sized chicken wings, and sometimes they're miniature wings. Considering how expensive the meals are and their inconsistency, I'd recommend saving your money or ordering elsewhere.

I was FINALLY able to stop by Studio C this morning and snag some Indy Dough goodies. I've been following Indy Dough for months on social media and have been anxiously awaiting an opportunity to try her donuts that everyone raves about. This morning I tried the apple fritter and vegan-ish old fashioned donut with chocolate frosting and sprinkles. I also got a vanilla iced chai. The apple fritter was still warm and melted in my mouth. Perfection. I saved a few bites for my husband and he thought it was delicious! We split the old fashioned and both loved it. We're both not huge donut people but couldn't get enough. The iced vanilla chia was also perfection. Great flavor. Cannot wait to try more of Amanda's creations in the future!

The HOLEY GRAIL of DONUTS!  I've been to all but one of Amanda's show stopping pastry pop ups.  It's mostly donuts but ever once in a while you will get graced with a perfectly chewy cookie, a delectable galette, a scone, or slice of cake perhaps - but it's all glorious - all delectable.   I will warn you - once you go Indy Dough... you'll never go back!

So the owner, Amanda, is literally the sweetest and one of the most humbly talented pastry chefs I've EVER met.  Her pop-ups are insane they sell pur in less than a minute - if you miss it that's the game baby, try again later.  You've been warned they literally sell out online in less than one minute everytime and normal in store pop ups in less than 30 min (and those start at 6am).

I can't pick a favorite - it'd be like picking a favorite child.  However I will say...

Her french cruelers are something like I've never tasted before - they're light and airy and moist and crisp and adorned with delicious flavors like cardamon or coconut hibiscus.

Her Old Fashioned donuts are similar to a cake (if I have to compare them to something) but their also not comparable to any other cake donut you've ever had.  

Her yeast are o so delicious, but appear in rare form as they take a lot more work and space to prep than any others.

The Fritters, if the heavens shine down on you and you are lucky enough to get your hands on one of Amanda's Apple Fritters... crisp edges, chewy insides, loaded with cinnamony apples, a sticky glaze, and flaky salt.  They're perfection.

Chocolate Chip Salted cookie, they're that perfect chewy cookie with melty chocolate chips and flaky salt on top and I highly recommend devouring them immediately or topping with some ice cream.

So if you want a bite of heaven follow @indydough on insta (it's the only way to know) and set your notifications and all your reminders, and maybe say a little good grace!

I've been seeing tons and tons of photos on social and so much buzz about this place. This "place" happens to be a pop up so it might change based on the day. 

I just so happened to come across them with a Tinker Coffee partnership. They were sadly out of most pastries, but we ended up with a galette-like tomato + cheese tart. It was so damn drool-worthy. 

It had a variety of colors of tomatoes. It was perfectly creamy from the cheesiness and salty from the buttery pastry. Can't wait to try more of their stuff and hope to see them do more pop ups downtown!

Indy Dough is the real deal, y'all.  I've tried Amanda's donuts four times between her pop-up's at Studio C and collaborations with Circles Ice Cream and Guggman Haus Brewing, and every time I was super impressed with her offerings.  Give her a follow on Instagram (@indydough) and cross your fingers that you'll be the recipient of her culinary creativity soon.

2020 Indy Bucket List: visit an Indy Dough pop-up to score one of the famous, drool-worthy baked goods that appear in your Instagram. This pop-up happens in Studio C, a creative culinary wonderland that consists of private chef dinners, single daily meal specials, morning coffee and this sweet pop-up. 

When Amanda took to creating these artisan donuts, the city immediately flocked. Follow her on Instagram (@indydough) to see the different baked goods she cooks up each week. She usually makes donuts: think everything from cherry vanilla crullers to guava cream cheese old fashioned and black sesame glazed donuts. They're truly cooler than any donuts you've ever tried. 

I saw a post about white cheddar, green onion scones and immediately hopped on it. I messaged Amanda the night before the pop-up and she set one aside, as they usually sell out. This is the kind of place that you will have to arrive incredibly early to even have a chance at scoring a donut. There's a limited amount and they sell out in person within 30 minutes. They'll be a line outside before the place even opens. Go to bed early, get up early, and be ready to wait for the experience!

Thank you Amanda! I gobbled up the scone so quickly and it was so, so, so GOOD.

The hype surrounding Indy Dough cannot be over exaggerated. They are seriously so so good and feel more elevated than your average donut because they are small-batch and are made with really unique flavors like guava cream cheese. I went to the pop up at Studio C a few weeks ago, but you'll have to follow along on Instagram @indydough to find out where she will be next! When I arrived 15 minutes before opening, there were already a few people lining up outside so definitely arrive early. I got a donut, a buttermilk biscuit with jam, and an iced chai latte and everything was divine. 

Studio C is right on the Monon, so if you're out for a run and think to yourself "I'd rather be enjoying coffee and a donut" then stop here!

Indy dough, run by Amanda Gibson, is a speciality pop-up baker focusing on doughnuts! I can't begin to say enough about how amazing the baked goods she puts forth are. 
While her focus is doughnuts, there is opportunity to snag cookies, fritters, scones, and even more! She does brioche, old-fashion, and cruelller donuts but it'll depend on what is made as options are typically limited. 
She was based out of Studio C but now will do pop-ups with other local businesses which is always a plus for me. If you want to find the next pop-up, follow the Instagram account to keep up to date. When a pop-up does occur, you will need to get there at least 15-20 minutes early (I would suggest 30 minutes to be safe) or have a timer ready to order a ticket for an event.  The price is a bit more than a standard doughnut but it is totally worth the cost in my opinion. 
Her apple fritters are one of the best I've had and actually what got me to try them with her balance of sweetness, apple chunks, and salt it really does hit the spot.

Indy Dough is a new donut pop-up by Amanda Gibson who previously worked at an artisan donut shop in Florida developing recipes and thank goodness she's here because these donuts are amazing. I was lucky enough to snag a couple at her most recent pop up and the caramel miso apple donut had me salivating all day. 

Tips for her pop ups
- check indydough on Instagram
- show up early 
- 2 donuts per person so bring a friend if you want more
- DONT be angry if she's sold out in a few minutes because these donuts are just that good
- show up again for the next one

It takes some patience, alarm clocks, and memorizing your credit card number if you want a chance to try these doughnuts from Indy Dough.

I think Amanda does a nice job of crafting flavor combos and taking the doughnut from something that can be simple into an art form. I was hoping for a melt-in-your-mouth doughnut, but found my two slightly chewy. Overall, I do think the doughnuts from Indy Dough are good and have fun flavors. I would definitely get the doughnuts again if I'm wanting something more than just a plain yeast doughnut.

It is a one-woman pop-up shop, so there are a limited number of doughnuts that are sold during each event. So have a little patience when you're trying to get your hands on a box.

What can I say other that it's worth all the social media hype! These donuts are amazing and would stand up against any other donut shop in Indy - and easily give them an knock out! The flavors are deep and developed & unlike anything you'll find anywhere else. Today I tried all four flavors she offered {I brought a teammate because it's a 2 doughnut limit}. The apple fritters are so delicious and have just the right amount of sweetness. The crueler was light, warm, and covered in a delicious sugar blend. The banana doughnut was covered in a tasty glaze and freeze dried bananas for a unique and tasty flavor combo. My favorite though - the champ of today - pistachio chocolate! I will forever have heart eyes for this doughnut. Keep up the amazing work and we will keep coming back!
The Doughnuts and Beer pairing at GuggmanHaus Brewery were amazing!  The doughnuts were so fresh and tasty!  YUM!!!  I can't wait to try more!!!

Delicious breakfast burritos! I've been wanting to try them for a while and finally had the chance today and they exceeded expectations! I had the Morn'n Gale and my husband tried the Rural King. They were warm, cheesy and seasoned perfectly. I'm already thinking about the next time I'll get to enjoy them! Can't wait to try more.

Best breakfast burrito in Indy - hands down. Quick and friendly service. I wasn't sure where it was at first, but luckily I saw a very nice gentleman who explained how it worked. You can order online and have it ready when you arrive or order when you get there - I waited less than 10 mins.

Set up behind the church there is no sit down space to eat, but perfect for on the go (especially perfect since I work Saturday's and it's hard to find somewhere not packed that I can grab something before work). My co-worker also approved.

This is such a fun addition to the Near Eastside with a tremendous cause behind it. For starters, Indy hasn't had much to offer in terms of breakfast tacos or burritos over the year so I was giddy to hear of Brookside Burrito coming on the scene from a friend. Who doesn't love a grab and go, affordable weekday breakfast option?

Before I dig into the food, I want to talk about the mission behind Brookside Burrito (one of the coolest parts about it, in my opinion). Brookside Burrito provide jobs and critical on-the-job training to those most at risk. In their words, "Every item on our menu tells the story of our streets, hand crafted by the folks who call these streets home. With every satisfied customer, we are reweaving the fabric of our community and helping at-risk individuals rewrite their own personal narrative. Together, we're highlighting the value that Brookside brings to the near Eastside of Indianapolis and showing that we are more than the stereotypes, labels, and statistics suggest." A lovesong not only for the community of the Near Eastside but its people. 

For those who live downtown, this is less than a 10 minute drive! The online ordering process is seamless too. The night before our porch breakfast, I placed the order (all burritos are $3), and scheduled my pickup for 7:30AM.
