I pulled up to the church where the kitchen is located, called the number and within a few minutes my bag of hot burrito goodness was back on the road. I have to say, this is a great offering for catered work breakfasts, etc. 

We ordered a variety of burritos - vegetarian, the One and Onley (named after the street and filled with egg, potato, meat, cheese), and a few others. All were great and held their heat really well.

Can't wait for our next visit and for more folks to discover this Near Eastside treasure.
From Las Vegas, in town for FDIC and this is the BEST breakfast burrito I have ever had! Service was amazing. Pull up, order and go! Really a great spot!!!

I love this new addition to the east side! They have a great, user friendly website and you can make any modification to your burrito. We got the   One and Olney, the Morn'n Gale, and the Green Tuxedo. My husband likes his burritos very basic so he loved the Olney and Gale. I like mine with tons of stuff in them and multiple flavors so I loved the Tuxedo. 

Next time I'll definitely have them delivered (only $3) since they had gotten a large order and I had to wait longer than I had planned to for them to bring them out to my car. But it was worth the wait! I can't wait to try the other burritos and I'll definitely get the fresh squeezed OJ next time.
Great-tasting burritos at an amazing value. Mission-driven business that hires within the neighborhood. Spend the extra dollar to get the Rural King- you won't be disappointed.
Ordered delivery over the weekend. And sooo yummy. Food arrived on time and ready to eat. My whole family can't wait to order agai!!

If you are into breakfast burritos this is your spot' they have a variety of choices for you to  grab and go. There isn't inside dining, you can call ahead or order when you get there. 

What makes theirs so great? First off, it's a good value $3, it had the right amount of contents inside the burrito and it came with fresh salsa. The packaging was simple yet had substance. 

It's simple, unassuming, and spectacular value!

Can't say enough great things about Brookside Burrito! From the mission of the restaurant to the clever names that pay tribute to streets in the Brookside neighborhood to the burritos themselves, it's all wonderful. I've tried both the Green Tuxedo and the Morn'n Gale. Hands down my favorite was the vegetarian Green Tuxedo! I've been back several more times since my first visit and get it every time. I've placed my order online and had prompt pick up every time I pull up curbside.  Just be mindful that they're closed every Sunday!

Let me start by saying Brookside Burrito has life figured out by breakfast! What attracted my husband and I was a review written by an Elite Yelp reviewer whose name escapes me as I write this review... I convinced him to heat up MY other burrito that he has decided was now his,  this is the fabulous moment that was created by purchasing an amazingly-satisfying-life-figured-out-on-a-tortilla!  FOR THE WIN

This place is AMAZING and a secret gem! The curbside option is convenient and their burritos are a steal at $3! I had the "one and Olney" and it was perfect. Would highly recommend and can't wait to visit again!

I ordered the Green Tuxedo and was so pleased with my choice! The flavors were incredible, and that salsa was yummy. Supporting local businesses that give back and make a difference in their communities while serving yummy food?!?! Sign me up!

Home of the $3 burrito! Only open weekend mornings, Brookside Burrito is now anchoring our weekend routine with these delicious breakfast burritos. If you're thinking about breakfast burritos do yourself a favor and get some!!
Not sure what the lady at the drive thru name is but wow!! Super awesome service very friendly and super nice totally will come back because of how good the service was

I joined a friend for lunch here on January 19.  My comments:
-Friendly
-Clean
-Beans, side salad, corn tortillas very good
-The 3 piece chicken, white, was very dry and seemed way overcooked.  Being that the chicken is the main reason to visit here I was disappointed.

Just opened here on Irvignton. 
My first time Ever at a pollo loco here in Tucson. I am  a picky Mexican foodie and I avoid a lot Mexican food places for the same reason. I stopped to get give this place a try and I was very pleased with service and food. 
. I placed my order through drive through, Michele was the person who attended me and she delivered professional service, She was very attending, and happy. The grilled chicken was very good! The chicken burritos we very flavorful and my picky children ate them all and they wanted more. 
Keep up the amazing service and the tasty food. 
I came back for more!!

Just tried this food stop for the FIRST TIME EVER yesterday (1/12/22). I tried the classic chicken salad, basic, had a good representation of items, don't care for pinto beans so swapped out for black beans and tried a sampler bag of salsa heats and the guacs...BEST SALAD!!!! I AM HOOKED. Can someone make a suggestion of what to try next  ????
Delicious! I had the double protein bowl and hubby had tostada salad...both great! We will be back.  Oh, the chicken was so flavorful!

I like the food from here a lot, I'm just disappointed because I just went there at 10:00 pm and they told me it was closed. I looked up their schedule and says they close at 11:00 pm. So I don't know what's up with that. It's very frustrating to see a lot of my favorite places to eat close so early.

This place was soooooo incredibly clean & the staff was so nice . I normally don't  write reviews , but I HAD TO COMMENT . This was so clean & I even saw the young workers actively cleaning between orders . Management & employees are doing a great job !

I was happy to see this fast food spot open.  I love their chicken and we ate at the San Diego location often.  But this spot -well I was disappointed.  The chicken was dry.  I ordered the 10 piece thigh and leg meal.  The sides were good, you can't mess those up too much.  But the chicken was dry enough that I really doubt I will go back.   There are plenty of other fast food choices in that area these days that I don't have to settle for below average food.   Sorry El Pollo Loco - you could do better.

I LOVE this place! They have never gotten my order wrong, always been overly kind, and they always take the time to wave hello to my dog when I bring him through the drive through. 

Honestly I was worriedfor this place being right met to a taco bell? But it's the taco bell who needs to watch out! El pollo loco guacamole sauce is wonderful, their salsa is always fresh and it's SUCH a good deal. Their churro always makes a bad day all better.

Good service, fresh stuff. wimpy salsa?  no huevos for the caliente I guess.

Chicken taquitos salad - very fresh at 10:30 AM Saturday 1-15-2022 its all leftovers for the rest of you.

Fairly easy in easy out via signals. But watch your butt you're in S. Tucson/N. Nogi.. Don't chu know.

Normally the food here is good but I don't recommend getting your food from drive threw. It's been at least 3 times where I get home and realize they gave me the wrong order or made the order wrong.  I don't live close to the place so it's not like I can just go return it. My suggestion is when you get your food take a bite of your burrito before you leave to make sure it's right

Glad that something special opened up at this location after the loss of Res Ipsa

Great service, nice outdoor seating, and excellent cafe fare - really great bagels, I had the tra la lox and caneles which were both excellent - excited to come back

I'm not sure whether to give it four or five stars - but if you come here, get the milk bread. It was so flavorful and delicious. I don't know if I've ever had anything like it and can't wait to return to get more. We also got bagels, which weren't soft like normal bagels - but they were so different from typical everything bagels that I loved them. Only six people allowed in at a time and they do have a sign encouraging social distancing. I can't wait to return!
LOVE their breakfast sandwiches. Quick and easy to order and the staff is efficient and friendly!

Lost Bread took the place of Res Ipsa (RIP) but I was actually quite impressed, especially since they're known for bread/bakery. I was craving a simple breakfast sandwich and wanted to give this joint a try. I got the classic bacon, egg, and cheese with arugula and pickled onions - not bad! The egg was a little too over cooked, but everything came fresh and was very satisfying. I got this all on an everything bagel, and the bagel is definitely on a whole different level. It had a lot of aroma and spice that definitely beats the average everything bagel. It's definitely worth a try!

Deli rye was the most full-flavored rye bread I've had in years, amazing for sandwiches. The maple whole grain toasted had an incredible, crunchy crust and subtle flavor that was outstanding. 

Excited to welcome this wonderful bakery to the neighborhood! 

Edit: I'd previously mentioned that there needed to be a sign with the capacity on the door during COVID. There's now a sign saying 6 max, which is way too many people in such a small storefront IMO. Thankfully they have a great takeout system in place and my online order was waiting for me when I got there, literally requiring less than 10 seconds in and out. Won't change my five star rating as their food is excellent and the staff are super friendly, just FYI for those who are wary

It's great to have a fresh bakery in the neighborhood and Lost Bread Co. has a good range of options. We did a half dozen of bagels with plain, everything, and hominy. They were okay; there are better bagel places in the area. I did enjoy the hominy bagel as a new-to-me option. Very good with some butter and honey. We also got a loaf of the French batard which was also decent. Very crusty which is always a nice feature on fresh bread. Looking forward to try other menu items but would probably skip the bagels.

Feeling a little Lost about this place. Located on Walnut and 23rd, this shop has multiple locations (Philly/NY can be found in retail stores and farmers markets) so it was confusing because they charged artisanal prices. I had to wait about 5-6 minutes for them to make my bagel, which I totally get isn't a long time to wait, but there was no music so I was just kinda staring at the walls awkwardly haha. Anyway, I got an everything bagel and it really had everything on it. It almost tasted more like pizza, which was strange but it wasn't bad! I probably wouldn't go back unless I was in a pinch. The people were really nice though so that's def a plus. Maybe don't get this bread

Lost Bread has gotten a lot of love from friends and strangers, so I wanted to check it out. I'm normally a big bakery fan, but Lost didn't do it for me unfortunately. The chocolate croissant was just so-so (a bit dry). Their assortment of items was also not too exciting, with quite limited types of pastries, and many of the baked goods use fancy grains or try otherwise to be healthy. The staff were friendly, at least. Feel free to visit if you want to try for yourself, but not my favorite bakery in the city.
A company that values bulk online orders and not the people actually in the store with product in hand seems like they don't need, or want, people to shop in their store. Disappointed.

Wow x3!!
This is a delicious way to have freshly made choices with amazing customer service. Tried the Mango Sticky Rice Vegan Ice Cream Sandwich. It is a flavor punch of sweet, salty (pretzel bread cookie) and depth of flavor. The drinks we ordered were all well done. And the people working are personable and knowledgeable about their products! I can't wait to return!

Lost Jawn - Mango Sticky Rice Coconut Pretzel Shortbread

Bread - Buckwheat Cherry

Chocolate Croissant

So happy I walked down Walnut St and stopped in here!!! I've heard lots about it.  This location is a small but has lots of goodies.  It smelled so good as soon as you opened the door.  We really just wanted to check it out but $25 later walked out with a bag of goodies!  The bread selection was  good even at 3 pm. We bought a bag of milk buns that were perfect for burgers.  So tasty! I had to have the chocolate cherry babka and was not disappointed!  The dark chocolate together with the doughy bread and dried cherries was yummy with my morning tea. It could use more cherries though.  Of course we had to buy the pretzel shortbread Such a unique flavor combo.  
The staff person was so friendly and answered all our questions plus gave some info about the company.  
There is a glass jar with small biscuits on the counter. When I asked about buying, the cashier said they were complimentary with coffee. I'll give you some to try!  She gave us a handful. The biscuit is pieces of a croissant baked so it's almost like a biscotti. They were delicious!
I'll definitely be back I love supporting a Small business that has employees that make you feel welcome!!

Love love love Lost Bread! I've been a huge fan of their creations since I started getting their bread and other products at Union Square Greenmarket. So when we were driving through Philly I knew I wanted to check out their store. The hominy biscuits and gravy were delightful!

A lot of fuss. I've been buying their stuff in Fish town since they opened. The Rittenhouse location is not that close to Rittenhouse. It's in the old Res Ipsa, spot. No indoor dining yet. Bought a dozen bagels. $24. I hope they are great! Really took like 10  minutes for them to bag my bagels. I never liked this location.

The Lost Bread Company's newest location has such friendly Employees and a streamlined process during the pandemic. 

Excellent bagels, house made shmears, bagel egg sandwiches, and egg pockets! You can order online easily, or in person (though the space is small). Their prices are quite steep w bagels + schmear $5 and a breakfast sandwich around $8.  Nevertheless it was good for a splurge. Their herby cream cheese was delicious!

As for COVID precautions, this venue was offering the following of the essentials: 
+ carry out
+ masks on all employees
+ limit in store clients (6 person limit)

We will be back for their breakfast and lunch soon!

I'm so thrilled that LOST has opened this new location! I had the Egg Pocket, Tra La Lox on an everything bagel, and Pepita croissant plus an oatmilk cortado this morning. CHEF'S KISS on all of that stuff, especially the bagel and the croissant. The croissant was just so thoughtful and buttery--like an almond croissant, but not so sickly sweet, instead showcasing the unique flavor of pepitas. 

Also, for home bakers, there is a good selection of freshly milled flour (no whole wheatberries though, if you mill at home). 

Finally, I appreciated ordering at 1 of the 2 self-serve kiosks. I didn't think I would, initially, but it actually gave me a chance to slow down and think about what I  wanted.
The worlds worst chocolate croissant. To even call that product a croissant is an insult to the worlds worst croissant. Not buttery, flakey or wonderful in anyway. A waste of money.

Lost Bread supplies bread to restaurants and cafe's all across the city, so I figured I would try their new Rittenhouse cafe. The variety of options is nice, but in summary, each item suffers from the same fate... It's a bit over cooked. I had the Scrapple, egg, and Cheese, Chocolate Croissant, Canele, and Chocolate chip cookie. I would return for the sandwich.

Scrapple, egg, and cheese- Delicious, the anchovy aioli really adds a nice touch, and the milk bun was soft 

Chocolate Croissant- It's wheat based, so it's naturally a little drier, so the pastry really needs more butter to compensate, especially when it's over cooked

Canele- The custard based interior was nice and the only thing counteracting the dark exterior

Spelt Chocolate Cookie- I will chalk up my feelings to my lack of experience with spelt, but the cookie was slightly spicy, but also bitter

Feeling a little Lost about this place. Located on Walnut and 23rd, this shop is part of a chain so it was confusing because they charged artisanal prices. I had to wait about 5-6 minutes for them to make my bagel, which I totally get isn't a long time to wait, but there was no music so I was just kinda staring at the walls awkwardly haha. Anyway, I got an everything bagel and it really had everything on it. It almost tasted more like pizza, which was strange but it wasn't bad! I probably wouldn't go back unless I was in a pinch. The people were really nice though so that's def a plus. Maybe don't get this bread.

I feel that I'm deceiving you with my rating. I ordered a breakfast bagel and the buckwheat cherry bread. Having been a fan of their shortbread pretzel cookies, decided to pay them a visit at their recently opened location on walnut st. Their breakfast bagel was absolutely delicious and well flavored with was quite a surprise. I think the dash of pepper on the egg is what did it for me. There were a few reviews that commented that their bread tends to be more on the charred side and I'm inclined to agree. I think I will stick with their sandwiches and what they refer to as their pantry items. Still well worth a visit.

Very crusty bread and bagel. Fast service. You can place your order on the ordering station.

Cherry bread has a weird artificial flavor. I'm not a big fan of it.

Canele has a nice crunch shell with moist filling but it is missing a citrusy flavor, it's quite bland.

Egg tart. I thought it would be sweet like those in Chinatown but to my surprise it's savory. Nice creamy custard.

Chocolate croissant and chocolate cookie are my favorite from today's haul. 

Bagel is relatively small.

In the middle of the bakery there's a shelf with bread as a display. You can also pick up some coconut pretzel shortbread and burnt toast biscotti. Against the wall on the right you can grab some flour.

There's no sign of the capacity so some people are waiting outside. I suggest that there's a sign indicating the room capacity for social distancing

I am sooo excited this opened next to me. I think the existence of bread is why I can never be skinny. I loveee their breakfast bagel sandwiches and breakfast sandwiches. I'm usually not a fan of scrapple but lost bread has totally changed my mind. Their lunch french kiss was surprisingly good with beef tongue. Their pretzel shortbread cookies confuses my tastebuds, but they're delicious and incredibly addictive. They also make these dog bones that my dog goes crazy for! Check it out if you haven't already!

They are not reliable or considerate. We had a prepaid advance order to pick up for break the fast. About an hour before pickup they called to say they were canceling the order as they had run out because there were too many advance order! They obviously knew what they needed days before. If they told us a day or 2 in advance we would have made alternative arrangement. Certainly they should have known as these were advance orders. Either they cannot manage their inventory or they prioritized walk in customers which would have been reprehensible. They said they were sorry but did not sound that way on the phone. A quality business would also have given something like a future free bagel to entice us to give them a second chance. We will never go there and will tell everyone we know not too. Their food may or may not be good- we never got it to try- but their reliability and concern for their customers is atrocious. And they seem to lack any sense of normal courtesy. They left us scrambling around last minute to pick up the food we had committed to bring. I kept the voice mail in case anyone doubts the facts I am presenting here
Worst and slowest service. Bad stale tiny bagels. Very disappointed and don't recommend

name: Poke Nash
address: 5055 Broadway Place, Fl  2nd, Assembly Food Hall

reviews.text: Nestled inside of assembly food hall towards the back of floor 2, you do not want to pass this up! One of the best Poke bowls i've ever had. You can make your own bowl or there were three options already to choose from, I got the already made option with white rice as the base, marinated tuna (to die for!), crab, edamame, crunch flakes etc the options are plentiful. If raw isn't your thing they also have cooked shrimp and chicken bowls as well. Portions are plentiful and pricing isn't bad considering what you get. Give this place a try you will not be disappointed !
Had Oke poke and it was amazing . The tuna tasted just like what I've had in Hawaii , the place is clean and staff was awesome !

The place is in the Assembly Hall Food Court in Nashville when I was there for a conference so had to give it a try.  There was a long line so my expectations were high. Ordered the spicy ahi with brown rice, edamame, fried onions, sweet onions, and with unagi sauce.  Didn't expect to get two scoops of ground up fish.  Not chunk or cubed ahi that is customarily sold in Hawaii but ground. The flavor came mostly from the unagi sauce and some sriracha but that ground up fish did not go well and was totally unexpected leaving me very disappointed. 

I would suggest using chunked or cubed ahi for the poke to get it closer to original poke if you want to call it "Hawaiian". Unfortunately not a fan and would not recommend.  Will give them credit for trying. This is based on the one food bowl I ordered and tried and doesn't reflect anything else they sell and serve.

I like options for savory poke, and everything here was sweet.

I got a regular bowl with Ahi Tuna and Spicy Tuna, topped with Spicy Mayo. The portion was good, the ingredients tasted fresh - just didn't want the sweetness. 

The Ahi was marinated chunks of tuna, and it actually tasted great, I just wish I knew it was marinated before ordering. Then you add a weird sweet Spicy Mayo Ailoi and what looked like eel sauced drizzled on top, and it just wasn't for me. Was the Spicy Tuna sweet too? I couldn't tell since it was everywhere. 

Good quality, if you like traditional sweet soy poke; definitely try them out! If you're a simpleton like me who likes plain tuna w spicy mayo and soy sauce... probably not for you!

Oke Poke is located inside the Assembly Food Hall at Fifth and Broadway in downtown Nashville. We decided to come here for a weekday lunch and it was an excellent choice. They have a lot of toppings available and the build-your-own-bowl option did not disappoint. I got a mix of tuna, salmon, and fresh vegetables. The only thing that was hard was to hear and be heard between masks and noise and what not. When your order is ready they will call it out and you can pick it up from the pickup counter. They were generous with offering the sriracha and spicy mayo to enjoy with the bowls as well. The Assembly Food Hall has a lot of seating so you can walk around and find a place to sit as well. We would certainly come back here!
Ate here for the first and last time today.  Ordered spicy tuna bowl and the tuna was ground up. Not like the photos. What's worse is there were bones in it.

Haven't had Poke in a while and seen this place and had to try it. 

Food - Great fresh ingredients, fish , good portions , flavor is perfect,  sauces are on point. 

Service - Employees are nice but could cheer up a bit more . 

Prices - Paid almost $18 for a large bowl wth avocado added, a lil high but was good. 

Location  - Inside the assembly hall. 

Would probably try it again, but would venture out and try the other restaurants first.
In the crowded and busy food hall, I liked this quick service, selection of options, and freshness of the ingredients.

What a wonderful addition to the food hall! After getting my first shot, we walked down to the food hall to check it out. I love food halls slightly less than I love malls. Note: I LOVE malls. I always say, when a food hall grows up, it becomes a mall. Yeah! 

Oke Poké was everything I needed it to be: healthy, clean, fast, and well-priced. You build your own bowl and they have plenty of yummy toppings. I got spicy tuna over rice with avocado, edamame, sweet onions, crunch, ginger, scallions, and cucumbers. It was a perfectly sized, slightly overflowing bowl! We took it to go because, life, and it traveled fine. I'll definitely be back. I'm so excited about 5th and Broadway. They packed in so much into this new block. On one end you see Bridgestone and the other you see the Ryman. Nashville needs more walking malls, especially downtown. It also needed more affordable fast-casual dining options and I'm glad they included a healthy, fresh option for people who want to skip the heavier foods. So go try it out, okay? Oke!

Great dining experience,  food cooked fresh and made to order. Great things in life are definitely worth waiting for.  My server Jasmine was very courteous and polite.  I'll definitely be back again, and again, and again.  This is now my new favorite spot. So long New Orleans Food & Spirit.

Slightly off the beaten path in New Orleans but we came here after a swamp tour and the food was incredible. Home-cooked and delicious, this rivals any seafood I've had all over the city. Staff was incredibly courteous and polite. Highly recommend the New Orleans Style BBQ shrimp and the etouffe.

Myself and my family happened to stumble upon this gem while on a trek looking for an authentic restaurant that represented New Orleans. My am I so glad we took a chance on this place! Immediately we were greeted by cute decor, and our server Jasmine. She was the sweetest, and most prompt server. She was patient and kind. Our food was made to order and the food came steaming hot. The food was AMAZING. Everything was flavorful, portion sizes were perfect. We were even given complimentary Salads, mimosas, and desserts!! We had the opportunity to meet the owner, and she was so sweet, humble and gracious. Whenever I'm back in New Orleans I will make sure to visit!

This place is a true hidden gem. I love coming here with my mother. The Blackened Catfish is my absolute favorite. Y'all should bring back the Yakamein! 

I had to redo this review. Faubourgs has so much potential to be a 5 star restaurant. The only reason I go back is because the food is undeniably good. Devin the server deserves a raise. Every time I visit he is my server & has to make up for whatever mistake the kitchen makes. Devin is possibly the best thing to happen to Faubourgs. Today for an appetizer I ordered the Seafood Egg Rolls, when I received them they weren't stuffed. Then upon leaving was told that if you use a paid coupon you cannot take your food to go. How can you dictate to patrons what to do with food they bought!? Especially when you can't even provide optimum service. This restaurant need to do WAYYYY better in order to be better. I love to support black owned businesses, but this is the third time I've supported this one & each time it's an issue. THANK YOU TO DEVIN FOR ALWAYS DOING THE BEST JOB YOU CAN DO!
I took my Dad here for lunch. The food was amazing. The service was exceptional. The price of my meal was very reasonable. My new lunch spot! Great restaurant
This place is a true hidden gem. I love coming here with my mother. The Blackened Catfish is my absolute favorite. Y'all should bring back the Yakamein!

Lovely people, great food (received rave reviews from guests), excellent service and good planning help.  Being my first time having an event at my home, I was particularly interested in everything going smoothly.  The waitstaff explained what hors d'oeuvres were being passed and were very friendly.  I couldn't have asked for better!  The manager did a great job too.  Unfortunately, the bartender was not familiar with Manhattans or Old Fashioneds, which I specifically wanted.  Every time anyone asked for one she had to refer to a recipe or ask how they were made.  I had requested a specific bartender I had met at another party.  She was guaranteed to be my bartender but she was replaced by another at the last minute without anyone notifying me.  She was available but was pulled off at the last minute for another party.  I was very peeved by this and called the party planner.  They apologized and tried to make it right.  For a cost of $2,200 they reimbursed me $80.  Not exactly wanting my business I guess.

We've started carrying some of Hollyberry's sandwiches and salads at my work and I can't get enough of the Italian Club! Sandwiches are my new favorite thing, and it's the perfect blend of ham, turkey, bacon, and cheese. 

I've been able to sample some of the items off their catering list as well and let me just say, gooey butter cupcakes! It's genius. 

Reasonable prices and a friendly faces make for a wonderful business!

We absolutely loved Hollyberry! We got so many compliments on the food! Hollyberry was so easy to work with and they were professional and friendly during the entire planning process and day-of. They were also so attentive and wonderful during the wedding day. We took our time choosing a caterer and we're so happy we chose Hollyberry!
Hollyberry is great! They're easy to work with and their food gets rave reviews.  Highly recommend them!

Hollyberry catered our wedding, and they. were. fantastic. 

I was looking for a place that catered to vegetarians, and they have SO many vegetarian options! Lindsey was my contact, and she was there whenever I needed her. She answered emails super quickly, but kind of hard to get a hold of on the phone, mostly because she's always with clients. But that wasn't really a problem because I like email anyway. The catering staff was there on time and was exceptional. It was so nice that right after the first dance the catering staff asked what we would like to eat, because otherwise we wouldn't have eaten at our own wedding. 

She also was on the cake cutting. My mom had made the cake, so she wanted to make sure it was set out and cut and everything. They did such a good job. 

Everyone complimented my parents on how amazing the food was. I only wish I would have gotten to eat more of it! 

Overall, I would highly recommend hollyberry for any event. Superb event service, customer service, and food.

I love it when we cater from Hollyberry!  The gooey butter cake is awesome (try the chocolate too) and the sandwiches are good.  They really have a great taste. 

Always happy to see this in the kitchen!

We used Hollyberry for a coworkers baby shower. We had to choose from a list of preferred caterers and to make things tricky....we have one person GF and one person vegan and to top it off, it was a small party of 7. This was no big deal for them. They created a menu for us and the price was amazing!

And let me tell you about the food. Listennnnnnnn....those collard greens were the most flavorful greens we have EVER EVER EVER tasted in my life! I want to have a party and just have their collard greens. They have been on my mind since Friday!

Thank you soooooo much Marti for making this happen for us!

For Easter we wanted to do something we hadn't done before, AND was doable during this quarantine time...so we ordered catering from Hollyberry Catering for our Easter lunch! We already knew about Hollyberry because they cater our kids school lunches, and he loves their food and raves about their COOKIES! So long story short, we called them up and they were super friendly and helpful in the process of ordering, making sure we got all we wanted. They explained the "contact-free" pick up process and the process was seamless! Oh, and the food was AMAZING. The ham was beautiful and flavorful, asparagus and potatoes and gooey butter cake were wonderful as well! We also got some brisket, mashed potatoes and carrots, and it literally all melted in my mouth! Thank you and great job! Hope to do it again!

We used this company for a Sip and See. I would NEVER use this company again. Issues include: we had to follow up continuously with the party planner, because they never followed up with the contract and the information we requested. They did apologize for that, so we decided to use them anyway. 

At the event, the servers stood around or in the kitchen speaking to each other instead of serving our guests. The bartender was rude to our guests. At the end of the event, there was a lot of food left over that we asked for them to package for us, and instead, the servers packaged it up and took it home for themselves. When I called Marti Weber, the Catering Sales Director to discuss it, she was rude, curt and hung up on me. This company does NOT know customer service and has very poor follow through.

The burger was outstanding! I only wish I had bought 2 cause it was so good. The fries were great as well and there were plenty of them. 
The atmosphere here is very welcoming and the young man working here is very nice and attentive. He visits several times to make sure we have everything we need which is appreciated.

First the good. Or, at least passable.

The food is perfectly reasonable fast food. Average fast food, average price, average time to get your order.

Here is the bad:

The name of the place should actually be "Random Fire Sandwiches & Treats." Not "Rapid Fire Sandwiches & Treats." Because, based on my experience, the odds are, they are going to make a random mistake with your order. That's not an exaggeration. Since they opened, I've ordered from them over a dozen times, and every single time, they made a mistake.

Every. Single. Time.

Items missing, wrong drink,  wrong cheese...every single order,

It is almost as if they believe your order is more a "guideline" than, you know, an actual list of specific items you'd like to buy.

They are consistent, so if you don't mind random, give them a try.

Cheeseburger was really good. It was very hot on the dining area.  To help alleviate the heat they cracked open two of the sliding doors.   That brought in the flies.   Had to ask for the table to be cleaned and there was a water leak of some sort.   There was a large puddle of water on the floor and the young girl who waited on us who must have been some sort of management because she was working on a computer behind us just walked over it several times

This spot is a new local business.  We wanted to support it and give it a try. The food we had was delicious! The reason for the 4 star is they forgot one of the items we ordered. Then they wouldn't answer the phone to remedy the situation. They claim to have call ahead orders. How can you order when you won't answer the phone? Anyway, based on the food I would give them another try. The onion rings were very good. The San Francisco melt was very cheesy and good. The gyro was huge and good.  The spicy chicken was not spicy but for a chicken sandwich it was tasty. I wish I could have tried the chicken bacon ranch wrap but that is what they forgot in my order. Hopefully in the coming weeks they will get the service end of things figured out. Then we will give them another try.

The food is always hot and fresh. The grilled spicy chicken breast sandwich is always a good size breast for the $3.99 they charge. You couldn't touch a sandwich like this (grilled chicken) Anywhere else for less than $5 or more.

Food was ok. If you want to get a double know that it is super large patties. A single is the size of a regular double. The service was fast. The 3 star is for the cleanliness. There were 4 people sitting doing nothing when we walked in. And tables were dirty and trash on the floors by the trash bin. My opinion unacceptable. If you're busy I get it but they had zero customers and people doing nothing. So get the place squared away.

Addictingly decadent lehmajun. I've had both fresh and frozen and they're both perfect after 45 seconds in the toaster oven. Each pita is the perfect serving size for a snack or a part of a meal. With ten at a time, the price is right, too.

Small takeout store with some of the best Armenian food around.  
The lahmajoon (meat with dough) is some of the best I've had and well worth the price.

Talking online with friend from high school, we were joking about a Facebook quiz "How Armenian are You?" which I aced, even though I may only be a tiny percent. Anyway I commented how much I enjoy lamejun. My friend asked my mailing address.
Next thing I know, FedEx delivers a box with two bags full. Our dinner plans changed immediately. We baked iff a couple to serve warm. Liggt, crispy dough, complex yet delicate meat and spice mixture, and a unique aroma I've not experienced in decades. 
I couldn't resist one for breakfast this morning. Warmed with freshly sliced heirloom tomatoes and drizzled with lemon, Mediterranean breakdast from heaven.
Thanks folks! Ive never been in your store but I wish you sucess and good luck. And thanks Jim Tashjian. What a guy.

I have been buying their Lacmajun from our local middle eastern market for years. As an Armenian from Los Angeles, growing up with all home-made Armenian food, I'm a harsh critic of how others make this treasured staple. In all the years I've been eating Armenian Lacmajun, this is still the best I've had. Being here in Maryland, it's not easy getting good and authentic middle eastern food. Everything in our area (Ellicott City) are chain stores and chain restaurants. I don't know what I'd do without their Lacmajun. Thank you for continuing to make this to perfection! Even though the price is going up, it is still worth it! I just wish you would add the standard caloric labeling all other foods have.
Esta buena la comida pero esta demasiado cara pagos 70 dólares para 6 personas y solo agarramos burritos

I've been anxious to try this local diner in hopes of finding my "new" breakfast/lunch hangout. First and foremost, my waitress was top notch! She was friendly, fast and engaging. Now for the food. I was disappointed in both the coffee and my breakfast. The coffee had a good flavor. But, it was too weak for my taste and not hot enough. But for diner coffee I give it a B because it wasn't half bad. The breakfast was also disappointing. Here's the run down... I ordered poached eggs easy, hash browns, sausage and toasted English muffins. My reality was, poached eggs medium, country potatoes, bacon and floppy semi warm English muffins. There were only two customers in there so I'm going to blame the head cook on this one. There just isn't an excuse for this kind of mistake. I saw the ticket and it was ordered proper. My waitress offered to bring me the proper order and offered to comp my meal. I declined and ate the plate delivered. It was tasty, just not what I ordered. I'll try their restaurant again. Maybe they'll get those extra stars next time.

They have a inside restaurant now, which is nice. I ordered a breakfast burrito which is the best breakfast burrito that I have ever had. Nice flavor, and they grill each side for a perfectly extra touch.
They charged my son $11 for a hot dog with only ketchup! There are many other taco trucks deeper into Sunvalley.
Friday night, girl with braces taking order is terrible. Very distracted...said no cilantro no onions 3 times. Came on every single item. Not good if your allergic!‍ No need to go back.

Wow!!!!!!!! This place is exceptionally delicious!! I came here around 2 PM and was greeted by the daughter of the owner. She was so sweet and kind! We got some screwdrivers and guacamole with chips to start off. Love! Then we got the quesebirria tacos... holy moly! Delicious. My daughter got the sopita de fideo and it was so yummy. Reminded me of my grandmas. 10/10 for this place! One little thing that could've been better was the drinks. Needed a little more vodka. Other than that the food was bomb!

Wasn't impressed with the food.  BLT had tiny slivers of bacon.  The lettuce and tomato were on the side with onion and pickle.  Keep the onion and pickle.  It's a BLT. The chips weren't seasoned and cooked way too long for my liking.  Service was fair, but friendly.  Three tables, including mine, had issues with the orders.

New and much needed burger spot on the Southside. Second time coming in as first time was on day 2 of them being opened. Scratch kitchen and you can tell form the quality of the food. They struggled a bit on the first night in the kitchen but really got it together tonight.  There is no dieting at Prodigy but if you are looking for every comfort food you can think of this is your place. 
The smash burgers the first night were shot over done so went for the Waygu tonight and it was excellent. The sides include duck fat fries, loaded tots and loaded fries plus several other choices all good. We also tried the cheese curds which were of Wisconsin quality. Local beers on tap and the bar tender made good cocktails. Also finished with an adult milkshake that was ok. If you are looking for a good burger check this out on the Southside

The whole experience here was not good whatsoever. We wanted to ordered drinks & asked what the specials were for the day, the server said there weren't any. We later found the specials on the menu & Mexican lager was $3 for Tuesdays. We ordered the bang bang shrimp & the breading on it was soggy. The burgers were alright. When what seemed to be the manager brought out the food we had to ask for another drink from him. Then we went to order a third drink, just a corona in the bottle on special,  that we waited over 10 minutes for. While waiting for the beer we saw the server eating back in the kitchen & eventually said forget it that we would just take the bill. Upon getting the bill they tried to charge us for the corona we never received & charged us $5 a beer instead of the $3 special. We will not be coming back again.
Burger was very good. Sweet potatoes were hot and crispy. Server was fast and friendly

Heres my personal breakdown;
Food quality: 4
Taste: 4
Price for portion: 3.5 (granted its a scratch kitchen)
Over all not bad, they are still new so obviously they could improve, time will tell. For being new and very understaffed, it met expectations for sure. Will definately come back after they get on their feet and enjoy.

This restaurant was decent.  It is located in a little strip mall and has ample parking. They practice social distancing, especially in the bar area, but they still have ample room. The entire staff thee is very friendly. My server was Morgan. She was awesome and she kept my drink filled,  which is definitely something that I look for. She also stopped by periodically (not too much) to check on us. I hate having to track down my server. I ordered the Black Sabbath Burger with fries.   The burger was OK.  The fries were awesome.  The seasoning that they put on them takes them to the next level. I also recommend the fried cheese curds as an appetizer. They were pretty good too. This is a nice new restaurant and they definitely is deserving of all the buzz it has gotten.

I loved the fries! They were crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. I really enjoyed the seasoning on them too. I was also surprised by the burger too. The burger came with a layer of peanut butter then cheese on top with some jalapeño slices sprinkled over the cheese. I enjoyed my meal and would go here again.

We have been watching for this to open.  It was previously an Irish Spots Bar.  It closed in April with COVID and permanently closed in June.  In July new management moved in and began what appeared to be a remodel with a new business coming soon.  Soon after the Prodigy Burger & Bar sign showed up with opening coming in September.  It opened about two weeks ago.  We decided to give it a try tonight.  It was disappointing from the moment we walked in and realized the furniture was the same table  and chairs as the previous owners.  The walls had been painted and redone.  The TV's and furniture are old worn and outdated, cleanliness was fair at best.  Service was OK team wasn't well trained which was obvious as time moved on.  The adult drinks ordered were weak, the Pepsis were under calibrated and tasted like soda water.  My fries were warm and my wife's were cold.  I ordered a double burger that was not well done it was burnt and crusty and the portion size for the cost wasn't acceptable.  It reminded me of the WENDY'S commercial years ago 'WERE'S THE BEEF" all in all it became comical my wife looked at me smiled and said we tried it this is the first and last time and I had to agree.  We spend $56 plus tip I can say it was worth about $6.  Sorry but I not only can't recommend Prodigy and will not go back to give them a second chance.  I hope they get better and I wish them well but this wasn't done well.  Quality, Service, Cleanliness and Value are not acceptable.

What a surprising find!  A family friendly sports bar/restaurant! Great burgers in a few different styles, like smash burgers (thin patties), a beef blend thicker patty and Wagyu burgers.  With so many to choose from, it was hard to make a decision but hubby opted for a Macafee smash burger - two patties, bacon and Mac n cheese on his burger.  He said it was very, very good.  It could have been better seasoned but a nice compliment of flavors and very craveable.  For just an extra dollar, you can get the duck fat fries so he got those with his burger.  I have never had Wagyu beef so this was my chance.  I ordered The 16th Masterpiece which had sautéed mushrooms and two cheeses.  It was EXCELLENT!  Again, could have been better seasoned but did not detract from the meal.  I ordered the regular French fries and there was a different between the duck fat fries and regular.  Both quite good so having both was a treat.  I normally barely finish half a burger but this one was so good I ate the entire thing.  There are several other interesting things on the menu so even if you aren't in the mood for a burger, you can find something appealing.  I definitely want to try several more menu items so will be back!  I highly recommend them and a great neighborhood eatery!

Enjoyed a chance to sit in and eat a burger and fries with the family. When arriving we where greeted immediately the place was not crowded for a weekend, I enjoyed the freedom of free parking. Our waiter did mess up our order from not using a note pad but the gentleman did apologize and quickly fixed the mistake, now let's get to the food, THE BUGER WAS GOOD, it was on the high end of calories with extra grease lol but good! I did appreciate the kids meal being affordable and my son saying the Mac and cheese was extra "Cheesy" like he likes it! Overall a 3 star for good food and a peaceful atmosphere for our family to enjoy one another!
We had great food and service here! I had the Macafee burger and it was delicious! Our server was excellent-- she was very attentive. We will definitely be back!

The wings are better the Buffalo Wild Wings. And the pulled pork sandwich was better than some BBQ places around here. Coleslaw is mayo based and delicious! Fries are amazing they have a special seasoning on them (we ask for extra)

Give it a try!!

We decided to try Prodigy for the first time and I will not be going back.

I paid $18 for a build your own Wagyu beef burger with bacon and guacamole. The patty seemed small. It was barely bigger than one of my dad's smash patties which you get two of. My wife got a Wagyu beef burger and it was almost double the size of the one I had. My burger also had a smattering of guacamole. Hardly worth the $1 extra to add it. To top it off it was like someone smashed the burger when they put the bun on. If the portions of the build your own burger are different this needs to be clearly noted on the menu. 

We also ordered the pepperoni stuffed breadsticks. These are not really breadsticks and I found a single pepperoni in the one I tried. These are more like deep fried cheese and they had RAW dough in the middle.

Extremely disappointing and there are much better options out there for a better price.
First time here. Great atmosphere! Service was good & manager came by to make sure everything was ok. Perfect for a Friday night. Drinks & comfort food. We'll be back

Considering this one on Meridian in Greenwood just opened about a week ago & it has seemed like they have been pretty busy since the time they opened. We figured we give them a try for my birthday dinner. 
We got in, was seated, server came over & asked for our drink order, she got them & brought them back fairly quick the first time (they weren't that busy at arrival time) she had us (table of 6) and another table as well. We ordered 2 apps, fried pickles & breadsticks. The breadsticks were fairly good & the mariana for them tasted like it was house made & pretty good. She came back & got our order after a while. As we sat waiting for our order, multiple servers continued coming to our table with other peoples food. We waited about 45 min or so for our food order & during this time, our server couldn't keep up with our drinks at all. We were having to tell the servers that were bringing us other peoples food that we needed drinks. 
Our order finally arrived, but not everyone's at once. Some had to wait another 5 min. Now the menu states the burger are cooked to order. We were never asked, at all. Pretty much each one of our burgers came or we added a special sauce to it. None of them came with it, we had to ask when someone who worked there was around. Also, during this time we dealt with a numerous amount of gnats & flies around us for the rest of dinner. 
One of us in our party had asked for teriyaki sauce on the burger, it wasn't on there, but they did bring it when we asked for it. Its not teriyaki, its bbq sauce. Another in our party ordered the jack Daniel's whiskey sauce, again, not on the burger, had to ask for it. Its not a sauce, its pretty much a straight shot of Jack Daniel's, its terrible. I ordered the duck fat pomme frites, they were soaked & sitting in a huge grease pool, I couldn't even eat them at all. Their filet tip mac & cheese is very dry & the meal taste like it cane from a box out of the frozen aisle at Wal-Mart.  After we were just over it because of how bad things were going with everything. We paid & left. 
   Going back to they just opened not long ago, staff was terrible & didnt seem trained well at all. The flies/gnats were ridiculous & it didn't seem very clean in the dining rooms at all from the ceiling to the floor. I think they need to close down & complete more training & cleaning & look over their menu & get rid of things because it seems as too much & they can't keep up. They also need to go over their menu/recipes on everything & adjust them. Teriyaki & bbq is not the same. Jack Daniel's whiskey sauce shouldn't be straight jack. 
We, the entire party of 6, will not be back. Awful

Dinner with friends a week ago at Prodigy Burger Bar in Greenwood. My friends first sandwich came out with a hair on it. Manager on duty brought second sandwich that was cooked medium rare but she ordered well done.  By the time they brought her third sandwich everyone else in the party was done eating. When she received her bill it was full price. We didn't expect to get anything for free but we did expect the manager to acknowledge their mistakes. The manager came to the table after our server got him and he was not a pleasant person. My friend told him what happened and he said "I know". She told him she was surprised that he didn't offer any kind of apology...no verbal, no discount, no offer of a dessert, nothing at all...to our complete shock his response... and I quote... "you ate the food so why do you expect anything? If I ordered and ate it I would pay full price no matter what happened.  If you feel like you deserve a discount I'm sorry." 
The manager on duty was John. We let him know that we would never be back to this restaurant again and he said "okay, I don't care" and walked away.  I think my statement of being shocked was an understatement. We go to dinner as a group every Thursday and this had been one of our stops every 2 or three weeks. Our combined totals, for the entire party, usually top $200 or more but apparently this restaurant group is doing so well that they don't need our business. We will definitely never return. Another person in our party was given the wrong sandwich as well.
rude and unprofessional management. they clearly care more about what's on the tv rather than doing their jobs.

Prodigy is new to the southside being opened for a couple of months now. The space is big and tables are spread out. Known for burgers, sandwiches and their fries. Great outside seating space for warmer weather. 

I ordered THE PRODIGY PBBQ - a barbecue sandwich on a pretzel roll topped with onion straws. Definitely soggy but you can pick it up and eat. I ate with a fork. Solid 3 out of 5. It was tender but just a typical grocery bbq sauce. Could of used coleslaw on top. 

My husband ordered The G.O.A.T. He really enjoyed and took half of it home for leftovers. Surprised by the $16 price tag. Way too much. 

You can build your own burger or build your own smash burgers which are like Steak 'n Shake patties. My kids ordered plain hamburgers and devoured.

The fries were good, they use a nice seasoning salt. Husband ordered the truffle fries and he ate every single one. The house chips are just ok. Would definitely order fries next time.

Came in for lunch. Server was excellent and extremely funny guy. The other two ladies who worked, one was the bartender and the other a manager I think. Absolutely reeked of marijuana. Now while I know that that's acceptable now to be under the influence while serving food is to much. Not the type of thing you want around your children. To make matters worse we left through the back lot and the same two ladies where blatantly smoking weed! Absolutely unacceptable. My Son is a cop and that kind of behavior is something that can get you into a lot of trouble. Very disappointing. And will not be coming back. My wife and I are praying for them.

My family and I were extremely excited to try Prodigy Burger in Greenwood. 
 for the 1st time. We arrived around 5:30pm on a Friday evening and it took about 5 mins to be greeted by the hosted.  She stated that they were extremely back log in the kitchen and even though there were many open seats she would not be able to seat us for 20 mins or so to give the kitchen time to get caught up. We were seated within the 20 min mark. 

We were seated for about 10 mins before our waitress introduced herself and took our dink order. My wife ordered a hard blueberry lemonade drink; when the waitress brought the drink out there were no blueberries in the drink. We asked and the waitress stated they were all out of blueberry's and that the blueberries get stuck to the ice and don't add any flavor so it's no big deal- we were completely shocked by her response! 

We then order our dinner; we ordered the fried green tomatoes, the Prodigy burger and the cobb salad.  I asked if I could have pepper jack cheese instead of cheddar cheese; the waitress said I could not alter the burger in anyway then I asked if I could have some extra pickles and she said she would have to check. 

We received our dinner and noticed there were no extra pickles and she said they don't have any extra to give out only what come with the burger. Then during this same time the table across from us was asking their waitress about their seasonal salad for it did not have any pecans, strawberries or apple slices on it and the waitress told them they were out of those items too. 

I asked to speak with the manage; after approx. 15 mins he come out and said is there a problem....why would you not tell someone that you do not have all the ingredients to make that item(s). I asked for the hard blueberry lemonade to be removed for the bill and he stated no. I then explained to him our experience and he said "you don't have to come back it you don't want too"- seriously!  The manager ended up giving us $1.00 off our bill. 

We eat out once a week typically on Friday evenings and we understand that the eating out experience is much different than pre covid; However, this was a horrific experience!!!

Ate at this location on Friday evening and our entire group has gotten violent food poisoning. I was the only one who did not eat dinner and I am the only one not sick. The service was great and our server was very pleasant but the food was awful. Very disappointed with the quality and obviously now knowing they may not take care of the food products correctly, we will not be back.

The food is pretty good here and the setting was really nice, especially the patio.  Service was friendly and prompt too.  Plenty of parking out front during lunch.

There were just a few minor issues that kept this from being better rating.  My wife and I ordered non-Alcoholic milk shakes and though the taste on each was delicious, the shakes were very thin, almost milk like.  I like my shake to be cold and more than chocolate milk in consistency.  We both noticed and I don't think that it had to do with it being a warm day on the patio.  We drank them fast.  The straws they provide are standard skinny straws so if you order a shake that has any cookie crumbs or fruit, you may have trouble getting those.  We asked for spoons to grab those bits.  Maybe they should look into getting boba straws while making the shakes thicker.  Skinny straws would be really tough to use if the shakes get thicker.

I broke one of my own rules by ordering seafood at a place that specializes in burgers.  I had one of their signature burgers at the Carmel Prodigy, so I decided to try the Teryaki Salmon just because it sounded good.  I devoured it and it was cooked perfectly.  Remained light and flaky and the sauce was tangy.  The steamed broccoli was a little bland (kind of expected), but some lemon pepper would go a long way to making it more tasty.
My wife ordered the Hoosier Daddy Tenderloin and like most places, the meat greatly exceeded the bun size making it necessary to cut the tenderloin and stack it to get any condiments and topping with the meat.  Much of the meat was cooked okay, but parts were really dry and tough to cut through with the table knife.  The breading was okay, but could have used more seasoning as well.  just a bit bland.  The house chips were crisp and crunchy, but the oil had a slight burned taste even though none of the chips were burned.    Everything was fine to eat, but no wow factor.  The Asian slaw that also came with my meal could have used just a bit of sweetness to offset the vinegary taste.  
  The restaurant looked very nice and clean and the patio is smartly styled with fresh flowers and plenty of umbrellas for the tables.  This place has a wide variety of foods available including cocktails and some craft beer (provided mainly by BrewLink).  I will gladly return to try some other items.  Good service throughout the meal.  Review #3937
Fantastic meal, service and atmosphere. Excellent location had great time with family! Food was fabulous. Get the Mac and cheese burger! Fries are 10/10.

Overall good service behind the bar. Quick service on drinks and got the Buffalo dip to go. However the actual serves did not seem to know what was going on. Also, as I was there the place was closing due to plumbing issues. Not sure if it will be open tomorrow.

The Buffalo dip was served with kettle chips that were immediately soggy and just not the right chip for the job anyway. The dip was ready within seconds (suspect). Would not really recommend. Prolly try their burgers I assume.

On  beautiful Thursday evening I took my 22 year old twins and friends to Prodigy for dinner. Our server wearing a nice Cubs mask which I complimented him on ran us out in less than 4 minutes. He seemed annoyed when I asked for a menu and if they had any specials. When we started ordering he demanded to see id's before we could look at the menu. Another guest asked for a Coke and He replied" I'm only taking orders for Alcohol right now that's why I asked for ID's" . His snarkyness and rudeness just cost Prodigy tonight's business and our business in the near future. 


PS. We came here to celebrate their 22nd birthday since covid ruined it last year. Dropped $200 at another spot and had a blast.

Don't go!!!!!!  Greenwood. St Rd 135 and County Line.
Tried to make reservations on Thurs for a group of 15.   Told they don't take reservations. Showed up at 1:50. Told it would be about 40 minutes.  Said we would wait. Asked about 30 minutes later if we could split up.  Said no. 55 minutes later after the group that was there left, they told us that we would have to split up, they couldn't seat 15.   Finally the manager came out from the side nobody was at. He had been sitting there on his computer not helping out. He argued with us saying we were told they couldn't seat us together earlier, which we  weren't. I tried to ask why they couldn't seat 15 now, but an hour ago they didn't say they couldn't.
Then he told us to get out and never come back.
Guess they did finally get something right.  We won't be back. Do the math of what they lost.

The food tasted great, a bit overpriced in my opinion. Had a mixed drink that tasted good and hit the spot. Unfortunately our waiter left a lot to be desired, he was pretty scarce and was downright rude at one point, hence only two stars. I probably would have given four stars but the waiter's rudeness left such a bad taste in our mouth I doubt we will ever go back to try it again.

Having passed this spot often we decided to meet friends on. Saturday night there to try it out. Upon entering we found it to busy and s bit loud, but were greeted promptly and led to our friends. The interior is nothing special and has several dark rooms with TVs, so I might suggest an overhaul of the decor but if you think sports bar then you won't be disappointed.

The waitress was prompt and friendly and had good suggestions. She was fast given the rush of people which we appreciated.

We ordered the fried pickled pears which were delicious! Think coney dog batter and crispness with a tender pickle inside. I loved them! Plus you got 5 spears which is plenty for sharing it almost a full meal. The sauce that came with it was also ideal as it had some spice but the creaminess of it tempered the fried crisp of the pickles.

We all got sandwiches or burgers and everyone seemed pleased. I had a veggie sandwich which was good. I liked the Asian slaw aspect which made it seem fresh and light. It came with house chips which my husband loved and thus ate. I actually preferred his fries which were perfection. Either way they had plenty of side choices fir s small upcharge.

I got a fresh cider which was delicious, and I always appreciate a place that has not just canned ciders.

Our friends had an adult milkshake as dessert and said they would go back for that again.

It was a great tasty spot for a night out, keeping in mind it is rather loud with the TVs so definitely not conducive for much conversation. But a fun spot.

One note though is that the floors were absolutely disgustingly dirty. As soon as we walked in both my husband and I were worried as if the floors are an indication of the overall cleanliness what might the kitchen look like? So note to managers, maybe beef up your cleaning and a more regular vacuuming is definitely needed. Or ask in Robert Irvine to change it all out for you so you can't see the dirt?

Burger was tasty but it drained a ton of watery stuff onto my paper- lined metal prison tray of a plate. Annoying and messy. I assume it was a sopping wet leaf of lettuce. Indicates inattention. Way overpriced for the quality, service and barren decor. Not cool. I will dine elsewhere.
Ridiculous prices for hamburgers also their "wagyu burger" LMAO that's aldi meat for sure. Fries are good though so I guess that's something

This place is a decent burger bar. They have lots of unique burger combinations. 

I am disappointed that they took away my favorite appetizer the tom Edison stuffed breadsticks. They were probably one of the best things on the menu.

I always get the craisan burger, something about peanut butter on a burger just makes my taste buds happy. 

It gets a four star from me because it is good but it is just another burger place. It doesn't set itself apart. 

Their desserts are limited and nothing to call home about. I would hold off and grab some ice cream from the local place up the street.

Got the smashed double burger. Patties were medium thickness small diameter and cooked to death. Restaurants really need to stop using the term smash burgers if they don't know how to make a real smash burger. "Steak n shake, Workingmans, smash burger, etc" Burgers are not good medium well to well done unless they are thin IMO. 

Loaded tots were cold, sent back and still got charged $3 up charge for them although I didn't get them remade because we were about done. 

$12 salad was like a side salad. 

Menu has a ton of options but hard to keep quality food coming out with that many options. 

Not very kid friendly. 

Service was great for the most part minus the up charge being removed. 

I give it 6 months.
The waitress have attitude. They think they are Angelina Jolie. Always eyeballing on guys especially the one with dragon tattoo. Food overpriced. Nothing much to drinks.

I'm going to give them 5 stars because my Long Island iced tea was fantastic the fries were delicious and my burger (The Captain) was cooked to perfection and delicious. I was there for the lunch rush and my food came out very quickly.

It was ok, we did finish our burgers. Food is all overpriced by a few dollars. The menu is so big it takes forever to find what you want. The drink menu is all 10.00 please see my pics for the menu. 3 basic burgers one soda 43.00 crazy.

In the spirit of trying something new, we ended up at Prodigy Burger. This place is huge inside. We were here once when it was the Irish place. They must have knocked down walls because it wasn't this big. We started with Breaded Cheese and Fried Green Tomatoes. The cheese was good, bit too much breading and I bet they are frozen not fresh breaded. The fried green tomatoes weren't green and were cut too thick making them sorta soft inside, but they had a lighter breading. Had they been half the the thickness they would have been better. I make awesome fried green tomatoes. I got the Ultimate Bacon Cheese Burger. Only complaint the bacon needed to be crisp. It was pretty stretchy. But the burger was good and cooked right and the fries were good. Husband got American Smash Burger he said it was good. He ate every bite and the Tots were good. He also got a Chocolate Madness Shake. I thought it was pretty chocolatey he said it could have been more chocolate, but he's a chocoholic. One friend got the Hoosier Daddy Tenderloin. I didn't much care for the texture but she liked it and it was her sandwich. She got a side of house made chips and they were pretty good. Other friend got BYOB I don't remember what she got but she also ate it all. God Son got the Mac N Cheese Smash. It was super messy. It kept sliding all over the bun but he loved it. He also got a Cookies and Cream Shake. I would like to try the Carmel location to see how they differ in food and service. Our server was a bit rushed and got a little snappy at one point. The folks that brought out the food were super nice and made sure we had plates and extra napkins.

Outdoor seating is pleasantly decorated with planters.  Fried pickles and fish & chips were very good with nice proportions.  Smothered filet tips were good but a little salty.  Server was friendly and attentive.  I knocked them down a star because they are not honoring their special nights shown on line and in their menu.  For example, I went for their Monday tenderloin special, but was told the south Indy site is not doing that.

Dinner with friends last night at Prodigy Burger Bar in Greenwood. Our friends first sandwich came out with a hair on it. Manager on duty brought second sandwich that was cooked medium rare but she ordered well done.  By the time they brought her third sandwich everyone else in the party was done eating. When she received her bill it was full price. We didn't expect to get anything for free but we did expect the manager to acknowledge their mistakes. The manager came to the table after our server got him and he was not a pleasant person. My friend told him what happened and he said "I know". She told him she was surprised that he didn't offer any kind of apology...no verbal, no discount, no offer of a dessert, nothing at all...to our complete shock his response... and I quote... "you ate the food so why do you expect anything? If I ordered and ate it I would pay full price no matter what happened.  If you feel like you deserve a discount I'm sorry." 
The manager on duty was John. We let him know that we would never be back to this restaurant again and he said "okay, I don't care" and walked away.  I think my statement of being shocked was an understatement. We go to dinner as a group every Thursday and this had been one of our stops every 2 or three weeks. Our combined totals, for the entire party, usually top $200 or more but apparently this restaurant group is doing so well that they don't need our business. We will definitely never return. Another person in our party was giving the wrong sandwich as well.

The cheese curds were yummy, but our server was less than proficient..the tenderloin had way too much breading and the patty melt had way too much bread and not enough meat.....it didn't taste bad, but it just wasn't what we were looking for.   I can't see us going back....the little blonde server that helped our server was really good....we should have tipped her.

The better half and I decided to try Prodigy Burger Bar for the very first time, needless to say, I was quite impressed with my turkey burger and side salad!

I ordered a turkey burger on a lettuce bun, with bacon, American and Gouda cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, pickle, red onion, sautéed onions, mayo, ketchup, mustard and avocado!  It was delicious, cooked perfectly!! I ordered it with a side salad and the apple vinagrette dressing, loved that it was a real salad and that no iceberg lettuce was involved!! I snuck some of hubby's fries and they were yummy too, a sweet/salty combination.

If you haven't been, I highly recommend it.  As well as everywhere else right now, they seem to be having trouble with staffing, so come with some time to have a drink and enjoy your time there - or maybe if your looking for employment...

The only drawback was they seemed to be short staffed, things took a little longer than they needed to, but the food was enough to bring me back for sure.

Yum yum yum. As soon as I finished my plate, I was wishing for seconds. I had the CLT which was fried green tomatoes, lettuce, and pimento cheese on toasted bread. This sandwich had so much flavor and the tomatoes were super crispy. I didn't miss the bacon at all, although you can add it for an additional cost. The fries were good but I was hoping for the pub chips the menu listed with the sandwich.

I ordered for delivery and everything was packaged well. It even came in a sealed bag.

There were several other things on the menu, including the option to "create your own masterpiece" burger I wanted to try so I'll definitely be back.

Not sure  why this place only has 1 review, because it is soooo great. The staff was super awesome. We came after they closed but they were still kind enough to accomodate us. They made us salmon sandwich and mac n cheese balls because that was the only thing they could make with their grill off. I was a bit skeptical because it's kinda whatever they could do with grill off. But OMG its soooo good. The food was crispy on the outside and the inside was so tender and juicy and tasty. Full of favor. But most of all, such a great staff!! Had a super great expetience and glad I made the stop!
Amazing ribs, pulled pork, and mac n' cheese!!! They are no longer in the Boxyard after the lockdown. Where did they go? A great friendly staff with great customer service. Please help someone.

I'm always weary of mesquite smoked meat as mesquite tends to burn too hot and leave an acrid flavor on the meat. My concerns came to fruition. The ribs were undercooked, not raw by any means, but undercooked that the ribs took a lot of effort to eat. Cutting the ribs almost broke the plastic knife. The ribs was cold and then reheated on the grill top which lead to a rib that was too hot to handle in certain areas and too cold in others. So context for this place, it's a cool place to grab  bite while you're drinking at the Boxyard, but definitely not a BBQ joint to be a destination.

We stopped into the new location at the Metro Wildcat convenience store.  I wish I would have asked the owner his name, but cool guy from the Bronx.  Tucson was his last stop in the Air Force, and he stayed making these delicious burgers!  We tried the catfish burger and the regular burger, both were just great!  The buns were the perfect size and fluffy - on point.  The catfish had coleslaw and a nice bite that made my nose run!  There were fried onions and cheese on the burger, the burger was juicy and went down like butter!  The mac and cheese balls were ok, there was a green sauce inside of them that threw me off a bit, but great experience.  They've only been in this location for a month, and the owner asked how we heard about him, which was Andi from "This is Tucson"!  Burgers were a steal at $7.00 each, and you can get 4 of them for $20.00 at happy hour which runs from 4:20 - 5:20!

No lie, the staff is sooooo friendly, it's as good as their food!! Whether you're drinking or not, you will enjoy the food. We were there after they closed and they were still nice enough to keep the stove running for us, and in all honesty I couldn't be more grateful. Have their balls or salmon burger, unless you hate fish, you wont hate this. Whoever writes a weak review for the lovely staff is only depicting their weak persona. Respect to the staff, and more importantly, the food. Thank you for your kind cuisine service. 

Sincerely, 
L.A. snob foodie

#bronxbbq

I've been to this location several times and never had any problems with ordering or our pizzas.  Normally would only give a pizza place 3 or 4 stars, but feel like I need to counter the bad reviews.  Most importantly my kid like the pizzas.  Glad they are closer now.

I have given this store a couple shots thinking how bad can you screw up a chain store?  Pizza Hut is Pizza Hut right?....How hard can it be?  First off answer the fricken phone?  The phone rang approximately seven times and then sent me to an automated service asking me if I wanted to hear the specials or if I was ready to order.  I was ready to order so I hit the designated number. Well I guess the system knew the store was unavailable to take my order and then chose to send me to some #800 center where apparently several hundred people are employed to just take the overflow Pizza Hut calls.  Interesting.....but okay let's just get the order in and my delivery going.  Well this person located somewhere in the US can't find my address in google maps, which has been happening because it is new construction.  So she says she has to transfer me back to the store where they will know more about the local area.  I said the local store is not answering which is how I then got to her.  She says, well they will answer for us!  What the hell?  So she gets back on and says when I transfer you back you will be on hold and someone will be right with you.  I was on hold for 7 minutes.  Service sucks.

Please understand, given our location we have very few options.  Sooooo I hung up and called back this time someone answered.  Delivery was going to be 2 hours so we decided to do pick up.  All three pizzas were over cooked and horrible.  I WILL NOT visit this store again.

If I could give less stars I would. I've been giving this location a chance since it opened and EVERY SINGLE TIME they screw something up. We've ordered wigs from this location several times and every time we would go to pick them up and they hadn't even started cooking them. Tonight we ordered pizza and had  to wait almost 2 hrs for delivery. It's ridiculous. The staff is rude and horrible at their job. I refuse to order here ever again.

Ordered delivery. Pizza arrived undercooked and doughy. Called and complained they sent out a replacement. Another undercooked pizza. I drove to the location and let em have it. Managers response was that sometimes pizzas just cook like that?!?!?!? Do I look like an idiot. Never again. Fix it before you get people sick!

Ordered late night pizza 1030pm placed the order the manager Jacob calls me and tells me that it's going to be an hr or an hr and 30 mins for it to get here. Which I thought is pretty normal. After we got off the phone I saw they closed at 11pm so I guess he was trying to get me to cancel it. My stuff arrives within 40 mins and when they drop the pizza off, no one rings the bell or knocks on the door and just leaves the pizza outside and walks away, if my security camera didn't notify me, I would have never known it was there. When I go grab it I notice that one of my sides looks like it's been stepped on, and one of the pizzas the cheese is stuck to the top of the cardboard like it had been pushed up against the roof of the pizza box or flipped with the amount of sauce that was on everywhere. 
I get that it was close to when everyone is getting off, but you close at 11pm I ordered 30 mins before, you can't punish your customers by ruining there food. 
I spent close to 60$ and I left the driver a 6$ tip. 
Are you guys for real.

I don't know why we continue to do this to ourselves- the fact is that we rarely ever order from here. And we forget.
our memories of spending the night in the bathroom after consuming one of their pizzas fades away and the $8 coupon for a large pizza seems too good to pass up. 
The crust is greasy and the sauce is tasteless. Sickness ALWAYS follows. 
The people who work inside the restaurant have not figured out what customer service is just yet. 
Maybe they should hire more people?
Maybe they should make employees wash their hands?
Maybe they should cook pizzas thoroughly?
Is salmonella an extra topping I'm not paying for?

I've been meaning to post a review but life happens and I forget. Today when ordering online  I noticed the reviews weren't great for this location and I thought I've never had a problem the last few years.  
Pizza Hut has actually been the fastest delivery, hottest pizza and friendliest staff in the area. Today it said 70-80 minute wait time for delivery it was actually around 40 minutes or less. As always the pizza and breadsticks were hot and delicious. 
The first time I ordered delivery a few years back they got to our house so fast that I even said "Wow, that was super duper fast."  The man apologized and they emailed me a coupon.  He must of thought I was not happy but I was.  The pizza was cooked; hot, fresh and delicious. I even left awesome feedback on their survey. 
I've had no complaints in the last few years.  I have gone here for carry-out as well and they are always polite and my pizza is always hot and the correct order.
