Pizza Hut has always been my favorite since I was a kid. We would go inside; eat breadsticks and salad bar why we waited for our pizza.  We would play songs on the jukebox and of course play PAC-MAN. Those were the good old days.  At least now we can still enjoy the same pizza at home.  
Thanks Pizza Hut for being prompt, polite and above all hot, fresh, delicious pizza.
This is by far the finest place to eat. Their Sunday Brunch is fab...service is fantastic and the atmosphere is by far gorgeous..
Excellent service, friendly staff. Food was outstanding from the Cesar salad to the crawfish Napoleon and the gulf fish. I highly recommend this restaurant. Great atmosphere.

Someone suggested to come here for brunch- came on a Sunday with my son and his friend. Overpriced, slow service, live music was practically non existent. We were there for about an hour and they played for about 10 minutes. Food was not bad but it was not at all what we expected at that price- would not recommend

Crab cakes were awesome!  Pork chop was dry. 

Services was bad. 

Honestly not worth the prices .... I won't be back.
I'll say for the price, the quality of this food could be ALOT better! But Our waiter was wonderful, I'll add.
Awesome dinner. The crawfish cakes things were good, the trout was better, and the gratin almost made me fall out of my chair.

We were here on a Monday, we had great service.   We walked in with reservation and were seated right away.   The music was playing in the patio creating a great feel.  

There was plenty of food selections, turtle soup was great.  The glazed ham was amazing and made to order omelets.   Plenty of desert options too.  

Staff was very attentive through out our meal.

OMG!!! Beautiful experience. Respectful and attentive waiter. He had the Brunch menu to the point. We had a nice peaceful brunch delight!
The turtle soup was a dream... very substantial and excellent with the Sherry on top(I add the plentiful amount) the duck was tender, the veal was divine, the grits to its maximum- I wished my tummy was larger. I ended with the savory pecan pie!! Yummy

This restaurant deserves 0 Stars! Recently, I went to Two Sisters and experienced discrimination by the owner. I overhead the owner/manager stating that they did not like Hispanic/Latinos people working or dining at the restaurant.  I felt deeply disgusted, outraged, and offended by such heinous comments.  New Orleans is a city that embraces a diverse and rich Spanish, Latin, creole, and African American culture. To have a business owner/management express such ignorant and inhumane views is unacceptable.  If you care about equality and respect for all human beings, do not eat at this restaurant. There many more delicious, diverse and inclusive dining options in New Orleans.

You pay for the ambiance! We were seated close to the tree in the center of the courtyard (which made for fantastic photos) and paid approx. $45 for two people for brunch (no drinks).  The turtle soup was too salty for our liking, and overall the food was okay, but you don't dine here for the food but for the location. We will certainly be back!

This is my favorite market to stop in. The new bakery is amazing with fresh bread, hand pies, cookies, and other delectable desserts. They have a great selection of olives, cheese, spices, Turkish meats, and pantry staples. You have to stop in to see all of the offerings. I always leave buying more than I intended to!

This is located next to an Army Surplus store.  Great spot to pick up lunch meat, milk, fruit and veggies. Prices are good. Owned by a very nice Turkish couple, and they are always happy to answer a question. Try the round Turkish bread with sesame seeds. Get some Merve white cheese, roma tomatoes, green onions and olives here. Makes a great lunch. Baklava is good as are the home made salads such as hummus, potato, macaroni etc. They have a butcher who is very accommodating. He will double grind your ground beef to order. Good soups. Marinated chicken kabobs are delicious. Haven't tried the lamb & beef kabobs yet. Next on my list.

Went here today to pick up some lamb kebabs for the grill. Emily offered some advice on how to prepare an authentic Turkish yogurt sauce to accompany the lamb. Picked up some cucumbers, fresh herbs, and peeled garlic as well. Very nice kebabs, had a nice spice to them.

Harry-West Chester, Pa. Visit Delran, NJ  every 12 months (put Christmas decorations on family graves in nearby Riverside) and always stop at Turkish Market on drive home. Miss seeing the old WWII tank out front, but love the new Four Seasons Market, especially the baked goods. The hand made turkish cookies and pastries are "to die for" delicious. Not overly sweet and filled with fresh fruits baked to perfection. At $8 lb-order a variety and enjoy the diverse flavors with your tea. Darn shame Christmas only comes once a year. Enjoy 5*****

This is my favorite Turkish supermarket.
Honestly it's very clean,organized,great product, meat section is very good . 
I wanted to get some Adana and chicken for BBQ and I was happy I drove all the way there because it wasn't a disappointment . My family enjoyed every little bit of that meat , so tender,juicy . 
Now this is my ultimate place for any Turkish products.

The bakery in this place is amazing, lots of delicious breads and pastries. We've also been to Tasking bakery in Patterson New Jersey, and I have to say four seasons is just as good, with many item we think are better! The staff are helpful and friendly, we love coming here.

Over the last few days, we tried the Adana Kabab, kofta and Turkish style burgers...nothing taste like before. Adana kebab has a weird taste and the kofte and burgers are chewy...it looks like chef Usman left and took all the recipe secrets...

Really disappointed with the food quality at this place. We used to get the ready to grill Adana Kabab and kofte and prepared doner, but since the butcher chef Usman left this place few months ago, the meat quality is not like before.

Chef Usman used to also prepare homemade awarma and Sujuk. I'm now hesitating to buy awarma and Sujuk from this place.

Really sad to see this happen to one of my favorite stores in the area.

I guess we will have to look for another place that prepares the Turkish products the way chef Usman used to.

By the way, All the photos I'm posting here are from the time when chef Usman was the butcher at this store.

I stopped in for the first time over the Christmas holiday.  I saw a sign advertising chicken gyro and mentioned it to my wife.  She decided to take me there and I have to say I was really surprised.  It is a Turkish market with halal meat.  The gyro are chicken during the week and beef in the weekends.  It was different the. The traditional gyro because it is served as a sandwich not on a pita.  It also does NOT have the normal white sauce.

I requested to have the chicken gyro sandwich how it would "normally " be made.  It was great. We also bought bread and that was fantastic as well.

Stop in and give it a try.

Have driven by this place a million times so I finally decided to go in and check it out. Lots of packaged cookies and canned tomatoes and pickled veggies in a jar. Spices looked very interesting. There is a bakery with fresh baked bread and sweets behind the counter so I thought I might buy some baked goods. I bellied up to the counter and stood there for about 5 minutes but the man behind the counter completely ignored me. There were no other customers but he seemed to be doing some kind of busy work. I gave up on the bakery, but then I saw the meat counter, which also offers takeout food. So I walk up to that counter, intending to get a takeout, and the two women behind the counter completely ignore me for about 5 minutes. They didn't have other customers to help so I got the sense that they did not want to deal with me because I am not from their culture. But that seems like a poor way to run a business. Stay away from this place!

This Burger King is very clean. I also loved Abigail the cashier and her awesome cheerful attitude. You can tell she's trying to do a great job and I appreciate that. Overall doesn't seem like a great work environment but Abigail really goes over the top to make you feel at home and she asked you if you need any other additional things like sauces while you wait for your order to come out. Way to go Abigail!

Its unfortunate that I read some of the reviews and still decided to go ahead and have my husband order the veggie burger with fries. First of all, we ordered via drive through and the young Lady was very rude: no hello, no thank you, no please.. We get to the second window, we pay and we are told to "pull up" (again,noone used the word "please"). So we pulled up, waiting..not sure why..but patiently waiting...5min passed, 10 min passed, 2 cars from the line decided to drive away as the waiting become quit long..Since we paid we had to wait..my husband decided to drive back to where we originally ordered the burger ,and same young Lady was like: pull to the second window (after we asked about our burger). So we finally got the burger and asked what happened,why wouldnt ANYONE tell us that it would take time to get that burger.  Anyways, burger was hard and definitely not tasty..its unfortunately that we wasted out time AND money ... 
If you can avoid eating there, you better do so. 
I think the manager of the store needs to educate young people at Burher King about simple etiquette and benefits of providing positive customer service..

Took forever to get our food. There was only one other couple inside. The line was long however the staff (mostly the cooks) were taking their time, making jokes with coworkers, and moving very slowly. Did not seem to care about customer service. On top of waiting. We overheard them about to cancel our part of order we had been waiting for saying it already went out. Luckily we caught it in time to stop them. A half of my husband's crispy chicken sandwich was tough and inedible so he stuffed the bare buns with nuggets to salvage his lunch. Wouldn't return to this location again.
My entire family loves Burger King and the famous whopper. It is a family place for sure

**Updated Review***. I gave a review from a poor experience I had at this BK.  This location has made some changes and it shows.  I had the pleasure to interact with Betty at the drive-thru window and she was phenomenal!!! Betty was polite and courteous and exactly what customers need, especially during a time like this.   Thank you Betty!  You Rock!!

I have been here before and received great service.  I went there last night with my son and it was obvious that Noelia doesn't like working there.  After telling me to pull forward and handing me my food, I told her thank you, she just nodded.  She handed me my credit card, didn't say thank you, never made eye contact.  I told her thank you one more time, she nodded again and shut the window... This is our future, it's a shame.

Not only did I have a poor experience at Burger King one day, but actually two days in a row! On the first night I went into the lobby to avoid the long line in the drive through. After waking in and waiting over 25 minutes for my order, my order was incorrect. I had dealt with the same manager and employee during my whole time. I called when I got home and realized the order was wrong. I spoke to the manager and she said she would gladly replace it tomorrow. The following day we returned. The cashier was the same gentleman from the night before but he said he didn't remember me at all. The manager on duty finally came up and said she saw a note in the back about my order and then said that she would have someone create it right then. After about 10 minutes none of the employees had made my meal yet because they have seemed to forgotten about it. Finally after about 10 more minutes they bagged up my meal!
Worst Burger King in the area. Say in the drive thru 20 minutes got tired of waiting and left. I went here October 20 2021 at 650 PM

Slowest "fast food" on the planet. Don't order the new chicken sandwich unless you plan on dining inside. Had a 20 minute wait in drive through while they figured out how to make it

After a very long wait. No apology. Forgot to give us napkins. And made the new sandwich wrong

Traveling through Wilmington for a family event. The bakery just opened, owner is super helpful. Enjoyed a quiche, chocolate croissant and two rounds of iced cold brew latte - the foam was sweet and delicious, I left with a nice coffee buzz to start our morning
Went here today again and glad to see word is getting out and they had more customers today.   I had the banana nutella crepe, my friend had the quiche Lorraine!    Both awesome dishes!

Stopped by the bakery this morning after a coffee run (I should have waited because their coffee menu looks great). It's walking distance from many of the hotels on the Riverfront in Wilmington. This area is growing and has great shops and dining. We purchased cinnamon rolls, quiche, and the croissant donuts (filled with strawberry cream cheese filling). They were all amazing! Next time we visit, we will definitely be trying the crepes. The staff took the time to explain the menu thoroughly and were very kind. Will be back for sure!

Beat quiche ever!  My daughter just moved to Justison Landing and we were looking for a quick place for lunch. Saw the bakery and decided to try it. We both ordered the salmon quiche and a salad. Both were excellent. The salad was a simple spinach and cherry tomato salad with balsamic dressing. And the quiche was delicious. The staff was very attentive and pastries looked amazing although we didn't indulge
Amazing pasties and baked goods. Chocolate Croissant was interesting. Chico are baked into flake rather then a chocolate goo

Just went here for the first time and I love the simplistic and clean aesthetic of this quaint cafe. I think it's a phenomenal addition to the riverfront. On my first trip, I bought a regular croissant, a chocolate croissant and a sugar brioche. As you can see in the pictures, the croissants were under baked and did not turn out flaky as a well done croissant should. The middle was gooey (not in a good way) and when I cut into the chocolate croissant, it fell flat. It was really disappointing because the ladies making the pastries looked super professional. Otherwise, I think the flavors were spot on. I am optimistic that this place will improve on quality as time goes on.
Amazing - very clean, friendly staff, great selections. The quiche are fantastic! The "cronuts" are filled with blueberry filling - I think everyone should try them at least once in their life!

Stopped in a couple times.  1st time I walked in and realized quickly from the menu that it's not your typical American "bakery", so i walked out empty handed feeling a tad intimidated. 2nd time i walked in i was able to try a cold mocha coffee or something like that and it was delicious!  3rd time I came back with my father for breakfast.  We both had small coffees and decided to split the sun-dried tomato quiche.   Coffee was just WOW good.  My dad will never think to get a large actually said he easily could have downed a large it was that good.  I agree!  The quiche was so delicate in flavor and texture... i want it again!  Its quite filling, but worth every bite!

So happy there is an alternative to Giant Coffee Co on same block. This bakery is excellent. Delicious baked goods all made on premise and La Colombe coffee. Cool environment and friendly staff. What's not to love.

This place is amazing!  Bittersweet that I don't live in the area, but I will surely stop by whenever I'm passing through. 

To add to the wonderful pastries, desserts and quiches, the staff will make you feel like a welcomed friend.  Margo and Julia were both, so kind and professional and the rest of the staff who's names I didn't get, were genuinely kind as well. 

I was looking for something that was hearty for breakfast, but not too heavy, for I wanted to get in a workout.  I had the Chicken quiche the first day and the Salmon quiche the next and not only were they delicious and the filling perfectly cooked, the crust was as flaky as you can get. I was bursting with energy after having had it and when I went to the gym a few hours later, I felt as if I could go all day! 

This place is a hidden gem in Wilmington and you will not be disappointed if you go.  I was half tempted to pull a move from the movie Last Holiday, where Queen Latifahs character ordered one of everything on the menu, for everything in there looked like baked perfection. Perhaps someday... 

Kudos to you, Riverfront Bakery!
The absolute best cheesecake I've ever tasted! It's too bad we couldn't bring them back to Virginia because they're so soft and moist (they wouldn't travel well)
Holy wow! The chocolate croissant and the sugar chouquette from here were amazing. The space is open and bright and the staff very friendly.
Great location, delicious croissants, great coffee, lovely staff. Smells great in there.
Found the Bakery on Yelp as we were passing through. Had w warm welcome when we walked in. Had a hot coffee and chocolate croissant, delicious! Great selection and place was vey clean!

This bakery is only 2 weeks old today and is off to an awesome start.   You walk in and the atmosphere is light and airy.   High ceilings.  And the food - OMG delicious.   My friend and I had the quiches, she had the chicken quiche and I had the salmon quiche.   Both were really good.  They play good music, part of the vibe to this place.   So glad to have Riverfront Bakery in our 'hood!!!!!  Welcome!

I wasn't expecting this place to be as AMAZING as it was! I'm from DC and I would go back here in a heartbeat over some of the highly rated places there. The service was phenomenal and they even came out of the cafe after we had gotten carry out to make sure everything was okay. The donut was unlike anything I've ever tried- so unique and delicious. The chocolate brioche which was the day's special was an even better take on a chocolate croissant. The draft latte was perfect! Not bitter at all and very smooth.  I can't wait to come back here when I'm in the area! Highly recommend!

Absolutely love the Riverfront Bakery. Food is fresh and delicious. The quiche Lorraine melts in your mouth. The Nutella banana crepes are perfect. We took some pastries home for the week. They also offered special orders for Easter, bake at home kits and cooking classes! We will definitely come back.

This was part of a weekend getaway. Ending with brunch here. The sit-down dining was available and it was quite empty when we came but almost full when we left

Tea was quite good. Coffee was also good

Ham and cheese sandwich was
Quiche with salmon was the excellent.
Their pastries did not look great from the window. We did not try them however
Parking is on the street. And easy to find and free.

Services great. You order at the counter and they bring the food to you if you do sit down and dine.

Overall if I was in the area I would definitely check out this place.
This is an outstanding bakery. Chicken salad on a croissant was delicious as were the pastries, especially the one with hazelnut creme. We tried 4 different items Anna all were delicious!
The bun was not bad, but it was burnt on the bottom, so I rated it low.   I may return for a croissant, but this place is just okay.

Stopped by for a quick bite on our way to the Children's museum. Area was clean and well spaced. The service was great - very kind and helpful. Ordered ham and Gruyère cheese croissant and the quiche Lorraine, a coffee, and a cinnamon roll to go. I loved the croissant sandwich, would definitely get it again. Quiche was awesome as well. The rosemary was a little strong so my kids didn't eat it, and the ham was diced a little big but overall it was very tasty. They serve La Combe coffee and it was the best cup I've had in a while. We went at 11:15 on a weekday so it wasn't very busy. It's across from constitution yards beer garden so we are outside there and let the kids run around. Definitely delicious and will definitely be back!
Delicious French crepes and pastries. Very attractive store, plenty of parking and worth the trip.  I really hope people support this business.  And there's a great pet shop next door.
Wonderful! Quality food, nice people. Bright, clean, with open kitchen, and some indoor/outdoor seating. The Quiche Lorraine was excellent.  I'll be grabbing a chocolate croissant to go!
Can't say enough good things about this place!  EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING but the Napoleon was one of the best things I've put in my mouth in a looong time!

Always leave with something really great from here, took home a chicken potpie and eggs loraine the other day and was really impressed.
will definitely go back here when in need of quality baked goods!

A friend and I visited Riverfront Bakery on our drive between Philly and Baltimore last weekend. We stopped in for a few pastries and a couple of coffees. The pastries were pretty good, the service good, and the space nice. Not a bad place for a quick bite for breakfast or lunch!

This bakery is amazing! It only got 4 stars because their hours are awful (8-3) and their exteriors lacks a call to action- there's nothing from the outside that pulls you in. 

IMO, it should be open earlier to catch the morning crowd heading to work (have you seen how busy Starbucks is at 7a.m.?)- many mornings I'd love a delicious croissant but they're not open. Not to mention getting a dessert to take home after work or a coffee and sweet treat after dinner or movies- you can't- they're closed. 

 I passed by for a long time before stopping in because I didn't have a need for cakes or cookies. But this is far from a typical American bakery. Looking at the bakery from the front, you'd never know it's a European bakery. There's just a black awning that says "Riverfront Bakery", no personality to it. You have to go straight up to the window and peer in to have any idea what deliciousness lies within. They have an assortment of goodies that include freshly made crepes, quiche, scones, croissants and so much more!

I tried the chicken salad and it was very fresh but sadly lacked any flavor. It tasted like chicken & mayonnaise and that's it. However, everything else that I've tried is wonderful.

They have a small sign across the street from Starbucks that tells more about the place than looking at it from the outside. The folks that own it aren't very friendly or personable either, but their treats make up for it. If you can catch the place open, it's worth stopping in.

Giving it 3 stars only due to VERY poor customer service. The baked goods are amazing!! Really good quality!! I the issue with the poor service is really hard to overlook. I should also add that I am frequent customer so this review is not just based off what could have been one "bad day". The staff who works the counter is inattentive, unfriendly and indifferent towards customers. I hope the owner can invest in some additional training to help make this a better experience.

I keep looking for the elusive perfect traditional croissant and it remain elusive except for one place that is way too far for a weekly jaunt.   In any case, I did try Riverfront's plain and chocolate croissants to see if they come close.   Sad to say, they don't.  Yes they are airy but I would not call them flaky.   The dough itself is very eggy and almost has the texture of a popover.  However, I also got the chouquette and this was a very tasty pastry with a cream that was not quite whipped cream nor patisserie cream but something in between.   I would order this again.   So this gets a 5, the croissants a 3. Overall, food 4 stars.

I can see where parking might be challenging here but I was lucky to get a spot out front.

Love this addition to the Wilmington Riverfront! 

Riverfront Bakery is an adorable little establishment offering delicious pastries and La Colombe coffee that we tried for a recent Sunday breakfast. They offer a few tables along one wall and have set up a couple of outdoor tables to be more COVID-friendly. All staff were masked and sanitizer was readily available, and there is a layer of glass through which you can watch COVID-safe workers prepare more pastry. 

We had a tough time choosing which pastries to try; they offer a lot of traditional French baked goods like chocolate croissants and pain aux raisins. We wound up with a plain croissant, a cheese brioche, an "everything" brioche (modeled after the bagel, of course!), and their croissant-donut of the day, which was pumpkin pie flavored. The croissant was excellent, with the light, flakiness you'd expect from a well-baked croissant. The brioches both had pockets of cheese and flavor in the middle, along with seasoning on top --- both were delicious, though I think BF and I agreed we preferred the Everything Brioche over the Cheese. The croissant donut was delicious --- two donut-shaped pieces of cinnamon-sugar covered flaky pastry with pumpkin spiced pastry cream between, a divine fall treat. 

I'm looking forward to trying more of the menu, including crepes and quiches. 

Side note: the quote painted above the menu speaks to Yelpers everywhere: "There is no love sincerer than the love of food." Clearly, the designers of this place are my kind of people.
The croissants are wonderful and the staff have always been helpful and friendly. Love having this little bakery here, and it's an extra bonus that they serve La Colombe coffee

I happened upon this spot for a quick "make it through the afternoon" sweet and was surprised to find they make sandwiches too. The chicken salad sandwich which is typically served on a croissant, sounded really good. The lady recommended I get it on a fresh baked baguette, and who was I to tell he how to do her job? It was one of the best chicken sammys I've had. Baked goods are on point too, but that chicken salad sammy keeps me coming back...had to remark about it today. Get you some!!!

Everything was fantastic. Brioche was amazing. Excellent croissants. Had chicken salad sandwich and ham and cheese sandwich and both were very good. Would definitely go back again. Looking forward to crepes next time
Great food at reasonable prices. Their Calzones are huge and delicious.  We order from Paradise often and will continue to do so.

FALSE ADVERTISING AS AUNTIE EMILYS PASTA HOUSE ON DOOR DASH. I originally ordered through DoorDash as the food looked great by the photos which look nothing like it does irl, unknowing that Aunties was actually Paradise Pizza Cafe (which I have ordered from once before and hated). I ordered the cheesy garlic bread, chicken parm & shrimp scampi. The cheesy bread that I received was on stale bread with half melted mozzarella cheese. The chicken parm is over cooked spaghetti with a frozen chicken patty. The shrimp scampi had the smallest shrimp that I have ever seen, the noodles were over cooked and tasted like lemon extract and a dirty oven (similar to the way 7-11 pizza smells and tastes). I'm usually not the one to make a big deal about when I order from somewhere and dislike the food but it's gone too far when you're being misleading about where the food is coming from & what it looks like!

This place is absolutely horrible PLEASE STAY AWAY. I wanted to give this place a shot....... and a chance even after the 150 min delivery time estimate YES OVER two hours.....thinking well MAYBE the QUALITY is worth it..... nope. Here is an example of what the "Cobb salad" is like. To the owner : please hire or do better yourself maybe some friends can help you out for cheap idk but figure it out.

I learned about this little spot when I was delivering a doordash order from them. I decided to give the place a shot and ordered the chicken alfredo and it came with the garlic butter bread knots. A great pairing and a great meal. Will be returning.

We were super excited to try this new place out. Ordered pepperoni pizza, cheesy garlic bread, and fried mushrooms. It tasted generic-the bread, the sauce, the cheese...everything tasted previously frozen and flavorless. We ended up throwing it away.
Went in to pick up an order and the person who gave me my order was very rude to me made me feel like a criminal never do business here again

I saw this place on UberEats for the first time a week ago and was craving chicken wings so decided I'd take a chance. These wings were SOO good! Good sized wings and not skimpy, great quality, cooked to perfection, and the sauce had a great flavor as well. Wow! The lack of reviews on here makes me think maybe this place is new? If so - do yourself a favor and try them out. I'd never heard of them and can now confirm they have amazing food at unbeatable prices. Under $1/wing?! Ok! And to reiterate, it didn't taste like cheap "get what you paid for" food. They offer a very fair price point especially when so many families are out of work and businesses are needing our service to stay alive. Go here so they can stick around!
Absolutely amazing! Peter the sushi chef knocked it out of the park. Best sushi I have ever had with gorgeous presentation. We will be back!
Super good service. The rolls were excellent. Good fried dumplings and egg rolls. Beautiful presentation. Highly recommended!

Great new Thai and Sushi place! We had the volcano rolls, pad Thai, and orange chicken. We got to meet the sushi chef, and he's been making sushi for over 25 years! It was some of the best sushi we have had in Nashville. Our pad Thai and orange chicken were also good, and they had pretty nice sized portions. I definitely recommend them- and try to dine in if you can!

We had a great experience here at LJ's! They have recently reopened under new management. We hadn't been to the old spot, but were excited to try the new one.

It was pretty quiet when we were there which made sense. It was clean and I noticed the fish looked really fresh!

Our server was attentive and helpful. We original ordered the beef salad to which I explained I didn't love the rice powder. It was served with rice powder which was mistaken for MSG which I'm allergic to so they took it back happily. It's still unsure if there was MSG in the dish.

My husband got a yellowtail roll and pad see Mao with beef. The noodles were really good and he said it was the best Thai food he's tried in Nashville so far!

I did the sashimi/Sushi combo. It looked gorgeous! And the pieces of fish were thick and bright in color! It normally comes with crab, but they helped sub it for me. There was so much I couldn't finish it. But it was really delicious, tasted fresh, and was a fantastic deal!

The ginger dressing was so yummy. They don't sell it yet, but when they do we will buy it!

We love that this spit is local to us too with lots of free parking. There are still plenty of things on the menu we would like to try so we look forward to coming back! I'll also likely be back for some lunch specials!

Really homey place, great food. Was planning to eat at sub-par text mex restaurant next door and saw the lights on here. I'm so glad we decided to come in. We tried some apps and sushi this time, but were enticed by the other entrees which included thai noodles/curries, pho, teriyaki dishes and fried rice. The man behind the sushi bar was so kind and hospitable. He made suggestions as we looked through the menu. The sushi portions were huge and well priced for the great freshness and superior plating. We will be excited to come back!

I found this restaurant on Yelp as I was sitting in parking lot of Cracker Barrel, and decided to divert. I am so happy I did. This place is an absolute gem. It's in a strip shopping center and very unassuming from the outside. Inside, it's very well layed-out and so clean. I was impressed the tables were being cleaned with bleach wipes. It has a split level plan with 3 small-group-sized private dining areas, and a main open seating area with booths. There was only one server, but he was quick, attentive, polite, and accurate. On their website they have some pics of their food. The one of the Tuna Tataki is what lured me (I'm sure it's a stock photo), but the presentation in person was even better. I started with the avocado salad, then to the Tataki, and for a main course the red curry with chicken and shrimp. All of the dishes had great presentations, were served quickly, hot, and fresh, perfect portioning, and were absolutely wonderful. The sushi chef said goodbye to every customer who departed, and seemed genuinely happy to have been able to serve. I love this place. Hi travel across the country for work, and will absolutely return to this location each time I'm in the area. In fact, on my way by tomorrow as I'm heading to the airport, I may stop and grab dinner again. This place is a must try!!
A hidden gem for Asian/Thai cuisine. Been to many spots in Nashville, I'd say this ranks among the best.

We had the worst experience there. 15 mintues after we order our food ahe is back to see if we want fries instead of rice cuase the rice is old....
Which we said no. 30 minutes later she is back with our food.

I came here for a quick bite and was immediately attracted to this place because it wasn't busy at 6pm on a Saturday ...but I kind of see why. It's nicely decorated & sets a nice ethnic vibe inside, plus the front windows open to Whyte ave for a cafè-like feel as you watch pedestrians pass by. There's also a TV and Middle Eastern music playing overhead to add to the ambience. 
Staff are friendly, but service is a bit slow...but I think it's because the food was made to order. The nice thing is that they serve the food up to your table after you've ordered. Unfortunately most of the tables were not cleaned up /wiped down from previous guests. 
I also don't think my meal was good value for cost. I ordered a donair poutine and a can of pop and it came to about $16; taste-wise it wasn't anything amazing either, but at least they had a good ratio of donair fillings to fries. 
I think this would be a great place to socialize and linger while you wait for your order. I think if I came back here, I'd probably order something more authentic on their menu than fusion flavored junk food.

On Whyte Avenue.  Middle eastern food.  Place was quiet.  Ordered a donair and asked for onions, taziki sauce and peppers.  To go.  Had no onions and sweet sauce instead.  A lot of lettuce filler and light.  A donair should have some weight to it. Not happy.

This place use to be my favourite for donair on whyte ave but I had the worse experience last night. Did ask what I wanted in my donair. Waited forever to make fries which is fine, but when they were ready the guy scooped up fries for two boxes before me and I ended up with some cold fries that were already siting there when I had been waiting there the longest. The kids running this place now are gonna run it out of business, I will be taking my business to the other 5 donair places down the street

Was craving a meat and rice dish, ordered the lamb kebab. After the 10 year old working the till came around to see what I was talking about and confirm they do have this food, he took my order. The meal was supposed to come with rice and salad.
When it finally came out after an "express" 45 minutes or so, I was treated to a bunch of lamb pieces on a bed of parsley and onions and pita bread. No rice, and no salad to speak of. Asked about the rice and they said it would come out right away, but it didn't come by the time I finished and I left. 

If this is the experience you're looking for, you've found your place.
One of the cleanest Subway stores in town. The two young ladies working today were very friendly and helpful. Quick, easy and healthy choices available for my healthy eating preferences.

This is a very clean and well managed subway. The workers are courteous and fast. My only issue, is that the staff routinely takes its smoke breaks out front. 

Now I have no problem with their right to smoke, However, it's an unprofessional act to smoke cigarettes  in plain view of your customers as well as blowing second hand smoke around children as they are let out from school. The same hands that are making all those sandwiches are right there being used to smoke cancer sticks. 

Again, nice place , but take the smoking out back please. It's like watching employees use the bathroom without washing your hands.

So much for the Sub of The Day special. Gone from the menu at all stores, the server tells me. Dumb move, Subway. What used to cost me $6.66 now costs $7.98.  Not worth a 30% price increase. There are lots of other sandwich shops around, and I'm on the hunt for one!

Not much to say about a chain restaurant. This is the first time going to this location. There was only one employee. The other was outside smoking. Then she came in, said something to the working employee and left. It was right after lunch time but it was busy. The kid that was working was very polite and doing his job well. Very friendly. An older customer was telling him he was moving and the employee acknowledged he had spoken with him many times before and wished him well. So kudos to him. And shame on the other employee.

This is the best Subway on the Northwest side of town! The workers are quick, friendly and polite. They go above and beyond to ensure I leave happy, even with my difficult orders. They are patient when my son orders his food as well!

I'm working close by and trying to eat better so I thought I'd try a salad here. The place was standard and of course it appeared shorthanded as every business is these days. The 2 girls that were working were talking negative about another customer and seemed oblivious to those of us in line. 
The salad I got/made was solid and the price was right. Good place to grab an affordable bite.

Thank you to Indy Veg Fest for welcoming Southside Animal Shelter to it's event!   We are happy to share our shelters no -kill mission, and are so happy that Nacho the Chihuahua found his forever home.  The food, atmosphere and people were fantastic!

Do come to Indy VegFest if:
-you want to support the vegetarian/vegan community
-you want to know more about a plant-based lifestyle and its benefits
-you are hungry for some plant-based sweet and savory treats from local businesses

Do not come to Indy Vegfest if:
-you hate crowds
-you despise standing in line

I was second in line and was one of the 250 first folks who got a goodie bag.  Thanks!  I want to go again next year, but I am hoping for a bigger, brighter venue; perhaps in a park where there is free parking???  Indoors with all of the black curtains and black booths was not my cup of tea.  Being a vegan is a bright spot in my life with many colors of veg and happiness.  Black was depressing.  Other than that, I loved going, even when it was so packed you could barely move.  Loved the vendors!
It was very promising for the first year! All the food items were delicious, but the food seller booths and lines need to be better organized for that size of crowd. Will return next year

I loved Indy Vegfest. I finally am getting around to reviewing it now, but the event was awesome. There were some really great speakers who seemed like healthy and effective activists. The vendors were great and the food samples were delicious. I bought a t-shirt too. The only complaint I have is the space. It was crammed and I wish there would've been either fewer vendors or a larger venue.

Too many people and too many unrelated vendors - dog rescues, jewelry, etc. Small space and loud crowd. Crazy lines to sample or purchase anything edible. Good thing I had lunch prior to it. The best thing I got out of it are free expired veggie seeds that hopefully are still alive....

Way bigger crowd than I'd expected, but they managed us very well. Most of the items tasted very good, with some being too earthy for my palate. I really enjoyed it and learned about a lot of vegan products I'd never even thought of before. Hopefully this becomes an annual thing, because it was very beneficial.

Update: 5 stars for an awesome venue the second time around. So much fun, so much food and honestly this is doing wonders for the vegan movement. Thank you to all of the vendors and people who have worked hard these last 2 years to make VegFest happen

This is my first VegFest. You can't be mad at the crowds. We took our patience and worked our way through the crowds. Grabbed a couple jackfruit tacos and a Rueben. Both were great. And I love that Miss P was there w a delicious cupcake. So make great vegan cheeses for me. Purchased a few different vegan cheeses. 

Great friendly vendors. The soaps smell so great. 

We will be back. (Hint it was clearing out around 4 might be a good time next year)
Parking was insane. Thank goodness admission was free. Too many people for the space.

The turn out was really incredible! 

There are a wide variety of booths, not just vegan eats. There are also a variety of other booths, like dog rescues, and sustainable jewelry and health information booths. I think they needed a bigger venue, it was shoulder to shoulder in the hall. 
The beet burgers were delicious, I also recommend the kombucha booth or marshmallow booth in the middle. 
The Center of Wellness for Urban Women was handing out free seed packets, and there were a few places with food samples. 

Overall other than the overcrowding this festival was really cool. I hope that there is another again next year! 

Ps- for the non vegans there appears to be a parade of food trucks just outside the convention center, which gave us a good laugh.

Was crazy busy but cluster truck had amazing samples! 

Got there right at 12 and the line was insane.

I was a bit disappointed with veg fest. I was really looking forward to it but was very underwhelmed by content and overwhelmed with people. Drove by around 12:30 and the line was crazy long. It was hot and rainy so my bf and I decided to come back later. We returned around four and the line was gone. It was still very busy inside however. The place was packed and it was hard to see some of the vendors which made it difficult to determine if we should wait in line or not for any given booth. It was also dim inside. I was confused about why you could get free tickets ahead of time if you didn't need a ticket to get in. From an economical standpoint it would have made more sense to have free RSVP and $5 at the door or something. 

We ended up walking around the area once and heading out. I hope the next one has a bit more organization and content. It would have been helpful for me if similar things were grouped together.

Wow! What a great event. My husband and I had the free early admittance tickets so we were lucky to try so much great food early on. There were vendors from near and far. A shout out to my employer Eskenazi Hospital and Dr Lisa Harris for all they do to promote, health, wellness, and sustainability in our community and at this event. Dr Harris has been ahead of her time in this area of health. Food is medicine. Great job IndyVeg Fest!
What an amazing event!  Thank you so much for bringing this to Indy!!!  Lots of great food and wonderful people!
Tons of free vegan samples- including cheese sauce (since cheese is one of many of our weaknesses), chai, ice cream, breads, essential oils, bath products.

Update: they need to change where the event is held. Inconsistent electricity is one thing but multiple cars getting stuck in the mud for an hour with four other cars is definitely not enjoyable 

I want to thank Deputy Randy Potts for helping us and the other cars get out!




I really enjoyed going to this event! It's almost making a year of my being a vegan and I enjoyed having so many options to choose from! I was able to enjoy some great matcha chip ice cream from Brics along with grabbing a 32 oz growler from Circle City kombucha(they sell their products on the indy market wagon website I believe).
I will definitely make it an effort to come again next year!!

So glad to see Indy have a vegfest! I worked the event and thought it was a bit too long. It should have been cut into two sessions or have just been shorter. I say this because I saw how much it slowed down after 3-4pm. I also noticed that food vendors had run out of food. Maybe it was because the food was just that damn good. Not sure though. I did have the gyro from Three Carrots and it was delicious! 

What a turnout! It was a bit over crowded at points and I don't think people could see which vendors were where. I thought it was a great idea how the vendor names were high above the vendor tables though. It just was hard to get to at points. It was great to see how many vegetarians and vegans are in the area though. And how many businesses are!

Overall, great event. Especially for the first year! Can't wait for next year!

I was certainly looking forward to this event, but there were several logistics that could have been given more thought.  Specifically, the placement of the food vendors was not ideal, as no one could tell what line they were in and it was way too crowded. The beverage stations were on opposite sides of the venue from the tables and food vendors. The flow of the raffle was odd. The venue was a bit tight and humid (the rain didn't help).  I assume no one anticipated the large turnout, but I hope that will be taken into consideration for the next event.  It was still a good time, but next year I'm hoping for a great one!

Amazing venue (Biltwell Event Center) and event...just keeps getting better every year!  Free admission and SO MANY vendors.  Second floor had a huge food court set up with tables in the middle.   First floor and south end of 2nd floor featured holistic/natural/vegetarian booths.  The Fest was so well-attended that we waited in line for 20 mins. to get in!  My non-vegan friend totally enjoyed the event and said he would return next year.   
The Biltwell is a beautiful, amazingly restored building which would be suitable for any event.   I was actually trying to come up with a reason to rent it on the drive home!
Indy Vegfest 2019=supreme success.  My sincere gratitude to the organizers!

We wanted to see what the hype was about, so I "reserved tickets" online. One would think they would ticket this free event to help with crowd control. Not exactly.

We were there right at opening time of 1:00. It was raining, which normally deters otherwise hardly Hoosiers. But not today. The line wrapped around the entry space a few times then around the corner. The rent-a-sheriff wasn't letting people park in the grass lot across the street. That was all I needed to drive right on by. We did look for street parking around the block, but when we couldn't find any for 4 blocks west of the event we decided to kill time downtown and come back later.

We hit it again at 3:00 and luckily there was no line. There also was no parking. Though we could see several empty spots in the paved parking lot right behind the Biltwell, more sheriffs weren't letting anyone in--only out! The fact that we still had to walk 4 blocks in the rain just because these guys and gals wanted to trip the power fantastic, was stupid and infuriating. And they knew there were empty spots and they were just not having it. We weren't the only ones who were put out. Others were grumbling about it as we all walked in. I learned from these fellow attendees that people were getting cars stuck in mud in the grassy lot across the street earlier, but no one could figure out why the cops weren't letting us park in the actual property's own paved parking lot given all the available spots. It created a severe traffic problem in the surrounding neighborhood that I'm sure the residents didn't appreciate. 

It was still pretty crowded inside half-way through the event. I can't imagine the craziness that beset the place at 1p. There were a ton of volunteers in purple Eskanazi shirts clumped up front, in a few conspicuous places near exits and main arteries, but they were seemingly not doing anything helpful. Not checking phones for tickets, not facilitating lines, not taking out trash or the like. Just standing there.

The bottom floor had clothes and beauty product vendors, holistic practitioners, and various organizations' booths. Upstairs were vegan food vendors. When we got upstairs by about 3:20, lines were still quite long and most vendors were out of at least some of their offerings. After standing in line for 25 min so my son could buy a vegan sugar cookie for $3 just to find out that the ladies at the booth were gabbing endlessly with whoever, I'd basically had about all I could take. We'd signed up for iridology readings (insert eye-roll emoji), so we did that and then were out. It was an okay event to go to once, but we won't be back next year.

This event was well worth the wait. I am a vegan newbie so this was perfect timing! I arrived a little after 3 pm, which was perfect timing for less crowds and lines. The Biltwell Center was a beautiful venue. A few improvements was the lack of parking available (carpool) and the dim lighting on the first floor. At times it was hard to read signage from the amazing vendors. I really enjoyed the variety of vendors from food to hygiene. Also that Indy VegFest was being sustainable by encouraging attendees to bring water bottles, bags, and had recycle/compost stations. This vegan event was very friendly and accessible to those new to veganism or considering the vegan lifestyle. I am super excited to attend and potentially volunteer at next years Indy Veg Fest

Loved seeing all the vegan community come together for the first veg fest. My favorite part was being able to taste vegan items from across the city. Definitely check out Whelpdale chocolates for some chocolate that even non vegans couldn't taste a difference in!

I'd love it if Indy got more VegFests like this. What an awesome event! I lived as a vegetarian for 10 years straight, and still am not a huge meat eater. Here in Indiana, though, that can feel like a completely fringe way to live. It was great to see so many local options for vegetarian dining and also plenty of health and beauty products related to an animal friendly lifestyle.

So excited to attend Indy Veg fest! There were lots of vendors and food, though most of the food vendors ran out early.  I think it was due to the overwhelming turnout! I think they definitely need a larger space next year, which is great news for sure.  SO many people came out to experience the event.  I hope there are more vegan vendors next year and more food vendors see the market for vegan options.

Loved the new location of the Indy Veg Fest this year. I won two VIP tickets this year which allowed me to go an hour before the general public. In the future, I will purchase the VIP tickets. It was well worth going in early and not having too much of a crowd to sample everything. I was also introduced to so many local brands I didn't know about. My two favorite vendors were Circle City Kombucha and Roamers. I look forward to visiting again next year.

I really enjoyed going to this event! It's almost making a year of my being a vegan and I enjoyed having so many options to choose from! I was able to enjoy some great matcha chip ice cream from Brics along with grabbing a 32 oz growler from Circle City kombucha(they sell their products on the indy market wagon website I believe).
I will definitely make it an effort to come again next year!!

I had high hopes for this event but it was so crammed we only spent a few minutes there before deciding to leave. There were so many people in attendance around noon (which is awesome!) that you could not even walk through the vendor booths without feeling like a fish swimming upstream. 

The one sample I was able to try was Clustertruck's vegan curry dish and it was SUPERB. I would have gladly had a full bowl of that. 

I'm hoping with whah a success in numbers VegFest had this year that they can have a larger venue next year. The city is clearly interested this type of thing, so I think next year people would be willing to pay for a ticket if it meant the space was bigger and better.

Love that the Indy foodie scene has enough interest & enthusiasm to host an event to celebrate plant based foods and products. There was all kinds of vendors, not just food...jewelry, clothing, essential oils, etc. I really enjoyed the cooking demonstrations. Great event!

For a first-time event, this was great. And c'mon, who would've thought that the capital of TENDERLOINS would be having a vegan/plant-based festival? It's pretty amazing if you ask me.

I attended early in the crowd to receive a gift bag full of awesome goodies, including a chocolate bar from my fave: Endangered Species Chocolate. 

Many reviews say that the businesses were unrelated including rescues and advocacy-based organizations. Really? I didn't feel that way at all. We're all in this together and it starts with an entire community of raising awareness to make something like plant-based living become a common, socially acceptable lifestyle. 

I loved the variety and diversity of the groups. 

A few suggestions for future VegFests: 
- bigger space. Look, the space it was held in 2017 was great for a first year. They didn't expect so many people to show up so they did the best they could and honestly, it worked. 
- more food. I love me some food so even more food tables would be perfect. 
- I can't remember from 2017, but was there a nutritionist there? I'd love to have more medical professionals there (i.e. nutritionists, doctors, pharmacists) that are using more holistic approaches to their medical professions. It's hard to come by in Indy sadly. 

Really looking forward to this year's fest and can't wait to see an even higher attendance to support plant-based living!

I knew this event is a wild success each year, but I'm not a vegetarian or a vegan. I fully expected to simply check it out and then eat elsewhere. NOPE. I ate DELICIOUS food from amazing vendors - many that I didn't even realize serve vegan options.

Located at the Biltwell Event Center this year, the first floor consisted primarily of food vendors (both cooked-to-order and pre-packaged options). Bizs included: 

-Three Carrots
-Ezra's Enlightened Cafe
-Union Jack's
-Mama P's Bakery
-Duos, BRICS
-Circle City Kombucha
-Tlaoli

New, amazing businesses I encountered for the first time: 

-Sea Salt & Cinnamon
-Simply Divine Cupcakes
-Roamers (delish beet hummus)

There were a TON of people at this event. My tip would be to come towards the end so there's less lines. It's a great spot to learn about your food and also try amazing local options.

This event was wild. There were way more people attending the event than I ever expected. They could have chosen a larger venue, but I enjoyed the event overall. I learned a lot about veganism and tried the various different types of food they offered.

Lots of vendors, lots of food. 

The parking for the event was a little turn off. I understand it was the space and not the event, but parking is huge. 

The bottom floor was extremely dark; way too dark for an event of this many vendors and guests. The upstairs had all the light. They also had more vendors, but also had panels and exhibits. 

Overall, I think the next year it should be held in a different space.
This spot is the one inside the garage next to the living room theater. Food came out hot and it didn't disappoint. Employees are very friendly. Would recommend

The food and service was very friendly. Over all the portion sizes seemed small especially for the size of the container they were served in . The hush puppies are not anything fantastic. The fish and chips was decent over all. The scotch eggs tastes more like a product that was warmed up and not made fresh.

Ate so fast I forgot to take a picture! We got the crab cakes and they were a great size, made fresh and tasted great! It is hard to find good crab cakes in Indy but the Harbour definitely delivers good flavors.  Don't forget to grab some malt vinegar packets for your fries. 

Ordering is easy. They text you when your food is ready so you have time to go secure a table!

My husband is British so we were PUMPED about a British chippie being in The Garage Food Hall. This spot is run by a Scottish man, aka someone who's grown up having good chippies all around him. I ordered the fish and chips and my husband got the fried sausage and chips. The fish and sausage by themselves were good, but the chips were average. They should definitely make them in house if they don't already. Enjoy!
These are some seriously good fish and chips.   I opted for the catfish as I have never seen them before (obviously I've had fried catfish, but never Brit-style).    Delicious.

Just grabbed a drink here while at the garage food hall. Discovered west fork's canned bourbon cocktail-- Highball. It was so weird to have a canned cocktail but nice to have that option. Only 7% alcohol content. Can be compared to the likes of white claw. Great customer service. She was very patient as we were deciding what to order.
It was hot I'll give them that. One piece of catfish with crinkle cut "chips" $15. It was slimy. Cod was flavorless. Service was lacking. Owner refunded my money.

The Harbour has one of the larger food menus at the Garage Foodhall, and sells beer and other beverages. I was looking for a fish sandwich, and oddly the place adjacent did not have one on the menu... so fish and chips was my next best option and this was on the Harbour menu.

The Fish and Chips were decent. I wouldn't run back here to get it, but there wasn't anything wrong with it either. The steak fries or chips were very mediocre. 

If you're looking for some fried food/seafood, I think this is your spot! The soda is free refills as well.

Tried the cod and chips! They were fantastic fish was fresh and meal was hot including the fries.  Service was great also.  Can't wait to go back and try the other menu items.  Also, husband had the shrimp they were large and crispy.

We hit this place for lunch today and we were pleasantly surprised!!  The haggis hush puppies were great!  Hands down winner was the scotch egg!!!  AMAZING! Food was served quickly.  A draft beer from Metazoa Brewing was the perfect pairing!

Before this place opened it was advised as having authentic British fish and chips. As a British guy I was very excited for this place open. However I was very disappointed with the food. I've had better potions and just as good quality at Culver's 

 Very pricey, and I was served 2 incredibly small pieces of fish. Basically $23 for a large box of fries. Not sure if I'd go back there. 

The 3 stars is for the wonderful customer service from the lady at the counter. Very friendly and helpful.

I think they just opened and I'm very happy! The Fried Cod and Chips are authentic. Served two huge,  thick pieces of Cod. The crust was crunchy and not overly thick; inside the fish meat was steaming and flaky. Cooked perfectly. Nice helping of chips. The tartar sauce was thick and rich. I tried it by dipping the chips into it. Vinegar only on the fish,  by my choice, anything else is a culinary crime!.

My boyfriend and I decided to stop by The Garage for some dinner after a dance lesson on a Wednesday night. The Garage was quite busy even on a weeknight. As we wandered trying to decide what we wanted, we decided to share the cod fish and chips (they also had catfish) and an order of Scotch eggs. I love me some fish and chips and Scotch eggs. They took our order and my boyfriend gave them his number so they could text us when the food was ready. They said it would be about 10 minutes. After what I'm sure was more than 10 minutes, I started to wonder if they got his number wrong or something. I saw a couple containers waiting on the counter to be picked up. Sure enough, they were ours. He just didn't get a text. Oh well, the food was still VERY hot and fresh. The fish and chips felt authentic very good and not overly salty. The fish was nice flaky. The chips were like authentic UK hot chips (what we call steak fries). The Scotch eggs were just ok. They were cut into quarters, and the breading on them was kinda chewy - not crispy. I wasn't crazy about them. They came with a red pepper aoili, but I would have preferred a mustard sauce. All in all, the fish and chips were definitely worth trying this place again. Only thing is I forgot to take pictures

This is my 2nd visit here and they are officially amazing. My family and I visit The garage frequently and we absolutely love it. However most of the food is specialized so it was nice to find a place with wings and mozzarella sticks

The first time I went was just for mozzarella Sticks, they were great. 
Next time I went was for wings fried hard and mozzarella sticks and they nailed it. 

I love this place because I love "regular food" in the ambiance is the garage door 10/10!!!

Seeing this shop pop up made me think of my days in London, bopping around to random pubs and snacking on chips throughout the afternoon. Naturally I was excited to grab a pint and indulge in some fried food on my first go-around of this joint. In case you were not aware, this is from the same owner as Macniven's that was previously on Mass Ave.

I prefer to go eclectic when I dine out, so haggis was going to be my choice for the afternoon. As cool as it seemed, it was more ho hum than anything. It had an excellent fry and texture, but the inside lacked any flavor. Perhaps it was an attempt to not make it too game-y with the liver and heart, but it really just tasted like mildly savory oats that were fried in casing. The chips were pretty average as well, especially for a place that has to compete with fries from other locations easily accessed within the complex. 

For $15 for a handful of fries and a piece of haggis that was the size and shape of a medium-sized corn dog, I was pretty disappointed overall. It likely should be 2 stars on this experience alone, but I'll give it the benefit of a doubt for now and try the fried fish or sausage next time.

The Harbour has several of the mainstays from MacNivens, including haggis, fish and chips, and scotch eggs.  On today's visit, I had the beef stew and fried mushrooms.  The beef stew was fantastic and the mushrooms were gigantic, breaded nicely, pipping hot, and delicious.

We only tried appetizers, but we were thoroughly impressed. First time trying a Scotch Egg. I'm not sure what to think, but it was unique (and tasty in its own special way). Liked the curry dipping sauce. We really like the wings - naked with sauces on the side. We will definitely be back!

Not sure about all the 5 star reviews.  Went there for take out tonight.  Not easy to find as it is actually just part of a pizza place.  Guess they just put two signs over the door because once inside you would never know it was "two" restaurants.  3 of us each got the Goldie Hen.  None of us were impressed.  Parts of my sandwich were actually burnt and overall was pretty flavorless.  Can think of several other chicken places in south Tampa that are way better than this.  None of us plan to go back.

Well.  I can say I tried it.  Well I guess I can't. Since the Sandwich the Bartender recommended came with Pimento Cheese was ordered he came back and same no Pimento Cheese.  Really?  On a Friday?  And not like there is a Publix or Trader Joe's to buy some until your supplier delivers.  Got a different sandwich with Buffalo Sauce and blue cheese was good but wasn't that special for 9 bucks. Sandwich only.  For 9 should include a side or make the sandwich 7 and 2 for a side The place itself it really nice and clean but the for what you get food wise not worth the visit.

My husband and I purposely went to try the chicken sandwiches. They were terrible and we were the only people in the restaurant on a Sunday around noon. This should have been a clue for us, duhh! My sandwich was covered in some king of salad dressing that made it wet and it did not taste good. I only ate half of mine. My husband too only ate half of his chicken sandwich and that is unusual for his big appetite. He got the waffle fries and they need a lesson on that from you know what fil-a place. We didn't finish the waffle fries either. Just get me out of here so that I will never come back. One star for our very friendly server. Maybe the place just needs to stick to their pizza (it's actually a pizza place not a chicken place).

Chicky Chicky Bang Bang honestly changed my life. I'm not sure what they're doing to these chicken sandwiches OR the Mac n cheese but OH. MY. GAWD. Don't change a thing!! I want to send a personal thank you to whoever made this delight. 

This place is a MUST try. You will have a new favorite spot!!

I found this place because they sent me a card in the mail. I think maybe they had some insider knowledge that I LOVE chicken tenders and they opened up near where I live. They are actually part of the Tampa Pizza Company, so don't let that fool you since they are the same place. 
When I went online to order, it goes to the Tampa Pizze Company page on ChowNow which confused me. I did see most of the options on the menu along with Tampa Pizze Company menu items. I decided to call and order to go. When I called the nice guy who took my order explained that they had just added this new concept, so I can order online even if it shows Tampa Pizza Company. When you go their website and order online page, it'll take you there but don't be confused because it's the same owners! 

I know I just explained how much I love chicken tenders and I do BUT once I saw the delicious chicken sandwich options, I had to pick one of them! I went with the Chick Jagger and my boyfriend selected the Cocky Balboa! Yes, the sandwich names are awesome! They have several other choices including a grilled option and a grilled wrap. They have chicken tenders along with Mac and cheese options! Most sandwiches are $8 (grilled are $9) and you can add a side of waffle fries for $1 or regular mac and cheese for $1.50 or special mac and cheese for $2. The two special mac and cheese option are Buffalo and Truffle. Note: For some reason the Cocky Balboa doesn't show up on the online order options but it's available if you call and order. 

* See my pic of the menu options for descriptions of everything! Also available on their site. 

Both of these sandwiches were delicious! I tasted both and would eat either one again! They were big, chicken was cooked perfect and juicy! Just the right amount of ingredients and the flavors popped! Nice portion of waffle fries for the extra dollar! We also got a large size truffle Mac to share so we could taste it. Also delicious! 
I couldn't even eat all of my meal. 

I wasn't at the restaurant because it was to go (they have delivery too) and my boyfriend picked it up but I'll get pictures on another visit because we will definitely be back! We started inhaling our food, so our food photos are in the moment and gritty (AKA.., partially eaten!). I'll call these artistic! 

You should definitely try this new joint in South Tampa!

Came here to eat twice in the past week, and it has not disappointed one bit. Located in a nice little restaurant, this sandwich place left me in awe with their scrumptious chicken sandwiches. I do not mind the 30 minute drive for this quality of food and service. Highly recommend checking them out, plus they have weekly specials for everyone.

My kids love fried chicken tenders and french fries, so when I saw this place pop up on my yelp, I knew I had to try it.

I ordered delivery from their website. Ordering was a bit of a pain because I got the processing circle that never resolved, and no confirmation email. I called the restaurant directly, and they said that they did receive the order. Then, I got an email from their online ordering service saying the food would arrive in an hour. Half an hour later, a delivery person was at my door with the food. It was too confusing, but I'll forgive it as this is a newish restaurant, and I certainly preferred that the food showed up significantly early rather than significantly late.

We tried the chicken tenders with waffle fries. The tenders were huge, half a breast of chicken each. They were juicy, but the breading wasn't crispy. I thought the fries were underseasoned.

It doesn't exist anymore!!!
It was a pop-up that no longer exists.  Take it off Yelp and take down the website!

I can not give them a a full 5 stairs because of this.

Burgers and fries are good service was good to.
But don't order a Sunday or a shake you would think it takes two min to make it we wanted 20 freaking min for something simple  it was like we ordered for a 100 people when we ordered for two.
What is so hard about two things a shake and Sunday gee we did not ask them to re Event the wheel come on no body in line.
They have the poor cashier bringing out food if they are that short on help get that manger off her rear to help with drive through.
You go there be prepared to Waite  for your shake or Sunday they are so dam screwed up there it's not funny anymore
This place sucks! They tell you to pull around to beat their timer every single time. Never fails.
The a1 burger is supposed to come with an artisan bun, yet I get a kids bun. Very disappointing.  Im always asked to pull up and wait for my order even with no one else in line.  Get it together BK!!
Always wonder if they have go out kill, slaughter, and cook the cow. Wait is always long at this location whether you go in or drive -in.
I ordered croissants with bacon egg and cheese. The egg was scraps and the cheese wasn't even melted. Do not go here!!!
Just plain horrible food. The order was wrong and I'm pretty sure they counted the fries...twice.  They should provide a disclaimer on their window "we suck."

absolutely love the work done in my new apartment.  I had 2 TVs that needed to be mounted and they came and took care of it same day. 

team was very helpful and quick, and they made sure to clean up the wires and any scuffs on the wall.

Let me just start by saying I need instant results I hate waiting. I moved into my new place on Thursday, Jacole Sound came out the next day and mounted my TVS, and projector in record time. He was responsive, reasonable and professional. He understood that I wanted it done immediately and was kind enough to fit me into his schedule for the day. I would absolutely recommend this company.

Did a lousy job. Didn't put the right tv mount and stayed 4 hours fixing Idk what (also he put his covid mask on the couch - Idk what was the point of coming with one at all if you are not going to wear it). We paid him more than we should have but he said he'll come back to finish the job. It's been one month since that. Once he briefly answered the call and said he'll come next week and one time he texted saying he'll come next week but that didn't happen. He just didn't respond to other 20 texts and calls. He also deleted account on another website - the one that we used for communication when I originally booked him. Now I realize that 5 stars ratings are just because he makes new accounts all the time. That is just bad. I really tried to be understanding and patient but now when we had to call another guy to fix his work, I decided to write a review. Jonathan you are not ok!


Update and response to the Jonathan's lies: 
We were overjoyed that you finally left our home. 
No one asked you to connect our devices which btw we had to do all over again bc it wasn't well done. But thats ok bc thats not your job.
You were supposed to bring swivel mount but we got different one and you admitted that you made a mistake and you'll bring the right one. Let me remind you that you came into the house without a mount and asked if we need one even tho we previously agreed on this. So you just forgot. Thats ok it happens. Just don't lie. Your girl then pulled out from the car the mount you had at the moment. 
No way that we said that we hired you because you were least expensive, shame on you for saying lies like its nothing. I clearly said that you had the best reviews out of 3 people who responded and that is why we hired you. Lies, lies, lies. Now I now reviews are fake. And do you want to say how much we paid you?? Was that cheap? 
We were away for 5 days only and when we got back we kept calling and calling and then after 20th call you said YOU were away and will call tomorrow to schedule appointment and that didn't happen. We kept calling and texting.
On Thumbtuck your account IS deactivated, does not exist anymore so I found you here and the communication was really miserable. You said: I'll come next week. I asked can you schedule exact time and date? You read it and never responded. I sent two more messages - nothing. 
So just stop lying.

I would totally recommend Jonathan and his girl to anyone! They did an amazing job! They mounted 3 TV's while I was running errands and when I came back all TV's were better then I anticipated. 

- Absolutely no visible wires! Clean job
-Sent me photos of the final work to confirm it was what I wanted. They even adjusted my TV when I asked. Perfect service
- Sent me the instructions to control the LED lights
- Priced better then anyone else
- Very very responsive and great with communication.

I would recommend Jacole Sound to anyone looking to get a TV mounted. Jonathan provided a quote within minutes and was able to come out the same day to mount my 55" TV. He was very professional, kind, and communicated when he was 30 minutes away. The process was quick and his work is beautiful.

I would recommend Jacole Sound to anyone looking for TV installation and sound system. He even went out of his way and went to the store to get the right part that didn't come with the sound bar. Also very professional.

Jacole came on his day off to help us set up in our new apartment and he did a great job! Super friendly and made it seem super quick and easy. We really appreciate him going out of his way to help us.
Great service and work. Came to my home within 24 hours and neatly mounted 65 inch tv and even cleaned up afterwards. Highly recommend for their attention to details and overall amazing service!
Highly recommended. Quick and efficient. He installed both bedroom and living room televisions in no time at all. Made good suggestions and accommodated our request.

Jonathon stole $400 from me. I'd give him zero stars if I could. It was the worst experience.

I hired him to set up a home security system. He asked that I prepay $400 for the equipment, which I naively did. On the day of installation, he didn't show up, has not responded to my phone calls, has not responded to any of my messages, and based on his silence it's pretty clear he won't reimburse me or give me the equipment I paid for.

Honestly terrible. Save yourself the misery and don't hire him.

name: Wingstop
address: 11752 E Martin Luther King Jr Blvd

reviews.text: staff here sucks more than mcdonalds employees. slow. playing around in the kitchen in front of customers instead of working. wouldnt even trust eating at this location. dirty as hell.

This establishment has been open for only 1 month and already going downhill...Poor customer service. Placed on hold twice for nearly 20 minutes and when order was finally made,  she hung up in my face. Wings are just okay/mediocre.
The most shitty place to work at the boss treats there employees like straight shit don't apply it's definitely not worth it

My first time eating at this chain was through door dash that i ordered from this business. My first time was a negative 3 star. They sent me these uber burned thighs that were tiny n gross. I was so mad I didn't leave a review. On yelp but crucified them on doordash reviews.
Cue 5 months later;

I decided to take a gamble n see if my review reached them n they saw how horrible n terrible quality their food was to me that time. They must've felt my wrath n the nails of the cross i put on that review. In this order i got the 10 piece combo almost free of charge from door dash phenomenal recovery bonuses from previous fails. I literally paid $9 bucks from this meal fit for 3. This time around i got huge pieces, not nuked or terrible tastes. It was a well done batch like it was made by angels. It had love written all over them. So far my favorite sauce is Hawaii n smoked bbq. I cannot for the love of me handle their hot selections. Shit goes down heavenly n then comes out painful lol
The cheese fries didn't look like much i thought they rip me iff cheese UNTIL i started to peel them off n realized there was more cheese hidden in layers of fries! 

They did a great job doing this recovery meal n i hope that in my next orders they deliver this quality every time for future endeavors.
Ebony dropped my order the last of the night 15 mins before closing. Much appreciated because I was starving and she saved my life for my early am fight. Thanks Ebony

name: Tinker Coffee
address: 7800 Col H Weir Cook Memorial Dr

reviews.text:
To be honest this was just not a good experience. The barista seemed annoyed with multiple people before me. Then when she handed me a plain latte when I ordered a 5 Spice... I told her what it was supposed to be. Her response, an annoyed "I can just add it now." Ok sure. 

She heavy poured the syrup in and gave it a stir and handed it back to me. It was so syrupy that I just threw it away. 

I love Tinker and their 5 spice latte, but I wouldn't recommend the airport location. Seems like Tinker just built it and handed the keys over to staff that just do not meet their level at the real location/roastery.

Could not believe nor was prepared for a fantastic cup of sweet balanced bean juice cleaning out the early flight blues at an airport! These guys fired up a perfect brew of five spice latte epic sips that lasted me all the way down to Florida! I was way too happy while the others munched their overpriced foods to drink a great value supporting a local roaster and getting very fresh quality beans in the deal. Not sure why airports tend to attract the worst service and reviews but I am super happy to announce Starbucks is dead!

I didn't give a 5, mainly because of what I observed with the manager at 5:20 on a Sunday morning.  The women working were there early, busting their behinds on an early morning with many people waiting to be served. The manager managed to berate the person making breakfast sandwiches, yell at the barista, and then yell at the woman taking orders to not include breakfast. Really bad, and she should find work elsewhere.

Least helpful people ever. I asked if they had anything LIKE the medicine ball at Starbucks. The guy kept saying they didn't sell that there. I walked away after the third time that I had to repeat if they had anything like it. I get they don't have the same things since they are 2 different places but to be so rude! I refuse to give them my service.

I am so happy Tinker is here at the Indianapolis Airport! It's such a better cup of coffee than the typical mass chains which you always find in various airports. If you are looking for a great, smooth cup of coffee, make this pit stop, you won't regret it.
