It's always nice to have a local shop in an airport.  I think it used to be something different, but now it's a Tinker.  They tinkered with the name and the space, I guess.  They should tinker a bit with the placement of the menu though as you have to kinda be right up in it's business to read it.

The coffee was good and it did the trick for the plane ride home (for alertness, not the other effect).  The line wasn't too long when I was there, but I'm guessing it can be during peak morning hours.  Staff was friendly and the drink was delivered promptly.

If I'm flying through IND again, I'll probably stop in here for some coffee.  Unless they tinker with the space again.

Really glad Tinker opened up at IND. I want local coffee options where I can get a single origin at an airport and this fits the bill. Tinker is probably the most well known roaster in town and one of the more consistent. This Tinker being in an airport makes it a lesser Tinker experience than outside of the airport. They have justifiably less options and it is too busy to have personable interactions with bariastas like you would at the actual roaster.  But it is here for different purposes (a good coffee in an airport). So try Tinker at IND and give them some grace for being in an airport.

Loaded patatoes is what we ordered, we got patatoes that tasted like day old, re-heated fries, not much love from the cook. 
Meh wont be back.

Went there with my Groupon. The service was pretty good. We ordered the Benedict and it was really good. Also ordered breakfast quesadila... honesty I didnt like it at all. Overall, I think they could've made dishes a bigger. Haven't tried other dishes but I probably won't go there in the near future.

The service was great, very friendly and welcoming :) the food - my hash browns in some parts were cooked to much and not cook in others:(. I definitely will have to come again to give this place another chance.

Absolutely the place to go for your cozy diner breakfast or brunch. The menu offers tons of options, everything from healthy picks to an over the top Sausage Stuffed Biscuits with Gravy. Wowza!! The coffee is strong and delicious and the staff are so friendly. It's not high end but is good quality served with a smile.

We ended up at this cafe on Mother's Day, due to everywhere else being crazy busy. It was a busy day for them also, but we were seated promptly. The service was good. The food was ok. I found the portions a bit small for the price. And it tasted fine. Not bad, not great. Would not go out of my way to eat there, again.
This a classic diner type place.  Had a decent Ruben sandwich for lunch here.    Fries were excellent.   And the service was quick.   Will come back

I've had two meals from this place and both were unimpressive. I will not order from or eat here again based on these experiences. 

I had the southwest turkey club, which was the most boring sandwich on earth. I could have made it at home -- it was on whole wheat grocery store bread (untoasted), had sliced luncheon meat, and enough sauce to make it soggy. I couldn't believe I had paid for something I could have easily made in my own kitchen. I would have expected a nicer bread or real turkey or even just a toasted bread... 

Secondly, I had the big bite breakfast. I'd ordered this through uber eats, and to be honest by the time it arrived it was cold and the hashbrowns and toast were soggy. That may be because of the delivery, but all of the other food I order through uber is hot -- I feel like it was sitting on a counter for awhile before it came my way. I acknowledge that this could be uber' fault and not the restaurant, and the eggs were cooked to the perfect "over medium".

Very delicious comfort food. My party had the BLT Benedict and the French Toast Crunch. The staff were all very nice and welcoming. They have great coffee as well. Looking forward to going back and trying more of their menu items.

Warm friendly atmosphere. 
Think ski lodge 1995. That being said, its Clean and quick service. with a diverse menu that has something for everyone. 

I had the chipotle chicken wrap messy but delish...

It was ok, nothing to special or different than any other breakfast place.  The fruit is very generic, nothing like Cora's!
Probably would not go back unless I had a groupon.

One plain waffle for 8 bucks? That's right. One plain waffle (no whipped cream, fruit, etc) was 8 dollars. When it arrived at our table were shocked, so we actually asked the waiter if he accidentally entered in a side order of waffles. Later the hostess (who actually took our order) told us that she "doesn't order the waffles anymore because it's such a small order." That would have been nice to know when we were ordering. Aside from that, the food is really poor quality (probably microwaved). We'll never go back.

Food was very good, hash browns could have been cooked alittle longer, pancakes could use some fluffiness. And the coffee, that sad typical restaurant sludge, pass on the coffee. The place is nice, clean, bright, we will be back. My friend loved  their eggs benedict! My favorite part, they actually brought the maple syrup in a syrup container, no cheap plastic servings like Macdonalds! Very nice touch! They even have take out and the menu looks like it's worth exploring more, well done.

Best of Meats aka BOM is a new meat-centric Boise-based food truck that serves Japanese charcoal grilled meat. They offer appetizers, mains, desserts and drinks. I visited for the first time on 11/12/20 and ordered a Grilled Platter. Platters come with two skewers of meat, seasoned rice, cabbage and house sauce. I wanted the beef tenderloin but they were out. I ordered one chicken thigh skewer and one pork tenderloin skewer ($13). That week, everyone who ordered a platter received a free Glazed Donut Ice Cream dessert. One of the owners heard me mention that I was bringing the food back to my office, he generously threw in two more skewers of meat for me to share with my coworkers. I and my three coworkers unanimously agreed BOM deserves a 5 star rating. I am no expert when it comes to Japanese charcoal grilled meat but the meat was high-quality, flavorful and tender. It was served on top of a generous bed of rice and cabbage with a delicious house sauce. The appetizers which consist of two meat skewers, would be perfect for those following a Keto,  Paleo or Gluten-Free diet.

The food was well priced. I was expecting a huge barbecue and they were cooking on a smaller grill so I was a little bit skeptical.  No need to be!

I have a chicken thigh combination. It was delicious. The rice was great, the cabbage slaw was incredible, and the chicken thighs were full of flavor! $11 is a total good deal for a food truck lunch like this!

Great fresh food for lunch, I had the appetizer and the platter, both chicken and beef and it was delicious. Let's just say it's one of the best places I tried grilled chicken or beef. The flavors of the sauces and coal was very surprising as I was used to deep fried food truck foods. Definitely recommend this place. Make sure you save to room for ice cream donut, which is out of this world.
Doesn't exist at stated address, no sign or stickers or anything. Don't go to the address expecting to find the truck, or a brick and mortar. Super sad panda
Is this place still open?? We went during the posted business hours and could not find the food truck. :(

What a cute little cafe on 97th! This was the first time I've been here.  And though I only ordered a couple of papaya bubble teas, I watched the many dishes ordered here look and smell delicious.  The bubble teas were great and reasonably priced, $3~3.50, though they are smaller than other bubble tea places.  I also found that there were some ice chunks on the bottom that prevented you from sucking up the last bit of juice.  A minor inconvenience.

It's a very small place, 6 or 7 tables, but it looks like a great place for a quick lunch or dinner.  It was kind of neat to watch the Hong Kong shows on the TV.  Would definitely be back again to try the food.  I really liked it here, giving it 3.5 stars.
A hidden gem for some Hong Kong treats in the heart of edmonton. Affordable and no frills. Limited choices on the menu but the owner is the cook and server. Give it a shot!

I found that the Bubble Tea Cafe has a little more to offer than some other places. 

In addition to their large selection of bubble tea they also serve, slushes and milkshakes. If you are hungry they also have a small menu to choose from. I am no Bubble tea pro so I can't tell you that I know exactly what my orders should taste like but it tasted dam good. As long as I am not disappointed it doesn't matter I guess. 

The staff is really nice, very outgoing and extremely welcoming. They make your visit very pleasant.

It's no secret - I love bubble tea. I love the sweetness of the taste, the texture of the chewy sago balls, and seemingly endless choices of flavours. As a result, I was very excited to see that a new bubble tea shop was opening, right on 97 street in the heart of Chinatown no less.

The Bubble Tea Café sells a variety of bubble drinks, coffees, milkshakes, and slushes. A limited menu of Asian meals and snacks is also available. The price for a bubble tea is slightly lower than I have experienced in other places. My taro bubble tea tasted exactly as I wanted - sweet and milky. On another visit, I had a chocolate milkshake. The serving size was slightly smaller than I expected, but again, it was very rich. 

There are a few tables in the café, and service is very friendly. If you find yourself strolling down Chinatown and crave a refreshing drink (and there are a few hot drinks available that should be perfect for our coming cold weather), definitely stop into The Bubble Tea Café.

Best bubbles in Edmonton!!! 

I have searched long and hard for a bubble tea place that is comparable to Taiwan, origin of bubble tea. I think that I've found it here! The bubbles are perfect - chewy, soft, and sweet. The drinks are also delicious. I got an original flavour, and it tasted just like the milk teas of Taipei. The pricing for drinks is $3-4 and the sizing is smaller than other places. I think that the cost ends up being comparable though. The store is small, with only a few tables. There also aren't any games like in other bubble tea shops. So I'd say grab a drink to go.

I grew up in the South, but moved to the Boston area about 2 years ago. 
My biggest complaint about New England is the lack of really good, authentic Mexican food. 

I was home for a quick 3 day visit when I discovered Fonda El Pocito. 

I had the huaraches with beef tongue and cheese dip. 

Hands down, best Mexican food I've ever had. I am so happy to have experienced it while I was here; and I will buy it every time I'm in TN for a visit. 

Well done. I love Mexico.
Great for Springfield. Good prices on drinks. We had a few tacos for $1.75 each. Good quality. The server we had seemed new and wasn't much help, but it is the best place in town for Mexican food.

Came back a few more times. 5:30 after work and I can't order a beer because the girl old enough isn't in yet. The food has really gone downhill since they first opened. I couldn't even finish my meal. The salsa was more like water than any sort of dip.
Great food, big portions and friendly staff. Definitely recommend if you're looking for authentic.

Wonderful food! Definitely a hidden gem in springfield. The cheese dip is creamy and the chips are fresh. I ordered the Carnitas Chimichangas. It was amazing. Not dry like most, and soo much meat. Service was to be expected for a small restaurant. So glad I got to experience this place. You cant go wrong here.

So dang good! Come here for your authentic Mexican food fix. Yelp is a pain in the ass though. "So dang good" was good enough but have to type a bunch of other stuff to fill it up so it will be a review not a tip.

This IS our favorite Mexican restaurant in Springfield. There are several, but El Pocito has the freshest food, the best guacamole, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is inviting. We will be back!

All you can eat sushi on monday nights!  The cuts are a little inconsistent on the sushi but quality is great. My wife orders the habachi chicken and likes it. You can order half rolls which is nice with the all you can eat sushi so you can try things. Went three weeks in a row on monday and have no complaints. Will go back.

OK, this place has lost us as customers. We brought in two guests tonight with us and the service and food was horrible. We'd come by about a month ago and thought "Hmm, it's sliding down hill, things aren't as good as they used to be"... but tonight it was truly abysmal. 

They have a new waitress that should know things by now and is really messing up badly. Part of our order was missing, the appetizers came to the table along with the sushi. One person ordered hot food and it was 30 minutes late to the table after the sushi was there for everyone else. I know that the manager was not having a good night but why should the whole restaurant suffer? For an 89 dollar dinner, we should have gotten better service and food. I have no idea what they're putting in the rolls now, but they are using way too much rice and not enough fish! And lettuce? In three of the rolls, they used lettuce as filler. WTF???  What am I paying for? High-priced lettuce?

Nope, we're done. I used to love this place, but it's gone downhill and soon will be gone. Too bad. I had high hopes. You can't expect to keep customers with bad service. There was a huge table in the center of a large family and they got all the attention of the two waitresses while everyone else was almost ignored. Who do you think is going to give better tips? People with a lot of kids or four guys who are out on the town? Why did the waitress go around and clear tables with no people, yet leave our table full of dishes and trash? That's just common sense!  Anyone know of a good sushi place in Avon? Because I don't any more.

My husband and I came in and spent $28 for the two of us. We got three sushi rolls, two salads, two soups, five crab Rangoon sticks, scallops with veggies and rice and waters to drink. We left plenty full. We will totally come here again!!!!

Great and accommodating!

Want a place that will let you customize their sushi rolls? Look no further. I am a picky eater, so I like to add and subtract things when I order food. They gladly switched things around for me which gave me a delicious final sushi roll. The staff here is very friendly. The place is clean. I would gladly return.

Well, I don't eat sushi personally-- I tried it when I was overseas in Japan but never really enjoyed it-- so I can't comment on the sushi quality here.   What I can comment on is their other traditional hibachi cooked dishes.  I had the Chicken Yakisoba dish, and it was just as I remember it was from overseas-- noodles were properly cooked, and yes they used the proper noodles, unlike the other various buffet restaurants who use generic noodles for Yakisoba (or Lo Mein, the Chinese equivalent dish)

Very good quality cooked food, and the restaurant is usually not very busy so it is good for a quiet meal.

Love this place. Been several times with kids- who love the California rolls and say best miso soup ever (not as much fish sauce as other places). I've always ordered some version of a spicy roll - usually what is on special- and loved them all, especially the ones with the crunchy flakes. Definitely best sushi we've had on this side of town..
Great Sashimi! I had the Trio Sashimi dinner which was awesome. It's a hard day (haha) when tuna is matched and outshone by both the salmon and yellowtail. ;-)

Awesome, was a little leary about stopping in  never seemed to be busy. Was looking for a place for lunch on yelp.  Seen all the good reviews thought I would stop. Sure am glad I did!  The lunch specials are reasonable. The sushi was unbelievably fresh and delisious! The service was perfection. I will be back!!!
Best sushi on this side of Indy! Fresh food, clean restaurant, excellent daily specials. And the lunch specials are amazing as well.

This is one of the best sushi places I have eaten in a very long time. The food was fresh, the service was outstanding and the portions large. I had the $19.99 special; any 2 rolls including salad or soup.  The place itself is clean and modern, don't let the small strip mall its located in turn you around.
habachi was too much sauce ..the server was too slow ,I guess that's because there was just one woman she had to do server and host ...it's not a really good place to recommend
Food and service were great! Clean place with decent pricing.
Excellent sushi! Had the Fancy Rainbow, best raw roll we've ever had. The Las Vegas and Lobster Lover were excellent, as were the spicy mayo and honey wasabi sauces. Yum!
Its Delicious food ,I'm enjoyed eat there good service nice environment . definitely I will coming back again

We went there for a birthday dinner with a party of eight. Our first time. Everyone loved it. We had a little bit of everything off the menu. A must try. Check out the menu. I bet you will like it. Had great service from a young man. He was very professional and polite. Probably the owner son. We will definitely be going back again.
Great sushi and hibachi, all while reasonably priced. Especially great deals during the week. Our new favorite sushi place on the west side.

Still, after 5 visits now, a solid place to get sushi in Avon, especially at lunch. Prices are a bit lower and they have a free appetizer (but you have to ask for it!).  Going to take some friends there in a few weeks and I'm relaxed about that because I know it's going to be just as good as the first time.
Amazing sushi! Affordable, great service and daily deals. Also have coupons on pinpoint perks. Love this place!! Millenium roll is delicious. A must try

Couple things. 

1. Their hours on Yelp are wrong. Yelp says closed, but i'm sitting here eating lunch and the sign said Open. I almost didn't come here just because of that fact, but I had a feeling it was off...

2. This place is pretty nice, but abnormally empty. I'm talking "echo, echo, echo...". See the pic I posted. And just because it's empty, doesn't mean the waitstaff has to hover. It's highly uncomfortable. So, even as the sole customer, I felt rushed.

3. There is such a thing as too much rice. There IS. See pic I posted. I'm not paying for rice, I'm paying $13 for fresh fish and flavor and whatever else you consider sushi; maybe artwork.

4. I got a roll that had shrimp tempura in the center. And while the roll was very good and flavorful, you could tell that the shrimp tempura had been made earlier in the day and was now cold, and a little chewy. Obviously this ruin the flavor of the roll, It wasn't so bad that I didn't eat it, but it was definitely a little off.

5. The floor was so sticky that I literally had to go into the restroom and scrub the bottom of my boots with soap and water.

Now to explain why they still get 3 stars-- i'm nitpicking. These four things I've listed added up might not sound so great, but I've been to a bunch of sushi places in Indiana and taste wise this is definitely up there.

The best sushi and hibachi. Service can be very slow at times because they only have one woman serving the entire room. I've had two other waiters in the past but the last handful of times they've been M.I.A. Still can't get enough of this place because their food quality far and above outweighs the occasional service issues.

We went on New Year's eve, when they appeared to be very busy. We expected to have to wait an hour for a table, but we were seated in just 15 minutes. Despite this it took another 15 minutes for someone to come take our order, in the meantime a well-meaning customer (friend of the staff?) brought us our water, silverware, and even brought an appetizer to our table.

Despite being busy, the sushi prep area appeared to be clean and well organized, as did the kitchen. Front of house was less organized, but passable. The biggest exception being that the tables were sticky, and our table had some damage to it. There was also a poorly placed room divider that was knocked over and hit a couple of guests on the head. They appeared to be fine however. The general atmosphere of the front of house was dark and cozy, which was perfect for our mood that evening, and cold which was less welcome. Once we did get our food, we were treated to a train of all the FOH staff stopping by to see if we needed anything. I appreciate attentive service, but our drinks were full and food uneaten. No. We need to be left alone to enjoy our food. (I'm being nitpicky here. My date didn't seem to notice/mind these issues, and everyone was friendly and helpful, just super busy)

We ordered a couple basic and a couple specialty rolls. These were well presented and tasted good as they looked (5 stars, really). I'd say more but every meal consumed at this restaurant appears to be well documented on yelp already.

On the whole this tucked away little restaurant is worth stopping in on. I'll update this review if we go back on a less busy night. I'm sure I'll be able to give 5 stars at that time.

Visiting from out of state, this place does not disappoint!  We ended up there two nights in a row for dinner. Staff were very friendly, food came out super fast. The shipwrecked roll was by far my favorite, but everything was delicious from the onion soup to the chicken hibachi.  Highly recommended, looking forward to going back there next time I'm in Indianapolis.

This is a good sushi place if you're in Avon already and on a budget. Great specials!  

We ended up here after no luck finding a sushi place that had half price sushi on Wednesday.  

The presentation was great. The server was great and the price was great. The food was really good.  We normally get raw sushi. I had the Tuna and Salmon and Smoked Salmon. It was all really good except for one piece that I had, of smoked salmon that was gristly.  The miso soup was great and seaweed salad was great!  Two of us had soup, salad and 2 rolls each (water to drink) for only $34! 

I would defiantly go back if I was in the area.
Excellent.  The sushi is legit and fresh.  This place has the lowest prices I've seen for sushi.  The place is kept meticulously clean as well.  I highly recommend.

Sushi Lunch Combo was an amazing deal... I would recommend coming here for lunch or anytime. I tried the Spicy California and Shrimp Tempura Rolls, enjoyed both of them. The gentleman making the Sushi was so smiley and very quick. Our waitress was a sweetheart. The Onion soup was on point. If you are looking for Sushi in the Avon area you should give this place a try!

I can't at all understand the two other "not recommended" reviews here. 

We at there for the first time yesterday and I found it to be quite nice, both service, interior and food were all darn good for a Sushi restaurant in Avon. No, it's not the best one in the Indy area, but totally on par with other sushi places we've tried.  The pricing was very good, two adult males ate our fill for under 35 dollars. The miso soup was better than some of the higher-priced places we've tried and the sashimi pieces we had were fantastic, fresh, thick, big pieces, well worth the price. The rolls were a little loose, but still great sushi taste and lots of variety on the menu. We didn't try the teryaki food but might next time just to see what it's like. And yes, we'll be back.

Negatives: The only things I'd say negative were that they need a better style of ordering sushi, as it's very difficult to keep track of what you want if you are ordering pieces at a time. Print up some cheap sushi tabs and get some pencils, problem solved. That's a standard used in most places. As well, the salad was swimming in dressing by the time I was half done, so ease up on that and perhaps throw in some arugula and romaine instead of all iceberg lettuce which is just plain wrong.

All in all, a pleasant experience and we'll definitely be back with friends.

We had sushi it was awesome. Had a California roll, spicy tuna roll and shrimp tempura roll. All were very good. I got the chicken pad Thai it was so good. The best I've ever had. My daughters both got the chicken ramen.  It was very good and had a lot of flavor.  The service was awesome. And Saturday night is free edamame. And is was good too.

The service here was great, what was not so great was the food.

My mom and I ate here on a Thursday night. There were a few other tables, and one server but he managed to take care of everyone fairly well. He was entertaining and funny, which was the best part of the meal.

Now for the food. I ordered a spicy tuna roll. It was disappointing. They chopped up the fish into some type of puree before putting it into the roll. It was not spicy at all. I would not recommend ordering this roll. Maybe their others are better.

My mom ordered the shrimp hibachi. The shrimp were terribly overcooked and rubbery.  I had the chicken hibachi. The meat tasted had a freezer like taste to it. Both meals came with veggies and fried rice, which were pretty good. The sauce they put on the hibachi is pretty good, like a standard teriyaki. The meals came with a weird sauce they called "yummy sauce" and it was basically like spicy mayo. It didn't seem to belong with the meal. 

The bill came to about $40 for the two of us, and the food was just not good enough to command that price. I don't plan on coming back.

Wow. I came across this place on Yelp and was a little skeptical. I was even more skeptical when we walked in and were the only guests, although to be fair it was a Wednesday night. It is a little hole in the wall off the beaten path. However when I tried their specialty rolls I was blown away. They are amazing. I live in Chicago so there is no shortage of good sushi. I would put this place up there with any place in Chicagoland. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is they don't serve alcohol.

Clean, great service and Great food! Had the chicken udon noodles. Delish! Also ordered the Las Vegas roll and Millenium roll! Both were good but Millenium was amazeballs! Definitely recommend for any occasion! Also got free edamame with the order! It was the Saturday special. Definitely will be back!!
Bought a chicken & mushroom philly cheese. Not enough chicken, but it was flavorful and nice & hot off the grill. At only $4.50, a good snack for someone on the run.

For a couple of years already, I have been to Ricky Cafe whenever I have a chance to grab a good selection of Asian rice and noodles dishes. It's the best on Drexel campus; that's why I don't go to Kim Dragons, Kim's Orientals, or Teriyaki Truck (right next to Ricky's). They are all feel so Americanized and cheap (cutting corners); if you like that kind, then go ahead. 

Owned by a Cantonese Chinese couple, they are down to earth, friendly individuals who will cook the food on the spot and deliver it to you. There's a good selection to choose from, but I would recommend the steak over rice/noodles, beef & tomato over rice/noodles, or the teriyaki chicken over rice/noodles. Ranging from $5 to as much as $8, I guarantee that you will be ridiculously full due to the ridiculously large portion. 

Ricky Cafe is probably the best food truck on campus that can deliver awesome, filling Chinese rice and noodle dishes at a fairly good cost. It can get very busy, so definitely allow some time to stop by!

This place used to be great but then they started using kids to work in the truck and cheap labor (i.e.: friends or relatives freshly arrived from their country who do not speak or understand English at all). Now they never get your order right (EVER) and you have to wait 15 minutes for an egg and cheese sandwich. Time to find a new breakfast spot.

I came here after a friend recommended the ricky's special breakfast sandwich with turkey bacon, egg, and cheese. It was a good sandwich for about $3-4, which is unbeatable for the price. I agree with a previous reviewer about the coffee being hit or miss, but what do you expect from a food truck? Obviously, it's a lunch truck right on Drexel's campus, which makes it targeted towards broke college students and not for people of exquisite taste buds. Because of this, they have been in business for quite some time now and it doesn't seem like they will be leaving anytime soon. If you're hungry and need a quick and cheap meal, stop by here on your way to class!

I think they definitely deserve a five star!! i checked out Ricky Cafe at 8 pm and luckily I got the last steak over rice. It was super flavorful and juicy. I can tell the meat was in high quality and very fresh. Sesame is added on but really great. Big portion and due to I do not have enough cash , the owner gave me a deal. Really appreciated! It is more than a business. I would like to talk with them, even if it was my first time checking out this food truck. Will try more food ! They offer breakfast as well..

I love this place!  The food is delicious - fresh and beautiful and tastes so good.  I feel so sad that it's never busy when I go in there.   The steak with angel hair pasta and spicy red sauce is so good that I never want to try anything else but my friends have gotten other things and always been pleased.  Huge portions and great prices.  Try it!

Today I tried Cini for the first time...I will be back!  

I really enjoy places like this where you can create a healthy, custom meal quickly and for a reasonable cost.

THE FOOD
- I tried each of the "starter" cini's, with some alfredo sauce for dipping.  Each was unique and tasty...not sure which I prefer best.
- For entre I had angel hair pasta with Italian sausage and the diavolo sauce.  Then, I added black olives, artichoke hearts, spinace and some fresh parmesan.  It was fantastic.

(one note:  the amount of diavolo sauce that was served was a bit small, so I asked for more.  then, as I was eating my meal the manager came around to check on folks...I told him I wish I had a bit more of that tasty sauce and he hooked me up!)

THE SERVICE
Most everyone was smiling, and customer focused.  I really appreciated the manager's attention and engagement!

A group of friends and I went to the Grand location on 11/23 to find that it was closed.  After checking online we found out about the Ladue location, and headed down there.  Of the lot of us four of us absolutely loved the Grand location, two more enjoyed it, and two more were excited to try it after hearing us talk about it.

When we arrived at the Ladue location we should have left immediately.  It was six o'clock on a Saturday night and we were the only ones in the restaurant other than the employees, one of which was eating in the dining room.  

Two trainees were at the counter, neither of which knew the menu.  Many items that we enjoyed from the Grand location were now no longer available (the bisque, five of the six cinis, the breaded chicken) along with many of the toppings (arugula and spinach were no longer available, they ran out of pancetta and angel hair, so on).  

Disappointed we placed our orders while the manager explained the Grand location is now closed for good, and explained about what happened with the owners.  As he did, the trainees wrapped up our orders without offering us toppings.  When I asked if this had changed they opened up the to go containers and we went through the process.  However, the counter had a puddle of water, which the trainees ignored, placing two of our to go boxes IN the puddle.  The manager noticed it eventually and wiped it up, but made no attempt to correct the two orders which had already been left in the water.  

I wish I could say this was all that was wrong, but it isn't.  One of our party is rather cheese sensitive, but after tossing the pasta in the sauce the cook started throwing cheese onto it, and looked shocked when he asked him to stop.  They should have offered to replace the meal, but did not.  We ordered four orders of cinis, and rather than tasting fresh and fried they tasted like they were reheated and baked.  

The manager knew there had been problems and offered us free bread and cookies.  A nice gesture, but nowhere near enough.  Of the eight of us who ate that night five of us ended up having stomach issues.  After the venue change, the management and employee change, and the drastic reduction to the menu I can safely say the Ladue location is nothing like the Grand location which we loved so much.  A very disappointing end to a once lovely restaurant.  
Avoid.
Great little fast and friendly Italian cafe. Limited service, but fast and fresh. Light Italian dishes, pasta, etc. Lots of parking, convenient location on edge of Clayton/Ladue.

Food is really great but just this week they got back the portion size of their pasta order. Even though they offer "you pick 2" similar to StL Bread Company they refused to sell 1/2 orders of pasta with full orders. Wonder how bad they want to stay in business

So I decided to give Cini a try for lunch today.  My prediction is that they will be gone within a year.  

Why you ask? ... 1.  Horrible acoustics - like so many franchise/chains in strip shopping centers, you walk in and the cacophony is so annoying - the super high ceilings causes talking and music to be practically unbearable and so ANNOYING.

2. The menu is confusing and convoluted. I consider myself to be a relatively intelligent individual and I found that I had to inquire what the deal is with their ordering process ... the employee in front of me told another employee to explain it to me, I got the sense he was fed up with explaining the process...ps the music and noise level was so loud I could barely hear the explanation.  

3.  Cost vs. Quantity - this place is overpriced for the portions - I have had so many outstanding lunches throughout St. Louis for under $10 bucks and I can tell you that most of them, you can split or have left overs to take home.  

I ordered a pick 2 -  an order of "cini", should be "chintzy" - 3 very small arancini - got the 4 cheese variety with the pomodoro sauce.  With a salad - NO grilled items (that would have tacked on even more $$) and an ice tea - $9.25.  The portions were small by any account - and I was finding myself trying to get every little scrap from the salad bowl.  It was so disappointing - the food is tasty I will give them that - but the price they want you to pay for the the quantity and the Blech atmosphere.  I'll pass !!!

Very clean space. The food is extremely fresh, and the service team is kind, friendly and always smiling. I was very impressed. Tried the diavolo sauce on noodles with fresh vegetables. It's a very good primavera. The cini's were good - they're basically fried balls of risotto, from what I can tell, and they have three different flavors. They were yummy. Each with a unique flavor to them. I appreciate what this place is trying to be - the Subway of italian food. Yummy.

I got the piadina first. It's a wrap of sorts. You pick the fillings . The concept is interesting but the sauce made the wrap so soggy I could not pick it up. I took it back and asked for the pasta bowl. The diavolo sauce was just ok and the pasta was just undercooked. Not quite al dente. 
The place was clean and modern but I was unimpressed by the food.

The place is cool looking but food is not good at all. I ordered a pasta with various vegetables and they threw raw mushrooms (cold) into a pasta with hot salmon. The concept doesn't work. My kids liked their buttered noodles but the 'adult food" was a no go.

YUM! I tried Meal Prep Reno this week for the first time and ordered 7 a la carte meals. I was actually blown away with the quality and taste! The shrimp, steak and turkey meatloaf were my favorite of the 7 I ordered. They are reasonably priced, tasty and healthy. I ordered 10 more meals for next week and can't wait to try more dishes. I like that it's fresh ingredients and local unlike some other competitors where you pay more for it to be shipped frozen or from who knows where! They also have great customer service and answer any questions you have quickly.

It took my a while to remember to keep an ice chest outside for Sunday deliveries when I was out of town, but they took care of me and made sure my food didn't spoil! They even texted me when my first delivery happened. Although it wasn't standard procedure they went out of their way to make sure I had fresh food. I love the balanced meals and it works for me because I refuse to grocery shop. The only thing I would change is having the option to choose lean meals vs. bulk meals. I can't have carbs with every meal and it would be nice to opt out of the carb option for some of the meals.
I absolutely love Meal Prep Reno! Everything they serve is extremely well seasoned and prepared. Thank you so much for helping me attain my fitness goals before summer :)

We started using Meal Prep Reno in October 2019. The food is always delivered fresh & tastes delicious! The meals are easy to heat, well portioned with dietary/nutritional info clear, and stay well throughout the week. 

This has been an amazing option for our household dinners, catering to different taste preferences in our household, convenient & healthy! 

Now let me tell you about why would i give a 3* rating with such a fantastic product. 

Menu options- eh. They rotate menu items, but not enough. They have a wide variety but not a large variety of meal, but unless you have a wide palette, you don't have a lot of wiggle room. 

Online menu vs what's delivered- While they offer a wide variety of options (low carb, extra protein), they don't consistently tell you what substitutions will be used. For example, the low carb steak option showed rice on the menu, I expected rice (not really thinking about the low carb part). I emailed them and was told that that because its low carb, they substituted rice for veggies. No biggie but I just expect the menu online to match what I'm ordering. Also, low carb also sometimes means cauliflower rice with almost every meal. Some of the low carb substitutions weren't bad, but green beans smothered with enchiladas were just kind of weird. 

Inconsistent & unreliable software issues - During the holidays, we skipped a couple weeks worth of delivery. I had gone on their website & selected the option to skip deliveries. The first week skipped fine, the 2nd week- I got charged and when I emailed them, they said their systems glitched and apologized, immediately refunding my money. A couple weeks later, we were back on deliveries & we got a call that they were changing subscription platforms and advised we would need to sign up again. I went online and signed up again, selected meals for the upcoming week & thought we were good. Turns out, their new platform is not any better, as it "forgot" my order (despite an email confirmation) and we didnt receive our delivery. When I emailed about that, they offered to deliver some of what we ordered but said they couldn't fulfill it all. We opted to go grocery shopping. 

We have recently started alternating weekly deliveries with other companies to provide some variety. I'm finding other companies have more consistency with the food substitutions & their menus match what is delivered, as well as less technological issues.  They all have their pros and cons, I will continue to alternate MPR into our routine, and confident they can rock the market with the kinks iron out.

The best meal prep service I've ever tried! I've been ordering from them for a few months now and the food is always delicious. The deliveries are about the same time each Sunday and they send you a reminder text the night before. I love the steak, the peanut butter balls, and the breakfast bowl.

Yummy! Finishing up my first week of meals and I am impressed. First off, I like the options of meals and being able to choose between standard, low carb and vegetarian. It was hard to narrow it down to just five meals! Every meal I chose was phenomenal! The portions and flavors were on point and I didn't have to add any salt or pepper. Can't wait to try the next five meals!

Very impressed with the amount of protein in each meal we received.  Lots  of chicken in the enchiladas as well as the teriyaki chicken.  My husband loved the chimichurri steak and the teriyaki chicken was not too salty (which is usually the case with teriyaki chicken).  Looking forward to trying another five meals

I cannot say enough good things about Meal Prep Reno. I'm going to tell you my favorite things

First and foremost: the food is fantastic. They have a huge variety. There are options to fit most diets including low carb and vegetarian. I'm trying to really watch my calories and macros right now so the low carb options are mostly what I've been doing. They're so good! They use things like cauliflower rice and green beans instead of regular rice and beans, so you don't feel like you're missing out. So far my favorites are shawarma chicken, red enchiladas, and chimichurri steak. Honorable mention: chicken cacciatore with polenta. AND I AM ONLY 1.5 WEEKS IN!!! I'm so excited for all the other things I will be trying in the near future. 

Second: convenience. I used to spend at least half of Sunday meal prepping for the week. Hours of being on my feet in the kitchen (instead of spending time with my family or doing fun things), and then half the time I would be sick of the meal I made by Wednesday and wind up with takeout anyway! Now my Sundays are free! They deliver to my front porch (for free) and I get to have a different, delicious, healthy meal each day. And they only take a couple of minutes in the microwave to prepare.  

Third: ease of ordering and customer service. Their website is user-friendly, they have all the calories and macros listed for every meal, and it's very quick and simple to hop on and choose my meals for the week. On my first order, I accidentally selected the wrong delivery day for my orders and didn't realize til after I submitted the orders. It was easy to figure out how to change it for future orders, but I couldn't change it for the current week. I emailed them requesting a change and their reply was prompt and they fixed it for me. 

Fourth: cost. Someone told me they thought it was kind of expensive... but when I really sat down and thought about it... no, it's not really. I thought of cost of all the ingredients I was using to make 5 of the same meals for the week, plus the cost I was incurring when I got sick of my meals halfway through the week, throwing them out, and getting takeout anyway. Plus, as they say, time is money: my Sundays are valuable to me! 

Meal Prep Reno is worth every cent. I look forward to every single meal, AND in just this week and a half with no takeout lunches, I've lost 5 lbs. And I got to spend my last two Sundays relaxing and enjoying my friends and family. Win-win-win.

I love this service. I love that it's local and fresh and less waste because there isn't a box and overwhelming packaging. Food is yummy and always on time. Please add one more meatball to the Turkey Sesame meatballs!!

Have been thrilled with Meal Prep Reno. Great tasting meals that are healthy and properly portioned (We usually add a green salad or an additional vegetable. We order for part of the week to give us a little break and then enjoy creating our own meals the rest of the week.  The ordering process is a snap and the delivery is super easy. Great chefs create delicious meals at a super fair price.  Love it!

I can't say enough about this company-I'm so grateful for them. The meals are delicious and perfectly portioned. I've wanted to meal prep forever but never had the motivation to do it. The variety is great-and zero prep.

We tried this for about 3 weeks and sadly cancelled. Their website states that you need to place your next week orders by Wednesday at midnight, but really if you have a subscription it's Tuesday's. Unfortunately we got the same meals as we had ordered the previous week because Tuesday is not stated anywhere. The food wasn't bad just bland and it was pretty big proportions, but since contacting the company and explaining the order cut-off misinformation, their response was that the Wednesday deadline is for their workers making the meals and that they recommended for the customer to make their selections by Monday even though the website states Wednesday for subscriptions. Their website should have the correct info especially since that's the main mode of communication. The whole purpose for me was to not have to eat the same thing week after week and she didn't provide great customer service for this mishap which turned me off and the meals weren't that flavorful. So if you have a subscription, place orders by Monday to avoid this.

I've always been curious about meal prep places in town and I was excited to finally try this place. I ordered some smoothies for the week and they were so good. I also appreciate the packaging and delivery service they offer for locals. The packaging kept the product cold. The prices are not too bad compared to other meal prep businesses. Definitely try this place if you are in a crunch for time or want to eat healthy-fast!

The food is really delicious. The only problem is, they don't have a lot of paleo options. They offer veggie subs to some of their meals but not a lot. I can't wait for them to get more business so they can expand and make more meals and maybe offer more vegetarian and/or paleo options.

Ok, this review is long overdue!
I ordered some smoothies awhile back but  wasn't feeling too well then and started keto.
So, these smoothies healthy as they are, are not keto, little disclaimer there.
I kept them frozen until now. (Best used by 3 months).
Anyways I'm on summer vacation now and am back on track on eating more healthy and thought what's better then an icy cold smoothie for breakfast!

First off I was so impressed on the delivery of these shakes. They come in the best insulation and huge ice packs.
They were so frozen when I got them
And knew they would be great!

Fast forward to this morning.
I had ordered five and could not decide which one to try!
I'm so new at this and didn't know 
how to proceed LOL!
I chose the fruit with greens and threw it in the blender with some water.
There aren't really instructions on the carton so when my blender wasn't blending I added more water. 
It didn't have a lot of flavor so added a little orange juice and some mango yogurt I had.
Like I said I'm new at this LOL!
Much better!! 
Enjoyed my smoothie and look forward to one tomorrow with coffee and dates! Maybe add a little honey!!
The prices are a little steep but hey it's a great service for your money!

My first time trying out a meal prep business...

I ordered six:

Today, I am eating the red chicken enchiladas..and very impressed with how much chicken!

I love the communication and the delivery.

So convenient and a great concept!

Thank you!

Meal prep Reno gives you one less thing to worry about! They deliver fresh, healthy meals straight to your door. I tried their smoothies for 5 days. They were simple, made with fresh, clean ingredients and very convenient! My favorite was the berry oat smoothie. You just blend it up with your liquid of choice and you're good to go! Definitely looking forward to trying some of their other items. Online ordering is so easy!
Love that this place is so convenient to where I live.  It's much cleaner than the typical Wawa.  Shakes and French vanilla cappuccino are amazing!  Gas is usually pretty inexpensive as well

This Wawa has friendly service, and it is clean on my visits.  The food is as it should be, and I find it really easy to make special requests on my food orders.

I especially appreciate one of the cashiers.  She is very friendly and goes the extra mile with her position.

I was concerned about the expiration date on a container of milk, and asked if someone could look for fresher milk.  She answered me honestly, stating they were really busy at the moment, and there is probably no one to check on it.

I really like her answer.
  
Why?  Because it's honest, and I would rather be told the above, rather than be told, "sure hun, we'll get someone on it right away," knowing that no one will have the time to actually do it. 

It's better to be upfront than have people waiting around. . . for nothing.
Thank you.

This Wawa has a great staff and is nice and clean just like it should be. They have a great selection of everything you might need. I come here all the time to get my coffee, it is a great Wawa location.
If you want gas great!  Food gave me indigestion. The chicken fingers advertised as great were processed and microwaved  I won't ever eat there again.
I love this place! The workers are super friendly and helpful. I love the food too. I miss y'all selling GNC supplements though, that was super convenient. Staff is awesome and I would recommend.

Great WaWa.

-One price for fuel regardless of payment form
-Apple pay accepted at pump
-New card swipe at pump I have not yet sorted out how to use, but sure it's fine
-Convenience store with many snack options (mostly junk foods), but really appreciate the fresh fruit, nuts, and healthier items
The staff is great but why is their constantly homeless people hanging around. I've literally seen people smoking meth on the side.
Love the larger menu. Great place for any occasion. Some of the best food I've ever had.
My favorite north Indian cuisine in Norristown.  Very flavorful dishes. I just hope the quality stays until long.  Coming back soon!!

I love this place! Honestly I have never had momos before eating here, so I have no basis of comparison- BUT! They are the best dumplings of any kind I have ever had. I've tried the chicken and vegetable momos. They are incredible and a must. The dipping sauce is some kind of peanut/sesame with some kind of hot pepper I think in it. Recently I ordered them to go to share with friends and they all agreed with me. Otherwise, the other food I've tried is also delicious. They have a nice lunch special at the moment, but that may change with the buffet opening soon. I can't wait to try more of their delicious dishes. Very peaceful and warm atmosphere as well, with very kind staff. Highly recommended!
Good food. Biryani could do a little work (rice was a bit too oily and sticky as compared to most goat biryanis). The orange kulfi was great and ambiance was good.

This place is amazing! Plenty of veggie options as well. My girlfriend and I got 4 different apps and an entree each and everything was incredible. This and Bombay Dhabba are my 2 favorite Indian restaurants in the area.
Ordered tiger shrimp for takeout-it was bland (I specified spicy) and rubbery-very disappointing.

This was our first visit based on a recommendation from a friend.  We were pleasantly surprised our favorite server, Happy, was working now at Nirvana.  We enjoyed the Gobi Manchurian appetizer the spice level was perfect.  My husband was very happy with the vindaloo and I really enjoyed the Tandoori Salmon.  We also had bindhi Masala and two great desserts.  We highly recommend this new restaurant.  We will be bringing friends and family here to enjoy good Indian cuisine and great service.

The old Dosa Hut is under new ownership and the food and service are excellent!!  Stopped in for a quick lunch, the menu has expanded and the quality of the food also seems to have improved. Don't hesitate to try some of the Himalayan items like momos and thukpa, they are very good!!

Last night was our 2nd visit to this location. Always liked the Lafayette Hill location and this one did not disappoint. Food was great. I frequently find Naan very greasy but not at Nirvana. It was perfect as was our eggplant and lentil entrees. Happy is so welcoming and attentive. The atmosphere is very cozy.
Our first visit and we loved it. Service was excellent. Food was well prepared and fairly priced. The chicken Korma was super great. We'll be back.

Small and cozy atmosphere with some of the best Indian food among many in this area.  The eggplant appetizer is sooo good.  The Naan the best.  And I'll be so bold to say, that you cannot go wrong with any entree.  We have loved every dish we ordered so far.  The meats are tender, the sauces flavorful with the option of your spiciness.

Got takeout from here last week and it was great enough to bring us to dine in this week. The takeout was really good but dining in was even better since the food was obviously more fresh and hot. Everything was absolutely delicious, many options and some interesting specials. From the appetizers - we had the tangy eggplant and samosas- to the entrees - chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo- to the desserts - orange kulfi - an amazing orange sorbet treat that is a must try! Everything was fantastic. 

The service was friendly, attentive and polite. The dining environment was welcoming, clean and cozy. Prices are fair compared to other places. With so many Indian restaurants to choose from especially in this area, even on this road, this is definitely my new favorite! Highly recommend.

Great restaurant! Beautiful atmosphere and aromas. Manager is super friendly and sincere and entertaining, accommodating to dietary requests.
All dishes incredible, including Naan. 
Love it here!! Would give it 10 stars if possible!!

First time I visited Nirvana for buffet. At $12.95 it was a basic but very good. My friends and I were very impressed.  Server was very helpful considering we werent experts on the cuisine.

We'd go back for buffet but will continue to eat off the menul We were a bit disappointed thay were our of chicken momos.  This is my new :go to" place for meals.  Greatfood,friendly staff.

Outrageously delicious! Impeccably clean and beautifully warm ambience. The owner was very friendly and personable. Portion sizes were very ample. We only dine out eating Indian cuisine and this restaurant easily rates 6 stars!!!

Had a wonderful experience at Nirvana Eagleville.  I hadn't been to their Lafayette Hill in a few years and their quality of Indian food continues to impress me.  Great food!  Excellent service!  And the owner, Mr. Nabin Chhantyal personally cares for his customers.  Happy to see they continue to grow.... in Lafayette Hill, Eaglesville and Wyomissing.
Fantastic food. Chicken biryani was really really good, butter chicken and garlic naan was a classically good combo. Chicken 65 was also good.

This is the third time I have eaten at Nirvana and this time was as good as the other two.  I really enjoyed the butter naan and lamb rogan josh. My coworker liked his chicken tikka masala.  

The decor is quite charming and the service attentive.   You could plop Nirvana down in the middle of Greenwich Village or Berkeley and would do quite well.  Audubon is very lucky to have a restaurant of this caliber.

We just had a marvelous meal and had to write about it. We had Gobi Manchurian, Tikka masala, biryani and garlic naan. EVERYTHING was perfect! Crispy gobi, creamy tikka, aromatic biryani and the BEST naan we have ever enjoyed. Do yourself a favor and try this place!
The food is really good.  They are careful with the spices.  Wait staff is excellent very polite.  If you like vegetarian then this is a must have in your list.

This was our first time trying Nirvana and we weren't disappointed.  I based my order off of other yelp reviews and got garlic naan, lamb sukka, and Chana masala.  All were excellent.  The samosa left something to be desired but we will def be back!

Wow! This was our second visit and we can't wait to visit again and try some of the other offerings on the menu...They really have quite a selection and everything we've eaten has been fresh and delicious.  Service is great and the staff are lovely.

We went to this restaurant because we found out that our favorite server was working there. The food was excellent and of course the service was the best - Happy is the best in the business. We had Gobi Manchurian and Chili Paneer for appetizers. Our main dishes were Butter Chicken, Chicken Korma, and a dish that Happy recommended Chicken Dhansak. Everything was excellent. We finished with Orange Kulfi. Of course we will return many times. We highly recommend this restaurant for some great food and excellent service

Friendly service, delicious food. We got the lunch special: 2 dishes (one you choose, one chef's choice), rice, naan, dessert. Plenty of food! I had the lamb saag and yellow dal. Yum. Then we ordered chicken momos- wow! I'm Chinese and very picky with dumplings but these were delicious! Anyhoo, we will certainly be back.

Dosas and curries bursting with flavor! Everything we've tried has been delicious, and everyone I've shared it with has agreed. The ingredients are clearly fresh and the dishes are prepared with care. All of the servers are attentive and delightful.

With so many new Indian cuisine places to choose from in our area, you might struggle to decide. We live less than a mile from this one and gave it a shot for Friday lunch, partly because it was the closest, most convenient choice. We hoped we wouldn't be disappointed by a "rebranding" of the previous Indian dood at this location (which was...meh).
There was absolutely no need to worry! The new owners obviously are in it for the long game and know what they are doing. (Presumably, this is related to the Nirvana in Lafayette Hill? We've never been, but this place seems like the work of experienced ownership.)
We shared the Chicken Momo as an appetizer. These dumplings were obviously hand-made and fresh. They were delicate, and steamed perfectly. Each one held the broth from the perfectly-spiced chicken inside. They came with two spiced dipping sauces: peanut- and tomato-based
My dining partner ordered the day's tandoori chicken special, which they described as "I think ... the best chicken I ever had." It was delicious. 
My Nirvana Shahi Paneer was perfectly spiced and really well-balanced kind of "stick to your ribs" vegetarian dish. It is my new Indian cuisine fave. (I have to admit to beaming with pride when the owner said, "A lot of Indian customers order this." We are obviously not Indian. )
We were full from our lunch and even took home leftovers, but wanted to see the menu again (it is extensive and we were already planning our next visit/take-out). Our discussion led to the waitress (also owner, I think?) bringing us a free sample of the Rasmalai. We were so glad she did. This cottage-cheese based dessert is hand-made. Meaning: the cottage cheese is made on-site, as well as the dessert. At least that's what they told us and it is believable. They're like little pillows of delicious in a milky rosewater bath with ground pistachios. 
We will definitely come back (and order takeout from) here again.

Phenomenal food and fantastic option. My brother and I enjoyed making numerous entrees a family style undertaking and left contented and awe-inspired. Service was quick, attentive and food was filling, delicious.

Nabin's food is the foodie BEST! 
You MUST go and eat heartily at his latest restaurant.
The only reason it doesn't get 4 stars is because I like to receive Naan basket gratis from the moment I order and have free refill option during the meal.
Server could be a little more attentive.
And I appreciate fancy platters. These are more plain than he has used in past restaurants.
but the food, oh the food!
We had vegan Saag and Yellow Dahl - I'm not sure what they call it on the menu.
In my opinion, these are among his best offerings.
He makes incredible appetizers too.
It is a little pricey. But you must go!
Wish he'd put a buffet in there. His buffets have always been the best.
hey Nabin - you can put the buffet in the little room!
Food was good but not service. Papadam was burnt and ask to change, they says we have all like that

My husband and I love the Nirvana Indian Bistro in Lafyette Hill, so I was really excited to find out they opened another restaurant in Eagleville! My husband works in Norristown and i work in Collegeville & Nirvana Indian Bistro in Eagleville is only 10 minutes from both of our jobs! I love everything I've ever tried here. My absolute favorites are the Chicken 65 and Chicken Saag. The staff is always very helpful and accommodating :-)

We just ate here for the second time. The food here is excellent. Nirvana took over old building that used to be Dosa Hut. This area has had a big influx of Indian restaurants but we have found Nirvana the best of the lot. Happy who runs the dining room is great and makes sure you are satisfied. He floats around the dining room making sure all the customers are taken care of. He compliments the great food with energetic service. We are now dedicated customers.
Fresh and authentic, always friendly customer service. Decor needs some serious help but the good food far outweighs that!

Whenever I see a new Indian restaurant or even a replacement one in this area, I get nervous. I think, "Could there possibility be the clientele to support so many?" Well, after realizing Nirvana has the same owner as the well-known Nirvana in Lafayette Hill, I was immediately ecstatic to have one close by again and then relieved--THIS menu will sustain. 

We had: Gobi Manchurian, egg fried rice, mango chicken curry, chicken korma, lamb suka, garlic naan, and the orange ice cream. It was ALL delicious and the best we've had. 

I like this restaurant's ambiance and we had great service. If you're part of the local Indian restaurant scene, you'll be glad to know Happy is here!

Welcome, Nabin and family! We're so happy you're here.

We really had a nice meal at Nirvana. It's a quaint BYOB with a very clean ambiance. There were about 5 families in and out while we were there. It's clearly got a steady dinner business. My wife had the tandoori salmon and was extremely impressed. It was well cooked and was not dry. I had a spicy chicken curry dish and really enjoyed the flavor. We very much enjoyed the Gobi65 fried cauliflower appetizer as well. Very well done, Nirvana. Thanks for a great meal!

I just went to this restaurant for the first time and I was blown away by the meal I had.  The naan was so fresh and hot it was almost too hot to touch. The gobi manchurian was crispy and the sauce was well caramelized and spicy. The biryani was delicious as well. All food was served piping hot. The service was friendly and professional.  Everyone made sure we had everything we needed the entire visit.  It was definitely the best Indian meal I have had in the area. I highly recommend this restaurant!

We needed a new place for the traditional family holiday Indian dinner gathering after the previous venue closed. This place doesn't look like much from the road, but the inside is fine and the food was wonderful. The Tandoori Salmon in particular was both flavorful and moist, and the Malabar Fish Curry was very nicely done. Good attentive service. They still need to get a new sign outside, so don't be fooled. Definitely recommended!!
I visited it today first time. Very friendly people and good food. Tell them what you like and they will make the best of it.

We wanted to try the food under the prior ownership, but the mixed reviews kept us away. There are too many wediocre restaurants.
So when we saw this restaurant under new ownership and read about momos, we decided to stop by. We were glad we did!
Happy met us at the door and we knew it was going to be a fabulous meal and experience.
We tried chicken momos, grilled paneer appetizers, chicken tikka masala and lamb korma. All were perfectly spiced/seasoned and sooo tender. Also enjoyed naan and potato paratha and rice.
Happy was attentive as he always is and brought the owner/chef to the table to say hello.
We enjoyed some delicious orange sorbet slices to cleanse the palate.
We will be sure to stop back and explore the rest of the menu soon.
THANK YOU HAPPY...WE MISSED YOU!

Went in during a week night. Only one other table occupied. Service was slow. Couldn't get on their WiFi. Samosas were bland and tasted like they were filled with just potato. 

Too many other good Indian food options in the area!

Good place for Indian food.

Will recommend the tandoori chicken !!

The picadillio was outstanding with large portions. The alcapurria was fresh and delicious! Very friendly owner and staff. I  drove by many times and finally tried it and I was glad I did. Highly recommend!
Was close by and decided to give it a try I was glad I did the owner was very nice and welcoming went with the white rice black beans and picadillo will definitely be back to try something different
Food was delicious definitely recommend it especially the Jibarito Plantain Sandwich 8"

Authentic tasting Latin food.  My favs are their chicken breast and black beans with rice.  They have a vast menu - see pic.  Also, this a family owned business -  good customer service
and great tasting food.
Fantastic food, super nice staff. The alcapurrias and the Jibarito plantain sandwich are a must! And BTW, this is a Puerto Rican restaurant!

Tonight my boyfriend and I ordered a large pizza with green peppers and onions, 1 order of regular fries and 1 order of the cajun fries.
I ordered at 5:52 pm. It said the order would be ready at 6:10. I get there around 6:10 and everything was done. Pizza was in the heater to keep it still warm, the fries were in a pizza bag staying warm. They gave me the wrong order of fries, so we had to wait an additional 7 minutes, my pizza looked ok but when we got home to eat, it was so undercooked that we had to throw slices in the toaster oven.

I only ate the toppings and cheese off the top of it. So dissapointing, i tried calling the store twice so they could redeem themselves but no one answered so I had to contact corporate.

This was our first time here... we usually order from blackwood Clementon road because we've never had an issue. They definitely lost our business here, its a bunch of children who are running this chain and they don't know what they are doing.

Management please step in and help them out, they will only continue to fail.

Ordered carry out today, paid and the woman handed me the pizza but forgot my wings. Ok no big deal, open my pizza to find it half cooked, you can see in the photos it's mostly dough and look at the crust that I spent an extra $1 on for pan pizza .... come on. Place is absolutely terrible!!! Rather eat shit off the ground. When I called they said we will give you a pizza on your account. Really? How about a new pizza delivered! What a disgrace save your time, money and stomach!

Not even one star. Very under prepared. Ordered a pizza for a 6:30pm pick up. After arriving for our pick up we were told "it would be a while" after we paid. Finally walked out at 6:50. No empathy, no apology. Very unorganized and unprofessional.

This is about the New PizzaHut in Sicklerville. This was just the nastiest. Nothing  appealing about it. I've always love Pizza Hut and i was beyond excited that a New was built near me. But this place i would never recommend. Both of my pies were overcooked. Hoping they just need to work out some kinks, and it'll be better soon.

Even my 1 year old didn't want it and she usually likes pizza. Need to do better.

I went to this pizza hut last week- I do agree with the other reviews on here- they didnt answer the phone but a general line answered my call and took my order.  When I got to the pizza hut, my order wasn't ready so I sat there and embraced the chaos.  Literally there was 2 young guys working, thats it, and you could see on the order board that there were ALOT of orders.  People calling, people walking in, people ordering through drive thru.  I honestly felt really bad for the 2 guys working because they were hustling.  Pizza was just meh, but they need to hire more people.
I'm pretty easy to please when it comes to food. Especially pizza. Both times I've tried this location the pizza was terribly undercooked. Nobody in my family could even try and finish the pizza.

I am not a fan of chain pizza places however my wife is. So I decided to order a pizza for dinner. The cost for a supreme pizza and a 2 liter of soda was almost $21 as if that wasn't bad enough the pizza wasn't ready when I got there to pick up.. but that's cool. I got home and opened the box and I could tell it was barely cooked. I had to throw it into the oven for another 15 minutes just to make it edible!!
Save Your Money. Order a pizza at a Mom and Pop place. Trust Me!!!

Good-bye to plain ole ice cream sandwiches!
Hello to chewy cookies with creamy flavorful ice cream!

I had the Gingersnap with Lemon Cream Ice cream and if I hadn't left I would've had a few more!

It doesn't matter if it's cold outside.  You will send your sweet tooth over the moon with happiness if you take the time to enjoy a treat from The Sugar Wagon!
I am on the BOD of a local non-profit and bought boxes of assorted cookies for Thanksgiving gifts.  I have been receiving emails all morning about how "to die for" the cookies are!

New food truck/wagon in town. They stopped by my office and sold us their delicious ice cream sandwiches. I was blown away! The salted caramel ice cream with chocolate chip cookie was to die for. Perfect blend of sweet and salty. They have also been riding along with other local trucks. Follow them on Twitter @sugarwagon to catch up with them. You won't be disappointed!

Once you have an ice cream sandwich from Sugar Wagon you'll never want to touch an ice cream sandwich from your local grocery store ever again...I had never heard of this "food truck" until this week. 

I had a salted caramel ice cream sandwich...the "sandwich" part was chocolate chip cookies!! YUM is an understatement! The cookies were not soggy at all and the salted caramel ice cream is pretty much the best ice cream I've ever tasted! 

Definitely check them out if you are a fan of sweets! I will be back for more :)

We had The Sugar Wagon provide the dessert at our wedding reception this past June. My fiance and I wanted a fun alternative to cake, and the ice cream sandwiches also seemed like a way to keep our guests cool on a sweltering June day. We had four options-  mocha, vegan peanut butter, mocha, and green tea. Each was delicious (we were especially fond of the green tea) and out guests couldn't stop raving about the sandwiches.  The ice cream is homemade, as are the cookies. Even the vegan options are excellent- I would definitely recommend them even if you aren't vegan!
If you are thinking of hiring the Sugar Wagon for an event, I would highly recommend them. Jane was very professional-  they arrived on time for the wedding, provided everything as stated in the contract, and even let me pick up the leftover sandwiches from her the following day.

Although I was apprehensive about trying Mexican food in Louisiana, I had to give Rio Grande a try. 

Simply amazing!  From the authenticity of the mariachi and folklorico music playing in the background to the fresh and flavorful food, Rio Grande represents the New Mexico flag they fly in front of the establishment well!

Rio Grande, we will meet again!  Thank you.

Great food at a GREAT value. They have the cane sugar sodas from Mexico. I got the chili con carne burrito and it was delicious. I am looking forward to going back and trying more of the menu. It is a small, cozy place that gets your food out fast and fresh. The staff is super friendly.

My dad stopped in here today to pick up some lunch: two orders of tacos, beef enchiladas, and an order of guac and chips. He couldn't stop commenting on how absolutely lovely the couple who own it are, and that he watched them cut and cook everything. In the commotion, he left his phone. The proprietor noticed it immediately and held it for him behind the counter. My mother loved the enchiladas. It was far more than she could finish. Dad & I loved the tacos. The shells are made there, fresh, huge. Overstuffed and the meat seasoned to perfection. This was a first of many future visits. I loved it. The guac was also perfect.

We went last night with the Algiers One Meet and Eat group,it was our first time trying this place and I can tell you, it won't be our last 
The food was delicious and the service was outstanding

Rio's chicken tacos with sour cream are currently on my weekly lunch rotation. I'm fighting the urge to venture into two trips a week for fear of burnout. The other tacos are solid, but I offer that the chicken reigns supreme.  Don't pass up this West Bank gem.
Awesome!!! Small place just down the road from work. Great food! You can't go wrong with anything. Everything is fresh and reasonably priced!

Eating tacos in a fancy place is kind of an oxymoron. It just doesn't work. That's precisely why this place works. It's eclectic, very homey like in abuelas kitchen, super friendly service and the tacos were too legit to quit. The price is just right. I love the bullfight posters and super cold Jarritos in the fridge and they offer $1 fresh made beverages as well. Can't go wrong. Good for a weekday lunch since they're not open late or on the weekend.

We are very disappointed and feel like we have been hood winked with the Kirkwood location.  The selection terrible, frozen meats are freezer burned, the one defrosted chicken the size of my fist was $13. 

The produce is poor and a lot of the same labels as shop n save, but 2 and 3X's  more expensive.  There is nothing to choose from, the beer is 50% more, the so called prepared food is not fresh, 2 selections, poorly priced.   What's positive - there was at least 7 staff, nice to support employment and wages, unfortunately most of them are standing around since there are only 5 people shopping at 6pm on a weeknight.  Obviously, this venture is heavily subsidized and may be time will help.  

To boot - the baby formula was listed at $41 the same product through Amazon is $22.  This has to be one of the worst excuses for a food market and reminds us of Sappington Market, except they sold Xmas trees and pumpkins.   I only saw a few items 150 mile and a few 300 mile labels, do the owners think we are dumb, we can afford to live here I'm sure we are smart enough to know when businesses are trying to get over.

They should have let the furniture maker lease out the building.

Organic food buying:  Is that like committing to an Organic diet like a Vegan commits to a non-meat diet?  Or is it something you buy now and then just to make yourself feel healthy? 

If it is the former then you need some serious income to feed this habit!  I walked through this grocery store today ( formerly  McDonnell Market)  and was I UNDER-whelmed by the smell, decor, and enthusiasm of the employees. When you walk  through the door, a waif of unpleasantry doesn't set the mood for a good experience. In all fairness McDonnell's had that same odor. Local Harvest spared NO expense remodeling the place either. I would not have known it changed hands if the signage did not tell me so or until I actually investigated the contents.   I was OVER- whelmed by the sticker shock on the items. A small Cornish Game Hen $18.99 that is one hen for one person that you have to cook yourself. Do you cook Organic food in Organic seasonings? Do you make Organic sides to go with it? Every item I picked up seemed ridiculously priced. They offer a Rib- Eye Steak $19.99 that said Grass Fed. I thought all cows ate grass... am I missing something? Do I need to be Organically enlightened? 

This weekend was their less than Grand Opening. They had a few people handing out samples. Well, the wine lady was sampling but it was kind of like, 'one for you one for me', OK, one more for me, it was the highlight of the visit.

This place was just a total let down from the odd smell, the jazz music playing in a 50's retro grocery store, the lack luster hospitality, to  the eye-opening sticker prices.

It will be interesting to see if Urbania  can co-exsist in Suburbia.

First of all, I would ask any of these critics if they have ever run a grocery store.    Your largest overhead is your rent .   See all the people being booted out of their houses.   Then comes wages.  And if you cannot get a distributor forget about anything being on the shelves.  Today grocery stores have the merchandise company stocking the shelves not the employees that work for the stores.  Also, way back when for every part time person you hired, the union required a full time person be hired.  Women that were married, had children were told to leave the work force (kinda like the legislatures are doing today) and no moonlighting allowed (companies wanted 100% of your energy).  So what are your representatives and companies doing for you today?   Sorry, I thought a little history of then and now might help.

Bottom line.  Nothing has ever been easy.  Things change because of people and I think anyone who endeavors to start a business should be congratulated not criticized.  Ask a better question, what did the place look like when they moved in and how good was the equipment.  This is a reflection on the landlord, the mayor of Kirkwood.  The lesson here is get the whole story before you make a comment.  Thank you for reading my feedback.  Remember only you can make the difference.       

Kay

Loving the new Local Harvest Location in Kirwood!

1) Great local foods clearly indicated int he distance system (150 miles, regional, etc)
2) Delicious breakfast sandwichs and coffee
3) Amazing beer selection (locales as well as some great Belgian beers)
4) Super friendly staff.

So stop in and do some shopping (joing the 150 miler club for added benefits!)

3.5
I enjoy going here knowing that many of the items here are the healthiest things I should be eating in the area.
The price of everything is a bit much.
I loved the bean dip I bought from the deli in the back.
I LOVED the homemade pickles.  ADORE them. Did I mention they were yummy?
My new breakfast bar phase are "Thinkthin" bars and they are a lot more expensive here than at TJ's.

The place is lacking atmosphere as it looks like they opened before working on the interior. It looks they threw some items on the shelves, put some casual tables/chairs in the front and forgot about the rest.
Some shelves seem a bit bare but I suppose that leans towards the knowledge that you will find something fresher than in an overly stocked grocery store  
The interior is NOT inviting nor does it make you want to eat there.
I do love the deli snacks in the back. 
I will be going back to try some sandwiches and maybe a brunch.
Right now it looks like you are eating in someone's back stockroom with less charm.
I'm sure they will improve. I am willing to give it more time. I am positive that the pricing will not improve but this place is not for your average grocery shopping trip. This is to get those items you are particular about or for something incredibly healthy.
To add to the "organic" scoffing I always roll my eyes at that word also as Organic is everything that is organic. lol. Silly stuff.  
This wood is organic!  IT MUST BE THE BEST WOOD AROUND! hehe.
Ok  /rant off.

TLDR:
Expensive but not for your average grocery shopping trip. Great deli but currently the inside is not inviting enough to stay and eat the deli items.
