Try their pickles from the deli! :) Yum! I will be exploring more.

I'm extending Local Harvest a loan of 3 stars because I think it has potential.  I'm happy to have access to locally sourced items without having to tie myself down to less frequent hours/seasons at a farmer's market.  And, I'm so happy to find my favorite greek style yogurt from Windrest Dairy for sale at a lower price than I pay at the WashU Farmer's market!  

A trip here incented me to buy a local, free range turkey---it was four times more expensive than a regular ole' butterball and not nearly as juicy.  I probably needed some guidance on cooking such a bird---it was a lost opportunity to help me out.  I likely will not spend the dough on such fowl next year.  

My turkey experience has made me a little nervous about trying the grass fed, etc, meats.  For the premium price, I need to feel like I'll be able to prepare something that makes the cost worthwhile.  Recipes?  Classes? 



The staff always welcomes with a hello, which is nice.  However, the store itself is somewhat lacking.  I like the old school look, but the place seems dimly lit.  The cafe is in no way inviting.  Not an iota.  Something needs to be done if it's going to work out.

Was hoping for a taste of Chicago so went to this Harolds.  Harolds, come get your name back.  The only thing in common with Chicago Harolds is signage and bullet-proof glass.  My entire order was wrong, and tasteless.  Ask for sauce on side - chicken drenched in sauce.  Fried hard/salt n pepper - not hardly.  Pizza puff - half soggy, half-frozen. Coleslaw - HOT. Your menu on Yelp claims wing buckets - not here.   This review does not even begin to capture my disappointment of a hometown favorite.  I really, really, really, really, wanted to like this place. No need for a return visit.
The chicken is seasoned well, juicy along with a airy and crispy outer crust. The popular mild sauce is very tasty also.

I truly truly hate to leave a non good review especially with this being a new business so I left two stars. The fries I ate. I did check via Yelp the menu and it was completely different than the phone call. I was told Facebook and the website are more accurate just in case anyone would reference the pricing and items. 
I was excited as harolds is legit whew..... so I just got the 8piece dinner for $14. Paid via phone and headed down to Union. 
No issue on parking as I was able to park by the building. It was a cute young girl asking if the order was a phone order, she proceeded to give me the receipt to sign and told me to have a blessed day. So sweet. 

Smelled good. I got enough for my mother to try actually, I was excited because harolds  is in St. Louis. I opened the bag and first thought.... "Breaded"........ this is oddly light... whew please say this chicken is done all the way. My mother saw the light color and declined to try it I was scared because it's chicken yall. That can go wrong..  
second thought, Harold ... fried hard my fried hard... you eat harolds... fried hard   salt , pepper mild sauce on the side of that thang... this can't be but let me rethink, it may be St. Louis version. I was truly afraid to try,  so there was one chicken that was a half shade darker than the others and I tried because I was going to throw away but I had to see. 
I can say the fries were good but unfortunately I'm so sorry to say that the chicken didn't have taste to it. It has a greasy taste which I didn't feel so good after but I had one and it didn't have flavor in it which I was hoping. It could possibly be the day and time I came. I will say please make sure if frying breaded to make it golden at least. It could've been done all the way but I was so nervous from seeing them like this I was afraid but I did try the one. 
I hate to leave a review such as this but I believe it's so much room for improvement and it could've been an off day.

As you can see from my previous post, I was highly disappointed BUT after giving it a second chance, it was perfect! This is the taste of Chicago I'm used to. The line was much shorter, which had a direct impact on the quality of the meal. The chicken was crispy, fresh, well seasoned and the sauce was perfect! I def will be back again!!!

When I heard Harold's was coming to St. Louis it was like a dream come true.  I was born and raised on the south side of Chicago and Harold's has been a staple in my life since I was a child.  I think the person taking orders was training so she did require help, but overall the ordering process was smooth.  They request that you stay in the waiting area which is quite small and kind of hot, but even that wasn't too bad.  We got our order pretty quickly (a lot faster then the Harold's back home lol).  The food was fresh and hot and I couldn't wait to dig in.  The food was delicious, BUT that was not Chicago mild sauce.  The breading on the chicken was different as well, it was more similar to Popeyes... But I actually prefer their chicken over the Harold's chicken in the chi. Everything was on point though, the sauce that they used was really good (they were a bit stingy with it though lol).  My advice is to just keep doing what you're doing, just add more sauce to the chicken and fries and fill your sauce containers.  Kudos to the owners, I hope their business prospers. I will definitely come back!

The city of St. Louis has waited decades on the arrival of Harold's Chicken but unfortunately, the mark was missed. Not even close to the authentic Harold's Chicken of Chi-Town. As someone who grew up on Harold's from 87th and Halsted and this wasn't it. It reminded me of a London's & Son- the mild sauce was more like ketchup than mild sauce. The hot sauce, wasn't hot. The chicken was fresh but love and flavor were not presented. The chicken was lacking seasoning and there wasn't a lot of sauce. Since they've just opened, I'm willing to try it again when it's less busy, to see if the qualify of food has approved. And it hurts me to give this just a low review but this ain't worth the 60+ minute wait.

We found this place on Yelp and stopped to try it out. We drove up and it is a gas station, yep inside the gas station. The BEST pizza we have had in a long time. Don't let the location fool you, try it!!

WOW!!!  This new pizza place is the BEST!
Tough to find quality pizza. Willing to travel for this NY style pizza.  The owner is a transplant from NY (he has lived here for several years) and knows how to make pizza!
Our group of seven ordered four super size pizzas. Everyone enjoyed theirs and we had lots of leftovers.
Who would have thought that this new venture (out of a Shell Gas Station) would have been a hit from the get-go!  Prices are very reasonable.  Clean tall tables in the common areas to sit and enjoy.
We will be back soon. Traveling from South Tampa and so worth the drive.

I saw Diesel Pizza on Fox 13 and just had to try it. They are tucked away in a Shell gas station, which I may have never noticed if it wasn't on the news. Although they have a lot of yummy looking options, I went with a pepperoni pizza, their V-Plus, so I could tell the quality. 

The pepperoni slices are smaller than I'm used to and they formed these nice little delicious boats on top of the pizza but they did trap the grease in them. The red sauce had a really nice flavor and the cheese was nice and gooey but the real treat was the crust. It had the perfect amount of char on the bottom and an amazing flavor. 

I'm so glad there is a decent pizza joint nearby.

Great Pizza, great service!!! Really great for a Naples style Pizza! The crust and ingredients on the pizzas are very authentic. 
We enjoyed the personal service!!

What a nice surprise here in Riverview, Luca the Italian pizza owner open 3 months ago next to the gas station a very good authentic Italian pizza, plus great desserts, tiramisu, panna cotta and chocolate mousse! Grazie Luca

The owner, Luca, comes from experience running Italian restaurants In New York. Diesel Pizza is not your average pizza - it's handmade with delicately selected ingredients and with a cooking process that guarantees a delicious pizza. Let's go diesel!
Best tiramisu ever!!!!! Also we're obsessed with creating our own arugula/ prosciutto pizza!!
Riverview has really needed a good quality pizza shop for years. Diesel pizza has stepped up to the challenge and nailed it with Authentic pizza cooked on a stone hearth

I'm so thankful to have found this place.

I love how you can see your pizza being made. Greeted by friendly customer service, props for the cashier handling an extremely disgruntled customer. He assured me my order wouldn't take long, and it didn't. Very clean and orderly. This pizzeria is located in this gas stop that has my fave Itlaian ice, and has some other things I need to try like the tacos. There is indoor seating. You can call to takeout your pizza too. Not sure if there's delivery.   

Unique selection of pizzas. They have other items too. My margherita pizza was made perfectly. Easy on the eyes, and balanced taste. The meat and onion pizza, can't remember the name, was just as good. I don't say this much, but I really like the crust/dough. It's tasty enough on its own. Perfectly baked and charred in all the right places. Almost smokey. 

Price and portion is just right for the quality. Please keep it up, this the only pizza option around right now.
Hey scroller. You stop thinking about. And go ahead and get some.  The pizza at this place is delicious. You will not be disappointed.

Fabulous pizza! Who would think pizza from a gas station would be so amazing? We ordered two and they were both fantastic. For the best New York style pizza around, go to Diesel. You will be glad you did.
EXCELLENT east coast style pizza. The desserts were amazing, as well. This will definitely be our new go-to spot, so happy we found it!
This place is great! Flavors are amazing, best pizza around! Don't let the location fool you. Also, the owner is a really nice man. I try to go here for lunch once a week.

Was looking for a new option for pizza in the area and found this spot and the pictures of the pizzas looked amazing so I had to go try it. Food definitely lived up to the expectations and it will be our new go to for pizza in the future. Added bonus is that they were super friendly but I'd have gone back for the pizza regardless :)
This spot is amazing! I love the owner, he's so nice. A true New Yorker working his magic. Super amazing pizza at a great price. I recommend this place if you're ever craving REAL pizza!

Pizza and salad was delicious. Presentation clearly there. Customer service is outstanding. Super sweet staff! Everything was fresh and exactly was described. Definitely a little hidden gem. Hopefully they maintain this. Highly recommend.

My BF was always skeptical about restaurants connected to a gas station. I used to tell him don't knock it til you try it. Well Diesel Pizza changed his mind. They make the pizzas fresh right there in front of you with fresh ingredients. My basil was still growing on the plant . They have gluten free & vegan options too. Cute pizza names to match their restaurant name. Very friendly service. Highly recommend

I do not usually review restaurants... but this place is too good to not say something! Customer service is incredible. Pizza is even better!! Reminds me of trips to Italy.. and the chef is from Italy! Highly recommend.

Updated: 
I had high expectations given the poor excuses for pizza at so many local places...  and having high hopes we'd be back, I even added 15% tip for the takeout... 

They did give us the wrong salad for $9.00 instead of the Caesar salad we added and badly burned the edges of our gluten-free pizza  Then there was charging for provolone cheese on one pizza, even thought it replaced the standard cheese topping (my wife is lactose intolerant) without telling us at ordering time.

Candidly my margarita pizza was VERY good, as was my wife's provolone-topped pizza and the gluten-free was good, when the absolutely charcoal blackened crust was avoided... Why serve that when they can see how charred it was?  (to the point of being able to use it as a charcoal pencil)...

I'm in the habit of trying places a second time before a bad review (this one is an average review)... and I'm seriously glad to see so many 5-Star reviews for this new place... giving me hope we just had a bad one-off experience.

We will try it again, because I can see the great possibilities, but will eat the pizza there (as others said the atmosphere is gas-station chic), as the pizza was indeed luke-warm when we got it home, as well...  If it's good fresh out of the oven, we'll go back to take-out and reheat when we get home.

They did add a few small slices of other pies for us to try (great idea, and good tastes) and they did add a couple of deserts which were tasty, which was nice, but we could have done without the extras and just had what we actually ordered, done right, and been happier.   

We did call them about the salad and they promised us a coupon to make up for it, but we have not gotten it... so, jury still out, and I'm still out $9.00.

We too will bring some friends as I love to support local businesses but I also don't mind giving candid feedback in hopes a better meal on my next visit.

This place is outstanding. The pizza is absolutely delicious. A friend of mine told me about this place and he was spot on. The staff was amazing and super friendly. If you want to great pizza and in in the Riverview area this is the place for you. We can't wait to come back and try some more if there pizza.

Do not even think twice-GO HERE NOW!!! This pizza is the best my husband and I have ever had. Everything is made from scratch, authentic, amazing quality and made-to-order. We ordered the margarita pizza and the mozzarella that was on it was the freshest we have ever had. Highly recommended to anyone considering giving this place a try! Luca was awesome and gave wonderful suggestions. And last but, most definitely, not least-YOU HAVE TO TRY THE DESSERT!!! We had the tiramisu and the chocolate mousse and they're to DIE FOR! 5 stars across the board!
Their crust is amazing! The meat toppings I got were kind of salty but the sauce & crust made up for it.
Super fresh ingredients. Pizza was so good my wife said that we can't order from any where else ever again.
Absolutely fabulous pizza! Best crust I've had in years, quality toppings. Very impressed. Hidden gem of pizza joy!

1st time giving these guys a try and I am not disappointed.  The blend of Neapolitan and NY style pizza is amazing!  Ordered the Margarita and the Diesel.  They even hooked me up with some dessert with my order.  I will definitely be back to continue supporting these guys.  Thank you so much!!!
Love this pizza! It's so hard to find great quality wood fire pizza! I can't wait to bring my friends here to try this pizza! It's become a staple in our home on Friday nights!

I Love Taco Bus.... The new Saint Pete location is the best!
New, Clean, Friendly staff and Very tasty!!

Oh man... where to start. I ordered two burritos. One for my vegetarian wife and one for me. My wife's burrito was... mostly vegetarian since she is a vegetarian. But somehow some chunks of chicken got added. Just a few pieces, this could be a problem for someone who has Been a vegetarian for a long time or for religion. My burrito was mediocre. I asked for grilled chicken. I didn't get that. It was basically boiled chicken with some sort of sauce on it. The rice was crunchy and hard. I have to give it two stars because, Well it was food. Change some stuff up guys! Train your employees! Take some pride! Seems like you guys are trying to grow your business, I'd love to see you guys do better!

It takes a lot for me to leave a 1 star review. How this place calls themselves authentic is a damn mystery to me. No cilantro, no white onion, the rice has CORN, CARROTS and PEAS in it???? What the heck ? The quesadilla was barely cooked....awful. The beans were soooooooo old and rice was undercooked and hard. My dogs enjoyed it though....if they had thumbs they would've given them 5 stars.....

Disgusting and extremely slow service. No wonder this place has moved around. I would never spend another penny in this place. I came here because the one in Tampa is so delicious however this was a complete let down. Save yourself the trouble and find somewhere else!

The service and food quality is very bad. I used to eat here all the time but gave up on them after they screwed up FOUR to go orders in a row with incorrect toppings. They are also almost always out of at least one thing that I order. The meat tastes past it's due date and they can't even keep cilantro in stock. My last order was for chicken tacos with no toppings and they still screwed it up! They just don't care at all. Don't go here.

The rice was either undercooked or left out all day it was hard and gross, unfortunately for me it was in all of my food. I will never! Ever! Waste my money on this second rate establishment. Taco Bell is better! Save yourself the hassle!

DO NOT EAT HERE!!! This is NOT a real Taco Bus. The food is so bad I just had to throw away the whole meal!!! The rice was raw, the shredded chicken taco was mealy.      dry chicken ... the queso dip had corn in it and was tasteless and the chips were stale grease ridden!!! I don't know what is going on here but they should be ashamed to call this a Taco Bus.

Stopped here for lunch yesterday. The woman working was very nice and apologetic BUT she was the only one there to take orders, hand make each order, etc... 

Should've known it wasn't going to be good when they didn't have many items on the menu because they hadn't been made yet at 11:30 for lunch. Also, this is very much a gas station and just didn't look particularly clean. 

45 minutes after ordering we told her to just cancel the order because we needed to get back to work. She wasn't able to refund us because the manager wasn't there but we had no choice but to leave. Again I'll restate that she was nice, friendly and doing the best she could but the management of this location is unacceptable and definitely not setting her up for success. 

If you are craving Taco Bus and live in this area just suck it up and drive to one of their other locations. This one is terrible and a huge waste of time.

This is not the same quality as when Taco Bus was on Central Ave.  The food served (carne asada) was cold, and it seemed to have been sitting for a while (i.e., not prepared fresh)  The chips were stale and even though I ordered the combo, there was no drink.  When I asked the server, he conveyed that he was doing me a favor by giving me a drink.  The server was nice enough, but there are too many other good taco places at which to eat.

They have really good food and great customer service.
Last time I walked in there, they had the el jefe competition and there were two people in the competing each other with a crowd watching. It was a good experience and I had fun for the 10 minuets I was in there.

I was driving for a meet up in the st. pete area, and I wanted to get a quick lunch and this place was the nearest. I had their quesdilla and it was amazing. the employee told me that they have new management and it has gotten better since before. I love their atmosphere and their customer service. great food. keep it up.

I've been wanting to try their fries for a while and today I finally got the chance! I ordered the MEGA-sized original fries and was able to pick up to 2 flavors. I went with Sour Cream & Onion and Garlic & Parmesan - both were equally delicious. The fries were warm and crisp. Will definite come back to try their tater tots!

Fries are the ultimate snacking food. Before I left the mall, I made a stop at potato corner. There was a good amount of people waiting for their orders. Orders were taking a while, not sure why though. On a positive note, my jumbo sour cream and onion fries were nice and warm. The flavors were on point and for a "small" it was a decent size. Was it overpriced? Yes, but all mall food and snacks usually are.

Trying new places is my thing and when I saw a place that supposedly focuses on potatoes and is "the world's most famous flavored French fry franchise," according to their website, I figured I was in for a delightful treat.  I may have put the cart before the horse here.

It took me forever to find this, for lack of a better term, kiosk in the mall.  Not having even seen one of these world famous potato places I was not sure how this worked, let alone what the menu consisted of.  I kind of just stood there and tried to watch how things went here, but that did not lend me anything, I was still as clueless as when I finally found this kiosk.

I finally went to the counter and decided to do a combo, but not a potato combo, a chicken combo.  If you are world famous for your flavored potato products, why is there chicken?  I might be focusing on the wrong thing, but that does play part in here.  I went with the tender combo.  You get three chicken tenders, a Mega size fry, and a medium drink.  The price was there, and it seemed like you got a fair amount of food for the price.

So here is when things started to go south.  I finally made it to the counter and the young lady that is working seems less than impressed to be where she was at that moment in time.  She talked in such a monotoned voice at such a low level I had to keep asking her to repeat herself.  I lost count of the times she sighed, I had no clue how the ordering process went and she just would have rather been rolling on out of there for the amount of times she rolled her eyes.  Now, I think that the employees here were fed up because they seemed to be short staffed.  Also, either the manager or owner shows up and does nothing but have a conversation on the phone and paces back and forth in such tight quarters.

Anyway, I finally get my food and make my way back to where I was staying.  Get there and open up the box and think to myself this ought to be good.  Well, it wasn't.  The chicken was basically flavorless.  Which shouldn't be a surprise since this place is supposed to be world famous for their flavored fries.  I was like, OK, let me dive into them.  Well, it was a disappointment to me.  When you have your fries, you get a choice of six different flavorings that can be on your fries.  I opted for the cheddar flavoring.  Now, when they say flavoring, I assumed a coating on the fries that would shine through.  Not the fries being encased in flavor.  I mean no surface is left uncovered.  The cheddar flavoring was not all that great, in fact it reminded me of the flavoring packet from a microwaveable mac n cheese bowl.  They felt over-greasy and my fingers changed colors.  

World famous, maybe not.  Philly famous, probably.  But definitely not the best place I have ever had a fry at.
We ordered the cheddar and the garlic Parmesan fries along with the wings. Not bad. I like the variety in fry flavors. We would definitely stop by here again.

Yea! Potato Corner finally opened today in the Fashion District. There were plenty of people waiting for their orders of fries, tater tots, chicken tenders, and definitely no salads.

I came with my coworker, and she got a combo tots and tenders because the chicken poppers advertised on the menu were not available. It came with a large drink. I went with the "jumbo" (small) tater tots only.

There were a lot of young kid staffers with two or three older men who just have been the managers. Because the staff were just opened an hour or so, it was not a well oiled machine and it looked like bumper cars in the small space for all of them. There also was some confusion as to which direction does the line go for ordering and pickup.

The food itself is made in some industrial stainless fryers which you just pop the product in the hopper and set a time. Then a few minutes later you're good to go. My tots were nice and crisp with no grease taste. The chili BBQ seasoning was fine. Not homemade, but good. The tots from my coworker got the cheddar seasoning and also was just fine. Her chicken tenders were crispy. They weren't great, but also not the worst she's ever had. I saw they were just regular grade tenders in a sealed plastic bag. The ranch dip was good. She was disappointed that the lemonade was just the Coke variety and not a fresh squeeze like we get at the Reading Terminal Market (see my review!). 

So there are some kinks in efficiency to work on, but I'm sure in time that will work out. The food is good when you're in the mood for some comfort food. 

My jumbo tots were just under $5 and the combo meal came to $11. You could probably get a better meal for that amount elsewhere, but this was nice.

Absolutely would come back for the tots.

When I saw this on my map I for sure wanted to get some. I used to get this in the Philippines when I was younger, it definitely took me to memory lane of how good these fries were. At first, we couldnt find the location because we thought it was its own storefront but it was inside the mall. We got 2 giga fries, garlic parmesan and cheddar cheese. Got the fries super fast and each fry had the powders evenly  distributed.

Great first time here after years of patronizing other Corner Pub locations! The restaurant was only a quarter to half full during our visit and we felt comfortable COVID precaution-wise due to the ample space; we cannot speak to how protocols were enforced at other times.  Our meals and drinks came out in a reasonable amount of time and were perfect--and on par with other locations of Corner Pub.  Service was a great mix of welcoming, professional, and efficient.  They checked on us numerous times and made sure that we had extra water, refills, sauces, etc. before we asked.  I like the atmosphere of this location and plan to return soon!

NO COVID GUIDELINES WHATSOEVER. This place needs to be shut down immediately. The managers and employees don't give a single shit about the pandemic we are currently living in. People CROWDING around the bar and came in with NO fucking masks and literally strangers leaning on my friends chair while the rest of them are STANDING at the bar behind us when all of the seats were already taken. There were plenty of tables open but bartenders were so focused on pleasing their friends and regulars that they forgot about proper spacing and seating. Disgusting, We will be reporting this bar. NEGATIVE 10 STARS.

Ok gave them a second chance.  Still think its the best sports bar option in Cool Springs.  They are still lacking in the kitchen and bar.  Ran out of Miller Light draft Wednesday and still out Friday??Tonight they also ran out of Ultra.  Seriously guys?
Ordered wings and wanted extra crispy again.  Came out warm and a little chewy.  Wing size and flavor is great but your cooks cannot make a good crispy wing. Our table also ordered the Reuben (very good) the quesadilla that was ok, the french dip (lacked meat) and nachos (boring).

Inside is really nice.  Sat at bar and ordered wings.  I asked for them to be extra crispy.  Literally two minutes after ordering my wings came out.  They were anything but crispy.  Tasted like they were made an hour before and sat under a heat lamp.  Bartender asked how they were and I said "they are not crispy and there is no way an order or wings can be fried in 2 minutes".  He said "great" and kept working the bar. You will never make it if your food is not fresh.  Such a shame because your inside is an awesome sports bar.
Burger week offering was a clear looser.   Hours latter and I'm still tasting it.   Would never pay $13 dollars for the anguish.   It's obvious the food is secondary to the alcohol.

Been here a couple times since they opened. Amazed at what they did with the space. So open and airy. Fantastic remodel. 

Food and service have been good. Menu has something for everyone, too. Definitely on our regular list now. While I miss the decor of Franklin Abbey, I really like the new energy they brought to the place. 

Left my credit card there the last time. Honestly not sure who was happier about finding it, me of the host! Even got a nice note left with it when I picked it up. That's a mark of great service that won't be forgotten!

Nice, friendly, clean, well located spot. Happy Hour prices were good but an epic fail for us 'couple of oldsters' is not having any domestic beers on tap! I know, craft beers are trendy, but some people feel awful after drinking them. Michelob Ultra on tap would be most appreciated. We enjoyed the grilled shrimp appetizer and a salad. Nice tasting sauces. Everything appeared freshly made. Thank you. Nice to have some great choices in the Cool Springs area. Cheers.

Good food, nice location, cool setup and fun atmosphere. Always enjoying visiting the corner pubs. The food and service are usually pretty good. The place has a good friendly feel to it and yet they are still doing really good to take precautions with COVID. Love the open garage door in this location.
this place will be gone by thanksgiving. poor service. cold food and looks like a warehouse with bad air conditioning. it's the WORST

this place has fed me all week while out of town on work! Requested Nicole. she's done us real good the whole time!! 
Polynesian Chicken and the meatloaf are my favorites here!

I was introduced to Corner Pub when it was in Brentwood, near Chili Burrito and the former Kroger's. A lunch break with a, "You've got to try this burger place," conversation resulted in 5 or 6 of us going. It was actually in a corner area of the strip mall, so 10/10 for name. A burger and fries were affordable and tasty.

I was delighted when I saw the new location was on Carothers, closer to my abode. Take-out after COVID was a game changer for restaurants, and I decided to mask up and help out a business. 

We all got burgers (see my Ground reviews for why I picked a new place). 

The burgers were meh. The fries also meh. It was not some flashback to the first bite from back when it was in Brentwood (insert visual of the food critic in the animated movie Ratatouille when he finally tastes his meal). In fact, it was a, "Sorry, I overpromised and they under delivered," to the family.

My hope is Corner Pub was just working out the kinks. With that in mind, I'll wait a while and give them a second chance. The location is central, but I've seen several places come and go in that area of Mallory. If they can get back to the basics, it will be nice.

this place will be gone by thanksgiving. poor service. cold food and looks like a warehouse with bad air conditioning. it's the WORST. why is this place overall still in business ??  Bad food, bad service and not che

My daughter loves their quesadillas and has requested to go back a couple of times this week. The grain bowl with Salmon is good, considering I was not expecting too many healthy options. Friendly staff. Nice, clean, roomy and  no smoke smell from previous establishments. I'm happy they opened here.
We've been for lunch on the weekend twice in the past month. We've been pleased with the wait time, service, and food. Kid friendly and tons of TVs for entertainment
Great local place to get a bite. Ambiance is like a local pub/ sports bar. Good service and nice menu.

Good food but slow service 

Strengths: 
Great location
Friendly staff
Great liquor and beer selection
Clean
Bar area with TV's

Opportunities:
Limited menu
Can be loud depending on time of the day
Service was slow

This is a hard review for me since they replaced my beloved franklin abbey pub.  Walking in they have completly wiped out anything from the old pub except the bar but it was nice. Very roomie and not loud at all. Look forward to going back for a few pints when things get better in the world.  They expanded the patio area and lit it up really nice.  Have a full wall of tvs for game day.  Well ordered take out and they had it ready on arrival.  The hostess took the time to check the order and saw we were missing a side of fries and the manager quickly  corrected it.  We ordered the steak biscuits and they were awesome, especially the moist biscuits.  They did however forget the Aujus so I called to ask about it and the manager offered a discount for the mistake even though I only made an inquiry, not a complaint.  They were great without it.  In regards to the covid complaint in a previous review, well I did not have that experience although it was 6 p.m.  so not a large crowd.  All staff had mask on, tables were far apart and the few people at the bar were far apart.  Even though they took my favorite pub away I look forward to enjoying the new atmosphere and hopefully  see some of the old gang there.  Usually would give it a three but since the manager took care of the minor issue without me complaining and was so nice about everything I added a star for great customer service.

This is my favorite hangout.  Guinness beer, and a full bar, and the best food around.  The patty melt is exceptional!  The wait staff is always over-the-top friendly.
If you are looking for a warm, friendly, and comfortable place to have a drink or two, or maybe grab a burger with the best fries in town, this is the place!

Stopped in for a local bite and beer on our way south, staying in a nearby hotel.  We were more than pleasantly surprised with the food and service.  My wife is a wing junkie, and normally doesn't order boneless wings.  She did, and was really impressed with them - nice white meat and a crunchy exterior, with a good "Carolina Gold" sauce, and I had a good French Dip. Our server, Justin., was excellent, and answered all our many questions, like what is a "Bushwhacker?"

Great place to watch football on Sunday!  Easy walk from the hotel we were staying at. The bartender/ waitress was great. Food came out quick and was REALLY good. My son ordered the smokehouse burger and it was gone in about 5 seconds!  My daughter got the kids quesadilla  with fruit. Hubby and I shared the CP Steamers and the chicken tenders. The CP steamers were amazing. I want them again just thinking about it. And the tenders has a good pepper/kick to them, use the honey mustard if it's too much for you. If we were in Franklin again, we would definitely visit. Wish we lived closer, we'd be here every Sunday - Sunday ticket!!!

To the Karen with the one star review. This place is very compliant. Maybe you just need to stay home and eat your top ramen or whoever Karen's eat. Get over yourself. Great staff great food and most of all safe  from Covid exposure.  Dustin was awesome
The food was ok.  When I went to get my order they told me it was at the other corner pub 15 minutes away but it wasn't then told me it was an Uber order when it wasn't very confusing.

honestly this place is the WORST.
horrible service, terrible food. they will be lucky to be open by Thanksgiving stay away. If you think you might want to try it do yourself a favor and go to McDonalds

We went at 5 on a Saturday and it was dead. After receiving our food we understood why. The food portions were tiny for the cost. 7 wings for $14 and 1 small piece of fish for $13.5. Good food and good service, but we won't be back.

Honestly disappointed in this place, that they refused to play audio from a game of a local sports team, because it wasn't NFL. Nashville soccer fans don't bother coming here. Originally asked for the audio they said they couldn't because there were fans that were here first, and when I noticed they left I asked again they wouldn't do it because they only play music and football.

My hubby and I have been coming here since it opened, and unfortunately the management does not seem to be addressing persistent staffing issues. We haven't been in a few months (after spending easily $100+ every weekend to enjoy the patio during the warmer months), so we gave it a go today - this was later in the afternoon during a TN college football game. There was 1 large party in the restaurant, but otherwise it was not busy. There only appeared to be 2 bartenders working to make drinks, run food, and bus tables. After getting our first round of beers and an appetizer, it took 25 minutes for anyone to come back to our table (beers had been empty for over 10 minutes). This place has so much potential - the food is always delicious. But management is not present and clearly the owners are not paying attention. We won't be back.
Zero food at 5:40 at night. Looked like they only had 1-2 things. Stood there for almost 5 minutes and no one asked if I needed anything.
Not a typical gas station food, very good empanadas ( I'm Hispanic , so I'm picky with my Hispanic food ) recommend the place to grab lunch or even a few appetizer

Food is delicious I give them that but a few workers broke the rule during this pandemic. He made my food wearing no mask at all. Highly dangerous with this Virus going on and health department will know about this matter.

These idiots.. I ordered before I started work so that I wouldn't have to worry about my lunch and they cancelled my main item (a burrito) and tried to deliver a side item. Assholes! Are you out of burritos? Couldn't give me a call to see if I wanted something else? Instead you try to have me pay $10 for CORN?!

We got this for lunch for our two daughters, my husband, and I the their day. My husband got the spicy chicken chimichanga and it was super flavorful and still somewhat crispy despite being smothered in queso. Their salsa is great, it's simple and not too complicated. I had the carnitas burrito "bol" (I actually ordered the marinated pork but they gave me just carnitas). My daughters shared a chicken quesadilla and it was flavorful but soggy. Overall I'd try again!

Food is normally decent but customer service could be better. Placed an order tonight through a delivery service, waited for over an hour until the delivery driver called and said taco bus would not fill the order. I called the restaurant to confirm and they stated they were too busy to fill their orders and hung up.

The grilled shrimp burrito is ahhhhmazing!!! My husband was kind of iffy trying it but when he took a bite he said, "OMG! I want one!!" Additionally, it's located in a really nice, spacious Victory gas station; I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in. The customer service was also quick and sweet! I will be back for sure!!!

Shocked to read the reviews on this Taco Bus location, this is place awesome. Excellent, made to order, fresh, authentic Mexican food right off I-75 in Riverview. As good as the food is, the service is even better. This restaurant is located in a gas station (Victory Lane on Gibsonton) but it's NOT gas station. I eat head regularly, never had a better, always treated great at the counter and my food comes out hot and fast. I've had tacos, burritos, bowls, quesadillas and empanada; all perfectly done. Again, awesome little Mexican joint... highly recommend!

I very rarely leave reviews unless the food is really good or really bad. The family and I wanted Mexican but our new favorite food truck Lolis was closed when we ordered so we decided to try Taco Bus. This was our first and last time ordering from this establishment. We ordered 3 different taco plates. The order said it came with 3 tacos, chips and salsa. My daughter had carnitas and she said is was ok but dry. I had the carne asada tacos which was dry and tasted like what I would imagine dog food would taste like, maybe a middle of the road to higher end dog food but dog food all the same. I took two bites and spit the second one out. Maybe it was an off night but I won't be taking another chance to find out.

Worst customer service, I have ever received.

They are unable to make any order correctly, and when you call and explain that you are met with, "there's nothing I can do for you".

I understand that I order from Uber eats but if I am calling stating my food is incorrect and half my order is missing, and I'm willing to drive to get my missing food, you tell me nothing.

I've been to multiple locations and have never had this experience.... shame on you

P.S. thanks for Uber eats to handle this issue accordingly. The real mvp

Surprised to read some of the reviews on this Taco Bus location, my experience has been awesome. Excellent, made to order, fresh, authentic Mexican food right off I-75 in Riverview. As good as the food is, the service is even better; the owners (?) are incredibly friendly and accommodating. This restaurant is located in a gas station (Victory Lane on Gibsonton) but it's not "typical" gas station food! I eat here regularly, never had a bad meal or experience, always treated great at the counter and my food comes out hot and fast. I've had tacos, burritos, bowls, quesadillas and the empanada; all perfectly done . Again, awesome little Mexican joint... highly recommend!
Great breakfast and great lunch for an affordable price. Call in your order for faster service but great food takes time. The people are nice and the food is great

One of my favorite breakfast spots. My go to is either the chicken and waffles or fish and grits with eggs scrambled. As I'm writing this I'm craving my fish and grits . Pro tip: call and order first they take a little while.
This place is good and cheap. Really busy spot. Worth the wait. Will definitely be coming back. Not for the squeamish.

I use to go here for the breakfast sandwiches which were better than average so I recently decided to try lunch. I went in thinking chalk it up as a loss expecting to dislike their shrimp curry version. It was very good without the fanfare and expense of the big Jamaican restaurants. I like that the shrimp was cut up so that it was flavoring but not over doing it. It was about $8, however the average to small portion size would have been a bargain had it been $5. The only other major gripe is the soupy dish should've been served to go in a plastic container since it can easily leak into the bag using the platter boxes they use. Overall very tasty and good to the last bite.

Amazing! My coworkers and I love this place! I always get the steak tacos with avocado or a steak burrito with everything. Delicious food, great prices, and fast & friendly service. Gets very busy around lunch time on Thursdays and Fridays.

Menu is very basic- tacos, tortas, burritos, gorditas.. Food is AMAZING! I tried the asada Taco (double corn tortilla) and a frijoles con queso gordita.. Added a hot sauce.. Both had amazing flavor.. We also stopped into the adjoining grocery for a few candies before leaving.

This is another good authentic Mexican restaurant and also grocery store as well right off West Washington and Moores I have got to taco pork and I had to get a steak torta that was very good I've been there quite a few times I would recommend this to everybody

So where do you go to get the best Mexican food? Well... I hope your first choice is Mexico, but then you have to deal with passports, foreign currency, and travel. What if I say that you can feel like you're in Mexico, but never have to leave the west side of Indy?

The Taqueria is a small Mexican food stand within a small Mexican grocery store. The menu is all in Spanish, the drinks are all imported, and the food is amazing. Yes... the decor feels like you're in a 30 year old food court but when you have an authentic burrito slathered in fresh made salsa in your hands, you're not paying attention to things like weird tables. 

The food is all really good. I can't recommend this place enough.

Go here for great Mexican food, but only if you're going in person. DO NOT I repeat DO NOT order online. I love this places food, but if you order online you will more and likely be missing items. I've order from the four times within the past 3 months and every time I have been missing items. Then the only thing to do is request a refund for them (which is fine), but it sucks because now you're out a meal or a drink. When I called to see about getting my items they said I would personally have to come get it. Which in my opinion is disappointing because I not only paid a delivery fee, but now I'd be using my own gas to go fix the mistake made by the restaurant. Personally I'm not going to drive 15 min away just to get a drink or a quesadilla that was forgotten. It's just upsetting when you order food and everyone in your house gets to eat, but now you have to go eat leftovers because your food was forgotten. Just eat here in person and you'll be better off.

name: Opa! Time Gyros and Chopped Salads

reviews.text: Good place with generous portions. I had a gyro wrap sort of dish with Greek salad. The counter service was fast and friendly. My dinner was delivered pretty quickly. This was a great gyro dish with salad that was able to be two meals. Will definitely eat there again if I'm in the area and craving Greek food.
Good food! Got the low carb Gyro platter and was pleasantly surprised at the quantity and quality as well as the overall presentation.

I've eaten at Opa's many times at other delicious locations in Tucson. The gyro that I was served today was the most repulsive and awful food I've ever seen, smelled or been served. I ordered it to go, arrived home, took 2 bites & was utterly disgusted. My dog was grateful at first, she ate HALF of it and walked away! That sums it all up. Because of this one experience I will never eat at this or any other OPA location in Tucson ever. The snotty and arrogant cashier also contributed to this most unpleasant experience. I do NOT recommend. I am HOPING the food wasn't spoiled & I don't get sick. Awful.

Good food and portions. I had the gyro wrap and it came in a big wrap. The gyro meat was flavorful. The salad was good. The service was counter service in a food court kind of setting. I was a little disheartened they didn't have the gyro meat rotating, but I probably caught them at a bad time. The food court is cool and this restaurant is good. Service wasn't the warmest or most curtitous, but it was a slow night and counter service. Definitely passable service and good food.

Exactly what you expect from a carryout place. Mediocre food served in styrofoam containers with plastic utensils. I was good with that. What I was, and never will be good with, is a cashier fishing for a tip.. What exactly do they do that can be construed as service that requires a gratuity? Take my money, ask for a tip (which I begrudgingly left) and she still got my order wrong. Asking for a tip before the order is placed is extortion-like. No tip = eat at your own risk.
Needless to say there will be no "Next Time"

Great food and service.
Nice atmosphere.  Grest place for a date or a great meal

Opah's food some of the best Greek food Middle Eastern food I've eaten next to New York City I mean I'm from back east I could go get falafel down McDougall for 250 for a sandwich maybe five bucks for a Shawarma but guess what I'm not in New York and this is not Los Angeles I Chicago it's Tucson but but opus great food great service I would eat that every day of the week
Food is great and the service is fast. I've tried some of the platters and starters and there is nothing I haven't liked.  They don't skimp on the portions. Great place for lunch or dinner.

The food is delicious!  The spicy chicken kabobs are my favorite. It's healthy, flavorful, and served in large portions. I usually take half home.
     I'm taking one star away because of the location, but that doesn't stop me from going there and it may help keep prices down. 
     The nice thing is that it's located in a building with several different food outlets and a coffee bar. There is one large dining area with plenty of tables and space. That's a great concept because my friends and I feel comfortable sitting and talking for a long time. Also, not everyone in your party may feel like the same type of food.  Opa's Greek food is my favorite though.
Sir Pizza is great. We eat in or take out at least once a week!  The crust is delicious.   We love that it's located in a former pizza joint from the 80's too!

Well... I have been super excited about sir pizza being back close to me... but this is the 4th time I have gave them a chance. And I just paid 36.05 plus tip even with me walking in and picking it up for a medium pizza and large cheese fingers... I drive back home passing other pizza places... to find out they left the dipping sauces that we ordered and are on the ticket ARE NOT IN THE BOX!! I was told I should have checked my order before I left!! Are you kidding me!!! I also ordered extra sauce/cheese on my pizza, was told it's at the bottom. I should check behind what your job is!! And was seriously told to drive back and they would give me the sauces TO GO WITH COLD PIZZA.... Awesome sorry I'm not a kid I don't care for cold pizza when I paid for what I except to get!! This is EXACTLY why nothing in rivergate last!! Over it!! HARD NO!!

Sorry there isn't a negative star points

Getting better each time. Same great Sir Pizza taste and most importantly, they use a true pizza oven instead of the conveyor belt type oven, it makes a difference. Wish they would open a location in downtown Madison.

BEST PIZZA!!!! 
I love Sir Pizza! Their food is delicious! Every time I go the pizza & the wings are always fresh, delicious & the quality is great! My favorite pizza hands down!!!

Called ahead and got a pizza to go it was ready on time and made correctly Been back there a couple of times since haven't had any problems. me and my friends like their pizza I think you might like it also

Do not waste your time here! After sitting for an hour waiting on our pizza, the most the manager only offered to cover the sides, which literally costs them a few cents per glass. There were only a few other customers there on this mid-afternoon. I recommend that you do a little more to make things right after holding customers hostage for an hour.  A genuine apology and taking care of the meal is way your customers MIGHT actually give you another chance after you mess up. Without that? No thank you! Never coming here again.

Stopped by last week for coffee (iced with splash of almond milk) which was very good. My husband enjoyed a warm scone as well. So today we came for coffee and breakfast which was delicious. The avocado BLT wrap was outstanding and loaded with fresh ingredients....lots of lettuce, bacon and tomato...and yummy avocado. The breakfast sandwich was freshly prepared with cheddar cheese, scrambled eggs and sausage on an English muffin.....quality ingredients. Friendly and helpful staff.

I'm so happy they opened up another location! Very proud of perks! We live by the one on clearview which we visit often (that one has a drive thru). 

We actually sat down and ate and had some coffee! The blt wrap! Soooooo good! Whatever that Mayo is the bomb!  and we got the chicken Caesar wrap was very delicious too! 

I also tried their granitas which are actually really good. I used to drink caffe frescas back the in the day and since they are closed forever, I can't seem to find anywhere that compares, but this is pretty close!

I just tried Perks new location on Veterans for the first time and I loved it! I got my favorite, the Perky Turkey Panini, and it was delicious. Their pesto aioli is absolutely amazing. The Avocado BLT Wrap was huge and so so tasty! I greatly enjoyed their skinny granita as well. I found their ingredients to be fresh and the quality of their food to be exceptional! I definitely found their food and drinks to be reasonably priced for the quality and quantity. Both locations have pretty much the same menus, but there are a few differences like the bread they use for certain paninis or the taste/consistency of their pesto aioli. Nonetheless, the differences did not make their dishes any less amazing! The inside was so so cute and I loved their decor. The staff was very welcoming and helpful! I cannot wait to go back!!!

Love this place!!! Their spicy fried chicken sandwich is so good! Even better than Popeyes. They also have an excellent Granita. The staff is always friendly & the atmosphere is nice. Always my go-to.
Obsessed with the grits and honeysuckle iced coffee. They have wonderful breakfast wraps as well. This place is amazing if you want to eat something besides dull scrambled eggs for breakfast!

This is a cute and sponsored place by Yelp. Close to the airport in a strip mall and next to a local favorite, Perks still holds their own. Again the menu prices are about 20% lower than the actual prices, which I find negligent by management and inexcusable as a customer who does her research. I had a yummy honeysuckle latte. Very nice and with non dairy milk.  The shrimp and grits came with shallots and bacon. It was packed securely and stayed hot until I got home. The food and service are decent for sure and I will go back, but be forewarned the prices don't match the menus here or on the counter.

purchased a smoothie. Price shown on Overhead price board was 5.45 plus tax for a small drink. When I went to pay the price for the drink iwas 7.14 plus tax. I asked why the difference, the young girl waiting on us said it was due to supplier shortages. Truly sad. If the prices are higher than what is is currently on price board, the price board needs to be updated to reflect the actual price. Will not go back!

Place was very clean. Wait staff was friendly.

So happy this place opened! Never heard of it until I was at Chick-fil-A and saw it next door. I think they just opened but the service and food was outstanding. My friends and I dined in and the manager (I assume) was so attentive and friendly. The female who took our order was so so sweet. I got the Buffalo chicken wrap, fries, and a honey suckle Iced latte. All were 11/10. It is a bit on the pricier side but there's like no ~healthier~ options over here so I'm willing to pay.
Newest and cutest cafe in Kenner! Love going here for breakfast or simply just to pick up a coffee or tea!! Great quality and never a long line or wait!
Super clean.  Staff is friendly.  Worked here for several hours and was very productive!  And found my new favorite iced tea -- Honey Ginger!  Yum!

The staff was real friendly and seem to actually enjoy their job. Good came out fast and was really good. The drinks are also delicious. Definitely check this place out . Vest service from. Coffee shop in a long time .

The food is pretty darn good!  Their shrimp is fresh.  Their spicy chicken sandwich is great!  My son loves the kids chicken roll up meal.  The frozen caramel macchiato is amazing.  I tired the cruiser bagel and it was very good.  I haven't had a bad meal yet!!!

I have ordered from Perks for over 2 years and have consistently loved their food until this morning. I ordered a shrimp caesar wrap on wheat and both the wrap and the shrimp were uncooked. I'm hoping this was a one time incident so I will give them another try. If I end up with raw food again, Perks will unfortunately no longer be my morning go to.
Rude rude RUDE rude rude staff, terrible service, 15 minute wait with only one car in front of me. This was breakfast.

They do not open on time.  Got here at 7am when they are suppose to be open and they said wait 10 minutes.  They need to open on time.  They're open late and they're usually not busy so I like this location but they should open at the time it says they open

Best chicken quesadillas from a Taco Bell! We always go in extremely large groups around lunchtime because of our line work and each employee is friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. We have a vegetarian and he often subs out meat for beans, and that has never once been overlooked or forgotten. On days where they know customers will be waiting longer than usual, they'll give out free small drinks to keep us satisfied until our food arrives. I've literally been to hundreds of Taco Bell's across the US and this one has, by far, the greatest service.

Had workmen at my house at 7am that wanted breakfast, They decided to go to Taco Bell. Sadly at 7:30am your restaurant still wasn't open. Not good if you to be a successful business. If you are not going to be open at 7am stop advertising what you can't deliver, change your business hours !

The counter person, Edward was very nice and funny. I had nice conversation. Got my order very quick. 

It is one of places that I would eat again in this area.

The food comes out excellent but they take wayyy too long while I'm in the drive thru . The employees seem like they don't know what they're doing most times because I've got some stuff they I didn't pay for. This place is convenient when you need a quick bite but I don't necessarily recommend if you don't have a lot of patience

Absolutely lazy staff. Came by late night to get some food before going back to house sitting. They told me as well as at least 2 dozen other people that it would be a 30 minute wait because their system was down. Not the first time I've heard this exact thing at a Taco Bell late at night. Of course if you wait the 30 minutes you drive back through and they tell you 15 more and it just keeps going until they get you to leave. When they told me it would be a wait I thought they said 5 minutes and continued to look at the menu. Overheard on speaker "great she's waiting" lazy staff who don't want to work. Don't go here.

Lazy.  That's the best description for the workers here.  They were out of lettuce.  How can they be out of the ingredient that is everything?  Taco Bell only uses the same 5 or 6 ingredients on everything so how can they possibly run out of anything?  Don't even bother going here if you want service.  There's another Taco Bell on Dunn only a mile away.  Also they don't open on time.  Got here at 7am and they said wait 10 minutes.
Coffee was good, Hot chocolate- not so much.  Fun sport to hear the open mic night.  I'd go again to try the food.  Staff was nice.

I loved it here. I've been here I think once before. I came last Sunday to see SoulChess preform and my Cranberry mimosa was amazing!!! The lady bartender was nice and the one server was so personable (not the one that has only been there a month and couldn't answer any questions. Food was awesome and the deals were great. And any mistakes they fixed right away. I definitely recommend

Used to be a fun, eclectic, attracted young people. It was a nice place to get coffee, tea, have a sandwich, pita, veggies & hummus, pasta. It was a Mecca for live music. Good for musicians starting off to practice on stage. Former music engineer/producer helped make it a safe place to encourage budding musicians & pros to entertain or polish their craft. Several musicians who played there have gone on to much bigger music careers. All this right there on Rock Block! That's all gone away. Owner sold it to a criminal who abused workers, physically & mentally. So did the previous owner somewhat. I knew people who worked there for many years who had to leave due to the very bad change of atmosphere. It wasn't safe any longer. It didn't help that sometimes clients got over zealous & started a fight now & then. It used to be a better place. Again, new owners who said they wanted to recreate the old neighborhood atmosphere. I think it was too damaged from the previous owners to revive the old & well loved Cafe CoCo. Maybe one day amends could be made & this place might have a chance to revive. Good luck to the latest owners.
The waitstaff made my experience worth while, food was good, maybe better with live music and Livations, but I tried breakfast.

A little piece of France in the heart of Nashville. While I didn't get to meet coco, we were graced with Dimitrys presence and he was both a gentleman and a scholar. The tots and grilled cheese were top notch. 10/10 would eat again. I will also say tables were 10/10, excellent size for both beer die and beer pong.

This coffee shop is in a cute house with nice outdoor covered and non covered outdoor seating and indoor seating. The cannoli's were excellent but the cappuccinos were disappointing--too weak.  And, if you expect your barista to wear a mask, he wasn't.

I guess I'm the first to review but this place is really chill! It's counter order but they had plenty of seating indoors and out. I had the Nashville bowl and a latte, both were exceptional and i loved the idea of using the tots on the bowl and the service was great as well!

Often driven by, found myself downtown on a Sunday morning. Decided to try it out. 30+ minutes from order to food delivery when we were the only people there! If the food had been extraordinary, it would have been bad but forgivable. But the over-cooked rubbery eggs were inedible. Even the coffee was not great. Quantity was good but quality was so bad I ate less than half.

Run do not walk from this place. It gets one star because service was ok and ambience is cute.

I haven't tried the food here yet, but I can already tell this will be a neighborhood favorite for me. Stopped by for a date and got a Naples butter pecan latte. I was pleasantly surprised by the live music in the back- this kind of thing is why I moved to Nashville! 
It has the cozy ambience of a friendly local diner with coffee beverages that are a little more fancy. 
The touchscreen jukebox was another nice touch that added to the atmosphere. 
If you want a place to go that isn't a bar that's open after 8, this is a really lovely choice.

My friend and I were visiting Nashville and were desperate for some late night grub after a show. This place came up after searching for "late night dining options," and it was conveniently located, so we decided to give it a try. First impression: the place was really dirty, w/ debris on the floor and an overall unkempt look. Secondly, there was no one behind the counter; we waited a good 5 mins before someone emerged from the kitchen. And last but not least, the food was nearly inedible. We ordered spinach artichoke dip that tasted like it came from the freezer section of a grocery store and was microwaved. The fries were fresh out of a bag. We didn't eat much even though we were starving. I do not recommend this place.
This spot has everything you could ask for. From yummy eats to the super friendly host, you won't be disappointed when you go to this quirky little hole in the wall.
Veggie wrap, omelet and tots were very good. The young man who served us was so nice and cheerful. Glad we happened upon this cute place.

Whoa maybe I will try this at some point but not right now sitting is weird and uncomfortable music loud as hell who could ever hear anyone talk no food uninformed bartenders bottle works better get it together or we won't be back. No signs she can get into the bar very strange the whole set up

So pretty!

I've been meaning to visit Bottleworks for a while now, and it was truly worth the wait. Sundry & Vice is so pretty inside! The decor definitely matches the art deco design of the original building. I was surprised by it's tardis-like interior (bigger on the inside!).

The cocktails were expertly crafted and the staff were friendly and welcoming. I imagine this would be a great place to meet up with a group of friends for cocktails & conversation ~or~ a perfect place to find a quiet nook for date night. The possibilities are endless!

My husband and I decided to pop in here while waiting for our table at Bodhi. It was a rainy Friday night and there was plenty of available seating. We entered through the hotel's main entrance where the bar is just to the left. A hostess checked our id's upon entry and then told us we could sit wherever we'd like. My husband ordered us drinks at the bar. Both were enjoyable and had high quality ingredients. The atmosphere is dark and moody and the service was friendly. I'd definitely return and look forward to trying more of their cocktails.

This is a cool addition to the Bottleworks hotel and campus. It's tucked away behind the front desk area so you get the speakeasy feel when you walk in. The espresso martini was on point and I liked how they had unique options like "mini cocktails" as well. The bar spots are the best seats in the house and offer a nice view of the main Bottleworks street.

Yay! A great bar inside Bottleworks Hotel! Great music, good vibes nice selection. 

Really nice craft cocktail menu as well. I'm a sucker for cocktails that include egg white and I think they have maybe 3 on their menu. 

They don't serve you at your table, you have to go to the bar to order which is slightly annoying, but outside of that it's a cool addition to to Bottleworks area!

Sundry & Vice is a pleasant addition to Bottleworks Hotel in Indianapolis. The music is good, it is dimly lit for a very relaxed vibe, and the bartenders are knowledgeable and nice. I would recommend for any chamomile or floral lover to try the Chanel No. 5. The chamomile syrup stands out in this draft cocktail and you will absolutely want seconds. Other mentionable cocktails include the Bloom of Youth, Garnet, Heaven My Reward, and their Old Fashioned on draft (an original recipe, perfectly balanced and absolutely worth it). You won't want to miss this one! Stop on in with a couple of friends and enjoy the unique ambiance this cocktail bar brings.

Similar to my fellow Central Coast locals, I am stoked to have Broad Street Oyster Co. (BSOC) return to Santa Barbara. Prior to Covid they were posted up in the Funk Zone, but now they have a late night brick 'n mortar space within the shared space of Kim's Service Department. It is sandwiched by its neighbors, the Shaker's Mill and Modern Times Recreation Academy. Previously in this space was Cubaneo, but they have given it a retro-nautical 'shark attack' vibe. I personally love the fun touches of decor, particularly the old TV with a fish tank. I was awaiting Nemo's appearance. :P
I ventured in during their soft opening to get my hands on a classic New England Lobster Rolls. Even given our coastal location, this is not something that is easy to come across. BSOC offers both a lobster roll prepared warm with butter or cold with mayo. I had to order one of each with a side of crispy fries. My partner and I brought them along for a wine taste down the street. Lobster Roll + Chardonnay = Heaven on Earth! While it may be a slight sin to admit, their reddish Old Bay (or so that's what my taste buds think it contained) dipping sauce that came with the fries also paired perfectly with the mayo lobster roll. :X
Given that this location is brand spankin' new, you could tell they had experienced staff and own the eternally popular Malibu location. The staff worked hard as a team. One example was when I had requested my order for takeout, one person prepared the sauces, another plated it nicely, and the final person bagged it up for me. This visit was smooth as butter. See you again soon BSOC!

I am so happy Broad Street Oyster has returned to Santa Barbara! My wish finally came true. Anyone who's been here knows the quality of seafood is locally sourced and always fresh. I mainly come for the warm lobster roll, which is served on buttery toasted bread. 

In my honest opinion the lobster rolls here are the best in town! There's no competition compared to this one. 

I'm glad the location is shared with the Shaker Mill and Modern Times. It gives you a chance to grab a cocktail or beer from either place. There's plenty of seating inside and outdoors. 

I've pretty much covered everything I love about this place in my review for the Malibu location, but I had to represent the 805 of course!

So wonderful to have Chris and his Seafood Crew back in Santa Barbara. And great location too.

Comfortably wedged on lower State Street in the old Cubaneo space, and right in between Shaker Mill and Modern Times. So nice to have the option of sitting in the outdoor patio space with your seafood and beer. Very fun and very dog-friendly. 

Chris and BSOC have brought back their delicious Lobster Toll, Clam Strips, Oysters on the half shell, and other tasty treats.

Can't wait to share this delicious space with friends and family.

Broad Street Oyster Company is back in Santa Barbara and better than ever with its first SB based brick and mortar location, and an incredible menu featuring its beloved favorite New England Lobster Roll and more! 

First, to the deities at Yelp. This business is a brand new, Santa Barbara location not to be confused with its restaurant in Malibu, CA some 75 miles away from Santa Barbara. It needs its own dedicated Santa Barbara location Yelp business page. 

It's incredible to witness the massive evolution of what started as a humble food stand pop up achieve a pretty hardcore cult following. Those who ventured down to Malibu to get your BSOC fix after the SB pop ups stopped know exactly what I am talking about. Hungry foodaphiles stood in the cue for hours to get their hands on a lobster roll. 

The new Santa Barbara restaurant is sandwiched between Modern Times and Shaker Mill, formerly home to Cubaneo. It is a must visit for the BEST Lobster Roll on the West Coast. Feeling fancy? Top your roll with world renowned SB local Sea Urchin, caviar or both! Don't forget to grab an order of oysters on the half shell to slurp down. 

I am looking forward to seeing what exciting additions are added to the menu once the new SB based team gets its sea legs. The Malibu menu is pretty extensive. 

As far as the ambiance goes, I love the throw back beachy vibe - any 80s or 90s child can appreciate it. Given the current prevalence of COVID19 I am also thrilled with the option to take my gloriously enormous tray of seafood outside to the patio at Modern Times with their delicious beer. Yes folks, you can take your food and roam about the building freely to Modern Times or Shaker Mill if that floats your boat.

I'm so glad to see Broad Street open an official spot in SB. I remember visiting his booth at Muni wine a few years ago, and I knew he'd be doing big things. Next thing I know, he's got a hot spot in Malibu. The lobster roll is a must, but don't skip out on the burger! We had the fried shrimp too, and boy were those plump, sweet and juicy!
Bad customer service, bad chicken, overall just bad experience. Hard no. Try love & honey fried chicken down the street. Makes this place seem as if they serving Mcchickens.
I don't understand the negative reviews. We just ordered and everything was great. Either people are just haters or they fixed whatever problems they had before.

Stopped in the middle of September 2020, ordered the Mofongo carne frita (fried pork), for $14.99, I wished I would have tasted it prior to driving off because I would have told them they forgot to season it.  It had no seasoning to it; no garlic, no salt pork, nada.  Worse Mofongo, I ever had.  It came with a small container of sauce, so once the sauce was gone I threw most of the Mofongo away, I tried to eat the fried pork which were nice chunks but they were either fat or too chewy; waste of $15.00!  I don't live nearby otherwise I would have driven back with their tasteless Mofongo, they made me.  Lesson here:  taste food before you drive off.  A Bodega $4.00, Mofongo, (without the fried pork) tasted a lot better.  For what you are paying this Food Truck, you should go into a sit down restaurant because if they forget to season your food and/or give you poor quality fried pork you can have them bring you out another plate.  I really thought I would be getting a true Puerto Rican Mofongo, but it was tasteless; like eating plantains without salt.  Very disappointed.  Not sure what the issue was and/or if I can try this place again.
Food was OUTSTANDING. Super authentic flavor. Just like eating in Old San Juan. Lovely family-run food truck that's very deserving of stopping by if you're at all considering! 10/10!
So delicious and fresh everything was great great customer service I will be coming back for more the best food truck !!

OMG!!!! I swear the regular tripletta is a food porn recipe!!! This is carbs done in the best way possible. I'm beyond impressed with the portion size and the smothered like fries and sandwich that are the PERFECT compliment. Feeling sad... get glad with the regular tripletta! It's the perfect topping for a bad day. The meat is juicy, not greasy and oh sooo succulent. It's a lip smacking, finger licking sensation all on one plate :-D

Mi familia y yo fuimos a este truck esperando tener una buena experiencia y comer algo con sabor boricuas. La primera impresión dice mucho del lugar. La señora que estaba atendiendo nos ignoró como que no había nadie es su ventanilla. Luego cuando le pareció nos preguntó qué queríamos, sin ninguna carisma, ni cortesía. Esta señora parecía que a su opinión,  ella nos estaba haciendo un favor con venderme algo y después cin una actitud de mala ganas. Nos hizo esperar 40 min, para dos alcapurias fritas en aceite viejo. Todas grasosas y con olor a aceite viejo . La comida que pidió mi hija parecía un desastre, como que todo fue tirado como quiera. En mi opinión nunca vuelvo, ni familia, ni ninguno de mis amistades que yo me encargaré de decirles que en este lugar el consumidor es puesto en poco y tratado sin Ninguna cortesía y la comida no sirve. El buen trato hubiera hecho la diferencia, aunque la comida fuera un desastre. Gracias

This location is garbage.  Employees have no sort of customer service or clue on why they are doing.  Ordered in person and over the app, both times ridiculous.  In person waited in the drive through told they were behind orders and to go park.  Didn't take a vehicle description at all, waited a good 40 minutes to be get cold food.  Last visit and will be last visit ordered over the app, said pickup at a certain time.  Came in and waited 30 minutes past pick up time for them to finally make it in front of me.  Seriously need to get this act together.  Prime location, *** for service.

Probably the worst panda express I've been to.

I didnt wanna believe the reviews but its true. The food tastes like its made by a 6th grader. Probably has poor management

Something has got to be wrong with the way the cooks and workers at this location have been trained. We get to drive through and pull up to the window and the guy says "I told you to hold up" huh?! No one said to wait or hold up when we ordered. At. Ever
Also, they ran out of food last night. They had nothing. We tried again  today. These noodles are so dry it's almost as if they've been sitting around all day. Dry and sticky. It's really, REALLY bad. No flavor. They also don't have any milk teas at this location. We asked, and the response was "we don't do that here." I'm not sure I can go back. This was pretty gross.  Not to mention I think I got overcharged :-(

It's a Panda Express.  Average Chinese food you've had in the mall a million times.  This place has a dismal star rating because who really rates an average chain store unless they messed something up.  This place is ok, nothing wrong when I went.  It is what you expect it to be, average.

1. A new location 2. They just opened 3. We're in a pandemic give them some slack. I have no complaints, for a fast serving Chinese food place they are doing fine.  Food was average, workers were nice, and fast serving. They only had one egg roll left but said we could wait for 7 minutes and they would have more. People are such in a rush in today's age...7 minutes is nothing. Yet I'm sure most people would complain about this...y'all waste your time on the daily yet complain so easily. Good place will be going back :)
It was disgusting. Chicken tasted fake and they ran out of what I wanted. Rice has no flavor.
The food is constantly the same at all Pandas, But this location is clean and that my friends earned them a 5 stars.
The food here is delicious and lots of yummy drink options, and tequilas, to choose from.

So apparently this place is only been open for a couple of weeks and they haven't had their official grand opening yet so I was trying to cut them some slack. However, when I first arrived it took about five minutes for the waitress to ask me for a drink when there were (counting me) three people at the bar. I was then asked if I wanted to run a tab in my card was promptly taken.... no big deal I kind of get that but it just seemed a little odd. I got the chips and queso and it was out in literally 5 minutes so no telling how long it had been sitting underneath the heat lamp. The chips were stale and the cheese, after you broke through the crust on top,  was not too bad. There then was a shift change which I found odd considering the place opened at 4 and this was only at 6. The new bartender did not seem all that enthused to be working there at that moment. I had been looking at a menu because I was going to get something to go but the new bartender promptly took the menu and stashed it under neath the counter. Thankfully I knew what I wanted. As of this writing I have not yet opened my burrito but I'm hoping it's going to be worth the almost $70 I spent for 4 drinks chips and queso and a burrito. I do not see me going back there again.

Started off good. Nice decor. Ordered drinks and the $9 chips and salsa appetizer. Appetizer came out with the meal. Definitely not a $9 value in my opinion. My wife ordered veggie enchiladas no cheese. Came with cheese so had to send it back. Rice was dried like it was overcooked or left in the pot a long time. . My al pastor and carne asada tacos were good and my wife liked the veggie enchiladas when they finally came. Manager was nice and comped her meal and chips. Not impressed overall with the experience
I absolutely loved this place and defiantly will be back! They have amazing tacos and an awesome happy hour menu. Really cool atmosphere especially when the Dj comes in at night!

We had the door opened for us as we approached, so it was a warm welcome. We were immediately sat and the atmosphere was new and exciting. Our waitress Kali was very kind, informative, and made our experience great. 
The chicken nachos were really good! They were just a little too salty. Maybe just a bad batch. The carne asada taco had just a little too much red onions and mayonnaise/sour cream for my liking. There was also no dessert menu. 


The ambiance was very captivating and I was drawn to the atmosphere. Tacos satisfied my interest to the point of ALMOST trying  more options. The original taco is superb and savory. The music was good but I was unable to hear my friend (after 10 pm)

This is my absolute favorite pizza place. The staff is so kind and welcoming to everyone. We look forward to going in and ordering and talking for a few with the people who run The Slice Stl. Did I mention the pizza is kick ass?!

This place is the bomb.com!!  Food is amazing!!!  I got the deluxe pizza and the Italian sausage marinara.  It's so good!! So so delicious!

Portion sizes are generous and prices are reasonable.   You can taste the care they put into it.

This is now my go to pizzeria!
