I wanted to order from this place but live pretty far and didn't want to go and they weren't open...I called several times throughout the morning starting a little after eleven after they opened..so I thought..over the last hour I've called about four times on a Saturday and have not gotten an answer..if they open at eleven it's very unprofessional for them to not pick up the phone if they're open..they could also add a professional greeting to their voicemail..instead of one that sounds like you're calling someone's house..it's now afternoon and I still haven't gotten an answer. Not ordering takeaway for delivery because I want to go see who I'm getting my food..make sure the place is clean the employees are clean..etc. I don't usually go into this area but I guess I'll have to make a special trip sense their phones don't seem to work. Hopefully the pizza is worth the trip like the reviews state. TO BE CONTINUED....

I ordered from Postmates.  The food was still warm when it arrived so I was happy about that.  It looked very appealing and the cheese was browned just right on the top of the pizza. One thing i noticed was that my sausage and pineapple were on top of the cheese but the pepperoni was under the cheese., interesting.  Now the pizza was good and tasty and i didn't even have to ask for extra cheese because they pile it on.  I know i tasted some provolone and im not sure what other cheese because the provolone was dominant.  So if you di not like that particular cheese, this is not the pizza for you.  Mu children didn't like it so much because i think they're just use to mozzarella base pizzas.  I also ordered the veggie alfredo.  It as warm as well and the ingredients, fresh.  Now im starting to act like my children but i love fettuccine alfredo and i feel like they messed up because they melted some provolone cheese on top of the alfredo.  Now im sure i would've loved this when i was younger on a drunken night maybe but i really wanted some regular fettuccine but i will take the hit for that because the description said melted cheese in top, i just didn't ask what type of cheese, i assumed parm.  Overall i would support again.

Ordered via POSTMATES. Deanna was flawless and communicated with me telling me that they forgot to make my wings! Lol yeah I was pissed. But they quickly completed my ordered once they remembered.  Food arrived about 10-15 mns after that.  Pizza was veeeery tasty. It looked simple but had lots of flavor.  The Pepperoni is underneath the cheese lol. Would definitely order from them again.

Just left the slice. We ordered two large pizzas one the Veggie and the other pepperoni hamburger and bacon. We got mango habanero and sweet chilli  wings. Everything was piping hot and fresh! I loved the veggie but That Meat pizza  seasoned to perfection  The wings are very saucy and bursting with flavor! Oh I can't forget the cookies! They really are FRESH baked! Everything was delicious. We didn't wait long at all. The customer service was excellent! I'll definitely be going back. I wanted try everything on the menu!
Had to wait over 2 hours for food! Delivery drivers don't know their way around and can't seem to knock on a door. This store is pathetic. I will NEVER order from this location again.

If I could put no stars I would. I ordered my pizza online, when I got to the store to pick it up I waited at the counter for 10 mins no one came out to check and see what I needed, I even yelled for someone and no one came, but I could hear them laughing in the back. So I left I called and asked to speak with a manager who was very rude and didn't seem too care about losing business. I will never go back to this store and will stick with West Shore Pizza and Hungry Howies.

I ordered a pan pizza. I trusted them. They are professionals. They do this all the time. Well, this isn't what I experienced.

I ordered half green pepper, tomato and olive. What did I get?  No olive. Onion substitute instead. 

I bit into it, in a darkened room, and immediately chewed and swallowed the onions... tried to pick the onions off, but there were too many. Soon after I was off to CVS for tums and benadryl.  I know how I get. So I ended up eating a cold-cut sandwich instead. 

Why Pizza Hut? Why did this happen? Explain? I have English as a first language, as did the guy who took my order. 

So, how soon can you guys make me a free half of a pizza?

I didn't appreciate my allergic reaction. So now I await a managerial reply.
Experience date: October 27, 2019
Time: 7:00 P.M. E.S.T.

Sincerely,
Hungry in Clearwater

I ordered a pan pizza. I trusted them. They atr professionals. They do this all the time. Well, this isn't it. 

I ordered half green pepper, tomato and olive. What did I get?  No olive. Onion substitute instead. 

I bit into it, in a darkened room, and immediately chewed and swallowed the onions... tried to pick the onions off, but there were too many. Soon after I was off to CVS for tums.  I know how I get. I ended up eating a cold cut sandwich instead. 

Why Pizza Hut? Why did this happen? Explain? I have english as a first language as did the guy who took my order. 

So, how soon can you guys make me a free half of a pizza?

I await a managerial reply.
Post date: October 27, 2019
Time: 7:00 P.M. E.S.T.

Sincerely,
Hungry in Clearwater

I read the bad reviews, but decided to go ahead and give them a chance they said it would be 45 minutes. I told them I had read the reviews and were they sure it wasn't going to be two hours? The nice young man checked with the manager and the manager said it was more like an hour. Well twenty minutes later they were at my door. The pizza was hot, good, but a bit skimpy on toppings.

This Pizza Hut is always terrible!! They never make the quoted time for deliveries even though we live 0.9 miles from the location. I usually always have to call and check on the order almost an hour later to be told that they are busy and have lots of deliveries but are leaving with it soon. Tonight we ordered 2 desserts and that is it. In 8 minutes, it will have been an hour to get 2 desserts, and upon calling was told the same old same old. For Pizza Hut to be a staple in the pizza community, this location needs to get their act together, especially since it's Sunday night at 10:30 now. Wow !!! Thanks for an excellent experience....not!!!
I order from this Pizza Hut quite frequently. Their delivery time and product quality is excellent. They do a great job.

This Pizza Hut is the worst I've encountered by a loooooooooonnnggg shot! Extremely poor costumer service and not to mention their hours of operation are all over the place. Every order is not only wrong but also very late. I highly recommend everyone to stay away from this place.

I am Vegan. I ordered my usual from Pizza Hut. A deep dish pan pizza NO CHEESE just sauce and black olives. Sometimes with pizza huts they don't make too good. Like hardly any sauce or black olives. But this Pizza Hut did it PERFECTLY!!! They were VERY NICE on the phone when i placed my order even though I can be kind of annoying repeating myself saying "deep dish NO CHEESE just sauce and enough sauce so that it doesn't bake off and black olives." So I get the pizzas and WOW!!!!! LIKE THE BEST PIZZA HUT IVE EVER HAD! The sauce didn't bake off, it had a thick layer of sauce and LOTS of black olives! This Pizza Hut did a wonderful job making my order. My complements to the chief! :) plus they gave me lots of paper plates and napkins!

I don't see how they stay business. 
They are less than two miles away and the slop they brought me was half cold and pathetic. With her hot pants on.

At 7:42 p.m. on January 9, I ordered a large beef and mushroom pizza with wings. The correct wings were brought at 8:40 p.m., however the pizza was a medium peperoni and pineapple pizza. We ran out the door to meet the delivery person. They saw us and continued on their way. We dialed the number right away and were connected to customer support. At 8:54, we spoke to Mark (employee number 7530). He informed me that the store had closed and that he could provide me with a store credit. I stated that I needed my money back, and he told me that if I wanted my money back, I'd have to return the day-old pizza the next day. I requested to talk with a manager. First he told me there was no supervisor, then after waiting on hold for several minutes a very rude Dave answered the phone. He refused to give me his employee number and said " there's not need to beat a dead horse." I explained that we cannot eat the pizza because we do not eat pork, and it seems reasonable to return our money. He refused. Upon further investigation I noticed that the store closed at 8:00pm but accepted out order at 7:40pm, perhaps they shouldn't be accepting money from customers if they don't intent to provide decent service! Unacceptable. I want my money back!
Confirmation Number3220109184241001313038611
Order Date Sunday, 01/09/2022, 7:42PM

The place was throughly cleaned and the crew was amazingly good at customer service. The chicken was fresh and tasty as well. This gave me a great impression of the business and staff collectively that I just had to write a review!

Wish I had my receipt still to give a shout out to the great staff on that night.. I had come thru the drive thru pretty late ready to munch out and your staff had me laughing and then delivered my perfect meal to me. Couldn't have asked for a better experience.. thanks again!

This place NEVER has anything ready. No matter what I order, when they finally decide to take the order, it's always a 10 minute wait. When management isn't there, the employees act like it's a high school lunch period. The *only* good thing about the food never being ready is you always get fresh cooked chicken

This location hours are off. They not open.  False time. It's always this location with off hours they close 8:30 or 9 pm they just want to close earlier please update your hours of operation. Corporate need to start checking these Popeyes restaurant. Because they are failing the Popeyes name and reputation.
How the hell do they mess up a 10 piece order and give me 4 pieces. So tired of this BS, I'm checking everything from here and if y'all short me again someone will catch these hands!!!

This Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen is more of a mile stone than a fast food chicken chain. You may be asking, "what do you mean by a mile stone?" I mean a mile stone in life! And for most it will be the last one you ever achieve as this experience is equivalent to meeting Neo from the matrix and taking the blue and the red pill! Their crispy chicken sandwich has taken full control of my life, just one taste and you will be hooked like all the fish Hank caught in the crack fishing episode of King of the Hill. My loved ones have tried several interventions to attempt to manipulate me away from this tasty, juicy, spiritual-esk experience that is the crispy chicken sandwich. I've been fired from my job, lost my wife and kids, and have just received a foreclosure notice on my house. But not to worry, as long as this Popeyes continues to serve this life changing food item I will be in constant nirvana. Thank you Popeyes of Trenton, NJ. You have elevated my life to heights before not even believed possible. Your staff are angels and your food is other worldly! I look to the heavens every time I order this and give my heart and soul to the man upstairs who created the Popeyes staff who have single handedly changed my life

One thing I can say about this location is that it has by far the best chicken sandwich in existence. You can travel far and wide across different countries and cultures but you will be hard pressed to find anything comparable. Popeyes in general has a pretty good chicken sandwich, HOWEVER, this locations sandwich is a glorious gift bestowed upon us from the gods. Would I order anything else? Of course not! I will eat this sandwich every day for the rest of my life to show my appreciation and dedication to this delectable bird on a bun. If there was a religion about chicken sandwiches, they would need a particular sandwich to look up too... to write books about, this chicken sandwich at this location would be that entity. Deliver us from dry chicken, and forever hold the warm bun. For one can lose faith in the chicken, and be brought back to the light with this simple, small, inconspicuous Popeyes location in Trenton, NJ. Thank you for serving us, and thank you for the best damn sandwich ever created

Yep, I stupidly believed the hype over the famed Popeyes Chicken Sandwich, in this case, the Spicy Popeyes Chicken Sandwich. It. was. awful! It doesn't hold a feathered and beaked candle to the Chick Fil A Spicy Chicken Sandwich. Chick Fil A's vastly superior version actually has the spices and flavoring seared into the breast and the hotness is perfectly matched with the Pepper Jack Cheese and the mayonnaise cools it off. 

Unlike the disgusting sandwich I couldn't even finish choking down from Popeyes, the Chick Fil A sandwich isn't overly thick or ridiculously breaded. It just didn't taste good. The breast was too thick, the sauce didn't improve the sandwich, and there was no cheese.

It also just looks sloppy and messy and didn't taste any better than it looked. Chick Fil A's sandwich actually looks deliciously tasty, there isn't meat hanging out all over the bun, it's compact and appealing and inviting.

This is the crappiest chicken sandwich I have ever eaten at a fast food chain. Chick Fil A's is the gold standard and Wendys' Spicy Chicken Sandwich is much better. I would have been better off ordering McDonald's Spicy McNuggets which is considerably better than this overhyped tripe.

Avoid at all costs or don't listen to me and fall for the TikTok hype pretending that this sandwich is life-changing when, in fact, it was nothing but vomit-inducing.

I had to re-yelp the experience my mother just had at this Popeyes location today. It's truly upsetting she had to deal with this after she just had a long day and just wanted some comfort food. Below is what happened to her:


I have been a regular patron at this restaurant for years. However, today I was appalled by the way I was treated at this location by Inbran. I placed my order, pulled up to the window, Inbran read back to me my order, and I explained it was incorrect. I proceeded to repeat what my order was, including 3 apple pies. She said, "We don't have any apple pies." I informed her that the person who took my order, confirmed they were available. As she yells at me, "We don't have any and we are about to close" (half an hour before close time), another employee began to place the apple pies in the bag. She then proceeded to rudely ask, "Well, are you going to pay or not?" Taken aback by the consistent animosity, I simply told her she could've just acknowledged making a mistake and I was unsure as to why she was being hostile. Then, she slammed the window in my face. 

I would think, especially during these times that businesses and people are struggling to pay bills and make ends meet (due to COVID-19), you would want to maintain customers and repeat business. However, Inbran is pushing customers away. I asked another employee for her name and was advised that this has been an on going issue with this same person that is supposedly training to be a manager, which prompted me to write a review. She very clearly doesn't have the capacity to de-escalate situations, lead by example, or at the very least..provide good customer service.

When ordering on the app, you're given the option of indoor pickup even though the dining room is closed and doors locked. My review score isn't based on that. They get 3 stars because they always forget something. Last time I ordered a large and they gave me a medium, this time they forgot to add all the sauces :) As if we don't pay for them.
Just ordered a regular chicken sandwich meal and received the wrong order. Got a spicy chicken sandwich and sweet tea instead of the plain and fanta orange thanks.. also late on delivery.

I don't know what all the complaining is about on here, it is the best chicken sandwich you can actually buy. It's actually the best chicken sandwich you can make too. And it's not all Popeyes, it is this Popeyes. I don't know what they're doing here but they literally transformed bread and chicken into a dazzling tantalization of the mouth. That has kept me eating here every day for the last week LOL

Keep up the good work.

Asked for spicy tenders got plain tasteless ones , ordered an extra Mac and cheese got coleslaw instead since they were out buy could've gave us a call but no they were being lazy. No sauce and food cold.

Surprisingly strong fried chicken down on South Broad Street by Popeye's. 

The bright orange shop has been there for several years, but always seemed out of place as a drive through box in the middle of urbanity. My bad for not checking it out before now. Walked in on a very clean space staffed with friendlies and stocked with trays of golden brown clucker. 

Their two piece lunch deal came with one side and a biscuit. Under $5 for a filling and tasty treat. I ordered the spicy version. While it wasn't too spicy, it was certainly hot and crisp. The inner meat in the breast burnt my fingers as I ripped it apart. Soft and juicy. Really liked it. Actually gave me two wings along with the breast. Coke machine offered a large variety of their soft drinks. 

There is another excellent chicken shack further down Broad, so there is a choice of good stops to satisfy the bird lover in you.
I brought 3 chicken sandwiches and all 3 were old and disgusting. I will continue to go to olden ave as usual where it is ALWAYS Fresh

This small shop takes me back. The interior is dressed like an old store front. You can see the chefs and their stations. What looks like a old time delis delivers a delicious sub. 

I had the Hot Pastrami Reuben. It was wonderful, from the fresh sub roll to the meat itself, I enjoyed the meal to the end. The sub was full, complete with pickle slices and thousand island dressing. 

The server was very nice, even coming out to wipe down the sidewalk table. 

To me this is the meal I wasn't expecting but I'm glad I got it. 

Oh, by the way, I was told the deserts were made on site, but I did not have the room to eat any.

Thanks and good luck!

We've eaten here twice this week and looking forward to going back! The sandwiches are extremely flavorful and filling. All the baked goods are made fresh at the shop by the owner, as are the sandwiches.

Now more than ever I am all about small, local mom and pop shops.  This place definitely hits my criteria on that.  To boot, they have AMAZING food.

Located on the main street of a small town, easy and cheap street parking or a very VERY short walk from a free lot, this place is a great place to stop for good food.

Hot, tasty sandwiches in portion sizes bigger then I can eat (which my hubby doesn't mind, as I share it with him).

Take out is easy.  They have a small but OK sized indoor dining area. 

Check it out!
Amazing! Bomb.com sandwiches, soups and ridiculously good baked goods. Love swinging by on my way home and snagging a meal on the go

What a find....my work order lunch from there last week omg it is awesome. I went there for dinner and got the pastrami cheesesteak  delicious. If you are in the area stop in you will not be disappointed

I ordered wings and fries. Omg ! My email said my food would be delivered at 6:05pm. I did not receive my food until 6:32pm. Before I opened my food I knew it was cold. Fries are disgusting cold. Very disappointing.

This has to be the worst place for customer service around! I keep going back for that damn stuffed crust, so i can't give it up altogether. However, each time i order, it takes 2-3 times the original quoted time to actually arrive. They tell me 30-40 minutes and it's at least 2 hours EVERY TIME. I usually do pickup, but there are times that I can't. I wish someone would whip this place into shape and at least give REALISTIC wait times!
Ordered 2 hours ago. Still haven't gotten my food. God  knows what horrors await when it gets here next week.

Worst Pizza Hut I've ever dealt with. I sworn them off at least three times then I go back and they screw up my order again. Last time I called and they gave me a credit because they won't refund no matter how bad a job they do. So I call to use the credit and am told it's not in their notes on my account but I can "buy a large pizza for $10." Screw you. Never again.

This is by far the worst pizza hut I have ever dealt with. I have ordered time and time again from this location and every time I get my order they forget something. EVERY TIME. This time they brought my ranch for the wings but didn't bring the wings. I am beyond upset at this point with this location and with pizza hut. Last time it was my ranch they forgot with my pizza. They offered to bring it right out asap and after an hour and a half and a cold pizza I told them to not bother bringing it at that point. When I called the 800 number last time they said they would gave me a 5$ credit to my account and would automatically be subtracted from my next purchase. It never happened, I never received the credit. What's the point of ordering if they take more than 2 hours to get it to you and then don't bring you what you ordered? I have given the drivers more than 20% tips every time as well only to find out that someone didn't even do their job. This is so frustrating. 1 time sure, 2 times? what is going on, but 3 times??
Typical Pizza Hut. Pizza was done on time. No real issues except they forgot my garlic sauce! Blasphemy! 2 star deduction.

Ordered here again. They were out of mushrooms. No big deal especially since they gave me $1 off for my trouble. Nice people. Food is just not good. The pizza was soggy. I thought maybe it was just mine but my girlfriends was pretty much inedible too.  I won't return. Too bad my girlfriend doesn't really like jets. I guess it will be dominos next time we are hankering for a quick za.

First off, the guy who made my pizza wasn't wearing gloves when I arrived to pick mines up... So that made me leary to even eat the food so after he brought it to me I asked was he wearing gloves and he said" I wore them when I made yours" . So I asked him to show me and he goes and pulls gloves out of the garbage can(he said the gloves he threw away the gloves he wore when he made my pizza) and the gloves looked pretty much new except being turned inside out. Now the pizza wasn't the best at all. There was seemingly not enough cheese on it nor was the pizza hot. I mean I'll eat a cold pizza from the day before but if I just purchased it then it should still be hot.... Not room temperature. So overall I give this place 2 stars because the manager did give me a store credit but even the pizza I ordered with the credit was crappy smh.

Probably the worst pizza I have ever eaten in Nashville. 
Two large delivery pizzas cost $50. Just regular pizzas. Nothing special added. In fact they didn't even have one basic vegetable and had to leave it off. 
Dough was badly undercooked. Obviously rushed through with no thought for quality. Both of us are sick the following morning. 
Will never return. Avoid at all cost. I miss Jets.

I was having issues with my online order & my free coupon code for cheese sticks so I decided to just come into the restaurant and talk to them. I spoke with the manager, Stephanie, and she was a huge help! She honored my free online order code and discounted my deal box also since the app hasn't been working correctly. I also completed changed my mind and wasn't going to eat Pizza Hut anymore but Stephanie made everything right.

Placed an online delivery order at 8:30am for a pizza party. I needed it delivered. Because I can't leave to pick it up as it's for work and I'm a manager. They waited until 2pm to inform me they had no delivery driver. The delivery was suppose to be here at 2:30. So now I have no pizza and no way to get someone delivering it by 2:30. I feel like I should've been notified way earlier. This isn't the first issue I've had but this is the first one that's made me upset enough to write a review about it.
Looking for a sit down Pizza Hut innFranklin-Cool Springs-Brentwood area. IS THERE ANY?

This particular location is a joke. They only do delivery or carry out, yet they literally NEVER have a driver. They're boasting of "contactless delivery" yet the last five times we've ordered they either "have no driver" or are just plain closed. If this was strictly a recent issue I might chalk it up to the pandemic, but I've lived in the same house for 22 years and it's ongoing. The kicker is, I'm closer to the West End location. But due to some random circumstance, I literally cannot place an order with them. If you want to avoid the frustration, get DiGiornio.

My order was wrong and when I called they basically said they didn't care. I ordered 2 orders of wings and 2 orders of fries. Sounds had no sauce, they didn't send ranch and only 1 order of fries. I can forgive mistakes, but they were rude on top of it. Didn't even offer toto send our correct order. Ordered from Domino's, they were here quickly and our order was right. I'm done with pizza hut. Horrible!

It's a chain, it's pizza and wings on Super Bowl when you don't have a favorite. Yes, we had rude service, yes they messed up the pizza and the wings. Yes, they are residing on expensive Charlotte real estate. Not sure how long they will last.  Did not trust their delivery, but when we went there were 4 Pizza Hut cars there on Super Bowl Sunday. Odd. Pizza meh. I remember it being the best pizza. Again, it's Pizza. It's cheap, don't expect much more and you won't be disappointed.

This was a "half and half" pan pizza with the hut favorite crust flavor. When I called them asking for it to be replaced they informed me that I would need to bring it back with the receipt and that they wouldn't even begin prepping a new one until I got there.

My husband and I used to love Pizza Hut when we lived in Iowa. Since being in Nashville, we discovered Jets pizza. After seeing tons of commercials lately we decided to order Pizza Hut to be delivered. I placed and order at 9:30 am to be delivered at 3:30pm. The Pizza came in time, however it was cold and tasted old. It seems like they accidentally made the order at 11am when they opened and just let it sit under the heat lamps for the next three hours. The special right now is 50% off online pizzas and I totally can see why. We won't be getting it again.

Great place to get a bunch of dumplings to share. They are new to the area and only have 2 tables outdoor. Wish they had more. People love their outdoor seating. 

We are complete American newbs but love us some good dumplings!


Ordered to share: 

-Crab/pork soup dumplings (pierce and drink the broth inside then eat the dumpling with special sauces on table) (I think 5 per order)
-Pork Soup dumpling (5 per order)
-Shrimp Shumai (Shrimp dumpling) (4per order)
-Pork Bun (1 per order) got one for everyone. Big warm buns you just eat with your hands at that point. 
-Fresh cucumber salad (garlic soy sauce taste super tasty) 

Service was fantastic. Food was great! Will be coming back with more friends and family!

Great to have Dim Sum in Phoenixville!  

Terrific location.  Service was excellent. Food was great. Loved it! 

We've been missing Manapua (dim sum) ever since we move from Hawaii.

Food was so good, we doubled the order and took the second order home to enjoy.

Dim Sum Court is a keeper!

Not often compelled to review, however this place deserves it! Fresh, authentic dim sum and Chinese food. Highly recommend. The General Tso's is amazing along with the buns, and variety of dumplings! Check it out. The hype is real. Don't forget to BYO!

We tried the dim sum and entrees. For the entrees we got beef black pepper & sesame chicken, and they were delicious! Moist and very good flavor. For the dim sum we had, Soup Dumpling, Shrimp Shumai and Pork Chive Dumpling. They were all delicious! The service was quick and good, and the place was clean and the inside of the restaurant is very cozy. Will definitely come back and recommend to friends!

I was born and raised in Hong Kong and my parent are from China so I get to know many fish from both side with their real taste for many many years before I moved to American. I love Dim Sum 點心, When I was in Hong Kong I go yum cha 飲茶 for dim sum with my family every Sunday as tradition. I usually go to Philly Chinatown to get real Chinese food, I was excited to see a dim sum place opened up close to where I live and had to try it. First of all there is not a dim sum variety having the restaurant name as dim sum court, it should focus more on dim sum as it main course before any other entrees, I recommend expending more, my favorite dim sum dish like chicken feet and sticky rice with lotus leaf is missing, hope they add it one day. Second I think the owner maybe from China as I can tell from the menu are based in China as it follow the cuisine from China and Shanghai. Anyway enough talking, today I order a few dish to try. Steam Pork Bun 菜肉包, BBQ Pork Bun 叉燒包, Pan Fried Pork Bun 生煎包, Yang Chow Fried Rice 揚州炒飯, and General Tso Chicken 左宗棠雞. 
1. Steam pork bun is on point, the look, size, and taste is good. I recommend this bun, but I don't think it should cost 2.5 a piece, maybe it's inflation.
2. BBQ Pork Bun is also on point, but I think this is a mini version because the regular one is usually bigger. The pork is lean and without fat which I like, sauce and taste is good, the bun itself is soft and good. I recommend this.
3. Pan Fried Pork Bun, this is a Shanghai dish, what I received could be bigger, usually it is bigger size in Shanghai. The taste and look is good, I recommend this.
4. Yang Chow Fried Rice, this dish is missing the main ingredient BBQ pork (Char Siu 叉燒), instead it used shredded pork which is ok if you don't know, to me this is more like the American version of house special fried rice, also it's missing green pea. It need more taste, it's missing its fragrance. I probably won't get it again.
5. General Tso Chicken, no doubt this is an American dish and I don't care much for it, but my wife is American and she love this dish so she got it, the chicken just a little smaller than most Chinese restaurants, but it looks ok and my wife say it's good and it's spicy. I don't think any Chinese restaurants can mess it up but I recently got one from a dim sum place up in this area and it's awful. 
Overall I can recommend this place and will continue to try different dish like soup dumplings and beef chow fun. The price is ok because you can't find a place that serve dim sum up in this area if you are craving them. My order is for takeout and not dine in, so I don't know how the service is.
Very solid food.  The fried rice is especially flavorful.  They turn tables quick and reasonably priced.  This place will be a staple in Phoenixville for a while...high end quality food.

Cute place with a big tasty serving. Can't go wrong with the view of the Colonial theater across the street. The only downfall was I think they forgot my order cause it came out like 15 minutes after my friends'. I would like to return though.
Great dumplings with prompt and friendly service! They are new to Phoenixville and I hope they stick around!

My bf and I ate here for dinner last night on Xmas eve. Very clean inside, cute decor and friendly service. We were offered complimentary pickled radish and some peanuts. Radish was great!

We shared the pork and chives steam dumplings, scallion pancakes, sesame chicken and beef chow fun. Winner was the beef chow fun! Delicious with a ton of flavors. I would definitely order this dish again. Loved the veggies that were inside as well.

Scallion pancakes sadly gets a big thumbs down. Came with a good amount, but way too over fried. Could not taste any scallions and could only taste fried dough. Drenched it in sauce and it still didn't help. 

Dumplings were great and the filling portion was very generous! Sesame chicken was good, but just average. Normally sesame chicken is a dark brown with lots of sesame seeds. This dish was orange like orange chicken and had a small sprinkle of seeds. This was just okay!

I can't wait to return and reorder the beef chow fun and try new things off of the menu!

I got takeout for the first time here.  

Chinese broccoli w/ garlic $9.00.  Not chinese broccoli, regular broccoli.  So much different, I could return it just for that.  A pint when for $9.00 you should get a quart.  Taste is OK. Not going to complain.

Fish ball soup $6.00.  Nothing special.  Tiny portion, maybe a cup and 4 fish balls.  Worth $3.00 at most.

Pork fried rice $9.00.  Full quart, so decent value.  But the port isn't recognizable as pork, it's ground meat, a shortcut.  Should be diced pork, not ground.

I didn't try the dim sum.  If you're in Phoenixville going out to eat, it's fine, good food, but don't expect anything special. Really disappointed with all of the good reviews.

We had a wonderful dim sum lunch before catching a Sunday movie across the street at the historical Colonial theater! This place is located right in downtown amongst some cute shops and restaurants. The food there is delicious! We got the soup dumplings that had flavorful pork and soup filling wrapped up in a perfect dumpling shell, Shanghai sui mai filled with sticky rice, scallion pancakes and a really tender beef brisket noodle soup in a flavorful broth. The service is quick and friendly. This place made for us a nice start of our little road trip and Sunday fun!

They had a variety of dim sum but we were only there to try out their Shanghai soup dumpling.  I had low expectations but the dumplings turned out better than I thought.  It's good for a place in the burbs.  Now we don't have to drive to the city for a decent soup dumpling place.  Will definitely return to try other items on the menu.

Ordered dumplings and two chicken dishes.  Dumplings came last.  Everyone who was seated was given a bowl of peanuts and pickled veggies.  Nothing for us even though we were the only other guests until everyone else came.  Never going back since food was meh!

Dim Sum court finally opened about a month ago after a long construction period during the pandemic. Glad they did.

They have an extensive menu that includes some Dim Sum favorites, Twaineese options, and what one would consider American Chinese options.
It is not a traditional Dim Sum restaurants with push carts, but rather you order what you would like from the menu.

Xia Long Bao (soup dumplings) have a slightly thicker wrapper than I would like but it is good to see these available in the suburbs.

Like the fried peanuts and pickled radish served as an "amuse bouche".
You could taste the "wok hei" in the Beef Chow Fun.
Crystal shrimp dumplings were decent.
I loved their housemade chili crisp oil.

It is family-owned and the service is super friendly.
One small issue we had was that our waitress disappeared at the end of our meal and we had to wait for 15-20 minutes for our bill.

Right on Main Street in phoenixville, this place is in the heart of everything. Awesome outdoor seating! Menu is mainly Thai food. Soup dumplings were good and cold noodles were the best! A bit of an acquired taste but really good.

My family loves dim sum and was so glad one opened up in our hometown. We put in an order for pickup and it was quick and easy. Their menus have a ton of pictures so you can see what you're ordering and it just makes the process easier for our kids to choose as well.  The food was delicious and our kids enjoyed it as well. We cannot wait to come back and try out more items.

New restaurant in Phoenixville. Went there with three others including my Chinese brother in law who did most of the ordering for us. They have a wide assortment of dumplings and many staples of the Chinese restaurant trade in the US. So if you want something a little different from the norm (all the dumplings) but still have a hankering for Kung Pao chicken or General Tso chicken this is your place. Service was great.
This place is so delicious and very detail oriented when it comes to your dining experience. Very new and already booming . Please go check it out

Found this place on Yelp and thought, gotta go there now and give it a try. Had multiple different kinds of dumplings. The pork one's were my favorite. The only negative was our waitress. She was not very friendly and did not want to answer my questions about the food. I will go back though for sure and hopefully get a different waitress.

Well, went here for takeout on a Sunday night and got the beef with Black Pepper. It was 80% onions, bell peppers, carrots and 20% beef, with very little flavor. Typical Americanized "chinese" food. From reading the other reviews here, I suspect the Dim Sum part of the menu is far superior to the larger entrees masquerading as Chinese food.

I was really excited to hear that Gangnam Street Food was opening up in the mall. I love Korean food. I have to say I was mildly disappointed when I had my lunch.  First of all the selection is not as huge as in the main location and I really had my heart set on ramen. (Ramen is at the main location.) I was hoping they also had some vegetable options as well...which they don't. What they have are Korean style hotdogs, kimbab (similar to sushi), and Bulgogi cups.  So I ordered the Beef Bulgogi Cup. The flavours were delicious but the portion was soooo tiny! It would so much better for presentation and content to throw in some green sautéed veggies and extra rice...and it wouldn't cost a lot more.  I ended up having to order a soup at the Thai restaurant to fill up on something. For a snack this is probably a good place to go, especially if you want a different take on a hot dog or fried chicken. Not the best bang for your buck if you want to be filled up at lunchtime.

Found this little fried gem in the mall! Ichiban deep fried corn dog was a must. I had a hard time deciding the sauce but settled on the recommended mustard, ketchup, sugar. They add the sauce right on top so no awkward dipping! Took long enough to make but it was freshly deep fried, crunchy outside, doughy, moist hotdog. Was very decadent for a corn dog and I'm so glad I splurged on the calories!

So this is a review for the kingsway location...This is an affordable fast food option, especially when I'm in the area looking for a quick lunch different than hospital food. It's right in the food court and I don't usually have to wait long when I order here. There's a lot of fast fried food options that are varying in sizes, I typically opt for those items when I'm at the south side location, but I've been leaning towards the k-dosirak at this location. It's basically like a quick & easy Korean bento which saves me from having to decide what to eat because it's a nice sampling of different food that's not overly greasy or messy. The spice level is actually quite tolerable- it seems mild for someone like me who has barely any heat tolerance. K-dosiraks are also packaged nicely and travels well so I can enjoy it back in the office.  I'm pretty happy gangnam street food has expanded to kingsway and will likely hop over here again for food and bubble tea when I'm in the area for lunch breaks.

I shouldn't like this place as much as I do. I like it enough that I am working towards completing the whole menu. Sadly, they recently adjusted the menu and removed a few of the more obscure, hard to find items but 90% of what was there is still available although by different names. 

Highlights include anything with bulgogi (Bibimbab in particular) and the Cheese Dog (which is like a big mozza stick). The chicken bites are good but recommend the rice bowls for a more substantial versions of the same. They now have monthly specials at a discount which is a great way to try them out. 

Note: The Bul-Dog is a unique menu item only available at this location. Worth trying.

Not only was the lamb wrap really good, I must say Emad have outstanding service. At this airport a lot of the people are rude however Emad changed my whole mood with his great customer service I wanna give you a big San francisco thank you!

Nearly missed my connecting flight because of their inefficient system- you order at the counter, then instead of them making your order while you wait in yet another line, only start working on your often once you get to the front of the line. Waited over 20 minutes for a hastily-made breakfast platter (sausage was burnt, eggs pre-made and oily and hash browns had been sitting a while). Might have just been the day I visited, but didn't have a good experience at all!

Two stars for the weirdest order experience I've ever had. There were woefully few food options at BNA, and they all had crazy long lines. Pyramid had two lines- one long and one short. It took us a couple minutes to realize that the short line was where you ordered and the long line was where you picked up your food. The madness? They don't start your food order until you get to the front of the line and they take your order ticket. Everything is mostly pre prepped but still. Overly crispy fries and absolutely zero attempts to not cross contaminate- my steak sandwich and fries came with some chicken tender breading and my husband watched them dump falafel in with chicken and fries so good luck to anyone strictly vegetarian I guess. The bread was super soggy and soft, and overall the meal left much to be desired- especially since it took us 40 minutes to get it and we had to dash to the gate.

Mixed experience.  Decent line, but goes fairly quick.  Cashiers were awful.  I order a pyramid sandwich and fries, she typed in pyramid plate and fries and then charged me wrong.  I figured this out and asked them to correct the order and was due back 2.63 and received 2.57?  6 cents off...  Lady behind me said she asked for euro meat with rice and was charged for each seperately instead of given the plate option.  So pay attention  when ordering.  Food was really good, fresh off the grill, fries were warm.  Would go back, hope they can improve the ordering process!

I will never understand why every airport restaurant gets eviscerated by the Yelp community. The food is usually perfectly acceptable but people love to get on their high horse, chasing a power trip from crushing some poor small airport food counter into the ground.

This place was JUST. FINE. Was it the best chicken platter I've ever eaten? Hell no. But it did exactly what I expected from it. Fast, cheap, and edible bordering on decent. 

I thought my meal deserved three stars, but I'm giving it four to counteract everyone else on Yelp who absolutely lay into airport restaurants for no good reason. We don't give kids play-doh and judge their creations against Michelangelo's David. We don't give people crayons and expect Van Gogh's Starry Night. And we sure as hell shouldn't go to an airport and expect Michelin star food quality.
Friendly service this morning.  The egg and cheese biscuit was slightly abysmal.   Biscuit ok, lukewarm egg.  Coffee was pretty decent, strong and hot

Based on the limited options in this airport terminal, this restaurant was pretty good and seemed like the best choice.  They have a confusing system, two separate lines, one to order, one to pick up, some people started in the pick up line and then had to go start over in the ordering line. They hand you a ticket and then you get in the second line and they ask for the ticket - why?  Why don't they just give the tickets in order to the cooks?  I think I was overcharged as well as others have commented but they didn't give me a receipt to check, so either overcharged a couple dollars or tax is really high in Tennessee.  Their food prep looked like utter chaos, surprised they got any orders out - it was mass confusion and really slow.  That said, once I got the shrimp sandwich it was really good.  The shrimp were cooked perfectly and the pita bread is very fresh.  My husband had a chicken mediterranean salad which was ok but the cucumbers pieces were huge, bigger than a bite, as were the red onion pieces.  A little chopping and prep to the salad would help.

Two stars maybe too many. 

Lamb gyro was just okay. No cucumbers, onions or tomatoes and tzatziki was runny. Lamb was good and so was the pita. 

Greek salad was awful.  85% cucumbers that was mostly not ripe two pieces of tomato, four little pieces of red onion and barely any feta. 

Ice tea was good. 

Service was friendly but given the remodeling, one of the few choices. Meaning about a 20 minute wait in a second line after you pay. 

Next time, I will try one of the sit down bars. Probably just as fast and I would get to listen to live music.

the breakfast croissant sandwhiches are premade and the croissant itself is tough and a bit dry -- not at all the flaky greasy sandwhich i was hoping for

the place next door is probably a better bet, but it honestly didn't look that hot either. article upon article says the food at this airport isn't much to write home about; such a missed opportunity

Breakfast combo review

Croissant sandwich with sausage was bland and pre-made. Hash browns are not hash browns. Just potatoes and they were average. Coffee was good.
I ordered a gyro plate with hummus and it was over $20. The menu price had a much much cheaper one. I don't appreciate being lied to. Or the price gouging.

Best airport food I've ever had! I got the chicken Greek platter and it came with a huge salad. Chicken was grilled right in front of me with onions and peppers. So fresh! 
The line was long but totally worth the wait. You wait in one line to put your order in and pay and then you get in another line to give the cook your order and then he makes it. Make sure you have enough time to eat here. 
My fiancé's gyro was delicious. He got the gyro platter and it came with rice and salad. The gyro meat was outstanding. They also offer toppings such as feta and taziki , yum!

Waiting for my flight and thought I would try this place! Disappointed by the person at the cash register, very rude & unwelcoming. Food was alright as well. Definitely would recommend eating elsewhere at the airport!

Lines are very confusing. I stood in one line for twenty minutes only to find out it was the wrong one. So you order in one spot and then they don't even start your order until you get to the end of the line and give them your ticket. Everything frozen and cross contaminated. Also, the price on the menu board is not correct. They will ring you up for $2 more

Check your receipt! You will be charged will be much more than what they have on the menu board. They never gave me my drink for the combo either.
SCAMMERS!!!!!!!

I don't think that this restaurant is accessible if it's in the airport area is it inside the terminals then your ad should say that is inside the terminal which visitors are allowed in the terminals for lunch?
Best food, fast service and all the food is fresh. From front dest to the chefs they have stuff ready infront of you and very big plates for the price.

I will start by saying the staff here are working very hard. But waiting 30+ minutes for a smoothie is unacceptable. Shame on the owner/management. This is a good concept but perhaps unsustainable if they cannot hire enough staff to make food and smoothies promptly. I have visited other locations without this issue so I tend to believe there is a short staff issue.  My detox island green smoothie was great once I finally received it.

When I went to this Tropical Cafe, I was greeted by a kind young man and a menu that was more than I had expected! It's so much more than smoothies!  The food was cooked right there in front of me and was fresh and delicious! Excellent quick food and healthy! Great service, healthy food, clean environment, that's my kind of place! Thanks Tropical Cafe, Paoli!
Soooooo good! And the guys that work there are great! Made me a yummy smoothie and delish quesadilla! They were super friendly and helpful.

Best smoothie in town for sure. Yes obviously like any frozen food place during the summer this place is bound to get busy but the staff are always super helpful and very much seem to genuinely want to make sure you have a good experience at their cafe. The smoothies are great and I will keep coming back for more!!!

Third time I've been to this store and they made my vegetarian wrap with meat. Third time. And you wait so long. I used to love the store in Florida, and I keep hoping this one will be better, but each time I go back, they make my vegetarian wrap with meat. They did give a couple free sides and smoothie

We came when it wasn't busy so we didn't run into the wait problem that a lot of other reviewers seem to have experienced. In fact, we came and we were the only ones in the store. Immediately when I walked in I was hit with the pungent smell of artificial cleaner. It was like they had just sprayed every surface with an entire can of lysol and it triggered a minor headache for me. I hope it doesn't always smell like that.

I ordered a smoothie (can't remember the name) that had pomegranate, cranberry, and some others. It was super red/purple. I was hoping it would be refreshing and light but it tasted like sugar syrup and was way too sweet. I also found out after that for the pomegranate and cranberry smoothies they use a concentrate (rather than the real fruit) so that was disappointing.

The smoothie was okay, but considering it was a peanut butter cup I expected it to taste like PB and chocolate. Instead it mostly tasted like banana with light PB and a hint of chocolate. The quesadilla was the same quality I could make myself at home with cheap ingredients, but where this place really falls apart for me is the employees.

The guy making our food finished wrapping the wrap, pulled my quesadilla off the grill and left it sitting on the counter, and then just walked off. He was gone for about 2 minutes before the other employee noticed the food, went to the back, came back and finished it. And literally all that was left to do was put the quesadilla in a box, cut it, bag it and the wrap, and hand it to us. What was so important you left my food out to cool down and couldn't ask the other employee to bag it?

Speaking of the other employee, she was at least quick about stuff but she went from the register to the smoothies, and packed our food all without ever changing her gloves. Gloves aren't magical, if you touch stuff with them they are contaminated just like hands would be.
Great customer service! Food was delicious and fast served.Alex was the best and nicest server.
Solid place. Tez had a great sense of humor. Brandon wasn't shy with the buff sauce which was a power move

Thoroughly enjoyed the solid beer menu and two of the Hot Dog choices on the menu. They were amazing! They're big, but so good you'll want to devour it all. I also had the chili as a side. Very unique and very good. Highly recommend this place. Also want to note that the redhead behind the bar was running the entire floor - all the bar work and all tables. Super impressed with her work ethic. She was slammed but never made us feel we weren't her only table. Very pleasant and just a great asset to the restaurant.

A great little pub set in what looks like an ole' gas station, large garage roll up doors with concrete floors. There's a great selection of beers on tap along with Bottles and Cans. If you're into wine, you can get a good selection from a variety of places along the NW. I went for the Smoked Drumsticks and the Frito Pie. The legs come coated in a edible buffalo hot sauce, smoked to perfection. The Frito Pie was awesome...definitely hit the spot! In the pie included Fritos, chili, Tri-tip steak, cheddar cheese, chipotle sour cream, and pickled jalapeños! Overall, we'll done, and I will be back when in town. Plus for travelers, it's right across the street from a great Hilton Garden Inn!
Great beer and wine list...we will be back! Very nice outdoor patio(inside is cool too). We ordered the frito pie...so good!
Great service, really enjoyed the beer selection, and the Mini baked potatoes were absolutely delicious- cooked perfectly with the most wonderful candied bacon. I will definitely go back!

Hands down the best value I've had in a long time.  

Tri-tip sandwich, kick ass bowl old spicy chili and a beer for $22.   

Not much going on because of the weather but I'll be back next time I'm passing thru Boise.

Hands down the best brewery in Boise. Great service and very clean place . The staff is incredible (Christine) and a great variety on the beer on tap. If you are ever in Boise, don't miss out on this place at all.

My order has been messed up for the 2nd time and if I'm paying $9 for a salad and a CUP OF ICE, My order should be correct.  This isn't the first time that my order has been messed up either. Looks like I'll have to go to a different location.

I usually love going to Subway for the fast and fresh sandwiches but this was not the case! The line moved very slow and my cucumbers were dry. Also they forgot to give me and offer me a free cookie because I got double meat, which is Standard in every subway. Needs improved but is in a great location by hotels and an industrial park. Very close to my work so it's an easy drive to get there.

Takes them FOREVER ago build a sandwich! We sat in the drive through for 10 mins! And there was no one in the lobby  and 2 employees. Then when we got our orders it was wrong! They took food back through the drive through window which I'm pretty sure is a NO NO. Over all horrible experience.
Great experience! I am a bit picky with my order but they didn't seem to mind one but!

Drive thru ordering was the most frustrating experience that I've had in sometime. The person taking the order kept rushing the order. Never made it to my sandwich bc the lady kept telling me to pull up to the window for my total without ever asking if that completed my order. Food may be good, but I don't know.

Visited subway at 11:00 am to avoid the crowd. The place was clean and good spacing of tables to maintain distance required. The staff was not especially courteous, but very efficient. They got the order correct with no issues. I had the meatball sub and it tasted very good. I love all of the fresh veggies here!

Got sick of the salesman and manager at West Edmonton Hynudai so I decided to try Southtown again. Mind you, my initial meeting with Southtown Hyundai was back in 2011 and I got a sleazy salesman at the time so I stayed away. This time was much much better. Straight talker, not pushy, asked important questions and listened to my answers well. I was lucky too that I met the sales manager who sold me two vehicles when he was still at West Edmonton Hyundai. Done deal in half a day. Got the car early next day. I didn't appreciate the finance lady being pushy about expensive add-ons which I clearly indicated I didn't want. That was the sour point in what would have been a great afternoon. Also, the service area seems a bit small and they don't offer free service like West Edmonton Hyundai does. Love the low interest for 72, 84 or even 96 months. Why buy used when you can get a new car with lower monthly payments. Always check for their slaes events because they often have them and it often covers most models.

In 2006, I set out to buy my first car with my dad at my side.  We visited many dealerships and test drove many cars, but I finally decided to purchase a new Hyundai Elantra from Southtown Hyundai.  I had visited the dealership at least three times prior to making the decision to purchase, and when I was ready to buy the car, we felt very comfortable with our salesman and also the choice I made.  As soon as the deal was handed off to the sales manager at the time, things started to get difficult. 

I picked out the trim level I wanted, and decided on the color I wanted.  My dad and the sales manager worked out an excellent price for the car, and we were thrilled that we were getting such a good deal.  The color I wanted was popular, so they had to find a car to ship in to Edmonton.  They found one in B.C. for us, and when we looked over the paperwork we discovered that it was a test car with over 30,000 km on it, and they were going to drive it to Alberta for me.  Not ship it on a truck, drive it - all the way from Vancouver.  I was paying for a new car and wanted a new car so we insisted that they find a different vehicle.  We had to ask a lot of questions to finally get a straight answer about this particular car, and if we hadn't asked questions, they would have driven in the test vehicle without telling us it wasn't brand new.  After another short wait, they found one for us that was new and would be shipped in via a truck. We paid for the down payment on the car (with the rest due when we picked it up) and walked away smiling with our signed contract.  

This was on a Saturday, and we were to be sent the bill of sale for the car on Monday so I could get insurance and registration for it.  They didn't send us anything on Monday, and we called on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday asking for the bill of sale.  The manager wouldn't return any of our calls and when he finally did the excuse we got is that the color I wanted was impossible to find and that there wasn't a single one available in Western Canada.  What did I pay for then?  My dad was suspicious and called a few Hyundai dealerships in Calgary - we found eight Elantra's matching the trim level and color I wanted.  

On Thursday night I finally decided I didn't want to deal with Southtown any further and we called to cancel the sale.  The sales manager's reaction was to say "fine" and hang up on us.  As this was my first experience car shopping, I was crushed that it ended so badly, and did not even end up purchasing a car that summer.  A few years later the new sales manager found my open file and couldn't figure out what had gone wrong and called me to see if he could "make it right".  Since I was no longer in the market for a car, there wasn't anything he could do, but even when I went back to test drive an Elantra in 2011, I still could not get over how bad my first experience was.

Service department is great, worth the drive! The dealership in my area gave consistently poor service so I decided to try Southtown. Thanks to Derek P. my experience has been excellent! He promptly gets back to me with updates, car repairs are completed on schedule and he takes the time to provide clear information about my vehicle. I won't go anywhere else.

I got t boned in January 2016 and my car was written off, so I needed to find a vehicle and quick. I saw the Hyundai Veloster at Southtowne Hyundai online and liked it enough to go test drive it. The evening I went I brought my husband as he's good with the mechanics and I look more for comfort / bells and whistles. When we got there the salesman greeted us politely but then kept telling me it was a manual car...obviously I know it's a manual or I wouldn't have called in to test drive it. The majority of the time we were there he would talk to my husband which pisses me off because I'm the one buying the car. I ended up buying it definitely not because of the salesman but because of the car.

In the year that i have had this vehicle, I've realized the service there is crap. If you call and ask a question they never know off hand and always say they'll call you back, but then they never do. If I take my car in for service their shuttle service won't drive me to my work downtown and will only drop me off at the nearest LRT station...but every other dealership I've dealt with drive you downtown. They're not helpful and it feels like they don't care about their clients and they're very pushy.

Jonathan Yam provided me with the most gracious and wonderful experience to purchase my used Veloster.  I was going through a recent death of my mother as well as some personal physical issues which required me to buy an automatic drive car.  Jonathan was attentive, sensitive to my needs and was able to find a car that perfectly suited my needs and negotiated to a price that would work for me.  Jonathan is extremely knowledgeable and very personable without any pressure.  During this sad time in my life, the experience of purchasing through Jonathan was like m birthday and Christmas rolled into one.  Hyundai is lucky to have Jonathan on their team!!!  I am one happy customer and will definitely tell friends and family to go to Jonathan to purchase in future.  I will definitely come back!

I had a great experience when I purchased my 2007 Elantra from this dealership in January 2012. But then I had to take it in for an issue in July 2013 and I have to say that this service department is the worst service I have experienced. Took a week to get the car in. Then I didn't hear from them for three weeks because they were "having trouble finding the part".  Every time I call this department I get bumped back to reception because no one answers the phone. After the fifth time of being bumped back to reception, even the receptionist was annoyed and she sighed and said, "They never answer!" When I went to the dealership to get a copy of the work order, I stood at the service desk for five minutes without getting any attention at all. I was the only customer standing there. The assistant manager was having a personal conversation with the shuttle driver and everyone else was just sitting there. I wondered for a moment if I was invisible. I finally had to go stand RIGHT in front of the computer one guy was sitting at to get noticed.

Of course what I needed done wasn't covered by warranty and I was quoted $700 for the repair. I got a quote from another place for $300 less. They got back to me the same day I called them and can get my car in this week. So, I called to cancel my appointment at Southtown...and go through the same ritual of being bumped back to reception over and over. Finally I get to speaking to someone and I am told there is no appointment for that day for my name. Why am I not surprised?? 

I will NEVER go back to this place again.

After doing our research on SUVs, we decided to purchase a Tucson.  After our great experience with Go Auto Direct, but choosing to purchase a new vehicle, we ended up at Southtown as they too are part of the Go Auto group, and they are located close to our home.

We made an appointment to see George on a Friday night to test drive several models.  He was very helpful, knowledgeable and quite funny as an added bonus.  He was never pushy, and gave us time to discuss our options.  He helped us get a great deal on a 2015 Tucson as well as our trade in, which we were very pleased about.  We definitely recommend George!

Our experience was slightly soured by our interaction with the finance aspect of our purchase.  The woman we dealt with on the Friday night kind of rushed us through some paperwork without much explanation and told us the rest would be explained when we picked up the vehicle.  We asked about securing the loan and other vehicle options (ie. undercoating, rust proofing) and their effect on the price, but we were told the vehicle's price was the final price, which didn't make sense.  When we were asked when we wanted to pick up the vehicle, and we suggested several days later, we got told we should pick up the next day, which we were a bit surprised about.  We didn't think that would be enough time to have the vehicle ready, but we were assured it would work.

The next day when we arrived, we were told the vehicle wouldn't be ready for another two days.  Thankfully with the Go Auto group we were able to get a loaner vehicle.  We then saw another finance person, who proceeded to sell us the other vehicle options we had asked about previously.  We had no problem waiting for our SUV, but would have appreciated a phone call to tell us about the delay.  When I did finally pick up our SUV, there was still a fair bit of plastic covering that I needed to pull off myself.

We will be returning to Southtown for our SUV's servicing, and hope that the service department is as great as the sales staff!
the worst dealership experience I have had in my life, I was charged 3 times what it should have cost and it took them 7 days to do a simple 4 hr job....Never Again.

I had a great experience with the service department. They fixed my main concern, gave me a quote for other issues that they found in their inspection, but never once pressured me to get the work done. This was very appreciated, especially after previous bad experiences with being pressured at places like Midas. I will definitely be coming back for any work I need in the future
Very untrusting! Got a quote from Southtown Hyundai for $7000 and all it needed was a new Alternator. I won't be going back there ever again.

Very shady business. If you talk to 10 different people you'll get 10 different stories. They promise you things and then don't deliver, and still expect you to pay for it. I've dealt with them twice now, not sure why I went back the second time but both times I left disappointed. I'd recommend choosing somewhere else to buy your vehicle.

Honestly, run while you can. I started a sale with Graham he was polite and kind... Until negotiations took place. Imagine dealing with an adult temper tantrum when trying to buy a car. So at that point I felt it was time to go. I should've ran then. No, this was my own fault though. The sales manager riegned me in. We worked out a deal the following day. I came in to hopefully finalize the paperwork. THEY  SOLD  THE  CAR  I  HAD  THE DEPOSIT ON. They sold the car. They sooooold the car. 

Worry not. It only gets worse. They said they had the same car on the way. Keep in mind I wanted this in black, this what was on the agreement. 

I get a photo of the "identical car". IT  WAS  GRAY. 

Anyway, it got much worse. 

Fortunately, Kyle from Northstar Hyundai saved the day and we made an excellent deal. Please, if you're from the south side. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND making the drive out there.

To be honest, Hyundai Southtown contain a lot of professional and friendly individuals, however for my experience there with Micheal Castro (sales associate), The deal we worked out was no where near the total amount I had to pay (I had to pay an extra $2250). He is a great sales associate some may say and I would agree to a certain extent since I found his car knowledge to lack proficiency. 
In other words, he may know how to sale a car perhaps but can only sales talk you into purchasing one with very basic information about the car, which may portray him as a knowledgeable sales man. 
Quick tip: Ask for all the details up front with Micheal Castro (from my experience). Do not work out a deal before he shows you the AMVIC and made you aware of all the car conditions. That way, the deal may be reasoned efficiently. On the other hand, Genevieve's patience amazed me. Kudos to her. 
P.S. My experience may differentiate from some others and this is not to say that the salesman is a bad one. I am simply telling the truth. At the end of the day, I still had to pay the extra $2250, which was not the deal we originally worked out and he did not advocate for me, regarding this extra amount, as a customer. 

05/12/2015 
Up to date: I had my car serviced today for a horn and break pads. The initial service was awesome, I must say. From my perspective Derek P. took pride in his job and was efficient throughout. On my check out, when I went in to pick up my car again, I was told to wait a few minutes in the customer area since my car was taken for a "courteous wash". I thought that was really nice of them to be honest but then I got to see my car: I wish I upload pictures so you may see for yourself. To make a long story short, the "courteous car wash" that I patiently waited for was done at a very very poor quality. It makes me wonder of the service I received on my car today. I surely will go double check it was done with quality else where.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Honestly we are so shocked at what has gone on with this dealership. We were working with them on purchasing our first car and everything seemed to be going well. However, when we decided on a different car from another dealership, they called us constantly. Immediately, we suddenly started receiving calls about a free TV ad posted from our phone number on Kijiji. So, their sales people pranked us. Nice. Absolutely unbelievable and not to mention grossly unprofessional how they took our personal contact information and used it against us. From what I understand, if you spend your money there, they'll be nice to you. But once you decided not to, all bets are off. We will be pursuing legal action about the breach of our personal information, but in the meantime, I urge you to AVOID THIS DEALERSHIP AT ALL COSTS.

Bought a "new" car here, when we were signing the papers for it, they came in and changed the VIN on the papers.. We questioned it, was told not to worry, it's still the same car, brand new..  Upon delivery, noticed the car had 400+ km on it and asked the Sales person why?? Our Bill of Sale says 5 km on the odometer..  We were given the car that people had been test driving! Felt duped, cheated, would've never paid what we paid.. They claimed 'human error' - seems to be an ongoing excuse with this dealership..They did ask what they could do to rectify the problem, I asked for lifetime oil changes, they agreed & said the work had to be done at their dealership but if we ever missed a maintenance appt the lifetime oil changes would be null & void.. THEN  they called back and said "Oh and also, you have to give us 100% on our survey".. Long story short, would rather give you guys the review you deserve.. Also.. look further down on their reviews for the terrible ones regarding the Service Dept.. which is also why I don't want to bring my car here for servicing!

We had a great experience at Hyundai. Referral from a family member to a nice gentleman named Audi :). Who then referee us to an ice Salesman named Derrick. We weren't sure if today would be the day to purchase a car but... we did. Derrick was very nice, even entertained Baby A while test driving the car. With a few conversations back and forth- we signed on the dotted line. Never had a Sante Fe before but the deal was good and the staff were extremely pleasant. We even one 600$ "dealership money" for their family and friends event draw. Would refer others!

When I first shopped for my car, the salesman was great at locating the exact make and model I wanted.  However, when I went to purchase it, I was left waiting for literal hours for the manager, who then tried to upsell me on unneeded features and extra warranties that I repeatedly said I didn't want.  He even tried to hide extra costs by saying "It'll cost the same, we'll just extend the payment period" when trying to add several thousand dollars to a $22k basic car.

The service desk promotes unneeded service, and when near the end of my warranty I said the manual shift linkage squeeked and there was noise coming from the front-left wheel, the noises were miraculously gone when I picked it up and I was billed $200 for inspection with 'no issues found'.

The noises both came back about 3 months later.

I compare this to the Leduc Ford dealership that my mother bought a car from, where the sales pitch was literally just "Okay, here's the price that was listed on the car" and we had the keys in under an hour.

Southtown also does a really shady 'customer survey' after service where people working the desk tell you that if you don't give 5 stars, it will affect them personally to guilt people into giving good in-dealership ratings.  Don't trust any reviews on their website.

In the 5years I have had my 2012 Hyundai Elantra, it has spent 6 weeks in the shop for repairs. Since the warranty expired two months ago, it has already been back to the shop for 2 more repairs.

I have been driving for 35 years and this is the worst experience I have ever had with a vehicle. I have been very clear with them for almost 3 years that I cannot believe the number of problems I am having with this car.

Sometimes, I have had to sit in the car with the mechanic or manager and ask how they don't hear the problem I am describing after they had told me they hear nothing.  Both times, they heard the problem when I was in the car with them.

Now, they have asked me if I would like to trade my car in and get another one.  I thought that was weird. I am not sure I would buy coffee from this company.

Overall terrible experience, from being mislead in the finance portion of the deal to not being given the proper paperwork. I don't regret the vehicle purchase itself the 2021 kona is great, and wade my sales person was very good to work with, but everything else was not a good experience at all. Would not recommend this dealership for a first time purchase of a new vehicle. Still have not received paperwork that I should have received without having to request more then one time.

Nope. 
Went here to cross shop for an SUV for my mother in law. She already had an 08 Tuscon that she loved, so she thought why not try a new one? It was awful. The experience with the dealership, the vehicle, everything. 
It must be something to do with the Go Auto umbrella. Not only do they delay getting you into a vehicle to even test drive it, all they want to know is your financial status, and your phone number. Why would you talk about finances first? Most people are there to cross shop, and deal with numbers later. Such a turnoff.

To be honest, Hyundai Southtown contain a lot of professional and friendly individuals, however for my experience there with Micheal Castro as a sales associate, The deal we worked out was no where near the total amount I had to pay (I had to pay an extra $2250). He is a great sales associate some may say and I would agree to a certain extent since I found his car knowledge to lack proficiency. In other words, he may know how to sale a car perhaps but can only sales talk you into purchasing one with very basic information about the car, which may portray him as a knowledgeable sales man. Quick tip: Ask for all the details up front with Micheal Castro (from my experience). Do not work out a deal before he shows you the AMVIC and made you aware of all the car conditions. That way, the deal may be reasoned efficiently. On the other hand, Genevieve's patience amazed me. Kudos to her. 
P.S. My experience may differentiate from some others and this is not to say that the salesman is a bad one. I am simply telling the truth. At the end of the day, he made the mistake and I still had to pay the extra $2250, which was not the deal we originally worked out. He did not advocate for me, regarding this extra amount I had to pay. That is what I find shameful.

I ordered from this place twice and was disappointed both times. The first time I order chicken finger platter and I got chicken nuggets instead. The second time I ordered the cheese burger which smelt amazing, but it was not done. And it was not like a decent burger patty, it was like something I buy from the store and put in the oven. How do you mess that up??? With the burger incident I called to get my money back, but I was told that it was not an option. They only offer more food not refunds....

This place is great. I work in the area on Saturdays and I always order from them. This pizza place GETS it!
1. Knows my info when I call
2. Always gets any special request correct. Never had an issue with an order not being exactly as I asked for it.
3. Nice amount of things to choose from
4. Big portions.
5. Great taste!!!
Will not go anywhere else!
Have had gyro, buffalo chicken salad, pizza, burgers, buffalo chicken cheesesteak. All great.

First of all the gmo wings are disgusting. Second of all they were cold like have been sitting in the fridge cold. My mini tacos were totally sitting for awhile cause they were rubbery. And don't get me started at the extremely rude person who took my orders. I politely asked for all flats or at least at many as they could give me since I'm not a fan of drums and don't like them nearly as much, the girl said "we don't do that they come in a bag" and then proceeded to give me 8 drums as if she couldn't of flipped the ratio. We live 2 blocks over and took about an hour to receive our food. This will be the last time I order from this establishment and it's a shame considering this has been my favorite pizza place since I moved into my apartment in January. There are plenty more places in the area save your time and gratitude for a place that will take pride in their food. I will also he calling in the morning to verbally complain. I don't want my money back. I don't want an apology. I want to just order food from a place that wants to make good food and provide for their community. Take my word that you'll be better off just making a meal at home and saving your money.

If you want a cheesesteak (as long as it's not chicken) it was pretty good. The buffalo chicken cheesesteak was mediocre at best though. We ordered cheese fries and they sent us regular fries. We called back for them to redeliver the cheese fries and they sent back cheese fries is that's what you could call it. There was literally like a teaspoon of cheese on them. That's it. 95% of them were dry as a bone, possibly out of spite. Idk. I would not recommend this place. Just order elsewhere to avoid disappointment.
Ordered online through seamless and gave simple directions. It came almost 45mins late & my throat swells when I eat cheese whiz ‍

This place sent us a menu so we ordered from them a couple times. However, the last time we ordered we got a call a half hour later saying they cancelled our order because we live too far away. Um, what? Why did you send us a menu? Why were we able to order before? No explanation, just a cancelled order a half hour after placing the order. When I placed the order I was even placed on hold so she could confirm we were within their range. They could have at least said they'd bring us our food this time but wouldn't be able to in the future. I asked for the manager to call me but of course he didn't. What made it worse was the order was for a pregnant woman and a bunch of construction workers who'd been working hard all day so everyone was crazy hungry and upset.

UPDATE:  They did deliver the correct pizza.  It was cold, hopefully it wasn't a pizza they got back from someone else.. we still aren't ordering from here ever. ORIGINAL MESSAGE: Thus is the 2nd time we ordered here and didn't get what we ordered and they refused to fix their mistake.  They lies both times stating we will get credit.  The new owners are dishonest and now the quality of the food socks.  Just like the other one, this place will go down soon. They 1st asked for the pizza back so, they are reusing the food.  In covid.  Never again go to COLONIAL 610-284-7811

If I can give this place less than 1 star I would. I just order food from there. They told me to pick it up in 20 min but when I get there the guy says someone had to go out and get ingredients to make my food but my fries were done.
