I said I wanted fresh fries if  I had to wait for my food and they said okay. When my sandwich was done they refused to make me fresh fries and attempted to give me the old ones anyway. After I waited all that time for my food. You can't tell a customer they have to take what you give them especially when your the one inconveniencing them to begin with.

Wanted to try a new spot. I'm a fries girl. Add mozzarella and I'll do a happy dance. 

Enjoyed the customer service and my food was done at the time shared. I enjoy that they offer deals and will try something different next time. Food was good. Pizza the next day is always good.
$14 for a salad and all I got was a handful of lettuce, no tomatoes, cucumbers. Just lettuce and 5 shrimp.

Decided to try somewhere new.
5:15 - order pizza, told 30 minutes
6:15 - call shop, asking where pizza is
6:25 - pizza arrives cold, called request hot pizza
6:45 - slightly warmer pizza arrives and we return ice pizza because owner wants it back(why?)
6:50 - eat pizza

Now maybe if it was really good pizza I would have let it slide, but it was lackluster at best. Delivery man was nice,which is the only good thing I can say about this experience.

I'm not sure what happened with Zesty Pizza.  It used to be a staple in the Lansdowne/Yeadon PA area.  Perhaps it still is for some, but for my family, we won't be ordering again.  The cheesesteaks are bread sandwiches.  If you want bread and no meat, order from Zesty or Italian Kitchen.  Both of these places went downhill.  Sadly places want to give you less food and either charge you the same or more.  I understand that these are tight times for everyone, but why risk losing customers?  Meet us halfway!  The woman who wrote the review about the poor excuse for a shrimp salad that Zesty sold her is utterly despicable.  Get it together Zesty.  You will be hanging by a thread soon.

Pizza was great but service unfortunately was not. After our food was delivered, nobody checked on us again. Did not ask how the food was, if we needed anything else, refills, etc. The staff was more concerned with a larger party that came in about 20 minutes after we did. We finally had to go to the kitchen to get our waitress after waiting 45 minutes just to get our check. I understand a large party takes up time and will bring more money, but please do not ignore your other patrons.

The pizza is actually really tasty! Probably the best pizza I've tasted in the area since I've been here. I would give 3.5 stars though based on the wait and the restaurant itself. The last time I ordered for pick up, I was told it would take about 30 minutes but in reality I waited an extra 20 minutes in the restaurant for my order to be finished. And there was only one other customer in the building. Also the inside is in terrible condition. Doesn't look clean or up to date, and made my wait in the store kind of uncomfortable. But the pizza makes up for it.

This place is okay enough that I keep coming back. But honestly I only come back is because out of the last dozen or so times only 1 pizza really wasn't good. I always get the Chicago style pizza. It's almost always really really good. I love the crust. And the toppings are always great. But you couldn't get me to eat there. I know it's an older building but it's just not the nicest. So I always order and pick up. And then there's the service. The service times are really horrible. When I call to order, I'm usually told on average 25 minutes. It has taken up to an hour and a half. It's so bad I know to take my time getting there to pick up my pizza. And then I still have to wait. The other day I waited almost a half hour past the time I was told. But the pizza's good.

We arrived to find sign on the door indicating it was reservation only, along with a phone number. We called for an immediate reservation, and were told which booth to sit in. We were told it would be a few minutes before someone could take our order. This was at 6:58 PM. At 7:15, another party walked in without a reservation. They were seated and a server greeted them and took their drink order. No one had yet been to our table. At 7:22 we waved down that server, who told us she was going to go talk to the chef.

At 7:32 a server came to take our drink order. No apology or acknowledgement that we'd been sitting there for 34 minutes. Someone else dropped off our drinks. 

At 7:42, the first server we flagged down came back to take our food order. I asked for dinner rolls, since this is a family favorite. We were given 4 rolls for 5 people. We played rock, paper, scissors to determine who would be left out.  
Drinks were empty for at least half the time we waited.

Our pizza came out. It was the wrong size. We had to wait AGAIN for the correct item to be remade. When we began to eat it, the center was cold.

They offered us 50% off our meal for the issues, which is why this isn't a 1 star review. We spent more than an hour waiting for staff to figure out who would serve us and waiting for them to correct the errors made. A manager NEVER came out to speak with us. I really want to support local businesses during this time, but this experience makes that very difficult.

Been here twice now and have had the New York Style pizza both times. The pizza tasted great with a crust that was both crunchy and doughy. The 20" pizza is huge!  The restaurant itself has some room to improve, but we ordered carry the second time to eat at home.
We were greeted rudely. The pizza was meh.  The dressing was decent.  We will not be going back.
Favorite pizza around. All the food is amazing. Service is ok and they probably barely passed the health code inspections but I look the other way because the food is so good

This was Talayna's. It's now Wagon Wheel. Nothing else has changed: Same ownership, same menu, same dive decor. 

We've enjoyed this place for years. New York, St. Louis, or Chicago deep dish style pies available at fair prices. Fresh rolls included with your pizza order. 

We had terrific service on a Friday night. It should have been: We were the only ones eating in though Wagon Wheel was doing a brisk business with pick-up orders.

We recently moved to the neighborhood and have been wanting to try some of the closest Mom and Pop restaurants. We gave this place a shot on a Saturday night with a large NY style one topping to go. The restaurant is fairly small and to dine in you'll need to set up a reservation as of July 2021. I'd imagine due to staffing/covid. The pizza was a little undercooked for my liking as it wasn't firm when folding the slice. But the taste was excellent. I dug the sauce a lot as it kind of hits most of the things I appreciate about NY slices I appreciate. Simple, not too sweet, not too thick, etc. My whole family loved it and we'll be going again.

Underrated pizza joint if you ask me! If you're a sucker for crust, this is the pizza for you- best crust ever (NY style can't speak for the STL style)! The salad dressing they make is also what makes the salads, seriously some good stuff, they also sell containers of it if you're interested! Onlyyyy downside is it takes awhile for the food to be made but well worth the wait :-)

This was our first time here & won't be back.  Had to call for reservations (at the door) was told to wait 3 minutes to clean a table off.  Another group was told to wait 15 minutes.  There was 1 family in the restaurant.  We were seated at a dirty table with no menu or drink order for 10 minutes.  We ordered pasta and NY pizza.  Bread came out just before our meal, it was ok.  Pizza was NOT NY style, hubs is from the shore in NJ.  We had NY pizza in feb, so we have good comparisons.  The crust was sooo heavy and was very rustic.  Seemed like it was made By a newbie.  Only way to call this NY style is all mozzarella and cut into wedges, not squares.  Only 1 server for 2 families and she needed help.  We were hoping to find a good place to get NY pizza, we will keep looking.

I ordered a spaghetti with meatballs platter and it was so bland that it reminded me of hospital food. Sauce was brown, not red. Meatballs were frozen style. Just very bad for the price. So disappointing.

In the interest of full disclosure, I WILL say that my turkey sandwich was pretty tasty. The fries were just okay, as some were burnt, and I think they had freshly washed the lettuce, as my sandwich roll was soggy in spots, and had a bit of a drip when I held it. Still, tasty and tasted very fresh. BUT, bring cash, or just avoid this place. Im kinda upset with how my lunch scenario went. My lunch special came out to 8.65 and I only had $8 in cash. So, like everywhere these days, there was a $10 minimum for credit card purchases. (FYI, that practice is illegal if a place accepts any card more than AmEx....), so I bought a piece of cake that I didn't want, to meet the minimum. My new total; $13. Huh? The freaking slice of cake was 3.50, there was a ADDITIONAL 75 cent charge for using the card, and THEN they rounded up from my total of 12.90 to $13. THEN, and this is the kicker, my special came with a can of soda, which they didn't have, so they tried to charge me an ADDITIONAL dollar for a 16 oz substitute. I had already paid at that point, so I'm assuming it was the only reason they didn't make a big stink about it. I PROMISE that unless I have cash, I will NEVER eat at Napolis again.

Thus guy offered me a job at 5.50$ an hour like i m a fugitive and it's 1964 and he said I want to see yr face now come here only for few minutes to remember the face with the number like he will send a hit out if I alert" the world about it..he needs a slap that ain't even inuff for gas to get to him not to mention all my qualifications witch are way over qualified my background might not be the best but if ima go back to slave work specially a cash job best believe u better pay me worth it...not t mention I won't be getting taxes back not that I ever really did regardless but paying into yr social security helps...some what that's a insult and a half someone has to tell this guy it's 2017 never in my life I heard of that low a salary geez ...sucks the three days four hours is OK with me but from a 14.50$ an hour job to 5.50$ an hr ain't happening I'll stay home and ride the sofa

One star because a half a star option is unavailable.  I ordered a special of 2 large pies for $14.95. It arrived promptly after 30 minutes. When the delivery driver arrived I was surprised to see that the total jumped to $18.50 with no additional toppings.  When I went to open the box I immediately knew from looking at the crust that this establishment uses cheap frozen dough. The cheese and sauce were lacking in flavor. The pizza was disgusting to say the least. Beware of these lackluster pizza impostors.
Cheese steaks are good after me & my husband ordered from every pizzeria possible in this neighborhood. Im still discovering more but so far theyre cheese steaks are the best

First time here. Pricey for fast food. Courteous service, extra long wait  (25 minutes) because they got are order wrong. Fish was ok, I got the chicken tenders. I got very sick. Total food poisoning. I know it was this food, it was the only thing I ate all day. I wouldn't recommend. Very disappointed.

I decided to try this place since it has a new name and under new ownership. I got the 1 piece of catfish and 3 wing combo. It comes with 2 pieces of white bread and fries and a soda.  Wings were good,  would eat again. Fried nice, not much batter. Fish didn't taste like catfish...maybe Swai. And it was very salty...will not eat again. Fries were good. I didn't eat the bread.

I called in my order because my drive was gonna be 20min or so. Got the 3pc fried catfish that came with fries & 2 white slices. Order was fresh & hot, fish was a nice size crunchy & delish. Fries were good too, not bland but nothing special. Hit the spot for my "I want fried fish but don't feel like making it" mood. I would make a suggestion to open bag & poke holes in container to keep a crisp on the food. I believe mine held up well because I did that. I did order the pizza rolls but it was not in my bag. I went back just in time while they were closing and got a refund with no problems or stank attitudes. Young lady in drive thru was cool.

This restaurant has changed so many times that it didn't faze me when it changed again, I really didn't even pay attention until my Husband brought some fish home one day
I was pleasantly surprised. Now this is a fast food establishment not a sit down restaurant, so for this particular category, this place is pretty good!! 
Their fried Whiting and Catfish are good, and the Whiting are big pieces not the skinny pieces you get at other places. You get 5 large pieces of Whiting, fries, 2pc bread, and soda for $10. They provide all the condiments.
They have a variety of condiments and hot sauces.
They also have fried chicken, we only tried the chicken wings, which are whole wings
The sides are typical pre-frozen pre-made but the french fries are delicious!
The only suggestion I have is that I would like my fish fried a little longer so they are a bit crisper but this is a good spot to eat

This is the reason why they closed the first time. Expensive, drive through is a joke, food cold and super greasy and the girl had and attitude Because I waited 7minutes in drive through. Drive pass and go up the street to Popeyes

Wow. Found a coupon in the mail and figured give this new jawn a look see. So glad I did. We had wonderful service when I went. The fish and food was not only a bigger portion that I was expecting but also very tasty as everything was fresh, cooked upon order. Catfish was bomb. Flounder good too. Unbelievable for the price. Def going back.

Fresh food bc it's cooked after you order. You'll have to wait a few, but it's worth it. They bring the fresh n tasty food to your vehicle while wearing masks.... and you get a lot of food....get your money's worth
This place was absolutely amazing. Good and fresh. Worth the money and friendly. I def recommend. I had the catfish, 10 pc shrimp and hush puppies....unreal. And I know good food.

I went on a Sunday, and they were shortstaffed (just one guy there!) but he worked his butt off working the kitchen and was very friendly. 

I think they need to dial their food in a bit more. Reviews have been pretty spotty and I think I have to agree. The fish isn't quite there, however the sides are fantastic. 

This is a great unique new spot and I wish them the best of luck!

So the reason they get a 3 here is their process really sucks!   I wanted to try them today for the first time knowing it was a drive thru and it was recommended to call and order ahead.  Well , you can't order ahead because they don't Answer the phone !  I tried for 10 minutes to call. Nothing but busy signal , then number not I. Service , then just random messages about the number. Ok. So I go online through yelp and place the order. Well on there the prices are like $2 more and .75c to$1 more for sides. Which is crazy since I'm picking it up. So I placed the order and figured I'd deal with that when I arrive for my order.  The young man at the window says he was the manager but had no idea why the prices were different and recommend not using it???? What??? And he stated maybe the owner knows ????? Who is the owner ??? Because you should have rectified this at the window since it was a pick up order.  
Anyway. The food was good , love the chicken and the fish was also good. Just can't order it until you get there then pull over and wait like 15 min for the order. 
Needs a new system where you can order ahead and be charged correctly when you are picking it up.

Mom took me here after having been here a few times with friends. She enjoys it. The portions are big enough for her where the leftovers are a late-night snack or lunch for her the next day. It wasn't too bad. I may visit again.
It's kind of expensive but fish is good and fries . Bread is soggy and nasty .  The cashier was very nice but the place itself can do much better and the sides are not that interesting to pic from

This is the Fish Combo-2 pc Flounder 10 pc. Shrimp And fries...when I say this is deliciousness, I mean the flounder has a cornmeal breading that is perfectly fried to order and taste beautiful. Then you have the shrimp with a light panko breading seasoned with herbs and devined, yes they cleaned them from the black vein ! The fries have a light crispy taste to them. They are similar but seasoned better than KFC's new fries.  You'll have to wait in the assigned parking spot, but SO WORTH IT! Or call ahead?! And finally but certainly not least they had the prettiest, smiling cashier. Who was so patient with all my questions, taking my order Thru drive thru. My receipt says her name was Lashawna. Hopefully that's her. She had the cutest Poms  Poms hair do. I even called the restaurant and  raved to the manager. Welcome to the neighborhood JZ's Fish Wing Chicken. Please keep up the good work and you'll have even more success! ‼

I am just as shocked at anyone that I am giving a "fast food" place 5 stars, but it earned every one.  I've seen this in online passing a few times and had it in the back of my mind as a place I had to check out.  With everything going on as of late, curfews, shut downs, its hard to gauge hours of a lotof places that say they are open but aren't so it took me a bit to get here finally, but I did.  I pulled into the drive thru which had a large menu but you order at the window, which made it easier and more personable. Ordering went smoothly, I went with both wings and fish.  They make to order, which I was hoping, it was a short wait, you are directed after ordering to a numbered spot and your order is brought out to you.  My order was packed perfectly, even down to the extra sauces requested. They delicious smell peeked through the foil pan and into the car on my short ride home.. I unpacked and was pleasantly surprised everything looked great smelled great and tasted great!  they only really had fried offerings so I stuck with fish and chicken no sides except an order of hush puppies and fries came with the wings... everything was A+++.  I'm so glad to have an affordable place like this so close by with great hours, everyone in the house enjoyed.  Only thing I regret is not visiting sooner, will definitely be back soon & often!

Had chicken wings 10 with fries and okra. The okra was pretty good. Wings were very small and cooked a little too hard for me, you know when you can't warm up the next day. Fries were okay. Overall a 3.

My husband has adopted this location as his fav and brought our family along today to enjoy. It's clean, with new signage and the food is tasty. I ordered. The catfish and my daughter had three wings. Of course my fork is always in ready to taste. The fish is previously frozen but done well considering. It was light and flaky perfectly fried to a light brown golden crisp. The chicken is well done crispy and good. There price is not bad. My 3 piece catfish, fries, drink, 2 slices of bread was a little more than $13. 
So far I've been here a total of 3 times. They are consistently good. I definitely recommend them. Yummmmy
The whiting had a lot of bones. That is not okay for a restaurant. I would understand 1/2 but this was crazy. Also we got a fried leg platter and they were pink on the inside.

I couldn't resist I bought the 3piece catfish meal and 5 wings. The wings were almost like homemade. Yay!  The catfish was light, tasty, the food didn't take long to be made, seasoned perfectly. Fresh tasting at a reasonable price. The lemonade was so good. It was a frosty lemonade. I rate it as yummmmmm! Overall if you do not want to cook and bust those suds then this is a really good option without breaking the bank. Bon a petite!

VERY GOOD.
I ordered a 3pc whiting/10 pc shrimp combo with fried okra instead of fries.My bf ordered 10 pc scallops with onion rings instead of fries.As people mentioned before, its a drive thru place where they bring your paid order to your car.
Worth every penny..food was fresh, hot and the portions are good, came with everything I needed except lemon.My bf LOVED his scallops as he isn't really lover of heavy breading.I tried his scallops and they were very tasty..buttery even
The fish and shrimp were standard but tasty and we both really liked our sides.
Will definitely be back to try the other menu items.

Small and new, don't expect 5-star decor and wait staff but you will bet superb traditional Ethiopian food.   We ordered a wide range of items from fried lamb, stewed chicken stew to the vegetarian platter and everything in between.  The food was on par with what you could find at the best Ethiopian Restaurants in the big city.  The gem was the Shiro Wat (warm and spicy chickpea dip) that was the best that we had ever had!  This was one of the only Ethiopian restaurants that made Ethiopian tea the right way with a pinch of hot pepper and hand-roasts Hararr coffee for their coffee ceremony.   The balance between heat and spice was spot-on for the western palate and they gave us a little extra berbere spice to sprinkle on top!   The most amazing is the freshly made (daily) injera flatbread that elevates the sourdough to a new level!  We will be be going back.

Delicous, good value, fresh
Great Ethiopian restaurant, the food is freshly cooked and the injera bread is an unique taste with the meat and veggies entrée.

I really like the atmosphere in here. Nice decor and music. Loved the coffee ceremony set up at the enterance.  Service was nice but really slow and I am not sure why. We were one of two tables there. 

Food was good and the general usual for Ethiopian cuisine. We ordered the vegatarian combo and Special Kitfo.  We also ordered the peanut soup.

We found the peanut soup was  too sweet and I didn't finish mine. The rest of the food was really good though. I especially loved the Yesimir wot which is spicy red lentils. My husband loved the special kitfo. 

It  was great, but I am not sure based on price whether it was either it was better of worse than the other Ethiopian places we went.

Oh and give the spiced tea a try. Although it came almost after half our meal was done.

This place was delicious. We tired the Shiro Wat and the Vegetarian Combo. I've never tried Ethiopian food before (I know I'm late to the game) and I really loved it! You don't get a lot of places that add collard greens to their food and I had no idea it was a staple in Ethiopian food.

With our Shiro Wat we had Injera Bread which is a sour fermented bread that they make in Ethiopia. They wrapped the dish in the bread! We also had the vegetable Sambusa which was amazing!

I would definitely eat here again and I'm so glad I tried the food!
The best Ethiopian restaurant. We went as a family and we had good time good location a lot of parking very clean staff are perfect

The absolute best chocolate mousse-like dessert I have ever had! The counter guy said the chef doesn't over-sugar his amazing creations, and he was right. I'm diabetic, so I thought this splurge would knock my blood sugar reading into the sky, but it actually stayed within my green zone. I just wish their coffee was richer.

It's a new neighborhood cafe, they served great selection of pastries, gelatos and of course coffees 
Everything is freshly made there
They have outdoor sitting
The owner is a nice guy too!
Good to know there is new local coffee shop to go to!

I was so excited to see this cozy cafe open up in my neighborhood. For a long time, we had nothing like this place. The food is delicious, service staff helpful and a good place to see your neighbors go by. However, very hard to find a place to sit these days. I am not sure, whether the owners intended this place to be a study hall?  Most of the time the tables are taken  by one person, studying or doing homework. These individuals sit in the same place for hours on end.  I guess, we will have to continue to go to other neighborhoods to have a cup of coffee with a friend and neighbor. So sad..

I'm visiting from out of town and staying in Belgravia, so I decided to get my morning coffee from this place. It was quite busy, but this might be because it's the only cafe in the area. I ordered a cappuccino and was surprised when the barista handed me a large paper cup filled to the BRIM with milk. It was like an XL glass of hot milk. Not even close to a capp, which is 1 part espresso, 1 part milk, 1 part foam. I couldn't even taste the espresso. Anyway, it was disappointing and to top it off there was nowhere to sit and drink my huge glass of hot milk.

Really nice spot for a good coffee and a dessert or some lunch. Service was friendly and the place is decorated nicely. Had an espresso (they serve Roasti Coffee) and an eclair that was divine! Wanted a croissant because I heard they're really good, but they were sold out. I'll have to get there earlier next time.

If you like pancakes this is the place to go but if you like breakfast food not so good. Potatoes weren't cooked enough and sausage links seemed under cooked. The pancakes had a large amount of fruit and seemed good. I was with a friend and she lived the pancakes.

The nutella crepes we ordered was on the eggy side, and they could have pound and tenderize the meat of the country fried steak more. Veggie omelete was decent and so is the hashbrowns. They are fairly new so hoping its just growing pains and they can eventually work out some of the kinks.
Small locally owned breakfast/ lunch restaurant,  located in former Hella's Greek restaurant. Basic diner food,  large portions,  reasonable prices.

Absolutely horrible.  I got the southwestern sunrise skillet, I substituted the chicken for steak and it was beef jerky! No flavor on the rest of the skillet and in fact it was missing some of the other ingredients. They also don't carry yellow mustard.

Great breakfast/brunch! It was a weekday at noon, over the holiday week, so the place had plenty of seating open. The menu was perfect diner food. The pecan and chocolate pancakes were both a hit at our table as was the Belgian waffle. The waffle was part of a combo, with two eggs and sausage. The eggs were good and a generous portion. The two sausage links were not bad. The side of hashbrowns were a very large serving. The chorizo burrito was the favorite - flavorful and large. Coffee was hot and quickly refreshed. We were a party of four and unanimously agree to return. The only suggestion I have is to change the color scheme: gray and black, to almost anything else, as it made the ambiance a bit sad on a grey and gloomy day.
Service was prompt and the prices were reasonable. I will definitely return.
Just tried this for first time. They have been open a month at the old Hella's spot. Big portions at good prices. Really enjoyed my chocolate chip pancakes! Check them out.
Delicious!! Unsuspecting little gelato place. I had the Nutella crunch, which was delicious. I never would have thought to combine those ingredients. I will be back!!!
I got the peanut butter gelato and it was so good!! I would definitely recommend it. Had a lot of flavor and was smooth. It was also cutely decorated. Would recommend!

We love this gelato, especially the peanut butter  gelato and the affigato with chocolate gelato. The sorbets could use more intensity of flavor. And, at least tonight, the music was so loud that we almost left without placing our order, which we had to almost scream in order to be heard. If they improve these issues, Iesoecially the loud music, I will submit a new review with a higher rating.

We didn't realize this little gelato place was even a thing until we purchased a Groupon. I actually have been to Ariano before for dining under the stars but that was before they added this on. The girl running the gelato section told me it's been there for about a year. 

It was a lot nicer inside than I anticipated. There were bar stools up against the wall/windows and there were also a couple of tables...one big one. You can have Ariano food served there. That seemed odd to me. Personally, I wouldn't want to dine at that table where people are in and out buying gelato. But that's me. 

The girl running the gelato counter was extremely nice. She had great customer service. She explained how everything worked, that the printed menu wasn't always up to date because a lot of the gelato is seasonal and changes often but you can add a shot of espresso OR a shot of liqueur to any of the gelatos. She said we could order a single scoop, a double scoop or a "home made" which was a triple scoop...you could combine any flavors. 

We were able to try as many flavors as we wanted before making our final decision. I was shocked but I actually liked the hazelnut better than the Nutella crunch...and I am a BIG Nutella fan! The cherry amaretto was good but I wouldn't get it again. The hazelnut was definitely my favorite. My man got pistachio and Oreo, both of which he enjoyed. I love that the gelato was nice and cold. I've been to places where the place isn't cold and the gelato itself isn't cold. I was happy to have a nice, cold gelato!

We took them to go. Service was quick. She did explain to us though that she makes the desserts for Ariano as well so sometimes it gets backed up if people are waiting for gelato and servers are waiting for desserts. 

Cute little establishment, clean interior, delicious gelato and great service! We will return and I highly recommend other people give it a try! I'm glad they had a Groupon available so I was able to be introduced to its existence.

One drawback...I really needed to use the lavatory but there weren't any located on this side, I would have had to go to the main restaurant side and I felt weird doing that so I waited until we got home.
It's a diner that looks like an indian or thai restaurant. That said the food is good and the prices are as well. I'd take a shot at it
Somehow, the ghetto has moved to a single location in upper Gwynedd.  Avoid at all cost if this continues.

Staff was nice, food was mediocre and boring.....big menu though .... service was terrible. Not much else to say, this place was less than memorable even for bad reasons. Its not the worst but its really not that good....at all.

The mystery of Clubhouse Too continues. Back when the 'Astor Place' opened it was fantastic. The food was good, the bar was packed, and the owner had high standards. Now? Its dreadful. I made the mistake of going there with my girlfriend for breakfast. Her meal was made wrong, no service to replenish drinks, and they were almost out of syrup which i found out after asking 3 times. The service is terrible, the food is bland, the bar is a ghost town, its dirty, and the dollar hungry owners have no standards. Save yourself and go somewhere else.

Solid 24hour diner, back in business after the extended Sumneytown Pike closing. Average to above-average food and rooms. On our last visit, they had signs that their (new?) patio was open for the season.

Taken over in late May the Clubhouse Too is working hard to correct the issues that were there. The quality of the food has improved over the last few weeks, a new larger breakfast menu has come out, and the place is brighter and cleaner. Try the specials on the whiteboard and a canoli for dessert.
Brendan is an awesome bar tender who always makes sure the customers have a god time. Great place to hang out.

New place on the West End side of downtown. Delicious and fresh! We tried the Mango Passion and Detox juice. Both were very fresh and plentiful. It was early so it wasn't busy. It was fully staffed and everyone was friendly and helpful. I will certainly be back.
We had an awesome breakfast at Grain and Berry! The smoothies were perfect! It was so delicious we returned a second time the following day.

Had a delicious smoothie at Grain and Berry (the Health Nut) - I will be back to try the açaí bowls and other things on the menu. The location is a bit hard to see, on the side of the Moxy hotel--but worth finding!

We stopped at Grain & Berry yesterday for an early lunch.  My son works there and he wanted to introduce us to his boss and let us see how good the food was! He was especially excited because I often have a difficult time finding food since I'm gluten free, vegetarian/pescatarian and have a citrus allergy.  But the food was very complimentary to my dietary needs.  The atmosphere was very cool and clean.  They followed the Covid guidelines by having everyone wear their masks. The staff was also compliant by wearing gloves and masks. 

The food was delicious!  I wish we had one in Greenville,SC!! You will definitely enjoy the food here!

Great Experience. Even though they were slammed l, every item that I ordered was made to perfection. He even offered an extra for our during their busy time. I'll recommend this to anyone looking for fresh and healthy foods. Shoutout to the owner and the guy with locs.
It's amazing! I am addicted to the pitaya bowl and finally they have peanuts instead of tree nuts! This bowl makes me feel good and tastes amazing! A weekly treat for me!

hands down the BEST juice bar in Nashville!   You can't go wrong with literally anything on their menu.  Banana splits are so creative and filling!  The Thanks a Brunch quesadilla is so delicious and will fill you up.  The Healthy Elvis smoothie is my favorite!  Their staff is soooo GREAT!!   Every other juice bar staff if either rude or slow or a combination.   so thankful Grain & Berry is in Nashville to raise the standard of these local juice/smoothie bars

My friends and I ordered a few smoothies via DoorDash while spending the weekend in Nashville. I was very impressed by how fresh everything was and how well everything traveled to us. I am used to delivery from other smoothie places resulting in watered down smoothies, but everything was perfect for us! They seem to have locations in Florida and Tennessee, so I am hopeful that one day, one might pop up in Georgia!

Excellent fruit bowls 

Dragon fruit was great so was the Açaí 

It's all fresh stuff and high quality 

Recommend getting peanut butter & honey along with strawberry blueberry kiwi pineapple and banana 

I'm not a mango fan but they have quality mango 

Haven't tried the Apple or kale

Smoothies are also good

Great establishment! My fiancé and I love açaí bowls and have had our fair share of them. We love grain and berry because they have OPTIONS for the base. Most açaí bowl restaurants only have the regular açaí base. Awesome customer service and quality food. Ignore the 2 or 3 bad reviews.

I hate writing reviews like this... but I am beyond disappointed with my order from Grain and berry. I bought over $60 worth of food and drinks and both my kids couldn't even finish there meals. All our avocado toast were terrible!!! The avocado had to be a spread (pre-made) and our eggs where over cooked and cold. They husband and I got poached eggs and this is what we got.
The establishment was clean and staff was nice... but I do not recommend eating here.

I've seen Grain and Berry on Uber Eats so I thought I'd give them a shot for breakfast. Through the Uber Eats app, I ordered the Egg & Avocado Toast and Healthy Elvis Smoothie.

What was given to me was Avocado Bread with Scrambled Eggs... yuck. While this may not sound like a big deal, if I order "toast" I expect it to in fact be toasted. Why would anyone on planet Earth want breakfast BREAD not toasted?? Also, the fact that there wasn't an option to choose what egg you wanted seemed silly to me. I assume avocado toast comes with a fried egg (there was a photo on the app that showed a fried egg but it now shows scrambled eggs). A suggestion for management is to add egg preferences on their Uber Eats app - fried egg, over easy, sunny side up, poached, scrambled, etc. I was going to eat it anyways but after traveling the avocado had made the bread mushy and it was not edible (hence another reason you want TOAST).

The "Healthy" Elvis tasted like a milkshake..... While I love a sweet smoothie, I want it to have a smoothie consistency and I wasn't a fan of their smoothie. 

I may give it another chance in person, but was super disappointed. Avocado toast is pretty simple to master and theirs was all wrong.
The acai bowls are the BEST I've ever had! And the owner is the absolute kindest! So glad to see this place in Nashville!

I had heard good things about grain and berry, so I decided to try it out. I ordered two açaí bowls, which first of all, were pretty overpriced at $12.50 each. Nonetheless, I had high hopes that my investment would be worth it. I asked for 1/2 banana on both of the bowls, which to me, was a simple instruction- both bowls were served to me with way too much banana. The bowls also had way too much granola to even taste the fruit or açaí at all. Furthermore, the açaí and the fruit were very mediocre quality and there was very little of it. I will never be returning this to place. Frutta bowls on elliston place is much better and way more reasonably priced. The employees at grain and berry were nice, but the food was not nearly worth the cost (also the building was so hot on the inside) I don't even think I would eat it for free.

Worst experience I have ever had with trying to improve my diet. My doctor told me to go on a Vegon diet. To improv my dieabetes and low and behold I was instantly reminded of why I have NEVER been a vegon. First of all, the granola got caught in my windpipe I think it was undercooked.  My wife's labia minora was SWOLLEN SHUT upon one bite of this Acaee. DO NOT EVER eat in this establishment. I think It is run by republicans

First time ordering from here via Postmates.  My husband really liked his food, and I really enjoyed mine...until I found a hair in my meal about halfway through.  Completely disgusted and turned off from trying here again.  I don't like to write negative reviews...but I'm hoping that management will see this and implement some positive changes that result in more hygienic practices.

I did finish the smoothie that I ordered (the Green Wisperer).  I believe it was made with fresh ingredients, but the taste of ginger was overpowering.

im a fan for the most part. to be honest, the food is a little overpriced and sometimes it feels like forever waiting for a smoothie. but the food all tastes really good and it's a very nice atmosphere which i believe makes it worth it and it's why i keep coming back here. i mean, where else can you get delicious and fresh fruits plated in a very pleasing way?? HOWEVER lately there's been a few minor problems, such as my friends finding a hair on her toast or plastic in his smoothie. luckily no one got sick but hopefully this place can be a little more cautious
They have the best acai bowls in Nashville! I'm obsessed with their bowls and smoothies!

Another GREAT smoothie bowl shop which may be my new favorite in all of Nashville. The store front is very clean and has plenty of indoor seating. The lightening is perfect for foodie pictures and they have a cute mural which makes the perfect back drop. Their menu is extensive - they have everything from smoothie bowls and toasts to quesadillas and banana splits. I ordered the classic grain & berry bowl with an açaí base. I loved how it came in such a cute glass. The actual smoothie part is in a plastic bowl that can easily be removed from the glass. There are SO many toppings which is both good and bad. I love all the toppings but it felt like I was just eating toppings for a long while before I finally reached any of the smoothie part.

Super disappointed I just ordered via Uber eats. It doesn't look like they added spirulina which I paid extra for and I asked for granola on the side and didn't get it which is basically my favorite part.

Phone number on the receipt is invalid so can't even call to let them know.

I ordered the Keto bowl and a  "Turn the Beet Around" juice via Postmates. The juice was good and the combination of ingredients worked well. The bowl however, was really disappointing. The base was guacamole and it was very obvious that the guac was the cheap premade guac that doesn't taste very good and I suspect is made with very few real avocados. Unfortunately the cherry tomatoes were also not at the peak of freshness and were limp and tasted old. The rest of the ingredients were okay but the bowl in general was severely lacking in flavor (even salt wouldn't made a significant improvement). I love all of these ingredients separately but together they made for a mushy, unsatisfying bowl. I think fresher ingredients would help but I think some nuts or seeds are also needed for texture.  For a $12.75 bowl I would absolutely expect fresh ingredients so I'm pretty disappointed in this and I won't be ordering again.

The quality of the salads are horrible. You have no choice in the type of greens that you get there. On top of that the salads I know cheaper than Honeygrow or Sweetgreen. If you were coming here and trying to decide whether or not you should keep walking towards Chick-fil-A... definitely keep walking. The turkey chili is literally disgusting. It's definitely worse than canned chili. The turkey chili and a salad kind of gave me that feeling that was soap contamination.  Stay away. Saladworks rebranding is superficial. Don't expect a good salad.
All three of the ladies work behind the counter had no us how to make one of the sandwiches on their menu. Finally, the male staff starred to make it and it literally took 10 mins to make a sandwich.
Not nearly as fresh as it used to be. The prices are high for the limp lettuce. Still the best "healthy" option at the Willow Grove food court.

One star because none is not an option. Stopped before Christmas shopping. Ordered a chicken parm panini. Waited half an hour and when it finally came out, the chicken was not very cold and the bread was burned...REALLY?  Who left these two idiots in charge?  When I took it back they ask, do you want me to do it over?  Yeah, because you're the only place to eat and I have another half an hour to kill...uh, NO. Give me my money and I'll go to another shop. Worse salad works EVER.

This Salad Works has the worst customer service. I have been to several different locations and have even worked at one for a short time. Never at any of the other locations have I encountered such rude employees.  The eye-rolls and annoyed demeanor and tone are just some of the things you will encounter here. As someone who works in retail, great customer service is key. This Salad Works is the closest to my job. I have given them several chances to change my mind about this location, but every time I go the experience is worse. This time I didn't even allow them to finish making my salad before leaving. I do not recommend this location to anyone. The owners need to hire an entire new team.

I just had the worst salad works lunch of my life. I ordered two Sophis Salads to go with Avocado and the Vegetarian Chilli. The chilli was STILL CONDENSED and completely disgusting, the chicken in my salad tasted funny and was rubbery and now my stomach hurts, and to top it all off, the avocado was DARK BROWN and I had to pick it off of both salads when I arrived home before eating. 

I bought this salad at 3:00 pm when the store was not busy and I was their ONLY customer at the time. This makes me upset because I am an extremely busy person and I was counting on them to make me two quality salads and a soup that I could grab quickly to bring home to my husband but instead we both had a disgusting late lunch and now my husband is in the bathroom because his stomach feels funny.
I always stop to grab a salad here when I'm at the mall. Love their portions and the fresh ingredients. Very consistent with the service.

I looked at the reviews and still went because it was closer. So I have no one to be mad at but myself. Salad was horrible. Was not fresh, they lacked my sides I normally put on my salad and really just a waste of my money.

I have always gone to salad works for a good hearty salad, but never again! I stopped by the willow grove mall food court to pick up a decent salad and what I got was a disgrace! Nearly 10$ for a few pieces of lettuce, drenched in dressing, I got more crappy topping than actual lettuce! And the ladies behind the counter, the attitude, don't even get me started. Already over priced but this is just unacceptable, will never go to any of these places again! Oh kudos to shrinking the bowl, but not the price! Here's a pic of what I got!

Called today to place a catering order for a lunch meeting and they refused my business.

'Sorry we won't take orders over the phone'

Enjoy not receiving my $200 order and negative review

Just ordered two salads, two soups and a kids meal for delivery that cost me $60.00.  My salad had limp and frozen, wet lettuce with two small cold chicken pieces for my crispy chicken.  My kids meal of crispy chicken, roll, oranges and grapes came with two small chicken pieces like they put on the salad, cold with bread crumb crumbs.  The little mandarin oranges pieces and two grapes, cut up.  My son's salad was so cold from being frozen that he had to let it warm up before he could eat the limp lettuce.  We are thankful for the two soups because that's what we ate from our order.  Never again.

As someone who has visited many of Salad Works' locations, this one always has the worst customer service. I used to frequent this location, as I work in the area. I have seen many employees rotate through this location, but one in particular has always been there. She is always nasty, throws your items in the bag, and looks miserable. Because I love the food I would always ignore this associate but after today, I will no longer eat at this location.

I am so happy to see this location has reopened and I will share my thoughts from our dinner.  First, the service and menu are excellent - the decor is great ( a bit loud for my taste) and clean!  The food was good and has some opportunities ( my definition) for improvement.  I had the Spinach Gnocchi which was wonderfully light, but a bit lacking in taste.  The marinara is also light, good, and could use a bit more punch.  The branzino and veal dishes are also equally good and a little blander than we like.  Everything was served beautifully.  Portions are very generous!  All in all, a very good experience and we will be back.  I just would like to see a bit more flavor and sizzle in the taste department.  I want the new owners to succeed and thrive!

How are there not more reviews on this gem of a very local feel BYOB restaurant.  What a find! 

Calamari was perfectly cooked. 
I had the pesto stuffed cheese ravioli over a tomato sauce which was super tasty.  We had a couple of deserts that we all loved.  

I'm struggling to remember all of the dishes we had as I probably had too much wine.  What I can say is we were raving about the food.  

Our waiter was the biggest disappointment.  He has been there only a month which I'm ok with, but he lacked basic waiter skills. Not going to get into the details, but they should work with him. 

Regardless, I will definitely be back!!

Stopped in today and was greeted by the lovely owner, Cucina. Not only is she vibrant and attentive, but her hospitality goes well above and beyond what I'm looking for in a restaurant. Their food is another staple as I can't stop thinking about the bread topped with oil, mozzarella, red peppers, and spices. Next was the sweat potato gnocchi, and was quite literally the best I've ever had. The sauce is everything you'd want in a dish and the gnocchi's are tender and delicious. 
Anyone looking to enjoy a casual dinner, or a night out with wonderful Italian food, Cucina Maria is the place to be. Couldn't be happier leaving after our first time there!

We stopped by Cucina Maria today for lunch and plan to return soon for dinner. This restaurant was previously known for many years as Cucina Forte which closed last year. Maria Forte sold the restaurant to her chief cook (Juana Franco) and her husband who opened their updated restaurant on 6/1/21. I had previously written a review for the old restaurant (Cucina Forte). I can now confidently say that Juana has updated the menu and the results are better than the original.

For lunch today, my wife had a succulent salad, a broccoli rabe side and the fabulous ricotta gnocchi's with marinara sauce (which are better than the original version). I had homemade fettuccini with meat sauce which tasted like my Italian grandmother would make from scratch in NYC sixty years ago. 

In the Covid time we currently live in, it is amazing to see a family trying to start a new restaurant.

The food is fresh, tasty and the service and the family involved are a treasure.

First experience was treacherous in that there wasn't one. I called ahead to make sure they were opened and I went there with my 80-year-old mother for lunch. Upon arrival, one of the bespectacled workers was lying on the floor between the kitchen and the dining room and the other was sitting at a table folding napkins. The one folding napkins quietly tried to get the bespectacled boys attention to let him know there were customers. Upon being alerted but not knowing we were there and while no one else was in the restaurant, the boy with glasses still while lying down on the floor yelled out what do you fucking want! My mother and I were horrified and upon saying that the kid leaned up from where he was to a sitting position and saw us and said oh yeah we can't help you my mother is out right now and she's the one that cooks so there's no one to cook. I was a palled and I thought to myself lock the goddamn door if the cook is gone at a restaurant rather than having a worker and an ingrate sitting there playing with themselves there's nothing better than to say to customers then what do you fucking want. Perhaps this is for hiring and the cook is excellent but I'm a little ashamed to even go back.

Cucina Maria is a unique pleasure in Philadelphia's Bella Vista neighborhood, which we could have lost were it not for owner/chef Juana Franco. It was previously known as Cucina Forte, until the previous owner closed during Covid. Luckily, Juana took it over, and more luckily, she was the previous chef for decades. That means the menu we've come to know and love will continue. 
As Italian Americans, my wife and I attest to the quality and authenticity of the fare. The pastas are particularly excellent, and Juana offers a variety. All are prepared exquisitely, with a good mouth feel and suitable sauces. the agnolotti alla pesto, a crescent-shaped ravioli filled with pesto in a tomato basil cream sauce, was exquisite in taste, preparation and presentation.
Non-pasta offerings are also excellent. I had the calamari appetizer , and it was grilled to perfection. The Veal Saltimbocca, sautéed in a wine and sage cream sauce, was generous and flavorful, tasting as though it was prepared seconds before reaching my table. Others had the grilled salmon served over a bed of spinach, which was equally tasty.
Vegetables are cooked crispy and served healthfully. 
Prices are all reasonable for the quality, and being a BYOB, makes Cucina Maria especially well priced. This restaurant is an example of the small eateries that make the Philly scene so great and fun. I encourage folks to come out and enjoy this treat. Help keep them in business.

The best meal I've had in years!  The ricotta gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce was divine.  Light and creamy and delicious.  The sachetti with bolognese was fantastic.  We didn't have a single item we didn't like.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I was led back to the kitchen to tell the owner how wonderful the meal was.  She is back there by herself, cooking all of the meals.  Excellent food, reasonably priced.  We'll be back!

Great neighborhood gem. The marinara sauce is incredible and hits the spot. The grilled calamari was fantastic....the Italian menu is very mixed and has something for everyone. Service is attentive and fun-loving. Highly encourage people to discover this restaurant.

They keep changing  the name but wont change the  Terrible recipes poor service and dirty restaurant   Please please don't eat here you will be sorry Literally McDonald's is better go to the Mexican restaurant next door they're great

Came here for lunch on Monday. It was one of the best Thai/Lao meals I've had in the area. Some standout dishes include: 

- Beef larb: super good with sticky rice and fresh veggies 

- Beef heavenly jerky: flavorful and not dry at all

- Som tam papaya: great flavor and spicy! Not for the faint of heart 

Don't forget to order khao niaw (sticky rice), which helps balance the bold flavors of the dishes. 

Will definitely be returning!
I'm surprised this got bad reviews...the food is pretty delicious here and the restaurant was clean too! If you go, then make sure to order their pho and mango sticky rice dessert!
Absolutely spot on. Licked the plate clean. The hospitality Pauly exuded was just like home

Staff is awesome , very delicious authentic south east Asian food , I've have quite a few menu items and everything has been fantastic.  Pho is very delicious . I like that they have a variety of different selections  thai , vietnamese and laos authentic foods . Highly recommend!!!

I've had dinner here several times now and the service has so far been terrific and the food fabulously good. I love eating here! By far one of my favorite Thai, Laotian, and Vietnamese infused restaurant in the area. Not only is the basil chicken to die for, but spring rolls paired with the "hurricane" sauce is something I would 10/10 recommend!

I had a frozen/reheated fry rice inside a pineapple :( . HORRIBLE!
Very very Dissapointed. Ordered here because I saw good reviews, I'm wondering how it's that possible?
One of the worst experiences I had when you talk about food.
I do not recommended this place!!

I hate making bad reviews, especially to the people I might know. I know the previous owners, but have yet to meet this one.

I ordered for a delivery (Door Dash) and never went to the actual restaurant since it changed owners, probably will never. 

I am Lao, so I ordered their Lao dishes to test it out; Pork Laab, Sticky Rice, Papaya Salad, Chicken Wings, and their special spring roll. Flavor wise it's ok, but it's not the Lao taste.

Pork Laab; they gave me chicken Laab. Also, they stir fry their Laab, how do I know? Cause it's swimming in oil. Laab is a dish where you blanch the meat, let it cool, then toss it in the dressing with fresh herbs and spices. Not stir fry in a pan with oil.

Sticky Rice; ordered two and got only one. 

Papaya Salad; was good, but then agai; Not Lao, it's sour, sweet, and no fermented fish sauce. This is more of a Thai Style, without the peanuts.

Chicken Wings; they did good.

Spring Rolls; this is where it's funny. We opened up the container and found a mess. My son can roll a better spring roll than this!!! Looked like they dropped one on the floor and placed it back! (See picture).

Now to add to all this I get a message from my deliver guy (see picture). Also he had to wait 15mins over the time, left, came back and wait again.


I give the driver a nice tip cause he warned me.

This is a little place in a shopping center full of restaurants.
The food and customer service are what sets this place apart.. Paul, the owner greeted us and waited on us. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about the foods from Vietnam and Laos.

Food was delicious and served promptly. This is a small family owned business that we need to help survive this pandemic.

This was an Uber Eats order so I cannot speak to their dine in service.

I order a chicken pho and Shrimp Spring Rolls. I got pho with no meat / chicken and I received fried egg rolls. I desperately needed this because I am very ill. I tried the fried egg roll to see if maybe in fact this is how they did their shrimp rolls (which is usually done through rice paper), and turns out nope -- it's a major mistake on the order.
The food is authentic without any msg and the hospitality is great. We will be back for sure.

Whatever you guys did to my wings last night...keep doing it, they were Love.  Also, promote the chef that worked at 6pm-close on 11/10/21-he deserves it. Thanks!

-Ashlee Christine
So glad there's a wingstop in the neighborhood now. Finally got around to ordering for dinner tonight and it did not disappoint.

My friend stopped here and got the Buffalo wings and fries. The wings were too crispy and not juicy.. also, the fries were not seasoned and gross. I wouldn't actually go there to buy food myself especially after this experience.

I know Wingstop doesn't have a great rep in other areas but this one is ALWAYS on point for me!! Nice sized wings, fresh fries and the staff is always friendly. I haven't had an order that wasn't good! I hope they stay this accurate and fresh. Tonight I had lemon pepper (which I have to get every time) and spicy Korean. It was my first time trying this flavor and the taste was pretty good! It's a bit saucy but I liked the flavor!

An absolute failure in management to staff two  young women on a busy Friday night.  I watched these girls work their butts off for 45 minutes trying to keep up with a constantly ringing phone and 8 people standing in the lobby.  If you can't staff a business, don't bother even having it open.  And maybe, just maybe, to staff a business, you have to pay a wage that encourages people to come work.  I don't see Chik fil a having trouble hiring.  The young women did a great job, but Jesus, don't do this to your employees.  Maybe you should show up to work instead of disappearing on a holiday weekend.

My experience with this particular store was... *sigh, eye roll* I felt uncomfortable from the time I left my car to checking out. I was stared at the entire time; maybe I was turning colors going from aisle to aisle, idk lmaooo. However, I retrieved the item I came for. The cashier at self-checkout was nice, though. And would you know, she spoke, too! lol. It takes one positive moment to outweigh every other trivial thing. 

Thank God there are way more locations with great customer service and better stocked stores. And girl, my Amex will go where I'm accepted and celebrated...OK?! So, don't worry. The revolution won't be televised in the frozen fruit section. I'm good. I won't be back.

BUT: this is was Oakville. I acknowledged where I was, and I know what it is.

We purchased the 8 piece fried chicken from the deli at 5:45pm. We assumed the chicken would be fresh since it was dinner time. Wrong!!  It was the smallest pieces of chicken we have ever seen and it was all dried out. One wing was so small that it only had a piece of a bone.  One thigh was dried out and was missing the crispy skin. It was just a piece of almost black dried meat.  We couldn't eat half the chicken it was so bad. Apparently there isn't any quality control in the deli. Very disappointing.

The staff at this pharmacy are rude and scatterbrained.  Three times now they have told me a one hour wait and it has always been at least 90 minutes.  I suspect they delete their messages from doctors as my doctor usually has to call them two or three times to get anything done.  "Well they just called it in 5 minutes ago", when I was standing there when the nurse called it in 2 hours earlier.

While visiting family in the area, I came here a couple of times to pick up groceries. I thought the selection was decent, especially in the produce area. The cashiers were friendly enough, and offered my niece and nephew stickers on our way out the door. Not the best grocery, but it will take care of your basic needs!
this is one of my favorite schnucks to frequent. I love the salad bar. they have a large produce section. a butchers meat counter, etc....

I grew up with Schnucks as our go-to grocer out in West County.  The staff is always friendly and welcoming and ready to help you.

They have great WOW Wednesday deals and Drive By deals on Friday that spark my interest.  They also have great deals that you can pair coupons with and make it an even better deal.

Way to go Schnucks!

I love Schnucks! It has been my grocer of choice for years. I have been very disappointed lately in the service at this location. The checkers and the baggers always seem engaged in personal conversations and do not pay attention to their customers. I have started to go to the location on Butler Hill or to the Dierbergs on Telegraph. I would like to go back to my weekly shopping at this location but I need you to raise the bar on service!

Well, I was in a pinch and needed to whip up a salad for last minute company, so I gave this Schnucks another chance.  Fool me once, yada yada yada! Lesson learned.
I think I could have gotten fresher produce at an antique store!  
Never again

They have rude employees, frequently out of certain products.  Not as much variety or selection as Dierbergs.  Gradually seem to be selling mostly Schnucks brand items, which are the absolute worst. Don't know what Frankenfood the shredded cheese is made of but it will not melt, tastes like cardboard.  Wish it was better since so close to home but I would drive 25 miles out of my way to avoid this place.

This is our neighborhood Schnucks but I don't understand how if your going to advertise something you don't have it. Went to buy some meat they had advertised now wouldnt be so bad except this is second Schnucks I went to today and they were both out of the same product? they advertised country style ribs for $2.49 a pound I get there they don't have any, they have two little packages and they're higher priced the little girl at the counter said I can mark them down Which was nice of her but I'm going to be feeding 4 guys at a camping trip this weekend I told her they were supposed to be a family pack and two little pieces of ribs isn't worth it she checked in the back and said they didn't have any.more.Now this is country style ribs a common item that Schnucks carries how do you just run out or do you just not put it out because it's the last day of the sale? Kind  of disappointing and now I'm going to have to go somewhere else and I just don't like the other place I have to go!

After baseball games at Collier Park, we stop in to g et quick sandwiches as a healthier alternative to fast food. Usually get there 30 minutes before closing. each and every time we arrive, most of the food is either empty or put away. The food that is out looks past it's prime.  The people working are put off by late comers so I am paying for a sandwich that has below average food quality made by someone who doesn't want to be there.  This could be there busiest hour of business with over 100 families leaving the ball park at the same time! Hint Hint!

Totally disappointed this makes me not eat subway again!!! I order a flat bread with tuna , and the flat bread was horrible stale bread and with a strange taste! 
the tuna was dry and frozen totally disgusting. and the place was very dirty

I came on Sunday about 6. One person working. Before he would make my sub, he asked if he could use the bathroom. What can I say? Ofcouse. Over 5 minutes go by. Ugh 

Why is there not more than one person working the dinner rush???

I went in today and it was the CLEANEST I've ever see this location!!! The gentleman that helped me was so nice! I didn't use the restroom but I'm sure they are clean as well based on behind the counter! New management.

Horrible chicken quality the manager was very unapologetic.
Very worst subway experience we have ever had
Casey? the manager was unprofessional & unprepared.

We Gator Coaches have declared this OUR subway of choice, Lee's exceptional customer service that trickles down to his employees is why we have always visited this location. Last year they sponsored two team meals for OUR 2017 6A Softball State Championship Team and we are sincerely grateful for what this SUBWAY does for our girls. Keep it local visit the Subway located in the Big Lot's plaza, GO GATORS!
Great service, great prices, and great pretzels! No complaints at all. I've been going to this's pretzel shop for years and nothing's changed.

Philly pretzels are where it's at!! The Philly Soft Pretzel Factory, no matter the location, delivers some delicious, soft soft pretzels that live up to our cities food reputation. While by no means gourmet, the pretzels must have crack mixed in the dough to make even the strictest person on a diet eat more than one. I'm not strict, which causes a problem whenever I come here. But they're just so darn good.

You can get a dozen for $4. And they have nibblets, pretzel dogs, and plenty of other tempting pretzel goodies that kill a diet with the quickness. The ones fresh and hot out of the oven are the best. Seriously, if they're finishing up a new batch, wait for those. It can make a world of a difference. They offer free mustards to put on your pretzels, but you can also buy mustards and dips for to-go.

Mmmmmm....hot pretzels. Soft pretzels are a Philly staple. Suitable for breakfast, lunch and dinner (if you ask me!) Only took one star off for the 7 minute wait on the sausage pretzels. But how can I complain that they wanna gimme a fresh one out the oven and not one that's been under a heat lamp the better part of this morning! Carbohydrates are the ENEMY!

This place is an absolute hot mess. Called and placed an order for a rivet tray for my son's Halloween party. The person who took the order said no problem it would be ready at 8:30 AM. I show up to a line going out the door and employees yelling at customers. Once I reached the counter and asked for my order they said it was not there and that I had not placed an order. I know I have done some hallucinogens in my past but I am certain that I called and spoke to a young gentleman and also confirmed their location. I will never be going back to this location as I am too old for a mosh pit and being yelled at for being a customer

If I could give Negative 10 stars I would! ! As I was paying for my pretzel rivets I looked left to see pretzel dough rolling off the belt machine and onto the floor into a pile of dough that had already been there. The cashier seen unfazed by it and continued to wait on the customers as dough contined to land on the floor. As I was leaving I drove past and looked into the front of the store(which is all glass) I saw him making pretzles with the dough I'm sure he just picked up off the floor. Horrified that I just bought pretzels I threw my items in the trash for fear of an unknown pathogen!Never again will I eat at this store! The cheese looked indescribable and didnt taste like cheese or anything at that! Which got chucked as well!

Friday April 30 2021

I didn't catch his name but he was an army of one. He made the perfect pretzels and had 50 of them ready for me ahead of schedule. ... I know they will be delicious because Philly Pretzel Factory never disappoints. But I had to write this review before I forget because I am so impressed with the worker today. 
Also, 50 fresh from the oven, handmade pretzels for $18 - how are you going to beat that!

We recently checked out Kamiyo for the first time. This spot on whyte seems to be almost rotational so I had some high hopes for the latest try. 

We had a great experience, so much so that a couple of the reviews below surprised me. Our server was courteous, and prompt, and our tea pot was never not full. We had the tuna and salmon sashimi, both of which were fresh. The salmon in particular was very good... Almost one of the better ones I've had in yeg. 

We had a blossom roll with crab and mayo on top that was really spicy and I really enjoyed, and two more specialty rolls. 

I think based on some of the reviews before me that they might have been working out some bumps with starting a new restaurant. Our experience was a great one and I hope they are successful! I'll come back for sure. :)

Absolutely awful and very overpriced for what you're getting. I've lived in Japan for a number of years, my husband is Japanese, and we were appalled. Another friend who also lived in Japan told me the other day that he felt like the ingredients weren't fresh and that he could make better. I agree.

This place just opened and I am so happy to have stumbled upon it! The service is friendly, fast and they are very accommodating to different diatery needs. One member in our party was a vegetarian and although there is no vegetarian sushi option on the menu, they were pleased to make a veggie roll (cucumber, avocado, carrot, tempura sweet potato and a mildly spicy sauce) as well as a fruit roll (mango, grapes, avocado and an AMAZING honey wasabi sauce!).  

We also ordered wakami (seaweed) salad that was dressed in a delightful sesame dressing, miso soup, a sunset roll, and a Hawaiian roll. All of the rolls came drizzled with the most scrumptious sauces which we later found out are all made from scratch daily. The final item we tried was the tuna sashimi which was also phenomenal. The quality of fish was top notch as it practically melted in my mouth! It was served on a bed of spinach and beet leaves and was was dressed with two awesome sauces. 

If you'd like to try something new on Whyte I would highly reccomend going to this place before it starts to get super busy!

I had an evening to myself and decided dinner for one was in order.  I love trying new places and was in the Whyte area so I wandered into Kamiyo.  

The service was prompt, polite and very courteous.  I ordered a salad trio, salmon sashimi and a BBQ eel bowl.  The salad trio came first.  The wakame (seaweed) salad was perfect.  The dressing was light and flavorful and fresh and not too oily.  I then moved onto the calamari.  A little squid sat in front of me and I was a little scared, so I went for it.  It was chewy and delicious!! I will have that again for sure.  Then I ate the edamame....they were dusted with salt and perfectly cooked.  


The salmon came next.  I have never seen salmon sashimi done this way but I really enjoyed it!  The salmon was nicely cut on an angle and fresh with a slight drizzle of two different sauces and red onions on the side.  I didn't use any soya sauce as their preparation was perfect!  The fish was fresh and sweet with the complimenting sauces. 

Last came the week bowl.  The eel was nicely done and the bowl included a nice helping of veggies and rice.  I ate the tomato, corn, wakame and one piece of broccoli.  The broccoli tasted a bit off to me (no seasoning and I don't love broccoli) so I left the extra piece.  The eel was nicely done and a good sized serving.  The only thing was the bowl was kind of luke warm, including the eel.....and I have this thing with food....it either has to be freezing cold or piping hot or the nurse in me is having an issue.  It was still delicious and I will probably try it again just to see what I get! 



I will definitely be back!! Check this place out if you are looking for something fresh in the area!

Even having no expectations of Kamiyo, I was still disappointed after my first and last meal there. Dining with one other, we ordered gyoza, seaweed salad, red tiger roll, spicy salmon hosomaki, salmon sashimi and green tea. The portions were beyond small, perhaps enough to feed one person, maybe just. 

Four tiny pieces of gyoza ($5.50) arrived tepid, but of course, when the serving plate felt like it just came out of the freezer. The red tiger should have been advertised as 4 pieces, but it was 5 cut rather finely. The red snapper on top of the rolls were definitely not fresh. And the spicy salmon hosomaki reminded me of the rolls you can pick up at any 7-11 stores across East Asia, yes, it of that quality; fine, if you're wanting to eat something on the run but we were neither on the run or in 7-11. The hosomaki was not restaurant quality. The spicy sauce over-powered any taste of the salmon. The salmon sashimi ($10) came and again thinly sliced, not because of the mastery or expertise of the chef. The daikon (bed of white radish served underneath the sashimi) was crudely sliced and dripping with water. 

With the bill at just under $40 for two, plus green tea, it lacked value and taste. It was only $40 worth of disappointment, even though neither I or my companion had any expectations. Kamiyo is neither Japanese or fusion Japanese, it is just bland food masked as Japanese cuisine.

I was walking on Whyte ave and I suddenly noticed a new Sushi bar. This location use to be so many restaurants (Hookah Bar, Fancy french restaurant, Tea house) that I call it the cursed restaurant of Whyte. However, as soon as you enter you will notice that these guys had a complete renovation. The restaurant now looks bright and welcoming in contrast with previous businesses. 

The menu was a little bit strange. I always like to stick to simple rolls when I go to a sushi bar (e.g. Tuna maki and Salmon maki) but their menu only had more complex roles like rainbow and dragon. So I asked the waiter if they can make simple maki roles and the chef was super flexible. He technically told use he can put whatever we like inside a simple Maki role. 

The fish was fresh and the Maki was roled properly. I also liked the presentation. The price was really good. 4.5 $ for six piece Tuna Maki. However, there was something wrong with the soya sauce. I am not sure if it was the low sodium version or it just tasted watery. Anyway not my favorite. 

They also give you a piece of good quality chocolate (Lindt) with the bill instead of usual candies. It was a very nice surprise. 

I will defantily go back there. I am sure they will fix those small problems.

We came in around 5 and I was the second table to be seated in the house. The food was good, but took a long time to arrive. I think it's because there is only one person cooking. The rolls are sliced very thinly which is easier to eat but if you are expecting 8 pieces but in reality it's more like 6 pieces at another restaurant you will feel a little ripped off. The two servers were friendly enough but didn't come check on us to see if we needed anything. No water or tea refills and we had to ask twice for our bill. Don't try paying in cash because they don't have any change - as in they couldn't break a $20. The servers were more interested in watching the cook make rolls than helping us.  The restaurant itself is nice, well decorated and plays modern music so at least you're comfortable while you wait. There are just too many great restaurants in town for me to come back to this one. Too bad because I had high hopes for this new restaurant.

Stopped in here for a quick dessert after getting lunch.   We got a mini Blizzard and a cone to go.  Decent service and the place was pretty clean.   This is not a stand alone location; its located at one end of a strip mall

I went in today for a frozen treat. There was no one at the counter and the place was desolate. The freezers were empty, the mop bucket was still out, and the place just didn't feel clean. Finally a girl came out with attitude to spare. The blizzard I ordered was melted and tasted awful. I threw it out as soon as I got home. Was very unimpressed.

This Dairy Queen in Exton/Lionville decided to just stop giving out free small cones on the first day of Spring. My daughter was the only one who wanted one. They had a sign on the door no more free ice cream but you could still buy some. With all the money people spend at this place smh- go to Scoops or Chik fil a instead. The chik fil a is honorable. They made a small cone instead of a large and gave us both.

Went to Dairy Queen today. The place was empty.  Got a mini blizzard, which is tiny to begin with but I was surprised that it wasn't a full mini. Grabbed a high chair to put my son in- strap was broken. Brought that back and grabbed the next one.  Strap was broken. Brought that back and looked at the 3rd and last high chair - strap broken. All were also dirty. We grabbed one but I asked the three girls working if they had a high chair that was not broken. They all came out to inspect the high chair and then said that's all we have. I asked how long the high chairs have been broken for and they didn't know. I tried to obtain owner info to send an email or something to advise that as a customer the High chair straps should not be broken. I told the girls I didn't want to write a note for him. And they told me that they would give me his info. Finally when ready to leave I asked if they wrote it down. They advised that the owner isn't comfortable with people reaching out. So I left my number and will now leave reviews. I'm surprised as a owner of a business in the neighborhood that he would be scared for a patron to want to contact him. Interesting.

Our family was craving DQ last night.  There was a sign on the door saying take out only.  When we walked in it was so clean you could smell it.  It was nice to know that they are taking the appropriate precautions at this time.

I will not be returning to this location again! While we were waiting on our order, there were THREE separate customers in the restaurant with NO MASKS! Not only were they allowed in and served, two of them were greeted by name. 

With the warm weather over the last few days, the store was understandably busy with several people inside and others waiting to get in outside the doors. Those individuals without masks could have exposed everyone in that store or even worse, the girls behind the counter who could potentially expose many others. I hope the board of health sees this and goes to have a chat with them.

This is a hidden Gem. Great tacos al pastor. It was recommended by one of the Black Jack dealers at Atlantis. Easy to find. It seems like all the locals call in the order first and then come pick up, so maybe I'll do that next time I'm in town. The wait wasn't long, but I could maybe have played a few more cards.

I stepped out of the office and was greeted by a food truck with an identity crisis. After doing some research I discovered this truck runs under two names...Loncherra Los Charros or Tacos Los Charros. Their Facebook page shows signage for both. Regardless...it was a new place for me so I had to give them a try.

The lady taking orders was very pleasant. The menu is pretty simple and presented in English and Spanish. I elected to go with a chicken burrito and two asada tacos to get a little variety. The tacos were great. The burrito was just average. Interestingly there were little bits of corn kernels and peppers in the burrito. It reminded me of mom trying to trick me into eating vegetables as a kid by camoflaging them in something else since they aren't actually listed on the menu. Part of the rice perhaps?

The good...The price points on the menu are perfect for lunch. $6 for the burrito and $1.50 per taco. The service was quick. They include radish and carrots on the side with both items. Yes...your veggies are good for you if you're eating this many carbs.

The bad...The burrito was not terrible, but it wasn't great either. They also do not accept credit cards. So in this case, lunch actually cost me $20 because I had to loan $10 to a coworker.
