Wow what a experience... the food is off the charts Soooo Good... the atmosphere is warm and peaceful.. the wait staff kind and friendly.... they make you feel like you just pull up to your momma's house and she been cooking all day just waiting on YOU!!!!!
I can't wait to go back there!!

First off best damn vegan soul food and drinks hands  downnnnnnnn !!! The customer service is A1 Sean made us feel like family  loveeeee the energy in this establishment . We LOVED everything and now we hooked on the food so I'm going back today it's worth the 1 hour and 15 min drive if I had to catch a flight to them once a month I would it's worth every penny and more  thank you again Sean we'll be back today when y'all open up
Most delicious vegan food. Beautiful ambiance. The people treat you like family. Had a wonderful experience there. They gave large portions. No disappointment here.

this place was amazing! the reviews aren't lying when they say the staff treats you like family, i've never been to a restaurant with kinder and more welcoming employees. highly recommended the Philadelphia International which are the best vegan wings you will ever have, and the vegan mac and cheese was also amazing! you could bring a whole group of non-vegan people here and they would love it too
Best Vegan place around!!!! You won't be disappointed whenever you go there and order anything off the menu!!!!:)

Ohhhhhhh, just when I thought I had ready experienced  the beat vegan foods on the planet.... this 5-Star vegan phenomenon shows up in Wilmington! This establishment is on a mission to provide healthy food and beverages to communities! The magnificent quality, flavor, and taste are just drops in the bucket! 

There is NOT one item that is 'distasteful!' THEY ARE ALL AMAZING: the Philadelphia International, the Delfonics, Major Figgas, the Plateau, Uptown, South Street, the Fresh Prince, Broad Street Bully, Teddy P, Beanie Mack, Jazzy Jeff, Phyliss Hyman, Eve, Patti Labelle, and MY FAVORITE IS THE JILLY FROM PHILLLLY!! It's Jerk V-Chik'n steak with cooked with peppers, onions, BBQ sauce, Mayo, AND LOVE on a long roll! It is AMAZING! 

The desserts are incredible as well.... and the fresh juices! The peach cobbler, the snickerdoodle, the Roots, Lemonades, sweet sorrel, pies... oh the CHOICES! 

Stop reading this and GO NOW! It's a hotspot, so call ahead!
This place is phenomenal!!!  The service is kind and genuine and THE FOOD IS OUTSTANDING.  Look no further than Go Vegan Philly!

Phew! Shame I didn't get any pictures. Super nice staff; the cook was coming up from to chat to the handful of customers. I'm a little hesitant about vegan Philly-style food, since it tends to be a bit greasy and cheese heavy, but the sandwich was nothing like this - just light enough; and the mac & cheese was good too. 

If I were to have any get-off-my-lawn complaint, it would be the lack of printed menus - it's all QR code, which I don't care for. Oh well. Hopefully go back soon.

Deeeeee-lish!!  I was so stoked to find this vegan restaurant in Wilmington! The staff was super patient while we decided what to order. The food came out hot and delicious. The waffles were the perfect crunchy as were the oyster mushroom chicken. The powdered sugar on top lent a sweet accent to the dish. We met the owner and he was nice as hell.
This place customer service is the best I've ever had the vibes are immaculate!! Food is amazing best vegan place ever!

Incredible food for vegans and carnivores alike --- absolutely LOVED my first meal from Go Vegan.

We ordered takeout on a Friday night; we did call in the order because we did not see an option to order online. After a brief hold, a friendly employee took our order and advised it'd be 15-20 min. Pick-up wound up taking a little longer, but mostly because the employee who was handling orders got tied up taking a large phone order around the same time we arrived to pick it up. 

I ordered the Teddy P, which comes with fried oyster mushrooms, cornbread, and choice of two sides. The fried mushrooms were outstanding --- flavorful with perfectly crispy breading and a texture surprisingly similar to fried chicken. For my sides, I got the Vegan Mac, which was creamy and delicious, and the collard greens, which were flavorful but tasted a bit salty after a while. The cornbread was on the sweeter side and a little dry, but overall really yummy.

BF got the Phyllis Hyman, which includes "krab cakes" made from hearts of palm and jackfruit that achieves a texture and taste very similar to the real thing. BF also got the vegan mac, but ordered the veggie stir fry --- a well seasoned vegetable medley. He really enjoyed his meal, though said he's planning to order the Teddy P next time.

Overall, a great first experience at Go Vegan --- can't wait to try more of the menu!

Notes:
- One of the first few restaurants in the area (yay!)
- Pick up only
- A large selection of Indian sweets are also available

Food:
- We ordered the butter chicken and tikka masala (each came with 1 naan) and an order of plain rice. This was more than enough for two people. We had leftovers for the next day.
- The food was delicious! When you order, they ask you the level of spiciness that you want (mild, medium and spicy). We ordered it medium and I'd say that this would be enough for most people. I'll probably try the spicy next time, but I like things REALLY spicy. If you're not much for spice, I would recommend trying the mild initially.

Service:
- We were quoted 30 minutes for pickup, but it was probably closer to 50 minutes by the time I was out of there with the order. To be fair - the restaurant is new and getting a lot of word of mouth AND it was Friday AND the neighbourhood has really been dying for a local food place. Staff were friendly and efficient despite the volume of orders and customers.

I used to order a lot of take out from there. But one day i went there in person. The owner was packing my food. While he was doing that i saw him wet his fingers with the water from the sink to open the plastic bag. When i said sir its not hygienic. He replies rudely by showing me attitude "well do u know how much bacteria is in the sponge we use for doing dishes" then i just left after this when the owner doesnt care about hygiene of their customers. Its ridiculously unprofessional.

Place is located in a small strip mall surrounded by more shops. Upon entering they have marinating food for purchase as well as many Indian sweets. For a new business, I didn't receive a very warm welcome. I think they could work on their customer service skills, even though I was just picking up an order. 

When I opened my food I was delighted to see a lot of naan. The quantity of one order varies from restaurant to restaurant so I always order two just to be safe. This place doesn't skimp on naan. I ordered two garlic, however, I received one garlic and one regular. I was surprised to see quite a large container of Shahi Paneer but when I opened it, it was mostly just sauce with barely any paneer; luckily I have lots of naan. I asked for mild spice but the food had quite a kick. I would be afraid to order the spicy option! Unlike most places, they leave the spices in the sauce (think chai latte spices) which are unpleasant to chew on when enjoying your food. 

Overall, I won't rush back to this place considering there are many better options around the city.

Indian Chef Executive Takeout as the name suggests is a takeout place. Infact they are the only place serving Indian food in the SW around Chappelle. The prices are reasonable and the selections are mostly, if not all mainly North Indian ranging from variety of  chaats (Indian Street Food),  Curries (Veg/Non Veg), Breads, Assorted Rices.
We usually order their Mutton Curry ( CAD 14.49 ). What I love about their curries is they always serve a plus one Naan (Bread) free of cost! The only downside has to be the amount of oil they use in their food which is quite high. All my instructions while placing an order is to reduce oil.
Their Samosas (Veg, Chicken- CAD 1.50) are good as well! Served with Tamarind chutney (tangy) and Mint chunty (minty/spicy).
In short, a decent place serving Indian dishes right around the corner for last-minute fixes!

VFM - 2.5/5

I got delivery from here recently due to the current situation. In terms of food, I tried their Butter Chicken Lunch Combo, Lamb Vindaloo (Medium Spicy Level) and Garlic Naan. The Lamb Vindaloo stood out the most as it had nice pieces of meat and a good flavour/spice level. The butter chicken lunch combo was average, but a value item. The garlic naan was average.
Very good food. Compares very well to the best Indian food we have had in places like Toronto and Vancouver.
We order butter chicken, lamb curry, pani poori!! Everything was great!!! Very yummy. Must try!
My husband and I have our regular Indian spot we've been going to years. My sister just moved into Chapelle and said we had to try . This place is a 10 ! Unreal and super friendly service :)
Wings are super tiny and very much over priced in my opinion. Service was good and I've heard the crab legs are really great though!

Great corner location in downtown Saint Pete next to Jannus live. Will be a good addition to the neighborhood. I was there opening day during COVID-19 so they were still working out the kinks, but overall I think they will be well received.
Hey y'all. Did I just pay over 20$ for this? Or am I just that fucking hammered? 2 stars because I haven't thrown up yet.
This was a "we just need some food" before Grand Prix St Pete, the whole family was amazed at how hospitable the staff was, and how good the food was. We had wings, a salad

Really great place if you're looking to get Covid-19 and treated condescendingly by staff. I especially loved getting threatened by the employees after asking for some water with my order. Would highly recommend if you're looking for mediocre food, power-tripping workers and unsanitary kitchen conditions.

First time here and it smells super clean inside! We only got fries which were really tasty. They were well seasoned and crisp. Only negative was if you place a take out order they don't find you. We were standing right outside and our food was waiting a while inside on the counter. They should call a name or give a buzzer. It would have probably been hotter which is always a positive. Just so you know! The prices seemed reasonable and the sauces were just like the original hooters.

Ordered online and picked up. Got home to find out the order was completely wrong. Called to let them know and was given nothing but rude customer service. Had to go back and given no apology or any sort of defect customer service. Pretty disappointed.

Go! I like the simple menu yet great flavors. Our first visit, I ordered the hot wings with loaded fries. It was very good. The wings were a bit jumbo for my liking but the flavor was still good. The fries are seasoned and loaded so perfection with bacon and cheese. 
My wife enjoyed her boneless wings and waffle fries.
The next day we dined again and this time I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich. It's huge! But I ate it all. You have a the option to get it dipped twice, add a slice of cheese and my loaded fries and I'm all set.
Definitely worth a try!

Reggae rise up music festival was at Vinoy park near by. Afterwards went here for dinner (searched prior to ensure they were open, which said open until 12am) and was told he was closing early because he was overwhelmed (it was 11pm). Turned away lots of business that night. Luckily the pizza place next door wanted the business and happily took their customers. Poorly run. Poorly managed.

I am providing two stars. The food is good. It is typical wings and fries type of joint. I had no complaints after ordering the boneless wings with both TMI sauce and Hot Buffalo. The loaded fries were decent as well. My complaint came from the customer service. The woman who assisted me both over the phone and in person today was absolutely rude and disrespectful. She was sarcastic and her customer service skills were truly lacking. The only service she needed to provide was taking my order and handling payment, both of which experiences were truly awful, perhaps her manager should be made aware of her degrading and sarcastic attitude for which she provides to paying customers. I will likely choose not to provide service to them again base merely on the customer service at this point.

The new version of Hooters was something I wanted to try since they first announced they were coming to St. Pete. When restaurants first open up I always like to try their daily specials or happy hours so I don't have much money invested if I don't like the place. At Hoots I tried their boneless Tuesday special. Which consists of a half order of waffle fries and 10 boneless wings any sauce for $7.99. At the actual Hooters this would be much more expensive. One of my main concerns about this place is the location. When I walked in the door their was a homeless man with his private parts hanging out asking for a cup of water. The manager immediately showed him away. I am curious to see how they are able to control the homeless and maintain cleanliness standards. The Starbucks across the street smells of urine, I hope this location doesn't turn into that. 
Now back to the food. Overall for the price the food was very good. Both the wings and fries were very crispy. However where Hoots makes money is charging an extra $1 for any sauce or blue cheese. In my opinion an order of wings should automatically come with a side of blue cheese. Charging an extra $1 is ridiculous.

Very disappointed. I ordered 10 boneless wings, fries and celery (extra charge) and all of it was terrible! The wings looked like scraps from actual boneless wings. The fries seemed like they sat out all day and then were re-fried before they were given to me. NONE of it was edible. The celery was super dried out and looked old. I can't believe this food was sent out like this. I will never be going back.
Food and service were great.  I could get my Hooters fix quickly and to go.  Love the curly fries!!!

There are plenty of choices for pizza in Philadelphia, and Gabby's pizza is really good. There menu is quite large so I have no had everything, but the few items I have had were delicious. There crust is the best part.
Our go to neighborhood take out place. Awesome chorizo and guacamole. The pizza is crisp and the sauce is flavorful. Still have to try out the Mexican pizzas.

I've ordered form this place probably 40 times or more and I never got a bad meal once.  I order from them on grubhub and they usually come lightening fast. And they probably have the best late night pizza.

This was very close to being a very good cheesesteak.  We got the Royal cheesesteak.  Nice cheese melted on top and toasted roll.  But, the roll blew out.  It had a good amount of extras but they needed more grill time and a better mix.  I am still undecided about $12.
This spot is great.  A pizza place with very good Mexican food (recommend the al pastor burrito) and also great mozzarella sticks.  Recommend for Mexican or American in South Philly.

This spot has pretty late pick up and delivery, so I went with some cheese fries and a shake for a quick dinner. The delivery was quick, food was hot, but the portions were small for the price. Shake was just okay. Free delivery made it a bit more worth it. Would love to try something else here to get a better idea of the menu!

Heck yes!!! Late night solid meat lovers pizza. They put the meat under the cheese and made it more flavorful with less falling toppings. I would absolutely go here again. No pic cause we tore that pizza up! Huge menu. It's South Philly so whatever your cultural food you have to add Pizza. This was Mexican and pizza and they did it right! Fast service and pizza was done frfr. Family store, open till 4a and definitely my new little hot spot down SoPhilly
Food is always good very dependable specially for a late night Togo food. One I f the few places I can get a Milkshake anytime of day.

Honestly, pizzas average. Forgot the tomatoes , cheese, and spinach on the left side of our pizza and told us we could get it for 5$ more even after admitting to messing the order up. Okay. Cool. Your food isn't even that good
So glad i tried this place i got a large sausage pizza it was delicious will be ordring from here again cant wait to try other stuff on the menu

Hands down one of Nashville's unique treasures!! It's crazy to get such specialty food, from a top notch chef with premium ingredients at an affordable price. The interior is beautiful & every dish is a work of art. Run there! 5 stars

Today was our first time at Locust, and if I could give more than 5 stars, I would. My wife and I had fast and friendly service, and the food was fantastic. We ordered some wing skewers, the cucumber salad, crispy dumplings, and the numby noodles. The unique flavors here are a must-try if you're in the 12 South area.
Amazing! We had everything on the menu and it was so good. The steamed dumplings are the best I've had since Din Tai Fung, so tender! Great service, too. Make reservations.

I'm not sure how to adequately prepare you for a meal here. Think simple food, but prepared exquisitely. Every bite, every sauce, every plate has been considered before it gets anywhere near your table. I've had more than a few dumplings in Japan. I haven't had any better. And, I've eaten more than my fair share of Japanese shaved ice. This is perfect . Try everything. EVERYTHING!

I got takeout but heard they are opening dining room for In-house dining soon.

Dumplings are LEGIT- we got an order of 8 fried dumplings and we could have easily hammered down another order. The dumplings aren't huge but are perfectly fried with crispy outside and soft flavorful filling. I'm actually still dreaming of them and considering ordering them again tomorrow night ha!

Spicy Numby noodles were so spicy my husband couldn't finish but i thought they were great. 

You absolutely MUST order the dessert-
White chocolate something (sorry can't remember  the name, it's long). It's an absolutely heavenly cream-filled light pastry dessert that we couldn't get enough of!!! But it would have been sinful to get two orders for just the two of us ;p

Bottom line- get all the dumplings, and definitely save space for dessert.

Inventive takes on some Asian classics! Portions are on the smaller side, and service is somewhat slow (we ended up waiting ~20 minutes for our food after we texted them that we arrived).

Shrimp Toast: 4/5
Loved how the outside was crispy and buttery while the inside was fluffy and stuffed full of shrimp. Only thing was that I thought the sweet chili sauce on the side didn't add much.

Tsukemen Dipping Noodles: 4/5
I could tell that the noodles were fresh, and the ajitama (ramen egg) was cooked perfectly. The chicken broth was also packed full of umami flavor and had a decent amount of heat, which I enjoyed. Although the chicken wing was tasty, I couldn't detect much of the scallop. Another thing is that since the noodles were served cold, they stuck together in one big clump, and I had to use my hands to pull them apart.

White Chocolate Kartoffelkage: 5/5
The star of the meal! Wasn't sure what to expect, but this ended up being a giant white chocolate cream puff layered with caramel and surrounded by a thin blanket of marzipan dusted in cocoa powder and sprinkled with candied fruit. All the components complemented each other to make a truly unique dessert.

Oh, wow. Four of us ate dinner on the patio Sunday night and had a great time. Apart from the dumplings and the oysters, there wasn't one dish that we had ever tasted before -- and both of those were as delicious as the rest. We ordered everything on the menu, including the dreamy shaved ice desserts. It's expensive -- about $280, including the service charge and plenty of adult beverages -- but a splurge worth taking.

This place was so disappointing. I had a couple of people highly recommend it to me. I was finally able to try it this past week and I honestly don't get it.... although the staff was friendly, the service was painfully slow. Waited a long time to give drink order and even longer time to get food. The wait for the food was absurd. The dumplings were actually pretty good, but the shrimp toast was one of the most disgusting things I have ever had. The texture and appearance of the stuff inside reminded me of spam. It was encased in a breading that tasted like it had been fried 10 times. It was so greasy and so gross. Maybe you just need a certain type of palette to appreciate this food. But I will never go back.

I notice I'm not the only one who experienced dumplings melting in their mouth! For me it was the fried dumplings that had that effect. Maybe it's because they literally make them by hand per each order? Maybe it's magic? I also felt like I was transported out of 12 south when we were chilling in the patio. So kudos to the designer for that seemingly impossible feat! The shaved ices (we had both), were like gifts that kept on giving. As I dug deeper new flavors and colors emerged!! I also wanted to give a shout out to the noodles from hell, they were amazing as well. It's 8 am many days later, and I can still imagine them in my mouth. Thanks Locust!!

What an addition to 12 South! World renowned chef in Trevor serving up the best dumplings ever created. You will never have had a dumpling so light, flavourful and meticulously tried and tested for perfection. The Kakigori is not only stunning, fun and instagram-able but delicious. Simplicity, deliciousness and attention to detail at its finest!

Hot and tired upon arriving in Nashville. What could be better than Japanese shaved ice (かき氷)?  This "fusion" version with almond milk, salted caramel and passion fruit was surprisingly good. We also had spicy cold noodles for the main course.

The dumplings are the greatest.  They are both fantastic but the steamed must be ordered!   If you like spice, the noodles are great!  Make room for shaved ice at the end.  

Lives up to the hype!!!!
Love Love love. There was some trouble with the online order but it all turned out perfect. Staff super sweet and atmosphere relaxing. Food was BOMB!! Coming back for sure.
Incredible space with a great team running it. All of the food is on point. Beef tar tar and dumplings are both incredible.

Absolutely LOVED this place. Got the pork dumplings, cucumber salad, and the two desserts they have available at the moment. The dumplings were everything I wanted and more, the salad was great and the desserts were like nothing I've had before! Not to mention the outdoor seating had heaters and was adorable. The personal ordering text updates were a funny bonus too. My new favorite restaurant on 12 South. Will definitely be coming back again soon!!

We went to Locust on Halloween. The aesthetic was really nice. It was chilly out but they had lots of outdoor heaters to keep you warm! The staff was also incredibly nice and knowledgeable! We got the steamed dumplings, fried dumplings, noodles, and 2 chocolate salted caramel shaved ice. 

This place is definitely somewhere to go after you've eaten dinner or you just want a snack. The menu is basically 4 appetizers, 2 types of shaved ice, and then 4 types of drinks plus whatever special they are having that night. The steamed dumpling (which was 9 dollars) only had 6 dumplings. The prices seemed very high for the quantity of food. The noodles were 13 dollars and were not our favorite. And you don't get that many noodles. We probably won't order the noodles again if we come back. The noodles themselves were pretty good, but the sauce wasn't our favorite...

In my opinion the menu was very expensive for what we got. It was 70 dollars for the 5 things we ordered!! 20% gratuity is automatically added to tab. 

If you come here, just get dumplings and shaved ice. The shaved ice was very good!! But be prepared to spend quite a bit and you will probably leave a little hungry.

This was one of the greatest dining experiences of my life! The restaurant staff treated us like family and ALL of them in the restaurant waved and thanked us as we left. The food... y'all. I cannot say enough. These dumplings are the best I have ever had. Cannot recommend enough and cannot wait to return on my next trip to Nashville!

Amazing experience, staff, and food!! & the shaved ice is amazing!! We loved that the whole meal was experience and good quality. Will definitely be back! Make sure you book a reservation before-hand.

Wow! I was SUPER impressed. The steamed dumplings melt in your mouth, and the shaved ice blew my mind; I am still thinking about it and it's over a week since I ate there. You can tell a lot of time and effort went into the flavors, the passion fruit in the center of the chocolate shaved ice is unexpected, and amazing. We sat in the patio area and totally forgot we were right off 12 South, it's so inviting there. HIGHLY recommend.

When it comes to Locust's amazingness, I don't even know where to begin. Let's start with their kakigori, which changes every month or two. We've loved every single one so far, especially the English tea kakigori with marmalade jam. Doesn't that just sound delicious? We also just had their scallop-stuffed chicken wings an hour ago, which was beyond this world delicious. In fact they were so delicious I had to write this review to do them justice. Their tsukemen was very tasty too and hope it comes back someday. They have a takeout counter and plenty of outdoor patio seating, which is perfect in the era of Covid-dining and feels very safe. What did Nashville ever do to deserve a place like this?! Please do yourself a favor and stop by Locust the next time you're in the 12 South area. I promise you won't regret it!!!

Locust is a neighborhood gem in the midst of 12 South.  We had an amazing meal, with impeccable service.  You should order a little bit of everything on the menu and try all you can.  You will experience exciting, creative food, lovingly prepared, with fantastic flavors.  You may not normally order dessert, but order both the shaved ice desserts and marvel at the wonder of these creations.  We'll definitely be back.  Reservations recommended.

The best dumplings we've ever had. Hands down. We ended up ordering multiple orders of the crispy dumplings because they were THAT good!! Also, the shaved ice dessert was unique and refreshing and delicious! Highly recommend!

I'm not sure what was better, the food or the service... both were INCREDIBLE! I can't say enough good stuff about this place. The dumplings were so delicious and the chili oil that it's served with added the perfect amount of spice. The elements of each dish were so simple but so well thought out. We tried everything on the menu and were not disappointed. Our servers were top notch and walked us through every dish with ease and helped contribute to a chill and comfortable atmosphere. I can't wait to come back!

I was so excited to try this place out and it didn't disappoint! The food and service was outstanding. The fried dumplings were amazing! I appreciate that they utilize the whole pig for the filling. (FYI - The filling for the steamed and fried dumplings is the same). The noodles are also good and I'm happy that I can customize the spice level. And last, I thought the shaved ice would be good for a bite or two but I was scraping the bottom of the bowl to get more.
I only hope they add a few more thing to the menu.

Great food with an awesome atmosphere -- open kitchen and the servers were all so kind and fun! The dumplings were delicious and the best ones in Nashville. The beef tar tar was full and rich. Tried the shrimp toast and more niche and wasn't a favorite. Otherwise, great quality of food for a good price. The small menu makes it nice to try several options and share!

I have never been one to expand my repertoire when it comes to cuisine, but this place really pushed me out of comfort zone in all the best ways. We had everything on the menu, and couldn't get enough of the dumplings (we had multiple orders). They were so moist and perfectly complimented by the chili oil that was paired with it--and I'm not one for spice. On the other hand, the cold noodles were delicious, but too spicy for someone who is sensitive to spice. That still didn't stop me from cleaning my plate! To cool my mouth from the noodles, I used the cucumber spears dipper in their special salt. They added the perfect balance of cool and refreshing with intense flavor and a little oil to offset the noodles. I loved the shrimp pillow, and couldn't believe it when I went back for seconds (not a seafood person AT ALL). Another favorite of mine was the beef tartar, which was brought out separately from the other ingredients, allowing you to create your own beef tartar sushi roll. The beef was so rich and buttery and paired excellently with the freeze dried capers, rice, and seaweed. To top off an already perfect meal, we had both shaved ice desserts. The almond salted caramel was by far our favorite. It was an almond milk shaved ice with merengue on top and finished with a thick drizzle of salted caramel on top. It was the perfect combination of sweet, savory and salty, and it was SO light! You didn't leave feeling overly full, but rather perfectly content. 
While this isn't a typical restaurant, the atmosphere and experience are truly one of a kind. If you're looking for a quick, grab and go place to eat, go somewhere else. If you're looking for extremely friendly staff, who focus on creating relationships with their customers and who provide you with an experience you won't forget, go to Locust!!

The best steamed dumplings, hands down, anywhere! The menu is small so keep that in mind. However that may be part of why they do it so well. I would suggest this for an experience similar to small plates rather than a full, sit-down dinner. Great blends of flavor. It was sort of a take on Asian cuisine with a fusion flavor vibe of East-West. Staff was incredibly friendly! Parental warning: At times, the fairly loud, not-dining-music isn't kid-friendly (@!&@!"!). Health-conscious diners will also be very disappointed with the lack of vegetables. Would definitely return but have a big salad  later that day!

Do you ever wake up, look in the mirror, and realize that the unceasing concession of years has slowly worn down your wonder for life? What in life really DOES it for you like it did in your youth? 
I'll tell you what does it for me: Locust.

My taste buds were awakened to a dawn I lost hope was ever even arriving.

Now let me be clear in the WAY Locust shines above the rest. They not only are the best at the items on the menu that others do, but they also have menu items you don't even know exist. Items that will take your palate to geographies unknown and glorious.

In a way, if you haven't dined here, you are the Canadian who somehow hasn't heard of hockey. Locust is Wayne Gretzky, and he has just invited you to a personal master class.

~Namaste~

Just WOW. My friend and I came here for dinner and we were both blown away. Lots of small dishes that were unique, perfectly crafted, and delicious. Recommend picking a few dishes to share. We had the dumplings, cucumbers, shrimp toast, beef tartare wraps, and a bottle of the Suigei, drunken whale sake. When you think you're done, finish off with one of the desserts which is light and refreshing. Trust me, you'll have room and more for it. We had the almond milk kakigōri (shaved iced) drizzled with salted caramel and paired it with a bottle of Proper sake's Diplomat Nigori. The staff were all so friendly and welcoming. Already looking forward to my next visit. Do not sleep on this place!

Stunning atmosphere with juicy, crispy dumplings, the cutest DIY noodles, and shaved ice. Every detail is paid the closest of attention. As a first generation Asian American, I loved this experience. Watching the chefs hand fold the dumplings and hand cut the noodles to order, and seeing the steamers stacked high on the burners, was nostalgic for me. This reverie for the cooking experience translates to the plate and palate. A welcome addition to Nashville's culinary scene.

Locust may officially be one of my new favorite spots in all of Nashville. The place looks very cool, the people are SO great, and the food is beyond amazing. They don't necessarily have a large menu but everything they do, they do extremely well. The pictures don't do the food justice. Definitely will be going back soon.

English Tea Kakigori
Pork Dumplings
Cucumber Salad
Shrimp Toast

There aren't a lot of options on the menu, but we tried most of them. The only thing worth getting again is the kakigori and even that was expensive. Not sure I'll be running back to get one again anytime soon!

Absolutely love this place. 

We are local & have had it on the list to try, but just got around to it last week. Man, what a great restaurant. 

Love that the space is small & more intimate as I really do think it allows staff to give more time for providing guests with lovely service. All the staff kind of wears multiple hats and each person we encountered was kind & helpful. 

But most of all, the food is stupid-good here. Condensed, minimal menu with daily specials. Everything is in general, simplistic..but perfectly done. 

The dumplings are some of the best we've ever had (we ordered more as they are that delicious). They also had a whole dover sole special that was OUT of THIS WORLD. 

Shaved ice is light & again, just beautifully done. We ordered both options to try and truly couldn't pick a favorite. 

Very impressed & will be return customers from this point on.

These people are amazing humans! They are top notch chefs. When we first walked in they all greeted us with such enthusiasm. Their customer service is beyond amazing. The dumplings are the BEST thing I have ever tasted! They made our day. I can't express how much I loved this place. This is not a restaurant. This is an EXPERIENCE. A must try for anyone is Nashville. Thank you Locust!

Best dumplings in Nashville. Hands down.  The menu is simple, and ever changing. Trevor Morain and his team never cease to bring quality, creativity and and bites that hit all of the pallet senses to the table.  The shaved ice is incredible.  Highly recommend Locust when you are looking for a place with atmosphere, and a menu that can be fully explored. The food is next level.   For more on locust and other favorites in Nashville visit Adventures With Scaggs on Instagram or adventureswithscaggs.com

I heard good things about this place and I wanted to give it a try. I make a lot of dumplings at home, Trader Joe's frozen dumplings and my skillet pan are my best friend. I've learned how to cook them well... however, once I tasted one of Locusts Dumplings, I realize that I never even knew what a true dumpling was until now. It was soft and delicate but crispy with a perfect crunch and a savory mouthwatering pork filling. The Trader Joe's dumplings that I've loved for years have now taken a backseat. Never did I know that I could love another dumpling more. I highly recommend skipping Trader Joe's and going straight to Locust...or in all reality, skipping any and every other place where you can buy dumplings and going straight to Locust. You won't find better in Nashville. They also have other food that's good as well, but I've never made shrimp toast or cold noodles at my house before so I can't compare them to my home cooking but they were pretty damn delicious.  

Dear COVID, please end soon so I can enjoy there dessert and cocktails in person.

Beyond excellent little restaurant. We are the entire menu and ordered some dishes twice!. The crudo was incredible. So fresh and perfect. I loved the steak tartare wrapped in noori. The dumplings were the best I ever had. Easy and casual atmosphere with absolutely spot on food. Highly, highly recommend!

This is our second time visiting Locust and definitely not our last.  This is our new favorite Nashville restaurant.  My husband and I ordered everything on the menu, as it is a smaller menu.  Every dish is amazing and full of favors.  
The dumplings are not to be missed, the oysters were a special and some of the best oysters we have had.  The tuna belly was the best I have eaten.  The tartare was one of the most amazing things I have eaten in a long time.  The deserts are so fun and we always get both.  Every single dish was mind blowing.  
The service is the best.  You can tell everyone enjoys their job and knows the menu forward and backwards. The music is perfect with a good mix....loud enough, but still able to carry a conversation with others.  Loved the service and all staff....they make this place better, which is hard to do because this restaurant is not to be missed!!! 
Cannot wait to return!! Keep doing what you are doing Locust, you have customers for life.
Very friendly and fun place to eat. We enjoyed trying different items on the daily menu. We are planning on going back soon.
Really bad experience with this place and their staff. There are too many other great options in 12S to bother with this one.

A top chef creates his own spot with Japanese small dishes and nails it. We ordered every item on the menu and it was the perfect amount fue 2 people. I was blown away by it all. The dumplings were so fresh, the beef carpaccio assemble-yourself "tacos" were out of this world. I loved the spicy cold noodles. Really the only thing I wasn't into was the shaved ice dessert. But my partner who passes on dessert, usually, devoured it. We will be back. And back, and back...
LOVE. Everything on the menu is stellar and because the menu is small you can try everything. They also play awesome music. Go here!
5* experience and meal. A total experience and not just a meal. Everything on the menu is phenomenal.

Must visit if you can get it because it's that good :) Trevor and his staff are next level chefs. Good people making good eats makes for a good...scratch that GREAT night. I look forward to many visits ahead. Get those spicy noodles baby

Visionary! This is not just excellent food, it is a warm therapeutic experience that is lacking in the food industry. I do not personally know these guys but they make you feel like you have been invited into their personal home as family! Truly inspiring!

You are welcomed into the chef(s) personal kitchen and dinner tables with an incredibly genuine and heart felt, WELCOME! We felt honored! My daughter even asked, "do you know them." Every unique dish is an experience of culinary pleasure.  Thank you chef(s) for today's moments and your genuine hospitality.

I have traveled the world and eating dumplings and noodles around the world including in Japan. I find a place terribly pretentious and the service is very lacking! Don't think worth the money! Very limited menu!

A solid 3. I wanted to like this place more but the servings are tiny and the menu is small in a way that seems like they are trying too hard. The service however, impeccable and saved this review. 

Dumpling wrappers are impossibly thin (how I had them while living in China) but 6 for $9 is hard to swallow. 

Shrimp toast was on point with flavors, but being fried not something I'd order regularly. 

Cucumbers were good and the Szechuan peppercorn in the salt mix was a nice addition but I never want to spend $6 on a cucumber again. 

Cold noodles, meh. 

We've had the shaved ice dessert in Korea before and loved it but didn't feel like continuing the meal. I'm sure it was lovely. 

The outdoor seating was pleasant but the music was way too loud and didn't go with the ambiance of the rest of the space. 

Maybe it was an off night? Maybe I just struggle paying for a mediocre meal after hyping it up in my head. You decide.
Such delicious dumplings and shrimp toast. Loved it!! Very cool atmosphere and friendly staff! We'll definitely be back again!
Great quality food and cooked where you can see it. Spicy means spicy. 10/10 restaurant.

This is the best restaurant in Nashville. It is so wonderful to have a restaurant that is trying new things and pushing boundaries. It is truly unique in the landscape of nashville and doesn't fall victim to the carbon copy upscale restaurant trend that the city has fallen victim to. 

Pro tip: order at least one of everything on the menu.

My much anticipated meal did not disappoint! These guys are making some awesome food. So skillful and technically made...that you might not notice it. It's just really good food, very well seasoned. All the way to dessert!
Shrimp toast was a table favorite. Dumplings were killer. Kakigori is a Japanese dessert...if you don't know, get one. If you do know, you're obviously ordering it. 
Don't forget to grab a staff favorite hot sake and a little chili oil ;) Can't wait to go back!
Best dumplings I've ever had. Also ordered the shaved ice and shrimp toast and they aren't to be missed. Great vibe and atmosphere in a totally covid safe setting. Can't wait come back.

Hidden gem - we loved absolutely everything from the sparkling water served right as we sat down to the shaved ice which was unlike anything else we've ever had. The menu looks simple and does not do justice to the complexity of the dishes. The dumplings were unfortunately only offered with pork inside but were not the best dish regardless.

8:15pm reservation. We weren't seated until after 8:30pm, forced to stand outside in the cold. Once seated, we were ignored for 5 minutes before someone poured water and reluctantly took our order. We ordered everything on the menu. After waiting for weeks for this reservation, our hopes were high and literally every dish was underwhelming. We ordered a bottle of wine. Our server visited the table maybe twice during the meal. The check included 20% gratuity (on a party of 2) and service was terrible. I am extremely disappointed in the food, service, ambiance, and experience as a whole. I discourage people from wasting their time and money at Locust.

LOVED the food. Shrimp Toast, Dumplings, Chicken wing dish were the table favorites. Chicken wings, de-boned and stuffed with scallops? Gimme more. 

While the food was great, the staff was the best part. So friendly, attentive, and upbeat. They genuinely looked like they were having fun in the kitchen, which made the experience that much better. 

When we were leaving, it felt like we were leaving a party with our friends. Just made you want to come back... 10/10 will be back.

Tired from a long drive to Nashville, we wanted a simple cold noodle joint. Locust fit the bill, with a limited menu that included cold spicy noodles. We also ordered the cucumber appetizer, which came with an innovative dip of salt and powdered sansho. Sansho is commonly used in Japan but is a rarity in the US. If used at all, it is an accompanying spice for grilled eel. I have a sansho plant at home and use the tongue-tingling spice for a variety of dishes. The sansho/salt dip worked perfectly for the appetizer. The cucumber was delicious but I would have left the skin on to prevent the sweaty slippery texture of the spears. The spicy cold noodle was a bowl of thick udon with a chile-sesame- canned bamboo shoot paste that you mix up. It was good but the thick noodles made for difficult eating. I would have preferred this with thin Inaniwa-style udon noodles. We eagerly waited for our dessert and were surprised by the giant box-like presentation of the shaved ice. This version covered and smothered the shaved ice, rather making it a centerpiece. The point is to cool off by eating this concoction. What we got was a fast-melting marshmallow-like dessert.

This is a cool little spot for the Nashville area! The chef comes from many experiences at Noma! The menu is very small, literally like 5 items, and they normally have daily specials. It's tapas style so we usually order one of everything. Everything is good, and if you're a foodie like me, I do recommend trying everything. The show stopper for me is the tartare! I do wish their menu option was just slightly bigger, or with the small menu I wish their plates were slightly bigger. Make sure you make reservations!

Nope. Just stop what you're doing right now and make a reservation at Locust. 

I'm a big believer in good aesthetics. You eat with your eyes first. Locust gets it. They've elevated asian food to the next level - no, the next dimension. 

Steaming potstickers. Yuzu cocktails. Spicy cold noodles. Blue fin tuna belly??? I'm dead.

The food is next level. But let me tell you about the service now. Our server, Tomas (the sweetest man!) was so full of energy and joy that I couldn't help but feel elated in his presence. He spoke with glee about the menu items and got us so excited about our food adventure. He is the epitome of what a server should be about. Well done with finding Tomas, good people.

As a fellow small business owner I couldn't appreciate this establishment more. They get everything right from beginning to end. Take all my money, Locust! I'm. in. love.

My wife and I ate at Locust for my birthday last week.  After a few bites I knew we were in for something special.  Outstanding dumplings, we ordered another round because they were so good.  We had blistered peppers with a delicious dipping salt.  They had fresh mackerel that day and we ordered 2 rounds of that, it was so simple and perfectly made.  A dozen oysters later and a few shrimp toasts, we were blown away.  

Locust is a place that has perfected the menu they are serving, everything is just so intentionally simple and refined.  You can tell that great care and thought goes into each dish.  The service was outstanding, and the staff greets every new arrival with a "hello, welcome, good to see you", its hard not to feel at home there.

Then came the shaved ice.  It haunts my dreams to this day.  I wanted to live inside of that desert and never leave.  

Just go to Locust and enjoy everything about it, we will be back soon.

For anyone that doesn't know, there's a new dumpling spot on 12 South! It's got a small menu - but that small menu is sure to have everything you need for a meal. We stopped by this pack weekend. As of January 2021, they are open for takeout only due to COVID. So, we ordered on Toast, drove over, parked, texted a number letting them know we were ready, and they texted back to let us know our order was ready at the takeout window. Easy, quick pickup. We ordered their dessert on the menu this week - a tea and cookies kakigori (a Japanese-style shaved ice) - which (because it's shaved ice) can't be made ahead or packaged to go. So I walked back to my car with a bag of dumplings and shrimp toast in my left had and the bowl of kakigori in my right. We ate it first also (I mean, it's ICE!), and it was great: icy, creamy, with great flavors. Then we had the shrimp toast - which was definitely a different take on shrimp toast than I've had at other restaurants. But it tasted great! Beautifully fried! The dumplings were good, too! And we were able to eat this whole meal in our car while everything was still hot or icy! A fun meal overall! I do think their menu is pretty limited (they only offer one type of dumpling - pork), and they don't offer anything for vegetarians except for the dessert (we aren't, but just FYI). In a single visit, we tried everything on the menu except for the Tsukemen dipping noodles and the other dessert on the menu. Still, if a meal of pork dumplings, shrimp toast, dipping noodles, and a fun dessert sounds like a meal you want to try - check out Locust. We enjoyed everything we ate!

I dragged my feet way too long on Locust. Earlier this summer a pregnant friend requested a meal at Locust and you never say no to a pregnant lady so off I went. WHAT IN THE WORLD HAVE I BEEN DOING?! Locust is by far my favorite meal in Nashville. It filled a gaping hole left in my life when Setsun closed. I got home and could not stop talking about it to anyone who would listen. My husband got tired of listening to me and frankly I got tired of talking. It was time to eat again. After texting like 4 different babysitters slowly going through dates round and round one finally had an cancellation and coincidentally Locust had one remaining reservation. It was meant to be.

Saturday evening my husband and I were finally going to eat at Locust together. Now there is always the fear that when you talk something up so much that the other person will not feel the same. There was zero fear here. Locust lives up to the hype. The best part though? It's an amazingly delicious and fun meal in the cutest, most casual space. We ordered the entire menu and one special. Each one was as special as I remembered with one exception. Last time I had a vegetarian and pregnant person with me so we skipped the beef tartare. DO NOT SKIP THE BEEF TARTARE. It's the best item on the menu. It's probably the best beef tartare in Nashville. I don't want to ruin all of the nuances to it so you'll just have to trust me. Eat it. Enjoy it. Soak it in. I could not stop smiling the whole meal. It's probably the happiest I have been in months. I can't wait to go back, I'm not even joking. It's our anniversary next month and I've already been checking their reservations.

This place is a gem. They have indoor seating and a cute little outdoor patio that is covered. You can easily make a reservation online. 

We got steamed dumplings, shrimp toasted, and shaved ice. The entire experience and meal was delicious and casual and fun. It is really reasonably priced too.
Amazing food and service.  They 100% know what they are doing here.  Best dumplings, amazing fish, creative specials and the shaved ice is a game changer dessert.

Wow.. so pretentious. Party of 2 for lunch, got turned away because we didn't have a reservation - who makes reservations for 2 for lunch?!  Half the place was empty, not a soul at the bar...they were more interested in acting busy than actually being busy...crazy. Customer service is truly dead...

We were introduced to Locust from some friends who live close to the restaurant. The best way for me to describe the dining experience goes like this.  It was the most approachable relaxed artistic fine dining experience I've ever had(I was in shorts and flip-flops). From the moment you open the door, you are genuinely greeted by the entire staff in the open kitchen. The taste of the food was nothing but a mirror image of that warm welcome.  And to the end of the meal (my, my) the dessert needs to be experienced in person, because words do not do justice. Fyi, we've been back twice now and I'm finally giving them some of the public credit they deserve! Keep up the wonderful work Chef Trevor and crew!

Locust was absolutely incredible. From the welcoming staff, warm ambiance, and creative dishes- it was a lovely experience. Don't let the small menu fool you. Everything on it is perfect. Order one of everything from top to bottom and it'll come in under $100, paced perfectly with healthy sized portions. Make your own beef tartare seaweed hand rolls? YES. Everything about this dish was so satisfying, but save room for dessert. I didn't know what to expect with "shaved ice", but this blew every dessert I've ever had in Nashville out of the water. It's hard to explain outside of "wow. Holy sh*t" because the textures seem contradictory, but it was super light and still satisfies your sweet tooth with the caramel drizzle and (I think) custard-like filling with some small toffee pieces inside. My only piece of criticism was the spoons were aesthetically pleasing but not exactly the most functional because they were pretty shallow. It translates to: I needed a larger spoon to effectively scrape each plate because every single thing on that menu was divine.
This place is beyond. Food is delicious. The service is fantastic. If I could find a way to eat here every day I would.

A very fun and positive experience as soon as you step in the door! The chefs smile and greet everyone who walks in and each service member that came to the table was lovely and interactive. They explained the dishes well and everything we tried was absolutely delicious (we tried everything on the menu). 

Everything about Locust was memorable, from the service to the food to the fun music the chefs were singing to! I can't wait to go back!

Went with two friends and we ordered the whole menu. The food was all good. It is a very limited menu so not for the picky eater. My favorite the night we went was the beef tar tar. Looking forward to them expanding the menu for future dining.
Innovative, unique, boundary pushing restaurant full of interesting food and people. Great add to Nashville!

The dining experience was amazing! We didn't have a great experience with the hostess outside. They were late on sitting us for our reservation on time. However, once we were seated and enjoying the food none of that matterd anymore. I had never had food that tasted anything like the dishes that were prepared for us. Order the whole menu and specials. It's totally worth every penny. I've already told my chef brother-in-law that he has to go there.

5 star experience!! They even offered complimentary hot tea while I waited as it was cold out. We purchased dumplings that were very delicious and shrimp toast. Let me tell you the shrimp toast was purchased on a whim. We dream of this toast and tell everyone the day experienced a perfect combination of textures and flavors. Seriously, eat the shrimp toast !
You know you hot the hibachi but the fried chicken was a gem. Delicious and you eat til yiu pass out

Place is actually pretty good! I love their hibachi and their sushi as well which are both my favorites from this place. The food in the general buffet today wasn't the greatest specially their pepper chicken. My wife loved the coconut shrimp and I really liked their butter shrimp. I'd recommend going for lunch

Many food bars closed. Limited selection. Service was minimal. The food they did have was not bad. Slightly over priced for the offerings. 
Much of the seating was closed off and the only tables available were dirty. Definitely not something I'm eager to return to.

I've visited this place for a few years now and while covid definitely took its toll on it its still doing great when compared to other buffets. The food is good and while sometimes its old they try their best to rotate the food out. They are understaffed so if you're visiting while covid is still a thing there is a high chance you might wait a little for your drinks to arrive

I was excited to hear that Pagoda was opened back for business. I'm a regular at Pagoda. They have a variety of food that is just great for me. It doesn't matter what you're in the mood for. Pagoda has the food for you. Also, the staff are very respectful and always near to help you. They practice social distancing and created appropriate spacing between tables.
Very good buffet on 38th St. First time visit but I am not disappointed. I will return with my family. They will love it for sure.

I order delivery from this location now less and less     When I have ordered the last few times I have not received my gift cards or movie passes. My delivery last night included a steak Caesar where they threw the meat on the salad and then the dressing and croutons on top of it making the dressing slimy to hold and also how is this food safe?? I will let you judge by the picture if you would want to eat this.

I was going to give this location 1 star but the customer service guy (Sam) afterwards deserves a star all his own.  I'm sitting at PapaJohns awaiting my order while I write.   I actually read these other reviews prior to calling Pizza73 and I said to myself, "this is just a delivery issue.  I'm sure they are really great!"

They really are friendly, but they had no idea who I was.  I placed an order 2 hours in advance and gave them a specific pickup time.  I was 10 minutes late when I came to the location and they took my name and came back with the wrong order.  I said, "no I didn't order two medium pizzas. I ordered pizzas, potatoes, wings, etc."  I gave her my name again and they looked but had no clue who I was.  I asked if they were sure and they said, "yes."  So I left!   

Called customer service while I drove, because I was late to my destination, and Sam looked into the order, double checked the correct location and called them to check.  They said, "yes!  We have his pizza!"   I thanked Sam and informed him that I had left.  He apologized and canceled the order from me. And then attached a curly fries to my next order in the future.

My family and I always order double pepperoni and extra sauce for one pizza and donair for the other, most often we get the pizza from this location but when we do there's  close to one pepperoni per slice the donair pizza looked like it had two pieces of meat on the entire thing. 
It's almost like the person responsible for doing this thinks if they add the toppings the customer asks and pays for that it will be a bad thing, perhaps they think each additional topping will be deducted from their pay??? I don't know why they constantly do that but I would like to start receiving the pizza we ask for and not what some cheap half wit pizza maker thinks is what I want. Definitely do not recommend this location until they learn to listen and act.

I order delivery from this location now less and less     When I have ordered the last few times I have not received my gift cards or movie passes. My delivery last night included a steak Caesar where they threw the meat on the salad and then the dressing and croutons on top of it making the dressing slimy to hold and also how is this food safe?? I will let you judge by the picture if you would want to eat this.

Horrible is an understatement. Called for delivery and told them I'm paying with debit. After waiting for 1 hour and 15 minutes the guy is here with no debit machine. He said he will be back so I waited in the lobby for 15 minutes and he didn't show up so I went back upstairs to my apartment. I open my order and realize it's Hawaiian pizza and I don't eat pork. Anyways the driver calls me after an hour (3:00am) when I was sleeping hungry!

I ordered the medium Mega meal from this location on January 29th, 2021, I got a ham and pineapple pizza and a chicken and roasted tomato pizza with the golden crispy wings. I receive my order from the delivery guy, go to eat it and it's NASTY. Pizza is rubbery and chewy and had barely any sauce, wings are spicy and they look like they've been sitting under a heat lamp for days, old and nasty. I call customer service and they offer to send a replacement. I get the replacement and once again it's NASTY and it's the same exact issue. I will NO LONGER be ordering from this pizza 73 again! Absolutely DISGUSTING. I've never had an issue with this location before. I should've just gotten my money back.

My family and I order from here quite abit and usually it's good but the last two times, last weekend and today it's been lower quality and It's just not what I'm asking for. Double pepperoni means just that it's pretty easy to follow and understand I would think, one to two pepperoni per slice after asking for double is insulting to say the least. I'm strongly considering not using this location anymore due their lack of satisfying their customer and worrying about a few extra pepperoni shutting the business down. Listen to your customers and aim to please or get out of the business altogether. This would be the third time now this exact thing has happened.
Was not impressed with the uncle bens tasting white rice !! My chicken was rubbery and the veggies tasted like frozen bagged veggies. not for me !!!!

Wow! Did not know what to expect, but what a treat I found and it's basically in my back yard. Very clean and friendly staff. The prices are very fair. The food is piping hot and enough for two or more meals.
Every visit here the food is fresh, and excellent service! The potions are big for the low price!
I went to this restaurant yesterday. It was delicious and beyond my imagination. The food was good, the service is good ， and the environment were good. I will come back again,
My first time here.. WOW enough food for two!! Everything was fresh and delicious and good and hot! I defiantly recommend this place!!

This restaurant is my new go to whenever I order food from doordash. I don't leave a review on Yelp unless I either have a really bad experience OR a restaurant becomes my new favorite location. The food here is consistently great, huge portion sizes and always shows up hot and fresh. If you're looking for some hibachi style food that's amazing every time, you found it. Thank you to all the employees for consistently making me delicious meals, I love you.

The real Shogun should be ashamed. I get that it's suppose to be 'fast food' which it was ready fast, it shouldn't be advertised as hibachi. The veggies were frozen steamed veggie and could not have touched any part of the grill. The rice was incredibly dry, as was the meat. I'm not sure what they were going for but it was not hibachi. Period. I will not be going back. I could've gotten better, cheaper elsewhere. 

The picture was my meal. 

This was after I doused it in soy sauce to not choke on it because it was so dry. The steak doesn't even look like steak. It looks like the steak you get in frozen dinners. Horrible. Do not eat here

I've been here twice now and recommend it to many people! I was a huge Koji fan and so living so far from the Boro I gave this place a try since they have the same drive they hibachi concept. 

I was very pleased at the quality and the friendly service. 

It doesn't break the wallet and they give you PLENTY of food!

Always fresh and they give you a lot of food and the sushi is always good! Try them, best express hibachi place in nashville.

（由 Google 翻译）
总是新鲜的，他们给你很多食物，寿司总是很好吃！尝试一下，在纳什维尔最好的快递 hibachi 地方。
This Burger King location is great. Staff's extremely friendly, food's tasty, and easy in and out. Can't believe some of the low reviews, it's great food and one of the better locations in Tampa!
I not only received the wrong order when I got home everything was cold and the buns were hard this location should close

Wish I could give this place 0 stars honestly. The most recent time I've been the drive thru cashier was extremely rude and had NO customer service skills. I've been to this location a couple times and everytime I've been they have forgetten something or my order takes forever. This time for instance my desert was forgotten and my order took 5 minutes to get to the window. The female manager who works there is unresponsive as well. Upon receiving my food one time I said "thank you" she gave no response and shut the drive thru window in my face. I will NEVER come back here, guarantee this location won't last long with the employees they have "running" the place.
I order food around 5:30 and it taste like this was made at lunch time. So cold, so stale. Disgusting

I consider Burger King to be a below-average fast food provider, and this location has a (typical for BK) slow drive-thru.

That being said, I was curious to try their Impossible Whopper. Why? Well, I find that Impossible "meat" is fairly tasteless, and I figured that it was the perfect choice for a meatless fast food burger. And I was right! When you eat a Whopper, there's the taste of whatever chemicals/seasonings they put on the meat to give it that "flame broiled" taste plus all the veggies. The Impossible Whopper tasted amazingly similar to a normal Whopper, but I could pat myself on the head for having a meat-less meal afterwards. (If anything, this just shows that the Whopper isn't that great of a burger, since it proves that you don't taste beef just everything but the beef.) 

So if you need a fast food meal and want to skip eating meat, the Impossible Whopper is not a bad choice. Of course, if you want a really good vegan meal, try the Mediterranean Chickpea, only a couple miles away.

This location is the ONLY one I have a problem with and it seems they are doing everything in their power not to work and try to reject all customers. We are just coming out of Lent where we can't eat meat on Fridays. My favorite go to meal is the BK Big Fish. I went to this location at 10:05pm and no one answered the drive thru, I pull up and the workers are inside cleaning. I knock on the window and an elderly woman says they are closed. Mind you the hours of operation is on the same window and says 1am. She says "oh well I don't know why that's there, we close at 10". The following week I get there at 9:02pm, and no one again answers the drive thru. I pull around and knock on the door, they talk through the door and say they are closed. I AGAIN point to the hours of operation, and they all look at me like a deer in headlights. So last week it was 10pm, this week is 9pm. Fast forward to 3 weeks later to this morning. I order breakfast through UberEats at 9:32am, Burger King Cancels the order completely. What The Actual F%&* Is Going On With This Store?!?!? Are you guys trying not to keep customers? Is the new slogan "Burger King you can't actually have it your way, nor do we feel like working, Go to McDonalds from now on"

So starting off you can't see the menu in the drive thru at night. There are barely any lights to see what there is to order. The display screen that shows your order wasn't working either, if it was my order might of been right. Got a double bacon cheeseburger instead got a cold cheeseburger. Ordered a 4pc jalapeño cheddar bites instead got mozzarella sticks. Got a large fry, that was correct but you can taste they had not been cooked long enough. Ordered a sprite.. and that tasted bad like the syrup pouch was out. Lastly asked for ranch and I got marinara sauce, probably for the mozzarella sticks I didn't order which also were cold. Thanks Burger King for feeding my trash can instead of me yet again. Would love my money back!

Pulled up at 11:39PM on a Sunday night (September 2nd). They list themselves as being open until 12:00 every night, but nobody answered when I pulled up to the speaker. Makes me wonder, if people like this can own a franchise, maybe it would be worth it to just buy a Burger King and run it correctly? Called corporate. Don't go here if it's late. I wouldn't know how their food is so I can't attest to the quality.

I'm a Munchies fan!

I'll tell you... at first I was a tad skeptical. Their sign always made me feel like it wasn't gonna be the best of places.

But then you go inside, and you immediately feel so welcomed. The owner's sons are behind the counter. Very nice people, really awesome.

I always strike up conversation. And I left my business card and won a free lunch!

Their food is awesome. I never know what to order because I feel like some of everything!

Their burritos are VERY generously packed. You don't get a skimpy little burrito with a surcharge for extra stuffings. 
Everything is very largely and generally portioned, in a nation where portions keep getting smaller and smaller. This generosity definitely costs them more, but keeps people coming back for more!

I think my favorite menu item goes to a Taco Dog though.
Awesome Hebrew National Hot Dog, in a nice roll. With everything you love in a taco on top!

All-In-All, a great place!
Always get a good conversation while waiting for your food (which isn't a long wait at all!), they are very very very very very welcoming and nice people! I always enjoy going. And ever since they absorbed the Willy D's custard shop that was next door... You can always get a good shake or malt too. An added bonus to an otherwise Mexican food restaurant!

VERY HIGHLY recommended!

Thanks again guys! Keep it up!!

If you're like my buddy Charles who likes a good 1/4 wiener then you'll love munchies. I give these guys a freaking 5. I had a slaw dog and just ordered a second. I love creativity in food and these guys get creative. It's delicious, the environment is really basic and chill, the staff is friendly and looking to make sure you enjoy your experience at Munchies. Definitely visit if you like hot dogs or Mexican food or mix of both cause they do that too. Loved it

Drove by many times, finally was convinced by my hubby to stop in. Boy am I glad he did! I ordered the Taco Salad, best I have had in a long time! Loaded with ground meat and tasty ground meat. The hubby got the steak tacos he really enjoyed his meal as well. Now the true test is the picky child, she ordered a side of rice and refried beans as well as chips with queso, well no complaints from her, she actually asked to go back the next day! I have to say the queso was pretty tasty as well!

I passed this place up all the time because its all suspicious looking. Until one day, I was in Breaux Mart, buying taco shells for my bomb ass chicken tacos I was making later that night, when my cashier told me how Munchies had some massive burritos and they were delicious. My BF was hungry and decided we go check it out since they were better than the other taco place in Chalmette.

We went inside & it's totally not how you'd imagine it from passing by. It's definitely cozy. We ordered something light to split. Two beef tacos dressed to order. The tacos were literally annihilated in 2 minutes !! Glad we made that tiny pit stop. 

Now the problem is, my chicken taco couldn't cure the Mexican craving and all the BF talked about the next day is how great Munchies is. I'm not mad though because I am craving for some too !

This Mom & Pop version of a Chipotle is Bad-ass and totally awesome! They don't really have Chipotles in LA, but this was even better cuz it is made by hand and with love! 

We ate here 2x while I was in town! The first time I had a ground beef burrito - it was MASSIVE! The biggest to date! Everything was fresh and delicious! Being a Cali girl in Louisiana, I was skeptical to try their version of Mexican foods! I was pleasantly surprised to say that it was tasty and really really delicious! Their refried beans were good, and not can tasting! Their rice was super flavorful and very good! They got a good couple of salsa's but their corn salsa is where its at! Not to red onion'y and just very well executed! 

The 2nd time I ate there, I decided to have the taco salad. The chicken was very moist and tasted yummy! The salad was fresh and crispy and very green, their black beans are OK, nothing to brag about, but the salad came out really good , and you get a massive amount of food, for what little you are paying! 

The guys that run the joint, are super cool, personable and nice. I found out he was originally from Texas, and he owns the place with his family. Its weird cuz they cook and sell Mexican food and Hot Dogs and then they got a frozen custard side to the shop .. Frozen custard, what is that you say? Just pretty much one of the best frozen treats Ive ever tasted! I only had a spoonful of it, cuz once you eat there, there is really no room for dessert! 

Its very very clean and the boys that work there are in tip top when it comes to service! So props to Munchies for having awesome munchies and super good Mexican food alllllll the way in Louisiana!

The guys at Munchies are kind and friendly which means service is excellent. There's no rush to choose what you want on your taco or burritos and the burritos are giant! I usually stick to vegetarian options and their salsa with corn and cilantro always tastes delicious.
The inside is extremely nice! From the outside it looks like a strip mall type Thai place, and on the inside it looks very modern and inviting. The food was also much better than expected.

Boise Thai Noodle is a new Thai restaurant that popped up on Yelp so we decided to check it out.  I had the Panang Curry with chicken and it had great flavor perfect amount of medium spice.  Vegetables and chicken were cooked perfectly.  My husband had the drunken noodles with beef and cleaned his plate.  The restaurant was very clean and staff attentive and friendly.  We will be back to try other menu items and will bring friends and family.

Newly opened, family owned and operated, small Thai eatery in a remodeled space at a west Boise strip mall.  (Location orientation: same strip that has Lindy's steak house on one end and Guido's pizzeria on the other.)  Frank and  Pisutkan (Pitsi) Adams are the owners, she is from northern Thailand and she and others from Thailand are doing the cooking.  It may be that Frank and the nice young woman who was our server are the only people in the mix who are not part of the Thai heritage family.

These are early days (take out started late October, dine in started November 2) for this small business' kitchen and they are still gauging customer demand.  One day in October take out times they were literally bought out of food after a Boise newspaper article reported they were open for take out. At peak times the small kitchen needs time to fill orders.  As a customer I recommend approaching this with grace and perspective.  As in considering a delayed meal or sold out item from a small, newly opened eatery is an inconvenience not a life tragedy.

TAKE OUT - DINE IN:  If our lunch time experience on their second day of dine in service was typical for less than a dozen people in the roughly 50 seat eatery but with a good number of  people coming in pick up take away, it may be that people are unaware dine in is available.   Now you know! 

SERVICE:  Full table service and server was covering the dining room and bar seating  areas and managing take out orders.  She was friendly, knowledgeable about menu, efficient and clearly enjoyed working there.  Both she and a cook who came out of the kitchen as we left thanked us for our business.  Very nice.

MENU / PRICES:  The same menu is used lunch and dinner and focuses on: 

*noodles (3 kinds $13.50 - $14.50) and noodle soups (4 kinds $14.50), 
*curry dishes (5 kinds $16 - $17), 
* tom soups (2 kinds $$14.50 - $17.50) and salads (3 kinds $12 - $13), 
*specialty rice dishes (4 kinds $13.50 - $17.50),  and 
*starters like crispy rolls, fresh rolls, chicken wings and... (7 items $9 - $11)

GOOD FOOD FIRST VISIT & PLANNING SECOND:  My experience as disappointed consumer of Thai food in the Boise area, after having enjoyed lots of it in other cities, is that many local Thai places over extend their menus to include Chinese and other Asian dishes and do none of them very well.  The menu here is smaller which allows focus to create good Thai food in the small kitchen.

Given Noodle in the name of the restaurant we ordered noodle dishes on our first visit; pad thai - because it is for us in a Thai eatery as spaghetti with marinara is in a family Italian place, a benchmark dish - and khao soi - a northern Thai spicy egg noodle curry that is a fav of mine and not often found on Thai restaurant menus locally - in fact Mai Tai may be the only other serving it and they offer it only at dinner.

We enjoyed both dishes, although in my experience with khao soi it is served brothier than was the noodle dense presentation here.  But it was good for flavor and presented in the classic style with braised chicken leg included and Chinese style soup spoon and chopsticks for eating it in the traditional way even if it lacked the pickled mustard greens and thin sliced shallots I've had elsewhere.   We appreciated the pad thai was well seasoned and not the overly sweet, sticky finish that can be in this dish in some places.

Spice levels offered mild, medium, hot.

Such generous portions that there were leftovers from both dishes to take home. 

Next time we'll try Thai basil rice dish and tom yum...or maybe pumpkin curry, another favorite.

VIBE & SEATING:  Nice job of remodeling what was a dingy  (Chinese food restaurant) space before, it is a little dark inside, in the way of moody not unpleasant, given wall color choices and limited windows.  Seating at bar and in bar at two top tables are high seats.  Two standard height four top tables also in  bar (hooray) and throughout dining room.  We also appreciated that it was peacefully quiet.  One could hear the buzz of conversation, including appreciation for the food, from other diners and the owner greeting a diner who already was considered a regular as he asked her, "What should I try today?".  No piped in music, the tv over the bar was on with no sound.  Ahhhhh-some!

ACCESSIBILITY:  Accessible parking spaces (2) outside door in lot.  All on one floor inside, standard height tables with path of travel to and floor space at some looking ample for diners using wheelchairs as ADA requires for equal access.  They even include the ADA required standard height seats in bar which so many Boise dining places ignore.  Good for them. Didn't check the loos.

PARKING:  Private lot shared with others in this strip mall. 

HOURS:  Open Mon - Sat for lunch until 3:00 then closed, as many family restaurants are in late afternoons to let staff eat and refresh the kitchen before dinner service, reopening for dinner at 5:00.

So happy to finally have a great restaurant on this side of town. It's beautiful Inside and so far I've always been able to walk in to get a table. We have been two nights in a row now because we wanted the chance to try something else on the menu after loving our food on night one. Plus it's family owned and operated! Highly recommend the drunken noodles, panang curry and coconut shrimp. Oh and don't forget the sticky rice with mango, you won't regret it!

Very expensive for rice, noodles, vegtables and chicken. Beautiful decor but was hoping on a good cheap noodle place to eat daily. This is just another special occasion only place located in a cheap eat strip mall.

Had a delicious lunch at the new Thai spot in town. The name and exterior had me shy away for a bit since it didn't scream authentic to me. But kept hearing rave reviews so I figured I'd try it out. The interior is clean and has a nice ambiance. Frank was super awesome and talked me through the menu and gave his recommendations. Because of him I tried the Thai coffee which was delicious. If you love Thai tea and also love coffee it's a must try. Reminded me of a non alcoholic White Russian . The pad Thai was a little on the sweeter side but still delicious, if I order again I'd ask to make it a tad spicy to balance it out. Overall I was very pleased and can't wait to go back and try some other menu items. If you love Thai and have been disappointed with the others in town I would tell you to check this place out.

This may be the best hidden gem in Boise.  Easily the best Thai I have had here.  The staff were super nice.  It is a family owned place, which is also a huge plus.

We got:
Chicken satay, which was pretty decent
Rota and curry which far exceeded my expectations.  Very good
Green curry and fried rice.  Omg.  Very good and tasty
Spicey basil stuff with chicken.  Very good.

Only drawback is it could have been spicier, but I like things crazy hot too..  excellent
Howard and I just had a delicious meal. We had the shrimp pad Thai and yellow pork curry. Best in Boise
Very friendly people, food was really tasty. If you like spicy food, ask for the chili oil.
Best restaurant food I've had in Boise for some time. Worth the wait. Can't wait to go back!!
