We ordered the spring rolls, yellow curry, and drunken noodles. Everything was delicious and flavorful. The yellow curry and drunken noodles had the perfect amount of spice. Definitely going back!

Awesome place if you're craving authentic Thai food that doesn't surrender to compromise. Love that they make their curries and sauces from scratch, which is important when balancing heat, salt, sour, and sweet flavors that make for a rich sauce that goes well with your choice of meat, fish or tofu. 

So far we visited twice -- once for dine-in and the second time for takeout. It's on my list of favorites, so we'll be back again soon.

Friday night, I placed to-go order via phone at 5:24pm. I was quoted 45-60 minutes. I arrived at 6:13pm and waited in lobby until 6:55pm. It was clear that everyone who ventured to this place waited as long, if not longer. The staff scurried in an chaotic, disorganized manner - like an opening night.

I ordered panang pork spicy , pad thai beef medium, mango sticky nice and fresh rolls for $52. The curry was oily and bland, with none of the tang typical if panang. The pad thai is pale and also bland. I don't know if giving them time to get the place organized would help the bland flavor. So disappointed.
So incredibly delicious. Service was great. Nice clean atmosphere. This is my new favorite place!

The wait is over.  The Treasure Valley finally has a Thai restaurant that actually serves REAL Thai cuisine.  To get the ingredients she needs, Pisutkan Adams grows some of her own special items.  The attentiveness to getting the flavors right, really comes through in the dishes served.

The word is getting out, so anyone who chooses to wait to try this place may be missing out on a really good thing.

Thai cuisine is all about FRESH, BRIGHT flavors, not the sauced-over starchy stuff that some other "Thai" places in the TV offer.  The owners in many of those instances are not even Thai, and it shows in the poor quality.

We had the Som Tum (green papaya salad) at a level 5 heat and the Thai Cashew Chicken.  I have been visiting Thailand since 1986 and have spent many weeks there over multiple visits.  It was there that I learned about the heat of Thai food and its special flavors.  The salad was beautifully prepared and the flavors were in superb balance.  Not the soggy fishiness found in other Tresure Valley salads.  Those other places suffer from the lack of fresh & correct ingredients and in trying to make up for it, the restaurant throws in too much (old) fish sauce.  Papaya salad is supposed to be a delicate, lively dish, not something that smells like a fish tank. The cashew chicken seasoning was outstanding, the rice was perfect.

There were about 5 tables of families/couples in the dining room and the takeout was bustling.  I think we saw 10+ takeout orders ready to leave there right when the people came in the door.  That was in roughly one hour.  The kitchen was working hard.  

They are closed from 3-5 each day, between the lunch and dinner service, so don't be confused by the hours listed on Yelp.

They have 5 different noodle soups in addition to the standards of Tom Kha and Tom Yum Koong.  There are 5 different curries.

They have 6 brews on tap.  Totally recommend the Tangerine Wheat Beer and Mac & Jacks Amber.  They pair well with the food.  

Michele R. review hit the nail on the head with regards to the quality and taste of the cuisine from this business.

One reviewer needs to go back to Las Vegas and take her bad attitude with her.  Scoring a place that has been open less than a month with a 1-star is soooo low class.  Very non-Idahoan.  These hard working folks do not need your disrespect.   

We strongly recommend Boise Thai Noodle House.  Join us as we go back, and back and back...can't wait to try the Larb.

Suggestion: have them add some spiciness (1-5) as it really wakes up Thai food.  Walk on the wild side - you can always dial it back on a subsequent visit.

This is the BEST Thai place EVERRRRRRR...

We ordered the Chicken Sauté, Pineapple Fried Rice and the fresh shrimp roll...Woweeee!  Mouth-watering DELISH!

I recommend this restaurant, but be careful...you'll become addicted to it like we are!

Really good sandwiches.  The bread was crazy-fresh.

I had the Tuesday special, which was turkey, ham, and bacon.  The meat was fresh-sliced, the toppings quality, and it was just a really fantastic sandwich.

The counter person was extremely polite and helpful.

I'm definitely going to be back!

I am here about every other week and have been since opening. I'm so glad Goodscents came to South County! The sandwiches are always fresh, store is always clean and staff has been great. I at times bring my 2 year old with me who likes to "help," the workers are always friendly with her and don't mind when she hands them her chips or money.

I was excited to see them opening this new location. Food is good. Nice selection of sandwiches and boxed meals. Parking is hard to get in and out of. Service really lacks. They have an extremely rude employee working in front. Hopefully, they will work this out.
Went to pick up family pack of chicken Alfredo, TOLD THE GUY THAT MAKES IT IS NOT HERE. I left with my money and went to the Noodle Company at the mall...

This is my first time at this restaurant. My understanding is the owner was the owner of Pho Quang Minh in Marrero. He sold his previous location. I ate there once and thought it was good.  I heard he opened a new location so I was excited to try it again. I have to say I was a little underwhelmed. I ordered the most basic thing (Vietnamese egg rolls) and they were out. She offered me the Chinese egg rolls. I was hesitant to try it but I agreed to it anyways. I am not sure how a Vietnamese owned restaurant has Chinese eggrolls versus Vietnamese eggrolls. The eggrolls came out hot and crispy but I could tell they were the frozen kind that you could buy and fry at home.  My son wanted dumplings and they were out of that too. I proceeded to order spring rolls and com ga quay. Spring rolls were the traditional kind, it had specks of black on the rice paper which really turned me off. The com ga quay was the best dish and my son enjoyed it.  Overall I was not impressed but I will certainly give it another try. We need more Vietnamese restaurants so I am hope they succeed. My suggestion is shorten the menu to their specialty dishes and leave out the fluff.  Service was mediocre but I don't expect anything more. Vietnamese restaurants typically has meh service.

This spot is tucked away in the center of a food strip off Manhattan. You'd never know it judging from the outside but it can easily accommodate 100+. 

They are mostly known for their pho ga and rice dishes. We stayed on par with the course and ordered the No.1 pho ga dac biet, hu tieu thap cam, and the salt and pepper spare ribs with rice. For my non-Viet yelpers, Dac Biet is generally used to indicate a specialty or combo on a menu. Let me be one of the firsts to tell you the broth was just that -Special. Just the way grandma makes it simmered on low for hours on end. The true test lies within the color of the broth. You're looking for a broth that's clean, clear while still full of flavor. Check. Check. And Check. 

Hu Tieu, like pho, is a Vietnamese noodle soup. However, it is loaded with pork, shrimp, crab meat, and tiny pieces of crispy pork skins (more of that please!). 

The salt and pepper spare ribs were lightly seasoned. But maybe they were off having an off day I'm certainly willing to give it another try. And while the portions were perfectly sized for me, the bowls looked tiny against my 6'2 bf. The current portions doesn't really allow much room for you to add in your fixings (leafy greens and bean sprouts). However, it is worthy to note that our food was served fast and piping hot. 

If the weather is too hot for soup there are other options available on the menu to choose from including vegetarian. We will definitely be back for the hu tieu and the other items on the menu.

Food here is really good. I know it's the owner of the old Pho Ga Quang Minh. Service on the other hand is really iffy. There's this lady who always seem to be grouchy. One time ate there, the food was great but service wasn't that great. There was a bigger table which she seem to be more focus on than the table my wife and I were at. This time as I sitting here eating, I want to say something. We order the same dish as last time. When the food came out, there was only one medium size bowl of white rice. We said since we ordered two dishes shouldn't there be two bowls of that rice? The younger lady said no should be one of the medium size bowl for the two dishes. She said if we ordered one dish we would get one small bowl of rice which btw only good foe one person to eat. And that person had to add more, no way that's enough. We said last time we got one big bowl with that one dish. She said there's no way. So basically she said we lied. If you add rice, they going charge you extra. So be aware of this. Food is really good but service is subpar at best.

The food here is really good! I've had a lot of different dishes here. The pho ga dac biet, mi vit quay, and com ga quay are repeats.

The only really bad and said thing about this place is the service. My family and I have come here so many times and the service has been horrible. Sometimes it'll take 5-10 minutes to take our order and they seem to get something wrong every time. The food takes awhile to come out too. I guess you can't really expect a viet restaurant to have good service but they could at least have decent service!

If you're in a rush or get impatient waiting I don't know if you'd want to wait this long. Again, the food is good but service is so bad. I hope the service gets better just overall for their business so customers are happy and are more likely to return.

Owner of former Pho Ga Quang Minh's new location. Glad he's not located so deep in the back of Barataria anymore. A more spacious location with the same, extensive menu. Service is a hit or miss but the food is always good. A few favorites are the pho ga dac biet, mi xao, mi hoanh thanh, com ga quay and vit quay.

This is my first time visiting. Waiter came over and brought my menu and asked if I would like to order. Advised that I would like to view the menu first and ask if they were still serving lunch. He came back with my ice tea as I was still viewing the menu and asked if I wanted anything. Responded that I wouldn't be here if I didn't want anything. As he walked away so did I.
I love their Banh Canh Ga dac biet, which is not on the menu. It's like a Vietnamese udon soup with dark meat chicken. Their pho is very tasty too
descent food with reasonable prices for the most part, except when i ordered the combination fried rice, hardly anything it it except fried rice. i took picture and was disappointed.

Ah yes, the Riverwinds in West Deptford along the Delaware river.......Great atmosphere, decent service, not great food.  This was my third visit and took someone for their birthday.  Would not have picked this establishment, but she did and it was here birthday, so couldn't argue that.

Knowing I have had bad meals in the past, I just ordered the Filet Kabob appetizer.  Ordered it medium rare, and the waiter said he would have to tell the cooks.  COOKS?  Where is the chef?!!?  My birthday partner ordered the shrimp scampi.  So my kabobs come out, and even though most pieces were medium rare, the felt and tasted like the well done. Not to mention, over seasoned with pepper, even if you like pepper.  As for the scampi, well there was a fair amount of shrimp, but half the spaghetti had no sauce on it.  Very  dry.  The parts that had the sauce tasted fine.  The shrimp seemed fresh, and had a decent taste.  Portion size was also fine..  Lets not forget the bread and butter they serve before the meal.  Bread is nothing to get excited about.  Bakery fresh bread, but leaves a bit to be desired.  The whipped butter I would have assumed was homemade as they put enough salt in it to almost cause an instant heart attack.  This is coming from someone that uses a decent amount of salt, and it was well over salted for I.

This was not my first bad experience at Riverwinds.  Last time was poorly cooked and poor quality rack of lamb.  Service was decent.  Waiter was very attentive.  Cocktails a little under poured for the price.  For $7.00 I would have expected a much better pour.  Atmosphere was great, over looking the river and watching the snow.  Its Greek owned, so can understand why the food is not up to par.  Have never been to a Greek owned restaurant with great American cuisine.  Would not return for food, but would for the atmosphere.

Nice location, decor and ambiance.  Menu is the same as it was when they opened 8 years ago.  I recommend the owners change it up a bit.  Get creative and come out with seasonal menus, or at least add a new meal to the I once or twice a year.

Holiday Dinners:
My family went here for Thanksgiving in 2017.  This was family style and the service was good.  The food was amazing and the serving sizes were perfect!  Sides were brought out in smaller portions to pass atriums the table so as not to waste, but refills were brought quickly upon request.  We even went home with plenty of leftovers to split amongst 4 couples.  Although I rate this 3 stars overall, I rate 5 stars for holiday dinners.

I had a birthday dinner on 10/5/17 at 4:45 with a friend . Spent $110 including tip for 2 people . Tables were half empty .ordered dinner , was halfway done when server begins clearing friend's dishes off table bumping my arm twice .causing me to drop my forkful of fish & sauce on my lap & soaking my clothing . Food was overly salted & spicy . Dessert brought to table , had not touched my coffee & had one bite of my dessert & being handed the bill . Felt very rushed & insulted . Server returned several times to get the check we had not finished eating . I do not root through my purse to pay for the bill until I'm finished eating . 
I felt like it was a race against time to get us out of there . It was rude , embarrassing & I apologized to my friend for our poor dining experience . I hope Riverwinds reads this as they need to certainly retrain their servers .  Rating of 1 . Obviously I won't be returning . Wasted $110 .

My husband took me here for dinner tonight and it was delicious!  Really cool view of the Delaware River and the Philadelphia skyline, and you can also watch the planes come in to land at the Philadelphia airport. Pretty neat! We sat inside and figured out later that we could have sat outside. I would recommend outside if the weather is nice. It looked really cool and we were disappointed we didn't know to ask to be seated outside. There were LOTS of wine, beer and cocktail options. Our meals were both great. I had the crabby pasta and my husband had the ribeye. Both meals came with salads and we got to pick house salad or Caesar. We  were both very pleased. There were also several desserts to choose from that all looked delicious. 
This is a great place for a special occasion. We saw several larger groups seated around us celebrating birthdays etc.

go there for the view. The food is good but the price us slightly inflated. my steak was cold, so they reheated it. any real chef would know you can't reheat a steak and have it come out to medium. kitchen can't time food coming out

Beautiful location and great views of Delaware River. It's really loud inside. The mixed drinks are tasty but pricy. The food is mostly very average. A few things are better like cheese steak spring rolls, French onion soup but the filet mignon for example is just ok. The chicken is tough and thick. Scallops are often undercooked. The salad that comes with the meals is nothing and comes with a house dressing. No choices here with the menu, things come a certain way and there's little or no variation available. The kids menu is over priced....one choice is spaghetti and does NOT come with a meatball or any protein but is priced like it should have more. It's really not a great place for kids but yes people bring kids. 

Their menu is limited, and very boring. Also the menu hasn't ever been updated, as far as I can tell, so it's the same old thing over and over for years. Usually every few years (at least) places add new things. You can't even get a normal baked potato here. This place could be so good but they need to re-invent their menu. It's long overdue. 

It's really nice to sit on their patio in spring and fall. They do have a singer out there on Fridays. It's geared toward 40 and up but it's a nice setting for a date. 

Also they have self parking or valet if you prefer. A polo and khakis is fine for men but no hats. Women can wear jeans and a sweater. I wouldn't wear sneakers but overall it's not as fancy as you might expect....from the appearance.

we went on a Saturday night.... when i walked in I was like "ooh this is nice" we were seated right away.... service was good and my crab cake was delish! The bar area was nice too.....def coming back

I suggest someone buys this little gem and make it the destination for boaters and locals alike.
The service is very poor "people walking out as I type", the food is average, but the atmosphere is friendly .

Someone who a strong desire for bringing food, booze , and entertainment here would have a gold mine .

If you have about  2.5 hours for a cheeseburger, this is the place to come, otherwise go to Burger King.

Good luck!!

That's quite a lot of braggadocio for a tiny Chinese takeout shop on the bad side of Brunswick Avenue in Trenton, NJ. Actually, there is no good side in that part of town. Of course, it is just advertising; meaning that none of that name is true. 

This chop shop is state of the art dumpy and depressing. The woman at the order station is friendly enough, but the kitchen help spends a lot of time staring out at the customers. Just a little weird. Whether eating in or taking away, the food is served in the same closed take out containers. Plastic and styro all the way. Chinese tea? Bring yours from home. 

It's not that the grub is bad, it is about average for a joint that doesn't much care about you, and assumes you know nothing about Chinese/American food. The wonton soup, pork egg foo young and fried rice were recognizable by sight and taste. Yellow dye chicken stock, thick skinned dumplings, day old yellow chunky rice - just the way they taught them in mail order cooking school.  

Edible, but forgettable.
The most underrated Chinese food spot around! Quick and friendly service with large portions.
Food taste way better than any other Chinese place around. Lady behind the counter is friendly. Keep up the good work

Don't be fooled by the name or this pic. The food was okay. I was looking forward to a great meal, but that wasn't what I got. Everyone knows the spots in the hood are the best, but I won't be going back. I paid $24 for boneless ribs & Lomain, fried shrimp, and crab rangoons. And they didn't even include a free can of soda ! The boneless ribs were tough & the lomain tasted old. I ate because I was starving, but I probably won't even eat the leftovers. Disappointed & the name definitely should be changed.

If i ever get Chinese food in Trenton. This is where i go. I like the BBQ chicken wings cut up and the shrimp rolls. Basic but delicious. The customer service is regular there's not much you can do because of Covid. They don't allow people into the actual store anymore. The number is also always busy but if you go to the actual store you can order. All in all the food is pretty good and the prices are pretty regular. The lady who takes your order is cool. I think the make shift box to pay for your food is funny. I can't see the kitchen so i really don't know if it's clean or how they cook back there but the place has 4 stars so i assume it's clean and i don't actually see a rating in the door. So i really don't know  wow this review went to Sh*t quick. Anyway i still eat from here the BBQ wings are delicious.

This is the best Chinese spot around. We looked at the place like yeah ok let's try it. I really think it's gonna be nasty to my surprise it was some of the best Chinese I have ever had and I'm very funny about Chinese food. The lady was polite the place was clean and quick. The name does say it all best dood in town and that it is. I highly recommend it it's worth the small drive from anywhere in Mercer county area!!!!!!

Called to order a burrito the guy told me to wait then left me on hold for 15 minutes before I hung up. Went in to order the burrito for takeout in person. Waited another 40 minutes before they told me they were waiting on takeout boxes but that they would be there soon. Then waited another 15 min before I decided to just eat there. The server then brought out the wrong order and I decided to just get a refund after an hour of waiting. As I was trying to get my refund the server acted like I never said burrito even though I had the receipt. Very disappointing considering their food is amazing.
The food was really good it's very close to me and the service was so much better then last time I came here.

Decided to visit this new restaurant in Kenneth City. While waiting for our food I decided to open a Yelp page for them. It took a little while to get food because they were fixing a large to go order. Hubby got 3 tacos and said they were delicious. I do not eat meat or dairy so ordered some black beans and rice along with a tostada with black beans, veggies and no cheese. The beans were delicious but runny and blended. So next time I will request a mixture of rice and beans rather than just beans. We shall return, it's nice to have another spot here in Kenneth City. I do hope they get a better understanding of no meat and no dairy.

i was quite excited when i heard they had  birria tacos a while ago. the birria was ok but somewhat greasy which made it somewhat hard to enjoy. however the chips and queso was amazing 10/10 would recommend it.

I stopped in today for lunch and was pleasant surprised. I ordered the agu Fresca de jamaica and the asada fries. The fries where freshly made, looked hand cut ( which I appreciate) and had a lot of meat/ topping. the atmosphere is fun and inviting. Food was served quickly and with a smile. I highly recommend this place!
When I feel homesick, I know I could come to this restaurant can get a little Touch of Home.

I was craving some Mexican food this weekend so I decided to check out a new spot I recently heard about, Tikismexicangrill. This spot is north of St Pete, actually Kenneth City. It is located in an older plaza and is somewhat hard to see from the road. I called in my order, so this review focuses on the food.

I decided to try some tacos and a quesadilla. I went with a pastor, carne asada, and tinga taco. I saw they offered birria and decided to try a birria quesadilla.  They said it would be 15 minutes which worked out well. 

I arrived and they had my order ready. I paid and walked out to the car to find only one box in my bag and it felt a bit light. I found 4 tacos in my box instead of the 3 I ordered and a quesadilla. I went back in and told them about the issue and they tossed a quesadilla on for me. It came up quickly and I was on my way. They were good about making it right.

I got home and dove in. The birria taco looked great and also tasted great. The consume was on point as well. It was nice to find another solid option for birria close to St Pete. The chicken tinga was really tasty as was the carne asada & pastor. All of the tacos had a generous amount of filling. The birria quesadilla was hefty and quite filling. I had hoped it would be served with the consume, but it was not. They packed it with a solid amount of cheese and meat. The sauces that were served with the tacos and quesadilla all had great flavor and a decent amount of heat. 

Overall, the food was quite good. There was some confusion with the order, but they made it right quickly and I was happy with the way they handled it. The birria taco was on point and I really look forward to having a few more of those. I will definitely return in the near future to enjoy some of their other menu items.

The BEST BEST BEST Birria tacos we have had so far. We always get the 3 for $10. With some horchata (a must) u always get chips and salsa. The service is great and food is amazing. We have tried about 4 other restaurants trying to find the best tasting Birria but far they rank #1 with my family. whenever we travel to st Pete we make sure with hit tikis tacos.

This place needs to taste the food they are selling..taco carnitas chewy and bland, burrito  absolutely tasteless,  the Mexican street corn was nothing like what I've ever had before it was swimming in something sour, it supposed to be just mayo and butter and the tamale was apparently cooked days ago and was dry, but not too bad...and I forgot everything we ordered was a dollar more than the menu mentioned...sorry. I won't be going back!
Place is under new management, food came fast and servers were great. Definitely a spot to sit down and dine in!

I love to support local businesses and love Mexican.   The first time was takeout and my food was excellent and food fresh.  Second time, we choose to dine in and Quesa birilia taco preparation was not the same and we were all disappointed with our tacos and nachos.  I made the waitress aware, she seemed clueless as to what to say.  We paid and left.  

I am posting pictures from my first takeout, again, the better experience.  

I may try to go back again but definitely disappointed with the lack of consistency with food and honestly service was lacking.

Stopped in after a long and particularly exhausting day at work, in need of taco therapy. Tikis did not disappoint! The el pastor was good but the birria carne asada was the best taco birria I've had! I also had an elote which was tasty but cold. Jamaica was perfect. I'll definitely be back! Hopefully they will have esquites next time.
Went to the tiki taco and beer restaurant, sat there for 15 minutes they weren't even packed. I finally left, they need help they look confused.

My first time here. Was greeted with such kindness. Brought my client with me, we ordered the 2 taco special. I also had there chips and dip with guacamole,  omg the guacamole was so darn good. I always wanted homemade Mexican food done just like I like it. I will be coming back. I'm also going to let my social media friends know about them to. Yes to Tikis Tacos and beer
Great service, the girl was so nice and friendly! And the food was delicious! Would recommend the quesabirria tacos, azada fries and the new bowls
I'm from Chicago born and raised Mexican and this Tiki restaurant is the best Mexican restaurant in St Pete.

if i could give this no stars i would. literally the worst service i have ever had at a restaurant, the servers were nice but took 40 minutes to come and refill our drinks and chips. There were 3 tables in the whole restaurant including us and it took us an hour and a half to get our
food. the burrito we ordered had a hair in it, the salsa and queso were very bland, the queso was genuinely just melted cheese. my tacos were fine i guess, but didn't have much flavor and were loaded with cilantro even though I asked for no cilantro. I work in the food industry and never complain, but this was ridiculous.
They put 3 slices of cheese in a foot long, shoul put more, also the same with tomatoes, pickles, olives, etc......

Just a heads up. Don t waste your time going to this location if you wish to use a subway coupon from a local publication. This owner per her franchise agreement chooses night to accept the corporate supplied coupons. To make matters worse this owner owns 2 locations on West Esplanade, Loyola, and Williams Blvd lakeside. So I guess her attitude is I pretty much I have a monopoly  in Kenner so if you don t like go some place else. So I will BYE BYE SUBWAY! There are other choices!

This place just screams horrible customer service & lack of business sense. The two females that served me and my husband were trashy in appearance and manners. These ladies weren't courteous to us by any means. None of them said "Welcome to subway I'm .... may assist you today with making your sandwich" I asked for a chipotle steak and cheese wrap and one of them was rude about having the tomato and basil tortilla wrap.These females were ruder to me when I asked them to put more veggies on the wrap they were flinging the ingredients all over like my food like it had a disease. They put on the sauce where it was too freaking much.

If you are in the mood for Subway this is a nice, clean and well ran Subway.  I have been to other Subways and received HORRIBLE service and they were out of stuff and the veggies and meat didn't look so fresh but here they are always on point, quick to let you make your eventeenbillion choices for a sandwich and get you on your way.

nasty guy making our food was not wearing a mask. is he at least six feet away from the food? no!!! this dude was making sandwiches during a pandemic breathing into the food and all of the ingredients! unacceptable!!! this location need a reality check! you are making peopoe
sick!!!!!

I've never been to a subway that gives so little meat on their sandwiches. There were 4 bit sized pieces of chicken on my sandwich. Also, I asked for salt and pepper and the lady put whole peppercorns on the sandwich instead of grinding the peppercorns. Worst subway experience ever.

The staff here need to find new occupations. They can not make sandwiches, simple as that. I often wonder if THEY would even eat the sandwiches they make. Just a sloppy embarrassing mess. There is another subway location just down the road on the corner of Loyola, not even a minute away, and much better than this location.

This was my first visit. I must admit I will be going back. The service was excellent. The food was great. I  had the fried flounder and garlic noodles   they were both ever good and the fresh lemonade was equally delicious.

0 stars if I could. Owner is a complete jackass. He's disrespectful and completely fill of himself. Can't admit his mistakes. Makes an order wrong and insists it's the customers fault. Shouldn't be running a business. His attitude alone is the main reason not to go here. The food is not worth the money when I could buy it at shoprite and make it better. Steer clear. Go to the boiling house in deptford if you want some good and reasonably priced seafood.

If I can give zero stars I would, please stay away from this place. Management is very unprofessional. 

My family have been waiting to try this place for a while. We finally decided to try this place and my mom was super exited because she wanted this fish po' boy (made with cod). We got our food, starting to enjoyed our family night when she noticed, after starting her sandwich, that it was shrimp. She is allergic to shrimp. Now mistakes happen, however, this was not a simple mistake. Thankfully my mom didn't have to get rushed to the hospital. 

I called the restaurant to speak with the manager. Mike came on the phone and didn't believe they made a mistake. He was very condescending with his responses and even made jokes about the refund saying "I can give for a refund for just the sandwich and a piece of key lime pieee" in a funny tone.  I have never felt so disrespected in my life. This is my mother and if anything were to happen to her, it would have been very devastating. I asked for a full refund and was told that wasn't going to happened, but I can bring the sandwich and receipt back.

When I went back Mike left, leaving his associates to deal with this issue that is still not resolved. Mangers are suppose to be leaders for their staff and the fact that he left just shows he is not ready for a leadership position. I'm just very disappointed and will not support this business or the other locations.

I have been waiting for this place to open up and finally got to give it a try. I have been to The Boiling House in Marlton and was excited when Express opened in Deptford. Now Keep It Shrimple opened up down the street so I'm in seafood heaven. I ordered on Grubhub and decided to pick it up. I thought the inside of the restaurant was pretty cool and definitely different from the other two restaurants. I want to say it felt like a restaurant down the shore and it even had a booth area that was shaped like a boat. Anyway the hostess went to go and grab my order and handed it to me but it was definitely light. I had ordered 1lb of shrimp with sausage and seafood fried rice. I looked in the bag and saw only one tray. I said to the hostess I think I'm missing an item so she went to the back to ask. She came back with who I think was a manager and she told me everything was there. This then turned into a polite argument. I popped the tray open and only saw shrimp and sausage and I told her I ordered seafood fried rice as well. She told me I didn't. I showed her my Grubhub order and she said it didn't come through and only the shrimp was on there. Well if it did or didn't come through correctly I still paid for it. She went to the back to get the rice made and told me it would be a few minutes. She came back, handed me the bag and I didn't look back. Got home, take the food out, and it was just shrimp fried rice. No crab, no mussels, just shrimp! I called Grubhub who offered a refund but I really wanted the food. Anyway I went with the Keep It Shrimple sauce and went hot this time. Sauce was good and I liked it better than medium that I got at Express. The sausage was good and it came with a little roll with butter and garlic which came in handy to soak up some of that hot sauce. Also the rice was tasty but really wish it was what I ordered.
Friendly staff, great food.  I ordered take out.  I got the Shimple fried rice and it was great.  Will be my Shrimp go to place.
This site it's.  really pathetic. Because the people make sandwich.  It's.  mad.  I'm mad too never come back here need mor attention at costumer service.
It's so slow , they only have one person working there.  It's not like they are making awesome hoagies there. It's considered fast food but it's never fast.

This location is in the Levittown Towne Center ( real name, no joke ) within the Wal-Mart Supercenter. I am confused about this because the seating area can only seat 40 people, heck the store is over 100,000 square feet so more than that is on one asle at any given time. While they do try to deliver a quality product some how my sandwich was just mushy and some parts tasted odd which had the remaining 2-3rds end up in thr rubbish. Did they have an off day ?  Was a supply truck overdue ?  I don't know but i expected better. It is the cleanest location i ever saw though...

There is a young guy with blonde hair that kind of has a wave in the front who gives amazing customer service and was extremely kind to my son and I. My son asked me to give him a good tip and I'm not sure if they can even take tips, but in the midst of checking out and getting his drink and making sure I'd get to pick my other child up in time I lost track of doing so but will make a special trip to go give him a tip. Good customer service is so rare these days, this young man deserves to be commended and they should be proud to have him as an employee.

Another fast food chain that sells disgusting food . 
Goodluck eating here, they even have the most overrated nba player promoting this junk. I wonder what he got paid to LIE

Looking for lunch on a rainy Sunday.  Checked out many different stands in this newer food hall in downtown Nashville.  I settle on this place because I like corndogs and never had a corn-brat.  

I put in my order and wandered off because they said it could be 10 mins.  Their estimate was pretty close.

The corned brat was OK - it was a bit tough.  Being from Wisconsin I consider myself a brat aficionado and this was far from the best brat I have had.  I still like the concept of this food product.  Now onto the tater tot side.  These were hands-down the best tots I have every had.  Not sure what their secret was beyond lots of salt but these were perfectly fried.  Good job.  

Finally I ordered their cream soda.  It was not very good.  It almost tasted like the fountain mix was incorrect.  It tasted off and a bit yucky.

So a mixed experience.

Watched the guy put the sausage on the grill, I think. Or at least it looked like that was what was going on. ... After he showed up from out back; should have known we wouldn't get anything edible after the initial impression.

I think the sausage got to room temperature. Maybe they're stored at room temperature, dunno, but it did not appear that this thing spent any time in the presence of heat.

I'd heard good things about Pharmacy, clearly that was not referencing this location. Avoid this food court at all costs.

I was excited to try the Pachanga because I've had some good vegan sausages in the past and it sounded pretty good on the menu. I wasn't especially impressed, though. Upon ordering, they told me people always freak out because it tastes and feels like real sausage, but not to worry because it's 100% vegan. Well, I would never confuse it for real sausage. The texture was super mushy and the flavor was just kinda bland. While I liked all the toppings, there was just too much to even attempt to eat by hand. Not the worst thing in the world, but it was also difficult to eat with a fork and knife, plus made the "toasted" lobster roll kinda soggy.

The redeeming factor was probably the tater tots. They gave me a hearty portion on the side, and perfectly crispy to make sure I was filled up. May not  go back, but I appreciate their efforts to provide a vegan option at least.
Ordered corn dogs for the kids, they couldn't make them because the guy said "I can't figure out how to make the batter" and by the time he finally substituted hot dogs, my food was cold.

I was a bit nervous to order from here being that it was 12:00 at night but the pizza was fantastic. Being from Jersey, I know good pizza and it all starts with the dough. If the dough sucks it's not even worth a bite but Palazzo's dough was ON POINT. Sauce was also delicious. I'd say this place is better than Eddie and Sam's which El Pres rated in the high 7s. Great job guys. We will be back!

SO good! I picked up a white pie from here last week. I met the owners. They are super friendly. It's so nice to see a building that has been empty for ages come back to life. Seriously- this pizza is delicious. 10/10 would recommend. I can't wait to come back!

We came here from St Pete's because we saw a piece on the local news about how they had opened as a new business during the Covid19 pandemic and we wanted to support them.  We had a great experience- such friendly people and the pizza is so good!  The crust is delicious and has a great chew.  High quality ingredients and reasonable prices.  I'm picky about my pizza and this is a pie worth traveling for.  We ate very well and will be repeat customers.  Palazzo Pizza deserves the community's support.
One of the best pizzas in Tampa. Fresh, high quality ingredients and a remarkably friendly staff. Will definitely be one of our go-to pizza spots going forward.

If you like wasting money and don't mind your pizza burnt and paper thin, then come to this place. This is one of the worst pizzas I've ever had.   Other than being flavorless, the texture was  overly crispy. I took a bite and couldn't even touch the rest of it. Service isn't great and parking is impossible.

I have been around the world a few times and this pizza is worth a try. You can tell they are using top quality ingredients from start to finish. Hard working Authentic Italians making authentic pizza. Tampa should be proud to have the chance to taste such wonderful flavors. And the kids all loved the pizza as well and that usually doesn't happen. 
I will be back on a regular basis as this is my new go to for fantastic pizza

I ordered pizza from here for the first time today and was pretty disappointed. My Margherita came with no sauce on it whatsoever, the crust was alright though maybe a little on the burnt side but without sauce it was bland and barely edible.

Visiting the Tampa Bay Area and looking for Great authentic Pizza at a good price! We couldn't be more happy with choosing Palazzos! The Lion was amazing and the Greek salad was the best salad I've ever had at a pizza joint. We received the wrong pizza from the Grubhub driver and the Owner personally delivered the correct pizza himself promptly. Would definitely recommend and return myself!
Has to be the best Meat Lover's pizza I've had in Tampa. Great vibe, awesome music, super convenient location. All around an amazing place to grab a slice.
Friendly staff and great cheese pizza and garlic knots. The cinnamon toast crunch is a great way to end your meal too. We will definitely be back soon.
Pizza was on point!! Great flavor, perfect crust, thin but not too thin. Amazing customer service as well.

We decided to come here on a Friday night after hearing friends telling us how good the pizza was and so glad we did...the pizza was top notch as you could tell they used the finest ingredients, "NV Meatballs"  were an excellent appetizer and the cinnamon toast crunch" was a sinfully good dessert.  If you want great pizza, this is the place!

Awesome pizza and salad. Sauce is homemade and you can tell. Salad is salad but the dressing is fabulous. You can tell it's homemade. I want to try the Sicilian next. My go to pizza place now. Great owners. Very personable. Everybody in South Tampa should try this to see.

I ordered a veggie pizza because I am a vegetarian. I was so hungry that I just opened the pizza and grabbed a slice and ate it. It had pepperoni. I called and told them and the owner said "well in our defense she's not blind is she, she could've seen the pepperoni before she ate it" 
I asked for ALL veggie

Horrible plain slice. Over priced. $39 for a 1/2 pepperoni+cheese large pie that was 1/4 as good as Digiornos. The only positive is that they are open until 4am in an area that a lot of people walk home - so if nothing else they Atleast provide a tiny bit more of security to those pedestrians and potentially a place to use the bathroom if the dude running the window doesn't rob you first. Absolutely do not eat here if you like pizza. I know a lot of people like to know if they were wearing masks or not ... I don't remember. But what I do remember is that I'd rather eat my dead grandmothers mask right before she gets buried than eat this

The pizza is really good! Came from Spring Hill, Fl to try it because pizza in Spring Hill area is not that good. It was worth the drive. Definitely have to order the Greek salad with your pizza, the salad is good. The staff is friendly. We will be back soon!

This place just opened a couple months ago and if you haven't tried it, you gotta check it out. Anthony was awesome and hooked me up with a delicious sausage pizza. The crust is the perfect amount of thickness and they're open until 4 am, can't beat that! Very nice guys that work there, highly recommend!

Finally, a fantastic pizza restaurant in the heart of Hyde Park! Their meatballs are by far the best I've had!! And I'm a meatball connoisseur! And their pizza is delicious!! Their staff is friendly and the atmosphere is cozy! I give it 5 stars and all thumbs UP! If you like pizza and meatballs you have to check it out!

Beware: Unauthorized charges placed on multiple credit cards across different people's accounts. This is clearly a SCAM that they are running here on unsuspecting patrons. Charged $35 for an $18 pizza and $43 TWICE for another $18 pizza.

The pizza itself was subpar and there are ZERO covid precautions being taken and the kitchen looked FILTHY.

Ordered the large Meaty Meat pizza and both the Tampa and Greek salads.  The website for online ordering was very simple and fast (I did carry out).  All items were very good.  The crust was fantastic and a bit crispy on the bottom which I love.  I felt like the ingredients in everything I ordered were of high quality.  I only wish the sandwiches were available before 10 pm as being an old man I am typically in bed before they'd be available.  I will definitely be a return customer.  The "small" salads were huge and I believe could easily serve two people.  The pizza was also very large and at $20 I thought a great value.

Nah...I love pizza and this pie did nothing for me.  Cheese was wayyy too sharp...they must use some sort of blend instead of mozzarella.  Additionally, the pizza could have used an extra 2-3 mins in the oven. 

Overall, I rate this as not good pizza but it's probably suitable for the drunkies after the club/bar.

On to the next!!!

Pizza was pretty darn good. But the wings... the wings must've been from new born chickens. The smallest wings I've ever seen. Tasted great but man for the price they are and the size you should get double the amount of wings. Just do better at picking product!

This is the best pizza I have had in Tampa! I keep asking them what do they put in their pizza and they always say the same thing, they use the best ingredients out here to make their pizzas. The customer service is extraordinary and I always feel like I am family when I dine in. The place is always clean and they have TVs playing local sports and National Sports and at night they play really good music for the night crew to enjoy the late night crowd because they stay open till 4am! Love Jason too!!!!

I don't know what is Boston-style pizza is, so I cannot comment on their authenticity, but Palazzo Pizza offers up fast pizza for carryout via their website and porch window that is easy to eat.

I ordered two pizzas online, and I was told to give them 15 minutes. That kind of turnaround time is impressive. I requested to pick up in 30 minutes, and when I arrived on time, I could see them putting the pizza into boxes. The restaurant has a large deck, and there is an ordering/pick up window on the deck, so I did not have to enter the restaurant. That's super handy in these COVID days, and it probably is a great convenience for people showing up at 3am for after bar pizza (they have very late hours on weekends). 

The pizzas were fine. I appreciated the crispy bottom crust. My husband and kids shared a large pepperoni pizza (half mushroom). My husband commented that he suspected the mushrooms were canned. I ordered a small sausage pizza since they mentioned on the website that they used a locally sourced Italian sausage supplier. I found the sausage to be tasty but not very remarkable. 

There is a small private lot next to the restaurant, so pick up was easy.

I found the pizza to be fine if not extraordinary. I'm glad that there's another locally owned pizza place in South Tampa.

HANDS DOWN BEST PIZZA IN TOWN!!!!!!
Flavor is off the charts! Super crispy! 
Loveeeee the white pizza!!!!!  
The steak sandwich that is ONLY available on Wednesday's is sooo yummyyy! I'll be back soon!

I'm always looking for a good pizza spot and came upon this new addition to the Hyde Park area.  I ended up ordering online and despite having a carryout order, there is still a convenience fee assessed, which was a bit puzzling.  Wait time for a Friday night wasn't bad at 25 minutes and paying for my order upon arrival was easy as they have a walk up window outside.  

I had ordered the Meaty Meat pizza, which has sausage, meatballs, pepperoni, and bacon toppings on the normal sauce and cheese pie.  Size and taste was great.  The icing on the cake for me was that the crust had a buttery flavor so it didn't have that normal cardboardy taste.  The crust was also chewy and a good consistency.

We were having trouble finding anything open passed 10 pm and ended up here, so happy we did. As long as you're  not a drunk mess you can go inside.  Every single person that worked there was so nice and friendly, our server was great and the owner even came over to say hi. The service was absolutely incredible. Being from Jersey we know pizza and this place is top notch. Don't hesitate to come here!!!! Ps F you Jason

Great pizza spot in soho! Located next to HPC there is limited parking on the street but an empty lot across the street. Feel free to seat yourself (we chose the patio.) we started the night with a few appetizers-empanadas, sausage + peppers, Greek salad and wings. You wouldn't expect empanadas at a pizza joint but they were actually really good! The salad was our least favorite of the bunch. It had quite the block of feta but overall the dressing wasn't your typical Greek we were expecting but more so of a vinegar and olive oil type dressing. The sausage and peppers weren't my choice while ordering but they were surprisingly delicious. Now these wings were the highlight of the night. Crispy fried outside but juicy inside. The garlic parm dry rub was intensified with the garlic sauce we just poured all over them. Honestly, some of the best wings I've ever had! Pizza was also great! Buffalo chicken could've used more Buffalo sauce for my liking but a side for dunking will suffice as well.

Don't go here unless you like burned dried up pizza.  No joke, 9 out of 10 times they serve you burnt cardboard.  I called and complained to the manager months ago but nothing changed.  So one time I had them go through all the pizzas looking for one that wasn't quite as burnt.  I asked why they cook them like that and was told that's how the person that cooks them likes his pizza. Sorry but that's ridiculous. I will drive out of my way from now on to go to a different location.

K I hate to do this because the gentleman helping was very nice, but My family and I get Little Caesars a lot and even when we get the 5$ it seems much better than this. There are more pepperonis than the 5$ but other than that very disappointing. The crust almost seems to be as if you reheated your pizza. There is very little cheese n the crust is huge. I looked at 4 5$ pizzas n they all looked horrible almost like the didn't have enough cheese and sauce to make a pizza, so I told him I'd buy the 6$ pizza. Not happy with waiting the extra 10 minutes for this and my normal Little Caesars would have made even a 5$ better than this. Hope they can make some changes at this location soon or I won't be visiting again that's for sure!

This is the second time I've had a horrible experience here. The workers are rude and unfriendly. They take your money and then tell you that there is a 15 min wait. Why not tell us that before and suggest something else? We asked them this today and the worker said "yep" and slammed the window in our face. That was terribly rude and the owner needs to fix it here because apparently I'm not the only one.

The only thing good about this place is that you can get drive-through pizza. With that said, I've been waiting here in my car for pizza for 15 minutes now. It's 6 PM on a Monday. No reason not to have pizza ready.

My brother and I go to this location once in a while, and it seems like EVERY time we go to this location they NEVER have pizzas ready. I thought the point of "Hot and Ready" was for them to be available upon order with the exception of a busy weekend night and they are trying to keep up. We went tonight and as usual the cheese pizza was not ready. We were told to park up front as usual and were told in 5 mins or less they would bring our order to the car. We waited and waited ( they were not busy) finally after about 15 mins and seeing three cars drive off with pizza, my brother went in to check the status of our order. OUR ORDER HAD BEEN READY JUST SITTING THERE!! . I am calling the manager tomorrow, this ALWAYS happens to us and it seems judging from the comments below it happens often.

The only excuse anyone should ever have to go here is for the 5 dollar large pizzas. Everything else? Go somewhere else. The pizzas generally contain a large amount of dough, little toppings, little cheese, little sauce, and very little taste. However, if you just happen to have a large craving of pizza that needed to be instantly satisfied for 5 bucks? Go here.

Gave myself my boyfriend and my best friend food poisoning!!! Do not go here!!! They shouldn't be aloud to serve food it's messed up how many people have complained and are still getting food poisoning.

Holy Crap!!!! Talk about communication and customer service.... Seriously I have been standing at the counter like a complete moron. One guy asked me what I wanted and then walked off. I've been standing here waiting for someone to actually take my order.

I know there busy and this is just Little Caesars but damn beef up on your customer service skills.

I can't believe this place is still in business. After reading other reviews, it seems everyone has some sort of problem here and management does absolutely nothing to fix it. Well let me just warn anyone who decides to come here, DO NOT and I repeat, DO NOT go here. I remember the first time I had this pizza, and it was from here, and I thought it was the nastiest thing ever. I got sick to my stomach and refused to ever have it again. My roommates and boyfriend on the other hand, enjoyed this pizza, so I'd occasionally have to smell it being around. A few months ago, they got it from this location and I can't believe how rancid it smelt. I told them to be careful because there's no way the pizza they served was remotely edible. It was thrown away because it was just that - gross. Just this past weekend, my boyfriend and his sister decided to share a pizza. And let me tell you.. they both got the worse food poisoning I have ever seen. It was from their pizza sitting out, for god knows how long, developing bacteria. I was so glad and am so happy that I don't eat this junk because for 5 days, they were sitting on and throwing up on the toilet. I've never seen anything like it. It became so bad, they both had to visit the ER because it turned out there was also blood involved, they couldn't breathe, etc. I know it is from this pizza place because it is the ONLY thing they shared. I WILL be calling FDA on them and hopefully this place gets shut down. They should not be a business. It is disgusting and I get that people chose to eat here because .. I mean, $5 pizza .. but that $5 can be spent elsewhere, unless you want to spend $5 to waste 5 days of your life literally feeling like you're about to die. We have records and hospital notes, etc and like I said, FDA will be called. I wish I could give it no stars because I would.

Horrible customer service and the pizza quality is not worth it anymore! I tried calling to report sour crazy sauce and there I no answer! I'm going to be Upset if I have to go over there cause no one is answering! Ugh! There's always something every time! Don't come here to this location only if you want to experience disappointment and the most horrible customer service of your life!!!!

My friend and I stopped in here tonight after a walk in the woods.  It was around 6pm. We have been at the other Firetruck (Sentinel Peak) Brewing on Grant and I must say I like this location better, although its location does not make the building stand out because you don't have a direct view of it from the main road .  It's quieter and the outdoor patio seems bigger.  We had our two dogs with us and ate outside.  We each had two beers --I had the Heatwave Hefe and later the Desert Blonde; my friend had the Icebreak IPA and the Irish Stout.  I ordered the Hummus platter and he had the vegan nachos that he said were bland.

My Hefe had a slight waxy aftertaste that I don't remember from previous pints.  The pita bread on the hummus platter was toasted and thus hard; I would have preferred softer bread to dip into the hummus.  I'm thus docking one star as our meal was good but not mind-blowing.

Our server was very good.  The patio slowly filled up as we were there for the hour

Changed their name from Sentinel Peak to Firetruck Brewing. Same great neighborhood bar and grill, same great owners, same great service with just a new name!!!  Nikki, Nate and Tammy are kick ass bartenders and Erin kills the table service. Go there......now.

Food has never been a disappointment here. Typical Bar food, but always good. Service is hit or miss, but I think that's due to Covid right now. Hard getting people to show up for work I guess. We go there quite a bit. I would recommend it.

Was really anxious to give this location a try. The Grant Road location has declined with service and quality of food. Was really expecting great things at this location. Sadly, I was disappointed yet again. 

Slow service, poor quality food, and the same beer selection since this business opened. I guess when the 'president' doesn't have high standards, why would I expect anything different from location to location. 

Too many other options in town to waste my time and money here.

My 2 reviews may have been deleted.. will try 1 more time...
Food was horrible.. a salad and sandwich took 40 minutes.. staff was too busy hanging out to look up and help customers.. this is the worst restaurant in Tucson.. salad was rancid and was unpresentable.. restaurant should be shut down

Had an eye exam next door, so we decided to try again. We both had a hamburger with fries, and both were good. Service good. I do still miss tots as an option, but much better impression this time. Next I need to try their wings.

Whelp, Growlers in Oro Valley has become a Firetruck Brewing. If I'm correct, Growlers merged with Firetruck Brewing? I had high hopes for the food after looking at the menu. Growler's food was good and we felt they did one of the best burgers in the area. And great tater tots. I have not had a burger yet, but was completely disappointed in the chicken salad sandwich I did have. My husband had a philly-cheesesteak. We both felt that they were all bread, very little filling. And they give you a thimble sized portion of coleslaw. You can get fries, and I haven't had yet, but no more tater tots. Yet they are charging $14. That's a big NOPE for me.

The place itself hasn't really changed at all. They have put up flags outside, one U.S., one for firefighters and changed the sign. Mostly the menu that has changed. I understand that this is a microbrewery, so that's what many will go for. I am not a big alcohol drinker, more of a foodie so not a lot of appeal for me. 

Anyone have a different experience with food here? I'm big into second chances, so let me know.
The hot wings were almost inedible because they were so hot. The burger had no flavor at all and the kids meals were not good. Wouldn't come back. Service wasn't good either unfortunately.

Nope! I had the tacos and never again! Horrible!!! I'm sorry, I hate to give bad reviews, but the tacos were so bad I ordered through grubhub and I got my money back!

Greasy-salty-yuck! 

The only thing I liked was the Tequiños and I guess cause they are frozen

This is the best place in town to eat Very good food come get anything you want from here!! Friendly and fast service excellent first impression and it's always nice to come enjoy tacos from here. Please come enjoy good food at Digby Mini Market!!
Comida muy rica, típica casera venezolana y también tienen otras especialidades, el sitio es atendido por sus propios dueños, son súper amables!

Empanadas, cachapas y arepas son buenisimas.
Food is amazing. Hands down good. Service is great. Convenient location.

For some reason was feeling like eating Venezuelan food and found this place online. Only one review but still decided to give it a try. I am so glad we did ! The place is attached to a convenient store. The restaurant is very cozy and clean. We ordered several things from the menu : a cachapa, empanadas , patacones and a Chicken arepa. Everything was very freshly made and delicious !!!!! The menu has a wide variety of items and the service was excellent. I got to talk to the owners of the place. Very nice people. We will definitely be coming back. Great food and affordable prices. Sounds like a deal to me !
This place was a great find. The food is super flavorful and service was fast and friendly. Loved the empanadas!
The food is just amazing, the service is awesome and the prices are affordable, love it, definitely I'll come back

Chef Chic saved Thanksgiving! The team at Chef Chic went out of their way to help my elderly mother have a wonderful Thanksgiving - it meant the world to her and me. Her food was delicious and they delivered more than enough. We'll certainly be ordering from this establishment again.

The portobello burger and vegan quesadilla were outstanding: cooked well with high quality ingredients. The veggies that came with the burger were fresh and the quesadilla was flavorful. Very easy to order online and pickup. The place also has many grab and go meals that look awesome. Definitely need to try some.
Awesome and amazing burger. Great service and super yummy food! Will go back for sure! A+

Really good food. I had the mushroom Swiss burger with onion rings. Nice and thick rings cooked very well. My partner had the cauliflower lemon tahini salad. He was happy. He also had the quest Rita with chicken. He was quite impressed. We both finished with some carrot cake.  Quite tasty. The only drawback and it's more a personal request to make the cream cheese frosting a touch thicker. Really well done. Would do 4 1/2 stars but the system does like that.

Culinary Institute of America graduate, one of my homies!

Nice home made creativity going on here, love the funky little dive of a concept that puts out wonderful & creative soups, sandwiches, 
salads, and more! 

A foodie must try!!

Here's a find for you. Tucson Iron Chef Wendy Gauthier has her own place featuring eat in, take home and catering. The offerings are simple and very reasonably priced considering the quality. The burger of the day is 6.95, a pho sandwich is $7.95 and the most  expensive thing on the menu is $9.95. The restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch. They feature  Arbuckles coffee, excellent quality, reasonable prices and yes they have vegan choices.
She also does a large catering business and has to go meals in the freezer for you to take home.

So, I've been wanting to try the food at Chef Chic in Tucson for months and months now, and finally said today was the day to do it. I have previously worked with Wendy Gauthier and the Chef Chic staff for a private catering event before the pandemic (and they did an excellent job, BTW). However, I haven't tried their food since they opened their own store ... until now.

I ordered a Quesarita, a Chicken Melt Sandwich, and fried cheese curds for curbside pickup. The online ordering process was easy, I received text and email notifications, and I arrived promptly on-time. The food was ready, brought out to be after less than a minute of waiting, and I then headed home for a good lunch.

Well. Wow. Just look at the photo. They don't skimp on portion size and ingredients, the food was perfectly cooked, and I snarfed down half of the meal in no time at all. The cheese curds were buttery deliciousness and the bang bang sauce for dipping was a perfect match.

The Quesarita is big, had abundant chicken and cheese, along with black olives and maybe some green chiles. The chicken melt sandwich was equally delicious, so much messy goodness with chicken, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and mayo. For the sandwich, you can have choices for the toppings, too.

I am sitting here happily satisfied with one of the best lunches I've had in a while. So, really, head on over to Chef Chic, sample the rather large selection of menu items, and enjoy yourself. I'm really glad they are in Tucson as they are a fine addition to the culinary scene here.

We were looking for a place that would do salads and sandwiches for lunch.  We stumbled upon Chef Chic.  Mom got the salad of the month - chef salad and I got the southwestern chicken melt, with fries.  This was an excellent surprise.  The fries are perfect, the sandwich was amazing and mom enjoyed her salad.  It had the perfect balance of lettuce and meat and cheese.
thanks!

We used Chef Chic to cater a special event dinner for a small group at our home. We were underwhelmed with the food. At the price we paid, we expected a lot more - the food was prepared prior to her arrival and was served lukewarm and it seemed the effort that went into making the meal was so-so. It also seemed that the chef was preoccupied and rushed the entire time and didn't put us at ease. The plating was disappointing and the overall flavor/quality of food was meh. Overall, it was a disappointing and overpriced experience.

They were able to accommodate about 30 of us after a pro Trump flag wave after normal hours.  Everyone said the food was fabulous.  Good, friendly service and fair prices.  Our group will return.  So should you!

Chef Chic is no joke!  The 2019 Tucson Iron Chef winner holds down a super bright and clean place with an amazing array of choices and adventures for one's palette.  Outstanding breakfast items (and available all day!).  Get their amazing sandwiches or weekly burger special and chill with an amazing view of the Catalinas. Now open on the weekend, you can get take-home readymade meals to go. (Soups are mouthwatering...yeah, I said soups).  Get on it now, you won't regret placing your order, or just stopping by to raid their fridge.

I am completely floored.  The roast beef pho sandwich is nothing short of perfection.  It looked great, but as I bite into it overwhelmed the senses.  Perfect texture, perfect flavor, perfect...period.  Do not change anything, ever.  The rest of our food was fantastic too (poutine fries, turkey club w/ Brie, etc), but the roast beef pho sandwich was truly inspired and pho-king delicious for damn sure.  Loving the food scene surprises in my new home, Tucson!!!!  This tops the list.

Owner is winner of a Tucson Iron Chef Award 2019! 

Culinary Institude of America'graduate one of my homies!

Nice home made creativity going on here, love the funky little dive of a concept that puts out wonderful & creative soups, sandwiches, and salads and more! A foodie must try!!

I love these guys! Used them twice for the company Christmas party and just had them deliver to my home during the Safer at Home period. Their brisket is my favorite. soooooo Tasty!  Love all their sides. And both the dry and candies ribs are awesome. Totally recommend them!

Amazing place!  My husband ordered lunch to be delivered on a Friday and instantly made his coworkers jealous.  The next week it turned into about 8 additional orders.  This coming week, I have a feeling it will be an even larger order because the entire office smelled delicious and some of the people who hadn't ordered the previous week definitely felt left out.  

Absolute crowd pleaser!

Finally a BBQ spot I can truly refer to others about. By far this is the best take out bbq I've had so far in the Nashville area. Candied Rib Company is truly a unique flavor of TN BBQ. 

One of the only kind (as far as I know) farm to table style BBQ joints in the area, they get their meats and produce from local farms. 

WHAT I ORDERED
From their 9/19 Sunday menu, I ordered their Phat Daddy Sandwich with the smoked tomato bisque soup as my side, a quarter chicken, a side of "I hate potato salad" (potato salad), and their fudge banana pudding.

HOW IT TASTED
As much food as it was, I still ate it all. It was that delicious. The open faced "Phat Daddy" sandwich had a balanced combination of flavors that brought out the flavor of the meat even more. The meat was cooked to perfection with just the right amount of fat left on it. The smoked tomato bisque compliments well with the sandwich in which I even started to place some of the soup on the sandwich itself on a few bites. That "smokey" taste of the soup was unique - I which I like, especially as a fan of smokey style whiskey. 

The chicken was also different from many of the BBQ spots in the area. The only way I can describe it is that it tastes like a light candied glazed broiled skinned bbq. And you can definitely taste the difference in the chickens they use. Again, the chicken was cooked just right. I was recommended the white bbq sauce for the chicken by the girl at the cash register and she was most certainly right.

Trying to keep this short and concise, the "I hate potato salad" is definitely worth trying and is different from the typical potato salads you will eat and the Fudge Banana Pudding was the right amount of sweetness and it reminded me of my mother's banana pudding. 

OVERALL
Candied Rib Company is definitely a must try, especially if you're someone from out of state. Being from someone who is from Los Angeles, Candied Rib Company sets the bar and I will most certainly be back, especially on my Sundays after church. Looking forward to trying other menu items throughout the week

This place is pure gold. Without a doubt the highest quality food in Mt Juliet. This is the type of place that chefs go to when they want 5-star and non-pretentious food. Candied Rib is all about local, fresh, and perfect flavor blends. 
We had their 'I Hate Potato Salad', chicken avocado salad, and their special of the day sandwich. *there's no pics. We ate it in the car*
The potato salad was the best I've ever had. We asked about the name and were told that the owner/chef hates potato salad, so he made one didn't have all gross stuff in it. Well, he nailed it. 
The salad was top notch. Freshest ingredients possible, perfectly cooked chicken, and the dressing and slaw were just perfect. 
The sandwich was made with perfectly cooked beef, ginger vinaigrette, and even a little pineapple (which I normally hate, but worked very well in this). The crunchy 'burnt ends' of the beef were *chefs kiss. The bun was perfect. I devoured it in about three min. 
Can't wait to go back and sample the rest of the menu!!! Seriously, you've got to eat here.

This is one of the best restaurants in Mt. Juliet. The family owned business doesn't cut any corners. Ingredients are locally sourced from a renowned chef that's been In the industry since the early 90s. The food is insanely good. Must try. Run to this place.

A+++! Absolutely incredible! The food is delicious and they use locally sourced ingredients. Really flavorful and interesting combinations. Homemade everything. Always different specials offered so that is exciting. The customer service is phenomenal. Everyone is so friendly and personable and very knowledgeable. Shop local!

Delicious Dominican food at a reasonable price.  Very clean, well lit and attractive for a casual place.  The service was polite and attentive.  We are looking forward to delivery as well.  The chicken mofongo was excellent and large enough for two meals.  The ox tail was savory and had a nice kick to it.  We are grateful for a quality restaurant to anchor what is otherwise a dreary corner of Germantown.
Everything was cold to the touch. Threw it straight in the trash. Seems like it could be a nice place. But all my food was ice cold. How do you serve people ice cold food from a warning tray?
This is a great new addition to the neighborhood.  Great, authentic Hispanic food.  Looking forward to eating here more.

Delighted to have tasty Dominican food in the neighborhood.  Staff is friendly, place is cute and reflects the effort this new business is putting into Germantown food scene.  Have been in three times for take out and have not been disappointed.   Rice, beans, chicken and stews are wonderful.

I decided to try this since it is relatively new in the neighborhood. First no Menu on the walls or on paper.  I would describe it as a food truck from the 90's but inside a building. Lots of rice served with your choice of meat. Wasn't worth the money and food bland.

My wife and I were really excited that we wouldn't have to drive across the city to get good Dominican food. Since they opened less than 2 weeks ago, we've eaten there 4 or 5 times. 

Each day, the proteins vary and may be prepared slightly differently which is nice. Ex. sometimes there is oxtail, some days there is goat. There has always been chicken and beef options. The pernil was really good. 

Since it is close to a lot of bus stops, they are having a few hiccups with estimating how much food they will need prepared each day but I assume that they'll figure out demand soon. That means that by 8pm they may have run out of empanadas for the day. 

The biggest critique we have heard is where they try to accommodate an American palate. Just make standard Dominican fare and your clientele will come.

Owner of Jeisy Grilled Chicken: Please read and correct course ASAP. Philly is home to some underrated Dominican restaurants, especially North Philly, so perhaps my expectations were too high. When I saw that Jeisy was opening at Chelten and Germantown Ave, I was excited to support a new restaurant, but boy did this place disappoint. Now, normally I would just write a restaurant off and keep it moving, but I want to give an honest and detailed review in the hopes that the owner(s) will fix the issues and improve. 

First the good, the inside of the restaurant is designed really nice. There is adequate seating. The location is central and the potential is there for this to be a good restaurant. However, the food, customer service, pricing, menu leaves a lot to be desired. The food is arranged behind the counter in a way that indicates that you can get fast and simplified casual dishes with traditional staples (chicken, rice, plantains).  However, I had to wait a while for my meal. I ordered what I thought was going to be a chicken platter with plantains, rice and beans and a side salad. Instead, I get a bed of cheap iceberg lettuce, four measly slices of unseasoned cold chicken, and the dryest rice and beans this side of Zatarains. No plantains, but I did inexplicably get some generic Chef's choice blue cheese dressing that I didn't ask for. I paid close to $10 for what amounted to season free cafeteria food. 

Everything about this dish was bland and basic. Furthermore, none of the staff made any effort to engage, which is a must for any new business. 

I am rooting for this place to succeed. The intersection where the restaurant is had a previous tenant who didn't last long. 

Here are some suggestions. 

1. Make your menu DISTINCTIVE. Scratch whatever that was that I got and work on making your meals memorable. Pull out the spices and sauces and bring some sabor. Own being a Dominican restaurant because that makes you stand out.
2. Speed it up. You have multiple bus stops in that area. Work on making your takeout a quick in and out process. You are surrounded by fast and convenient restaurants and you cannot compete if the wait time is too long, especially for the type of food you are serving. 
3. Be personable. Talk to your customers. If you see people waiting for the bus inside of your business. Strike up conversation, offer samples of your food, do something so you can actually stick around for the long run.   

Apologies for this long review, but I wanted to be as thorough as possible so this business can improve and serve Germantown better.

We ordered food from the TooGoodToGo app and enjoyed the amazing food from Jeisy Grilled Chicken! Our favorites were the cinnamon plantain, drumsticks, and the potatoes. Overall the food was extremely flavorful and they gave us a ton. We definitely recommend this restaurant.
The staff was super friendly and the restaurant was very clean.  The food is delicious and a fairly priced.

3.5 stars
Not the fanciest place for dining in. But their great for cheap eats. Basic menu you would typically find at a food truck spot. Business hours they stay open pretty late. To go orders you can drive up to the curb and one of the ladies will approach your car for orders. And the food will be brought out to your car. 
They have the cantaloupe drink here that comes in a extra large cup for $3. Definitely a favorite that has us coming here just for the drinks.

Son mis tacos favoritos en esta taqueria, bueno lo eran ahora ya no, la carne tiene mucha grasa y la carne tiene mucho tiempo recocida eso hace que pierda el buen sabor, la salsa es muy sobraza y el servicio de las meseras me párese muy bueno ..!! Admiro sus ganas de trabajar a pesar de los diferentes climas .!

They have the best tacos from any taco truck in the area! However they are ridiculously priced! I bet they make a killer profit! I got only 4 mini tacos, and they charged me $9!!! I think price per taco is normally $1.25 but they have steep prices to add cheese and avocado (on 2 tacos). Back home, for $7 i got 4 tacos, charro beans AND a baked potato. I mean they're good. But not THAT good. I'll definitely be taking my business elsewhere.
great food, opened late. service is a bit slow, but the food makes up for it. best place for tortas!

Great little gem on Nolensville, meats are grilled outdoors on wood fire, had carne asada and pastor tacos with rice and beans....very tasty....friendly service, delivered food to car after I ordered at window

The servers are just terrible at what they do... You are seen by them in which they don't ask if you've been helped or not yet. Having to ask for your order to be taken after 20-30 minutes of sitting down is ridiculous! The next morning my family & I had an upset stomach with diarrhea in which it was food poisoning smh. Never are we coming back especially with the service given & food quality.

We had a pretty large take out order including the pescado frito which was against my better judgment but the boy child wanted it. We paid almost $50 after tip to our carhop/waitress and I really didn't like that they don't have pricing up outside. Maybe it's offered inside where we've never gone. We had 3 tacos de lengua which were average and 3 tacos de carnitas that went into the trash. Those carnitas were so dry it was like eating wood shavings. The sopes and gorditas were just ok. The plate the gorditas were on had a large whole burned through it so grease got in the bag and all over the other plates. We ordered one each of the tamales just to try them. The red was a big no. My son ate the green so it must have been okay. The rice and beans that came with the fish were inedible. Overall, most things lacked much flavor. Entire meal only came with the green salsa made from peppers and oil and it needed to be blended better. Had a very chalky taste. We've had better experiences from them before so I'm giving them 2 stars but we won't be back. Way too many other options up and down Nolensville.

i'm only giving 4 stars because of the way the place is maintained. i'm here from Miami and my friend suggested this place. very authentic mexican joint. they have a food truck outside with like a curbside service and an inside where you can order and eat. we went in and grabbed a booth which was not that comfortable and the cushions were falling apart so I was skeptical at first. the menus are also worn out and torn up HOWEVER. they have large bottled sodas and different juices and amazing choices from tacos quesadillas burritos and gorditas.
