WOW all of us were amazed and didn't speak the entire meal of how good this food was. I am going back before heading back to miami I 100% recommend. pls pay this place a visit !!!!

This is an​ after-work​k/late night food if your tired of the usual​ cookout/McDonald's run.  OKAY?

....this place is not cute whatsoever, so don't get too boujie. 

There are two ways to go about this restaurant​:

1: Walk in and sit ​at any table or booths which are NOT comfortable​ and enjoy watching the news on one of the two TV's till someone comes to give you a menu or take your order if you are ready. 

2: Drive up to (usually a line) resturant, people come to your window and you order and they bring the food to your car and you can eat in the ambiance of your car or drive home and eat there.

The food process: 
It does take time so be patient, they are actively​ cooking the meat, and putting the tacos/sope/burritos/etc, together for you. 

Once your order comes, its time to enjoy. Trust me the wait is worth it.
When i want chinese food delivered this is where i go...foods always hot and fresh when it arrives an they deliver in less than 30min not to mention the ppl are insanely polite!

I ordered 4 wings and fried rice. I drove all the way home to feed my 3 year old and realized 2 or the chicken were still raw and bloody. To drive back and they tell me they can't give me my money back. I wouldn't recommend this place at all.

Had a hankering for Chinese and was on  this side of town and thought I'd stop

Ordered the lunch combo of sweet and sour pork with fried rice and wonton soup.  Also ordered an egg roll a'la carte.  Portions are HUGE!! 

The soup had 3 large wontons that were delicious.

The sweet and sour pork surprised me as there were giant chunks of meat, not all doughy breeding that you get at most places.  The fried rice was solid, nothing special.  

The egg roll was delicious, fresh and crispy....as close to perfect as you can get!

I saw a sign that said they deliver with a minimum order of $15 AND within a 3 mile radius.

Definitely pleasantly surprised and will be back!!!
Don't really like Chinese food but this place is really good and authentic!!! Only Chinese place I'll eat.

I've had food here since I was 8 years old from time to time. But it's been 10 years since then and the quality of some of the items changed a lot. The fries 70 percent of the time is oily so you have to drench with sauce to mask the taste but the meat is always perfect. but since quarantine I've been ordering here a lot again. And in person they frequently change the prices I'm not sure why it's quite often too but the food is good so I'd still order
Food is good but they need to have someone answering the phone who can communicate EFFECTIVELY with customers.

My wife and I tried the Bacon cheeseburger, fries, and motz sticks to-go over the weekend. The bacon had good flavor, and the bun paired well with the burger and burger was cooked more well done, but still juicy. Fries were satisfactory and the motz sticks were really good too. The place opened up during the Pandemic- so kudos to them for not stopping their plans. We look forward to enjoying more meals from here!

Walking in made me think of shake shack the why the resultant is set up except you can't see the cooking area at all which should have been the first sign that I wasn't going to get the kind of burger I was hoping for.   The second sign should have been that no one else was there at 12boon on a Saturday.   

The burger was thin on the greasy side the bun was soft and fresh.   Tipping where fine.   Fries were crispy and well done but had the added seasoning which I'm not a fan of.   When I say seasoning not spices but extra breading.   

The place was clean.

I do not like to post poor reviews but the burger place does not deserve a good one.  I was overcharged and was told it was my fault and not given my money back.  The burgers were dry and tasteless the fries were OK.  The soda was self serve which with the pandemic was not something I like to use since there were teens there playing around with the machine and it was not cleaned off the entire time I was there.   One employee had their mask below their nose.  Sorry but I will not be returning.

I loved this place so much I went back the next weekend.  They have such high quality food and such a wide variety of options that it's nearly impossible to get the same thing two times in a row unless that's what you're into.  The people are so nice and I couldn't be happier.  I plan on going back next weekend as well.
I love the burgers here. Only thing I change is the cheese on my burger, not a fan of American cheese. Onion rings and shakes are top notch. Not cheap but worth it.

I went to this restaurant for the first time today, it is very clean and the staff very friendly and professional I met Ashley whom also prepared my meal, she was on staff with a gentleman but I didn't have an opportunity to get his name, but he too was very pleasant I ordered the surf and turf double burger, I LOVED it!! I can't express how good the food was.  This burger comes with Not one but TWO patties accompanied by mozzarella AND cheddar cheese also with bacon AND shrimp!  Oh my goodness the food was well seasoned and cooked well done.  The shrimp are so big that they cover the entire burger!  If you have an opportunity, you MUST visit this restaurant! I can assure you will not be disappointed!!! Thank you Burgerzoid you have definitely got a regular supporter in me.  The most powerful and effective type of advertising is by word of mouth, and I am going to tell anyone who will listen to me that they must must must go visit this restaurant.

I tried the limited edition Jupiter Burger. The food was ready very fast! I was recommended to try this place by the YouTube channel NutreezTV. The burger is amazing! I love the donuts and they worked surprisingly well with the burger, cheddar, and bacon! It also was not as heavy as expected. The next time, I'll try a shake or the Belgium waffle burger (the "Mercury burger")!

name: Sam’s Boardwalk Style Pizza & Bottle Shop

reviews.text:
Surprised to be the first to review. Got take out pizza here today.  I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the pizza. Crust was light and thin with just right amount of crispness and the sauce to cheese ratio was just right. It's definitely a solid step up from the shop's predecessor, Janos. The staff was helpful and friendly. 

The major change from Janos is that the seating along the walls are now replaced with beer fridges on the left and shelves of six packs on the right. Decent selection of craft beer with lots of single options so you can mix and match. Also some taps and Growlers are option. Good option if you show up to Vida next door empty handed. The downside is that now the only seating is three high bar tables in the middle. So it's not really conducive to eating in, particularly with young kids. But maybe that's intentional. 

I plan on going back for the pizza. I think it's better than most of the other Havertown options and I would pick up beer there if I happen to be there. The selection of hard to find high-end craft beers (eg $4-6/can) is still better at Boccellas, but otherwise you will find good options here (eg Jai Alai, Sterling Pig, etc) to satisfy your needs.
Solid choice for pizza from a wonderful group of folks. The crust is great with awesome topping options.

Was in town for a meeting and David Portnoy had visited the same day! I thought I definitely had to try. The pizza on the video didn't look great, but I was still intrigued.  We ordered a large cheese just like Dave.  Wow! His review was a generous 7.3!  Our pizza was flavorless and not even close to good.  Oh well!  We gave it a 5.3 haha.  Super doughy and the cheese was low quality. Better luck next time.

This was a very very very good cheesesteak, eye opening experience and 1 of 3 ways to enjoy a beer with your cheesesteak. It is very refreshing when you ask your rider where to get a beer and cheesesteak and they reply, 'the place I am going to.' All by it's self the cheesesteak was very good. The meat was plentiful, moist and flavorful. Very good amount of cheese and melt. Mushroom flavor came they on first bite. The roll; the roll was very good BUT I don't think I liked it for this cheesesteak. I would love for this roll to be a garlic bread roll and then the cheesesteak on it. My other favorite thing about Sam's is you have 3 ways to drink a beer with your cheesesteak; 1. Craft beer from cooler at Sam's. 2. Eat in McGillicutty's next door (no smoking). 3. Take ur Sam's CS to the Ivy Room (smoking). Great overall experience!!

I almost walked out the moment I stepped in. None of the four employees working there had on a mask, including the two cooks. The complete disregard for the health of the customers makes me question other health practices that they are expected to follow. I will never return to any of the Sam's establishment after this visit.

The pizza was average- crust lacked crunch and there could have been more sauce.

Love this place! By far the best chicken caesar salad and upside down pizza in the area! Their homemade salad dressings are out of this world and they really should bottle them and sell them, I would definitely be buying them! Highly recommend this place!

This place was soooo good! Can't believe we just tried for the first time after 10yrs living in the area. Sauce was good, cheese was fresh and the crust was perfect. Totally as the name claims- Boardwalk Style! If I had to compare it I would say it's closest comparison is Manco and Manco from ocean city. But it has its own flavor and stands on its own! Definitely try it if you haven't!

I live down the street from their Drexel Hill location and let me tell you, they NEVER disappoint. (Except that they don't specifically have a yelp page so I'll review on this one.) Their pizza is my favorite in the area and they know how to make a stomboli as it's meant to be. FULL. Not an air pocket in bread with some toppings. And their pizza is always amazing. My husband loves their chicken strips and fries as well!

Melty, gooey, fantasyicky cheesesteak!  So delicious I may just say that Jesus himself presented himself to me in that cheesesteak. How else can that be explained?  Stop being a dork and reading and eat one!

The pizza was flavorless and bland. Not really sure why this has such great reviews. The Stromboli was also so salty no one finished it. Portion size was good but not good flavors from this place at all.

This pizza is so good! My family has been ordering pizza on Friday nights for my whole life so we have tried a lot of places and Sam's does not disappoint. It really does taste like boardwalk pizza and reminds me of Mac and Mancos (Manco and Manco's now) down the shore. Support your local businesses!

Unfortunately I was highly disappointed.  So the girl that answered was really nice so that's why I gave one star.  The guys were literally sitting on a freezer and leaning over a table on their phones I take it these were the cooks.  After this. I got home and the pizzas were horrible. The middle was like a pool of mush!!!!MUSH! I could swim in the grease on my margherita pizza I couldn't pick the slices up the just were horrible! The cheese pizza barely had cheese it there was so much bare hard crust! Don't waste your money!

There aren't many pizza places I'll give 5 stars to right off the bat. But this is one of them. 

Anytime you can get a flavor like this sauce has with a brick oven style pizza, you will win me over. Great spice, perfect texture, just a phenomenal pie all around. 

Ordering is easy and service was impeccable. I had to wait due to demand and it's a little pricey, but the line to get the pizza and the amount of orders they were taking were telling me everything I needed to know. 

Since my weight loss surgery, this is perfect. Thin crisp crust settles well in my tummy. I can get a small, have my couple of little slices and split it with my son with leftovers. 

This is a winner.

This was the second time ordering for pick up. Sam's pies are big and have a swirl style mix of sauce and cheese. 

This is crisp, thin crust style. The pizza is saucier than most but works perfectly with the cheese ratio and crispy crust. 

So far we have just had the plain pie, no toppings. 

If Sam's can keep the crust crispy in peak times ( others in town pull their pies too quickly on busy nights leaving the crust soft and doughy) this place will be our regular pizza stop. It is that good.

I was far from impressed with Sam's.  Honestly, my pizza was pretty lousy, not to mention somewhat pricey.  There was very little cheese and even less sauce.  Boardwalk style pizzas usually have the obvious swirl of sauce on them, but there was so little sauce on this pizza that the swirl was almost nonexistent.  While boardwalk pizzas are known to be a thin pizza, this was the thinnest pizza I've ever had outside of those with a cracker style thin crust.  Ironically, while my pizza didn't have nearly enough cheese (or sauce), the cheese fries I ordered had way too much cheese.  That's a rare complaint from me, but the fries were completely soggy due to the cheese.  I'd highly suggest asking for the cheese on the side.  When I called I was told it would be 35 minutes for a pickup.  Figuring that seemed a little long, I arrived in 20 minutes expecting to get my food the moment it was ready.  My food was already done and waiting.  Normally I'd be thrilled about this, but I was told 35 minutes and had I waited that long it would have been even less desirable.  As it was, though ready before quoted, both the pizza and fries were lukewarm at best.  Who knows, maybe it was an off night for these guys.  But with all the competition in the Havertown area, it left me with a bad first impression and no real desire to give them a second try.  Just to note, it appears Sam's is owned by the same family that owns JD McGillicuddy's next door.  There is a connecting door open to the bar area which made Sam's extremely noisy.  While there aren't many tables available for eating in, if you decide to do so you may not want to bring the family during prime bar hours.

It's breath of fresh air in an area of stale pizza

It's a nice change up from the norm
Nice shore style pizza. 

Good chicken fingers 
Tasty wings

Give it a try. I don't think you will be disappointed
Great pizza!!  And good beer selection. My go to is white pizza with a Caesar salad. Nom nom nom.

If I could give this a zero star review I would. This was my first and last time ordering from Sam's Boardwalk. I called and placed a take out order for a small plain pizza and a burger at 5:20 pm and was told 25 minutes. I arrived to pick up 25 mins later, went to the counter, said my name and paid. I also gave a tip. I also ordered two water ices to go which I ended up putting in the cooler because they were melting. I stood there waiting for my food which they clearly forgot to start cooking. No one said anything to me as I stood there, workers and the cook constantly had masks below their noses. Multiple people came and went with orders. The cashier walked by at one point and said let me check on your burger. Finally the delivery man walked by almost a half hour later and said "your burger is being flipped now" and walked out to deliver an order. I didn't get my order until 6:16 pm and would have appreciated if they were honest at first and said the order was never started. I understand this is a difficult time but they did not seem busy. Disappointed in this service and experience. The room temperature pizza, average burger and overcooked fries are not worth another visit. 

*dislcaimer: I have eaten at Sam's Brick Oven in Ardmore and have had no bad experiences.
Sam's took my order never delivered my food after 1.5 hours and although they where listed as open for another hour stopped answering the phone.

I live close to Sam's and have tried numerous items which have normally been decent. Unfortunately it's never really consistent. Tried one of the cheese steaks this evening and it was probably the worst I've ever had. Very bland. Hardly any cheese or meat. I feel it's been really going down hill. Disappointed. Although I have enjoyed their Italian Tuna salad recently. We shall see if it stays consistant.

If your driving an RV Don't bother stopping here. They provide no overnight parking and actually no parking at all for an RV. They don't allow parking at all outside and in the lower garage only certain hours but it's very dirty, noisy and basically stinks. You have to walk up 4 flights of stairs that are unmonitored and creepy. No elevators working on this level.  

The Buffet is $22 and very small with a very poor selection. The prime rib I chose tasted more like a over cooked tri tip, the Corn beef was dry and stringy. Other than nasty looking fish and not so appetizing looking fried chicken that was about all that was offered in meats. The rest wasn't much better of choice or prep.

This Casino Needs to be shown that poor food, Rude security and high prices make for no business. Don't stop here if you RV.

Bland food and horrible selection for what they are charging, wouldn't eat hear again even if they were giving it away.  Save your money and go to Golden Corral or Sizzler instead.  Only gave it one star since Yelp doesn't have a worse rating.
The foodwas great they had an amazing selection, but the desserts were to die for it was great.
We have been going to ameristar for a few years now I ways not pleased with the pool party they are having now on sundays it uncontrolled it made it very difficult to enjoy the pool

The breakfast at the Falcon Diner at the Amerstar was not good. The quiche was not hot, the crust was soggy. And it was obvious that the bacon was not fresh. It, too, was cold and greasy. My orange juice and water were good. Later that afternoon I had diarrhea. I won't eat there ever again.
Awesome cute little coffee spot! Had a peanut butter latte.. Delicious!! Also had a Cuban was also delicious. Fast & friendly service..
The coffee and their breakfast cookie is AMAZING!! My only complaint would be the prices are a bit high.

6 February 2020,  just had two sandwiches, chicken salad on croissant & a Cuban sandwich. Both were excellent. The chicken salad had grapes & walnuts, with hardy chicken chunks.  The Cuban was just what I was hoping for. We really got our moneys worth. We will come back.

The best spot in town - good friend, good food and good times! 

Plenty of spirits and great food to be consumed. Don't miss out on The Bunker.

I don't think I've ever been here and had a good coffee no matter the combination :( they get things wrong all the time so I've decided not to order from here anymore. The sandwiches are really good though! The coffee always tastes burnt and kind of... sour?? I'm not sure how to describe it. It's a cute place though!

The Bunker is a cutesy coffee and tea shop located in Ybor City. They also serve food. However, I ordered a large chai latte which was  bursting with flavor in every sip. I'm glad to have found this one of a kind spot.

This is probably my favorite trap and skeet club in the entire United States. Top-notch facilities, and top-of-the-line instruction from Tim Miles of Coyote Springs (he's the best in the business). Call Tim today and arrange for a lesson. You won't be sorry.

Good service and good equipment...the price is very reasonable....just for beginners that have not shot at a range before this place can be a little intimidating....no real signs of were to go to get started...and you have regulars that just sit there and watch you as you try to figure it out....but all in all I plan to go back a lot...great place to fine tune your skills

Ive always liked shotgun shooting over rifle or pistol due to the reactive targets, but found it difficult and intimidating to come to Tucson Trap and Skeet Club by myself. I came here this weekend with a coworker for my first rounds of skeet and did terribly but learned a lot for next time! 

This place is much closer than I assumed as it only took me about half an hour to get here from the Northwest side of town. The staff is friendly and the facilities are well maintained. I will definitely return for more skeet or to try out the other games.

My friend and I stopped by Tuscon Trap and Skeet last week while on a road trip. We both had very little to no experience handling or shooting a gun. We wanted to try it out. Like others have said, we felt a little intimidated but decided to give it a try anyway. 

From the moment we stepped into their office, the staff were nothing but warm, helpful, kind, and completely accommodating to us. We watched a short video and when it came time to rent the guns, we were helped by the club owner, Tim Miles. He completely took care of us knowing that it was our first time... and on top of that gave us a big discount on the gun rentals. 

Jerry brought us out to the fields and basically taught us how to shoot a gun and then guided us on a complete introduction to the sport of trap and skeet. He coached us so well that we both shot quite a few birds throughout the day despite being beginners. 

He then gave us a tour of the facility and also took us out to the sporting clay fields and introduced us to that as well. It really felt like we were hanging out with family. Jerry was super awesome  to us - if you're a beginner and need some guidance I very highly recommend him. He was very patient, kind, and knowledgable. Both Tim and Jerry gave us names, websites, and recommendations of where to continue the sport after we returned to our hometowns. They really went above and beyond. 

The facility itself was well maintained and very easy to use. It was my first time shooting clays so I don't have much to compare it to but I thought it seemed massive (it can accommodate over 200 RVs) and I do know that they hold a lot of competitions there and have held the selection for the Olympics there. 

If you're an avid shooter you probably already know of this facility and how the whole process works... but as a beginner, we weren't sure and their website wasn't very clear at explaining it for someone that was completely new (it is aimed more at seasoned shooters). Basically if you just show up during their office hours they will be able to help you. I will definitely be returning the next time I'm in the area!
Best shotgun facility in Arizona.  It's beautiful, comfortable and well run.  The sporting clays range is the best, and getting better all the time.  Sure wish I lived in Tucson.

Tucson Trap and Shoot is awesome. They have updated/new fire arms and a huge and well kept facility. Zona is wonderful to work with and instructors (volunteers) are informative and wonderful! I recently brought a group of 25 to the facility for an event and everyone had a great time!

World class shotgun shooting facility! 

This beautiful shooting facility has many trap and skeet shooting stations as well as sporting clays.  It is located about 8 miles south of the Desert Museum on old Ajo Road.

The facility has 210 hookups for R.V.s and a great clubhouse with a bar and grill.

The Tucson Trap & Skeet Club is an Olympic Quality Shooting Facility.  Not only does it have Trap and Skeet, but also has a sporting clays course on it's huge location.

This past year there was an event for Olympic level folks.  We went for an afternoon to just watch.  It was truly amazing to see competitors from places like Russia, France, Italy, etc  walking around in their uniforms.  All of this going on and most folks in Tucson have no idea....what a blast.

Staff is always very helpful.  If you are new to shooting chat with the folks in the office and they can set you up with an instructor.  There are trap, skeet and other leagues that occur during the year.  They have sign ups for individuals who are not on a squad and will place you on one.  My son did one league not too long ago when he was on a college break and was placed on a squad and had a great time!

Very highly recommended!!

One of the most beautiful ranges I've been to. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly and the ata shoots are always so organized. We came from California to shoot an ata and felt very welcome by all. Thank you for the hospitality and kindness towards my son/family! We will be back :)

This place is awesome! I came here with my friend who is a member and we shot 3 rounds of skeet. I just got a new shotgun so it was fun testing it out for the first time.
This was my first time shooting skeet at an actual venue (usually we just go into the desert somewhere). 
There are TONS of slots for shooting and an actual range on the end of the row. Even the views from the range of the mountains were amazing.
We did make the mistake of going to the International Skeet slot (not knowing the difference) but it was still fun - even with the launch delay.
The staff and everyone there was extremely helpful and friendly which made it a great experience.

Great experience, highly recommend! I had never held a gun in my life and was actually a bit nervous.  Vern our instructor was so patient and taught me so much.  I ended up
actually hitting more than the average for a first timer.  Can't wait to try it again.

If you've never had Peruviian food now is your chance and you will not be disappointed! This is a gem!!! The rice is so amazing good it beats most Asian spots! Did you know that there is a heavy influence of Asian cuisine in Peruvian cuisine? This lends to an amazing amalgamation of flavors. The rice is beyond good! This plate was only $10!!! How can you go wrong?! The sauce is the perfect accompaniment to the chicken and plantains. I can't wait for the new menu they will reveal soon!!! Please check them out it is so worth it!!! Enjoy!!!

Had a good sampling of Peruvian food at H&B at 3905 State Road in Drexel Hill. On this visit we tried the Plantanos Dulces (Sweet Plantains), Lomo Saltado (Beef Slices with Rice), Chaufa de Pollo (Chicken Fried Rice) and Flan for dessert. The place was immaculate and service, friendly. We need to return to try their roasted chicken next.
(For some odd reason, they've retained the reference to the "New York Style Deli and More)

We found this place on a road trip going South. We've tried Peruvian food from DC to VA to NY to NJ. This place is amazing, the people are warm and welcoming, the food is DELICIOUS. Support this place, and enjoy their food!

At first  I thought it was a New York style Deli as posted but there was nothing New York style. Otherwise I might give it a higher rating. Need to try more of their menu to come up with a more credible rating.

Why is there only one review on here so far and only a week away?  Is this place really that new?  

I wanted to try this place because:

1. I saw the Peruvian food sign
2.  They are trying to sell Peruvian food under the name ". . . New York Deli"
3.  Just by the first time, I was guessing it might be a gem since it's in such an unassuming place.
4.  It's as if the previous? owners used the same name, but had a typical sandwich/hoagie joint.
5.  nearby Inka Wall in Upper Darby was a Peruvian restaurant with bar and even a stage and a Peruvian shop, and it closed permanently
6.  When I was headed on my way there on the first visit, I got State Rd. mixed up with Garrett Rd. as I wanted to go by my geographic "memory".  So, once I realized I messed up, maybe a dash of "FOMO", and because an order was already put in, then of course I re-directed myself to the right place.

I technically made 3 trips to this place with 2 intended.
The first visit, they didn't have the alfajores arrive yet.  I picked up my noodles, a flan, and this purple chicha drink which reminded me of a purple drink I had when I was in Peru.  It was similar here but in a bottle and it was made of maize or corn, which I knew was comparable to what I had in Peru.

Then, I re-visited the place at night for the alfajore (cookie with peanut butter in-between).  I liked the alfajore, but I would've preferred a raspberry or blueberry filling, but maybe that would be americanizing it too much.  Kind of like how I get slightly perturbed when people rave to me about philly steak sushi is one of the greatest sushis they've ever had with that implied unawareness that they don't know how to appreciate what else is really out there, lol.

On another day, I was craving for more.  So I ordered, not 1, but 2 entrees (lol)- fried fish fillets with fried rice  and also steak with egg, rice, and fried plantains.  It took me 4 meals to finish everything.  I don't remember which item came with a side salad.  On this visit, they had their drink machines running.  I'm guessing they do this only on the weekends and maybe Friday.  They had a brown colored drink, a white drink, and a purple drink that they told me is not the same as the chicha in a bottle.  I liked all of them and they let me sample all of them too.  I wanted to go with all three of them, but I figured I'd just keep it at one for now, lol.

The prior reviewer mentioned how there is a heavy Asian influence on Peruvian food, which makes sense.  There was a time when a significant number of Japanese immigrated to Peru.  In certain communities, the population of Japanese is about 33% of the entire community I believe.  There was also a wave of Chinese immigrants later on after that.

There are only five reviews of this place on GrubHub and since August 27. So, this change or place must be recent- like within a month or two.
Look like the chicken might be too dry- that is something I didn't have from this place.

My best friend took me here because she was craving a soup from there, well I was craving perogies but she didn't know so I decided to get the combo plate that has a little of everything, is the first time I ate everything that I tried for the first time! Everything is good, but my favorite ones where the perogies and the cabbage rolls!!! I didn't wanna eat all my cabbage roll because it was so good!!!!! They have some deals on Facebook!! If you are close stop by won't regret it!!!
Wow what a great  find.  I got the combo plate and it was excellent.  So was the beet soup.   I wanted to try more but I was too full from the combo place.  Next time I'm in the area I'm coming back.
Mmm!  Perogies with a variety of sauces, all delicious!  The coleslaw was made fresh and very tasty. Service was friendly. The place is clean. I will be back!

Tried The Purple Perogy for the first time and had the Buffalo Chicken Perogies, $13.99 or $15.49 if you order on SKIP for 9.

The actual perogies were delicious and the flavour of the shredded buffalo chicken was good, but the texture of the shredded chicken was off putting.

Glad I have tried it but unfortunately at that price for 9 I will probably make my own perogies at home and very easily can make the buffalo chicken for on top.

My husband and I got a bunch of food for our anniversary a while back. Let me tell you... I have dreams about their borscht... like I think about it, a lot. Maybe it's because of covid and not having much excitement but it was so wonderful. Even just writing this makes me want to place an order and get my husband to bring some to me! 

The perogies were good. I really liked the dill sauce. My baby also enjoyed them as well. The meat was good, it didn't blow me a way but garlic sausage is always a hit. 

When my husband picked up food, they followed covid protocol and were very friendly and efficient. We will definitely be back to eat again! I wish I had photos of the food (next time) but we just ate it so fast haha. Highly recommend!!

Yes please!  oh man, I love perogies so much.  And when I am too lazy to make them myself, it's good to have some authentic choices.  It was Ukrainian Christmas, and I needed to pick up something delicious on my way home.  I didn't want to drive to my usual place on the north end and remembered hearing about Purple Perogy!  Actually... I had tried something from their food truck in the summer and was impressed, but hadn't had a full meal from the restaurant yet.

I called in an order because I assumed that they would be crazy busy.  I *LOVE* their combo plate and love that I don't have to make any decisions.  It comes with a little bit of everything... perogies, nalysnyky, pedishke, cabbage roll, garlic sausage, and meatballs.  I would say that the garlic sausage wasn't anything extraordinary but everything else was fantastic.  The meatballs really stood out to me... very tender and flavourful.  Pedishke is always my favourite and I absolutely loved these ones.  

Prices are great and service is fantastic.  If I'm not mistaken, I believe it is run by a single family.

Everything was really good AND it survived the 25 minute drive home without getting terribly soggy.  I'll definitely be back.

Great food! The staff is also very courteous and kind. The building is brand new and thus very very clean. 
We ordered a wrap, a cheesesteak, a medium pizza, fries, and onion rings and nothing disappointed! The pizza was exceptionally delicious. The onion rings weren't soggy at all. Appetizer portions were huge (wow!). Overall, this place was a total win!

Paid for order through Yelp, showed up approx 1.5 hours later, delivery driver won't give me sandwich until I pay cash as well. I told him forget it, luckily they gave me a refund. Never got to experience the food, the service got in the way before I could.

My pizza delivery took about a half hour longer than they said.  I ordered a veggie pie with NO OLIVES, but it arrived with lots of olives, almost as if they purposely did the opposite of what I asked for.
I ordered pickup and it was ready and hot when I got there. Cheesesteak was awesome but that's all I got. Really nice staff too. It's nice to have another option in the area for pizza/sandwiches etc.

It's been a while, but you all did not disappoint!  

Gaetano's is our go-to for late-night cheesesteaks. Here for a quick visit, we hit up all the spots we miss most. Gaetano's is not high on the list, but they are always on the list. 

We got worried when we found their Market Street location was closed but we called their new one just in time.  Our delivery came as expected.  Steaks were piping hot, made exactly as ordered with cheese laden fries and a cold Pepsi. No complaints here. 

As for the negative reviews. Is it the best cheesesteak I ever had? How can it be without the Amoroso? Are they always on the ball with service? Probably not, but then again who is?  Everyone is entitled to a bad day. 

Regardless, Gaetano's has a dependable quality of cheesesteak. A consistent level of service. And that is what makes it a neighborhood gem worth going back to time and time again.

Despite the website schedule in the building signage when I arrived about 25 minutes ago to get breakfast I was told at the drive-through that they would be closed for the next 20 minutes. This is supposed to be a 24 hour business... I will be calling the 1800 number to inquire about this.

I tell you, it doesn't matter whether it's morning, noon, or night, the entire crew is horribly slow. Pandemic or not, they've always been like this. 15 minutes for a simple order of an original chicken sandwich and a whopper from the 2 for $5 deal. Either the employees are slacking or the manager of this location doesn't know how to schedule people accordingly (including placing employees on call). Get it together!!!
I had to wait more than 30 min for one single burger, the burger and the fries were cold and the server was impolite. Do not come here specially if you are in a rush.
Talk about slow food. The slowest Burger King ever.  Be prepared to wait 25-30 minutes in the drive thru. They move slower than molasses as this location. It's beyond ridiculous.
I'm a truck driver , took a shower at pilot , got a double whopper . Just as I expected , fresh food. Fast and friendly service and people. Nice clean place. Thanks.

If there was a 0 star option I'd be choosing this. Incompetence at the max. After 40 minutes I made it to the window where instead of taking my money the guy acted busy and avoided to talk to me. I hope he enjoys eating what I ordered if they even had it cooked.

Wow, I thought this Chuck E Cheese was actually ok however this place has really went down hill...

Now the line hangs out the door and you must wait to be seated so I opted to not be seated and stand up which means this was going to be a short visit.

Besides the adults who are hogging the games and bullying kids and the adults who arguing over the ticket feeder and about to fight.

This place is really bad now..

On the scale of Chuck E. Cheese's this is a solid 2 stars -maybe 3.  We attended a friend of our child's birthday party here and it was typical chaos. Many of the games were broken and the place was clearly understand.

However, the staff that was there was very attentive and the lady who helped our party was great/  Very patient with the kids and the birthday girl got the "1000 ticket" ticket in the ticket blaster.

 I generally loathe Chuck E. Cheese - but my kid loves it - and we did have a good time.

i was desperate to hook my tot up with a treat, so we basically went here for the games. it's not bad and my little guy generally enjoyed himself, but i thought some of the parents needed some finishing school or basic training in manners. 

and when i was leaving a group of moms with their little ones kept making comments about my kid crying (he was upset that we had to go). i mean, they wouldn't let up. they acted like they wanted me to apologize or...throw down...

pretty sure i'll go out of my way to NOT hit up this location.

I live right around here and I used to take my brother here when I babysat him all summer for an afternoon for something different. I almost had parents arguing with me and kids running wild asking me for tokens or trying to take our tickets! The manager always gave me a hard time coming here cause god forbid I wasnt the childs parent the food is horrible and their salad bar needs a review from the health department, stick to dave and busters at mills for good games...I will never return to this location.
If I could give no stars I would many games not working either stealing tokens or not giving tickets and no one around to help you. We didn't even last 10 min inside

We just had my daughter's 3rd Birthday party here.  The staff was great from the time we walked in til the minute we left.  All the kids had fun and the pizza was decent.  No complaints, very clean, great time
I had my 7th birthday here in 1995. I brought my baby cousins here a few months ago and they still have games in here that were old when I was 7. Wow!

I get so skeeved out when I go to a Chuck E Cheese location. They are so dirty and unkempt. This is one of the better locations that I've been to if you can imagine that. The pizza isn't what it used to be and the mouse puppets are never working. My daughter seems to like it and that's really the only reason I keep going. Every time we leave though I purell her and I from head to toe and then she gets a bath when we get home. I will NEVER have a birthday party here. Please clean your location from top to bottom.

I thought the one in SW Philly was bad, but this one takes the cake. The place was packed. Kids running around every where and bumping into each other. They recently converted over to cards instead of tokens and most of the machines don't work. It will be a while before I bring my kids back here.

I would never take my kids to Chuck E Cheese's on my own accord, but we did go for a birthday party. Because my expectations are not particularly high when it comes to this establishment, it's kind of difficult and unfair to really review it. I think it's exactly what I expected it would be. It's not the cleanest place. There are a lot a lot a lot of unsupervised children running around, which isn't the fault of the Chuck-E-Cheese as much as it is the parents who aren't watching their kids. In fact, Chuck E Cheese's has a system in place to try to keep someone else from running off with your child. The pizza is mediocre.  A lot of the games are broken or outdated.  I'm not sure that the soda machine have water. They have some sort of zero calories Diet Water situation, but it definitely wasn't water. I found the staff to be courteous, and helpful. My son had a really good time. I guess that's really all you can ask for. So, in conclusion, if you're going to go to Chuck E Cheese's, you probably know already what you're getting yourself into. I believe this is true no matter which one you go to.

Not a huge fan of this location mainly because of the people who are attracted to this location and area. People don't watch their kids as they run amok- and there are kids basically bullying other kids and hopping on their games as the parents are MIA. 
The pizza is so/so at this location- but my daughter and her dad like this location. The staff don't seem very happy to be working there and the stamper guy doesn't stamp the whole party for some odd reason. Which I think could be a security issue that they need to fix. 
I think the manager tries his best and he basically does every job in the place- and he actually shares a smile and a warm conversation with customers. He's the only reason I enjoy this location- he bends over backwards to make sure the customers are satisfied. 
He's a large black gentlemen-he looks like a football player- I wish I had his name because I feel like he makes the experience at this location worth the trip- if everything else isn't so great.

Came here expecting big things... very disappointed the place is tiny. it's so squished we heard the lady at the table next to us announce that she was lactating the whole restaurant probably heard it that's how tight it is. service was very slow. for a small place it was sure hard to get the waitress's attention as she was always in the back. I ordered the steak special. salad was amazing. steak was overcooked thin and doused with steak spice. in fact the steak spice was peppered over everything somehow. horrible! crumbrulee was good but topping was burnt. overall I would never come back here! does not live up to the hype!!!
Wow...lunch was so delicious.  The atmosphere is so inviting, and so clean. The perfect place to go for a relaxing meal.

Korean Fried Chicken Burger $21.95
Medium Rare Carnivore Club
6492 Cartmell Pl SW

Korean fried chicken is one of my favourite things. 

A few months ago, I abused Wow Pop's Korean fried chicken like an incel abuses his penis. But then, hell froze over, and the Koreans sold my beloved Wow Pop to Indians, turning a top-five joint into an unmentionable dump.

Since then, I haven't really bought any Korean fried chicken, but my cravings are still there and stronger than ever. 

Last weekend, my wife and I ordered dinner from the Medium Rare Carnivore Club. I like their name, and I've heard good things, so I had a rare feeling of optimism. And when I saw a Korean fried chicken burger on their menu, I started to salivate like a zombie with a fresh brain in its hands.

Sadly, the drool wasn't worth it. The Carnivore Club's Korean fried chicken burger is a gimmicky, uninspired turd. 

I doubt the chicken is fried twice like authentic Korean fried chicken - it lacks that trademark crispiness. And the thing is entirely dependent on just a little bit of sauce for its Korean flavour. I admit that the sauce somewhat mimics the sweet & spicy flavour I love. However, it's limited to a measly, bitch-ass splash on top of the lacklustre chicken, failing to cover the entire hunk of flesh.

You know, Backstairs Burger charges $14 and PrimeTime Donair charges $16 for their flagship burgers - my favourite burgers in Edmonton - but the Carnivore Club has the gall to demand a whopping $22 for a bottom-tier burger that fails to deliver what it promises. 

Sure, the sauce is pretty decent, but calling this thing a Korean fried chicken burger is hyperbole and false advertisement. It's on par with me adding a little Safeway-bought butter chicken sauce to a McChicken, calling that crap a butter chicken burger, and peddling it for $22. That would be dishonest and stupid, and these adjectives sum up exactly how I feel about the Medium Rare Carnivore Club.

My Rating: 1.95/5

Phenomenal! I loved everything about this place. You start off picking one of their 25 unique flavors. We tried the recommended favorite. You then pick a chocolate to dip in, you can choose your favorite or mix it up. Then they stick the topping on. You pick your fruit (can also mix up ) and can put a topping on your fruit, I chose condensed milk. This was an explosion of flavor and I'm very grateful for a place like this in Tampa, very unique!

You guys HAVE to try this place. The best paleta I have ever had and the Aqua frescas were so refreshing. I got an avocado paleta dipped in milk chocolate fruity pebbles with strawberries and a strawberry cheesecake paleta. So good you all!! They are also so friendly and helpful, such a great experience! Will definitely be back soon

My family and I happened upon this place after having lunch nearby.  Wow - it is amazing!  The concept is great: you pick your ice cream on a stick and then customize it through dipping in chocolate, toppings, and fruit on the side.  The combinations are endless and so you can layer flavors to your heart's content.  The concept of mixing a paleta with agua fresca is so great - it's like a flavor bomb.  My mom said the pistachio paleta was the best pistachio ice cream she's ever had - and she's tried many. Highly recommend this place and hope others will support it, too!

I was beside myself with heartbreak over the loss of Sweet Charlie's, but when I saw the signs for this new ice cream spot, i was excited, eagerly waiting for this place ti open. This is a paleta shop, gourmet mexican ice cream on a stick with the refreshing creaminess that makes me think of gelato. Like its last two predecessors, the paleta bar also offers toppings and drizzles to customize your treat. They offer several choices for cream flavors, and between that and the toppings the choices are ENDLESS. But I zoned in on my classic go to faves. I went for a coffee flavored paleta with dark chocolate coating, pecans, chocolate with caramel drizzle. It hit the spot on a sweltering hot day. The ice cream itself was creamy and smooth, yet had a good bite to it, and didn't leave me with a messy mouth. It paired well with the dark chocolate shell and crunchy pecans, so I had a good variety of flavors and textures to contemplate as i enjoyed my treat. The worker behind the counter was very nice and had alot of energy as he explained everything they have to offer. If paletas are not your thang, they can make a milkshake out if any treat, but I do recommend trying the paleta first.

The treats from here were very delicious. The customer service is spot on! There are so many fruity and creamy bar flavors. Once you pick a flavor you then have the option to dip in either milk, white, or dark chocolate. You then can choose to coat the chocolate with a topping like sprinkles, nuts, fruity pebbles, etc.

Both of ours were dipped in milk chocolate and then coated with sprinkles. My toddlers enjoyed every bite.

I also ordered two drinks. One drink was more creamy/smoothie like and mixed with strawberry and mango. The other drink wasn't creamy and was a mix of blueberry and lime. It was so refreshing and had real blueberries. Both drinks were delicious. 

*There are no sugar-free options for the bars. 

I would recommend this spot to anyone looking for a fruity treat and/or refreshing drink.
This is awesome. Select your ice cream than a dipping sauce and a topping. SOOOOOO GOOD! Got the watermelon water and HELLO taste spuds! Great place and good people.

Literally the best place I've been to in a long time. Right as we walked in we were greeted by the kindest worker ever. He gave us samples of everything he thought we would love. My boyfriend got an amazing milkshake and we ended up buying 3 popsicles for my family. Love this place and loved the experience. Definitely going back again next weekend!
Under rated delicious dessert cravings your heart will fulfill. Munchies? Come come. Definitely worth it. Very friendly.
amazing worker who cares about the business, i can't wait until more of these open up on the east coast !
This place was delicious ! Ramon & Wallis were super helpful and provided great customer service . Will definitely be back thanks to them.

If you find yourself at West Shore, you should definitely have a visit here.

We stopped by very close to closing time, so we didn't have a chance to really take in the whole menu of options.

The ice cream bars in the display caught our eyes right away. My wife got the pistachio dipped in chocolate with nuts and my daughter got the strawberry. Both were gone in mere moments, which is the best compliment for the quality and taste!

I had a bite of the pistachio and it was just the right amount of flavor to feel fresh versus artificial.

We definitely recommend!

We were pleasantly surprised by this place. Paletas, okay, so what? At The Paletas Bar they upped their game. We had one dulce bar half dipped with coconut and pecans and one taro half dipped in white chocolate with fruity pebbles and coconut. They were amazing. The staff was also incredibly personable and helpful. Highly reccomend trying this place out!

I went to lunch a few doors down and wanted a little treat to enjoy on the drive back home. If you are familiar with Popbar, this is similar. They have a cute little popsicle selection that greets you right at the door. I am a fan, but knowing my clumsy self and the traffic across the bridge, I needed something more stable that would survive the car ride. 

It was a hot day for December so I decided to opt for their horchata. I read some reviews and saw pictures of a fun horchata/coffee blend... I absolutely loved "dirty horchata lattes" from this one shop in Cali so my mind was set on that. 

Unfortunately, my new friend behind the counter informed me that they didn't serve coffee anymore, but offered me a small sample to try the horchata. I'm not gonna lie, I was a bit disappointed BUT the horchata tasted pretty good on its own... Creamy with a kick of cinnamon. I made sure I saved half a cup til I got home and made my own coffee to add and mix in. This combo is so good! Highly recommend adding the coffee horchata back to the menu if you can!

Went today for the first time with my son Amazing place.
Service was extra great. 
Keep it up.

My family came in to try this place and I'm in love! I had the taro with half dipped white chocolate and fruity pebbles it was amazing I cannot wait to try it again! I want to try to fruit with the seasonings and allllll of that. Recommend to try at least once, very unique tastes. I also sampled the horchata very good my husband liked it as well! Ooh and my son loved his Fresca bar !

I'll admit that I was a bit skeptical because I'm usually not a fan of ice pops but my wife insisted that we try it. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it! I got a strawberry paleta filled with lechera and had it dipped in white chocolate and topped with m&ms. It was amazing! I also ordered mangos and strawberries and had the white chocolate drizzled over them. It was one of my best discoveries of the year lol. We definitely be back!

I'll be honest, I had no clue what a Paleta was but man, am I glad I do now! These customizable Mexican ice pops are delicious and handmade daily! There were so many flavors to chose from and you can dip them in chocolate, add toppings such as fruity pebbles or nuts to name a few, AND can add additional fresh fruit toppings as well! You can't go wrong! They have aguas frescas and street corn as well.

So delicious to say the least. The staff were all so friendly and had lots of suggestions. In a very quiet neighborhood totally recommend this place and highly recommended u guys open another closer to home lol in the Riverview area. But hey I will totally drive 45min again just for your paletas

If you are around, this is a great place to visit!

They have a pretty wide variety of flavors, and you get the option to dip it in different types of chocolate plus your choice of toppings.

The paletas themselves are delicious, my recommendation is to not over the top with the add-ons (unlike what I did). Overall this is a place I'd visit multiple times.

The treats - Wide selection of flavors, well made and delicious, plenty of toppings, and endless combinations. The service - Spectacular, tons of patience about sample requests, super helpful with indecisiveness. I wasn't wanting something too sweet so I got the avocado flavor with dark chocolate and pine nuts. My son got pretty much the opposite with cookies and cream, milk chocolate, and crushed oreo. We were both very happy and I can't wait to go back to try the spicy mango.
Best mangonadas! Not super sweet or artificial syrups of flavor! Also the pistachio chocolate dip paleta is awesome!

We wandered over after lunch in the same plaza deciding between the local ice cream chain shaped like a cone or this place - SO glad we tried this one.

First of all - the service was excellent. Already happy with the place.

Then, the paletas were delicious. There are a wide variety of flavor choices, which all seem delicious. You can get a half or full dip into white, milk, or dark chocolate. The topping options were fantastic too.

My family both tried the Oreo ones and were very happy with them. I tried the taro with white chocolate and fruity pebbles, which is probably my favorite dessert now. 

We will absolutely be back.

This just got added to doordash so i decided to give it a try. I got the combo teriyaki rice bowl with one spicy mongo bao and one bbq pork bao and it was delicious, as expected. Reno doesn't have a lot of (or any) options for bao, so it's super exciting that we now have this place! 10/10 would recommend, it was delicious!!!
We ordered 2 of each type of bao and the textures were all good and the fillings very flavorful. We also got some steamed dumplings. Everything was solid.

It's frozen food reheated at an American restaurant. You can find better at Trader Joe's frozen section and heating it up yourself at home. Don't support these frozen food door dash companies and please support actual Asian restaurants in the area.

Zero stars if I could. This is NOT a real restaurant. They are operating out of Sizzler on Prater Way and they buy the food frozen and prepackaged from "wow bao" and just heat it up upon order and delivery. It was a complete disaster because I genuinely thought I was trying out a new dim sum spot and that couldn't be further from the truth. If I wanted fake Chinese food, I would have ordered from Panda Express. Even that would be have been a thousand times better than what we got here. The chicken teriyaki and orange chicken bowls were terrible- they were just bowls of rice topped with a mush like substance that tasted of teriyaki and orange but there was no really discernible vegetable or chicken-- almost like it was all grounded up and blended into a thick sticky sauce. The baos were awful- hard dry stale buns with the same kind of filling- super ground/minced meats in a sweet mush sauce that you could not discern any meat in the filling at all. Almost like a paste filling. The dumplings were equally a disaster and tasted of freezer burn and cardboard. I ordered through Postmates and gave them the whole run down of how this place is not even a real restaurant and just a scam and received a full refund ($66!!). I would never want to try to put a place out of business but this is just shameless and they don't deserve to be in business!

Not a real restaurant, it's a ghost kitchen. I ordered it through DoorDash and was disappointed to find out they didn't open a restaurant here in Reno. The food was clearly prepared in a microwave. I tried most things on the menu and none of it was pleasant. I would definitely give a real Wow Bao restaurant a try but not again here in Reno.
This place is trash DO NOT EAT HERE. it's a ghost kitchen that works out of sizzler that microwaves all there frozen dim sum and bowls. Took two bites and threw it away
Its just a ghost kitchen restaurant. I picked my food up at sizzlers and my order was wrong.

Not even close to WOW...maybe WOW that was awful.
I ordered off Door Dash because they were new.  Wanted to try the Bao.  Ordered a kung pao bowl plus 2 bao for $15.99.  It was a small serving, and honesty if I was in a restaurant and was charged $15.99 for that I would really disappointed.  I would pay $5 at the grocery store frozen food section for this but NOT a restaurant.  Will not ever order it again.  It tasted like a microwaved meal.  The bao was all dough and no filling.   If I save just one person from disappointment I'll consider this a win.  Wish I'd read the reviews first.  Lesson learned.
It's not wow bao it's sizzlers and the bao tasted like metal almost. Not impressed... don't take the risk out of spite of the bad reviews.

Ordered off doordash ordered orange chicken with white rice no vegetables. I dont know what type of chicken I got. Never had it before and dont like it. I also got a bunch of vegetables in it. I have been searching for a number to call them but they dont have one.

You should definitely give this place a try! Tasty turkey ribs and crispy snoot! It's hard to find smoked turkey wings and these were tender and juicy. The snoots were the best I've ever had; crispy and delicious!
I don't mean to beat a dead horse, but I hope this is a lesson for all the new restauranteurs. Fake reviews would only get you as far as fooling your customers once.

Monday, noon, beautiful weather, no other customers. Bad sign.

Ordered $8 + tax lunch specials - rib tips sandwich and pulled pork sandwich. Each came with 1 side and soda. Total $17.xx.

Absolutely BLAND meat. No flavor at all. No smokiness whatsoever. More than likely came from an oven.

BBQ sauce - totally tasteless.

Watery and bland baked beans.

Slimy slaw.

Cold bread came straight from the fridge.

The ketchup, mustard, and hot sauce are all of the generic Sysco "House Recipe" brand. Such low quality condiments belong in the kitchen, not on dining tables.

I shouldn't have paid more than $3 for a gross meal like that.

Will not visit again.

Well I thought I would try it out because the new owners spruced it up on the outside of the building a couple of notches. That's about as good as it gets. I ordered the 1/2lb wings and fries and my bill was $11.91. I got 5 extra large wings. I was reluctant to eat them as they were too big. I was hungry so I blessed it and took my first bite. Not much flavor and the barbecue sauce is very peppery. I won't be going back for seconds.

The wait is at least 15 minutes and I was it wouldn't take long for the entree. I hope this food is worth 21 bucks waiting I  rain too. It's a bit spicy but good. Average portions of meat but they don't fill the sides up. I had about half a cup of greens and 3 quarters of mac n cheese which was delicious.

Pulled pork, chicken and tri tip were tender and juicy.  Sauce was perfect.  Greens and mac were flavorful.  Prices were fair and staff were extremely pleasant and friendly.  Did I mention free drink refills?! This won't be our last time at Que City!

5 stars!!! We are so impressed with this place. My wife and I came here for the first time on a lunch date. It was also her first time trying Thai.
I ordered the Massaman Curry, Thai hot (my usual favorite at any Thai restaurant, pictured left). I forget the name of her dish but it was the #3 lunch special (pictured right). We also got the Avocado Crab rolls.
The food is EXCEPTIONAL. Among the best Thai food I've had. The presentation is gorgeous. The restaurant is nice, clean and welcoming. An added bonus is that we live within walking distance, and we plan to dine here frequently!

Popped in this new venue. The menu was typical Thai food. Had the Thom Yum soup which was very flavorful and had nice chunks of chicken and veggies. The drunken noodles with shrimp, it was very flavorful and the shrimp were sweet and cooked perfectly. Also had a couple sushi rolls that tasted very fresh. The dining room is as basic as it comes. Best for carry-out and so wonderful to have a delicious new authentic Thai spot in the neighborhood.

This is a new Burmese/Thai/sushi restaurant on Northside of town across from North Central high-school. Cute little restaurant, clean, very atune service. Food was good. Got fried spring rolls, steamed chicken dumplings, pad ka prao minced chicken, and Burmese curry noodle soup. The soup was certainly the highlight of the meal. Very similar ingredients to a kao soi but no crunchy rice noodles and a thinner, "soupier" broth. Reminded me of consistency of a Tom kha soup. It was exceptional. The pad ka prao is sliced meat here but they made it thai style by request by mincing meat. The entree comes with side of jasmine rice topped with fried egg. The stir fry was good, not overly sweet or overly basil flavored. It is in the middle of pack as far as this particular dish goes around indy metro. The spring rolls and dumplings were both fair as well. Definitely will be back to try more entrees, menu items to gather better opinion. Great to have another thai spot in metro.

Definitely worth trying! This is my new favorite hole in the wall restaurant for authentic dishes. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes. The service was quick. All delicious and very flavorful! Reasonable priced and good portion sizes. The Thai boat noodle was my favorite. I plan on returning to try more menu options!

Really enjoyed my dinner here - all the food was delicious. Fried apps were hot crispy, sushi was fresh, and entrees were bursting with flavor. Prices and portion size are very reasonable. Already thinking about the next time I'll be back to  try more of the menu.
New sushi joint is the sh*t!! Popped in and the chef recommended a dish he said I would fall in love and he was not wrong. 10/10 recommend

We ordered the pad thai, the massaman curry, crab rangoons, and fried rice. Everything was stellar. Great flavor and was ready very quickly for take out. This place is more of a take out place; the interior is very clean and the staff were very polite. If you live in Nora, give it a try!

First time trying this new restaurant.  Overall, I would say it's flavorful and was ready for pickup quickly.  Be aware of the spice level you order - I chose mild for the drunken noodles and it was so spicy I had a hard time eating it all.  We also got a curry dish with medium spice and it was so hot I couldn't imagine what actually ordering hot would be.  The veggie spring rolls were really good - hot and fresh.  We probably wouldn't order the crab rangoons again.  The filling is minimal and is yellow - seasoned with a spice we didn't much care for.  We will order here again with low spice levels for sure.  Worth checking out!

WORST SUBWAY EVER!!!!  Unless you work at Nissan and only have time to go to this one don't go.  The person making my sandwich was doing it the way the others do and the indian woman came up changed everything and charged me more and said that is what I asked for when I never even spoke to her.  Will not go there again.

This is definitely the first subway I have been to that doesn't carry buffalo sauce so I couldn't get what I always get (buffalo chicken sub). I'm pregnant so I have pretty limited options unless it comes to chicken or meatballs. When I walked in I had to just stand there for 2-3 mins while nobody greeted me but I could hear the employees talking in the back. As soon as one did come out from the back she seemed perturbed that I was even there. The ordering process was fine but I said thank you before I left and couldn't even get a thank you back or anything at all. I will certainly keep going to subway but not this one!!
. The woman on this subway said" no refill your drink" because i carry out eating and come back in 3 hours to refill my drink in the same day purchased. Don't come here.

All of the negative reviews for this location are old and irrelevant. I went today to this location and the entire staff was so kind and accommodating! Sandwiches were done quickly and perfectly, and the store was clean. Will definitely be back!
This is a top-notch pick up Chinese place. The food was picked up in 10 minutes it was hot and ready. I loved their fried rice it wasn't the normal bright yellow kind. So yummy.
Small bar feel on a Funday Sunday-kicked back at the bar watching Football and my hubbie's enjoying  unlimited Bloody Marys-$10!

It was our first time at this restaurant. What a great experience. The bartender waited on us in the dining area as we were there right when they opened. He did an exceptional job!! His name is Wade and he provided some of the absolute best customer service that we have experienced in quite some time at a restaurant. His attention to our needs were handled before we could even ask. He offered options to make our visit very pleasing. He had refills of our drinks to us right on time without needing to ask. That is a big deal to me. The food was great and the service was exemplary. Thank you Wade for providing great customer service. If you get a chance to visit this place, ask for Wade and tell him Big Steve sent you.

We had been hearing about this place via radio sowe decided to try it. There were literally only 4, maybe 5 tables that were occupied...it took longer than it should have just to put a drink order in. Then we ordered wings as an apetizer and specifically asked if they can be brought our before our meals...well the wings came out with our burgers.....we never were asked blue cheese or ranch and the wings didn't have either....we never were asked if we wanted ketchup or condiments....the burgers were warm at best and we're very bland....back to the wings....they gave us garlic parmessian when we ordered honey bbq.....we got the correct wings when it was time to go....took our waitress forever to get a to go box, mind you the place still had a handful of tables occupied....the waitress would just disappear at times and it would be a while before you saw her.....the wings actually had good flavor....but over all expierence was poor and at this point we will not be going back.....we eat out a lot and use yelp to give our true honest opinions about our expierences...very disappointed overall.

The service in this place is the worst. When we arrived there was hardly anyone in the place. We ordered food and it took them 15 minutes to tell me they were out of the soup.  It is now 30 minutes since we ordered our food and we still don't have it.   There are plenty of other restaurants to choose from. I suggest you do that.

We checked this place out for the first time today and left happy. The inside is nice and clean and the staff are friendly. Their menu has a good variety and multiple categories (stuffed burgers!) and we look forward to returning for more. Plus, they have different specials/ themes every night- a few of them are unique to the area, which is great. I recommend stopping in.

Local bar, service ok, but this was a NFL game day and the staff were not knowledgeable to how to change the channel on the main screens.  There is a sign outside advertising their 120 in screens but they were not turned on either. We ordered wings and continually expressed that we wanted them crispy. The sauce was good, the flats were tiny but not crispy at all.  They ran out of the beer we were drinking after one pitcher (No backup?).  The liquor shelf seemed to be missing bottles and the beer fridges looked empty with many shelves empty. Bathrooms were adequately clean.

Delicious and fresh ingredients!  I've tried something different each time I've gone and haven't found anything I haven't liked yet! From Açaí bowl to avocado toast to THANKS A BRUNCH, which was my personal fav so far!!

Congrats to Grain & Berry for opening up their 13th location in DTSP! I couldn't be happier because I will pass this location several times during the week/weekend!

We stopped by during their Grand Opening Weekend and were greeted right away by one of the owners (who actually has been a friend of mine for over 25 years LOL). The restaurant was in pristine condition as G & B ALWAYS keeps their locations. 

I am a creature of habit, so I started with the Grain & Berry Bowl and Everything Avocado Toast plus a Poached Egg. B had the Relax Eat Repeat Bowl. Everything was amazingly delicious (as always) and consisted of the freshest ingredients. 

We were treated to some Wheatgrass and Ginger shots and they were tasty, as well. If I could have someone make me these Wheatgrass shots every morning, they would certainly start my day off right! 

The staff was very friendly and there is lots of parking behind the shopping plaza G & B is located in. 

Don't forget to add the app for reward points and to order ahead when you are in a hurry! 

Thanks to Brendon and the Grain & Berry staff for a great experience! I look forward to seeing you soon! (Insert Heart Emoji here)
The flatbreads & smoothies are absolutely amazing! You cannot beat delicious healthy food paired with wonderful customer service/friendly staff 11/10
Grain & Berry is an asset to St.Pete!   It is a must go to and enjoy all the healthy treats.  I highly recommend
Very delicious and refreshing. I got the Grain and Berry bowl and it looked as good as it tasted! It was also very filling too. Definitely worth a visit

I've tried all of the smoothie bowl places in St Pete & this one is BY FAR superior. I will not be eating anywhere else! Super fresh, super tasty, and give you a ton of energy! Could not recommend this place more! Just had a custom bowl & loved it so much!
The best I had in a longtime for all natural and nutritious menus Great service and friendly staff and asset to Saint Pete

Love this little gem! The newest addition to the 4th St North Tribe in St. Petersburg, Fl is Grain and Berry. The restaurant has the vibe of a chill Starbucks scene with the offerings of an Açaí Bowl/Smoothie Shop and more! Upon arriving to the location there is ample parking behind the store front. Outdoor seating is available with plenty of bike racks to park your emissions free ride. 

Inside the decor and atmosphere is vibrant, colorful and cozy. Beauty wood paneling and bright lighting makes it warm and inviting. High top and low top seating is available for your preferred comfort. The menu is presented on large digital panels and is easy to read. The staff consists of what loos like eager college students who are ready to be of service. 

The first time I went, I built my own açaí bowl. Seeking to avoid gluten, I asked if the granola was gluten free. The young man was helpful but was unsure. Luckily, the owner was around to help to provide clarity on the gluten free options. Staff knowledge on gluten-free (allergen) items/ingredients is a growth area but does not
 ruin the experience. Perhaps they can add the GF, D, S letter by menu items on the panel to save on time or questions. 

After receiving my bowl, I was very happy with the presentation. I did end up going back for more shredded coconut and almonds, but that's just my preference. When I asked for more toppings and offered payment, the staff was very helpful and offered them in a closed ramekin for free. Lovely gesture! 

Overall, this is a lovely spot for those non coffee drinkers who'd like to get some work done, have a healthy meal, and get out of the house.  The prices of most items average about $10-$12 with out tax and tip. AND always remember to tip because all of the staff is making everything by hand. With gloves and masks on of course! 

I encourage everyone to make this apart of the spots you frequently visit. It is worth it and a refreshing break from a coffee shop.

Grain and Berry was probably my favorite açaí bowl of all time! Açaí bowls are some of my favorite things to get when I travel and always looking for new combos/appearances of them. Well, the big glass bowl is comes in for starters was enough to sell me with how cool that is! 

The service was great, very friendly and bowls were fast. What I loved about the açaí was it was more puréed and not like ice. I hate when açaí places have icing açaí and is so annoying to eat! The toppings were a great combo and all the fruit was fresh. 

Really can't say enough good and really would recommend trying. Prices are on point with any other açaí place! Much worth the try!
Fantastic selection and quality for bowls, smoothies, and flatbread pizzas and quesadillas. The staff was super friendly and expedient. Coeur d Alene, Idaho needs one of these!!

This place is the best, they will customize anything you want. Their hale to the kale juice is a must try and you can't lose with one of their delicious açaí bowls. A go to after yoga or for breakfast
Went there for the soft opening.  The menu is filled with selections.  We tried the bowls and were not disappointed.  The staff is friendly  and the place welcoming.  Give it a shot.

This was my go-to spot while on vacation. Food was great! I personally recommend the avocado toast and Health Nut smoothie. The açaí bowls had a beautiful presentation too! Staff followed COVID protocols and were very nice. The place was clean and had outdoor seating available.

We ordered G&B from Uber Eats recently. We got two flatbreads, avocado toast and a smoothie. Unfortunately, when the order came there were no flatbreads, only the cold items. We were sad. But, I was so curious about the restaurant that I called to see if they still had the flatbreads there. The owner got on the line and offered to deliver the flatbreads personally to our house. It was such amazing customer service, I was shocked! And the food was amazing as well. Please order the Meat Your Heart Out flatbread and the everything avocado toast. Delicious! Will definitely be ordering from here again. Thank you!

I Love and enjoy their smoothies and bowls. Unfortunately, this time when I ordered with a friend they didn't blend it right. At the end of our smoothies are some whole fruits that is just the downside of my experience.

We just picked up a couple fantastic açai bowls and a delicious smoothie made with blue spirulina. All of them are delicious and the people there are so nice. We found by searching on Yelp and they only opened a couple weeks ago.
Plus it is very clean inside and the bathroom is clean. Such a great place! I'll be going back. I noticed they have four kinds of avocado toasts as well. Cool and yum!

What a treat! 

I did a create your own açaí bowl topped with granola, strawberries, bananas, peanut butter, and Nutella. So good! The bowl was practically overflowing with toppings. Everything combined very nicely!

Ordered the mango passion to go and it was so freaking good (Açaí, Organic Granola, Mango, Pineapple, Honey, Coconut Shavings and Almond Slices). Very filling and a huge amount of food. A little on the sweeter side, so next time I'd probably order it without honey.

Highly recommend!! Great place!! Super healthy options and beautifully prepared. Indoor and outdoor seating. Really nice inside. One of the owners was there and he was very nice and you can tell he really cares about the business and customer experience. Will definitely be back!

Fresh and clean eating what's not to like. Fun and healthy choices for you to choice from. The staff is super friendly and the place is very welcoming. I would highly recommend stopping in and trying one of these delicious Açaí Bowls today.

We got the açaí bowls and give it 4/5 stars. It was good but not the best ever. Maybe a little more honey and peanut butter was needed and maybe that would of made it 5 stars. Cute place, come check it out!

Grain and Berry is the perfect healthy treat post workout, or anytime really.  This was my first time here and it did not disappoint.  They have plenty of outdoor and indoor seating, perfect for the summer.  The restaurant is clean and smells like the fresh bananas located all over the counter.  

I especially liked that they had combo options on their menu, which allowed you to combine their toasts, juices, smoothies, and shots.  I ordered the everything avocado toast which was delicious.  I loved that there was a layer of cream cheese at the bottom.  For a smoothie, I ordered the green whisper which was very refreshing.  The prices were fair, the staff was friendly, the food came quick, and the packaging was durable for to go orders.
Packed well .. Fruit was fresh .. Bowl was delicious and filling. Wanted to try something new that was healthy .Good decision!!
Great service, manger is super nice! Tried the grain & berry açaí bowl & it was delicious! Defiantly recommend you trying this place.

We ordered the summer salmon, jalopeno bacon burger, enchilada appetizer.  All of the food and flavors were interesting and great. The food didn't come out after the appetizer unfortunately the appetizer came after and the server didn't know the menu very well.  I am giving it 4 stars for flavors and the servee was good but still new; hopefully everything else gets better with time for this newer but different restaurant.  It's nice to have a good tex mex place like this.

I had the chimichanga and my wife had the chicken naan pesto sandwich. Very good! I was impressed with my first visit. It was take out so we will be back for a dine in experience but I think the food quality was excellent.
Me and my husband really enjoy this place it's are little favorite spot sometimes on the weekends great food and drinks reasonably prices

The place is really good and we will definitely be back. We got the 12 spice Mac n cheese and ultimate burger. Food was delicious, especially the burger! Even the chicken nuggets for the kiddo were good. Friendly service. Get off your whatever and order from here!

There were so many things about this visit that were strange, if not unsettling. 

Firstly- this restaurant went into a recently vacant Ruby Tuesday & did no renovations. Had there not been a new menu in front of me, I would have just assumed I was at Ruby Tuesday. Like seriously, they didn't even tear the sign down. 

Secondly- the food was just bland. I ordered the BBQ chicken flatbread & could only taste the BBQ sauce. The chicken by itself was dry & the cheese was tasteless. My family ordered the chicken quesadilla & had a visceral reaction to the apparently overwhelming taste of the rice. By far the best part of my meal were my French fries. 

Thirdly- I watched 2 employees have a 15 min conversation with customers without masks on. We visited in December, as COVID cases were on the upswing in our area & it just felt super irresponsible for the employees to be conducting this conversation when our region is under a mask mandate. 

Honestly, the only reason this review is 2 stars & not 1 is because our server was very nice & great at answering my menu questions. I understand they are a new establishment, but I do believe they need some work in the kitchen, as well as some adherence to current COVID policies.
