Sat at the bar and felt like I was with family. Bartender Anthony was awesome and the food was amazing!!!  It was a great time and great food!  Thank you Anthony!!

Went to this location as a suggestion from a friend. When I got there, no one was wearing masks except the host. The lady at the bar who took my order was very friendly and nice. The main complaint I have is the appetizer of fried green tomatoes which was $7.99 which should have been $1.99 at most. Thank God I used a Groupon voucher instead of paying money. I would have been pissed!!
Love this place!!!  We need something new in Smyrna and this is it.  Anthony is an amazing bartender. Food is so good!  Check it out and keep the néw/local business going!!!

This is a great place for some Tex-Mex and cajun food and a beer. I had the Fajitas and they were very good. The Salsa for the chips had a nice kick to it. I recommend this place for dining in during the COVID-19 pandemic. Great service.
I am so glad they are back. Blue Cactus was one of our favorite restaurants. Food is fantastic and staff odds friendly!
We came here for lunch and all 3 of us got burgers.  All 3 burgers were great!!!  I'd go as far to say, best burgers in town! Good service and delicious food!!!

If you're in the mood for a twist on your traditional Tex-Mex/ Cajun cuisine then look no further. The Rodeo Bar & Grill provided great service, attentive staff, and delicious food. 

Although the atmosphere was subpar, the restaurant is brand new and that can be fixed easily. The hours were not posted online and no one answered the phone so we went out on a limb to try it... but we were glad we did 

If you had ever had Blue Cactus Cantina, this is the exact same thing... even the same menu holders (which isn't a bad thing) ! I will absolutely be returning to this restaurant and recommend anyone to try it!
Wack  no open no notice saying it's closed but they charge your credit card    Phone just rings and rings

I've never left a restaurant before and we walked out. Let me preface this saying there were 9 people in the whole place. We got our appetizer quickly, ordered entrees and an hour later still didn't have them. She finally brought them out and they were cold. She was nice but there was clearly a restaurant issue. We paid for our appetizer and went somewhere else. It was ridiculous.

Terrible for the price point. If it was cheaper, than I would have been ok. I spent $25 for pot stickers, bao and the chicken teriyaki bowl, before tip. Ate it all in one setting. I was full, bit pricey, for $25 for one meal, should have been great.

I was actually surprised that the bao dough itself was decent. The filling quite unimpressed. I tried the bbq pork and mongolian beef. They were quite small. The vege dumplings were ok. Thought it was weird it came with no dumpling sauce, just packets of soy sauce. Definitely cooked from frozen.

For the price point and the amount of food, it should have been all homemade. Defiantly was not. Just go buy frozen bao or dumplings at an Asian mart and save yourself a lot of money.

I only had hopes of this place because they described themselves as Asian street food, which I lived off for a year m. You can taste some white guy started this company.
I love baos so I'm not surprised how much I enjoyed these. A fair price and they were delivered quickly to my house. Definitely worth trying.

The kung pao chicken bowl I got was a joke. Very little chicken, little flavor, a ton of rice. I didn't finish it. The Bao were fine, but no better than the ones I get frozen at any Asian grocery in my area, and for twice the price. I will not be ordering again.
This place is just very okay when it comes to taste. Portion size is small for the amount you pay. Overall you're better off hitting up Panda Express or your local wok.

Part of my stay-at-home delivery guilty pleasure list...

This place does a few things only, but does them really well. The Chinese dishes are... eh. But the BBQ steamed buns (which are a guilty pleasure I find myself fiending for often), and the potstickers, with gingery tender chicken filling, are AMAZING. They even have an Impossible meat version on the steamed buns, and a vegetarian option on the potstickers!

So: Meal? Maybe not. Snack/guilty pleasure? Damn skippy.

I believe this is one of their "dark kitchens" that
 I read about on their site (meaning a restaurant franchises it and only uses the kitchen part to serve- that's why this is delivery only). We ordered bao buns (3 kinds) and pot stickers. They were all good (the bbq was my favorite), but it's definitely over priced for a chain. $15 for 6 bao buns that I don't think they made from scratch. It's fine if you're craving it, but just be ready to pay the extra $. Also potstickers didn't have any sauce, so I dinged them for that.

Would have gotten 4 stars, but again it's pricey and it's delivery only.

very excited to find a wow bao in indy! got delivery and was very impressed with the bbq pork bao. a little cold and soggy but that's to be expected with delivery. the veggie spring rolls and veggie bao were not as great, maybe it's an acquired taste but the amount of fiber and uncooked couscous-like filling left an undesirable texture. will definitely be excited to get the bbq pork and beef bao in the future! would love to see the dessert bao make an appearance!
Honestly all I have to say is get the ginger chicken potstickers. I could eat them all day every day. I've never had bao buns before this either and the beef ones were amazing!
Wow. That was bad. There was no meat in my bowl, and the rice was mushy. The baos were cold...and not like delivery cold, actually not heated cold. A huge disappointment.

This was literally the worst meal I ordered from doordash. We chose the combo meal, chicken bowl with 2 buns, the chicken bowl hardly had meat/glaze in the dish. Not fulfilling at all. Not worth the money or time.

Man, I don't know about this place. I honestly thought that the bowl I received was a joke of some sort, but then I saw other reviews that complained of the same thing. I had maybe 6 pieces of tiny, brown, flavorless chicken. My bowl was 90% rice, 5% orange chicken sauce, and 5% orange chicken. What? Not good. Not good at all. 0 stars. 

The bao were pretty good, though... which is the only reason that they got 2 stars. I would definitely order those again. I get the feeling that bao is the specialty of this place, and then they added on some crappy bowls for flair. They're definitely an afterthought. Again, not good. But I'd order the bao again... once I get over my annoyed-ness of the gross, overpriced bowl.

I thought it was a mistake and gave me child's portion of the teriyaki chicken bowl. It did not look appetizing. I can't believe I spent so much money on this tiny bowl....why not fill the container? I also was not impressed with the bao buns, they were too gummy, like they were not cooked. Ended up giving it to my dog which he sniffed, then walked away. I gave it a two stars for potstickers, which were good. Bottom line: Too pricey for this hot mess.
Mushy dumplings, missing part of the order. Chicken teriyaki from the mall food court is better.

I wish I could give it 0 stars. The order was completely incorrect. The potstickers were vegetable instead of chicken, not to mention they were greasy and falling apart. I was supposed to receive a variety of bao, but only received one kind, and it was the incorrect number of them. Despite that, they did taste a little better than the potstickers, but I'm incredibly disappointed. Never ordering from here again. I should have listened to the other reviews.

My first experience with this place will be my last. Ordered 4 of the coconut dessert bao and ended up getting 4 vegetable bao instead. I understand that you didn't have them, but why not call to let me know and ask about a possible substitute? Why not just refund the money if you didn't have what I paid for? Why resort to taking it upon yourself to think that it's ok to still take my money and send me something I didn't pay for instead. Couldn't have replaced it with one of the bao that actually taste good either? Someone just had the bright idea that I would be ok with my DESSERT being replaced with VEGETABLES. I have never spit anything out faster. And like, I ordered the cheeseburger bao and those were really good! Couldn't have used those as a replacement instead? I'm not mad at this company, I'm mad at whoever made the personal choice of thinking that vegetables can replace dessert! And I'm sorry but those vegetable bao are really gross.

i really wish i had looked at the reviews before ordering here. i ordered the spicy chicken bowl, bbq pork and spicy beef bao but received 2 coconut custard baos!! i don't like coconut. and the chicken bowl was awful, it had no taste whatsoever i couldn't even finish it. please save your money.

The Bao and potstickers were delicious and if you ordered just that, you'd be fine! What was less-than-impressive for me, and many others on this page, were the bowls. 

When we opened up our order, it looked like they just gave us this tiny cup of just rice? The meat mixture was a tiny scoop on the side of the bowl so you couldn't even see it at first and it was pretty disappointing... especially when all the pics corporate shows are these beautiful loaded bowls with all kinds of green onions and veggies on top. After mixing it in the rice to meat ratio was too great, and you'd just get bites of plain rice... Which was disappointing because the meat stews were all super flavorful! I got the chicken teriyaki and my husband got the spicy kung pao. For $15, it just wasn't worth it to me at all.

The Bao were large and fluffy, and I liked that they came with the paper on the bottom to list what flavor they were since my husband and I ordered different ones. But we both loved the spicy mongolian beef and the chicken teriyaki bao. The BBQ Berkshire pork was okay, but we preferred the flavors on the other! This is my first time trying Bao, and all the dough was interesting to me... Maybe a little dry? I'll definitely have to find a local, non-chain bao place to try and update how they really compare!

As for the potstickers, they were a teensy tiny bit overcooked, but the filling was good and they were delicious... You can also get 30 of them for $30 so you know where I'll be next time I'm eating my feelings!

Warning! If you google the "Wow Bao" address you'll find this is a dark kitchen location in a Fazoli's Italian Restaurant!!! Probably why the reviews suck so much. I was craving some dumplings and did the research. Buyer beware. The Wow Bao website even has fine print that says all their food is frozen and shipped to dark kitchens nationwide. You are NOT getting freshly made food. Go local instead!

Grew up eating these in Los Angeles. The price of these compared to size is definitely marked up double the price. A dozen pack of these size buns back home were around $20 and if you upgraded to large ones they cost $30. Have zero clue as to why they are priced so high here, but it is what it is.

Taste: 9/10 perfectly cooked, stuffed and seasoned.

I probably wouldn't bother ordering again, I can make them myself and three times the batches for the cost I paid for these mini buns. You would think they would advertise the size but they don't. These are the small appetizers, not the meal ones they have during dim sum hours or that you usually can buy on the carts in Los Angeles.

I stumbled upon this place on Grubhub, so I thought I'd give it a try. I've probably only had bao a few times in my life, but I sure like anything that's like a dumpling. So a bun filled with meat? Perfectly delicious! I love how easy these are to eat. I wanted to stuff my face with a whole bunch of them. I managed to eat 3 and I was stuffed. I ordered the 6 pack of bao and a 12 pack of dumplings. I got one of each of the meat dumplings (they have a veggie option too). Pork bbq, Mongolian beef and chicken teriyaki. Of the 3 flavors, I ended up liking the chicken the best. These would be great for a quick lunch. They're easy to eat with your hands, so great if you have to grab food on the go and eat in the car or while walking around. I imagine they'd be a fun and clean meal for kids to eat too. The dumplings were also very good. They didn't come with a sauce like I often see with dumplings, but these were fine on their own. I also ate them with my hands, but they do have oil on them, so not as meat as the bao. Overall, I really liked this place.

I LOVE bao, and stock up when in Chicago. Now I can, and have them delivered! They were delish. I also added an order of potstickers that were fresh and tasty.
Unfortunately not all of the family enjoy Bao, so we included an order of Orange chicken. It was a huge disappointment. The bowl, although large, was 98% sticky rice with a splash of something on top. My daughter likened it to vomit- that unappealing. I was the only one brave enough to taste it. It was bland bland bland. I hope we just got the wrong order because there was nothing orange about it.
This was a delivery order.  Go for the Bao - it's the bomb.

I don't often leave reviews but this meal was very disappointing due to taste and how tiny the bowls were. They appeared to have cut 1 strip of chicken into 30 tiny chunks and put in my chicken teriyaki bowl. Wish would have read reviews first.  I hate leaving bad reviews but people should know before spending $$ on this food.

We ordered the shareable meal for 2 and 5 dumplings. The buns are soggy and mushy. The filling is honestly tasteless and mushy as well. We were supposed to receive 3 different types of bao but only got one (possibly spicy Mongolian?). Received no potstickers with our order. Despite the dumplings looking disgusting, they are also soggy but the flavor wasn't that bad. If you are a texture person DO NOT buy this food. Matter of fact, no one should eat this food. It's honestly inedible. I ate 1 bao and 3 dumplings and my stomach is in knots. Believe the reviews and do not purchase. 2/10 (also I wouldn't go to any "wow bao" because I have heard they are all the same)

DO NOT ORDER! Like other reviewers, we were shocked at the small portion sizes for the price. We ordered 2 bowls and got about 2 ounces of chicken on a small bed of rice. Each bowl had maybe 2 spoonfuls of chicken, hardly enough to justify the $10 per bowl price. 

Do yourself a favor and skip trying this place. It's not worth it! The menu images are complete lies.

I got the orange chicken bowl. The flavor of the chicken was not bad at all but they barely gave me any! And it did not look how they advertised it. They also did not deliver utensils with the order. Some of the rice was mushy as well. If I had more chicken and the rice was cooked perfectly, this would have been better.

Great new supermarket, cafe, butcher specializing in Indian foods. Big location with large assortment of Indian products. Also has a cafe serving hot Indian dishes that were really good. Loved it and the assortment of products. Prices were also good.

I was just at the store 15 mins ago and concerned that they are not following Covid spread guidelines adequately.
It is a new store and is spacious and clean currently, which is good. 
The thing that is very concerning to me especially with infection rates at their peak in Tampa /Fl area is that employees who work in the back and are stocking and restocking their produce bins are not wearing mask or gloves.  I had  close brush with a couple of them who just showed up to stock the bins and one even just with his bare hands moved my cart away.
I know the ladies up front are wearing at the cash register are wearing mask and gloves. By letting a bunch of employees work without adequate PPE they are doing a disservice to their employees and customers for sure.
Also for a large grocery store they can provide goodwill by providing cart wipes or some spray disinfectant to clean.
I hope they will pay heed to these business improving tips , especially if they want to stand out among their competitors rather than  focusing on cost cutting measures.
.

This is probably the cleanest indian grocery store out there. It is spacious and rivals a true grocery store, like Publix, for Indian and south asian/middle eastern foods. There is also a little cafeteria where you can eat or take home rotis and a wide variety of other curries, appetizers, and desserts.

They have just about everything that Patel brothers has, but the one thing that is lacking in comparison is the fresh vegetables. For fresh veggies I 100% recommend going to Patel brothers, but this place is not bad.  I did notice a lot of fleas around the potatoes and onions on two consecutive trips, so now I just avoid buying any veggies from there. It is mainly the packaged foods, rice, flour, and other bulk stable indian foods I get from them.

Prices are fantastic too. I actually think they're cheaper than Patel. Also, it is easy to socially distance while shopping here which is not possible at Patel.

Authentic Ethnic Cuisine #62. Indian Cuisine. 

This cafe is located in the Grocery store. It has it seating area and business location. The place is clean. What I like about is they have the wash hand area if you decide traditional way use your hand to eat. There is a water station for you. 

We started with the chicken wing drums stick. It was delicious. We also got the lamb chop. The meat was process and it is not tough to bite. The meat still present some pink area which is great technique to keep the chop delicious. We also got the veggies curry puff. It was delicious too. My friend got the dosa. It has potatoes inside. It also come with curry soup to dip. It look very decent. 

Lastly is the mutton biryanis. The mutton is soft and good curry surround it. The rice is perfect. The food may have prepared in one tone of spicy level. I actually like it that way. It is indian food after all.

New Tampa has a new interesting grocery store. Taaza is new kid in the block provide the indian grocery choices to shop other than the typical grocery store. Price is affordable for the people who shop here. This is one of the kind. The space is huge. 

They have divided into several sections. The rice section has different rice. Basmati rice is one of the kind. Other included brown rice and Aromatic Kalijeera rice. I never have the Kalijeera rice. It is short grain. The produce section includes fresh veggies, fruit, ground produce like potatoes. They also have long shaped eggplant, baby cucumber, lychee, longan, and more.

They ready to eat section provide convenient for the young people to take home or stop by their cafe to pickup the food you like. The meat market is per your order meat cut. They also has the cheese, ready pre cut food to be cook at home. The sweet section is very tempting.

What an awesome Indian Supermarket filled with Indian groceries and dining options. If you need spices, curry powders, etc that you can only find in Indian markets, this is the place to visit. Not only can you get the groceries you need, but you can also eat a buffet or take out delicious Indian food. I had the Mutton Biriyani, Samosa Chat, Chicken and Egg puff, Dosha, and Gobi Muchurian. All were delicious! The food was a bit spicy so beware and I preferred the egg over the chicken puff. I definitely plan to visit more often to shop for my Indian items not found in other grocery stores.

I have been using the store because it's convenient as I live in new Tampa however, this place you must watch because they will overcharge you with a lot of things because of the idiots they hired I have no clue at the cash register. Multiple occasions I have noticed them over charging things without actually knowing the price or even paying attention to what they charged until you pointed out to them. These are bunch of stupid idiots for working here without any customer care or concern is they have no manners. Typical of the Indian mentality however, if they want to remain competitive, then they better get their act together and hire some real people with some English speaking skills rather than kids just off the boat.

Wanted to buy groceries & some takeout from the restaurant, but after shopping saw the HUGE line up to check out (the entire length of the store) and abandoned my cart & any plans to get hot food. 

Epic fail.

We came to check out the grocery selections and more importantly the food. The cafe has pastry, food and drink selections which all looked fantastic. We choose to do a combo platter with chicken lollipops, mango dhal, paneer curry, a potato/masala dosa, roti and rice, everything was really good but the show stopper was definitely the paneer curry. I dont know what they put in it to make it soo good, ive had this dish at a bunch of other places but hot dang this one was finished within minutes of eating. We other grabbed some indian snacks, bread and vegetables. They have a very nice selection of fresh vegetables and some fruits. I will be coming back for the paneer curry! I ate it so fast i forgot to grab a picture!

My 1st time visiting, here's my thoughts:

I really liked the market side! It was clean, organized and had a great variety of items! The produce selection was very fresh and reasonably priced, best okra I've ever seen. The halal meat section was more butcher counter style, mostly cut to order with a few selections precut in the cooler shelves. My two pet peeves was there were a few items on promo sale which didn't ring properly (I didn't notice it until after I looked over my receipt) and the cashier was very slow bc she advised the register wasn't ringing my items up. She had to hand input in a lot of my items. Kinks I really hope they work out since I don't like to be misled by sales. 

The to-go food side was spacious and looked clean, a mix of modern style booths and tables, ample seating for both large groups and singles. There's also a hand washing station with 2 sinks. The walk up food counter was a bit more chaotic, no designated line so there was people gathering on both the left and right sides leading to the single cash register at the center making it difficult to social distance.They have a deli style prepared hot food selection, a dessert counter and a little bakery area. On the weekends they offer different specials, this weekend it was 3 varieties of biryanis. 

I ordered food to go which included 2 apps from the hot food selection, a chicken curry combo ($7.99 for main entree, white rice, 2 pieces whole wheat rotis and a lentil soup), a lamb biryanis, and the Gobi 65 (a spicy Indo-Chinese battered cauliflower dish). Total came out to $45, good amount for 2 people. I was told it would take 15 mins for the biryanis special and Gobi 65 which I understood. It took them 40 mins to make the special; at the 30 mins mark I went up to the counter for an update and was told it would be 5 more mins. When I went up to the counter a 2nd time, I was rudely shooed way. I'm very patient to hospitality staff but that was the final straw for me. I was ready to ask for my money back for the last 2 items and leave with what I had when my order was finally done. I was hurriedly given the rest of my food. Customer service was extremely lacking. My food was good but not great. Surprisingly the hot counter food was better than the specials! Rice in biryanis overcooked but at least lamb was delicious and well spiced. Gobi 65 had good flavor but was a disaster! The tiny container they stuffed it into made the batter turn mushy. This is a dish where they batter and fry the cauliflower then toss it in a sauce so why they would sabotage it like that is besides me! 

If you plan on getting hot food here, call ahead or order the prepared hot deli selection. Otherwise, prepare to wait. Staff is not very friendly or helpful in giving descriptions. I just googled menu items I wasn't familiar with while waiting for my turn in line.
Amazed to see a huge Indian store ! And just the right location. They have groceries from dry foods, fresh foods , butchery, and even a cafe. Will be coming back again
5 stars I am giving here is just for the samosa.  But I wanna say cafe overall is pretty good. I have tried fried rice, which I liked a lot. Chappathis are also really good. Vegetables are good too.

Great new Indian grocer in New Tampa! The ethnic chips and snacks are cool, spicy if you're into that. I usually hit up the little fast casual restaurant they have in the back. This is the chicken combo. $9. Chicken tikka masala, dal, rice, and naan. Spicier than some other places in town, so I guess it's authentic? Not from there so wouldn't know. All I know is i'm going here for my curry fix!

Taaza Mart is MASSIVE! I haven't been to an Indian grocery store that actually allows for more than 2 customers to browse an aisle at one time. Taaza mart has ample space for several customers to be in a single aisle at one time. There are so many options for each item you are shopping for. Whether you are looking for lentils, rice, or savory chai time snacks, the varieties are endless. Aside from their dry goods, they have a large produce section. Although I was not able to check it out for myself, they also offer a meat market and a cafeteria inside. The only downside is that the lines are a bit long. New Tampa could always do with more indian grocery stores. This one is a great one to check out!

YOGA FLAME!

Taaza is an Indian grocery now located in the now defunct Staples in the BJ Wholesale plaza.  It makes me chuckle that they put existing letters on the distinctive red facade. 

The store is generally clean and well stocked with spices, produce, poultry, teas, namkeens (savory snacks). It has a cafe where they serves snacks and full meals along with certain breads/baked goods.

Unlike Patel Bros, you can actually walk in the aisles without walking sideways. The aisles are well labeled. It has many of the same brands and items as Patel though there are some different ones here and there.

One product I would recommend is Tea India's  Massala Chai tea. It is around $6 and has 72 tea bags. It is in a red square box. (Just use two tea bags and microwave for 2.5 minutes if you have a 1100Watt microwave. Then add sugar/cream. You're welcome)

Cafe:

I have tried the chilli chicken dish from here. It is pretty flavorful with a good amount of meat. (It does not come with rice or any other starch/bread though)  4/5
In the cafe, they seem to have a different biriyanis on different days. On a Sunday, they had Mutton Biriyani for $14. It was great but had the bones on it so be careful.  4/5 

Cons:
One time my mom got Onion Pakora there and the cafe employee only gave the broken fragments that were left over and refused to give her whole ones. 

Like Patel Bros and other Indian groceries, the frozen kebabs/meats are overpriced.
Great new halal grocery store. Wonderful selection of meat, veggies and fruit. As well as all sorts of spices and rice. Perfect place to get all your shopping and support a new local business!!!

The place is big and spacious. The Cafe inside is good with good seating and good food. But the customer service at the food counter is horrible. They are not courteous to the customer requests. The vegetables and other groceries are priced way to high than other places. 
I would not suggest this place. There are better Indian stores and food outlets which has gratitude to customer and good customer service in Tampa. I would go there rather than get humiliated here.

I don't like cooking, so I was so excited when Taaza Mart is opened in Tampa Palms. I gave them several chances to their cafe before posting this. 1. Chicken Biryani is not at all authentic and didn't taste good, they suggested Talapakattu biryani, it was so bad I had to throw away. 2. Ordered Onion pakora and Badusha for friends, we all had stomach upset after eating. 3. chicken fry was only bones, it was as it they fried leftover junk 4. Last weekend was final straw, chicken fried rice was so bad and I got sick, I didn't realize it's food and ate next day, I had such a bad stomach pain that I couldn't work 2 days. Every weekend I am spending 30-35 bucks and trashing food. I am done with their cafe!! Be careful, don't fall sick!!

This is in the same plaza as BJ's where I go a couple times a month, so it's convenient to shop here, but it doesn't beat Apna Bazar International for variety or prices. It doesn't beat Patel Brothers either, so I just stop in if I need anything to fill in for convenience. Nice clean large store.

My first visit to this place. The store is large, spacious and clean. Pricing is more expensive compare to other Indian grocery stores. Long wait for check out. Customer is horrendous and rude. I purchased serval items during my visit, 2 of which were two jars of grape leaves with price sticker of $2.99. The cashier scanned them and the price came up at $3.99. I told him the price is $2.99 and that there's many more of the shelf with the same price sticker. He insists on telling me that he does not know how the price sticker got in there and that he has to go by what it's scans up on his system. No apologies for their obvious mistake. I won't be recommending this place or coming back.

The food is super dirty. Lot of people working in the kitchen without masks and coughing. Feels very unhygienic. Groceries are ok. Vegetables are stale.

Wouldn't recommend going here.

Tazaa Mart is really the best hidden gem that no one knows about. The grocery store carries everything you need and has a wide variety for vegetables as well as halal meats. 

However, the section we fell in love is their food court. Their indochine food is really good and we also love their biryanis and curries. 

The chicken biyrani is our favorite because not only does it have the mixed rice, but also a whole chicken thigh and drumstick hidden underneath it all! And your also get an egg on top of everything. It's really flavorful and is definitely worth the $10!

The goat/mutton curry is also our favorite! The meat is so tender and fall off the bone. The flavors are amazing. They do not cheap out: the staff will put as much as possible into the container without even having to ask if you can have some more. 

They also have made to order dosas and naans -- these are great pairings to whatever dish you order from here!

I am not Indian; I have yet to learn to cook Indian; I am new to Indian markets; & I therefore may not be a good judge of an Indian grocery. (So remember that as you consider this review.) And I did not eat in the Cafe, so this review does NOT cover it. *Previous reviews of this grocery do cover the cafe.

Why 4 stars & not five? I almost laughed after reading the sign near checkout that stated there are NO RETURNS OF ANY KIND due to Covid. What? Seriously, that makes zero sense, but it is awfully convenient & profitable for the company. Also, the floors weren't the cleanest (ex. dry food items spilled in aisles & no one performing a clean up), & there were too many stock boxes lying around because shelves were being stocked during business hours-- although the boxes were at times lying empty in aisles not currently being stocked.

To this Indian grocery novice, prices appeared VERY GOOD!  A BIG KUDOS goes out to stocker "Reddy," who took at least 10 min to show me what spices I'll need in order to cook most Indian dishes, where to find them, & how to use them. Truly an EXCELLENT representative of this Indian grocery! Thanks to him, I bought much more than I had originally intended, & I'm more likely to return. (I only went in to browse after shopping next door & spotting this market.)

Located in Market Square in Tampa Palms beside Petsmart, this grocery is open daily from 10 AM till 9 PM; however, the Cafe is closed on Mondays. Its hours are 11:30 AM till 9 PM Tuesday thru Sunday. 

In this market,  you'll find fresh fruits & vegetables; halal meat; bakery items made on site; buriyani; appetizers; frozen foods; grocery items; many grains, spices (SO many) & sauces; & just about anything an Indian family might want from a grocery store...including lots & lots of rices & incense:) 

This is a decent-sized grocery that has wide aisles & a high ceiling. It reminded me of a small Costco or Sam's Club. There was a nice selection of fresh produce too well hidden in the back behind tall freezer cases (where you'll find the frozen Naan/Nan). The cold section is to the far right. The Cafe with tables & a large TV is located on the far left (see pic). Each aisle in this store is marked w/ an overhead sign; the food items appear to be decently organized. 

Check out is easy. There are two old registers behind plexiglass; however, the registers appear rather new... & quite nice-- each grocery item rung up by the cashier appears in bold print on the screen so customers can easily see how much they're being charged. (See pic.) Your items will be bagged in small yellow plastic bags. 

Thank you, Taaza Mart management, for a good variety of food items, for the great prices, & for "Reddy"! I shall return...& return to tell "Reddy" how my Chicken Korma & other homemade Indian dishes fared!

My husband and I haven't been to the restaurant, but we have ordered Uber Eats on several occasions. The selections we have ordered: coconut shrimp, pizza, burger, and the shrimp pasta. Everything has been delicious! The pizza is very thin, so it wasn't my favorite, but the flavors were excellent. The pizza would be better suited for people who prefer it to be very thin. I absolutely love their shrimp pasta with the fresh tomatoes and sauce. My husband loves their burger and you can't beat the price for the size of the burger, and the included side. The coconut shrimp and sauce were also cooked to perfection; the sauce was sweet and flavorful as well. The menu is eclectic with an array of modern and European cuisine. We will definitely be stopping in to the restaurant one day to fully enjoy all it has to offer, but are excited to have a nice bistro close to home!

The menu has a variety of food from different places. I got the Bistro66 Salad with pork and mushrooms, it was delicious. I definitely recommend. Everyone at our table enjoyed their food. The staff was friendly.

Absolutely blown away by the food quality. I had the chicken bellagio. I tried this place on a whim and will certainly come back. The night I showed up had a German folk music live performer and the overall atmosphere was extremely friendly and welcoming. I'll make coming here a regular habit

I never review places and I consider myself to be quite critical when it comes to food. My two brothers and I came here for dinner and the quality was amazing. Very authentic food. The flavor was diverse and succulent in every way. My new favorite place that I will be coming back to.
We had two versions of the bistro burger-- one as a burger and one as a platter. The rice accompanying it was great. The red sauce -- ajvar-- is spicy good!

Nice menu. Eastern European specialties with traditional American favorites Hamburger and Pizza. We had two dinners of the Eastern European specialties, unfortunately I can't write them because the names were foreign. Both were fresh and flavorful and came with a salad or vegetables. The salad was a generous size with a nice medley of greens. The vegetables were the best roasted vegetables I've ever had.

We will be back! Give them a try for a nice variety of absolutely fresh and tasty food that is far from the same old boring chain offerings.

Speed and food were great.   This is a brand new McDonalds has only been open about 30 days.   Both times I have been in this McDonald's it's filthy floors are dirty and the burger line is gross. 
Tables are dirty and very small space.  The Manager Layla both times I've been in there is horrible to the employees who work around her she treats all of the employees horrible in front of customers and does nothing herself when it's busy... everyone else has to do it even if they are busy too.     Really good first impression on a brand new location.   First impressions are everything, I'd rather drive out of my way for better service.
This is the 2nd time I have placed a curbside order.  This is the 2nd time I have waited over 15minutes for my order.  SMH

Waited in the drive-thru for well over 20 minutes.  Once I finally got up to the first window, my order had vanished.  They had no clue what I had, so I had to re-order.  Finally got my food, there was 4 nuggets in my 10 piece box.  FOUR.  I didn't even waste my time going inside to attempt to get it fixed.  Frustrating and ridiculous.  Never again.
This is the slowest McDonald's on the planet. It takes at least 20 minutes to get through the drive thru.

Literally at the speaker waiting to order breakfast, waiting on the cashier to take my order, they switch the menu boards from breakfast to lunch and will not allow me to order breakfast. This is a display of the 100% lack of customer service... Terrible! You obviously have no concern with customer satisfaction whatsoever. Possible solution, switch over the menu boards from breakfast to lunch but continue to take breakfast orders until your customers start ordering lunch.

Speed of service was a joke during my recent visit. Went inside as drive through was backed up in both lanes.  When inside it was obvious there is poor management at this location. Employees standing around watching and doing nothing. Someone needs to set expeditions and be a manager.

Spent $50 for pizza and I got the most pathetic pizzas I've ever seen. Crust was Udis GF crust not even hand made. They said 20 mins and the pizza was cold when I picked it up. They didn't even put all the toppings I asked for and got the order wrong after charging $1.50per toppings. This is not a place that takes pride in the food they are serving but just in it to charge premium prices for less than mediocre pizza. Also got to-go drinks and more than half the cup was filled with ice. I will never go back and if you are looking for gluten free pizza or a place that values customers and the food they serve do NOT go here. This is by far the worst pizza I've gotten in the area. Very disappointed and appalled that someone would even serve such dry and tasteless "pizza."

I have been to many places, here in the US and abroad, and this is hands down the best pizza I have ever had. @calusapizza . The sauce doesn't come from a can, they make it in house from scratch. They have craft beer (I loved the one with mango). They have many other options like pasta and raviolis that I'm definitely trying next time. Lucky you if you live in Tampa Bay area. They opened this place a couple of weeks ago and they are already killing it. Congrats!!

Hubby and I had a great experience Wednesday 6/2/2021. We were excited to try this place & my husband loves pizza and I  to support our local small businesses and we are glad we did. Started with the steak flatbread and the flavor was great. The crust was perfectly crisp and thin to my liking, yes!! On this pizza they topped it with a drizzle of avocado sauce and I really like it, nice touch.  My hubby got a custom pizza Pepperoni, mushroom and onion, again great flavor with a base red sauce. The crust was perfect and they serve on each table crushed red peppers we both loved that. The owners husband & wife were wonderful. We welcome them, wish them success and they were happy to meet & greet their new customers. You can eat in at a table or the bar area to experience their craft beers and other alcohol selections or take outs or delivery. Nicely decorated and be sure to read on the wall behind the bar how they came up with their name "Calusa" Pizza & Craft, it's interesting. We will be back because it was great and the owners mingled and they have an extensive menu!! I hope to try something new maybe each time like the Tortellini but that "Steak Flatbread" was awesome!

Great experience and owners were super nice and seemed to be really passionate about ensuring you have a great experience. Food was great had pizza and bruschetta. Only recommendation I would make is to use fresh mushrooms on your pizza. Canned mushrooms definitely are not as good on a gourmet pizza but other than that great.
Food is really great. Staff also super friendly. Pizza was fantastic. Pasta was insanely good.

This place is amazing. My girlfriend and I went today and would highly recommend. The staff is friendly, the food is great, and the restaurant is very pretty. The owner even came out and said hi to us. Definitely will be back.

Tomato soup is the best btw

By far some of the best pizza around definitely recommend them  
Also good selection of beer & wine 
& doesn't break the bank 
Will be back !

We flew into Tampa late and was looking for a local place to eat at and ran across this gem! We ate the pizza and it was amazing....and don't turn down the garlic rolls! The owner is incredibly nice. It was such an enjoyable evening after a long day of traveling the first night that we decided to skip the normal touristy places at Clearwater Beach and go back and try the pasta and dessert the second night. Boy was that a good decision. What a great experience, what great food, and what a wonderfully nice owner. Thanks for sharing some time talking with us and for the amazing food.

This place is a very nice addition to the Van Dyke area. The service and food was great. We had the Buffalo Chicken pizza which was great. They also have a decent craft beer selection. We will definitely be back.

So like with lots of restaurants not every menu item is a winner.  We did a sample tonight of flat bread, salad and dessert.  The Steak Flatbread ended up being just that Flat,  gray meat, thick crust for flat bread, it was just okay.  The Chicken Cesar was great, dressing was fresh with a mustard under tone.  The Almond Cake Dessert and Tiramisu were the bomb did not disappoint.  Will go back and try something else next time
Delicious pizza! Finally a great tasting pizza in Lutz! Got the Chief and it did not disappoint! Let's keep this place in business!

We had a wonderful lunch at this new spot! We ordered the tomato and basil soup, the artichoke dip, buffalo chicken pizza, chef's salad, bacon calzone, sangria and almond cake. They do everything home made! Highly recommended!

Food is just as amazing as pictures look. Lobster ravioli and pizza (can customize or split half/half what you want) was delicious. Light and flavorful food with great quality. Friendly staff and met Mr. Torres- interested in customer feedback and connecting with customers to make a welcoming restaurant. Without a doubt will be back and highly recommend!!

Just flew into Tampa and was looking for a quick spot to eat. Service was fast and very helpful. Pizza was a bit above average, mozzarella sticks and garlic knots were delicious. Would come again for lunch if in the area.

Enjoyed our evening out at Calusa pizza! The pizza was incredible! We also had the chicken parmigiana.  Their pizza dough and sauce are delicious!!! The service was top notch! Sierra was very friendly and took great care of us! Owner stopped by our table for a friendly chat.  Highly recommend! Will definitely be going back very soon!!

Tried this spot after I saw it's now open. Very impressed. This is a thicker, doughy style pizza. Fills you up and is satisfying. Not greasy or over oiled, nice and clean and packed with flavor. Tasted very fresh. Hope this place sticks around!
Just stopped in and the pizza was really good.  Nice and clean and everyone is extremely friendly.  I would highly recommend this place.  They have a large TV for sports and a bunch of beer on tap.

Scale 1-10
Atmosphere 8
Service 8
Cleanliness 9
FOOD- horrible 3

The Chicken Alfredo was blah. The salad was blah. The pizza is the worst pizza I've ever had. There was close to zero sauce and cheese! The sauce was tasteless, the toppings were scarce. Those that have reviewed it previously have probably never made in out of Lutz. Rename this place CalBlah! 

Totinos have more flavor!!!

A great little pizzeria in Lutz!  Enjoyed a late lunch here. Although I did go with the lunch special, I think ordering a fresh pizza would've been best based on reviews from others.  I enjoyed a classic 2 cheese combo and also tried the eggplant parm.  The interior is decorated nicely and they do have outdoor seating.  Service is great and they have QR coded receipts (using Toast) for a much faster payment process!

Cute little pizza place located in the HomeGoods plaza on the corner of Dale Mabry and Van Dyke. They have seating inside and outside available. Greeted by a smiling face when we walked in and able to choose our seat. We chose to sit inside at a booth. Immediately approached and given menus. She took our drink orders and had them out quickly. Placed our order for a Greek salad and a small Calusa Chef pizza. Salad came out first and was actually disappointing. For the price and description of being a Greek salad this was far from what I expected. But I'm comparing to Mellow Mushroom Greek salad. This was merely some lettuce, onions, black olives and big chunks of feta. Hubs and I shared. Pizza was large enough for the both of us with taking about 4 slices home! Pizza made up for the salad!! Very good. Love the crust also. We will definitely be back just no salad next time.
Pizza was meh at best. No flavor. Not a lot to rave about. Gyro was cool though. Not the greatest for that price.
Pizza wasn't very good.  Stingy with toppings and the sauce was no where to be seen

Tried Calusa for first time today and was pleasantly surprised.   Very nice menu, food and service were great.  In addition, they did a real nice job with the interior.   We had the froed mozz and caprese apps, both were excellent.  2 in our party had the make your own pasta, own pesto one bolegnese.   They were both very good.   One of us had the stromboli and I had the buffalo chicken pizza.  Dough is done nice and flavorfull.   The owner was very kind to introduce himself.  Overall, excellent experience!

We have been to Calusa many times since they opened and we enjoy it more every time.  First visits were for the pizza (awesome) but now we try something new every time and they never disappoint.  Spaghetti with bolognese and meatballs is my new favorite.  One night we had the calamari and mussels that were so good and  "bread-dipping" awesomeness!  But if you want to really have a night - don't leave without having the Italian Almond Cake!  I can't / won't describe it because I need to secure my monthly quota.  I'll just say it is really good - and they have local craft beers + excellent service.  Check them out!

This is a nice addition to the food places in Lutz. The owners are very friendly and come around to the table to make sure everything is ok. I've had a few different meals and everything has been fantastic. I really like the pizzas here and they have pickup available. They will be eventually going to a third party delivery service which makes it so much easier. I highly recommend this place.

Really like the crust.  The West Coast is delicious.
Gotta have the almond cake which I've never had anywhere else.
Calamari was good. 
Very consistent across a number of dishes and welcoming owner.  I can see why he was successful  for two decades in VA.  Their loss is Tampa's gain.

The veggie could use a couple more ingredients but we are pain in the neck gourmet food types.

Good selection of beers on tap for a restaurant that serves good food - a fine balance.
I even filled my growler here.

Will be returning...

Pizza is in the name but they are so much more! I walked in and was greeted with a smile. Looking around I noticed they have Angry Chair, Coppertail, 3 daughters, and Cigar City on tap awesome that they have a hand full of local breweries. 
I started my visit with a espresso and Tomato Basil soup, Soup was right off the stove and not out of a microwave.
After I moved on to The arugula pizza which was even better then I imagined. The crust was light and crisp, not even soggy in the center and the cheese was lightly browned to perfection. There was no room for dessert but I suggest dipping you pizza crust in the tomato basil soup.
It was ok.   Have had better have had worse. Place looks nice throw. Would try again maybe just ordered wrong.

This is the best Mexican restaurant in the Edwardsville area.  Service is outstanding! The food is fresh, hot, and not the typical warming table fare. It's worth a bit of a wait for fresh food. 

Love the salsa although another reviewer said it's too spicy. It has flavor and that's refreshing instead of a tomato juice concoction found elsewhere. 

Not ashamed to say we come here, at a minimum, once a week. There are so many dishes I order and haven't run out of great options. My husband prefers the La Parilla for a plethora of meat.

I enjoyed the pork carnitas street tacos today. It was a very nice preparation and the sauce that came on the side had a nice warmth to it. I would recommend them. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Free chips and homemade salsa upon arrival. I will return to try a dinner entree. The interior has gone through a nice remodeling from its previous restaurant uses.

We went for lunch on Cinco de Mayo.  The dining room was bustling so we opted to sit on the patio.  The staff was very attentive and the food came quickly.  Wife had the lunch fajitas and love it.  The meat was tender and flavorful and the vegetables added to the flavors.  I had a beef chimichanga that was excellent.  Even though we ordered from the lunch menu, it was a ton of food.  Good food and a pleasant experience.
Took a large group here and the staff and food was fantastic. Delicious Mexican and fast!

Conflicted about my review.  I really wanted to like the food better.   Their chips and salsa are really delicious.  But it ends there.  The burrito grande seafood, was not really a burrito. It was HUGE, but not really wrapped like a burrito and everything just fell out.  The enchiladas supreme were, meh.  The chicken has no flavor, the beef didn't really either.  And it was all smothered in sauce.  I like sauce, but not to where I can't even see the food underneath it.  Consider less smother.

They did a really nice job on the interior.  It is spacious and the staff is really great.

My new favorite Mexican restaurant in town. The staff is SO friendly! Food is fresh, hot, and delicious. We were a big fan of the salsa. Large menu. Modelo on draft. We had a large party and they were so accommodating. Tasty margaritas! Spacious place. We'll be back!

So we decided to try this newer place and arrived about 4:30pm. We were literally THE only ones in the place! Once seated we were greeted by our server and immediately asked if we were ready to order!? Really? We just sat down! When we said to please give us a few minutes he then asked what we'd like to drink. Chips and salsa were brought as well as our drinks. He asked again if we were ready but we asked for a couple more minutes. A couple minutes then turned into almost 15!

This is when things went downhill!

We actually had to call out HELLO!!

He finally came back and took our order and we waited again! 15 more minutes plus! Now there still wasn't another patron in the place. When our food came it was ok but nothing special. My taco carnitas were like deep fried or something because they were crunchy! My wife's burrito was cold in the middle. The food had a good flavor but that's where it ends. 

There's a lot better places to go with much better service!!

Mexican food is a crowded, perhaps over-saturated, segment in Edwardsville, with new ones coming and older ones going. We gave this place a try. In all honesty, the food is average and not sure they stand out from the crowded field.
Chips were very thick and salsa was probably a bit too spicy for the average person. The server (one of the brothers) was very friendly. The inside has undergone a drastic renovation from previous restaurant iterations and looks very charming. My 12 oz steak seemed a bit small for 12 oz and was dry. Rice really needed something ( a dose of salsa helped) and the salad also Needed more flavor - remedied with a dollop of sour cream scooped from my wife's salad.
Final verdict: nice ambiance, average Tex-Mex fare.
Great, friendly service! The tacos al pastor were delicious, as was the margarita. We'll be back.

Excellent! This is still part of their soft opening but the place was hopping!! Plenty of space both inside and out. A young staff but working hard to keep food and drink flowing! Our server, Avery, was excellent!! She helped guide our selections as we requested and checked back several times. The prosciutto pizza was delicious as were the tuna tacos (which came with the best fries!!). This is definitely part of our restaurant rotation now!!

We have given this restaurant a try more than we should have. I worked in the restaurant business for over 10 years in almost every capacity so I know the business well and have been overly sympathetic to the industry over the past 18+ months, always patronizing local and tipping overly well. While I understand lack of staffing it does not excuse incompetence and basic training. We've had a range of experiences here from untrained servers, the funniest was one who didn't know what unsweetened iced tea was. BUT it's 5 mins from my in-laws home and we were celebrating 3 birthdays at their home last night so I placed a large order online ($170+) at 10:45am for 5:15pm pickup thinking that would be enough time for them to get it together. Picked up, brought it home and we were missing an item. Deep breath. Called, not an immediate apology but an excuse as to what went wrong. Drove back, waited and then was brought it out with a flippant 'sorry about that', like I didn't have people at the house and this wasn't an inconvenience. At minimum the item should have immediately been refunded, but the least I expected was someone to take accountability. We're done looking beyond the constant shortfalls.

Went there for the first time yesterday, we ordered the chicken Cutlet sandwich with Broccoli raab and roasted peppers. I don't know how they did it but it had absolutely NO taste. The beer was good as was the service. I may give it one more shot to try the pizza.

This is a great spot to grab a quick and delicious bite to eat (and maybe some drinks too).  The menu has a wide selection, with much of the menu being bar menu style items (pizza, wings, fries, etc.). However, this food blows typical bar food out of the water! It is elevated and the flavor combinations are awesome.

We got the spicy pepperoni pizza, which had a kick but was also sweet because it had honey drizzled on it. We also got the watermelon habanero wings, and same thing: had a kick to them but were also sweet, tangy flavor. I would recommend both.

The drink menu also had a nice selection. My fiancé got the strawberry Bangin' Lemonade. It was pretty sweet to the point where you couldn't really taste the liquor, but it was delicious nevertheless! 

The service was great and our food came out super fast too! There is also a bar area that you can sit/hang out at. It did get pretty loud in there while we were eating, but we didn't mind at all.

We didn't eat here just stopped in for beers.  Service was very good, beer selection was all over the place, almost whoever's buying the beer is just going with what the Beer Reps are pushing.   We'd like to actually try their food, their menu looks good.

I like this place. It's not crazy pricing, indoor and outdoor seating is available. And the pizzas are right sized. They have a nice variety of creative toppings, and they are woodfired.

The pizza dough here is a little unusual - it seems not super thin, but thin and somewhat chewy. Well I am usually a fan of thin crispy crust this had a good flavor it was definitely worth a repeat visit.

Was really excited that there's a new pizza place in the area. We ordered takeout last night. It only took about 15 mins and our order was ready. However, once we got home to enjoy our pizza, it was very soggy. Pizza shouldn't get soggy in that short of time. We got a cheese pizza with broccoli. Definitely needed more broccoli. It was really mediocre in flavor. Extremely disappointed and can't say I'd be back to order their pizza.

3.75 stars.
Made the impromptu decision to get over there in time for happy hour this past week. Made a reservation thru open table for 5:45 and arrived just a bit earlier and was greeted and seated right away. The spot itself is in an interesting location, as there are townhomes just behind and many open retails spaces nearby, so just when you feel you are in the wrong spot, you see all the people and the restaurant itself.
Quite spacious with an outside seating area out front and some space out back too. Not sure they are seating parties out back. Will investigate on my next visit.
Our server was sweet but couldn't quite answer our questions regarding the "boardroom spirits" off of the HH menu, so she talked to the GM and came back to let us know it was simple drinks using Rum, Gin or Vodka. I would have loved an inexpensive whisky on the menu, but settled on a rum and coke and my wife had a rum and ginger beer. It was nice she could get the ginger beer too and not a ginger ale. 
Since there were things to order for food off the happy hour menu too, I put in an order for onion rings and the angry mussels. 
Onions rings showed up after a few minutes and it was a stacker of 6-7 rings. Thick cut onions and super flaky batter which would fall off at the slightest touch, but delish. They were served with a marinara and a spicy pesto sauce that was fantastic. Soon after, the mussels arrived and a good sized portion and 3pcs of bread to soak up the broth. Fresh mussels and great flavor. We were not full, so I was ready to order up a pizza, but the place filled up fast and our server was simply overwhelmed. It was 15 minutes before we had her back to our table and we didn't have the time to wait much longer and that food settled in our bellies, so we didn't leave hungry one bit.
Looking forward to the next visit to get one or two pizzas and get a beer, as the tap list looked solid. This place can get busy, so show up early or make  your reservations.

My first visit to Revival  Pizza Pub was extremely disappointing.  The pizza was overpriced at $16 for a medium sized plain pizza. It was advertised as large 16" but you can bet it was much smaller.  The pizza came within 5-6 minutes of the order which is suspicious for a pre-made mediocre bar pizza.  And sadly it was pasty and flavorless, much along the line of frozen supermarket pizza.  There are much better pizza places from Exton to Elverson. This, for now, is a hard pass.  Maybe they will pick up their game and improve the quality and value to customers.  On a positive note the wait staff was attentive and friendly.

Stopped in for a second trip in a week . Again service was on point and friendly.
But have too say they changed the Caesar salad I raved about last week from what I would say was a loaded Caesar to a regular Caesar. The egg, charred broccoli , bacon, and Avocado were now gone. It was still a good Caesar and a small  with a sled of calamari  made a great meal. Truly hope the loaded Caesar returns to the menu( server told us a lot of people were asking about it). My daughter was in for her first trip and had the small salad topped with grilled shrimp and was very impressed as she said shrimp were perfect. Wife got salad with a side of meatballs and had one and took other 2 home and was ecstatic as she said meatballs were closest she had had in a restraint to her Italian born aunts homemade . A side note that should be mentioned..,for anyone with tree nut/ peanut allergies.. was well documented by server and manger came out to assure us nothing on menu to worry about but dessert and that that is kept in totally different prep and storage area . So no chance of cross contamination and that she personally had staff change gloves and wash hands as extra precaution ... needless to say from someone who has been to the ER a couple of times with my child due to nut cross contamination that made the meal a lot more enjoyable and comfortable as in our family it is truly a life and death issue . These days it is a most welcome relief. Looking forward to many more great meals and happy times at this new much needed community establishment.

I called in a pizza takeout order, and had to listen to a very long spiel of their hours and how to order online, and their catering, etc etc etc.  A full 2 minutes later, they finally told me to "press 1" to place an order.  Seems like they don't want call-in orders.  I ordered 2 of their specialty pizzas, Margherita and South Philly. Both were very tasty, and not too salty.  But, the pizza size is SMALL.  I ordered "large", but I think their pizzas are one-size, and they are definitely NOT large.  I would call this a medium pizza, and they were not enough for the amount of people I was feeding.  The restaurant looks nice and clean and I will probably go for a pub meal at some point, but I'm not sure about ordering takeout pizza again.

We stopped in for dinner on Saturday night and loved our experience. The restaurant has high-ceilings and the tables are spaced out so it never feels too crowded. We ordered the Hemingway and Italian Melon Spritz - both were delicious and creative drinks. The homemade ricotta appetizer was AMAZING! Served with delicious homemade bread. The fries were perfectly crunchy and had Old Bay seasoning. One member of our party had a nut allergy and the kitchen was very accommodating. Our pizza was plentiful and very yummy. We will definitely be back!

I really want to like this place as it is close by and the atmosphere is nice, but I've had multiple bad experiences here. I have been overcharged twice, once for a Build Your Own pizza which is listed as $15 base (no toppings) on the website but was charged $16 base (before the additional toppings), and a second time when we were charged an additional $5 for the side that we were told came with a kid's meal. Other than being overcharged, the pizza has been extremely soggy in the middle, making it very difficult to eat, and the new crinkle cut fries are nowhere near as good as the hand cut fries they used to serve. Finally, on our last visit there last week for a birthday celebration, one of us in the group got mussels which came out around 20 minutes after everything else, and that was after asking about them multiple times. They did comp the mussels, which was very nice of them, but I can't remember being at a restaurant in the past where the timing was so off. I will be going back soon to try the new garlic knots. I hope that the price is accurate and that they do not disappoint.

Great vibe but food was unfortunately lacking flavor across the bar. Spicy Impossible cheesesteak was dry and bland (not at all spicy) fries were very delicious tho. Lemonades were just sugary water with no real flavor

Four of us stopped in for a beer, not interested in food today....a bit of a strange beer list, two of us went for the Flower Power, no carbonation as if it was old. Two fruited gose's struck me as two too many. Two pilsners and a light lager probably would make the main stream customers happy so I get that. Workhorse Golden Lager was a bright spot. 
I will give it a pass because it's so new, hoping the beer buyer will learn what customers want is not always what the beer sellers want to sell. 
Food menu was interesting enough to bring me back in a few weeks to try more.

Stopped in to try it out during soft opening this week. Was very busy but outside was nice and comfortable .  Staff friendly and attentive. Several items on menu wanted to try. Wife and I got Small Caesar salads( add the chicken or shrimp and it is large enough for a lite meal. Was a really good Cesar with some nice touches like charred broccoli ,avocado, real bacon and house made croutons.(definitely order next trip again).  Next up was the meatball sub.my wife is a meatball aficionado and gave these a top rating . While I'm not normally a meatball sub guy was impressed and would order again. Next up was the watermelon habanero chicken wings which were large enough for two to share had a sweet slight hit of heat .. the blue cheese dressing was excellent (hint order two). I would say y try he wings needed more time in the fryer as did the fries with the sandwich. Hopefully that gets rectified as this was the soft opening. The only drawback which should be easily rectified .
Can't wait to return and try other menu items.

Finally a good pizza for our area. It can almost pass for a pizza from pizzeria Vetri. Great flavors, thin nice crust, and it doesn't hurt portions are great and it's priced well. Now, can this quality be sustained??

When I went to order, they immediately said they were out of almost everything I asked for, then waited for ~40 minutes for a hotdog when I finally asked what was going on they said they were just now starting them. Very basic food and very poorly ran, overall my worst food experience in my life. I dont know how this business is around, but I do not recommend going as it will probably waste your time as it did mine.
Great spot. Had the Chopped Cheese opening day and am definitely looking forward to returning soon.

OMG this place is horrific, this is the 2nd time we have had nothing but issues. Today we even called to see if you were open and had CUBAN bread because the last time we ordered, you didn't. Now after calling and speak with a man, we placed our order and HE CLOSED the store!! Seriously, why in the world would you CLOSE the store knowing you had an order to fill!! We even placed a call to the owner who just didn't care.....he stated," I'll be open tomorrow" Sir you just lost our business!

This has got to be one of the coolest sandwich spots I've ever been to!! We went to the Grand Opening last Sunday the 16th, and the place was packed! They had a DJ outside, a bike show and lots of Ruff Ryders showed up (R.I.P DMX). There was a long wait for the sandwiches but the vibe was so cool, the owners were mingling with the customers and the music was sooo good, you didn't even notice. They played old-school hip-hop the entire time and we had soo much fun just hanging out. The sandwiches were delicious and definitely worth the wait! I'm actually looking forward to visiting Spring Hill again just to visit the shop
Pretty standard Taco Bell. Been through the drive-thru twice and no mistakes on the order. 3 Stars because its Taco Bell and tastes like Taco Bell.

Ordered thru mobile app for drive thru. Ordered 2 new grilled cheese steak burritos. #1 Spicy with guacamole. Contained no steak & no guacamole, was charged for guacamole.
#2 Regular (Not spicy) but added tomatoes. Contained no tomatoes. Disappointed
The girl who took my order was nice and polite. Everything we ordered was correct. When we received our food everything was made fresh and perfectly yum.

Ordered 5 soft chicken tacos using on line app. Confirmed at drive thru 5 chicken soft tacos. Arrived home with 5 soft ground beef tacos. Very disappointing after confirmations. Not the first time I've had issues with the app.

Planned ahead, placed an order online well ahead of time I'd be picking up....still waited 15 min as it appears they didn't START the order until I arrived. Online order placed at 4:58 pm, I arrived at location at 5:08. Wasn't surprised it wasn't done but was surprised to watch them make the whole order starting 10 minutes after I arrived. Sooo, I'm not sure why we bothered placing the 5 item order (nothing huge) ahead of time. Wasn't given any indication of when order would be done or that I'd be waiting a while. Left with food around 5:25. Food was OK, did some customization to power bowls and was disappointed to get heavy rice and hardly any beans, when light rice was ordered. The place did appear clean and all workers in the kitchen did appear busy. Just not sure about the prioritization of orders....maybe a service like door dash gets priority as the cashier asked me if I was picking up for them and replied "no, just a regular online order."

We have stopped at this location a few times since my first review and I have to update my review to 4 stars. The food is still the average Taco Bell food, but the service at this location is outstanding. They have never messed up an order, they are always extremely friendly, and when we have gone inside to order/eat it is noticeably very clean.

Fantastic food directly from Mexico City. Don't expect globby, cheesy, beany plates. This is high quality. We got a sampling of tacos--the meat was so tender and delicious, and the fixings were simple and perfect. Love the decor! Clever and comfortable. See if you can spot the tiny UFO in the Teotihucan mural.

"Wow!"
If Yelp would let me get away with it I think that one word would sum up my feelings after trying Sabroso today for lunch.

I stumbled upon Sabroso a few days ago when picking up a late night pizza and immediately wanted to try it. One of my favorite hobbies is trying out new restaurants. Since they are closed on Mondays I had to wait until lunch today. I was absolutely floored with the experience.

Upon entering you are greeted with a cafeteria like setup. The staff here were fantastic and seemed genuinely excited when I told them it was my first time here. They had me try many of the entrees on the menu and everything I had was delicious. I settled on the Plato Especial, which is two entrees and two side items. For my sides I did beans and rice. For my entrees I chose Birria and Cochinita Pibil. The Birria they have here is beef instead of goat which is what I was expecting however it was still fantastic. The Cochinita Pibil was also wonderful, perfectly seasoned. The rice and beans were also fantastic. I had flour tortillas with my meal and ate about half of the meat by itself and the other half folded into tacos.

The man behind the counter also gave me a small side of chips and salsa to sample. I enjoyed the taste of the salsa; however, I prefer spicier salsa.
I ordered Jamaica (hibiscus tea), for my drink and was very happy with it. The flavor was much stronger than I am used to however I really enjoyed it.

The entire establishment looked very clean and multiple employees stopped by my table to make sure everything was good. These employees really try their best to make you feel welcome and I appreciate that.

My only complaint would be that everything I had was very mild. The flavor was there however I wish there was a bit of a burn on my tongue. I am not going to deduct for that though as the flavor was fantastic and next time I come I will just bring some hot sauce with me or ask if they have any.

Tried to go to this place a few weeks ago. Off the beaten path in the back of 1/2 closed strip mall. That being said... it was great. Fast and friendly service.  No brewed iced tea but they did have Mexican Coke. I ordered each taco in a 5 taco combo and they were all awesome. Asada was a little touch but everything else was mouth melting. My lunch ate got carnitas burrito and cleaned the plate. Good crisp chips and salsa and salsa verde.  Lunch was 30 bucks with tip for the two of us. It would have been cheaper but for the 5 Ala carte tacos. The ambience is not that much but it was clean and well lit. I will be back!
Best tacos in St Louis!  Really great street tacos.  We had chicken, beef, rice, horchata and jarito.  Fantastico!

Convenient because they're open til 5am and it was connected to my hotel. The first time I went the wait was over an hour so I left. Tried another night at 4am, only waited about 20 minutes. The pizza was okay. Waayyy too much cheese.

My husband and I stayed at the Capitol Hotel in Nashville, and Till Five Pizza was connected to the property. For being just a tiny "hole in the wall" type place, the food was really good! I ordered the cheese ravioli with white sauce. I've got to say, it was really good! The white sauce was super creamy, cheesey, and flavorful. The ravioli was stuffed really well with cheese and herbs.
My husband ordered the seafood fettuccine alfredo. It had a ton of crab, shrimp, peppers, and tomatoes. The sauce was really good. He very much enjoyed it.
Both meals came with handmade bread sticks. They were a bit dense for me but, he loved the handmade, yeasty flavor.
Overall, I'd say it was a win!
Horrible service missing food in orders blamed driver DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS PLACE SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! Hung up on me then put me on hold for 20 mins.. still has not resolved or refunded my money

We ordered food around 8:00 pm with a delivery time of 9:01-9:20 through Door Dash. It's now 10:30 & we still have no food. After contacting the business twice, we were told our order was transferred to a 2nd location 45 mins away & they can't cancel the order even though they know it wasn't delivered.

I don't ever do this but trust me when I say do not order from this place. Three hours later and multiple phone calls we finally got some food. Not all of what we ordered was with the driver. He was completely incompetent and we had to walk down from our condo to meet him finally... only to be given pizza out of his car window that was cold and the rest of our order he had no clue what we were talking about.
The pizza never even came. Person on phone laughed when I explained and hung up on me.

During our first stay in Nashville, stopped at this pizza joint to grab a pizza to go which was alright (I've had better) but customer service is shitty.  This Muslim lady was rude and the guy ignored us as if we didn't exist.  Never again....
First off, I am not one to leave a review. But, this was the worst service imaginable. They never picked up the phone! I believe this place is a scam based off of its reviews and service. Stay away.

***Came on a Monday night*** It's in a great location next to Broadway St, I love that it was open until five because on a Monday night your choices for late night food was slim pickings. Plus, who doesn't love late night pizza?! Though I will say, if you are super drunk and won't notice the quality of pizza then this is the place for you... It was overpriced along with the wait we had; it was not worth it at all. We were told 15-20 minutes, but it took more like 30-45 and several more people after me were told the same thing both in person and over the phone. Service was standoffish but I understand they were super busy and working hard to accommodate the number of orders they had. The dough looked frozen/hard/stiff, as if it was just taken out of the cooler plopped with some sauce and ingredients then thrown on the rotator belt to cook. It was super greasy with no flavor and didn't have a great smell either because of all the grease. I recommend getting food earlier from somewhere else.

The people who work here are greasy low lives. They should not be in buisness with such terrible service. The only people they get good reviews from are the drunks and idiots who tolerate such low standards. I would not trust their opinion reviews or taste buds. The young men who work there need a hospitality check. I wouldn't even call them men. More like little boys trying to operate a lemonade stand for the first time. Even then they would find a way to ruin the lemonade buisness. Scrubs.

My girlfriend and I have been waiting for our food for over two hours. Been on hold on the phone for over an hour. Unable to cancel on Uber Eats and unable to get ahold of anyone on the phone. Honestly should've read the reviews first -- this place is an absolute joke. Go anywhere else.

Absolutely the WORST food experience ever.   I don't do many reviews but this place inspired one.  Where to start.  Horribly slooow.  It's called till five because you may not get you food until 5 am.  The staff was all rude and disinterested.   The best part was the crackhead who appeared to be a friend of one of the staff.  He just hung out harassing the customers. 
No staff seemed to care.  Overall a ridiculous experience that no one should go through.  Go anywhere else.  Carry a granola bar in your pocket. 
Anything but TIll Five Pizza.

LIARS AND THIEVES.!! DO NOT EAT THERE.!!!

On 2/10/2021 I placed an order10.27am. I asked if it could be brought out to me as I was unable to go in due to my job. I was told yes,  we can do that. I ordered and put it on a credit card. I Told them the exact time I would be there. (An hour later at 11:20) I was there on time. I pulled up out front and honked the horn several times. They kept looking out the window like I was a crazy person. I tried to get their attention all while being ignored. I had to go back to work. Tried calling to cancel order and no one would pick up my calls.  A few days later, the processing on my bank account went thru with a $2 tip attached and I never got my food, my money back, and still no one answers when I call.    
LIARS AND THIEVES.!! DO NOT EAT THERE.!!!
They don't give a shit. I mean that fair I wouldn't either but don't come here expecting service or quality. Shit sucks ass

Stopped in around 2 AM, got a club sandwich, was warm and got it within 5 minutes. I've read other reviews, I have no idea what they were referencing. Our group was satisfied and I'm glad I was able to get a quick bite as this is only place in downtown Nashville to get food this late. I'm gonna reference a past review, some jerk left, the Muslim lady was very nice and polite to me, thank you very much!
Never got food I ordered - worthless customer service - called multiple times to let them redeem themselves and never got a solid answer.
Really delicious pies. I dont know what these negative reviews are coming from. Definitely try the meat lovers
Other than being like 40 minutes late for the delivery it was worst burger and chicken I've ever tried To eat (both were thrown away after first bite) very disappointed

Absolutely unfair treatment.  Placed order online, prior to paying,  or advertised 20 minute pick up.  Once I paid,  it changed it to 70 minute pick up.  Tried calling to cancel order,  sat on the phone for over a half hour.  Message kept telling me that I was next in line. Yet,  nobody answered the phone for 32 minutes before I hung up.  Absurdly unfair process. Don't trust them. Don't order here.

We went into this establishment and didn't receive our food for a full hour. The seven people who came in after us got their food 30 min before us even though they came in after. The food was not even that fantastic. She asked if we would mind a hand crust pizza after we ordered thin crust because they messed up our order AFTER THEY LOST IT. We'll never be back here, 1.5 hours for a pizza and sandwich is ridiculous when there was no one in front of us!!

One star is more than I wanted to give. Called late (around midnight) to place an order, they told my husband it would be over an hour for delivery. We called back immediately to cancel. I was on hold for only about 2 minute, when answered they said it was too late to cancel. When I ask why they couldn't cancel when it was going to be over an hour to deliver the guy literally said "I can't tell you that".
