He then told me he would call his manager and ask if he could cancel and called me back. He never called me back, I never received my order and they still charged my credit card. I have disputed the charges but it has been a huge unnecessary inconvenience. I wish I would have read the reviews prior to ordering.

1.5 hours to deliver. ordered at 6p got it 725p. philly sub and fried shrooms
sub was very dry, meat over cooked. 
fried mushrooms wilted. 
wont order again but hey they dont deliver to Texas so I wont have to worry about it. 
guy that answered the phone was great very personable

Definitely should've read the reviews before coming here... service was incredible slow at 1:30 am on a Friday morning. Fine, we had time, wasn't a big deal. However the pizza was not good. The sauce tasted like something I've never tasted before and it wasn't good. The only redeeming quality was the Buffalo wings which were decent... would not go back.

They said 45 minutes and I waited 40 minutes outside the place I said to meet for them to have never delivered my order. I just wanted to eat after work and waited till 2 am for them to mess it up completely. Trash

This place should be shut down. First off - terrible customer service. Also, they like to make pizzas with no gloves on. Picture taken after the person touched the cash register and the phone. Lastly, you will wait over an hour for terrible food. Don't recommend. Waste of money, time and energy.

This was the worst experience, we waited an hour and a half for a pizza just for it to get canceled 2 minutes before delivery time. When we called the place they were extremely unhelpful and rude. DONT ORDER FROM HERE !!

Do not order from here. It's been over two hours and we haven't received our order. Customer service is a NIGHTMARE and keeps telling us to call different numbers; no straight answer from anyone and we were even told that there was no record of our order despite us having multiple confirmations. They are trying to give us the run around and make it so we pay for nothing-- this place is a terrible establishment and should not be support by anyone.

I tried the food here and it was great it tastes delicious and was hot when I got it delivery was an hour but they told me that in the phone I didn't care because they were the only place open but I made the right choice it was great .

Probably the worst experience I've had with customer service. Not only was I charged for my purchase, it took 5 calls (3 of which they hung up) to respond. Whoever did pick up sounded uninterested in assisting me.
The calzone tasted like cardboard and made me feel sick - don't waste your time and money... eat somewhere else

Never received food I ordered. Scammed. Waited over 3 hours until I considered it a loss. Also, more than an hour wasted trying to get in touch. Don't lose your money. If I could give below 1 star, I would. Hopefully someone sees this review before they place their order.

Till Five Pizza provided my brothers and I with food at a much needed time. It was the only place we could find to get food on a Sunday in downtown Nashville without reservations. I love their business model: be open all the time. The food was not anything special. We got chicken tender baskets and mozzarella sticks. The chicken, fries, and mozzarella sticks were all probably made from frozen. However, we were so hungry and desperate for any form of sustenance that it didn't matter.

I will say this, the place looks cute and is not a disaster like the previous place.  I've been in twice and been disappointed both times.  My last visit, I ordered ahead for cupcakes for my daughters birthday.  Went in, spoke with the owner and discussed what I wanted and a pick up time.  They didn't have my order ready when they said they would.  I'm pretty sure they took the day old cupcakes from the display and took the old frosting off and then frosted them while I'll waited.  Then charged me $20 for 12 regular sized cupcakes.  Nothing fancy. Will not be back.  Plus all the tables were dirty and no one seemed to really be working.

Meh... I was looking to purchase 1 fantastic over the top cupcake for my daughter-in-law's bday. Went to a couple of places and they were closed (maybe because of Black Friday?) so I got smart and called ahead to this place. The woman who answered said that she was making cupcakes at that moment. I informed her that I would be there shortly, she responds "great! see you soon". I live in Indianapolis but made the 30 minute drive to Brownsburg because I REALLY wanted this cupcake. Upon arrival, I was told that they forgot to cover the cupcakes from the previous day and it would be about an hour before the next batch would be done. If I had known that, I would have waited before driving out there. Super annoyed.

Very disappointed customer.  Used them for our daughter's wedding and didn't receive our deposit back because supposedly not all cake parts were returned from the "fake" cake.  She said it would be Styrofoam but it was cardboard and therefore the venue through that away.  She is not promising her end of the bargain when everything else was return except cardboard that had icing on it.  How can one possibly use that again.  Not a great experience during a very happy event.

Went to eat here for the first time with my wife. The store is a bit smaller than expected and very stuffy, it was 90+ outside though and prices are a tad high. 

With that being said, the food was great, service was ok and very polite. We both ordered the Brownsburg Cheese Steaks, I had potato salad (which was phenomenal, btw) and my wife had the mac & cheese.

This review is for The Kickstand portion which is the food part. Great prices first off for what you receive. We got a chicken and a 1/2 slab of ribs meal. We came when they were close to closing about 20 minutes.  They guy working was super nice. We got our food to go but it did take about 20 minutes to get the food heated and ready. It was delicious and for the price it was worth it. In the future I will know to call ahead of time. 

The food was great, the chicken was a half and it was huge. My husband said the ribs were great. The potato salad was the best and the fruit salad was so good. 

I suggest to stop by here.

I am beyond upset right now. Went last week to order a cake, they made me prepay, no big deal. Go to pick it up and the bakery is closed! The joint grill says she left for the day and closed the bakery. Now I'm here with no cake when i need it and she won't pick up her cell phone. Nobody even called to let me know. Most unprofessional business i have ever dealt with. Don't order anything from here, they may just take your money and leave you with nothing.

This place is awesome, when it's awesome. When it's not, well... When it's not the cupcakes are dry and you are left wishing they'd charged you "end of the day prices" (like Dunkin Dounuts does when they just basically give you 2 dozen for the price of 3 individual) and then you'd feel great about the dried out cupcake you just ate instead of wishing you'd saved yourself the money and the calories.

When they are fresh, I really do like the cupcakes though. And they have a flour-less brownie (or something) that my wife loves.

The Kickstand Cafe has something called a Brownsburg something (Press maybe) that is absolutely amazing. I tried one other thing one time (Brisket maybe) and it was good, it just wasn't spectacular like the Brownsburg Press. This is my absolute favorite thing to eat in the Brownsburg area, and my go-to place when I don't feel like cooking.

Ugh...not sure if their cupcakes are this bad all the time or if they were just having a bad day.

I picked up 6 cupcakes to surprise my girls & each one was dried out & pretty much tasteless. Very disappointed to say the least. Not worth the cost at all!

I've had better from Kroger next door.

I don't get it! Aside from the horrible service. I get my order and looks like a 2 year old made it. Chili cheese fries no cheese & a small spoon of chili. And look at the corn dogs. Can't you pull them out of the fryer. Just garbage!

Great service and great fast food. Nice to have something other than bland boring McDonald's or having to wait an hour for a messed up order at Freddy's. Junkyard burger hit the spot and the onion rings were great. Everything tasted fresh with great friendly service.
Hit up the drive thru today for the Junkyard chili cheeseburger and it was amazing! The fries were hot and crispy! I hope this location can maintain this type of service and quality.

Just okay. I have only been there twice but it isn't overly great or bad either. They send out coupons in the mail often so maybe wait for one if your on the fence about trying. So so hamburger and hotdogs. Ice cream is just okay too

We went last week, must have only been open for a couple of days. Fast service, good food. I mean yes it's fast food, but it's decent! We order chili cheese fries and all beef dogs on pretzel buns and everything was fast and fresh! We will return!
My favorite raspados in Tucson. They don't taste like pure syrup like most of the other raspados. Food is also great, this place won't disappoint.
Super friendly staff. The space is clean and the burgers were delicious! The strawberry raspados were excellent! We will be back!
Fun little hidden gem! Delicious food and all the staff is incredibly nice! A ton of delicious unique options with raspados and the food!

Stopped by for a Raspado and it did not disappoint. We had the raspado con nieve with strawberry, mango and pineapple. It was ice, ice cream and fresh fruit. The ice was soft and it had plenty of fruit, there was enough fruit at the bottom of the cup to enjoy at the end. We also had the Nino which was mango raspado with chamoy, tajin, lemon, reilito, serpentine, saladito and tamarind stick, it was sweet, salty and icy. The staff was very nice and our drinks came out quickly. It was bright and clean. They have dine in, take out and delivery. Masks required.

Ice cold bottle coke on a hot day, yum. The sanoran hot dog was pretty good. The bread had a light toast on the outside but was still fluffy and aerated inside. The bacon warped hot dog had crispy bacon and a lil bit of snap to it still. The toppings, pinto beans, tomato's, and dressings were evenly proportioned nothing over powering. I did like it. The birria tacos, well. Over all it was okay I think this place is well know for it's raspados and more munchie foods. Next time I will have to try some of those.

Now I'm writing this because I stayed the night and the room was nice, unfortunately the smoke alarm  flashes constantly and when the room is dark it flashes right on the bed? So it bothered me all night and once I fell asleep housekeeping knocked at 9am with the door sign on... I had a 1pm check out and she knocked at 9am???? 

The casino is great dealers and floor personal are great... I have to say free parking is a plus not sure if that's always the case but it's a nice gesture. I will have to go again as I did like the poker room a lot as well as the sushi restaurant.

This casino is a short walk away from Citizens Bank Park. I stopped in after a Phillies game to kill a little time before calling an Uber to take me back to my hotel. 

My first stop was the restroom, which was clean and nice. Definitely no issues there. I then walked around a bit. Lots of table games and slot choices. I noticed that most of the slots are the same as in Vegas. 

I went to a circular bar in the center of the casino to have a drink while I waited and watch the end of the Tampa Bay/Dallas NFL game on the TV. There were 4 bartenders working, and yet it still took 40 minutes for one of them to take my drink order. Yes, you read that right ... 40 MINUTES!!!!! Yes, it was busy. The Phillies game had just let out and the first game of the NFL season was on, but it wasn't that bad that I should sit there that long. All 4 bartenders walked by me several times, and even though I held my hand up to get their attention, they just walked by pretending not to see me. I even noticed at times one of them just standing there doing nothing for minutes. When I finally did get my beer, I didn't even want it anymore. 

When I left, I asked a security guard where to pick up an Uber, and he directed me to the Valet parking area. A few other people were waiting for rides as well. At least that area was well organized and went smooth. 

Pretty nice place - just avoid the bar in the center.

I would give this place zero stars if I could. My husband and I stayed there for a night away. Little did we know it would turn into a nightmare. We got a call 24 hours later stating that an iPad had been removed from our room. First of all, there was never any iPad there to begin with, and they claimed there was an iPad and a docking station. They charged us 500 on our card right before Christmas and we have 5 kids. They refused to give us our money back. My husband had to go over in person at midnight to the casino to try to get our money back so we can get the money we had set aside for Christmas gifts for our children back. Let me stress also that we never received our 150 deposit back either. This place is a fraud and they took money away illegally from two innocent people. Horrible. Please please ban this place!

Live casino has a great atmosphere but super mismanaged. 90% of time they do not have enough dealers to open multiple pits and popular games like Criss Cross which they have 4 tables are never opened. When I ask any Pitt boss, the answer is always the same. We don't have enough staff. I understand Covid but this is just poor management.
It's a nice casino, a little dark on the lighting. The sports bars fill up quickly on game days with reservations. A nice variety of games to play.

Live! Philadelphia casino & hotel on 10th & Packer Ave. ( South Philly) SAME hotel & casino as the Maryland Live! in Anne Arundel County. Friendly staff.  Plenty of machines.  New slot machines that I have never since at Maryland Live! nor Mgm National Harbor casino

Nice casino.
They let you win, but do not try to win a lot or you will be walking out shaking your head.
They run some promotions to try and give back time to time. 
The place is very clean and there is no smoking. Which is a good thing for people like me that do not smoke. A nice numbers of live tables and some slot poker games as well. 
Have not been to any restaurants within the building. But will soon. 

Definitely will be back.

Not ready for Primetime ...no liquor on the floor allowed...room nice and clean ...coffee maker broken was fixed immediately...security staff a little too into there jobs with arbitrary rules on bringing non alcoholic drinks on too the floor ...you cannot get to food court without going through security last day I had a Mountain Dew they refused entrance onto casino floor thus the food court...that's ok ..lots of better options at other casinos ...place was empty acted like they were doing you a favor
Comps and payouts are limited to high rollers only. Little guy playing penny and nickel machines....forget about it. Rivers Casino is where you want to spend your $$$$. Decent payouts.

The hotel is nice because it's new so 5 stars to that. The service is so bad, like no service at all. I called front desk last night for a box of tissue, a lady said: sure, someone will deliver to the room in few minutes. Then we never got  it, no one cares about customer needs. The room air conditioning was not working well. It was still on even tho I turned it off. Cold air still came out so now I am having a COLD. Last thing was the view, there's no good view outside of my room even though it's high floor. (16 floors, the penthouse) It's just the huge parking lot outside of the window lol.

Very disappointed. Extremely slow service. We wait at least 30 to 45 minutes almost every time. But the food is always delicious. Tonight it sucked. The service sucked. The cashier had an attitude. In the Bensalem location I never had to wait more than 15 minutes. In the NYC locations there was a less than 5 minutes wait every time. 
This place needs to get it together. They have two girls there who really hustle and try to keep things moving. Aside from them, the staff moves at a snail's pace.
We ordered ahead and arrived 10 minutes late only to find out the Chiptole was 40 minutes behind on orders.  Just make food at your home. Not worth it.

Standard chipotle food but the restaurant is always so dirty and strewn around. Lettuce, rice and other ingredients are all over the counters. The service is slow as well. Probably worth the extra couple of minutes to drive to Neshaminy Chipotle.

Worst service everytime I am in here, dont know why I ever come back its always a painful experience. They must not interview the employees or provide any training. Dont order online to try and avoid the shitty service or youll just be stuck waiting for an hour to still have to deal with the shitty service when they claim to not have your order or make a mistake. Save the headache and money don't go.

Waited almost 45 for my order that I had placed before hand so I wouldn't have to wait. The place was a mess and they barely gave me any food. I'm a small person and don't eat that much and it still wasn't enough for me. I ordered a veggie burrito bowl. There was another guy fighting with the manager about uncooked meat. Highly NOT recommended.

Worst chipotle ever, took 2 hours to get my online order.  Did not get the guacamole I paid for, the food was ice cold and the sides for quesadillas were in little containers half the size they should be.  Every time I've gone here the experience get worse.

This is not the fist time I have ordered from this restaurant, and each time there was something wrong with my order. Just today I have placed a simple order of burrito bowl and nothing else through the delivery app. My estimated time was 20-30 mins max. I received my order hour and a half later. The food came cold, there was almost no rice, little amount of steak, they completely ignored that the order had guacamole. If I could give this specific restaurant 0 stars I would.

We have tried TWO BOOTS in Smyrna 3 times so far. Each time we try a different pizza. I love the fact they have such unique pizzas. After Pie Five closed we have been searching for a pizza we liked. When we heard about Two Boots I looked  them up on google. It's a fascinating story.  I prefer thin crust pizza and that's what we got here. We have tried the Cleopatra Jones,The Pep and today we tried the The Dude. So far The Cleopatra Jones has been our favorite. They sale by slice or whole pizzas.  Everyone there has been friendly. I highly recommend trying them out. You can order online and pick it up or have it delivered or even eat in. This place is a New York pizza place in Smyrna. Love it.

Best pizza your going to get in TN. I'm a NY/NJ pizza guy so it's really hard to get close to that. This spot is better than any pizza I've tried in TN for sure though. Thin real NY style pizza. Ask for NY style they will make it better. Owners are awesome too.

We had the Cleopatra Jones pizza today and it was the best tasting pizza I ever had. The sauce is amazing and the peppers were very fresh and delicious. I would highly suggest this pizza to anyone. I will be coming back to try the other pizza. Great place.

Two Boots is my favorite NYC pizza place and I lost my mind when I heard they were opening in Smyrna. This pizza is my favorite for flavor, crunchy crust and perfect size. Also I love being able to order by the slice!

Perfect pizza.  Even better garlic knots.  Worth every penny.  Unfortunately, we were told the pizza would take 20 minutes to prepare and that we could get garlic knots in 5 minutes to tide us over.  Garlic knots never came.  Finally arrived with the pizza so we didn't even want them at that point.  They were amazing tho.  Disappointing first time experience.  Employee didn't seem to care when I voiced my disappointment that our appetizer came with the main course.  That was the one thing I feared would happen and it happened.  Don't tell me I can order a five minute appetizer and then bring it out twenty minutes later with my meal.
We ordered delivery from two boots and we were both very impressed! Our food was fresh and the pizza was still hot! We absolutely love Two Boots and are very pleased with the delivery of it.

Two Boots has unique pizza offerings and it is delicious! I ordered The Dude, andouille sausage, Tasso Ham and ground beef with mozzarella and cheddar cheese. I have been waiting for this location to open, and I was not disappointed.

4.5 stars! One of my favorite places for NY thin slice pizza! I frequent their midtown location when I was in office; so I was thrilled to see them open a location close to home! I love that they sell pizza by the slice! I love variety - one of each please! My favorites are the classics - plain cheese and pepperoni. But Greg have lots of options - including vegetarian and vegan! I haven't seen Ms. Kitty on the Smyrna menu yet, but if you see it, get it! It's topped with Hattie's hot chicken, what! You can also order whole pies, for delivery or pickup! There's plenty of seats inside and even patio. All employees were wearing masks. Prices are fair and so is service! The only reason for the -.5 star is for grit garlic knots, which were hard and burntish. I prefer mine soft and pillowy. But I will be back for their pizza, any day!

Was in Smyrna today and my daughter had told me about Two Boots Pizza so I decided to give them a try. Met Row (short for Rowena) and she explained to me all of the options available. Love the fact they sell a number of different slices so I decided to try a slice of cheese and a slice of The Newman. The cheese was good and the sauce on the slice was semi-sweet with a solid tomato flavor. Nice amount of cheese complimented the slice so you could enjoy all of the flavors. For a slice of plain old cheese...really good with a nice crispy crust. The Newman slice is their "classic white" meaning no tomato sauce, just cheese with Sopressata and Sweet Italian Sausage. This slice of pizza was exceptional...all of the flavors clicked on this one and the lack of tomato sauce wasn't missed at all. What impressed me most was the crust on both slices. It had a really nice flavor, crispy, with a tinge of sweetness to it...one of the better crusts I have had in a long time and it was easy to "fold" when eating. I asked Row if there was a special ingredient and she told me corn meal...WOW!!! 

Overall...really good pizza, some interesting topping options (Italian versus Creole), good pricing for a large slice, and great service.

I have had 4 different pizzas from this location. All 4 were not worth the price. The pizzas are different which is nice but to date it has never satisfied that pizza craving. The taste just doesnt do it for me. Every pizza has been very underwhelming. Two medium sloppy pizzas plus a 5 dollar tip came to 40 bucks. Not worth it. Grab you a Dominos for less.
Some of the best pizza in middle Tennessee, hands down, owner is super friendly and very attentive

Today I tried the Meat the Mets pizza...5 STARS!!! The jalapenos and spiced chicken gave a little kick, but the spice wasn't overpowering. All of the toppings were extremely fresh. The ricotta cheese elevated the flavor. This is the best pizza I've had in the Smyrna area. You get what you pay for!

This place is funky. Funky awesome! "Meat the Mets" is our fave. Soooooo delish. Quality ingredients and huge, NY-style slices. Whatever you do, you MUST MUST MUST try the Buffalo ranch. Oh my lanta *drool emoji*. A great, eclectic joint in Smyrna! Service is amazing too. Go here go here go here!

A couple of team members was wanting to try the new place out and wanted Two Boots Pizza for our next manager meeting luncheon. The order was 3 large specialty pizzas, one personal pizza, some garlic knots and salad. The wrong dressing was provided for the salad, the pizza crust was tough and I did not care for the seasoning. Needless to say, I should have made Digiorno's pizzas instead.
Was not the least bit impressed,  pizza's didn't have what's on the menu on them, and 2 hour's from closing,  they're out of knots!

The pizza here is amazing. I came in last week to order their slices and was impressed. Decided to stop back in today to get an entire pie and a few other items. The garlic knots are some of the best garlic knots I've ever had and their Italian sausage is flavored perfectly. A lot of Italian sausages have too much anise in them and it makes them overwhelming.  

Great place to grab a slice quickly with unique flavors or make a whole pie.  Glad Two Boots has made Smyrna one of their homes
We really loved their pizza!  It is unique and full of quality ingredients.  You will not get a soggy, bland crust here.  Would definitely recommend!
Great pizza option if you like NY style. Is this as good a slice as something from the Big Apple itself? No, but for Smyrna TN it's definitely top two in the county

Beware!  I ordered pizza at the new Two Boots location in Smyrna.  While this pizza heightened some senses, it dulled others.  Potentially dangerous.  It was a little disorienting walking into the old Pie Five location, to begin with.  On the drive home, I decided to try a slice.  Not only did my 45 minute drive home seem to take 10 minutes, but I accidentally ate half a pizza and *almost* got caught in a speed trap due to my being so caught up in the flavor. I even caught myself saying audibly (and apparently to myself), "What IS this MEAT?!" 

I'm not cultured.  I think I had some creole chicken and pepperoni on one and sopressata, tasso, and andouille something-or-other on the other. I don't mean to sound cliche', but my experience was other-worldy. Be careful when eating and driving!  I recommend enjoying at home or in restaurant with the company of others. 

In addition, I ordered a couple of pizzas that are not currently on their menu, but were on the menu at another location (because I was looking at the wrong thing, I guess).  Even so, they still made them. 

I'm not sure if the owner was at this location due to it having just opened or not, but the staff seemed more like young business-men than your typical staff. They were amazingly cordial and acted like they had a stake in the restaurant's success.  In conclusion, and all jokes aside, best pizza I've ever had. I DEFINITELY recommend Two Boots (not one).
Terrible. Not much ingredients on the pie at all. The sauce wasn't that goo either. I won't go back and I don't recommend anyone to go. I don't know how they got the stars that they did
We were greeted at the door as soon as we got in. The staffs were very friendly. Pizza were fresh and hot. They were not a disappointment.

This pizza place is incredible, definitely better than another local NY style pizza place. I use to venture out to Nashville to try their pizza in Nashville. I am happy to see them closer to the boro. The prices are reasonable and worth it. I ordered the Earth Mother. It has fresh quality ingredients such as organic fresh spinach, roasted garlic, roasted peppers, red onion & marinara sauce. I think it's suppose to come with mushrooms also but didn't see any. This didn't take away from the pizza. It had generous amount of toppings. The sauce has a tiny kick to it, but not overpowering spicy. I also swapped out the vegan cheese for mozzarella cheese.  Second item ordered was a calzone called CBGB. It was supper delicious, I left out the chicken and it couldn't be any better. Haven't had a good calzone in years. It will filled with lots of broccoli and it was spilling out of the sides. Lastly the garlic knots were the best, super soft and doughy on the inside with a good stretch. They were huge! The side of my palm if not bigger. Very flavorful, bursting with tons of garlic and worth trying out.
Service was exceptional! Food was awesome!  Thank you so much for having options. We vegans love our options!
Best Pizza in Smyrna!!They  are new to the area!! I have also ate at there downtown location both are real good!! New York style slices!!

I have been so anxious to check this place out and finally got a chance today. I can say... it was love at first slice. 

This is by far the best pizza in the area, Salvos is now second best. You can buy it by the slice, or an entire pie. There are even gluten free as well as vegan options. 

The dough was so perfect and the ingredients were fresh. Today I tried the "V is for Vegan" 10" pizza. I may head back tomorrow to try some other things that caught my eye. The only disappointment was that a cookie was the only dessert option. 

The staff members were welcoming and the store was decorated pretty cute. I had to hunt for a clean table and eventually sat at a dirty one, but I suspect they'll see a lot of business and that may become the norm. 

This is definitely my new favorite spot to eat on this part of town. I can't wait to return. 

Note- Their posted hours are inaccurate, for example: Closed on Sundays. If you're driving a good distance, you may want to call first. This branch is a franchise.

I'll make this quick. The pizza was delicious. Never had pizza crust like this before. The price was average for boutique pizza places. 
Important note: they do not have bacon as a topping choice. Instead, they have a sort of spicy pork barbacoa. Service was fast and the place was clean. I would eat here again.
By FAR, my favorite pizza since moving to Nashville.  NYC style pizza with an amazing flavor, array of toppings and a great staff of people that work there! Just wish it was closer to my house!

Ordered a pizza from here on way home to try something new. It was easy to order online and the pizza was ready when I arrived. 
 Once I got home and tasted the pie, I really enjoyed the flavor of the crust. My dogs were mad because I would usually feed them the crust, but not today it tasted to good. 
 Will definitely order again and try some other pies
I and my husband ate here, the pizza is very delicious, that exactly new york pizza. We will come back again, very yummyThank you very much.

I was pleasantly surprised at show much I liked this pizza. I had a few slices of plain cheese pizza because I beleive that's the standard mark of excellence in evaluating a pizza joint and an few slices of a pie that had ricotta and sausage. Both were worthy of a return visit.
Love this place!  Super friendly staff, very affordable, really good pizza, and fast.  The different names of the pizzas are fun too, named after fictional characters.

I had to stop in and check in since I knew they had vegan options.  The V is for Vegan is amazing! Great combination of flavors. 

The website says they use Daiya cheese, but they actually have BeeHive cheese and meats. 

I will definitely be a repeat customer.

We walk in and the restaurant is empty except for one table in the back. This may be a good thing. It's 6:30pm and we hope to finish eating by 7:30pm to catch a show at The Keswick.

We hover at the entrance. The hostess is behind the bar, scribbling in a pad. She motions for us to wait. We wait about 6 minutes for which seems strangely long for a mostly empty restaurant. Then she seats us.

When the waitress comes to take our order, I ask: "Hey, we need to leave by 7:30 to catch a show -- do you think that's doable?" (See, I was a little nervous about slow service after the hostess with the pad, but maybe she was writing the climactic conclusion to her novel and needed to get the words just right.)

"It depends on what you order. Some dishes take longer to prepare."

Sounded reasonable. I wanted the cheesesteak but they were out so we ordered two cheeseburgers.

Remember, there was only one other occupied table. They were behind a partition so I didn't get a head count but it sounded like a family. 

Otherwise, the place was empty.

And then we waited. A long time. The waitress told us the burgers were on their way at least times.

After 40 minutes, we gave up and left.

Tonight, I decided to support this restaurant and the service was absolutely horrible. I was not greeted properly and was seated  in the back of restaurant. The restaurant barely had any customers. I sat there for 25 minutes without anyone taking my order before I left. When I left the hostess and waitress sat in front of the restaurant on their cell phones. I will never support the restaurant gain. I don't care how good the food may look, smell or taste if you have horrible customer service the food doesn't matter anymore.. @metropolisrestaurant

So, this is an interesting restaurant it is located within or beneath apartments- really nice inside and has a great mood- BTW the music was boppin- All my faves arrived on a Sunday evening- was asked if we had reservations which we did- and were seated immediately- we got a cesar salad which was super tasty-!! For my drink i got honey lemoney lemonade-  Food: fried chicken /side of green beans and yellow rice- my spouse ordered salmon/side mac and cheese and yellow rice- I personally would probably get something different next time- Or it's my fault i did not ask for them to make the fried chicken pieces extra well done like i normally like them- they were just ok for me- I LOVED the green beans!!! I also tried some mac and cheese omg that was sooo tasty- I think next time i will get the Shrimp and grits meal mmmm or even BBQ short ribs and some mac and cheese - they were sold out of the BBQ short ribs that night!  for dessert we got homemade cheesecake that was delicious!! Also coffee which had a great flavor and super hot!

When it first opened, things were in disarray. I provided feedback and returned because I want to support as many black businesses as possible. I've been back a few times since offering my feedback. I've only done takeout and the service, the owners, and especially the food has been MAGNIFICENT! I am about to place another take out order now.

Give them a shot.

I called on a Sunday at 2:45pm for a to go order. I asked for an estimate time that my order would be done and was told 3:45. I arrived at 4pm to pick up my food. I walk inside with my son and no one greets us. I have to announce myself and why I'm there. I tell them the name for the order. The staff says they're going to check on my order. The staff come back out and do not update me on the status of my food. So I asked, is my food ready or will I have to wait some more. I was told it's coming right out. About 10 minutes pass by and I take my son back to sit in the car with my sister because he's getting antsy. I go back inside and ask again about the status of my food. The owner then says to me "I was here when you walked in and you came in like (hand gesture) that". He was condescending. He was saying I had an attitude when I was just coming in and asking about my order instead of being told about it when I called in. Questions, that staff should be able to answer.  I said "sir I called you at 2:45. I was just expecting my food to be ready." Then instead of apologizing for the wait he tells me that this is a restaurant and we get 100s of orders. (You're a restaurant. Getting orders is what you're supposed to do). He then says "you would have to wait at Chik Fil A". I said "ok sir". Then he says "I see you want to get the last word".....I was not at Chik Fil A. I am at YOUR establishment. I don't care about how many orders you have. No acknowledgment of my wait or frustration. Before leaving I HAD TO REQUEST utensils. CUSTOMER SERVICE IS KEY AND THIS ESTABLISHMENT HAS NONE. I have no problem waiting for food when it's addressed early on and communicated clearly. However, when you are spending your hard earned money you're paying for an experience. I will not be back, plus my fish was cold.

I tried this place for a new Sunday night take out spot. I order it on DoorDash and it came close to room temperature. This is definitely not a place for authentic soul food. I'm not sure about the other food but it was subpar. The yams were okay. The Mac and cheese was more like a cheese sauce and not baked like I thought. You can also tell they use previously frozen salmon which is strange. I wouldn't recommend this place for soul food maybe for some other food but I can't attest to that.

I know people are skeptical of 5-star reviews but hear me out...
The pizza at this place is like what you would find in New York! (And I am NOT joking.) The pizza menu here has been totally revamped by a local guy named John who gets his flour, cheese, and other ingredients from local farmers. The freshness of the ingredients totally comes out in the pizza. I never tried the pizza here before John came in but I know that pizza is a genuine passion for John since he was a NJ/NY native!
The pizza is very thin crust like what you would find in old school authentic pizzerias in NY, baked on a gas-fire oven, and doesn't sit in the oven long before getting a perfectly balanced and charred crust.
I got the classic Margherita as well as the Pesto Shrimp. They were both super simple pizzas but very well executed. I seriously can't believe that pizzas of this quality are being made in a somewhat obscure restaurant in the Wyncote/Glenside area. Please check it out and support local restaurants!

After I left this restaurant, I left message on the owners phone. Less than 24 hours later, the owner called me back listened to my concerns about my experience. She encouraged me to come back. I decided to come and my experience was 1000x better than the first. I am happy gave them a second chance because it was worth it. The wait staff was attentive and timely, the owners was present and the food was amazing. I will be back to support the restaurant.. #goodmoodgoodgrubgoodtime

I had my husband's birthday dinner here on November 19th as I have been here twice prior and really try to support black businesses. The food is amazing, however it is never hot when served. The servers are friendly, but not attentive(even before the pandemic). They will disappear for long periods of time without checking on you. It was a hassle just to get a glass of water for each guest and eating utensils. There is also a $50 charge to bring an outside cake, however its a BYOB restaurant so you can bring alcohol which is great but seems more of a liability than a cake. Although the owner was very friendly in person, whoever is in charge of responding to emails for private events was not very helpful or seemed to not want to be bothered. I requested a phone call but was told email was the preferred method of contact. Overall, the guests enjoyed their food and the ambience.

I was so excited to try this restaurant...I ordered at 7:20...estimated time was 104 minutes and I was okay with that. Over an hour goes by and my door dash driver calls me that she's waiting and no one has even asked her what order she's there for and she thinks it might be a while. I said that's fine. She calls back saying they came out and said they just can't make my order. They "didn't get the order" to the chef in time and my order just couldn't be made. So now it's 9 at night and I ordered at 7:20 and they just didn't make my order.
During covid & servers not wearing masks. Orders were wrong. Too many menu items unavailable. Slow service even with minimal patrons. Ambiance is nice but food is average, at best.

I order the double cluster, crab cakes, Rasta Pasta and requested to cancel the order for carrot cake if it contained nuts due to an allergy. What came to my door was walnut laden carrot cake and somebody's soggy salmon fries I never ordered. They refused to honor doer dashes redelivery request for the $80 in food I didn't get. Nobody was trying to get over you really sent out the wrong order, very simple to do because the order was in a black plastic bag with no name on it. Do better. 4 hours no food.

Order food at 8:40... it's is currently 10:08 and our appetizers has not come out yet! Waiters/Waitresses have no idea what's going on. Terrible! Only thing we received was strawberry salads.. we were sat outside and the lights don't work. Just a bad experience.

I'm so over them!!!! There has been several times that we have placed orders from Metropolis, and every time, there has been an issue. But when you're trying to support "Black Businesses" and they are convenient (same building you live in), you think it would get better each time. But not today!!! My boyfriend ordered food @ 7pm, and they said they would call as they normally do (it takes about 2-3 long hours) but at 9pm he never heard from them. He called down to them to only be told that the order was never put in!!  WTH?!?! Then was told that they were about to close and he couldn't get the food, they were only serving carry-outs (Uber Eats). They are the worse!!! I called Metropolis to let them know how of bad they been us since the start of us patronizing them... I told them NEVER AGAIN!!

Amazing amazing amazing food, staff and service. Though the food takes some time to come out- it is homemade, plentiful & tasty! Give them a try plus the owners are really friendly! We will be back especially for seafood night!
Extremely friendly staff & the food pics speak for themselves... Definitely give this place a try if you haven't already

Very poor customer service!!!... my family and I made a reservation here. Darn near vacant with the exception of party that was having dinner there. The waiter/host proceeded to seat us and some rude employee told him to and I quote "they have to sit outside" (no option to sit outside like a normal establishment) it was cold outside and we had to place our hands on the menus to keep them from blowing away! Needless to say we sat for 15 mins and they didn't even over us a drink of water, no one came back to the table after we were seated! I would give this place zero stars if I could. Very unorganized and unprofessional. We left and I strongly doubt if they noticed that we were gone!! I need people to stop scream support businesses with zero professionalism. Don't waste you time or your money!
Food is so delicious I had it for the first time yesterday for lunch then I came back for dinner same night then I came back for lunch the following day-food is delicious.
Absolutely amazing. My guy even started dj'ing while we waited for our food!! Absolutely felt like love, the food, friendliness, everything.

My fiance and I order 2 medium jerk chickens which were a great size. The chicken and rice were delicious. It would be 5 stars if the cabbage was not severely overcooked. I will definitely order again.

I just got Jerk Chicken with rice and cabbage. Let me say this the girl that took our order said that they had the better Jerk Chicken than the place we had ordered from before. Of course everyone would say that but this actually was the best I've had!! And I've had Jerk Chicken At plenty of places before. We definitely will be ordering from here again and again.

I had the oxtail platter with rice and peas and plantains,  sooo flavorful and plentiful. The service was fast and they were courteous.  We came another time and that time had 1 of the platters with Mac & cheese, also good. Highly recommend this place.

I live in Florida and was in town for work. I ordered Jerk Chicken which is off the grill amazing. I had oxtails that we're amazing. She is a beautiful person vert pleasant. I would eat here everyday if I could.
Absolutely amazing! I got the large Jerked Chicken with cabbage and green beans. Best jerked I've had in the states. Brings me back to my vacation in Jamaica!

Just had the jerk chicken, Mac and cheese and rice and everything was delicious! My first time trying this restaurant in my local area and I will
Definitely be back!

Food was amazing.  The place was recommended by a fellow New Yorker and a true Jamaican.  The food was the best Jamaican food I've tasted here SJ since moving down here 10+ years ago.  I ordered the oxtails with rice and peas and cabbage and fried snapper with macaroni and cheese and potato salad.  No complaints about  the food but the potato salad.  The potato salad was too sweet for my liking.  I ended up doctoring it. They also forgot my cornbread, so I cant review that. Overall I will definitely order from here again. TIP: Order 45 minutes before or you will be waiting.

We were looking for something a little different and this came up on Yelp. Only two reviews (not counting this one) but both were 5 stars... So glad we gave it a shot. Online ordering was a breeze but it did take closer to 45mim for our order to be ready which didn't matter bc quality food is worth waiting for. We ordered 1 jerk chicken with cabbage and rice and beans and 1 stew chicken with Mac and cheese and rice and beans. Oh and two beef patties. The food was out of this world. You could taste the smoke on the jerk chicken and the perfect combination of spices. The stew chicken was fall off the bone and perfectly seasoned also. The sides were equally as delicious. Hands down some of the best mac and cheese. And the beef patties were flaky and scrumptious. Everything was reasonably priced. The woman at the restaurant was super sweet and nice. 1000% recommend. Go now!!!!!!

This is my first time ordering! I ordered a large oxtail with peas/rice and cabbage. The peas and rice as well as the cabbage were very flavorful. Although the ox tails (6 small ones) had good flavor, they clearly stayed under a heat lamp for way too long and in minimal liquid. The connective tissue that usually becomes gelatinous goodness as ox tails simmer, was a gummy bear like substance, and barely available on four of them! I will order them again but do so when they first open to see if there is any change in the appearance! The picture is of the ox tails. I ate the rice first.

The food was great! In town visiting from Houston and Me and the family was looking for somewhere to eat.  We stopped in and tasted the Jerk Chicken and had to get a plate.  The food tasted like your Grandma made it!

I Give This PlaceA 1 Star . I wanted To Come Here To Try Some Of The Food I've Been Reviewing On Yelp But They Can't Seem To Get Their Times Of Business Correct Anywhere . It Is Very Misleading And Aggravating When Your Told 4 Different Things . And When You Call The Phone Number It States They Are Open On Sunday's At 12 .

Quick decision for a hearty lunch. I ordered a medium oxtail platter with rice and peas and cabbage with a side of fried Plantains. I was told 25 minutes for pickup which was accurate. Food was hot and fresh and the custom service was on point. Will be stopping by again.

Ordered today! Alisha was so Nice and helpful. Very large portions, easily good for two meals. Had the jerk chicken, Mac and cheese, rice, plantains and beef patty. All delicious! Ordered for the whole office and no complaints at all! Thanks guys!

Came here after reading the reviews and was not disappointed.  The curry chicken and the jerk chicken was excellent.  Nice place with a carribean decor which I loved.  There was some nice Jamaican ladies cooking in the back.  My plate was a medium but looked like a large.

Instead of Flowers, Inc. 
1100 94th Ave N, St. Petersburg, FL 33702   This is an outstanding service! I ordered a meal to be delivered to my son and wife in West Virginia for his birthday a couple of weeks ago. He raves about it! So he sent me a meal for Mother's Day. It was excellent, easy, each part of the meal wrapped in ribbon and came in a practical and reusable cooler bag. Who could ask for anything more. The price is very reasonable and the quantity of food was generous. What a great service and wonderful gift idea!!!

I have to say I had a dinner delivered for my parents anniversary.  They were supposed to be in Paris having Beef Bourgogne for their 43rd anniversary but due to Covid they were home.  The packaging was great and the dinner was amazing.  My parents loved it and it warmed my heart.  I will use them again for other important days in their lives.  Thank you for this service.

Really good wings, fries etc.  I would recommend ordering on line or over the phone and picking up.  Due to COVID you can't eat inside and they are so busy that a walk in order can take a while to fill.  Will definitely go back.

I'm giving three stars because the food was hot and the person behind the counter was friendly. We ordered some Cajun wings, some hot wings, and french fries.

I don't know if all locations have these sweetened french fries but we were not expecting that and did not like it at all. 

The hot wings were pretty good. 

The Cajun wings had Parmesan cheese on them and not much other seasoning that we could see. We were expecting a typical spicy Cajun seasoning blend, but these seemed to just be sprinkled with Parmesan and didn't have much other flavor.The Cajun wings also had a sweet taste as if the marinade has sugar in it. 

We don't really care for the sweet items but might go back for more hot wings.

First off, they forgot not just one of the drinks I ordered, but both drinks. So I did not receive both of my drinks. I ordered two sides of cheeses and got none of them. On the 15 wings I ordered, I got 14 drumsticks and 1 wing. This is not a mix of flats and drumsticks as wings are normally done. It seems they have us whatever was left of the wings remaining. They should notify a customer of this if this is the case. Wings were okay and fries were good, but on that aspect, they totally didn't add the Cajun seasoning I requested as well...

Stopped in the other day and got a dozen wings, half original and half lemon pepper. I'm thinking about going back already. The young lady at the register was training someone and helping prepare wings in the back at the same time, it was getting pretty busy so props to her. Coming from experience I would say I would get a first name and last initial or the first and last for orders. That type of demand will cause mixups in people getting the wrong order. For example someone says Ryan and they heard Brian. Anyway the wings were great and the service was as well!

Wings ! How I love you... unfortunately I have a love / hate relationships with wingstop locations. This one is fairly new but I rarely have any issues with this location. 

Today I did order 8 wings (half boneless and half classic). They gave me all classic, but I was hungry and wings are wings. I got a dry rub Louisiana and unfortunately it was too much seasoning. 

The fries were perfect ! My order was on time, neatly packaged cooked well. I have to dock a star for the heavy hand in seasoning but all in all this is a quality location that I will come back to.
Second time back. So far so good. Wish the wings were a little bigger though. Better than other wing joints. Very clean, made to order. Great fries also.

I did not like this food. 1. Cheese fries were entirely too salty. 2. The sauces were just blah, nothing to write home about.  3. Blue cheese dressing was not tasty at all...had almost no flavor.  Food was at least fully cooked and you got a lot for the price but I would rather better quality over quantity.  My husband didn't hate it nearly as much as I did (he said he would give 2 stars because "it wasn't very good") but I certainly won't go back.
I spent $32.00 for chicken and fries. Chicken was not warm fries were cold.  I will never be back to this place.  Good luck

Just got my ham and it is delicious as usual.  However, I was disappointed with the store. Have frequented this business since they opened a few years ago and always happy. Today was strange. Walking in to it I was confronted with a horrible odor of old meat?? Not the usual smell of good food. As I walked around my feet kept sticking to the floor which made me uncomfortable combined with odor thinking not sanitary. Usually displays are attractively arranged to make me want to buy other food items, but not today. Boxes opened and unopened were strewn around, some with packaged food falling out, no displays, no organization, nothing to entice me to buy more. When I asked about sides or rolls she pointed to a picture on the counter and walked away. Employee said she didn't smell anything.  I have been in the back of butcher shops and meat markets and know the smell of rotting meat. It is normally kept separate away from fresh meat and customers to be disposed of in a sanitary manner. Thinking the local food inspector needs to take a look here!!

As soon as we walked up to the doors I could barley see inside. The entry door glass was so Dirty. Walked in and the place smells like bad meat. Only two tiny tables to sit at. The place looks like nobody is caring for it. Dirty floors, no meats in the cabinets. Looks abandoned and unsanitary. Worker behind the register was on her cell phone. Quickly decided to leave and not order any food. Something bad going on there. Not looking good at all.
Sadly.

***Edit - the owner called at 5pm and told me if I could get to the store in an hour they'd honor my coupon.  (I am not going to do that now).  But the worst is that he said he was going to "do me one better" than the coupon and then offered the buy a half ham, get another half at half the price - an EXISTING offer for everyone. How is that doing ME one better, LOL?  

I called to ask if they would accept the $10/half coupon one day early as I need to work this weekend (I am a nurse at a major hospital) and possibly into the foreseeable future if the virus hits us as hard as they predict. I wanted to support a local business and have something in the 'fridge for my family while I am gone to eat while I work 14-hour days - something they enjoy, that's a reminder of fun times. Sounds stupid, maybe, but even stupider is that the store would NOT honor the coupon one day early. I won't be back. That's something easy to do, that eases stress for people, and they refused. I can't see the reasoning in this - so I'll just take my business and my (very) hard-earned money elsewhere.

I was also told they were having an in-store promotion of buy one half, get another half at half price. Who needs the equivalent of a whole ham when we are NOT supposed to be gathering? I don't think this store gets it.

Not sure if l & my wife will be back here, came in twice & the last time had no problems. This time the ham looked weird, I took some pics of it & if we did not live 25mins south of here, I would've drove back & got a replacement or refund. My wife said the container was not sealed all the way so air got into the meat & turned it brownish, i thought at 1st it was the brown sugar they used but this had nothing to do with the brown sugar. Did not tasted the same either, took a shot of the potato salad & coleslaw as well, coleslaw seem a bit slimy & the potato salad seemed dry. Place seems to be older & a bit run down, not like the one in Clearwater that is newer & always busy. If yu come here, make sure to check yur meat before yu leave, there's no telling what it will look like.

I would give this store a zero.  The store is dirty and they were out of croissants and chips.  The girl said sorry my boss didn't order this week.  Very disappointing do you expect to run a business this way

I can't give them any stars because they won't honor the coupon we have with there address on it, and today wasn't the first time. So my wife went to the honey baked ham store in port Richey and right off the bat Lacey said we don't honor that coupon even though it has their addresses it and Lacey was nasty to her by saying we don't have any product anyways and went to the back of the store. This is the second time we were told that they won't honor their own coupon. So I called Spring Hill and the lady was nice as can be. I can see the port Richey store closing down, and just FYI I will never be setting foot in the port Richey store again.

This place straight up lied! I called the store to reserve turkey and ham for Christmas dinner and was told it was not necessary, they had plenty, just walk in. So, when I did as instructed, drove an hour to get there and was then told "we are only serving reserved orders" Are you kidding me!!?!?!?? I called to do just that and was told otherwise! They are liars!!!! And have ruined my family's Christmas dinner! Do Not shop this place ever!!!
Zero stars rating! The absolute worst!

Tucked in between two buildings, this outdoor cigar vendor also has Cuban coffee, and, from the looks of it, pan cubano and/or sandwiches. $2 for a cortadito.  Nero-Cuban-bachata music and three little tables make this a nice spot for ducking out of the traffic flow along Greek row.

went to try Cuban sandwiches.   very tasty.  They use real roast pork vs just deli meat.  you'll have to ask for the sandwich as they aren't advertised...at least not that I saw there.  but great sandwich and worth trying.

I love Cuban coffee and get one every opportunity that I see.  Walking by this little stand yesterday, I was really craving and looking forward to an authentic cuban coffee.  
Unfortunately, I ended up with just a very small regular coffee with milk and sugar.  
It was tasty, but not something I would have paid $2 for.

Visited this place a few weeks back. Got to grab some cigars and when I left I found out they were fakes.

Lazaro has a lot of fake Cubans, he is a fraud. Stay away. Don't believe the stories
Great coffee and cigars. The Cuban sandwiches are to die for right in the middle of downtown Tarpon Springs Sponge Docks.

After discussions with the owner I realized all the cigars he claimed to be from Cuban leaf are fakes. Lazaro claims to have a source in Cuba and at El Laguito but it's all a ruse to lure you in. For those who are new to the world of cigars STAY FAR AWAY!!!!!

I had the cauliflower pizza with Hamburger, onions, and green peppers. They didn't overload with tomato sauce which was a great thing. The crust is tasty and I recommend it. 

I will definitely be back!

Love that a Mexican / Italian kitchen opened up near by. Mexican food is amazing & fresh, the burrito bowl was AMAZING!! The pizza crust was chewy and perfect. Sadly, they have closed. Now it's just another bbq place..

We read some good reviews and decided to give it a try. We ordered a half pepperoni half cheese pizza. Honestly this is one of the best pizzas we've had in quite some time. Perfectly cooked, great flavor. You can tell the dough is freshly made, and the sauce has just the right combination of seasonings. Everyone inside the restaurant was super friendly and thankful. We will definitely be back, looking forward to trying the Mexican food as well.
Best NY style pizza we've had since moving here 5 years ago. Fresh ingredients and not super greasy.
Mexican and Italian in the same place?  Yep.  They nailed both of them.  Going back tonight for the 3rd time.  Fast becoming a family staple.

So excited to have such a great place so close to home! The ingredients are fresh and the staff is friendly! What a treasure! The pizza is amazing. The crust has such an awesome flavor. I haven't had anything I didn't love!
Pizza was super yummy and good price give you guys 5 stars for sure will definitely keep going here for my pizza nice and clean place and friendly atmosphere

name: Salty Shamrock Fishing Charters and Events

reviews.text: We had the pleasure of experiencing the new Chefs Table  dinner last night and it was a culinary feast! Each course was carefully prepared and paired with a wine selection-there were six mouth watering courses each better than the last! This is a new monthly feature Chef Jose is hosting and we have already RSVP'd for next month!

We gave a try due to lack of decent restaurants in this area, besides Circles, and we found  that the staff is friendly, normal setting, we wanted to sit outside which was no problem since there were enough empty tables, so we got seated, but just by walking through I felt the disgusting smell of cigarrete smoke. The waitress/hostess very nicely moved us to a different table but just the same the smoke stench was unbearable so finally we had to move inside. The food was ok, my rice could've used a little more cooking, kind of gritty. They were polite and helpful, but have to Address the smokers issue.

Nice ambiance. Slowish service but they are new. We had the oyster plate, lobster Mac and cheese, tai peanut tacos and the paplano chiles tacos and nothing was amazing.  The lobster Mac was best. Under impressed!

I was lucky enough to be invited for the soft opening on Feb 28th and the food was absolutely delicious.  The former owners of O'Brien's in Brandon have struck gold with this much needed Seafood Gastro Grille.  Seafood with a twist and at an affordable price that's "Hooked and Cooked" same day.  The menu also has plenty of casual eating options and small bites.  There's something for everyone....even those who aren't fans of seafood.  Gracious seating inside and a large covered patio with additional  seating outside.  The patio outside has several TV'S, ceiling fans and bar seating making it a nice cozy, breezy place to enjoy your meal or cocktail.  Please come check out this awesome neighborhood business.  Support Local and you won't be sorry!  Eat till you bust.

I really can't understand why this place has high reviews. Fish and chips were "ok" and like the outdoor seating, but had to wait an hour (from the time of ordering) for fish and chips. After telling our waitress we were going to leave, she came out with our food less then 5 mins later.  The kicker was the food was room temperature, which meant it must have been sitting for a bit. Fish and chips tasted like you would expect fish and chips to taste. 

Read the reviews, long waits (+1hr) are a common theme here.

Bottom line, the convience is not worth the trade off of long wait time and poor service.

I enjoyed the fish 'n chips. Tish, my waitress, was friendly. She was very busy but always had a smile for her customers.

I'll be back.

We've lived in Apollo Beach for well over a decade and have tried every restaurant that has occupied the building that is now the home of Salty Shamrock. (It has housed at least four different restaurants over the past 10 years.) We weren't sure what to expect when we visited the latest incarnation, Salty Shamrock, last night. 

Well, we were thoroughly impressed! First of all, they've redone the inside to expand the bar seating exponentially and extend it outside, which seemed particularly smart during our visit since it was a gorgeous evening. The new configuration will make the pub an outstanding venue for televised sports, and there are televisions distributed around the bar to make watching games convenient. They've also added a decent draft beer selection that includes ciders as well as local brews from Cigar City. Our bartender, Amy, crafted first-class cocktails and handled a large Saturday night crowd with humor, competence and aplomb. 

We ordered food as well, and even my husband, who is an incredibly picky eater when it comes to fish, was impressed with the Salty Shamrock version of fish 'n chips. The dish featured nice, firm, thick white cod filets coated with a unique batter that may have included corn flakes and fried to crispy perfection. We also had a mushroom pizza and crab cakes, both of which were excellent. We found the prices reasonable and the service impeccable.

Apollo Beach has long needed an upscale pub offering a decent beer selection, excellent food and fast, friendly service, and now we have one. We wish the Salty Shamrock the very best of luck and will definitely be repeat customers.

Very excited to try the newest spot created by one of the former owner's of Brandon mainstay, O'Brien's.
We had the margarita pizza to start and throughly enjoyed it. Nice thick, fresh mozzarella, but they don't put sliced tomatoes on it. I hate tomatoes, so it's all good for me.
The crab cakes are so good! So good! They are made fresh and you can tell. The texture is like a pancake. Must be pan fried them as opposed to deep fried. The ratio of crab meat to breading is perfect too; you can really taste the crab. Comes with a tart and tasty fried green tomato all over remoulade. Definitely recommend.
My friends both had the fish n chips. It was a big delicious piece of fish instead of little frozen sticks you get most places. I tried a bit and it was great. The guys both devoured it. Served with a side of coleslaw, fries, and smashed peas. 
The ambiance is a simple bar & grill with a fisherman's flare. There are mounted fish on the walls and dockside whatnots. It works for the proximity of the location to the bay. 
Samantha was our server and she was very friendly, helpful, and attentive.

We stopped on a whim when we were driving past; couldn't have made a better choice.  Four different entree's, each one excellent!  Ham & Cheese on pretzel roll, Grouper Ruben, Brisket Ruben, Southwest Chicken sandwich. Service was great, it is a cute Irish Pub, we wilL definitely  go back when in the area again.

A great Scottish restaurant!! Loved the ambiance here. I was impressed with the food and delighted that the let me bring all 3 of my dogs inside, and even let them go back into the kitchen! One kitchen employee gave them ear hairnets to prevent any allergic reactions. What was even more delightful, however, was that they gave me, a grown woman, a discount because I chose to save them money by sitting in a high chair instead of a booth! Nothing makes me happier than supporting a Czechoslovakian-owned business. Overall very happy with my experience!!

This is  one of my favorite places to go to bike night but upon visiting this past Thursday it was very disappointing. Waiter asked everyone around us if they could be served but we were completely ignored. This made me very very disappointed. Even their chairs were wiped down after the rain.  But not me and my friend.

We were so lucky to get this food truck at work last Wednesday! A fairly new truck, they specialize in a sort of flatbread/pizza rollup in a variety of flavors, in addition to decadent parmesan truffle fries and more apps. They were super friendly, fast and delicious, not to mention accommodating to our needs.

I LOVE that they had local drinks like Made cold brew and Mother's kombucha on tap!

Unfortunately, they did run out of a few items: cold brew, fried chicken; so, I recommend getting in line and ordering first before it's gone!

I had the meatball Impasto and it was so hearty and delicious. They do NOT skimp on ingredients and I had enough for leftovers.

Suggestion for the business: It would be great if you created a "half rollup, half fry" meal deal for people who don't want leftovers or who don't want to spend too much on lunch. I think it would do really well!

Nice job at the softball invitational this week folks!!! The wraps we got were outRageous and fresh ! I had the margarita with fresh basil  legit  cheese and fresh  my god team you rocked it.  My husband got the Hawaiian which was spectacular.   I didn't get them but dayum their basket of some crazy Parmesan fries was ginormous and looked amazing.   I'm a nice size and can eat but my gosh the wraps were huge!!! I forced it down because it was so good !!! I might stalk them now

I ate at the Impasto truck at the Viso Sunshop grand opening party and was impress-to by their food! 

The Itali-bano was a great take on a cuban, but with enough touches to make it unique(prosciutto cotto, deli pickles, and mustard aioli), though it was a tough decision to go with that over their many other offerings. Portion size was good as well, mine stretched into two meals along with the truffle fries which were crispy and golden, perfect amount of crunch.

I would highly recommend stopping by if you ever see them out and about or need a lunch option for an event!

The Impasto food truck was nearby during my lunch break so I decided to give them a try. I wandered to the food truck and looked at the menu. The menu is full of their Impasto wraps and various other options (they have vegetarian wraps too!) The wraps are artisan flat bread folded into what I thought was the equivalent of a pizza burrito. I decided on the Impasto Meatball. It took around 7 minutes to be completed which wasn't terrible. The owners of the truck were really polite so it helped. 

When I got back to my car to eat it, I was thoroughly impressed. I love myself a meatball sandwich but this was above average in my book. The outside of the artisan bread was lightly salted and paired with the meatballs, sauce and cheese...it was the perfect balance. Even though it was a chance encounter with the food truck, I would like to try another one of their yummy wraps! I definitely recommend!

This was absolutely delicious!!!!  I had the itali-bano which is Italian braised pork, prosciutto cotto, deli pickles, and mustard aioli.  It was soooo good and needed absolutely nothing else.  It was also HUGE, I could not eat it all.  It doesn't look that big when you get it, but then it's like that never ending plate of spaghetti (o:  I am happy to see they will be coming back to my work as I think I want to try the Italian Beef and Parmesan Truffle Fries over the next two visits!

This is a little gem tucked in a strip mall. Amazing choices of fresh healthy sandwiches, salads, juices, smoothies, and Açaí bowls. So glad we found this place. The atmosphere is on point, even has a small covered area with tables to enjoy the beautiful outdoors.

Safety Harbor is one of my favorite areas and the new Karma location is perfect. It's in a brand new building on the second floor. It's airy and fresh, there's a view of the Main Street from the top. The decor is so cool and hip and fun!!! My fave area is where.the wicKer chairs and nice ceiling lanterns are located.

I've been wanting to check out Karma in Clearwater for sometime. Little did I know they recently opened the Safety Harbor location! 

The tropical Acai bowl was amazing. I want to try Out their other options in the near future. They also have coffee, tea, smoothies, salads, and toasts. I saw a pretty blue spiralina latte. I've never seen one before and it looked amazing!!!!

What a wonderful chill place!!! It's also dog friendly!!!

Blessed to have this place in quaint safety harbor. Healthy food, wonderful staff. Bowls are amazing as are the coffees. Kids live the healthy options. Salads and sandwiches also fantastic. Always feel great after eating here!

This place is the perfect vibe for studying, relaxing, and socializing. It's on the 2nd floor balcony which looks out to Main Street. The staff here was very friendly and the açaí bowl was the best outside of Hawaii. Will definitely be coming back here.

Cute place with good açaí bowls. I would just say to check your orders before you leave if you get take away.

Today I stopped by and ordered 2 tropicale açaí bowls and they forgot 2 of the toppings (coconut flakes and almonds) and served mango from one of those fruit cups or cans (wasn't fresh mango). I also asked for peanut butter and they forgot to add it so they gave me PB on the side... 

So for a bowl that only has about 5 toppings, to be missing 2-3 of them was very disappointing. 
Definitely check your orders if you get take out!

It's lovely here - the food and the view amazing. The reason I gave it 4-star (I was thinking even 3), is because the service is sooooo slow. I mean slooooowwww. To be fair it was fairly busy and I'll still be coming here but is sloooowwww

The açaí seemed like it was frozen and not very fresh but overall it was a good amount and delicious . The upstairs seating is really nice to hang out.
Here's the menu

TLDR: beautiful space, decent juice. Perfect for a quick bite. 
The juices taste clean and pure. We have tried a few different options and have yet to find one we don't enjoy. Menu is very simple. I would recommend the caprese. Tomato's, mozzarella & basil what's not to love.  Overall this is a place to experience for ambiance if not for the love of clean eating. It's well lit, organized & ergonomic! Located in the heart of down town & the service is very prompt ' professional.

Love the salads and açaí bowls here.  It's all I come for.

Chicken salad on greens is my fave salad and you can't go wrong with any of their açaí bowls.

Safety Harbor location has a nice vibe, up on the second floor.
Love this place! Great healthy food, açai balls, salads, sandwiches and juices. Great recipes. Nice atmosphere in safety Harbor. It's all open and spacious and very clean.

Sorry unable to snap a photo of the food it was that dang good! The woman who owns this restaurant are freakishly fantastic at what they do. I haven't had this good of simple comfort food from the East Coast, NM since I was on the East Coast. I will definitely be going back here again. The lobster soup is so creamy and thick and the tomato basil grilled cheese sandwich is sinfully good.

Tried this for the first time today. Placed a carry out order. Sandwiches and loaded potato soup....The food was excellent! Also, staff was friendly and courteous. This was a great experience. Will definitely be back.

Omg I can't believe I waited so long to try this place! They're only open for lunch, so it's a bit difficult for my schedule, but I finally made it work. I went with the caprese sandwich and the roasted red pepper and gouda soup. They were both amazing! Everyone in my party had something different and they all raved about how good the food was. Even my toddler ate with no complaints and that's saying something. My only regret is that we didn't order dessert! But that's just all the more reason to go back!

What? I cannot believe the other reviews here have not mentioned their amazingly delicious pies. How can anyone go here and not have dessert, is beyond me? 

I hosted a small gathering of cousins for a Christmas dinner and one of my cousins brought two pies for dessert. She knew my favorite pie is Pecan, so it was one of them and the other was Lemon. She dropped them off at my house the day before Christmas. Having a freshly baked pecan pie in my house was a huge temptation. I had to use all my strength, I wanted a slice so bad. Christmas Day could not get here any faster. I wanted that pie. 

Once we were done with dinner and our gift exchange, it was dessert time and you know what I wanted. I've enjoyed a lot slices of Pecan Pie in my day and I will say, this is one of the best if not the best I have eaten. Another one of cousins who attended our holiday dinner raved about the Lemon pie. 

If their pie is this good, I cannot wait to go and experience their lunches. The cousin who brought the pies, is a semi-regular diner, so I will tagging along with her for a lunch in 2021. 

When: Christmas Day
Why: Dessert for holiday dinner

Magnificent surprise! Thanks to the Pick 2 or 3 lunch combination options.. we were able to try many items on the menu! Everything was so fresh and DELICIOUS! The Caesar salad with homemade dressing and croutons was one of the best I have had. The chicken bacon ranch sandwich and stacked ham sandwich were both great. Super clean and cute place!

Great pizza. Picked up 8 slices of different specialty pizza and they were all yummy. My son, who only eats Pizza Hut, ate two plain slices and wanted more. I will definitely drop in for some pizza again.

I've been in this place after a movie. As the previous writer indicated, horrible is not strong enough to describe it. Service, cleanliness, food quality are all a zero on a scale of 1-5. It makes you question how this place even remains in business.

My husband and I recently moved into the area and needed a good pizza place, as we order pizza for our family every Friday night.  We tried a few pizza places in the area, including Giuseppe's, where I grew up eating pizza.  I have to say that Fratellis is the best we've tried.  The crust is nice and thin.  Sauce is delicious and the ratio of sauce and cheese is perfect.  It's also a family owed joint and they are so friendly and welcoming.  We have lived in our place for over two months and after trying many others, we have continued to order from Fratellis for the past 5 weeks in a row.  Hope this review is helpful!

Not sure why this place gets such low ratings. Swung in today for a few slices, sure the place is a little tired looking on the inside, but the pizza was delicious. If you like a thinner, crispier crust, then stop on in.

Came in tonight to grab a few quick slices for my daughter and I. The place was very empty and sort of clean. And I use the term 'sort of' very loosely. They had a few varieties of pizzas to choose from. We got 3 plain slices (very adventurous we are). It was super cheap. 3 plain slices, a bag of chips and a 20oz soda was $7.80. Not bad at all. However the pizza is just lacking in flavor. I've had frozen pizzas that taste better. But my 2 year old? She LOVED it. So I can't really complain.
We order from here all the time! Cheesesteaks are awesome, as well as the pizza! Customer service is top notch and they have great prices. :)

Average food, horrible service. This place was not busy AT ALL on a Saturday afternoon. Nevertheless, when my girlfriend, our kids, and I came in and ordered, the cook/owner shook his head at me while I was ordering, simply because it took us a while to place the order. What an asshole! Clearly he doesn't have kids, or understand that sometimes it takes a while for them to figure out what they want. Anyway, the food came out pretty quickly... the waitress that was working there was pretty quick, so I give her props.

The wrap I ordered was decent. Most of the rest of the food we ordered was average to poor quality. My girlfriend's son never got a slice of pizza that he ordered (the cook mistakenly gave it to another person who ordered after us). This wasn't really a problem, except for when it came time to pay...

When I went up to pay, the cook told me the total. There was no bill, just a number he had written on a piece of paper. I asked to see the bill, and he told me his system was down. Never mind the fact that he wrote everything down when I ordered. Apparently it was too much trouble for him to write up a bill for me. I told him that my girlfriend's son never got the slice he ordered, and to subtract that from the bill. The cook acted like I was lying. He reluctantly subtracted the cost of the slice from the bill, but he kept muttering that he was sure he had given us the slice.

The final straw came when we were leaving. We had a couple plates of the kids' food that we wanted to take to go. I asked for some styrofoam containers and a bag to put them in. The waitress helped us out with that, but she gave me a paper bag to put them in, which was too small. I asked her for a plastic bag, and the cook said, "We don't have any"... which was a lie. There was a pack of plastic bags hanging up on a hook behind him. I had had enough of this guy at this point, so I turned and left the restaurant. However, my girlfriend stayed behind and told the cook, "Sir, there are plastic bags hanging up behind you." The cook ignored my girlfriend and went back to whatever it was he was doing. Eventually the waitress came back over and gave her one.

If you ever find yourself over in this area (possibly because you're going to see a movie), and you think of eating at this restaurant, THINK AGAIN!!!

Pizza very dull. Little bit of sauce. Rude man making pizza.
