Wow. Outstanding. I love tacos but there's no good taquerias in fishers compared to this one. I usually drive out to get tacos unless my mom makes them for me. This place is super authentic. My boyfriend and his mom go here all the time.  They love it. So of course he had to put me on. I had tacos de asada and he had al pastor and a torta. Everything tasted SO GOOD. Not to mention super friendly staff. 10/10 new favorite taqueria!!!

Delicious food & lots of options. We've gotten takeout twice so far, trying tacos with chicken, steak, al pastor (marinated pork), & carne asada. Authentic double-tortillas (corn or flour) come with meat, onions, & cilantro. On the side are green & red salsa, sliced radishes & cucumbers. Bottled Mexican sodas are yummy, too. Recommend!
Tried the steak chimichanga, comes with rice and guacamole.  Fresh and crisp presentation, wonderful flavors.  I'm definitely looking forward to trying the other items on their menu.
The food was made fresh, clean and tasted AMAZING! We tried the California Burrito and the beef and chicken tacos. The salsas we also really good!
This place is clean and the food is delicious, highly recommended, friendly workers  will come back for sure

First time here, we will return! Food was absolutely delicious.  We had a chicken chimmi, steak chimmi, arroz con pollo, and Esquite. 

Esquite is hard to find at a restaurant and one of my favorite Mexican street foods. Theirs did not disappoint.

Very good tortas so glad they open this 
Muy ricos tacos también
The other taqueria I used to go closed downtown 
Noblesville so I was very disappointed 
But I'm glad this place is here to stay 
I hope they put night lights out on their sign to get more 
Customers

Just go - this place is incredible. The loco burrito special was phenomenal and the carnitas tacos were top notch. I would have taken pictures of the food for you but we ate it all. Be warned the red sauce that comes with the entrees is VERY HOT.

Meh. Tacos are okay, the rest really lacks excitement. The cheese is like what'd you'd get at a snack shack or movie theatre. I'd comment on the salsa, but we did not receive ours with our carry out order.  Left me feeling like we should have just made our own. Underwhelmed.

Pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. The service was friendly and fast. The space was clean and well managed. While it feels more like a fast-casual spot, the food quality is better than many full-service Mexican restaurants.

We love their franchise!!! The employees are so pleasant and remember us every time we come in, puts a smile on my face! The tacos dorados are a common craving and the chips and salsa go hard every time. A solid choice with great variety and great flavor.

Service is great here! Friendly and they give you recommendations from their menu. 

3.5 stars - Spinach tortilla veggie quesadilla. This had a lot of veggies in it. The veggies were cut pretty big and was more like a knife and fork kinda quesadilla. Not quite what I expected. 

3 stars - Rice. The rice was undercooked and over seasoned. I couldn't eat it because it was only half way cooked. 

If I'm in a pinch I may go here again. Wish they offered more vegetarian options.

I'm a Mexican food snob but thought this place was delicious! I got carne asada tacos with chips and salsa

Knocked 1 star off update: second time visiting, I placed a carry out order and was told 15 minutes, I came 30 minutes after to pick up and now have been waiting a total of 45 minutes and still haven't gotten my order

We recently ate here for the first time after hearing rave reviews.  The tacos were absolutely delicious and the burritos were good. I liked the corn, but the rest of the family did not. It was a little pricey for almost $5/ear, so probably won't order that again. The queso was lacking in flavor, but overall, the food is good.

If you're a fan of chorizo, you have to try the chorizo tacos here. They are PHENOMENAL!

Both the guacamole and the street corn were good too. 

I felt the chicken taco was a little underwhelming, but it doesn't matter because I will be ordering chorizo every time I come here in there future. 

Did I mention I love the chorizo?

Getting carry out.  It's not been open too long.  Decent selection of foods, including tortas and cemitas.  I love quesadillas and shrimp was an option, so....   Plenty of parking.  No alcohol.  Occupancy max is 52, so will not sit many.  I would guess about 1/2 that now, in Covid.  I enjoyed the food, I ended up eating with a fork, normally I'd eat quesadilla by hand but it was falling apart.  The shrimp taste good.  It's close so I'll try again.  Good option when you want something quick.

This is our first time going there and first impressions are lasting impressions. We ordered two Breakfast burritos w/Bacon. They are not only massive but delicious!  You don't need to add salsa as Pico de Gallo was also in the burrito.  We will definitely go there again.

Awesome
Place great food ! Outstanding breakfast burritos and I am sure everything else they have is amazing also.
Visiting from out to state and had a craving for Mexican food. This definitely was a hit! The burritos and portions are huge and everything tasted delicious.
First visit today after fishing pyrimid lake all day. This place is on point!!! Southern California flavor. It's bomb!!!! Great job. Can't wait to fish so I can eat a burrito  after. Thanks guys .
Yoo, this asada burrito is fire. Definitely getting the fries next time. Try the red salsa too it's bomb. This is definitely going to be my new spot. Kicks Roberto's a**! Plus it's also 24 hours!!

We ordered food here on Grubhub, and we were very excited to try it. I ordered steak fries without sour cream, guacamole, and salsa (weird, I know) and my partner ordered steak fajitas. 40 minutes later our food arrived and we got chicken fajitas and steak fries with everything on them. I couldn't eat mine and my partner said the chicken fajitas were nothing special. We won't be trying this place again.

I was super excited this location opened right down the street in Sparks. Plus, it's open 24 hours & late night options are limited on this side of town. I tried to visit on opening night, but the line was long & my stomach was empty, so I went elsewhere. Tonight, I finally got to try Rivas @11:30pm, after ending a busy restaurant shift. I ordered the steak fries & my boyfriend ordered the carne asada plate w/ corn tortillas. It cost $24 & some change, which seemed somewhat pricey considering we didn't even get drinks. But, we hoped the carne asade was worth it & also a good indicator of the quality of the food. We got our heavy bags, went home & were extremely disappointed once we opened the containers. 
I will lead with the postive: the portions are HUGE...I guess that's the only positive, honestly. I had very few bites of my steak fries. Immediately, the flavor of the meat bothered me. It tasted like it had been cooked on the same dirty griddle from the old philly cheesesteak restaurant that used to be in the same location. It smelled and tasted of old grease, which is really odd because they have completely transformed the building & it should be like new. The guacamole was obviously pre-packaged; it had the bright color and flavor of store bought guac, which was a little disappointing. I was hoping there would be fresh avocados at a Mexican restaurant, but maybe I expect too much. I would have gladly paid as much for 2 pounds less of the steak fries & real guacamole instead. Also, there really wasn't much to the actual fries. Yeah, there was like 10 pounds (ok maybe 3) but it was fries, gross meat, cheese & gross guac. 
On to my BF's food....as you can see in the pic, it is not the carne asada plate that he ordered, but actually what looks to be steak fajitas. He didn't try his. He doesn't eat bell peppers & I think the disappointment of the incorrect order ruined his appetite. I tried it and couldn't get past the flavor of this same gross meat. Didn't try the rice or beans. Didn't care at that point. 
I feel like my 3 stars rating is generous because I will most likely never go back. I wish they gave people reasonable portions, with fresher ingredients and took the time to make sure everything they handed us was correct & something they would actually want to eat themselves. There was so much wrong with such simple food. I will stick to the taco trucks.

It's pretty good food but somewhat lacking. Great portion sizes. Could use some more moisture, I found the California burrito to be reaaaaaalllllyyy dry. Salsa was a little too spicy in my opinion (at the time) and didn't help make the burrito better. It needs some sour cream and pico or something!
Great food! The 24 hour drive thru is also convenient. I purchased the bacon and steak breakfast burritos. Both were great! The value of under $8 each worked for me as well. I'll definitely be back.
Just opened here in sparks very good I had pastor burrito and the .99 crispy chicken tacos my wife had the grilled shrimp taco the verde salsa is very good and hot

LOVE LoVE love the Carson location so I was so excited to see this one open! Unfortunately they still seem to have a learning curve, I always order the el pastor or carne fries with pico,meat and guacamole only...
This location has now messed them up 2x a little frustrating this time they forgot my 2.25 soda as well. So $15 something for fries and a tip is a little outrageous for a screw up. I hope they improve because they are so tasty so that's the 3 stars
Spend over 25 dollars and they charge for a small cup of water.  Then argue when you tell them no and ask for your money back   Food was very bland   Do not recommend   Tables dirty and floor also

.99 Chicken tacos on Wednesday night! Crunchy and yummy. Worth the visit for drive thru, take out or dine in.

We also tried a steak taco and wet bean and cheese burrito. All very good. Horchata was delicious.

Self serve soft drinks are available.

Go check them out.

This is some of the worst Mexican food I've ever had. We got delivery and went pretty basic, some nachos, some authentic tacos and a crunchy taco just because.

The nachos were plentiful, and a good portion, but tasted like... completely unseasoned everything. If you want plain chips, with meat that hasn't even had salt put on it, with guac and Pico that has no seasoning in it, get the nachos.

The authentic tacos were absolutely inedible. There was so much guacamole on them that you couldn't see anything inside of the taco, and on top, was a small sprinkle of Pico. One bite and I had to force myself to swallow it.

The crunchy taco was... okay. Another bland offering that had very little flavor, but a good portion of meat.

The flavors were so incredibly bland, I started wondering if I had covid, and began searching my house for things to smell/taste, of which I could smell and taste everything. Rivas just sucked that bad.

2 stars for the portions, but if it wasn't for that it'd be 1

I was very anxious to try this place! ( used to be Philadelphia cheesesteak which always smelled horrible like bad grease) the place looks so much nicer and has been totally redone! I got the rolled chicken taco's and my husband got the cheese enchilada these came with rice and beans! Beans were so flavorful yum! The rolled taco's were stuffed with chicken and nice and crunchy! Smothered with sour cream,cheese and guacamole! Wow! My husband loved his enchilada. The service was wonderful and quick!  Good I got there when I did as there were 5 cars behind me! We will DEFINITELY be back!

This place opened up in the old Philadelphia Cheesesteak spot.  A great add to this neighborhood and they have the drive through.  They have huge portions, and the prices are great.  Each time I've been it was nice and clean, and they are friendly, and food is served fast.  I've had the nacho's twice and probably will again.  




7/21
Food was delicious! I got steak burrito, chicken burrito, fish tacos. The flavor was soooo and the green sauce was delicious.

Have my whole office hooked on this place. Their carnitas fries and smothered burritos are just too good!! High value large servings with amazing flavor and perfectly cooked meat. Can't stop ordering from them!!

This place is new in my neighborhood and it is the BOMB!!! Food is beyond amazing!! Service is fast and friendly! Best Mexican food made FRESH!!!There is almost always a line but, they are fast so be PATIENT because, items are made to order!  You have to try it you definitely won't be disappointed!!!!!!

This place is open 24 hours. Im at work, 3 of us ordered food. One coworker went t pick it up at 0124 in morning. Guy said, no order, yet I was charged, he was rude in broken english. Yet my credit card was charged, thought I ordered wrong, I checked again, it was ordered for Sparks, NV. Even got confirmation that it was complete, he said, no order. I called when coworker got back, he was very short with me and didnt care, I said I would call his manager in the morning. This wouldve been my first time eating there and now definately my last.

I have hit this place up late at night and Dashed it more than once. They haven't failed to deliver. The pastor is well seasoned and excellent in a torta, but so far I'd have to say my favorite is the plain old chicken burrito. The portions are filling and the prices are reasonable. 

As an aside, I have seen people complain about this place but honestly they do claim to be a gourmet edgy Mexican experience. This is convenient street comfort food and is actually considerably more authentic than most places in Sparks and Reno.

As Joan Rivers used to say, "Can we talk."  I ordered chicken nachos through Doordash.  I should have known there was going to be an issue when it took way longer than the estimated delivery time.  The nachos, when they finally came, were cold and looked like a plate of brown mud.  They screwed up my order. I specified sour cream and guac on the side, but they mixed gobs of it in my mud plate.  Also my drink was not there, and the chips were staler than my breath  after a night of drinking too much.
Best Mexican food ever and I'm from San Diego. Absolutely incredible. I have so far tried the Carne Asada Burrito and the carnitas tacos. Both were the best I ever had.

I placed an order for about 9 tacos. 9 pastor 1 chicken and an horchata. When my food arrived I only received a single tacos. The chicken taco. When I called the store they kept informing me my order was at the store when the order was for delivery. It does not make sense how a almost $40 order only contains one taco. Not only that but the tacos is the saddest thing I've seen

This place has wonderfully flavorful food! The retried beans were delicious and not that usual bland pile that is most common around town. Long wait in car line, but to be expected right now. Was worth the wait!

I got the steak nachos and a Beef hard shell taco: food is amazing! Flavor is great, portions are huge. Had so much steak on my nachos there was a ton left over after I finished my chips I needed a fork. My husband got the pastor sopes combo and steak fries. He couldn't sip raving about how it's the best pastor in town. He has pastor fries to take home too.. Definitely will be coming back over and over
Great find in Reno. Tacos were amazing, menudo was good, green creamy salsa was the bomb. Will stop by again for sure.

So I placed an online order for the rolled taco combo & realized a couple minutes later that I forgot to ask for no sour cream. It's seriously 2-3 minutes later that I'm calling & asking (politely) if it's possible to change that. He says the order is already done, so I ask if they could possibly just remove the sour cream part & add back on new guac & cheese. He sighs & says okay & we hang up.
But THEN for an order that apparently was done within a couple minutes, it then proceeds to take 40 minutes now to be ready. It's 2am too. So I finally get my order & not only is the sour cream not removed, but it's smothered all over the rice & beans too. I ended up just wiping all the sour cream off with napkins & eating them dry & bland. 
I get that it was my mistake to not ask for it in the first place but I was super quick to try to fix it, super polite about it, & in return they do that to spite me. like for what???

Tried this for the first time tonight. The first thing that almost made me immediately leave was the smell. Never have I smelled whatever that was in a restaurant. I can't even identify it but it was awful. Second, they charge you to use a credit card. Ummm no. I'm not paying your business expenses. Sorry. 
So the food itself was....okay. The rice wasn't too bad but the terrines beans tasted EXACTLY like Rosarita in a can. Not that that's a bad thing, I like Those beans but you'd expect more from a restaurant. The chips are not good, the salsa bar is seriously lacking. So overall, absolutely no need to ever go back.
Best breakfast burrito ever!!! The burrito is huge and always very hot and fresh. This breakfast burrito will not disappoint you.

Food was pretty good..Got steak, pork, and shrimp tacos but they charge a fee to use ur debit card...I didn't see the sign until I got to the window..They REALLY need to change that...No one on earth charges for debit card anymore..Not attractive....I paid extra .85 just to get my food..Not kool...

Heard great things about this restaurant. Ordered a DoorDash order, missing items and the two chicken soft tacos that did show up were not very good. The chicken was hard as a rock and when I showed my husband he thought I was joking and had handed him a piece of dog food. Disappointed because I was starving after working all day. Not sure what went wrong here.
Awesome, we went through the drive through. Steak Nachos and Chorizo Breakfast Burrito. Huge portions with quality ingredients.Extensive menu. Definitely going to be go to place.

This place was bumping, and I see why! Kids got chicken nachos and chicken fingers and taquitos. Husband got steak nachos and he said they were amazing! I got steak fries they were great missing the cilantro. We waiting probably 20 minutes for food and it was worth it, serving sizes are huge! Definitely have leftovers. 

I'd like to go back and try there breakfast menu!

I ordered pozole. I got little pieces of meat on a bone, very little hominy and mostly juice. I got stale tortilla chips when I wanted corn tortillas and the price went up., too.
When my friend went to Rivas he asked for menudo with hominy. He asked twice about the hominy and they said yes it has hominy. When he arrived home, no hominy!
It saddens me that prices are going higher and the food is losing its quality. 
It isn't worth the price and I was very disappointed.
Be consistent people, use better quality of meat (since the price is higher) and no bones and stop being 
stingy with hominy, really!

Yuck.  I work nights and get off late, so after one of my co-workers mentioned this place I figured I would give it a try.  Horrible mistake, actually writing this as I'm cooking dinner after throwing my burrito away.  First there is a weird smell to it as one reviewer mentioned.  I can't put my finger on it either.  But definitely not a pleasant one. I could smell it all the way home from the take out bag.  Take one bite of the burrito and couldn't even swallow it.   It was so disgusting.  No flavor to anything except this really bad after taste, kinda goes along with the smell.  They charge you $4 to add guac, $2 to add rice,  making a brcg a $11 burrito.  I wouldn't care if it tasted ok.  But I literally just tossed the whole thing in the garbage.   If it wasn't so bad I might give them another try and chalk it up to being so late at night.  But the horrible taste literally might make me steer clear of Mexican food period, the thought of it now grosses me out.   It was that bad.  Really I'm thinking maybe they used a gross towel or sponge to wipe down the grill or something.  That's the only thing I can imagine making food taste that bad.  I hate leaving bad reviews.   Had really high hopes for this place, but if you want better Mexican food I recommend Roberto's down the street off McCarren.

Best BEST best Mexican food joint, my #1 favorite place to come too... A little on the pricey side, but it's worth it. 

Besides that Just stay away from the manitou, it's not that good.  

5 stars for sure.

This place sucks don't go here! 
I have a lactose intolerance continually ask for no cheese!! Beans!!! Or sour cream spend well over $35 bucks a pop and they always mess up! Always 
Then they laugh when you complain middle finger up guys 
Never have this problem at the Carson location
Awesome food! And the drive thru is open 24 hours. I ordered the carne asada fries and they were so delicious and tasty with a big portion. I will definitely come back
I was expecting my tacos to look like the picture that was advertised but it definitely wasn't and the fish was burned

the food i ordered was not what i was given at the drive thru. shrimp fries yuck the shrimp were under cooked the fries were under cooked the guac looked like green paste the shit was nasty and over priced.
Recently ordered a shrimp burrito. It was early in the morning. Got bad food poisoning. Buyer beware!

I order via door dash and I got a burrito with only meat and guacamole. No beans no sour cream ... wtf am I suppose to with an only meat burrito I am so f***** mad. I was so hungry. And they charge 2.50 for some f****** rice? LAME.

We finally got the chance to stop in and check this place out. We went though the drive-thru and decided to order two breakfast burritos, one with bacon and one with sausage.

They contain potatoes, eggs, cheese, pico and the protein of your choice.  We also asked for green salsa as well. 

When we opened the bag we discovered these breakfast burritos were huge!  My wife had the bacon burrito and really enjoyed it. I had the sausage burrito and enjoyed it as well. 

It's cool that the drive-thru is open 24-hours too!

Very tasty and great for the price, we will be back, in fact, we came again this morning for breakfast burritos. We need to try something else.

We used to love this place and we go here at least once every three weeks. Well we went through the drive-through I ordered two burritos in taco. Got home and there was only one burrito and one taco. I've never been so happy not to eat a burrito. After my husband ate the burrito he got violently sick for three hours and lasted for 72 hours. He got salmonella poison from this place.
Wanted to try this little drive thru. It is very good. I got tacos pastor and shrimp tacos very good even though the pic makes it look not so great. I definitely want to try again.

Stopped here for a burrito on my way to work one morning and decided why not give em a try. 
I ordered my usual goto burrito which is bacon egg and cheese. They asked if I wanted pico in the burrito which I've never tried so I said sure! I wish I didn't the onions were way too much for my liking. But besides that the burrito tasted great, there wasn't too much cheese - a perfect balance of everything! 
They also have a drive thru which was speedy and is just super convenient for a busy mama like me.
I will definitely be stopping here more often! I can't wait to try more.
Absolutely the best " Mexican fast food" I have had! BIG PORTIONS, came out fast and staff was very nice! I will come back again! Thanks for making our first experience wonderful!
Their Pozole and Menudo remind me of home. And of course the tortas are delicious! Keep up the great work Rivas! You definitely will see again.

ABSOLUTELY by far the best carne asada burrito ever!!  Been searching for this forever in this town. At first was sad there were no fillers. beans and rice, but with meat this good who needs them!  I am now addicted. Must. Have. One. In the house at all times. Granted, I usually break it into 3 meals and make my own rice and salad on the side. Thank you Rivas and welcome to the neighborhood.

Felt like "hole in the wall" Mexican food, but needed drive thru and this place came up. We got the carne asada fries, plain quesadilla, wet asada burrito and large horchata. The fries were tasty and my partner loved his burrito. Said it was better than his favorite place that we just had last week. I didn't finish my fries since the portions are huge. Service was faster than Mcd's which I was surprised. I will be back to try a shrimp burrito and tacos.

Worst place in the world. I told them that the order was wrong and I would throw it away. That it was against the health department codes to put food that has hit a table back in the kitchen. The question was shrugged off and the order was not ever filled....
Just got my 2 bacon breakfast burritos... full of dry French fries instead of hash brown... on both... not a mistake... just lazy...
Unbelievable good food for a drive thru restaurant. Huge amount of choices. Our go to place for Mexican food!!
Protein portions are VERY generous, prices are reasonable which is a good thing since I live near by and will be here often.
This place is awesome. Check it out. Ace is best bartender around! Lots is good drinks and food. Games and other cool stuff too.

Pretty good atmosphere! We went for an afternoon snack and drink and were not disappointed. We ordered the buffalo chicken fries, which were very good and enough for the two of us to share over a drink while playing a game of checkers and watching the olympics. They have several two player games and a nice patio outside with several more game options. Also they will let you try the daiquiri flavors and have good specials on drinks.

I've been putting off this review because I needed to get out of my head what this place used to be (cheese burger Eddies) and what I hoped it would be. Because it's not... While I love that they put games outside (bean bag toss, Jenga) I really wanted to be able to eat outside instead of just lounge. The food is just bar food. It's definitely more of a daiquiri shop then cafe. While I heard they are kid friendly I won't be bringing my kid back. All of of tables are tall pub tables. Not great for the little ones. The service was good for being a new place I could tell they were short staffed the evening we went, but they guy was nice and even checked on us a couple of times.

Just had lunch here. It's a nice quick place to grab a bite when you're on the go. The menu looked like it has a good amount of choices like personal pizzas, burgers, and a variety of fries. Also the appetizers look very good, I need to try the jalapeño cheese bites next time. I went with a basic salad and it came out wrong the first time so they actually did not charge me for it, it was very very nice of them and I felt bad but I'm sure I will be back to try more items. Servers are very nice and polite and their frozen daiquiris looked so good on a hot summer day!
Tonight, my husband and I both had the classic burgers. They're 8 oz Angus beef, and tasted great.  I ordered mine cooked medium well, and it was cooked perfectly.  We'll be back!

I was so excited for opening night! As soon as my mom got home she mentioned they were open, and we headed straight over. Because it was opening night, I'm not quite sure if it will remain "seat yourself" or not. The atmosphere tended slightly more towards a bar than restaurant. 

There were so many daiquiri flavors! Wedding cake, peach Bellini, banana, Blue Hawaiian, margarita, Pina colada, strawberry, jungle juice, 190 antifreeze, and White Russian. One I have never tried before was Red Bull. I asked our wonderful waitress, who was from Chalmette, and she said that Red Bull is their signature daiquiri. The traditional flavors will stay, but seasonal flavors may be traded in with other flavors such as wedding cake. She mentioned their other location in Chalmette, and I remembered that it was quite good as well.

My mom and I split the chips and queso with ground meat as well as the taco pizza. Besides a few little messups - it was their opening night after all - everything was wonderful. The employees were very friendly and quick to fix our issues. Unfortunately, the menu does need to be edited. I'm not sure exactly what is the correct version, but our pizza had jalapeños (which aren't in the taco pizza details), and the meat was missing. They offered to rush out another pizza for us, but we opted to keep the pizza we had because we were already pretty full from our tasty queso with meat. We were pleasantly surprised to see that our taco pizza had been backed off our check, and my stepfather will love his leftover pieces of taco pizza with all the additional jalapeños we took off of our pieces. 

We enjoyed the crust of the taco pizza A LOT! It had a good crunch.

Altogether, I believe their opening night is going well. With a variety of daiquiris, a nice selection of food options, and friendly employees they are set for success. We will definitely be back; we have more food to sample!
Ate my burger with no tea. It took that long for a refill. My fiancé ate 1/2 of her pizza waiting for a beer. Food was below average at best.

Pretty good place to grab a cholada fruit and condensed milk beverage or other Colombian ice cream or fruit salad dessert or snack food. :) La Montana on Armenia is my preference for the fruit items and food.. :)

I lean more towards 4 stars than 3 because the dude working there was cool and has very good customer service skills. The guanaba batido was tasty and the guy gave me an extra half cup of it from the blender so that was nice.  Prices are higher compared to other similar establishments (they increased prices recently).  But for that part of town, there's only a couple Colombian places so it's worth checking out if you're in the TNC area looking for a cholado, raspado, etc.

One  just because the paleta ( popsicle) was good! 
We got in and a rude lady was at the counter, we asked for a salad ( they promote on a picture) she said no, asked for arepas and she was giving us some packages of frozen arepas ( really?? )  everything we asked for ( it was on the menu) they didn't have it.
Very disappointed of this place
Amazing food and great service. Just look at the photos. We did not take pictures of the empanadas but they are one of the best in the area. It's worth the visit.

I was in town visiting a friend. We were out drinking the night before and he wanted to bring me to this place to "cure" his hangover. 

We walked in to be greeted by a rude woman telling us not to take pictures. Well that just turned me off.. Not a welcome, or a hi, just a stank face. 

My friend decided to still order since he is a local and comes here. The shake was good but at this point, I didn't want it. 

Tourist people like to take pictures and it could drive more business having people promote it by posting pictures and reviews. 

Customer service is surely lacking here. It's not what you say, it's how you say it. They lost business for sure from us!

If I could rate it 0 stars I would. I waited 30min at the place even though I had placed the order through door dash,I paid 20$ for this prison lunch .nothing had flavor nothing had flavor ,you couldn't even bite into the food from how stiff it was. Never again ! Don't waste your money.

Yummy cholado !
On a blazing hot summer day, you must try the Colombian cholado. It's an ice shaved ice dessert with tropical juices and fresh cut up fruit on top, topped with plentiful condensed milk. It was fantastic. I bypassed the previous reviews of a rude lady because I just needed by fix of sweet goodness. I didn't find her rude at all, if anything she is quick and wants to serve you right.

I came cause I wanted a smoothie. I had to wait a few mins cause the lady was on the phone. When she hung up the phone, she said omg he wasted my time, I'm not giving my things for cheap! So I asked if they had the caldo no, then I asked what I wanted the smoothie they said no cause they had too much work... I just left! Didn't get to try anything, customer service is the key!!!

Being from NYC, I'm used to a different type of Colombian food.  Cholados do not measure up. The Tamales Need more flour filling.  The masato had pieces of whole rice in it(no, no)  Prices went up.  So make sure you look at the menu.  The online prices are old.  
Service was good, staff is friendly.  A one time deal for me.  If you are a tourist snd want to have good Colombian food/fruit salads...This is NOT the place.  We waisted our money and had to throw out everything we bought.

i wish i could give 6 stars. the best vegan blt EVER. staff is so friendly (even when u come in right before close/ sorry bout that). the prices match the portions. hours and location are perfect. really chill atmosphere. love love love. ALSO best gluten free chocolate dessert !!!

We had a WONDERFUL experience at Fully love's the night my daughter graduated from Tucson H. S.! GREAT food, OUTSTANDING service, TERRIFIC ambience! We will DEFINITELY continue to support Fullylove's!

Finally got to try Fullylove's & it definitely lived up to the hype! Warm family run establishment w/ chef casual food. I love places where you get amazing quality but don't have to pay for the frills, which is exactly what you get here. I had the chicken sliders w/ fries. I'm a fry snob and these were on point. The chicken sliders had an original flavor combo of coleslaw, honey mustard, and pineapple on a Hawaiian roll. It was the perfect combo of sweet and tangy. The chicken was breaded and fried just the way I like it (& didn't have any of that chewy sinew which you run into at a lot of places). We had our food delivered to the back bar which they just opened yesterday. Cold beer (they had my fave, Pizza Port Chronic Amber) & awesome service w/ a laid back artsy atmosphere. Looking forward to trying a paint class! I ate my food too fast to snap a photo, but I did get photos of the beautiful hallway on the way out (one of the owners painted the art/hallway herself). Highly recommended!

Very simple and compact menu but you can taste how fresh it is! The spices really stand out from everything from the fries to the burger. The Simple Shorty is a good place to start and the Pineapple Upside Down Cake is a great pace to end!

The best vegan burger I've ever had!!!

I don't usually start my reviews this way, but the v-licious burger is seriously the best vegan (and vegetarian) burger I've ever had. The moment I tasted the truffle oil balanced out with avocado and cheese, I knew I would be posting a review. I haven't stopped talking about this burger since I left!

With my burger I got fries, they were very good, fried up just right. I definitely plan on returning as there are other sides I'd like to try. I would like to see the drinks expanded to include less sugary options but I was okay drinking a capri sun that night. 

Overall a delicious burger joint. It can be tough to find good vegetarian/vegan burgers so I'm super happy to have this option. Go try it, you don't have to be vegetarian to do so!
This place is absolutely amazing and the service beats the food and that says enough about this place. And that food though..... BOMBBBBB
great food especially the deep fried peanut butter smoreoes. Employees were really nice and there is a cannabis friendly art studio in the back. definitely coming back

Onion rings. Enough said. I'm a connoisseur of onion rings, and these are the best I've ever had. Thick slices of sweet onion are battered in the same batter as the chicken, which is unique. There is a lot of fried food on the menu, but it's not greasy! They know how to fry at the right temp so it gets crispy without soaking up the oil. The chicken sandwich was super moist. My only suggestion is to get extra aioli. The burger was just okay. The buns are huge, and the burgers thin. Skip it and get the chicken sandwich. The cheese curds were soft, instead of rubbery, which you typically find. The Mac and cheese was good, too! For dessert, don't skip the fried oreos. I can't wait to go back!

I tried this place for the first time. The lemon pepper wings are so salty and overcooked. The onion rings are okay, Mac and cheese too wet. The bird sandwich is average- I don't like the smoky aioli they put on it.  My son said his hamburger is average. I relied on the 5- star reviews but I was disappointed.
Dessert on a Saturday night. Fullyloves didn't disappoint! Got fried peanut butter oreos and the pineapple upside down cake. Going back soon to try their burgers. Staff were awesome

Stopped by the new location opening today on University and Park. Staff was super nice and explained the menu to my friend and I. Super clean and welcoming environment. I ordered the cheese curds (midwesterner in me) and the bird with fries; I have to say, the seasoning on the curds and fries were great! The front manager who worked the register, Fiesta, kept checking in on us and was super nice and friendly! My friend and I are excited to come back and try more items, especially the SmOreos and Mac n Cheese. We told all of our friends/coworkers about Fullyloves. Happy this place had an opening when all university students left for break, so I didn't have to wait in a long line- lol.

Great spot for a quick bite or vegan eats. 

We had fries and onion rings and they were delicious. 

The from scratch onion rings were very good.  I really liked the fries too. 

Staff was really nice!

came here after having some drinks and was craving a burger and fries. got the classic burger and fries and was not impressed. the burger is all bun with a thin burger and it was extremely salty too. On to the fries, they were hot, really salty, but soggy!  The onion rings had a cakey batter and were not crispy at all. will not come back.

My SO and I were walking down 4th Ave and, even though we had just eaten, my SO wanted to try Fullylove's since it's newer. I was content with my dinner so I just stole a couple of his fries, but I wasn't envious of his burger and fries one bit--the fries tasted like the oil they were fried in was too old and the burger looked unappetizing... I asked him, "How's the burger?" and he showed me the paper thin beef patty and made a grossed out expression as his answer. 

I can't speak personally for the burger, only the few fries, which weren't good, but I will say I don't think I've ever seen my SO this unhappy with food in the last 5 years that we've been together. We left and continued walking down fourth and he commented, "That had to have been the worst burger I've had in ten years. It was like a $5 cafeteria burger, but worse." He went on and on about it until we got to University Blvd, and he's more the quiet type so I was actually surprised by his lengthy dialogue. 

Just when I thought the tale of the terrible burger was over, several hours later when we were in bed and starting to fall asleep, he said out of nowhere, "I just. I just can't believe how awful that burger was..." I chuckled because I couldn't believe he was STILL thinking about it hours and hours later, but it must've really been memorably bad. 

I don't believe I could pay him to go back. But I'm always a believer in second chances so perhaps one day I'll go there by myself and update this review. Not any time soon, though.

Staff was super friendly and helpful. Many Businesses could learn from this place.

Honestly once I sat down i was grumpy and skeptical. I didnt have much dishes to chose from. They have only a few main dishes but they made my chicken sandwich well. I thought the price was high, hence my grumpiness, but I didn't realize I get a side. I  was offered fries, onion rings, veggie chips or sauteed veggies. I went with fries. They tasted like they were freshly cut and seasoned just right. Back to my sandwich. It wasn't some cheap fried patty. The best way I can explain is extra crunchy with big pieces of breading. The bun had the right amount of moisture and crumbled in my mouth. Not like any brioche I've ever had. And the pickles, yum. I am a picky eater and i didnt have to modify the sandwich any way.

The misses had their curds. Pretty tasty as well. They add some herbs that brings it through. Not as heavily battered like Culvers, but not lightly battered either.

The reasons I deducted a star are small amount of curds, the seating was limited and very sticky. The seats and table tops were painted using house latex. My pants were sticking. My arms were sticking so bad that when i lifted my arms some skin was left in the paint. Kinda gross to think how much of other peoples DNA was embedded in the table. Also, I know its petty, but they charged 75 cents for a side of ranch.

The onion rings looked delicious and I hate onion rings.

We also got deep fried oreos. They are good as you can imagine.

I would love to come back, but the 4th street development is causing parking to be a nightmare. 

Oh yeah, they had Franks Red Hot packets. Good move.

Cheese curds are a must have here, great customer service as well everyone here has a great attitude.  The chicken sandwich (the bird) was also great tasted like a homemade bun with a sauce that adds a little kick to it

This place was awesome on 4th and now they're awesome on Campbell. Nestled inside Prep and Pastry, these folks love what they do and the taste of their food tells that story too. The owner is super friendly, he helped carry my families order out to my car, and the staff is always great to connect with. They're really showing up for Tucson, and the pandemic hasn't made it an easy go. Support this crew and your stomach will thank you too!!

Chicken sandwich was awesome, as were the cheese curds. Maybe I don't get out enough but their onion rings were the best I've ever had - obviously made from scratch, fresh to order with great crunch and flavor.

The service was so slooowww!  The cook could only put one order of burgers on the grill at a time.  The cooking grill was large.  The fries & onion rings were cold. Sunking waitress was very attentive but she couldn't make up for the slow food & less than stellar food.
Great place to eat , quick and friendly staff . My son enjoyed the burgers and the impossible burger was incredible there ..

It was so good! The burger was flat like Steak 'n Shake has theirs, but was SO good. The meat had awesome flavor and spices but wasn't overwhelming. The cheesy fries were good, not overwhelmingly good but still delicious. Their Covid regulations were up to par. Definitely recommend!

Amazing what feels like off the beaten path in Nashville. Plus who doesn't love the name. Visited on a road trip taking my son back to college during Covid. While this review is late that had all the protocols in place. 

The food was amazing, I had half a chicken dinner and my son had a pulled pork sandwich with the fixings. The chicken was crisp on the outside and the tender on the inside with a great smokey flavor. I would say the same of my sons sandwich but he ate it so fast I didn't get a chance. Speaks for itself. 

Also good on tap beer selection.

One Trick Pony is definitely rather awesome. Awesome place and the prices are reasonable. Everything I have ever gotten here has been fresh and tastes wonderful. Awesome central location, top-notch service. Can't wait to come back to One Trick Pony for more.
Meat was too salty, bun tasted like cardboard. Onion ring just ok. Save your money go to five guys or go to a real smash burger. Disappointed, won't try again.

We tried this new spot during a recent stop in the Sun King Test Kitchen. I had been following them on Instagram, so I was excited to dig in. The burger was amazing. Had similar style to a Steak 'n Shake with the flattened diner style burgers. I only got a single, but there was options for double or triple. I really enjoyed it. The fries were good, but I will say mine were way too salty. It was almost hard to eat some of them without drowning the salt taste down with some ketchup. Overall though, I really enjoyed the restaurant and am excited to see them grow within the test kitchen.

Ever since I started following their Insta, i've been wanting to try it, and today was the day!   Weather wasn't too bad, it's Sunday so maybe not too crowded, perfect! 

I'm so glad i decided to try it today, it definitely lived up to expectations. 

I love the simple and straightforward menu that OTP has.  It made me decisions a little easier after spending a good amount of time trying to pick the stuff I wanted from the other shops. 

I opted for a single with lettuce , onion, cheese and mayo.  It was a great burger with my only regret is only getting a single.  Not quite enough meat especially compared to the lettuce ratio.  Don't get me wrong, it was perfectly made, I will get that exact thing again but with twice the meat next time.   
Also got the onion rings - they were crunchy and big. I loved them. 

Long story short, it was delicious and I can't wait to go back.

We decided to try this place out. The burgers were delicious. We tried the cheese fries and they did not disappoint! The beer cheese was so yummy. Can't wait to go back and try the loaded fries. We will definitely be back again!
Their burgers are SO good and very reasonably priced. Love the chili burger and regular burger. Onion rings are usually top too.

Drove out of our way to enjoy the burgers and onion rings and are looking forward to doing so again! My wife tried the veggie burger that they were testing, even tho they didn't have it on the menu. They could have easily said "No" but very generously cooked one up. It was excellent!  Excited to go visit again!

They do smash burgers well, exactly as stated in their logo. I'm also still dreaming about those onion rings with cheese sauce, best onion rings I've ever had! And friendly, quick service is a big plus! We'll be back.

Workers were very kind but was disappointed in the food. The food was overpriced. My burger barley had any meat, on it, but was overflowing with toppings. It also tasted burnt. My cheese fries were also very expensive and were way too salty.

Wait time was long. Ordered online and was shown 20 minutes. After twenty minutes, was told 10 more. I ended up waiting 10 minutes beyond that, 40 total minutes. It looked busy, but it didn't look like there was much organization in the kitchen. Grill mostly empty, no one taking charge. Burger tasted good but since they put two burgers, only partially wrapped in foil on the bottom of the bag under two orders of fries and onion rings, the burgers were destroyed during the walk up stairs to my table. I can only imagine the atrocities you'd find if it was carried further or driven somewhere by Door Dash. I thought the idea of cheezwhiz on onion rings sounded endearing, but it was very anticlimactic. It appeared to be straight out of the can and was very heavy tasting and applied heavy handedly. The chili on the fries was lackluster as well and no utensils were in the bag so it was a messy adventure. 

It wasn't all bad. The staff was polite even if inefficient. The big bright spot was the thin, crispy edge burger and the dandy sauce. Both tasted great. 
Better packaging for take out would be necessary. See photo for how burger was wrapped. This was laying in the bottom of the bag. 

I expect far more from a place where 2 burgers and chili fries and a pile of onion rings with cheez whiz is $42. 

It's good, but there are other options at the test kitchen and I'll try them.

This spot is about to take all my money. When discussing smash burgers this is exactly what you want. Easily in the top 2 or 3 smashed burgers I've ever eaten. It's that good. The onion rings were the surprise. I've found it difficult to locate a high quality onion ring, but my quest is over. I could eat a pallet full of those rings. For a burger and rings then there isn't another joint in the fishers area that even comes close

I took one bite into my cheesy fries and was awakened to the fact that I've truly never had crispy fries before until the ones I got here. The crinkly fries were so perfectly crispy, hot and tasty that I really felt like I had a fry awakening. You can choose fries or onion rings, then have them cheesy style (cheese on top), three-way (cheese, chili, roasted chiles), four-way (cheese, chili, roasted chiles, sour cream) or oui oui (garlic French onion gravy). 

I also got a single stack burger, NJB style (mustard, pickle, onion, shrettuce, American cheese). All of their burgers are diner-style smash burgers and you can get anywhere from one to three patties. You can then get those roadhouse style (with American cheese), old John style (shrettuce, pickle, onion, tomato, mustard, Mayo, American cheese), dandy (shrettuce, onion, pickle, tomato, American cheese, rempujase) or the NJB style, mentioned above. Soooo delicious! 

Shout out to local chef Neal Brown for crushing another local foodie endeavor. Located in the Fishers Test Kitchen in Sun Kung, it's a fun environment and great spot to try a new food. There is hand sanitizer everywhere and you'll go up to the counter, order, get a buzzer, and then pick up your food yourself when it's ready. Enjoy!

I will be dreaming of this burger til the next time I leave my Broadripple bubble and venture to a place called Fishers.

My only regret is I ate it while driving instead of enjoying it at a table. 

I had a jam packed day full of adventures which includes my first trip to OTP. I got the Dandy burger which had a lovely herby remoulade. I also got a nice side of onion rings. They were crispy and well friend While I was clogging my arteries I thought "why not get a coke?"  It's in the glass bottle. Enough said. 


P.S. They don't put ketchup on their burgers. It saved me from saying "no ketchup. Because ketchup the worst.

I ordered the "Old John" single cheeseburger (no onion, please) ... and wow! Tasty, just-right juicy, good-sized, and liberal with the toppings. Price was just right.

I will be back!

A couple weeks earlier, I'd went to try a single hamburger at a new fast-food place near the Sun King Brewery/Fishers Test Kitchen, which is where One Trick Pony is located. That other place's burger was the same price, but small and had a much more conservative amount of toppings.

GOOD but no Shake Shack. With Shake Shack literally right in front of this  place I took a chance and ate here.   Bad decision.  Shake Shack has the perfect burger and this place just tries hard. Probably the meat blend. Again not bad and if it was anyplace else than right next to Shake Shack it would have been higher!! Oh and their Oklahoma onion burger barely had any onions...what's up with that?!

If you have not visited the Fishers Test Kitchen it is a MUST! There are several options to choose from. We chose burgers from here and fries from Korave. The dandy sauce was delicious it tasted like Mac sauce but not as thick. I loved how thin the burger patties were. My husband on the other hand likes a thick burger. It just depends which you prefer. I give it 4 stars because it needed a little more sauce. It was lacking in flavor. Next time I would ask for extra sauce!

My friend and I tried out One Trick Pony inside Sun King Fishers Small Batch Brewery recently. I'd highly recommend ordering a double or triple patty sandwich because the burger patties are insanely thin! Extremely delicious even as thin as the patties are. The burger tasted similarly to a In-N-Out burger in my opinion. They offer the delicious crinkle cut fries. There's no seasoning on the fries but the silverware packs come with a little salt and pepper packet so if you wanna spice up those crinkle cuts, shake away. Highly recommend trying out this place and while you're at- order a delicious Sun King beer for burger beer pairing!

One of the success stories of the Fishers Test Kitchen at the Yard is that there has already been a transition from one of the businesses to a replacement.  One Trick Pony has stepped into the last kitchen area in the row of pop up test kitchens next to Sun King.  I got a chance to talk after my lunch with the man running the restaurant.  He has grand hopes for franchising his concept across the whole country to maybe 1200 businesses!  Talk about ambition.  The key to that is finding out how your first business is received and ironing out any problems before you go big!  I must say that this is an impressive start.

First, the name:  "One Trick Pony" refers to their logo which states "We do one thing really well.  An that's hot, fresh, smashed burgers that are diner style, made to order, & pressed on a hot griddle".  That is definitely true.  I ordered a double burger and each of the patties (about a quarter pound) was individually seasoned and seared to bring out the deep beef taste.  

Know that you can order a single, double, or triple burger.  Instead of telling them what you want on your order, they have "Styles" of toppings you can select.  I picked the Old John style which has shrettuce (shredded lettuce), pickle, onion, tomato, mustard, mayo, and American Cheese.  There are several other styles you can order and if you need other condiments, there were some packets near the cash register, so be sure to look if your "style" doesn't come with a particular one.

I also ordered a side of fries.  You can get just plain fries or onion rings, but you can also order them with many types of sauces/cheeses (basically a poutine).   

Let me say that the first bite of my burger had a great crunch to it!  Crisp toppings (pickle, onion, tomato) and a crisp sear to each of the burgers was a pleasant surprise.  That's the way I like my burger and although there was a lot to eat, I didn't feel like I had any trouble fitting these smashed burgers in my mouth.  (Much different than eating the half pound Big Mouth Burgers that are usually underseasoned and rely upon the toppings for flavor.  If anything, by seasoning each of the burgers, they were almost too salty by the end, but they didn't get too bad because of all the toppings on mine.

The cheesy style fries were okay.  The cheese reminded my of the creamy smooth Cheez- Whiz style so that it could be pourable/dip-able.  I noticed that the cheese was poured directly onto the fries and by the time I got to the end, the fries were getting soggy.  After lunch, I stopped by and asked if the owner would like any feedback.  I suggested they pour the sauces/cheese for the fries into a small cup and let the customer dip the fries.  He said he really like that idea and thought it would be really helpful for carryout orders.  So if you get fries with a topping and don't want to eat them first, simply ask for the sauce on the side!

The stand along fries seemed crisp and already salted, so my wife grabbed some ketchup packets from the counter for hers.

Overall, we really enjoyed our food and interaction with the owner.  

One thing you should be aware of if you go in for lunch:  Sun King doesn't open until the middle afternoon, so you will need to order a beverage from the restaurant, or wait until later in the day if you want a beer with your meal.  Don't blame One Trick Pony if you can't get a beer.  This business is not associated with Sun King in any way other than sharing the same dining room.

Note that like the other food places in the Test Kitchen, you pay when you order and they give you a buzzer that lets you know your food is ready to come pick up.  That way you can stake claim to one of the seating places in the common seating area.  Also note that napkins and plasticware are located at stations near the entrance.  Down below is the place you can throw away your trash.  (I believe Sun King busses the tables later in the day.)  Near those stations, they also have sanitizer and cloths you can use to spray your own table and chairs before sitting if you are uncertain when the last time it was sanitized.  

It's nice to see a new business looking successful during these difficult times.  We enjoyed our experience and would gladly return to dine again!

Note that it isn't a cheap burger place like the fast food places, but depending upon the number of burgers you stack on your sandwich, the price can climb fairly fast.  But the prices are clearly posted.  Just pay attention before you order and you will be okay!

Review #3816

I'm not one to visit The District as it's quite busy. This evening though we had some friends from out of town who wanted to go to the Sun King Brewery and since the test kitchen is there we also made it dinner. Ordering was easy and the service was good but the food...is unimpressive. 

I got the RazorBack and my wife got a Build-Your-Own (basic burger). Both of us commented that you can get a better burger at the local Culvers, and for a lot less. There just wasn't any flavor in our burgers. My bun was a bit stale on the top, not sure why. Also, I'm not certain what Dandy sauce is, but I can tell you that it doesn't really have much of a flavor thus it wasn't dandy.. I expected that a $12 burger would be pretty great but it was pretty disappointing. There just wasn't any flavor...at all.

Next up, the chilli-cheese fries. These too fell flat. I felt like I was eating them to just get the money back that I'd spent on them. I didn't enjoy them. The fries are just you basic crinkly fries. The cheese and chilli...meh. I'm not sure what all of the intent is here but It all falls flat and fairly tasteless.

Given that there are sooooo many great burger places around, some for a fraction of a cost, to have an expensive burger that is fairly tasteless and chilli-cheese fries that are attempting to be something they are not, you are better off trying something else.

I rarely write a bad review as I can usually find something to find some pleasure in, but this was one of those places. So a couple of stars for the friendly staff.

Terrible service and took a very long time to get our food. They also gave us the wrong burger. We returned it and had to wait again. When we got the onion rings they were over cooked. Very disappointing considering how there's so many options in burger joints, and they can't do better. Also the associates didn't apologize for the mistake.

by far the worst burger 
I ever ate. meat was over cooked and the cheese was thick cheese wiz, no flavor and portions was terrible. that' a large fry in the picture. no ketchup mustard mayo, I was sitting upstairs wait for my food to be ready and when I got down stairs it was just laying on the counter where anyone could had cough sneeze or whatever on it. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE. waste of time and money. smh

one trick pony is an indoor quick service restaurant that serves hamburgers. it's located inside of fisher's test kitchen. you place your order at the counter and if you choose to eat inside you'll receive a buzzer that alerts you when your food is done.
 
i totally should have listened to the reviews more because i wasted my money and am still upset about it. i'm very confused on this place's existence tbh. overpriced - mediocre- why? i was hoping my food would magically turn into a meal from five guys (price) or steak 'n shake (taste) . having a cold bun cold lettuce on a thin patty is ..., i mean girl i guess. the fries were good & seasoned. the portion of fries is great too. the cheese whiz lololol. if you're only going to have one trick you need to be thee best at it. -- i'd get a side of fries if i returned & needed a snack or something---

staff was okay. not nice but not rude// they did their jobs ya know?

This place is located in the Fisher's Test Kitchen. You can also get to it through the Sun King Brewery.  The Test Kitchen consist of three restaurants, one of which is the One Trick Pony. This restaurant's one trick is burgers, which they have a few exotic choices of. They also have fries, onion rings and other sides. The place was very clean and orderly.

There is indoor seating and a very nice outdoor patio that has music playing out there.  I am not sure who owns the seating, whether it is Sun Kings, or the Test Kitchen.  I believe that it is shared.  But when you do sit down and eat, a waiter/waitress from Sun King will come out and ask if you want anything.  For me that was a bonus, I got one of their frozen drinks to wash down my meal. But for those of you that are not drinking, it may be a bit awkward.  They do have non-alcoholic drinks

I got a little crazy and ordered the Whiz Bang Burger with two patties and had them add some bacon to it. I ordered a side of fries for good measure.  The food was delicious. I really liked the burger. It is smash burger type and decent sized. Very top notch.  It was extremely flavorful and filling. 

This is a wonderful addition to a trendy section of Fishers. It is a semi-fast food joint that is available for dine in or carry out. If you are looking for a good burger, look no further. This is the spot.

Tried to eat here after hearing good things about this place but the employees are not properly wearing masks. 2 of the employees cooking had their masks down below their noses. There were 5 employees there in total with one who seemed to be the manager. So you would think someone would have told them to wear their masks correctly. Disappointing.

Popped in for lunch after a day of shopping . I got the dandy with bacon and a side of fries to share. 

The fries were COLD. Literally cold. Absolutely disgusting.

We got 2 dandy burgers with bacon. The bacon Is from smoking goose which is a favorite. The burger however was extremely soggy. The bun was falling apart. All in all, this wasn't the best experience .

This is what I've been hunting for.  A burger place that makes a regular burger that is really good.  This is one of if not the best burger I have ever had.  It is very similar to steak and shake, but not gross or greasy/oily/wet, but still juicy in the right way.  The fries are good too.  They were a bit over salted.  I will be eating here again soon!

I've been dying to try this place. It's one of the new restaurants at the Fishers Yard in with Sun King. I saw on their Instagram page they were running a special on Thursday's, a single burger and fry for $6.00 so I finally made it there last night and it definitely did not disappoint. 
 
I ordered my single patty with cheese, shredduce, tomato, pickles, mustard, and ketchup. All the vegetables were crisp and fresh, loved the pickles they are thick and they put several on my burger. Also love that the lettuce is shredded (hence the word shredduce). If I had to do it over again I think I would order a double though because the patties are thin, go with the less is more on a single. But don't let the thin patty fool you it's full of flavor! 

The fries were absolutely amazing as well! Hot and crunchy! Everything is made to order so it's all hot and fresh. 

Definitely recommend OTP if you've got that " I just need a good cheeseburger and fry craving"

Went back tonight and luck for OTP the first time
Was amazing. Tonight, if this was my first visit I would go back.

We ordered 3 burgers, 2 cheese fries, 2 onion rings. The griddle needs a serious cleaning as the meat tasted like old grease and was burnt to a crisp. Onion rings where black and hard. Cheese fries where just fries, NO cheese, no salt.

VERY DISAPPOINTED $70.00 of bad food!

I was really looking forward to trying this as I absolutely love the smash burger. Unfortunately this was not a good experience. Not only was the food bad, the cook that was preparing the food was not wearing gloves. Very odd, especially during COVID. When placing burgers on the buns, he was adjusting everything with his bare hands and then wiping his hands on his clothes. See pictures of the cheeseburger.

I second that review! Awesome burgers you can choose from their selection or build your own. And only $5. Seems like I've been paying more than double that at most restaurants these days. Pair your burger with a brew from Sun King in the Test Kitchen confines or on their upstairs or downstairs patio.

One Trick Pony was a hit for us during a recent grab and go experience at the Fishers Test Kitchen. It had been a bit since our last visit so we decided to make the trek to check out the latest addition along with Lil' Dumplings temporary winter ramen menu. Note that carryout is fairly easy here but that they also have plentiful outdoor (summery spaced out) seating available. 

The "no frills" double smash burger topped with lettuce, onions and cheese knocked out socks off. From the crispy edges of the burger to the juicy center and flavorful onions, we savored every bite. Next time we'll have to try the cheesy fries or loaded onion rings. The menu is limited for a reason- but fret not, you don't need any other options  Congrats, Neal and OTP team. Looking forward to our next visit.

My husband and I really enjoyed the burgers here. I had the single dandy burger. The patty was thin and crisp and the dandy sauce had a little bit of tang. The cheese on the cheese fries was also delicious. It was warm and very flavorful. My husband got the burger with melted cheese and fried jalapeños. I tried a bite and it was very good. We'll be back so we can try more burgers on the menu!

Love this place! Such a great addition to the Fishers Test Kitchen that brings the best smash burgers I've ever had! First time I visited I ordered a single patty with shreduce, pickles, cheese and dandy sauce and it was delicious! I'm a sucker for some crinkle cut fries and these were fried to my liking with an extra crunch! All burgers are customizable to your liking and you can have up to 3 smash burger patties per sandwich. 

For St. Patty's week they brought in a Reuben twist. I ordered it with a single burger and all the toppings and I think I ate it all in like 2 bites? If you haven't tried OTP yet, this is your time to go and try this new "burger" before it leaves after this weekend. They also just opened up a second location in the sun king in Broad Ripple so if you're looking for something a little more south check out the new location. What's better than a tasty burger and ice cold beer? All food in the test kitchen is a self serve and then a sun king server takes all the drink orders!!

This restaurant is one of the Test Kitchen restaurants at Sun King Brewery in Fishers. We tried the Oklahoma Onion Burger and Green Chili Cheeseburger. Both were excellent. Thin crispy patties with fresh tasty toppings. Cooked fresh and ready quickly. The Onion Rings and Fries Three Way are great sides. The small orders are generous. Cool concept and great execution

I thought this was going to be a good burger place but the burgers I got were burnt and inedible yuk.  This was the one in Fishers.  Maybe I went on a bad day but it was terrible food sorry.  I'll try the one in Broad Ripple next time.

Not much to say because it is simple. Smash burger, add American Cheese, put on a bun, lettuce tomato, eat. Seriously the best tasting burger in the Indy area. I am addicted to the French Onion Sauce and the plastic cheese sauce drenching crinkle cut fries. It is simple, but so, so good. 

I am not surprised that this is one of the best burgers I have ever had since it came from the same chef who introduced me to the peanut butter, mayo and pickle sandwich (maybe that sandwich should make a comeback here!?!?). 

Get in while you can.

IG is how I learn about new places so when I had the chance to go check it out I took it, one trick pony is located in the fishers test kitchen, think of the test kitchen as a nice food court.
The menu is pretty standard but sometimes it's nice to get back to basics. I got a burger with everything and some fries.
I was impressed with my burger, it's the smash style which is one of my favorites, nice crispy outer rim, and the middle was juicy and flavorful.
The fries are worth checking as well, crispy and just the right amount of salt. Don't forget the Mayo and ketchup to dip.
All around great experience, and a place I would go again!
I got food poisoning in that place once and I haven't been back I just don't trust once I get sick somewhere that said I never go back but I hope you enjoyed it

This place is so local to home and I could've be happier that it is open. 
One of my first times in and it's a great vibe in this place. My waitress (her name was Nicole, I think she was blonde) was cool and very attentive- she fixed my drink right away when it came back incorrectly. 
For being new it already had an awesome vibe, and great staffing- everyone seemed so happy and kind. Will be coming back for sure!

Food was spot on!!! And waiter was very friendly. Order the philly's cheesesteak with a side of tater tots and a blue moon. Food and service was so awesome I had to tip not only the waiters but the chef also. Definitely be back during happy hour again.

This was our first meal out post-Covid so I might rave just from that fact alone, but we really enjoyed out meal at Flowing Tide. It is newly opened and they did a great job revamping the space making it comfortable and upbeat. Doesn't look like the old place at all. My husband had the blue cheese burger and was very happy with it. Cooked to a perfect medium. I had the seafood platter which is an app and it was huge. Gt a side of fries which I definitely didn't need but was tasty. Both were enough for leftovers for another night. Their drink and on-tap beer selection was ample. Servers were all very friendly and efficient. Welcome to the neighborhood Flowing Tide.

So glad to have a FTP in our neighborhood! Went there yesterday with a large party and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Ruben sandwich was on point, fries are fantastic, the salads are both fresh and enormous...frankly, I can't wait to eat my way through all their various (and numerous) offerings. Thank you, FTP, for coming to South Reno!

Pictured is the buffalo chicken wrap and the sampler platter. Came her back in May with my gf a couple times when we were in town. Came back in August, and the bartender remembered our drinks like it was yesterday. Big statement, but Adrian is the best bartender we've had ANYWHERE! Above average bar food, huge menu, and awesome staff. And open 24/7?! Forget it, if we lived here, there's no question that this would be our neighborhood bar. Thank you for the hospitality!

These covid times are just too darn frustrating.  I had a small amount of time to get lunch with my wife, so we called ahead and got ourselves on the "reservation" list.  Thankfully they had space!

When there all of the precautions were being taken as could be expected.  The daily special was some sort of turkey sandwich and a cup of clam chowder.  SOLD!   When it came out..it was great.  Flowing tide is one or two steps up from bar food as you would normally expect it.  It's not fancy pants snobby food.  Just good food.  That is why it's a great choice when nothing really sounds good.  You can almost always find something that sounds good there.

We didn't get any drinks because I was on lunch.  The service was great too...the food came quickly and our tab was handled quick as well.  

I will be going back whenever the mood strikes me...which should be more often than not.

Not impressed with the Bloody Mary.  It was very brownish red, and so spicy it was undrinkable and gave me an upset stomach.  The pre-made mix had either gone bad or was plain made wrong.

In anu event it has sent back.

One of our go to places for happy hour. cocktails are only $2.25 each. A great deal. most of the appetizers are five or six dollars. they have a good selection. We really enjoyed the chicken nachos a lot of food and very flavorful. We've tried most of the things on the menu. The potstickers were good but they're fried and not steamed.  I prefer steamed potstickers. Our waitress was great overall good service and the place was full. Sanitation was in place.
Terrible service. Our bartender took our order then went outside for the rest of his shift then enjoyed the rest of his night gambling and never spoke to us again. Don't really think about that.
This is our favorite FTP location. Great service, always... and consistently excellent food. NO SMOKING huge plus and an awesome Happy Hour!

Food was fine drinks were good. Went in there with two friends and had a decent time. Turns out today, the blonde bartender had an issue with me I only just found out about. I hadn't even thought about this experience until I had an acquaintance who goes there said she had complained about me being an asshole. My friends I was with, said they didn't notice anything about me because they were busy eating. But they also said if I had done something in poor taste they would have noticed. I did nothing wrong to her, at all. I thought of it as an extremely ordinary dine out. Well now someone I know personally has a low opinion about me because the bartender decided to talk about me behind my back in a slanderous fashion. I've worked in the industry for almost ten years and I never treat servers poorly. So I wont be going back and I'm sure my acquaintance will be upset with me for writing this review. Dont care. Wont be going back. UPDATE: this same server is still talking to my acquaintance and is now complaining about this review. My acquaintance let me know. Avoid this place like the plague and this is absolutely shameful.

First time going to this location and I have to say, this is my favorite location. Super spacious, super clean, nice and new. I love that there's so much space. I feel like the location closest to me is so jammed pack. 
.
I went to happy hour at 10 pm. It was great. We all ordered some drinks, wings, nachos and tacos. Our waitress was so nice. I forgot to catch her name, but thank you!!! This is a great neighborhood bar if you are looking for one. The food at happy hour is great for the price. I only wish the nachos had classic nacho cheese, but it was still good! Thanks flowing tide!!

90% chips
5% chicken
5% shredded cheese(cold & gross)
Nacho Supreme $10.99 RIDICULOUS!!!

Inedible due to rock hard chips and cold shredded cheese that clumps up. Took a few bites of the chips and had to toss it. This was not the nacho I'm use to. I rather have melted cheese instead of shredded cheese. I'll stay away for awhile.

I would like to give a special kudos to this Flowing Tide for accommodating my family last night. We had a wonderful time, we love coming here for the Ship Wreck and we also got to try the Scooby Snack shot we've been hearing about.. It was actually really tasty and will order one every time I come now. I'm sad I didn't get a picture to share with you all, but I highly recommend giving it a try!

Okay last night me and a couple of friends wanted to go to happy hour at Flowing tide because we wanted to eat their $6 appetizers. We've gone to 3 flowing tides, and due to covid and restrictions they were all ful capacity and they wait was way over happy hour hours. So one of the places reccomended to their new flowing tide and honestly this place is a diamond in the rough. I'm guessing not a lot of people know about this location so when we got in we were seated right of the bat. Our server was very polite and attended us in a timely order. 2 of us ordered the tide wings and the other chicken tacos. I also ordered a side of nachos fir the table too. Honestly everything was very good, everyone well spread due to covid and everyone wearing masks and moderate noise level. The food was very good also. And honestly I may have to say their wings maybe better than the ones at their Prater location. All I gotta say is good job at this location. Might go there more often since all the other locations are so packed nowadays. And the wait list way too long. But I do understand because of covid. Hopefully this place stays very moderate and not many knowing of it.

FYI - This restaurant is open 24/7, not sure why their business hours aren't posted here on Yelp. They have not one, not two, but THREE happy hours, their food is delicious and portion sizes are generous (the half order of nachos can feed 2-3 people easily). This is my go-to spot whenever I have visitors from out of town. Friendly staff as well! Highly recommend.

Great new addition to this end of town! Erika is awesome, glad she was able to transfer to this new location. Good food and great service make this a nice new place to become a regular at. They have a nice selection of drafts with the standard Tide food menu shared with the other locations. Décor turned out nice and contemporary too.

UPDATE 12-1-21
Ever since my first visit I've been hankering for fish and chips again. As predicted...my husband and I SHARED ONE ORDER. (SEE PICTURE OF TWO PLATES...that's one order) Megan was a spectacular waitress. She had them split one order onto two plates. Soooo very thoughtful and appreciated. THANK YOU!  After eating I was really already full but since we split an order we went ahead and shared a piece of caramel cheesecake. And now I'm definitely happily overstuffed again. 

NOTE TO SMOKERS...this location is a non-smoking Pub. If you want to smoke go to the location on Longley. I wanted to try that location today but it was too smoky for non smokers with lung issues, so we left and came here. Each table there has an ash tray...so smokers should love it!

Original Review...
Today is my first visit here after researching Fish & Chips on Yelp. It's been decades since my last trip to London but for some reason I've been dreaming of Fish & Chips. Haven't had them for probably 20 years because they were never good "enough" to measure up to London. THE secret to perfect fish and chips is the thinnest crispy batter. I AM SO DELIGHTED TODAY. I believe these are even BETTER than my memory of how much I loved them in London...TOP THAT OFF with understanding I have never even heard of BEER BATTER FRIES, and I'm sitting here OVER THE MOON. I usually don't even like fries. Oh my gosh golly gum shucks. I have never had French fries THIS DELICIOUS. Honestly though, the TARTER SAUCE is the real reason I usually eat fish.  And once again, I'm so picky it's hard to find PERFECT tarter sauce. But HERE IT IS. Even the coleslaw was PERFECT SLAW. And the kicker is HUGE PORTIONS. So if I could give this place 10 STARS I definitely would with regards to fish and chips. I'm actually taking half my meal home. Very unusual for me. I usually just stuff myself because I was taught not to leave food on my plate. But half DID stuff me. I will SOOOO BE BACK. But next time we will split one meal. Which makes eating here a serious BARGAIN. 

My husband doesn't eat hamburgers. Breakfast ended at 11 so the excellent waitress (NANCY) has earned her tip. She made several SMILING trips to get answers for me...and found out ALL the burgers could be ordered with a veggie burger patty. He got the mushroom burger and said it was excellent. But that probably won't matter for us because he will forever be forced to split Fish & Chips with me. (:-)

I'm just guessing that if OUR meal was THIS GREAT...most everything here is probably very good. 

ITS A SPECIAL DAY when I go in search of a special taste sensation from my youth and discover a place that not only meets my hopeful expectation but EXCEEDS IT. 

If you find this review useful please vote!

Food was fine drinks were good. Went in there with two friends and had a decent time. Turns out today, the blonde bartender had an issue with me I only just found out about.
