I hadn't even thought about this experience until I had an acquaintance who goes there said she had complained about me being an asshole. My friends I was with, said they didn't notice anything about me because they were busy eating. But they also said if I had done something in poor taste they would have noticed. I did nothing wrong to her, at all. I thought of it as an extremely ordinary dine out. Well now someone I know personally has a low opinion about me because the bartender decided to talk about me behind my back in a slanderous fashion. I've worked in the industry for almost ten years and I never treat servers poorly. So I wont be going back and I'm sure my acquaintance will be upset with me for writing this review. Dont care. Wont be going back.

Nicely designed interior and very clean and spacious.  Surprisingly expansive menu and some great daily specials.  Our waitress was delightful.  This location is family friendly although the kids menu is pricey and lackluster (kids were better off just splitting a regular menu item).

Great regular pub menu items like burgers and sandwiches with generous servings of crisp fries.  Tacos were great for the specials price of 2 for $4.  Cauliflower buffalo wings were really delicious, crispy and doused in buffalo sauce with thinly sliced celery and blue cheese crumbles.  Very tasty but definitely share as it's not something you can eat a lot of.  The only disappointment was the kids menu mac and cheese.  It was a large portion, but tasted like generic boxed mac made with margarine, thin and runny for $8. 

it's a gem, especially if you live nearby or are having a park play date.

So glad to have a FTP in our neighborhood! Went there with a large party and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Ruben sandwich was on point, fries are fantastic, the salads are both fresh and enormous...frankly, I can't wait to eat my way through all their various (and numerous) offerings. Thank you, FTP, for coming to South Reno!
Amazing vibes, the salmon was cooked perfectly. Although service was a little slow that only added to the anticipation of eating this beauty
The whole bar looks amazing and Taryn was amazing. Great service and great personality! Definitely would come see her again!

We love flowing tide. I know it's a pub but this one is kid friendly and it makes for a relaxing dinner with the toddler. I get something different every time and have not had a bad meal yet. We even came here for our kid's birthday!

Omg, finally getting back to some sort of civilization and its great.  This place is super clean and the staff are more than friendly. I think they've been waiting to serve people as much as we were wanting to be served.  And finally a draft beer.  So I ordered the BBQ burger with some modifications because I'm on keto so the pic won't look like a normal BBQ Burger would.  Hubby ordered the chicken tacos.  They were both delicious!  The portions were great and my burger was cooked perfectly for me.  We will be back!

This place rocks!  We love everything and everyone here.  Our favorite is Emily!  Friday thru Sunday days till 4.  She's so funny, her personality kicks ass and she's pretty easy on the eyes. Then there is Kaylyn.  Good times when she's on, Monday thur Thursday days till 4.  And I gotta give a shout out to Rick and Stacy they come on around 4 and we always have a blast with them!  The rest of the crew Megan, Erika, Haleigh,  Kayla, Taryn, Nichole, Lisa, and Ashley are awesome!  The food is great so shout out to the cooks!  Oh and I can't forget Sergio, the busboy, he really does a great job!!  This place is so great we visit it 2 to 3 times a week!

7 days a week HH with beer discounts during games.

Half of this is a bar with food and game tops, the other half a non-smoking restaurant. The variety of food (their standard FT menu) is chock full of pub grub to seafood. Friendly service. Always find myself here when I crave a ciopinno, a beer, a game or a massive burger.

Located on the corner end opposite the Raley's. Across from the park.

Enjoyed some Latin ways at the Localtopia festival in St. Pete.  I love sampling this and that, so I ordered two empanadas  (one beef, and other one artichoke-spinch) for $2.00 each, and an order of yuca for $5.00.  The order took under 10 minutes on this crowded Saturday afternoon event.  Both flavor empanadas was very flavorful, but the artichoke-spinach was my favorite!  The order of yuca contained about 8 or 10 stripes topped with fresh garlic , served with two small containers of mojo dipping sauce -Excellent!

Great taste and value.  Highly recommend.
Food is phenomenal here. The ladies working the truck are very sweet. I wish they had a permanent location so I could eat it every day!

So so good. I ordered a bunch of stuff because I am a bit picky and figured if I ordered a lot I was bound to like something. May have been a mistake because I LOVED everything, by the end I was painfully full but had to keep eating because it was just so delicious. I highly recommend!!!!

This food truck is amazing.  There's a reason now I know, why they sell out.  Their Cuban sandwich and tostones are phenomenal.  There really is no comparison, I've never had them so crispy but soft at the same time (tostones) and with chunks of garlic.  Yum!
Mofongo, Mofongo!! Oh how delicioso you are!! Enjoyed this VERY tasty lunch at the Indie Flea market. A nice side salad made for a very happy tummy!!
Came for the buffet... but no buffet... order from the menu ... good... but wanted to try buffet style... maybe they will fix... excellent food although..
The food is great,their is a lot of choices to choose form, the service is good, they're employers have such great humor

Very good Mexican buffet, 7.49 plus 1.99 for drink at lunchtime 9.99 for dinner. They have everything on the bar, burritos, chimichangas, tacos, taco salads, a topping bar, anything and everything. Well worth the stop, they keep it fully stocked at all times.

A friend of mine told me about this place. And I love the idea of a Mexican buffet and this one does not disappoint. There's lots of choices to choose from on the buffet at night there's steak chicken and shrimp. There's of course chips and salsa and cheese to make nachos. You can make tacos or fajitas they even have a few items for dessert. Along with cheese quesadillas and chicken quesadillas. And for those who need it there's some American food like french fries and chicken nuggets but I couldn't tell you whether not they were good cuz I ate all the Mexican food.  there's one thing I wish they had on the buffet would be some cilantro that you could throw on the tacos and such. I do love the fact they have jalapenos. This was my second time coming here and won't be my last!!
Heard the buffet was shut down. Called last night and was told they no longer do the buffet which is a shame because everything I tried was good. I said from the beginning it was a bad location.

Wow!Not vegan but these vegan donuts are probably some best cake donuts I had.  I wasn't expecting much but these way better than some traditional donuts. They have a cake Donut texture but moist not dry. Newly open but whether vegan or just a Donut fan it's a must try if u looking to satisfy Donut fix. Place was clean and they also sell vegan cakes and cupcakes. Will definitely be back.
This is a great option for your sweet tooth. Vegan options are great, pricing is fair and delish!! Try one now and you will love it. I don't like chocolate and I loved it.

I bought a box of 6 baked goods and they were all delicious! Even my friend that doesn't have any allergy restrictions (and is kind of picky) loved the cupcake i gave her! The donuts were simply out of this world, I can't wait to go back to try more flavors (make sure you go early because they sell out!)
Some of the best Vegan donuts I've ever had. Best part is they are also allergy friendly along with being eco friendly. Love this place and the owner is the sweetest!

The first time I caught Gaia Donut was at a Market on Florida event. All I knew about their donuts were that they were vegan. I purchased a half dozen of various flavors. I enjoyed their texture, taste and the fact that they were vegan.

Fast forward to now, Gaia has a storefront and my daughter is having a birthday party with one of her friends who has a lot of allergies in attendance. I started looking around for vegan cupcakes and learned that Gaia isn't just vegan. They also are gluten free, nut free, soy free, yeast free and artificial color free. This took care of all of the allergies my daughter's friend has.

Gaia typically offers a half dozen cupcake flavors and a variety of donuts at their storefront. When I arrived, about an hour and a half after opening, three cupcake flavors were completely sold out! I bought one of their sour citrus, one chocolate and two pineapple. I also bought a pink lemonade and banana split donut. They were running a special at the time, any six items in their case for 25 dollars. 

The people at the party who tried Gaia's desserts were very impressed. The girl I specifically bought desserts for selected a cupcake and donut. She choked up right before she bit into the pink lemonade donut and said this was her first ever donut. Due to her allergies she had never been able to try one before.

Thanks Gaia for making this girl's day!

Roundabout did an amazing job catering our wedding. They offered so much more than your basic choice of 'chicken or fish'. We had an amazing selection of the unique Mediterranean style salad bar to beef or lamb sandwiches and topped off by a mix your own mac & cheese bar! Everything tastes wonderful and the staff was professional. They would be a great choice for any of your catering needs.

We used roundabout catering for a wedding in 9/2014. The quality of the food and the service was great. I can't believe it got a bad review. I would definitely use them again. Great food and resonable prices. Definitely recommend them

Ditto, I love roundabout catering and I am about to hire them again!  They catered my daughters wedding in my backyard.  They thought of things I did not... Big help.  The food was outstanding.. Now I am going to hire them in a different venue.  Always friendly and professional.

Roundabout catering our wedding and the food and professional of their servers on the day of was fantastic! We met with the owners directly and Colin is so passionate about his job and it rally shows. Seriously their food is amazing, and all of our guests were talking about it-even buffet style the food was fresh, flavorful and cooked perfectly. There were a few hiccups on the rental side-mostly due to miscommunication from our end, and they had the problems solved in minutes. I wouldn't hesitate to call them again for any catering needs.

I work at Sierra Meat & Seafood and rely heavily upon Roundabout Catering for our customer and employee apreciation events.  Colin and his team are creative, budget conscious when needed and above all professionals.  I wouldn't hesitate to recomend Roundabout Catering to anyone!

We have worked with Roundabout Catering for many years, and consider them to be one of the very best catering companies in the entire Reno-Tahoe region. Their food is gourmet quality, with pricing that works for all wedding budgets. Their staff, lead by rock star and chef extraordinaire, Colin Smith, is also the best; qualified, well-trained, and fun to work with. Their vast array of menu options provides our clients with many delicious choices for their wedding or event meal. We continue to recommend Roundabout Catering to those of our clients, looking for a quality catering company, and always know we are in for a fabulous event with Roundabout Catering in the house!

Friday last, Vesta and I shot the Microsoft Christmas party. I know, it was after Christmas, but I'm told some companies like to have their party after and Microsoft Reno is one of 'em.

They had their event at the Rancharrah Estate, where they have that very famous Mansion, which is one very big house, 58,000 square feet big.

Microsoft peopled the party with two hundred and fifty of their employees and they had limos coming and going all night long. The people were dressed to the nines and out for an evening of fun and fine dining.

Which is where Roundabout Catering comes in. Microsoft didn't want a sit down dinner, just hors d'oeuvres for their people to munch on as they schmoozed and oohed and ahed the house the Harrah's built, while the band, which consisted of two kids who could really play, alternated between Eagles and Pink Floyd songs.

Roundabout set up food stations throughout the mansion, a mac and cheese station here, a beef, pork, salmon and potatoes station there, a salad station here, a risotto station there, an antipasto station here the desert station on the grand piano. And, of course, they had a full bar, but you didn't have to fight the crowd to belly up to it if you wanted a drink, because Roundabout had their people walking the floor with wine and beer on trays.

We had dinner before we left for the event, because we're professionals and professionals work at events like this, they don't chow down.

However, as soon as I saw Natalie, who works for Roundabout, I knew who was catering the event and I knew I'd be sneaking food all night long. And I did. Roundabout are one of the best caterers in America and not only does the faire they prepare threaten to send you to gourmet heaven, the presentation is as good as any you'd find in the world's finest restaurants.

But fine food and prestigious presentation will only get you so far in the catering business. To really succeed, to make the event a caterer is catering a real success, he or she has to have people pleasing people working for them and it goes without saying they have to be people pleasing people themselves.

No matter how delicious something is, if it's served by a grumpy grump with a food stained shirt, you're not gonna take away a nice picture of the server or the food she served. The Roundabout people all were clean, pressed uniforms.

And Chef Colin Smith and his wife MaryBeth have outdone themselves with their choice of staff. Every lickin' stickin' person in their employ serves with a smile and by the time the events they cater are over, the guests leave with a tinge of regret, because deep down inside they don't wanna go.

-----

A note about the photos I've posted: I didn't plan on reviewing Roundabout Catering when Vesta and I showed up at Rancharrah, but as the evening wore on and as I interacted with their staff, I began to think I might. So I went around the mansion and made photos of the food, thinking I'd post them with the review.

But I found several similar shots, both here and on their Facebook page of the food they serve and it's presentation, by better photographers then me. So I decided to post photos of the Roundabout People, because, I believe, they are the rock their business is founded on, even though their faire is divine.

Roundabout Catering is amazing! They catered my wedding and the food was wonderful! My husband and I wanted A LOT of food and we wanted it to be Italian as we got engaged in Italy. Colin was able to provide exactly what we were looking for plus more! I love pizza so they provided a late night pizza bar for our guests and it was delicious. From the polenta cones, to the wedge salad to the tiramasu and creme brule, everything was perfect! I highly recommend Roundabout catering for any party or event and I know I will be booking them again for sure!

I am the Office Administrator for a company in Reno, Nevada. Every week we have lunch catered for the crew and I cannot say enough about Roundabout Catering's services and wonderful cuisine!

There menu and food choices are incredible, their service unbelievable and they even cater to our vegans, vegetarian, and our gluten free people. They are always here on time, if we order a hot menu, it is brought hot and comes with all the supplies to keep it that way. Last week we had an amazing side dish, grilled vegetables and it tasted as if it came right off a summer BBQ get together!

When I first inquired Roundabout catering, I couldn't believe after speaking with them what I received. A very thorough spread sheet with weeks worth of ideas for our crew. They put together everything you would need for a complete lunch menu. We received a wide variety of choices from  the main dish, wonderful side dishes right down to the desert, and of course, what the vegan, vegetarians and gluten free people could choose from also. I didn't have to even think about it, just choose from the easy menu plan they provided me.

Thank you Roundabout Catering I give you 10 stars!!!

We had Roundabout Catering cater our wedding on August 14, 2015. Upon first conversation they were extremely kind and helpful. They also gave us a tour of the facility right away, which was much appreciated. Very willing to help us stick with our budget (which we went over anyway, our own choosing), and showed us how the prices would add up based on what menu we chose (as I assume most places will, I was just excited to see it done so I didn't have to do it myself), and very helpful when suggesting other things we may need for the wedding as well. They were not pushy about us using them, but very respectable when checking in about a decision. The options available are numerous and all looked very delicious. 
We decided to choose them and got to meet with Chef Colin. He, like all his other staff was very kind and helpful. We chose a BBQ style buffet in which we had brisket, chicken, cornbread, etc. I can't even remember it all. We chose this for the adult guests at our wedding, and a macaroni bar for the kids. Chef Colin helped us customize the macaroni bar to what kids would be more open to eating as toppings. 
Wedding day arrives. They were on time! (I was worried about anything going late that day of course), So I very much appreciate that. The food was very good, had excellent flavor, and there was plenty! The staff were very kind to us and our guests. There were really only two downsides, the food was a tad cold for my liking, but wasn't enough to upset me on a global scale haha, and the second thing was the cornbread. Mind you, I absolutely LOVE cornbread. My cousin (when she lived with me) used to think I was high because I'd be up at 3am making cornbread, solely on the fact that I loved it so much. Anyways, the cornbread from Roundabout. It had peppers in it. I've never in my life heard of cornbread with peppers in it. And unfortunately, I am allergic to them. Nothing happened, thankfully, as it's not severe allergy, but enough to where I choose to stay away from them so I don't risk anything. I was unaware of the peppers until I bit into the cornbread. I didn't even like the flavor of it, the peppers just made it taste off anyway. It was upsetting not knowing about the fact that peppers were in it. Even if I wasn't allergic, I wouldn't have asked for it because of the taste. I do not even remember being asked about allergies in the menu-decision process, so that could be changed. Other than that, the catering was excellent. Truly. I am glad we chose them to cater our wedding.

Roundabout provided top notch food and service during our wedding in Tahoe.  We chose Roundabout based upon the recommendation of our wedding planner, Hunter & Company, and they delivered amazing food and service.  We started with reviewing their menus, then tailored it to our needs - every dish had a connection to our travels, and they customized the menu to our tastes, all within a very reasonable price that met our budget.  Beth & Chef Colin hosted us for a fun tasting where we fine tuned the menu.  

Upon our wedding day, the Roundabout team provided six passed apps, a salad station, a hot food station (Argentine Asado), and fun ice cream sandwiches as we opted not to have a traditional wedding cake.  We did not want a seated dinner, and they provided a classy meal with beautiful place settings / gold cutlery!  The servers of the passed apps didn't have much travelling to do as our guests would chase them down for the tasty treats!  (This is not a knock on their service, but a compliment to how amazing the food tasted!)  A week later - our friends are still telling us this was the best wedding meal ever.  

I would 1,000,000%+ recommend working with Roundabout for any and all functions - they will not disappoint.

It saddened me to read a negative report on this vendor.  I have operated, for many years, a unique, highly regarded, 13-acre wedding venue in Historic Nevada City, CA. During this time, I've come to understand and greatly appreciate "professionalism" and "excellence" in catering.  It does NOT get any better than Roundabout Catering!
Their food is always fresh, local when possible, their equipment is impressive (tour their stainless steel, mobile kitchen!) and VERY IMPORTANT TO ME - their staff is beautifully trained, presentable, and respectfully uniformed - no baggy shorts, no baseball caps on backward, just a nicely attired, efficient staff in suitable clothing with company logo. ALL OF THEM COURTEOUS AND POLITE, TOO!  (I have never understood how a client can spend a small fortune on a beautiful wedding, then settle for an inappropriate caterer with a sloppy staff in tow.)  

Aug. 10, 2013, today:  Roundabout outdid themselves here on my estate: They began by setting up beverages and light appetizers in The Rose Garden for arriving guests, who soon moved to The Wedding Lawn.  Post-ceremony, guests were invited to return to The Rose Garden for lovely tray-passed hors d' oeuvres, while the bridal party attended to photos.  All the while Roundabout was preparing a wonderful dinner for the Wedding Reception, which was, one hour later, held in The Party Pad.  FABULOUS FOOD! ... and just what the bride and groom wanted.  It couldn't have been better!

A big THANK YOU to Roundabout Catering for their diligence and commitment to excellence in the field of catering.  They are welcome here anytime !!

Jan Roth
The Roth Estate
Nevada City, CA

Right from my first conversation with Roundabout I knew I found the perfect caterer for my wedding. The quality of rentals, food and staff is absolutely outstanding! I cannot say enough good things about this business. Erin's communication was thorough, timely and thoughtful. With her help we had everything we needed for our event. Before the wedding the Roundabout crew had everything set up beautifully and well before guests arrived. During the wedding the crew was on point and made sure everything ran smoothly. On top of that they were all super nice people! From the beginning to the end, my experience with Roundabout could not have been better.  I look forward to being able to recommend Roundabout to my friends and family. They really nailed it!

This place was amazing to work with for our catering needs. The menu was perfect for the occasion. Erin was on top of every detail down to the timing. Roberta was the most excellent hostess/server. She made all the presentations beautifully. Everybody went above and beyond for our graduation reception. Highly recommend them and their delicious fare.

We had the best experience with Roundabout Catering. The food is amazing and the price is really competitive. We recently had them do our wedding is South Lake Tahoe. We had a ton of compliments on the food and the service. We worked with Erin to get everything just right and the end result was exactly what we had envisioned.

I hired them after they catered a wedding we attended in the spring.  Our event was this past weekend.  They arrived on time, everything was as I had ordered it.  They passed appetizers that were delicious.
The buffet was fine.  The table was very plain, just the chafing dishes and servers.  Caterers in the past had always at least had some greenery on the table, so that was disappointing.
When they cleared the table only one server was doing it.  She was trying so hard to keep up with it, and one of my guests got up to help her.

My biggest problem with them was the fact that I had ordered fried spring rolls so I had to " rent" the fryer from them so they could fry them.  That was an extra $125.  Then for my 5 hot items for the dinner I had to " rent" the chafing dishes from them for $30 each for an additional $150.  I've been entertaining all of my adult life and never have I had to rent things for them to do their jobs.
I thought that was ridiculous and only for that reason I would never have them again.

They catered my daughter's wedding. The food was tasteless, cold, some tables didn't get served all the dishes and the wine wasn't poured at the tables. The signature beer that was supposed to be served  wasn't even ordered. The service staff was slow and unresponsive. One server was either really tired or under the influence. Many guests commented on her behavior. The bartender didn't appear at the reception for the first hour. I had to leave my meal repeatedly to ask the Roundabout coordinator about different issues.

When I called Roundabout after the wedding I got no return call. I gave up and wrote a letter to Colin. He called me back and left a message he was sorry and would make it right. That was three years ago and I haven't heard from Roundabout since. Although nothing can "make it right" since this was a once in a lifetime event, some effort to follow up would seem appropriate.

This was a once in a lifetime event that was carefully planned and every detail attended to. The poor food and poor service ruined our beautiful day. 

I have waited three years to write this review in an attempt to be fair. However, after seeing a huge article about Roundabout in today's paper, I am moved to    share our experience. The Smith's are nice folks whose business has grown dramatically in the last few years. I am happy for their success but their poor food and service ruined a special day.

Roundabout was absolutely perfect for our wedding. From the communication with Erin in the office, to the tasting, to the event staff, it was all wonderful.  Erin worked patiently with me while I changed menu options and fretted about what to do with our non-traditional 10am beach wedding and lunch reception menu.  She was kind and super easy to talk to and chat with at the tasting.  We had rave reviews about the selection of food: the freshness of the salad with delicious fruit toppings, the cheesy goodness of the mac n cheese (to die for!) and the lovely dry rub on the steak plus the portobello mushroom with cous-cous... people loved it! Christie, day-of event staff, was the sweetest person I have ever met! She helped my mother in law prepare a plate and take it to our grandmother, she refilled water jugs that weren't provided by Roundabout and she mentioned multiple times how beautiful I looked. She was honestly the best part! I would highly recommend Roundabout!

We planned a very special event in about 50 days - and could not have done it without Erin and the Roundabout team. 

From our initial email to the day before the event - Erin was responsive, friendly, and organized. After our first phone consultation, we knew we wanted to work with Erin. She made us feel like we were taken care of. 

We planned this event remotely from the Bay Area - and fully trusted Erin every step of the way. When you work with a caterer, having someone like Erin on your team is necessary! We never felt stressed or worried. 

The rentals team was professional and efficient when they setup and broke down rentals. They turned a clubhouse into a beautiful event space overlooking the lake! 

Now, the food... was amazing!! Our guests can't stop telling us about how delicious it was and the presentation.  

The Chef and catering team were a joy to work with. They made sure the food was hot and plenty - and knew exactly what they were doing. What more could you ask for? 

Thank you Erin and the Roundabout team for being part of our special day. You all truly made our event one that we will remember forever. I mean, who could forget a mac and cheese bar like that?!

My office gets lunch brought in once a week for us (I know it's amaze balls).  We've been bouncing around from chain restaurants to local caterers for awhile now.  Generally the food is good but not stellar and really there's no one that I've wanted to try again.  Until now!  Holy beejeebus Roundabout NAILED it.  
They brought in a classic (and super tasty) caesar salad, freaking amazing calzones, AND tiramisu for dessert.
First of all the calzones were huge, second of all they gave us options-meat, veggie, and gluten free.  Gluten free was basically a dough-less calzone but hey-super cool for the few people in my office who are GF to get real food!  I opted for the veggie and I was so, so happy.  You know how you can look at food and just KNOW it's going to be good? That's how this calzone was.  It was cooked to perfection-the perfect golden crust and melty cheese.  The veggies tasted fresh too.  I couldn't even finish it.  Half is in the fridge for me to enjoy later.  They also brought a tray of GORGEOUS grilled veggies.  Despite being full I tried one-just to try it and let me tell you what.  That grilled asparagus tasted just like summer.  Like summer I say!  Everything felt healthy too. Not greasy or fried or over sauced. It was thoughtfully seasoned with quality ingredients./ They definitely don't cut corners. 
Oh, of course I saved room for tiramisu.  It was glorious.  The food baby and I were quite pleased.  Overall everyone here loved it as was apparent by the lack of leftovers and the double servings of desserts. 

I hope Roundabout becomes our "forever" caterer.  I can't wait to see what we get next  time!

Looks like they opened a new restaurant in downtown Reno!! I can't say enough nice things about the food and the staff. We had our 39 th wedding anniversary dinner there and it was wonderful! They brought over some champagne for us and the GM came out and ask us how everything was. Our server was great.. We will be coming back for sure:)

THIS review is for ONLY for the prepared meal delivery plan from GymRatFoods.com, and it is long overdue. 

We enjoyed 4 weeks of food in April 2019. I've held on to my receipt in a pile of papers because this plan really deserves a review. 

First off, YES the food is REALLY GOOD. However this is the only pre-prepared delivered meal plan I've ever tried so I have no comparison. Although I DO know the difference between good food and bad food. AND THIS WAS DEFINITELY GOOD. 

My only issue was that the portions seemed to weigh much more than what was printed on the wrapper. Normally a good thing. Right?  Getting more than you paid for?  But if you're try to loose weight it's not good to eat more than you think you're eating. So if I did this again, to loose weight, I'd definitely ask about how I'm supposed to know if I've been given correct portions. 

I was doing it mostly to get off sugar. To just stop eating too much sugar. Retrain myself to eat more healthy. And to give myself meal planning ideas to get out of my food rut. 

So one thing that was awesome was that they allowed me to share my 4 week plan with my husband. Meaning, we each got 2 weeks of food. They allowed us to order different meal plans. So we each got 2 weeks of our chosen plan. They allowed us to substitute all the red meat and pork for chicken. 

That's a lot of allowing. The only thing they DIDN'T allow (almost a year ago) was a VEGETARIAN option. There was kinda a lotta meat if you don't usually eat much meat. So I'd probably have a hard time getting my husband to do it again since he's basically a vegetarian. He had a hard time. But he is also a very good sport and so he sacrificed 2 weeks for me. 

I did the full 1200 calories a day (3 meals a day + snacks) X 6 days a week. If I did it again I'd do the 1200 calories per day (equivalent) but only 2 meals a day no snacks x 5 days a week. I just looked it up and it's only $375 for ALL 4 WEEKS. That plan doesn't provide the whole 1200 calories a day...because it skips breakfast and snacks. I'd rather pay less and get less and just fill in a few items I'm craving as needed. 

A few times I froze the meals because we had to eat out. They were still great even though they had been frozen. 

I paid extra for home delivery. The fresh cooked meals are delivered in plastic bins with frozen cold packs to keep them cool. They are delivered twice a week. Even getting meals for two people we always had plenty of space in our refrigerator for them. 

I recommend you go into the office in Sparks and sit down and look at the menus and ask questions. They will show you what actual meals look like. They give you a couple free samples to take home. That pretty much sold me. I tasted it and thought "I CAN DEFINITELY DO THIS". You should check it out before you sign up for some other plan!  

If you find this review useful please vote!

We chose Roundabout Catering for our wedding. I could not give higher praise for their team. Erin was meticulous and professional in her communication. She was also super friendly. The servers who were at our wedding were some of the kindest people I have ever worked with! They helped above and beyond what they were there to do and made our evening so relaxing and easy. 

The food was also delicious from the appetizers to the dinner. I highly recommend Roundabout if you are looking for a company that provides the ultimate experience for your event!

Erin and her crew recently catered our daughter's wedding and did an amazing job.  They helped above and beyond our contract. It was a pleasure working with them. They helped make the wedding perfect!

Ok. So Roundabout is the "cafeteria" restaurant at Tesla.   I work there and take advantage of ordering there often.   
The food is always good.   They offer pre packaged grab n go food as well as made to order.  The taco bar is delicious.   Tostadas, tacos, burritos...yum.   Their salads are large and loaded well with proteins and such.   Pasta bar is fantastic.  We are lucky to have such a treat available to us for lunch.   It is a bit pricey for "cafeteria" food but good.  Employees are always super nice and they keep everything crazy clean.  
Can't post a picture because we are not allowed to, but it's a cute little set up.  I'm a fan.

So after trying three different mea prep companies here in town. I thought it was time to give a review on Roundabout Catering. There menu, customer service, and Judy overall positive experience have exceeded all
my expectations. I couldn't be happier with Roundabout Catering. Besides doing catering for any number of occasions, they decided to get into meal prep. Thee on-site dietitian works with you for the menu that best suits your needs you determine the calories that you want in your your meals per day and they resign the meals around that you choose from I have very extensive menu your case and they match the calories to your desire gosh what a great great car procedure in the individual customer a meal prep I absolutely could be your happy hour with Round Bout Catering and plan to stay with him for sometime in the future again I give them five stars and highly recommend ceiling the entire staff at roundabout. If your seeking a meal
Prep company do yourself a favor and try Roundabout

We love Roundabout Catering.  They have done several functions for our office, breakfast, lunch and dinners and we have loved the food each and every time.  I have recently asked them to recommend wines - which it turns out, our Employees Loved!

We highly recommend Roundabout Catering for any function.

They catered my daughter's wedding. The food was tasteless, cold, some tables didn't get served all the dishes and the wine wasn't poured at the tables. The signature beer that was supposed to be served  wasn't even ordered. The service staff was slow and unresponsive. One server was either really tired or under the influence. Many guests commented on her behavior. The bartender didn't appear at the reception for the first hour. I had to leave my meal repeatedly to ask the Roundabout coordinator about different issues.

When I called Roundabout after the wedding I got no return call. I gave up and wrote a letter to Colin. He called me back and left a message he was sorry and would make it right. That was three years ago and I haven't heard from Roundabout since. Although nothing can "make it right" since this was a once in a lifetime event, some effort to follow up would seem appropriate.

This was a once in a lifetime event that was carefully planned and every detail attended to. The poor food and poor service ruined our beautiful day. 

I have waited three years to write this review in an attempt to be fair. However, after seeing a huge article about Roundabout in today's paper, I am moved to    share our experience. The Smith's are nice folks whose business has grown dramatically in the last few years. I am happy for their success but their poor food and service ruined a special day.

Update: 
After posting this review, I got a reply (above) from one  of the Roundabout staff saying they would contact me privately. It has been a month and still no contact. 

I was hoping they would somehow want to rectify the terrible experience of a once in a lifetime event, but guess not.
We recently had them cater a birthday party and it far exceeded our expectations. Everything was so organized and the food was delicious. We've found our new go to caterer!

Roundabout Catering and Events knows how to make an evening truly special, and most importantly stress free for the hosts. That doesn't happen overnight. It's honed over time, and developed through solid leadership, which Chef Colin, MaryBeth and their team demonstrate so beautifully. 

As a host, when you envision your event, you're mostly thinking through the moving parts on a macro level. Timelines, menu, etc. Within each one of those are many micro pieces, and getting those right can take an event from "meh" to magnificent and memorable.

Roundabout excels here. The professional and talented staff had thought through everything for me, and asked me very specific questions that created a room and experience for my guests I could only have imagined. 

The TEDxUNR speakers dinner was a massive success thanks to Roundabout Catering. It was beautiful, seamless, and all served with a smile. Thank you so much for making this a memorable experience for us all.

Roundabout catered our wedding, and I have nothing but great things to say about them! Beth was always super responsive and they took care of everything! Food was delicious and they were so easy to work with!!
Roundabout catered our post wedding brunch and it was absolutely fabulous. Would recommend for any event, food is delicious and their team is wonderful!!

Hired Roundabout for our wedding, I cannot say enough great things about our experience. We had tight space for 65 people. They handled all of the seating, bar, food and linens. They efficiently moved the tables from the dance area after dinner to clear the dance floor. 
The food was AMAZING!!!  The service impeccable! Rick and the rest of the crew made everything seem so effortless, and handled any requests in no time at all....if you want to take most of the stress away from your planning hire them!

DELISH! California girl here visiting my parents and wanted to a pizza spot with great pizza, and different food options. My family got 3 different pizzas and all were delicious! The meatballs were great as well. Good beer and wine list. I recommend the locals to come and check it out! My parents who live here will be soon he regulars. The owner was here and takes so much pride in his business!
Great atmosphere and wonderful service! Pizza had a crispy crust,and the sauce was rich and robust in flavor!

It's been a minute since 3 Wood opened their doors in Southwest Boise and I finally waddled my way down for some dinner. According to their menu, their NY brick-oven pies consist of a "combination of their 72 hour aged dough, their red sauce made daily using the finest vine ripened tomatoes and locally made sliced mozzarella make for an amazingly great pizza." 

I began my evening with a glass of Blackberry Boom from Meriwether Cider (6.9% ABV, $7.50 for a 16 oz), and my husband tried the Rocket Dog from Laughing Dog Brewery (6.7% ABV, $5.50 for 16 oz). While I can't critique on the quality/experience with the beer and cider since it's an entirely different company however I found the price for the cider a little steep. Not sure if that's just the brewery so no stars lost just an opinion stated. 

For food we shared the Pepperoni Lovers (vine-ripened red sauce, fresh mozzarella, spicy cup and char pepperoni and traditiona pepperoni, 12.00 for a 12 inch). I was a huge fan of the cupped pepperoni - it's definitely the way I prefer my pepperoni slices! However, I was not a fan of the thin crust. I like my bread thic! I can only hope in the future they offer more traditional or deep-dish pies. 

All in all, I'll go back, but I can say it will be soon. Knowing me though, and my constant uncontrollable cravings for pizza, it'll be sooner than later.

Wow what a great place! Services was amazing and happy good vibes all around! Beer Selection was great! They are super into loacl beers and even there decor is loacl what a great place to spend your time and money on loacl and friendly people also there kitchen is open until 10pm also amazing Wood oven pizzas

We love this new pizza gem in our neighborhood! They have a full bar, wine and beer options as well. We always start with their meatballs as an appetizer. The meat balls are incredibly tender and the sauce is perfect on top. It's a must try if you're dining. 
They also have a wonderful variety of pizza combinations. I can't get past their ultimate pepperoni. It's my favorite. My husband loves their bbq chicken (or something like that). They have options to build your own as well. Keep it simple though. I am a fan of thin crust pizza and 3 Wood Pizza & Pub does not disappoint. It even tastes incredible the next day and cold (yes, I love some good cold pizza).  I'm looking forward watching a game there (I'm a baseball and hockey fan) and having a pint or two with some friends. If you're in the mood for pizza, definitely check out this local joint. Your wind be disappointed.
Seriously the best pizza in the Treasure Valley.  They do an incredible job that is consistent.  Do yourself a favor and try this pizza!

Coldest draft beers we've found thus far!!! Great great pizza as well! Great establishment. You can see the ownership involved in the day to day hustle and grind. I am very impressed. This is our new pizza and ice cold beer spot for sure!

Great new spot for pizza! I'm new to Boise and we did the "Flying Pie" pizzeria that's locally well-known ...but me personally, I would take 3 Wood's NY Brick-Oven Pies! The crust is unreal, homemade dough aged for 72hr, fresh ingredients, great service...and great tap beer selection. Will be our regular pizza place in this area!

This place is right down the street from me and I couldn't wait to give it a try. We sat at a table next to the bartop (which is still closed due to COVID Restrictions) and the bartender took excellent care of us right off the bat. He let us sample, recommended his favorites, informed us all about the pizza selections, and made excellent conversation. The owner eventually made his way over and continued to engage in conversation with us as well, and we all talked food industry as I'm a bartender myself. I later saw the owner folding pizza boxes along side other employees and that impressed the hell out of me, as I know plenty of owners and managers that wouldn't touch tedious side work like that. After we finished our delicious pizzas and beers, we were lucky enough to be given a tour of the kitchen and continued to chat with the bartender. I cannot wait to frequent this place more often, especially come summertime when they're going to open pet-friendly patio seating out front, and maybe even consider a second job working for this great place. I was just so impressed!

Its a good decent place in Southwest Boise.  not a lot of good restaurants out there.  Pizzas are good.  Price is about 13 bucks.  beer on tap is good.  seating is mostly high top tables which i personally can't stand.  atmosphere is ok.  they have a few tv's so you can catch a game.  its a newer place and I hope they find their footing in South Boise.
The best pizza we have had in a very long time. Not only is the pizza to die for, Tim, our bartender, was freaking amazing!!! Highly recommend!!

The pizza is phenomenal!  Great beer selection.  They still need to work some kinks out of their staff.  We arrived at 5 and ordered a pizza and cheesy bread.  At 5:30 we finally got our bread and didn't get a pizza until we complained after an hour, and it wasn't what we ordered.  Props to the owner/manager who generously comped our bread and beers and insisted we take the pizza we did get to try.  Plus he gave us a gift card for a 16" pizza, which is what we had originally ordered.  We will give them another shot.

Place was great!  Happy to have good food and really good service in our neighborhood.  As a restaurant owner myself I'm happy to see pizza done right.  Made my wife happy so it's a true win in my book.
The pizza here is delicious. The pickle pizza sounds weird but it is actually really good. They have a good selection of beers with some local breweries as well plus a good atmosphere.

Visiting from Alabama and wanted to check this place out with a friend. It was an awesome atmosphere with really great and personable staff. The Pizza was amazing new style pizza with a bit of Idaho twist.  I would love this place in Bama, but I guess Idaho can have some good stuff too. Amazing!! Will visit again Ana again whenever I'm in Idaho.

WOW! This place is THE BEST! My husband and I came in from out of state and checked Yelp for some good pizza and this place did not disappoint! Now I see why it has 5 stars! We got the freight train which had a little bit of everything and the cheesy bread! The sauce is fresh and local as well as the ooey gooey mozzarella they put on! The topping are abundant and the crust is delicious!  Love that it's a thin crust too, we ate every last slice! You can tell they take pride in their food and love what they do. I wish I could fly this stuff home every week!!!
Also, can you guys bring this place to Colorado!?!?
Great place to eat with a great atmosphere! Love that it's tucked right into an area that is primarily full of neighborhoods.

Right as soon as my husband and I walked through the door the customer service was GREAT! They were busy (Saturday night) and he offered water and to sit down, even after we after we told him we were getting to go. 

The crust is amazing on their wood fired pizza and they really did a nice job with "our favorite" pepperoni, jalapeño and pineapple.

We will be returning.

This is our new neighborhood pizza joint.  They have wonderful pizzas that are pretty unique to the area.  They have a good selection of beers on tap that will be expanding over time.  They have salads for those that prefer something more healthy and a few sandwiches now.  

Pair that to a terrific staff.  Everyone I have talked to from the owner down to one of the cooks have all been extremely friendly.  

We have other "favorite" pizza places in the area, but this has quickly jumped to the TOP of the list.
Amazing real wood pizza place!! Loved it especially their red sauce that is home made and just out of this world! Loved the family atmosphere!! We will be back
Yummy!! My favorite was the Zorba and the Basque pizza. Staff was very friendly as well.
First time here. Environment is friendly/inviting. Pizza is really good. Great customer service. A definite staple from now on.

We first found out about this place because we got a gift card from a friend. We are so happy to have been sent here and we plan to make it our regular outing restaurant. We are always greeted by someone at the front and during our meal, the owner will walk around and say hi and ask how everything is. My husband is huge on customer service and really appreciates all the service they provide. 
The waitresses we have had have all been great. So happy to have a place so close to home to get some great food and good atmosphere. 
I almost forgot to mention their great food! The kids choose something from their specialties list and my husband and I usually do a custom pizza. 
Has not disappointed! Will definitely be a returning customer for a long time.

Wow!  We couldn't be happier about finally deciding to try this little hidden gem in the Albertsons plaza on Five Mile and Lake Hazel.  
If you haven't tried it or are on the fence (as we were), stop what you are doing and go, or order take out.  

The pizza was delicious with a light crust that neither under or overwhelmed. Sauce and toppings were delicious. We had their take on classic Margherita and it was perfect.  A bit of delicious char on the bottom and edges added to the flavor and presentation. 
We also got the meatballs and cheese bread.  The meatballs were HUGE and tender. They came with crusty garlic bread which was perfect.  The cheese bread was flavorful without being overly cheesy or garlicky. I would only suggest that in the future they serve open faced instead of wrapping it in foil like a loaf.  The cheese sticks to one side when you open the loaf.

The prices were VERY reasonable and the staff were very friendly, even just for a simple takeout order.

We will be back...frequently. I would rate it 9/10, the only missing point being from the cheesy bread cheese sticking to one side of the loaf due to how its boxed up.
Super friendly wait staff. Great pizza and appetizers. This "neighborhood eatery" is modern and open. Highly recommend.

The owner and their staff are good friendly people. The pizza is the best in Boise. Meatballs and other apps are fantastic as well. Good beer selection. The cheesecake is phenomenal! We go here a few times a month we love it so much.

Great experience,  even better food. Pizza dough made in house, which is a rarity. Crust baked up light and perfect.  Cheese bread was a delight. Ingredients are equally delicious.  Wide selection of beer and ciders on tap. Low key, casual atmosphere. Definitely a local gem!

Give 3 Wood a try. There aren't a lot of choices here on the south side (Lake Hazel and 5 Mile) So I appreciate this new spot. Dough- very tasty and the meatballs are bang'n. If ya want loads of toppings get delivery from Diggs or pick up a Papa Murphy's. If ya want a tasty, thin, specialty style pizza eat here ;-)

Great pizza! We love the basque, zorba, and just their sausage (it's a little spicy)! The meatballs are good too. We've only ever gotten take out, but it has always been busy inside. So happy to have a pizza spot like this nearby.

We just had dinner here and all I can say is-wow!  Terrific vibe, fun atmosphere , amazing pizza and a wonderful staff. We sat at a table near the bar so the bartender was also our server. He was so friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. He recommended the pepperoni pizza and the Basque pizza and both were incredible. They also have a large beer selection. 
Great service, great food, great people!  This is going to become a regular spot for us.
First time trying this place out! Definitely go back again. Loved the pizza and garlic bread.

Love this place! It feels like family, the pizza is amazing... crust to die for! Their beer selection is growing and always a wide range of tastes. The staff is so friendly and everything always so clean! We visit often and recommend to all who ask for a great dinner spot.

Phenomenal pizza! Great staff, super inviting. Seriously the pizza made us reminisce about Rome. Try the "Unknown" pizza with roasted pepper sauce, Italian sausage and mushrooms and onion, really great. So glad we found 3 Wood!
Service check. Pizza check. Beer check. It's all good! Recommend the Unknown Pizza. Amazing sauce and just the right heat in the sausage. Did o mention the dough?!

I'd be reading about this spot for a few weeks now; I mean who doesn't like pizza-right? I entered their location and was immediately greeted by the warm and friendly manager (owner??). You could tell he was passionate about the pizza and was so welcoming. I ordered the freight train and pepperoni lover (they allowed me to do half and half). The pizza is 12 inches and perfect for sharing (2 folks). The freight train has their house made Vine-ripened red sauce, Pepperoni, Italian Sausage, smoked ham, onions, green peppers, mushrooms, mozzarella, and finished with a Pecorino Romano cheese. The pepperoni features spicy cup and char pepperoni which is unique to them (very flavorful). I loved their red sauce, crust, and the cheese on their pizza-it was yummy!! Their pizzas are reasonably priced coming out at $12. The only negative was our waiter she clearly needs more training. She took our order and then came back asking what we wanted again. I ordered a side salad she forgot about it; then tried to charge us for it (I said I never got it; she was like do you want it to go? Haha). Plus she gave me the wrong ticket to start with; she was clearly off point and needs a lot more training. I'd say outside the customer service this newcomer to the boise pizza scene is a must try!!

Excellent pizza. We ordered half "The Unknown" and half "The Basque". You cannot go wrong ordering
this pizza,  if you are unsure of which of their many pizzas to order.

Super solid pastries sold here! If you're looking to satisfy a sweet tooth, look no further.  Somehow they took something ordinary and made it extraordinary! Chewy chocolate chip cookies sandwiching buttercream frosting and shortbread cookies sandwiching gooey caramel? Perfection. So happy to have this place in South Philly! And don't forget to visit their sister Porco's for amazing sandwiches! You gotta try this place!

I have a really a bad sweet tooth and walked like twenty blocks for a pickup order. Is this dedication?

Anyways this place has been on my radar for their super pretty sweets. I ordered a selection of 8 cold pastries and two macarons. The macarons were raspberry and salted caramel! Good price at $3 for 2. The cold pastries were super good although I wish I was a larger variety. In the eight I got, there were only three varieties, the pistachio tea cake, creme brûlée tart, and chocolate tart. 

Anyway, they also have a lot of dry pastries like croissants and galettes as well as baking pantry items. 

If I didn't live so far away, I'd definitely come here more!

Spectacular!! I was looking for a place to buy Birthday sweets for my sweetie and this place exceeded all expectation. The pastries are subtle, sophisticated, delicious and in my opinion very reasonably priced!

I can't wait to return to try the porcetta  (happy to see multiple veggie/vegan options for the non- meat eater in this couple)

Over- rated. 
Ok desserts, but definitely not worth the hype. They look nice, but several other dessert places/ cafes in Philadelphia have better tasting dessert.

I can already tell that Small Oven is going to be extremely detrimental to my wallet, but boy, is it worth it! The sweet treats here are beautiful, intricate, and delicious!

My friend and I came here on a Saturday afternoon and got 3 mini pastries to split. My favorite was the Apple Tarte Tatin (pressed caramelized apples, caramel mousse, rosemary sucree). The rosemary sucree was so delicious and gave an incredible depth to the tarte tatin. I also loved the Pistachio Tea Cake (shortbread crust, pistachio frangipane, pistachio ganache) - it was so smooth and creamy. Finally, we had the Hazelnut Paris Brest (toasted hazelnut pate choux with praline mousseline, hazelnut crispy). While this was probably my least favorite of the 3, it was still gorgeous.

I can't wait to come back and work my way through the rest of these delicate and delicious desserts!

The pastries are incredible! All over Philly you have the same pastry company providing the same croissants to all the coffee shops. Porcos pastries are very delicious and unique. The chai cinnamon bun, croissants, and bread pudding are all so fresh and tasty. Highly recommend this place. **also it's great for COVID: you can place your order before on their online platform and pick up at the window with very minimal contact

Can I just say WOW! I was driving around looking for something sweet that needed to be gluten free. When i called this lovely place, the gentleman on the phone was so sweet and energtic on the phone, I knew i had to go. The blue paint on the outisde allows this place to stand out. Only carry out orders from the window are available right now. The manager (maybe owner) was radiating kindness as we asked about any reccomendations. I wanted everything. we had vanilla and lemon macarons, red velvet petite fours, and a heavenly flourless chocolate cake bar. Everything was PHENOMENAL. They even wrote "Happy Birthday" on a card for me. Such a swet surpise. Next time I am in philly, this will be my first stop.

Small Oven is attached to Porcos Porchetteria, and is alone worthy of a stop! Their bakery creations are absolutely gorgeous and totally drool worthy! They sell them per piece or $36 for a bakers dozen. They're total show-stoppers!! 

We sampled the apple tart with rosemary shortbread and the chocolate caramel eclair. Insanely Delish!! 

We also sampled Nutella filled to order fresh donuts, which are only available on the weekends. Hot and outstanding! 

We also sampled their hearty, crispy ciabatta rolls that come with their signature Margherita Buffalina pizzas. These are also only available on the weekends!!  

The baklava cupcakes with cream shooters are up next for us! You honestly can't go wrong here!! 

They have all of your caffeinated favorites to go along with your treats, as well as non alcoholic drafts! Also, it can't hurt to grab a pork or veggie sammy to-go for later either! The veghetti was so delicious! 

Parking is street, unmetered and easy to find. 
Saturdays are pretty busy, but the staff was efficient!
Excellent sloppy joe was fantastic! Recommend pepper relish to any fan of spicy condiments. Meatballs and veggies were equally enjoyed

I didn't physically go in here due to Covid, but I ordered a desserts for my sister in law for nurse's week. They did a great job with my assorted 8 piece box and also added a very nice hand written post card just like I wanted to give it an extra personal touch. She and her husband ate all the desserts and ordered again from here because they loved it. 
Really appreciate you being open right now.

Great breakfast sandwiches, slightly on the greasier side. Egg sandwich with basil aioli was tasty but a note to vegetarians, mine had crispy pork pieces in it that weren't in the menu listing so make sure to SPECIFY VEGETARIAN when ordering! My husband loves their sandwiches and really liked the super breakfast Sammy.

My friends and I would occasionally drive by this place not knowing what they had to offer. It was not until recently that we order for pick up. Something savory and sweet. Their OG sandwich is superb. Their lemon bars and cheesecake bars  you've just got to try to understand.

Tasty. I visited here on a snowy day and I was glad that I did. I'm not even going to try to remember what I got, but I purchased about 6 pastries and a crumb cake. I'm a big lover of chocolate, so let's assume I had a few chocolate, a lemony something, and a fruit pastry. They're all beautifully designed, and I will say they're a bit more focused on flare and that's represented in the price. Either way, I'll be back.

We ordered in the mist of quarantine 2020 for pickup; a dozen of small cakes/pastries, OG, breakfast sammie on croissant, and a macaronsandwich. They were out of those and replaced it with a chocolate croissant and cookies sandwich which was more than generous. The OG and breakfast sammie was more on the greasy side for me but the boyfriend loved it. Definitely for someone with a big tummy. The dozen cakes was quite a sight and I would pay for them again. It's very well textured, complex flavored and you see what you are eating.

These pastries are next level! The tiny bite sized desserts were like mini artworks that immediately caused a ruckus by forcing people to choose one from the assortment. Everyone loved the one they got but they all want the ones they didn't get. We will buy this amazing wonder box again.

I'm not kidding, they are like gorgeous miniature art cakes!

My friend and I were super excited to try out Small Oven Pastry Shop as soon as they opened because of how beautiful the mini pastries looked. Turns out they were not only beautiful, but also delicious, well crafted, and unique! The sight of the pastries and their descriptions on the menu were enough to make our mouths start watering. Each piece is $3.50.
We shared the Apple Tarte Tatin, Pistachio Tea Cake, and the Hazelnut Paris Brest. All were amazing, but the Pistachio Tea Cake was the one that blew me away. Shortbread crust, pistachio frangipane, and pistachio ganache - holy moly! 
The Hazelnut Paris Brest wasn't my favorite but it could've been because the crunchy texture made it difficult to eat without spraying crumbs everywhere.
The Apple Tarte Tatin was amazing and I especially loved the combination of caramel with rosemary!
Definitely stop by this cute bakery if you can!

I would give this place six stars if there was an option to do so. For too long, this corner of the city had been lacking in the bakery department. Not anymore! You could go here every day and find a new favorite. My go to celebration gift is an 8 piece pastry box- whoever receives it will love you for it! I now can no longer go to my brothers without bringing something from here. Try the savory croissants and the lemon bars. They are my favorite.

Best pastries in the area! We keep coming back to this gem, having so far tried the cinnamon bun, bread pudding, cardamom puff muff, leak crossaint, apple bunt cake and coffee cake... I highly recommend any of their flaky pastries.

Got a pretty big slice of cake for the price of two cakes. I was thinking it was going to be great but I was wrong. It was average at best. Lots of great bakeries in the city, probably wouldn't go back.

Really solid spot to grab some pastries and is located right next to Dock Street Brewery. There's a small communal table inside for seating, but that's about it. Hopefully they'll add some seating outside as it warms up.

In terms of the actual pastries everything looked amazing so it was hard to choose what to try first. I got the pistachio tea cake and the apricot praline; both of which were really well made. I usually prefer more dense and less sweet desserts, so the pistachio tea cake was perfect. Pricing was also very reasonable at about $3.50 per small pastry item. Will definitely be back to try their other stuff.

Love this new addition to Point Breeze! I missed Kermits so much (the old bakery that was in the  the same location that abruptly closed a few years back) so I'm glad the space is put to good use. Point breeze definitely needed this. 

Baked goods I tried: chai cinnamon bun and the brown butter raspberry cake (favorite #1!- if there's one to get it's this one). The second time around it was the fresh to order Nutella filled donut (light and airy- although the Nutella mixture is not pure as it's not as dense as Nutella from the jar, bread pudding, strawberry short cake and dulce shortbread. I haven't tried their coffee yet though they carry la colombe. 

Every single pastry I've tried is phenomenal. I only wish it was a little bigger, for the average price of $3.00. You can get two good bites of their cakes.

Next ones in line to order are cookies!

Cheers to Small Oven Pastry Shop for keeping the baked goods coming during an unprecedented time in our history. I tried a medley of treats from Small Oven at a Super Bowl party I attended back in February and they were all delicious. Today, my husband and I treated ourselves to some breakfast pastries - an absolutely perfect chocolate croissant for him, and a delicious slice of coffee cake for me. 

In addition to baked goods, Small Oven also offers salads and paninis. I tried one of the salads last week and it was super fresh and satisfied the need for something healthy. 

Best of all, their sister business, Porco's, has a take out window so you can place your order online and pick up at the window without ever going inside. Thank you, Chad, for all your hard work in keeping the neighborhood fed and happy!
Awesome pastry shop. It is extremely tasty. I had a chocolate biscotti that wasn't too chewy. The biscotti had a good amount of chocolate chips mixed in which I really appreciated.

Hi Chad-

Please see pic below. It was $20, I've included the debit charge so you can see what I paid for the three items (one slice of cake, one cookie, one bar total $29.50). So nothing but truth here and that's what my review is about- my rating of my overall experience at your establishment, as it should be. 
Also want to point out I did not tell people not to go here anymore, just don't buy the cake slices because they are outrageously expensive and mediocre. I also review the taste of the items, as It's all relevant. 

Also Please understand I did say something at the moment, how do you think I learned it was $20! I didn't see a QR code, might have overlooked it But I did have the paper menu and there was the chalkboard menu (or whatever it was) and we also looked online later and none of those things mentioned the cost of the cake at that time that I could see. 

Your own response to the original review just confirms:
1. the cake slice is not prominently displayed 
2. That the cost is actually $15 (still ridiculous for slice of cake) which means I was also incorrectly charged for the item. 
3. That I was giving my patronage to your small business while we are in a pandemic 
4. I didn't demand a refund from your business (because we are in a pandemic and you are a small business). 

So if you are upset about my truthful review that warned people about a slice of cake (because again we are in a pandemic and people might not have $20 to spend on cake slice).
Acknowledge I might have been overcharged and not offer to look into it to correct it.
Not take into consideration to maybe just put the price somewhere people can easily see it irl.
But instead choose to just complain that I gave you this review in pandemic, WEEKS after I wrote it, then maybe you are really only confirming that you did deserve the rating you got from me for my experience with your business.

The owner, Chad, really cares about his customers and the food he produces. I say this as someone who has been to Small Oven PS a handful of times and witnessed this first hand. The majority of my visits have been exemplary and the one time it wasn't, I got his attention and he made it right. I can't say the same about many other establishments I've had similar situations with in the past. What's more, the positive experience has stuck with me. Regarding the food - Great bars, bread pudding, small treats, and other baked goods. You really can't go wrong here with anything you order. My only tip would be for those who order items that required or necessitated cold storage - allow it to warm to room temperature before eating. Bottom line - quality baked goods, quality customer service. Highly recommend.

The top coffee and pastries of my Philly trip, for sure!!! Excellent oat milk latte. Savoring it now. Impressive croissant and way better than the one from Metropolitan. Really enjoying the compost cookie, particularly its nuttiness. The gal working there was super friendly, as well. Good COVID window setup. Next to a beer distributor so conveniently grabbed some beer while (very briefly) waiting for my latte. Cheers to Small Oven!

Tried a bunch of Chad's petit fours at a Superbowl party, of all places, and every single one was gorgeous and delicious!  Beautifully constructed and the perfect "bring to a dinner party" choice.  Favorites were the Tiramisu, Pistachio Tea Cakes, Opera Cakes and the stunning looking and tasting Apple Tartine!...but every one of these beautiful creations were huge hits.

OMG! Pictures don't do it justice! You have to visit.  The pastries are works of art AND subtly delicious! My wife and I ordered a variety of pastries and a slice of bread pudding. Collectively, the flavors were all delicate, like Italian desserts rather than sweet like you may expect. We loved them all! The restaurant/ bakery itself, which opened in December 2019, was clean and rustic serving sandwiches, soups, drinks, and La Columbe coffees. The owner is onsite and is super friendly and welcoming - as was the Executive Pastry Chef. We will definitely be returning as I'm sure this will become our new favorite place for dinner party desserts. Highly recommend!

They share a spot with Porcos Porchetteria. While waiting for the sandwich inside, I couldn't help but get some coffee and a donut. I would say that you are paying for the presentation and appearance rather than the taste of the food.

name: Oxtail International Cuisine and Juice Bar

reviews.text: Man I was sooooo excited to see a Caribbean restaurant in south philly, I didn't hesitate to to go order the biggest platter they had. Which was expensive at that $20 large oxtail platter no problem... I'll literally spend that here all the time. Probably be a daily customer. Ohh how disappointing it was... the oxtail was the most bland tasting oxtail I've ever had in my life. Rice and beans had no flavor, and the Mac & cheese (which is my favorite) tasted worst than kraft. No seasoning AT ALL. Idk if they don't taste their food but they should maybe try a different  Caribbean restaurants food and then try their own to find out what's missing..

This place is solid. My boyfriend and I went there and got two platters with an array of sides to be able to try a little bit of everything. The oxtail was good, but I was really impressed by the jerk chicken. So many places get it radically wrong, but there's had a nice crust, while still being moist inside. The baked mac 'n cheese was really creamy but nice and browned on top, and the rice and peas - while not a show stopper - were still a good receptacle for all of the other things going on. I wasn't as impressed with the collards, but they may have just needed a little more salt. But the things that needed to impress, did. The spot also has a ton of Jamaican sodas and beverages, as well as some fresh juices, but we didn't get those - that'll have to be saved for next time. Welcome to the neighborhood, Oxtail International!

Tried the curried goat with cabbage and rice and peas as the sides - it was SO GOOD. The goat has to be the most tender I have ever tried, it melted in my mouth. The portion was really generous too - I probably could've gotten two meals out of it but I couldn't stop eating. Service was super friendly and quick, and there is a really nice array of beverages. I can't wait to come back and try more!

Great customer service.  Fresh Fantastic Food!!! My job has ordered for special occasions and the food was always fresh and seasoned superbly. I wish  I could duplicate the rasta pasta.  No meat added to the vegetables but they taste great.  i highly recommend this establishment. Venita D.

Great new Jamaican spot in the area that also does juices! There's no dine-in but there's delivery through DoorDash and pickup. You can walk in and order too. We ordered the jerk chicken, mac &cheese, oxtail, pasta and cornbread. Everything was sooo good and the customer service was great. The cornbread was sweeter than expected but still really tasty. Will definitely be back again to try out more food and their juices!

I didn't hear good things about this place but I wanted to try it for myself. The food selections were nice but that caribbean flare just wasn't there in the taste for me. I went a second time I decided to try a chicken patty because I believe in supporting when ever I can but when my friend  and myself were told there were no napkins  they were all rolled up with plastic wear and no napkins for people who are purchasing something that didn't  require a fork is ridiculous, take a trip to any dollar store for heaven sakes. I'm still hopeful  about this place but I'm not running back any time soon.

Based on previous reviews, we didn't have high hopes for this place.  BUT I don't always go by previous reviews and I'm glad that we didn't because the food was absolutely AMAZING!

We did a "test drive" by the place to check the parking situation(Oxtail is located at a very busy intersection in South Philly) and to check out the food.  I drove, so my husband went inside to grab a menu! He came back with a smile on his face! YAYYYY. He said the food looked good and the prices were actually a bit lower than other Jamaican restauarants.

We usually order oxtails and pepper steak platters and didn't deviate from that.  Total was $42 for 2 large platters. Seems steep but oxtails are very expensive and honestly would cost us more to make them at home. The platters included THREE sides! Impressive, simply because at  other places you're given a heaping plate of rice and peas and the only other side available is cabbage. Bleh...

Just one star off for not having sweet plantains but I've noticed that this seems to be common when you order Jamaican food later in the day.  No huge biggie.

When we returned from shopping to order the food, they were out of the pepper steak so we had 2 large oxtail platters. Mine had rice and peas, collard greens and candied yams.  My husband's had rice and peas, mac n cheese and cabbage.  The YAMS literally tasted like a sweet potato pie and no one can tell me different. AMAZING. The oxtails were smaller BUT they gave us plenty of them.  Nice and tender. I really liked that the rice and peas weren't covered in gravy because I could actually taste the rice and it was seasoned well!  My collards were just okay, a little bland so I probably wouldn't have them again.

Overall, the food was really good, priced right and we'll be back soon.

Had their oxtails, rice and peas, and cabbage. While the food was tasty, the portion was ridiculously small. I get that oxtail are expensive, but the portion they serve isn't worth the cost in my opinion especially for the rice and cabbage proportions. I typically expect 1:3 rations this wasn't even that. Overall disappointing.

I posted a review 4/5 months ago about how bad the pizza is- I posted pictures below (not even as big as a Race Trac slice) this morning while getting ready for work the owner guy (again) private messages me, still very seemingly butt hurt over a review I made- I tried to report him but the business is either not accredited or nowhere to be found in the BBB (wow what a surprise)- if you like bad pizza ya like bad pizza- don't go there lol
Love this place would eat here again not just for the pizza but for the fabulous Capri Salad. The mozzarella sticks aren't bad either.
The only place from which this born and bred New Yorker would order pizza. Best in town. Absolutely sublime. Thank you for your service.

So it is very rare that I will take the time to write a review but last night's dinner at The Crazy Italian prompted me; not only the food but the atmosphere brought me back to the 4+ years I lived in NY back in the 90's. The kids were begging for pizza, and not generally much of a pizza fan, particularly in New Orleans, I decided to order a meatball sub for me and a pizza margherita for the kids. The sub was amazing. Meatballs were nearly all meat with very little filler but moist. Tangy sauce and the bread.... Now onto the pizza, as I said not much of a pizza fan since Ive been in the south, but OMG did this pizza bring me back to the family owned neighborhood pizzerias on Long Island. The kids "gavoned" the pie, leaving me a sliver. That mere sliver transported me back in time. Thin, crispy, yet chewy crust with just the right amount of char. The tangy but sweet sauce with the mozz and basil, an absolute hit. Had I known by then, I would have ordered two pies!!! We will definitely be back!
Don't pass this place up. The pizza is delicious. The dough was amazing with a little crunch to it. The meatballs were wonderful too! Will be back!

Some of the best pizza I've had in the city and certainly the best in Lakeview and surrounding area. Tasty, no frills New York style pizza. The sauce is simple and delicious. Crust has the perfect bite of salt, chewy, not too thick or thin. The pepperoni pizza is perfection! My new go-to spot.

Should be called the Nasty Rude AF Italian!! Ordered dinner here after googling them and checking out the online menu... the prices were completely different and about 20% higher!! When we asked the owner about this he stated: " prices went up because of COVID and we have nothing to do with what's online, I'm very busy in the back you can get out of my store and you're not welcome back" 
Pizza is available everywhere in this area, and there is no need to go to this nasty, 2star mediocre, family owned place.... especially when pizza Dominica is about to open a mere block away!!! Will never patronize a place run by such nasty, rude people!!!

Don't let the fact that this spot is located in a small strip mall deter you. It's some of the best pizza and Italian food you will ever have. I had lunch here a few days ago and it was delicious. 

I enjoyed the margherita pizza, the white pizza, boudin egg rolls, Mount Vesuvius shrimp, meatballs, and spinach dip. Yeah, it was a lot! Thankfully, I was sharing with a few people. 

The pizza here is authentic New York style pizza with that perfect thin crust and cheese and sauce that speaks for itself. The place is family owned and the service is super friendly. It's a small spot, so give the crew some heads up if you plan on being in a big group. Otherwise, take out is a great option. I love the food here and I will absolutely be back.

While the pizza (Margherita) was delicious and the restaurant appeared to be as clean as a whistle, staff I encountered was not wearing a mask (I was).  The ordrer taker completely ignored me while she cleaned up old messages on the store phone.   I finally had to ask her if she could take my order. 
Customers entering the store were not wearing masks and were not asked to mask up.  No one asked to see my COVID Vaccine information.   I will return, because, like I said, the pizza was very good, but I'm disappointed that a restaurant in Orleans Parish was violating city mandates so blatantly.

Working from home, I've tried just about every place that delivers around me. Pizza Hut and Dominos is always easy to order, and while it cures your hunger it just isn't great. I decided to The Crazy Italian and wasn't expecting much, but I have to say it was much better than expected. The pizza arrived warm and it was perfect. It wasn't soggy and the toppings didn't slide off. It was perfectly done, not over cooked or undercook. I will definitely order again!
