The Crazy Italian uses actual water from New York to Jake their pizza dough.  We had the large pepperoni and it's definitely a big "football " style pizza.  The crust has New York pizza chew and is a lot of pizza for under twenty bucks.

Pretty good. The whole family seemed to enjoy the pizzas. 

I used the Slice app to find an open pizza restaurant. Given Hurricane Ida and the pandemic, it's been difficult to find open restaurants, in general, much less pizza places. I gave Crazy Italian a try based on the reviews and they did not disappoint. The taste of the back crust reminded me of Papa John's, but not as sweet. 

At 18", these pizzas are huge! I ordered pepperoni for the kids and a Hawaiian for me and my wife. I also ordered a side of fried mozzarella sticks. I added pepperoni, sausage and red peppers to the Hawaiian, but they forgot the pepperoni. The pizzas were lukewarm by the time they reached us, but they had a nice flavor. I popped a few slices in the air fryer the next day and they were cheesy and tasty. I will say the bottom crust is very soft. I wish the bottom crust was crispier or firmer to hold up to the toppings. The mozzarella sticks were crispy, cheesy and seasoned. I didn't care for the tomato dipping sauce, though, but they went well with a sauce I got from Bavette Grill in Plano, TX. 

I expect we'll be ordering again in the future. Maybe we'll eat there in person.

What a cool little place.  Very clean.  Very friendly.  The Caesar salad was made to perfection (something you don't find very often these days)  
The calzone and pizza was absolutely of the charts.  This guy knows his pizza.  We will definitely be back.  Very friendly atmosphere.  And awesome pizza.

As if...I cannot believe I found another new place doing NY pizza in two weeks.  Last week I find NOLA Pizza Co. and this week it's the Crazy Italian in Lakeview!  What is happening in New Orleans?  The crust, the sauce..it seriously reminded me of a dive pizza parlor in Wildwood, NJ.  They also had an authentic Caprese that I learned to love in Italy.

Stopped in the Crazy Italian for the second time in one week. During my first visit I ordered a whole Supreme pizza, which was huge. The taste was awesome and just the right amount of toppings. During my second visit of the week, I ordered a slice of the White pizza and slice of the Supreme. The white pizza was very good and again had the right amount of toppings - cheese. The crust is perfect not too thin and not thick. The supreme slice was just as tasty as the first time I had it.  This is not your fast food food pizza, it is very fresh and tasty. The place is small but has ample seating. The folks working there are very warm, welcoming and friendly. Will definitely be going back soon. Great addition to the Lakeview area!

The pizza was amazing. It reminded me of being in New York. Better than any other pizza in New Orleans hands down. The owners were 2 of the nicest people you'd ever meet. They were so sweet with my wife and I and our toddlers. Can't wait to go back! 

From the water to the flour to the sauce to the toppings to the oven it is cooked in ... this place knows detail and the importance of using high quality ingredients and the proper cooking technique to achieve the perfect pie. Anyone who says anything different doesn't know pizza or, should I say, good pizza.

Incredible food, great service, and a super friendly 
staff. Best pizza I've ever had in the New Orleans area. 10/10 would recommend.
The best pizza in NOLA, hands down (I grew up in NY, so I feel like I know something about good pizza). We are so lucky to have this place!!!
Food was bad. Not very hot. Pizza tasted like it had been reheated in the microwave. Found aluminum foil in one meal. Spaghetti sauce not good.

Pizza was great I got pepperoni but wish I would've added more toppings.  Sauce cheese dough were perfect will be back.  The owner is awesome. The only thing was the Caesar had grated cheese I prefer shredded or slivers of Parmesan cheese.  Dressing was great and salad was fresh.

Probably going to be my go to pizza place in town from now on. Huge slices of floppy thin crust, perfect walkin around pizza. 

Fettuccine alfredo was also good, and the cannoli was huge. Ayyy.

Pretty good Lakeview pizza spot, good dough and tasty, filling, gooey New York style sauce. I got the Pepperoni, but curious to try the other toppings. They closed on Tuesdays so don't accidentally order using the app, because there ain't nobody there. Next to a food store so you can get your dranks next door. No complaints, cept some of us want our pizzas Tuesdays too.

Excellent pizza at an excellent price! The ingredients were fresh, and the crust has just the right amount of crispiness and chewiness. We got half meatball pizza, half white pizza. Highly recommend! They also deliver via door dash and Waitr.

Born and raised in nyc and basically grew up on pizza, ive been searching for a decent pizza place in new orleans for years. Ive been to the all cities so called ny style pizza joints but all were disappointments. That being said the crazy italian is a hidden gem for nyc style pizza, it truly hits the mark.
I was really looking forward to trying the pizza. It looked incredible, but the taste was just not there. Very bland and generic.

Stopped in again and ordered the white pizza. The slice was a good size and taste was awesome. Great staff very friendly and welcoming. Great addition to the Lakeview and surrounding area. Definitely recommend Crazy Italian. Have not been disappointed in anything I have ever ordered. I recently saw that they are offering gelato. That's the next thing I'm going to try! Don't miss out!

I thought that the combo of Pizza and Sushi was really odd. But we just tried their Pizza. Without a doubt, without exaggeration, this IS the BEST pizza in Delaware. The pizza reminds me of what you might find in NYC. Even after being in a box and going home the crust was still crunchy, the sauce flavorful, and the cheese perfect.

My recommendation is that you order more pizza then you think you'll need. Because we all fought for that last slice!

We didn't try the Sushi yet. But this will be our new Pizza Place. We'll definitely be back.

You guys, this place is legit!  Truth be told, I had already eaten a (light) meal nearby, but I was so excited to find it that I spent $20 on a Tomato Pie and Tartar Jar (salmon) just to try it!  The tomato pie was served piping hot out of the pizza oven, on a gorgeous bubbly and slightly charred crust.  Delicious sauce!  The tartar jar was fresh and tasty, and pretty much good enough for me to live on daily for the rest of my life!  
It's a takeout place, but they have a handful of outdoor tables.  Grab a bottle of wine down at the other end of the shopping center and definitely plan on enjoying a nice casual meal on the patio right there if the weather's nice!

Having the option for both sushi and pizza seems like an odd feat, but both are pretty tasty and the menu is diverse with unique arrangements of flavors rather than just standard sushi and pizza combos.

 I had sushi tonight and i have to say it was very fresh. The prices are a little too expensive for me, comparatively to other spots I frequent often, but the quality is fresh and the sashimi comes in large pieces. The black garlic soy sauce is a plus and complimented the octo-eel yama maki well. 

The owners care much about the food and will make sure your service is fantastic. Support your local small businesses and go try Pizzeria Maki, where their slogan is problem solved since 2021.

Just had two pizza's ( The Baller and Veggie) at this restaurant plus sushi as well. I know people may think pizza and sushi in one place...it works!!!!. Had the Shaggy Shrimp sushi and wow that was great. Everything was delicious and yes had the Sample deserts you get 4 different ones. Will be going back and letting my friends know about this place.  The staff is friendly and helpful as well.

Pizza...sushi....strange combo, right? But it absolutely works, and Pizzeria Maki nails both in its own way. The pizza is up there with Bardea's quality (though not as sloppily divine as Dimeo's, perhaps), while the sushi is decidedly American-style but still delicious. 

What rounds out the appeal of this place is the diverse collection of apps - every single one is delicious. Not to mention, delivery is lightning fast. Highly recommended for your next Friday night takeout splurge!

Came here for my husband's birthday lunch! We were excited to try this place since it had two of his favorite things! Pizza and sushi

We ordered the baller pizza that had meatballs. The pizza was really good and we enjoyed that. The sushi rolls we got...not so much. We got the everything bagel, Octoeel and the salmon nigiri.  The everything bagel and Octoeel were okay. I didn't like how they put a lot of fillers on top like cucumbers...basically hiding the roll. The salmon nigiri looked like the regular salmon we get from the grocery store (as opposed to sushi grade salmon)

Prices were pretty high for everything we ordered. Maybe we ordered the wrong sushi items. I'm willing to come back and maybe try another pizza and sushi roll in the future. The staff was very nice and the place was so cute when we walked in! So kinda a bummer.

Underrated. 

Not sure how competitive the Delaware restaurant scene is, but I think Pizzeria Maki has to be close to the top of the list for pizza (and sushi!) concepts.

Pizza was good. Sushi was good. Drink selection includes a number of Boylans craft sodas and some other neat glass bottle drinks. The desserts they offer come in convenient to go cups with a screw on top. I really enjoyed this spot and will definitely eat here again.

When it's cold, you may want to order ahead. There isn't an indoor area to wait for your food.

Pizzeria Maki is a must try! Ordered pick up online which consisted of the small margherita pizza, small vodka pizza, the Philly roll with honey miso sauce, and the shaggy shrimp roll. We also couldn't resist all three dessert jars - s'mores, cheesecake, and green tea. 

The pizzas were A+!! The sauces were great, crust perfect and crispy; both were really wonderful. The sushi was also fresh and flavorful and the miso honey ponzu sauce was a great addition. Lastly, the desserts were awesome. The seasonal cheesecake flavor was my favorite and the other two close behind. 

Staff is super kind and the food did not disappoint. We will definitely be back.

Phenomenal food! Recommended to us so we had to try it! The perfect pear Yama maki was delicious! We also tried the Standard pizza which was equally just as good! Such a great idea for a restaurant and well presented!

Well let me just say, what a delightful surprise to find originality in take-out. This location has everything a person would want to have on a Saturday evening. Fresh flavors to excite the palette in every bite. The pizza was really excellent. I ordered a have white half cheese pie. The crust was chewy and thin. The perfect ratio from sauce to cheese was again everything I needed. The sushi was melt in your mouth scrumptious. The pickle veggies were crisp, elegantly displayed and super tasty. I can't wait to order again. I see this little business will be booming in no time.

New combo concept of pizza and sushi! A duo that I didn't know could exist. If you love them both, than this place is it. 

Very clean and bright takeout establishment. There are chairs and tables outside if you can't wait to devour. Plentiful of parking, even if you rather eat in your car. 

Good pizza with tasty marinara and cooked just right. Sushi is fresh. Dessert cups were smaller than I expected, but the Green Tea Trifle was delicious. Prices are a little high, but substantial in terms of quality. Last but not least, friendly staff.

Really really impressive food! My family would go to Maki for just their pizza and would go just their sushi but they have both! Amazing! Thank you for solving a few of our meal choice debates!

Quite surprised of the value of what we received: the flavors were distinct and high quality, excellent presentation, and for a very reasonable price for both the pizza and the sushi for the area!
Pizzeria Maki slid into first place for me. Closest taste to NY pizza. Well worth the 20 min drive. Establishment is very clean also.
Always an easy, quick way to order subway close to our hose. Friendly staff both in the subway restaurant and the gas station. Very conscientious, happy and recommend!
Not enforcing mask rules. I will pass the word around.

I always get the same sandwich when I go to a subway , however with this location , Probably one of the most awful tasting sandwiches I've had. Toasted for like 5 seconds chicken had a rubber texture. Wouldn't recommend.
Man kept making saying words to me in Spanish because I was Mexican and made fun of my accent

Stopped in for a quick sandwich to-go. Ordered the foot-long Italian B.M.T. and since we live nearby, the sandwich was still hot and delicious when we got home.  We asked for our sandwich toppings on the side with Subway's salad dressing.  Everything was packed perfectly and as we requested. Kudos to the cook.

This Subway is located in a Shell station so there was free parking and easy in and out.
I stopped in this place on a whim and it didn't disappoint. Both pizzas were delicious but the mortadella was my favorite! Service was excellent! I'll definitely be back!

Pizza was great! We got the prosciutto pizza and the pepperoni pizza. They were delicious and the pepperoni was not greasy at all! The arugula on the prosciutto had just enough of some sort of dressing, it was very good! In addition to the pizza being delicious, the servers were awesome! We ate outside and we brought our young dog who we are training. The staff was so awesome about it and the service was great. They didn't rush us, food came out timely, but most of all, they were super courteous. The delicious pizza along with such awesome servers made for such a great dining experience!

Pizza Crimine is new to the scene and I couldn't wait to try! So many things are made in-house -- from the mozzarella to the robiolina -- and each thing on the menu is thoughtfully crafted so it all just flows perfectly.

The owner really put his heart and soul into the pizzeria and it really shows. We had "da shroom" and "prosciutto 3.14" Da Shroom was my personal favorite.

We also had a sweet tooth and ate the "pizza frita" which was fried pizza dough tossed in cinnamon, orange zest on top with dulce de leche dipping sauce 

Oh! And the wings? Straight fire! Sharing some pics below.

Please never get rid of the vegetarian fig jawn pizza from the menu. It is the best. All time favorite. Wanted to try this place because the pizza are very similar to a pizzeria in Philly and it's literally a dream come true to actually have the fig pizza as a permanent item on the menu and the fact that all the pizza in general is not extra thin, burned, and hard. Begging to please don't ever start ruining pizza that way and then say the change is bc other customers like it that way. They can go somewhere else. The pizza is so excellent as it is so I would be so happy if its texture is kept as it is . Pizza Crime is my new favorite and I hope it's always around and always stays this good! Thank you.
This place had amazing great pizza and amazing al Fresca dining dining experience! The pizza is brick oven neopolitan. Owner super friendly and staff was great! Definitely coming again.
If you want some of the freshest food around and a great value, make sure you visit this place. I haven't had food this good in a long time. It was absolutely delicious!

Absolutely a delicacy in the pizza game.  If you are in the mood for a Neapolitan style pizza this is your  spot.  Everything is just perfect.  Thin but not floppy crust.  Very fresh ingredients.  Friendly staff and just a good vibe.  You know when they say you can " taste the passion" or " taste the love " that goes into a good pizza? You get that feeling here.

Friday night. Amazing pizza fun byob vibe!

My 2nd trip here same amazing food. Can't wait to come back up.
Wow, what a pie! This pizza is beyond amazing. They have innovative toppings and friendly staff. My new favorite spot.
Absolutely phenomenal. We enjoyed the margarita and the fig with Gorgonzola! Yum yum yum

The best pizza in Jersey! From apps, to entrees to dessert Pizza Crimine's food is just amazing. With great food, comes their outstanding service and hospitality. Their staff is polite, and accommodating. I highly recommend Pizza Crimine.

The pizza here is absolutely awful and overpriced.  Ordered the Prosciutto and Salsiccia Di Beyond.  

The Prosciutto was a round flat bread cooked in an oven, than prosciutto and arugula was just dumped on it.  There was almost no mozzarella or fontina on it either.  Nothing was cooked onto the bread at all.  It might as well have been a flat bread open faced sandwich.  Very bland and something I could have made at home, much better as well, without paying $17.00.

The Salsiccia Di Beyond was another round flat bread that had tomatoes, Beyond Sausage, and broccoli rabe very sporadically placed on it.  The bread was burnt and very bitter.  There were very few ingredients placed onto it as well.  I really would not have paid $18.00 for this, or any price for that matter.  

Both pizzas were completely bland.  I don't know where these other reviewers have been getting their pizzas, but Pizza Crimine is neither pizza nor is it worth the money.

This is not a corner joint kind of pizza place. If that's what you want, look elsewhere. But if you want delicious, high quality toppings in creative combinations on amazing crust from a former chef at Osteria in Philly, this is your place!

I've had the margarita, the fig jawn, and the nduja. All three were fantastic! Give them a try, if you know what to expect, you should be delighted.

Best brick oven pizza in South Jersey. Period. The "Pepperoni Jawn" is my favorite and recently got voted best pizza in South Jersey for a reason. The owner is super friendly and always comes out to greet the customers and the staff is very attentive and polite. My go to is to order the Pepperoni Jawn but ask them to add some Mikes Hot and Honey to it *Chefs Kiss*, you're welcome.

Are you a pizza lover? If so-- and you want some REAL pizza like the ones that come out of an fire oven like in Italy-- Come to this pizza shop! It's so beautiful inside and they even have outdoor seating

We were out at haddonfield and was looking for place to eat dinner...

We sat down at the brewery next door but didn't find out that they do not serve any food till we sat down.. luckily they allow outside food

Pizza crime was next door... I called but was told that they were "too busy" and was not accepting any order by phone and recommend me to order on their website... to our surprise their website not only allowed us to order but said the food will be ready in 15 min.. which honestly confused me .. if they were truly that busy how is the food ready so fast?

Anyhow, I originally had high expectation of their pizza as every other table at the brewery have crime pizza boxes on their table but... it really just didn't taste good (had a charred flavor and the bread tasted like cardboard)... their wing also has a weird charred taste..

I hate leaving bad reviews but I probably won't be back..

The crime here is the size of the pizzas, the price and the taste.  $15 for a medium pizza. They were not cooked through, I like a crust with a bit of a crunch. The Cesar salad had soggy croutons. Extremely limited menu. Horrible pizza.
Omg so good. I keep coming back this is the only wood fire pizza in south jersey. Definitely try the dessert. My favorite was the prusscito pizza. It's BYOB so bring some good wine.

South Jersey often gets overlooked as a destination for real deal, top shelf pizza, which is a shame because if you overlook south Jersey as a serious destination for pizza, you might very well miss out on this great pizza place.

Not only does Pizza Crime have great pizza (not to mention a cool name), it also has a cool vibe. The outside definitely catches your attention and the inside has a very cool ambiance. This is a great place to just chill and enjoy some top notch pizza.

I definitely recommend Pizza Crime and give it five stars. Don't miss out on this place. Check it out and you will be a fan.
Outdoor seating, BYOB, overall a great place. The prosciutto pizza was delish along with the zucchini app we got and the stuffed peppers. Menu is creative without being too outlandish
Awful service. There is a man who works here who is extremely rude to customers. I will go to the PPF at the Walmart instead from now on.

If i could leave 0 stars I would.  The owner is incredibly rude and has no sense of customer service.

Now i know why it always seems to be empty!

I ask why don't they have the pepperoni pretzels..she says ohh we do just ask and we will be happy to make you one whenever! I say cool definitely next time.....now I've came here two separate occasions and first time sorry big order can't spare one and then next day how can I help you, ohh sorry can't we're closed ...... I guess 15 min before closing means u get nothing but what's left.
I don't even know if they put meat in this thing 4 dollar is pretty expensive for something that meatless

These pretzels take me back to my childhood in Philly, and the "pretzel days" we would have in elementary school.  

Fresh! Clearly baked daily. Chewy, soft and yummy.  I stop by here whenever I can, while visiting my family in the area.  At five for $2, you can't go wrong.  And try some hot mustard if you're down for spicy goodness; it really is hot.

I was visiting Sherwood Park mall on this rainy day and decided to warm up with a buffalo chicken poutine from Joey's Urban. One would not think that gravy and Frank's red hot would mesh well together but it seemed to work with neither flavor overwhelming the other. The full portion of poutine and ingredients seemed like good value for the money although it could have used a few more chicken pieces. Including a drink it managed to get me full for under $10.00. The staff were also pretty nice. The lady at the till asked my name right away and continued to use it for the duration of the transaction. It was a nice little personal touch that im not used to getting from a fast food restaurant. If I was in the mall again I would have no issues returning. The food is a higher quality then I am used to getting from a fast food establishment and the staff made a great first impression with me.

First time in the new joeys and there's no doubt it is a great improvement from the old location. It's fresh, clean and roomier. The food has always been good in the past but quality is lacking a bit here. I had a steak and asked for rare. It came blue rare as the middle was cold to cool. We also had the California chicken sandwich but the chicken was cool. They did replace it and did not charge us which was good of them as the sandwich came after we were all done eating. The steak I just ate anyways. Service was just ok (and that's a compliment).

Mmm yummers this is the best fast food place in the mall like a New York Times best seller that's how good it is 8/8 -IGN

Ps: Doug is talking about a different place

I enjoy joeys urban when I'm looking for a good shrimp taco! My favourite one is the tropical shrimp! A couple of months back you were able to get two tacos with one order but now they weirdly reduced it down to one taco (about the same size) I'm disappointed about this because I really enjoyed being able to have two. Their selection of poutines are outstanding and possibly the best poutines I've tried in town yet! The location of the restaurant in the food court is good on their outcome as well because their restaurant is really the only one that bases themselves purely on fried seafood. If you enjoy unique poutines and good shrimp tacos I recommended this place!

Intrigued by the all you can eat so I took my daughter after dance on a Tuesday. Amazing kids food options and large adult selection. Service was quick- got in and out fast. Bathroom is very outdated but clean.

Will be back to try out more of the menu!
For a fast-food restaurant, Joey's satisfies with top-quality ingredients, an amazing variety of poutine, and prompt service from friendly staff.

So it's a regular old Sunday, felt like a sandwich. In the line to order there was a roach CLEARLY walking around the sauces. Made it's creepy little way down to the veggies. Just eating it's heart out. Alerted the sandwich artist, who scooped it up with his glove and disappeared into the back. Needless to say... everyone in the line, canceled our orders.

Ok y'all it's Subway I get it, but I frequent Subway a lot during the work week for lunch since I can pick it up and go and there seems to be one wherever you are.  I went to this location since I was running some errands at Clearview Mall and I WILL NEVER GIVE THEM MY BUSINESS AGAIN.  I stood in line waiting while one of the employees talked to someone she knew who was passing by and the other employee was putting bread away. There was no acknowledgment that I was standing right in front of them or "I'll be with you in a minute".  Finally, the employee who was talking asked what I would like.  I have never seen someone move so slow in my life.  You are making a sandwich, not performing surgery.  The second employee just stood in the corner and coached the girl on how much meat she should use.  After what seemed to be forever to make the sandwich it was time to cash out.  Well not so fast.... there were 2 people who just walked up and the lady told me "just a minute" and started to take the other orders.  WTH? THE SECOND EMPLOYEE IS STILL STANDING IN THE CORNER.  At this point I was done.  I asked them if they could please check me out now as I was on my lunch break and needed to get back to the office.  The girl in the corner finally moved and checked me out.

I think customer service is the most important thing to any business and this Subway location does not have any.

I frequent this Subway on the run. The owners are nice but they haven't been there in a while. The young girls that work there are very nice. Food always sees fresh, at least the Turkey and Ham are from what I order. Soups come out of a bag so I don't think the soups are freshly made. Cookies are delicious and freshly made. I had left my card at another place one time and did not realize it until I got to this Subway, ordered and told them to hold my order while I ran to get my card from the other place. They were extremely nice and even told me I could take my order with me but I didn't until I was able to pay them for it when I got back. They offered me a free drink the next time I came in when I got a special artist cup and didn't need a drink at the time. Appreciate the kind customer service from the employees.

Horrible experience, went in to get lunch with my boyfriend and they didn't greet us the all just stared at us waiting in line for like 5mins, then the worker lady sitting at a table finally came to take our orders and mid order she just abruptly left and went to the bathroom without even saying anything.... the whole experience was not pleasant.
Horrible service!  The tuna looks old and crusty.  My meatball sandwich was ice cold.
The chicken sub tasted as though it was Not Real Chicken....I will not go here again. I only went because they had a promotion

I live around Temple's campus and found this pizza spot only a few blocks from my house. I usually get pizza by the slice, chicken ranch or buffalo chicken, which feature the chicken drizzled with the respective sauces. I have also tried their crispy chicken salad, gyros, and a few sandwiches. Obviously I like it cause I come back whenever I want a quick bite. Cool owner and main cook/chef too.
Ordered Templetown Pizza through grubhub. Delivery was fast. I just got a plain pie. It was pretty standard, but it was really good. I'll definitely try some of there specialty pies in the future!
By far my favorite spot to grab a pizza a burger a cheesesteak. Whatever you want it doesn't matter you can close your eyes and point to anything on the menu and I promise you it'll be good.
Hands down the worst pizza I have ever had. Frozen store brand tastes like something. Their pizza is basically bread. This whole place is a joke

Terrible place. Took 45 minutes to get a burger, even though people after me got their food way before me and they also were just getting burgers. After waiting 45 minutes, the burger was extremely below average. It was a thin, chewy, not tasty burger. It was cold, the cheese wasn't melted (looked like it was just slapped on), the lettuce tasted cold and the bun was soggy. Extremely disappointed, will not be back.

Great food and friendly delivery service. The other night I got the munchies so I ordered from Temple Town Pizza & Grill. I ordered a small pizza, cheese and pepperoni, along with 2 sides; fries and onion rings. The food arrived hot, perfect and on time. Great job, Temple Town! I will be ordering from ya'll again!!

5 Stars!

An honest review from Jamie W.
Price for the natural drinks are to high for a 20 Oz  I got the Tajadas con carne and very small portion my grandpa got the mariscada con coco he said is good but pricey
Very disappointed in the price of baleadas $5 for a small, terrible, store bought bread with nothing in them. Won't be going there anymore

Muy buena la comida. mucho sabor y gran cantidad. Buen tiempo con la familia!

servicio superior!
Wawa, you use the worst tomatoes ever. I alway try to support local but wawa is open late.. so that's the only reason I go to one. Please use better tomatoes!

Love this wawa!  I work down in King of prussia and live close to this one - so I have visited a great many different wawas between here and there.  This one is by far the best as far as customer service and speed.

This part of town used to be pretty lame with just a 7-11 and random gas station.    This is the perfect place for a Wawa if you are heading out of Pottstown and about to hit 422.  

The food is pretty good there, the parking is excellent, and you can leave the area using a few routes if cars get stacked up in one area.

Minnesota needs a Wawa, had one of the best cheese steak sandwich from afast food place let alone a real restaurant,great price huge portions
Maybe its a good thing I dont have one near me

First let me say kudos on the upgrade,which was most needed. 
 Now for the bad news, there is no consistency from the deli. The staff is very nice there, but depending on who is running/working that shift determines on how good or bad your choice of product will be. Maybe a Lil bit of training and 1 on 1s on a daily basis from the managers would correct the issue 

Long time customer. ...

Alisha Was great!!!
She take our order because the machine wasn't working however she made our food perfectly Thank you... alisha

I'm just going to stop going to this Wawa. This is the 3rd time in a row they have gotten my sandwich wrong, and it's not even like it was busy in there! I am so tired of wasting my money at this place. Maybe if they would spend less time singing and more time concentrating on what their screen says, they would get their sandwiches right.
Great place to grab some food or a quick drink. Friendly staff, clean restrooms and the lowest gas prices in the area.

We were so excited to try pink taco but such a disappointment! We ordered 2 soy chorizo and papas and there were no potatoes at all. The serving was so meager especially given that it was $4 per taco. It was like a spoonful of filling.

Yes!!! So I am excited for this pop-up Pink Taco Truck! Finally, some excellent tacos in the Sparks area! Reno Pink Taco Truck has popped up in Sparks on Visita and Wingfield Hills Road near the United Federal Credit Union or across the street from Starbucks!
The food is fresh and made to order! My daughter loves the freshly homemade pink tortillas. Those and the pink crema were such a fun touch to the meal. 

The meat is tasty, juicy, and bursting with flavors. 
We tried the chicken tacos, the quesabirria tacos, and the Mexican Asada pizza. Every one of the dishes had its own savory flavor. The tortillas are homemade daily!

I can't place the chicken flavor, but boy, was it delicious! I wanted to go back for more. This could be bad for me as I live on the opposite corner of where they have popped up! 

The quesabirria tacos are made with chopped-up birria stew meat served with onions, cilantro, and a consommé, all in a cheesy pink shell. They are were rich and flavorful. The image of these tacos with the tender, juicy meat and fried, crispy cheese sticking out the top, being dunked into a deep red consommé, warms my tummy up! They also serve this delicious meat as Birria Ramen. They do the beef birria stew meat topped with onion, cilantro, and a squeeze of fresh lime juice all over noodles! I can't wait to try this! 

My daughter enjoyed the Mexican Asada pizza and chicken tacos. She is tickled pink to see the pink taco shells and the pink crema! My daughter also requested more of the Mexican wedding cookies they gave us as a treat. These buttery cookies feature ingredients like butter, sugar, spices, and nuts. They are oh so delicious! We have requested an order for three dozen already. We hope our friends enjoy them as much as we did. 

The customer service was fantastic. We spoke about the history of the business and the owners behind the delicious creations. Thank you for the conversation and delicious food! Give them a try, and I'm sure you won't be disappointed. I hope the Reno Pink Taco Truck will continue to stay in the Sparks area as we lack restaurants in the area....plus, they are so yummy.i

*Edited to add we went back and tried the chicken burrito, Asada tacos and the Birria Ramen. We enjoyed everything and my daughter is already asking for more of the Birria Ramen soup! The chicken burrito was huge!!! It was filled with chicken, beans, rice, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole! It was really good.
Ordered 3 carnitas and 2 chicken tacos. Absolutely no flavor.  Really disappointing. Super unorganized order and food delivery at the first 2021 food truck Friday, Reno. Hopefully will get better.

Found this place tonight and LOVED it. Grew up in Southern California near the border so I'm always on the hunt for authentic street tacos. This place did not disappoint.
Ordered the queso Birria taco and wish I would've ordered more than one. 
Tried my son's carne asada taco and it was just as delicious.
Can't wait to come back!

name: State of New Jersey Motor Vehicle Comission

reviews.text:
The Salem MVC office gets the job done.  Some employees are friendly and some aren't so much, and my most recent driver's license photo is so bad that I wouldn't be able to pick myself out of a lineup, but if the state of NJ is okay with it, who am I to question?

This review isn't so much about the Salem office as it is about the state's system; it just took place in the Salem office.  Hubby and I had received notices late last year that we needed to renew our driver's licenses.  The NJ native (me) had to trot in there with my six little points of identification, but the non-native (him) got to "skip the trip".  We sent in his payment and forgot about it.  In all of our decades of license renewals (in other states), we've never had a problem.

We didn't realize until last month that his license had never arrived, so we went to the Salem MVC office to find out what was up.  Sure enough, they looked it up and found where we'd made the payment in plenty of time, but the license just got lost, somewhere.  Now, one might think, based on that info, that they could just reprint the license and send him on his way.  Not in NJ.  We had to pay the entire fee AGAIN, and the reason was (this is priceless) that the first payment was sent to Trenton, but we'd never paid in the Salem office. You just can't make this stuff up.   

So, we paid the fee AGAIN, got his license, and they gave us a form to fill out and mail in to get a reimbursement of the first payment.  Obviously, the state's computers talk to each other, because the local office was able to see that the payment was made, but it's informational only, nothing that helps us.  We're thinking that maybe we should skip the "convenience" of  "skip the trip", if we're still here when we need to renew, again.  

Every day in NJ is a new experience in "you've GOT to be kidding me!"

Am a military serviceperson who has registered his vehicles in 5 different states over 20 years.  This Salem branch was the least crowded and most helpful branch with which I've done vehicle-related business.  Branch manager, Shirlee, personally eliminated a military-related challenge I was having trying to renew my drivers license and made some calls to Trenton on my behalf.  Am very thankful for the personal attention of Shirlee and her very helpful staff.  Thanks!

Maybe this location could be okay for simple needs like renewing a driver's license -- but things get messy beyond that.

Many years ago, I purchased my car at a local dealership with my mom as the co-owner since I was fresh out of college without much credit history. I recall requesting primary ownership (and subsequently paid it off myself in years to come). But my mom held onto the important docs, and she/Honda lost the title (possibly a postal error, not entirely clear what happened).

Since moving out of state a couple years ago, it's been on my to-do list to attain a new title in order to transfer the registration. I requested one through the mail in July, and about a week ago received a rejection from the state, notating they needed my mom's info. Turns out my car has never had my name on it, which required her to pay for a duplicate title ($60) and "gift" the car to me. I was told I needed proof of insurance in VA before that could be done. Our first visit last Thursday to this DMV was long and confusing, but it helped to sort the issue in person rather than states away. Or so it seemed.

I don't know if the workers had a collective case of the Mondays this morning, but without going into every detail:

The receptionist declined to accept proof of insurance via my phone, even though I was told (erroneously, I'd later learn) that via phone was fine. She tried to send me to the library to print it, which I declined and requested a supervisor. I was given a ticket and had to wait for her. Meanwhile I listened to other associates blatantly talk about me and my issue within earshot.

The manager basically told me I was a liar, which I did not appreciate. She stood behind her group 100%, wouldn't discuss the issue with my mom via the phone, and refused to provide an email for printing purposes. It's 2019. The DMV really should have a client inbox. Eventually, she caved and provided a fax number. I called my insurance and they sent it right over.

Once everything was sorted and the first person acknowledged she remembered telling me the incorrect info and apologized (something the manager should have done), I was given a temp tag. I asked how it goes on the car and was told "there's a screwdriver at reception."

I walked to reception and told them/the security officer that I have a bad back and asked if assistance was available. The (male) officer told me that I was fine and it was a simple task, in the most haughty tone. It took everything in me to not go off on him right then. How dare he tell me how I feel? Hell to the no. Not okay.

It was drizzling out as I worked on the task. A bystander couple then walked up to me halfway through, and the wife told me to let her husband help me. She had heard what I said about my back. How sweet is that? They were so wonderful, and I hope to pay their act of kindness forward.

As I walked back in with the old plates to surrender them, the security guard announced, "Good job!" I told him he needed to learn kindness and he shrugged and started whistling to himself. So rude. Would they treat my 90-year-old Grandmom that way? Or someone with a more obvious health condition? Shame on them for being ageist and apathetic. The DMV should have someone on hand to assist.

Fortunately I'm done with the NJ DMV now, but I hope they can maybe kick the disgruntled government workers stereotype and learn that we're all humans, and being rude or cruel isn't professional or necessary.

I have held a drivers license in 23 different states and can safely say this is the worst experience and place I have ever been.  Let's start with the lousy instruction on where to stand and where to go, next having to fill out the same form 4 times for no other reason than they can't read and organize themselves with just one.  Next the poor attitude of every employee in the building, they were playing on their cell phones and it took three of them to take care of my license.  No appointments for at least four month, poor web services and lack of clear requirements.  Let's just take a moment to remind everyone 23 different states I have done this.  Blame Covid but offer no social distancing for the customer.  New Jersey you need to get your act together.  Last and very much not least I'm baffled at the way I was treated due to being gay, I was called a dyke twice by the middle aged Karen at the desk.  I couldn't get my registration done, bc they need a title (THE ONLY STATE). Then they tried to deny my ability to register to vote.   Lucky for me I have it all on video though I was told I couldn't take a photo or have my camera by the ass hats that "worked" there.    New Jersey I am so lucky this is only a one year pit stop!

Word of advice: if you're between leasing and buying out your leased vehicle, buy out your lease before your registration expires. I extended my lease with the dealer by two months and renewed my registration ($85 for the year). After the two month extension, I bought out my lease, at which time I had to pay a new DMV registration fee for assuming ownership of the vehicle. Unfortunately, the $85 was 5/6 of a waste because the DMW wouldn't refund me for the 10 month period during which the vehicle was no longer a lease. So, basically, I paid to register my vehicle twice. Talk about a scam. Even New York State reimburses you...

This is a nice little Middle Eastern market in the same plaza as Mays Ulreem Pita, a large hookah lounge and a Marine recruiting place.. Boon thinks he's a tough guy?

They have date cookies, halvah, ginger honey and lots of other interesting snacks and foods as well as some prepared chicken, meat and spinach pies, plus baklava.type desserts and a few other prepared foods. The owner is friendly. I believe he's from Jordan. 

We enjoyed our visit.
Their kunafa makes me feel like I am in UAE again. I drive an hour all the way there just to get some. It's perfect.
A traditional middle eastern store. Fresh pita bread and beautiful pastries. Visit Hookah lounge next door for Turkish coffee to go with pastries
Delicious Arabic pastries and sweets I drive an hr to come here to get my sweets. Worth the drive.

Bought a fresh tray of basbousa from them this week for $15, and OMG they were amazing!!  Perfect amount of sweetness and nice crispiness on the edges and I love how they put a cute almond on each piece .They have a variety of pastries and really affordable prices. Definitely will be my bakery for Arabic sweets.

The basbousa and the kunafa, it's all about the pastries. Baklava, too.Yes, they have a small market of groceries too but the markets at Sultan or next to the Greenland restaurant across the street are larger and better. You come here for their pastries make no mistake about it. They do have a good selection of honey, which if you're going to try to replicate some of their delicious pastries at home, you're going to need. Most importantly, aside from the fact they have the right recipes and know exactly how to make their sweets to perfection, everyone in the community also knows this so turnover is high and pastries won't sit around and spoil or dry up. Come here, get your pastries, go get some dinner at the pita place next door and Turkish coffee from either the next door hookah coffee shop or Palms coffee shop (my own favorite) across the street.

In a word, greasy. The Queso burger is just a low quality flat burger with some extra condiments. Onion rings are ok. BK does a better job. The chicken sandwich also lifeless. McD does a better job. I don't see the attraction.  Won't be back.

Terrible customer service! The person taking the order did not understand what I asked for and got irritated when I told him there was more to the order. Pulling up to the window was a whole different story, the kid at the window had a terrible attitude and refused to add or even do a separate order for a milkshake that I hadn't been able to order since the first guy taking the order in the drive through was irritated! Went back the next day and I believe the kids name is Marcos also had a terrible attitude! First he didn't give me the correct change and he slammed the money onto the table! We've never had any issues at this Sonic! They need to hire people that actually want to work! And not little kids with terrible attitudes that don't know what customer service is!

Love the set up at this location. The team at this location are friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu. I love the cream slushes and this store does them just right. The other stores done seem to know what they were doing. I'll always go to this location now.
I told them too late that I wanted my Oreo blast to be made with chocolate ice cream... came down to a blast full of chocolate syrup hahahahahahahahahaha. A for effort, this was a good laugh!!!!

Had lunch here for the first time. Cheeseburger and chili cheese fries were yummy. Food was warm and burger had lots of fresh veggies. 
Service was quick and friendly.

Glad that they finally have a Sonic on this side of town. Not as many stalls as the other location but im not complaining. Now, I'm just waiting for them to add the location on the app so I can get 50% off my drinks!
I have been there three times now each time the food is cold and it doesn't taste very fresh at the sonic in South Reno the new location.
Everything is good except the music in the dining/garage area, which is horrible. "Sonic Radio" is absolutely the worst " music" I've ever heard. What genre IS this stuff?? And it's  too loud.

I got a vanilla coffee, tater tots, and cinnamon bites.  
They were great and as soon as the app lets me order from it I will be ordering again.   
The service was great. It looked like the everything was being ran very smoothly.

Absolutely horrible experience at this location. The food tasted stale and greasy. The workers were extremely rude. 
 
I used to eat at the local Sonic restaurants, but the quality has truly gone down over the last few years. Not sure what changed, or why the restaurants have gone downhill. But they've definitely hit rock bottom with this location.

I literally had to throw my food away. 

There are so many other fast food type restraints in this area of town. Do not waste your time at this one, unless your looking for completely inedible food at a poorly run establishment.

Okay, so we came here, parked in the car park, and ordered 2 milkshakes. After about 20 minutes of waiting, we asked where they were, and the workers immediately apologized and not only corrected their mistake, but comped the milkshakes and added extra things and had it out to our car in no time. They have such good customer service, special shoutout to Diego and Karson. It's really fabulous the way that they can manage to turn something that should have been a bad experience into a really good one. They were so good that I literally wrote my first ever yelp review for the sole purpose of letting them know how good they were.

Sonic was about as I expected. The chili cheese dog was ok. The onion rings were good. Husband enjoyed the chicken sandwich but said fries were soggy. I do like the enclosed room with garage style door as opposed to an open patio. Will try mozzarella sticks next time.

What an complete cluster F.  Let's start with the girl taking our order being sarcastic and joking about confirming she's going to give us the wrong food.  We initially went to Sonic, which we never do, to get the new Cheesecake blast.  They brought us a regular vanilla shake..  They seems to care less when we told them it was the wrong order.  The staff clearly could care less.  Whoever runs this store needs to get a clue.

Went here today at 11.30.   Sat waiting to place order for 10 to 15 minutes only to watch people in cars that just pulled up get their orders placed. Finally gave up and left heading to jack in the box instead.   
Great way to not head back there.
I have had so many bad experiences. I have even had money taken from my account by ordering through Sonic. I called corporate and told that it was not their problem.

First time I ordered thru the app.

Thanks to fellow Yelper Tommy J. For mentioning the app.

I was shopping at Trader Joe's, and easily ordered lunch for myself and the hubby.

The app is easy to use.

Likes: I liked the French fries, onion rings, and drinks with crushed ice!

Dislikes: Confusion chaos! I drove up, and there's small orange cones directing you.. small signs saying left lane is drive they and right lane is the stalls...

There was another car that did the same thing I did, was pull up to the building : it had a sign saying employees only..

So I followed the car and we eventually made it to the stalls. The number of the stall is marked small on top, and no clarity if the number belongs to the left or right..

Worker came out and brought my order.

Didn't care for the chili dog, wasn't even warm and barely any chili. Basically I just ate the hot dog because of that.

Maybe they do better with burgers...

I know I'll come back for an ice cream cone!

I would've given it 5 stars. But the drive thru worker kept cutting us off; long reddish hair.. Thats ok. Could be a new employee. What really got them 3 stars is the amount of times I counted their employees touching their hair, face etc. With gloves on and some with no gloves on at all especially the Asian employee. She kept running both her hands thru her hair.  Thats disgusting and not very hygienic.

I just stopped in for an all beef premium chili cheese with onions and jalapeños.  I also bought their medium order of stuffed jalapeños which were tough, and I complained about them. I had the fellow taking the orders not knowing what to say or do, then they sent the car hop out to get the jalapeños. Then I had a women ask me ,  "What  is up with the order"? I explained that I ate two and broke apart others and found they were tough and over cooked. Lastly, a lady came to my car and told me she could not give me a refund because she said, " I Ate them". I explained that I tried eat two  but the jalapeños were tough and over cooked and I spit the jalapeños out and the rest I broke apart . So a $4.49 order she did not offer to replacer something else instead she said you ate some so I can not refund your money! Well I will NEVER eat here again. Sonic is scratched off my list of fast food forever!

Killer foot long Coney dog. May the chili and cheese host a silent night. Onion rings are perfect, along with the pretzel sticks.

I was amazed it all fit on a small lot, I remember when that lot has a small gas station!

Employees are nice, and that is the key! Close to home and a good place to watch to crazy ass  200 yard long drive-thru line at Cane's across the street.

I went one day around 5pm and the drive thru service was good, I ordered mozzarella sticks, tots with cheese and a corn dog and they gave me plenty of sauces. I came the next day around 3pm and only ordered mozzarella sticks. I got to the window and waited there for like 2-3 minutes before someone decided to ask me "Do you need something?". I guess ordering, speaking to someone and then going to the window isn't a drive thru norm lol. I got my mozzarella sticks but they didn't even give me any sauce. My order was way too difficult to stay on top of I guess. 
Different kinds of service at different kinds of times, annoying.

So nice to have a second Sonic location! This is centrally located and convenient. I love their coney and regular hot dogs and cherry limeades are so refreshing. Ice cream and shakes are such great desserts to end your meal! Also love the retro feel here.

I ordrr sodas and I am diabetic. The server gave me the sodas and I asked which was diet and he pointed to one. When I got to enjoy the soda my sugars went up greatly. This was bad for me and other diabetics. Sonic need a plan so this never happens again.

this place is absolutely horrible. sitting and waiting in line for almost an hour. the people that work the drive through are so rude. they don't ask how you're doing or ask if there's anything else they can get me. they also seem under the influence every time i come. they're super slow and seem to not care at all for how long we have to wait. this place was recently built but the speaker is so difficult to hear them through it. i've not had one good experience at this location.

Had a great experience as usual. I am mainly writing this review to shout out the employee that corrected the misspelling when they wrote my name. You're a real one, 5 stars for customer service.

Ordered 
Large Ocean Water
Large Cherry Slush
Large cherry limeade slush
2 Large Tater tots

This is the worst sonic in Reno! They always forget to give me my sauces who tf wants to eat their French sticks without syrup??? Or their tater tots without fry sauce or ketchup??? They really need to hire people with common sense because wtf!

Tried to order a small popcorn chicken.  Cashier refused to sell me a small, saying that they only offer medium and large.  I can see the menu "...small popcorn chicken $3.19".  At this point, he is very confused "Uh, we only offer medium and large".  Nice upsell tactic, but screw this.  Not everyone needs or wants that much food.
Awesome food, amazing service. The bacon cheese burger and tots were some of the best, and talk about service they brought my two dogs snacks. Customers for life.

When I want a shake, it's usually one thats blended, with even dispersal of the ingredients it contains.

But this sonic consistently under-blends it's shakes. 

This is not the first time this happened. Oh no. 

Tonight I got half a frozen banana in my shake. Unblended, just clogging up my straw. 

Yes it all tasted good. 

But did I want a sundae I have to eat with a spoon? No. 

I wanted a shake, to drink with a straw. 

Ug.

So far, I've only had GREAT customer service here AND delicious food - the coney dog, various shake flavors, a cherry Vanilla Coke with lime - all of appropriate temperature and tastiness. Not sure why so many reviewers have trouble leaving honest, productive criticism or speaking to a manager about their experience, rather than leaving such low reviews from the get-go - Yikes! The staff here is friendly and courteous, and the drive-thru and parking stall situation seems to have smoothed out, as I've gotten my order in reasonable amounts of time every visit. So glad this location is close to me for late-night cravings!

The food was awful. Fries were hard and inedible, the food tasted like it had been sitting all day. The ice was filled to the lid in our drinks, we only got three sips and the drink was gone. Corn dogs were extremely hard. First time visiting sonic and never going ever again!

I've been going here since they opened, it was good at first then things just kinda got worse. I use the app since I work near by and many times I have waited more than 15 minutes for my food. My fries have been over cooked and cold, and the pretzel are yummy when they care cooked right which they haven't been here.
The fella working the morning of November 28th  2021 was awesome! He was professional and the food tasted great.

I love this place kids that work here usually get my order wrong but they always replace something or fix the order so I do appreciate that. They have good customer service and they are fast and efficient.  good job!!!!

Customer service could use some improving! I asked to add a bag of ice....ICE!!! Which in my opinion should have already been made-up and ready to go. The girl taking the order acted like she didn't know how to add things to an existing order, she went to grab the manager who came to the window and told me they couldn't add things to the order because it would back up the line (pretty sure it took longer for her to come tell me that then to do what I had requested). Again...just A BAG OF ICE!!!!
Fries were like little stale sticks, bacon on the burger was completely burnt, sides were cold, burgers were dry. Wouldn't go back

Place is all lit up, but apparently their hours have changed. Yelp says they're open until midnight. Website says midnight. Google says midnight. Don't update your hours, you're getting a crappy rating. Which is unfortunate. I like Sonic, but going to be a while before I go back to one now if they can't bother updating their website with correct hours.

went through the drive-thru stalls and after waiting nearly 20 minutes the lady comes out with the wrong order - i wait another 10 minutes for the correct order and they still got the sizes wrong. 

spend your money elsewhere.

I wanna give it more stars because the Strawberry Limeade is always on point.  We went to Sonic looking for a burger I realize its a fast food burger but what I was served was absolutely atrocious lets start with the meat that was probably sitting on a table somewhere because it was nowhere near warm, because it had no warm my cheese slices were seriously like straight out the package placed on the burger  and lastly the bacon.  Listen y'all if they had cooked this bacon any further it would have been cremated.    I don't mind a bit of crunch to my bacon but come on.   So half way through my sandwich something tastes off not sure if its the meat that had been sitting after being cooked or the almost cremated bacon but it was awful.  I ended up making myself a Peanut butter and Banana sandwich that was 5 stars compared to what that sonic called a bacon cheeseburger.
Awesome gem in Delaware. The services was great and the food was really good,especially the spicy hot wings. Will return for more!
This place is amazing.  The food is truly incredible, the chef is super nice, nothing but great things to say.  Everything is grilled so that's healthy, go here, you won't regret it.

I really like this place. It's more or less the same as Piree's that was here before (the franchise no longer operates in the United States) You order at the counter and the friendly cashier Allison brings the food to your table. There are plenty of seats and a big screen tv in the back. Everything is generally really good and freshly prepared. My wife enjoys their quinoa salad with grilled chicken and my son likes their grilled chicken espetada. I always get the edamame and a fabulous juicy quarter chicken with sweet potato fries and grilled corn. Get the mango lime sauce. It's the best. Just watch out for the soda machine. It's possessed.

I used to live in Leeds and frequented real Piri Piri, so this restaurant was very disappointing. Although the menu copied the real chain, the food was non remarkable in fact the corn was raw. It was very overpriced.
Best place if you love spicy food! Have been here several times and glad to report that it has never disappointed!

Came here after some friends of ours recommended it. We were blown away by how good this place is. The hit of the night was the wings which  might be the best wings that we've had. They had amazing flavor to it. I ordered a chicken sandwich with lettuce instead of bread and it was tasty and fresh too. Major points for serving halal chicken as well. Yes, folks, you read that correctly! Service was friendly and the prices were reasonable. Will visit here often.

Food quality depends on the day. Yesterday was my last day spending money at this place. As we watch the waitress serve nachos and dip to the guy next to us and right before we were leaving another table. This had us very upset since we did nothing wrong and are the type of customers that you would love to have. Seeing that it was more family environment working there I always left a huge tip, as for last night I left nothing. Never again!! And I hope it wasn't a problem to them that I wasn't Spanish and my husband is. I will not bring my family here anymore. It's a shame because my daughter loved seeing the police officers eat there.

I was dying for a good Mexican restaurant to open in North Philly. I did not expect a truly excellent one to open but here it is. I have been here 5 times and tried something new each time. So far the chicken mole is a killer dish. The sauce is truly sublime with a hint of heat. Now in my top five restaurants in the area.

The owner Nicholas is usually in the kitchen and he is the best great prices and even better food the best Mexican restaurant in Philly everything on the menu is superb and fresh always.  I would recommend this restaurant hands down.  Edgar colon July 30 2017

I swear I wish I could give them 5 stars ! They are totally worth it , when the effort is put in . 4 Seasons has always been one of my favorite Mexican Restaurants . I used to stay strict to the burritos, but this summer they tried something new that blew me away . They took their cooking outside ! & the idea couldn't have been a better one . They began grilling the steak outside in front the restaurant , & yes , it's amazing ! Literally the BEST taco I ever ate in my life . This brought them so much clientele, put them on the map honestly . I'm so proud of them ! 

Now for the cons , cause like , why would I  give them 3 stars if they are the best ? 

Two words : COMMUNICATION & CUSTOMER SERVICE !!!! 

I cannot stand trying to order food and not being understood . I understand that everyone isn't perfect but in a restaurant/business setting , I just feel like there is a certain level of professionalism that should be held when dealing with a language barrier . 

As I've stated in other reviews , I am Puerto Rican but choose not to speak it . That's always a big problem I face in Philly . The daytime crew gets it poppin' ! They do their job effortlessly and quickly . The nighttime crew , which actually consists of young woman working the register and whatever cook they were able to get to work later , is terrible ! The girls are clearly not open to learning anything which has made me refrain from ordering after 6-7 pm , unless they're still outside . I even had one instance where I called in an order , went and picked it up & paid with my card , just to find out the next day that the girl gave herself a $5 tip! Like ... wtf .. regardless they fixed it the next day but the point is W T F . Lol . Anyway , if you're in the area and you see them on the grill , STOP ! You won't be sorry
Great Food And Sevice... Had The Shrimp Tacos And Steak Fajitas Everything Nice And Hot And Well Seasoned....!

The food is awesome. It's a popular venue in the hood for cops like me that serves good Mexican food. I work up the street in the police district. When I'm in the mood for some Mexican, I always think of this spot. The tacos are amazing. I always order chorizo and tongue tacos. When I'm not in the mood for tacos, I order a chorizo burrito which is quite a handful. If you dine in, you get treated to chips smothered in refried beans and cheese. I'm getting hungry just thinking about all this deliciousness!

The chicken breast looked unappetizing and tasted horrible. I had to stop eating it because I was starting to feel sick. I paid for tres leches and didn't receive it. I'm upset I didn't realize until I got to New Jersey. I'm so disappointed. Never again
El mejor restaurante que e ido en philadelphia su sabor. Su servicio, me facina ir a comer hay voy casi todos los meses mi restaurante preferido
I've stoped at tacorias all over Philly, most suck, Today I found a gem in the hood. Friendly, helpful staff, quick service and terrific flavors. Definitely stoping back for more.

Bruh this place is lit. 6 dollars for hefty burritos and other menu items are super cheap as well but dont let the low prices dissuade you because they definitely dont compromise on quality.  My buddies and I ordered 6 entrees, an app, and a horchata and the bill was just under 50 bucks!  I'm guessing cops frequent this place a lot because the day we went there there were like 30 officers dining there. So if you have the drunchies or "munchies" and you tryna bust a mean grub just be on your best behavior otherwise you might have to deal with law enforcement.
Did this place close down?? No one picks up the phone! I called many times and it seems disconnected.

So far so good!
We tried the rice bowl and curry chicken, tom yum soup and chicken noodle soup tonight.  They are tasty and fresh!  I would definitely recommend everyone to give them a try to support their grand opening.  Will definitely return to try their other dishes.
First time customer. Everything was fresh and delicious. We had two soups, and two bowls. It was enough for lunch and we had left overs for dinner. We will be back very soon!

New place on south street that's a welcome addition. Affordable delicious food with chipotle style ordering. I had the ginger pork with coconut rice and it was amazing and fresh. The staff was friendly and generous. Check them out it's worth it.

This place is awesome. It is hidden away in a little strip mall next to Dunkin donuts. When I first entered the place, I had to ring a doorbell to grant the access. When first walked in, it was clean and open. I was greeted with a nice friendly smile. Right there, it was a cute sign. It is a take out place where ppl can order food over the phone til 2:30 then they r closed. 

The price was friendly. I ended up ordering the sweet sausage, cheese and everything ones just to try. I did not wait for long for the food to be ready. These panzarotti were not too greasy. The outter crust was crunchy but not too hard and dry. In addition, they were really generous on the stuffing. I was full when I was half way through with one panzarotti. 

I would definitely go back to this place. Highly recommend it.

If you've never had a panzarotti, you're missing out. And if you've never had a tarantini panzarotti, you're really missing out! 

The Tarantini Panzarotti store is located in a small strip mall with limited weekday hours (M-F 10-4). To enter the store you'll have to ring a doorbell. 

Inside they offer both fresh panzarottis (which you can call ahead for) and frozen ones. I've purchased both here & both are delicious!

Wow. We just called to see if we could stop in to order a Panzarotti and the man on the phone was super rude. Our friend is visiting from the west coast and we wanted her to experience a Panzarotti.  She was surprised by how rude the man was to us on the phone. He had an attitude and acted like we should have known that you can't make phone orders or in person orders after 3:30. Geez, even if they would have said you could place an order in person, we wouldn't have gone in. Customer service is important and this guy definitely didn't have it. Sad.
Where the original Tarantini Panzarotti are made, also retail is done 10-4 Monday to Friday.

Why this place hasn't been Yelped yet might be even a question Siri can't answer. I tend to write really long-winded reviews because I spent 32k on a MFA in writing and it's the little things that takes the edge off of my relationship with Sallie Mae. In this case, I'll just leave you with the words of my fiancé, who said it best when he said, "Honey, this is the only steaming hot, juicy pocket I prefer over yours."

Seriously though. If you haven't ever had a Tarantini panziarotti, you haven't had one yet. I mean it. You've had a totally different animal. Probably a fried pizza turnover. This is not that, I promise. 

This will make living in Jersey as justifiable as Yelping does for my student loan.

When looking for a caterer for our St. Patrick's day wedding finding someone who understood the concept that we were looking for was challenging. I came across Foodwerx and felt a bit of relief when seeing on the website that they specialize in fusion food. Irish cuisine is not necessarily known for the classiest of dishes, but it was a wedding and I wanted to carry on the theme of the day. I originally spoke with Nicholas who put together a wonderful family style menu for us. From there I went on to work with Shannon and Dawn. Both women were very helpful, accommodating and patient. Everything from linens, to utensils and servers was taken care of. That was a huge help considering that I was planning the wedding from across the country. The day of the wedding everything was set up beautifully. The staff was polite and efficient. The food was delicious! (Especially the vegetarian Shepard pie that my family was doubting) The price was fantastic. We are very pleased with our experience. Thank you!

I recently got married and finding a good caterer in South Jersey was such a hassle (since I live in north Jersey). We were told about Foodwerks and saw their menu and were instantly excited. Thy had SO much to choose from. For our wedding, we wanted to do a bunch of passed appetizers but we also had a tight budget. I worked A LOT with Shannon, who was a huge help. She gave a bunch of options and then had us come in for the food tasting. As soon as we had the first bite, we knew they were the ones to cater our backyard wedding. The food is really good and they also handled our tent rental too. It was almost like having a wedding planner! I would absolutely use them again and recommend them to everyone.

We've done a few catering orders with Foodwerx.  Delivery has been very reliable, even to  highly confusing/complicated areas of a school campus.  The food is delish.  They have a fantastic assortment of sandwiches, wraps, salads, etc. that are ALL very tasty (ie. no leftovers).  The cookie platter is loaded with yummy choices, and let's face it, when you see a chocolate covered strawberry on a cookie tray, its a good day.

I give them four stars because they are a tad on the pricier end, even for the area.  But, I'd definitely recommend using Foodwerx for catering.  They're worth it!

We had them cater several events for family gatherings and the food was excellent.  Nick is a great guy and the work hard to make everyone happy.  We ordered the Chicken Marsala and it was delicious.  If you are looking for cater give them a call.

Nick and Brian along with Kate and Katherine as servers did a fantastic job at my daughter's baby shower on Sunday, March 9,2014.  The array of food, the presentation and the tastiness was beyond our expectations.  We had over 65 guests and everyone loved the food and took their cards.  I am so glad we chose foodwerx!!!  We will use them for both small and larger venues.  They even did a platter for gluten free guests!!! Shelly and Family

Alyssa and the team at Foodwerx could NOT have been more helpful in my desperate time of need. My husband and I decided to postpone our original big wedding plans for a small, intimate wedding in my parents backyard. Having worked professionally with Foodwerx in the past, I reached out to Alyssa; not only did they create a custom menu (matching exactly what we had originally planned), but at great pricing. She offered to handle all of the rentals as well, but I decided to do that on my own. I'm not going to lie, I was not very excited for this plan and stressing out every day. Little did I know, it was exactly what I wanted. The food was amazing (if you are debating on getting crab cakes... just do it, they were incredible), the displays were amazing, and the service was even better! A huge thank you to Alyssa, Nick, and the Foodwerx team for making our wedding the most perfect day!! :)

I held a baby shower yesterday for my daughter who is having identical twin baby girls. This is a very special event for our family and I could not have an ordinary baby shower. My sister-in-law,  recommended Foodwerx and specifically Roxanne DeHart to help me plan and execute the event. It was one of the best pieces of advice I have ever received. From beginning to end, Roxannne was well beyond the ordinary. She met with me at the venue for initial planning. She listened to my vision and gave expert advice for the menu, venue set-up, decorations, and party help.  For the next two months she  stayed in touch with me refining every detail and getting back to me (sometimes instantaneously) whenever I had a question. Yesterday Roxanne was there making certain everything was nothing short of perfect and stayed well beyond what she should have to make sure the party flowed well. When Roxanne says "No worries" she means it.
Nick, I want to personally thank you for the fabulous food and the first time customer complimentary pot-stickers. The food was absolutely delicious and exactly what I had had wanted. Melanie, our server, did a fantastic job making sure all of the party chores were done as I wanted and when I wanted. 
Again many, many thanks, especially to Roxanne for helping me throw such a memorable, spectacular party that I, my daughter, and hopefully all of my guests will always remember.
Sincerely,
Gina K.

I cannot speak highly enough about the wonderful service we received from Foodwerx!! They were phenomenal!! I just held my 50th Birthday Party over the weekend.  The food was beyond exceptional, and the staff was extremely accommodating! Roxanne was amazing!! Her planning and organizing of the party made it completely stress-free for me. She and the entire Foodwerx team worked so hard during the party to ensure that all our needs were met and that everyone was enjoying themselves. Every comment I received from my guests was full of compliments to her and the entire staff. I look forward to working with her and Foodwerx again for our next party!! I can't wait!!

I'll start off by saying the food was great at a recent catered event.  I wish I could end there.  A sight of a good catering service is that you're seen and not heard.  However this group was heard all night long.  Possibly two of the most rude waitstaff I've encountered.  The exceptions were the bartender, youngest member and one of the servers of the crew.  They represented what service should be.  
Examples of bad service: looking for utensils in the Kitchen as a guest, a member of the waitstaff rudely asked us to leave because we were in his way rather than asking if we needed any help.  People talk and apparently we found this rudeness from other party attendees.  Even though the food was great the service left a bad taste in our mouth. There was a great variety of appetizers and sandwiches! It was really unfortunate as the owner was not there.

My daughter uses Foodwerx for her corporate clients & recommended them for her sister's Bridal Shower. Roxanne was fantastic, she made sure we had everything we needed to make the day a success. Our servers were attentive and efficient, and the food, it was amazing! All of our guests were raving about the food and many requested business cards for their future events. I can't thank Roxanne enough for making my daughter's bridal shower such a stress free and delicious celebration. We will definitely be working with Roxanne and Foodwerx again, they're our new go-to caterer.

Less than impressed considering how much they hype their style, and service. I paid 12k and didn't get to eat the food from my wedding day. If I hadn't provided extra decor, presentation would have resembled that of any local buffet. My vendors complained about the timeline, and felt like the event was rushed. (And that was even before it started, so of course Murphy's law, it started late which made their timeline to accommodate their staffing that much worse) 
When pressed about it, the owner wanted us to take more time off work to meet with their staff about it. Uh, wtf? How about just apologize for not meeting expectations and not being able to fix our wedding day. 
I picked this vendor. 
I picked the menu. 
I paid for it. 

The only reason they get any stars is because our guests said that what they did get tasted good- but the portions were stingy and stations including dessert were not refilled. 

We didn't get our couple meal to go or our leftovers that we'd previously requested.
We didn't get the wine we didn't use for our toast back. 
Their staff told my guests that they don't normally eat at events bc people always order the same things but our menu was different and they enjoyed our food. 
My mom saw their staff with trays of food to go, these same people claimed they gave that food to her. 

It was the most regrettable part of
my wedding day/weekend since we had to return home to feed the guests we planned to leave the leftovers with. 

I, as the bride- spent 12k on this caterer and have no idea how the food at my wedding was and they didn't care enough to even apologize.

Just a whole headache, and I should have called the other 2 preferred vendors at my venue. I could have paid a lot less and left with the same level of dissatisfaction. 

I had high hopes for future events with them, but clearly that won't be happening. 

Ps. Always check your final invoice against your original contract and any payments- a week before my wedding I had to send back the invoice several times and explain why it was wrong on multiple levels -  how you gonna send someone a final bill (after deposits) where the amount due is higher than the original contract amount for the whole event. And have the nerve to insist that it is correct (it wasn't, it was all wrong) 

Just, ugh! Save yourself the headache and avoid! 

FYI- if you use them for a wedding, the bakery they use for the included wedding cake is way out in chestnut hill PA and they only serve pound cake. (It wasn't anything special)

I came back a few times & realized that the sweet twisty thing I like is called a churro.  Las Lomas's churros are still solid though not as great as I thought before -- I've had much more delicious churros since then.

Churro is good, soft and doughy on the inside: 3.5 stars
Doughnut is a bit dry: 2 stars
Mille-feuille or Napoleon is okay but not flaky enough: 2.5 stars
Horn-shaped thing filled with custard is not recommended, dense pastry with a custard filling that doesn't taste good: 0 stars

This is my go-to place for party desserts - I always pick up a fresh tres leches cake, haven't even made it over to the other baked goods! It's usually $25-30 for a large cake and party guests always love them. You can also buy by the slice, 3 layers of moist, fruit covered, authentic tres leches yumminess for ~$2. My husband and I have stopped in after dinner a couple times just to get a slice of dessert on a budget. I also saw some local contractors go in and order tamales - the woman behind the counter went over to a large steam pot and pulled them out fresh.
