I was sure to get these next time and they were just as good as what you'd get at a trendy mexican place and were ~$1.50 each! There were multiple kinds mixed in the pot, I gladly took whatever kind she pulled out first. Friendly people, very little english.

Tried 2 of the pastries from Las Lomas.

Mille-feuille (or Napoleon): Not bad.  Filled with cream, some peach.  Layers were not flaky.  Maybe it wasn't that fresh and had got soggy in the meantime?  2.5 stars.

Horn-shaped thing filled with custard: NOT good.  Pastry/bread part was dense -- I was expecting something lighter and flakier.  Maybe that's just the style of the dessert.  But, the custard is disgusting -- it tasted fake, like it came from some cheap package of powder.  I usually love custard, but I did not want another bite of that thing.  It's headed for the trash can.  0 stars.

I'm giving this place 2 stars for the mille-feuille.  Usually, I'd average the two ratings, but I feel bad giving 1 star for such a small place when I've only tried 2 things.  Maybe they have other desserts that are better.  Just stay away from the custard.
Excellent Tres Leches cake!! Took it for a work party and it was a big hit. Beautifully decorated with peaches and strawberries and delicious!!!

I decided to check out Las Lomas Sunday morning.  While I was impressed with the selection, it was obvious that the pastries had been there overnight.  The sugar coating on the conchas was delicious, but the ends were stale.  I'm willing to try again, but since other reviews have mentioned that the pastries come out of the oven in the late afternoon, I'll plan accordingly.

These days, there are tons of Mexican grocery stores in S Philly, with 90% of them carrying the exact same things: tortillas, packaged breads and sweets by Bimbo, salsas and canned vegetables by Herdez and La Costena, juice drinks by Jumex and Boing!, a few sugary conchas near the front of the store, maybe some dried jamaica leave and other spices -- they all have the SAME stuff. 

But Las Lomas has fresh cakes and pastries, too. And, granted, Mexico isn't known for its pastry chefs, but you get some interesting variations here on what you're probably used to -- and you can probably get a great deal on a birthday cake.

I now know that my favourite thing at Las Lomas is this Sugary Twist Stick thing.  It's like a doughnut that's shaped like a straight stick instead of an O.  Dusted with sugar, the inside is soft and doughy, kind of like a cruller.  Very nice.  4 stars.

The (normal) doughnut is all right.  A bit bready in texture.  A bit dry.  The dough itself was not too sweet, but it has a sugar dusting.  2.5 stars

Would definitely come back for the Twist.

I was referred to this Mexican Bakery by an employee of a Mexican Ice Cream spot on the other end of the Italian market section. I was not disappointed! The outside and inside look a little questionable, dingy lighting, lots of items making it look a bit disorganized, etc. But if you're looking for amazing tres leches cake in Philly, this is your spot!!

I was stuck between tres leches cake and chocoflan. I opted for the tres leches cake because that's what I had been craving first, but I was prepared for disappointment. The slice looked dry but I wanted to give the benefit of the doubt. I drove back home to fishtown. I took the first bite and wow! It was moist and so good! I was very pleasantly surprised! Will definitely go back to get the chocoflan, and perhaps another slice of tres leches ;)!

Las Lomas is a Mexican Bakery/Store located at the end of the Italian Market on 9th Street. 

After passing by a few times, I decided to venture in and see what they had to offer- which was ALOT more than I expected. The place was packed with products, and the back had a huge display of baked goods- yum!

The baked goods are not labeled with a name or price- so you're taking a gamble on whatever you pick. After reviewing all the options- based on looked alone- I selected a muffin like item topped with chocolate and sprinkles. The muffin, like all of their baked items, was huge and easily shared among two people. 

The muffin came to a $1.50, less than I expected. After taking my first bite I discovered it was corn muffin- not something I would have originally picked- but it was surprisingly good! 

I'm making it my goal to try all of their mystery baked goods- I'll keep Yelp updated on the progress.

Omg this is the best Mexican bakery!! They have everything. The customer service could be better. They're not rude but they're not that friendly either. They were however friendly to my babies so I guess they are friendly, just not outgoing. That's okay though. They have a huge variety and are always in stock of everything. I'm never disappointed at this place! It's not a place to sit down but they are right in the little Italian market in south Philadelphia which has a park right around the block with seating there. Great little spot!

Let me tell you, Las Lomas Restaurant was really magnificent. The whole place has a great vibe. Every single item that we ordered was extra fresh and delicious. Workers are very pleasant and service is very swift. Amazing. Las Lomas Restaurant did not disappoint.

Amazing pan dulce! Super cramped store, jam packed from top to bottom with groceries and home goods. The pan dulce was still warm from the oven. The owners were hard at work stocking and baking. Cheap too!
Omg I have been looking for a good gyro they are my fave food finally found one!!! Sooo good

First time for me in Pitas republic and I will definitely come back soon! The guy was very friendly and help me choose what I was gonna try this time. I tried the shawarma and absolutely enjoyed! Delicious!!
Wonderful people! Delicious and fresh food and the peach smoothie is sooo good. I would highly recommended it to anyone who wants fresh food instead of fast food.
My girlfriend talked me out of going to Qdoba and stopping in pita Republic.  The folks are real friendly and the cheese steak philly pita is SOOOO good. 5 stars

This place was a surprisingly delicious place. My pin a col lata was amazing. Wish I had one now actually lol. I also ordered a cheesesteak wrap that was so fresh and flavorful I will be putting this place on my list of favorite for satisfying quick stops.

This is our new favorite place! We will be getting food from here once a week. They delivered to us during the snow storm and it was pretty bad out.  The food was delicious! We got a cheesesteak, fries and tortellini with crab and shrimp. Portions were huge! Thank you to the new owners, please don't change!!

After seeing many pictures posted on FB I finally convinced my husband to go pick up dinner from Italy to Go.  We got a large cheese pizza and Fettuccine Alfredo dinner.  My husband who eats a cheese pizza twice a week said it was amazing and my pasta dinner portion was huge! I ate leftovers for 2 more days. We will be back food was fantastic

Different Cheesesteak #891.  Based on their name I thought they would make a very good Broccoli Rabe.  I got a cheesesteak with Broccoli Rabe, roasted peppers and provolone.  The Broccoli Rabe had a good flavor but it was stem'y and hard to eat.  The peppers were decent.  Provolone was on the bottom.  It didn't eat well.

Ordering was easy online and they delivered to the hotel. Driver was lost but eventually found the place - and followed all covid protocols. Nice man. Delivery was quick. Food quality was ok - i ordered because yelp had high stars - we rated it not so much. Salad greens - some were wilted and croutons were stale. Calamari was breaded and cooked in fresh oil but very chewy and stringy. Pizza was good - cheese fresh and gravy rt spice but dough so so ( we are from philly so we are picky pizza eaters. The dessert was divine.
Really good pizza...crust is better then most pizza places around here...they do a good job
this place is a shit hole pizza made me throw up not 15 minutes after eating it and the owners son sells drugs out the back door dont eat here ever you will probably get drugs in your food

Several trips but same results! Wrong order all 3 times. Pizza n wings, got no wings, 2nd chicken sandwich no provolone, 3rd cheese steak hot pepper on side but were in sandwich. Kid looks high or heavily medicated every time there.

Horrible, place is dirty the son looks like he's on drugs. Ordered cheese steak with FO pickles ketchup n mushrooms. Hot n sweet peppers on side. Got chicken cheese steak called guess the son answered told him what happened. His response wasn't me that made it. He says Bring back will make you another if you want n hung up. Never again will I order from there.

This place is trash, there is about 2 people working there who cant keep up with the work load, they also like to charge peoples debit cards twice, yes sadly they did that on more than one occasion.I couldn't even put the pizza in the mediocrity category,  it's that bad, undercooked worse of all toppings sliding all over the pizza after you open it. I saw someone rated this place good, you should probably reevaluate your miserable existence on this earth and as a so called pizza lover. I hope this place goes outta busines!! SHITHOLE!!
Sicillan meat lovers was great. It's worth a look and I am going to be checking out the rest of their menu next.

The food is good but the owner is literally off of his rocker. God forbid you wait in store for your food, you'll hear him going off about politics and his love of Trump. Don't say anything at all unless it matches his views, you'll know. High prices (due to chicken increases etc etc I know) but horrible attitude. Called my mom back just to be rude.

Damn good pizza all around and the best in the area. I frequently order from here and have never been disappointed! Everything from cheesesteak pizza to fries to sicilian is amazing every single time. Wing sauce is the best and a must-try! Highly recommend this family owned restaurant, TRUST ME ITS WORTH IT

AMAZING TAKE OUT! I ordered take out late night while I was staying in the area. Ordered a pizza, loaded fries, and garlic parm wings. When I got my order, everything was incredibly fresh and the presentation was amazing! I've been ordering a lot of take out since covid started but NOTHING tops this! Perfect pizza, perfect ratio of garlic to Parmesan on the wings, and the perfect amount of cheese on my fries! I also ordered a lot of sauces on the side, and they didn't miss a beat!!! It was so good, I had to call them and tell them it was so good! I highly recommend if you're in the area!!

BEST OF SOUTH JERSEY HANDS DOWN
The food is FRESH, PLENTIFUL,DELICIOUS & presented nicely. The staff are very welcoming & courteous to all. The atmosphere is clean, bright and cheery with a bit of a decorative touch. Not easy to pick a favorite from the menu, but I'd have to say mine.. & many others from what I hear, would be the CHEESESTEAKS  You'll not find any better, I guarantee that. The owner, Benné is certainly a great spirited character for sure. Energetic and really takes pride in the art of his food.
Not to mention, a very friendly man.
It's always a pleasure to visit as well as leaving with a happy belly.. or soon to be!
If you haven't been, you're missing out.

stopped several times after a doctor apt., no customers other than me,took home a menu,ordered a few times for delivery, I,m a senior citizen with disabilities. First few deliveries, no problem, second to last ordered a dinner, that came with home made bread & salad, $3.50 difference without, did not get bread or salad. Wanted to give another chance, ordered again, asked what the cost, was told too busy to figure it out, so ask for the delivery charge, man started to rant, that he should charge extra, because  I did not live next door, sandwich arrived 45 minutes later, very cold, it was a cheese steak wrap, should be hot, Needless to say, menu is trashed, hope they belly up!

One of the better pizzas in area for sure. Very tasty. The cheese steak Stromboli excellent as well. Only complaint delivery is long and when arrived only had 1/2 the order but did return with pizza. With the 50 delivery time the 1/2 order we never got few dollars off or soda for the trouble
Very dirty inside the cook picked up my slice with his dirty hands. They use old oil so it has a bad smell I would never come back to this disgusting place.

The owner Tessa is a great person! She was able to teach my wife and I, along with our three kids all how to paddle board at the same time! We all have different levels of water confidence and she was able connect and teach to those differences. We had a blast and will absolutely be back again! If you're a novice to water sports or even seasoned, or just looking for something fun to do at a reasonable price, this is a great place to start. I love the location, which is right on a small family oriented beach!
What a great experience!  I was on vacation and wanted to go out for a bike.  They were able to supply me with everything I forgot and gave me ideas on where to stop on the bike ride.  Thanks you!

I'm not sure if this place is still open.  After several phone calls, we decided to visit the address to see if they were just super busy and not able to pick up the phone but they weren't there.  The last time I saw an update on their facebook or twitter account was on 12/19 saying that they were going to be closed that day.  Still no call back after 2 weeks.
I took the paddleboard/yoga class and had a great time. Awesome workout and nice to be outside. I'll definitely do it again

If I could give zero stars I would... after walking around in circles I had to call the place to see where exactly we were supposed to check in because we already paid online to rent 3 bikes. On the phone they told me to go to the concession or to these two trailers in the parking lot. There was no one by the trailer so we go to the concession and the guy seemed kinda off put by the fact that we were there and didn't seem to of known we were coming. He opens up the trailer and fishes out two beach cruisers and we had to tell him we paid for three and he then proceeded to tell us that he didn't have another one but he had a mountain bike. We were like okay? He pulls out this rusty mountain bike that looked like it was on its last leg and that's when we just had to say we needed a refund because that is not what we paid for. They told us to text the number we had called them on a picture of our confirmation and that we were requesting a refund. Hopefully we will get our money back. Do not recommend. Maybe if they had bikes that actually worked and also something so simple as a sign letting you know where to go that advertised their services they would make some more money.
Greasy and flavorless. Ordered the spicy bourbon chicken. Not spicy, just piles of grease
Not a fan at all. Rice is mushy, I don't know what what in the egg roll. Greasy, no flavor. Paid $12 and the bottled water was the best part. Won't be back.

Horrible service just for a simple egg roll. Egg roll was mediocre as well but a lot better than the service. No welcome, no thank you, no smile, no what else can I help you with. I was not even asked if I wanted a drink (I did). Guess what?? NO TIP!!! And I asked for a copy of my receipt and I got a HUGE ATTITUDE!  My only TIP TO YOU IS TO TAKE A CUSTOMER SERVICE CLASS AND DONT WORK WHERE YOU ALL NEED TO DEAL WITH THE PUBLIC!!!!  NO THANK YOU!!!!!

I've eaten here twice so far. Food is great! I didn't like their life metin noodles at allllll, but their orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken and teriyaki chicken were phenomenal. Their fried rice is excellent as well. Great price too. Spent $7 and there was so much food I had two meals out of it.

My husband picked up dinner at china max tonight and BOY what disappointment! My complaint is the very small serving of meat I was given for the beef and broccoli. Hubby said they prepared my to- go box in the back. If they ever do this while patronizing their business do yourself a favor and look at serving size before you pay. The serving was 4 thinly sliced pieces and 3 or 4 crumble sized pieces. What a rip off!

This fast food restaurant is in the Tyrone Square Mall's food court.

I was here for lunch and had the two entree and one side plate that, with tax, came to a total of $8.45.  I chose two helpings of pineapple chicken and fried rice.  

Pineapple chicken has been my favorite Chinese dish since childhood.  (People who claim that pineapple chicken isn't "real Chinese" have never been to restaurants on the subtropical Chinese Island of Hainan.)

My pineapple chicken was delicious and the fried rice was really good too. I liked my food so much that, in the future, I might visit the Tyrone Square Mall for no other reason than to dine at this place.

I have been to China Max at other mall food courts but this was the best China Max experience I ever had.

I'm a local, so I had to try out this place. I got the turkey club wrap, which was one of their specials for the day. It was really, really good, lots of turkey and vegetables were really fresh! Great flavor/seasoning, and their homemade chips were also excellent!

Only thing I would knock them on is that none of the 3 employees were wearing masks, including the guy in the kitchen, which was especially disappointing. Not sure I would eat there again for that reason alone.

I work near by and stopped to checkout the new grub. They had their soft opening this week. I had a pineapple cider and a mushroom Swiss burger. My coworker had the fry bread tacos.  Looked amazing. I will be back to try this trendy fun comfort dish. Service was outstanding and the food was good too. We will for sure be back soon. Might even stop by tonight to listen to the street music and have another beer. Cheers!
Down home, local hangout spot. Try the food. It's amazing. Yelp wants me to keep writing, so...... brand new joint. New decor. Service is great and they have a good environment.

This new Downtown eatery joins a mostly-vacant area that's trying to ignite interest. The small interior has an old floor from a previous tenant and some large wood beams on the ceiling.  
    Service was fast and friendly. Our food was good. Wife got a hamburger and I had fish tacos. 
Wife's kettle chips seemed a tad old. I really hope this place makes it. They promise music on the weekends. Some food and drink specials may help bring in a crowd.

We came in here from an advertisement on Facebook. All the reviews seem good and let me say the food was awesome!  I got the black and blue Burger and it was piled high with  blue cheese. Yum yum. My husband got the jalapeno burger with Jack cheese and I had a taste of it again delicious!  Regulars inside were very friendly and also the owners. Just a very inviting place and will be coming back with some of our friends. Spread the word.  I saw other people's food coming out and everything looked great!  I think I will either try the nachos or the smothered chicken next.

The best place in downtown Clearwater

This is the best restaurant downtown - the owners are awesome and they have the best burgers in town. The Mac&Cheese bites and grouper tacos  are also amazing! Besides the bingo music  and trivia night are the best! People here are always in a good vibe and we always have a great time! I definitely recommend

We live right around the corner from this place and had high hopes.  However, the food just did not taste good or fresh.  It honestly had an off flavor and was one of the lesser meals I've ever had.  This is a place that I definitely cannot recommend.

If you really know what Chinese food is supposed to taste like, you will know this man is the real thing. I have never gotten anything that wasn't excellent and I usually don't like fried rice. Dont let appearances fool you. This is one of the best!
Still after so many years it just keeps getting better. When you crave good chinese food, call the Fried Rice King. You won't be dissapointed.
I have eaten here for over 10 years (I think).  Nice mom n pop feel.  The food is exactly what I expect each time.
My orange chicken wasn't that good but the sweet and sour chicken and beef with broccoli was great. Delivery was super fast! Will order from again!

The food was good. It was your typical good Chinese "fast food". There wasn't anything that was the best of the best Chinese but there also wasn't anything that was bad. Bourbon chicken was surprisingly very good here and the wonton soup was great. I wish there was a tad bit more flavor in the crab Rangoon's but all in all it was good and we will definitely come back if we're in the mood for quick Chinese food again!
This place is awesome!  Consistently great quality, fresh, delicious.  Always quick delivery and 100% accuracy.  Can't say enough good things about them.  Will never go anywhere else!

I heard the food was fantastic and couldn't wait to try it. But it was clear that the single person working the store (counter, phone for orders, PLUS cooking), with a single person on delivery wasn't enough to keep up with the demand. You could tell the food was made way in advance and just reheated for each order. My sweet and sour chicken was fried so many times it had grease pockets and the chicken inside was crunchy. The fried rice was the same way, old and dried out.

This place looks small but is really big on Flavor and service. Family owned and operated makes it one I like to support. And the food is always good! 
And fast.
Went here for quick carry out! Soups were great. Overall everything was pretty good. I really want to try the Vietnamese pho! Nice to have decent carry out so close to home!
Panda Express is better. Very disappointing. Tastes like frozen food from my freezer. Don't waste your time

Short:

Fried Rice disappointing because of name.  Soup is delicious and recommended getting one.  Fast and friendly.

Long:

For a place called Fried Rice King, their fried rice isn't exactly great or anything special.  Though to be honest, we only did try the fried rice from the dinner combos.  Maybe its better if you didn't get it from a combo but order it as a meal?

The style here is NY takeout but their way of cooking the meal is definitely different than other Chinese Takeout places.  The fried chicken wings are small.  The general Tso's chicken chewy and not as good as other take out places I've tried.  

With that said, what stood out here is the soup.  The Egg drop and the hot and sour soup are incredibly delicious.  Probably one of the better tasting ones I've had.  Lots of flavor, I was surprised how much flavor the egg drop soup has.  Because it is such a simple dish, I didn't expect much from it.  I mainly stick to ordering the soups from here now.  

I'll probably continue getting food from here since its in the area.  The people seem nice and I don't recommended eating in, just take it out.

They should actually call this place Onion King.  Every entree is 50%+ cheap onion filler.  The Mongolian beef was literally 60% onion, 40% beef.

The $12 seafood entree was 95% onions, green peppers and carrots, and 5% seafood.

I just moved to OSH and I'm looking for a new Chinese take-out place. Some local friends said they sometimes get it from this place so I decided to give it a try since it's just a few minutes from my place. First impressions were not great. When I walked in to me it smelled like an ashtray. Not terrible, but like someone smokes there at night and then airs it out for the day but like it has gone on for a very long time. This is 100% anecdotal since it was not smoky and I don't know if anybody there smokes. It just smelled like it to me. I guess the idea got stuck in my head because the food tasted the same as the way the restaurant smelled. It was disgusting.
This place is totally underrated. Great quality food every time and very pleasant customer service!!

Great locally owned takeout Chinese food place run by a father and two sons. I like their "Hot and Spicy Chicken" which I haven't found elsewhere. I don't really recommend the fried rice (don't order it just because of the business name) but I also don't eat fried rice. I'm also fan of their Hunan beef. They will deliver.

Former New Yorker here and I take my Chinese food very seriously. This is exactly what I was looking for when I was thinking of trying takeout that could compare to what I expected in NY. Tiny shop, family owned, nothing fancy when you walk in, paper menu and the bonus was excellent prices (even with Covid price increases). I ordered hot & spicy beef off of the dinner combo menu which came with fried rice, an egg roll and I chose hot & sour soup. I don't think I've ever seen hot & sour soup as an option on a combo menu before and it made me so happy because that was exactly what I wanted. They also let you customize your level of spicy and since I like to burn my face off, I asked for extra spicy. It did not disappoint at all!!! Very tender beef, super flavorful sauce, great amount of food. All for $11 and ready in 10 minutes. The gentleman who took my order was so kind and efficient. I will absolutely be ordering from here again. They easily won my business.

I decided to order from here, even after reading some bad reviews. That was a big mistake. I order general Tso chicken with white rice and a order of crab Rangoon. When I put the bag in my car I felt like it smelt kinda funky, but I continued my drive home. When I first opened up the box I could smell the funk even worse. I decided to try a piece of chicken. When I tell you this was probably some of the worst food I've had in my whole life. I didn't even take a full bite spit it out and took the food I immediately back and asked for a refund.

Delicious! Although the actual restaurant itself is a no frills, ugly little hole in the wall... The food this place serves is VERY GOOD! I am thrilled that they are our neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Their food is always delivered super fast and piping hot and they never make a mistake! As their name implies, their Fried Rice is delicious! As is everything else on their menu...especially their egg rolls and their egg drop soup! You won't be disappointed ordering from this neighborhood hot spot. They treat their customers very very well, and I respect a business that will go out of their way to make sure their customers know how much they are appreciated! *yum*

Have been coming here for over 10+ years. Have never had anything bad or even slightly wrong with our order. Great mom and pop place. The Sesame chicken is always amazingly tasty. Crunchy Egg Rolls, Yummy Lo Mein, Hot and Sour soup, bbq ribs, etc. Always plenty of extra white rice as well, love that. Can't say enough about this place. Will always be my no.1 choice if I want Chinese food.

This is our go-to place for Chinese food because it's always consistent, delicious, and fast.  The owners are so friendly and accommodating.  Everything on their menu is fresh and they have a huge selection (even for vegetarians).  Best all around!

I decided to try this restaurant because it's from the same owner of South philly Barbacoa. I was not disappointed! I got the carnitas, tacos dorados, and costillas! Sorry I did not get to take a picture of the costillas they were looking too good not to eat right away! I also didn't take a picture but the platters come with beans and handmade corn tortillas too. Everything was delicious! The chef that took my order was so polite and that makes for a great experience!!!! Would definitely recommend this place.

Was excited to try to this place last night and it did not disappoint. There was a limited menu (maybe 8 things?) with a nice variety of vegetarian and meat options. The scene did remind me of Mexico City as there was a women up at the front rolling, pressing, and grilling the tortillas. The highlight for me were the cauliflower taco which I added their homemade hot sauce to and then the street corn. Will definitely be back!

A truly authentic dinning experience! Cash only, chalk board menu which changes daily, BYO. If you are looking for real deal, home cooked, authentic Mexican than this is a must try. Some of the best Mexican in the city. Will absolutely be back. The staff were fantastic, make you feel like your at home.

can't comment on the food, just the experience. Friend and I were looking around for something to eat, and were thinking about getting some tacos.  The guy working there was friendly, but wayyyyy too pushy. Stood outside looking at the terribly designed laminated menu with very out-of focus pictures. The guy was just so forceful with trying to sell to us, he didn't give us any personal space, and it was beyond awkward. My friend almost ordered something just because she felt so much pressure of the guy hoovering above us.  We were able to wiggle out of the situation though and move on. Maybe the food is good, but  these are tacos, not a used car. they need to chill, and back off with the salesmanship.  it was too much.

Went there with high expectations, since it's South Philly Barbacoa's sister restaurant. Made the 2 1/2 hour trip from the DC area to try it. Sadly it was disappointing. 
Cochinita Pibil lacked flavor. Wasn't served with the proper garnish (pickled purple onion and habanero). The Pata on the tostada also lacked flavor. Nopales were undercooked. The Sopes were a little too thick, although the cecina on top was fine. Carnitas... I've had better. Agua de Tuna was a bit watery, not much flavor either. Added to this, they were understaffed, so service was slow and food took a long time. The Staff was friendly, for sure, and the portions are generous. But that's not enough to compensate. I was craving for some good Mexican food. I still am.

This is the best Mexican restaurant I've ever eaten at! The enchiladas and the tacos are delicious!! The meat in the carnitas tacos was sooo delicious! They give you a lot of food for a good price and the staff is very friendly!

This is the sister restaurant to the famed Barbacoa (next door). This place is legit scratch cooking Mexican. We sat with Luis who is an exceptional human and provides wonderful hospitality. The owner Christina, who needs no introduction, is gracious and kind and came out to say hello to our table and the other guests. 
The tortillas and chips - are made from SCRATCH using LOCALLY grown products. This is so exceptional and requires a lot of thought and care and a loss of profit margins. Yet, the prices are very approachable so all in the community can enjoy. Casa Mexico prioritizes people and wholesome cuisine in a casual setting. Also, Luis, our server, shared with us a bit about the cooking and donations that Casa Mexica/Barbacoa are doing to feed the community. It was my birthday and they even brought me flan on the house. It was the best flan my friend and I ever tasted. It is a true family vibe with a loving Mexican family and traditions. I will definitely be a regular here. 

Duerido Casa Mexico: Gracias por hacer que cumpleaños fuera tan especial!

** I will note for the other reviewers, keep in mind it is a pandemic still. And we all know how tough things are.

Got the shrimp tacos, best breading and seasoning I've had for shrimp! omg! 

Compared to South Philly Barbocoa (sister store), the food is more authentic. Don't get me wrong, the food is amazing but we got their around 12:45pm and a handful of their items on the menu were not ready yet. I eat zabiha/halal which South Philly Barbocoa serves but Casa does not. There is meat in maybe 85% of the menu. The few items that were vegetarian  or pescatarian were the dishes not ready-except for shrimp tacos. pThere is chorizo in the elote, which was a bummer and it's premixed. Again, food is authentic and amazing just upset at the limited options for vegetarians/pescatarians. It might not be part of the culture too!
Cristina Martinez's another restaurant, and great food just as South P. barbacoa (We had their Wednesday Cow head tacos).
May have been the best tacos I've ever had! Large portions and the guac was amazing. The staff were really nice. Will definitely be returning!

We had chicken enchiladas with green sauce four weeks ago we liked them a lot. 

Two weeks ago- we placed an Uber eats order and it was cancelled at the last minute. Frustrating because I drove crosstown only to find out my order was canceled.

Yesterday we ordered chicken tacos and enchiladas. Maybe this is a cultural difference but the tacos were not soft. They were more like "taquitos" found in Tex Mex cuisine. (Deep fried and hard, narrow rolls) The chicken was over cooked and rock hard. It was impossible to eat. The chicken enchiladas this time were over cooked as well. We had an upset stomach afterward.

The inconsistency in food quality and ordering reliability makes it difficult to us return to Casa México.

This place is legit. Delicious food and excellent friendly service. We had the pork tacos that were on special and the Camarones Mojo de Ajo, both were so good! Can't wait to come back to try more things. BYOB is another bonus.
The flavor is actually worse than the appearance - these are their veggie tacos...for $15!! There's nothing on them, all single tortilla wrapped, and no flavor. Really disappointed.

Just ate at Casa Mexico and was very impressed. I stopped by when it was relatively slow, even though I don't think it will stay that way much longer since the food is exceptional. I met the super friendly chef. She mentioend that they change the menu pretty often.  I love that since it gives the ability to try new things with each visit. 

I wanted something small and opted to get the beet shrimp ceviche tostada. A very interesting (in a good way) dish. Beets tend to be too earthy many times, but the addition of the lemon along with a sprinkle of spice with the surprise appearance of raisins all complimented each other very well. The shrimp was fresh and the tostada chruncy.
Definitely give it a shot.

Same owner as South Philly Barbacoa! 

Everyday the chalkboard menu changes. 

Ingredients are local in Italian Market.

Cash Only.

I like that the menu is small and simple.

Parking can be a bit tough in that neighborhood.

Definitely worth bringing a date here.

The vibe inside is old classic Mexican restaurant. 

Fairly cheap and delicious!

Ate dinner here last night.  The weather was so nice that we ate outside.  Like many restaurants right now, Casa Mexico has tables along the sidewalk and in a few parking spots on the street.  The tables were spread out and each had it's own container of Lysol wipes and hand sanitizer.  

Before we got there, we were worried we would have to wait for a table but we got there around 6PM on a Thursday and were the first ones there.  By the time we left, a few other tables were occupied.  Cute area a little south of Washington.  Our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive.  We ordered the guacamole and chips.  Really good portion size especially for two people and delicious!  

I ordered a cauliflower special and my bf got chicken enchiladas.  Not too many options for a vegetarian but there are a few.  We both agreed that the sauces were the best part!  The flavors were amazing.  Portion sizes are big and very filling.  

BYO.  This place is great for a casual date spot, at least for outdoor dining.  If we had to eat indoors I would have taken my food to go.

Also, I thought Casa Mexico only accepted cash, when we went to pay our waiter asked if we were paying with cash or credit, so I guess that changed?

I could not possibly begin to put into words how delicious the food is. While waking home we admired the bright and cozy out door seating area and the enticing smells and got about 40 ft away before we both agreed to turn around and have dinner there. We got the shrimp ceviche, queso with chorizo, ribs with the verde sauce and the steak tacos. Each and every bite made you want more and more, I'm surprised we had anything left to take home. The evening was cozy under the heat lamps and we had a fantastic server who was absolutely wonderful. We will now make this our regular spot

The first time we went here 6 months ago this place was great..... but tonight we had the worst experience. The place stated it was open until 10 and we arrive at 8:30 and were told we had to order in the next 2 minutes before the kitchen closed, which we did... ALL our food was ice cold, taco tortillas were stale and just over all a bad meal we didn't even eat it. Our chicken was cold as well. Meanwhile other tables were seated After us. Our server was rude and rushed everything, never asked us how our meal was even though we didn't eat it. we were very disappointed and ended up eating dinner down the street at blue corn (fabulous) . We won't be going back. Super sad that this place has no interest in people actually eating there

So, so good! Went this week and had incredible carnitas tacos, chiles rellenos and coffee flan. The Casa Mexico/South Philly Barbacoa community is involved in so much important work related to immigration and food justice, so being able to support their restaurants is an honor!! Staff are friendly and kind and wearing masks. Tables outside are well spaced out and each has hand sanitizer and is cleaned a second time before you sit. Cash only, but well worth going out of your way for.

A new fan of Casa México. Stopped in for a bite after a virtual 15K. Didn't have a big appetite just needed a nibble and the tacos dorados did not disappoint. This is a very simple dish that I've eaten hundreds of times over the course of decades of travel and these were exactly as I remember. Order more food if you're hungry. These come 4 to an order with red & green salsa. The red is "hot". 
BYOB & cash only. Im looking forward to a deeper menu dive.

We went up 9th street to get burritos and decided to give this place a try. Burritos weren't even on the daily menu but she just chuckled and said "yeah we can do that." We got a steak and a carnitas burrito, and they gave us chips, salsa, and a piece of apple cake to go with it. That was the best burrito I've ever had, and I spent seven years getting fatter in Los Angeles. The food is absolutely fantastic and we cannot wait to go back.
Absolutely incredible. DEFINITELY get the fish taco, best I've ever had! So light and flavorful. Tostadas were also delicious!!

This place is a sister restaurant to south Philly barbacoa. Very welcoming staff. Food is very authentic and flavorful.

Fried plantain: plantains are very soft and covered with I think sweetened condensed milk that create a very gooey texture. Very good.

Tamales is small but flavor is on point. Pork is fresh and the cornmeal is perfectly cooked.

Nothing short of fantastic and a beautiful follow up to the ever popular South Philly Barbacao. Casa México doesn't have a menu, rather just daily specials always different and giving you a wild range of the taste of the culture.

They have outside seating and the price points are fantastic for the quality/quantity. An awesome South Philly gem that will be welcomed well by the neighborhood!

Hands down the best tacos I have EVER had. The carnitas tacos were amazing. The ribs were cooked to perfection and the meat fell off the bone. They came with tortillas which were amazing but the meat was so good I didn't want to dilute the flavor. 

Chasing the perfect taco we ended up here after an errand outside of Philly. It was a block from the famous cheesesteaks of Pat's and Geno's. This was a no brainer first experience. I shall be back! Hopefully next time I will be in line in the wee morning hours at Christina Martinez's famous South Philly Barbacoa (the sister restaurant). 

By the way, you WILL pleasantly be greeted by Christina who is shuffling between her two master piece restaurants. The down the earth chef is actively involved in the businesses! 

Do yourself a favor and make a road trip to Philly for tacos and more! Your taste buds will thank you.

Casa Mexico is South Philly Barbacoa's sister sit-down restaurant and a wonderful complement to the taqueria. I ordered the red mole chicken that came with rice and beans and it was unique and the the thigh was moist! It came with corn tortillas to assemble tacos which was a messy endeavor but enjoyable. Mi esposo ordered chicken taquitos which were quite good as these us usually tend to be very dry with shredded chicken but these were moist. Best I've had? No, but better than most. The service was excellent and they do accept card. Recommend for anyone looking to find authentic Mexican food rather than the usual tex-mex most Americans are used to.

This is probably one of the better places to have somewhat authentic Mexican food in Philly; is also helps  that it's located next to a nationally-recognized icon of Mexican cuisine. Went here for lunch outdoors during COVID; have a nice outdoor seating area that's covered with well spaced out tables; hand sanitizer available on each table and heat lamps lights above the tables for chilly days. Service was fast, but our server was a little terse and not very welcoming. We ordered guacamole and chips which was good; also had the chicken tacos dorados (three in our order but I believe the menu says four, which we didn't notice until later) which had a nice crunch and flavor but a little dry on the inside. Delicious and sweet horchata water. We've also tried the tamales which are average. TIP: the corn tortillas from this restaurant are some of the most authentic that I have found in Philly; they are handmade and sold by the dozen. Another tip, bring cash; there is no signage mentioning that they only accept cash.

We both got the pastrami sandwich but it wasn't really pastrami more like a beef. I wasn't really crazy about the meat but I loved everything else about it!
Thick bread, pickled cabbage, bacon, pickles, cheese, Russian dressing, bourbon mustard.  I could only eat half.  The fries were cooked and seasoned just right.  The fry sauce was really good. I'm still not sure if the sauce made the fries so good or vice versa! 
I'm  going back to try something else.  You definitely need to try it.

Always amazing! Love their IPA Salad! The owner is a saint (he was smoking turkeys and hams for families all the way through Christmas Eve.) Their meats are one of the best in Boise and crazy affordable. I 100% recommend it.
We ordered through grub hub, and unfortunately our food wasn't ready on time. When we got home to eat it, we were  pleasantly surprised - fresh, and delicious !!!!!! Worth the wait.
I have never been disappointed.  The salads and tacos are worth finding a place to park.

So many gems. From the wings to egg rolls to the pork sandwich (which they don't seem to be making anymore... checked at least 5 times to see it's sold out but I think they just 86'd it). Check this place out

We have done both delivery and pick up from here. They are always super timely and the food is delicious. The beer and bacon burger is the best burger in town and their fry sauce is also our favorite. Delish!
Everything on the menu is great here. You really can't go wrong. Amazing burgers and pulled pork sandwiches.

I had a few days to spend in Boise, and this restaurant was very close to my hotel.  I had the Elk & Kobe burger and the chopped cod salad with chicken.  Both were excellent, and the presentation of the burger was exquisite.  Very friendly staff, tables moved apart for COVID, good music and many beers on tap available.  Tables were clean, and food was delivered quickly.  I'll stop by again next time I'm in town.

My significant other and I chose this spot for a late lunch. It was nice and quiet which was great, we like our mid week quiet meals. 

So for starters we ordered the beef jerky (decent)
And an order of chicken wings with "bbq rub"
The wings were beyond dried out, and the rub was literally a ton of chili powder. 

I ordered the fish and chips, which was alright. Not that great but not bad either. Their fries also were chili powder seasoned. 

He got the smoked bacon cheeseburger. Not bad, but not spectacular. 

Over all.. won't go back, not worth the price for ok food. But we're always happy to try new spots.

Got takeout for date night! Beer & bacon burger was just okay (the bacon jam stuff was really sweet and took it a weird direction). The tacos were kinda dry, and sauce for the white dog fries had a weird mashed potato consistency. That said, the fry sauce and jalapeño popper egg rolls were SOOOO good. I'll be back for those egg rolls and more fry sauce for sure, and I want to try their pulled pork. Also glad they have gluten-free buns since we have some food sensitivities in the fam.

I've had decent food when ordering from these guys within Gas Lantern, but the to-go order today was pretty bad... got the elk burger, ordered medium rare, but it came well done. While it was still somewhat decent, being a lean meat, it would've been better as originally ordered. The fries are what truly made this order horrendous. They were lacking any flavor/salt, and were so dry, it left me wondering if they had been left under the warmer all day, or if they were a day old. Not a repeat for me.

Love that White Dog and Smoke & Thyme have created a seamless delivery of good food and drink. You would never know that food is from a food truck because it looks and feels like a nicer restaurant. Wait staff was attentive and made good suggestions. The food was elevated, hearty and delicious. Only con was there were a lot of flies.

We stopped in Boise on our way to telluride and stopped in at the white dog brewing for a beer and a bite to eat.  The beer was very good however the meal we got was very disappointing. We had the finger steak an Idaho original with a side salad of the 3 finger steaks only one was edible. The salad was typical spring mix with a few grilled tomatoes which tacked on an extra $2 to the meal. Unfortunately the wait staff hardly acknowledged the fact the meal was bad let alone offered to take it off the bill or offer a different option.  I am not knocking white dog too much because it is not their food but since they are serving it I would have hoped they would take some responsibility. I will definitely not be getting the finger steaks again.

Tonight, my company offered to get me dinner from anywhere, and being new to
Boise, I don't know what's around. So, I jumped on Yelp, noticed this spot, courtesy of their photos and took the risk. Well, it was an excellent decision and I had their chicken Cobb salad, it was out of this world!! Even better than what I was anticipating, especially for take-out. I will definitely be a recurring customer, thank you for the great salad
Only half of my order showed up. I guess there is no process for checking order completion or they are trying to boost revenue. Reuben was poorly made bread crust was hard.

name: State of New Jersey Motor Vehicle Comission

reviews.text: Love my local DMV.  This more so a shout out.  I've been here several times and never had to wait for more than 15 minutes.  Great service and efficient.  Just make sure you have your 6 points ready.  In and out today for license renewal in under 10 minutes.  I can only imagine how terrible it is at the camden DMV.

Had to go up here yesterday to resolve an issue and I was really impressed.  We were there about half an hour, but I was surprised at how quick and efficient the staff was.  When we got there, they were at number 145, we had number 166 and were still out of there pretty quickly.

I shuddered when I realized that I was going to have to go to a DMV in New Jersey.  Boy was I pleasantly surprised. I found the staff to be efficient, courteous, knowledgeable and polite.  The office did seem understaffed and so there was a bit of waiting but it was a far cry from my previous experiences with N.J. DMV.  I was particularly impressed with the lady named Stacey who assisted me who was the consummate professional.  She even helped me fill out a couple of forms when she realized that I was having difficulty writing.  All in all it was a relatively painless experience.

Who writes a review on NJDMV? I guess I do. This place is super fast. You are in and out with renewing your license, registration or any other simple task within 20 minutes. 
I remember years past sitting in the DMV for hours and hours trying to renew my license. Well they have their act together and its quick and easy.

I've been to many MVCs, and this is probably the most efficiently run MVCs that I know!  Service is expedient, cordial, and so efficient.  At the front desk, there are multiple people directing you to which part of the commission that you need to go to.  Before you go though, they check all of your documentation so that you don't end up waiting needlessly.  They direct you to which waiting area to go to, and voila, you're taken care of.  I had to go get my drivers' license renewed, and I was probably done in about 10 minutes TOTAL!  I love this place!

as a proud lifelong NJ resident who has transplanted to Philly through a series of events, i was irritated to say the least when i found out i'd lost my license. googled the closest NJ DMV to replace it and was pleasantly surprised to find that this location has late-night hours on Tuesdays until 7:30pm.

it was really easy to get to from center city and there was ample parking. it was not crowded at 6:30pm in any shape or form. actually received helpful and friendly service -- imagine that! paid my $11, accepted some kind conversation while i waited literally 2 minutes for my license to print, and i was sent on my merry way.

will definitely recommend this place to any one of my fellow jerseyans who require their services.

Went in today at 10:00 and was seen by 10:10 and out the door by 10:20. I was prepared for a long wait based on the reviews but the clerk Robin at window 3 was great she had me in and out!!!! 

Thanks Robin at window 3

I had to renew my license and arrived right at opening. There was a line outside. As soon as we got inside, we were able to get right down to business. If not for the clerk needing to reboot her computer, my license renewal process would have taken about 15 minutes. Of course, I had all the needed documents at the ready...overall, great experience.

I'm still amazed at how efficient this location has become, relatively speaking.  Especially if you are old enough to remember the previous nightmare of a location (see Tim P's review for a hilariously accurate description).  I definitely spent more than a few childhood afternoons there back in the day with my mom.  NOT FUN.

The West Deptford DMV (I still can't say MVC comfortably) is not a magically transformed place of fun, but it is generally an efficient place of business for a state gov't department.  They move people along fairly quickly (of course depending on the time of the month) and everything is digitized.  I have never had to wait overlong for services & you can even do some things online now.

Located just off a 295 South ramp.  I'm glad they got their sh*t together!

Saw the line and wanted to just cry... I stood in line and this was moving... fast pace no nonsence.... good stuff. I had an issue with an insurance carrier i dropped.. they resolved it .. no hassel.. good stuff

Awful every time I go there I wait for hours.  Went yesterday at noon and they were not giving out any more numbers for the day that's how many people were there.  I absolutely hate and dread having to go there.

It seriously has the look and feel of a mid security prison facility.  Why is government even involved in any of this?  And the registration, license prices, etc. are outrageously expensive.  A police state starts with places like this.  

Just yuck.
Lady at ID check was so rude and helpless, I can't believe I pay my taxes to be treated like trash!! Unbelievable,

Sitting here, waiting to have my driver license picture taken and I was told I was next in line. The gentleman who needed to validate my documents was polite and told me they'd call me back for my picture very soon. I've been waiting 20 minutes and there are 3 photo booths open and the agents are engaging in idle chitchat with other patrons in adjacent booths or amongst themselves, but not actually taking pictures. It's people like these that give these centers the bad reputation. It doesn't matter how many processes you put in place to expedite service, it comes down to people and their work ethic.

The lady working ID check on 10/30/2018 at 12:00 was extremely rude (I believe her name was Don). Honestly she needs to get fired. I never had such a poor interaction with another individual.  I hope management sees this review. I'm not even the type of person to leave negative reviews; however, yelling at a person who comes into a business for a service is completely unacceptable.

3 hours to get my drivers license.
I had all the proper paperwork 
Filled out all the forms. Sat and watched groups of workers away from their cubicles just enjoying themselves while people wait for service. They call the same number every 5 minutes. I got news for ya if they don't show at your window the first two times they left. 
When I walked up to the first counter I wasn't greeted by can I help you or hello, I got a Yeah, what do you need. Just really terrible, I D check line acted like they couldn't be bothered . I would recommend avoiding this dmv unless you don't value your time.

Ww came, we saw, we got to leave at a decent time. DMV time again and his time i went with my bff. This visit wasnt really bad. Came at 10:00 am and finished at around 11:30 am. Veru professional and was not to crowded as you would expect.

At least we're sitting INSIDE now! 

I took my daughter to this lovely site (Runnemede  cldnt accommodate  directing us here). 

In line- in line - in line outside with some people cursing and smoking for over an hour.  Fun times. 

You are told that you'll get FOUR texts  from DMV once at the front of the long line. 

We were were told to come back in two hours, after the initial text confirmation went through. 

We get half way to Deptford  Mall (approx 15 min)  when a text comes in asking us to come back!!! 

We go in the area where people already have gotten their cyber tickets. 

The final text tells you that you can come in - THEN you await your ticket number to be called over the intercom. 

The numbers aren't in order - and have A & B pre fixes. 

The woman literally in front of us left approximately 20 minutes ago now.  WTF?!!

I asked an employee question to clarify my confusing text and she had an attitude with me! 

I told her that the text was confusing.  (See picture). 

"WAIT FOR YOUR NUMBER TO BE CALLED!"

Okay - ridiculous when numbers 20 higher than yours are being called now!

I walked up front and found out that "Reception 1" showing on my text was THIS area that  we were never told about from Pam - the only nice employee - who gave us (or rather DIDN'T give us that  MISinformation) 

The man at this correct area was very nice but cldnt help us without an original birth certificate (I had a certified copy), despite many other forms of original documents that I had on me. 

The whole infuriating trip was for naught! 
HOURS of our morning gone! 

I literally started crying. 

I will figure out a way out to not come back to this sh*t show location!

LOVE this DMV...and I never thought I'd ever say that.  Always fast, friendly, and located super close to our house.  They even stayed open a few minutes later to make sure we had everything we needed.  Great experiences and the kindest people!!!!!

Do your best to avoid this life trap. I was looking to transfer my out of state license and register my car. Waited and hour and a half only to be told that they can't do that all in one sitting, I will have to get back in line for the registration. After that, they said that I couldn't get my license because my social security card didn't match my license. I have a long ass name and it won't fit on the license. They told me to contact social security to try and solve the issue...

Btw, they close at 430pm and start making announcements at 1pm that if you're there for a suspended license, the wait is over 2 1/2 hrs long so you may not get serviced today. The people that have reviewed this place and say it's open late are lying. Lying liars tryin to make people waste their lives away at the DMV. F this S place

What a shit process! U get checked in and most Windows's r closed!! So you sit and wait until the dead asses call you! Thank god this is my tax dollars at work! I am 53 years old, have no convictions, has not had my license suspended in any state and top it all I am a USA veteran and I am subjected to this bull shit!!! Our government at its best!

If you remember going to the old place in Deptford with your parents or as a young adult, you'll agree that this place is 1,000% more efficient.... Very quick process, as long as you show up with the necessary documents....
At the old place, you could show up at 7:30am and at 5:30pm be just getting to the front of the line to be served. Breakfast, lunch, a snack, and possibly dinner would be bought at the pizza and Chinese joints located in the attached shopping center... 
Can't say that i miss those days, although i do laugh about it from time to time....
Thanks DMV for the painless 10 minute service I received today. 
Can't say that it was quite as quick at the inspection center... But it's a pleasure going there these days since they cut out all of the crap that they used to fail 50% of the vehicles for...
Back in the day, I'd show up to get my car inspected with a full tank of gas.... Today, I showed up confidently with my tank on E and the light glowing....lmao

This location is so ghetto all the workers are so ghetto, and racist. While I was in line the worker yelled at a Spanish lady because she didn't understand what the ghetto worker was saying. Like if you are working for the government speak properly so other people can understand you! Same thing happen with me with all attitude because I was Spanish and the worker was rolling her eyes all the time like I hope she gets something on her eye so she stops giving people dirty looks!

Was able to visit this place many years ago and enjoyed it so much.  The food, and the market were so much fun.  It was really great to see the beautiful temple.  Things were still under construction back then, I am going again this Sun. and can't wait for the experience.  Lovely place, amazing architecture, warm and welcoming people, just a great way to spend a day.

I practically built this Temple, not on my own; but it was a community event. When the Wat, ( Thai's, Loa's and Cambodian's call a Buddhist Temple). The structure or building stick out like a sore thumbs. It is practically across the street from the Bensalem Police Department. It sits between the Polish American VFW and the first Elementary school of Bensalem. It is north on 95, get off at the Street Road exit, continue up Street Road to Knights Road, turn right on Knight's and if you cross By berry; then you went to far.

I am the token White guy at the Temple. There is another white couple who are just friends, I never talk to either one of them. I know all the monks and regulars. I go to the Temple more then I go to visit my Father or brother. For me it is a very relaxing place. My Thai is not as good as it should be But I have been immersed in the Thai culture for over thirty years. I been to Thailand twice, live in a Thai commune for five years, while stationed in Germany.

Will you get the Thai experience? Yes, somewhat; even though the majority of the "Thai" people that go there are friendly and educated, Thai's are shy by nature. But if you smile to them, they will smile back. If you show an interest and respect in their culture, they will more then happily be willing to show it to you.

I truly love the Thai food that they make there and it is truly better then the Thai restaurants around the Philadelphia area. But be advise, the food here is made for the Thai's who come to pray. The food is not Americanized, like at the local Thai restaurants do. If you ask a Thai or me, if  is it spicy, we will tell you the truth whether it is or not. No one wants you to get sick and have a bad experience. Sunday lunch is open to the public and a small donation of $5 or $10 would be appreciated. Also Thai's do not use chopsticks when eating, it is more preferable to use a fork and spoon. I am a big fan of "sticky rice", served in a wicker bowl. But I recommend eating the regular rice, till your stomach get use to it.

Any diary product will counteract the spicy taste in Thai, Loa or Cambodian food.

Women should not ever touch the monk, wear V-neck or any top that would show their cleavage.

The Monks chant in Bali, not Thai. But usually give sermons is Thai.   .

Only Theravadin Buddhist Temple in Philadelphia -- and it's only 10 minutes away from my house! I lucked out. 
It's much more focused at the supporting Thai community, but they're so welcoming and kind. This is my Sangha.

I visited it in 2006 I think.  Quite a while ago.  At that time I had been to Thailand four times, and since then up until now another 10 times.  My friend who is very world traveled was quite pleased the way the place offered a place for Thais to congregate.  It was a very welcoming place and I exchanged a few greetings using my limited Thai language skills.  My friend has a german wife and appreciates other cultures and things like Polish American Clubs, or whatever groups are involved.  I also that year while working in the New Jersey area was able to see the Dali lama who was lecturing at Lehigh University.  Just a beautiful year.  I am now working in New jersey again, near Newark, and will get back down to Bensalem very soon and am looking forward to it.

Very friendly and open Theravada temple. Been coming here since I was a kid and have watched it bloom from a rented event hall to a full temple mirroring the smaller ones I visited in Thailand. Check out their site for ther Sunday gatherings which are fantastic! So many people bring food and you get to sit an enjoy the variety of tasty goodness from many of the Thai and Lao members of the sangha.

Frusco's was my steak place and when they closed, I had to look elsewhere for my cheesesteak needs in the Northeast. Francesco moved into its place and added a pizza oven. Decided to order a steak to see if it's any good. I got a pepperoni cheesesteak and mozzarella sticks. There wasn't a lot of pepperoni but there was a lot of steak (my friend got a pizzasteak which didn't have a lot of steak) and they put their cheese on the top of the sandwich. Everytime I took a bite, my cheese, ketchup, and pickles kept spewing out over the top making a mess. The steak itself wasn't bad, finely chopped and lean (main complaint with most places is chomping on chunks of fat but Francesco didn't have that problem). Roll was nice and soft. Overall, the sandwich wasn't bad, slightly better than the usual fair. The mozzarella sticks were ordinary, sauce was ice cold though.

I ordered the Fresh Greek Salad. They forgot my anchovies and eggs as listed in the ingredients in the menu. Also, the delivery driver seemed timid and uncertain if he had the right order. Overall, a pretty bad experience. I don't think I'll be ordering from here again.

was staying in pa not too far away, and we got hungry at like 830pm ..it was a 12 min drive ...Excellent cheesesteak,, fresh hero on a Sunday night cooked right..yummyy. Banging milkshakes there the best I had in a while.. Pizza and fries were not that good... But worth the ride for the shake and steaks... a lil slow but solid place nice backyard seating area.

I would like to order but the delivery guy seems to collect them for over an hour and deliver them after closing . So at the end of the night when there is a lack of business you will still wait an hour and a half to two hours for an order. So I'll just make a sandwich.
the wings are AMAZING! For such great food they have great deals. The pizza steak is also really good. This place is so underrated! They open until so late and the food is still sooo good!

Bad for business man. I ordered food from here last night way before closing hours not only did they not have what I wanted they also never even showed up with my food. I ordered at 1 am and stood up til 4am very disappointed will never order from here again.

So my boyfriend loves the place. And my go to which is around the corner from the house is closed. It's new years day what you expect?  This place is open. So usually we order from grub hub. Today I called. Not only was the guy pretty rude on the phone he barely seemed to be paying attention. At one point I was placinf my order he rudely told me to hold on. To the point my boyfriend heard him through the phone and looked. 
He came on I placed my order I wanted to pay with my card. Which they take... but they charge you an extra $1 to pay with a credit card. I have a menu that does not state that fact. This is illegal. But I just want food until my dinner is cooked so I accept this. However as I told my boyfriend we are not ordering from them anymore.
Although hands down they have the best cheese steaks in NE philly .... 2 hr wait for delivery is horrible customer service
My fries looked good until I ate some they were completely raw it was a waste because they weren't edible. Will never order cheesesteak fries from there again. So disappointing!!!

I was back in my old neighborhood and was craving a cheesesteak. I ordered a wiz with and a order of cheese fries. Guy at the counter didnt seem thrilled, even when getting the food, no "have a good day", seemed miserable..but whatever, I was there for the food. For $14.91 I paid for cheese fries that were soggy and I ended up throwing them out. It shouldn't be hard to cook fries. The cheesesteak was garbage. Chewy meat, was so salty and the wiz..was just smeared on top of the roll. It was the weirdest thing. It wasnt even on the actual sandwich. I got the whiz from the wet, uncooked fries and put it on the cheese steak that had no cheese on it.  I took about 3 bites just to get some food in my gut. The rest of it went in the trash too. One of the worst cheesesteaks I've had the displeasure of having.
Really? $2.00 for fried onions on a cheesesteak? Not extra onions just onions!

When at Francesco Steaks do what Francesco does.  We got the Francesco steak.  It came with pepperoni, fried onions, mushrooms, green peppers, sauce and cheese melted on top. I like a toasted roll and this had a Toasted Roll.  It seemed like the pepperoni spent time on the grill and the green peppers did not.  I did not like the crunching of the green peppers.  I wish the green peppers that spend time on the grill or sauteed or something so they matched the other textures of the rest of the cheesesteak.  I thought $10.79 after tax what's a little high considering what's around them.

Gave this place a couple chances and it was pretty horrible each time.  They take forever to cook up a simple cheesesteak and it just tastes like my buddies drunk uncle made it. 

I miss Fruscos

I just had the worst experience with the delivery guy from this place i ordered 2 small pizzas one with credit one cash. First he goes to the wrong address were I have to go find him and then dosent want to come to the correct address to get the cash he stars to walk away i ask for my pizza that already paud for he tells me he not giving me shit and I asked him what the hell his problem was and he said bitch you upset you hungry. I dont know where this is acceptable but i will no longer order anything from this establishment

Order at 11:42 PM Arrived at 12:08 AM. Estimate arrival was suppose to be 12:40-12:50AM. I was happy that the food arrived very early. But, the food wasn't even hot. The cheese of the pizza was smother to one side. Cheese was very chewy I believe they could've oven the pizza a little longer for a nice crisp and melted cheese. Also, I've found a fried mosquitos in my FRIES!!!! I have kids in the family that was eating their food too. I've read reviews of this restaurant I see that I'm not the only one having this pizza problem. Said it would be fixed for awhile now still same thing. Never will I ever again order here!!!! Big disappointment!!! Sadly, I can't give this a 0 star.

I drove a couple of miles and had ordered from them in the past. The cheesesteaks are good. One day I ordered $35 in food. I asked do I get a free soda bcz it's over $30 bucks. They said no. It has to be over $40. I'll never go back to them. They don't look out for their customers.

I had heard Francesco was rough around the edges from a friend of mine, and decided to give it a shot anyway, Ordered some food off GrubHub while i was visiting my moms. I ordered a Steak, Guido Fries, and a Burger Combo, only one of which managed to impress. Suffice to say people didn't lie, there is certainly some room for improvement.

I want to start on a high note, its rare for a pizza shop to sling a solid burger, but i give credit where credit's due. Francesco's burgers are solid, served with lettuce a la carte, self assembly, the way its meant to be, bun's are toasted up nicely, which is rare in the area, meat itself was decent, looked like it came from a supplier judging by shape, but, tastes like some decent home cooked beef. Cheese was also decent, and they gave a generous portion, no single Kraft single's BS. The fries served with the combo were also decent, desperately needed some salt, but after that they were pretty good. Texture was lacking, no stiffness or crisp to speak of but the flavor was definitely there.

The steak itself was okay, nothing  to write home about but pretty decent. Id say its in the upper-middle rankings as far as northeast Philly local shops go. Issue being the sandwich was more bread than meat, some of these bites were 60% roll in the center, and that feels chintzy, if they fix the roll's would be a lot better of a value proposition.

Guido Fries were a wholehearted disappointment, it sounded good, it really did but there was very little seasoning, and /whatever/ that concoction it was smothered in, had zero flavor. The lackluster mayo pulled away from any seasoning that may have been placed on the fries, and drudged the whole experience down. Not to mention the lack of crispness was only made worse by the watery smothering.  Methinks not, not ever again.

Burger was legitimately good, steak was middling with the bread issue, and the Guido's?  TERRIBLE. Suffice to say i have mixed feelings, maybe some other stuff on the menu is actually great, maybe they should call them Francesco's Burger's, i don't know, but i want to give benefit of the doubt and try again- just...not those Guido fries.

Flavor & Presentation 2/5   |   Speed & Service  3/5   |   Pricing & Portions  3/5

Overall  2.66/5

Where do I begin with this horrendous experience? I should have walked out as soon as I walked in they had Arab rap blasting out of the speakers to the point the one guy had to turn it down so he could take my order. I really wish I could give this dump zero stars. 
The place is filthy from top to bottom. I didn't really notice until after I placed my order. You have to understand it was 11pm and I just got home from work. I actually wanted a cheesesteak from across the street from Frank's steaks who I Know has great cheesesteaks but as I pulled up the lights went out. 
The cheesesteak came on a stale roll that would have been terrible even if it were fresh. The little bit of meat on the Sandwich was so low grade I didn't even finish it. It was sloppily made with grease and ketchup all over the outside of the roll. I asked for pickles, they put four pickles on the whole Sandwich (see picture) this sandwich felt like a slap to the face. I for the life of me dont understand how they are in business. They should be shut down for serving such an atrocity. Please for your own sake do not even enter this monstrosity of a restaurant.

Ive been trying to find any way of NOT having to write this, but this last order from the restaurant has made the decision on its own.  I've also try to order from all around the menu so I could give a fair opinion on the food.  One of the few positives is they are one of the ONLY places in my area that are open very late, and will also deliver, usually until about 1:30am.  The quality of the ingredients used in most of the items are of such low quality, and it looks like they try to compensate for that by serving somewhat larger platters(than most places), which some may see as a positive, but what good is having a $/-/i T ton of terrible food?  If you are intoxicated and stumping around the area early and are looking to stuff your face without notice to the taste, by all means! Which is why I left 2 Stars.  1 star for the hours of operation, .5 for the size, and .5 for the drunk dude looking to get greased up and gassed out.

Drop the name. The food is awful. Not mediocre, not ok. Awful. 

We ordered for the first and last time today for pickup, and we Literally threw out the food. 

The shrimp poke bowl is the worst poke bowl I've eaten, with bland shrimp, flavorless sauce, lazily cut cucumber and jalapeño (thin slices are better. We got about 3 big chunky wedges.), and something in there, in the ocean of flavorlessness, tasted like it had gone bad, so after a few lackluster bites supplemented with sauce from my house, it ended up in the trash. What a waste. 

Then there was the "spicy chicken teriyaki" which was neither spicy nor flavorful. Again, there was a freshness issue with this pile of assorted dark meat chunks seemingly boiled in a bland and sugary sauce that, for all of its sweetness, could not cover the taste of chicken well past its prime. So that part went to the trash. I dined on white rice and boiled shredded cabbage. 

What a disgusting experience. I have no idea how a place like this exists, but I recommend anyone to avoid it. Yucky Teriyaki.

This place advertises itself as teriyaki, sushi and poke bowl.  We had take-out.

The portions were ample, if a bit pricey, but the teriyaki had no flavor whatsoever.  The chicken teriyaki tasted like cardboard, as did the beef teriyaki in in the"bento" box.  The "salad" in the bento box was a small handful of plain lettuce. The 3 gyoza were overcooked and brittle.  The California rolls were tiny and came without any form of wasabi or pickled ginger.  But the main problem was lack of flavor Thee was no teriyaki in the teriyaki - it was utterly bland.

Beef Teriyaki, fried rice, fried dumplings, chicken teriyaki roll and California roll. Everything was 7/10 besides the chicken teriyaki roll. It was very bland. Overall very good food. 7 out of 10 in my book.

Great portion sizes, pretty tasty sushi rolls & miso soup! I ordered through a delivery service so I can't speak for an experience at the restaurant itself. I did however thoroughly enjoy a tuna avocado, a salmon avocado, and a veggie roll, plus a large portion of miso. The veggie roll was probably my least favorite because I'm not a fan of lettuce in rolls & mine had some. But the tuna & salmon roll were fresh, well filled with protein, and came in a decent sized portion - 8 pieces per roll. The miso had seaweed and tofu with far more seaweed than tofu, but still quite tasty & a large portion for just $1.99. I paid about $22 for all the food, the delivery service, the fees, & the tip, so if you went there in person you could probably get all of that for around $15 or less; an awesome price for plenty of tasty food!

The worst sushi I've ever eaten. I got 4 rolls for takeout thinking that I could save some and eat it the next day (didn't get anything that would go bad). The sushi almost made me throw up. Every roll was terrible. I wish I didn't have to write this because I love sushi but it was just so bad!!!
"Do not go to Yummy Yummy. You will waste your Money Money.  You will be mad because the food is that bad"..Robert Victor

This place is great. Good food, nice people.
I will definitely come back here, every time I come in here they are so lovely and nice. I'm keeping on writing more because it helps as I have to. But they are very good and I will eat here all the time

I got my food through Uber eats and had a great experience. The sushi was surprisingly very fresh tasting and not fishy at all. I'm going to order again despite the other not so good reviews... I really enjoyed it the first time!

The chicken cutlet sandwich is very good, the service is quick and with that Philly edge that I love. Is it as good as Shank's Original? No. But it's one of the few decent places to eat in 30th street station(unless you want a cookie from Au Bon Pain or ice cream from Ben and Jerry's). It hits the spot.

I heart hoagies!  I meant to review Cucina Italiana the last time that I passed through 30th Street Station, but it slipped my mind... cuz, well, it's not really -that- memorable.

Regardless, it's as good eats as it gets in 30th Street Station, as far as I'm concerned.  When your other options are Mickey D's and Cosi (which I abhor), having the yummy and filling option of Cucina Italiana is a wonderful thing.

For roughly $7, you can score a "regular" sandwich on fluffy bread with a huge amount of meat.  Y'know how Subway uses one of those paper-wrapped prepackaged cuts of deli meat?  My traditional Italian sandwich at the Cucina came with -two- of those.  And they're not messing around.  Then topped off with fresh, crispy lettuce, tomatoes, and thin translucent rings of onions, sweet peppers, and a generous squirt of oil and vinegar, the resulting monstrosity is easily enough to be filling for two people (or in my case, two meals for one and a half people).

Can you think of any better train food?  I'm gonna go with... no.

I didn't even get a chance to eat the food because the wait staff was very rude and also racist. My sister and I wanted some authentic Italian food in South Philly so we stopped by Cucina since it claimed to be Zagat rated. The waitress seemed to dislike the fact that we even stepped into the restaurant and we seated ourselves. We ordered our food and I ordered a Manhattan after the waitress explained to me that it was a whisky drink. I changed my mind and wanted to change the drink to a Long Island. She complained that she had just made the Manhattan and would have to charge me for it. Any other restaurant would've just made a new drink. I tell her to make the other drink and just leave one charge on my bill and sit down. She returned the Manhattan to the table and I went back to the bar to return it. Eventually I did get my Long Island but by that time we figured that they were taking extra long on tiny pizzas because we were Black people in an Italian neighborhood. We just paid for the drink and left.

Does CI have the best Italian hoagie I've ever had? Negatory. Are they pretty much the only place I will eat in 30th St before catching the Amtrak to NY Penn Station? You know it. 

CI is a counter service deli/sandwich shop near the main terminal. They have a good selection of sandwiches and sides--some of the sides look incredible, in fact, like the marinated artichokes--and are very reasonably priced.
