They have a Subway-ish model of service, where you order a sandwich, they start to assemble it with pre-packs of meats, and then you point out which toppings you'd like on it. 

Their Italian hoagie is not too bad, with mediocre bread (a little too soft), and decent meats. My main qualm is with their hot pepper selection. You can opt for jalapenos, which are hot but not right for an Italian hoagie, or their hot pepper relish, which is oddly sweet, in a gherkiny kind of way. 

That said, they are vastly superior to the other options in the station, and I've never had a bad experience here.

Well, just hopped, on the megabus after grabbing lunch here. 

My order today: A "small" (**cough** bull%&#* **cough**) turkey sub with provolone cheese, tomatoes and onions with extra mayo, and granulated garlic sprinkled on top. Man, they do make huge, "small" subs. My order came out to $6.97. 

My take: The turkey was standard processed turkey, a bit on the bland side. The tomatoes and onions though, were fresh and yummy, as I am a big fan of both veggies. Overall the bread was very good, and the sandwich was good for it being tasteless processed turkey. Subway's processed turkey tastes better than this place.

I have yet to try any other meats there, but if I were you, I'd skip the turkey. I'm only judging this place on the meat/sandwich I had on this visit. I heard good reviews on the Italian sub, so I'll try it again, however on the way from SEPTA I saw another place that uses Boar's Head meats in 30th Street, so I might not return to this place again (Old Nelson Food Company- haven't been there, but will go because of the Boar's Head brand being there)

Food is always great, but I called to place an order and customer service was horrible, guy taking the order acted like he didn't want to take it, he almost made me hang up, I would've ordered else where if I wasn't so hungry.

Overpriced garbage. Salmon and shrimp were over cooked, rice was old and vegetables were hard. Everything was sitting in a huge layer of margarine not butter. It's obvious they use cheap quality products. On top of the poor food, their customer service subpar. Do yourself a favor- don't order here!. If you want shrimp, just go to Sid Bookers.

I ordered a salmon platter earlier this week. The customer service was horrendous and the food was subpar. I won't be patronizing this establishment again. The entire staff needs to learn that your goal is to make the customer want to patronize your establishment again not run the other way!!! #DONTBUYFROMSEAFOODSENSATIONS
Ordered food at 615 PM at 7:30pm called they said it just came up I will get in 15-20min. Called back at 8:15 no answer. So I will never order from them again

I ordered take out from here earlier this week. NEVER NEVER AGAIN. The young lady who took the order was shouting all over the place to co-workers while mopping the floor with pine so strong it over took my breathe I had to go outside.  The young lady didn't like that I was asking questions. The look on her face said "irked".  No air-conditioning so it was very hot in there. 

I ordered the crab cake platter and they were balls and had waaaay too much Old Bay; all I tasted was that. I could not eat them. The tartar sauce... smh. Their menu states food is in butter sauce. NOT!!! I asked the order taker and she stated it is margarine. Ummm I know butter is expensive but when you are paying $20 for a platter it should be automatic. If it's not butter change the menu. You only get a half an ear of corn. The food was luke warm. My man had the tilapia and that wasn't bad.  We went outside to wait for our food and the order taker never came out to let us know our food was ready. 

Wasted money! I will not be back.

Another day. Another Mexican restaurant I must try. This very location used to house another mexican restaurant called Kika's Kitchens that shuttered around Christmas 2017. Is this one any better? Absolutely! The new owners nearly nailed the complimentary tortilla chips. The chips were thick and crunchy (house made from cut corn tortillas). Unfortunately; management missed the mark on the salsa which was too sweet (think Ragu) and suffered an apparent overdose of chili powder. My guest ordered the combination fajitas while I ordered the steak burrito. I was the unlucky one. The chicken on the fajitas was outstanding. Tasty tenderloins properly seasoned with lime and garlic. The steak was sliced strips of skirt marinated in a garlic based dressing. The protein portion was extremely generous. My only real complaint is the vegetables were a little undercooked.  My burrito was a huge 14 inch Tortilla filled with everything else other than meat. Lots of beans, rice and undercooked veggies. At least the refried beans were good. Chunky. Not your typical runny. The prices appeared to be in line with nearby mom and pop Mexican establishments. Sadly; as of 3 Saturday's ago, they don't have any lunch menu yet. They say they're working on it. I'm not so sure. I may return to sample other items on the menu but I'm surely not going to pay $12.00 for one lunch.

I agree with a previous diner's experience...the salsa tastes like spaghetti sauce with a Mexican flare.  The cheese dip was ok.  

The menu is very abbreviated and although the choices are limited they all cost about the same price (between $8-11). Some items come with rice and beans, most do not.  

I ordered the asada tacos because I really wanted Mexican rice and it was a dish that it came with.  While the steak was cooked to perfection I was given no condiments for my tacos (sour cream, pico, shredded cheese, etc). The mexican rice, however, was utterly disgusting.  It was gross Chinese buffet rice meets Mexirice.  There were green beans, carrots, peas, and corn in it.  So disappointing.  Refried beans were decent.

My husband ordered the Mariachi burrito.  Its a cheese covered burrito stuffed with chorizo, potatoes, rice, and beans.  It was HUGE and tasty.

Both our children (not connoisseurs by any means) ordered chicken tenders.  Both kids said they were too dry.  

The restaurant was clean, staff incredibly friendly.  Overall not a miserable experience, but I definitely won't be back.

The food is seriously delicious here! I had the chicken chimi and was very pleased! The queso is the BEST I've ever had anywhere! Their salsa.... it's a miss. It tastes like spaghetti sauce. But don't let that deter you from their food. It's fresh, delicious and the staff is so warm and welcoming, I can't wait to go back!

Go here, you won't be sorry! Excellent service and truly thoughtfully put together and prepared dishes. Always ask about specials, because they're almost always delicious. The tamales are particularly tasty; and the fish tacos are also pretty awesome. You'll always appreciate their vibrant and delicious salsa, too.

Honestly this is probably some of the best mexican food I have had in the area. We regularly eat her and it it always fantastic. Make sure to ask about items not on the regular menu. I highly recommend trying the cemitas (just ask). The staff is incredibly friendly here. They recognize us and take time to talk with us each time we are in here. I cannot recommend highly enough...

There was absolutely no other customers at the restaurant when we stopped in for lunch at noon on a Saturday afternoon. My husband thought this place was El Magueys & we stopped in to eat because he's been there before. When we left he realized that El Magueys was a few spots down from here & the place we ate at was actually El Mariachi Loco! I am so glad he made this mistake. The food was excellent! He got the carnitas nachos, I got enchiladas & my son got the kids Mac & cheese (which I thought would be from a box but was clearly not!) It was all so delicious. The salsa was superb & the service was  great!!! We will definitely be back next time we pass through the area!
The food here is was great and the staff was very friendly.  Had the Mariachi fajitas and good meat and lots of veggies
This is a great family owned restaurant!  Great food at great prices and even better people that are the owners!  They will treat you like family from your first visit!  Please show them some love?!

Wonderful food, always hot.  We've found our new favorite Mexican restaurant.  Service is wonderful...but today we are getting carryout today because of the 'stay at home' rule.  We love the chicken chimi, Chilie eelleno, queso and guacamole - just to name a few things.

Love - love eating here. The food is always well prepared...fresh with nicely balanced flavors. We've been pleased with everything we've ordered and we're tough on Mexican food - having eating western authentic for years, where from scratch, hand press tortillas are the norm. This is the best Mexican food we've found in the StL region. We've become regulars.
Plus, the margaritas are tasty with buzz quality, made with GOOD tequila, not low rail liquor. The manager and serve staff are always friendly and accommodating. We also appreciate that this restaurant is kept CLEAN and has a nice open ambiance. This is a hidden gem which deserves 5 stars! Definitely worth your eating time.
Excellent food.  Excellent service.  This is some of the best Mexican food I've ever had... and I've had a lot of Mexican food.  They know how to treat a customer!  Thank you!

It was a Monday and I was looking for street tacos unsuccessfully. After two other tries at places evidently closed on Monday I struck El Mariachi Loco. Not much traffic at high noon. Though they did not have it on the menu they allowed me to try all three of their tacos in combination with some rice. Pastor, Asada and Carnitas. They started me out with chips and salsa fit for gringos like myself crisp chips snd salsa was not too hot. The tacos were served on a big cutting board with rice. Although they put peas in the Mexican rice, they were easily removed. The Pastor was best with juicy chunks of pork and Pineapple which I have come to love.  The Asada was also excellent. The carnitas was unremarkable but passable and al three were complimented by a  nice Verde that was not too
Hot but left a pleasing burn on the palette that did not last too long. Friendly service. Clean and quick. 15 bucks for 3 tacos, salsa and chips and a tea. Solid effort.

I used to love this place. On one occasion I found a long hair in my cheese. They quickly replaced it. I went back several months later and I found unfair business practices. ... I was dining alone and they added Gratuity to my bill for the first time. The waitress said it was a new policy. ( not posted anywhere)  I was totally offended!! I'm

Wow. I am surprised by the two other reviews. I come to this location at least two or three times a week, sometimes four or five for their chicken Caesar wrap. I don't think I have ever had a bad one. The two employees that I have dealt with here on every occasion have both been very nice and helpful. Jason, who made my wrap today now knows my order and sets it up for me perfectly every time I come by. I am definitely a fan of this place for something quick, healthy and on the go.
Advertises coupon that doesn't exist. Customer service is non existent. Go to the restaurant. Much better.
Love this place. Absolutely delicious!!!!  Beautiful atmosphere.  Mr. Owner, please recycle!!!!!  That my only complaint.

Yuck! I hope the real restaurant is better than this kiosk. I was at the mall for my nephew's ice skating party and wanted something healthy to eat. I ordered a rice bowl with turkey, hummus, basil, etc. First, it came without basil. When I asked about this he said, this location doesn't carry basil. Really? Maybe reflect that on your menus. I wouldn't have ordered this! Second, the meat was so old with that strong refrigerator taste. I tried a few bites and finally had to throw it away. It was literally $7 bucks down the garbage. I will not try the mall location ever again. I suggest you save that money and go to whole foods (also at the mall) to spend your money on tasty, good quality, health food.

I am so disappointed ! I normally eat at the place in Oldsmar but decided to get a wrap while in the mall. The avocado ranch wrap and it literally fell apart and tasted different too! How can the same establishment vary so much in taste and the way they prepare the food . I will most definitely avoid this location in the future and stick with Oldsmar . They didn't even have wasabi dressing which I always substitute for ranch .

Probably won't order through Uber Eats for this place again, they don't read the instructions. Maybe you'll have a different experience going in and directing them. The Buffalo wrap essentially has no buffalo sauce, its just a rosemary/thyme grilled chicken. Asked for extra sauce the last time with side of tzatziki, got it all mixed in the  wrap and was a saucy mess. This time I asked again, no extra buffalo 'on the chicken' or tzatziki on the side, wrong chip order. Threw in an extra coke either because (again, can't read) or maybe apologetic for messing up the order post-haste? Having worked in food all through college... just read the ticket order please.

name: The Port of Peri Peri - Ballwin

reviews.text:
Been waiting forever for this place to open and finally get peri-peri chicken in STL.  The food did not disappoint!  Flavorwise I would say it's better than Nando's which I love.

Staff is still in the learning process so ordering was a bit of a challenge, but they've literally been open 2 days so I won't fault them for that.

This will become a regular for us.
Amazing customer service. They are doing their best despite the pandemic and it's so appreciated! Yummy food. Super fast. Friendly environment. Will be coming back!

I don't write reviews ever: either positive or negative but I was super frustrated with this location today that I had to post one. 


I know they recently opened and are in process of training their workforce  but in a week they have missed up my orders multiple times. Either incomplete orders or giving me someone's else order. And when I call to let them know they were extremely rude and displayed disrespectful customer service. While food is great, but this kind of service and attitude the employees show towards their customers is unacceptable and completely pathetic.

I never got corrected order or my money back from them. Such a terrible service.

The chicken was excellent as was the filafel.  The hot sauce brings heat and the mild is creamy.  No issues with the food.  What keeps this review from being higher is the chaos in their ordering system and their back of the counter management.  I ordered on their app and paid with a credit card.  I received a confirming text and email saying my order would be ready at 4:50 pm.  On the way, I got another text saying the order would be ready 10 minutes later- no big deal.  When I got to the restaurant, the staff had no record of my order.  I showed them the confirming email and texts.  They apologized and said my order would be assembled at put togetherness 5-10 minutes.  There were others who were waiting for a while well.   Then there was 15 minutes of chaos- 3 staff members trying to get orders, then disappearing.   I finally saw what looked like my order being put in a bag and then later stapled.  The bag sat there while other orders were filled and no one paid attention until I called it to their attention and it was indeed my order.  By then it was close to 5:30 pm 25 minutes after the 5-10 minutes I was told. I also noticed while I waited that the app had sent me an email saying my order was ready.  I understand ordering app issues- it was their app. What made this difficult was the lack of anyone taking charge to make sure orders were being filled.   Oh, and I should have opened up the stapled bag, because when I got home- the side was not in the bag.  The food was great- the service, even by pandemic short staff standards, was very bad.
The peri peri chicken is amazing.  It is about time a place like this opened in St. Louis.  The food and portions are great.
Food is amazing. Portions are larger than you think and the spice is a lot hotter, so that is something to take into consideration when ordering. Staff is friendly too.

It was alright, nothing special. 

I was brought here from the reviews comparing it to Nando's but was disappointed. It could be because it was ordered as a pick up order and I live in Brentwood? I don't know. 

I ordered the lemon and herb chicken over rice with corn on the cob and coleslaw. While I am picky when it comes to coleslaw, theirs was good. 

My boyfriend picked up the order and said the inside was really nice so maybe we'll come back again to try it fresh and dine in. I'll edit my review after the fact.

We have been wanting to try this new place but we kept getting distracted.  Finally we made it we were pleasantly surprised.  Chicken is obviously their speciality so my wife had the tender sandwich and I had the chicken and rice.  Delicious.  Careful, because they have several spice levels and they ramp up fast.  Mild was fine for me.  We loved it so much it took us two whole days to crave it again.  Also the perimayo corn is delicious.  I tried it with my chicken and rice the first time, and loved it so We ordered two large helpings to go the second time.  Couldn't get enough.  The person who took our order and served was from Algeria and she was very friendly and fun to talk with.  We will be back.

Who "steams" chicken?  

Saw 1/2 baked chicken pulled from drawers below the grill, placed on the grill and then water poured on the grill to create steam. 

I had chicken tenders. How can chicken tenders be tough?  And  the chicken wings had soft rubbery skin. 

Inedible and tough. Useless utensils and napkins. 

Other reviews praising the food. I find skeptical.
The food is fresh, made to order and absolutely delicious! Super friendly staff - only negative is the accoustics aren't the best - but who cares when the food is so good?
Great chicken and definitely make sure to get the Mayo corn dish!! I got the family platter and it was a perfect amount to share with three people! And the staff was very nice
Flavorful grilled chicken with a wide array of equally flavorful and spicy sauces. Great alternative to burgers or burritos.
Wicked good spices and chicken preparation- lamb was good, though not enough meat - I can't wait till summer to go try this place at the restaurant

We stopped in here yesterday for a quick bite. Had 1/4 chicken, Sizzler sandwich and hummus. Everything was really good. So good we went back today and tried some other stuff. Can't wait to go back. I pray they can establish a good base of customers so they stick around for a long time

Cool establishment and fastastic food! The chargrilled- to -order chicken with PeriPeri sauce, a birds eye chili infused tangy concoction is stunningly delicious. We ordered a pita wrap, half chicken, wings and an order of cassava fried bites. They also have lamb chops, falafel and other vegetarian dishes, as well as delicious sounding desserts. Counter ordering (or order online) and they bring it out to your table. There was a bit of a wait due to chicken being *to order* and the chic dining room filled with families was quite loud and echo-y, but we didnt mind....it was worth every second. 
** Be aware, the spice level here is quite hot, we ordered mild and medium, and the medium was at the limit for me, and I am a spice lover:)

If you love Nando's, you're going to love the Port of Peri Peri. Fresh, delicious, fairly priced peri peri that never disappoints. We especially love the cassava fries. The Beyond burger is also pretty tasty. Lots of choices for vegetarians! We get delivery from here at least once a week.

The wings are terrible. The skin had the texture of gelatin. Zero crisp. 
If you love wings go elsewhere.

We weren't sure what to expect when coming here, but wanted something different.

After looking over the menu, we ordered the falafel rice (hot) and a chicken sandwich (extra hot) along with some fries (with the peri peri seasoning).

It took a little bit for the food to come out, as it looks to be freshly made when ordered.

As we waited we watched a large number of carry out orders getting picked up. The dining room was empty except for us.

The food was very good! Fries were from actual potatoes and super hot and fresh. The seasoning is very good and adds to the flavor. Wish I had a ranch or tzatziki style sauce to dip them in.

When they say "hot" they mean it! Very flavorful, but nice and spicy. Perfect if you like heat but not pain.

Chicken sandwich had mayo on it also and when mixed with the hot sauce, made a delicious drippy mess!

We are looking forward to coming back soon and bringing others!

Not much to look at from the outside. It's in a strip mall, next to a Fresh Thyme, but don't let that fool you. Go and enjoy!
Clean, staff was friendly and fast,whoever made my wrap made it look nice and taste good. The location is pretty nice and new. They have healthy options for a quick lunch break.

Quick and friendly service. Great food at a great price. So glad this went in in front of the Terra Bella apartments. Looking forward to eating here for a quick bite on nights where we can't decide what to do for dinner! The Cuban sandwich was delicious!

What is shitshow at 1 p.m. today. I ordered curbside pickup nobody came outside so I went inside and they couldn't find my order they said it would be ready. In the interim the shakes finally got ready as I waited 20 min and they are melting...
They asked me for my order number I show it and they said oh it's been ready the whole time sitting here getting freaking cold now I got cold sandwiches and melted smoothies what a disaster today. The sandwich was disgusting when I got home. Its dripping in sauce. Also the smoothies are used with all ice and 1 scoop of product. My suggestion dont use ice. Get new staff....

Why 4 stars?

A new spot that popped up in the area. I have been before but it has been a long time at a different location. 

The food was decent and fresh, the smoothie was recommended by an employee and was very tasty and the facility was clean. 

Not much more to ask, but not a 5 star drop what you are doing spot. Those are rare. 

The highlight of the trip was a friendly employee by the name of Liam. He explained a lot, did it with a smile, made recommendations and is the type that makes your spot get an extra star.

I had the Avocalada Smoothie and Thai Chicken Bowl. The smoothie was a massive size and inexpensive for only $6. The ingredients did not seem fresh, mostly sugar. It seems more like a sonic fast food place. The chicken was terrible on my bowl, the romaine lettuce was so cheap. This is 100% not healthy at all, I might have just ate at McDonald's. Would not recommend.
I regularly get smoothies from here. It's my favor smoothie place. I'm trying to work my way through the menu and so far I have yet to be disappointed. Their food is delicious as well!
Flavor is absolutely there, work has been catering lunch from there once a week and I get a pita with chicken and pesto fresh vegetables. It's hot when it gets to me and I eat everything.

The owner has a sign in the window to announce they are a veteran owned business. Yet, they stopped giving military discounts. Owner remarks they pay for their stuff everyone else can also. Needless to say as a vet, this location won't get any more of my business. I will make sure to spread the word to all my friends who are veterans.

Clean environment, and the staff was nice. I decided to change my smoothie for a different one and they kindly changed it without a problem. Nice switch up from your typical fast food restaurant. This place is great for lunch.

Great Korean and Chinese eat in/take out restaurant inside of H Mart. 
Everything I had was delicious. Prices are great considering the quality and portion size you get and I assume that all the food comes directly from the market - always fresh. 

Restaurant seating area is cozy and clean. Kitchen is open, clean which I tend to like.

Great Korean food located inside the HMart. People working there are more than willing to talk through the menu options to make sure you'll enjoy your meal. English translations are included on pictures at the register. The food was definitely better quality than I expected for being inside a grocery store. Appropriately priced and speed of service was reasonable.

Our favorite place for ramen! Family owned and the food is amazing!!!! We eat here almost once per week. H Mart is always a bit cold so bring a sweater. Not wonderful ambiance but who cares... the ramen is bomb and I like the cute family who runs it.

I have always wanted to try the food here for as long as I have been going to H-Mart, since this tiny restaurant is located inside the grocery store. But, I will admit that the menu initially intimidated me. None of the dishes were familiar to me. Even though there were English translations for the names of each of the dishes offered, I still found myself standing in front of the order counter Googling what each dish traditionally included.

I knew that I had a soup craving when I came in here, and I am so glad that I settled on the gamja-tang. The pork rib broth soup was so rich and flavorful, and it included some delicious, big, meaty pieces of pork on the bone. The potatoes and other vegetables inside the soup were also very flavorful and cooked to perfection. The seasoning was just right with this dish!

I didn't know that I would also get a side of white rice, kimchi, and other small container filled with what appeared to be some type of bean. All of these little additions were excellent to eat with my soup. And as an added benefit, my meal that was close to $13 really turned out to be two or three meals given the amount of food provided. I enjoyed the soup again when I reheated it the next day. Still so full of flavor and rich. I would certainly come back to try some of the other menu items.

Easy to take this spot for granted because it's not a standalone restaurant building... but I love this place! For anyone wondering - food has stayed delicious and high-quality throughout covid. 

I got Korean fried chicken and ojingeo bokkeum (spicy stirfried squid/vegetables over rice) for takeout - so, so good... Call ahead so you can pick up as soon as you get there - otherwise shop around for 10-15 min. Service is friendly/patient and pays attention to detail. The entire Hmart location is super clean and has a lot of safety precautions; I didn't see dine-in options when I went.

UPDATE - I went again today because I started craving it after writing this review and they have dine-in available now!

Food is mediocre. Service is unbearable. The owner asked if we could eat fast as I was completing the payment because she has to close at 7:00. What kind of food business closes at 7 first of all and if so, why did she take the order at 6:30 if she was that desperate to close at 7 sharp. I felt so uncomfortable and wanted to leave but here, you pay first before you eat so she can make it to-go but would not issue a refund. So it was eat in 20 minutes or eat in the car. I wish she could have at least mentioned it before I made payment. I really miss the original owner. This used to be our go-to spot but the quality and service went to trash. The price is reasonable but it is not worth to bear the horrible customer service. If you love eating in 20 minutes while someone awkwardly stare at you, you have found "the" place! If not, find somewhere else.

Hands down the best korean food in the area! Its a hidden gem as it is located inside of the market and there arent any signs outside. Everything tastes authentic and homemade and the portion size is very generous.
Top notch Korean food and friendly staff. Not sure why people would complain regarding time, new ownership means new rules etc.

Korean food done right here at Manna Kitchen.  As soon as I tasted the kimchi; it set the tone that this place was going the be delicious. Different Korean restaurants have different styles on making Korean food. Manna Kitchen is very unique in that aspect. The bulgogi is something new other than the traditional marinade that other Korean restaurants have to offer. It is mixed in with a entirely different sauce which is one of the most delicious delicacies I've had in a while. The tonkatsu, budae jigae, bibimbap, and other dishes are worth trying. One of the hidden attribute of this Korean restaurant is its ability to make fried chicken! The fried chicken is extremely delicious and in my opinion way better than the likes of local philly favorites: SOHO and Bonchon. The setting is a small old fashioned mini restaurant where the prices aren't extremely outrageous. You can also shop at HMart while you are waiting for your food. If you are dining in you can request extra side dishes such as kimchi at no expense! Just make sure you come in on time before closing where the food will be at it's peak. It's proper etiquette to show respect to the hours as this place and any other restaurant like to close early. I'm here at-least once a week to go eat and in my experience I have dined once during after hours. I was not told to go eat in my car nor told to hurry up as a previous review has said. If you actually eat out a lot you should know it's best to dine in way before closing to get the best experience. I wholeheartedly recommend this place as the food will bring peace to your soul.

Living in Bucks County my options are limited to real Korean food unless I want to drive 30+ minutes (minus the one restaurant not far from here but, to be honest, I prefer this food here.)  This little spot is clutch because I can order, go about my grocery shopping, and pick up my food on the way out.  I usually order my staple of tofu soup and bibimbop for the husband. The banchan is good and the kimchi is usually tasty.  We even had them cater part of our wedding and everyone loved the food!!  Definitely worth checking out this delicious family business.

Hidden in the front corner of H Mart in Levittown, PA, lies Manna Kitchen, a tiny Korean restaurant serving cuisine from the homeland and China at reasonable prices. There are only four tables, so takeout is the primary focus. I stopped in yesterday to check out their Korean Fried Chicken, which comes six pieces to the container for nine bucks and change. 

To be transparent, we seemed to have a small miscommunication about exactly what I was getting. I asked for Korean Fried Chicken Wings, which I thought the friendly order taker agreed I could have. Instead, what I got were a few wings and a majority of thighs. Now, I like thighs, but they are not the same as wings in taste nor texture. So, when I arrived home my first impression was that I had received huge wings. First bite told the tale, and disappointed my taste buds. The crisp was there, as was the delicious ginger soy finish, but the taste of the dark meat chicken could not be mistaken. 

I am willing to chalk this confusion up to poor ordering on my part, rather than intentional misdirection by the staff. I did enjoy them once I realized what I had, it's just that my expectations were left unmet. This accounts for the loss of a star. After all, meeting expectations is what satisfaction is all about, and thus, reviews reflect that reality. 

Still, I will get back to Manna sooner or later to see what else is going on. I do hope for no more misunderstandings, and that the chef is wearing her mask at all times while handling food, which accounts for the second demerit.
Amazing!!!! I literally wanted to order everything off the menu but settled with 4 items and each one was better than the next. Spicy beef stew

Excellent Korean restaurant. The Garbi-tong (beef soup) $13.99. Great flavor and nice portion. This family really knows traditional Korean cooking. Forget the fusion foods, they have destroyed Korean food for what it really is. Family run, the daughter at the front counter was very nice. 
The food here will be better than any Korean full service sit down restaurant. You must try it. It is located inside the H Super Market. RATING A +

The south side needed a new Indian restaurant and we go it!  Mela is phenomenal. We went with our old standby, butter chicken, just to get our toes wet and test the waters a bit. Along with the entree, we also got garlic naan bread, vegetable samosas, and stuffed bread pakora. I've never had or heard of stuffed bread pakora before, and let me tell you, I am SO happy I tried it. It's two pieces of bread stuffed with kinda the same mixture as the samosas and breaded with a chick pea batter then fried. Wowie!  It's a carb lover's dream!!  The naan bread was top notch. It was soft and fluffy, not tough, chewy, or burned like has been my experience lately with another Indian restaurant. The samosa wrapper was light and crispy, and the filling was on point, not too spicy but definitely not bland. The other Indian restaurants around here seem to have ones from the frozen section at Costco. Lastly, the butter chicken:  oh my gosh!  Delicious!  The chicken was tender and not dry, the sauce was fantastic, and the basmati rice was cooked to perfection. We got our food for takeout, and the appetizers came in this cute little paper box instead of styrofoam, which I appreciate because I don't like hot bread items in styrofoam. They end up getting all soggy, not to mention styrofoam is terrible for the environment and is filled with chemicals that could possibly leech into the food. Warning:  If you call to place an order, they might not answer right away. I think there was only one person working the front of the house and taking phone orders. I called three times and almost gave up. Luckily, I called back and got someone to answer on the fourth try. Not a big deal, just wanted to let others know. Overall, Mela knocks it out of the park and I'm so happy to have a new Indian restaurant option on the south side!!!

Amazing Indian food in a beautiful restaurant. I must admit I am always stepping out of my comfort zone when trying new independent restaurants. This one however came highly recommended. We dined with another couple which allowed us to share different appetizers and mains to get the full experience. The starter is a very thin crisp with a "salsa" that is to die for. Think of it as Indian chips n' salsa.  The appetizers that we chose were chicken samosas and the paneer. The samosas were amazing and were accompanied with a wonderful sauce.  The paneer was ok, but worth the try! We followed up the apps with Butter Chicken, Mango Wala (chicken), Tandoori Lamb Chops, and Lamb Kolhapuri.  All dishes were served with the traditional rice and mixed greens.  The flavors are amazing and the meats were so amazingly tender.  The wait staff is very patient and willing to assist in helping you make the right choice.  We must support this place and make it successful because they are putting out some amazing cuisine.

Had chicken Tika masala and butter chicken. I must admit that this is the worst Indian test that I've been to in Indianapolis. On top of that it was super expensive for tasteless food. I'm better off to go spend that kind of money in Carmel and eat better Indian food. I def not recommend this place. The chicken tasted old.

After seeing all the great reviews, we decided to give this a try.  The food was delicious.  We've never had Indian food before so we asked for recommendations.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  We got the butter chicken, tikka Marsala and chilli chicken.  We got the medium sauce and it was plenty spicy for us.  The sauce is rich and filling.  We'll definitely be back.

*face palm* Too hungry to take food pictures. 

We loved our food tonight! 5 orders: Chana masala (Great flavor, low heat), salmon tandoori, butter chicken, chicken tikka masala, and okra vegetarian meal (I forget the name). 

Everyone loved their dish. Half the table had never eaten Indian food and everyone was very pleased. We had picked up our order and I was delighted to see how beautiful the restaurant was when we visited. 

I hope to return! Excited to give them our business again.

As we walked in the door at Mela, we were greeted by a very friendly employee, who seated us immediately. The food smelled delicious from the start. It took a little bit for the food to come, but the ambiance was good, and we didn't mind. Everyone enjoyed their food, and the service was great.

Excellent and highly recommended new Indian restaurant in the Franklin Township/Beech Grove area. Lots of options, and plenty for vegetarians and vegans as well. Papadum and a green cilantro chutney is given as a free app (think chips & salsa at a Mexican joint). For an appetizer, my wife and I shared the allu tikka chat, which is 2 fried, spiced potato patties on a bed of chana masala, along with some very tasty chutney; more than enough for 2 people. For my main entree, I picked the Vegetable Korma which came loaded with all sort of veggies and beans (cauliflower, potatoes, peas, peppers, zucchini, onions, paneer, chana). Everything was cooked perfectly and piping hot and fresh. I'd have to say that this is one of the better kormas I've had around Indy, or anywhere for that matter. My wife got the Chana Saag, which is a spiced pureed spinach/greens gravy along with garbanzo beans, tomatoes, and potatoes. Again, very fresh and hot, and absolutely delicious. The chickpeas were cooked quite well, and were soft just like they should be. The basmati rice was cooked with cumin seed and possibly a hint of other aromatic spices to enhance its flavor a bit. The garlic naan was fantastic! Had a little bit of browning/charring but was still soft and chewy. For dessert, we got the gulab jamun (always hard to pass up!). Temperature was hot, which I prefer, the syrup was light and had great aromatics, and they also threw in some coconut shreds which added a nice element. 

The restaurant itself is quite new and looks great. The décor is comfortable and inviting, and the entire place was extremely clean. Great atmosphere all around. They did a great job turning an old Sears building into this beautiful restaurant. The bar area is spectacular and they have a ton of high quality liquor and spirits.

Overall, we highly highly enjoyed our visit to Mela. It wasn't very busy but it certainly deserves to be, and I'm sure it will be picking up speed soon. A wonderful addition to Indy's south side!

We absolutely love Mela! Their Tandoori chicken is always cooked perfectly! They have a side of curry served with their tandoori chicken, which is delicious! The restaurant's atmosphere is calm and great for a date. Their food and service is definitely worth the price! I also live that they serve ooooo dum/ "chips" with chutney when you sit down! We keep coming back to this jewel of the south side!

Recently tried Mela - great food but the service maybe not so much. We actually started our dinner at the restaurant and had it packed up before the entrees came because we spent so much time waiting and didn't even get waters. Not really mad about it but I wouldn't dine in again. 

Food was awesome! We ordered the Aloo Gobi, which is a stir fry type cauliflower dish as well as the Milagi Khozi Chettinad which was a Chettinad pepper chicken dish. They were both delicious but the chicken dish was the star. Honestly I've never experienced clove used so well in a curry. Absolutely fantastic and it had a perfect heat level that built and subsided quickly. We had their fresh papadan as well and one of their stuffed Naan bread options. Both fantastic. I love Papad so I'm always happy when it's offered. Finally we ordered the Pani Puri and a strawberry lassi. Those two items I wouldn't necessarily recommend. The Pani was okay but awkward and the sauce was in a styrofoam coffee cup which just felt cheap. The lassi was just not good, no tang, tasted like strawberry kind. 

We will come back but only for carry out!

I eat out pretty regularly and love trying new restaurants. I'm not easily impressed by most food out there. This restaurant from start to finish, was an experience to say the least. Each new thing I tried, the chutney with the appetizer, the lentil soup, the chicken tikka masala, was packed with so much incredible flavor, I'm blown away, more than I ever have been by a restaurant, it inspired me to sign up to Yelp to leave this review.

It's brand new so I was the only one dining in. I hope more people can try this hidden diamond and keep it running.

The ingredients and spices you can tell are all fresh and top notch. I just hope they keep up the amazing quality in the long term.

Update 5/26/21: I went back recently and sad to say had a much different experience. I ordered the exact same thing as my first visit I raved about.

First the free appetizer gave a good indicator, the green chutney was not nearly as fresh and popping with flavor as before.

The lentil soup had a very foul taste to it, and lacked the seasoning the first one had.

And for the chicken tikka masala, the chicken pieces were cut so big that they were not bite sized, and they too had a strange flavor. The tikka masala gravy was just normal, like other Indian restaurants, It did not have the same impressive seasoning it did the first visit.

So sad to say it seems they've already had to start cutting corners to save costs, be it use less seasoning/spices or using non fresh ingredients. 

Based on my first visit they were number 1 of all Indian restaurants near the southside. Now, of Clay Oven, Tandoori Flame, and Mela, if they continue on this path I would rank Mela last among the others now.
Great food.  Restaurant was very nice and the staff was friendly.  Excited to have good Indian food on this side of town.  Will definitely be returning!

Wow!!! This spot is excellent and deserves to much busier than it is. I got the chana masala and it was fantastic. My partner got the chicken tikka masala and it was also delicious!! Highly recommend and this will be a regular dinner spot!

MARRY ME!!!! We haven't even gotten our main dish yet and we're in love with the appetizers. Friendly staff, clean airy place. My new FAVORITE restaurant. I love far away but I will make the drive for this.

My wife and I ate here recently. The entire experience was amazing! We had some appetizers and entrees that were all spectacular. The salmon was the best I have ever eaten in my life and I have eaten salmon at probably more than 100 restaurants. I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant and I can't wait until I can return.

I was there with a party of 6.  I've never been charged a mandatory gratuity for a party of 6 before - usually party of 8 or more.   I was charged and that was noted quite a ways up the receipt.   It's my fault for not reviewing the receipt I guess, but that waitress ended up getting a 40% tip - 20% automatically and another 20% that I put on.   I don't recall seeing anything on the menu about a group of 6 being auto-tipped and I feel like they hid the tip knowing most people don't read the receipt closely.  Felt shady to me.
Very rude. They refused to give me a cup of tap water and told me they did not have any bottled water for sale. They told me if I wanted a cup of TAP WATER it would be $3.00.

Why would charge a service charge for a to go order?! Very sneaky  Why would I pay to order food from your restaurant ?! Service charges are the amount a patron is required to pay under the terms and conditions of purchasing food and drinks at the restaurant. Service charges belong to the restaurant and not to the employees. You don't even mention a service charge , you just tacked it on to get end of the bill. Most places are actually grateful for any patronage. 

They charge $7 for a tiny milkshakes made with cheap ingredients and don't even dress them. We ask where the whip cream and cherry was for the milkshakes and they said they don't do whip cream and don't have cherries. What kind of place brags about running the best authentic soda shop with milk shakes charges a hefty free for milkshake with no whip cream or cherry?  Chick-fil-A makes fresh handspun milkshake with bits of Oreo cookies, topped with whipped cream and a cherry, size large for $3.45!

First and last time we will order togo from your place.

Ordered the White Oak Barbecue Burger and that shyt was delicious son!! Fries were ok, service was good no delays and that was on a Saturday night so a lot of people at Fifth & Broadway! I have no complaints except on the fries I wish maybe try a different style.

Came here for the first time a few weeks and had a burger and fries with a drink. Both the burger and fries were good. Recently opened near in the heart of Broadway, near the Bridgestone Arena, Broadway and the National African American Music Museum. The service was nice and quick.

Three people working and after they saw me it was a few minutes before they said they'd get to me.

Burger was ok. Nothing to write home about and I certainly wish I hadn't bought it.
It was fabulous, the service was great and quick. Everyone in our party was happy with their meal!

Two weeks ago my wife and I went there and ate farm burgers. I had it with tots she had sweet potato fries.
Worst burgers ever.
The food tasted only like salt and more salt.
My wife didn't even make it to the car before she had to go to the bathroom.
We will never eat at the whole assembly hall because of this burger.

Great restaurant.    Had to wait a while for the burgers, but they didn't disappoint!   Super nice outside courtyard area with picnic tables.   Pet friendly too!   Met some nice people at the other end of our table also!

We were glad to visit The Pharmacy in its newest location at 5&B. There were tons of people there due to a nearby conference (we were part of that crowd), but The Pharmacy handled it professionally and courteously. The burger was fantastic and the fries were even better. I love the atmosphere around it and its proximity to everything else around it makes it that much better.

We arrived to a cashier that was obviously ill. After 10 minutes of waiting she was tasked with making our shakes - with no gloves! We asked she not make them.  No apologies from staff. Another 15 minutes- our burgers were cold by time shakes were done - yep, had do those too. Unprofessional team leader and staff! Then to tipnit off.... When we went back to the counter to get condiments and a silverware, the staff was talking bad about us ladies making them recook our food. Ultimately the food was good, the service was horrendous !
The Pharmacy burger was very tasty and the meat was very fresh. The line was very long but it goes quickly. The fries are also super good!

We love this little gem we found! I roommate has been going for weeks and bringing home treats, but I went today myself for the first time. I bought a Bavarian creme donut and a cinnamon roll. I had had the cinnamon role once before, and they are delish! The donuts are amazing too! I would love to try more of a variety next time, but I was unfamiliar with a lot of the baked goods just as a cultural difference. Everything looks delicious! Very authentic.

Passed this small business many times as I shopped at Ace Hardware next door and finally had the opportunity to stop and do some shopping.

It is a small, family-owned business that is primarily a bakery with a small market and restaurant included.  The baked goods take up one entire wall and has a large variety of Mexican baked goodies, from cookies to sweetbread to rolls.  

The restaurant seems to be mainly takeout with just a few tables for people who want to eat there.  They have roasted chicken, tamales, and other Mexican fare.  Prices are reasonable.  The home-made tamales caught my eye because good homemade tamales are difficult to find and these fit the bill. 

If you are looking for authenticity, you will find it here.  Hasta luego!

Found out about this hidden gem while I was on Facebook.  So glad that I came to try it out!  The red and green tamales are authentic and flavorful.  The chile relleno's were just like you would expect from abuela's kitchen.  I dined in and the owner was amazing!  Best service ever! They had lots of baked goods but I was just too full to try them.  I took a couple dozen tamales and 1/2 dozen relleno's to go.  I'll definitely be back!!
Excellent food and service! This place is hidden in Gilbert's corner in Smyrna TN. Must try for a unique experience.
Great little store! Their tamales are very tasty and so is their freshly baked bread.
Great little spot with awesome tamales! Everything is really good and cooked fresh. All the employees are just as sweet as they can be. Prices very very reasonable. Definitely check it out.
I ordered chorizo, chicken and steak tacos from this restaurant via Uber Eats. The Chorizo was the only good meat. The chicken was dry and the steak was hard and rubbery.

Pork Tamales were delicious!
Unfortunately, the bakery items we picked - conchas and marranitos - were very stale.

This quaint bakery and eatery was quite a hidden gem. It had an assortment of pastries and cakes that looked magnificent. I ordered two tamales, three taco de asada, and half a pound of barbacoa and rice. The tamales were nice and tender, the tacos were rather nice, and the barbacoa was delicious. It was all washed down with a refreshing watermelon drink. Before I left, I bought some of the pastries. I recommend this place, if you're craving authentic cuisine, for a great price.

Very good! Retried beans are the best I've ever had. Tamales are delicious. Whatever you choose will be good. The whole chickens are so juicy. Just make sure you get the REFRIED BEANS! Never knew beans could be so life changing delicious!
Absolutely amazing. Great food and service it speaks straight to your soul. Danielle is amazing and very informative! Great restaurant and amazing service!!!
The food was horrible. Needs more species. That spicy ranch was great. And the people was nice.
Had fried shrimp was excellent.  Husband had chicken sandwich he said was good.  We wish they had breakfast.  Our waiter was awesome.

I'm not sure what the other poster from here was talking about "solid spot for lunch", but this is a souvenir shop on Bourbon Street. 

If they have food, I didn't see it.

Mostly t-shirts and Mardi gras  beads.  Tourist trap.  I paid $9 here for a pair of Falcon's beads, I bought at another store for $7.

A sucker...born every day.
Hidden gem for quick drink n bite! Duck n andouille was amazing in bread bowl. Bartender, host, and waitstaff were very welcoming and attentive. Can't wait to go back!
Solid spot for lunch.  Nothing really stands out, but it's a good meal nonetheless.

Wow. Shocked this place wasn't on here yet. Went in expecting your traditional crappy mall Chinese food catering to the American Chinese flavor and was treated to authentic Tiawanese flavors. If you like that more authentic flavor at a great price this is should be a go to in the mall food court. I travel for work a lot and always try and find good Asian food. I was worried when I looked at the noodles but man they look plain but bursting with flavor. They also had more authentic dishes like Taiwanese chicken and jalapeño chicken. So good. It was really a please take surprise to find such great food that you would normally find in like an Asian district inside a food court. Great prices too and portions.

It's a small shop. Friendly people.

The food was decent, but a decent star below Panda.

My son had the orange chicken, which was a little burnt and not as spicy as he would've liked. The fried rice was on the wet side, which was doable, but would've liked it more dry.

All this to say that this is still a good option if you're in the mall. The owners gave us free spring rolls, because we had a baby with us and they were being sweet.

So please give them chance and support small business!

Chinese Gourmet Express at WestShore Plaza in Tampa is a great place to stop for quick and delicious Chinese food when you are hungry and need something fast. The food here is fresh and flavorful. I have been happy with all of the orders that I have made from here.

My friend went there and had very high hopes for the food due to the amount of people that were in line. He got the special that included 2 meats and one side. He got spicy bourbon chicken and beef & broccoli with a side of noodles. It is said that the spicy bourbon chicken was decent, but the beef tasted "musty". Almost like it had been leftovers sitting around from the day before. The noodles were also very dry and had no flavors/veggies. If you're going to be a mall Chinese restaurant at least do the bare minimum and create satisfactory food for your customers.

Not sure what the difference was but they seemed a little off today. The food was very flavorful but had a a lot of grease sitting in the bottom of the containers. Mine food was okay but my wife and daughter ended up throwing there's away.  Disappointing because previous trips there for at least 4  Bad day a I guess.

I have been ordering from Grandma Pizza since it opened in the Petrolia Shopping centre probably 30 years ago.  By far, THE BEST PIZZA IN EDMONTON!  You can imagine how sad I was when I went to order last year only to be told by a recording that they had left that location.  I then spent the next year wandering Edmonton like Kung-Fu, except instead of finding people to help, I was in search of a replacement goto pizza place.  I tried many places on the Southside, from chains to small independents and found everything lacking.  Once you've had Grandma's, all the rest are just pedestrian pie.
Then(!!!) about 2 months ago, I got home to find a menu wedged into the frame of my front door.  Even walking up my sidewalk, I could see the familiar face of Grandma on the menu.  At first I assumed my friends were playing a cruel trick on me - knowing my love of Grandma Pizza and the fruiltless seach I had been on (oh, how I complained out loud at any mention of pizza), I figured they had either found an old menu or printed a bogus one up, and planted it on my front step just to tease me.  But it turns out.....dramatic pause while we listen to the angels singing from above....Grandma Pizza had reopened!!!!  Sure, it was a bit more of a drive from Petrolia to Riverbend, but I was more than willing to make the journey.  Was I trepidatious and worried as I drove there?  You bet!  What if someone just took over the name and was serving the same old shopping mall outlet by-the-slice-heated-under-light-bulb junk?  What if the move from Petrolia to Riverben had somehow damaged the original pizza oven and it lost its magic!?!?
Rest assured!  I'm here to tell you that the new location is serving up the same pizza that was offered at the original location - and it is still THE BEST PIZZA IN EDMONTON.  Every few weeks, I gladly make the short drive down the Whitemud to fetch my Grandma and she's as great as she always was.

Delightful!  As good as it gets in Edmonton!

Pizza is important to me ... it's easy to make a basic pie, as Pizza 73 demonstrates on a day-to-day basis, but a good one?  Its elusive to say the least.  Thankfully, Grandma Pizza in Riverbend fits the bill, and does so handily.

This isn't New York pie: the crust is robust (thankfully not quite at the lasagna level that Whyte Avenue's Chicago Deep Dish Pizza provides), the sauce is sublime: it's not just tomato sauce but the spices are subtle.  And the toppings?  VERY generous and always fresh.

Thankfully, Grandma delivers all the way to Laurier Heights from their location in Riverbend, and I'm always more than happy to be generous with the delivery person: they are bringing a bit of Edmonton magic every time they show up.  Forget the corporate pizza places and go with an E-town original next time you're craving a pie ... it's worth every penny and then some!

The best in town! I have gone for years in Petrolia. Great pizza
Owners are great and load the za
the pizza from grandma was great- they have since gone out of business or have relocated -

I stumbled across this place New Year's Day and I was happy to find it open. One of the few places that was. It is pretty bare bones inside but I imagine they do all their business by delivery & takeout. They have  a few specials two mediums or two larges for 23$ & 27$ respectively. Pizza is very good for the price and service was fast. I would definitely go back, and recommend this pizza joint.

Definitely not my grandma's pizza, cos she's chinese and would probably make it with rice or something. 

It was delicious, I ordered special pan (sub pineapple instead of shrimp because allergies.) And veggie. 

Ordering was easy, the guy was very nice on the phone.

I eat pizza just to get the crust. That is my favorite part. Carbs make me happy.

The crust had a light crispy shell and was soft and chewy on the inside. So. Good.

Only complaint was the middle of the pizza was soggy. If somehow they can fix that, it would be a perfect pizza
I love their burrito and where else are you gonna get two dollar pounders of rolling rock! Recommended.

Our favorite place in all of Florida. Hands down the best fish taco you will ever have - I promise! We love the blackened fish and ahi tuna. With the ocean across the street, cold beer on tap, and great food, you can't go wrong. Highly, highly recommend.
Great price for happy hour wings, delicious. Great view, service and atmosphere. Definitely go for happy hour you won't be disappointed!

Came here at 445 on a Wednesday and still were not waited on at 5 - waved the server down to say we were here - and totally ignored. I bet my wife someone would wait on us and give it til 5 to get a drink. My wife won!

They butchered the hummus I ordered and truthfully I didn't think it was humanly possible to butcher hummus. It looked like wet cat food and  tasted worse than it looked. Note to self- come to the tiki bar for the entertainment, not the food.
Takes forever for your food, waitress was slow, inattentive, and didnt seem to know how yo do her job. Fish and chips was soggy and tasted like water and mush. I would not recommend eating there.

I play volleyball frequently as well as a lot of my friends. I have had good experiences with Selena as our server.  But recently the service has been terrible.  These servers need to serve guests specially when we sat 40 minutes before closing time.   As a person who runs leagues at the volleyball courts, I will recommend Neptunes and Omaddy's as the go to places to get food and get good service.   I will not return to Tikis anytime soon.
First things first. Service was excellent (Jacki) , tuna tacos were great!!!! Key lime pie fantastic. 5+stars

Was riding past this place on bikes with my mother and we were actually heading to a different restaurant but we saw "3 dollar margaritas, margarita Monday" and made a sharp U turn. Good advertising for sure pulled us right in! I ordered the hummus and pita toast and the homemade hummus is absolutely spectacular. It had so many different flavors going on and made a party in my mouth. My mother and her friend had the grouper tacos. They thought it was so good they ordered 2 more! The menu is not extensive and definitely relaxed vacation food for a quick but delicious meal. However we enjoyed all of it. This is definitely a beach vibe bar with good people. If you're looking for a bar to wear a fancy suit to and get some expensive meal this ain't it. But if you want a good beach vibe with good music, food, and a positive ambiance I highly recommend the the tiki bar. Margaritas were delicious and the service was excellent. thank you tiki bar.

I disagree with the other rater!!  In fact, check out the ratings under the previous name (Little Tommy's Tiki) for a more accurate review.  I have been coming here for years.  I always find the service to be friendly and usually efficient. The food is AMAZING!!  The ahi tacos are the best you've ever had! I work north of Tamp sometimes and travel an hour just to come get a taco.  They sometimes have a special of dates stuffed with goat cheese, wrapped in prosciutto.  To die for!!  I highly recommend.
ThevTiki Bar is dirty, has poor service and takes forever to get your food. I thought that with new investors, it would improve so I gave it another chance. Some old service.

In town for a day as we get tired of hanging in our hometown. Parked in the free parking spaces around the corner and took a walk. It was a Monday afternoon and many places in town are closed, not here. Walked up, masked up and sat on the eastern most seating area under the roof. Immediately ordered 2 Margaritas because it was "Margarita Monday" for $3 each. Also ordered some freshly made pico and chips for $5 happy hour special. Wow, the pico was great. The margaritas had a bit too much sweet and sour in them and not quite enough salt but that is easily changed depending on the bartender. We had a great time and will definitely be back. It is clean and open inside and spacious. Plenty of areas to choose from. Also an outdoor patio area if you so choose. Staff were great and very friendly. Gotta love an $11 tab. Go here! Even if for just a drink on happy hour. It has great music and isn't super noisy like next door. Definitely a tiki done right! Well done Tommie, well done!

Cuban my butt!!
What a disappointment!!!!!

I ordered the Cuban sandwich and it was definitely NOT A CUBAN sandwich. 

First off, they gave it to me in a hoagie roll. It was not toasted, it was not pressed, nothing!

Then the meat they had on there was pitiful. I will be lucky if it even hit an ounce and a half. It was a tiny little bit right in the middle of the sandwich. They couldn't even be bothered for it to cover the bread.

Talk about a sorry excuse for a sandwich, a Cuban no less!

I even pointed this out to the waitress. She thanked took my sandwich away and gave me a free Coke. What a joke! Didn't ask me if I wanted anything else in exchange. Didn't even give me the option to keep the crappy sandwich to offer to a homeless person.

I hate wasting food! Even if it is sake food. Someone could have eaten there. Had to take away the sandwich and offer me a free Coke was so lame.

Get your act together and learn how to make a Cuban if you're going to claim your Cuban restaurant. I did not even realize that until I looked at your description on Yelp. You guys are terrible!

Wednesday night, open mic!  Stopped in for dinner and got a show! I had the mahi tacos, wife had the taco salad. I enjoyed the tacos, gonna need 3 next vice 2. Ask for the house hot sauce. Taco salad was good, but needed some greens.  

Music was very interesting. Two songs and their out, must be a batch of guys waiting.

Happy hour 3-6. Beer was cold, wine choices were mediocre. Need a Sauvignon Blanc. But the usual chard and merlot. Catch up Gulfport.

The BEST fish taco you'll ever eat. 

$5 fish tacos AMAZING

We came back two nights in a row. 

Fish & chips is second up for $12

And then the shredded chicken burrito. 

Such good fish!!!

Honestly , just not good.   My family says one of the worst pizzas ever.  We eat a ton of pizza and were excited to have something in our neighborhood.  Very Soggy, too heavy, and a Ton of oregano on top. You can see in the pictures.  The piece taken out was all that was eaten.   I know you are a new business so please let me know when you improve your quality and we will be willing to give you another try.

I'm sorry to say that my first order will be my last.  We were so disappointed with our food tonight.  The medium pepperoni pizza was so undercooked that the inside and bottom of the crust was still raw dough.  The sandwich we anticipated to be an authentic Cuban had tomatoes and was on a hogie roll, not Cuban bread or toasted.  

We literally threw the food out after 2 bites.  I've never complained about take out before but given this was $26.85 and not edible, just needed to share.

Although excited to try you out, the preparation of the food was just not good.  Sorry, but hope you take this into consideration and check your cooking before sending home in a box.

Best wishes for better success.

....tried to send an email or post on site but wouldn't allow
Tried this spot because it was in the same plaza as my chiropractor. Loved that they do pizza by the slice here! Food was tasty and staff was so friendly!

I heard this place is the best. "It's the best NY style pizza," they said. "Better than Mirros," they said. 

They. Lied. 

Tried it twice. Sauce is bitter, crust has a cheapness to it. This seems like a pizza you might expect at a fair, or a theme park, or a zoo. If those places were all run by people who hate pizza.

Delivery was $7 for a 1.5 mile drive. $7! 

Giving a tiny bit of credit because I also ordered Buffalo chicken tenders, and the hot sauce had a good heat to it. I appreciate that.

Maybe if they change to Palma Ceia Buffalochickenria, I'll be back.

Remarkably Bad! We ordered a large NY style pepperoni & onion, a small deep dish pepperoni, and some hot wings. We were both craving some pizza & wings and probably would have been satisfied with even just average product. This wasn't remotely close to average. 

The large Pepperoni/onion pizza was severely undercooked, and we think they just tossed a few red onions on the pizza after it came out of the oven because they didn't taste cooked. 

The "deep dish" pizza simply isn't deep dish pizza. They basically just use a thicker though. It was horrendous. Severely undercooked and just a messy/sloppy pile of dough, sauce, cheese. 

The wings were good size, and probably the highest quality product we received but were still fatty, undercooked, and the "hot sauce" would be considered mild in any respectable wing restaurant. 

Overall, just an extremely bad experience and I couldn't recommend avoiding this place strongly enough.
Just tried the New York style and it was delicious!! The couple at the counter were so kind and friendly. Can't wait to try the other pizza styles!

Excellent experience and food! Ordered pizza and wings for takeout and food was very timely and tasted great. The Sicilian pizza was the best and wings had the proper heat as well. Staff very friendly, all wore masks, and owner of business even greeted guests as they arrived which is rarely seen. 
Will definitely return.

Have ordered twice from them - the good and the bad.  The first order was inedible (horribly salty pizza, hours old chicken parm) but I wanted to give them a second try.  This time was better - pizza was excellent, veal parm was very good and incredibly tender.  The so-so, spaghetti noodles on side were over cooked, garlic knots had very little garlic flavor and were dry (could use more butter).  Disappointing is that they did not get either order correct - first time they sent home the wrong food.  The second time ordered garlic knots and mozzarella sticks and ended up getting two orders of garlic knots and no mozzarella.  All in all, I will give them another try but they need to up their game a bit.  If they do, they will be an excellent addition to the neighborhood.

Can't beg this place to give them my business. Stopped on a weeknight and was closed with a paper sign on the door. Ordered online and the order was cancelled after a half hour. Even tried to call in directly and nobody answers the phone. Plenty of other places to give my money to.

NO CUSTOMER SERVICE??

I sent the following to this company via direct message on ig and they literally left me on read. Guess I was a nobody. Just an excited POTENTIAL customer. Isn't the goal to grow your company? 

"Hello, I have been wanting to try you guys for some time. I live and work in south tampa during the day so its hard to get the opportunity to come your way. Finally decided to risk the timing during my one hour lunch break to drive your way. Drove 30 min to find that you guys weren't there. The website says that you are open and I tried calling. Now driving back with no success. My feedback would be to extend your hours more or to be sure that your availability hours are correct/updated on your website and social media pages. This was soo disappointing."

No wonder there's always a line. I was a 1st timer & I have to say - I'm glad they are on the other side of town. Otherwise, I'd be starring in "My 600 lb. Life". Excellent lunch of fried shrimp, lobster tail & fries.

The food is always amazing and the customer service is always great. I order online and I've never had to wait in line because it can get really busy. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is for the schedule. It's best to follow them on Instagram so you can know when to come they're pretty good at updating it.

I have been wanting to try Three Generations forever and it just never worked out for me. Either I wasn't on the same side of town or if I was they sold out. Well finally the starts aligned and it happened.  I eagerly placed my order and went with the fried lobster tail and shrimp over cheese grits and blue crab fries. 

The shrimp were good and crispy and well seasoned, they were served with a little spicy mayo sauce on the side. The grits were tasty but I wished they were a little more creamy. I think they were regular cheese and not Gouda. I will have to try to get the Gouda ones next time.  

The showstopper was the lobster tail. The batter was crispy and tasty and somehow the lobster tail was sweet, tender and buttery. I could have just eaten this and been super satisfied! 

The blue crab fries were good but a little spicy for me but I already knew that. The crab was tasty and it was a very good sized portion. Overall it was a good food experience. I will definitely be thinking about coming back again for that fried lobster tail, yum!

Chef Melly is doing it right!!! Our plates were amazing and heavy (amount of food) for the price. Service was great! Look for Big Things from this Chef on the brick and mortar opens!!! 
I may hit this spot again... ww shall see.
Me oh my this is a good spot! They got us our food with in 15 minutes and we had 4 full menu items, you can't beat that. Come to this place ASAP if you are hungry for some good good!

I was going down Spring Hill Drive three or four days ago and saw a sign that said Chinese restaurant at Kass Circle. So today, Saturday I figured I'd dropped and try it. Very nice and courteous service. I was sitting there and they came over and brought me the crunchy noodles. As I munched on them and the duck sauce I decided to have a fried roast pork egg roll. I also ordered wonton soup wonton soup. Everything was hot and tasty and delicious. I didn't order more than that because I'm in the mood for a submarine sandwich for dinner. Be assured I will be back one day this week for the lunch specials. Only 13 days left with 20 percent off. Come and enjoy some good Chinese food and save some money. No delivery but eating in is nice or take out. Other people were eating next to me and they had already been here a few times and said their dinners were delicious. I will take a picture of the menu for you.

First off - This is a WONDERFUL little business. My overall all experience was great from beginning to end. I was visiting family in florida and they insisted we eat here. I'm very happy we did. 

Here are my notes: It is a small hole in the wall kind of place. There are maybe 10 tables in the seating area. The server was very nice and polite, The owner is super kind as well. I felt very welcome at this restaurant.

My Aunt ordered Crab Rangoon for the table and DANG were those things stuffed! They were very tasty. 

I ordered the Pork Lo Mein and Fried rice. The Pork Lo Mein was loaded with yummy veggies and pork. The egg fried rice was awesome too! 

My aunt recommends the Kung Pao Chicken and at a 6 of spicy (1-10) it was very good. 

Any time our drinks were getting low they asked if we needed anything else. We ended up with 3 free bottles of coffee before we left as they had a box marked "free coffee". My aunt was given one and then the owner brought 2 more over for us as there were 3 of us. To top everything off the owner wa talking with us and walked with us and held the door for us as we left. Very nice and kind. 

* Service was fantastic.
* Food was great! 
* Prices were more than fair for the portion sizes! 
* Owner was very Friendly. 

The only thing that makes me sad is that i live 13 hours away from this place. Please enjoy it while you can!!

Beware!  First time ordering from here and will be my last.  Ordered via bite squad for delivery. Food arrived very fast, BUT the bone in ribs were putrid!  I'm not talking a hint of a bad odor, it gagged me and my husband. As soon as I opened the bag I smelled rotting meat. There is no chance that they didn't realize the ribs were spoiled, not with how rank they were.  This tells me very poor quality control.

Good, reasonably-priced food and the lady who works there is great.  Last time I tried to call in a takeout order the phones weren't working so I went there to place my order.  They may want to look into the phone situation.
Outstanding food. We're from Hawaii and been looking for 2 years trying to find a decent Chinese food place, we just found it. Service was great, food was awesome. We will be back, often.

After reading the reviews we decided to order for delivery by Door Dash. Our food was delivered much later than we were told, like an hour & half late. We received an egg roll instead of 2 spring rolls, and a text message much time after placed order that they did not have veggie egg foo young which was half of our dinner! Wings & hot sour soup was ok. Paid the highest tip too! Ok disappointed with this restaurant & finish with this delivery service.

Absolutely the best Chinese food in Spring Hill. Dumplings and crab Rangoon are delicious. The flavors are so refreshing. We've been looking for and trying all the different spots and our search is over. I can't believe how hard it was to find good Wonton soup but theirs is the best I've ever had. Since finding the garden we've eaten here more then a dozen times! I don't normally give 5 stars but I think they truly deserve it. It's not a fancy place by any means but the Food is that good. And I grew up on NY Chinese.
P.S. the two 1 star reviews: one was someone who showed up at opening and they were late the other is just a moron

This is a absolutely the only chinese restaurant to go to!!!....Everything is so fresh and delicious, not to mention the owners are so hospitable and generous! I frequent this place, and I don't eat out often, because I like to eat homecooking....definetely a MUST!!! Try the egg fried rice and crab wontons. Yummy

I hate this!  Yesterday I was craving chicken lo Mein and a spring roll. I researched several places in Spring Hill. I decided on this one. I have never not been able to eat a meal to this extent. My chicken Lo Mein was nothing more than spaghetti noodles al dente no less with a ton of garlic and some olive oil. The chicken was a very odd. No vegetables. The spring roll was not crunchy and mushy in middle. I spent $17 and couldn't eat it. I did call and the woman told me I could get another another one. I appreciated that offer however not sure I will do that.

This place is the best place for Chinese food in Spring Hill. You can tell when someone really puts there heart in what they are preparing. We all have different preferances but the food here is really good. Kimmy the server, is really sweet and wants to make sure you enjoy your meal. I love cheap prices but they are to cheap for them to survive. What I like about this place is you can tell its made from scratch. This place prepairs Chinese food the way we used to get it. I am a tough food critic so I held back the 5th star not because anything was bad but because I evaluate the restaurant as a whole experience. If you want good Chinese food make the trip and enjoy the food as well as their cheap prices!

This place is delicious!!!! There's just something about it that makes it so different from all the other fast food Chinese places! The taste in the food is outstanding! We've only tried the beef with broccoli and the boneless spareribs, but I will definitely try something new next time.
I've gone here a few times for pick up and dining in, and the service is phenomenal! The older lady at the front is super sweet and kind. Always thanking you for coming in and keeping conversation with you. She always asks to spread the word, because surprisingly for as good as they are, they aren't too popular. Although they are a little hidden.
They always throw in some wonton chips and they are freaking addicting!! Makes you wont to order a huge bag of them!
The plates are always LOADED to the point they need to wrap them in plastic wrap.

So if you're looking for some good Chinese food in the area, definitely check them out!

5 stars and definitely continuing to order from them.
Hands down, the best Chinese we've had since we've lived here (5 years)  We won't order from anyone else in the future.  Darn good!!
Very good Chinese food, we had sesame chicken, honey chicken and beef with pea pods.  Food was hot and everyone enjoyed it very much.
First time trying, and will be back! Had the house egg foo yung, and Mongolian chicken. Both were VERY good! Prices are reasonable, food was fresh and hot. Currently take out only...

I forgot to snap pics of the food because we got it to go, but I got the House Lo Mien, Crab Rangoon, WonTon Soup, and Chicken Fried Rice. Before you judge, it was for 4 people, not just myself, sheesh people! 

Anyway, I ordered through Yelp which then used GrubHub. The LoMien was for me, but my kids couldn't keep their chopsticks out of it because they loaded it up so well with the meats, and veggies! It was delicious. My mouth is watering just typing this out. I've never had Crab Rangoon like this one before. They were triangles, and was stuffed full of the goodness inside. The breading was a sweet crunchy outside and soft and gooey inside, topped off with the sweet and sour sauce just made it all so good together. I didn't try the soup or the chicken fried rice because my food was filling enough even with little fingers in it. My kids both gobbled down the soup, though! The rice still had some leftover, but not much. It was a lot of food!  

This place is almost walking distance from where I live, so now when I'm in the mood to walk, maybe that'll be where I stop! Then, I might have to be rolled back home but it'll be worth it!

This is the real deal NY style Chinese takeout that we grew up on. We had two combos, roast pork with Chinese vegetables with pork fried rice and chicken with snow peas with chicken fried rice and a couple of egg rolls. Everything was perfectly cooked and delicious - the portions were very generous, so much that I didn't even eat half of one of the meals (I'm a pretty big eater normally). China Garden is our new go-to Chinese restaurant even though there are at least three others that are closer to our home. We highly recommend this place if you love good Chinese food.
If our next visit is as good as our first visit we'll add another star to our review.

My husband and I ordered our dinners to be picked up recently - he had cashew chicken, pork fried rice and I ordered shrimp with vegetables and pork lo mein.
