The restaurant is now pick up only due to the corona virus, so we dined at home. The hostess greeted me warmly. He found the cashew chicken as passable but didn't care for the sauce in it, and noted that it didn't have a lot of cashews. Pork fried rice was good and was his favorite of the two. My shrimp with vegetables was also passable and I wasn't crazy for the sauce - too salty. Pork lo mein was passable but not as good as what we've eaten in the past - either in St. Augustine or NYC. We're going to try other places in the area before we try this place again.

Tried the chicken in garlic sauce today. Was too sweet and not what I expected. Will order something else if I try them again. Not a lot of traffic for a restuarant trying to make it. The hot and sour soup was greasy.

Third time I've been here since it opened. I've gotten a bacon dog each time. Someone working there needs to stop assuming everyone wants cheese. I did not order a bacon cheese dog. It was rang up correctly as a bacon dog. The second and third time I even specifically stated NO CHEESE. Each time I've received it with cheese. 
Please teach them how to read the ticket!!!

Third time I've been here since it opened. I've gotten a bacon dog each time. Someone working there needs to stop assuming everyone wants cheese. I did not order a bacon cheese dog. It was rang up correctly as a bacon dog. Each time I've received it with cheese. 
Please teach them how to read the ticket!!!

There are plenty of fast casual dining options in this area and I would not recommend visiting this restaurant. I ordered one burger and a fry and have waited for over 20 minutes for my order. The staff in the kitchen do not seem to care about the long wait that everyone is experiencing. Disappointed and will choose another option next time

The food was good, but the fountain drinks have an awful taste. I cannot eat a burger without a tasty beverage. Will not return to this location until this problem has been fixed. Honestly I am not sure why they continue to serve fountain drinks with that rancid taste there

This Five Guys restaurant gave us our food and we opened it up and it looked like someone sat on our food. They also told us that we didn't need to pay inside, but when we got there they told us that we had to go in and pay. I do not recommend this place to anyone unless you want terrible service and food.

I'm not a Five Guys fan.  I'm just not.  It's not you, it's me.  My husband, however, is a big fan. 

It was his night to pick dinner and he picked Five Guys.  This was our second visit to this location and our first w/ DoorDash. 

The order arrived hot, fresh, and fast.  

Here's why I'm going four stars.  Hear me out.  My burger patty was delicious.  Like, I'm not even sure it came from a Five Guys delicious.  It was well seasoned and well cooked.  Seared with crispy edges and a tender center that was just perfection.  No other Five Guys in the surrounding area has been able to do this. 

The jalapeños on top were grassy and fresh.  

Four stars from someone who, generally, is not impressed by this burger chain.

Got the bacon burger the burger part was good. But the bacon part was not it was chewy and hard to eat. Fries were good but not the best I've had at other five guys. The service was a little slow but not the worst I've had. They really need to work on that bacon I've never had bacon that bad.

This is a beautiful space for hosting private events. There is a large room that is perfect for a cocktail hour before dinner. The dining room is large with giant beautiful windows that look over the water. The food was delicious. The bathrooms were spacious and clean. I highly recommend this place for private events.

My husband was co-chairman of a charity Golf event at Feather Sound and we could not be more pleased with the outcome.   We worked closely with Francine Burruezo and Robert "Rob" Spiars. 

The venue is amazing, has been recently remodeled but it pales in comparison to the staff.  They had a member event in the AM, a child's birthday party, a member birthday party in the evening and still got everyone where they needed to be without issue.  

They made suggestions to make our event better and provided much help behind the scenes.  

Francine's smallest suggestion was listened to because of the expertise she displayed.   She was able to rely on wait staff, the dining and bar staff to execute her plan flawlessly. Her faith in their professionalism made us trust them to do their jobs.  

Rob managed the golfers and our lack of skill without a hiccup. Even when he was out of town he returned correspondence promptly and professionally.  As carts were returned from the Members event, they appeared clean and ready for our event.   Rob made sure Aaron and his other staff were aware of our first time organizer needs and took great care of our volunteers and guests. Rob personally updated scoring info into the evening to make it all happen just as the sun was setting.  

As soon as their work was done, they faded into the background so we could take all the credit.  

The wait, golf and kitchen staff were courteous, kind and provided endless help throughout the day.  Every time I turned around there was a neatly dressed Feather Sound Staff member helping out our volunteers and guests. 

The Members as well were welcoming at every turn on the course or in the clubhouse.  

In all we raised much more funds for our charity due to the excellence of the staff and facility.

Have been a member for about a year now and overall enjoyed the club.  The food on the regular menu is very good and reasonably priced; however the two times I have gone to the Thursday buffet was very disappointed.  Was not impressed with the buffet quality or the price.  The golf course and pool are nice and the gym has everything you would need with a view of the pool and golf course.  

With your membership you must spend a set amount.  If you do not hit that $$$ amount then you will still be charged.  If you haven't hit your spending minimum then you can order steak or wine for home...Just don't forget or you will kick yourself when you get the bill.

Let me start by saying that I am not a member but I have a friend who is. I have come here a few times for wine tasting with a few friends and man is this place gorgeous. It has a lot of amenities and a great course from what I hear. 

But as for my experience it has always been amazing. The wine tasting, well more of a pairing happens the first Wednesday of every month. The cost is 25 dollars and man is it worth it. You get to sample so great food such as lamb lollipops and fresh tuna. As well as some awesome wines. The host talks about the notes of the wine and its origins with each bottle which is also available for purchase after the tasting. We also go the restaurant for some more wine and munchies. The staff is always courteous and friendly.
It was a pleasure doing business with Rob Spiars at Feather Sound Country Club.  I recommend you look him up during your next visit.

My family has been a member here for quite a while and recently I joined myself. The course is beautiful yet tough. The staff is so great in every aspect. The dining room food is delicious, Chef Jeff does an amazing job. I recommend every stopping by to check it out.

For many years, Feather Sound was home to the Chris Thomas Memorial Golf Tournament. Chris was one of the most popular sports television and radio personalities in Tampa Bay until his sad passing in 2004. 

I was fortunate to be an invited guest to play in many of those events, which help put Chris's daughter through college, and Feather Sound did a very nice job as the host. 

Since the property is a private club, I had rarely played in anything but charity tournaments until I was invited to play a leisurely round with my golf buddies from the Tampa Bay Lightning the day after Memorial Day weekend...when absolutely nobody else was out there on the course.

For that reason, our pace of play was wonderful. Condition of the golf course was very good in all facets. Greens were extremely fast and looked as good as they played. Also, the practice range, chipping green and putting green are quite nice.

While there was no beverage cart on this day because we were basically the only group out there in the heat, the turn from the ninth green to the tenth tee features a convenient spot to stock up on snacks, Powerade, beer or free-poured spirits. (Nope. I don't drink on the golf course...although a shot of Glenlivet might have done us all some good on that second nine today.)

This is undoubtedly a second-shot golf course. I regularly hit most fairways here, but that guarantees me nothing on the scorecard. Most greens are elevated, a missed green is rarely an easy chip and putt and about half of these greens can be three-putted easily because of their size and shape.

The location of this golf course is one of its biggest positives, because it is just across the Howard Frankland Bridge from Tampa and the track works its way past a number of very nice homes in the Feather Sound development. Many players often find their way right across the street after the round to Courtside Grille to take the edge off a score they won't be bragging about the next day.

While I choose not to be a member anywhere to keep my golf costs down and because I like playing a variety of courses, this would be my second choice right behind Carrollwood Country Club in the Tampa Bay Area. Both of them way ahead of overrated places like Avila and Palma Ceia.

Went to this club for a sorority brunch with my daughter. Club itself looks nice, but the brunch food was absolutely SUB PAR. First, the menu choices consisted of eggs, hash browns, bacon, a few pieces of sliced cantalope/honeydew and "just defrosted" tasteless pastries.   The "scrambled eggs" were like chunks of yellow brick with a green/gray color in middle of each piece! The bacon was barely cooked, the hash browns very salty, and the pastries freezing cold! UGH! Felt like I was at a college dining hall, or a cheap diner. The college girls could have made a much better brunch!
It was a total rip off for all the sorority girls' families that wasted the money and time to attend. Never again for this club!!

One of the most unprofessional experience I've ever encountered. I was interested in joining Feather Sound back in January 2021, but heard that they were going to close the course for ~ 7 months to renovate the course. Didn't understand why I should pay the $4k initiation fee to be relegated to other courses for 7 months.  Also, I know the course will not be in great condition when it does reopen; new greens are hard as rock, etc.  So, I looked at other clubs in the area and after 2 months I'm ready to make my decision on which club to join.  When I circled back with Feather Sound I was told that their initiation fee had now increased to $10k?!?!? AND they would not honor the initiation fee offered just 2 months earlier. They claim there is high demand to join and even a waiting list now?!  Wasn't one 2 months ago! The Membership Manager said that no one could make any adjustments to their initiation fees, won't even discuss the reasons for it?!  Very short sighted, lacking customer service or simple business etiquette.  BY THE WAY I LIVE ON THE GOLF COURSE?!  How many potential members could I bring with me or................ turn away?!  I think I know the answer!!

I ordered the steak plate, and it did not disappoint. The steak was moist and tender. I ordered my steak well-done and it was cooked perfectly - it wasn't over cooked or burned. The seafood potatoes were also creamy and addictive.
Grilled Catfish Topped wi/2 Grilled Shrimp, Seafood Potatoes, and Asparagus. Young Chef. Good food. Faintly colorful. And worth every dime.
seriously waited an hour for 20 wings! missed my whole lunch break! 20 wings!!!!!!!! smdh

MKM Creations

 Young chefs are making the way starting with from building a business from personal deliveries,  then growing to a takeout restaurant. That's exactly how @mkm.creates started her legacy. For the longest time, I have wanted to support this black owned business, and I definitely had my coworkers roll right with me for this one.
    We grabbed lunch one Friday and everyone was extremely happy. All together, we ordered "Grilled Salmon Burgers", "Lobster and lamb chop plates with seafood potatoes", wings and "Seafood Wraps". Everything was outstanding. Y'all already know I ordered the Lamb Chops. They were crazy flavorful and you could tell they were cooked at a great temperature. The plate came with two grilled . They were a great size, juicy and buttery. The mashed potatoes  were slamming aka amazing. They were topped with creamy seafood sauce.
   I also tried a bite of the wrap. I will certainly will be ordering  that on my next visit. The bread had a nice grilled flavor, was still soft and that sauce was just perfect. It was rich, creamy, cheesy and full of seafood. The lobster  was also grilled nicely and seasoned even better. The fries  were crispy but the salad should have been put on the side. It was soggy due to the sauce from potato ran over. For me this was okay because the sauce is just that darn good, but for someone expecting a salad  to eat it would be a bummer.
    MKM was very accommodating and pleasant. Unfortunately, they do not take phone orders and I would like to be able to find the menu online a little better.
Overall 5/5                                   
Atmosphere 3/5                                      
Service 5/5                                
Food 5/5

It's a solid meal, definitely tasty. I think it was a bit overpriced because while in Nola, I had a similar plate elsewhere that was a lot less. I had the fried salmon with seafood potatoes. I liked that they use red potatoes and you get some skin in them. The salad that it comes with is put under the salmon, separated by foil, but the heat caused it all to be wilted immediately. They should definitely change that. I'd suggest going early because when we went around 5pm, they were sold out a most options.

Authentic New Orleans cuisine. This will now become my go to whenever im In Nola and want that true orleans flavor. I devoured every bite. The location is pick up only so plan to take it to go. But its worth the effort. Cant wait to go back.
Best take out food you'll ever find. Now this is the type of meal you can expect out of this city. Can't wait to see them grow

After pining over Instagram photos and videos for months, I finally made it over to MKM Creations. For this first adventure I had breakfast. I ordered the Patton's hot sausage breakfast ($8.00) and a 3-pc order of glazed beignets ($3.75). 

The food and service were great. Other than the eggs, which had a box / govt. issued taste to them (I don't think they were freshly cracked eggs), the breakfast was spot on. The grits were creamy, cheesy and well seasoned. I think they add milk to their grits just like I do. I didn't have to add salt or pepper. They were delicious. Of course the hot sausage was sublime. If you're a native, you're familiar with Patton's reputation for producing a quality, almost irresistible product. Lastly, the honey butter biscuit was warm, fluffy and buttery. It's somewhat similar to a KFC biscuit. All that said, I don't know that it was worth $8. The grits were good, but it wasn't a lot of grits. The most expensive ingredient was the hot sausage. 

Next were the glazed beignets. I've been wanting to try glazed beignets ever since Antoine's debuted them. It seems more bakeries/eateries are adding this item to their menu. I had one as soon as I got back to my car and it was light, airy and not overly sweet. I could've used more sweet, though. I had another one when I got home, but by then it had become dense. Sooo, like a powdered beignet, these are best enjoyed when hot. 

The location is very small. It can comfortably accommodate about 7 people; pandemic or no pandemic, it's tight. I'm curious who their target audience is because the price point of their signature dishes are out of range for many of the people in the surrounding neighborhood. I'll be back to try some of the heartier dishes like salmon, lobster and lamb chops.
This place was absolutely amazing. The food was everything I expected and more!!! It was my first time eating lamb chops and I fell in love. Just wish I had mor lobster

I went to try MKM Creations for the first time when I returned home from my vacation. I live on the Westbank and don't travel across the river unless I absolutely need to... Dont judge me . Well, I think I may be making a trip on over there more often and if I don't... my kids may not speak to me until I do.  The food was AMAZING... so amazing that both of my picky eaters begged to go back the next day. The young lady who takes the orders was such a pleasure and breath of fresh air that even if the food was not amazing, I would've gone back. The food came out quickly and was hot and fresh. 

We had the steak, lobster, catfish, seafood pasta, seafood potatoes, garlic Parmesan wings, and seafood fries... We all tasted each other's meal three or four times.  My daughter hates red meat and ate almost half of my steak. The pasta was the house favorite. The lobster tail was a bit on the smaller side and, IMO, was not worth the extra $15.

I'm giving a rating of four stars ONLY because there were three items on the menu that were not available, so I would advise to go early. 

Overall, I would and will definitely recommend this place to everyone that I know.
The grilled salmon plate with the fully loaded potato is my favorite!!!! Wonderful service, great food!!

When I had planned to visit this establishment, I called numerous times over the phone and sent them a message over instagram,  but didn't get an answer or reply. When they finally did answer,  they said that they weren't taking orders over the phone. So we made our way over there and I ordered whatever looked best on Instagram, which for me was the grilled salmon and seafood potatoes with seafood pasta. When I say this, I mean it as a person fron new orleans, and not Texas, where we drove in from: LAWD! 

We loved it!  It had that it great Cajun flavor, and the potatoes were perfectly cooked, as was the seafood pasta. 
It's rare that I even come in to order food because I like to order on the phone and just come to pick up so that I don't have to wait, but this was definitely worth the wait! It only took about 15 minutes to make and it was as I had imagined it to be. I would definitely drive-in from Houston again just to get more of this food. My only regret was not having more time to order more to have it to go with me. Definitely do not order a small order of the pasta, make sure to get a large order, because it is quite good. Even my daughter liked the pasta, and my husband, who is quite picky, and only likes salmon if I make it, liked the salmon as well. And I'm happy to support a black owned business!

The food was very delicious and tasty. I had been trying to get to this establishment several times. I am sooo glad I was able to taste the good cooking everyone keep bragging about. It was really good!!!

Food was really good, big serving. I was able to have some leftover for lunch on next day. I had the grilled lobster plate. I was very pleased. I couldn't order over the phone or online, the wait wasn't long going inside to order as I thought it would be. Good food,good customer service.
The foods awesome.  If I could give more than 5 stars, I would!  You have to try them HIGHLY RECOMMEND . Courteous and prompt service

Let me start by saying this was my first time there this morning.  I had just missed breakfast by a few but I had to try the beignets.. the young lady at the counter was super sweet and nice... the beignets..omg y'all they were so damn good.. I will be back for breakfast and the lunch I can't wait.. support black ownerd businesses y'all.

Cars. parked all over sidewalk,  young people hanging around outside smoking blocking entrance, very uninviting. I can see why the previous rating was bad because it seems it is more of a hangout than a place preparing good food.

It's a shame because there wings are the best in my opinion in the area and they have good cheesesteaks. My problem is they always take 2 hours to deliver my food. 2 hours. I can understand one but c mon. This has happened three times already and I'm really tired of it

I haven't been to this spot since it was Georges Pizza so I wanted to give the new ownership a try. The cheesesteak and fries were good and the cook who may have also been the owner or manager was the only professional person in there. There was two other workers behind the counter who look like they might've been in there early to mid twenties. And they were cursing from the time I ordered to the time I got my food. One was a female working the register and the other was a male basically just standing around but he did answer the phone a couple times. The female wasn't that bad but every other word out the males mouth was profanity. Sadly the cook didn't bother to stop them. 

I may order from there again but I definitely won't be stepping foot into that place.

Yes we're in the hood but come on...this is a business!

decent prices and the pizza crust is good but they didn't give me what they offered on their pizza. Sure I had special instructions to remove 2 ingredients and sub them for 2 others, but it missed the ingredients it was supposed to have that I did actually want on the pizza.

I ordered the paradise special pizza (which is pepperoni, sausage, green onion, mushroom, tomatoes, onions and black ollives) with no sausage and no green peppers, but add ham, fresh garlic, extra cheese and extra sauce. Now yes they abided to eliminating the sausage and green onion and adding the ham and garlic, but the pizza also did't have the tomatoes or black olives on it. Ingredients that come with it that I DID WANT on the pizza!

Bleach!  Never never again. It was a greasy mess.... why would anyone slop greasy sauces over shellfish that needs to be shelled. And let's be real if you have to dress in disposable gloves like you worked at the Deli counter at Wawa just to eat, somethings wrong. Felt oh so sorry for the wait staff who were great and enthusiastic because they had to serve such badly prepared good in such a gimmicky way.
As a girl born and raised in the deep South, on nothing but seafood and creole flavors. I give this place 5 stars. Brook was an awesome server.  We will def back.

I tried this place for the first time a few weeks ago. It was absolutely fantastic and I have already been back 3 times since then! The food is amazing, and the staff is incredibly friendly. The first time we went, the bar wasn't open yet which was a bummer, but it seemed like they had just opened. The bar has been open every time I have been back and we even sat at the bar for dinner once. The food always comes out really great. You have to try the coconut shrimp with your boil bag! There is one employee that I always see there that I believe is a manager and is the most friendly restaurant employee I have ever met. I think his name is Joe? He's very enthusiastic and seems to really enjoy making the customer experience as great as possible. I can't recommend this place highly enough. If you haven't been yet, you have to give it a try!

We dined in tonight, the fried food and soup are really good! The make your own steam pots have a couple kinks to work out! Over steamed corn and potatoes and almost tasteless seafood. But it is still their soft opening so this is understandable!

Having wanted to try Crab Du Jour since its opening I'm sorry to say my dreams of a good seafood restaurant were trashed.  The portions were underwhelming for the price. The taste of the food was bland and unpalatable.   The sweet potato fries were wet slimy mush. They looked like overcooked oily pasta accompanied by the same texture. Not a crisp or a crunch to be had.  I'm glad I got to try this abysmal cuisine so I know NOT to go back or recommend to anyone I like.
Ordered take-out. Major disappointment: food was bland, bereft of any seasoning. If you are looking for Cajun-spiced food, regrettably, this is not the place.

Please avoid this place unless they make confirmed changes here. 

I had high hopes for this place as love these kinda Cajun crab boil places and been to a ton around the country but this experience was terrible. 

Let's start with the manager..very smug and rude. I called before hand and asked if they served alcohol and they said no, then I asked if we could bring out on beer, and they said yes. Very enthusiastically actually "yes, of course you can!"  So we did, sat down and my wife popped open her beer. But a min or two after the manager very loudly and very rudely came over and said hey I know you just opened that but you can't drink that here..we don't have our byob license yet. Please finish that one but don't open any more! I was like, well we called before and they told us it was fine and we could. Still he was very smug and the (white) manager was like "well..they (nodding to the Asian staff at front desk) probably don't understand". This kinda felt distasteful to me. If your the manager, take ownership of the issue and don't pass the blame. And the fact he was so loud and aggressive and not discreet about it with others around led to my wife and us feeling very embarrassed and put a total bad feeling on the meal. Def could have handled better. 

But the worst offense was the food. It was like SO bland, zero seasoning and tasteless! So bizarre for this type of place and def the worst I've had at this type of place. I got the "special" which is a mix of all the sauces, so you'd think would be packed with flavor but was just oddly watered down, completely lacking in salt (or msg or whatever) and no flavor at all!! No chunks of garlic or taste of spice which is common at these types of places. I got the medium which was just not spicy at ALL. If this was mild I wouldn't have blinked an eye. I could forgive that but not the lack of seasoning. It seemed like they just boiled the seafood in plain unseasoned water, which was confirmed by a FB reviewer that spoke to manager who told him that's exactly what they did.  It didn't seem like the sauce was even cooked with or tossed properly in the sauce at all. It was just like...boiled tasteless seafood resting on top of bland sauce. So so disappointing! 

Also minor pet peeves, had to ask like 4 times for some melted butter for my wife and kids to dip their crab in and only got it when they were 2/3 through meal. Didn't clear out our shell buckets when obviously full and we were still eating. Also the bags they used are very deep, much more so than any other crab boil place been too which made getting to the food very awkward. Again minor but just..weird. 

Just so you don't think this is a total hit job, the location is nice and the staff (other than douchey manager) were very friendly. And my wife and kids who just got  plain steamed seafood enjoyed (although did say lack of salt, but the seafood itself was cooked well at least to temp and texture if not flavor). 

So maybe if you just enjoy very plain, low to no seasoned seafood you may like this. But to me the only reason to visit this sort of seafood boil place is for very flavorful Cajun seafood and this was so far away from that. And esp for the price (180 for fam of 2 adults and 2 young kids with tip but without drinks or ability to byo) for such an underwhelming and flavorless meal is borderline criminal. Def please stay away unless Crab Du Jour corporate can somehow get a handle on this location and make some quick changes. Otherwise predict a very quick demise of this restaurant sadly

I went here with my husband for a drink and a couple of appetizers before dinner at another restaurant. It was pretty slow when we walked in, but it was a Thursday before a holiday and 330p. We sat at the bar and the bartender immediately greeted us. He was quite fantastic during our whole visit. We ordered beer and wine and then the coconut shrimp and fried calamari. The food just fell flat - no flavor. For the coconut shrimp it was pretty much fried shrimp with some coconut flakes sprinkled on top. It was topped with some sauce, but it really should either be well coated or ideally served on the side. The calamari needed salt or some time of seasoning. 

Their happy hour is pretty decent, so would go back for the drink specials, but maybe not for the food. Service was great and the host was really nice as we were leaving. Would give 3.5 stars if possible.

Big disappointment that the clam chowder was inedible and was sent back. The rest of our meal was not very good either.  We has a shrimp basket that had way too much battter and was overcooked. Nothing we tasted had any real flavor. Service was ok and our soup was taken off our bill. Sorry to say we will not be returning as does not seem to be just a new restaurant getting into their groove.

The food here is DELICIOUS. One of my new favorite places in East Norriton. It's a great seafood place and all their food, including non-seafood like French fries, etc are tasty and delicious. Both my wife and I love seafood. If you're in the mood for seafood this place is THE SPOT! Great place!

We love seafood and this place is a real find - we order the 'family basket' every time which works for the 2 of us.  You order the flavor you want and combination of seafood - it comes steamed and delicious

The garlic butter sauce (medium heat) on snow crab was phenomenal!!!!!!  I just thought it was pricey for the amount of crab I received.  Crab with potato and corn was nicely served.  Restaurant is tastefully decorated.  Waiter was great!  Lots of big screens to watch games on...also a screen on each table!!!!!  I think you can set that to what you want to see.
Awesome food awesome service!   My waiter O.J was on point with everything!  If you are a seafood lover like me you will love this place.!  Definitely recommend !!!

It's your regular Popeyes store.. stopped for a quick bite since we had very limited time! Got the voo doo tenders combo - 5 pieces of chicken tenders, Cajun fries, 1 biscuit, and a drink.. the biscuit was really dry. The fries were not great either. The chicken tenders were good specially with the sweet n spicy sauce.

Okay I'll be the first to rate it and bring it on the board. I was skeptical at first since it had zero reviews and I wasn't sure it even existed but it's close to my climbing gym and I'm glad I went. Fast service, good chicken, and never crowded. The combo deals are great and $10 for 5 chicken, 2 sides, and 2 biscuits is more than enough.
Always enjoyed Popeyes and this is a new clean and maintained location. They always have fresh biscuits and chicken on deck! Great to see they have spicy chicken tenders!!

Popeyes is usually quite the experience. Depending on the location, there are long wait times, impatient workers, and sometimes, just quick and easy service. For this location, they can have you order online, so I picked up an order and when I arrived, it was all ready for me. On the pick up side, everything was fast, pleasant, and oh-so easy.

Sat down in store to eat a piece or two and was pretty bummed to find that the chicken was not that fresh, plus there were chicken organs inside of the thigh pieces. I know maybe the freshness was my fault for walking over too slowly, but the chicken is definitely not suppose to have tiny brain looking pieces inside of it. Tweeted it to Popeyes and they told me that it wasn't normal and to reach out to customer service, but they never responded to me after that attempt. 

I'm usually a fried chicken lover, but I can't get over the thought of accidentally biting into a soft, lukewarm piece of brainy flesh. Shiver. Even the tenders weren't as good as I remembered.

This Popeye's location is solid. Good chicken (like, delicious. if you haven't had their sandwich, where have you been??), quick and courteous employees, relatively clean inside. It's nothing fancy... I mean, it's a Popeye's. Never had a problem here!
Blackened chicken was phenomenal! Great flavor and very tender! Yum! Will def come back here
I order the food by Uber eats,food are still warm and delicious when they arrived. The only problem is Cajun fries and chicken are a bit salty. Good dinner experience.
They forgot the biscuits I ordered so I essentially overpaid for a box of chicken. Awful place to eat.

I was just there bought 4pcs chicken for $7.55 she just gave me 4 tiny wings 
The popeye at Girard is away better

I went to this spot to get a two piece chicken. Have been going here for a few years. Chicken was always good. Chicken was boxed by manager Got home chicken was old and dark and extremely small. Called back manager had left employee informed come back next day would replace. Went in and spoke to manager who became extremely rude, indignant and insensitive to what had happened and we are talking two piece. It was horrific and terrible  it was unbelievable. I asked for my money back. Do not go to this Popeyes. You do not know what you will get and in this case the customer was not right and from his attitude never will be. Disgrace for a manager. 
327 Spring Garden Street. Please remember this address.
Just ordered an 8 piece and got 5 wings in the box.  Also the 2 girls behind the counter severely lack communication skills.

Good Colombian! I've tried vamos a couple of times at Crooked Thumb. I've had the arepas and the plantains with hogao. The arepas are authentic (I'm Colombian) but a bit pricey. However that is pretty typical of any food truck. The steak arepa  was my favorite.
I had their Blackened Chicken Arepa.  So good.  It had chipotle mayo and mozzarella cheese.  Their yucca fries we're yummy too.  Check them out.

Arepas are one of my all-time favorite food that I grew up eating in Venezuela. These guys did not disappoint! The texture of the arepas was divine and there are such a variety of toppings! Their customer service, even in the middle of COVID-19, is fantastic! We will definitely be hunting these guys down to try them again!

We had the pleasure of eating from Vamos food truck when we were recently at The Loop having our favorite brew! We happened to be on a date where they had their mini tacos for $1.00.  They were delicious! So much flavor!! We also ordered the  Yuca fries, also good! I can't wait to go back and order from them again. Update: we ordered the chorizo arepas and fiesta arepas.. oh my...sooooo excellent!!

Ok, I literally just got done stuffing myself so I cant even show you a picture of what the food looked like before but holy cow! IT WAS DELICIOUS!

I ordered the Steak & Fries. My steak was cooked a little over medium (I ordered medium) but the seasoning and flavor was perfect. The chimi sauce was delicious and the fries were tossed in it! I thought I wouldn't enjoy it because the fries would get soggy.. but no.. I was wrong. it was amazing!

I also ordered the Yuca fries. UMM BOMB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I 100% recommend this place and I cant wait till they come to my work place again! Will visit every time!

I tried the Colombian rice bowl. It was rice, shredded beef, piece de gallo, guac and chipotle mayo. There was a lot of rice and little toppings so it was dry. It was over priced coming in at over $9. My friend tried the steak arepa and fries. He said the arepa was good. I had a few of the fries which were good but it's pretty hard to mess those up. The food was ready timely.

Awesome arepas at this Colombian food truck! We spotted them on Charley Belcher's feature on Fox News because he was at In the Loop Brewing. You can find this food truck there on Wednesdays through Sundays. 

Service was friendly and helpful. Food was so good and tasty and flavorful for not a bad price. They give you a beeper and beep you when it's ready.

Meanwhile you are chilling at the outside brewery with an amazing water view enjoying life.

It's a win win! I definitely want more!

They have arepas, Colombian burgers, fried yuca and Colombian empanadas here. They also have Colombian soft drinks Colombiana and Manzana Postobon.

Check them out!!!!!!
Ordered 2 empanadas from this truck. The meat inside each one was cold. I wouldn't trust anything else from this truck.

My wife and I always look forward to "Third Thursday" food trucks at the Grand Central. This week we took a look at each truck  but honed in on Vamos! Gourmet Food Truck. 

Did we regret our decision? *Drum Roll* Heck No! 

My wife got the loaded fries, which she loved. I got the Steak and Fries. My meal was topped with a delicious chimichurri sauce. 

I used to frequent a place back in Baltimore called "The Local Fry" they had all sorts of delicious loaded fries, 5 stars every time. I think Vamos! could give them a run for their money! The fries are perfect, slight crunch on the outside, nice and soft on the inside.

What really got me was the steak. I was expecting lackluster steak since it was a food truck. But man was I wrong! The steak was cooked to perfection, slight char on the exterior giving it a great flavor, and nice and juicy inside. 

8.6/10 - Found my new loaded fry place in Tampa!

Awful Awful Arepas. Did not taste authentic, too much salt, inedible.....after 2 bites I had to throw it away after waiting almost 30 minutes to get it in the first place. It was also extremely over priced at $6 per tiny Arepa 
If this were a restaurant and not a food truck that people try at events and never go back to I would be very surprised if it stayed open.

I ignored Vamos Food Truck every time I stopped by In the Loop because if there is one thing I thought I knew about arepas, they aren't vegan. Turns out, I was wrong.

Vamos has a couple of vegan items on their menu. They have loaded fries that can be made vegan, a vegan arepa and yucca fries.

I ordered an arepa and the fried yucca. The arepa comes topped with ratatouille vegetables (eggplant,  squash, zucchini and tomato), pico de gallo, guacamole and chimichurri sauce. All of this is loaded onto a handmade, white corn, arepa. The filling was incredible. Five star worthy in my mind. I found the arepa to be a bit too salty. Tone down the salt a bit, and Vamos becomes a five star joint.

The fried yucca was on point. Expertly fried, not too greasy. It was crisp on the outside and soft and melty inside. I loved dipping them in the chimichurri.

Vamos is almost a perfect food truck. Next time I visit In the Loop I will definitely be ordering from them.
Service was fast, food even better. I got the tostones with chicken and everything was seasoned perfectly. Will get again when it rolls back around!

Highly recommend! The owner is wonderful and gave us a few sample beverages, no cost, to try. Food is fantastic and served quickly. Definitely check this place out if you're looking for breakfast or lunch in Broad Ripple.
They had a very welcoming environment from the beginning. Very diverse selection of food. Great taste! Definitely recommend to try it out!

So good I went back twice in one week! I ordered a very simple Denver omelet with potatoes and toast, but everything was so fresh and delicious that I had to double back in the same week! On my first visit, margaritas were $5 in honor of Cinco de Mayo, I ordered the passion fruit and it was delicious! The Horchata is amazing on it's own, but even better as creamer in your coffee or tea!

Were going out for a late breakfast and decided to check out Dad's Kitchen in Broad Ripple and were very glad we did. The food was freshly made and delicious and the restaurant was so clean and fresh looking. The owner (formerly from NYC) waited on us and we were able to have conversations about their future visions for DK. She was lovely and she and her husband opened in December 2020...tough time to start a restaurant but I feel the high quality of this place will rule. We highly recommend trying out this restaurant and supporting them!!

Wow.  We ordered for delivery through Door Dash for lunch at the office.  Had to submit another order with a note to combine the orders.  They got it and made it happen!

Now the food-  Awesome!  Always iffy how the food will be with take out/ delivery because I like my food fresh and hot.  Let's just say even the shrimp was on point and cooked perfectly.  

All four of us enjoyed our food. No complaints and all agreed to do a repeat. 

Will definitely order again!

Great experience and service on our first visit today. My family had the beef quesadilla, tacos, and Mexican Caesar salad. All super fresh and tasty! I got an iced coffee which is a go-to for me and it was strong and delicious! We will be back.
Amazingly delicious western omelette.  Pretty presentation.  Clean surroundings. Attentive service.  Such a gem.

Been wanting to try Dad's Kitchen for some time now and was finally able to go! Wish I didn't wait to go for so long.  It was amazing.  Although the place was short-staffed, the food made up for it.  You could tell they actually made the food with immense effort and love.  So good I'm going back tomorrow.
I really enjoyed the food very tasty! Prices are very reasonable and I will be a regular return customer. Dad's Kitchen is  the best that I've had in a long time. Keep up the great work.

I loooooove this place. They literally have everything; breakfast, mexican food, pasta/etc. I get their brisket tacos and WHEW they are to die for. My boyfriend & mom have always gone the breakfast route and their food is always good too. Everyone who works there is so so so nice. Service is always fast, food comes out HOT, and it's in the perfect spot in Broad Ripple. I can't recommend them enough!

Delicious! A great selection of foods, coffees, drinks and desserts. I was very happy with my tacos and mimosas, and my boyfriend loved his burger. I wish I was hungry enough to try one of each of the baked goods on display - they all looked so good!

What an amazing place! We had a late brunch, and everything was superb. From the Peruvian coffee to the French toast to the desserts. Our server Mikayla was on top of everything and very sweet. We will be back for dinner (as she suggested)!

I tried Dad's Kitchen while in Broadripple stopping to pick something up at Artifacts just across the street. I really didn't know what to order and I was a little overwhelmed with the large selection since everything sounded good! I ended up with a modified Pollo Saltado (described on the menu as ; chicken stir fry Peruvian style, served over French fries & side of rice - mine did not have fries but was mixed in with rice). It was delicious and ample for 2 people. I brought it home to eat and despite the 20 minute drive it was still nice and hot when I got home. I stopped in about 4:30 and received my take out order in about 10 minutes. Parking is a bit tricky but that's typical for Broadripple. I am very much looking forward to going back and trying other things on the menu! Very friendly service!

Dads kitchen has it all: breakfast foods, Mexican foods, Peruvian food, Italian foods, sandwiches, coffee, and sweet baked goods.  So far I've had the chicken tinga tacos, house burger, and lomo saltado which were all great.  Everyone who works here is very friendly also.  Cute spot for eating in or works well for take out.  Happy to support a family owned local business!
Best roast beef sandwich I've ever had...absolutely delicious. The sweet potato fries were incredible.

Had a delicious takeout meal from dad's kitchen last night. We got the lomo saltado, which was pretty good, and the arroz chaufa with chicken, which was delicious! Both meals were at least 2-3 servings, so we have leftovers for lunch today. My husband also loved his shrimp tacos. The mango smoothie was fantastic. Hugo also gave us a free cucumber drink for stopping in. Excited to order from them again soon!
I had lunch there and had the shrimp tacos and the mango black tea. Both were excellent and I recommend both.

I met a friend for lunch & neither of us will come back again.  My 3 cheese quesadilla was ruined by slimy over-cooked green peppers in the filling; and $13 for 3 wedges of quesadilla and ZERO sides.  I was just drinking water and the server never refilled the tiny water glass until my friend asked twice.  Her tacos came with 6 street shells but only enough filling for 4 and, again ZERO sides.  We both had cake - huge mistake not asking the price - one normal-sized slice of tres leches cake was $9.75.  We lingered chatting (2 hours total), but the place was empty so we weren't holding up a table.  As we left our server said something rude to us like "You're welcome for us letting you stay so long"  Wow - you got $60 off the two of us & you begrudge us a table for 2 hours?

So it's a Sunny day in Ripple and I'm up for some local cuisine and Dad's is new and calling my name and is definitely a locally-owned establishment..

The choices are many from breakfast to lunch and believe they close early evening... 

Plz check out the menu it's diverse and too long to go into detail, you will thank me later..

I wanted to try the Lomo but it was lunch and I didn't want to fill all my belly space so the server Mikayla suggested the beef tacos and I had read the shrimp  were divine so here we go...

Beef was stewed and flavorful it came with au jus for dipping...with no extra charge Birria!   The tacos were double shelled and good they had a light guac topping...  The green and red topping salsas were good not the best but serviceable...

The shrimp taco too was loaded with flavor.  The Chipotle crema was a nice compliment and fresh limes for a squeeze......

I will be back to try more items as I heard surrounding guests talking and it was all good...

Atmosphere was light and breezy
Service by a very personable knowledgeable young lady named Mikayla, Was efficient..
Food, coming back should say enough and the three tacos sufficed...

Eat Local, Shop Local, Live Local


JC

Nice atmosphere. I went during a quiet morning, staff was very attentive and welcoming. Breakfast was standard decently priced. French toast was very flavorful which was surprising. Latte was with oat milk and was freshly brewed! Eggs weren't the best and I requested cheese with scramble eggs, what I got was eggs wrapped around a hunk of cheese. Overall it was okay. Will have to try the baked goods one day.

Fight me but I think Broad Ripple needs more breakfast options that serve alcohol and aren't boujee. 
This place fits in perfect for that exact reason and there is a huge window to people watch while you sip your mimosa at a very reasonable price. 

The staff was attentive and let us know of new menu options that hadn't been updated on their menu yet. New items include chilaquiles that I was so close to ordering. 

When it comes to breakfast I am as basic as they come. I'm happy with eggs, a meat, toast & hash browns/home fries every time. Which leads me into the breakfast sandwich. Eggs with bacon & american cheese on chibatta. That chibatta was FRESH and delicious. Choose it. 

We also had the mimosas- good but a tad heavy on the OJ for me...but I also would be happy with a out 2 drops of OJ. Pancakes with eggs & bacon. Pancakes were great! 

As we were about to grab the check our server let us know they had chocolate croissants fresh out of the oven so obviously we had to try that as well! It was amazing. I'm a rene's girl for savory croissants but this was something I will be back for!

Also a ton of taco options, sandwiches and it looked like some peruvian food, if I'm not mistaken. They are open until 8pm so something for all the meals- not just breakfast!

I stopped in to grab some breakfast to-go while I was in the area. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant was clean. They have a large case with a variety of bakery items, all of which looked really tasty. If you're into that, this is definitely a spot worth checking out! 

I got the french toast meal. It was perfect. The recipe has a nice touch of what I believe is lemon and not too much powdered sugar, which I
appreciated and will return for.  My eggs and sausage were also great. The wait time for the food was appropriate. It's nice to see a new local spot in Broad Ripple. I'll be coming back to check out the other items on their menu! I would definitely recommend Dad's Kitchen to someone who is curious about it.

Second time ordering from Dad's, and this time they got it perfectly right. (First order was accidentally switched with another carry out order). I had the house burger with fries, and by husband had the Lomo Saltado. We called to order and it was ready in 10 minutes. Upon arrival I had to drool over the amazing case of sweets- I was able to control myself and not order one of everything, but it's a good thing Valentine's day is right around the corner! 
My burger was excellent with the sliced avocados, pico, and cheese. The Lomo Saltado was also good and smelled amazing. Looking forward to trying more options and sweets.

OMG. Food is amazing. Didn't known this was here till a Yelp search for breakfast pulled them up. Service is a bit slow , but everything is made to order and fresh. Pancakes were awesome. I did not expect the citrus flavor. I don't know if they use orange juice in their batter or what, but it works. The french toast had cinnamon and vanilla they were also awesome. We will be back to try lunch dinner items. The food we saw coming out of the kitchen all looked good. Chicken Salad. Waffle Frys , hamburgers , tacos.  May be our new go to for breakfast.
This place is fantastic! The shrimp tacos and lomo saldado are definitely worth stopping in for, as well as their sandwiches and sesame bagels. Cute environment, great food and worth every penny.

Delicious!!! Great service, customizable menu, HUGE portions, huge selection with something for everyone. I had one of the Peruvian lunches and it was delicious. Love the decor and casual vibe. Go support this local business! Can't wait to come back and try something else! Thanks again!!

Word of mouth said to give this spot a try, so a breakfast with a friend was the perfect time. I ordered the French toast, eggs and bacon - extra crispy, please. The French toast was delicious - the batter wasn't soggy. Just note- the sodas come in bottles. Totally fine, but if you're a fountain soda drinker just be prepared. The server was great and friendly!

my parents and i go here almost every weekend. it's always amazing and the staff is super friendly! i highly recommend the shrimp tacos or pancakes. the chai lattes are also to die for! cannot wait to swing by again soon

This was my first visit to Dad's but it won't be my last. The food is amazing and there are so many options! Something for everyone! Love the location in the heart of Broad Ripple. 
Now to the even greater part... the service is incredible. They are fun and offer good suggestions. I had a hot chocolate and the owner wanted me to also try it the way he makes it so when I finished mine he brought me a sample of a hot chocolate made with oat milk. 
The whole experience was great and I look forward to coming back to try my next menu item. Also a great location to take a walk on the monon after so don't miss that opportunity!
The food here is amazing, the ambiance is nice, the music was great and the owners are very kind people. Everything is fresh, would recommend 10/10. Will be coming back soon

The food was fresh and the restaurant is clean. Everything was made to order and hot. The severs were very pleasant.  The bacon was crispy and not burnt.  The French toast was delicious. The coffee fresh and hot.  Would recommend for a tasty breakfast!   Can't wait to go back and try other menu items.

Really enjoyed having brunch here with a friend and daughter. I had the chicken, spinach and Swiss omelette with potatoes. The potatoes were so good you didn't even need ketchup. The portions were perfect and I didn't leave here overly stuffed. My daughter got the pancakes and my friend got the lox with cream check and a bagel. Everything was delicious. The wine selection wasn't great and only had one white wine which was ok. 

There is not tons of seating and no outdoor seating is available, but we got in quickly with the last table open. Service was pretty good but we did have to follow up and ask for item a couple times. (Refill on water, condiments and reminder to bring the wine we ordered). 

This will not be my last time visiting here and I see us coming back probably next weekend.

When I first heard of Dad's Kitchen, I was genuinely curious about what sort of cuisine it would provide. It's nondescript name offered all sorts of possibilities and come to find out, it's perfect for the restaurant. 

Dad's Kitchen offers a variety of flavors, dishes, and types of meals. Peruvian in its roots, DK's main speciality appears to be traditional American breakfast. This is highlighted by the quantity of items on the menu and the bulk of its social media posts pertaining to the first meal of the day. However as I mentioned above, there's more than what meets the eye. The menu also has sandwiches, burgers, Mexican tacos, quesadillas, and Peruvian dishes. Picking up dinner there also presented me with an array of yummy looking dessert goods as well. 

My experience with Dad's was a good one. I enjoyed talking to the owner while paying. The site is tastefully decorated and very clean. Most importantly, the food was tasty too. My wife and I had the fish tacos and the lomo saltado. The former of which was great! The latter was good, but not mind blowing. True to its name the saltado was a little salty but flavorful nonetheless. I think in the future, I would swap out the fries for something else, for I'm not sure how it complements the rice and meat. 

Overall, Dad's Kitchen is a great addition to the Broad Ripple neighborhood because it fits the mold of being family owned & offering unique specialities. It may be trying to put its eggs in one too many baskets, but it's new, it's the pandemic, and I think restaurant owners right now are doing what it takes to draw in as many customers as possible. I know personally I'll continue supporting this restaurant, and I look forward to witnessing how it it'll grow and evolve in the future.

We usually go to Garden Table and see this place. We decided to give it a try. It was good but we honestly probably won't be back. The pricing is really weird on some items. For example adding chocolate chips to pancakes is an up charge of $2.75. A burrito is $2 more than Garden Table. A slice of Cake is $8.25. I don't think we're paying for quality of ingredients or labor, I think the weird pricing is based on location.

THIS PLACE IS A HIDDEN GEM!  Authentic Peruvian cuisine, Juicy Burgers, All-Day Breakfast, the masses of Desserts, the Aesthetic....incredible!

I left a Google review of Dad's Kitchen 6 months ago, and since then then it's received over 12,000 views-  People love this family-run business and they love serving the Broadripple community!

Went again today and wanted to leave a Yelp review to help them advertise even more!

And I love the Lomo!
-Benjamin

Agua Bistro is the best restaurant in the area hands down. Better than any restaurant on the Main Line or Philly. Their mussel appetizer is phenomenal, every dinner I have ordered has been exceptional and the desserts are all homemade. Agua is a BYOB so bring a nice bottle of wine and enjoy! Maria makes you feel like you are at home dining with family. You will love it!

So I waited till after my third visit to write a review. Probably for selfish reasons because this is my new favorite place. The food is absolutely delicious. Some of our favorites are the calamari, the beet salad, homemade lobster ravioli, and absolutely incredible homemade soups and desserts!  The whole staff is so accommodating. Maria treats you like family the minute you walk in the door. Her husband is the chef and it is so nice to get a chance to meet him at the end of the evening when he checks to make sure you enjoyed your meal.  The wait staff is phenomenal.  There is really nothing I don't love. The restaurant is warm Cozy and romantic. Can't wait to go back soon.

I love this place! The food is delicious, expertly prepared. We needed a restaurant like this in our area. BYOB which makes it more affordable to dine! The owners and staff are just so lovely! A must try. They have indoor and outdoor dining.

We live right down the street and this is the first time we've tried this place. We came here for my husband's birthday and had one of the best meals ever! The staff was very welcoming and ALL the food was absolutely amazing! We had the calamari, Caesar salad, beet salad, short rib dinner, salmon dinner, crème brûlée, tres leches, churros and macaroons: There wasn't one thing we eat that we disliked. Will definitely be back and hope you support this local business!
The food is prepared and served amazing! I love this place and the cute atmosphere. The outside dining  takes you away from being in town. It's a sweet treat. You have to try it!!

I've had the pleasure of dining here many times. Food and service are consistent and top notch! Atmosphere is nice and the entire staff is pleasant! All of that plus it's byob...make a reservation...you won't be disappointed!

Absolutely amazing. The beet salad was so fresh and delicious. We had the falafel burger and N.Y. strip steak. Exceptionally prepared and also delicious. The owner Maria and her son were very attentive and there was a lot of attention to detail. A dinner experience at it's best and a great new addition to Lower Providence. Will be back for dinner again very soon.

I saw that a new restaurant opened, when I called I was overwhelmed by the hospitality of the phone call that I made a reservation for that evening. We just left and I can't begin to tell you how we thoroughly enjoyed EVERYTHING!! We have already decided that this is our new favorite locally owned restaurant!!

AMAZING steak. Incredibly juicy and cooked perfectly. It came with crispy potatoe wedges on the side topped with their home made chipotle sauce that tasted amazing. 

We ended our night with the flourless chocolate cake and let me tell you it was delicious. 

The owners are so friendly and interesting to talk to and you can really tell that they take pride in their food. 

10/10 would come here again.

It was awesome!!! Caeser salad to start was great. Home made dressing was on point and not over dressed. Perfect amount. Pork chop was cooked perfectly and had me licking the plate. Everything was hitting!!!! Give em a shot I'm a tough grader and they knocked it out

This delightful restaurant has the sophistication of the big city
They managed to take a small porch , give it a romantic feel and present beautiful food.  And it BYO
What more can you need,  Make a reservation and btw the service is excellent
Keep this gem in business with your support, you will not regret it

My husband and I finally got to try out Agua Bistro!! 
Usually when we have called they have been packed but tonight was a chilly Tuesday.  They are BYOB so good to know for next time.
We were helped by Maria who was fabulously attentive and ensured everything went perfect from start to finish.  Oh and Finish, you must - The crème brûlée dessert was to die for! 
I got the Pork Chop which was amazing and Pablo got the Steak.. both great. I started out with the beet salad which was great. 
The ambiance is homey and is a great "date night" place.  

Looks like they are also planning something for Thanksgiving, we may have to check it out if they have room!

Amazing food and great service. The shrimp appetizer was seasoned and cooked perfectly! We also order the signature burger and cavateli pasta, and they were both well cooked and very flavorful. We are excited to go back!

Amazing food, staff accommodating definitely a gem
Loved the salads and the tuna was the best I have ever had and do I mention the cheese bread

Great food and experience. I came here on a Friday night with my family with a reservation and dined indoors (windows were open). Our servers were friendly, receptive, and masked the whole time. The floor manager (or hostess?) checked up on us multiple times throughout the meal and lightened the dining room atmosphere with margaritas and conversation while dimming the lights for ambiance.

I wasn't hungry when I sat down, but when I took a bite of my salmon, roasted veggies and pearl pasta, I couldn't stop myself from finishing the plate. The portions were a good size and the flavoring was perfect. Not too salty. I would definitely come back again and would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a nice dinner out in the area!

Just finished an awesome dinner at Agua Bistro.  We started with the Arugula and goat cheese and Beet salads and both were fresh and delicious. For our entrees my wife had the Halibut and I had the veal Osso Buco.  Both were fabulous! We barely had room for dessert but I had to try the caramel cheese cake and my wife had the cannoli.  Loved them both!  Service was very good and we had a nice chat with a senior at Methacton HS who was working at the restaurant - she sang opera for some of of the patrons and she was fabulous!  Highly recommend you give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.

Exceptional service and delicious food. Everyone commented on how good the food was. This place is also BYOB so you can save money on the alcohol By bringing your own. I ordered short ribs that fell apart and melted in your mouth. Charcuterie boards were the special appetizer. Very good. We had a private room for our group who was there for my friends 40th. I would highly recommend this place for a small group event and or dinner with a loved one. Reasonable prices for how much food they give you and very good.

We have dinner here Saturday night. Superb service, especially in light of the American staff shortage thing. Friendly, multiple servers, welcoming and charming owner-hostess. Experience tells. 

We missed getting the covered and decorated wrap porch, a lovely outdoor space. Cosy inside, not too loud. Great in winter I imagine. Decorated Med coast style. 

Is there better and more ambitious food in north Montgomery County ? LMK - I haven't found it. Lots of what I call evolved Bar Food, several are excellent at that. Hotel food maybe. In any case, the Med French output at Agua is 
special and welcomed for an occaision. Hats off the the chef and the front of the house. 

My wife's and our son's roommate porkchops were first rate. She said best ever. Our son devoured his rack of lamb rather too quickly! I had the venison just to get outside my usual lamb or veg zone. Delicious. I say try to get the specials. 

Oh, we had mini calamari on lettuce to share. Quite fine. Seems like better 
ingredients than usual. The meat and cheese board was average IMO. 

PLUS PLUS PLUS BYOB. You pay a couple bucks more for that; well worth it.

All good and most highly recommended. We'll be back when the young man completes his first semester! 

.

Last night we finally made it to Aqua Bistro. It is literally 3 minutes from our house and we had no idea it was there until our daughter recommended. It was an over the top experience and our new favorite spot. Every single morsel of food was delicious from the warm rolls to the warm flourless chocolate cake. We had the fried calamari, roasted tomato soup, Caesar salad, Lamb Bolognese and Moroccan chicken and shared everything! The complementary glass of champagne was a very nice touch. The atmosphere, decor, attentive staff could not have been better. Oh, and BYOB put it over the top. My only hesitation writing this review is not being able to get a reservation in the future but they totally deserve the props. it was obvious that many customers are regulars. Can't wait to go back.

Although we have passed this place many times since it opened, we didn't truly notice it until we saw some growing reviews on the neighborhood group.  We made an appointment for Friday evening and glad that we did, pretty much all the outside seating is occupied or reserved.  

Anyway, the outside seating area is clean and comfortable.  The hostess and servers are busy but came by several times during the meal to check on things and replacing plates/silverware.  They also brought us some bread, mango puree and a freshly made strawberry drink for our daughter while our order is being prepared.

For appetizers, we had the fried calamari which is well seasoned and crispy; the beets salad which is refreshingly sweet.  For main dishes, we ordered linguini with clam, Mediterranean roasted chicken and fresh pappardelle lamb Bolognese.  The linguini and Bolognese pretty good.  The chicken is a little dry.  We finished with a coconut crème brûlée for desert.

Overall, it's a pretty nice BYOB restaurant with decent food and very good service.  I am glad it came to our neighborhood.

Update: We returned to Agua Bistro last night, and I was excited to see how they updated the outdoor dining to help with the chilly weather! There were heaters next to tables, and there was a clear plastic around the railing of the porch to help block the wind. It made it a very comfortable dining experience! 
The food was excellent once again, and I loved their oyster special with the vinegar dressing! I wish I remembered the name of the peanut butter dessert because it was delicious, and I highly recommend it! It was a chocolate mousse with a peanut butter fudge crust on the bottom. 
Overall, another great experience at Agua Bistro!

I have been to some excellent restaurants in the past such as Per Se, The Gotham Bar and Grill, Jean Georges, Vetri, Laurel, and Le Bernardino to name a few. I was recommended Agua Bistro by a friend and was impressed. The meal was excellent. My filet was one of the best pieces of beef I have ever had. It was prepared the way I ordered it cooked. The escargot was a tasty appetizer as well. My Wife had eggplant parmigiana and she throughly enjoyed it. The vegetables that were served with the filet were tasty and crisp. The mashed potatoes were excellent as well.

Two minor complaints I had was that the room was not comfortable. (No shades on the window and sun was shining on us while we ate.) and the waiter was inexperienced but he was trying his best.  We were offered a better table in another room by the hostess when we arrived,  but we opted for the warmer room. By the way, it was 97 degrees outside when we arrived.  We will return soon for sure and this will be on our list as a keeper.

When it's all said and done it's really all about the food, right? Hence the five stars. To need to try the new restaurant. It's also BYOB.

I hate to write this review. This is northern italian, more than mediteranean. Homemade pastas. Not just some. All. OMG! We have all gone to the mom and pop pasta places. They are meh on a good night. Huge portions, no substance. This is the oposite. Perfect portion sizes. You will look forward to every bite. Even desserts are homemade. 
Table of six did not leave a mosel behind. 
Great fresh fish too! Every dish is amazing. BYO!
Dinner took just under two hours which is near perfect pacing. Waiter was there when we needed him and not when we didn't. This place is way way better than anything in Philly.

Very cute BYOB - absolutely different than anywhere around here. The food was fantastic and when we did get service it was very friendly. We were out on the wraparound porch which is so cozy and makes you forget where you are. 

The service was a bit slow, it seems like they don't have a lot of staff but our server spent a lot of time with the other tables and didn't really check on us. 

The chef sent out complimentary bites which we loved. The calamari was good. My husband got lamb which he loved and I got a shrimp pasta which I wished I hadn't gone the pasta route but it was good. Creme brûlée for dessert which you can't really go wrong.

Agua is INCREDIBLE. We went for a family dinner and got mussels, burrata salad, salmon, striped bass, and venison. Everything was delicious-- The venison was cooked to perfection and was the best I have ever had. On top of the food being top notch, the service was also great. Would highly recommend and will definitely be back!

Agua Bistro was our first restaurant to try once the restaurant restrictions were lifted. And, I'm glad it was. The menu is simple but offers all diners something delicious. The outside dining was exactly what we needed especially after quarantine. I recommend the double bacon cheeseburger and the mushroom pasta, as shown below. The double bacon cheeseburger was prepared with fresh ingredients and was cooked nicely with a crispy side of French fries. The mushroom pasta was cooked "al dente" with fresh mushrooms in a light sauce. I can't wait till I visit Agua Bistro again!

The first time I ordered from them it was great had got the boneless chicken bites (my favorite)...the second time I got the quinoa chicken bowl it was ok the chicken didn't have any seasoning on it the quinoa turned out to be rice, didn't feel like waiting for a new order so I chalked it up, the 3rd time I ordered the boneless chicken special for my order and it was regular wings, called them to correct it bout a hour later nobody came so I went to the store, the driver is just sitting there so I knew they had no intentions of redelivering my order and today (3/26/19  was the most annoyed I've been with them, yet again ordered the boneless special the driver gets here with only the bites no fries or soda, I called to correct the girl tells me I'm wrong and that she packed the bag and it's there after being put on hold I was told I'd have to come get the rest of my order so I asked for a refund of my delivery fee was told no because my food was all ready delivered.. that pissed me off if I'm coming to get the rest of my food how is my ordered complete? When I get to the store every one seems to be confused about what order I'm talkin about

The fries are okay, basic potato product. We liked the actual burgers that came from the place and our kid liked the hot dog but the wrap was sub-par. So soggy it was dripping and there was no reason. Will steer clear of the wraps next time.

So I attempted to try rocket burger last night for the first time even after seeing some sketchy reviews because I am not one to assume right away that a place is bad over one or two reviews but I was wrong this time. first off I ordered 45 mintues before they stopped taking grub hub orders, and an hour before closing my order was cancelled! so I called to ask why? The answer that the grill was off is unacceptable the person on the phone was unable to speak properly and had a very annoyed tone like I was wrong for even asking. Considering this place is new I would hope this wont happen again and will update my review if it changes but so far nope.

Just tried to order food from here 15 minutes ago and was told that they are closed that they change their hours so I told them that their menu says they're open till 11 he said they need to get new menus I told him he lost a customer and probably a buch more and he hung up on me they're rude they're ignorant and they're food is not worth the money they charge.
The menu was intriguing and has a lot of items in it that sounds great but the food tasted basic. Has a lot of potential to be a great burger place.

They are new in the city and they are my new fav place in Philly . 
This place is really clean and the food is really nice.  You have to try everything on their menu!. Their ingredients are fresh! Its a fastfood place but actually fresh, crispy and delicious. Highly recommended!!

The worst place ever. Ordered honey bbq boneless wings, got chicken cutlets with a gross sauce. Did not even taste like bbq. Ordered bone-in wings as well. Very soggy. They sent a "free" piece of cheesecake, and fries. probably to try to make up for the gross shit they sent out. Also came with a rocket burger magnet-they need to save the money on the mags, and focus more on the quality of food.

So this place has a awesome sign. That is the only thing good I can say. If burger is in your name, you should have good burgers. Frozen patties in the perfect flat circle, menus on walls the Moe's money then the real menu. I had one with blue cheese crumbles that where fully blue. Had one bite.  There "steak fries" where frozen reg size fries. This best thing was the free cheese cake because someone else made it!!

I live down the street and it was my first time eating there.  The place was dead, the cashier was very pleasant and accommodating.  The burger was fantastic, thick, juicy and was a traditional bacon cheese burger.  I think the bacon was beef, but that's okay.  The cost was reasonable.  The timeliness was a little long for me being the only patron.

If I could I would not even give one star. This place is absolutely horrible. First of all I ordered boneless wings that look like big huge chunks of fatty meat!! I then paid extra for Cajun fries and received regular fries and the box usually is filled to the top when I order french fries from any other takeout place this place gave me about 10 fries in the box. I was charged $35 for two every day specials and a salad that was all basically slop!!! When I called to speak to them about all of this I was hung up on twice!!!The girl who had taken my order lied and said that it was not her mistake and that she could not find my receipt...Well I have my receipt and I am going in there today with the on eating food and demanding a refund!! THIS PLACE IS DEFINITELY A NO GO!!! Don't Do It!!!

Good cheeseburger exactly how I ordered it. Restaurant is good for takeout but you may be battling lots of flies and restroom out of service if you dine in. I tried to pay in cash but they didn't have exact cash so bring a debit card.

If I could I would not even give one star. This place is absolutely horrible. First of all I ordered boneless wings that look like big huge chunks of fatty meat!! I then paid extra for Cajun fries and received regular fries and the box usually is filled to the top when I order french fries from any other takeout place this place gave me about 10 fries in the box. I was charged $35 for two every day specials and a salad that was all basically slop!!! When I called to speak to them about all of this I was hung up on twice!!!The girl who had taken my order lied and said that it was not her mistake and that she could not find my receipt...Well I have my receipt and I am going in there today with the uneaten food and demanding a refund!! THIS PLACE IS DEFINITELY A NO GO!!! Don't Do It!!! Save

Halal Burger, Halal Sandwiches , Halal Salad, Halal Boneless Wings, Halal Chicken Tenders . 
All burger, sandwich, salad , $5.99
10 wings $4.99
Home cooking at its best! Fully seasoned food! Great prices! Very friendly staff! Love this place! :)

I don't give 5 stars but to only the most incredible places.  But a 3 star rating is fair for this place. Boudin balls were nicely seasoned large but missed a remoulade sauce or something of that nature to take it over the top. A mistake was made on my wife's order and the server graciously gave us a leg quarter meal along with a corrected special . Leg quarter was a  salty but evened out with the super sweet yams and the earthy greens over rice. The fried fish rocked and the cornbread dressing was enjoyed , the mistake item was okra shrimp and sausage over rice and my wife enjoyed it! All in all it was a good meal . Only suggestion from this Chef is to cool down the restaurant a bit,,, it was ungodly hot in there . ( not sure if the ac  was working properly)
Nice staff!! Friendly owner! delicious wings, prolly some of the best in the parish. will be back for more!

Once upon a pandemic, I discovered a business called "Chef Nat's Kitchen," where Chef Nat was literally slinging meals from his household kitchen. The food was good, so I looked forward to the day that he would open a brick-and-mortar restaurant. Well here it is.

I ordered the Wednesday special, which consisted of mustard greens over rice, cornbread dressing, and candied yams. It normally comes with baked chicken, but I paid $2 to upgrade to fried fish. The fish was maybe a smidge under salted, but better undersalted than over-salted, and it was otherwise good. The greens were good too, and I especially enjoyed the dressing and yams. My meal was roughly ~$14, which is really fair considering I'll be eating off of it twice. 

The staff was friendly and my food was ready fairly quickly. The restaurant is a bit bare looking inside, but it's casual and still very new. I will definitely be returning.
 
#blackownedbusiness
Wow! Amazing food and service. We got the hand burger and philly cheese steak Poboy and everything was fantastic. If you don't try the Oreo cake, then your missing out

#blackownedbuisness
Yet another place on my quest to get Chalmette locals to POST reviews and support businesses. Food was awesome! Fresh cooked to order and priced perfect! What makes a burger great good juicy beef what makes better dat Nola hot sausage but wait there's more top all of that with SHRIMP  ‼! Prime location with great food hopefully they support this place! Locals don't seem to like trying new places
The food is absolutely amazing !!! Me and son were absolutely pleased with our dinner! We had the sgt. Poletti fries and fish everything was so good! Definitely recommend Dat Kitchen!

So I Brought the 5 piece Ghost pepper Wings and Cheese Fries. The Wings were too hard to say the least and all Legs was lacking that fresh taste. The Cheese Fries We're okay I give it a 3/10 no flavor at all whatsoever & don't get me started on the Special Punch! It's a No for me , tasted like str8 up kool aid , maybe I had tried them on the wrong day. But for $19.00 I was cheated i feel like.

LOVE CAVA and was excited to find out one was opening in Newton Square! This CAVA in particular had a nice indoor and outdoor seating space. Service was quick , and the portions were great (a lot larger than I've gotten at some locations). Definitely recommend for a quick but healthier/fulfilling option
Love the harissa avocado bowl (but I sub in the right rice).  Very tasty and 1 serving is 2 meals for me. The staff is friendly and attentive.

Customer service is AHHH MAZING! This place just opened and I'm already planning a weekly dinner here. Prices are reasonable And the harassa avocado bowl was unforgettable! It's spicy watch out but wow great quality ingredients! Do not pass on Cava!

OUTSTANDING!!! Passed by them omw to taking my daughter to work at Panera on James Redman prkwy in Plant City. I'm always up to try a new food truck. Hawaiian is on the menu. Everything on the menu sounded sooooo good and tastes awesome!!!

Cool little Hawaiian-Taiwanese fusion food truck.

This truck has been on my radar for months, but only recently did they have an event in Tampa. Usually, they are in Plant City or Lakeland. 

The food is an interesting fusion of Hawaiian food and Taiwanese food. I ordered the HEFTY, which is Taiwanese beef with rice on a scallion pancake.
