It was an overstuffed Asian taco, and not very easy to eat. But the flavors were very good. The beef was well seasoned and reminded me of Taiwanese beef soup. It was topped with pickled veggies and some sriracha mayo. I could have done with less rice and more scallions in the pancake, but overall, I was  happy with my order. I also tried the haupia pie, which was awesome. It is a purple sweet potato pie topped with coconut and on a perfectly crispy crust. I found the crust too sweet (although I usually think things are too sweet), but otherwise, it was a great dessert. They also have a bunch of Hawaiian beverages, so my kids got some Aloha canned juices.

Food is made to order, so expect to wait 10-15 minutes. 

I'd give the food a 4.5, but I'm rounding up because they are new. Serving sizes are generous. The owners are very nice and enthusiastic. I look forward to trying more of their food. Their General Tso chicken sandwich and XXL Ramen chicken look fantastic to me, but they also look like they don't travel well, which is a consideration when getting food to go.

Super excited that I was able to try the food at Happy Ending Food Truck. Hawaiian & fusion Asian food is always screaming my name!!!

I ordered the Pew Pew Shrimp - similar to a bang bang shrimp.

The Heft - I love the texture of the scallion pancake and combo with the meat. It has a slight spice kick but not much.

The Hangry Hawaiian - pineapple and roasted pork on this burger in addition to the burger patty. They also put jalapeños which I said no to.

Haupia Pie - sweet potato like dessert with a crust and on top is a solid cream coconut layer. Texture is different. I loved it! 

Coco Loco ice cream - super creamy pina colada ice cream. 

My faves in order were:

1. Coco Loco ice cream
2.  The Heft
3. Haupia pie
4. Pew Pew Shrimp
5. The Hangry Hawaiian burger 

Don't get me wrong! Every thing was excellent!!

The owners were absolutely awesome!! Super welcoming and helpful and considerate of my time. They had tons of orders and were quite busy. I waited about 40 minutes. I would order ahead of time next time. 

Next time and there will be a next time, I want to get their Kilauea nachos, xxl ramen chicken, Haupia pie(which Haupia is a Japanese sweet potato - similar to Ube, a Filipino sweet potato used for desserts), coco loco ice cream(think super creamy pina colada ice cream) & scallion pancakes. 

Yes I loved it that much!!!
Love their secret special chicken sandwiches and BUT chicken wings are so bomb delicious!  Will definitely come back again soon to get more chicken wings!  You all are rocks!
The Heft was amazing. Meat cooked to perfection. Melts in your mouth and the light and flakey tortilla wrap finishes it off !! I will be back

I hired this food truck that I found in the Tampa area and I am sooooo pleased! Happy Ending Food Truck came during a thunderstorm, set up quickly, and then served the most delicious, amazing food! Both my employees and guests were RAVING about every single item that was ordered. The scallion pancakes were incredible, I think I had 4 of them lol! Bangin Shrimp Tacos are fire! Nachos are just ridiculous. I can't say enough about this husband and wife team! HIRE THEM!! Or go find them when they are out and about! You WILL NOT regret it!

Most Creative Food Truck Ever! Yum!!!

I have rarely had a great experience with a food truck... most often it's either meh or just ok (except for Mitch's BBQ which is superb!). Happy Ending Food Truck is AWESOME!!! We tried it at RRRV's 4th of July party and everything we tried was excellent. The truck is super clean; you can see the inside of the kitchen because they keep the door open. Can't say enough about that. To me, that makes it or breaks it! Super duper organized!

We tried most everything in the menu because there were a few of us. I can say everything was beyond good. My favorite? The pancakes and the shrimp... I could eat those over and over! The nachos were over the top! And the pig tacos? Yum! And don't forget their pie... it is soooo good! I hope they keep coming back because I will repeat the order over and over! Great job guys! You Rock!
general tso chicken sandwich was absolutely delicious. great amount of food for your $$. fries were yum!

The name and logo caught my attention, veteran, family owned business drew me in, but the food flavor and service will keep me coming back!

I'm a chronic over orderer and usually end up with a ton of leftovers. This time, however, as I sit here mouth breathing trying to muster another bite, I can't bring myself to packing the food up later. Its just too good!

Hawaiian spring rolls have a perfectly crisp shell, filled with faintly smokey pork. The pork has a familiar taste, with a delicious pacific island flair.

The HEFTT is option you can feel good about eating. The rice, beef, scallion pancake and sauce will leave you satisfied without feeling like you need to avoid food and spend the next week in the gym. 

The wings are awesome! Crisp, tender, juicy, fall off the bone kinda perfect. No extra sauces needed; eat as they are. Mild kick.

The Hangry Hawaiian is the best burger I have had in a really long time! And I am always on the lookout for great burgers. I had beef, topped with pork, bacon, jalepenos and pineapple. Its an amazing combo of balanced, sweet heat. I loved it! (The fries were also really good)

The haupia was a sweet, unexpected addition also. Its a buttery, graham cracker crust, layered with sweetened, purple sweet potato, the another layer of a coconut milk pudding.

Places like this is the reason why I prefer food trucks and mom & pop spots over chains and big names. Happy Ending Food Truck lived up to its name. Good people, great food, big flavors! I will definitely be back for more!

Great fast service only waited 15 minutes. I needed my quick fix for pizza to start my weekend and on my way home came across Dominos. Pretty busy for a small place, I counted over 8 people ahead of me. Staff were fast and friendly. Over heard a customer called back to change an order which was already made and the staff were very accommodating, definitely will come back to their 4 topping special for under $12! Tried first time philly steak pizza and delicious!!!!

This location has always been very speedy (usually less than 25 mins for delivery) 

Pizza is always cooked perfectly 

The bacon garlic fingers are to die for!!!


My fav pizza place by far
Delivered to my house and it looked like this when I opened one of the pizza boxes. It looked like they dropped it and still gave it to us. Order came from Domino's Riverbend Square (Edmonton).
Not sure if it's this location only but they are not accepting gift cards. Super disappointing. I will be taking my business elsewhere from now on.

WE'VE BEEN HOODWINKED Let's make this viral! Okay fam I ordered Dominos with me and some friends and I what happened next will blow your mind. 

After waiting for almost an hour, we were informed that according to the Dominos pizza tracker that our pizza had arrived, HOWEVER THIS WAS NOT THE CASE. In a frantic rush to find out what happened we were informed that the Dominos pizza tracker is a bold faced jape. It is based on average times. Not actual. So you have no idea where your pizza might be!!! This is unacceptable and I will not rest until pizza tracker is fixed.

Ordered (2) Cheese, Extra Cheese + Beef pizzas with an order of crazy bread. I get the order and check it before I leave, one pizza has extra cheese but no beef and the other has only the regular amount of cheese. I take them back in, no apologies from the guy working there but he said he would remake them. Meanwhile my crazy bread is getting cold. He gives me the remade pizzas. I checked them and they're both wrong. One has "a little" bit more cheese than a regular but they're definitely not EXTRA cheese. At this point, the kids are restless and are just ready to eat anything... I tell him I don't have time to wait again and that I am just very dissapointed. As I'm talking, another couple walks in, he stops listening to me completely and says "hi, can I take your order" to them.... unbelievable. This guy couldn't have cared less about any of this!! Wasted my time and money...to save a few bucks over another pizza place?? Bad idea..

I know, 5 stars for a Little Cesars? The crew works hard to get your order right every time, and if it somehow manages to get fudged, they will fix it; they tend to special requests and keep the place cleaner than any of the other pizza joints; the food cooks on a conveyer, the same conveyor every other Little Cesars uses, so the speed is always the same; they don't skimp on ingredients; it's always fresh; and they honor all their cupons without a hassle.  What more can one ask for in a pizza house?  Good job!

I wish I could rate this Little Caesars on their pizzas, but I can't. I have stopped by several times over the last couple of months and have yet to get a pizza. I have ordered a "Hot and Ready Lunch Special" only to be told "We don't serve those after 2:00pm, 3:00pm", "We're out of them now". And today I was told ( at 1:15pm) it would be 10 to 15 min wait. When I asked" I thought you had them Hot n Ready" I was told "Oh, that's weekdays only". 
So, as much as I do enjoy Little Caesars pizzas, it seems I CANNOT ever get one at this location. 
Good luck trying to get the special.

It's not too much that you can say about a chain restaurant that hasn't been said before and the same holds true for Little Caesar's. I caught a taste for inexpensive pizza on a road trip that I had taken back to Louisiana. I stopped to fill up and saw this location and figured, "Sure, why not?" I ordered the three-meat AND WAS COMPLETELY SURPRISED!!! It was the hottest, cheesiest and most meaty pizza that I've had from there in years. Pleasantly surprised and job very well done!!!!

15 minutes to get a pepperoni pizza that's supposed to be "hot and ready". I'm thinking if the three people working there weren't sitting down doing nothing maybe it would indeed have been hot and ready. Also, and I may be wrong, but isn't it a health violation to be sitting and standing on the food like that?

Ordered two pizzas on line. When I went into the store to pick the pizzas up the place was packed. I stood waiting for someone to come to the front register and take the orders of the new arrivals like me. When no one came to the front after several minutes of waiting, I asked the others standing around if they had all been waited on yet. The second guy in line said he had been waiting for 20 minutes and no one had come to the front to take his order. 
I then observed that there were 3 employees making pizzas so I asked one of them if anyone was working the counter. A young man gave me a dirty look and walked to the front (his name was Tyler and he claimed to be the manager). He asked who needed to place an order. The woman at the front of the line spoke up and Tyler said "she already waited on you". The woman said the other girl looked at her on line order but never said if it was ready or when it would be ready and that she had been there long enough for them to cook it by now. Tyler told her "It doesn't matter" and moved on to the next person. I told Tyler that was no way to treat someone. They lady then addressed Tyler and said "I wasn't being ugly I just want some information is all" Tyler look at me and said I don't care. 
I told Tyler that if you don't care then just cancel my order. I don't want someone making my food that don't care. Tyler said fine I'll be with you in a little while. I then left the store to cool off cause I was pretty pissed by now. 
When I re-entered the store I asked Tyler if my order was ready and he said yes. I said I would just take the order instead of my money because my kids were hungry and I didn't feel like waiting somewhere else. Tyler said "No. You wanted a refund so your getting a refund". He then gave me a receipt and I left the store.
I posted a complaint to Little Caesar's corporate web site but have heard nothing back. Tyler refuses to tell me how I can contact the franchise owner or the General Manager. 
I will never be back to Little Caesar's. I will buy frozen pizzas from Walmart and eat them cold before Little Caesar's ever gets another dime of my time or money.
Never had an issue, pizza and breadsticks have always tasted fine to me.  Sometimes during peak hours they run out of pizza quick, but never had to wait more than 4-5min.

This little roadside joint serves up delicious jerk and curry chicken, plus goat if you're feeling it. Sides like balck beans and rice and plantains are super sioid, too. Great for take out and very reasonably priced at about $12 a platter.

What a nice addition to the Mount Airy dining scene.  Located in a colorful little hut behind Milo's and sharing their atmospheric beer garden with them, Germantown Jerk Hut is a perfect summer and Covid-19 dining out treat.  They serve Jamaican platters that are filling and tasty.  I ordered the Jerk Chicken platter with rice and cabbage.  It was enough for two people.  The Jerk Chicken def had flavor and when I got home I added some heat for an excellent meal.  The rice and cabbage were just of the standard variety.  Some plantains would have been preferred. Service was friendly and I have no doubt I'll be heading back to the hut for another Jamaican feast...maybe next time eating and drinking in the beer garden!

This food have no jerk taste to it at all.  The chicken was tough, the rice was over cooked (wet) and the cabbage taste like a stick of butter. I refused to recommend this place. I'm re-heating the chicken in my oven trying to fix this disgusting meal.  Hot sauce did not save this meal!

My husband and I purchased 3 Jerk Chicken Plater (2 w/extra cabbage and 1 w/ Mac and cheese) yesterday (Saturday Evening) behind the former North By Northwest restaurant. I must say we were highly disappointed. The red beans and rice was watery. The cabbage was soggy with peas mixed in. The chicken needed more time in the oven. Everything tasted like melted butter. This was the worst meal ever! Those platters went in the trash. It was truly a waste of time and money. You may ride pass like I did and smell some good seasoned food cooking...KEEP DRIVING its not worth it. Your stomach will thank you.

I passed by this little place and the smell smacked me clear in my jaw. I ordered the jerk chicken, beef patty and chicken patty. All of it was so good; down to the Mac and cheese and cabbage. It's def better than Jamaican D's and Ron's. Will def come back and try the other options.

I live in the neighborhood & ALWAYS support local businesses... I understand COVID-19 has taken a toll etc however, COVID-19 has nothing to do with poor customer service. Without going into a list of other things I'll just say I gave it 2 try's and was disappointed ... very small portions as well. I truly hope they improve, it's a great location and setup.

I'm jumping right in... Best thing on the menu is the Jerk Chicken!  The Curry Goat is ok..needs more seasoning!
The sides need help-Period!

We all have watch every food rescue type of show where the expert states 'focus on what you are good at and get rid of the rest'!  The Mac and cheese (shells..is a joke-not cheesy at all..straight out of a box ; the rice and beans need seasoning; the cabbage was the best..keeper)!

Friendly staff and good portions for the price..if I could give 3.5 stars I would for the things just mentioned!

Not sure I would try again when there are so many other good food options in the area!

This restaurant should NOT have Russ's salad on the menu claiming it's the same as Russ's from Busch's Grove , far from it and could not even eat it.  The dressing ( which I got on the side thank God)  was a dish of mayonnaise with some green bits in it!!!  When I asked the waitress she said it was yogurt and mayonnaise,  that is NOT the Russ's dressing!  Bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer was a joke , 3 baby shrimp on skewer over iceberg lettuce!!!  more like baby frozen shrimp and also only two shrimp in the salad cooked like the appetizer one!!
Beware they are only using the names of the "classics" on the menu and have no idea how to even cook them. 
On a Friday night there was only one bartender, one waitress and she was both!!!  Bad time.

I really want to love the new menu and updates to this hotel- the patio furniture is so uncomfortable to sit for a long time and it really didn't fit the ambiance of the courtyard- was excited to try to Busch's Grove Russ's salad.  It is NOT the same.  Grilled chicken and grilled shrimp and the dressing was not the same.  The pork chop and polenta was pretty greasy/ it was their special of the night.  
The service was fair, but our waitress was new (2nd day).  The courtyard was busy.  Almost every table was full.   I will try it again and order something different.  I really love the Seven Gables.

Came here for clayton restaurant week.  What a great value for $25!  The staff was super nice.

They weren't very good at course timing.  We got our apps and dinner at the same time.  It was about 15min between salad and apps and 15min between dinner and desert.

We ordered 2 apps, the tuna tartare and sliders.  Tuna was ok but wasnt cold as I expected.  They did sear it and cut it into tiny pieces.  The wontons were really greasy.  The sliders were sub par.  All pretty dry and plane.  The meat was smashed so thin all you tasted was bun.  The tzatziki sauce was dry like blue cheese.

The pam seared salmon was really good and I liked the sauce.  Rice was spot on too.  The veggie ham mix was almost all salty ham flavor.  No thanks.

The strip steak wasnt cooked that well.  They charred the outside and left the middle pretty raw for a medium rare.  Lots of stringy veins not rendered out.  The veggies were a soggy mess of butter and pepper.  And the mashed potatoes were the smashed variety and mostly butter flavor.

The carrot cake is no good either.  Tasted like it was frozen and recently thawed.  The middle had that frozen chill to it.  It was super dry and crumbly and the caramel sauce was really sticky and fake tasting.

What a great place!  
Love the food and especially the new menu. 
Looking forward to coming in for breakfast soon. 
My favorite appetizer would be the deviled eggs. One of the most unique dishes I've tried!
Nice HH specials and excellent bourbon selection. 
Will be back!
One of the best dinners we have had in months the food was cooked to perfection and the staff was warm and inviting.

Staff was very nice and friendly at the Seven Gables Inn restaurant.

Butternut and Pumpkin Bisque $6
Lobster Bisque $7
Al Bakers Mushrooms $14
Seared Mahi Mahi $31
Salmon in Brussels $26
Pink Lady Cobbler $12

.|\---/|
| o_o |
.\_^_/..2021

Ordered a vegetable medley.   It was about 3/4 of a cup of chopped vegetables.  Tastes great, too much money for a tiny portion.

Also walk to the restaurant, do not order from room.  Yes, make the walk!  Food was about an hour late.  Almost empty hotel.  Hotel front desk young man didn't communicate with restaurant, hence the huge delay in receiving our food.

Lefts review on the Facebook page and they didn't post.  Makes me wonder how many other posts weren't mentioned.

My husband and I enjoyed a delicious dinner on Saturday night.  It was Clayton restaurant week, so it was a limited menu, but there was something in each category that we loved!
In addition to the appetizer, entree, and dessert, we were surprised to learn that a salad was included.
There was so much food, and it was all prepared perfectly - we had to bring home doggie bags!
We each enjoyed a delicious Cesar salad, the tuna appetizer, a steak entree and seafood entree, and then dessert packed to go, as we were too full to eat one more morsel.
This restaurant is a hidden gem in the heart of Clayton, and located in the recently refurbished 7 Gables Inn, in a totally desirable Clayton location.
The only thing missing was a warmer temperature outside.
Our server was great, and Barry, the manager, is a total delight.
We will definitely return.

I have been a long time Panera lover. I was so excited for this new location. Both times we have gone we have ordered online with a scheduled pickup time. The first time we waited nearly an hour past the scheduled time, the second time nearly half an hour. The second time they were out of nearly everything. This is a good business on a school campus. If a student needs to get to another class but wants to patronize this business, they shouldn't have to budget over an hour to receive their meal.  There seems to be plenty of staff, but a lot of not putting in the work. Whoever is running this location needs to step up and get their efficiency together. As for us, we probably won't be back anytime soon.

The General Manager, Sara was a pleasure to work with. This cafe will succeed if they can increase staffing. I recommend expecting a wait if you order from the kitchen. Be patient and kind, and if you see Sara, say Amber from the Pro-team says hi!

I haven't been to a Panera in years! This has been a long awaited restaurant premier in town - everyone is stoked for Reno to finally have a Panera. When I walked by this morning and saw that it was finally open, I knew I had to check it out. Being opening day however, I decided to order online and avoid the crowds. What an easy wonderful experience that was! The online platform was very user friendly and my lunch order was complete in minutes. I got an email notification when my food was ready and walked over to pick it up. 

The new location is wonderful with a full display of pastries, a nice big wall menu, lots of indoor and outdoor seating just outside the restaurant, and a bank of self service order iPads. The food pickup shelf was easy to access and my meal was all packed up and waiting for me. It couldn't have been easier! 

Now, the food was as I remember. Fresh, tasty and relatively healthy. The portion size felt a little small for the price however. My bowl of soup was $8 and my friends salad was $10. I probably could have eaten both, no problem. I was still a little hungry after my soup so now I know to order more next time. For a quick lunch though, it's a great new option - tasty and convenient. Welcome, Panera!

Happy to see Panera finally in Reno. I'm not familiar with UNR so finding it was difficult. I recommend parking in garage and taking elevator to 1st floor. After getting off elevator turn right, the walk is less than 5 minutes. Panera is on the right side on corner. Hopefully there will be more locations soon that are easier to get to. The location is definitely good for students and anyone that works in area. Looking forward to seeing if they will do delivery.

First time going to Panera Bread and it was ok. Didn't have to wait long to order and got the food pretty quick. Probably won't go back just because it seems a little over priced and I think some local places have better pizza and grill cheeses.

Friendly service but wait times are absurd. Over 40 minute wait for one sandwich. Wouldn't be bad if you knew that's what you're in for but for a food place on campus which students are getting food between classes just isn't worth jt

Edit: Posted this while waiting, correction 55 minutes wait

Panera bread always has good food and usually great service, but today the wait for food was over an hour long and server Al orders, including mine were skipped or forgotten. The staff was working hard, but they were avoiding eye contact and the group of about 10 people trying to ask them their place in line were unable to talk to them. I eventually had to get a refund and cancel my order because the staff was not able to look up what place I was in line and give me a time estimate after waiting for an hour and 15 min. I was given a free pastry for my troubles and an apology from the cashier which I appreciated. 

It was the first day of school, but the staff was unapproachable, the wait time was ridiculous, and I had to cancel my order and walk away hungry. I'm not sure if this is a reliable spot if I have to cancel my order altogether and walk away.

im sorry yall but they need to get it together.. love panera to pieces but the wait times are so long and they're always out of stuff): i hope it gets better though cuz its a nice location and the workers are nice, and the food is good too but one time i legit waited 2 hours just for the wrong order and there was barely anyone there

I'm torn. I really love this chain, but my experience here was not great. Maybe it's because it's on the UNR campus. 

I order for pickup, wanting to avoid lines. Pickup was set for 4:30. I arrived at 4:40 and it still was not ready, as there were "30 orders ahead of me". I ended up waiting until 5. There were about 20 others waiting with me. On top of that, the student lead or whatever her title was, was very short with me. I get the feeling that this is an issue they deal with daily and she's sick of explaining it. 

Otherwise, the food and bread was good as usual. The squash soup was way too sweet, so I wouldn't recommend it.

Honestly I am SO happy that there is a Panera. This winter I will be eating a lot of it. The staff are very kind and prompt and are over all just good people. I love the steak sandwich and tomatoe soup! All this being said, it is pretty pricey. I paid 31$ for my friend and I. It might be because it is on the UNR campus but still. Other than the price, great food and warm and welcoming atmosphere .
best birria tacos ever! great food truck and authentic mexican street food and the chefs kinda cute ;)..
The vegan tacos are so delicious! Very generous with their portions. Definitely can't wait to come back for more.!!

I was at a festival where all the food vendors were grossly overpriced but was lucky to see Los Tacos Mariachis Food Truck, which was one of the only vendors not price gauging, offered the best value out of over 9 food trucks in attendance, and had great house made green and red hot sauces! 

Mariachis Food Truck serves 5 kinds of tacos including Quesa birria, Pollo, Carne Asada, chorizo, and veggie, loaded nachos, chicken Quesadillas, steak Quesadillas, and tres leches. 

The Quesa birria shredded beef tacos had an amazing flavor and a savory dipping sauce. 10/10

The Carne Asada Steak tacos had a great marinade and paired well with the red and green hot sauces. 10/10 

Los Tacos Mariachis Food Truck staff says they will be setting up a permanent spot off Adamo drive, 2 blocks East of US 301 Highway at 8505 East Adamo Drive, in the Brandon Area of Tampa. If you're in the Seffner or Brandon area of Tampa and craving some authentic birria tacos, definitely check out Los Tacos Mariachis Food Truck!
Very good.  The salsa is awesome. Good flavor. Great atmosphere and clean.  The quesabirria amazing.  Loved it definitely will be back
Ayo!! If you are a fan of AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD...waste no time anywhere else!! This is the number one spot! Best Tacos. Best people. Best food truck, ever!!
Excellent food, service- loved the bourbon chicken and the Mac and cheese!   Will be back again!

Same owners of Dunedin Smokehouse so I had to try this place. For only 4 Yelp reviews I didn't expect the place to be so busy especially with all the great resultants on Main Street.
Service was top notch and friendly and the vibe was a+ for a bbq joint.
I went with the 4 meat platter with choice of 2 sides. The sides being broccolini and Parmesan crispy brussel sprouts. 
The tri-tip in my opinion was by far the best of the bunch. Super soft and tender and juicy beyond belief. Salmon was a solid 8/10, pork belly 7.5, and dark meat chicken quarter was an 8.
Brussel sprouts needed to be salted more evenly as some bites were too salty. 
This is a good spot if you want to try different meats and vibe out eating bbq
Back again and loved it again. Service is wonderful and food delicious. Will keep continuing to come, it's my new favorite local spot!
Lucky to find an outdoor spot here, and the food was really good. Special shutout to the chef for making sure the po boy bread was toasty and fries were crispy. Highly recommended.

The server was very friendly and knowledgeable about the food, chef, and owner. The food had a twist and was excellent. I've been back numerous times trying something new each time and I've never been disappointed. It is a great addition to downtown Safety Harbor. You definitely need to check this place out.

Excellent bbq and service! This place just opened up in safety Harbour from the same owners of the Dunedin Smokehouse! 

We order trifecta with salmon, tri tip steak, white meat chicken, the slaw and Gouda grits - everything was incredible! Everything was cooked to perfection and had a ton of flavor. 

There isn't a ton of seating but they plan to expand into the space next door. I would definitely give this place a try!

Nice new place in our town.  We went on third Friday and still had great service. Wings were big and juicy. Great sauce 
Only wine was in a can,but I liked it.  Liked the concept and execution very much.
This is a great new addition to Safety Harbor. The Ybor (cuban) is fantastic. The macaroni salad is so good. Great place.

Food 4/5
Service 5/5 
Value 3/5

Let's start with the 4 meat plate platter!!  All the meats were great but my favorite was the tri tip followed by the salmon and then the chicken, pork belly was not what I expected as it was on the chewier crispy side but solid. My only complaint would be the amount of food for the cost. I remember getting my plate and thinking to myself there's no way because I could eat 2 of these plates myself easily it felt like I was paying tapas prices for a small handful of meats. The Parmesan Brussels were decent but too salty for me to enjoy . The broccolini was good with roasted garlic pieces and a nice ranch sauce. Everything was good but a bit on the smaller portion size , you could blow a pretty penny here trying to get full but I'd come back for another meal for sure .

Astonishingly good first time visit. I had the shrimp Po Boy with a side of baby potatoes. The flavor of everything was awesome. The sandwich was ample and the potatoes were just right.  The draft beer seemed a little small though- it might be an optical illusion using the small mason jars they serve it in. I really liked the solid chairs they had inside- too many places have flimsy furniture.  I'd give this four stars when they expand which I was told would be soon- it feels a little cramped right now, and the beer size, both of which distract from the star of the show- the food.

Simply amazing. When I say it was never expected. The Brinehouse prepared their meats in ways I've never seen before. It was like discovering a whole new color for me. Just the whole new taste leaves me wanting to come back every day of the week!

I love this place the people are nice the food is to die for and  it's so close to home. Last couple times I have gone there the eating area is not the cleanest. The tables and floors are always sticky but as long as you take the food to go you will be on cloud 9 after you finish eating

I don't know what happened to this place.  The food has gone down dramatically in the past year.  Today will be my last visit.  The egg rolls were greasy and burnt.  The pork fried rice had plenty of onions but no pork and the shrimp egg foo young was greasy and missing the shrimp.  No more tries for this place.  The food has been below mediocre on our past visits. Plus the prices increased which only adds insult to injury.  Looking for a new Chinese restaurant.  Please take my advise and skip this place.

I order food from here twice...They gave us plenty to eat and it looked very good...  The first time the food was ok but the last time the food was bland, tasteless and dry... I don't understand why there was such a difference between my first order and the second... 

I will say that the staff was very friendly...
Finest ingredients. Cook knows what he is doing.  Generous portions.

I have been ordering from this place for 15 years. The food quality is consistently good. The portions are equal to what you would get at any other Chinese food takeout place.
The lo mein varieties here are flavorful and are as good as you could find in a take out restaurant. The shrimp with garlic sauce is excellent and they use jumbo shrimp for it.  I can only suggest that you have your order repeated back to you so that there's no misunderstanding of what you're asking for.
Three stars is just an average place. Five stars is a gourmet place. If I could I would give this place 3 1/2 stars. I believe that would be fair.

This place deserves 0 stars but because I have to give one to leave the review, there it is. 
I ordered the 8 piece garlic wings and the 8 piece buffalo wings with the sauce on the side for both orders. I paid and picked up my order and recieved only 8 wings and the sauces on the side.

When I called to tell them my order was wrong I was told that I recieved 4 wings for each order and that if I split them in half there would be 8 wings. I told him no that would be 4 wings split in half and I need the other 8 wings that I ordered according to the menu of which he hung up on me. I returned the wings to the restaurant and asked him to explain how 4 wings magically becomes 8 and he said, it's 8 because the woman didn't split it in half to make it 8 and because I ordered my wings on the side it makes it a whole wing which would be 8 because it wasn't split in half. I told him that didn't make any sense and he told me that that's how it is and kept walking away as if he didn't care with hearing what I had to say and he laughed saying thats how all the restaurants do it. I told him I had never experienced that going to any other place and if I order 8 wings I expect to get 8 wings, of which he laughed and I told them I wanted my money back.

I'll never order from here again, not only because I was being cheated out of my order but because who ever that male was that I spoke to, he didn't care to hear my concern or care to talk to me like I was worth hearing. If you want to be disrespected as a paying customer... This is the place to go.
The food was extremely salty and the rice tasted a few days old. I ordered chicken wings they tasted like the oil they were cooked in was burnt. I couldn't finish any of the food.

If I could leave no stars I would . Awfulllll service . We ordered on doordash and called them and we were told that they don't do doordash. The call was interrupted and my friend called and the lady hi g up in her face while she was talking. The food was cold. There was no napkins or forks like we didn't order all of this rice.

Wow wonderful food! What a great addition to the neighborhood this little place is! My friends and I were there today and had a delicious meal. I had the avocado BLT which was really great and my friend had the Philly cheesesteak which was really good also.A nice place for a quick lunch and very clean. The people were great and so was the food I highly recommend this place Farmacy vegan kitchen!

Great addition to the Westshore Marina District! The Cheesesteak is made with impossible burger and soooo good! Vegan donuts on the weekend are addictive too. Grab and go options are great when u don't want to cook. The Mac and cheese is made with cashew cheese and this non vegan (me) didn't want to share with anyone. They are still getting started and staffing so hours (like all restaurants) can fluctuate. I'd recommend ordering on their website to save time and be sure they are open. They told us they plan on expanding hours soon.

Bummer they were closed at 5p when Google says open till 6p. Got a few things to go but doesn't do me any good now. It's in a little apartment complex inside the Duckweed Grocery. If you aren't looking for it, you'll miss it.

Who would of thought that a Vegan Cuban Sandwich would be this good. Thanks to @growfinancial and @farmacyvegankitchen I was able to try out a Free Vegan Cuban Sandwich with a Guava Puff pastry. It surprised me guys, aside from the fact, that their Sandwich was big and filling. But thier Guava pastry, awww.....so tasty and rich. I think I might have to go back to try thier fan favorite Vegan Burgers. I heard thier  enormous and big, but healthy
Great Vegan food from the Farmacy right here in West Shore at the Duckweed Market. Hard to find unless you know to go in the grocery, but worth the time to find it!

This place is a gem! The Hoagie pictured below is a half which was enormous I only had half of the half and was stuffed. They will accomodate any request, I requested hot marinara sauce on my hoagie and the guy called my number right away and said "Is this right....Marinara Sauce?" Well I should have listened to him as this sandwich was MESSY but unreal good!

Quite an extensive menu and I hear the Fried Chicken is the item to get here. The only thing that is frustating is the road that this is on does not feel safe to me but if you are in the area definitely without a doubt come here over WaWa any day of the week!

It's 9 at night, nothing decent in the suburbs is open, and you're hungry. At that time, Lucky 7 is an oasis. Excellent convenience store fried chicken, and delicious hoagies. What more could one want? OK, really friendly staff, too!
Awesome place..great people.. and big ass cheesesteaks and hoagie.  Seriously! Great prices . Do I need to say anymore!
Best fried chicken in Montgomery County takes a little bit so call ahead.

I got a breakfast sandwhich the other day - BEC in a hard roll and it was literally amazing.   I was craving a real breakfast sandwich everything else around here so lame and chain based.  Would 10/10 recommend.  Gonna go back one day to try the lunch sandwhich.

My elderly father-in-law, who barely eats, decided he wanted a Reuben for lunch, I wasn't sure where to go in the Willow Grove area. Lucky 7 popped up on a Google search and they did not disappoint. The corned beef was lean and tender and the Rye bread, fresh and tasty. Never saw him eat with such enthusiasm. I had a pastrami sub special, which was also delish. The service was great as well. They take pride in their business at Lucky 7 deli!

Place is pretty clean. Fast , friendly service. Deli sandwiches are huge and tasty. 
Can also play lottery.
The food was good however my order was totally incorrect.  My salad was missing the dressing and part of my order was left out as well. Don't think I will be getting delivery from this place again.

This place is in an old Wawa, but the food here is way better than what you will ever get at a Wawa.  They sell a bunch of stuff, but I like the all day breakfast menu.  HUGE portions, yummy, very reasonably priced.  All made fresh, today I had a cheese omelette with sausage, grilled onions and mushrooms.   Yum!  Other people were coming in to get fried chicken and raving about it.
Great breakfast, large servings and excellent prices! A coworker bought a sandwich and the meat was piled higher than I have seen at any deli.

Great food, by far the best hoagie nd steak beats the socks off a place in North Philly called Max's! More meat than wawa!  The best fried chicken I have ever tasted! Customer service the best! Their rolls could be a little better! breaks a little! I  will definitely return!
My only complaint is one day I went in and two guys came in with no mask all though the cashier asked them for their mask and questioned she still took their order!  Thing is if we don't wear mask people get infected, everyone close down again and business lose out and we back in the house! I don't care how much money there is to be made, people health more important so no mask no food!

Portions are as big as advertised. Friendly people and very fast service. I've had both the fried chicken and the breakfast sandwiches. The layout is similar to the Wawa that occupied the space previously. Corner store type snacks and drinks available along with everything you can get at the counter.

We have ordered from here a few times.  In the past, I have had cheeseteaks and chicken cheesesteaks.  This is our 3rd time ordering breakfast from them.  We have had them cater breakfast before, but look at the size of these breakfast sandwiches.  2 sausage patties, a lot of egg and enough cheese.  The bacon sandwiches have about 5 or 6 pieces of bacon too.  We order from here for our work events based on our budget.  This sandwich was only $3.99.   Way better than other chain convenient stores and fast food places.
Had their breakfast sandwiches a few times and their hoagies as well and was always more than happy with both the quality and quantity! Their sandwiches are huge! Will be back again for sure!

Meh. I don't understand the rave reviews. Maybe I just ordered something weird (tuna melt, which consisted of brown (?!) tuna salad), but my sandwich was just okay. My husband described his pastrami as "solid but not great." We'll give them another try for stuff that's more mainstream, but overall, just okay.

I was up in willow grove and looking for an Italian hoagie. I saw a bunch of choices, but the pictures for Lucky 7 looked great. So when I pulled up and realized it was a Wawa type spot I almost changed my mind. Don't be fooled . This place takes it to a higher level. The hoagie was loaded with the right meats. Diets and Watson. One of my top 3 cold cut brands. The hoagie was well designed with enough lettuce, and the right amount of spices. Could have used a few more hot peppers but it was really good. They also had some nice desserts! The bread reminded me of hoagies in Bordentown and Princeton. A little softer but still really good . The people who run the place were attentiv

This little deli is a great spot to get breakfast if you're in a hurry in the morning. They have touch screens like they do in wawa but with wayyyy more choices and you can get breakfast all day. This deli is my go to spot for breakfast lunch and dinner and just to grab snacks for whenever. They also have canned goods which is a plus. Everyone there is also very friendly!

Best Fried Chicken in Willow Grove! Honestly all the food is bomb. Down to the salads! Quick,fast and friendly service. Fresh and made to order. I mainly come for the chicken. Prices are very reasonable!

Not only did these ignorant idiots make my food wrong when I took my receipt back they would not refund my money. Then when you try to explain they pretend they don't understand English and start speaking another language. It's dirty oh and they don't even try to hide their bug and mice traps

I've been to many Korean BBQs in my life and this is one of the best in Philly. The food is delicious and the setting is very nice. Reading the negative reviews based on people's feeling about the "cultural" issues is harsh. 

We are living in a difficult time where restaurants have to make due, so to see people try bringing a restaurant down without even mentioning the food is extremely disappointing and a failure of mankind to do the right thing.

Aside from the blatant Japanese and Chinese decor, beverages, and such (all of which I have now heard has been changed) I would say our meal here was delicious.  Now as a Korean, this is not authentic Korean cuisine but definitely a good try on it and with very little outdoor seating available for tabletop KBBQ nearby, this was enough to hold us over until other spots can accommodate.  The kalbi was decent- fatty and not quite marinated well- a little bland but the quality of the meat was good.  $58 for 5 pieces of meat?  Eh.   Banchan was decently portioned and tons of options.  The kimchi was actually really good, surprisingly, not like uhmma's but you know.  Charcoal grill is always better so I hope more KBBQ get on it and open up some outdoor options.  Service was excellent and speedy, everyone was super friendly and even brought me extra raw garlic to throw on the grill.

I understand this restaurant has received hard criticism. I think rightfully so - and they changed some of the things that were insensitive, lazy, or dumb (Sapporo umbrella).

With that said, their ability to provide a unique outdoor dining experience for people right now should be respected and commended. They are providing jobs in an industry that severely needs business.

The food was delicious. The charcoal apparatus was sweet. My date and I had a lot of fun. At no point did we think or expect to have an "authentic" Korean bbq but it did make me want to go back to Kim's Restaurant and Dubu and search out more KBBQ. I hope that this opens up a new audience to the delicious flavors and wonderful experience KBBQ offers. 

We had the flank steak bbq that was awesome. Our favorite banchan was the potato salad. It was incredible.

Got dragged here by my girlfriend who wanted to try it with her bffs and their boyfriends.  Nothing about this place is authentic.  
The decor is cheap and cheesy.  The food was okay at best. The place is over priced for what you get. No self respecting Asian person would eat here and like it.

If you're looking for good atmosphere, charcoal grill, Korean bbq Americanized then this would be that spot. The hostess was nice, our server was nice, but it's far from traditional and the flavors aren't quite there for most of the items that we've tried. I could be a bit biased only because I am Korean. 

Drink: Silk Road (comes in a fish bowl) not Covid friendly because it doesn't come in its own cups, literally a fish bowl with straws to be shared. The flavor was good but definitely diluted and not enough soju but it was good and refreshing! Someone posted that it was $28 but got charged $30. Our menu had the price at $38. So in a matter of 4 days they bumped the price an additional $10? 

Food - Appetizer:
1. Dumplings - it was good, flavorful, good balance of the skin, meat, kimchi. 
2. Scallion pancake - it was okay, nothing special, just a typical scallion pancake. Portions small, not much flavor, not worth the price. It would have been better if they went with a seafood pancake instead. 
3. Pork gyoza - too much flour (gyoza skin was too thick), a bit undercooked, could taste the flour inside. It was okay. 
4. Fish (I forget the name) appetizer - it was light, refreshing, some of us thought it was a bit salty. 

Food - Meal: 
1. Kalbi - the best one but again lacked flavor, it was  way lighter on the soy sauce and the meat quality was good but it didn't seem marinated enough. Also not worth, I think they gave us 4 strips.. 
2. Flank steak - too much soy sauce and no other real flavor. Meat quality was good but disappointed in the flavor.  
3. Bossam - I liked how they cooked it because traditionally it is just braised but it had a nice hard outer skin (similar to how Chinese and Vietnamese cook their pork belly). However, I didn't like how it had no meat, it was just all fat. Also it's supposed to come with oysters, cabbage, fermented marinated spicy radish to wrap it in, came with i think soy sauce (which was weird). 
4. Spicy pork shoulder - too salty and too much red pepper paste but it wasn't spicy and had really no flavor. 

The banchan (side dishes), it was okay, nothing spectacular. Their potato salad and kimchi was probably the better ones. 

All in all, my friends and I had a great time just being able to dine out and enjoy bbq but I probably wouldn't come back again. I was super ecstatic because Korean bbq on charcoal is seriously the best and there is only one place in philly where you can go for charcoal kbbq but the meat flavors just weren't fabulous that I'd crave it. However, they were very clever with how they set up the charcoal grills. It was a nice place to "try" but that's about it, nothing super negative but nothing so outstanding either, just so-so and pricey for the quality. I was hoping that their flavors were better because it's right in the city and that way i don't have to travel to north philly but the concept was good, service was standard and food mediocre. 

If you want to give it a shot though, I'd say try the kalbi and dumplings. Their other cocktails sounded good too.

As a group we were really excited about the concept of Char Kol and walked away feeling happy and content. There was a variety of well-thought out appetizers (try the spicy rice cake and scallion pajeon!), and the fun, interactive grilling experience made for a unique experience - oh and good cocktails, too. Main critiques are high price point for the BBQ meats which were just alright, and non-memorable interactions with the staff.

Enjoyed dining outside having kbbq. Beef Mandu and chicken wings were great. I would skip the egg bread next time. The short rib bbq was hella great and all staff was friendly and attentive. We had a great evening here.
Who mixes Korean and Japanese cuisine and calls it Korean BBQ? There's no Korean Beer, there's no Soju, no Korean liquor...I mean come on.

ROACHES ALERT!!!! We sat outside for dinner last week. Food was fine, wine was very well-priced and excellent. However, we had two roaches on the wall next to our table. My boyfriend killed them right before they came onto our table. When we informed the server, the manager comped our $10 appetizer and said that our experience is the result of outdoor dining. We saw two more on the sidewalk as we exited. However, we have dined outside at Mission and Oyster House in the last week (both next door) and we didn't see one roach.  Clearly, the Schulson Collective should invest in extermination like the rest of Sansom Street.

We thought food was really good and we've had "authentic " Korean as well. Not sure why people have to be so uptight these days about culture- when you make and share and eat food from other cultures it only connects the world more which is what we need right now. 
Service amazing, outdoor seating awesome , and inside looks gorgeous looking forward to sitting inside in the fall

Get the dumplings, scallion pancake, yummy

So my boyfriend and I were interested in trying this place - we probably should have done some more research before going here, but we just saw that it was on a list of pop-up restaurants that were recommended by Visit Philly. 

Let me start off by saying that the service was great. The hostess was friendly, our server was attentive, and they quickly cleared items that we were done with. 

From a food perspective, I was really hoping for something better - I love kbbq and have been to a ton of authentic places in the past. All of the food lacked flavor, and the cocktails seemed like they were mostly juice. We ordered the Kalbi - which was bland in flavor, and overpriced as they only give 5 pieces, so each piece was a little over $10...WILD. The banchan was "soggy" - I don't know how else to describe it, but there was definitely something very off in the flavor and vibrant element that banchan can bring to a Korean meal. 

My biggest issue for the meal was the makeshift bbq that they provided. Our flame was way too hot and the heat was extremely uneven so that by the time the ends of the kalbi meat cooked, the middle burned. 

It was a fine meal, but if you are looking for something authentic to the standards of taste that you are familiar with in a normal kbbq setting, this isnt the spot for you

Two stars is actually generous. I'm honestly irate that this place popped up but I'm not going to elaborate on that. Anyway, my Korean husband wanted to give them a chance and try this place so we did. We travel everywhere (including South Korea) just to eat Korean food so we know what it's about. If you are looking for a non-authentic Korean restaurant then here you go.. yes, I said it.

We did appreciate the charcoal grill bc KBBQ just tastes better that way. The host, our server and waitress were nice and attentive.

Fried Chicken Wings - it's their take on Korean fried chicken and it was good

Seoul Fashioned - it was okay, ginseng tea is pretty strong and didn't smell any of that on the drink

Galbi - eek! The meat quality was not good (fatty) and the marinade just didn't do it for us - it was bland. It was pretty pricey as well

Ban Chan - kimchi was more fish sauce, the rest tasted more just vinegar-y, we did like the soy daikon and the lotus root. Sauces was just gochujang and soy sauce, nothing crazy. I don't think they do unlimited ban chans either but not an issue if you don't know 

culturally tone deaf things: the paper lanterns with cherry blossoms are not Korean, should be a hard NO. A couple of the cocktail names should be changed (ie: Chong Li) seriously? There are no Korean liquors/beverages either.

Now if you don't know how to eat or haven't had KBBQ, you will be lost bc they don't explain what the ban chans were and what to do with that bowl of lettuce they just gave you.

We tried.. it's not for us. If you want to experience GOOD and AUTHENTIC Korean food, there are other options in the city.

Very interesting setup (outdoor, charcoal on table). Ultimately a fairly small grill though and the meat was just ok. Not as flavorful as one should expect for true kbbq (this is not actually a Korean restaurant). Hard to screw up fire and meat though. 

Although it's okay that the restaurant isn't managed/staffed by Koreans, it's clear that management (a very experienced group) has either not been thoughtful enough about running a restaurant that purports to be Korean or just couldn't care less and mashed up cultures that are close enough to Korean for them. The name, aesthetic, and menu items are problematic, yes. Worse though, is the apparent lack of understanding or hint of regret that the owners have demonstrated with regards to the public feedback they've received. 

No doubt there are better authentic Korean restaurants in Philadelphia and neighboring towns (Upper Darby). If you want amazing Korean food, go to these places. If you want to feed the Schulson empire, try this place.

Booked a table for a party of 6 to celebrate my buddy's birthday. Restaurant was closed when we got there. No answer on the phone. Extremely disappointed. Was really looking forward to a night full of good ol' sake and bottles of zinfandel for the most authentic Korean barbecue experience in the city. Really hope they get their act together and honor my reservation next time the same way they honor Korean history and culture.
The service was very subpar and the food was not good at all. Too bad since I do need to find some good Korean food to go to.

I get all the controversy around this new restaurant. But come on, the food is delicious. We ordered the beef mandu, veg pajeon and the short rib barbecue. Everything was delicious. Service was impeccable as is always with Michael S. Restaurants. I saw a lot of people getting the rice bowl and the wings. I can't wait to try it again!

I know there has been plenty of controversy about this place and it's appearance/theme, but I will aim just to review its food without delving into the cultural implications.

Overall, I am a big fan of kBBQ and I would say as someone living in center city the options are not plentiful. I know there are a few more authentic locations (that I invite all to support and try out) but I for one welcome this addition to the center city food scene.

For a group of 3, we ordered 2 appetizers and 3 bbq entrees. This along with drinks for everyone was probably slightly more food than we needed but I would say that the biggest negative of this place is the expensive price and the quantity. 5 strips of kalbi short rib will run you about 40-50$; however I do understand things will be more expensive in center city. 

The scallion pancake was doughy and unlike the fried crispy scallion pancakes we expected but we enjoyed them. We also shared the fried Mandu which was OK but nothing to get super excited about. 

In terms of bbq, you get one charcoal grill and a choice of meats to cook it on. We ordered the bo ssam (pork belly), spicy pork shoulder, and the kalbi short rib. Of these choices, the bo ssam comes to you already cooked and the other two you cook on the grill. 

With the meets you get an assortment of small plates (banchan). This includes traditional kimchi, scallions, carrots, lotus root, potato salad, corn, white kimchi, rice, lettuce. These are unlimited so be sure to ask for refills if desired. My favorites were traditional kimchi, carrots, and potato salad. 

Out of entrees, bo ssam is excellent; crispy skin with very fatty and tender pork belly. Goes great with lettuce wrap and some banchan. The kalbi was very tender with a sweet marinade but the only negative I would say about it is that it was a bit fattier than i would've liked for the price. Spicy pork shoulder has a nice taste and is much cheaper than the other two options we ordered. 

Overall, the ambience is fun, the charcoal grills are a nice touch and the food was enjoyable for people who miss going to kBBQ. Our whole meal for 3 people came to about 80-90$ a person and save to say we were stuffed by the end.

Another spot run by vvhite folx who love to water-down traditional korean food to the vvhite palette, without consideration or respect for the culture they profit off of. Everything about this restaurant is problematic- from the name (splitting "charcoal" into one-syllabic characters to "sound Asian"), to the menu and decor- it's just plain cultural appropriation and disrespectful.

Let's take a look at the menu and break things down- for one, the menu combines different words from both Korean and Japanese, but the restaurant is supposed to be Korean? Hamachi is not Korean- why would you take the language of Korea's colonizer and slap it onto a Korean restaurant menu? Consistency, at least, if you're going to bother trying to appropriate a culture.

Second- the chef is not even Korean, is that not the least you can do with a Korean BBQ joint? Sure, Rudofker may have worked with Chef David Chang, but that doesn't mean that he has spent any time really learning Korean cuisine and culture beyond work with a singular person. That, my friends, is tokenization. Just because he worked with David Chang doesn't mean that he is an expert or can craft Korean cuisine.

Third- decor. Sapporo umbrellas- looks like they can't get away from this theme of conflating Japanese and Korean cultures. Now experienced KBBQ goers will know that KBBQ is synonymous with Cass, Hite, Kloud, Chamiseul, and Chum Cheorum- why is not a single Korean beer to be found on the menu?

The kimchi looks unripe and quite honestly like the vvhite man's uninspiring take on a historical staple in Korea, as does much of the other banchan. Put your money towards a different, Korean-owned small business that actually will do you the favor of eating delicious Korean bbq, a win-win in terms of cultural experience, good price, and real, delicious Korean food. Perhaps try Muta Korean BBQ, or Serabol (which is also right in center city, and owned by a proper Korean chef).

If you're going to say you're a Korean BBQ joint, you have to do kbbq justice. From the banchan, to the appetizers, to the meat itself, there's a certain level of quality I expect when I splurge for kbbq. Name-choice, decorations, what-ever controversy put aside, at the end of the day...Char Kol's food is very blah.

PARKING: I hope you have better luck than I did. Ended up paying over $30 like a sucker to park in the garage right next to this area on Sansom street. This is definitely not a car-friendly part of Philly. Char Kol is located across the street from Oyster House and on a weekend, the outdoor seating areas are packed.

EXTERIOR: The staff members were professional and attentive. Everything was clean and outdoors in these COVID-19 times. The use of an outdoor charcoal grill was something new to me from a kbbq place. Normally charcoal grilled kbbq is reserved for extended family outings at the beach for me. Be careful when cooking because food cooks really fast compared to your standard metal grill at the table.

FOOD: We were told an order of meat comes to about 1.5 lbs. I don't think that's true. With three people, we ordered two orders of meat which theoretically should come out to 3 lbs. In my experience a 1 lb per person ratio should leave you absolutely stuffed. This was not the case and they try to make it seem like they give you a lot because they stretch their slices out on a large plate. The funny thing is that their menu says an order should feed 2+...maybe they meant birds?

+Banchan: If you're looking for traditional, this ain't it chief. Their potato salad is the kind you find at the supermarket. Not heavily egg-based, lack of corn or cucumbers mixed it. Korean potato salad is sweet, not the salty/tangy American type. The kimchi was decent. The addition of pickled radish/carrot (a Vietnamese condiment) confused me. And again the LACK OF SESAME OIL (one of the pillars of Korean cooking) threw me off. Ya'll they don't even give you decent sauces to dip your meats in because all I got was overwhelmingly soy sauce-based.

+ Scallion Pajeon: Actually liked this pajeon. It was crispy and flavors were authentic. Don't think the $11 price tag is justified. The only let down was the sauce that came with it. The sauce was very one-dimensional (a recurring theme here at Char Kol).

+ Marinated Flank Steak: Liked this one slightly more than the spicy chicken breast. I didn't think the flavor of the marinade was very impressive. Where's the sweetness? Where's the umami? Because all I got was salt. Flank steak isn't a traditional kbbq cut. Wished they'd gone for more of a sirloin or rib eye cut. Save the flank steak for your fajitas. A bulgogi type of marinated meat would have been better.

+Spicy Chicken Breast: Breast?? Choice of cut is again poor because breast is dry af, especially cooked over a grill. The flavor of the spicy marinade gave it more depth than the marinated flank steak. But chicken breast is not a good choice for bbq.

DRINK: It has a more classy and youthful feel here at Char Kol. Unfortunately the cocktail drinks here are WEAK. I ordered the subak which is your traditional watermelon soju mixed with a Moscow mule. The watermelon juice aspect was nice, but for over $10 I expect a decent amount of booze in my cocktail.

PRICE: Not worth it. For three people and some drinks, the bill was easily over $100. You can go to a legit AYCE kbbq restaurant for less than $30 per person. The underwhelming experience doesn't really justify the price. I don't mind paying a high price for quality BBQ and out of the many (many) Asian BBQ experiences I've had, Char Kol ranks pretty low on the list.

Overall: It's a shadow of what kbbq is in terms of FLAVOR. It's kbbq I would expect if I didn't know what kbbq was supposed to taste like and I read everything from a travel guide. Call it kbbq for beginners *shrugs* or what it actually is, a Korean/Japanese fusion restaurant. You can market yourself as Korean/Japanese-inspired too, but at the end of the day the food has to wow me and it didn't at Char Kol.

While many of the negative reviews discuss cultural appropriation, this review is about the food and atmosphere.

The food was decent, but I think the Korean BBQ at serabol is better.

Unfortunately, we had two cockroaches crawl on the wall next to our table during dinner. I understand the difficulty of keeping the bugs away since this is outdoor dining, however I have not had a bug problem at any other outdoor restaurant I've been to (including other center city restaurants).

Absolutely terrible food. If anyone has ever had Chinese food they will not be a able to eat this food.  The chow mien was half cooked and half raw, I don't even know how to describe the egg rolls.....but not edible. The fried rice is bland, and the black pepper beef is chewy. 

Waste of time and money. Never again.
Food is great and Stanley is always very nice and happy. He is definitely one of the reason we keep on coming back to this restaurant.

Ordered takeout for dinner - asked if they could put a rush on it and they did - food arrived when they said it would in 20 minutes! Great online ordering system. Food was delicious - will definitely order from there again.

I ordered off Skip the Dishes and it was over an hour late. The fault was 100% with the restaurant and they kept giving Skip the Dishes inaccurate information (food is on the way, we're handing it over shortly, etc). Taking to the driver, I guess the restaurant kept screwing up orders.

I tried calling the restaurant at one point and never got a call back.

When I finally got the food, it was cold, the chicken was dry and over cooked, the ginger beef was all breading, and they never gave me the lemon sauce for the lemon chicken.

It was just a terrible experience overall. It's made worse by the fact that they made the delivery driver sit there for an hour, which stopped him from making more money.

We ate their food once in the last month. I ordered from home and then picked up the food we bought ... most of it was OK, and about the same as any other place we've ordered from.

But the hot and sour soup was the best I've ever had, and that includes North China ... I'd go again, but just for that soup. Yummmmmmmy.

Two customers in the whole place. I sat at a table so I could watch the TV.   This very mean older male waiter asked me to move to a smaller table in front of his one, astonished, other customer.   Will never return.

The reviews made us visit

My wife & I needed a Chinese food fix and e decided to give King's Garden a try, based on the excellent reviews we have read. We were NOT disappointed! We are early birds and usually try to beat the rush and our food came out of the kitchen quickly, was piping hot and way more than the two of us could eat. The quantity of food amazed us and the quality was every bit as impressive. Best Chinese food we have had for a very long time and we fully understand the GREAT REVIEWS and why the take out phone never stops ringing. King's Garden is now our GO TO PLACE for Chinese.

Just moved to Edmonton in terwilligear had no idea where to go , decided to Yelp someplace close that has a few good reviews . Well I was surprised I did so well finding this place . I ordered take out and was astonished how tasty everything was and not greasy or salty like some restaurants . The interior was small and no buffet, but the food makes up for everything else . Prices were good . The waiter / restaurant owners were friendly and food came out quick . I will be going back to this place to order take out again soon !

I have never in my life has such great ginger beer. Yes, I know it's not real ethnic food. Yes, I also order pineapple chicken balls too. While we moved houses we had to have orders from here a dozen times and it was consistently the best "western" Chinese food we had ever had

The food is fresh and good quality, it's like a healthy version of Chinese food. I ordered it off Skip the Dishes expecting the classic sugary and unhealthy sauces, but there wasnt any on any of the food. The Chow Mein used thin noodles and not the classic is in noodles. The chicken tasted weird, like it was cooked in salt water. Only the spring rolls and chicken fried rice were as expected.

Best Chinese food we've had in a very long time!  
It was a "I'm not cooking" kind of night, but we didn't want pizza, so we thought we would try to order Chinese.  We hadn't read the reviews, but happened to have a menu that had come in the mail and was buried in the back of our junk drawer.  I loved that we could order online and they were really quick to call back and confirm.  Which was nice, at least we knew they received our order.  The food arrived within the estimated time and was hot.  It was the most flavourful Chinese food I've ever had.  Singapore noodles had some nice heat, but not overpowering, ginger beef was delicious and wasn't chewy and hard like many others I've had.  The chicken balls actually had a good amount of chicken and not all batter and the lemon chicken was nice and crispy.
We will definitely be ordering from here again.  Hopefully soon!

Thought it was great there was finally a healthy option at NOLA airport. 3 times I've been disappointed. One time they had two people there but neither could checkout that cash register and said I needed to come back in 30 min. Today there was a line, 2 people working, only 1 was making the food and she kept pulling her phone out and texting IN FRONT OF EVERYONE! She also kept ducking to the back (I can only imagine to continue texting on her phone). Waited in line (with only 5 people ahead of me) for 30 min before I had to leave because my flight was boarding. Don't bother if you're flight boards within 30 min because you won't get your food. Such a disappointment.
The sauces are great but things are just a little sloppy. There was avocado skin in my wrap...the sweet potatoes tasted a bit tender. Wait wasn't too long.

How does a restaurant at the airport run out of food? Well at 11 am City Greens had no chicken, shrimp or avocado.  I asked why they had for protein and the staff member responded "eggs".  

The restaurant should close if they were out of food.

This place is terrible! Zero stars. Only gave one because I can't post without the stars. I have stopped here on my way through New Orleans three times in the last three weeks and it just got worse each time. The employees and manager bicker with each other while customers heading for flights wait in line. Today, the serving dishes were dirty. They frequently run out of items in the front and are in no hurry to replace them. The staff is unfriendly. I wanted to give a Christmas tip to the person who served me to cheer them up but finally gave up after they got to the third dirty salad bowl with no apology or sense of urgency whatsoever. Will not stop here again!

I walked up to look at the menu and the person working there started listing out random food items (I was never greeted, it was just a food monologue). I asked what she was listing and she responded that those were the items they were out of. So I asked what they had and she asked that I come over here and see. I ordered something being that this was the second place that was out of sandwiches after Starbucks. No receipt was provided and they told the people behind me that they only accept credit cards. New airport, same staff.

This was an unfortunate City Greens experience. I'm giving it 2 stars because the food I got was good--it was the service and availability that are causing the low rating. The two workers were clearly unhappy about something and were not interested in working. They moved very slow--I even heard one say to the other "take your time, that line isnt going anywhere".  Disappointing bc there was a line! And hungry people willing to pay $15 for a salad! And then the salad--they were out of many things. Chicken, tomatoes, corn, ... And the unenthusiastic workers did not let you know about these missing items until your order was underway--saying "we don't have chicken" as if it's obvious and makes sense and I should have known that. I know it's new and they have some kinks to work out, so hopefully this gets better as time goes on.

Very unpleasant experience. I thought a salad stand in the airport must get my food quick. But no, I stood in the line for 20 minutes without the line even moving! The worker moved really really slow, and looked very pissed off. The only sentence I heard she said to customers were "we don't have chicken" or "we don't have turkey". No explanation at all. 

Avoid this place if you are in MSY. Even the sit in restaurants nearby would provide food faster than this place.

What a disappointment. Poor service and lack of ingredients. One of the two employees was making salads while the other preened at the register. Only half of the ingredients for the Thai salad were available, but it was only after I paid that the salad-istas bothered to say that anything other than than chicken was missing. First off, how has the chicken run out?! No replenishment of chicken in sight. No cucumber. No avocado for another patron. I'm glad I paid over $10 for a spinach and carrot salad. When I asked to speak to the manager, they said he/she was in the other terminal. I asked if the manager was en route. They said "someone" could call the manager but didn't bother to do it themselves. They were completely uninterested in providing remotely acceptable customer service. Now I'm sitting on my plane with a sad, sad salad that I didn't have time to discuss with the mythical manager. Well done, City Greens - transporting your dissatisfied patrons to another state is an excellent business model.

Southwest Breakfast Bowl had the best poached egg i've ever had. Maybe its sous vide, it's firm oN the outside and gooey but not runny. Jalapeño dressing A+. And the young man whom helped me while training was the definition of hospitality. 

Only down side they ran out of the cheese/protein box at 8am. 
and know you can't get the regular salads before 10am.

Wouldn't recommend this restaurant. The salad was absolutely terrible. In addition, they ran out of ingredients and the customer service from the staff working the salad bar needs to be improved. I had to ask for fresh spinach instead of the wilted mess they were trying to sell. The cashier was the only friendly person at City Greens.

Definitivamente "el taco Jalisco" era el mejor, ahora birrieria y taqueria Arandas me ha decepcionado mi orden de tacos: los de pollo casi crudos y la tripa quemada y pastor también...cambiaron los tacos pero los regresaron igual de quemados. Fueron amables y no cobraron todo y Espero mejoren, pero por ahora ya me perdieron...
Tried the fish tacos today. Best fish tacos I've ever had to date anywhere!!!! Been to Jalisco about 10 times now and have never had anything not excellent.

Definitely wouldn't have imagine this place being super good by the look of it. Place had about 6 tables, pretty small place. No other customers were there till we left because it was around 3pm. We drive by this place everyday since my boyfriend lives near by, I'm glad we finally stopped though. Menu wasn't big but that's okay, it's better to not have so many options. Menu on the board must have been a special because there was a dinner menu they give you when you're seated. Their kitchen was the food truck outside of the building. We got steak tacos and fish tacos. They were so fresh, not over seasoned to the point of salty, and both were cooked perfectly. Will definitely come back and work my way through the menu.

Good traditional Mexican food....the atmosphere is clean and the service was great...I got a simple chicken taco, fish taco with a side of rice and beans. The fish taco for some reason was a little soggy so I didn't like that but would eat there again...
Absolutely delicious. My favorites are the tripa (ask for it crispy), cabeza, and lengua tacos. I am sad they are moving! Nice service staff and very fast service.

This place is a hidden gem in Antioch...all authentic! The restaurant caters to local Hispanics, however they are super friendly and speak both Spanish and English...but don't expect Taco Bell, instead their food is excellent and one of the best authentic sit-down restaurants in Antioch with lots of regulars. The food is cooked in a taco truck adjacent to the easy-to-miss establishment.

As good of authentic Mexican food that you will find anywhere in Nashville. Small little place with a food trailer attached outside where the cooking happens. The best al pastor I've ever had. Great corn tortillas, fast and friendly service. This place is the REAL deal, no frills or fancy dining room just awesome food.  Price is very fair.

Don't order their quesadillas mine had shredded chicken with BONES. I was sharing with my toddler and after I got 4 bones out I stopped scared she might choke on one.Taste like they use whatever is left over. Had more cheese than anything. The other taco truck I go to has like actual chicken bits . Its okay but wont be going back.

3.5

There is so much good Mexican food -- from many, if not all, of the states/regions -- in Nashville that if one whines that s/he can't find any, I immediately put them on block. I can't waste time with willful ignorance. And, yes, the standard at many of these eateries is the taco.* Tacos are good and all but sometimes you need a break from them. Enter: the mulita. 

I hadn't had much luck finding these bad boys in Nashville until lately. You always remember your first time so to my understanding, mulitas are sort of like corn torilla-based tortas. The way I had them, the tortilla was more arepa-like and between the two was meat, cheese, onion, cilantro, and guacamole. Super good. Very tasty. Extremely addictive. At El Taco Jalisco, the mulitas are made with thin, standard corn tortillas, meat, cheese, cilantro, and onion. At $2 a pop, I am not going to lose my mind about the lack of relative heft. Perhaps mulita preparation varies by region? Perhaps I got a bargain basement mulita? At $2 a mulita, I'm going to call it a wash. ETJ has a wide variety of meat options so dig in and see what you like. I ordered 4: pollo, asada, chorizo, and barbacoa. The barbacoa was far and away the best meat option. I don't know where or how they're making their bbq, but it was fantastic. Don't get me wrong: all of the meat (and, thus, the mulitas) tasted great but the barbacoa was next level. From what I could see, the kitchen is a food truck connected to the dining room. The guys back there put in some serious work.

Something else I noticed was how clean the dining room is. The room is a good size and it's sparkling white. I think this has something to do with the woman who was running the dining room. She was on the phone taking orders, she was directing traffic, she was quality controlling the plates that came out from the back... she did it all. The reason for the 3.5 (rounded up) is that she was the only person who was at all friendly. There were three other young ladies helping her the evening I came in and none greeted, smiled, spoke, or otherwise made me feel welcome in the establishment. I noticed them interacting with other customers in Spanish so, perhaps, it was a perceived language barrier. I speak decent enough Spanish (especially when it comes to food) and at other Mexican restaurants I am greeted in Spanish, respond in Spanish or English and take it from there. Here, I was iced out. I saw one of the women bring my order out and she just left it at the front. After doña ETJ was finished doing all of her jobs, she asked the girl whose food she'd just left on the counter. She motioned to me and the woman in charge gave her a 'then why didn't you give it to him?' look. She, then, called over to me with a smile and gave me my food. So... full story.

*If you're paying more than $1.50 for a taco you're doing it all wrong. You are. Feel ashamed.

Service and food is always AWESOME! I order their steak breakfast burritos and it was so good. It comes with steak, eggs, potatoes, rice, cheese, bean and cooked with little peices of bell pepper. I will always stop by here a grab a bite to eat and it's never a disappointment with alot of sauce to choose from and you get a bag of chips. This is my to go place to get quick delicious mexican food on the go. Almost forgot, they packed alot of steak meat and thats definitely a plus.
