One of my favorite places to eat. Not to many options where we're at. They definitely rock!

This place is wonderful! Tonight I got an small asada burrito and chips and guacamole. My hubby got the large Chipotle burrito. Everything was wonderful and the service is always amazing they can get busy but are well worth the wait.

Outstanding Mexican Food, Wonderful Family Ownership.  I think is best food Trailer Serving Authentic Mexican Food.  Great for Vegetarians to enjoy.

Love you Folks
Jorge

I'm a sucker for taco trucks, so when I saw this one in Cold Springs I had to stop. Fuego Habanaro did not disappoint. I ordered an asada burrito, which was delicious; but if you order the burrito make sure you're ready to put down some food - this thing was the biggest burrito I have ever seen. It was packed with meat, and had a healthy portion of all the other fixings - beans, rice, guac, sour cream. I asked for the habanero sauce to go with my burrito, which was sweet at first with an incredibly spicy kick. If you're not hungry enough for a giant burrito, the tacos looked awesome as well. They also have sopes and other taco truck essentials. They even offer asada fries! If I see this truck again, I will definitely stop for some grub.

Best Mexican Food Truck(trailer) in Washoe Country Nevada.  Thank you for the fantastic Food and Family Customer Service.  
Excellent for Vegetarians!
Soo good. Very fresh. Variety of different salsas from hot to sweet. This food truck is lit in Cold Springs. We always get chicken tacos but I'd like to try the nachos next time :)

This is the best taco truck! I eat here like once a week and it never disappoints. Sweet family run truck and service is great. They have a huge variety for a taco truck but the basic street tacos are my favorite (especially al pastor). They have tacos, burritos, enchiladas, chimichangas, taquitos, tostadas, quesadillas, nachos, carne asada fries, chicken wings, and a steak fajita sandwich (amazing!). They also have tamales some nights (usually Wednesdays). Their avocado salsa is the best! 

They are generally open everyday except Tuesdays and hours are 5pm-8:30pm though they do have changes once in a while (check their Facebook)

We eat here regularly! My favorite is the fajita sandwich! The Chipotle sauce is absolutely addictive but varies in heat so beware of you are sensitive! The flavor is amazing and I love dipping fries into it. Hubby likes cheese enchiladas with green sauce. Always friendly and great prices!

Food truck I found sitting at Chuck's Market in Cold Springs.  I ordered their Carne Asada plate.  The street style tacos were on point and the orange sauce that came with the dish was amazing!  The sauce was spicy, but not overwhelming.  If they don't already, that sauce should be bottled and sold, as it is amazing.  I would definitely recommend this food truck, as they had great service, price and good food.  That sauce though, please bottle and sell it separately...it's that good!

MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE! Tastes delicious and home cooked, fair prices! (Except I always need to buy a million carne asada tacos, lol) I live in Cold Springs so quick food is limited but they are here a few days out of the week and its always such a joy. Everyone is SO polite. The wait time sucks BUT when you impress everyone in the community that's a small price to pay! Thanks, Fuego, for being the best part of Cold Springs!

So YUM!!! They are typically BUSY BUSY BUSY! So if you are in a rush probably not the best place to stop! But the food, customer service, and cleanliness of it all is great! They have asada fried to DIE FOR! Carne tacos are good but not the best on the menu! The burritos are something you see at super burrito! It's straight authentic Mexican food! Don't let that taco truck food you! They are straight up five star!!! Only bad thing I can say is they forgot napkins!

These are so good! I got the pumpkin spice and the cookies and cream, the second of which came hot. Be sure to eat them hot for extra deliciousness! My only complaint is the price, I'm here from out of town and it's quite exorbitant compared to what I'm used to

Federal donuts has a monopoly over the city and the donuts are pretty good. They have rotating flavors and I'm embarrassed to say I've had at least 20 unique flavors. It's in the Whole Foods and I shop there every week so it's tempting. Most of the donuts are delicious, nice cakey donut and cool combinations. Sometimes they miss and the icing is too sweet and gritty. I have also had the chicken sandwich and needless to say I won't  return for that. But, definitely go for the cake donuts.
My Man Joshua who works on Monday's needs a raise. He was an angel in this dark world. Sixers just lost game seven and he restored faith in humanity for me.
Definitely have the fancy donuts at this location later in the day (aka they don't sell through as fast).

Ordered 4 donuts  in order of most enjoyed to least 
All doughnuts are cake based and not fried.

1. Banana pudding- hands down was like eating banana bread with a wonderful banana custard on top.

2.Strawberry Rhubarb - strawberry coating was like candy. I want to say the rhubarb was just a drizzle but very well the two could have been mixed. 

3. Pecan pie- The doughnut was full of spices and was layered almost like a cinnamon roll-with nuts throughout.  The spices did leave this coating on my tongue like if you were to just dip the tip of your tongue into some allspice 

4. Raspberry Mascarpone - The most basic of the 4 doughnuts. The raspberry drizzle did complement the mascarpone but then the more you ate the doughnut it overpowered it.

My sister had Federal Donuts delivered for my birthday and I was super excited because I hadn't tried them yet. They travel really well because of the way that they are glazed.

This box was made up of fancy varieties: Cannoli, Chocolate Toffee, Blueberry Lemon, Peach Marshmallow, Banana Nutella, and some chocolate thing I couldn't figure out. they were all delicious but I am looking forward to trying some of their more basic flavors.

Federal Donuts is an institution here in Philly. They have built a great brand with recognition locally. This is definitely something to try when you are in town

Delicious donuts - I got the half dozen classics donuts to share with no high expectations thinking it was just donuts but wow... not sure how they can make plain chocolate donut and cake donuts so addicting? Told myself I was only going to eat 1 but ended up eating 2 donuts. (this is coming from someone who doesn't even like donuts that much). As I'm writing this review I'm thinking about eating another one... 

If you're a donut lover you'll love this place!! Must try :)

Great, high-quality donuts that aren't too sweet. I'm surprised by how much my family and I enjoyed the ones I picked up. I would recommend all of them except for the sugar plum because even though the sugar crystal sprinkles were pretty, they felt texturally unpleasant. That's just my opinion though!

This Federal Donuts is located inside Whole Food's, in their new food court, also has been referred to as "restaurant row". 

While I was shopping at this Whole Foods, I decided to try Federal Donuts. I came around 1:30 pm. There was no line but had to wait as 2 employees were busy filling an order for the woman waiting near the register. After that, this male employee took my order. I decided to get:

Strawberry Lavender, $1.75- This was served warm and had a nice flavor of sugar strawberry. The lavender was subtle.

Peach Ricotta, $2.75- I was curious as to what this would taste like and decided to order this. This donut has a glaze of peach and the middle is filled with ricotta. The peach is a little too sweet. Please note that this donut was not served warm and is considered a fancy donut, thus a higher price. I did not know this since there was no sign on the display case to indicate these are fancy donuts (I don't eat donuts often). 
---------------------------
(Total= $4.50, tax included)

I was disappointed that the donuts fell apart too easily and made for a mess. They just didn't hold up, compared to other donuts that I have had before. 

I was also very disappointed with my visit when I came here. After I made my order, I gave the employee my credit card and he gave me a pager. After waiting 14 minutes with no buzzing or lights on the pager, my husband walked back up to the register to ask the employee where our order was. He apologized and said he completely forgot about us. Please note that after my order, there was only one other person who was waiting for their chicken sandwich. Then the place was empty. The 3 employees behind the counter were just talking to each other. This employee began placing our donuts in a bag and said he would give us extra as an apology for making us wait. I didn't know why it took so long and just assumed they making my donut fresh or something. 

I don't get what all the hype is all about with Federal Donuts. Is it because they sell chicken too? 

This place really was just average for me. But with the long wait time (if my husband had not inquired, then who knows how long we would have waited. And we were sitting at a table right in front of the register so the employee must have known we were there waiting...). I would not come back here. 

Please note that this location only takes credit and debit cards are payment.
Too-soft ice cream. Kids working don't pay attention to you and chat with each other. Bad ice cream. I like DQ, but not this one!

If there was a zero star rating that's how I would rate this location. 
It is the worst ice cream ever. Not sure how the ice cream is mixed but it is NOT creamy. The ice cream is like eating air. Ewwww.

I have always been a big fan of Dairy Queen. I have visited this location several times. They offer ice cream at the drive thru for dogs. I recently ordered a cake online through them. It was ordered a week in advance and even received a confirmation email for my order. When we went to pick up the ordered cake for my son's 15th birthday we were told that it was no longer an option and they were not making it any more. I didn't get an email or a phone call to let me know the order couldn't be placed. This was a big disappointment since we had no cake for my son's party. The young girls at the counter called the manager or owner, whoever it was.  They were instructed to give us 25% off a cake from their selection of cakes in the freezer. Big disappointment!! Bad customer service and not a care in the world to ruin a party because of their neglect.  We will never give them out support again.

Just wish they could realize people go through a drive through for quick service.  Please management, hire more help!  Waiting 10 minutes in a drive through is crazy.  Luckily the people who eventually served us were very nice.

The ice cream was disgusting. I ordered a cookie dough blizzard, and it tasted like citrus fruit. It was so bad that I couldn't eat more than a few bites. They didn't even mix the topping all the way through the blizzard. Just some cookie dough on the top. I won't be returning.
Run away this place is for the dogs ..... go to another dairy queen the ice cream is not good and they don't follow the other dairy queen sales

Worse drive thru ever.  Waited 10 minutes just for someone to take our order than had to wait another 5 for our order.  Waited 4 minutes till I got home to eat my cookie sundae only for the cookie to be rock hard.  Will not be returning.

Is it possible to give a zero star review?

Do not go here. In fact, this place needs to be reported to the dept of health. The counters where the workers prepared the ice cream were filthy from previous ice cream making. Ice cream was dripping from the main machine onto the floor. The sink was filled with utensils and equipment. 

There was a 5 gallon sized tub of cherries on the counter and the workers would just grab a spoon and pour cherries over a sundae. Any extra cherries would fall back into the big vat. Over and over. 

When leaving we walked around to the back of the building and saw multiple trash bags lined up, not in a trash can or dumpster, just thrown on the floor. The door was propped open and there was no screen or anything to prevent bugs or rodents from walking right in. We witnessed a younger employee making a hot meal and were immediately disgusted by the preparation techniques: no gloves, cross contamination from using the same utensil, and the "prep counter" was filled with scraps of food and debris from previous meals. 

It was awful.

So is this the best dairy Queen ever? No. But it's passible and for those of us in Royersford it is super convenient. The drive-thru is slow, there is actually a sign that says if you're going to order food after 7 p.m. please go inside. But the service is friendly and the ice cream is decent so I'm okay with it. Usually I just wind up getting my favorite chocolate dipped cone or getting the kids in the wife mini blizzards. for some reason they don't participate in the blizzard upside down or it's free promotion along with other things. I have no idea why, the management is a little strange from what I've observed.

Wow, can't believe the poor reviews this place has received. This will be my 3rd straight Sunday visiting this location, and I think the place is pretty clean and ice cream is good!
Staff could be a little friendlier, but I'm looking for good ice cream, not necessarily a new best friend.

I was so happy with my service last night at DQ. Me and my friends wanted to get ice cream late at night and ended up getting there 2 minutes before closing. Even though we were so close to when they closed the still served us with amazing ice cream. I go the new Salted caramel blondie, it was go good. All though I was sad that she didn't serve it to me upside do she was very pleasant even with us coming in so late. Thank You. :)

If you want to get the wrong order every visit, then look no further. I don't believe they've ever gotten my entire order right at this location. Last night they made my blizzard THREE times and still on the third attempt it was wrong. Nothing like paying $10 for two blizzards and both of them being wrong. Would not recommend this DQ, you're better off paying a little more to go to Bruster's.
This is my local DQ that me & 3 kids often frequent for over 10yrs. Not once have we ever experienced a problem with anything. Always fast & delicious!

If I could give no stars I would after tonight's visit. It was less than lucky to find the first long hair in my blizzard this evening right after taking off my to go lid, but then to find a completely DIFFERENT HAIR in my blizzard not 1/4 inch away from the first was just pathetic. I'm used to service being hit or miss, but this just sucked. Maybe Santa will bring some hairnets for the employees stockings
The fried chicken here is delicious.  It's got a little KICK to it. Really fantastic.
Love them chicken wings here. Ask for the special sauce! They will make magic in your mouth.

today for the 1st time long time resident in the area stopped and got 3-3 piece chickens dark meat chicken was extremely dry hard on the outside there was no ice in the ice machine and the price was ridiculous as far as I'm concerned I  Will not bother to come back to this dump

This afternoon after a hard workout on the bball court I went to krispy krunchy chicken to replenish my fuel and electrolytes.  I got the 4 piece chicken tenders because I'm not a big fan of bones in my chicken.  And with my chicken I had a honey butter biscuit and red Gatorade to help my vains pop out of my arms.  My first bite of chicken was definitely crispy and most certainly crunchy but the chicken itself was kind of tough but because my mouth is so ripped it was not that bad.  I ate the chicken like a savage lion, king of the jungle.  When I grow up I will have a pet lion to guard my house.  But the chicken was far from my favorite part.  The honey butter biscuit was like kissing the hand of DJ Tanner or Fuller (if you are a fuller house fan) from Full House.  It was so delicate, beautiful, and tasty .  The one negative about this establishment is that they had a sign that said no shoe no shirt no service.  Well debatable because I have rock hard abs because I do sit ups and my feet are pretty much super model like.  I have been asked to be a foot model but I humbly declined because I did not want people to be jealous of my feet.  In conclusion my overall experience was good so I give this place 69 hams out of 80 sausages.

I got my chicken on DoorDash and it was great.  Fries are huge and delicious.  Chicken was Krunchy on outside, juicy on inside.  The chicken breasts were three times bigger than KFC.  Mash potatoes good too.  I recommend.
The food is always good. But if u come u have to get the sweet tea. It's the best in the bay.

Since there was only 1 other review, I decided to review my favorite fast Chinese in St Pete. 

I love close to downtown, but the couple places I went to downtown seemed dirty, and smelled like rancid grease so I didn't order. 

The Star is clean and run by a family. The neighborhood may seem rough to those who've never experienced a real rough neighborhood, but I've never seen an incident happen in the 4ish years I've been going there. I will say this is more of a take out place. There are tables, but I've never seen anyone eat there. 

On to the food, while I won't say it's the best Chinese I've ever had, it would be acceptable in any city up north as your local Chinese spot. It's the Americanized Chinese I expect without the sickly sweet Panda Express type sauces.

Not the best, not the worst, fine for a Chinese food fix.

I have two co workers that eat here religiously.  One can call in an order and does not even have to identify herself anymore.  We ended up ordering take out for a staff meeting.  Therefore, I have not seen the actual building, but I have tasted the food.

I was very skeptical when I heard we were getting Chinese food.  I ordered the beef and broccoli.  It comes with either a soda or an egg roll.  I got the egg roll.  The beef was tender, but a little fatty (and I'm a person who loves fat).  I enjoyed the egg roll, but the wrap was a little heavy.  I really enjoyed the sauce the dish was doused in and soaked it all up with my white rice.  

Overall, this place was the epitome of fast Chinese food.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but I'm happy enough if someone gives it to me.

This was the worst General Tso's I've ever had. I honestly do not think there was any chicken in it. Some places seem to use chicken skins in their General's lunch special - but this place doesn't even do that. I will NEVER go back.
The food is great they have many different combinations of food, take a look for your self, the service is quick and friendly, they also make a home made Tea it's worth the money

The wings are good but the service is terrible. The only English they know, is the $ they demand. They don't show basic manners. Gave me the wrong food, made it extremely hard to return took 3 trips, and they didn't even apologize. They take from the community, but they don't appreciate us, and they never give back. They'll even charge you extra for 1 sauce , not 2, 1!

Valet parking is $4, parking in the lots $3 with a free trolley ride or you can walk. There are shops and restaurants here. On the rainy day I visited the Pier, valet was full; however, I was able to locate parking in the nearby parking lots. Given my hairstyle (lack of hair), the little drizzle didn't phase me a bit. If you do park near the Pier (via street meters or parking lot), pay for the time you plan to spend at the Pier or the nearby museums, shops, and restaurants. The Pier is centrally located to many boutiques, restaurants, movie theater, parks (including a doggie park), etc.

This is definitely geared toward tourists.  Inside the pier are a lot of little 'touristy' shops and eateries.  We paid $3 to park 'for the day' and were only there about 40 minutes.  

The 2nd floor has an aquarium but it was closed when we were there on a Sunday afternoon.  I can't imagine that it is better than the Tampa Aquarium though.  

It is nice to go and walk along the water, but you can do that many places in the area.

Visit the Pier for spectacular view of St Pete and the water.  They have an aquarium, shops, restaurants and bars.  Something for everyone.  Come rent a fishing pole and fish for a day.  If biking is for you then you can rent a single double or a bike that will fit a family of five.
Before it closed, luckily I was able to visit this beautiful spot in St. Petersburg, FL. Sad it is closed/closing.  :-(  It was a wonderful pier overlooking the Gulf of Mexico.

Always a great place the relax and have a few drinks.
PROS:
Beautiful view
Cute shops to look into
Live music
Valet parking

CONS:
Usually Dead
Expensive cocktails
A little Boring and run down

There just isn't really a whole lot to see or do here. The past few times we visited, it was pretty dead on the rooftop, and I felt sorry for the performer there. He was basically singing to himself.

Nice place to go for one or two drinks though, just to catch the view.

From what I hear, this place is supposed to go under major rehab soon and I guess it needs it. As someone whose never been to St. Pete, I thought it was pretty sweet, but Grandma said it's seen better days and the Aquarium isn't worth the admission price, which I was bummed about since I though it'd be cool to check out. 

Anyway, it was pouring rain the day we went so, it was super gross and didn't do the pier any justice. We rode the trolly for 50 cents (25 cents for seniors) for a tour of the town and that was 5 stars all the way. We learned a lot of fun facts about St. pete and saw what it had to offer. Now I want it to be my first stop back in Florida next time I'm down this way!

The Pier is something you probably need to do when visiting St Pete. 

It is conveniently located near the downtown shops and attractions.  It offers great views of the waterfront parks which stretch some seven miles along the waterfront.

The shops are pretty touristy.  There are a number of restaurants on the pier and they all offer great water views.  If nothing else, stop by for a drink!

I understand that the Pier will be demolished and replaced soon so, catch it before it goes...

I have to admit I was a little disappointed. Great place to go and feel the sea breeze but other than that there's really not a whole lot to it.  A few overpriced souvenir shops, a few fast food eateries that leave alot to be desired and a couple of  restaurants that are way overpriced for food they were serving.  We sat at one table for about 15 min just to order a few drinks and an appetizer and nevr got served.  My advise...just pack a sandwich and a bottled water...set outside and enjoy the breeze!

I went her for a family function after not visiting the pier for over four years. They used to have a virtual reality ride in the front, which was much fun, but it appears to have disappeared from the place. They schedule boat trips around here since it's the pier and I hear DOLPHINS are around. 

(jumps up and down)

The restaurants located inside are spectacular, especially the one on the top floor, because of its excellent American food and the great view of the water you can get there. Sometimes people rent out the place in order to have wedding receptions or homecoming events, or even prom, but usually you can still walk around the top either way.

On another floor there is an aquarium with a select variety of fish, though it isn't at shocking as the Florida Aquarium. You'll find many tourist shops around here as well, so if you're not a tourist you should head down to the Baywalk to shop.

To summarize in one word: FANTASTIC!

St Petersburg Pier, we tried to do the free alfresco salsa dancing bit. Alas, we'd missed the lesson and there were no available partners. So the dancers who were there didn't know we could dance. No names on my dance card at all. Oh well.

Alfresco salsa dancing to a live band on a Sunday is not the only reason to go to St Petersburg Pier. But its one of the better ones. The rest of the stuff is just touristy shops selling stuff like salt water taffy, kitschy t-shirts, or sand candles.

There is a trolley that will bring you to the shopping/dining area for free after you park your car in the $3.75 lot. And there are plenty of park benches all around if you need to take a break. I'd return to the pier. It's a-ok.

Go there For the View. The food is maybe ok if you can figure out the menu.  The coffee is not good the the place looks old and dirty so if you are taking business assocates to eat make it dinner because there is to much light at lunch time and the floors show there age. I don't think they vaccum very offten.

Love the area and the view, but the tower thing could use a revamp in the stores that are there.  But then again, it is geared for locals.  Parking is pretty easy to find and there are some happenin' bars/restaurants (including a columbia!) on the top floors.

Don't go here for the aquarium or the cheesy gift shops, because both are mediocre at best.  The spectacular view of the Tampa Bay and the beach more than makes up for it.  And if I remember that place correctly, the Cha Cha Coconuts on the roof is a great bar to provide drinks and other libations to sit back and enjoy the scene.

I go visit the St. Petersburg Pier ever time I visit Florida.  I enjoy the walk to the Pier and hanging out on the 5th floor where they have a balcony overlooking the water.  There is not really much to do at the Pier.  It is definitely a tourist trap and a bit outdated.  There is an aquarium, restaurants and different shots to visit.

This Pier is ok, nothing fantastic about it.   The Pier is well maintained but the restaurants inside are not that appealing.  This Pier is a LONG walk and when you get to the end you are ready for some grub but the concession choices are not very appealing.   We visited some seafood restaurant inside and the food was not memorable.  Ok for the sights, just eat somewhere else before you come here.

What I remember most about our visit to the Pier are the pelicans. Huge! Never seen pelicans that size. Unreal. Got my pic taken with them, cool! 

The Pier is quite organized. Valet parking = good. We are very particular about food, so we stopped at the information desk to talk with the people working there. They didn't know much about the restaurants' offerings but had a binder full of menus to look through. That really helped point us in the right direction. We had a couple of fantastic meals at Captain Al's, thanks to them! 

The gift shops are basic cheesy touristy deals, no harm done. They are not as classy as the ones I'm used to on the Santa Cruz pier or Pier 39 in San Francisco, but I bought a few postcards. Never saw the aquarium, had heard about it but we just didn't have time to explore that much. People were friendly.

Wish we could have seen the Pier in all its lit up nighttime splendor, but I'm not usually up that late so I rely on pictures -- they really are something. 

As a native of the CA coast, it was really nice to visit a pier that encompassed warm weather. How great to feel the Gulf breezes in a light sundress and sandals instead of being bundled from head to toe in the CA cold! The most use I get out of my sundresses is when I'm in FL!

The missing star is because it's so dirty. Didn't seem to be any cleanup of bird crap going on, and it was piled everywhere. While the setting has the potential to be spectacular, with the water and sunsets/sunrise, I couldn't feel it as a romantic place, with all the feces.

The pier itself is cool. The restaurant at the top (Cha Cha something) and Columbia are both great. But, the atmosphere around the pier is a little worrisome. It got increasingly...ghetto as night approached. I got the feeling that it is more of a tourist destination than where the locals hang out. Plus, you have to pay to park which is a little silly in my mind considering it's a public place. 

I did enjoy visiting it though. The bar on the bottom had amazing margaritas. (The bartender made them really fancy!) 

Honestly, we felt like we were on a cruise ship when we walked in the main doors of the pier. Interesting ambiance! 

I hope I get to see it at least one more time before they break it all down. 

FYI: I think the pelicans are the best part.

The St. Petersburg Pier is set to close in about 8 weeks. So if you have not been, or have not been in a long time, get out there and check it out! Here's the scoop:

Locals - not much for you at the Pier except gorgeous views of the water, some good fruity drinks, and St. Pete's own version of The Columbia restaurant

Tourists - Inside the Pier you can find various stores selling souvenirs and novelty items. There is a hat shop, a candle maker, a photo booth, a few souvenir shops featuring Pier items and Florida items. There is a food court, and 3 main restaurants. This is the place to go to take pictures! On level 5 there is an observation deck with water as far as the eye can see.

The food at the Pier is just so-so. Maybe grab a meal on Beach Drive before venturing to the Pier if you are a foodie. On my most recent visit, I went to Cha-Cha Coconuts for the first time. The atmosphere was great, but the food was disappointing. I did buy a souvenir magnet of the Pier to remember it by, after it is gone.

The pier has definitely seen better days, but the location is terrific.  The quality of the food at the different venues is sketchy at best and most of the retail shops are tourist traps, but if you go for a stroll, watch the pelicans (you can feed them at the bait shop) or go fishing, it is definitely a nice area.

Eh. I didn't care for this place at all.  

Now if you tend to like touristy places, IE shops and restaurants that cater to out of towners this might be the place for you.  

Personally I always hope to use yelp to steer me away from such places. 

As some other reviewers mentioned Might be worth visiting to grab a few drinks up top and check out the view (might capitalized intentionally).  But after about 2 minutes I knew this was not a place I wanted to spend anytime.

Great views! The food and shops seem ok. There is a neat candle making place and a good hot sauce shop. Didn't go into the small aquarium, but seems like a good place to take younger kids and not worry about losing them.

What a waste of time, resources/money, and property. The pier is on every list of "things to do" in St. Pete, but I wish we'd ignored that. Typical crappy tourist junk in a few shops on the ground level, a lame-looking aquarium on the 2nd level (didn't pay to go in, but from what I could see at the entrance, it wasn't worth it), and two overpriced (and undoubtedly sub-par) restaurants at the top. There's an observation deck at the top, which is fine and all, but not much to see, and with a lack of seating (except in the overpriced restaurant area). You're better off in one of the many parks at street level just relaxing in the grass, or at a nearby beach.

She still needs some work, but hopefully the renovations will do just that. 

Was out there today for a great shopping event, but under normal circumstances the retailing out there isn't the best. The quality of the stores isn't anything that should drive much business, and it just feels like a run-down tourist trap that got left behind by more modern and better entertainment areas The parking situation doesn't help either, as unless you valet for $4 plus tip, you'll either need to hike or take a shuttle when things are busy.

The views from the pier themselves of both the water, south St. Pete, and Tampa Bay are sublime. You have to love the view of both Straub Park and The Vinoy if you're facing northeast. But that's not enough to drive people there.

There are discussions about massive renovations and an overhaul, which might be a wonderful idea if the city is willing to make the investment (ask the Rays about working with the local St. Pete government to get something built, however). But if you're looking for a funn destination for shopping and an entertainment complex, you might be sadly disappointed.

It's all I could find to do with the one day I had in St Pete, which was a Sunday and I was carless. I was pretty disappointed by The Pier. The aquarium was dinky, the shops were simultaneously eclectic and boring, and the food court was kind of sad. (The ice cream place was halfway decent though.)

The free shuttle to the parking was helpful though. And I've never seen wild dolphins, so seeing them in the water alongside the pier was fun.

My wife and I strolled down to the pier after seeing a movie at Baywalk.  It is actually a very nice walk down 2nd Ave all the way to the Pier.  They also offer free shuttle service from a couple of the parking lots.  It was a nice day so we decided to take the walk.  The only problem with the Pier is once you actually get to it.  There is almost nothing to do.  Pretty big disappointment.  We had been there before, so we had proper expectations.

The shops inside the pier are very touristy and dinky - not even much to look at.  The "food court" looks like it should either be in an arcade or a roller rink.  The aquarium isn't much of anything.  I have heard that the restaurant on top, Columbia, is pretty good but we didn't eat there.  

It is kind of a shame because I feel like the Pier has so much potential, but there isn't much of anything to do once you actually get down there.  It is definitely a nice walk on a beautiful day but it really doesn't offer much more than that.

Nice place to be by the water. We were able to see all the seagulls and also wild dolphin up close. There are a bunch of stores on the pier but non that caught my eye. You have to pay for parking and or valet which i thought could have been shut off during the weekday because it was very quiet and not busy at all.

Jimmy Reno's on the pier is a Casual beach bar/restaurant with dining inside and a bar and dining outside on the Pier itself. Arrived on a weekend day at 1:30pm and they had live guitar music outside at the bar. There is a very small menu- burgers, grouper sandwiches, hot dogs, chicken sandwich, shrimp po'boy, 4 "dinner entrees", 4 apps,  2 salads, and 5 sides choices. Luckilly, the beer selection is much larger than the food selection.

I Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and substituted grilled veggies for fries. The sandwith was very nice size and the grilled  veggies were very good and included red & yellow peppers, zucchini, onions, & raddachio (which I could have done without).

Overall, your average beach bar kind of place. Wouldn't go out of my way to go back, but if I was on the pier I would go again.

This is supposedly a major attraction in St. Petersburg and I don't know why. It's literally a crappy mall on the water. It has about 5 stores (actually there's a good hat store if you're looking for a hat!) and 4 restaurants. The view from Cha Cha Coconuts is good, but that's pretty much all The Pier has going on. Don't waste your time stopping here.

The pier isn't all that great, but if you are a tourist in the area, make sure you at least see it. Head downtown and see the area, possibly take a free trolley out to it, walk the perimeter of the pier, but you don't need to go inside really.

Downstairs consists of overpriced tourist shops (a hat shop,candle store, salsa/hot food store...), a small food court that's always quiet and makes me a little depressed when I sit there. 

Upstairs there is a small aquarium. I went here a few times as a child on school field trips, but I don't think I would ever actually pay more than 10 dollars to go inside.

On the roof there is a semi-expensive restaurant and a great view. You're more than welcome to go up to the top and just look at the view. Watch for planes out of the airport to the south (Albert Whitted) and check out the fireworks, if there's an event going on in the town from this roof..although it's usually crowded.

Back outside you can catch the Looper, a free (I believe.) trolley around the area, or catch one of the trolleys back to a parking lot so that you don't have to walk the distance of the pier, unless you want a walk. You can rent bikes, begin segway tours here and go fishing.

I used to come here and jog with my dog when it was still open. Duh amazing sunsets from here even. Though the inverted pyramid was closed, the pier was still in decent shape. It's hard finding a new spot to jog with a water view all around. I can't wait for the new pier to open in a few years and will not only be back to jog but also to enjoy the spectacular view!
absolute waste of time. crappy food, dumb shops (candles, random hats), terrible aquarium (go to tampa).

Beautiful views from an iconic structure. Too bad no one knows how turn it into a destination hot spot.  It's still worth having a drink on a pretty day and enjoying the view.  I hear The Columbia Restaurant on the 4th floor is pretty good, although I haven't tried that one yet.

It's tired, outdated, worn, and rather sad...but it's worth a visit - especially if you were putting around downtown St Pete with out-of-town guests.

It is a part of St Pete history, and you get a classic view of the downtown "skyline" from the water-side which you wouldn't normally be able to see.

I expect the whole thing will be demolished and rebuilt in the next few years, so take a peek while you can. Ride the elevator to the top floor and have a drink at the open-air bar up top. There's some good photo ops up there too.

Yum! We decided to try Salam Café for the first time for lunch. I ordered by calling them directly. We had one platter with chicken kebab and some very yummy sides, as well as an Ethiopian platter (okra, collard greens, lentils). We opted to get Injera with both dishes, but rice is also available. The food was ready quickly, and it was fun to be able to go and pick out some fun drinks to go with our food. The food was extremely tasty and satisfying! Will absolutely be ordering again in the future!
Delicious, generous portions. After a busy work day, it was great to pick up dinner for the family. We've picked up take out a few times, and they never disappoint.

Salam Cafe and Market is such a wonderful addition to Germantown.  Right at the corner of Armat and Greene Street, near Maplewood Mall, it is not only a cafe and a specialty market for packaged and prepared foods, but also a restaurant that serves a small menu of home style Ethiopian and Mediterranean-ish foods.  The portions are large, the prices are very reasonable, and everything we ate was fresh and delicious.  The lentil sambusas and the Ethiopian vegan platter were outstanding.  They do not skimp on the spice and there are so many vegetables in so many iterations on the menu.  They also do weekend specials and American-style breakfasts.  The owner is just lovely.  Salam Cafe and Market has a Facebook page with the menu posted, but I don't they have a website yet.

The hours are posted as 8am - 8pm Monday through Saturday, but I would recommend calling first.
Love having delicious Ethiopian food close to Mt Airy. We order delivery pretty regularly and it's always delicious. This place is great!

We highly recommend the Salam Cafe after celebrating a birthday by ordering the three-person dining experience. We picked our appetizers, our entrees, (the Ethiopian Beef, Ethiopian Chicken and the Lamb shanks) and our desserts. The entrees came with two different vegetable sides, six different sides in all, plus injera to soak it all up. I placed the entrees on a large round pan and we dug in. The quality of food was outstanding and the prices were very reasonable. 'Still swooning after having my lunchtime leftovers.
This food is sooooooooooo yummy. We got takeout for the first time a few weeks ago and still can't stop thinking about it. Can't wait to order again soon

This was my first visit - and won't be my last! Wonderful vegan platter (take-out) with  a large injera (the spongy, gluten-free Ethiopian flatbread made from teff flour), lentils and my choice of two sides - I elected the collard greens and chickpeas. All very subtly, complexly flavored. And one take-out order will make two meals for me. Delish!

Kind of hard to find because it's inside of a gas station and the signage doesn't actually say "Nevada taco shop" but once you do find it, man is it good! Cheap and deep fried so you'll have to use a cheat day on this one. Lots of combo options. I have ordered delivery from them too and the order is always correct and delivered quickly. If you need to fill up your tank (pun intended!) check this place out!

My first order was their tacos and I wasn't too impressed, They were kinda dry. But then I ordered their "Nevada Burritos" and they were excellent! Very tasty and loaded with ingredients, I got filled up just eating one of them and that's unusual for me.
I look forward to ordering from NTS again. Whenever I crave a burrito, they will be my first choice!

I found this place by accident and I'm glad I did. It is literally inside a mini mart. The signage is not great. However, if you are heading north on Kietzkie Lane, it is the gas station just after you cross the intersection at Mill St. It is Strickly take out although they put one small table with two chairs in the shopping area. Awkward and mostly used to sit and wait for your order, although you won't wait long. We have tried the California burrito that my boyfriend swears is far better than Roberto's . I've had the enchiladas and this time the Asada fries...also better than Roberto's.  Generous portiin of fries, meat and cheese and perfect anoynts of guacamole and sour cream. The closing hours are inconsistent but it appears just one person is running the operation. We have foybd them open at least until 10 pm but not 11 pm as stated on google. Give them a a shot, you will not be disappointed.

This place is a little hidden gem. Tucked inside a gas station found out about it because of yelp. The "NEVADA burrito" was delicious. Started with fresh crisp tortilla, loaded with a fresh cooked generous portion of Asada, perfectly crispy fries, guacamole, and sour cream. Perfect, best California style burrito in Reno. Also green salsa was delicious.

Don't.
Just......Don't.
Really, Taco Bell is a better option. Seriously.
Worst enchiladas I've had maybe. A British woman once made me one with ketchup that was worse but she was British, so you can't expect it to be good, right?
But I guess if you're looking to get two types of gas in one stop, this would do the trick.
Chicken Tacos were very good but disappointed in the chimichanga and burrito neither had very much meat in them.

No complaints as far as Taco Bells go. Terrible for you and terribly delicious. This place is my fast food kryptonite. 

The service here is quick & friendly and they've never screwed up my order, which is more than I can say for other Taco Bell locations.

I've eaten a couple of times at this Taco Bell, but I prefer the full sized version. I'm not crazy about food court versions of restaurants, but some like Chick-Fil-A pull it off a little better.  I've had better (Taco Bell).  If I was in the mall and had a sudden, irresistible craving for a Fresco Taco, I'd stop here. But it'd have to be one of those pregnancy type cravings with a big risk of breaking water.  Otherwise I'd drive to the one on Waters and Hanley. 

P.S. The pregnancy comment was a metaphor. You know, me being a guy and all. I mean, errr, never mind....
Don't bother to come here just for the Taco Bell, they gouge the prices and don't do happy hour, they raise the prices about $1.50 for almost every item

Love this Taco Bell it's an experience like no other and I've had some pretty crappy experiences at some others. The service is friendly and the manager Shakira just really makes the time worthwhile. Highly recommended and will return for sure! Thanks.

This is a Taco Bell, inside a mall no less, so you'd think it might be terrible. Honestly, this location is pretty good. The staff I've interacted with have been friendly and put out orders in an acceptable time frame. They can appear stressed when you first walk up, but, come on, they work at a fast food place in a mall. Cut them some slack. When I'm nice to them, they're nice right back and always helpful if I have a question about something. (Just HOW large is an XXL Stuft Burrito?)

The aspect that scores this location one star higher than I'd normally rate a Taco Bell is how much food they cram into every taco, burrito, chalupa, etc. There is absolutely nothing worse than ordering a taco, settling down to gorge, and you discover there's a sprinkling of a meat you didn't order and two shreds of lettuce. The items I order are always packed full and hot, and my order is fulfilled accurately.

If you've got the craving for food that is definitely not good for you, I've found this location to be a solid choice.

It's the finest in the land. I eat all the food here. No MSG. Kind people generous portions. General tao China chicken is very tasty and chicken has a crunch. Not mushy!  Chicken fry rice always tasty. I will always eat here!

Been about three years since I last had their food and it has not changed. Egg foo young was ok,Fried Chicken wings were Overcooked,Unchanged Oil/Burn't oil. same "Kid' behind counter (order taker) appeared "High". Very poor English ,even after years of dealing with people. I Will NOT go back to China Wok in Gallatin ,Until new Ownership or Management takes over. Wings were a waste of 5.95 + tax. Very surprised they are still in Business !
The food is awesome here & the prices aren't bad either. If your wanting Chinese I'd definitely say to go here.

Must have been a busy night. Food was not good stale fried noddles crab Rangoon was over fried and cold not ate-able. Rice was dry.  May need to look for another Chinese restaurant. 
I know they can do better.

Food was great and accurate. The Coconut Chicken  was awesome and plentiful. Fried Dumplings were good but smaller than what we are use to. Rangoon was interesting, needs more stuffing and Donuts were yummy. General Tso lunch version was also good. Not bad for first order. Hope they are consistent. Also been here a year and first Chinese takeout we tried.

All I got was shrimp fried rice.  I was surprised when I opened the container and it was brown, not as in using brown rice but literally marinated in soy sauce!  It was so salty it was inedible.  Believe it or not I went to another Chinese place for a quart of fried rice thinking that mixing the two would make it edible and give me leftovers.  Nope. So salty it burns my tongue.

I am a huge Chinese food lover. Honestly. Could eat it everyday. We got take out. Y'all their honey chicken is freakin amazing. The house special lo mein is very good as wel. The cream cheese rangoons are crunchy and not overly stuff but that is just how I like them. My friend said her general tso was off the chain too. Highly recommend. I am very pleased with this place and the freshness of our food.

I like China Wok because they are close, cheap, and reliable Chinese with a minimum of fuss. Our family's favorites are their General Tso's chicken and beef lo mein. That being said, I tried their beef pad thai for the first time today and it was the blandest pad thai I have ever tried and my expectations were not high. Everything else we tried was decent but wanted to throw in my two cents, do not order the pad thai, it is not worth the money.

If you're not sure what you want to eat and like to gamble on dinner, try China Wok in Gallatin! You have a 50/50 chance of getting the right order or getting good food! After one year of patronage, we give up! Upon calling the restaurant to advise of our last incorrect order, they offered 10% off our next meal. They didn't even offer to replace the incorrect item with the correct item. Done! The language barrier also makes it difficult to obtain accurate feedback of your order.

Ordered online to pick up on my way home.  Ordered Pork Fried Rice and Beef Pad Thai.  I enjoyed the PFRice the most.  Ordered the "small" but was enough for 2 meals.  Good amount of pork and great flavor overall. 
Same with the Pad Thai-very generous portion.  I think I was expecting it to taste similar to another chain restaurant's pad Thai so I was thrown off a bit on first bite.  It was really good too-just not what I expected. Order was correct-no issues. Much better Chinese food than the options closer to where I live.

This review is based off the food alone...

I really didn't know what to expect walking in but I'm pregnant and really had a Chinese food craving. Their menu is big. I'm used to ordering Chinese at places that have it all made in dishes to pick from...SO since everything is made to order here I took a stab in the dark at menu items I was familiar with from other restaurants. We got the Broccoli Beef with Lo Mein and Orange Chicken with Fried Rice. We also ordered cheese wontons. 
The 2 dishes were SO good! The Lo Mein was probably my favorite part. Mmmmmmm yum. Generous portions. My husband and I shared both dishes with leftovers at the end. The wontons were just ok. I wouldn't order those again. A couple egg rolls somehow made it into my bag even though I didn't order them. Those were really good too. 
I'm excited to go back and try more things and get some more Lo Mein! Tip:call ahead and order for pickup so it's ready when you get there. Because they make everything to order it takes a little more time then I thought it would...which is great but I'll order before I get there next time! Need to grab a to go menu to keep at the house. 
If you're in the mood for fresh Chinese that blows Panda Express out of the water then give them a try. It's nothing flashy and the guy at the counter is a man of few words haha but the food is worth it! 
I w

I order online all the time but the last two times they haven't had my order ready. They didn't even know that I had ordered. The kid at the front counter blamed me and asked if I was sure if I order online so I showed him the receipt on my phone. He is always rude and has no personally at all. The food is always great but they need to get some better help there

One of the better Chinese restaurants in Gallatin. Their Hong Kong General Tzo's chicken is pretty great. The egg rolls and crab ragoons are equally great. I wished they delivered. If u find yourself in Gallatin give this place a try

We have been frequenting China Wok over the last year since moving to the area. For the last several times when we order, the restaurant just can't make an order correctly.  Unfortunately, the gentleman answering the phone isn't too fluent in English.  We had decided to use their online ordering in hope of receiving a correct order. I had to call the restaurant as the online system placed an order for 2 sweet and sour chicken dinners, when only one was needed.  We confirmed the order for one of each broccoli and shrimp, egg roll, hot and sour soup, and sweet and sour chicken.  We arrived at the restaurant to pay and pick up the order. I will own that I didn't check the order prior to leaving. Upon arrival at home, we received broccoli and beef instead of the ordered broccoli and shrimp.  Immediately I telephoned the restaurant to advise of the error.  Once again, the gentleman answering the phone says we can comeback to exchange it.  I mentioned we weren't getting back out and they could provide a credit for our next order.  He replied with offering 10% off next order.  I suggested 50% since this isn't the first time.  After he conversed in Chinese with another man in the background, he offered 35%.  I told him we have been regular customers over the year and future repeat business was at stake.  I truly do not believe he understood me.  Needless to say, we will not return to China Wok.  There are other places who care about you as a customer and are ready to earn your money.  So if you want to play roulette with your food, you're in the right place.  If you want a sure bet on your order, try somewhere else.

Nasty food.  After waiting 5 minutes for the cashier to payout her coworkers ( why do that in front of customers?)  we ordered a chicken Florentine. This was the worst food we have received in recent memory. The chicken was not only ice cold and flavor less, it had the consistency of tuna which makes me believe it was canned chicken.  Avoid this place at all costs.  Expensive, cluess customer service and just plain nasty.

The crepes were good! We ordered mostly savory and one sweet to share. The texture of the crepe itself was perfect. They were pretty overfilled (which might be a perk to some!), so they were sort of hard to eat. Overall, though, I liked it.

Crepes are good but, overpriced and customer service is terrible. Not worth the wait, took over 30 minutes to get two crepes, was not even busy. Understaffed and staff was rude and slow. Somehow it takes 45 minutes to make one crepe. This place needs to step up their game and learn some time management skills. Thanks anyways.

Shout out to this little spot right between the Holiday Inn and Edge Hotels. We came in for breakfast after a really stressful night before at Salty's where no one was wearing a mask and the staff's BS cop-out "we can't make people do it" attitude sent us running. Not only are the made-to-order crepes fantastic, but the two employees did the right thing to keep themselves and their patrons safe. It doesn't have to be a law to be store policy. Well done, Holy Crepe! We loved the eats, we loved the service, and we loved your stand-up business practice. This is a small business that deserves to stay open .

Unique place not too far from the sand. We got a few different sweet crepes and one breakfast crepe. They were decent and semi-filling. Be prepared to wait a bit as they make them in front of you. All in all a decent place o grab something a bit out of the ordinary.

These crepes are not small and definitely delicious. My wife and I split a Turkey Crepe and a Berry Swirl and left satisfied, though not full. The service was great, the man making the crepes I assume is the owner or manager was so nice and loaded up our crepes. He does overcook the crepes a bit, but still 5 stars

Crepes a GREAT!! Service was Ok, seemed organized when we walked it but then quickly realized it was not!!! The team members didn't know what was going on and just making crepe after crepe. Then the next day, the crepe maker was broke??? Weird.

Just OK. Understaffed. Disorganized. Bathroom barren of toilet paper. Crepe was good but didn't blow me away for price. And I know you're catering to a younger crowd but dang that music! Lots of little kids and families for that kind of vulgar music.
This place is amazing! Got the garden veggie crepe with Vermont cheddar & it did not disappoint! Staff is incredibly nice as well! Come early if you hungry bc there will be a rush for breakfast.

I love this restaurant! The art decor is sooo cute and makes me feel like I stepped into Paris. The Eiffel tower and the sunglasses on the wall make a great vacation photo op as well. The crepes are delicious and so light and tasty. I enjoy the outdoor seating - when we ate there, it was beautiful out and it was fun to eat on the beach strip. We ended up taking our crepes to go and walking along the beach and it was such a great experience.  We will definitely be back. The only downfall I see, is that there are so many options to choose from and so many items to customize your own crepe, that it took me a bit to decide.
Holy Crepe lived up to its name.  Their crepes are delicious but you do have to wait.  We waited 30 minutes for two crepes but it was worth it.  Great place to get one of you have the time.

This is crazy. I just tried to place a order for pick up. I was told NO and hung up on. I called back and was told by another employee "I just spoke to the head cashier and he said no" and was hung up on again. 0 stars!!! We're staying in the area for a vacation and will obviously not eat there. And I'll make sure to tell everyone I encounter about what happened! Crazy!!!

The three young people working here seemed miserable. Even my 5 year old said, "He doesn't like his job." I actually laughed because my 5 year old was right. The 3 workers seemed annoyed that we interrupted their " screen time". The most annoying thing was, we dined in & asked for forks and knives & the girl said, "We're out of silverware" and she went back to her cell phone. My kids (and wife) made a huge mess...for the workers to clean up. Good for my family! Don't recommend!

Great place for Crepes, worth the wait. The wait was a little longer than we had hoped but they had only 2 you g men working the register and making crepes. Christian was amazing with his memory of who ordered what! Him and another young man worked steady to get them all made. Amazing and hard working young men! Thank you guys for the amazing crepe! You both deserve a raise!!!
The disappointment was the Manager and or owner came out when they had at least 14 tickets he stopped one of the young men showing him a ticket taking him off the line and stopping production. Then standing in the way instead of washing his hands and jumping into help. Then disappeared to  the back again leaving them again to handle it themselves.
The staff was very rude and dirty looking. We were looking forward to trying it. They both scared us away before even ordering so I can't rate the food. We will not be giving them a second chance
Excellent experience, we ordered three savory crepes and all were very tasty. Service was quick and friendly.

Maybe it was the time we went but it was the worst crepe I've ever had. Walked in and the place seemed to be smoky. To my surprise we got crepes that were extremely burnt and overdone and definitely not how crepes are supposed to be. Very disappointed because I love crepes and we were visiting Clearwater for the first time. Would not recommend.

Love this place! It was fun to watch them make the crepes and even better to actually eat. They have an amazing array of flavors including sweet and savory options. The only bad thing I have to say is how long it took for us to get our crepes. It took us 30 minutes to receive our food and had to wait outside most the time because of limited space and tables inside. Overall really good though!

If in the Clearwater beach area, Holy Crepe is a really good place to go. They had a good and vast selection of crepe wraps. Me and my daughter got the Strawberry Shortcake, and the B.E.S.T. Crepes they were a delicious meal. You can eat they for breakfast, lunch, or dinner!

We ate at Holy Crepe on Sunday morning and it was fabulous! The wait was reasonable for a fresh, made to order crepe and for the amount of people in the restaurant. The service was good. We got the berry swirl and bananas foster crepes, would recommend!!!
The crepe was DELICIOUS! The only reason they didn't get 5 stars was because they regularly get backed up and the wait can be long.

Hooray for Holy Crepes! They were so good! We had a chicken cordon bleu crepe and a strawberry shortcake Nutella crepe. Soo yummy !

This is perfect to eat in their cute outside patio. They do have inside seats, or perfect to bring to the beach. The way they assemble them seriously is very portable as well.

So they had one person checking people out and one crepe maker. He did all the crepes and it was a lot! So seriously it took like half hour. So it's not a fast treat on a Saturday morning, but it's really good! 

So many options as/or even customizable. When you look at the menu, you will be like omg! 

Now I was confused I didn't see a coffee pot, but I did see creamer. Coffee would work here really well.

This is a perfect breakfast, lunch, snack or light dinner. So so good!! It is part of a groupof restaurants in Clearwater beach. 

Check them out!!! Such a great treat!

Went to popeyes today and it will not last long with the terrible service they arw giving. Bad attitudes from management on down. No one has a since of urgency we waited 20 mins for cold chicken and they forgot 2 sides. Then when we went back to the counter to get what we paid for and fresh chickwn they gave us attitude. I will never go here again horrible.

Went there on Wednesday at 7:47pm.  There were four people in line.  At 8:13pm, the manager declares that there are no more chicken sandwiches even though there are still 3 people in front of me and 2 people behind me.  How can you run out of chicken?
I like their food but the stuff who working at this brunch are really slow and not friendly
Worst Popeyes ever, the women work on front were rude , no ketchup no utensils, no napkins, are u kidding me ?

I waited 40 minutes to get 5 chicken tenders and the woman at the register was rude, she kept giving me nasty looks when i was ordering. don't waste your time here, go  to china panda across the food court
if you want popeyes then go to your murfreesboro road location or gallation road location you will get treated fairly and tell them  that mark sullivant sent you

Wow, just had PH wings and am surprised to say this may be my new 'favorite wings place'!! My wife just wolfed-down her Supreme Personal Pan pizza and said she wished she'd ordered two!   See ya soon for wings!!!

You buy food and have to pay for crush pepper? Might as well go another place. I hope to see Pizza Hut go out of business for good. can't even give 1 crush pepper. It's horrible. Other pizza places always give extra.

GHETTO Pizza Hut. Horrible service. DO NOT USE!
Ordered using mobile app at 9:30. I paid. Tipped driver. Got the Confirmation text. Checked the track my order. All was good. 30min eta

Everyone complaining they're hungry. "Where's the food?" they keep asking.   Hour and a half had passed -- order tracking still said same -30min. Called. No answer. Called again and again. Nothing.  
Now everything is closed. I paid for food I never received.  Large group of people are hungry. Everyone's angry with me.   I'm furious with Pizza Hut.  Not the first time had problems either.  Rarely are they issue free.   
     Pizza Hut online ordering system is dogshit. Delivery system is lazy. They sub every single order to door dash.  So if Pizza Hut miraculously doesn't screw it up- the jagoffs from DoorDash will.  Good luck with doordash.  50/50 chance you get your food cold or the driver callin 5x and stalling
    Never again.  Avoid this Pizza Hut like the plague. Thanks for nothing.
Service was outstanding! George was so helpful and keep me  feeling super safe when picking up my order! Super clean and will be coming back!

Completely got order wrong. Tried to blame outside delivery service when they have NOTHING to do with the order. If you can't read simple pizza order what else can we do???? But After much discussion says ok we will re-deliver to you out of our area(20 minutes). 1.5 hours later still no show. I call them, after 7 disconnects because goes to a call center, says oh yea we were there but couldn't find it so we came back. I said you couldn't call? Or ask the hundreds of neighbors walking around outside throughout the development? Outsourced delivery guy found it pretty well. Google maps has me no problem. I know you're not working career there but have to learn customer service and actual decency of caring.

I have been to this cosi twice now.. Although not the cleanest cosi it's location is convenient. During my last visit I ordered the steak salad. The first time I received it, there was a big hair on it staring at me, after an apology from the staff they made me another one. This time there was a random grape in the salad and the steak was not good at all. I must say the panera steak salad is superior by far.
Great bowls, nice sandwiches, salads are mostly greens but tasty. Great takeout. Service was friendly.

The staff is friendly and the food is great. Visit after 6pm because it should be less crowded. Unlike Brew-HaHa the employees actually speak to you and say goodbye when you leave. Try the Hot Apple Cider.
When you order a hot menu item, you expect it to be hot.  It was like they microwaved it and didn't stir before serving.  The top was cold, the bottom was warm...erm, tepid.  Friendly staff though!

Slow slow slow.... Tasteless
Cold sandwich when I finally got it after asking twice...
The food is decent, over priced for what it is but decent. The staff at the Greenville location are very nice & helpful.

Came here today to fuel myself for a little (or a lot) of shopping post breakfast. This location is a a weird place and its been like 3 different stores since i last live in this neighborhood. The parking lot is intense even for the yuppers in Greenville.

I decided on the Cosi oatmeal with berries and brown sugar. It was hearty and filling . My only gripe is that they serve it in a cup/bowl thats a little on the small side for mixing up the additions that they plop on top. Please invest in some larger bowl.s  You can add a small coffee for 1.00 which is a steal and while its not La Columbe it did the trick.

With the free wifi i was able to get in a quick rosetta stone french lesson while i munched on my hearty breakfast.
Staff was friendly and the dining area was pretty clean as well as the bathroom.

Id return there aren't many options for an inexpensive breakfast this close this side of PA ave
i love cosi. it fits my healthy fast food concept and it had delicious salad / bowls. this one is slightly less impressive than the one in Glen mill. but still i would give an average rating.

I have no idea why the CENSORS AT YELP CHOSE TO PUT MY REVIEW IN YELP JAIL.  

Nelly's Tamales is located in the Chow Public Market.  This sweet lady prepares tamales every day.  Dozen $18, Half-dozen $10 - Pork w/red chili, Chicken w/green chili, Cheese with Jalapeños, Potato with Jalapeños and Veggies.  She also will take a special order like Chicken with Jalapeños or Pork with green chili with four days' notice.  She has frozen and fresh tamales, so you can also pick up ones that are not on the menu in a frozen condition.

The standard daily offering at her little stand is pork with red sauce and chicken with green sauce.  In addition to tamales, she offers tacos, enchiladas, burritos and quesadillas.  The fillings are Chicken, Asada, Adobada and Cheese served with rice and beans.  

The masa is smooth and pale.  The tamale fillings are very generous.  She has three heat levels of salsa to go with the food and I found the hot to be delicious.  I detected habanero in it - yum.

Nelly's Tamales have been sold at the seasonal Boise Farmers Market (BFM), so while I have not yet been to their new all year retail spot inside Chow I can attest to the quality of Nelly's products from purchasing multiple times at BFM for a couple of years.  Also, as back story that I think worth sharing, this business started to help raise money to care for a disabled family member.  I have personal connection to that status and I say "hooray" to the family that this business has earned success.

Another Yelper, Sergio A, who knows his stuff for good eats and in particular for Mexican food good eats posted a 5 star review for Nelly's on 1/29/21 but for reasons I know not it ended up behind the Yelp filter.  Since I think a number of people who might read reviews for Nelly's would find it as useful and cool as I did and since I know Sergio A is a Yelper with bonafides, with his OK to share it, I include his review below:

"Nelly's Tamales is located in the Chow Public Market.  This sweet lady prepares tamales every day.  Dozen $18, Half-dozen $10 - Pork w/red chili, Chicken w/green chili, Cheese with Jalapeños, Potato with Jalapeños and Veggies.  She also will take a special order like Chicken with Jalapeños or Pork with green chili with four days' notice.  She has frozen and fresh tamales, so you can also pick up ones that are not on the menu in a frozen condition.

The standard daily offering at her little stand is pork with red sauce and chicken with green sauce.  In addition to tamales, she offers tacos, enchiladas, burritos and quesadillas.  The fillings are Chicken, Asada, Adobada and Cheese served with rice and beans.  

The masa is smooth and pale.  The tamale fillings are very generous.  She has three heat levels of salsa to go with the food and I found the hot to be delicious.  I detected habanero in it - yum."

Was looking for some good tamales to brighten our holiday season.  I found Nelly's Tamales in Boise and they exceeded my expectations.  Purchased chicken and pork tamales, both were delicious.  The masa is so tender and not too thick and the filling perfect.
Will be purchasing throughout the year!

I live out of state and wanted to send my Boise-based partner some delicious tamales. This was my very first experience with Nelly's and I was a little nervous ordering, but WOW did they deliver! 

First, the email communication was sooth and easy. Karina was very gracious and quick with her responses. I was able to arrange for a delivery on the same day (Sunday). The payment was also super convenient via Square space invoicing. The delivery was very quick and the person making it was lovely. 

Being able to order some frozen tamales along with freshly made ones was a huge bonus. Now, admittedly, I myself have not had an opportunity to sample them, but my partner (who is a tamale lover) was very impressed! He commented on how smooth the masa was, and how delicious the flavorings of each type (he wants to know what the secret ingredient in the chicken filling is!).  They were clearly wrapped with love, too. All around a great meal and experience.

Family owned.. best tacos I've had in boise! I'm such a taco snob and wow!!!!!! Most authentic tacos I've had here. I hate to give away a good spot but this family is so nice I want them to do well!!! BEST TACOS IN BOISE
Small family establishment with great service and phenomenal, authentic Mexican food.

One word: Outstanding. Super fresh, well seasoned, quality all the way. 
This is my 3rd visit. Every time was just as good as the last visit. The rice is fluffy and moist. The beans are hearty and seasoned well. Each tacos (I have tried each one) are not too salty, moist and generous in the portion. Good value for the money. I have yet to try the items outside the street tacos; however, I will plan on trying every item for my future visits. Oh, the salsas that come with your order, are just the perfect touch to complement your order, homemade all the way.

This was absolutely delicious!! I had the chicken tacos and my girlfriend had the pork tamales. There was a little bit of a wait considering the woman working here was the only one working, but she was working hard and she was ON TOP OF IT! We appreciate her service, definitely would eat here again!!

I tried it because the menu looked appetizing. Needless to say it only looked that way. I went to the one in Kenner and I can say never again. I had wings and my husband had the burger combo. It's definitely a thumbs down! Sorry

This is one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant. There was only one waitress and she couldn't keep up. We ordered hamburgers cooked medium ( she asked us) we waited for at least 30 min to get the order. The hamburgers were so over cooked they looked and felt like charcoal. While eating they set someone beside us which a towel wrapped around her neck coughing and sweating. I told my family to leave and I stayed to pay the bill that was held up because their computer had to reboot. After I paid I start walking to the front door and almost slipped down. The air conditioner is leaking from a vent on ceiling to the floor leaving a good size puddle in the walkway. No sign and no warning.  I'll never go back to that place again.  Good luck to you if you go.

My family & I's first time to this diner, was a little nervous because the outside looked scary but we gave it a try! Our server was Ciel, & she was excellent! I had the omelette & it honestly topped all the other omelette i've ever tried, it was as if the kitchen made it with love. The hash browns were honestly better than waffle house! I recommend this diner to anyone who wants a quick breakfast or brunch!

My Team Family and I camr to Daisy Dukes from Cali and Houston just. Y checking Google. We were met by a gracious host and then....Ms Charmaine & Brittni entered our world and if felt like we were friends forever. Charmaine's customer service and Sass lit up our world!!!. The Chicken & waffles was to die for and the Customer service was off the Charts... Thank you Daisy Duke for the food & hiring the Queen of Confidence

I stopped in here during a work trip after reading a couple of reviews. I'm so happy I did! Everything about daisy dukes was great, from my server, Wes, to the atmosphere and the awesome food! I got a modified omelette and everything came out perfectly. I'm from the north so we don't have biscuits all that often, whenever I see them on a menu I make sure to order them, and they were so good here! 

Wes was so attentive and helpful-- I wish I lived closer and was able to go more often but if I'm ever in the Kenner area again I will 100% stop in and make sure to request him!

Great place to dine in and have some New Orleans food! I saw a review that talked about a waitress with pink hair... he goes on to talk down about this sever. I wanted to clear something up. This waitress waits on me all the time, I go in because of her. She goes above and beyond to make my experience the best! She interacts with her customers... like waitresses should. She shouldn't be shamed for doing her job. My wife is a server also, and I could never do their job. They have to deal with rude customers like you, and are expected to remain professional. & for the person who said she's racist, she's far from it. I'm Hispanic and get treated the same as any other customer, compared to most places where I'm treated differently. The atmosphere is wonderful, along with the service. From the time you walk in to the time you leave, you are treated with the best service! & definitely ask for the waitress with the pink hair! She's wonderful!!! You won't regret it!

One of the most welcoming atmospheres I've ever experienced in a restaurant. From the moment we walked in we felt comfortable and welcome. There is no way you'll leave this place without a smile. The food was delicious and the portions were very generous. You can definitely tell these people love working here and they treat their customers like family. We will definitely be back!

I went in late at night and had a great experience. Staff was friendly and food was prompt. I am not sure what made it so special but I tried their club sandwich and it was the best club sandwich I have ever had. Must have been the perfect ratio of all the ingredients. Will defiantly go back next time I am in town.
Great great food and service you ladies are awesome Ms Vickey and Ms Charamine great southern hospitality

This is a simply an old style diner with good selections of breakfast and lunch.  Service is very friendly.  Ambiance is "happy days".  Pricing is very reasonable.  We love the breakfast offerings.  Lunch is pretty good too.   Recommended!

This was my first visit to this location. The menu is smaller than the others I have been to. The service was good, and the food was good as well. I got the 1/2 shrimp po boy and gumbo. My husband got the blt with an egg and a side of sweet potato fries. The shrimp was hot and cooked properly, and just needed a little salt. The gumbo was pretty thick but the flavor wasn't bad, although I probably would not get it again. My husband enjoyed his sandwich and his fries. The portions were decent for the prices. We would go back!

First-time heee.  The food was really tasty and hot.  I had a cup of gumbo whixh was very tasty and hot.  I also had the shrimp and geits whixh wasnt bad. It was well seasoned. The presentation was a bit strange but this is a diner not fine dining.  
  The aeevuce was good.  She kept up with everything.  Nobody was left with out drinks and dood delivered as it came out the window.  Give this place a try.

YOU WON'T ONLY BE SORRY, YOU WILL DIE OF THIRST..... a Bactrian camel could not survive we were so thirsty.......SAD THING IS THE STAFF COULD NOT CARE LESS...... Zero GLOVES WORN BY COOKS, kitchen help came out to get a drink and never the 1st handwashing......WOW!!

I don't know where to start. I live here in New Orleans, my brother and his daughters were in from Arizona. I was wanting to show them an iconic New Orleans Staples, such as Daisy Dukes. I remember when this place was American Pie Diner and it could not have been better. Upon Daisy Dukes taking over, service has declined, the quality of the product is not the same as they are at other locations, and the staff was inherently rude. Never mind the fact there were food particles all over the place and in this growing age of COVID-19, I felt very uncomfortable. Nevermind the fact there is no handwashing going on, people touching their faces that were behind the line and the service desk..... I did not see the first repository of hand sanitizer anywhere in the building nor did I noticed any red buckets for cleaning.

So, we walk in at 11:33 a.m., according to my Google timeline, and we then proceeded to sit there for about 5 minutes before a middle-aged woman, with a bad case of resting bitc* face, with pinkish hair, and a wrinkled face finally came over to us and dropped off menus. She then proceeded to handle other guests and sit at least two or three tables. Those tables got sat, they got served, and they got menus, they got drinks placed on their table, meanwhile, they entered the building 10 minutes after we did. At the 15 minute mark, she comes over to say "hey I have your drinks on the bar and I'm going to get them to you shortly." Another table comes in and they get from sat,, drinks, and menus. Meanwhile, I'm staring at a menu in a table with four other people and my brother says to me "is this the best New Orleans can do?" We persisted to wait while other guests continue to get served and handled before we did despite coming in after us. We never once had an interaction with this woman so it's not as if we're being unreasonable. We were just sitting here for 15 minutes and not one drink was placed on the table. After another 10 min, I finally asked her, "hey, other tables get served, sat, menus, and drinks. Why exactly is my table being made to suffer?" She again said "well your drinks are on the bar and I'm trying to do the best that I can", to which I responded, "well if this is the best you can do, it's definitely not good enough." "25 minutes and not even a drink..... she then snapped around and nastily claimed it hadn't been 25 minutes Honey, you lost the point. Take care of your customers and quit having personal conversations and you might be able to get something done

Stay away!  this place is horrible since Daisy Dukes has taken over and I could not be more disappointed at a New Orleans pillar of hospitality and foodservice.
