YOU WON'T ONLY BE SORRY YOU WILL DIE OF THIRST..... a Bactrian camel could not survive we were so thirsty......

COVID-19 IS A REAL POTENTIAL HERE WITH THE DEPLORABLE CONDITIONS INSIDE......

PARCHED NEW ORLEANIAN!!
It is a chain but I totally dig this place. Food was fresh and delish and service was super attentive.

Omg this place is super cute! We've been to different Daisy Dukes before and always enjoyed them. This one, however, had an old time diner feel to it. The food wasn't as good as other ones we'd been to but the atmosphere made up for it! the bloody mary was on point as usual. The waitresses we're very nice and helpful as well! I'd go back if I'm in the area.

This places food was great, I had the two egg breakfast i got grits, bacon, a biscuit, I added blueberry pancakes. Everything was so good!! The grits were the best I ever had, they were buttery and creamy. The pancakes had real blueberries in them and it was so good I didn't need the syrup. They were thick and fluffy.. The biscuit was huge and it was moist buttery crispy. It was great. Wish I got a picture before I ate lol. My fiancé got a 6 inch fish poboy and a 6 inch shrimp poboy they had the really poboy bread, it was more than 6 inches probably about 8 it was a whole filet of fish on it and the shrimp poboy didn't have many shrimp in my opinion but they were real shrimp and they were the big shrimp you would boil, he didn't care for them he said they were shrimpy and he tasted the grease first than shrimp after and he didn't care for the batter it was fried in. They use romaine lettuce for poboy & the fruit cup comes with strawberries, blueberries, 1/4 banana and melon.

I had the shrimp and grits my hubby had a create your own omelet with fries. I had a cup of coffee that was fresh brewed. The shrimp and grits had a sauce on the side. The shrimp was plentiful and the grits were nice and creamy. The waitress we had was very attentive and personable.

Ignore the negative reports. I have now eaten here twice. Staff is attentive and extremely friendly. Food is honest, fresh and what you would expect from a traditional diner. The pancakes are some of the best I've ever had in a diner. Again, don't expect gourmet food at a diner and you will not be disappointed!

The Greek omelette was amazing. I added their homemade salsa and it have it v an extra kick. Don't sleep on the homemade biscuits. My team ate chicken and waffles. I almost hurt myself.... so tasty and juicy. Charmaine and Brittney were gracious hosts!

Stopped in for brunch and everything was amazing. From the decor to the staff to the food. I can't recommend this place enough. Everybody in my party ordered something different and we all were extremely happy with the food.

It was okay. I'd heard so much about this place I feel like I my expectations were maybe too high. Not a total waste. Food was pretty good though they were out of a lot of stuff we wanted. Also would've preferred a brunch spot that I could get a Bloody Mary but this basically won out because of location.
Had a great breakfast here this morning with my family! The seafood omelet was terrific!
If you guys get vegetable fried rice with your order ask for extra broccoli, mine's seem to only have two pieces of broccoli whenever I order.
Not good at all. Chicken & broccoli is salty & sour. The hot & sour soup is not even hot or sour. Don't recommend it.

For being "ghetto Chinese," as I call it, this place is pretty good.  We've never had anything bad from them like some other places. The staff is quite friendly, too.  Have been ordering from here for 2 or so years now.

Our family has been eating here for 2 years now.  I always get the sweet and sour chicken.  It's always been delicious, cooked just right, and the sauce is perfect.  Their boneless spare ribs are amazing too.

My girlfriend consistently devours their Pork Fried Rice and Chicken/Broccoli, as well as their eggrolls.  My son and daughter will pretty much eat anything from here.

Staff is friendly, prices are cheap, and delivery is even pretty quick.  It is in the hood, but worth it.

I was a bit leary of ordering from here because the prices are low, I figured it probably would not be very good.  Their dinner prices are about the same as "lunch special" prices at other Chinese restaurants.  I ordered anyway because there are not a lot of Chinese food options in Wilmington.  I was pleasantly surprised - good egg roll, ok crab rangoon - not the best but not terrible, good entree (Buddha's Delight), good sauces (brown and sweet & sour).  I have no copmplaints, especially for the price.  I will definitely order from them again. Also, no MSG according to the menu.

I was expecting a lot more flavor in my food...I ordered hot and sour soup, which was neither hot nor sour, pretty bland, actually, and general tso's chicken, which is also supposed to be spicy, but didn't have any kick. The fried rice was not cooked all the way, so I felt a hard bit in every grain of rice, and the shrimp roll...not tasty at all. I'd say the best thing about this place was the prepackaged duck sauce.

I just ordered from there literally Jan 14th 2019 this place should be closed there house fried rice wow horrible the chicken is not real chicken .. my wings were average. I only ate 4 wings and 4 shrimp out of a large house rice and wing combo. They will never get my my money again
A+++ went thru the drive thru, everything was fresh and hot! Very friendly not like our KFC's in Ohio

Cash only through the drivethru every time I have been here in the year I have lived in White House, with a note in girly handwriting using sharpies and pink highlighter every single time.

If this location is privately owned, get your act together. If it's corporately owned, someone get out here and fix this because you're on the fast track to plummeting sales and closed doors.

This store must be the red headed step child of the pepsi co family. While i waited in line for almost 10 minutes for food the 2 people that ordered before me had to wait at least another 5 minutes, with 1 gentleman who ordered a chicken pot pie was told it was a 20 minute wait. 
There seem to be plenty of workers but no real leadership guiding anyone. Come on KFC/A&W get your crap together and train these people correctly.

My husband and I stopped here tonight to have dinner while driving through this town..(were not familiar with the area/state at ALL being that were visiting from Chicago.) The manager on duty, Keri, was super friendly and helpful when it came to deciding what to order. Plus, our food was ready FAST! Thank you Keri, and staff for such wonderful service. Keri was a great example of true southern hospitality!! I wish people back home were as nice and diligent as here. Very happy tonight....

We went to pick up our food, as we usually do so it will still be hot and fresh. But the chicken was old, the biscuits older, and had no coleslaw. We called about six times, but no answer. Thinking about not returning to Whiehouse as a whole, seems like the same places in other locations offer the best . Spent 28.76, really on only one eatable thing, potatoes were ok. The the thigh was even dry, usually has the most juices.

After being excited to try the new Nashville hot chicken at KFC I was very disappointed with my visit today. Although my chicken was very good, I was extremely disappointed that KFC chose to charge me $1.00 for a glass of water. When I asked the cashier about the charge, he told me that's just the way it is. Being a diabetic it's not that I wouldn't rather have sweet tea to drink but I don't want to be discriminated against not being able to. Well this is one less customer that KFC will ever have in the future and that's just the way it is!

On Saturday, I was moving my son and his family to White House, TN.  At the end of the first day of the move around 7pm, I stopped at the Kentucky Friend Chicken at 803 Hwy 76.  We ordered a 16 piece meal for $42.79 for 4 adults.  I asked for plates and utensils.  Cashier stated they no plates. The Cashier and Servers were not wearing COVID mask.  When we got home (45 minutes later), there were NO biscuits and only 2 sets of utensils.   I immediately called, and reported the findings to the manager, Crystal.  I asked to be compensated for the partial dinner and that I was not going to drive 45 minutes back to their White House store.   Crystal stated she needed to discuss it with her regional manager, Keri.  She was not empowered to help.  It's sloppy customer service to provide a partial dinner.  And I had higher expectations for KFC.

On Sunday, I stopped by the White House KFC store at 3:00pm, and spoke with Keri.  She stated she was NOT THERE on Saturday, and she would only offer either 8 biscuits OR 4 pieces of chicken.  I don't know about you, but I did not want 8 biscuits at 3:00pm on a Sunday.  During our conversation, she keep breaking away.  Saying she could not discuss it.  I pulled out my camera to record this bedlam, and she went running away.  I asked for a business card - no way.  I asked her to write down her name, title and her manager - she wrote down Crystal name and her title as "General Manager".  I askeed her if the store was a franchise or Pepsi owned store.  After 2 or 3 break-away and returns, she finally relented and stated it was owned by "Alice Sdheler".

Alice is this how you train managers?  Is this good KFC service?  I need some help given the partial service, partial dinner, and partial response.  Help.  I'm rating my KFC experience as a 1.

Picture this: You're coming home from a 7 day venture on a boat where you've only seen water, water, and guess what, more water. You get off your plane and expect a nice little treat at this hometown KFC business. But guess what I saw when I walked through the threshold of this establishment. A man in the corner chewing ketchup packet corners off and then proceeding to spit them onto the ground. Well that was a little bit of a set back but oh well whatever. I ordered my food and since KFC is a family friendly business I also had the rest of my family with me, so we tried to get drinks but sadly the man at the counter could not count above the number of fingers he had on his right hand. We sat down at one of the many crusty looking tables to enjoy the meal we had before us. By the way our food looked like the stuff they fed the rats in the kitchen. To conclude the building looked like it needed to be put down like a dog that can't use its back legs. Next time I'll stick with the Wendy's square burgers.

Ordered 80 pieces of chicken for a get together. Was told when I picked them up they would adjust the price so I would get a better deal than retail. Chicken was wrapped in metal containers when it first came out of the fryer and it sweated in those containers and became soggy. Nothing like 80 pieces of soggy chicken. Called to speak to their manager twice and still have not heard from anyone. Plus I was charged complete retail. Lousy service and no communication makes for a sour customer that won't be back.

we got two acai bowls and they were good but needed a lot of blending and didn't have nutella. too healthy and we just wanted some nutella in bowls! almond butter is not a substitute for nutella like they said. very white suburban mom vibes!
I ordered in advance and my order wasn't ready when I arrived; HOWEVER, the staff is SO nice and my hummus salad was delicious...not to mention the watermelon mint juice! So. Good. I'll be back!
Awesome food and delicious, golden latte.  Customer service is fantastic too!   We'll be back.
Great team, the coffee one has way more "pick up" than any Starbucks or regular coffee.  Also it is filling until lunch.  Also the juices are really good!

I have been to this location a number of times over the past few months and I have always had great service.  The Juiceristas are always friendly and welcoming.  I have tried almost everything from acai bowls, pre made juices, fresh juices, shots, coffee, smoothies, wraps.  Everything is always healthy, fresh, tasty, and great quality.  I highly recommend giving this a location a try.  Another tip if you are in a rush I also highly recommend using the app to order ahead, anytime I have used the app my item(s) have always been ready by the pick up time listed.  Plus you get rewards.  Enjoy!

I visited this Clean Juice location for the first time today. It's pretty conveniently located and has lots of parking in a lot. 

Inside it's bright and clean. They do have limited seating areas but it is a pandemic so I think most people take their stuff to go right now.

They offer online ordering but I popped in and ordered in person. The menu includes a variety of juices, smoothies, smoothie bowls, salad bowls, toasts, wraps, rotating soup options and probably a few other categories I missed. They also have kids sized items, prebottled juice and juice cleanse packs, and a seasonal menu. 

Today I got the Cherry Chocolate One smoothie and an order of Hummus Toast. 

I'd say the prices are average for this type of place. My 12 oz smoothie (without any add ins) was a little over 7 bucks and my toast was around 5 bucks.

It was made quickly and tasted great! I'll be back.

Yum!!!! I tried this place for the first time just yesterday and I was hooked. The beauty bowl is filling, delicious and absolutely fresh. I can't wait to try to salads, wraps, and toast options. Plus they have all the calories listed. I couldn't ask for a better breakfast spot!!
Whether it's a juice or a smoothie they nail it every time. They have a great variety of flavors and add ons to customize your drink however you like it

I took the family to lunch. Wow! Great experience. The menu is great . I could of ordered 6 things for lunch that sounded great and wouldn't change any of the ingredients.The staff was very friendly and efficient. Once finished making our food they new exactly what I ordered. I had the popeye bowl with avocado ranch dressing. It was excellent and so much better than a fast food restaurant. It tasted great and I felt great afterwards. My son had the creamsicle smoothie and the berry bowl and loved it. It tastes as good as it looks on the menu! My wife had the avocado toast which was fresh and on tasty toast.This is a quality organic, well run place that is worth visiting!

This place is honestly fantastic. They have a HUGE menu, and the ingredients are fresh and good and NOT overly packed with added sugar and a bunch of artificial BS. They also have contactless curbside pickup which was great when I was sick and wanted something healthy and packed with vitamins to help my immune system . All the employees are always nice too. Also I am a Christian and noticed the cups and little cards inside have bible verses on them

My mother, aunt and myself went on this walking tour of Ybor with stops for good food.  What a nice time!  Our guide,  Raymond was very knowledgeable and friendly.  
It was about 3 hrs long,  we passed that 3 hr mark because we were sidetracked a few times and chit chatted quite a bit, lol. 
We learned great details and background about the early days of tampa, the culture, people and ybor in general,  very informative! Along the way we stopped for food tastings . Everything was great,  especially the stone soup company Cuban sandwich!  I would recommend everyone to go on this tour,  visiting or lived here for years this is a fun adventure.  And for the step counters we chalked up over 5000 steps ! It will help offset all the wonderful calories you take in on the tour haha
Great tour! Very informative  (our tour guide Raymond was awesome!) and the food stops along the way were very delicious. Definitely worth the time and money.

We had such a wonderful afternoon enjoying great food and learning about the history of Ybor City!  Pat was an exceptional guide.  She was knowledgeable and also really enjoyed sharing the day with us.  The restaurants were delicious and not the ones that always come to mind when in Ybor.  I'm a 4th generation Tampa native who learned something and ate at some places I hadn't been to.  Great way to spend a weekend afternoon, enjoy time with family and friends, take your company from out-of-state, etc.  The price was very reasonable.  Thank you Pat for a fun afternoon!

This was a great experience. My boyfriend and I visited Tampa back in July and lucked up and were the only two guests on the tour. We loved it! Along with great food (Cuban sandwich, Cuban coffee, New York Pizza, Wings in beer batter, key lime pie etc.) and nice portion sizes, it was a walking history lesson of Ybor City. Lasted a few hours. Would definitely do it again.

Check Groupon for a deal!  

This is a well organized tour. Raymond, our guide, was full of knowledge and kept us moving along the route.  We stopped for food at: Tampa Bay Brewery (wings), Pizza Place for a cheese slice, a restaurant for 1/2 a Cuban sandwich, a restaurant for black beans and rice, cigar shop for a guava empanada and cafe con leche.  The tour took 3 hours.  We met at Ybor Centre and started on time.  There is about a mile of walking.  You learn about the cigar industry and social life of the locals back in the late 1800's and early 1900's. It was an interesting tour and paired with good food.  I definitely recommend it.

Ybor, not just a city but a man! I learned so much on this food tour. Raymond our tour guide had so much knowledge on Cigar City. The Cuban sandwich really represents the molding of all the cultures in to one great community (the salami for the Italians, the pork for the Cubans and the ham for the Spanish). With great enthusiasm Raymond walked us around Ybor pointing out the original cigar factory that Ybor built. We also learned about the "casitas"; homes that Ybor provided for his 1,000 cigar works at cost! Ybor truly turned a alligator run swamp in to a bustling hot spot in the 1920s! Unfortunately, the great depression and machines crushed the city for 30 yrs! 

Tampa has really made a comeback with Ybor. New breweries, clubs and restaurants are moving in to the area. Truly a mixing of the new with the old. The tour is a lot of fun and I definitely feel I have a true understanding of the area. If you do decide to go on this tour, you must go on an empty stomach. All the food is super delicious but extremely filling. Keep in mind this may only interest people from out of town or those not familiar with the area. All-in-all I had a great time and will definitely be back to Ybor City.

We enjoyed our afternoon with Cindy who was a great guide. The local history was very interesting and the food stops played in nicely with the tour information. We will likely bring family and visitors back for this tour!

If you are taking the tour for the history: our guide was very informative and knowledgeable. Unfortunately, they did not share juicy tidbits that these tours often include but I did learn a lot about the area.
If you are looking for food: This is not the tour for you. We had wings, pizza, and a sandwich. seriously? I've been on dozens of these tours in cities large (NY) to small (St. Augustine) and they all had amazing gourmet food that you couldn't find on your own. Either this area is just a bar-food kind of  area, or the tour company doesn't have the right connections. If you are a foodie and going to have GOOD food, this isn't the place for you. You will be sorely disappointed.
Organization: 1. You walk in the sun for 30 minutes at a time, and then for 2 minutes going across the street. The organizes should be wiser in their chioce of locations so that breaks from the florida sun are more reasonable and better divide the time by choosing better locations. In addition, the guides have NO IDEA what is served where. They are ill prepared to service any special food needs. Yes, i am vegetarian, but like I said - I've taken at least a dozen food tours and have been fully accommodated with amazing food on every single one. Here, the places were not prepared to give anything decent. And at one of the places the tour guide said the food was vegetarian when it had chicken stock. This tour does NOT accommodate special dietary needs and should stop saying it does or should get a clue. BTW - the place was (As a result) ill prepared to offer a substitute and we got a few pieces of lettuce with a tomato on top. I don't need to pay $59 for that.

This was one of the best days Ive had lately! Our guide Pat was so friendly and really gave us so much historical information. . We had MORE than enough food and tried things from 4 or 5 places.. I learned very interesting things regarding history in Ybor...
Definitely worth the money amd a great way to spend an afternoon.

Very good informative as well as delicious food and city tour the food was great from chicken wings to pizza to red bean and rice to guava desert steamed coffee and cigar it lasted 3 1/2 hours (a little long) but very enjoyable

My husband and some friends did this food tour on a Sunday  afternoon. Our guide was Ashley who was extremely knowledgeable about the history of Ybor. The restaurants that we visited were well known within the Tampa and Ybor communities, yet we were still able to try something that I havent tried before. The tour was very informative as we learned not only  about the history  of Ybor but we also learned about the history of the buildings  and the culture of Ybor. I highly recommend this tour for not only visitors of Tampa but residents as well.

Interesting way to learn about Ybor City.

When I saw there was a Groupon for a food tour, I was intrigued. I've enjoyed other food tours, so I figured why not. I would definitely suggest getting the Groupon, as I noticed almost everybody (if not everybody) in our party had one.

Things I enjoyed about the tour.

1. The tour guide was super knowledgeable. Pat was a joy to listen to and she clearly knew her stuff.
2. The restaurants were interesting and I enjoyed the food for the most part.
3. I feel like I walked away with a lot more knowledge and appreciation for Ybor City.

Things that could be improved.
1. I wish I knew ahead of time that we would visit one restaurant and then 45 minutes would elapse before making it to the second. Pat warned us about this structure at the beginning of the tour, but that was too late for me to eat something before we started. I figured this was a food tour at prime lunch time, so I came hungry. That was definitely a mistake.
2. I thought the pizza was kind of a cop out. That didn't seem like a special dish to me in any way. This is a restaurant that many people have stumbled upon drunk and grabbed a slice for $3. It was odd to visit it on a food tour.
3. The last stop was a cigar vendor, so there were people smoking inside. A few of us on the tour ended up waiting outside because we didn't want to be inhaling smoke. One of the other tour participants even noted that this was a super odd choice as a final stop. Surely we could find good coffee somewhere else.

I think this food tour is a fun way to experience Ybor City, but it probably wouldn't be top of my list of recommendations if someone wanted to know what to do when visiting Tampa Bay.

Raymond was our guide who met us at Jimmy John's in the heart of Ybor city. Overall it was a very informative tour that started with a 8 min video of the city. The whole tour took about 4 hours and ends right where you start. With samples from 5 different local establishments. I would highly recommend this tour if your thinking about it. Also look on Groupon as they might have a deal or two going on there. And bring your appetite and good walking shoes. Also for you cigar lovers you stop off on a great cigar smokeshop. Essentially every place you stop is more welcoming than the last.  I don't really give out 5 stars much. So no offense on this company, in my opinion they were top notch!

This is my favorite Dairy Queen by far. It's busy but all the workers are wonderful people who have orders done very promptly. I love this place! The people who work here are so caring and extremely helpful.

What's not to like about DQ soft-serve ice cream? It rocks!  Why the 4 stars?  No burgers, fries, or chicken strips.  They offer only a few chicken sandwiches.  But hey... I believe this small location was designed specifically for peddling those tasty ice cream treats.  They have a handy drive-up window, making cone, Blizzards, Dilly, or Buster bar stops super quick and easy.

We went in today aug 4th. We ordered 5 items they brought out a blizzard held it upside down and dropped it on the floor. Finally got everything and no spoons eThey proceeded to mop it up multiple employs went through and almost fell. One employee did fall the lady in the picture and did not wash her hands before making and serving ice cream!!! Disgusting! Witnessed them replacing the monitor standing on the very top of the 4ft ladder which by law is against osha safety then proceeded to get a bigger ladder afterwards. The staff did not seem to be trained or know what they were doing. Disappointed!

Was a little worried about the negative reviews, but this was the first visit and it was clean inside, friendly fast service even though they were a little busy on a Saturday night. Sundaes were excellent!

We went in today aug 4th. We ordered 5 items they brought out a blizzard held it upside down and dropped it on the floor. Finally got everything and no spoons either m. They proceeded to mop it up multiple employs went through and almost fell. One employee did fall the lady in the picture and did not wash her hands before making and serving ice cream!!! Disgusting! Witnessed them replacing the monitor standing on the very top of the 4ft ladder which by law is against osha safety then proceeded to get a bigger ladder afterwards. The staff did not seem to be trained or know what they were doing. Disappointed!

Typical Dairy Queen fare.  Have been to this new location a few times.  Disappointed that this new store is NOT clean.  We were there today.  There were a few lulls in customers.  Instead of cleaning tables, floor, windows, the staff congregated in the back.  Even the prep area had papers on the floor.

Asked at the drive thru if I wanted my receipt, the receipt was already in his hand, I answered "yes please"
He proceeded  to walk to the trash can and dispose of it.
I asked again for the receipt,  he replied that he would get it in a minute,  then handed me my food, and said thank you have a nice day. I again asked for my receipt,  he replied, oh yes ok, er, I threw it away.
Again I asked him to retrieve it.
I hope they are not scamming by rerunning cards etc
1.00pm Tuesday 9 Feb 2021

Yes finally a dessert location close to home!! Now the west side has a spot for a cool delicious treat other than the Golden Arches . Who doesn't love DQ especially with our hot weather. Sweet tasty creamy treats for all to enjoy, young & old everyone is sure to find something here they'll enjoy. 
If you're in the mood for a float, or a super thick let them turn it upside down blizzard filled with all the deliciousness you can imagine head over to DQ this new crew of friendly faces will surely please!
It was surprising to see not one employee wearing gloves during this pandemic. It's wreckless and irresponsible. Hope this gets rendered.

We were excited and looking forward to having a DQ close by but after this second time there probably won't be going back. The bad reviews about bad customer service are spot on. The employees here seem to have no training and not know what they are doing, or they just don't care. We went thru drive thru and they got our order wrong and to go treats without lids making for melted ice cream. Take your money elsewhere.

If you want a quality BLIZZARD please don't come to this location, They only fill them 3/4 of the way and not filling them all the way like all other locations! I thought this was a fluke experience but after being screwed 3 times, clearly this is the nickel and dime standard for this location! Most Dairy Queens overflow their BLIZZARDS, not these cheapskates! Bye Felicia Queen!

Arrived at 7:58...
Well where do I start, unfortunately it was not clean to start with, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt because it was a rainy night out and maybe they were swamped with orders. The floor was dirty on both the customer side of Dairy Queen and behind the counter where the workers are.  Dirt, chocolate, straws, spoons, napkins and other things just laying on the floor. 

Also The staff was not very quick to greet customers coming in and taking orders promptly. I was the only one in line and the young lady behind the counter was messing with a blender, turned around and we made eye contact. Instead of letting me know they would be right with me... she just kept on messing with the blender. Approximately 3-4 minutes later a young man finally came to the counter and asked if I'd been helped. I let him know that i had not, 8:03 pm he quickly jumped on the register and "tried" to take my order. It was a simple order, 1 mini chocolate chip cookie dough blizzard, 1 hot fudge sundae with everything( peanuts, whipped cream, and a cherry on top), and 1 mini pecan cluster blizzard. The young man could not figure how to input the order or make sure that the hot fudge sundae had all the toppings. He finally asked the girl for help, the one that ignored me and was working on the blender. The order was finally placed and it was time to wait. So I took a seat at a little counter area that they have close to the counter. I figured maybe 2-4 minutes tops to get my order. Well I was wrong, I guess I assumed that because there 5-7 employees total working to make the orders and get them out quickly. 

While I waited a young man walked in with his female friend, the wound man quickly greeted him and told him "I got you" the young man that walked in was from the new dominos pizza right next door to Dairy Queen, they talked and bartered ice cream for pizza. Very unprofessional in my opinion but who am I to judge. Maybe that's how they do it at both businesses. The girl and the dominos pizza guy order several items and continued to talk about life events in each other's life( both the dq worker and the dominos worker) now its been about 10 minutes since I ordered. Still no ice cream. I walk up to the counter and ask how much longer, he apologizes and checks. Tells me one more minute! 5 minutes later still no ice cream. Dominos pizza kid and girl get all of there ice cream for "free" and walk out the door. Finally they walk up with my ice cream, 8:23 pm about 20 minutes after I order. Both blizzards completely melted like if they were ice cream shakes not blizzards, no hot fudge Sunday yet!!!! They were cleaning the outside of the blizzard because of all of the melt off, never flipped the blizzard upside down because it would have splayed in the floor like all the other nasty ness that was already there. I reminded them about the Sunday, they Findlay brought it out with no toppings, had to remind them of that also. I did let them know about my melted blizzards and non of them batted an eye. Never asked if they could remake them, or offer a refund. 8:33 finally left the store with two milk shakes aka melted blizzards and a half assed sundae. 

On my receipt they have a survey you can take online, I went to the online website and it let me know I could not complete the survey because that store does not exist!!!! So I couldn't even tell them what terrible service and product they served that night.

Most of us have been going to Dairy Queen for years this was absolutely the worst experience that I've ever had at a Dairy Queen. I hope they are able to get their stuff together and let their staff know that they need to make sure that they are providing the best service available. They were a lot of team kids that were working behind the counter but I would hope that they would have a better work ethic or possibly learning from this experience.

I wasn't able to get any pictures of the product itself, I was pretty upset and forgot to do that. But as you can imagine it look like a melted blizzard and the Sunday look like something a two-year-old could've made

I'm curious whether the hours shown on the Yelp app as well as Google are incorrect because after driving 30 minutes to this location we found it closed at 10 rather than 10:30. If hours have changed, that is understandable, but when we pulled up to the window we were completely ignored by the staff who looked at us and looked away. We had to knock on the window in order to ask whether they were still open. Very upsetting to receive such poor customer service, regardless of closing time confusion.

Used to be an employee here for about a year after it first opened and all I can say is it's gone steeply down hill. They can't even take an order correctly, I went with my mother and she asked for a small chocolate cone dipped in cherry and received a vanilla cone dipped in cherry and I asked for a small buzzard made with twist, PB cups and PB candy pieces and received just a regular PB cup blizzard. I even asked the drive threw worker if my order was correct and repeated it to him clearly and he look up at the screen and look at me in the eyes and said it was correct. Seemed like the girl taking our order was having a hard time finding items in the pos, she should not be on drive threw. Very sadden and disappointed at what this place has become. Hopefully the District Manager Greg will see this and take a look at this store.
This place is still going down hill, 50/50 chance you're blizzard is halfway melted, and 100% chance the cup is very dirty on the outside. Extra napkins are a must.

We have a small group of neighbors that head out for lunch once a week.  We try different locations and food and after seeing the reviews we decided to try NOT YOUR MOMMAS BBQ which just recently opened.  Between us we had the Carolina Pig, Brisket, and Ribs.   Everyone was very pleased with there meals.  I also had some of the best baked beans and one of us ordered the collard greens.  If you like good bbq this is the place.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

This place has the best BBQ on the west side of Pasco. The collard greens were fresh and delicious the macaroni and cheese is amazing and the BBQ is better then any of the places I have ate at on this side of Pasco. This is one of the cleanest restaurants I have been in and in today's society that is a major plus.
Amazing new spot. Food was great. Service was outstanding. Glad this place is here! We will be back

Saw this place on my way home yesterday and ordered today! 
WOW this has to be the most delicious Mac & Cheese I've had in my lifetime and the brisket on top just made it that much better!!!
The cornbread has actual corn in it not just the plain dry type.
This will be a definite stop when I'm at the office!!

First time trying there food and WE WILL BE BACK!!! The Ribs were coming off the bone and so tasty. That barbecue sauce was slamming!! The collar greens were on point! They had so much flavor and YOU CAN DRINK THE BROTH!. The baked beans were ON FIRE! They just burst with flavor in your mouth. The mac & cheese were the cheesiest I've ever had. NO NEED FOR SALT AND PEPPER!! The establishment was also very clean and the cook and the cashier where very pleasant and sweet to talk to.

I'm not a food "snob", but as a southerner, a Mississippian to be exact, I am super picky about my BBQ.  I grew up around BBQers who knew their craft, and t's difficult to find that same quality in Florida.  But when I do, I will drive an hour to enjoy that savory smoked meat.  Not Your Mamma's BBQ meets that criteria. Ribs, pork, and brisket are tender, flavorful, and never dried out. It doesn't require a drowning of sauce to get by, but the sauce is just an added component and not the center of flavor. Chef Ken has honed his craft around a smoker, but has the added bonus of being a master baker.   So when you go, save some room for dessert, because if bread pudding is on the menu, you get it.  Not sure if that's a law, or in the Bible or something, but you get it.  Period.  You'll thank me later.
DELICIOUS. Wonder family business..excellent Food. Priced just right. Good music. Clean environment. Yummy sweet tea.

Wow, some one here knows how to cook. My ribs were wonderful, sides are very good including the Mac & cheese. I found it a little strange they offer no condiments, like butter and honey for the corn bread and I didn't see any extra ketchup or bbq sauce. But I doubt your going to find any better bbq.

Not your typical "fast food" place. The husband and wife team create homemade barbecue and sides. They are friendly. Their place is clean. We had chopped pork, baked beans, Cole slaw, mac and cheese, and corn muffins. The portion sizes are generous. It took about 10-15 minutes for our food to come out. It was worth the wait.   The total cost including beverages was $32.

We just tried Not Your Mommas BBQ today. And we will be back!  First - I wasn't really hungry, but ended up eating my complete meal and part of my husband's. Now - the details!  We got there around 4:30 in the afternoon - just one other couple. My husband ordered the half chicken and I got the brisket sandwich; between us we tried three of the sides. We ordered at the counter and took a seat in a spotless and very clean dining area.  Seriously very clean; tables, floor, tables. After a bit, we were called to collect our order. OMGoodness!!!  Husband rushed me to take pics - it just looked and smelled that good!  And tasted just as good: tender collards, sweet baked beans and fabulous potato salad!  The bronzed chicken was tender and moist, the brisket was tender and delicious!!  Our recommendation is to get there early (or order ahead) so they don't run out!  We also got the red velvet cake - to go. That too is made in-house!!!  Saving it for tomorrow's breakfast.

Ate here a couple nights ago.  Food was wonderful. You could tell everything was made in house. I had the Texas hold 'em. The brisket was tender and juicy. And you could tell they took the time to toast the kaiser roll and give it that extra crunch.  And the staff was very welcoming and kind.

Woah, I was blown away by this place. I came here on a suggestion from a friend and found it to be the "go to spot" in NPR. 

I ordered the brisket and found it to be smoked perfectly with the right amount of juices kept in it. I could have had the full pound and been satisfied. I also got the Mac and cheese on the side and loved it. They did a great job with the meat and the Mac and cheese. My daughter got the ribs and I tried one and loved it. They did a great job on the ribs!! 

I also found the sauces to go perfect with the meats. They had a molasses based sauce and a mustard based sauce and they both paired perfectly with all the meats. I would highly recommend coming here. The service was great and the product speaks for itself. 

Awesome place and is my new favorite place in NPR.

Keep up the good work!!!
Surprised at how great the food is and how nice the owner is. I wish him the best and will certainly return.
The best BBQ in town! Love the coleslaw and pork. Don't miss out on this place. It's clean and food is homemade.

This place is FABULOUS!!! In town visiting family, our old BBQ place shut down recently, so decided to stop here. WOW! I had the Carolina Pig: the pork was perfectly tender, fall apart; the coleslaw was the perfect addition, not too strong (definitely not weak) in flavor, it just complimented the pork so well. My husband had the brisket: FLAVORFUL, great smoke ring, excellent temperature, good bark; pairs really well with both sauces (mustard based and molasses based). My son had the half chicken: white meat was juicy and tender; good char on outside. My daughter had the ribs: fall off the bone, big portion for half rack, and delicious flavor. We also tried the fries and sweet potato fries. They are both good, but the sweet potato fries are outstanding!! They are almost like a dessert...sweetened so well! Sweet tea is strong (which I love), but the pineapple sweet tea was incredible! It was the perfect balance of sweetness from the tea and from the pineapple. The pineapple flavor did came through without overtaking the tea flavor. Best flavored tea I've ever had! Customer service was superb; helpful tips, attentive, very pleasant and friendly. Wish we had this restaurant by us back home. You can bet we will be frequent diners when we are in town. Get to Not Your Momma's BBQ! Amazing!!
Absolutely awesome!! Best bbq I have ever tasted. I would highly recommend. The bread pudding was out of this world.

After reading all the glowing reviews, I was excited to finally go here.  HUGE disappointment.   A lukewarm 'minimalist' pork sammie, grainy, yucky mac and cheese-- definitely not home-made, probably, frozen-- and ice with a little soda for about $13.50 (ordering, pick-up self-service too) was a horrible experience.  Won;t be back.

My husband has been coming here for a few weeks now. Tonight I was able to go with him. Was hoping for brisket since he brought some home three weeks ago. Unfortunately for me they were sold out. So tonight I had the pork sammich, Mac n cheese and coleslaw. Everything was amazing. 

The portions are large enough that you bring home leftovers. Their traditional sauce was spot on. My husband got half a rack of ribs. Fall off the bone and delicious and we have leftovers with them as well. 

The prices are higher then other places however the quality and portion size offsets this. 

We will be back. Sorry no photos, was to happy eating.

This new BBQ spot is incredible!    Everything about it is awesome. Inside is immaculately clean and has a large variety of items from smoked sausage, pork, brisket, ribs and even fish.  I had the rib sandwich. It was huge. See pic (warning : bones are left in ribs--old school)   Wife had pulled pork. Both were cooked to perfection and loads of flavor. There caramel pecan bread pudding is to die for !!'  We'll be back.  Oh almost forgot their house sauce is sweet and spicy but not overly spicy.

OMG - it is soooo good.  The ribs have a real hickory smoked flavor that is outstanding. They are also very tender and meaty.  The baked beans are THE best. The Mac and cheese, fabulous. The owners are super friendly and helpful.  This is our new go to barbecue place.  If you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out.

We were considering going to a different BBQ place today, and changed our mind at the last minute. I'm so glad we did! Not Your Mommas BBQ did not disappoint. I got the ribs and my husband got the brisket sandwich. He said his brisket was great! My ribs were fall of the bone tender, had excellent flavor, and the BBQ sauce was so good. We both got the Mac and cheese, and that was pretty good as well. The baked beans were really good. The staff were so nice and inviting. We can't wait to go back. The wait was a little long, but we'll worth it.

When it first open it was good. The last two dinner orders were not good.   I even explained about the past issue.. When I picked it up they said it was right.  I didn't check.  See a picture of what I got.  Plus no bread and salad only had lettuce and slice of onion.    When I called when I got home and saw it was wrong again , I waited 8 minutes on hold and the owner wasn't concerned over a bad order.  Time to go somewhere else!

This has become our "go to" pizza place/ restaurant when we want to sit down and enjoy a meal. The pizza is absolutely fantastic! Highly recommend Bruno's! The people taking care of us were extremely friendly, pleasant and attentive. Everything was just great!
Yummmm the pizza is amazing has taste not even a comparison to sals down the road just FYI I prefer pickup here a couple incidents with driver for delivery

I've gotten carry out from Bruno's several times and it's always delicious.  It's now our go to place for pizza.  I've tried a couple of their dinners and they have been great.  I highly recommend the place.  And they are very nice to deal with.

Omg..do not order here.they think they have it all together but they don't.the way they talk about other customers after they came is with a pizza that was made incorrect.then to have a customer come to pick up a order & ended up waiting 45 minutes, but then they forgot to make An entire, so we had to wait again.they even forgot to cut one of the pizzas.they didn't add mozzarella, then when they added it they put it back in the oven which over cooked the pizza.
When we called to tell them what happens & one of the pizzas was cold we had to reheat it.the person who answered the phone said its wasn't there fault they just come in it 4:30 when this order was called around 8.
He blamed it on Gabriela the owner, he stated it was her fault nothing wAs ready. Instead of giving our money back they said they will take care of us the next timr, well we tossed the pizzas and three will not be a next time.
Pointing fingers & blaming others isn't the way to run a business.
I just found this place and am already obsessed. This is some damn good pizza, thin crust and just perfect. Will be ordering from here a lot.

I was looking for homemade Italian food, my husband asked what I wanted for my birthday tomorrow. So I inquired on save Hernando Resturants  and heard about Brunos Pizzeria. So I had my birthday dinner tonight @ Brunos! I was not disappointed, excellent food, large portions and service was excellent! Even sang happy birthday and delivered cannoli! We will definitely be back!!! Thank you!!

Over the phone, I was asked what dressing I wanted with my salad - but the salad wasn't included in my to go order. The chicken francese was absolutely tasteless. My side of meatballs was rubbery. I waited on my to-go order for a while, because the hostess said they were just waiting on the garlic knots. I said oh how nice, it comes with knots? I didn't order those! She said yes. But then no knots were given. I considered calling the restaurant to go back and get these items after I opened my bag and they weren't there, buttt neither cook was wearing a mask and I watched as the hostess wiped her nose with her hand while her mask was around her chin and not wash/sanitize afterwards so, I was kind of turned off by the whole place.
BEST pizza in Tampa Bay!! Owner is from Italy, love this place!!! Located in Hudson across from Skinnys. If you want the best pizza around, you want Bruno's. Love their Alfredo too.

Reason why the stars are so low is simply because of the wait. There was two people in front of us, we waited like 30 minutes and still got ours first. I felt pretty bad for those people. My girlfriend ate both of ours and they still ain't had theirs made. The girl taking our order was nice. She helped another family with their order (she seemed to be the only one working).

Even though I got the generic funnel cake, it was just like any other funnel cake really. Kind of glad I didn't get a specialty, couldn't imagine the wait.

In all honesty if you wait a regular funnel cake quick just go to the Zoo and get one...

If you want a specialty I suppose this could be a place to go. Now that I think about it I wonder if you can order in advance.

Today was my first time visiting Funnel Cake Factory, very clean and customer service was amazing!  There's wasn't a long wait for our food either. Definitely will be returning. Funnel cake must have with your order lol
Great service and great food! Funnel cakes tasted amazing with plenty of topping options. They even brought it out to the car.

I assumed a bucket of nachos would include more than chips and cheese?!? They were out of a lot. The wait was crazy long, no one answering the phones and my coworkers were disappointed with their food as well. Won't be going back even to try the funnel cakes.
Excellent customer service !   Excellent food !  No long wait !   They bring it to your car .   Lots of toppings for your funnel cake
Simply because there was a two hour wait for 2 funnel cakes. No dine in or call ins, so there really was no reason for the long wait.

15 minutes from the time I placed my order until it was ready.  8: on a Tuesday evening ...nothing big going on.  I was in the drive through.  When I finally got to the window all they said was sorry you had to wait.  I didn't pay, I didn't take the order...EXTREMELY POOR SERVICE!

SO I have a coupon for $4 for a 2 CROISSAN'WICH meal.  I then get 2 CROISSAN'WICH for $4 (special they have running).  That equals = $8.  They have charged me $11.78 three times!!!  Today again.  I had to argue with them as they kept saying I was wrong?  Im going back tomorrow to see if they do it again.  Learn to add man.
I like burger king but this place  need professionals manager they make the baddestsssss burger o god help us this place going good in the future
I went here with my boyfriend and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, plus the poutine could have fed at least 3 people!

This place gets an "A-OK" from me. Our service was very slow, partly because my girlfriend ordered a vegetarian hot dog off the menu. It took almost 40 minutes to come out and it looked like any other hot dog. 

I had a hotdog and poutine combo. The hotdog wasn't that great. I wouldn't say it lived up to the name of a place that serves only hotdogs. Poutine was a bit better, but not that much better.

Our server was nice and she did a good job serving us. Overall though it was an underwhelming experience.

DO NOT ENTER! 
We were in a rush to drop something off with my mom in St. Albert and my daughter saw the sign and wanted to go in. 
I thought, ok I'll have a cheat day. I asked the waitress for no sauce, just extra sauerkraut and I asked if the slaw comes in a separate container so the bun does not get soggy, she said 'yes'. 
She brought me 2 hot dogs covered in cole slaw and a container of sauerkraut. I told her the error and re-explained and sent it back, she then came back with 2 hot dogs with relish and mustard on them. 
I sent it back and asked for the bill. She did not take it off the bill, when I asked her to, she acted like she was doing me a favor. There was a middle aged waitress who was very nice and offered me something quick to go but no thanks. Cheat day avoided. There were no other customers in there so that should have been a red flag. I wish I would have taken pictures, it was so bizarre.

*** THEY HAVE VEGETARIAN HOT DOGS - OFF THE MENU ***

So I came here and was wondering if they might have meatless dogs and turns out they do, they just don't advertise this. At first I was like, "why!? you could get so many customers"... but then we had to wait like 40 minutes for one hot dog and I knew why. It was a decent veggie dog, but definitely not worth the 40 minute long wait. Poutine was pretty good though. 

Our server was really friendly and apologetic about the wait. I think she was also confused about why they took so long. I think they might be killing the vegetables and making the dog from scratch. I really wanted to love this place, because I love hot dogs... but this wasn't great. I think my partner said his dog was just A-OK. For a specialty hot dog place, this missed the mark for us.

Checked out Old Montreal Hot Dogs & Poutine. As you can see from the menu it's hot dogs, poutine, and deli sandwiches. They have about 8 tables inside. Seemed like a lot of people ordered takeout or skip the dishes as well. The place seemed clean, including the bathroom. They had one server on who was good. She got pretty busy serving the tables, answering phone orders and running food. She did everything with a smile and was really nice. We had authentic poutines with our meals. Lots of curds and the gravy had good flavour. My husband liked his sandwich. The hotdogs were good. The actual dog itself wasn't anything special but I didn't order a premium one. Liked the toppings and the toasted buns. For the tow meals and two pops, everything came to around $38. We were absolutely stuffed. In the end it was decent. If you have a hankering for a dog or poutine, check it out!
We needed a Poke place in Keystone! Really enjoyed my meal here- the veggies are super fresh, tasty toppings and the fish was super yummy! Highly recommend!

I have never been to a poke place before but my mom highly recommended. We aren't huge fans of tuna or that kind of raw seafood but they do have a spicy chicken option! I ordered the make your own bowl with salad, edamame, carrots, cucumbers, and crab stick. They definitely don't shy on the toppings as mine was like a mountain. We couldn't even put the lid on. As my first time on the sauces I went with what my mom usually orders with the OG sauce, sweet soy, and sriracha aioli. The sauces alone were delicious but everything mixed together was incredible! I can't wait to go back and try some of the other sauces! And to top it off they also sell Mochi!

Ps this may be hard to find/you may miss it because there is not yet a sign on the building. For now they just have a sign over the door but it's right next to Yolk and Ruth's Chris
This place is amazing! Service is great! Very friendly! Food out of this world. It's likes rolls of sushi in a bowl. Will definitely go back probably too much.

Amazing experience!

I have been a huge fan of poke since the trend started but that there's too many you have to look for something that distinguishes from the rest of them.

This place is cool and has a friendly website to order online although there's a very short list of pre designed pokes the optioned given to make your own makes it great.

If you register ahead and make your first order they will give you a discount.

Mine was spicy tuna, spicy salmon, sushi rice, crunchy onions, seaweed salad, carrots, jalapenos and a unique wasabi aioli.

This came in a huge bowl and was just exquisite.

Will definitely go back, specially since you're so close to my job.
my favorite place for poke! always fresh and delicious! when i order online, the order is always ready quickly. service is really friendly, love coming here!
We each custom made our Poke Bowls and they both were delicious.  The quantity was large and the ingredients were fresh and generous.  I'll recommend and return.
Their food is great and a lot of fish comes w the bowls. But there isn't a description on the sauces so that was a little hard to decide.
Fresh fish, great sauce options convenient to my office tasty results twice in a row. Help was polite and lead me through my choices. I will be back!

I wanted to shake it up for lunch one day and decided that I wanted some poke.
When I looked it up, this location popped up for me, and I had to have some. 
I ended up picking the Johnny Utah bowl and I enjoyed it! It had half brown and half sushi rice, with pineapple, mango, carrots, edamame, corn, green onions and ahi tuna, as well as a spicy, creamy sauce. It was a delicious and filling meal, and I even had some left overs as well. Everything was fresh and paired well together.
I also had some mochi ice cream that was tasty as well, I want to try more flavors soon! 
All around tasty meal and I can't wait to get into the physical location to check them out.
Pokè Bros is so good! Glad there's finally pokè near broad ripple. I've went here twice and got delivery once in the past week. The spicy salmon is always fresh.
Tried this place soon after opening. I got a spicy salmon and tuna bowl with sushi rice and gochujong sauce. It was great! Polite staff, fresh ingredients, and fun toppings. Highly recommend!
Very fresh. Love the options. nice helpful staff. Easy to carry out. we will return!!!

On a Poke-craving Googling whim I was delighted to find that Poke Bros. just opened in the Keystone Ironworks plaza!  Their space is small, but the flavor, variety of ingredients, freshness and portions are BIG!  

As sushi lovers, we were excited to try this Hawaiian "sushi in a bowl" dish. The menu has several Poke combination suggestions, but really you can add/subtract anything you'd like along the way in a fast casual Chipotle-esque style.

I tried a build your own bowl with sushi rice, marinated tuna, shrimp, and assorted veggies and three of their signature sauces including the spicy-sweet wasabi aioli.  Ask for any of the sauces on the side, if you want to test them out! If you're looking for low-carb, high protein (like my boyfriend) you can opt for salad greens instead of rice and then pile on the toppings!  For those not interested in raw fish, there's a chicken/spicy chicken option too.

No matter what the combination, the end result was delicious and fresh, service was prompt and friendly, and I can tell this will be a summer staple for us.  Thankfully they offer a punch-card for return customers and your 11th bowl is on the house!

Except being a little hard to find, this is a hidden jewel. 

Sushi in a bowl with all the extras. Order from pre-designed bowl or build your own. 

My wife is not a fan of sushi, but she loved my bowl & I had to order another for myself. 

Looking forward to returning!

So fresh, so tasty, and such a cool space! We built our own bowls with tuna and salmon mixes. Opted for half sushi rice and half salad. OG sauce and Sriracha mayo with crunchy bits on top! New favorite picnic lunch or dinner.

I ordered from here though Uber eats (no more lazy Uber eats for me). It's different than what I'm used to for poke. I'm used to fine chopped veggies etc and everything was so large. Spice wise it definitely met the mark. It just felt like something was missing. I would try this place again in person to see if my opinion changes.

A hidden gem in the Ironworks plaza. Poke bros is  quickly becoming my favorite poke place in the area. 

Ingredients are always fresh and there are many options to choose from. 

My favorites are the Johnny Utah which includes Salmon, Avocado, Edamame, Cucumber, Masago, OG Sauce, Sriracha Aioli. 

The High tide which includes Chicken, Shrimp, Edamame, Carrots, Pineapple, Green Onion, Avocado, Corn, Cucumber, Sriracha Aioli, Sweet Soy, and OG Sauce. 

and my favorite bowl the Hula which includes, Shrimp, Green Onion, Cucumber, Crab Stick, Avocado, Masago, OG Sauce, Sriracha Aioli, and Coconut Ginger.

You can also make your own bowl and mix up the bases. The options are really endless. 

Service has always been very fast and friendly when I go in, but they also have the option to order online, which has been great since I am always on the run. If you have never tried poke which is basically sushi in a bowl. Give this place a try. You will not regret it.

Poke Bros in Ironworks... run don't walk! This place just opened a few weeks ago. My DELICIOUS create-your-own poke bowl included sushi rice, edamame, seaweed salad, avocado, cucumber, crab stick, half/half of marinated tuna and salmon, masago, and spicy Mayo. Holy massive portions! This was sooo good! I will DEFINITELY be back! Ingredients were amazingly fresh and tasty!! Very clean and great service! (Forgive the not so great photo. I started mixing before I remembered to take the photo because I was too excited to eat. )
Easy to grab, fresh ingredients, and a kind staff! Definitely a place you'll need to check out!
Very fresh! I ordered delivery of a shaka bowl while I was waiting for my car to be worked on.  It arrived very fresh and fast! The bowl  was delicious and had plenty to eat! I was very pleased!
My wife and I got the hula bowls and they were delicious! Everything tasted very fresh and you get a lot of food for the price. Definitely will return.

This is a great tour. The characters are very entertaining, and it was quite special to visit Independence Hall in the evening, after all the summer weekend tourists had gone for the day. The peace and quiet made it almost possible to smell that Revolutionary air inside the Assembly Room, and the discussion among Messrs. Adams and Jefferson and Dr. Franklin was  quite moving at times. The dinner at City Tavern was OK. As someone mentioned, the various breads and dessert were very good. I was disappointed, however, that we were seated under a tent in the restaurant's garden rather than inside. Thankfully, it was a lovely evening. 

The City Tavern experience is as much about the restaurant's ambiance as it is the food. My husband and I have dined inside the tavern in the past, so we know what it's like. (We quite enjoy it.) If that's the experience you're hoping for, better check ahead to see where, on this tour, dinner at City Tavern will be served.

High quality acting, we wish there were a few more actors (2 during dinner, 4 at Independence Hall). Food was ok but not fantastic given how much money we paid (desert and bread were quite good). Overall though as a way of dramatically bringing to life July 4th, 1776 it was well done.
Neat to see the Hall at night with a small group but kind of long and the dinner was super disappointing...under s tent with plastic chairs instead of in the historic tavern. Bummer.
Took a trip to Philadelphia this was by far my favorite thing we did! Very fun and loved being immersed into history. The food was great. Gluten free and dairy free options too.

This is a fantastic way to spend an evening, taking in the history of not just Philadelphia, and not just Pennsylvania, but the birth of the United States of America. This is where it all happened.

Bear in mind, my review is written based upon our visit to Philadelphia and our having taken this tour package on September 1, 2018.

The meal at City Tavern was very good. We were seated at tables downstairs, and the room size was perfect for our group. The actors and actresses had ample room to carry on with their dialogue and fun while we ate.

From the City Tavern we walked (via our "tour guide" John Dunlap) over to Independence Hall. It was just getting dark when we arrived and the place was absolutely beautiful. I am also posting photos, which include some taken outside of Independence Hall, before and after we were taken inside the building for a private tour, and a peek into a vital point in our nation's history... dare I say, the world's history(??).

The package is well worth the cost, as it is filled with many different treats and available points of history being presented. I would especially recommend this for families, and it is equally applicable to couples, singles, young and old!

Go and support these fine folk who do a magnificent job, putting on an outstanding display of a peek into our history.

Booked this tour to learn the history face to face. Tour begins in Independence Hall Visitors Center. Mike walk our group to the City Tavern from there. On our way we met impersonator of the Dunlap and fun begun. During the dinner which served by servers "from 1700's" there was more interactions, we "learned " old Irish song,etc.. After dark we returned into Independence Hall , we had tour of it, watched "debate" about Declaration of Independence. After the tour Mike told us about charity work of the Company. Very impressive. Before we said goodbye everyone received copy of Declaration of Independence. Check them out!!! Lots of fun and help for a good cause, what can be better! !!

Oh my gosh I'm so happy I found this food truck! They used to have a restaurant here in the boro and they closed. He has 2 food trucks now. Great chicken, fish and the fried okra... dang it's good! I got the sweet heat and I think I'm going to try the next hotter level next time. They also have funnel cakes that I want to try. So glad I saw this as I was driving down Broad Street! Next to Hardee's.

Stopped to pick up chicken sandwiches for dinner last week, and decided to add on wings because I'm obsessed with wings. Holy mother of all that is sacred... These things are lightly breaded and literally some of the best I have ever stuffed in my face.  I got them seasoned with Sweet Heat, but I'm sure they added something to make them addictive. I've been back for more since and not sure I'll be able to keep driving when I see the red truck.  The guys were friendly and helpful, providing the menu and tip to call ahead next time so I don't have to wait with my impatient kiddos in the car!  If you haven't tried this truck, you are missing out!

This place was recommended to me by some colleagues. It gets 5 stars. The app just isnt responding. They are dead on and cheaper by a hair than the other wing joints. The best fried wings and tenders anywhere. That's all they sell, and it's all they need to. Smack Ya Mama is seasoned and cooked to perfection. They have other flavors as well. Best Lemon Pepper in Mid TN. Better than BWW, Wing Stop, etc for straight up chicken. 
For the next 2 weeks the truck will be at the Kwik Sak on the intersection of Old Nashville Hwy & Hazelwood in Smyrna. In the bright red food truck.
Can call ahead for pick up 615.804.8224.
Taking SuperB Sunday orders until Friday the 3rd.
This food truck popped in at my workplace and it was delicious! And affordable! I got chicken tenders with fries in the "Sweet heat" spice rub and it was so yum.
Being incapable of taking a simple order on numerous occasions is bad enough; giving the customer attitude when he's trying to get it corrected is unacceptable.

Food truck event allowed the perfect opportunity to visit Chicken Shack Express, based in Smyrna, TN.  I enjoy hot (Spicey) chicken, so I ordered their next to hottest dry rub spice with fries.  The food came out hot and I was not disappointed. The chicken was tender and juicy and perfectly prepared. The spice was not overwhelming and was very flavorful.  However if you like very spicy chicken I would suggest ordering the hottest spice. I was easily able to eat all four pieces without feeling like I had become a blowtorch. 

The servers were very friendly and kept the food moving quickly without a long wait. Overall, a very good dining experience!

This was a very disappointing experience the way I was treated, it was a reason to turn and walk out. But I stayed to see the full picture of how this will play out, and after I left was feeling like I was "racially discriminated". 
I paid for my items, BUT be sure to know that working in the area, knowing residents in the area, and will be voicing my feelings. 
To be a new restaurant in the area, I would have looked for a different attitude.
By the way, NO CDC GUIDELINES FOLLOWED. 
No gloves, No facing mask, No distancing.

I can't believe this place even stands a chance at this Center City spot. When you walk in it smells like a fried, greasy spoon. The chicken is entirely too greasy and over-salted. The prices are cheap because the place will essentially fry a shoe lace. The service was okay but no one acknowledged me or asked me what I wanted when it was my turn. I'm all for a good chicken shop, but this is a boardwalk greasy dive.

First entered and a family of four was waiting for food.  Father was NOT wearing a mask and the cashier/manager did not ask him to put his mask back on or wait outside.  Cashier did NOT greet me.  Felt unsafe and left.  
Came back 4 minutes later, Cashier/Manager was not wearing his mask..when he did put it on he wore it incorrectly with an exposed nose.  
If these people can't enforce basic safety in a pandemic, how the hell do you trust them to follow basic rules of food safety?   
DO NOT PATRONIZE

The inside is clean and the service was friendly and prompt. Chicken and rice is something like you would get from a cart in the city. Their chicken isn't bad and I would definitely get the bone-in because the tenders seem to be the run of the mill ones that are frozen and refried. Not bad but not your artisan fried chicken.

Actually the worst late night meal I've ever had and that's saying something. What the hell is going on here. Chicken tenders were absolutely wack. These French fries were pathetic. If  you figure it out soon I'll be a regular.

This is absolutely pathetic. It's no wonder their reviews are bad. $10 for a size of a small fry at McD with some little ketchup mustard and cheese with no onions like i ordered. This is just awful service. Business won't last long unless they fire management and retrain workers. Sad...

it was eh i got a Nashville hot chicken sandwich and and it came with mayo and ketchup i got both on the side and the chicken sandwich was just 2 chicken tenders with shredded lettuce and tomato, the bun was a bit soggy and poorly put together the sandwich was ok but doesnt compare to a Popeyes or kfc one it was even spicy they just put spicy seasoning on it about everytime i bit into it it almost came apart, i wouldn't say its bad just could be better.
You have good ingredients but you put that cold drink in with my hot food. When I got it the drink was warm but the food was cold. I'll give you 5 stars if you fix that
Look at ClusterTruck's model, where they don't start fixing tator tots until the driver is coming in...

The food was not good.  The hot chicken sandwich had no seasoning at all and tasted like it was frozen chicken.  The burger was not fresh and cold.  The buns advertised were not accurate.  Pictures show Kaiser buns, we got McDonald's buns.  Quality was poor for the price.  Should have been McDonald's prices.

Definitely not worth the price. The portions were small. I spent a total of $25-$26 for basically bread and the loaded fries that should've been $3 at most. I was given raw red onions rather than the caramelized ones for both the fries and melt. The nashville hot chicken was okay, but waaaay toooo much bread and not enough inbetween. I was left hungry as well and I ate everything. I should've been full even before finishing it. I don't usually leave bad reviews, but this needed to be said as it's the face of someone big with a fan base. Very very disappointed. Honestly, not worth it. Do not get it.
delivery was quick but the food was cold / soggy and the "seasoned" fries weren't seasoned. Definitely not worth the price.

We placed an order for my daughter, who selected this as her birthday dinner.  Twenty minutes after it was scheduled to be delivered, I received a text from door dash that there was an issue and the food would not be coming.  Fortunately, we had warned our daughter that this might occur after reading reviews but it was still very disheartening for her especially since it was too late to really go anywhere else for food that evening.  Fast forward a couple of weeks to find that our charge card was billed for food we never received.  I've called the only number I can find a couple of times now and left messages...wonder if I'll ever hear back?  I definitely won't be holding my breath.  Hopefully our daughter will learn that it doesn't mean something is a quality product just because there is a familiar name attached!  Order at your own risk!!

Stuff missing called the 877 number to ask they send out the rest.  I was told to reorder and they'll refund what was missing in a few days.  So pay once again and wait an hour. I just wanted the rest of my order.... why can't you just call the establishment?????

This is the definition of someone making money off its fan base without concern of the quality of the products they're providing. It's a cash grab. It's a scheme. The food was terrible. The fries were gross. The chicken sandwich was a frozen chicken tender thrown in a generic bun. It's such a weird business model too... why can't I talk to someone at the store I bought it from? And why are they secretive of the actual location it's being made? Bad food. Bad quality. Bad business.

Nothing special - it sucks that the hot sauces are still community style during COVID 

I feel of firemen are part of a Union than the firehouse subs employees should be part of the same employment union.  Protect those that are raising money in your name.

Absolutely no problems. Was picking up a postmate order at first and after delivering it, decided I had to go back and get me one as well because it smelt so good. I came in early for my online order I placed and they were bagging it up as I walked in and one of the workers had spidey senses and said my name immediately. Seems like friendly and fun staff:)

You guys have some MEAN subs. Absolutely delicious subs. Bravo! 
Your brownies however, need some work. I'm usually not one to give the one-bite treatment to ANY chocolate treat.. but that brownie.. I guess what I'm saying is that I wasn't really all in on the brownie.

So close to the house, and perfect stop to pick up a sandwich for the hubby.

I was a bit disappointed that there wasn't a big grand opening, or even a soft opening. 

Having to find out they had been open for three weeks prior, I am  still happy they are situated close to me.

It's clean and spacious, even without a drive-thru.

I liked the soda machine, and able to get caffeine free drinks.

Can't wait to try it!
My new favorite sub place!! They put so much meat in each sandwich! And they're served warm. Service was great both times I have been and so was the food! Affordable and delicious!

So I'm VERY picky with my sandwiches. Several other places in town have disappointed me. 

I only got one sub so far, but i got the Italian and it was DELICIOUS. I got whatever it normally comes with (except mustard), got it toasted and it was perfection. Best Italian in town; and my favorite sandwich spot so far.
They are great here. Friendly and helpful. The sandwiches were just as ordered, perfect

I think the first and last time I had a firehouse sub was somewhere circa 2005 on the east coast. So it has been a while! I was in the mood for a good sandwich and being gluten free, my options are limited. After a quick yelp search, I learned of this new location and their gluten free bread options. Sold! Not 15 mins later, I was in the store placing my order. I like firehouse because they serve their sandwiches warmed with melted cheese and they have a great array of toppings to choose from. I went with the GF medium club and it did not disappoint. I added hot peppers, cherry peppers, peperocinis, and pickles to spice it up. The sandwich was about $9, gluten free bread +$2 (a little steep, but whatever), and add a combo with chips and drink +$3.50, all amounted to about $15 for lunch. It was definitely on the pricier end of lunch options but it hit the spot. The store was large and clean with plenty of employees working to move people through fast at the lunch hour. Nice addition to south Reno!
I would highly recommend this place I have lived here in Reno (67) years, and have eaten at most of the sub shops here, no doubt in my opinion this Firehouse Is the BEST ONE,

Was very satisfying! Had the italian, good sized, great bread, fresh toppings and all melted
together. I love it when you eat a sandwich and your mouth waters while you eat it. They have a freestyle soda machine, lots of choices. Friend had the cheesesteak and was not left wanting or hungry. Plus, part of the proceeds support our Fire Fighters!
The sandwiches are amazing especially the Cajun Chicken but the service is spectacular. There's a young man there that's so nice, caring, and very considerate. Just wanted to do a shout out .

I had this sandwich bought for me, and thats why i am rating it a 3. It was just ok. I dont even know if its a good deal for the price, as i dont know the price. I am glad i tried them, been wanting to! I received the roast beef sandwich box, which included a sandwich (lettuce, onion and tomato), a bag of BBQ chips, a pickle spear, a packet of mayonnaise, a packet of deli mustard, and a giant chocolate chip cookie. The sub: alot of bread to meat ratio, however, everything was fresh and tasted decent. Nothing special really, but im a huge fan of Jimmy Johns and Pub N Sub. The chips were great, crunchy and delicious. I forgot what brand they were, but i took a pic of the entire lunch box. Pickle spear was fresh and seedless? A little strange. The packets of mayo and mustard added flavor to an otherwise dry sandwich. I bet the sandwiches would have been better with vinegar, oil and spices, more meat too, but that wasnt the option we had. The best part was the cookie! It was quite large, and great! Great texture and crunch and the chips were fresh!
The subs here are freakin delicious. I can't believe I ever ate at a different sub shop with this place in my neighborhood. Never again.

Varied menu. I like the option of getting double meat. It's nice to have a sub sandwich at least warmed, although they're cold if we take them home to eat.

A couple of annoyances: We always tell them we don't want pickle spears with our sandwiches, and we always get them. The other is being asked if we want to donate to their fund. Who knows if it's legit?

What a great experience! 
I was a first time customer and stopped in because I saw they offer a gluten free sub. I have celiac, and it's VERY hard for me to find a good sandwich, let alone a sub! The experience didn't disappoint. The staff was knowledgeable, helpful and went the extra mile to make sure my food remained gluten free and safe for me to consume. Quality service, excellent sub!

Just did an online order from the Damonte ranch store. I didn't even know they had opened but glad they did. Their website sucks but their app actually works well. Got two sandwiches and they were both great. On the cart waiting for me just inside the doorway. Hot and ready to go. Keep up the good work guys. I'll definitely be a regular.

My husband just loves the  New York Steamer... so here I am easily placing my order online.

It's so convenient, less than two miles from my house, and another two miles to drop off at his office... actually we are dining in the car today.

To my surprise, they took off one of the small sandwiches, because of my frequent buying (using my points).

Place online, walk in the store, and pick up on the right side  Rapid Rescue!

name: Famous Sgt Bob Smoke BBQ and Grill

reviews.text:
Wow great find - thank you YELP!

Very friendly lady at the counter who asked me taste multiple things all of which were great!

I will be looking for reasons to come back thru Pennsville and stop here again!

Great place!

Finally something new in this wonderful small town! After seeing our second Dunkin Donuts open up I was starting to lose hope. But here comes Sgt Balan! Definitely excited to try.

Came in for lunch! The woman at the counter was such a sweetheart, recommending me some things and asking me if it was my first time in. 

I went with the chicken kabobs and a pulled pork sandwich to split with my fiancé. The pork tastes great! I love the BBQ sauce, it's not overly sweet and the pork doesn't taste like pure vinegar which is always a fear of mine. Nice soft bun as well! 

The  kabobs are also very good! Chard on the outside and pulls apart nice and tender on the inside! They are huge in size too! You really get a lot for what you pay for.

Speaking of prices, they are great! The quality of food is very good, the service was exactly how I like to be treated, and the location is perfect for me.

Thank you for lunch! I'm loving every bite! Will definitely be back to try other items!

I don't really eat meat that often, but smelled the BBQ at Glasgow park last summer and was the juiciest and most flavorful sandwiches. And I came back every Friday for almost 3 months until the lbs. started showing.
