I just had the bbq chicken kebab at a night market in philly and was blown away. The sauce was ideal and the delicate, juicy nature of the chicken itself was astounding. We waited in line for thirty minutes and would do it again in a heartbeat.

Thoroughly enjoyed my first visit - was given samples of 6 different dishes; opted for grilled pork and rice noodles/vegetables side. Loved every bite - ate the entire (very) generous portion. Best Pork I have had in a long time- juicy, flavorful. Will definitely head back here next time I am in town.

BTW - Yelp posting reports hours until 6PM, actually open until 7PM

Hands down!!! The Best bbq and Filipino food I have ever eaten!  Bob and Lhot have catered several events for me and provide the best customer service. More than enough food for everyone with plenty of left overs!

We were just passing through and thankfully checked Yelp to find someplace for lunch. The food and service was wonderful. The samples made ordering easy we got everything, lol. We wouldn't hesitate to come here again when we are in the area.

Sgt Bob and his wife are super nice people.  I tried the pork and chicken kebobs, brisket sandwich, and the pork adobo.  Enjoyed all of it!  Look forward to going back.  I have to note this is a veteran owned business.

This place is AMAZING!! you can't go wrong with anything on this menu. Not to mention the customer service is great. All the meat is well seasoned and cooked to perfection. I've tried the adobo chicken, both pork and chicken kabobs, the pork stew, potato salad , both rices and everything was bomb ! 10/10 recommend !!! Do not miss this gem

I stopped here on whim coming over the bridge from a job in Delaware. Typed in "BBQ near me" on my phone and this popped up. This place was not quite what I expected but WOW! I was pleasantly surprised! It's just a small place with no bells or whistles but the extremely nice lady behind the counter gave me a bunch of samples and everything I tried was outstanding! BBQ with an Asian flavor. AWESOME. I bought lunch (the bbq pork and rice) and had to buy some babyback ribs to bring home. It was great! I'm definitely coming back and recommending this place to my friends.

The smoked brisket had a good flavor but was literally drowning in sauce. I love bbq sauce, and this was good sauce but it was  a bit overpowering. The brisket was nice and tender but was also shredded, not sliced. So be prepared for "pulled" brisket if that's what you are ordering. The Cole slaw was very good -- crisp and flavorful, without too much mayo or vinegar. Just right.
Language barrier here can make ordering a bit of a challenge. So check your order upon receiving it.
Wonderful family owned business. They are always cooking fresh food outside on the grill. You drive down Broadway and smell it!!! Prices are great too!

This is a spot that does Filipino style bbq. Decided to try it before going to work and get some take out for lunch. I ordered the BBQ grilled chicken with rice as well as sweet plantains and pork egg rolls. The pork egg rolls were delicious and it came with a sweet and tangy sauce. The sauce had a little heat to it as well. The chicken with the rice was very delicious as well. The chicken was very tender, smoky and plenty of flavor. The sweet plantains were on point. Very impressed with the food and the family who owns this establishment are very friendly and humble and happy to eat food made with love and pride.

Absolutely love this place!! Our ohana moved here almost 2 years ago from Hawaii and this is the closest we can get to our local plate lunch food back home. We eat here often and will continue to do so for as long as they are there!! They have a wide range of food, the staff is always friendly and the prices are reasonable.  Thanks for feeding our ohana when we come!!

I got the brisket sandwich. I was hoping it was on a long roll with cheese so I could call it a brisket cheesesteak.  That was not the case it came on a round roll and had no cheese.  Very tasty BBQ.  I did like that it was pulled brisket and the brisket and chunks of fat were floating around in really good barbecue sauce.  It came with a bag of chips but I still did not like the $9.99 price tag.  If you find yourself in Pennsville and you want brisket here you go. Good overall experience.
Just came from night market, all I can say is WOW with the chicken kabobs. Definitely making a ride to your shop this weekend.
Tender chicken and pork. A lot of meat in the platter box for a great price too!!! Super friendly family owned business. Was my first time in and will be back very soon!!!

I had a bbq pork and rice box at a fall even in Glasgow Park. $10 per box. Utterly LOADED with meat. The meat was soft, perfectly cooked, nice Smokey flavor, sauce was so delicious yet not overpowering at all (sometimes bbq sauces can be overly salty or pungent you know?). 

We ended up getting 2 boxes and ever since then have been craving it. Will update the review once we get to the actual store.

5/5 for now!

The grilled-pork kabob has a sauce that's just right: a little tang and smoke--not too sweet, salty or cloying; tender meat and solid quality. The grilled chicken kabob is fierce too (3 kabobs for $10). 

Beef brisket sandwich served on sesame seed bun at $10 (but kaiser roll or similar would do more justice to properly cuddle the flavorful, tender meat with its wonderful, subtle layers of seasoning). 

This man's a marine! Sgt Bob is REAL, and he's outside regularly, smoking and grilling the meats to perfection he uses to make his delicious offerings. I tell you, Tennessee ain't got nuthin' on this A-OK South Jersey BBQ joint!

This place is awesome! A great local BBQ spot that has delicious barbecue with Filipino inspired dishes.  We ordered the garlic rice, coleslaw, bbq pulled pork, bbq chicken and ribs! The pork ribs were thick and contained some bones. But bbq chicken and bbq pulled pork are so tasty! They also have a bunch of different options at the restaurant that aren't listed on the menu. I definitely suggest going there to order rather than looking at the menu.  We will definitely be back and can't wait to get our next bbq catered from here.
Great down home Philippine barbecue. Was offered samples as we came in, chicken is out of this world!
The best bbq I ever had. Portions that will fill you up and leave you some for tomorrow. You do yourself a favor and get down to Famous Sgt Bob's and treat yourself to some delicious food.

Three strikes you're out. Been here three times. Got takeout each time. Something was missing from my order twice. And they no longer serve their rice cakes which is why I was there today. The food is decent, or else they wouldn't have got three tries. Staff is friendly. But I won't be back. It's pricey.
Great chicken!  Something a bit different than the colonel's KFC.  I like the sauce on the side since I can put on as much or as little as I like.  Try their bubble tea too, the Mango is amazing.
This is probably my favourite fired chicken so far I have eaten and it was my first time trying from your restaurant  thanks For making it delicious and it was perfectly cook ‍

The chicken and boneless chicken are delicious. Very crispy, lots of flavours in the sauces and seasonings. Had boneless chicken with honey butter seasoning and 6 half and half chicken (soy garlic and sweet and spicy). The sides are fine, nothing to write home about. Would try their chicken again. Friendly owners running the shop.

Oooookkkkk dang. Was expecting some decent chicken bites when I ordered the boneless chicken but what I got was some dang DECENT chicken bites. Ordered with the sweet and spicy sauce which was definitely the best choice. That being said I have tried no other flavours. And I will try no other flavours because these ones were too good. Real saucy but not too saucy. Pretty crispy even after delivery sitting in the sauces. More chicken than expected with each bite. 10/10 would order again. Lovely.

Ordered Wow Chicken on Skip the Dishes tonight and it was really great.  
We ordered two Wow Meals - one 3piece chicken and with rice and the boneless chicken meal with French fries.  We tried the Sweet & Hot sauce on a few pieces.  The sauce was delicious; would consider it medium heat for those who like things really hot. Fried chicken was well seasoned and not overly greasy.  
The rice was yummy.. weird I know but I really like rice.   It was perfectly sticky and went well with the chicken.  
We also ordered the cheese sticks as an appetizer; they were still warm and gooey when it got here. 

Will FOR SURE order again.

I ordered pickup from here recently. The atmosphere seemed enjoyable for dine-in and the lady was friendly. In terms of food, I got their 10 pieces half and half - Sweet and Spicy (Extra) and Soy Garlic. The pieces of chicken were large and flavourful/saucy. The sweet and spicy (extra) was quite distinct from other places in that it was quite spicy. The parts I didn't like as much were that the pieces were quite differently sized from one another and a bit difficult to eat, that there were too much breading for my liking compared to other Korean Fried Chicken places, and that the meat was not as flavourful as expected (the sauce made up for it though)

I've already reviewed WOW Pop Chicken.. it's amazing. 
Just wanted to add that the onion cheese flavour is also amazing. So is the poutine!

We tried this place through a recommendation on Facebook. We didn't have much calories left on our cheat day so we split a poutine fries. It was pretty good. Usually comes with cheese curds but the day I went it definitely didn't seem like cheese curds...but honestly it didn't stop us. It was delicious. The young guys that worked the counter were actually nice and polite. Kudos to them for being cool! All in all, I will make another review when I try the hotdogs but for now. The fries are a solid 3.7 out of 5. The portions were huge which is appreciated! Will recommend this place and will be back soon!

My daughter and I were looking for a shopping mall during our Thanksgiving vacation and found the Meadow Wood Mall.  Shopping was wonderful, but the real find was Doggie Dogs.  Best hot dogs ever and we really have good hot dogs in SF!  These were made to order, took 15 minutes, but well worth the wait.  The skin popped with every bite.  The fries were perfect.  It was so good that on the way out I had to stop and tell the cashier, who was married to the owner and chef.  Met the Chef and both were as wonderful as the food they serve.  I wish them well and hope to visit anytime we are in the vicinity.  Delicious!!!

The hot dogs were great; had a wonderful snap like any good hot dog should. The chili was on point; a little on the pricey  side but you pay for a quality. The service, although really warm and friendly, was a little slow but they're still fairly new and just getting their rhythm down still. Overall experience was positive; will try them again.

Little hole in the wall! Yesterday was the first time I tried this place and it was a very delicious meal and the presentation of the food was great! Great customer service and I would most definitely recommend trying this place once! I swear it's worth the money and wait. Like I usually say in food reviews is,

((DELICIOUS FOOD IS NEVER RUSHED))

A new joint opened up at the mall specializing in hot dogs. They're keeping it simple but bringing the noise by offering only two different food items hot dogs and fries. But with that there's a dozens options for either one depending on how plain or adventurous you want to be. They've got plenty of everyone's favorite variations of both with a couple of curveballs in the line up. For example I got the Dogitos which was a hot dog cut in half and made into a tasty duo of taquitos. The flavors were complementary and was a delicious twist. I was aiming to get the elote fries but they were sold out which was a bummer but it was my fault for showing up late. They prep daily so everything is fresh and they make everything when you order it. So no hotdogs hanging out on a roller or in a steamer here. 

They have a sign stating to expect approximately 15 mins but it was probably half that and there were a couple people ahead of me. For a new spot everything seems to be flowing smoothly. The staff was friendly and was offering up suggestions and engaging with their guests. I'll definitely be back for the elote fries and to try another one of their d

The absolute best food spot in the meadowwood mall! 
Great service!
Amazing food!
Huge portions! 
Definitely recommend if your shopping and get hungry to try this place out!

Absolutely delicious. This style is like Greek-Sicilian crust with creamy cheese on top and then covered in lightly chunky sauce that has a fresh garlicky aftertaste. It's like the Greeks and Sicilians had a child and mated with the Italians from Wisconsin and Chicago. I just found out about this pie. This is a destination pie and I live 5 minutes away. It's not even my Birthday.
Killer Detroit style pizza! This stands up next to any square pie in the greater Philly area

My first three visits to the dimly lit brewery were great. The pizza was fantastic and the beer was like wise. However, the last three we disappointing. We blamed it on their being busy but, yesterday, there was no excuse. The pie was undercooked, the cheese was tasteless and it lacked the signature crispy sides. The crust once thick and well-cooked was tasteless. The only thing that reminded the same was the sauce. I hate posting reviews like this but we will not be back and will.go back to driving to Philly for great pizza.

Coming in with dimensions slightly smaller than a standard piece of loose leaf along with a definitive thickness this pie was everything I wanted it to be.  

Detroit style is all the rage these days and this pizza perfectly fits the bill.  Thick, chewy, not overly dough like a Sicilian but a crispy ness on the outside.  Gotta go pepperoni.

This spot is in the back of a strip center in Stickman Brews. They bill themselves as "Detroit Pizza."  Cheese on the bottom, sauce on top.  This is the "real" deal.    The wheat crust uses the same yeast as their beer which gives it a distinctive taste, the sauce is not sweet or tart and works with the crust and the topping.   All "scratch-made" and you can taste it.  Hard to judge given the lack of Detroit Style pies in the Philly area but, I give it a 9.0.
Best pizza in the region.  Nothing else like it in the area.  Amazing crust, with a symphony of creative toppings to choose from.

We were quoted a different price on the phone and time for pick up. The order wasn't ready on time, we were charged more than the quoted price, when asking about it we were treated rudely by staff. Then manager contacted my husband, berated him and hung up on him. 

Bet your ass we called corporate.
This store is awesome! Had my debit card info stolen and they took action! It was greatly appreciated and they were on it! Seriously the employees here rock!!!

Came in after calling in an order. Stood here for fifteen minutes and asked if I've been helped after I already paid and she said itd be a few minutes. 
Now they say I can either wait or get a refund like it was my fault. Don't come here

It's called hot n ready and it's advertised at a price that claims immediate pickup. So when you come in and order two and they say it's going to be 20 minutes..... where's the discount on the wait? What's with the false advertising? If it's an employee thing fire the employees that can't keep up with the slow business at this location!!!!

Little Caesars' deep dish pepperoni pizza is delicious, especially with extra sauce (additional charge).  However, on occasion, the extra sauce for which I've paid extra, doesn't always make it on the pizza.  On these occasions I've reported this deficiency to the store.  To date, they've been apologetic and happy to offer a redo or free pizza with next order.  Today, I ordered my "redo", and upon pick up, I was informed by the owner, Jim, that he would no longer replace any improperly-made, special-order pizzas.  Based on Jim's comments, it would appear that quality control and customer satisfaction are not priorities at Jim's stores (Holiday and Crystal River).  I simply expect to receive what I've ordered and paid for, but apparently that's more than what Jim wants to provide at his locations.  Disappointing!

name: Black Leaf Vegan
address: 2432 Dr Martin Luther King Jr St

reviews.text: Black Leaf Vegan makes good burgers, and the owners are super nice! The cbd lemonade is really good too.

I stumbled across this food truck at the feast of lanterns and I was humbled by their burger. It was so good! The burger had the right texture, the sauce was tasty, and it made my mouth happy! I will be monitoring them on social media just to find out where they'll be next! Also they were some of the nicest and kindest people.

This spot was at one of my favorite whiskey bars in my neighborhood. They had their food truck parked in front on a Friday evening. While I'm not a vegan I decided to try it because it smelled amazing! I was not disappointed! I ordered the nachos which included beyond meat (plant based protein). It had a barbecue flavor. It was really good. The ladies that served us were also very knowledgeable about what we should order based on the type of food we like. That said, rather you are a vegan or not, or maybe you are curious about vegan food, this is a place you should start. I give it 4 stars only because i think they are a tad pricey but the food is great!

Black Leaf Vegan did not disappoint!!!!!!!!!

My family has been vegan-ish for a few months and I've heard more and more about this food truck. I haven't been able to organically run into the food truck...until today!

My husband had an outdoor art show that Black Lead Vegan food truck attended. I was first in line and practically jumped into the food truck!

I ended up ordering two burgers because I you only live once and who knows when I'll run into the food truck again.

The first one I sampled was the guacamole burger. The teriyaki sauce that comes on all 3 burgers is amazing!!! Spicy and sweet! Perfect pairing with spinach, pickles, onions, and guac all piled high on the burger. 

Next was the bacon ranch burger. Oh. My. Goodness!!!!! It is sent from heaven!!!! The saltiness of the bacon plus the teriyaki sauce is a match made for your taste buds! I would choose this over a real burger any day! 

Both burgers came with a side of guac and chips. The price point is a little higher than a beef burger ($15-$19), but it's good for your body and soul!
The food was great. However, it took them an hour to prepare our food. I felt like they should have given a warning that they were so far behind. Other people were waiting for longer than an hour.

I can't believe it's Vegan!
A black minority owned mobile vegan food truck! 

They travel around to different locations and venues. 

Today they were at a health and wellness fair I attended. 

The food was amazing!

I ordered the vegan burger. The sauce had an Asian flavor and the texture of the burger was similar to hamburger. The veggies on the burger were crisp and crunchy. 

The side of guacamole and tortilla were just enough to make you want more. 

This is a great addition to the vegan and food truck industry here in Indy.

We have been wanting to try this place for a while. We were able to find them at the state fair. We got the loaded brat and it was delicious. Great flavors and textures (which can be hard with vegan food). They are exceptionally nice too! 

Tip for the fair - they are near the tractors and pioneer village. You can ride you bikes. Park near the midway with the free bike parking and walk right in!

Best food truck in Nashville!! 
The chicken & waffles are absolutely delicious! 
You can definitely taste that it's made from scratch and with a lot of love!
I try to get to The Waffle Boss  at least once a week!

We were having a bad day in Nashville.  The sky had opened up and and attacked us with water.  Drenched, we hurried to meet up with the comedy tour bus we had picked as our day's prime activity.  The bus did not show at the appointed hour.  We waited and waited only to eventually learn that the tour bus we were waiting for had collided with a motorcycle parade [true story] and that our tour was cancelled.  Distraught, we wandered around, wondering what we could do with our day.  We ended up taking a short and uninteresting horse drawn carriage ride with a driver who immediately copped an attitude with us as soon as we said we were from California and who, as an added bonus, did manage to convince us that we were about to spend the rest of our vacation with food poisoning due to the hot dog we bought off the street while we were hurrying to meet the tour we didn't get to take.  Disappointed and dejected (and waiting to become powerfully ill) we set out to see the Parthenon.  

In the vicinity of Parthenon, we stumbled on a gathering of food trucks.  Having lived in LA in the not too distant past, where the food truck scene is prime, we pulled over and went to investigate.  We sampled a couple of food trucks, most of which were forgettable and forgotten, and then we tried the chicken and waffles from The Waffle Boss.  We were instantly tickled by the variety of waffles and the guy taking our order was so friendly.  We became cautiously optimistic.  My boyfriend ordered the chicken and regular waffle while I ordered the chicken and red velvet waffle.  We had to wait 20 minutes or so, but man, it was so worth it.  The chicken (which came in strip form) was perfectly cooked and juicy with a crunchy delicious coating seasoned in such a way as to give a little flavor punch and perfectly offset the flavor of the waffle.  The red velvet waffle was a beautiful crimson color, so enticing to the eye that even if I was not a fan of chicken and waffles I would have been thrilled to eat it. [I confess to snapping a couple of pictures so I could elicit the proper amount of envy when I returned to Cali].   It was fluffy, dense (but not overly so) and flavorful.  Sweet, but not too sweet.  Combined, the chicken and red velvet waffle were genius.  Not since Roscoe's in LA had we enjoyed chicken and waffles this much (and that is saying something).   Our day was instantly saved.  For a moment we kind of wished we lived in Nashville. 

Amazing work Waffle Boss!  Cook on!

This was my...  Third stop at the 2013 Nashville Street Food Awards. This was my least favorite meal of the day. Like, by far. I will say that the sole reason was SOOOOOoooooooooo much build up and not much delivery. Why was there so much build up? When I ordered, I was told it would be 20-25 minutes. OK.. I can deal with 25 minutes for PERFECTION!  Who couldn't? He told me to check in at the 20 min mark. So.. While we're waiting we go to the Biscuit Love truck. Get the Princess biscuit from them. We eat that. We then walk around a bit and circle back to Waffle Boss at the 20 minute mark. Guy tells me... Another 10 minutes.  So we walk next truck over to the Sum Yum Yum truck and order a Bon Mi. We Eat that too. I check in again at the 35 minute mark. Guy tells me..... Another 10 minutes.So we walk over to the Delta Bound truck. They are sold out of most things so we just get their dessert offering. We ate that. Come back to the Waffle Boss and still wait....  It took 52 minutes to get out my order of Chicken and Waffles (original) and some fried Okra. 

Here's the let down. Seasoning. The Okra had none and wasn't cooked quite long enough. The chicken has some, but not enough. I will say that the chicken was cooked properly and not over or under. It had more breading on it than I liked too. I can't imagine anyone likes that much breading on their chicken actually.

So, for all that build up to get under seasoned Okra and over breaded Chicken, I was quite disappointed.

This was my first experience of chicken and waffles having moved south, and overall it was a good experience.  Waffle Boss adds this delicious cinnamon butter you can apply to your waffle, and it's almost like cake icing -- it absolutely made the dish.  Without it, I probably would have given only 2-stars; but the flavors really brought out the chicken and waffle combo and definitely bumped them up to 3-stars.

The guys in the truck were friendly, and service took about 12 minutes (I don't know if that is slow or fast relatively speaking).  I thought it was a bit pricey at $9, but such is the business of food trucks when you have a fixed cost that included higher gas prices and storage of your vehicle.

I don't think I would go back again, but I'm glad I tried it and I would recommend it to a friend to go and try as well.  

(Side note: they offer flavors such as red velvet and birthday cake and are in the batter of the waffle in case you were wondering.)

Can I give 6 stars? I LOVE this food truck. Chicken and waffles have become a great trend lately but I swear, nobody does it the way Waffle Boss does. Living up to their name, WB delivers made-to-order original, birthday cake, red velvet, and other seasonal waffles. The chicken is hot, fresh, cooked with the perfect balance of crunch and tenderness, and immensely flavorful. It was served with a cream cheese frosting and syrup. I seriously finished every bite.

I can't wait to go again!!

last weekend went to the food truck festival and I was determined to try these amazing chicken and waffles. the cashier immediately told me it would be a 45 minute wait (the line was insane) it was so worth it! tried the birthday cake and regular waffles and both were amazing and the chicken was perfection.  please try waffle boss, you will not be disappointed!

I came here for a birthday dinner. 

1. I told the hostess that I had a 7pm reservation and she told me the reservation was cancelled. I told her that I'm confident my friends are seated because they just texted me. We walk in the main room and I spot my friends. Can you please check before telling me my friends cancelled the reservation? 
2. Ordered a mojito. There were no mints in it. Meanwhile my friend ordered some Philly flower drink and she had a ton of mints. What is a mojito without muddled mint? 
3. There was 8 of us meaning a guaranteed 20% gratuity for the waiter. He was getting irritable because we took too long to figure out what apps we wanted, poor service 
4. Got the braised short rib for roughly 30 bucks. Though the portion was big, it was bland and tough. 

Only things that were enjoyable were my friends and the view.

Buyer Beware: If you're coming for the view, forget it. Both the website photo and the one listed on yelp are dishonest, deceptive and very disappointing. They should know better than to make the public think that the view of city hall and all of the other structures are what the dining room sees: NONE OF IT IS VISIBLE FROM THE DINING ROOM. Shame on you!!!

Otherwise, the food was very good, the staff very attentive and pleasant. 

But listen, management, "Psst...we came for the view." Why do you deceive everyone into thinking you have the one on your website, when, in fact, you do not?

We won't be back.

What's not to love about Level 33?  The view is breathtaking, after all.  You're seated thirty-three floors above Market Street (hence the restaurant's name) and if you can see past the looming lighted Aramark logo that dominates the skyline south of 12th Street you'll enjoy the best of Philly's skyline as you dine.  The wait staff are courteous and professional.  And my food -- from the butternut squash and lemongrass soup to the sea salt and caramel creme brulee -- was fabulous.

So why did I give Level 33 one star?  Because they handed me a wine list without any item pricing -- that's why.  I ordered a simple bottle of 2011 Ruffino Moscato d'Asti and they charged me sixty dollars for it.  That was the total price for a business dinner for two, inclusive of coffee and desserts, and the unpriced bottle of wine doubled our bill.  You can walk into any liquor store and pick up a bottle of Ruffino Moscato d'Asti for 11.99.  I expected to pay thirty dollars for it.  I was, in a word, bled.  

My advice to the owners of Level 33 is this:  Provide a wine list with itemized pricing for your customers or they will never return, because they will always, always leave your premises feeling ill-used.  For that reason and that reason alone I will never return to this lovely sky lounge, despite the otherwise excellent faire.  Farewell Level 33...

The view of this temporary restaurant was pretty amazing, even better than the view from some other restaurants perched above the city. We got a prime spot looking at the Ben Franklin bridge and over the river. 

Unfortunately the food did not match the view. While the Crabcake was quite tasty and had a lot of crab meat, the Butternut Squash soup was very thin and the Seared Tuna tasted overwhelmingly of vinegar. Service was also slow and not attentive (we had to ask for butter 3 times before we received some).

The views from up here are fabulous.  I shall not speak of the food because I did not want to try it.  Their bottled beer list is rather limited.  Luckily, they had good old Sam Adams to the rescue.  I sampled one of their mixed drinks that a friend got.  It was, as expected, cloying, but at least not terribly so.

Service at the bar was unenthusiastic but sufficiently competent.  The decor was chic - for the 1970's (they totally should have used the location in American Hustle).  I imagine its days are numbered as the hotel is getting renovated.  Drink prices were on the higher side, as you'd expect from a place trading on its location, but not absurdly so.

Level 33 has an amazing view of the city accompanied with great food as service. There is a limited number of seats right next to the window, so make a reservation in advance to get one of these. If you don't get a seat by the window you are still able to get a great view of the cities skyline. The food was very good with great flavors and excellent seasoning that made for a very enjoyable dinner. 

Ordered:
- butternut squash 
- ahi tuna

Per the last review, wine prices are now on the menu.

Awful service, mediocre food.

Our conference was at Loew's so we decided to eat lunch at Level 33 which is inside the hotel. We waited over 45 minutes for our food. It was next to impossible to get service. When I told them I was a vegetarian, they just replied, "no, we don't have anything for you to eat". So I ordered a simple Caesar salad with vinaigrette instead of Caesar dressing. My salad arrived with Caesar dressing on it. When I sent it back because of the mistake, they just brought it back (at least 15 minutes later) with the Caesar dressing on the side rather than a vinaigrette dressing.

My dining companions also reported their food to be mediocre.

My soy cappuccino really had little foam on it but, obviously, that's a minor thing compared to the rest of the experience. 

All three of us tipped less than 10% because the service was such a disaster.

I guess I can combine two reviews into this one as I stopped for gas recently at this location as it is close to where I work.  It was around the lunch hour so it was good to know that they have a full service Subway located inside the store.  So after I finished fueling up my ride, I walk in to make my sandwich purchase.  I was the only person in the entire store and was greeted by the one Subway employee they had working there.  She was quick to take my order, but once she started to assemble my sandwich the problems began to appear with this gas/way combo.  

She proceeded to put miniscule amounts of lettuce and veggies on my sandwhich, whereas the bread was completely visible on the inside of the sandwich once it was compiled.  I requested additional items as she was assembling it and even then it was too much effort to put more than two additional bits of lettuce and such into the sandwich.  I was too exasperated at this point to have her remake the sandwich and just paid for it and left.  The only redeeming quality and reason they got even one star is that if you work in the area, they have a list of employers who they offer a free 16oz drink with an id badge.  Lesson learned that I will now stick to going to a real Subway and avoid these gas/way combos.

Pretty good for a gas station Subway. The gentleman making the sandwiches was very friendly and service was quick. Eating area was clean with several tables. Drink dispenser had flavors you can add to soft drinks. Some of the low ratings for this place were not for the Subway but for the gas station/car wash.

Yuck!!  Today I found a curly black hair in my footlong, I'm SO grossed out!!  I used to think this subway was good, but yesterday the Arabic-looking woman behind the counter had an attitude and told me to call before ordering through the Subway app because she was out of a lot of ingredients?!?!?  ..and I find it very coincidental that the next day I have a pubic looking hair in my sub.  SO SO NASTY, stay away from this place!!
Best & cleanest Subway in the area. This is the only one I go to & have been for months now

So on the day of hurricane Irma this place was open for gas, which was great for people on there way to a safer location. They didn't have 87 or 89 grade gas working, just the 93 which I thought was probably right since there was so many people getting gas. Now the only thing that was peculiar was that after I was done pumping, the pump was still adding to my total!!! I only gave one extra star for being open, but kept it low for taking advantage of people in a time of need.

Horrible service!  We were the only ones in line to have our order taken (3 of us ordering sandwiches), another employee takes people that just walked in the door ahead of us and makes their food and checks them out while we are still waiting on sandwiches to be made.  Then the lady kept messing up our sandwiches.  Worst Subway ever!

I don't know if Jared started me going to Subway or my define disdain for fast food mystery burgers, or both. I like Subway. Yes it is a chain. Yes some stores aren't as clean as this store. All stores don't have the friendly service you get at this store.
You can pretty much depend on and know exactly what you are getting and ultimately eating.  I personally stay away from any of their cooked meat sandwiches. The ham, turkey, roast beef and tuna are my go to sandwiches on a whole wheat rool, with the bread hollowed out. I pile on the veggies and feel, I an getting a fairly nutritious meal at a good price.
There are tables to set at, but I usually stop when I am on the run. It is a quick in & out, depending on your time of arrival. I also feel it is a good value for what you are receiving. It's not Boar's Head,  but the portions are always the same.
What's a girl to do?  When you need a quickunch, personally, I think this is a solid choice.

This was the worst experience I've ever had at a subway. They were out of several items, the girl who was making the sandwiches seemed super out of it, mean while chatting in Spanish with her friend... I will never come here again.

Every time I walk into this specific subway my dude Justin is always on point with his customer service and all, his coworker Tina as well was very on point with my large order I had! These 2 employees need raises and promotions ASAP! Great service!!!

I hate this subway! I got take out today and I ordered and payed for two cookies. I left excited to eat my cookies. When I got home my cookies where not in the bag. I called and asked to speak with manager and they hung up on me. This is unacceptable! Anyone who continues to come to this subway is a heathen and is helping perpetuate this injustice. I will get my cookies!!!!!

They don't abide by their store hours. It's very frustrating when going by a schedule and to see that they're not open when they say they're supposed to be. Don't say you open at 10 am when in fact you open at 11. They say me waiting outside as well and didn't open the door. I'd rather drive an extra 10 min to go to another subway.

BEWARE: Online Orders Are Not Going Through!  Not sure what is going on, but I've placed several online orders at this location that have mysteriously become "lost."  I receive emails that state, "Your Order Is Confirmed" but when I show up at the designated time, the store has not received or prepared the order. Providing the Order # or Payment Approval # from the email does not allow them to locate the order in their system. I'm going to try a different store to see if these issues are specific to this location.

Ordered a footling turkey cali fresh, of course to my personal preferences. The coupon I had covered ALL footlongs, except the Cali fresh.  She proceeded to basically throw it in the garbage, and then force me to re-order a completely different sandwich, instead of just giving it to me. An utterly ridiculous absolute waste of time and money, I am in management and I would never make a call like that, not in 1 million years. It's not like someone's gonna order that same exact sandwich to those same exact specifications. Way to go, you just wasted a sandwich, lost a customer, and got a bad review. Well done, petite young black lady (that's the best I can do, I don't know her name)

Surely one of the pettiest moves I've seen by 
an employee in quite a long time. 

Oh, and the sandwich taste like shit. Back to not ever going to Subway anymore.

I've been going to Nico's locations all over Tucson for years. I'm so excited this one opened up right next to me. This one has a smaller menu than the other locations btw. 

Pros:

Super clean and brand new, huge selection of Mexican sodas, very friendly/outgoing staff, and they make your order in less than 5-10 minutes.

Cons:

None

We love the other Nicos locations.Consistent cooking.This location is new in Hidden Valley.No real beef available and greasy chorizo plates and burritos.The one thing you do when you start a new site is,  to be consistent with the food quality.Not at this location.The owner needs to check his cooks here.I know they are new and trying to come up to par.Right now not so good.Will try again in a few months.If it gets better we'll let you know.For now we are going to get our food at the other locations.This one here in Sabino Canyon is not ready for prime time!
So nice to have Nicos near Sabino Canyon. Fabulous shredded beef tacos and friendly service!!

Shredded Beef Tacos were fresh and authentic! Best taco I have had in a very long time! Beef was plentiful, lettuce was very fresh and crunchy and shredded to perfect small bite size and hard shell taco shell ( warm and crunchy) looked and tasted artfully homemade! And I was so happy to see the hot sauces in they bag and not in with the food!

This was our second time eating here.  The food was tasty and the service was good.  

We had a small problem with one of our meals and management quickly stepped in to resolve the issue.  

We're glad you opened business in our neighborhood.

I was a big Nico's fan for breakfast burritos and the occasional lunch burrito but I started getting messy unfavorably made burritos.  Than this Nico's on Sabino Canyon opened up and I stopped to try a bacon, potato, egg and no cheese burrito.  Guess what it was made perfect.  The bacon wasn't all chewy it was fried right and crispy and the egg and potato didn't have a greasy taste. The red salsa they give you is hot but good.  The place is roomy and clean with plenty of parking.  If your a runner or bike rider plan a stop after the workout.

I love Nico's food it's quick, fresh and healthy.  The staff is friendly and they offer a wide variety of options.  I recommend the Sabino Canyon burritos or the chicken taco plate.  Another reason to support Nico's is that it is a small business.

I found Jesus! He lives in this little shop on Sabino Canyon Road, just north of the Circle K, right next to the veterinarian on the northbound lane. During business hours 0600-2300 he can be seen performing miracles with some of the finest Mexican cuisine you've ever tasted. Finally we have a Nico's back in the foothills. No longer does one need to lock & load then make the pilgrimage into midtown ready to engage should their be gunplay. Incredibly kind and welcoming staff, huge portions, generous sides, reasonably priced,. Christ Almighty!

Well, you get the point. 

Be blessed, or something,.

I got the shredded beef chimichanga. The sauce was delicious the guacamole right on point and the salsa was super fresh. I'm from out of town and wanted some local deliciousness and I got it! The refried bean .

Live having a Nico's up here in Sabino Canon!

Rolled tacos are super delicious and throw in a bottle of Mexican Coke for a great meal. 

I was here Friday night and they had a Mariachi band playing out on the patio!

The dining room is very dirty.  Unfortunate, since I'm generally a big Nico's fan.  Dead bugs, food on tables and chairs and dirty floors.  Seems like easy stuff to get right.  Food is good. Just get it to go!

Delicious burgers and sandwiches. I ordered a double, which was way too much food so I'll stick with the single next time. They kept the drive through from the old McDonalds but since they make everything from scratch, it's a long wait in line. I'd suggest ordering in advance.

Loved going to the other locations and usually get a point break or Kevin bacon with beastie boys fries. 

Saw this location on doordash and delivered to Lansdale :)

The shop looks good from walking in the door however there were only  young teenagers running the shop. Upon looking at the menu we heard a worker in the back gagging and making some hacking throat noise followed by a bunch of laughter which made us immediately turn around and say no thank you.

I was appreciative that a original burger maker was taking the place of a former McDonald's Business. I ordered a tombstone burger, which was tasty save for two specifics. And I'm gonna be specific because compared to other places like five guys in shake shack which I know are more expensive this was a minor thing that they could correct. The first was that the bun got soggy way too quickly. Which didn't make eating it a lot a lot of fun. The second was the fried bacon on the burger. It could've been better and fresher. Other than that the service was awesome and I finished it no problem. I will try it again and update you.

Overpriced for the quality of the burger and milkshake. I ordered my burger without a bun and was given a small patty with little cheese and almost no toppings. The "strawberry" milkshake was soft served vanilla ice cream with way too much strawberry syrup, it tasted like children's cough medicine. I thought it would be actual strawberry ice cream served. I wouldn't waste your time or money.

I was so looking forward to this newest edition.  I ordered two burgers, both had bacon.  I was so disappointed!!  The burgers lack any flavor. But the biggest disappointment was that they use Bacon Bits instead of real bacon. The bun was a cheap white bun.  Lettuce on your burger?  try and find it.

Not going to spend my money here again.  This is the former McDonalds building.  And I'm not a fan of McDonalds.....but it's an upgrade in quality compared to this restaurant.  Thank God I didn't get their fries.  At almost $8, I would have been kicking myself for spending even more money.  Not worth the $$$

Just as expensive as Five Guys but with less favor and more grease. Cheese is nonexistent on the burger and they give you a pinch of bacon bits when ordering a bacon cheese burger. The cheese fries with bacon swam in a thick puddle of grease that settled at the bottom of fry container. Once I saw that I had to trash them. I will say that Staff is very polite and professional for all being young kids. But if you would like to spend a lot of money on burgers and fries just go to Five Guys.

We were hesitant to try after the reviews and we love their other location. We ended up giving it a try and calling in an order for to go. When I got there the food was hot and my milk shake was being made fresh. The food was really good. We will definitely be back.

Tried this place for lunch today.  Order a single cheeseburger.  Was disappointed with the very small slice of cheese.  The fries and tater tots were large portions   But overly salted.  Would have to ask for them with either no salt or lightly salted.

I barely ever right reviews but it seems like this place is new so it doesn't have too many reviews yet and guys...this place is AWESOME! Very inexpensive and so delicious. I got the chicken, shrimp and steak hibachi and it's SO much food for such a reasonable price. It's so tasty that I can't wait to get it again.

The food is delicious, and the prices are good.

The online ordering was a bit clunky as I had to create an account and get up to find my credit card rather than using the saved info in my phone. It was also confusing because there aren't descriptions of the menu items. I looked at some photos and ordered anyway. 

I got there, and the open sign was not on, but I went in anyway. My food was ready on time and tastes fresh. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. 

I got home, and the extra zucchini I ordered seemed like it was a replacement for the other veggies. I thought I was ordering extra, but that is ok. The food is really tasty, and I was able to get lots of yum yum sauce. Hibachi is my favorite and it's nice to find an affordable place that does it well.

Very good !!! 10x better than Benihana's I would recommend!! The yum yum sauce is also amazing .  definitely a new spot of mine I love it & it is very good priced I paid $29 for 2full meals and crab Rangoon.

My friend spotted this place from the road and we were intrigued. We love hibachi and the idea of getting it quickly to go was enough for us to give it a shot. The prices here are great and the quantities are huge which is perfect because hibachi is awesome reheated. I had the chicken hibachi and I added zucchini and onion. The veggies were soooo good! Everything was honestly perfect. If this place was closer to where I live I guarantee I'd be a regular but even so I will definitely make the trip back up here for this. Their ginger sauce is delicious and I also really loved the cabbage that comes with the meal. The whole meal only took 7 minutes to wait on! I wish I could prep a meal this good at home that fast haha. Overall I am impressed and this is a great spot for a meal after shopping at Costco or castleton mall!

Honestly very disappointed in this restaurant chain. My friend and I went in 15 minutes before closing and they made sure to charge me 40$ for 3 dinners but they didn't give any YUM YUM sauce. When I tell you I was beyond pissed it was so dry. We couldn't go back because they had closed. Absolutely unacceptable. Especially when each meal comes with 2 sauces each. I've never seen such lack of customer service. Won't be back again!

I tried this place bc I was starving and I figured it would be decent, can't go wrong with hibachi right?

Well I was wrong I ordered the shrimp fried rice and the portion was HUGE which I thought was SWEET! Until I opened the box. There was 8 shrimp on top of the rice with a splash of sautéed onions mixed in. 

I was shocked and pissed to say the least. Had I known this is what I was going to end up with I would've saved my $10.

I give 4 instead of 5 stars which is not at all a bad thing. I can say with all honesty that I was very happy with my meal. I would reserve 5 stars for the more upscale Japanese Hibachi Steak house that costs triple what you will pay here. That restaurant is in Chicago, and it would not be fair to compare Hibachi Express to that one.
What I ordered was the shrimp and scallops hibachi with zucchini and mushrooms. This was my first visit, so I really had no idea what to expect. 
The shrimp were not jumbo, and I did not expect them to be. The scallops were also on the small side, but again I was not expecting them to be.
I was pleasantly surprised that everything was very fresh and I was definitely happy with my order. I think the amount of food was a generous portion, I was surprised when I opened the package at home. 
The interior was very clean and at the time I was there it would have been around 12pm, I was happy about that. 
I will most definitely make another trip to try something different on the menu. I look forward to my next visit!
Cant get enough of this place, generous portions of rice and protein for a reasonable price

Let me start this review off with Benihana's be ready for some competition.  For the price and especially the big portions it is simply amazing . Me and my husband use to enjoys Benihana's but I think we like hibachi express better . The portions are huge and it is filled with tons of meat . I got the chicken steak and shrimp hibachi with a side of broccoli , it literally took me three days to eat it . The homemade yum yum side is too die for . We got a big side sauce so we can enjoy it at home also . My husband got the special fried rice filled with chicken steak and shrimp . He loved it he loves fried rice and he said it was one of the best fried rice with meat and vegetables that he has ever had , they only complaint he had was that he could have ordered more vegetables in his rice like a broccoli or more mushrooms . We will defiantly be back it was defiantly worth the money , I will be a hibachi express fan and loyal customer for a LONG TIME

Small business with amazing food. If you like Crab Rangoon, you know the vast majority of places make them savory. Very, very few make them sweet. I haven't had the sweeter ones in YEARS. Well Hibachi Express makes them like God intended. A mouthful of sweet cream cheese and crab instead of hot onions. I would go here just to grab an order of Crab Rangoon. The rest of the food was super delicious and generous portions. Service was also great!

This spot has good food!! I ordered the hibachi chicken and shrimp combo with zucchini and onions on the side! It so good. We only waited about 10 minutes. The only thing was the lady who took our order was a little impatient and kept asking did we want anything else while ordering. Good food for less than half the time at a sit down hibachi !!!
The food here is actually pretty good, but the location seems a little weird.    It really feels lime a mall food court place that was transported to a seedy strip mall.
I love this restaurant it is the best and you can't beat the price !!! My favorite is hibachi chicken and shrimp !!
This place has pretty good food and the customer service is really nice! Would come again!

The food is usually good, went today and someone was cooking with sandals, no hair net or gloves. Opened my food when I got home and found hair in my box. Called to complain and they refused to give a refund. Will not be back. Unsanitary
Best Mexican bread!!!!great small authentic Mexican store!!! You find everything here!
This is an excellent bakery ! The customer service was awesome ! The Tres Leches Cake was delicious ! My boyfriend loved it ! We will definitely come back .

This is a typical mom and pop Mexican store.

Pan dulce (sweet bread) is baked daily. You pick as much as you like and bring it to the register to weigh. This bread is perfect with coffee. 

The reason why I come is the amazingly delicious Tres Leche cakes. They have the cakes displayed, like any bakery, in a refrigerated display. 

A little on the pricey side but they have to cover their overhead. 

Do visit for specialty spices and hard to find authentic Mexican products.

I would definitely recommend going out of your way to pick up a cake here.

No se puede confiar en este lugar! Puse una order de tamales para hoy. Puse la orden desde el lunes pasado. Ellos me dijeron que podía llegar a las 9 AM por los tamales. Llegó a las 10:30 AM y me dicen que no están listos. Qué me llamron pero que no contesté. Les dije que viva lejos y que mi orden debía estar listo. Luego me dijieron que era mi culpa que llegue temprano por no haber contestado. Luego me dijeron que podía llegar a las 7 pm de la noche. Bueno por fin tengo mi orden y resulta que está mal. No hay tamales de dulce y me dieron tamales de pollo sin salsa. Solo pollo y masa. Nunca se disculparon ni me regresaron mi dibero. Muy mal servicio!

Le doy 2 estrella por el pastel están bueno, Creo que tiene que calcular bien sus letras y alabanza va con Z no con S, y feliz no se le entiende nada, Y mezcla mayúsculas con minúsculas, solo es una observación. 
Los pasteles son muy buenos pero es el tercer pastel que me lo hacen de esa manera creo que no es justo. Tienen que mejor a quien escribe sobre ellos

If you write a bad review on social media of them they will shame you on social media , they never really use gloves and handle money and food with out washing hands, but now all of a sudden they decide to follow washing hands as if this place is dirty

Being a New Yorker, I have a picky palate but local friends told us how good this place is. Was superbly impressed by their food! So authentic and delicious that even our 4 year old was slurping away at his first Ramen bowl! A must try if you are in the Indy area!

My boyfriend and I went to Seraphim for the first time today... and in short, this restaurant blew our minds!!! The patio was dynamite! We ordered edamame, bao, scallops, ramen tonkatsu, mango mocho, Macha milk tea and warrior saki. My boyfriend's favorite part was the scallops while mine was the bao. Our waitress was phenomenal. She was very friendly and attentive to our every need. Please drop everything and go right now! We will be back very very soon!

This is a phenomenal new addition to the Broadripple strip! They have a great patio space and inside has a nice modern look.  They served us a lemon, rosemary and strawberry infused water which was incredibly refreshing, We ordered the wontons to start and they were incredible! Caramelized and full of flavor, with a super tasty filling. We then moved on to the spicy coconut curry noodles, which had an amazing array of seafood and a super rich creamy broth. After all of that, I did order the panacotta dessert which was suggested, and it was unlike anything I've ever had before! A coconut froth on top of a lovely custard and topped in some fruit. This is a great place and I look forward to coming back and trying more dishes!

I've been waiting to try this place and was glad that I got the chance to go here for lunch with a friend. I ordered the chili wontons, expecting it to be a small serving size, and was glad that I was proven wrong. The chili wontons were nicely fried, and who doesn't like fried food. It also had a nice little kick to it. The filling reminded me about meatballs that my dad used to make while I was growing up. Needless to say, I would order this dish again, and I did. I ended up ordering another order for carry out. I ordered the curry laska for my main dish. The dish was super flavorful and also had a good amount of seafood. I can't wait to come back here and try new dishes.

Think of this as Asian fusion tapas! Everything we had was so delicious! Sit on the patio and people watch with some sake and enjoy some delicious grilled skewers of meat. We started with crispy chili wontons that were gigantic and filled with a good kick then went on to enjoy the robatayaki items (grilled on hot charcoal) - we ordered the pork belly, scallops and bulgogi beef. Our favorite was the bulgogi beef because of the marinade. The scallops each had different toppings but our favorite was the wasabi. We really enjoyed the complimentary pickled assortment with cucumber salad and kimchi, a nice palate cleanser. They have every Asian dessert my heart would desire, I was sad I couldn't try them all because of how full I was but we did get the Japanese cheesecake and mochi assortment. The cheesecake was so soft and spongy and the mochi flavors are so unique - we got mango, lychee and ube. Can't wait to come back to have some noodles!

The location of this restaurant is great since it's right in the heart of broad ripple, they also have patio available and they have a limited menu due to the recent opening. My favorites were the wonton in chili sauce and the chicken with peanut sauce. Really good and filled with flavor! Service is amazing, everyone is really nice, and they make sure you got everything on time. I'm looking forward to come back and try the rest of the menu!

First impression of the place is great. Water is tasty, they infuse it with strawberry and mint and it's very refreshing. The appetizers were flavorful, especially the pork belly and the chilli wontons. I didnt get a chance to try the tonkotsu ramen the first time i stopped by though.

Second time i came back the wonton recipes were changed, not a fan of the new fried wontons. I did order the tonkotsu ramen, and to be honest i am not impressed.The noodles and pork was good, but the broth is not authentic, creamy ramen broth. It was much more watery and not savory as typical ramen is.

I would come back for the appetizers though, especially the pork belly. Personally wouldnt have a full dinner here.

I have kept my eyes on this restaurant, waiting for it to open.  My mouth has been watering looking at the menu for the last month.  Since they just openned last week, their menu is really limited.  They are working hard to get everything up to speed, and I can say the 5 dishes I tried were great.  

Service was very attentive.  They were 40% full, so the real test will come when restaurant restrictions are lifted.  It's best to call them for their opening hours because the information is different between their website, FB, and Yelp.

I look forward to testing the rest of their menu, and maybe change my review to 5 stars.

I feel bad for my rating as they are a newer restaurant, however hopefully my review will help them improve! 

So I read the reviews before coming here and saw some loved it others not so much. I thought we would try it out especially as it's within walking distance from where I live. We get seated outside quickly and given a menu to share. I honestly think we waited a good 10-15 minutes before he stopped by to check on us, and when he did he started with have I gotten your order yet? They had 4 other tables- honestly not busy at all. He could be a new waiter so I try and give him the benefit of the doubt- this is what annoys me though....while we are waiting that good 15 minutes another couple arrives is seated be the waiter takes the order immediately. That's when he stopped by to see if our order had been taken- so we are ordering our food and one of the things we wanted was the pork belly app...well guess what the couple that had gotten there 15 minutes after us just ordered the last one...so no pork belly for us. 
 
We had the chili wontons, bulgogi beef and ramen tonkatsu. The wontons and beef were pretty good. The beef would not have been enough for an actual meal, you would need to order two robatayakis. Like other yelpers had reviewed the ramen did not have much flavor at all. I had seen the owner leave reviews that they were still working on the menu so I was hoping it had been improved- and honestly just flavorless. We added a bunch of hot sauce which gave it some heat. I was pretty bummed. 

Two positives: the water had lemon and lime in it which I liked, they also bring out picked vegetables to the table as a free starter. We had the veggies brought to us before we had any place settings. The waiter for the place settings to us quickly after that though which is when we also got the delish water.

I don't think I'll come back here again until I see a lot of positive yelp reviews. Hoping this restaurant improves and can survive here. I love being able to walk to eat!

This was an amazing dining experience.  Our foodie group decided to try this place out for dinner since it was brand new in broad ripple.  We were very impressed with the quality of the food and the service.   Diego, our server, was very professional and was very attentive to our needs for our group.  Most of us ordered the curry Alaska noodle soup which was heaven in a bowl.  The seafood and noodles were just delicious and the fact that they make their own noodles in the restaurant was just the icing on the cake of perfection.   I ordered the crispy pork as an appetizer which was very tasty.  The dessert was delicious and very different.   It was a custard like dessert that was very smooth and great on the palate.  The owner was nice enough to stop by our table and say hello and talk about the background of the restaurant.   It was very personable and felt wonderful that he would take time to talk to us about our dining experience.   I will definitely be back here for lunch or dinner.  This is a great restaurant that everyone should experience.

So hard to find a good Asian place in this city, unless you live near this lovely spot in Broadripple! This place is great for takeout or if you can find a spot on the patio. My boyfriend and I tried the Beef Haw Fun, Shoyu Ramen, and Crispy Pork Belly. Everything was hot, well executed, and packed with flavor. 

The broth of the Ramen was unique. It was very savory probably a beef and miso broth with sesame oil... I loved the flavors. The beef in the Beef Haw Fun was perfectly cooked and super delicious.. although I feel like it could have used more spice (next time I'll ask for sriracha) and the pork belly was some of the best I've ever had. Liked the drink menu as well. It was unique and we found stuff we hadn't tried before! 

Our host and server periodically checked on us and made sure we felt welcome and happy with the food. When we asked questions (like hey what's better this or this) they were quick with suggestions and opinions which I love especially when I'm at a new spot. The pork belly alone is worth coming back for!!!

My husband and I were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed this new restaurant on BR Ave. We started by trying some new beers that we'd never had before, both delicious. For an appetizer we had the wok vegetables and they were Amazing!!! For dinner I had the coconut curry which was packed with seafood and my husband had the short rib ramen. The meat in his entree was slightly tough, but the flavor was great. Service was amazing. We will definitely go back.

Don't miss this place...

Wow! We dropped in for dinner on a Saturday night with five adults and sat on the patio. In the beginning, the service was a little off by not having menus or silverware when food was delivered, but it got better. 

First off the food is amazing-I'm pretty sure between all of us we covered most of the menu-everything was so tasty. And even when things were getting slow, they were great at managing our expectations and letting us know. 
Second-the saki cocktails are everything. Not too sweet, not too strong. Perfect for a warm night on the porch. 
Finally-the value for the amount of food was amazing! 

I'm hopeful that this is one place in BR that will stay around! We can't wait to go back.

Overall, a solid Asian restaurant that serves the Broad Ripple scene well. 

Be aware that they are very busy and that the staff is (as the bartender mentioned when my take out order was delayed) "working their butts off." But he was kind and offered a drink and apologized for the delay. Unfortunately , when we were heading home, they forgot my wife's drink order. Not a deal breaker though 

Their pork bento box was good. The pork belly tasted like lechon kawali done right which is not a bad thing. But not what I expected. Tip: If you pick extra veggies or any option than rice, they won't give any rice. Fortunately we had extra rice at home. And my wife was content with her tonkatsu ramen order.

Food is good. And the staff works hard and is very kind.

After checking out the menu on here and seeing all the pictures I knew I wanted to visit immediately. I love the patio and the tables are spaced accordingly. We were greeted and seated quickly. The host was very friendly as well as our server. 
We tried to order 4 different items and were told they were out, it was pretty disappointing because those were things I literally came here for and it's just Friday and you're out of your most popular dishes? So our server recommended an item to us that we did not enjoy told her and she brushed it off. 
The yakisoba was delicious I would absolutely come order it again I am not a fan of mushrooms but the ones in this dish were amazing. We unfortunately weren't a fan of the wontons I think peanut sauce ruined it, I was expecting spicy and they were sweet. The Japanese cheesecake wasn't at all the texture we were expecting but good. I don't know if I would order again nothing to write home about. I want to visit again when all items are available on the menu.

I've eaten here three times so far, and have zero complaints. The Curry Laksa is probably the best seafood curry in Indianapolis.  Mussels, squid, scallops, veg, and homemade noodles, all in a lovely curry sauce.  It's just about perfect in terms of balance between rich, sweet, spice, salt.... fantastic.  The Bulgogi beef skewers and scallop skewers are awesome, juicy, and flavorful, and the little pickles they serve on the side offer a great balance.  Service is top notch, presentation is beautiful, and dishes come out in a totally reasonable time.  Don't miss this place!

This is a brand new Asian fusion restaurant in the area. We've tried it quite a few times and ordered different dishes every time. Though it's fusion, I taste a lot of authentic flavors in different dishes representing different countries (Taiwan, Korean, Japanese, Malaysia...) Their noodles are made in house; you can even see their noodle machine. When the weather is nice, the outdoor seating combined with food+drink+dessert definitely made my day. Service was very friendly. Love it every time! Sorry, I forgot to take pictures as we couldn't wait to eat it every time. Next time.

My family got carry-out, we had been interested in trying Seraphim since we heard it was opening in Broad Ripple. The staff was very friendly and helpful (and everyone seemed to be wearing masks). The limited menu wasn't available online yet, so the employee who answered the phone offered to walk us through the menu or email it to us. Since we had it emailed, I've posted a picture of the menu here. 
We tried the Bulgogi beef, Yakitori Chicken Breast Sasami, Curry Laksa, and Chili Wontons. All of the dishes were very delicious. I would warn that the servings aren't enormous like at many restaurants, a good option is to order many dishes and share. We also tried the Milk Tea, which was very tasty and not overly sweet.
I look forward to trying their full menu once it becomes available!

Ordered takeout on Friday night and wanted to give Seraphim a spin. We ordered the crispy wontons, beef haw fun, xiao bao biscuits, and yakisoba. All of the food was very well prepared. I think the wontons would be better eaten fresh, not carry out. It's hard to maintain crisp in a takeout container- but the flavors were great. Love love loved the beef haw fun, amazing flavors and tender beef. My only complaint was the yakisoba, it was so salty, bordering on inedible. I love salt, but this knocked my socks off. When I ran in to grab the food, I was taken with how nice the interior looked, and the staff was super friendly. I plan to go back for an in person meal, and try a few more items from the menu.

Excellent new restaurant in broad ripple. Awesome location right on the strip that has housed a number of restaurants that never found their footing. Hopefully this place is here to stay because the food is legit. We tried a number of different appetizers and a noodle dish and everything was great. Best new restaurant in broad ripple in a while.

Just returned from here and had an amazing experience! Started off by having the option to sit outside or inside, both areas were very chill and good vibes. To start, we ordered the edamame, beef bugolgi, and the super nice worker (sorry never got his name) sent over a free order of chili wontons, "just because"! Such a nice surprise and all small plates were seriously delicious. Then my husband ordered the Yakisoba and I had the Robatayaki Ramen and both AMAZING. We couldn't decide whose was better because they were both perfect. Not often you love every single dish and get great service! Definitely will return.

This place was five stars all the way around! Service was prompt, friendly, and sincere. The server was so knowledgeable and able to give me perfect recommendations of what to order. The person that brought me my food also prepared it for me. He even stopped back by to ask if the spice level was good for me. 
Also, GET THE PEAR TART! Best dessert I have had in a long time! I will be back soon!

We went to the soft open.  First of all, these guys know how to protect the public.  All staff were wearing masks, and they started turning people away early despite having empty tables to make sure the diners were safe!  We sat outside on the huge patio and were several feet away from other diners with a breeze going through.  We ordered several robotayaki (kabobs?).  Bulgogi beef was delicious, scallops with plum sauce were super tasty.  Chicken skewer was a bit dry with heavy wasabi dollop.  The kim chee wasn't as sweet as my preference but the pickled scallion heads were the best!!!  Crispy pork belly with Vietnamese vinaigrette was good.  I had the Taiwanese beef noodle soup and the homemade noodles had the perfect texture with melt in your mouth beef.  My husband had the ramen tonkatsu and the noodles, broth, pork, and soft boiled egg were extremely satisfying.  So excited to have another authentic Asian restaurant in Indy!  Definitely looking forward to coming back when they have a full menu!  Great service took our feedback at the end of the meal.

Met with friends on the deck for lunch. Great dry or traditional ramen as well as smaller bite skewers. My friend had the bulgogi skewers. I did the traditional ramen with beef. Great presentation as well as top notch service.  The assorted sides relishes are great, especially the kimchi. A decent selection of beers with really good food in a relaxed atmosphere. Good quick and friendly service.

Wanted to try this place out for a while so I finally was able to stop by for dinner to do so!

Nate (a manager there) greeted me with a warm smile and stopped by our patio table to give us some drink and food menus. They have different types of sake, some wine, beer.. I settled on the nigori u filtered sake. It was very good!

They have small plates which allows you to try different dishes and some noodles of different types in large bowls. 
I tried the chili fried wontons, one of my favorites now that has a sweet delicious flavor on the outside of the wonton, fried pork belly, they have housemade kimchi, a savory bulgogi (miss spelled?) meat on a stick.. I was stuffed! 
Nate was kind enough to pick some dishes out for us to try. 

The patio is covered and  nice. Inside the decor was elegant but not too stuffy,

And the cucumber lime water.... nice!

The new kid on the block and it's a welcome addition. I just hope the location is not a jinx since the last couple of restaurants didn't last very long. 
However the new spot has quite the potential. It's interior is very nicely done, with big bright art on the walls and more seating than you would expect when you look at it from outside. I recommend reservations, as they had to turn away a lot of folks the night that we visited. 
We had to make do with a limited opening menu, but still had plenty to chose from. Can't wait to see the full menu once they are up and fully running. 
We started with a little freebie appetizer of 3 differently pickled vegetables. All of which very spot on, my favorite being the tiny little onions. If they ever sell those to go, I will buy them all up.
I was particularly interested in the Robatayaki grill and so I ordered Nam Prik Shrimp. They were delicious, not sure what they did to these shrimp, but it works. Please be aware that all of the grilled items are very small, you will need something else ot go with it. There were three large shrimp in my order... yes huge shrimp, but 3 won't fill me up. 
So I am glad to have also ordered the chili wontons. Looks a little like ravioli, but hte taste is really interesting. The filling wasn't too great in my opinion, but my friends praised it a lot. 
The wok fried veggies were also quite delicious. We all agreed on that. 
The curry and various ramen were served steaming hot in large bowls filled to the brim  with noodles and broth and various delicasies. I heard zero complaints from my guests and they are a picky bunch. 
I also enjoyed a Vietnamese Iced Coffee, which was served in a huge glass. Strong delicous coffee. Highly recommend. 

Personally I say, check it out. I will certainly be back.

This was a great new place to stumble upon! We recently went to Broad Ripple Ave and were planning on visiting another establishment. That restaurant did not have much outdoor seating and was packed. We started to walk around and went by here. It's next to the old Triton Tap Room. 

Big outdoor area for seating on broad ripple ave. Plenty of tables, even spaced out like they have to be right now. Inside was also big and renovated since the last tenant. When the weather gets colder this will be a very nice place to hangout.

They had a beer special the night we were there, as well as Bento boxes as a special as well. 

We split a bunch of different items. For Apps, we split the chili wontons (awesome), roti with curry (interesting and tasty),  and the Xiaobao Sliders (could have used a little more filling, but great flavor). We also split the shrimp and scallop Robatayakis. Those were both delicious and small little flavorful pre-dinner pieces to our meal. 

We then got the Beef Haw Fun, the Curry Laksa, and the Ramen Tonkatsu. The Ramen and the Laksa were very similar in styles, but completely different in flavors. The Ramen was very traditional and had all the textures and ingredients that you would expect. It was good. The Laksa was a seafood dish, with scallops, shrimp, mussels, and probably some other stuff. The Laksa was so good! The sauce is awesome! My favorite was the Beef Haw Fun. Delicious sauce, well cooked, and just so tasty!

Not to mention the prices are great and the main dish portions are huge!

They have a good selection of both food and drinks!

We'll be back soon!
They had a smaller soft opening/covid menu but there were still lots of solid options. Some really nice noodle entrees and lots of small plates. Also, some tasty saki cocktails.

If you love homemade, fresh noodles this is your place! If you love a pleasant, outdoor patio this is your place! The food is flavorful & delightful. The atmosphere is calm & relaxing. The staff made me feel extremely comfortable with the allergen food menu. The restaurant was impeccably clean and they took precautions seriously. I definitely will be back to support this restaurant that recently opened to ensure they stay open.

We received wonderful service! We went for the lunch hours and it was moderately busy but not super busy! The food was really good i got the pork belly small plate(which had a good enough amount of serving, ramen shoyu,  and yakitori chicken sasami. It was all really good!! To wash it down we got the Japanese logger and japanese light beer, i loved it! I definitely recommend this place especially for the price and the GREAT service! The inside is also super fancy and nice!! I highly recommend it! The price all came out to only $40 you really cant beat that especially if you just want to try the food! Also i forgot to mention the flavorable water was very good!

So happy that there is a new restaurant in this location that offers a different type of cuisine that is delicious! We went during the soft opening and sat outside, the food was delicious and the service was amazing! Servers were very attentive and worked together. We got the wonton appetizer and edamame. Then for the entry I had the Taiwanese broth bowl, and the others had another ramen bowl, the shrimp and the bulgagi dish (spelling is off) everything was cooked perfectly! We will be back all of us left happy!

Soft opening this week. Limited menu but very good. There are lots of small plates so if you want a snack this is a great place. Or if you want to try lots of things with a group this would be a great place too. They started with their own pickled veggie plate - omg the papaya slaw salad, one of my favorite things I've ever had. Kind of spicy, kind of sweet, just perfect. Everything we had was so flavorful and delicious. The udon was my least favorite thing that we got because it came out last and lacked in flavor comparatively to everything else. It was still really good and we had so much before that we weren't even upset because we were full anyways. I know last few restaurants in this location haven't done very well, I hope this stays for a while because it was very, very good.

I feel bad giving a poor review to a new restaurant near my home with a promising menu, but I want to be honest. 
I don't know if it's because we got food to go or if it was a one off but the food we ordered was bland and disappointing. 

I'll start with the good stuff. The best thing was the spicy wontons, and I would definitely order them again. 
There was a tiny kimchi side that was VERY good, I wish I had more of it.  

We ordered the pork belly belly which was fine. The pork tonkatsu ramen had pretty good broth, but the noodles were stuck together in a huge lump making it a little harder to eat. I do think this was the fault of getting it to-go so I give that a total pass and would guess that the dish is better fresh in the restaurant. 

The chicken udon has great noodles, but the broth was very bland and the chicken bits in it were tough and chewy. We also ordered some peanut chicken skewers and I have no idea if it was an accident or how they are meant to be served but they were tough and bland didn't seem to have any sauce on them at all, nor with them on the side. Finally, the sticky rice with mango- this is normally one of my favourite desserts, but what we got was weirdly foamy and watery... to be honest it just plain did not taste good and had a weird texture. 

I would maybe give this place another try sometime in the future when they are fully open but we normally go to Meet Noodles for ramen and will probably continue to do so.

Currently under a soft opening as they are still working out the kinks. But don't be fooled, even with those kinks this place has great food and great service. Furthermore both the new-to-table-waiting waiter and the manager came up to our table and asked what worked and what needed to be fixed.  Not just a 'how was everything' but a 'tell us what we did wrong' which made us fee comfortable in giving honest feedback. My dinning mate praised the ramen but suggested the option of different spice levels. I had the matcha milk tea (delicious), pork belly (melt in your mouth), and the star of the show -- the spicy wontons -- a must get.
