Looking forward to going back once they expand the menu but the current menu is great as it is.

I wanted to like this place so bad. I saw an article about them during quarantine and have been wanting to visit ever since. We were a party of 4 and arrived for a later dinner on a Friday night. They had a great patio and it was a beautiful evening. Most of the tables on the patio were full with no one waiting for a table and maybe 1 table seated inside. 

We ordered the Crispy Pork Belly, Cantonese Wonton Noodles, and the Mango Sticky Rice. I think my husband had the Ramen Tonkatsu? Between the 4 of us, we ended up ordering 2 small plates and 4 different types of noodles and none of the food came out together. Speaking for my husband and I, both of our noodles were bland which we ended up adding chili sauce to. The mango sticky rice barely had any mangos in it, a lot of coconut, and unfortunately bland as well. It traditionally has condensed milk in it so it should have been a sweet treat. 

I think the crispy pork belly was the best part of our meal because it was the only thing that had flavor out of all of the dishes we ordered. Our friends ordered XiaoBao Sliders and they enjoyed those as well. 

Aside from the food, our service was extremely slow. It remained slow all the way until we left, even when they did not have many tables seated.
All I can say is WOW. They blew my expectations out of the water with their food. I will definitely be back and I will be recommending this place to everyone.

We have just had the best Asian food in Indiana!  We were not aware that The opening of Seraphim during COVID and just found out from our neighbors. This is not your regular Asian restaurant. Please expect fine dining Asian fusion quality like when you are in New York or San Francisco. We were served the side dish sampler (complementary like in authentic Asian restaurants) once sat down.  We were so surprised the kimchi, picked vegetables were really fermented ones not just those that mixed with vinegar and salt. They were full of life!  We ordered Chili Wontons and Pork Belly Robatayaki as appetizers. They were full of flavor and texture. We also asked for their homemade Siracha! Delicious! Then we had two Japanese noodle soup: Ramen Shoyu and Ramen Tokatsu. They were the real deal Ramen: with honest bone broth and sweet miso. Most ramens in town put salt or other seasoning which is mostly salty. But the broth here really taste the authentic ones! We later found out the owners lived in Asia and owned several restaurants in this country and in Taiwan. 
The concept may be confusing to folks here with these delicate Asian specialties. Think about it as high end California Asian fusion food with fresh ingredient and delicate preparation. We will surely go back often!

Well I don't really expect much due to covid and also new restaurants and all but the name fushion lived up to it's name, ordered ramen omg the worst ramen i ate in my entire life , and bulgogi was on stick!!! Skewered style hello since when ??? Again I know it's not authentic but again please do not do something out of ordinary in not a good way . On top of all they do NOT HAVE STEAM (white rice) I am done ! One star for nice service!!

Celebrated a birthday dinner with my husband here. We were both super impressed with the atmosphere, food, and service. 
Indoor dining- this place has both regular seating and high top tables. The chairs were super comfortable. Everything was clean and the staff were all wearing masks. 
Food- The menu had a great variety of options. We wanted a little help so the server was great with recommendations. We started with the chili wontons and steamed buns. The wontons were amazing! The wrapper was still crunchy and the sauce added a nice amount of heat. For dinner we shared pork belly robatayaki and a udon noodle bowl. Both were absolutely amazing. 
We are both looking forward to going to this place again and trying more of their menu

This spot is currently allowing indoor and outdoor seating! I had the Chili Wontons and Yakisoba! The chili wontons were just okay in my opinion, lacked filling vs others I've had. The chili flavor was nice. As for the yakisoba, it was extremely tasty. I love a great noodle dish, loved the amount of vegetables as well. I also had a Thai tea - INCREDIBLE. First time I've had it and I will definitely reorder if I go back!

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! The woman was extremely rude and had absolutely no clue what an over easy egg was. I had to leave, I would have felt sorry for the woman for not knowing how to cook if she wasn't so rude but nope, don't feel bad for her.

I eat a bagel every day. No matter where I am. For the last 30 years. These are the best in the world. So... when there is a line it is because the products are so good. If you come in on Sunday and special order bagel sandwiches you are going to wait. In a hurry? go to Starbucks and have a cardboard bagel from the freezer and be on your way. But if you want the best bagel there is, from a Mom and Pop shop that takes their time to create bagel magic the old fashioned way, get in line. Or do what I do, call ahead on a Wednesday. They are great people, but they are busy and again, not a chain with a million employees. Many times there is no wait at all. 

In a town where everyone loves their chains, and in a hurry, Skyy's the Limit is a true treasure. The salt bagel is my favorite. The Kummelwick is a nice treat. They are all awesome.

The bagels here are too soft--they seem to be a roll/bagel hybrid. What's worse are their bagel sandwiches, which I had to take apart to find the bacon...the bacon is paper thin and almost non-existent.

I live in Florida now. Used to reside down the street from this bagel Establishment. I was just told recently that they closed doors and locked up shop. Even though I'm almost 100 percent sure covid didn't help their business and keeping the money coming in i can absolutely guarantee their business practices had something to do with it.  I absolutely loved the owners wife but the owner(after Jim) was not a very nice person. As much money I gave that business throughout the years they should've rolled out a red carpet for me every time I entered that Establishment. So like I said, I'm sure covid didn't help but YOUR BUSINESS PRACTICES WERE ABHORRENT. I tried to bring in a group of my fellow disabled friends and was treated like absolute garbage, not by the owners wife but BY THE OWNER. So in the end I'll call it covid Karma

This place has been horribly run since the day it opened (regardless of who's running it), and today was the last straw for me.  The cashier coughed directly into her hand before reaching to grab my card and I'm completely grossed out right now.  The staff always looks like they just rolled out of bed and none of them make an effort to present themselves as people you want to be handling your food.  The bagels themselves are excellent, but cleanliness is a big concern.

We've just found our new favorite  Mediterranean place! The atmosphere is lovely from the tablecloths to  the music to an extremely clean atmosphere. Our meal began with some  warm bread and dipping oil with scrumptious flavor. We enjoyed house  salad as well as a Greek salad. Both were so fresh. We tried the Nabulsi  fried cheese appetizer and were not crazy over that, but the rest of  the food was so amazing, it didn't matter. We ordered the Royal Meal  Lovers Platter and the entire thing was delicious. Our favorites were  the lamb chops, and kufta kabob. We also ordered a child's meal of  chicken fingers and fries and it was greatly enjoyed.  We can't wait to  try breakfast here. Lastly, I am picky about having freshly brewed iced  tea (not bottled or fountain) and this place makes an absolutely perfect  iced tea. The service is amazing. We can't wait to go back!
I've tried the Greek salad, chicken Shawarma, Turkish kebab platter and everything was excellent.

I ran across this place after being in the strip mall for another vendor. I looked it up on Yelp to see if anyone has been here. Decided to try. Absolutely amazing! Not only is it beautiful inside, they have tables outside to dine if you like. The food was incredible and one of the best hummus and shawarma I have had. I will absolutely come back here. Sooooooo goooood!
Great service - very authentic- small portions - worth a visit because the food is excellent

Our first visit to this lovely restaurant was a bit disappointing. I had a falafel wrap that was the smallest wrap of this type I have ever had. No flavor, either. We also had the fatoush salad that was good but there was something odd about the oil used. Definitely not good olive oil like I have had at other Mediterranean restaurants. I want to support small, independent restaurants like this. Our waiter was friendly. We were glad to be there early because as the place filled, he was really swamped. We may give the place another try but not soon.
Omg the food is so good. And the customer service is so great. I went there a week ago for the first time and at least once a day I'm recommending this place to someone.

2 stars

I have gotten take out from this place once and called in an order another time only to cancel it soon after. 

First time, I called in an order for falafel, gyro, and salad and waited in the restaurant for about 15 minutes longer than they said it would be. No problem - happy to wait for good food, but there was only one other person in the restaurant. They asked and confirmed my order with me when I arrived in the restaurant but when I left with my food, they forgot one of the items. I was frustrated since we had been driving all day, but it happens so I went back to pick it up. Food was just okay, but pretty pricy for what you get. The exception was the gyro - it was good!

Second time, we ordered two gyros for pick up. They alerted me that it would take at least 30 minutes to be ready. After hanging up, we decided we were too hungry to wait and called back to cancel the order exactly two minutes after placing it. I apologized and asked to cancel the order, but the woman on the phone fought with me and said it was almost done and it can't be canceled. She said she would have to speak with the manager about canceling it. I don't understand how it could be almost ready if they said it could take over 30 minutes. Eventually she did cancel without charge because she realized I would not budge with her blatant lies. I was really excited to have a Mediterranean place close by, but we will not be trying this place again.
Excellent quality of food,fresh,tasty and well seasoning.Very clean and relaxing atmosphere highly recommended.
The chicken shawarma wrap was great but for 8 bucks just a pita with chicken inside  it is not worth it.

Absolutely delicious!
Appetizer Sampler was beyond good. The grape leaves were tasty, the falafel was spiced perfectly and the dips were worth the trip! Chicken shawarma wrap was 5 star. This is an authentic Mediterranean restaurant you don't want to miss. The decor and ambience were very well done. You won't be disappointed...I highly recommend!

This is one of the best Mediterranean restaurants around.  The food is delicious and the customer service is great.  I hope that they never close.  I just ate there yesterday and I'm already to go back tonight!

Best arabic food in the area. There's not much authentic Arabic food nearby in the land o lakes area that is good and I am so glad I found this. Real delicious Arabic flavor and so much to choose from.

Food looks to be amazing however you will be waiting for a long time due to short staffed. I decided to go on Sunday and there were only 3 tables and it took very long for us to receive our food. I was very disappointed with the service.
Great little family restaurant with a lot of Greek inspired dishes! Offering breakfast options and fresh coffee! Worth stopping by to give it a try!
Food was good, nothing fancy.  Prices are very reasonable and the staff was very friendly and attentive.  Will visit again.

Mediterranean food is my favorite type of food and with Garden Mediterranean Grill opening up right in front of my neighborhood, I didn't want to get my hopes up. I mean what are the chances of having the best Mediterranean food in town mere feet away from my home? Well I'm happy to say every doubt I had melted away with the first bite of my falafel and hummus! My Turkish kabob platter was even better! So fresh and spiced perfectly that I came back the very next day for another! I'm so happy to say I've found my new local food spot! You won't be disappointed! Check them out and tell them Kenny sent you!

First time here  This place is amazing. Some of the best mezza  and kabobs I've had since I lived in Qatar. There are some really good arabic restaurants around the area, but this is now my new favorite. I'll be back again very soon!

Love love love. Beautiful hidden gem and thoroughly enjoyed our service tonight. The Turkish coffee was thick and delicious. I highly push for trying a bit of everything and getting the sampler for an appetizer -- once receiving it I knew this was going to be a great pick. Our waiter gave me a great recommendation and I tried out the lamb kabob. Can't remember your name so Thursday night waiter, thank you for your service. Everything from start to finish was seasoned perfectly. We live in Port Richey but whenever in the neighborhood we'll be back.

Excited to have this spot nearby! I got the chicken shawarma and loved it. Very good seasoning. Texture of the chicken was great. I am very picky about the texture of chicken and rarely find chicken at restaurants that I like. This was clearly cooked fresh and seasoned to perfect. Got it 2 nights in a row :)

Fries are great too!
This is a magnificent spot.  The food choices are both plentiful and very tasty.  It's well worth a visit.  Aside from the great food and Moroccan green tea, the atmosphere is delightful.
Amazing food. Being waited on was practically non-existent.  I am hoping it was just a bad night as we will definitely give it another try.

Very excited to have a Mediterranean place local to us that serves  shawarma. We tried this newly opened restaurant. We got the falafel and hummus app, both great. The hummus was creamy smooth, a great sign of meticulous creation.
The chicken shawarma, all though very tasty, was a tad pricy for the size of it with no side included. Would reco either making it bigger or include a side. 
All was fresh, homemade ingredients which is another reason I get the price. A good shawarma is hard to find and this was delicious! 
They are open breakfast, lunch and dinner which is amazing and in these times of Covid hard so go check them out!!
This place is a hidden gem! Food was delicious, flavorful and beautifully prepared. We had to try a bit of everything! We will be regulars here for sure!
What a find.  Hidden gem on the side of a strip center.  Great food and reasonably priced

We really enjoyed our lunch today at Garden Mediterranean Grill. It was a very clean establishment with very nice staff. My husband enjoyed the Gyro platter, I had the falafel wrap, and my son had the fish fingers kids meal. It was so nice to come to a place that offered more than simple fried food or Mac and cheese for children! We will absolutely be back!
Absolutely incredible food! The appetizer sampler platter is delicious! If you love coffee as much as I do, you definitely need to enjoy a Turkish coffee.
WOW!  This place is the reals deal.  Had the sampler and lamb kabob player.  Everything is outstanding!!!   If you haven't tried this place, it's a must.

This tucked away restaurant is fantastic! The food is delicious, especially the falafels and the chicken kabobs! The owners are terrific also and very friendly. The best service we've had at a restaurant in a long time.

I've had their food dining in and togo--my recommendation: eat it at the restaurant! It's ten times better than their togo. The tender beef that they have on the menu is not very tender, but the chicken kabob is flavorful and surprisingly tender/juicy. Portion sizes are great, too. 

There are never too many people at this spot, so take advantage of a roomy, uncrowded place. Service was prompt and attentive. It's worth a visit, for sure!
Delicious!!! Everything was so fresh and flavorful. They don't skimp on anything and you can tell they use the finest ingredients. We'll definitely be back.

Very excited to have a delicious Mediterranean restaurant so close to home. The hummus, babaghanoush, and falafel were fantastic. The kafteji is an excellent choice for breakfast. Can't wait to go back for a dinner!
We were super happy to have found this location.  The fam and I tried their appetizer sampler and the meat lovers platter and everything came out amazing!!!! Definitely recommend!!!

We had meat lover kabab for two. It came with rice and salad. Some warm pita bread and sauce  was presented before the entree. There was minced pickle veggie in the olive oil for dipping -unique and tasty. The rice, salad and grilled meat were all nicely done. The flavor was delicate, the texture was perfect. I can tell that the chef paid attention in preparing the food. In menu said six types of meat, I counted only five. I thought beef shawarma was missing and was replaced by couple skewers of grill vegetable. The amount of food was plentiful for 2 persons. We had leftover to take home for dinner. Even after reheat, the food was still very good. Their service was OK. The   dining room was open and clean. The delicious food was the best of the whole experience.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this restaurant - the atmosphere was quaint, the service was perfect, and the food was delicious.

We went for lunch and decided to start with hummus.  This was definitely freshly made, and served with warmed up pita.  They also brought out an olive spread dip at the same time, which was incredibly tasty.

For my meal I went with the chicken kabob platter.  For an extra $2 I got the greek salad instead of the regular salad it came with.  Wow, was this good.  I loved that they pulled the chicken off the kabob for me; as any kabob eater knows-this step has lead to many a disaster.  The chicken was seasoned so well, and so flavorful.  The feta on the salad was light and creamy, and I loved that there was not too much dressing on the salad.

I'm not in this area frequently, but I will definitely return when I am.  Plus, I had no room for the baklava ice cream sandwich, and I must try that!

This was a delightful Yelp find! We are from out town and found this restaurant for lunch. All the flavors were good and the food was fresh. The service was excellent. We had gyro, Fatoush salad,kufta and kebab wraps.

Delicious! And a nice variety! We've been here a few times now and have tried mostly everything. The different dips, meat samplers, sandwiches, etc. 0 complaints - everything was tasty. The decor is also charming. I'm not going to make a food recommendation because it's all really good, but I'll mention that the chicken tends to be more heavily seasoned than the steak.

This place was great! The flavors were so authentic compared to other Greek restaurants in the Tampa area. I really enjoyed their falafel and their tabbouleh and hummus were some of the best I have had. While many restaurants have cut down the quality and quantity of their ingredients due to COVID, Garden offered a quality experience. They also serve complimentary bread with olive oil dip which is always a plus.

Good food. Great service. I experience a very friendly server (Saturday Around 1p) who checked on me several times while allowing me to sit alone and study for almost 2 hours. Thank you! I'm sure I'll add a star when I order anything other than falafels (my favorite).
Absolutely phenomenal!! If I could rate 100 stars I would!! Excellent food and service! Extension to my kitchen.

Id heard some good things about this place, and love this kind of food.  Living in LOL we have a bit of a drive to our favorite, Petras.  All the food was very good, very good sized portions.  I had the spicy turkish beef kebob with rice, it was delicious and had a decent level of spice.  I thought the interior was very nice, nicer than you may expect in this plaza.  The service was very good as well.  I will definitly come back!  It looked like they make the falafel fresh daily, it was very good, very nice green color inside.

Such a hidden gem! Totally blown away by the food. I'm from Chicago and figured authentic Mediterranean food here in Florida might be hard to come by. Especially in this area, I gave up the idea of something outside of a chain restaurant. I am THRILLED that Mediterranean Grill exists! It checks all the boxes. So authentic, incredibly delicious, and outstanding service. Everything we ate was fantastic and I can't wait to come back and work my way through the menu. I will go to sleep tonight dreaming of the baklava with pistachios and Greek fries. SO GOOD!

So I have debated about whether to write a review. I generally try not to write bad reviews especially for mom and pop restaurants as everyone's experience is there own unique one. However all I see are raving reviews on this restaurant and I truly don't understand it. We went here to eat approximately three months ago. We were really looking forward to it as we had driven by the place countless times on our way home And had read great reviews about it. I made a reservation online and we anticipated it all week long which we generally don't do when it comes to restaurants. When we got there there was only one other table in the place. The service was excruciatingly slow. The first thing we noted that it was very warm in there. The atmosphere was not what we had expected or hoped for. There was a loud TV playing a television show for children and I believe the owners children were sitting at a table watching it. Not knocking that but the loud TV did not lend towards the atmosphere we were looking for. We had read great things about the service and how friendly the staff was. There appeared to be two people working, a woman who was serving and a man who was in the kitchen. Neither one of them were friendly or welcoming. Nonetheless we forged forward with our evening. The air conditioning did not appear to be working or it was pushed up but it was probably 80° in there so not exactly comfortable. I ordered the lamb kebab and my fiancé ordered a chicken dish. To say we were both disappointed with what was brought to the table is the understatement of the year. My lamb kebab was tough and to be honest I can't say for certain that it was even lamb. His chicken was even worse. It was a very small half chicken, absolutely flavorless and burnt beyond recognition. I am hoping that we just got them on an off night and that all of these five star reviews are legitimate. My suspicion would be that there are several like me who did not enjoy their meal at all but do not want to write a bad review about a new family business. Our experience was so bad that we will not be giving this place a second chance.

Best surprise gem in Wesley Chapel.  The food was amazing and bursting with flavor in every bite!  Hummus was as smooth as a Nashe doorstop texture which is rare in this area served with hot fresh pita.  Chicken kabobs were amazing and the rice cooked perfectly!  Finished off with baklava cheesecake .. OMG delicious.  Make sure you order the Moroccan hot tea, it was the best I've ever had!

My wife and I have been talking about eating here for a few weeks. We were able to stop by last night. Where to begin..

The food is very fresh and flavorful. We started with the mint lemonade and appetizer sampler (probably the best falafel and grape leaves I've had). Our main dishes consisted of kufta kabob and merguez sausage. Portions were decent and the flavors were outstanding.

Desert consisted of baklava cheesecake (delicious) and Turkish coffee. The cheesecake was shared and was more than enough. The Turkish coffee was perfect.

The ambiance was nice and traditional music was playing. The staff were pleasant/engaging and very helpful.

If you are in the mood for some fresh Mediterranean food you have to stop by. My wife and I will be returning.
We have had pretty much everything on the menu and honestly you can not go wrong. Absolutely delicious!!! The chicken Shwarma is my go to but the meat platter is a great way to sample all they have.
Amazing food. The presentation was as beautiful as the flavor. My husband is from Turkey and this was one of the best Mediterranean meals we have had here ever.    He even took dessert home.

Saw this place on Yelp when looking for a place to eat. The pictures in the other reviews looked amazing so we decided to give it a try and we definitely weren't disappointed! We ordered the mint lemonade and it was refreshing to say the least. We also ordered the fried cheese (forgot to get a picture!) for appetizer which was a bit on the salty side but paired with the salad it came with and the pita bread it was tasty. We also ordered the meat lovers plate. There was nothing on the plate that wasn't delicious! Everything was so well seasoned and not dry at all. Of course we had to try the baklava pastries to go! Will totally be coming back again and telling everyone about this place!!!!
By far best hidden gem I've ever had!!!!! Abla was the kindest and treated us incredibly! Live in tampa and will 100% be making this drive for dinner!

Can't say enough about this place. In the last 3 months, we visited 7 times. From breakfast, lunch to dinner. My husband and kids rant and rave. The food is unbelievably delicious. Fill disclosure. I'm middle eastern and have never been able to find authentic food in this area. Doesn't get any more authentic than this. Today we ordered from Uber Eats, and the food arrived hot and flavorful. We've tried so many items on this menu. The gyro is the real deal, the beef Shawarma is amazing. And omg the Branzino fish. Get it grilled!
Fantastic little place. Everything was delicious. My son ordered a mint lemonade that was out of this world. And baklava cheesecake? Wonderful.

Oh my gosh this was EXCEPTIONAL food!! I am not shy when it comes to eating Mediterranean food and I've been hard pressed in this area to find anything more than mediocre but this restaurant was truly phenomenal. I've been on a chicken shawarma kick lately and their wrap hit it out of the park. Their appetizer sampler was very good but the star was the highly addictive baclava. It's a must try for all.

We have ordered take out and eaten lunch in at the restaurant. It is so tasty. The meat is always fresh and tender. I don't why this place wasn't packed at lunch time. 
Hidden gem I guess. The food was delivered fast with attentive staff. 
I highly recommend.

This place is pretty new but the food was great and service was wonderful!
We ordered some apps and the mixed grill meat lovers for 4 and I was really flavorful and filling.

This place is amazing. Super nice restaurant with an authentic Mediterranean menu. I was blown away by the flavor that my meal had. The Greek salad with gyro was far better than the ones I get at Hungry Greek and I will definitely be coming to Garden more often. The pita bread and hummus is so good! Thanks for making good food.

Quite literally the BEST good my husband and I have tasted since we moved to the area in 2020. We have lived in Brooklyn,  LA and Atlanta and Garden Mediterranean is the BEST. High quality ingredients, fresh meat, and attention to detail made our meal absolutely delicious! 

What we ordered:
Feta
Lamb chops
Lamb shishkabob
Hummus
Baklava
Mint lemonade 

Everything was AMAZING.
There are not enough words! Amazing flavor, kind service, and quaint atmosphere! Will absolutely be back.

We stopped by to give this new spot a try fo an early dinner and were not disappointed! The food was good quality, fresh and flavorful- we tend to be picky about Mediterranean food so we were delighted to discover such a find near us. We will definitely be back!

I just ordered from here because I was in the mood for some Greek food, I ordered the appetizer sampler and the Turkish Kebab platter, and I have to say I was very disappointed, the rice was so dry I needed something to drink after every bite, the meat had zero flavor and was also dry, like it was over cooked. I'm sorry but I'm not ordering from here again, my favorite place has been the Hungry Greek and I'm sticking to it.

You would think that something that cost $23-24 dollars that they would put a little care into there food and make it tastes good, but I guess I was expecting to much.  Back to my favorite.

Also your online menu is way off, it say$17.00 and I paid$23.00 so fix your website.

Purchased from Garden Mediterranean for the first time. Got a variety from grilled fish to lamb, grape leaves, and baklava. The food was good. The price is a bit higher than other close by Mediterranean places but at least, it tasted good.

My husband and I came for lunch on a Friday. My husband ordered kabob and I ordered  chicken shawarma. I wish I had taken a picture to upload however it wouldn't do it justice. The food was absolutely amazing with so much flavor. This was one of the most authentic Mediterranean Restaurants we have been to in a long time. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We will definitely come back next time in the area!!!
I enjoyed eating there. It reminded me of a Mom and Pop restaurant. The food was very good and the service was excellent.
What a gem! Wonderful food and very nice service. Lots of veggie friendly options. Very clean. Great experience!
My mom loves this place and she put me on to it. Everything I've eaten here is very flavorful and delicious. The staff is friendly too. Highly recommend for fans of Mediterranean food.

Tried somewhere new close to home for takeout and all in all would definitely order again. We ordered the garden sandwich, the gyro wrap, and Greek fries. 

Our favorite was the gyro, flavor wise. I wish they put WAY more tatziki on it though. They definitely don't skimp on the protein. 

The garden sandwich has merguez sausage and if you don't know what that is, it's a spiced beef sausage (SO GOOD) but again lacking on the sauce so it was a bit dry.

The fries were just okay. Might be better if you sat down and ate there. They got soft on the way home as they steamed in the packaging lol. Needed more cheese and salt too.

We used their website to order and pickup and it was a smooth process. Will definitely give it a try again.

The Garden Mediterranean Grill is a delight. With their Mediterranean Menu and different tastes in foods, it is an exploration that delights the palate. They are not your burger and fries kind of place but more upbeat. With table cloths and pleasant surroundings, you feel the comfortable ambiance. Did I mention the outstanding authentic food. It has become one of my favorites. The menu includes Beef Shawarma, Chicken Kabab, Greek Salad, Gyros and Meat Lover Kabab and much more. They are open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

My family came on Mother's Day and we loved the food! The portions were huge and satisfying. It's a small cute place. It got a busy when we were eating our meals and I could tell the servers got overwhelmed and neglected us for a little bit but we understand it can get like that since there were only 2 servers. We will definitely be back!

A friend recommended the garden Mediterranean. It seemed so off the beaten path that I was curious. Wow was I surprised. The food is fresh and very tasty. It seems very authentic. This is our new Mediterranean favorite. Terrific place.

I got the Greek salad with Greek dressing and chicken and it was all so good. I like how much feta they out on it. The olives have pits, so fair warning on that. I love Mediterranean food and it's so nice to have a place nearby. This was my second time and both times I have had to bring at least half the salad home. It's wonderful!

Unfortunately the worst meal I have ever had. The calamari was definitely frozen, chewy, and good luck trying to even pull it apart. Very small portion for an $11 appetizer, was hopeful the entrees would be better. I was also extremely disappointed with those! We got two wraps, one gyro and one lamb and beef. Seriously dry and flavorless, also a small portion. Way overpriced and very disappointing! Had high expectations because the decor is delightful, but will definitely warn people to steer clear of this place! I hope they find room for improvement and work on the food they provide.

Just recently this discovered this gem and boy am I glad I did-It's been a long time coming!

My coworkers have visited this joint several times this week. I had to find out for myself what all the buzz was about. 

Promptly greeted upon arrival by staff and were seated. I was extremely hungry so I placed an order immediately. 

Our appetizer and complimentary app followed minutes after with our sparkling water.

Hummus was freshly made and you can tell it was used with only the finest ingredients. 

The pita bread was fresh out the oven and ever so tasty.

Settled for the lamb kebab platter with rice. The temperature of the lamb was where it needed to be and cooked to perfection. The tzatziki sauce was nothing to sneeze at and paired very well with the lamb.

The chicken kebab is a game changer and might just be my new favorite go to from this spot. 

I left with a satisfied appetite and full belly. 

Highly recommend this joint. 
Definitely two thumbs.

If you're going to eat middle eastern food and you're looking for tender chicken and savory meat with a delicacy of Hummus this is the spot! 

Their food is cooked with love and you can't taste it in their spices. The owners are friendly and pertain to the restaurants needs. I'm middle eastern so I know a thing or two about Hummus . 

Enjoy their garlic sauce, shatta ,and appetizers. I've had their Fatoush salad, Hummus, and family of three mixed grill which comes with kostalata, chicken shawarma, beef kebab, chicken kebab, and shishkebab and it is delectable and is enough for about two to three people. But you might not want to share .  
Thank you for taking the real effort to share your authentic style of cooking! 

I don't have any pictures because we ate it all, but will be back to share some with y'all.

Chicken Shawarma quesadilla- yes - you read that right and it was delicious.
Husband ordered the lamb chops- cooked and seasoned perfectly these four bone in chops came with roasted vegetables and rice for reasonable price.
Also needed to try the falafel which were tasty, as well as the kibbeh tasty with cloves with plenty of filling .
Gyro platter lots of delicious meat seasoned well not dry.
Yes of course I had the baklava!
Lots of pistachio flaky phyllo crunchy,no honey syrup which made the pastry even better!
Mint lemonade must come out with your order as it essentially one of the most refreshing drinks!
We did not dine in but the restaurant is set up nicely with linen cloths and napkins.
Very good experience ordering food on the phone, was ready on time.
Plenty of parking, easy to find location.
Thanks Boon ! Your photos sent me over to try this place.

Always follow my fellow yelpers and use their recommendations.   Got Turkish kabob play fatoush salad and Baba ghanouz.   Super yummy.  Recommended to all.  To me the spice level is perfect.  It runs spicy.
Really nice lunch on our way back from South Florida! Lentil soup, foul, kofta sandwich, lamb shish kabob were all a hit for the family. Thank you!

Hidden off of SR-54, this is now my favorite Mediterranean place and a top restaurant in New Tampa. The food is very authentic and fresh. The service is great. Not sure what to recommend since everything is amazing. Always love to start off with the appetizer sampler. Strongly recommend one of mixed grill plates for 2-4 to get a taste of some of the more popular dishes. Strongly recommend the spot and can't wait to go back!

The best Mediterranean cuisine in the Tampa area. The food was absolutely authentic, delicious, well prepared and served by an extremely friendly waitress. If you are looking for healthy delicious Mediterranean food, this is a great place to eat. From the appetizers, entrees, and desserts everything was awesome. My family and I really enjoyed it.
Food and service is awesome! I recommend the Chicken Shawarma Wrap with the Lentil Soup. Prices are good and they also give you pita and olive oil dip to start for free!
I am Greek and the food hit very close to home! The rice was delicious, the tea was great, I had a lovely time and experience

Great and fresh food!  Mint lemonade also very tasty.   However 2 recommendations for improvement....   appetizer cheese was extremelly salty.   Verify your check in detail we didn't they charged too much for the side dishes which were supposed to be included :(

Absolutely wonderful experience!  My husband and I are fans of Mediterranean food so we thought we would try Garden Mediterranean Grill for an early Mother's Day lunch.  With all the mediocre chain restaurants in the Wesley Chapel area, this is the first time in years we have been Wowed in a very long time!  The pita with herbed olive oil started was very flavorful.  We ordered falafels for an appetizer that was very flavorful.  The dipping sauce was to die for.  Hubby had the Turkish kabob which was a mix of ground lamb and beef, and selected the Greek Fries as his side. I ordered the chicken kabobs and I have to admit, I can't remember the last time I have had such wonderful chicken.  It literally was so tender it melted in my mouth.  I selected the House Salad for my side that came with a light olive oil, lemon juice, and spices dressing. It was very similar to a Greek salad that we had in Greece a few years ago.  Hubby selected the mint lemonade to go with his meal. It was a frozen non alcoholic drink similar to a margarita. The atmosphere in the restaurant was a step above local chains with white table cloths and fresh flowers on each table. Service was well above par. It was a bit pricier than most of the local chains but, you get what you pay for.  I recommend Garden Mediterranean Grill for any special occasion. You won't be disappointed.

This is a hidden gem in Lutz! Some of the best Mediterranean food I have had in the area. Beautiful interior, food fresh and perfectly seasoned, friendly service and great prices. Dinner there was amazing, and I'm planning to take a large group of friends for lunch soon. Check it out!

Had a craving for a gyro and this was the closest place open that had them. I have to say, gyro was fantastic but wasn't impressed with everything else. I got a gyro, garden sandwich, and Greek fries. Starting off with the bad, the Greek fries had little to no feta on them and I personally like more crispy fries. The garden sandwich has  merguez sausage which is usually juicy and flavorful. I think this was a little dry. However, the main reason I went there was for the gyro. One of the best gyros I think I've had. Packed full of meat, each bite packed a punch of flavor. I will most definitely be back, but only for the gyros. Also, I did takeout so I can't comment on service.

Wow just Wow! That is best way I can describe the food at this hidden Mediterranean gem in Lutz! Between the refreshing Mint Lemonade, the delicious Kefta Platter, the massive Branzino, and the Baklava Ice Cream, you are in for a real treat!!

Delicious! Best Arabic food I've had in years! Hands down most delicious Falafel I've had in over 12 years! All the ingredients were fresh and very authentic, delicious sauces with each fish.  Loved my Tabouli salad as well.

I love Mediterranean food and my sister took me here for my birthday. Love, love, love this place. Very nicely decorated, quaint with tablecloths and candles. The place was very clean.  Upon seating, Mel, who may have been the owner, brought us fresh pita bread and olive oil mixed with herbs. Very good. We ordered the sampler platter and tabouli salad. It was delicious. I must say that was the BEST tabouli salad I have ever had. We dug in so fast, I forgot to snap a picture when it first arrived.  My sister ordered Turkish coffee, which was a first for her. I loved the vibe of this place and the fact that the food was delicious. I will be back!!

Wow!  The best that I've ever had!  From the Greek salad to the sampler appetizer and then the final touch with baklava and Turkish coffee 
We loved this place.  So flavorful and yummy 
The textures, temperatures and portions were perfect 

Thank you

Finally had a chance to enjoy a nice lunch here and I am so thankful for the addition of a local, non-chain restaurant in our area.  The gentleman who took care of us was incredibly kind, polite, helpful, and attentive. The menu had a great selection of items and everything we ordered was very flavorful with fresh ingredients and huge portions.  My gyro was delicious and my mom couldn't stop talking about her Shawarma dish. We definitely plan on returning for some more great food.

Finally we can say there is excellent Mediterranean cuisine near Wesley Chapel. Garden Mediterranean is taking over the previous Cuban restaurants. They redo the interior and make it more pleasing. The set up is nicer than the previous restaurant. One important reminder is on weekends dining, they get busy very quick. So you may want to be first one to be seated. We got here 11:30 and first to be seated. The advantage is you got the food before everyone else. 

We got the meat lovers kabab for two. It has variety of kabab. I like all of them. The kabab includes Shish and chicken kabab, gyros, chicken shawarma, kufta kabab and veggies kabab. The meat was well marinated. I like the chicken kabab juicy. The gyros did not have deep meat smell. The kufta has good edge grilled. The meat lovers is recommended if you have two or three. Good to have variety of meat. 

Service is a bit lack off. This may be the area to be improved. It is about 4.5 stars. The store has too less on service people. It need some help.
very dry cheesesteaks!!! they put your fries in a bag!!! i asked for extra meat n got a regular size cheesesteak!!!

Ordered a 16 in large white pizza and a cheeseburger platter for delivery. Had no problems ordering, they knew exactly where my apartment building was and how to enter, as their driver lives here. (Some places get confused, lost, don't understand the intercom in a high rise, etc).

Delivery was prompt, food was hot, driver pleasant. They give you ALOT of food for your money. Pizza was good, burger decent, a huge amount of fries included and cole slaw which I didn't try. Prices are cheaper then other local joints so I was kind of expecting less, but was pleasantly surprised. I wish they had included a newer menu as mine is 2 years old. Surprised this place doesn't get more action on Yelp. Would order again.

Best pizza place ever. Been going here since I was little. Love the pizza fries and cheese fries are the best. Their veggies pizza is also awesome. Very friendly and great price. Very fresh and my number one spot.

This is honestly some amazing pizza! If you are in the area this is a must have! I have been here for years with my family and I love it. Unlike a prior review mentioned, the people are very fluent in the English language and truly dedicated towards making your stay an amazing one.

Ordered $150 worth of pizza on July 3rd. The young lady on the phone asked if I wanted to pre add a tip. I said I would tip when the delivery person got there and asked if that was okay. Her reply was "well a lot people say that they are going to do that and don't". I was totally insulted. I have never not tipped, but the amount of the tip is based on the quality of delivery. She could tell I was offended and said she didn't mean to offend me.. but that was highly inappropriate and I will no longer be ordering from this place. I should've cancelled the delivery all together. Also, I pre-tipped $10, I would've tipped $20 when the driver got there if it wasn't for the ignorance of the lady that took my order.

We tried Pizza Express for the first time last week. We ordered a large Combo Special, which had pepperoni, fresh mushrooms, sausage, green peppers, ham, sauce, onions & tomatoes. It was very good, my husband loved it. I especially like the added tomato. We also ordered Buffalo wings. They were really small, but tasted great. The owner was very friendly. We will go back again.

Always had a good experience with Pizza Express. Best thing there is their Cheese Fries and Wing Dings. Salads and Wraps always fresh. I spend 15-20$ and they give me a free 2L soda for free. Friendly neighborhood store.
This is definitely one of the best pizza in my opinion. Always delivered fresh and fast. Everyone working there has always been very courteous. The delivery staff is number 1.

Not at all authentic Vietnamese food and a little pricey. But the chef is really friendly. I think he is from Thailand so it is understandable that he doesn't cook Vietnamese dishes properly. 

I don't recommend this place if you want to try Vietnamese food, but good option if you just need a quick, light lunch.

its cheap and quick pho on the vanderbilt campus. kind of hard to f ind and get to. But the pho is so simple man i mean they literally scoop up broth and vegetables and meat. it is pretty questionable

Amazing assortment of food for lunch. Quante atmosphere and easy to locate. I will definitely come back here. 
Great place to have a lunch date, we had a Valentine's date today...

Yay! Vandy finally has a vendor for Asian food! They sell Pho soup and Bahn mi, which is limited but its a great start!!! And if you're a student, this counts as a meal on the commodore card or if you're visiting, they take credit cards but not cash. It's located on the Vanderbilt campus in Alumni Hall. And they now have bubble tea :)

Mediocre Asian food that is hardly worth the price (or swipe in this case). The sides are by far the worse with the rice pudding simulating the texture of cheese and the flan bitter beyond all. You're better off with fruit cups. The phu and banh mid are passable but hardly filling. Will not return! Two thumbs down! No spicy chilis!

The venue is very modern with nice tv's to.catch various sport games, with room for private parties. Nice table set up, booth, single table, group table. They also have a second floor that you could probably rent as well for a function. I always enjoy the quality of the food and food deals over the week. The vibe is a must during oilers games and concert. Come for a drink or two. Had a prompt and nice service. I will be back. Only down side...parking.

Cane in a group of almost 100 recently to the newest BP's in the Ice District before an Oil Kings game. 

They were great about letting us place orders in advance to help with the speed of things.  The food was consistent and the service good.  A few mishaps but we were a large group. 

The layout here is gorgeous with huge floor to ceiling windows and an excellent view to people watch in the Ice District. 

Two thumbs way up on this new location! 

Thank you BP's for accommodating our Dance Co dance team and for being expedient for our kiddos in between dress rehearsal and the game. 

Everyone had a blast!  Loved how you had the silly mustaches laid out for the kidlets!

I've never been a big fan of Boston Pizza, simply because their menu selection truly is nothing special. Every item on the menu is something you can cook at home for a fraction of their asking price. My visits to BP are rare, mainly because I don't really feel like paying $10 for a tiny bowl of lettuce that they call a caesar salad... or $20 for a basic pasta dish that I could prepare at home in 2 minutes. 

The service at this location was fantastic, don't get me wrong, and the food quality was fine. I didn't experience any significant issues, but they could have turned their music down a touch. Ir was only a Thursday afternoon but the place boomed like a nightclub. 

I have to say that I still believe their food is overpriced for what you get. Nothing on the menu is impressive.

This was the first time I've been to this location and it was so nice! I would recommend the crispy chicken Thai chilli appy and the Big Mac inspired pizza!! If you can't decide between a burger or a pizza then this is the perfect combination. This location has a great atmosphere for after work drinks or meeting up with friends before an oilers game. There is underground parking nearby so you don't even have to walk outside to get there if it's cold. The staff was very friendly and always kept our drinks full. I would definitely be happy to come back here!

Definitely not sad that I was able to try this location. I've always called this "The Fancy BPs" because that is what it is. This is a stark contrast to the other BPs in the city. The decor is different, the vibe is different, and expectations are different. I had high expectations for this place but it didn't disappoint. If you all know me, you know that I love BPs - it's my absolute favourite place in the world to go. I've been holding off on coming here because you need to look good! This is the Fancy BPs, after all. 

The venue is very modern and not the typical BPs decor. It's more trendy and being near the Edmonton Tower/Ice District/JW Marriott likely influences this. They can't just have a regular BPs in this area lol. I did really like it though. It's still welcoming and the change in decor hasn't taken away from anything. 

The service was awesome. We had a great server who was quick, nice, and thoughtful. She never let our water drinks be empty the entire night which was great. 

Big THANK YOU to Bailee and Jenna for their amazing hospitality as well. :)

Food is of course amazing. I'm excited to go to BPs for my birthday on Tuesday! It will be awesome! Pasta Tuesday BABY!

Got a chance to check out the new BPs in the ice district this week with the large group of Yelpers. Bailee & Jenna were wonderful to pull this all together. The four of us at our table really enjoyed the various pizza options and wings set out in a buffet style for our group. My friends had a few more options to try being earlier to arrive and enjoyed that too. None of us caught if any of the pizzas were a new style but we were super appreciative that our vegan friend was well taken care of too. 

Service was great and I greatly appreciated the future parking & building tips from the bartender (if you're willing to pay $20, you can park underneath the Edmonton tower but there is no voucher or discount if you go to BPs). As my yelp friend parked in Delta parkade (which was where I was advised to park when I called ahead expressing my mobility concerns) and nearly froze trying to get to BPs from walking outside, we decided to try the pedway back to the car. So instead of going down the escalator, we went towards Delta through what I think is Stantech (there's also parking in that building and it seems to link up to where the Oliers fans were walking back from the game). This route was the friendliest warm walking option to getting parking in a less expensive but colder location, yet still being mobility friendly.

The place itself has a glam kind of style compared to what is the normal BPs we all know and expect. The space is quite open on the second level. I'm sure as people become aware of this location, it will be a neat drinking & socializing spot for all seasons. Most of the group was sitting at a large table (so they're still great at accommodating large groups) but there was a few smaller groups, like us, that sat in the booths along the windows. Booths with awesome space to set all our winter gear - yay! Finally a restaurant location that plans for our 6 months of winter weather. Maybe the name ice district inspired that but it's brilliant either way.

For those of you getting dropped off by friends, taxi or uber, the ramp to get to BPs is closer to the Edmonton tower doors corner. The corner BPs is on is all steps. The Edmonton tower doors are also the main doors to access BPs when it's really cold outside. If you're mobility limited like me, chat with a server on the lower main level to see if they'll accommodate opening the staff door for you to access the second BPs level. As then you can take the escalator up (and the bartender mentioned an elevator nearby too). Otherwise you'll sadly be stuck on the main floor, as the only public access to the second level is by a HUGE flight of stairs inside BPs. 

Overall, a very lovely space. Now that I know where to park and enter, I can see myself returning in the future. Thanks again!

Came here today for lunch just before it got busy. Was nice and quiet and sat on the bar side asap. Nice environment; really cool, nice upstairs and private room. Unfortunately that was all is was good for, our pop arrived and was super flat. After letting the waitress know she did tell us that there was an issue with the carbon and she didn't know if it was fixed (but still served us flat pop), she then brought us 'new' pop that still tasted the same. My and my friend each ordered pasta from the pasta Tuesday menu (fettuccine Alfredo and jambalaya fettuccine). I don't think I've ever tasted such watery cheese Alfredo sauce (stuff in a jar around have been better) also came with spaghetti noodle not fettuccine. The jambalaya fettuccine was ok, not very hot at all. We sat there for about 25 minutes without anyone asking us how the food was, once we told the waitress she didn't seem to care at all. Will never go back for lunch again. Maybe drinks at the bar but that's about it.

Great location, friendly staff, good customer service and the atmosphere is absolutely amazing! I really enjoyed the new look of BP's with modern decor, TV's all over the restaurant ( even though I am not a hockey fan. I can still appreciate the vibe). It is right across Rogers place which makes it so convenient if people are seen a concert, a game or any type of performance. The area does have several places to park. I decided to park at City Centre as after 5 PM is oly $5.00 which I think it is the cheapest around that area. I ordered a vegan pizza which was totally delicious with a big slice of tomatoes! I was feeling very cold so decided to get a perpermint tea. I totally recommend BP's to other people as it does accommodate large groups, close to Downtown and the Ice District! Come on down and have a drink and hang out with your friends!

This review is long overdue! I am a longtime fan of Boston Pizza, and this location does not disappoint. This is one of the newest BP locations in Edmonton, and it is conveniently placed in one of the most popular new areas of the city - The Ice District! The menu is standard Boston Pizza fare, but the service at this location is really outstanding. Also, the venue itself is impressive. This location has two floors with the entire upper level being the lounge area. There are many TVs to watch the game on while enjoying some food and a few drinks. You could come here to watch a hockey game and still feel like you're right in the action (it's just across the street from Roger's Place), but you could also come here for a bite before or after an event at Roger's Place.

A source highly recommended this place to me about a year ago (back before they moved to this location from old city) but made me swear I wouldn't tell anyone for fear that the word would get out and it would become even harder to get a reservation. I quietly ate at the old city location a year ago and enjoyed one of the best Italian meals I've ever had! I dutifully kept the secret until now... but with the pandemic ravaging the restaurant industry I think that it's time to let others in on the secret. I finally returned to try their new location and this place is still the best - old school charm, warm staff, amazing food. Do yourself a favor and try the arugula mango Gorgonzola salad and one of the special entrees and the tiramisu - but you really can't go wrong!

You got alota balls giving the portions u do for the amount of money. I got shrimp pasta tomatoes. Ramen noodles comes with more than you gave us plus your wine sauce is terrible wow. I paid 20 bucks for a shit shrimp and pasta meal that the portion was legit a 5 dollar Chinese food meal.  If only that was the problem , but the garlic wine sauce was horrible I knew from jump I should have told my sister I didn't want anything wow I still am baffled at the portion. If I got shrimp and pasta from anywhere else I would have been full halfway through

My boyfriend and I have been here twice since it opened and we cannot recommend them enough! Our server, Joe, alone is worth the visit. The everyday menu is small but they have just as many specials and they have regular staples. Every dish was incredible and well seasoned which is something so simple yet so many restaurants fail to do well. Service is great, and can't beat a BYO. There's a bottle shop inside the IGA across the street if you forgot to bring some beer or wine.

5 stars all around! Food, service, atmosphere: all amazing!

I'm always shocked this place isn't busier. It's relatively new and they opened during Covid so I feel like not enough people know about it yet but it's so cute and the food is delicious. It's my new go to when I'm craving Italian. 

The food is very authentic Italian. The freshest pasta and seafood. I always can't wait to hear the specials. Always flavorful and creative. 

Some of my favorites include: lobster and crab ravioli, orecchiette with sausage and kale, and the mussels. 

They also make an amazing zucchini vegetable dip with fresh bread for the table. 

Desserts are amazing too. The tiramisu is light and sweet and can never be passed up. 

Also it's BYOB and the prices are incredibly reasonable for what you get. 

They never disappoint!
Great neighborhood spot. BYOB!!! Food is fresh and they have great specials that change often. Portions are large. Indoor and outdoor seating.

Just noticed that this place has no reviews which is a crime. I am not normally one to write a review but I would feel somehow responsible if they didn't make it through the pandemic because I've only gone a few times and haven't spread the word to friends. Everything I have tried it next level delicious. If you are reading this you NEED to try them out!

Delicious! And the staff and owner were so nice. Can't wait to visit again soon We ordered 2 specials with one of the salads on discuss as well. The seafood ravioli and shrimp was flavorful. The rigatoni bolognese and salad were perfect as well. We wanted to get dessert but we're so full. We're saving it for next time we visit. The outdoor area was also very charming with lighting under the trees. There is also outdoor heat but we didn't need it last night. I forgot to take pictures of the food!

They are back with a vengeance , the appetizers are ridiculous !!!! The mango and Gorgonzola salad should be a staple on the menu. I HAVENT  Even made it to the main course and felt like I had to post this! Seriously if you're in the area, don't bypass this place. Make a reservation today.

Great place to go in Vail! Ate here for the first time yesterday. Service was great! And the food was good! I ordered the three enchilada plate with beans and rice. The enchilada sauce had a good flavor but was a little on the runny side. Needs to be thicker. My husband ordered the three chicken tacos and they were available soft or hard. The portions were a good size. Will definitely go back!

It's always exciting to get a new restaurant here in Vail. I've heard a lot of hype about Taco Giro. It seems a little odd to have a Mexican restaurant open up directly across from Fitos, especially with such high prices, but it looks like seafood is their specialty, so hopefully there's enough of a niche that both places can survive.

The big sign out front says "take-out and delivery only" but the place is packed on a Friday at noon. Literally packed. There is no social distancing, and this place is small. They also don't currently offer online ordering, so I'm not sure if delivery is even a thing. Hopefully it will be, because that would be convenient.

I entered, surrounded by people, and was given a full menu. I had to ask for a lunch special menu. They have very limited choices for lunch for 8.99. I decided to order from the main menu. Chile relleno + cheese enchilada + rice/beans for 11.99. I was told it would be a 20 min wait, so I sat outside. If you have Covid concerns, you definitely want to sit outside.  This place is a Covid nightmare. There is no signage requiring masks, and one small bottle of sanitizer at the front, presumably for employee use. While i was there no one used it. Bare hands wrapped silverware.

They have a small bar (six seats) and 10 tables, most seating four. Definitely not a place for groups. 

Besides Covid issues, the biggest problem I see is organization. They seem to have no system. After 15 min outside, many people cleared out, so I went in and sat at the bar. 2 closed containers of food were sitting at the food window, and no one looked at it. I realized that I hadn't paid, and they hadn't taken my name. I asked the bartender if I could pay. There was confusion and it took asking several servers before they find the one who took my order. She came over and I paid. She said it would be "ready soon", then went over to the window. Lo and behold! The remaining food that had been sitting for at least five minutes getting cold was mine! 

They do include chips and salsa with take out, so that's nice. The salsa is pretty good, freshly made. The beans had a canned taste, but good consistency. There was a weird sour flavor to them. The rice was fluffy, pretty average. The cheese enchilada wasn't too greasy, and was generous with the cheese filling. The sauce was mediocre. It tasted very Americanized. The relleno was really good. The batter was fluffy, lots of cheese filling. Really no complaints. Overall, it was definitely less greasy than most Mexican places, so that was nice. The food is about average. But the service needs some desperate help.

The service was great.  The drinks were fantastic.  The food was outstanding.  They have dinner specials between certain hours and I got a carne asada y camerones dinner for $11.99 as opposed to $18.99.  The carne asada was done to perfection.  Giselle, our waitress did a wonderful job and was very attentive.  The hubby had the carnitas, which he said was very tender and tasty.  We will definitely be back.

First time we went we waited for 20 minutes for a takeout order. Checked with our cashier who needed to be reminded 5 times of what our order was. Cook told her it would be a lot longer and gave no estimate on time. Asked for a refund. Tried another time and the food was not good. Beans were gross, rice is bland, steak tacos yuck. Salsa bland. Only thing worth eating was the shrimp tacos. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

My family and I came in tonight for dinner. The first thing we notice that the waitress was by herself. We came in seated ourselves and shortly after we were greeted. Xochiti (I believe that was her name) took our order and we enjoyed a couple pina coloda's (highly recommended). She was running that place on her own and trying her best to get to every table, take phone orders and deliver food to tables. Our order arrived and the food was excellent as always. You all need to give this restaurant a try but be PATIENT..they are trying really hard to serve everyone as well as the cooks cooking the food. Most importantly...ALWAYS TIP YOUR SERVER...this is their job.

I'd love to review the food but it never showed up. After 40 minutes we got a glass of water only no refills. We asked for chips. They never showed up. Other tables arriving 20 minutes after us had chips.  Finally we asked again and was told our food would be on the way in "maybe 15 minutes" the restaurant was woefully understaffed. The food we saw  seemed nice.  I would have liked to have tried it.   I'm not certain how a business with such extreme poor service will be able to stay in business in this town.

From near opening time but I still think about it: The orders took over an hour and were messed up, my husband's food was cold, like in a yucky way. Ended up being not charged for our meals but have to say that it appeared the restaurant wasn't cleaned in the process of being changed into the Mexican restaurant. We'd went to the previous restaurant and it really looked like nothing had been cleaned only added a bar and tried to add a lot of seating where there is clearly not enough room. The waitresses were rude aside from our extremely apologetic and inexperienced one. Hard to be mad when it's someone's first night and she can't control the wait. But she could have told us about the food taking so long instead she kept saying it'd be right out. The first waitress I encountered was very rude and people who arrived after us were seated and helped before us due to their mismanagement. The restrooms were filthy and seating was dirty. Hope it's gotten better!

The food is very good. The service needs to match and currently doesn't. To be fair a lot of the folks are new but the service we received was not up to par. Our food arrived well after 2 tables that arrived after us were served and we were told previously that there alcohol licensing was to be sorted out weeks ago and it is still not, so I was unable to order a margarita that I was looking forward to. Once they get the kinks out, it will be a good place to eat. Thank you!

Was excited to try. Had to ask if we could sit down because nobody sat us or told us to sit down as they repeatedly walked by and ignored us. Can't tell you about the food because nobody came to our table to take an order or offer chips. Completely ignored. Can't see returning. Off to Fito's!

Stopped at this locsl eatery location during travel from Monterey CA to Dallas TX  ordered food which was a challenge wait staff pretended not to speak English very well.  Discovered they spoke  fluidly after receiving our tip.   (Denver Omelet no onions and Hashbrowns)  which took forever to receive. Cook has no concept of food presentation.  Omelet like like my 2 year old grandson cooked it.  Good thing I don't have an allergy to onions.   The were scattered throughout.  Taste the wasn't any unless you count the well aged dry ham that was chopped up to oblivion.  I began to get nauseous after a few bites. No one in immediate area seems to have any concerns about COVID 19.  Buyer beware!

So, we're big fans of Taco Giro. We go to the one on 22nd all the time and have even been to the one on the south side a couple of times. So needless to say we were thrilled when they were opening one in Vail. We also know that anytime they open things in vail it's super crowded so we waited a bit and decided to go sort of late on a Friday night around 8pm. 
I walk in and there seemed to be mass confusion. One lady was complaining about something having to do with her to go order. I stood there looking and waiting to be greeted along with another person for about 10 minutes. The girls working there seemed to be trying to figure something out while me and the other lady were invisible. They finally figured out what was wrong and we were seated and they took the other customers to go order. From there things got better. Same great food as the other locations, hence the 3 stars. But the service continued to struggle. We had to wave out server down each time we needed something. She never would have came back to our table had we not called her over several times. If you want good food, this is the place to go, but don't expect excellent service until hopefully they work out their logistical issues.
You know it's bad when you walk in and they tell you they are out of beans and come back another time.

Hubby and I went to the New Taco Giro's in Vail, Az. on a Monday late afternoon. The manager or owner came up immediately and showed us the dinner specials that started at 5pm. He was very friendly.  We liked that.  We had gotten there about 445pm but he was willing to let us order early if we wanted dinner menu. 
He was out of several of the beers we chose.  Not complaining because I know the restaurant is new so I will give them a break on this. 
The menu is huge, lots of seafood items and a good selection of combinations.
They serve their chips with 3 salsas.  The spicer and medium were both good. The 3rd one looked like enchilada sauce.  I didn't care for it and it was made with flour or cornstarch which I thought was strange for salsa?  It had no real flavor.
We order chicken taco dinner and shredded beef taco dinner. 
The cook made a mistake and gave me a combo dinner with beef enchilada with sour cream along with the shredded beef taco. 
I like the beef taco with tasty shredded beef  but the beans and rice I thought were extremely bland. I couldn't taste any real spice in either of them, just a tomato based broth on the rice. I didn't like the beef enchilada at all. It was made with hamburger, was bland and the enchilada sauce was pasty with no flavor. 
My husband had chicken taco dinner which he said the whole plate was luke warm. (mine was the same) He also liked the chicken taco but didn't care for rice or beans either. 
The waitress was good, the food was delivered quickly, but unless they improve the blandness of their food, we won't be back. 
Mexican food is my favorite. I love cumin and chile spices, garlic and onion which is used extensively in mexican food.   I cook mexican food all the time at my home so I'm probably a picky reviewer for mexican food.  We love Rancho Rustico on Houghton and have never had a bad dinner there.  My husband likes Coronado's also on Houghton Road.  So, Taco Giro, we love you are in Vail and we want to support you but you need to compete with the other 2 mexican restaurants if you want to remain open for long.  I will try it again and see if anything changes but after the 2nd time, if still the same then we will return back to our favorites in the Rita Ranch/Vail area.

Amazing tacos the best churros and ice cold beer!.
Tacos- I can't even describe how this taco saved me from starvation. I didn't even know I was hungry until I took one bite. I took that first bite and my life was changed. Nothing taste the same, everything is dull now that I've had the best tacos.
Churros- That churro would bring peace to the world, save nations and heal the wounded.
Beer- so cold I forgot I was in Arizona.
Thank you for great lunch

We had an excellent dinner. The server was friendly, efficient and veery pleasant. The food was excellent. We had bacon wrapped shrimp which was perfect. 
 We will be back

Giving a 5 star considering this restaurant (not fast-food) recently opened up after things relaxed some regarding the Covid-19.  The service is not the fastest (again not a fast-food business) also knowing it is hard to get great employees with the unemployment benefits being better that wages and tips in the food industry.  Long story short, I much prefer to excuse the small inconveniences to ending up with just another fast-food place. 
Have frequented this restaurant numerous times and the food has been consistently good.  Come on Vail, support our local businesses!

Walked in just after noon and a green-haired girl with a nose ring told us to sit wherever! Seven minutes passes. No water, no chips, no nothing. Not even a comment. Stood up, said thanks for the outstanding service, and headed down MAC to a different sit-down Mexican restaurant. Were immediately greeted, given menus, chips, salsa and ice water.

5 stars for great service- we had 2 dinners and was out of restaurant within an hour.  The chicken in the enchiladas was fabulous but the sauce was extremely bland. I added salsa to it just to get some flavor. Rice and beans were fine. Only real complaint was that our table top was sticky.  My husband had rancheros and said it was great.

We had visited for takeout right after they first opened and had a challenging visit between the order and pick up, the place being packed and short staffed.  We arrived home with an incorrect order, no thanks to the server at that time who was having a difficult time paying attention.  In the spirit of supporting local, we gave them another try for dine in during off hours - around 3PM on a Thursday.   It is truly nice to have a sit down restaurant option out here in Vail other than Montgomery's or the Golf Course.

We sat in a booth and were brought a small bowl of chips and 3 little sauces.  2 of the 3 were good... 1 was almost a water consistency and I still not sure what it was but it was not great.  We ordered Mixed Fajitas and a Wet Burrito.  I will tell you the portions were huge, so you absolutely get what you pay for with leftovers.  The food was okay.  I had ordered the ground beef for the wet burrito and it was not seasoned and tasted like it was cooked in a dirty pan, as it was very grisly.  Hence the okay, not good.  

The service was friendly, and although it was not busy, the young lady taking care of us never once came back to check on us or fill up our drinks... only to bring the bill.  We have been Rancho Rustico regulars since they opened at their original location and the quality of food and service exceeds in comparison.  We might try this place one more time... I am always hopeful a local business will do what it takes to work the kinks out.

The food is very good here, some of the best in Vail which really isn't saying much considering the limited choices. This restaurant is poorly managed and the servers are not good. They have no training or don't care about service or both. If you decide to go, set your bar low for service and you'll be fine. If you go right when they open, don't expect food to be fast. This place needs a managers attention fast and train your servers on the drink menu if you're going to offer a drink menu. I'd give this place 1 star but the food is very good which is the only reason I gave it 3.

So since I went the first time I've visited 4 more times. 5 times total. One 1 out of 5 have been a good experience. The service is horrible. This time we got stale chips. Asked politely to switch is out and she gave out a sigh and said " well I can switch it out but it's gonna be the same. These were made this morning so I don't know what to tell you." I asked if she could switch it anyway. She brings me back new chips and says " it's the same like I said so I don't know what to tell you". Guess what... the new chips weren't stale. When I was ordering she interrupted me in the middle of talking very rudely and looks at my son to take his order  I'm guessing she doesn't care about her job or tip. She also happens to be the SAME SERVER I got the two other times that were horrible. The food is a hit of miss. It could be good if it wasn't old. Even the horchata has been given to us with the bottom of the drink so it was all chalk and watered down to taste like sweet water. Also, I'm assuming the server knows she's horrible and provides bad service which is why she doesn't wear a name tag.

We visited this spot while on our way to Colossal Cave, it was one of the last spots on the way to the cave. Upon entering the place was pretty dirty, lots of food on the floor and dirty tables. It was pretty full though and we were limited on time so we stayed. I know that COVID and a lack of people applying for jobs probably left the place short staffed.
5 stars to the two nice waitresses, they did their best.
1 star for the drinks, the water glass had red crumbs floating in the bottom of the glass and the tea was very cloudy.
0 stars for the chips and salsa, the salsa, which is like water smelled so terrible and tasted the same, it may have actually been rotten/spoiled, the chips weren't that great either.
3 star food (being a little generous) the meat was excellent but the rice and beans were not, ordered shredded beef tacos. 
The food did come out quickly which was nice.
This place is probably suffering due to staffing issues, hopefully they can turn things around. Maybe we just ordered the wrong item, will try another place next time.

The service, food, and price were all over the top! We started off with the chips and dip and a side of guacamole which was thoroughly enjoyable, with a cold beer and a refreshing margarita. We had the tacos and sopes and they were absolutely exceptional! We didn't even notice the wind howling across the patio, it was such an enjoyable experience. We will be back.

I gave them 3 stars instead of 2 stars due to this place just recently opened (but, they do have another location on 22nd).  My experience at the one in Vail was not very pleasant. I was seated and given a menu, chips and salsa and my drink came quickly. That was the only good part. I sat and waited and waited to order; the waitress asked people that came in after me if they were ready to order; however, that table requested more time to read the menu. I got the waitresses attention, as my table was close and stated, " I am ready to order" and she replied "okay" and walked off and never came back. She later returned and asked that other table if they were now ready to order and they did. After she took their order, she walked past my table and I again stated, "Excuse me, could you please tell my server that I am ready to order?". She replied "Oh, you didn't order yet?" and then she walked off.  After waiting and waiting again, as though I was either invisible or being ignored, the same waitress that I told twice that I was ready to order, finally returned and took my order (There were only 3 occupied tables, so being too busy would not be a good excuse). After ordering, she stated, "Oh, by the way; sorry about that." I ordered 3 Carne Asada Tacos with guacamole and they were okay. She was nice after I finally ordered and she refilled my drink without me having to ask. The Carne Asada were thin strips that were not very seasoned or tender. The rice and beans were fine. I will probably try this restaurant again (order something different) in about 6 months after they have been open for a while to see if the service and food is better than my first visit. For now, I will go elsewhere for my favorite Mexican food.
Love it here!!! Everyone is amazing and friendly!! Food was amazing! The waitress are attentive and super fast. I've been here twice now and they're all around awesome

I liked this new place and was looking forward to going back for breakfast but they changed their hours already in just the few short weeks they've been open.  It was open at like 8am last time I was there and now it's changed to 10am so I spent my money across the street at Fitos.

I have been to taco Giro in Sierra Vista many times and had great food and service. This new restaurant in Bill needs to have management on duty at all times. We've had for service twice from this location in the evening. Waited last night 20 minutes never received anything to drink hardly got acknowledged no chips and salsa it was 78° inside the building we finally got up and left. We might get to go but never got back to service
