We were so excited for this place to open but it is just all disappointing. The taco shells are not fresh, they are the premade ones you can buy at the store. The food is ok but service is so slow.

Great food and drinks.  The mariscos (seafood) is awesome and everything is authentic.  The service is friendly...come try a great drink, Jarrito Preparado is my recommendation, and authentic Mexican food!

I like their egg rolls. I can't speak for anything else because I haven't tried anything else. I also like the homeless looking dude outside who is hocking random novels to people passing by. Apparently there's a special deal if you buy 2 or more of the aforementioned books.

Not bad.  I tried them for delivery recently when I wanted tofu and didn't feel like cooking. The food arrived really quickly, was hot and tasty...and cheap!  I think I had four or five meals from my order.  Works for me.
They have vegetarian won ton soup. It tastes like won ton broth with veg dumplings. I LOVE it.

Awesome place to work. I was a dispatcher for them and i convinced that i taught them how to cook. I am glad my cooking skills paid off. A few motivations for them, and they'll be happy and living an excellent life style in no time.

Dragon House is my go to spot for fast, cheap, good chinese.  The proprietors are super, super, nice, and if you'd like some weird paperbacks, dvds, or costume jewelry with your food, theyve got you covered there too. Vegan tofu soup is 2.98/pint, 4.25/pt for veg lomein, 5 bucks for a pint of buddhas delight, and the other 10 veg options are 7.75. The quality is consistent and delicious, the sauces are tasty and the portions are good.

Went here and had twice cooked pork.. didn't disappoint. The service was pretty good,  and the pork bun wasn't anything too extraordinary,  but I haven't had twice cooked pork that good for quite a while.

Very basic little shop on the harbor. Was looking for coffee nearby before getting back in the car and saw the sign outside that said 'coffee'. Ok well its not starbucks...its just drip coffee, but if thats what youre looking for theyve got it! And most other things you would find at a gas station conventient store.

Start here for your pre beer and save some cash. With the restaurant $6 beers around you why not get a nice domestic at this great lil store and they even provide free gift wrap with  a very stylish brown bag as to conceal the libation. your already a few feet from the ocean and walkway so grab it and leisure on up to some nice SB ocean views.
They don't wear masks or enforce them. It's a simple act that can potentially save many. Shameful

The employees are not wearing face masks when serving customers, which endangers the entire community. I have reported them to the county because they are endangering the community and using  the ADA to try to justify their selfish actions.

Endangers the safety of staff and customers by allowing people to not wear masks citing "health reasons." I am asthmatic and yet can breathe through my mask. I wish more businesses cooperated so Santa Barbara would get better faster in regard to Covid-19 spikes.

This was always a great little market, especially for boaters at the marina but their disregard for safety during covid has us trying to avoid going in for anything despite wanting to buy hot coffee & donuts in the morning, or sandwiches and six-packs of craft beer. The workers rarely wear masks and regularly allow customers to enter without masks. The shield at the counter is great but not enough. Shocked this no mask behavior has been accepted by the city for so many months despite the state mandate and posted signage upon entering the harbor area that masks are required.

I saw that this restaurant took the place of Pizza Hut awhile back. I figured i'd try them out, especially since they focus on chicken. Well, my chicken bites were ok, nothing to be excited about. My co-worker's chicken sandwich was dry and didn't have everything listed on the menu on it. The fries were delicious. I may give them another chance since this location is just starting out.

I happened to be driving my usual route from the ShopRite at Baker's Square and noticed that the Pizza Hut had been replaced by a bright new HNT Chicken. Never heard the name before so when I stopped in a few days later with my hungry cousin who was pissed that the ShopRite was all out of cooked chickens I inquired about the brand.

The super sweet lady taking orders explained that this was a popular Brazilian franchise that had opened in Franklin Mills and this was their third new location. The place is pretty spacious and welcoming for dine-in. The menu offers all manner of fried chicken with a wide variety of sauces. 

My cousin got an ample box of bites, tenders and fries. They do charge an extra .54 cents for additional dipping sauce. I already my trove of food stuffs for the night but he gave a hearty thumbs up on his meal. I can't wait to go back and try for myself.

Why is this place a thing it's just regular tenders with different sauces the chicken by itself is just meh the fries are bland and it was only 3 ppl in the store but I had to wait for 20min. Until my food was ready horrible.

My husband just paid 33.00 for chicken. They put 5 pieces of decent pieces and rest was burnt and over cooked! No phone number on receipt and when looked up number no answer. This is 2nd time we had a problem. First time they forgot to give us our chicken that was at the one on 66th st resturant. Im pissed, will be email manager. Save your money, cook at home.

Came at 6:26pm. Sign on window says open from 11-7pm and to call your order ahead due to pandemic. Well when I called no answer. I go to the door and see that it has been cleaned for the evening and saw one person in there who was finishing up. 

All I wanted to do was taste this darn chicken and I'm damn hungry.

It's a very special occasion price but Included is the tip and tax, so for 2 people, that's $300 right off the top. Split that $800 two ways and included are some incredible wine parings and now it's really a great deal. Eight guests nightly. We started in the lower lobby of the Montecito Inn and after a couple of "house cocktails" and the first 3 bites, we were walked behind the restaurant into a secret room where we had one of my favorite things of the night, the "Golden Apple." After that behind us the kitchen is reveal and there is the team waiting to begin the adventure. So. Much. Fun.! There were 18 courses throwing a wide net over all the Santa Barbara seaside, farm lands and occasional winery (Thank goodness Brian who handles the parings focuses most of the wines in Germany, France and Italy--fantastic array--and generous servings.) I'm posting my menu from last night. I can't say enough about how delicious and creative every single bite. It really was an epic night and one I will never forget. Thank you Silver Bough creators Phillip and Margarita for a wonderful experience - especially the end of the night then we got to keep the party going and get to know you and the team a little better. Keep doing what you're doing and we can't wait to do it again someday soon!

The food is absolutely wonderful as you'd expect for a dinner at this price point.  Each course, and there's 18 of them, is well thought out to the minor detail.  The 18 courses are split into three major sections, of sea, land and desert.  Each plate is thoroughly explained by one of the three chefs.

Chalk up another huge success for Chef Phillip Lee and the Scratch Family of Restaurants, which includes, SushiBar (LA and Montecito), Woodley Proper, ScratchBar and The Monarch).

Difficult to put this experience into words.  With the oversaturation of tasting menus, a lot of diners have become numb to what chefs have to offer.  The Silver Bough has created an element of surprise to all the senses for even the most seasoned eater.

Tickets are available via Tock two months prior and beverage pairs are required.  If you would like the non-alcoholic pairing, contact the host and they will discount $100 for the selection.  The non-alcoholic pairing in my opinion, is much more labor intensive for the staff, some of the ingredients are fermented days before.  The pours for the wine pairing are pretty light, but add up, as there is a pour for almost every course.

Canapes and champagne are presented in the lobby of the Montecito Inn, while waiting for all the guests to arrive.  There were 6 guests total in our group, the max is 8 and I thought it was pretty snug while dining.

I won't go into all the details of the menu but wanted to highlight the extravagant ingredients that repeat in many of the courses:
*A5 Wagyu
*caviar
*spot prawn
*king crab
*venison
*pigeon
*gold and silver
*truffles -black/white
*Santa Barbara uni
*matsutakes

Food allergies are taken really seriously here and the staff ensure that the diner gets a comparable meal.  If you have a special occasion, there is nothing additional provided.  Love how all diners receive a menu and treats at the end of the meal.

The staff are super friendly, knowledgeable and the dry humor of Danielle really took it to another level.

Local ingredients are highlighted, along with head to tail animal wizardry.  The price point is what you would expect from this level of dining, I personally think compared to similar meals, it's a bargain and a standout meal/experience from all the others in it's class.  This is definitely a destination restaurant that is 'worth the detour' and will be emblazoned in our memory forever.
Wonderful culinary Journey with twists and turns with each amazing course and pairing Thank you Chefs for creating new fun memories

What an amazing culinary experience! The food was beyond phenomenal, as was the service. The night consisted of three acts: sea, land and sweets. The way that we were guided through each act was a special treat. The pairings of the wines and spirits were spot on as well. The choreography of the plating of each dish with the background soundtrack was quite something and made for some epic moments. 

This place is expensive but honestly worth every penny. If you can afford it, GO! You will not be disappointed. You'll be amazed. Get ready for something truly special. 

Thank you chefs for the best meal of my life!

This is an experience! First off I want to thank the chefs for being so open and comfortable, it definitely made the experience feel like a super fancy hangout more than an expensive private stuffy dinner.

There are no bad dishes here. I was trying to think if there was a dish I didn't like and I cannot think of any. The only tiny thing I noticed was that the wagyu did not cut as smoothly as previous wagyu I've had which was interesting to me. I was surprised that it didn't quite melt in your mouth. The dish was still amazing and I can't say anything bad about anything else I tried. I can go into detail about every dish but it's easier if you just try the food and then you'll know.

All the alcoholic pairings were amazing! And I kind of wanted to try the non alcoholic pairings more as they sounded very enticing.

The pricing seems excessive but it includes EVERYTHING! Parking, gratuity, drink pairings, taxes. You don't worry about anything except having a good time. They're not shy about the pours either and there's no limit to them. Once you take this into account, the price is very reasonable. It also may seem like small bites but I was very satisfied at the end. I don't say full because that typically means I overate. Let's just say I wasn't hungry at the end.

Quality ingredients, amazing pairings, and 3 friendly and very talented chefs made for an amazing experience. I highly recommend trying the silver bough!

Anything Gerson does tastes awesome. We saw the urban crudo truck at the lantern festival and knew we had to check it out. I've never had sushi tacos, but these were awesome. Very unique flavors that you don't taste very often in local sushi places. We tried every taco in the truck besides the salmon belly and after having them regret not trying that one too! We'll be back to try anything we haven't gotten yet, check them out!

MUST TRY!!  Found this truck today at a low rider show at Idlewild. I guess they just opened but man I feel like this is exactly what Reno needed! 
The sushi tacos are to die for. They have everything raw on the menu but they will cook it for you upon request which was great. The food came out beautifully, upscale. Worth the $. 
The scallop taco was so refreshing, light yet fills you up. 
I loved that taco so much I had to walk over for another an hr later. 
Their taco shell is tempura seaweed - it is different and blends well with everything inside their taco.
The salmon belly tho, I will be dreaming of that taco tonight!!! It was so good, the salmon was perfectly cooked and the pico was genius. 
My husband loved the spicy tuna poke bowl as well. 
I am very excited for this place and hoping it works out well for them business wise because it became one of my favorites. I will follow them around town. If you ever see their food truck out, please go try it out. You will not be disappointed!

Fanboy here..

The owners are some of my favorite sushi chefs currently working in Reno.  I have followed them wherever they may find themselves.  And now they are doing this and I am all in.

The price point is a little "stiffer" than just getting the variety of an all you can eat sushi meal.  But the funny thing is...you don't have to spend any more money to get satisfied.  Well, I should say I don't.  If you are still eating 5000 calories a day in 5 meals....this might get a little expensive.  But for me the price is totally worth it.  

I have been three or four times in the last month and cannot be more pleased with what they are offering.

I think my favorite is the tekka maki roll with tuna.  So fantastic that I get it every single time, no matter what else I may be getting.  And with their dipping sauces...BOOM!

The service is on point as usual.  When they are at the Eddy there is tons of places to sit and eat and even get a drink.  The spot on Wells that they are currently going to has no real place to eat other than in your own car....so plan accordingly.  But no matter where they end up....if you are in the mood for some great raw fish and poke bowls, try them out.

6 out of 5 stars... unique blend of authenticity with traditional sushi and a south-of-the-boarder flare! No surprise as Gerson and Jonathan have always made the most creative sushi dishes.

My fiancé and I each had the combo special... one of each tuna tacos for me, and the salmon and scallop tacos for her... absolute delight when paired with the gyoza, amazingly creative sauces, and pico de gallo topping!

Cannot wait to return and try the poke bowls next!

With this level of quality and flavor, only The Highest Recommendation is warranted!

Calling all sushi lovers, poke bowl lovers, raw salmon and tuna lovers, appetizer lovers, food truck lovers, and sushi taco lovers...

Wait, Sushi Tacos?  Yes, I asked myself that question too, when my friends Liliana and Herson, my favorite server and sushi chef at my favorite sushi restaurant, Hinoki Sushi, told me that they were working to open up their very own food truck with sushi tacos as one of their main focuses.  Sushi tacos are definitely a must, especially if you're a foodie and a sushi lover.  It's the most exciting  concoction I've seen in a while and it's definitely Delicious with a capital D.

In the case of Urban Crudos, Sushi tacos are like sushi rolls in taco form.  There are elements from Mexican culture- salsas, heat, and citrus- but no meat or flour and corn tortillas in sight (I do see tortillas on their pamphlet as an option, but need to double-check with them).  Their fillings are divided into two categories: raw and cooked and all come nicely packed in a deep-fried, lightly battered, crunchy, umami nori sheet with rice.  Comparable to hand rolls, but with a crunchy exterior and much more filling, the sushi taco can be customized to anyone's liking using a combination of their awesome sauces.

I was already excited to learn that my friends were applying their full potential (they are outstanding with what they do and have made Hinoki a family tradition for us) in creating their own business, and learning that they were concocting unique fusion foods made me even more excited.  I was as excited to hear about their sushi tacos as much as the first time I heard about kimchi tacos in L.A.

I thoroughly enjoyed my foodie adventure exploring this new exciting food and can't wait to come back for seconds. Update: I went the following day and found gold in the form of poke bowls, one of the best in town.  Everything was incredibly fresh and the combination of ingredients were well put together, with lots of room for customization on my part with their many sauce creations, though I didn't use any sauce at all except lime juice and enjoyed it one-hundred percent.

If you haven't already been to Hinoki Sushi, they are well known for serving up some of the freshest sushi creations using high-quality ingredients and fresh elements, including fruits and veggies.  They're also known for their fresh sauces and fast-and-friendly service.  Liliana and Herson were big players in building up their reputation, creating the perfect sushi dining experience.  You can easily find the same type of service at Urban Crudos: fast, friendly, and efficient and great quality food.

If you're looking for something new, exciting, and delicious, and served with a smile (yes, you can even see their smiles even with their masks on), please check out this food truck.  It will leave you wanting more.

Notes:
-They are currently parked in the lot of Buggy Bath Car Wash and plan to be at this location for about a month
-you can call and order ahead of time.
-Combo Special: 2 Tacos and one appetizer for $26
-There is plenty of parking in the lot of Peppermill Casino.  Turn into the lot closest to Buggy Bath Car Wash (next to blue-tinted mirrored building)
-Right now, they only have raw options for tacos and bowls.  Next week, they plan on serving their cooked sushi tacos. Keep up-to-date with them on Facebook on Instagram or give them a call
-their appetizers were all delicious and beyond fresh.  The jalapeno popper is nicely fried with a thin layer of batter and is a must.  I loved the California rolls that were sprinkled with japanese furikake seasonings.  Calamari was fried to perfection and  not oily. I loved dipping them in house sauce mixed with teriyaki.  The cucumber, edamame, and gyoza were all delicious.
-one taco is huge and is slightly bigger than the size of two hand rolls.  They are packed with so much filling.  Since the fish was pure and not seasoned, I added soy sauce and wasabi to all of my tacos for that salty factor, in addition to given sauces.  The outer shell was nice and crisp and fried to perfection.  Eating tacos within the hour is ideal to experience them when they are the most crisp
-the trick to a finding the perfect taco for you is to experiment with their sauces.  I advise for new customers to order all their sauces and combine them in different ways to find the right balance, like when customizing poke bowls and sushi burritos. 
-their house sauce was spicy but tolerable.  Their chimichurri sauce had pepper seeds and was mega spicy.  Their tomatillo sauce was not spicy at all.  Their teriyaki was perfect and matched with everything
-they might be at food truck friday
-they cater parties and events. This is exciting and would be ideal for any occasion, especially big ones like weddings
-no seating, Virginia Lake walking distance
Not bad, the special Monday to Thursday (4.99 gyro or rice bowl) is great. I've had better, but for the price and for a mall it was fantastic. Good service as well, will try again.

The food is good only complaint I could give is that the portion on the rice bowls are so little  that it still leaves you hungry and they dont give u much of anything  beyond that the prices are fair and the food is really good
Great gyro and fries, my wife had a rice bowl was also good. Prices good for being in a mall. Will be back. Baklava was good too.
Food was cold, your specials arent special. Nice kid behind counter tho. Wont be back.

If you going to sell a Greek salad make sure your employees know what it is  I received one with no potato salad I had to show him the menu where it clearly says it part of the salad .I got it on the side after . I will not  go to a restaurant where they don't know what's on their menu or what's in their entrees. And on top not a good Greek salad  Anyone who ever had a Greek salad  knows what comes on it . especially the employees should definitely know  not having to ask where it is and showing them their menu

This place is the worst. The pita is soggy, the seasoning on the chicken is awful, the salad came without dressing, the potato salad (for $2.99!) was in the smallest container on the planet and is too salty to even eat, and they forgot the French fries. Honestly, couldn't create a worse meal if I tried. Genuinely upset about it and wish there was a number to call to get a refund
Great food, excellent service! The Greek fries are amazing. I didn't expect cheddar and feta to mis so well, but they absolutely did.

Absolutely some of the best Texas brisket I've had including Franklin's in Austin. Got the moist fatty cut brisket (by request) and it couldn't have been better. Sides were fries that were piping hot and crisp and beans (not your usual KC style or even Texas ranchero style) which were different from what I've had in the past but were equally enjoyable to go along with my brisket sandwich. Sandwich could easily stand alone without sauce but the KC style sauce was just too good to resist. Owner along with his pit master, Scott, were both there tonight and couldn't have been nicer (as was the cashier taking our orders). Definitely have found my go to spot in St. Louis for BBQ after many trials at other BBQ establishments around town following our recent relocation. Bravo and keep up the good Q coming!
I love shaved duck. This allows me to have a quick bite without heading to the city. Their cheese sauce is the best.

We have been regular customers of the Shaved Duck since they opened in South City over 10 years ago so we were very excited to hear that they were opening a second location in Kirkwood! We had them cater our wedding at The Bluffs on Broadway this past Saturday, October 9th and everything was incredible! Pulled pork, chicken, brisket, mac-n-cheese, zucchini squash veggie dish and salad were our choices. All through the day, our guests told us that it was the best food they'd ever had at a reception!!  Kudos to  the the owner, Ally Nisbet and his staff for all of their hard work and enthusiasm- we had the best wedding ever! Thank you so much for helping make our day even more special. Affordable and delicious - you can't go wrong with The Shaved Duck!!

Just to mention that this location is a walk up counter inside a Schnucks grocery store. It wasn't clear and we drove all the way out there expecting a sit down dining restaurant. 

The brisket, BBQ sauce and baked beans were excellent. However, the pulled pork was very dry. They did not have wedge salad or sweet potato chips as their online menu mentioned so a little disappointed that wasn't more clearly indicated before we arrived. 

I would still recommend this place as a quick "take out" option.

Generally, I prefer my ducks with a beard, but still managed to stop by this location for a business lunch. It wasn't what any of us were expecting, being located inside a Schnucks grocery store. Okay, so it's not quite the ambiance we were looking for, but sure, why not have a meal in the small food court style setting? I am so glad we did. Everything, and I mean everything we had was really delicious.

I should start with the customer service. Even though it's an order at the counter situation, the gentleman helping us did a great job welcoming us and walking us through a suggested order. He actually told me if I ordered the cheeseburger, it would probably be the best cheeseburger I've ever had. Pretty bold statement. Especially because, I thought I should order BBQ like my dining companions did. 

That cheeseburger was so good, I didn't even stop to take a picture. I'm glad I didn't, because I probably would have ate my phone while looking at the picture later. It was just expertly seasoned and cooked with perfect simple ingredients and presentation. To be fair, not the greatest I've ever had, but easily in the top 10.

We had several sides, all of which were dynamite: BBQ beans, Mac & cheese and Brussels sprouts- and the cook even brought us some burnt ends to check out. Everything was excellent. My cohorts loved their brisket and pulled pork too. 

This spot is a real winner. I guess it's a much more streamlined menu then what is offered at their other location. I will definitely be checking out the full restaurant location the next time I am in town. An easy 5 stars.
They take doordash orders, in person orders and phone orders, with one cashier, if you want food from here be ready to wait 30-45 mins.
This place blows, staff is moronic and every order is extremely delayed & screwed up.

First time eating wingstop & will be my last time . It was horrible, everything was cold. Wings were so small & dried out . Can't believe i wasted my money on this garbage. DONT EAT HERE !!!!!!!!! Such a disappointment

We went to wing stop and spent $70 on food. The really short girl that was reading me off the food I bought had a attitude. Then I wait for the 4 drinks I bought. I just heard her talking under her breath saying "I don't have to be here". And then threw down my drinks on the table Smh. I never experienced  this customer service in the last 6 years I been in Levittown.  Also the wings are much better at baileys bar.

One of my favorite foods... Wings.
Unfortunately, not many places around here get them right. Also, unfortunately, Wingstop is a place that did not get them right, although that is their entire business model.

First the good.
-The prices are the same here as the other stores in the area.
-They prepare the food in the window that is given when you order.

The not good.
-The chicken wing (traditional bone-in wings) consistency is very... inconsistent. Half of my wings were done perfectly and the other half was edible but felt undercooked (they were safe to eat, it was the physical texture).
-Eating the wings was like two totally different flavors, the sauce would barely stick to the wings and you would taste plain chicken and then sauce instead of a combination of the two.
-The blue cheese dipping sauce I got was, without exaggeration, literally water. If I dipped a celery stick into the blue cheese and pulled it out, it ran right off it as if I never dipped it at all.

I would not recommend Wingstop and I will not be ordering from here again.

(I would however recommend other local places for wings, these would be Baileys, Pizza Hut, WingsToGo, and Pizza Star. In that order.)
Over cooked wings where like rubber fries not cooked fully screwed up my order over priced should I continue....

I love Wingstop but the service is always shitty at pretty much every location. I placed an order about 2 hours ahead of time to pick up. I arrived about 5 min after it was supposed to be ready. Guess what? It wasn't ready. I asked how long it would be & the girl responded "we're about to sauce the wings" with an attitude. Ok that still didn't answer my question but whatever. They used to show you the order to make sure it was correct but I guess they no longer do that. I waited about 10 min & it was ready. The girl didn't say anything & just placed it on the counter & walked away. I asked another guy working if this was my entire order. I just left without checking anything....MISTAKE. When I got to my destination (I ordered for a few friends) the whole order was wrong. If you want expensive wings, shitty service & the wrong order, this is the place for you!

This place is good for what it is...obviously if you're coming to a pizza buffet that's 2.99 you're not exactly going to get Ruth's Chris-level ambiance. BUT what you do get is above average pizza (try the hot wing pizza...my fav), salad bar, and soft serve ice cream. I've never been here for dinner so I can't say I've had to deal with the rugrats like some of the other reviewers have.  Nice place to kill 45 min - 1 hour on a lunch break though.

Very cheap, $2.99 all u can eat pizza buffet with ice cream!!!  Granted its not the best pizza ever but its awesome for the price!  They will make you any kind of pizza that you want for no additional charge!  The have a rotating specialty pizza that are always good.  The last one was a philly steak pizza, and this time its a macaroni pizza!  The macaroni pizza is phenomenal, and a guilty pleasure.  The staff is SUPER friendly!  I never leave without a friendly goodbye.  

Now the only downfall is that because its so cheap you get some pretty rough cliental.  It can be quite depressing sometimes.  Avoid tuesday nights at all cost because its "Kids eat free" night and there are a ton of munchkins running around.  

ALWAYS save room for the ice cream!

My husband had it right when he said, this is the kind of place I would have been "all over" in college. 

Would also be a decent place for a kids sports team celebration as kids are free to be kids...and there's a game room.

All-you-can eat pizza, salad, soda, doughy desserts, and soft serve ice cream...for $4. You pretty much get what you pay for.

So, unless you're a poor college student, a coach, or down to your last few Georges...I'd skip.

Other reviewers are spot on. Personally, I think the pizza is pretty tasty, and very worth the $2.99. However, if you care about ambience, this is not the place for you. Most of the patrons are families with lots of small, loud children. In fact, the restaurant encourages that type of clientele with a series of video games and other kid-centric activities. If you're able to handle the atmosphere, the pizza for the price aspect is quite worthwhile.
What can I say......where can you get a meal (let alone a buffet) for $3??  NOWHERE!!  I actually love the cinnamon rolls.  Go figure.  Great place to take a bunch of kids.  I'll keep going back.

I was ready to give this place a 3 star review; I really was. Well, 2 1/2 stars, but yelp wasn't going to give me that option. It was a two star place, but that magical $2.99 all you can eat price tag bumped it up a star. Their garlic bread was god-awful, the rest of their pizza was decent... not pizza hut quality, but close. Their desserts were mediocre at best, but they also had some pretty good ice cream.
I was ready to give it this review, then I heard these words called out..."Big mac pizza up!"
I had to try it. I just had to. Who wouldn't? As soon as I popped it into my mouth, I was flashed back to the days of my youth (or, more precisely, my lunch from yesterday). It tasted exactly like a big mac. It had everything... Burger crumbles, cheese, thousand island dressing, lettuce, pickles (!), and onions. 
As I walked out, munching contentedly on a swirl ice cream cone, I realized that this single pizza changed this review from a 3 star, possibly 2 star review to a full 4 stars. Well done, Pizza Street. You did the unthinkable.

We treated ourselves and the kids tonight and I really must say I am so let down the 10 wing zings I got were hard as stone and one of the 10 was just a breaded bone , lol not kidding. The pizza tasted a lot different this time so not happy with that either, I am not going to order from here again. The upside is if there is one the delivery guy was here super fast.

Their Italian hoagie was authentic with top ingredients. Specialty pizza was also very good and creative. Price was more than reasonable for the quality of my order.
Tutti Bene!
I'm a frequent customer and chef, the pizza they have is excellent and I consider myself critical of food. The other items are as equally great.

The food is delicious. The service was correct and fast. I'm an adult that loves chicken fingers and fries. The wrong honey mustard can ruin everything for me. The chicken fingers fries and honey mustard is perfect. We also ordered a pizza. Very fresh and tasty. You can tell the ingredients are homemade and very flavorful. I usually like Gaetanos pizza and baby Luna pizza. This could be my new favorite.
I loved this place but it's prices sky rocketed since covid and I CNT say I'll be eating here much anymore. Wich sucks because my girls loved there wings

I've had their menu for a while and figured I'd give them a shot. Used grub hub to order and stated in the comments section that I had a $5 off coupon.  I arrive and there are three people behind the counter. Not one of them acknowledged me. No hello. Nothing. I stood there for a while before a female employee said anything. Finally she grabs my order then informs me that I can't use the coupon since I ordered online. Why not? Because "sometimes" grub hub gives their own discounts. Uh, so what? Also, if this is the actual case why not give me a call to let me know this? Just completely terrible customer service all around. The food wasn't bad, to be honest. The poor service will keep me from going back though. Go elsewhere and find a place that actually wants your money and shows it.

I ordered from here while my boyfriend was doing solar pannel work on a house 8 minutes down the street from him. I ordered his lunch, a burger and fries. The man on the phone told me it would be a 45 minute wait and I called back after waiting an entire hour and asked how soon? He told me the delivery driver left 10 minutes ago and was on his way. The food didn't arrive until an hour and 23 minutes went by and I called back to explain how that messed up my boyfriends lunch break because he didn't have his food in time or even close to on time. The man responded by yelling at me that they are busy instead of offering some type of condolence. Will not be ordering again due to the lack in TIME MANAGEMENT and the rude response. First and last time
I've eaten here twice the hamburgers are a must best around!!! Chicken Caesar salad is great as well!!!!

MrBeast Burger is operating out of the Hawk n Hog off N Parsons. There's a lil sign on the door with the MrBeast Burger Logo. 
Honestly the only thing that disappointed me about this burger was the LETTUCE. Or lack thereof. The burger itself is great. Smashed and grilled till crispy and juicy. I had mine Beast Style just the way it comes, I didn't add or take anything off. My son had a Chandler Style Burger and completely destroyed it. Delicious. The fries are probably better fresh, but that's on me, I did have to travel about 15-20 mins to bring it home. Other than that, I do wish I could order a single patty burger, but then it wouldn't be a Beast Burger, would it? I can't wait to go back.

Super excited for the new location, especially that pickup is now available! Really confident for those not in the area or who might not be able to afford delivery fees.

We got our meal last night using UberEats. The price is average, but with an app deal it came out to only $6 (a steal!)

My only disappointments came with the burgers themselves. The taste was great in the patty - really flavorful and filling. However, I paid extra for ketchup and lettuce on the Chris Style and barely got any (see photos). It was also suppose to have fries on top if you check the menu on the website. I think my actual burger had two. 

Nonetheless, it was still a good burger, even without receiving my desired add-ons. The Beast Style fries were a mess and okay at best compared to other places. A mixture of mayo, cheese, some spice, pickles, and an array of other ingredients. We added bacon but the recipe is more for a stomach ache then a delicious treat.

Overall not bad, considering it comes from a ghost kitchen. I do recommend the burgers, but if you go in person make sure you get what you paid for.

I have ordered from here three times and all three times the order was  in time. The burger is excellent juicy and hot and fresh. The only time there was a mistake was they forgot the lettuce no big deal. We will be ordering from here again. Funny that someone complained about a 2hour delivery wait. That has nothing to do with the burger place. My orders are always on time.the lady at the counter is always friendly. No matter if you are getting burgers or bbq.

Did a pick up after Uber eats failed to deliver to correct address.  We tried the Beast Burgers (minus ketchup) and the seasoned fries.  Fries were average at best tasted like frozen crinkle cuts that stayed in the oven a bit too long.  Burgers were great!  Soft bun, good flavor, lots of meat, melty cheese.  Definitely go back to try the other burgers!

Mr Beast Burger in Brandon is located at Hawk and Hog in Brandon, FL. My husband and son both enjoyed their burgers....my son said it was the best burger EVER. My daughter and I had the grilled cheese and it was literally the most delicious grilled cheese we ever had! The only issue were the fries. They were kind of dry, missing the pickles and instead of the advertised caramalized onions they were diced white onions.

I  Ordered online and  And received an email that my order would be ready at 3:47. I got there at 3:50 in my order was not ready until 4:25.  I felt bad for the girl that was working there because there were several other people waiting also. Food was ok. Basic burger and  fries that were kinda uncooked. Nothing to make me want to go back again.
Great burger. Not the best burger I've had, but definitely juicy and cooked to perfection. We placed our order for pickup and had to wait about 30 minutes more than the estimated time.

My husband and I go to this Taco Bell often we went yesterday I was very disappointed I ordered what I always order 2 tacos supreme I got 2 soft tacos with about a quarter teaspoon of beef 2 tiny pieces of shredded lettuce and 2 tiny pieces of shredded cheese no sour cream no tomatoes and no green onions In the last year I went here 3 times and got very poor service I think they need to change something this place is really going down hill
Horrible wait time at the drive thru. What's normally takes 1 min at other taco bells, took 12 minutes!

Good gosh, it had been forever since I had last visited a Taco Bell location! It was a pretty decent visit: I liked my soft taco though I wasn't super pleased with my burrito or my fries. My fountain beverage was exactly as expected and I liked the little cinnamon balls I had for dessert. What really wowed me was just how clean the restroom was! I was actually quite impressed! It's rare that I find such a clean, well-maintained fast food restaurant restroom, especially since I was visiting on a holiday. I'm sure I'll return eventually.

It's nice and clean inside and the staff are nice.  It shares space with Kentucky fried Chicken. Free parking.  But I ordered a couple Beef super burritos for $6 each.  What I received was 2 bean slurry burritos that were like mush and not recognizable and I could not find the beef.  Where is the beef?  False advertising.  Very bad.  Will no longer frequent Taco Bell.

My boyfriend and I went here a few days ago and we used a coupon for buy a meal $5.99 and up and get a Mexican pizza for free. First off, they forgot to make the pizza and then they rushed it and it's supposed to have beans and beef in it. The lady on a disgusting amount of beans on one side and then very little beef on the other side. My boyfriend could not eat it. He said it tasted gross and it looked like baby vomit. Also my burrito was hot on the outside and cold on the inside. Like they heated up the tortilla and used old ingredients for the inside.

Ok so every time I come here the drive through is backed up really bad . I have ordered the same thing on 3 different occasions and each time they get it wrong and instead of the Doritos shell in the  Gordita it's a regular shell! THREE DIFFERENT TIMES! You spend 15-20 in the drive though and that often leaves no time to go in and complain because by the time you get out of the drive through you have to book it to work! Honestly find a different location the service is slow and the orders have not been accurate !

Ocean crab is our go-to spot for crabs and a good time! We have celebrated birthdays, anniversaries, engagements, holidays and more at ocean crab and it's always a pleasure! BYOB and order a steam bag of the best finger licking good crabs in the region. The staff is always so kind and welcoming - this place feels like my second home.

When this place opened up down in the Woodlyn shopping center, I was just mad that the chinese buffet was gone! I didn't expect much from the spot, since it's not in an upper class neighborhood. But when I finally took my adult son there, once I got my COVID vaccine, I was pleasantly surprised! First off, the decor is perfect for social distancing. High walled booths and plenty of space, so even with other people dining, we were well isolated! Then the food! He got soft shell crab, my favorite but not usually that good around Delco. He gave me a claw, and it was meaty and tender, just delicious! I had the fried catfish, because I can't get it here. It was thick and flaky, but maybe a bit mild. I like the wild caught catfish with the fishy taste! But honestly, this was great! And the hushpuppies are perfection!! I haven't had great hushpuppies since I was down south last! (and that was awhile ago) But even these were competition to those! I thought the servings were small, but ended up taking some home, so guess not! I will definitely be back. Lots more there to try! Thank you, Woodlyn, for bringing me my dream! Seafood in Ridley!   P.S. Don't confuse this for Ocean House in Collingdale.

My $44 king crab legs arrived in a plastic trash bag and that's where it should have stayed!  Looks like the 1lb included the 2 tiny potatoes and stingy ear of corn. In and out in 20 minutes?  What kind of fresh seafood comes out in 10 minutes. It was awful. Another disappointment was that the reviews on their site were great. I left this bad review and they deleted it. Fool me once...
I'll never go back. Don't waste your money!
We went here on our travels through PA from Utah. It was a great surprise. Good shrimp, clam chowder and fries.

This place is the best. Hugh mountains of Alaskan King Crab Legs all you can eat with warm butter both garlic and old bay seasoned. And a mountain of large shrimp u peel all you can eat. For 20 bucks a person? Yep!! Along with freshly sliced prime rib carving station salad bar and a Hugh selection of desserts. How does this place stay in business?  Just make sure you bring your appetite and a large grocery bag yes we were allowed to take what we couldn't finish on our plate home with us. 4 snow crab clusters to go our server was nice enough to make sure we got a container of melted butter AND a slice of prime rib to go home with us!!! I love this place!!!

Ordered 1lb each of clams and shrimp, with hush puppies and key lime pie as take out.   The food is authentic and very good!  I'm told the clams and pie were good- I believe it as he refused to share!Please give this place a try it was great!

Wow! This place is awesome. Super clean inside. It has a nice ocean themed ambiance. Blue LED lights. It has a Koi pond just inside the doors. I got their small seafood platter. 2.5 lbs of 1/2 a snow crab, 1/2 dungeness crab, dozen shrimp, dozen clams, half dozen crawdads, half dozen mussels, 4 baby potatoes, and two half's of an ear of corn. Worth every penny. Best flavor. Nice and buttery with the perfect seasonings. No drawn butter needed just dip into the bag of sauce! So good. The pictures don't even do it justice! The service was excellent.

Food was overpriced, and under w helming. 
A lot of breading, not enough actual seafood. Will not be returning.

This place is an absolute joke please take my advice and turn your car around and do not go inside this restaurant all these other reviewers who left five stars if you notice they are all family and related. 

The food was absolutely disgusting take a look at the pictures the calamari was dry it was old the chicken had an expired taste to it barely any crabs no vegetables the muscles were dry the corn look like it was bitten this place is an absolute joke hundred dollars for nothing and it took only about close to 10 minutes for the seafood to come out. Absolutely horrible and tasteless

When you can't take a friend out to celebrate, UberEat them Ocean Crab. Ordering online was easy. They don't tell you exactly what's in 'Seafood Platter Small' but I have pics! My bestie said hush puppies were hot and delicious. (I ordered priority and still came FASTER than original estimate.) she ate one then all 6-8-10... were gone. The spice for 'Fire' was perfect. Good flavor then an after kick that has you coming back. Fish was fresh and would def order again. Go to for seafood in/around Springfield- Morton area.

Came here for dinner as a surprise and boy was I. When we got there, the place was empty with maybe a table and someone ordering out. The front looked niced before waiting to be seating because it was a fish pond look. We ordered shrimp, head on, mussels and snow crab legs. We were told King crab legs were 49.99/lb which seemed outrageous. We ordered with sauce on the side and I'm glad we did. Mussels were dry. The crab crackers to break the legs weren't even great so it was a waste of food. Shrimp was good when dipped in the sauce, but I was more into the shrimp heads. Calamari was subpar. You would think they made their own for a seafood house. Would I come back? Nope. If the sauce was in the seafood, we definitely wouldn't have noticed. Goes to show why they don't offer no sauce on the menu

Great service and great subs, the perfect combination! The service at The Fairview Heights Subway has always been friendly and prompt. I enjoy stopping in this Subway to grab a sub for myself and a few for the family. 

The restaurant is clean there is usually plenty of places to sit.

Great customer service every time I go in. I typically go for lunch and there is a line but they work together pretty well so it always goes by quickly. They are always friendly and patient. The place is always clean and the bread and veggies always look fresh. They have soup, but they change it up everyday, my favorite is the chili. Highly recommend.
I just went in tonight. The most unfriendly lady was working there. She ignored me for the longest time after walking in to pick up my mobile order. She also WAS NOT wearing a mask. NOT GOING BACK.

First Covid aside, the workers acted as if no one just walked in, my sandwich was wrong when I got home to eat it (I placed an online pick up), and my cheese tasted like turkey for some reason.. hopefully it wasn't rotten. My experience in a Covid era-- the business was completely packed with people, you couldn't not be next to someone, workers did not have masks or gloves on.  One lady putting cookies away (which this is disgusting regardless of current events) was leaning on the counter, no gloves, no mask (regardless of a pandemic I dint think your mouth needs to be 3 inches from cookies while you're running it non stop a about checking cameras -- because everyone in there wants to hear that) touching the cookies, the baking sheet, and spatula with her hands... that's nasty. This place is nasty.

Horrible service, horrible location. I ordered 3 subs through the Subway app thinking that it was a simple enough order and I learned quickly that I was wrong.

Upon arriving at the location I immediately noticed that there was an altercation with the employees. One of the employees walked outside grabbed a bat from his vehicle and began to threaten a person who was supposedly there to pick up his girlfriend after her shift ended.

I walked into the store and things got worse. One of the employees was so upset over what was happening that she kept making mistakes on the order of the customer before me. The customer quickly became agitated by all of the nonsense and said to another employee who was obviously new to "just pull my sandwich out of the oven so I can leave"

The new employee, was visibly nervous and sweating heavily began working on my sandwich after finishing up with the other customer. When I asked him "hey which one are you working on?" because I had a concern he was going to make a mistake, he replied, "uh...I'm working on the 3rd one. I've already finished the 1st and the 2nd" I was confused by this but I decided to let him finish up. He then gave me a bag containing 3 sandwiches with a receipt sloppily thrown in the bag. I asked him "am I supposed to sign something?" to which he responded "no you're good" 

I get home, open the bag, unwrap the sandwiches and was amazed at what I saw. None of the sandwiches had meat on them. Just veggies and bread. I'll never return to this Subway ever again.

This has become a weekly (sometimes multi weekly) tradition. Late night cravings or procrastination leave us with very few late night options for delivery. Even what is open is normally very unreliable, and comes in horrible condition. NOT THE CASE WITH DADDYS PIZZA!! Delicious, generous portions that ALWAYS come fresh and fast. We greatly appreciate all of their hard work and delicious food!
Just moved to the area and found this from a Yelp review, figured I'd write my own review as Daddy's was the best pizza and wings I've had!

I can't even rate this place 1 star, but you have to in order for your review to post. My friends and I from out of town ordered from here on Uber eats for homecoming. We were quoted a time, our order arrived two hours after the time we were quoted. After contacting Uber they informed us that the restaurant in fact prepared and delivered our order and to reach out to the restaurant. I spoke with who was said manager and the manager proceeded to say "What do you want me to do? Instead you can never order from us again!" baffled, I said I'll
also leave a review, the manager proceeds to say "please leave a review, and good luck!" I've never been talked to in this manner, by a manager! Please please never visit this location, there was also bugs and hair in our food. And it was practically freezing cold when we received it.

I ordered from the generic "Netflix and Wings" listing on Postmates (aka Uber Eats) and apparently that order was fulfilled by Daddy's Pizza. I placed the order at 10:50p. The ETA was listed as 11:15p; Postmates said they could not offer tracking for this order. I gave them a call at 11:30p to get an updated ETA. I was told, "we just finished up your order and the driver will be on his way soon.  The restaurant is ~10 minutes from my work. At 12:12am I called back and was told, "it's out in the car with the delivery driver. We'll have him call you." He did not call. My order didn't arrive until after 12:30a and everything was cold -- well, except my drink. I'm at work with no way to reheat the food. Joy. Love cold mozzeralla sticks and wings.

Pretty decent pizza. Much better than Papa John's or any of the other local delivery places. The green olives were kind of weird, and the sauce could be better. But the crust was good and it was hot and on time. I'll order again
Best pizza to order on door dash! Very fresh ingredients and everything arrived hot and delicious. Will be visiting soon
Couldn't tell you how the food is because it never arrived. Just don't order from here delivery or off Uber eats.

name: State of New Jersey Motor Vehicle Comission

reviews.text:
7/19/17 10AM
Pulled in to find the parking lot half empty and silently thanked Jesus! Middle of the month, early in the day went in to find no line, no one sitting in the chairs and no one at the receptionist's desk. It's like the heavens parted and there was a ray of sunshine on the receptionist. 

We were there to get my mother's handicap hang tag renewed and since she's very handicap she was able to sit while i went from one place to the other with no issues. Just showed her license and pointed to her. 

The receptionist was very nice, did some typing into the computer, printed out what we needed, we stepped over to the registration desk and the woman working there was nothing but polite. It was completed quickly with no issues and we were on our way. 

While this was probably a total anomaly that they only had a few customers while we were there but even going when it is busy it's tolerable. The other reviewers obviously don't remember the days of sitting in DMV for HOURS back before it was privatized or they went in with an 'I'm pissed at the state bcuz i have to renew my registration' attitude. The workers have never been nicer and efficient.

This places sucks. Long lines, disinterested employees and the guy who sits at the desk taking people's numbers is an a**hole. I didn't catch his name, but a classic New Jersey jerk. If you don't like your job, get a new one Einstein. Life is short.
Slow service. Made us change lines 3 times in one visit, then made us wait because the person who was taking care of us had to go on lunch break.

They are not very organized when it comes to have people go to lines.  I was frustrated  due to poor instructions given.  They need to be taught.   Also, they think they are the shit but not knowing that  they are only shit  piles.

Like a slow death this place is the worst. See zootopia and the sloths that work at the DMV there? They are much faster than this place. No chance you get out of this place in less than a few hours... avoid at all possible costs!

Yes! Excited that I get to find another place that deserves 1 star. While I understand that the process here is state regulated and that there are certain procedures and policies that need to be met, the staff has a huge part in facilitating a smooth and painless process. That is not quite the case here. Staff are not the most helpful and sound very demanding. This is not a business that requires good customer service to be successful because everyone literally needs to get their license at some point. However, this does not excuse the rudeness and poor services I've experienced here. It's as if their goal is to make the process as least efficient and as gruesome as possible. I would recommend that they better train their staff in basic communication skills.

I'm originally from central jersey so going to the dmv even an hour before it opens is hell because there is already a huge line. I decided to still come about 45 minutes before this place opened to be in front of the line. To my amazement I was first. I got in and renewed my registration all in 15 minutes. 

Of course the key is to get there before it opens. If you get to the dmv in the middle of the day or we'll after it opens you're gonna have a bad time.

Short and sweet. All that needs to be said is horrible customer service. Haven't been spoken to like this in quite some time. Extremely rude and every question or concern is rewarded with rolling of the eyes, attitude, and elevation of his or her tone. My reviews are typically lengthy, but this isn't even worth writing more about. Sad day for customers.

Every week my daughter attempts to get her car purchased in March right before Covid-19 registered but she's faced with ridiculously longs lines week after week. People start coming out at 4:00 AM to start waiting!!!! You're turned away when they reach capacity and it's unacceptable. She cannot go online for what she needs to get done and it's a disgrace!!!!

I ate there for the first time today with my wife and 2 small kids. We ordered a pepperoni pie with extra cheese and sauce. I thought it was very good. They put a lot of garlic in their sauce which I liked a lot. I will definetly repeat.
The place was not fancy but was quaint and the pizza was very good, probably the best I've had in this area. Will definitely try it again and looking forward to trying other menu items.

Ugh I'm so torn about this place. I order from here frequently because the food is tasty. But it's a good thing that I don't have any allergies because EVERY TIME I ask for no olives and no mushrooms I seem to get extra olives and extra mushrooms on my pizza. 

I specifically state numerous times that I hate mushrooms and don't want them when I order and somehow they still make it to my pizza. I don't get it. Same thing goes for garlic bread with cheese that I ordered and even asked him to make SURE there was cheese on it and of course, no cheese. They get one star for customer service- they are lucky they have good pizza!!!!!
I will continue to order here because the food is tasty and they are the only place that I know of that delivers around here... But seriously- please pay attention to your customers wishes!

Not sure what all the complaining is about.  Interior is nice (was clean), service was great and the food was good (had the chicken and egg plant parm & a burger so I can't say how the pizza and wings are.)

Menu is limited to simple "Italian" fare... so don't expect a restaurant you'd find in little Italy.
Plz donate to this place it's the best and they have the best pizza's ever and if they had more customers they would be very happy so plz check out this place

I was visiting from Miami and this place has some of the best food I've ever eaten in my life. I couldn't believe how good it is. It was also super cheap and everyone is very nice. I brought my dog and they were very nice and accommodating. They provided my dog with her own bowl and food dish. I would definitely eat here again.

The menu on their site is incorrect and not valid. They won't honor their advertised prices. Person taking the order didn't know the menu or ingredients/cook on the items. Asked to add jalapeños to a steak sub and was told they can't do that, yet they have a pizza with jalapeños on it ??!?.  Just moved to the area and won't be placing another order. $70+ for two sandwiches and two pizzas plus a delivery fee. Prior to hanging up was asked if I wanted to tip the driver on my credit card ?!?, how about deliver my food timely and warm and we'll consider a tip. Could have went to a chain restaurant and had a full course meal plus adult beverages for the price we just paid for a local restaurant. Get with the program OWNERS, you're batting zeros with your community.  

Food arrived as promised, but owners, come on now with your quality. You're using frozen pizza doughs and pre packaged ingredients. You're probably getting everything from Sysco and charging homemade prices. Lost a potential consistent customer with poor service and sub par food quality. Do you put effort into anything on your menu? It was like ordering baseball field food, in fact I've had better field food that what you delivered. 

Sorry, not sorry. You're in control of your business, quality and customer service.

If you eat here you like donkey balls in your mouth. This place sucks. Isnt clean. The drivers dont care how you get the food. Ordered a pizza it came with all the topping on one side of the box. And they all look like meth heads. They are rube and all out nasty ppl who think they are the best in town. Lol slice of life pizza is way better then these f×*ks eat there not here. This place sucks just as bad as those ppl suck dick. Burn down aholes.

Listen, trust me. Being from New England I've searched far and wide for a really good pizza in florida. This is the place that has it! Get the "belly buster" you can thank me later. Good fries and sandwiches too.  If you live close they deliver. They don't serve alcohol,  but you're welcome to bring your own.

Must try the garlic Parmesan knots. The pizza reminded me of speedway pizza but was very clean service was friendly and welcoming. Would go again for the service prices aren't bad.. everyday special 2 slices and a can soda 4.95

I feel like King Arthur and this place is the holy grail. I live in NYC and I have been visiting this part of Florida for years and have been on an epic quest for a decent pizza place and at long last I found one. Pizza here is A-MAZ-ING! I was not able to snag any wings but I, and the rest of knights from the round table will def order a round of those next time. The owners are amazing, they said they just bought it a few months ago, so ignore the old reviews they are trash. Keep being legends!

We came here Friday and Saturday. My son was having a football games that weekend. I was surprised that the place wasn't packed being the only place to get something to eat for miles. I had a western omelet it was very good and for lunch I had a gyro that was also very good. My son had the pIzza that was yummy. The tea was not good at all instant tea.

This place needs an up to date review. 
I couldn't really find any info on how good this place was so I dove in and made an order. 

Garlic Knots - Not bad, not great. Instead of knots, they twist the dough.  While I saw the garlic and butter they seemed a little bland. 

Wings (HOT) - Terrible. The wings tasted like they were from the frozen food section.  Pizzerias usually do good wings with the exception of the chain pizza shops.  These were just BAD. 

Pepperoni Pie - Decent pie. The sauce was a little too sweet and there was something about the crust that just didn't jive with my tastebuds. A fair pizza but nothing special. 

Mini Cannoli - WOW! Star of the show as far as I'm concerned.  I wish these were bigger. They were free with the order, I don't know if they have normal ones on the menu but I'd be sure to get one. They were great. 

Good try for a tiny pizza place in shady hills, even with limited selections in the area I don't feel like they stack up with others.

Rudest service 
My son wanted near and Mayo. She kept asking what be wants I kept saying noting.. attempted to order mine but she said she had other customers to attend to.  So I ordered nothing. U will never go here again
I am going to make this go viral.  So disrespectful.

Customer service is awful. There were 2 ladies behind the counter but only 1 was making the sandwich. The other one was just standing. She finally took my order but proceeded to give my order to the one who is already busy making the sandwiches for the customer ahead of me. I was so disgusted that she made me wait instead of working on my order. She just stood there idle. So I left... and will never come back. 
The owner should train their staff about good customer service.

The most disgusting and dirty Subway I ever seen. Walked in the other day noticed roaches crawling on the floor under a table where people were eating, the whole place looked unclean and dirty. I turned around and walked out, health dept needs to pay a visit here

Absolutely awful, that's the best way to describe this location. We ordered through Doordash, but realized a couple minutes afterwards that we wanted to add something on. So we called, and they said that their doordash wasn't working. So instead of making themselves unavailable through the app, or canceling the order as soon as they got it, they decided they weren't even going to notify us. Would we not have called, we would have been waiting for an order that wasn't going to come. Now we have to wait for our refund(about 5-7 days... you have to be kidding), which is a fairly good amount considering we have a large group of people. Why would we have to wait a for a refund for the food that wasn't even made? Disappointed, but not surprised in you.
Great customer service did not order a drink but offer a water cup. Nice and consiste

Such terrible service. Lettuce was browning and definitely should've been thrown out hours ago. Half of my sandwich didn't even have the tuna on it. Only one worker. In my opinion the store definitely shouldn't be running. Charged us extra for cheese that we didn't want on. Told her which one to put on and still put the wrong one on. She was questioning the toppings to put on my sandwich and saying I already put this and this on it. If you want to go to subway don't go to this one. Any one but this one.

it's a sandwich so of course it's going to be good, but i'm so upset with the customer service and this bread! Half done ass bread smh and the girl only put the veggies on 75% of the sandwich because she was rushing to go back to playing on her phone. do better! i should've taken the hint when the place was completely empty.

Went to subway next to Dunkin and if there's an Indian lady don't go in. She literally had an entire conversation and it sounded like she was yelling. Not very professional. The food was okay but she does things so fast just wanting to get back to her phone.

We went to have quick lunch with my family with my kids. We were pleased and surprised  with an amazing service. Ms. Anika was alone, still she was patient, courteous and helpful with a pleasant smile. We left the store with glee. I am surprised that others had bad experience. But, we had a great time.  Thank you.
Great customer service did not order a drink but offer a water cup. Nice and considerate

If I could give less than one star I would. The employee working could care less that I was a customer. The store had just opened and the employee literally ignored me and I was not served until I asked if there was anyone working behind the sandwich bar. If I had not said anything to the employee who knows how much longer I would of had to wait until the employee finally went into the sandwich area to rudely took my order.
If you're looking for a decent sandwich and customer service this is not the place.

Horrible service, what seems to be the manager glanced at me when I told her the sandwich I needed never spoke back or looked my direction again. 5 min later she told another woman to serve me and she was a bad listener I hate this place. My friend had hairs all around his cup lol, good for him he should have made her drink it. I also hate this app for not allowing me to give zero stars!!!!
These days, good service is hard to find. However, the service from Dishant was excellent and based just on that, this will be our new Subway of choice.  The food was fresh as well.

They served me sour steak on a tomato basil wrap. It only took me one bite to realize it was bad. I drove back for with the food for a refund and was refused. Also all the lettuce was turning so I didn't get any on my wrap. Disgusting place and employees. Don't do it to yourself.
Food was really good but they are very slow at night took 20 mins plus to make only 8 wings!
Food was great! My salad was amazing and my son ate all his meatball sub. Thanks subway
This establishment has horrible customer service and is super slow never recommend this location.

After hearing so many good things about this place I finally decided to try it out and wow it's that good. The food was absolutely amazing! I ordered their chicken empanadas which tasted so good and had this amazing juicy steak with fresh French fries. Definitely coming back.

We were so pleased! The food was excellent! We ordered takeout and staff was so nice and accommodating! My husband loved the bandeja paisa and my tostones locos were to die for! We will be back for sure!
What a great discovery. This place is absolutely amazing. The service is great and the food is absolutely delicious. Will definitely come back again!!

My husband and I stopped in one weekday afternoon because we were lookin for something different. 
Columbian sounded great, so we tried this place we had heard of. 
Such a tiny place but it is BURSTING with flavor!!
Without a doubt some of the best food I had eaten in a very long time. You have to really pay attention to find it off Hwy 60 as this place is tucked away pretty well on Montclair between Lithia Pinecrest and Bryan Rd. The owner was super duper sweet and suggested this dish for us to share. I would have enjoyed the carne asada if I could cut it but we just got plasticware. Thats really the only negative thing I have to say. 
La Cocina de Cris is great, the food is better than great, and we can't wait to go back!! 
I think I can still feel my tongue dancing from all the flavors. :)

This place is AMAZING! I hope it gains more attention because they really deserve it for the incredible food, top notch hospitality, and a very cozy atmosphere.  Not to mention the low prices for the quality of food you're getting. A husband and wife own the place and you can feel their authenticity in the food and in the way they speak to you as if you're family. It felt like we were at someone's backyard cookout. There's an outdoor covered seating space right next to where you order with a little room off to the side where you could choose to eat inside as well, but the outdoor patio was very relaxing so we sat there with our two dogs. The wife brought out a large tray full of filtered water for the dogs on her own without being asked which was super thoughtful. Now let's get to the food! Wow!!! The empanadas were hot, crispy, and exploding with flavor and packed inside unlike a lot of places that serve empanadas half filled with air. Everyone was blown away by the flavors of their entrees- the pechuga was seasoned to perfection and the fried fish my friend ordered was fresh and crispy and done perfectly. Even the sides were made perfectly. The red beans were the best I've ever had. The star of the meal was the salchipapas. I'll be dreaming of them until I come back. The combination of the freshly grilled seasoned meats, fries, cheese, and sauce was out of this world. I cannot wait to come back to this place because it really is THAT good.

Every time I go in the store the people were very unfriendly. Nobody smiles they act like they hate their job, and when you ask a question oh I don't know that's the answer you get it. When you try to sit down at a table all the booth near the windows are filthy every single time I go in there. And you're never busy so I don't understand why the store can't be clean. They need to get some friendly people and learn how to clean and stock the lids. And when You asked if there's a manager around They say no there's no manager here tonight they'll be here in the morning. So who's running the show a couple of teenage kids seriously place is horrible

Here are the reasons I enjoy this particular Subway:

1. It's literally right down the road from my home. Convenience, convenience. I can stop by on my way home from work.

2. The service is incredibly speedy. I have been to other Subways that take their precious time moving people through the line. 

3. Friendly staff! You will always get those annoying customers who want "just a little bit of that" or "only 2 olives please" and "make sure you only toast my bread for 6 seconds." They handle those people in stride. Good customer service, I tell ya.

4. They have yet to make me a sub I didn't love. Whoop!

About on par for Subway.  Definitely not one of their larger locations, but well-kept, clean, and bright.  Staff was attentive, courteous, fast and gave a fair amount of toppings on the two six-inches I ordered.  Didn't even hesitate when I gave weird directions (add jalapeños before baking per my weird wife).  If I lived anywhere near here I would probably go here before another Subway.

I decided I wasn't cooking tonight and I had a package to pick up at UPS Store right next door, also haven't had Subway in years. 

Service was fast. Young man behind the counter was training. No issue with the two subs I ordered. 6in Meatball on Italian Herb and Cheese and Chicken Bacon Ranch on White. Bread was fresh one sandwich toasted one not. 

Tables were clean and they are requiring masks although not everyone following their request. 

Easy meal I didn't have to cook and no dishes to clean up after.

If I could give this place zero stars I would.  The computer went down so the staff said 7-10 minutes.  Ten minutes goes by and no updates from staff, just talking amongst themselves in Spanish.  I did not have cash so I was SOL.  Just left and will never go to this location again despite it being the closest to my house.

Went in with a coupon and the store wouldn't accept it claiming their system wouldn't allow it due to an update. Would not find a resolution to the situation so we could still try the discount. We went there because we had the coupon and bought footlong sandwiches for the same reason. We will not be going back to the restaurant. BEWARE IF YOU ARE TRYING TO USE COUPONS HERE!

***When we told them that they lost a customer due to this poor service, they replied that we were just one... even though the next customer walked out because she couldn't use her coupon either.***

Several items were missing and one item was incorrect. The meals that did arrive were comparable to a microwavable frozen diet meal. Hopefully the bao is tasty, but I wouldn't know because they were missing. At least the delivery came quickly.
Placed an order online. Food was unedible. Didn't get main entree and had to throw away buns because they were rock hard. Save you time and money go somewhere else.

the worst food i've ever had. save your money and go literally anywhere else. it's a straight up frozen meal dinner, i couldn't believe it. glad everyone else thinks the same as i do. bao buns were falling apart if you took off the wrapper too. authentic bao buns do not do that.

Food look like throw up. Also there were random chicken hairs all in the food. it was comparable to a tv dinner and the portion size was sooooo small for how much you pay for a dish. do not waste your money or time. I end up throwing my food away and had to get a doordash credit since my food was inedible. please listen to the other reviews on here. do not waste your time.

This food was not good.... It doesn't seem like a real restaurant. It tastes like a frozen meal from the grocery store. If you are looking for good food, you will not find it here. Even if this is the only place open, you should not go here. You will feel nauseous afterwards. My friend is literally throwing up as I type.

Stay away from this establishment it is a scam they will advertise if you spend over $15 you will get a free dish that is not true the food is awful keep your money This stuff that they call food it's not they will try to grab your attention with false advertisement once you receive your order there is nothing additional added to it but luckily the food is not good at all keep your money where it belong !   Don't do it.... The false advertisement is how they get you to look at The menu.  You're thinking what a good deal.  NOT The food is terrible and they are pulling you in; word to the Wise once again stay away from this place.

Ordered through Door Dash and immediately regretted my decision after looking at the Yelp reviews. Like everyone else, our order took 45 minutes longer than the original expected delivery time AND they messed up our order. In the four back of baos I was suppose to get a veggie, spicy sausage, chicken teriyaki & cinnamon apple but got two spicy sausages instead of the chicken teriyaki. The baos were alright. Lukewarm and the paper really stuck to the bao. The potstickers were very crispy but also very oily.

Where do I begin? I ordered through UberEats. I just flew into Nashville and the hotel restaurants were closed. 

I ordered teriyaki chicken bowl and 2 bao. They send a Kung pao chicken bowl that was cold and mushy. The 2 bao were cold and rock hard. They didn't send utensils so I had to call the front desk.

Another negative is how small the portions were for the price. $15.99 for a small bowl.... The bao were bite sized.

This was super good - I got some ginger chicken gyoza, ginger chicken dumplings, a teriyaki chicken bao, and a spicy sausage and egg bao. I got it delivered and it still arrived hot and delicious. Big fan! I ate it too quick to take a picture, unfortunately. Great prices too!

Don't waste your time, I've never left a review before but this was bad enough to get me to. 

Ordered off Uber eats, order took an extra 45 min from estimated time to even leave the store. Got some chicken dumplings, bao buns, and Kung pao bowl. 

The bao buns were not even the ones I ordered, and the ones they sent were very bland and disappointing. 

The bowl may have been slightly better if it actually was just a frozen meal. It was just mush on top of rice. 


I will say the dumplings were decent, I just wish I had read the other Yelp reviews before ordering.

I was excited to see a "Chinese" food option in Nashville, but this was the worst food order I've ever received. The "chicken teriyaki" had a bunch of soggy onions and bell peppers mixed in. Never seen it served that way. It's a way to be cheap. There was not one substantial piece of chicken in it. Disgusting. You should be ashamed of yourself for flat out stealing from people and Uber Eats should end business with you.
I actually have no words to describe how bad this place is. Too bad you cant give less than 1 star. My orange chicken bowl was a literal lean cuisine.

I rarely ever write reviews. But I needed to about this one. Decided to take a chance on this place despite all the bad reviews. Big mistake. The 6 pack of bao I ordered arrived cold. And the only two flavors I was looking forward to, which was the custard one, werent in there! They gave the wrong ones! Imagine my surprise expecting a custard bao and instead biting into a gross cheeseburger bao. Disgusting. The only one that was close to being good was the Mongolian beef. Please save your money people.
WORST PLACE EVER !!!!!!!!! No stars should be an option. I didn't even know what I was eating
Please whatever you do do not order from this restaurant it is a scam they will take your money and not give you what you order word to the wise don't do it

Just a word to the wise do not order from this restaurant it is a scam, they will take your money give you the wrong order and when you try to call they will give you a number that is out of service and you are stocked with food that is disgusting.   Please pass the word read the reviews and I guarantee you, that you will not order from this place.  You have been warned waste your money if you want.

If you ever catch yourself in the Fishtown/Port Richmond area - make sure to stop by this place. Really fun & local vibes here. Service is friendly, and just overall, this restaurant is adaptable. I follow them on social, and they are always changing and adjusting to the current pandemic and dining restrictions, and their offering has remained consistent (in a really good way.) 

They have a creative menu, from chicken sandwiches & burgers, to tacos and salads. Really solid options for vegetarians. I would consider it upscale bar food. We had a chance to try an apple pie dessert, which was FIRE! Totally recommend if they still have on the menu. 

Also, really cool bar scene. Drinks are great, fairly priced. 

I cant wait till they can operate at full capacity again!

To think I didn't go to Tin Can Bar for so long because I was still lamenting the loss of Bait and Switch! While I do miss the prior iteration of this location, Tin Can bar is the next best thing.
