The same bartender who used to mix my schuylkill punches is now mixing my blood orange margaritas and they are equally kick ass. He is an amazing bartender and I'll follow him anywhere, but for my convenience I hope he stays there. 
The food was so good too! I wish the menu had a little more but what we tried was wonderful. We shared the Nashville wings which are the same as they were with Bait and Switch, delicious as ever. Some of my favorite wings around. My boyfriend got a burger which he really liked. I got the bbq pork platter which was a revelation. The fries are absolutely fantastic. I'd like to say I got collard greens as my other side but alas I got the macaroni and cheese but I regret nothing.  
We are also loving the vibe here. The decor is a little darker which we dig. The pin ball machines, though not functioning during my visit, would be pretty cool, and the outdoor area promises to be lots of fun in warmer weather. 
I can't express my unbridled joy at this place doing its predecessor justice. I encourage my fellow hoodrats to make this place a fixture on their neighborhood rotation, and anyone else to come give it a try.
I love this bar! One of the best chicken sandwiches and fries ever. Don't sleep on this bar! Heated outdoor space too :)

I like it here!  It's a great spot to get a good drink/beer and some food.  The staff is always friendly and helpful if your not exactly sure what you feel like eating or drinking.
Wound up stopping in yesterday with my bestie for a bite to eat.  The bartender/waitress was great! Oh and their outside seating setup was so darn cute!!

I must admit-when bait and switch closed I had hoped this would become another banger Mexican place like the other joints by this owner. It didn't, but I suppose I'll get by and be grateful for the blood orange margarita. They have a small menu that I've heard get picked apart. Specials are starting to roll out and make my mouth water now that they have revamped their outdoor seating. Some of their cocktails taste like gasoline(I'm giving 5 stars, but I'm an honest boozer) others have me ordering seconds. 

The side takeout window has made walking the pup much more enjoyable during these winter months. 

Great place to catch a game without a bunch of drunk punks ruining the day.

I must admit-when bait and switch closed I had hoped this would become another banger Mexican place like the other joints by this owner. It didn't, but I suppose I'll survive with the bloodnorange.



On behalf of the entire neighborhood-BRING BACK THE PRICKLY PEAR MARGS

Wow, this bar is good. Great wings, service and drinks. Had the spiked hot cider and some apps and left really happy. Tables were distanced well so we felt safe the whole time. Come by if you're visiting friends in Fishtown or Port Richmond.
It was , okay. Shrimp taste old . Sauce was ridiculously salty almost caught a heart attack. They were new in town so wanted to give them a try. For the price , I wouldn't order again

ordered the catfish basket which is described as three pieces of Catfish.  I didnt want the fries. I received an overpriced fish fillet cut into 3 pieces. It was fresh and cooked well but not worth the price.

We enjoyed a shrimp and mussel boil tonight.  The shrimp were large and tender although the mussels were on the chewy side.  The portion was generous.  I did not like the spring rolls.  We thought the plastic gloves were a great idea to prevent messy hands and butter sauce dripping down our sleeves.  Will definitely return.

Po Boy Oyster sandwich hits the spot.  Oreo cake is an ice cream slice- It is a bit expensive, but it is good.  My fries were done well.  Pepsi was pretty standard that I got.  Based on what I read on past reviews and seeing people from a haircut place buy from this place inspired me to try this out.  I think combining all those things for consideration made my experience here satisfiable.  Also, I picked up at 9:10 PM on a weekday, a less busy time for them.  If not for all these things, would it have been different?  Maybe.

Everything was SO tasty ! 
Delicious,  not bad pricing,  and great size portions!
All of the staff were super sweet and attentive!

The seafood boil was good, but they forgot the soup on our order. I also asked for tartar sauce for oysters and did not get that.  Not having the soup made one person in our group miserable and it kind of ruined the whole experience of my birthday dinner.

I couldn't wait for this business to open.  It's in my neck of the woods and when one mentions seafood I'm right there. 

Location is in the Giant/Staples shopping center on Sproul Road.

The grand opening was 5/1/2021 with my first visit on Tuesday 5/11/2021.  Ordering online is simple and the takeout ready for the time I chose.  You'll find the dining room clean with a nautical theme and abundant parking.

I ordered the Takoyaki which is Japanese octopus balls in "chef's" special sauce (6) for $6.00. It was a lot of filler with a small piece of octopus.  I didn't care for this dish but encourage anyone to try it before you make judgement. 

My fav fried oysters were (9) for $9.00 and excellent.  

Couldn't go without the Oreo Cake which was good but the slim piece wasn't worth $4.50.

This writer believes the prices are high for this area.  Then again a seafood diner is expensive.  

Let's wait and see if the franchise works out since this location has seen a variety of specialties and none of them lasted very long.

I was so excited to have a seafood spot opening in the area. I had the king crab with the garlic butter and my husband had the king crab with their house sauce  which is a combination of all their sauces. We also ordered waffle fries which were the best part of the meal. The crab was either overcooked or old it was difficult to tell which. In addition it was extremely salty to the point that was not edible. The presentation was nice. They are still waiting on their alcohol license so the bar part does not apply. Overall it was a disappointment.

I have been to the Crack Crab twice in 2 weeks and both times were fantastic! The good was great and the service was even better.  They were friendly and very willing to make suggestions!  I would highly recommend them and I can't wait to go back!!!

im disgusted this was my second time eating here first time was great second time i ordered fried shrimp and got my boil to go. i got back to my hotel an put it in the fridge for later. literally halfway into me eating there's a HUGE bug! idk what kinda bug is this but i am pissed. i literally been waiting for them to open @ 12 because i will b back up there to speak to whoever is in charge.

Great seafood boils at good prices.  I have been here 4 times now, usually after seeing a movie at the AMC theater across the street. Place is clean, staff is friendly and prompt.  Never wait for anything. Food comes out quickly and is hot and very delicious.  Highly recommend.

I always want to give the new seafood place a try. 

Now it may not really be fair to judge them on what I ordered. Of all the things on the menu, I was in the mood for fried flounder and waffle fries. It just hit me. 

But I figured if they can get this basic dish right then that says something. 

They got it right. 

The fish was fresh and flavorful, and the batter had a little extra kick. It was fried to a nice crisp texture. And the waffle fries were pretty much perfect. 

I loved what I ate. The service needs to get a little more attentive but they're still new.

First timer here. Seafood has always been my go to. So I was very excited when I heard this place was opening up. 

We were greeted right away and sat down comfortably at the booths. Unfortunately they ran out of a couple items (not surprising since it's a seafood restaurant), but they were very accommodating when we wanted to substitute certain things for the "combos meals." Speaking of combo meals - must try the crack crab sauce. Which is a mixture of all four sauces. I did mild, and it was plenty spice for me, yet delicious! 

Service was excellent. Very attentive to us and every table that was there. Price was super reasonable for the amount of food. Pictured is the "combo #10." We shared it and it was definitely enough for 3 people. We'll be back for some more. Hopefully they'll have blue crabs next time!
This place was delicious!  I called in the steak and shrimp burrito..it was ready when I got there..soooo good and full of flavor. Definitely glad I found a Mexican spot up this way.

To be completely honest i dont think i will come back and order lunch from here again. The food was dry and bland and i had really high expectations from the food i was buying. To me i felt the food wasn't worth the price, I honestly could have made the food myself if i knew that I wasn't going to receive the food i was expecting. Small portions, over priced, dry, bland, and boring.

Primeramente, Entramos y no tuvieron la decencia de saludar. Esperamos unos momentos más al ver que estaban medió ocupados. Cuando se desocuparon nos miraron y Bajaron la mirada y nunca nos ofrecieron servicio. Perdieron clientes de por vida. Horrible servicio a el cliente.
The corn is the best!! But everything I had was great. Can't complain at all. I will be back to try more soon.
First time trying their food! It was great! The avocados was black and brown. Not good

Next to my Mexican corn, these were some of the best Elotes I've had in a while. The lady who took down my order was confused when I asked her to add cilantro and lime to my order but she did and provided good customer service in addition. I only ordered the elotes but I will return to try something else.
Ordered a chimichanga and received a soggy burrito. Churros were pretty good but the actual food i ordered was not good. Go elsewhere.
Love their chicken tacos, churros and fluetas ! This is my favorite place to get churros! They give plenty of really good sauces with your food too! I don't like their horchata though!

Okay I ate everything too fast to take a picture of everything I ordered but everything tasted absolutely delicious! I docked a star because I instructed for certain toppings to not be on my burrito but it's all good I'm not super pickey however my friend is so this ruined their experience. The corn was a little spicy but definitely the highlight of my meal. Love the vibe here and will return for yet another yummy experience!

Ordered tacos, rice, beans and a quesadilla through Grubhub last night, and it was incredible!! I've gotten Mexican food delivered before and it was not a good experience. However, Los Potrillos has been fantastic!! The beans in particular were very good! I'm sitting here now, eating my quesadilla for lunch, and even a day later, it is delicious! Will definitely be ordering again!

The person we saw making the elotes in the back did not wear masks or gloves. The lady in the front takes off her mask immediately after talking to you even though you have to wait there for your food for 15+ mins and when she does put it on, it doesn't even cover her nose. If you are ok with a restaurant that doesn't visibly follow COVID guidelines, then this is the place to go to. The food was ok.

The absolute best chicken tamales that I've ever eaten. The banana leaves make the masa so moist. The chicken is perfectly seasoned. The beef empanadas are ridiculously delicious. My husband had steak tacos and he was more than impressed. The food is a flavor bomb in your mouth. Loved it

I went to this little spot after ordering online for a taco craving! Man oh man are these some good tacos! I got them all with lettuce, pico de Gallo, avocado and crema! I order the shrimp tacos and the ground beef tacos along with the elote, and churros! The churros were delicious and the corn was amazing!! The place is a tiny little spot on the corner and right next to a few other small spots and a laundromat. I recommend parking in the laundromat parking lot because parking is super tight over though. I couldn't find parking for my suv and my preggo self did not want to double park and get out in the street (though it appeared that is the norm in this little area). The price is super reasonable and i got six tacos, Elote and 3 churros and a drink for around $29! I will be back because the meat was tender, the veggies were fresh and the flavor was on point, literally!!! The churros did not make it to the pics because I tasted one and kept going, next thing I know, all gone!
Amazing food, prices and service. Always double check your order before leaving. Twice I had one thing missing before I left out. Other than that, everything was great

Excellent food. I love the quality of the chicken and broccoli. If you're interested in healthy but tasty options, this is the place for you. The customer service is excellent! Clean restaurant. Highly recommended.

This place is the truth! I haven't had Chinese food this fresh in a while. What I enjoyed most is that some Chinese food has a weird after taste. This didn't! Fresh ingredients, very nice establishment. Whenever I come back to PA or South Jersey I'm going to stop by. The wait was well worth it!

The food was just okay. I've had better shrimp fried rice as this lacked a bit of flavor. The soy sauce helped make it palatable but I like to enjoy food that does not require anything else to make it take good.

The chicken wings were good.

Gotta give them five stars. The food was fresh and good. We got the Fusion Wings and beef fried rice. The fried rice was clean and tasted similar to what you get at other Chinese spots. But it definitely tasted fresher... THE WINGS...they were the truth! Crispy and nice flavor. Overall we can't wait to return to try their other Chinese dishes! Definitely a fan.
Food was top notch drove from WillowGrove to try it out. Great customer service and the food was ready pretty quickly. Can't wait to try out more of the menu.

I saw an episode of JL JUPITER, featuring this establishment on YouTube.  So, this past Friday(3/12/21) I decided to take the 2 hour drive from Tobyhanna, PA.  I ordered the wings with beef fried rice, as did JL Jupiter. For a small convenience fee they cut my wings up, as I like  (OCD) When you're subject to eat in a car. The fried rice was ABSOLUTELY delish,  I asked for duck sauce and hot mustard to which I ended up NOT needing.  The rice was moist and robust with flavor.  My wings (4 piece) were fried to PERFECTION. On my next visit to Philly I'll definitely make it my business, to grace this place with a revisit. I would be trying some of the other Faire. I support B.O.B!!! Accolades to the Father/Son duo OWNERS.

Not impressed at all.  It's just overpriced Chinese food.  I was really looking forward to liking this place after recommendation.  There's no way basic bland eggrolls should be $4 each. The same kind you can get from corner Chinese spot. Difference is elsewhere they're flavorful.  My orange chicken was horrible.  It was not only gummy but they left big slices of orange peels in it I had to pick out. Too many onions in rice.  I don't see myself ordering again.
The food is amazing. The issue is they are never open. Google says one thing, Uber Eats says another...they are not consistent.

Wish I could give a review but every time I ride past trying to get some lunch and support a Black Owned business, it's closed. They are closed Monday's and Tuesday's so I came by on Wednesday at 12:30 pm but looked online and saw that they don't open up until 1pm. 
We came back around after 2pm and the gates are still down. I've been by this place several times and I don't think I've ever seen it open. How can anyone give any honest review? Is this place an urban legend?

General Chicken is fire
Beef fried rice is fire 
Veggie noodles is fire 

If there's a wait it's worth it don't hate

I will give the objective first so that you can make your own call. Then I wil) give my scathing subjective opinion.
I ride a bike 30 minutes from Center City to get there at 745 pm as I read that they close at 8 pm. Lock my bike and go inside. The Father and owner according to YouTube tells me that they took their last order and that I can take a menu and return when they open tomorrow.  I explain I came quite a ways. He says he understands but kitchen is closed. I stew a few minutes outside, gather my things, get a block away but return. My intent is to clear the air and not have me bad mouthing them over a misinterpretation. The son points to dad who is taking out garbage,, but when I shrug he comes over. I explain to him my grievance.  Young man says they always have to stop orders in order to get out. I ask does it say that online? The  father back from the garbage run a few seconds interrupts the son's answer to ask Didn't I speak to you earlier? And what did I tell you? I(keep that same energy when talking with your Muslim Elders). I  say I was hoping to know when Ownet is in because I call myself supporting Nation of Islam owned,  but feel you aren't supporting me. He says No!. We not doing all that. The young man cosigns with you ain't the only customer. We would be here all night. The Father says We have to eat too. I speak to the father only askjng him Is that what you are going With? Because  I don't want to misquote you.  He proudly says Certainly.  I tell him Say no more. I leave the store. Now the subjective. He don't ever ever ever have to worry about me in his restaurant. I wouldn't eat it if it was free. Darn shame you have to go to Chinese restaurant with Chinesr people to get some respect. NOT impressed with your quick wit responses of you or the young man. Candace Owen's is articulate so what are we saying? Trump is articulate so what are we saying? Hitler was articulate,  so what are we talking? Your answers to me spoke to your heart. If you were like this when I have money, places to go and don't need you, how would you be if push really came to shove? If something this trivial got you to come out of Chara, I'm glad I saw your colors early. Most high for self, but what are you doing for others? You can see your rules, but can't see or even worst don't care about distress of others. I should've known from the video that selling food for profit put forth as if an act of philanthropy was the sound of a rat. No Thanks.

name: Crab Du Jour Xpress Cajun Seafood

reviews.text: Ggood food... Poor boys ..Mussels . Love the sweat potatoes

Went to the Nortistown location  today, it was a complete rip off! The half lb. of snow crab legs were more like a quarter lb. Compared them to a half lb of Dungeness I also got and it was a huge difference so I placed it on my food scale at home and it was surely under a half lb. 1 lb. King Went here today, it was a complete rip off! The half lb. of snow crab legs were more like a quarter lb. Compared them to a half lb of Dungeness I also got and it was a huge difference so I placed it on my food scale at home and it was surely under a half lb. 1 lb. King crab legs weighed a half lb when I got home and weighed them. COMPLETE RIP OFF!!

So extremely happy we decided to order from here last night through UberEats! Tried 2lbs clams (split half cajun-hot and half garlic butter-hot), 1/2 lb mussels (cajun-hot), 1/2 crawfish (cajun-hot), 1 cluster of snow crab (lemon pepper-hot) and 2 pc lobster (garlic butter-mild) and everything tasted absolutely AMAAZING!!! Everything comes with potatoes and corn on the cob so no need to order extra and not to mention the awesome sauces you can get on the side!! Highly recommend getting the 'Du Jour' sauce, blew my socks right off! For the first time in a long time I felt like what I ordered from a restaurant was perfectly seasoned. The cajun spices are unbelievably delicious, I am head over heels in love love love and will now be having a seafood boil once a month!

I ordered twice during the soft opening, once for dinner and another time for lunch. Pros and cons both times.

Dinner order - Hush puppies, make your own catch with snow crab legs, shrimp w/o head, and clams. The hush puppies were flavorfull but were nothing special, I would not order again. The snow crab leg meat easily slid out of their shell and tasted delicious. The shrimp had a watered down flavor typical of shrimp cooked w/o the head. This was an error on my part I didn't want to do the work but I paid for it with less flavor. Clams were delicious. I enjoyed the balanced original cajun sauce more than other cajun seafood joints. 

Lunch order - Shrimp po boy with sweet potato fries and clam chowder. I have to question if a po boy, with thousand island dressing, is really a po boy. However, the overall flavors of the fried shrimp, fresh romaine lettuce and tomato, and a nice piece of bread were great. The sweet potato was cut a nice size and tasted fresh cut. The clam chowder was tasty but for a $7 cup, I don't want to see it being microwaved.

Overall I would go again but I hope they keep the quality post soft opening.

Soooooooooooo disappointed.... I've been loving these Cajun boil bags so I found this place on Yelp it didn't have that bad of reviews.  


Ordered make your own catch which had two lobster tails, 1/2.pound clams, 1/2pounds  shrimp. Heads off

Garlic butter and mild spice...

First off there was no spice at all.... that is very disappointing that they didn't put any kind of seasoning besides butter and I didn't really taste any garlic there was no fresh garlic at all in it.


The clams for super gritty which that is disgusting you need to wash your clams ...

Corn tasted over cooked or something....

And because there was no seasoning on anything it just didn't taste that good it just was like buttered soaked boil bag... Yuck... 

Also I felt like there was not enough shrimp for the half a pound because as I said I've ordered from different places this basic meal. And it seemed like their half pound was correct size. 

Overall I was just disgusted and disappointed..
After having two amazing boil bags all with the same butter garlic and Mild seasoning this one definitely was the worst..

Order today via uberEats. Love the flavor. I would definitely order again. I was a little sad they missed some of my order. I did the make your own and I will admit I added a lot but still sad it was missing my Dungeness crab legs.  but still flavorful and will definitely be ordering from here again!!

I've ordered from here a few times now and I am very very pleased with the quality of seafood +freshness . Their boils are amazing and generous portions . One thing that really impressed me is that when ordering through the Uber eats app my orders are usually very specific and picky lol . They have never messed a single thing up , kudos to that .  You don't have to worry about liquid or anything leaking , they secure the boils in plastic bags . Delivery time is very reasonable ! I recommend anyone who loves seafood tries this at least once . You'll be hooked ;) 10/10

I love this location.  I come here every few weeks.  The amount of food you get for the price is great.  The quality is great, too.  Never messed up an order, always quick to prepare even when the location is busy, and always friendly when I pick up.

I recently ordered through Yelp and was required to select a spicy level but didn't want any heat.  I added a note to my order that I don't want heat and they prepared the accommodation.  Thanks!

Please put the air on. As a customer I was sweating just by standing there waiting for my food. Which took some time. Makes me wonder is sweat dripping into the food that's being prepared? I noticed some cans of callalloo. I was under the impression that I was getting fresh food. Especially with the high prices. Also the portions are very small for the prices. The food is decent too.
They were early and food was outstanding. This place is definitely going to my favorites. If not anything its worth at the least you should try them.
Pretty disappointed they canceled the order without calling to explain or if they were out of things to offer other items. Won't be trying to order from here again.
Good flavor on the jerk chicken and great portions. Might be a little mild spicy wise for some purists, but we're in the US so you can always add a dash of your own hot sauce.  I will be back again.

Very good, low-cost Jamaican food if you're in the area and have a taste for it. Their service is much quicker than other places like Hummingbird or Bamboo Grill. I came in during the middle of lunch on a weekday. No line at all, probably because it's not either downtown or on a major street.

Got the medium jerk chicken with rice and peas, plantain, and a beef patty. Jerk chicken was exceptionally cooked. A bit boney but really well-seasoned and tender. Rice and peas were great and so was the plantain (if you mess up sweet, fried plantain then you don't deserve to cook Latin American/Caribbean/West African food). Beef patty was flaky and good. Could have been spicier but that's just my preference. I'll be back!

Order here twice and disappointed both times.. first time they sent the wrong food and the second time I had to take cancel the order after the told me it would take 1.5 hrs to deliver
****Don't order from here ****

The food is good im not gonna lie but it's definitely not worth the price and the price not even bad for a supposed to be medium platter i ordered a medium stew beef mac and cheese and cabbage just look at the pictures it all speaks for itself remind u i havent eatn from it yet I literally opened it and was like nah 10.70 for a medium and there's barely any macaroni in it like how u that damn stingy

Well i thought i did a review when i purchased my plTters because i had told them i was goin to be the first to put them on.the map. My bad guess the food was so.good i forgot. The location is out east trenton.  say no but at least the better side of north clinton. When u walk in it is a very clean atmosphere. The owners are very friendly. They will answer alot of your questions.i have eaten oxtails for thousands of years but hadbt ever heard of them with butter beans so i asked and from google its common but no other trenton jamican spots were using.it i asked for a sample...omg the bomb ok. Like i said i cant remember what my order was beside oxtails but i wanted to say something. Its clean. I will be back when.its not so
Not happy with my takeout order of jerk chicken. Chopped chicken full of tiny bones. Tons of spice. Can't taste anything else. Good portion, but all the bones is a big turn off. Never again.
Highly highly recommend this place. Generous portions.  Tastes slow cooked... definitely marinated because You tastes the flavor all the way through to the bone!

Love everything they have and is difficult not to walk out with one of each. Lobe the bread, is always so fresh. The place is very clean and the service is always friendly. 
I highly recommend it.

Super cute, clean, cheerful bakery in downtown NPR. Next time I would bring the kids for a leisurely walk down the Main Street, then stop here and eat outside at their tables. My favorite was the carrot cake muffin and the spinach cheese pastry. I can't wait to try the fresh ciabatta and sourdough too!

I'm conflicted about my experience here. I went in for the first time and was so impressed with the artisan high-quality bakery items. The pastries and muffins I ordered were delicious and the coffee was surprisingly delicious as well.  The pastries are very appropriately priced given the exceptional quality. 
The employee behind the counter, dressed in all white, was an absolute prince and was very attentive and helpful. He was all smiles and courteous. But I when I was about to leave and gave a very genuine and gracious thanks, the ?owner? (Part owner? Not sure exactly but he was dressed in a plaid shirt, so not an employee) but he offered *nothing*. Not a word Or a smile. Not a 'thank you', or 'we appreciate your business', not even a 'come again! ' He was standing directly in front of me and the employee, and the place is too small to ignore customers, but he flat out could not even muster a smile at me. 
Interesting experience. Food was great! 
Customer service on the part of the owner could use some help. He made me feel like I wasn't sure if I was welcome.

What a nice family owned bakery in New port Richey. Jose greeted us on arrival. A great atmosphere  inside with outside eating area. The bread and pastries are homemade daily and were still warm. Specialty coffee and espresso available. They are closed on Mondays. On Tuesday, free coffee with purchase. We chose bread, pastries and bagels. You must stop by and check it out.

For the category of fast-food mega chain pizza joints, this location sure impressed me on my recent order. The extramostbestest veggie was fantastic, and the crazy combo was fresh and delicious. The pizza portal was broken, but the food itself and service was exceptional. It really made me question pizza life in general, as if I could get such a good pizza at a little caesars on Kentucky Ave, I may have to rethink the whole game. On OneBite scoring, I'd give it a 6.0 (though it doesn't show it exists in the app), but again, for the category of joint that it is, it holds this solid 5 star yelp review. Good job.

I love the pizza portal! 

I ordered lunch for a work meeting and went inside to pick it up. It was super easy to just put in my code and pick up my pizza from the portal. It opened up automatically and an electronic voice told me not to forget to grab my drinks before leaving.

A staff member still checked in to make sure I had everything I needed before leaving, which was nice.

The price is great too! It was just $6.99 for a large cheese pizza. They also have a $5 lunch combo that includes a drink and personal pan pizza.

Just wanted to grab cheese pizza for grandchildren.  Fast and ready go!! Cheap pizza but  they loved it and liter of pop $1!  Perfect!
Good service!!

I have only ordered twice from here the first order was last week and I was very satisfied overall. First up on the order was the deal and you get a one topping large pizza, I paid for extra toppings and there was barely any toppings, in fact the small pie of the week (Dixie chicken) that was half off price looked and tasted better. The delivery driver was friendly and fast too which was nice. 
The second order was last night, I ordered the deal once again and my sprite tasted like Alkaseltzer  it was so nasty I dumped it out and thought what a waste. This time the one topping looked better than the pie of the week (spring pie)  was supposed to have cilantro and salsa, definitely was no cilantro and very little salsa. 
Why do ya skimp on the toppings when you charge nearly $2 per extra? If I get skimped on one more time I'm going back to Papa John's they always load it down with toppings. 
(I like pepperoncinis and hate tootsie rolls anyway lol go ahead make my day)
Super young staff, does ok for the most part. We carry out their family order of stix on a regular basis. They're always fresh and delicious. The garlic butter is super good.

This is our new favorite pizza place! The thin crust pizza is amazing and the breadsticks are delicious. So happy to have crumbled sausage as an option. All this and super fast delivery!  Thank you for coming to Brownsburg!

Having ordered from this place near a dozen times over the months I believe I've seen enough to leave an informed review.  The pizza isn't too bad but I would say that 50% of the time they forget part of your order. Even now I've waited 25 minutes for the rest of my meal and the chances are they won't even bring it. It's sad that this is the norm with this place and I'm caking to dispute the charges as they have never offered anything after forgetting half of my order.

I'm a firm believer in second chances. I hit up the HotBox again for a thin crust B Ripp and a straight up cheese for the kiddos. Both of them were tasty. The B-Ripp didn't disappoint with ricotta, bacon and onion. The plain cheese was good but could have used a little more of that Italian seasoning and the regular crust was pretty doughy. I'm glad I went back again. I'd almost crossed these guys off the list of options.

It was a pretty so so experience at the Hot Box Pizza in Frownsburg. "Hey, we never get Hot Box" I said. Placing an order online was very easy and it was hot and ready when I arrived but the pizza, itself, failed to deliver.  A large Aloha pizza comes to about $19 after tax. The pizza did not have enough sauce and the ricotta cheese was only technically there. 

For the money, there's better pizza to be had but I'd give it another try.

I'll give a review based on service, not flavor. I called to order a pizza for delivery at 10:51. They close at 11. I said "hi there. I was wondering if I can place an order for delivery?"  The girl who answered the phone politely said "I would normally say yes, but we close in 9 minutes so..." I said "allllllllllllright then." It's a shame she didn't answer the phone and say yes of course I'd love to take your order. I don't care if you're closing in 9 minutes. You're not closed and you should have taken the order. I was staying in the quality inn, and I even talked to the blond female delivery driver cause I noticed about her person staying here order some pizza(and it smelled delicious). But I guess I'll eat gas station Pringles now. I would have had exact change cash plus a generous tip for the driver, but too bad. As the manager of a family owned business I know how much it sucks to get a bad yelp review, especially cause yelp agents don't care about businesses, so I'm sorry, but I was hungry, your food smelled good, and I have certain expectations for great customer service.

Friendly service both times I've visited.  It's clean and dine in tables are marked for social distancing.  My favorite,  Porky The Pie, was prepared perfectly each time with the right amount of sauce and toppings.  I added Cheesestix this time and let him  pick dipping sauce...Skyler choose nacho cheese! They were DELICIOUS! I love the Tootsie Rolls treats

This pizza is always delicious. We had it delivered and it came right in time. We has a meatiness and a cheese pizza with a brownie for dessert and some sprite to drink. They also have these amazing plastic cups you can get, the kids and I love them

Good pizza, great breadsticks and reasonable pricing. Look for there specials! Lunch prices are great and you get to walk away with a souvenir cup. Hate to admit it but my cabinet is full of them! Nice clean place.

I went in today to get my normal lunch box. Brandon and his boss were obviously overwhelmed and understaffed, but pushed through it in a professional and friendly manner. Brandon has ALWAYS been my favorite part about this location. He is always friendly and funny and a major part of the reason I keep coming back. I just only hope that they can get some help in here so they don't feel so obviously overwhelmed! It shows a lot about an establishment and employee on how they handle stressful situations, and he and his coworker are knocking this out of the park. I absolutely love him and HotBox!
Pretty cool little place, friendly staff and good food.  I love the atmosphere and the menu
The Trinity of the Sea salad is as good as any 5 star restaurant. Made with love. I went back and got a 2nd one to go.
Great pizza!  Great sushi!  And the Law t dah sandwich is the best ever!!!!!!!! Such a great go-to for us and we go a lot!  Love it.
Super tasty, good pricing, & great family who knock it out of the park. Highly recommend checking out this spot nestled in the foothills.

We happened upon this place accidentally.  The food was off the charts good and the staff was so nice and attentive!  We would have rated this a 10 out 5 if we could.  The only thing that might turn some people off is that my husbands meal came out about 10 minutes before my meal.  But it was all so incredibly good, we didn't care one bit!

The service here is solid, the pizza is really good, the meatballs are delicious, and the ahi tacos are elite. 

If you want pizza that is really good, and not just your standard toppings, then Spirals is a no-brainer. The Idahome is a unique and delicious pizza. I love restaurants that take a risk to be different while producing tasty food. Solid combo. 

Lastly, if you like Ahi tacos Spirals won't disappoint.

A pizza and sushi restaurant may sound like an odd combo at first, but don't let that stop you from visiting Spiral's--their pizzas AND sushi are fantastic. 
The pizzas have both classic and unique ingredient combinations, same with their sushi rolls. My family tried the Plato's Pi, which they loved; the small would be considered a medium at other places. The Wedge salad was also incredibly generous in size, and absolutely delicious as well.
I tried their Spicy T roll, minus the Sriracha and with added avocado on top. (Super appreciate they let me do that!) They did not skimp on the tuna--AT ALL! The tuna tasted super fresh (not fishy/tough), and the whole roll itself was delicious. 
The interior is very well designed, and the staff were all friendly. It's so nice to have this restaurant only a few minutes away from home! Definitely try it out!
Excellent pizza and sushi. The people there are very friendly!  Weird combo with pizza and sushi but it works!
Excellent pizza and the best homemade ranch dressing. I recommend the Q2. Thanks!
We ordered delivery, and it came early and the order was perfect! One of our favorite pizza places in the city, and this location is dangerously close to our house. Definitely doing this again.

We were a little disappointed at first because the website order was not as user friendly as expected. We immediately called after the pizza was delivered and HotBox went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make our dinner amazing!!

I don't live near this Hotbox location, but I do work near this Hotbox location. I placed a "schedule ahead" order on Wednesday, January 9, 2019 for 2:45 P.M. My order arrived right around that time, give or take a minute, which was awesome enough - BUT, things got even more awesome from there! I honestly don't think I've ever had a fresher, better pizza in my entire life. Everything tasted AMAZING. Based on the service, quality, and awesomeness, I will definitely be ordering pizza more often while I'm working - and by "ordering pizza", I mean ordering pizza from Hotbox! Thanks for the delicious pizza & stix, Hotbox on 96th Street! You da real MVPs!

I don't live near this Hotbox location, but I do work near this Hotbox location. I placed a "schedule ahead" order on Wednesday, January 9, 2019 for 2:45 P.M. My order arrived right around that time, give or take a minute, which was awesome enough - BUT, things got even more awesome from there! I honestly don't think I've ever had a fresher, better pizza in my entire life. Everything tasted AMAZING. Based on the service, quality, and awesomeness, I will definitely be ordering pizza more often while I'm working - and by "ordering pizza", I mean ordering pizza from Hotbox!

I was driving around the Castleton/Fishers area tonight hoping to find something a little different for dinner. While I've been to HotBox before, I'd never been to this Fishers location and decided to check it out. 

This Hotbox is located in a strip center. It's a bit of an older center but there are accessibility parking spots in 2-3 different places along with curb cuts. I parked down in front of Main Event, a bar and grill, and wheeled over to HotBox. 

This location has a decor that is fairly consistent with other HotBox spots I've been in. They do offer dine-in, though that seems to not be the majority of their business as I saw mostly carry-out going on. 

I ordered at the counter. I appreciated that an employee moved their menu down a bit so that I could see it in my wheelchair. 

HotBox Pizza is, of course, a pizza joint. During the day, they have some lunch and slice options, though this seems to go away at night. That makes it a bit rough for a single person like myself who didn't really want a whole pizza. However, I saw that they had a "create your own" option and I ordered a small pepperoni pizza. I also ordered a fountain drink, though I was disappointed they didn't have iced tea. They did have lemonade. 

I got my lemonade - I've always liked that their cups are easily reusable. The fountain dispenser was a little high but workable. 

My guess is the pizza took about 15 minutes. I wasn't paying attention and they did bring it to me. So, kudos for that. 

I can definitely say this was the best HotBox pizza I've had. The crust was slightly crispy, the pepperoni distribution sublime, and the overall pizza just really hit the spot. It was sliced into 8 modestly sized slices. I had no trouble finishing the pizza, though I'd not had a lot to eat today. 

The price was right around $14 for the pizza and drink. It's fairly close to market rate I'd say. HotBox is an Indiana chain with a little over 20 locations all in Indiana. They offer a rewards program and also are known for their generous fundraisers for non-profits. 

The absence of iced tea, the lack of a truly decent individual meal option, and a slightly, well, dirty dining room have me leaning toward a 4-star rather than a 5-star. However, it's a struggle here because that pizza was truly tasty. So, I'll likely return and see if I can fork over that 5th star. Employees are friendly and helpful - some masked, some not as the state opens up and more and more vaccinated folks go mask-free. 

This definitely hit the spot and I would definitely return.
Amazing hot box pizza. Food is always fresh and delicious. Logan helped me out greatly. Can't recommend enough!!!!
Great costumer service. Pizza and bread sticks were so delicious. Most differently coming back
If you know, you know! Best sandwich shop in pinellas county for years. George is the man!
This place has great Syrian good.   Kabob sandwich, grape leaves and hummus are excellent.  This place also delivers outstanding service.  5 stars.  Go there.

This place has the best subs I've ever had. I've been coming here for months now and have never been disappointed with any subs I've got (Tripleta, Ultimate, gyro and many others). 
P.S If you love a lot of food my man hooks it up!!

Great selection of sandwiches. Have tried various items. The philly steak is excellent with lots of meat. Maybe a little light on cheese if like cheese. The falafel pita wrap was also good. The tabuli salad was one of best I've had.

Shlomo's was recommended by a contractor doing work at our house.  He said they had the best sandwiches so we decided to give them a try.  AWESOME and large - really large sandwiches.  I had the Sloppy Man Sandwich (8") and it was as described - sloppy and delicious.  The slaw was freshly made and really crisp.  The turkey was real and not deli meat.  My husband really enjoyed his Shlomo steak.  We will be back.

I've had the food from here twice but the last time was so long ago apparently I didn't even know they had a new location. Anyways, we ordered the chicken ceasar wrap and the shlomo chicken wrap. Both were very generous portions. We had half of each wrap so we could try both. The chicken ceasar wrap was delicious! The shlomo chicken wrap was not so good. I misread the menu and thought it said it came with pickles, lettuce, tomato, pickle & spread but it was spread and pickled only so that was disappointing. Might try it again who knows.
This is a local gem. Staff is very friendly, sandwiches and sides are fantastic. My go-to sub joint.

best service, food, and bang for your buck of any sub/deli in the area. Large amount of meat and toppings compared to other places. Very friendly owner and staff. The food is always fresh and amazing. My favorite is the gyro and shlomo steak. They got buy one get one specials for 99 cents every day. There's also a rewards program where you get a free sandwich after buying 5. They have very long hours and deliver until 4 or later.

Tons of options and large sandwiches that are delicious! Thought we were going to have to choose between McDonald's and Taco Bell since it was late but we came across this gem instead and are so happy we did!!

Very mediocre sandwich. Wasn't bad, but definitely wasn't impressed either. Very bland taste both meat and bread. The grape leaves however were very good, probably the best I've had in a while and I'm a frequent Greek food eater, so I'd probably return just for those specifically.

I've been here a few times, usually a good amount of time between visits. I give it a try, get a little disappointed, and try again when enough time goes by that I forget why it's not my favorite. 

On the plus side, they are open late though, well into the middle of the night. The food is reasonably priced, about $7-$9 per sandwich depending on type and size (8in or 12in)

3 stars
Ordered from them from 10+ times and have never been disappointed! Delish options and the macaroni salad is top notch
Great healthy food, large portions for the price, and wonderful conversation with the owner. Highly recommend!
Some of the best sandwiches in all of Pinellas county. I had them for the first time delivered late night then went during the day and it's honestly good whatever time it is. I'll be back REAL soon.

This place is honestly deserving of 6 stars. If you're just doing a delivery you probably won't appreciate the whole place. I went in there at 11pm at night and the owner himself is making every single sandwich from scratch. No premade reheated sandwiches. And they are using quality meat. Everything is natural, no artificial BS, etc. For lunch or dinner, this is a 5 out of 5 spot all day. For being able to get food this good until 4am on a Tuesday. It's a 6 out of 5. I got a meatball and a Cuban. Both were great. I'm very picky with my Cuban and like a true Cuban like you'd find at the Colombia or in South FL. Thin, flavorful, properly cooked. I hate an "American" Cuban that is over stuffed like a hoagie and then pressed and labeled a Cuban.
Just went to slow Mo's the service was incredible the shakes were phenomenal I've never had a shake like that. Underrated best place ever. Please go give it a try and get five stars it is worth it

If you've never been here your missing out. I've had most of their sandwiches, they're all amazing,  my faves is the Shlomo Steak!. Do yourself a favor  and check out The best hidden gem in Palm Harbor!

This place is really good. Some of the pictures people have posted look terrible lol. But they are open late and the chicken Cesar wrap is amazing. Best one I've ever had. The owner is awesome and nice as hell. Definitely check it out and support local.
My favorite is the Shlomo steak. The stuffed grape leaves are good too. Plenty of parking and open late!
Best chicken philly ever. Made to order as exactly as requested. Will be back again and again. Glad they are just one block away !

I read the article in the Times and wanted to come support. Love that the owner does so much to support kids in the area by supplying bikes. 

I was a little shocked when I walked in a high school kid was there alone. I ordered an egg salad sandwich and was amazed when he went to the back to hand wash the bowl and chopped up the eggs in front of me. Just for my  sandwich. I figured it would be a premade thing. Very pleasantly surprised.

There were other goodies at the register so I grabbed a few bakery items to bring home. Boy, am I glad I did!

The sandwich was very chunky and flavorful and overflowing with tasty goodness. The cookie was soft and filling. Overall, incredibly happy with my experience and will definitely be back next time I'm in the area. They had a ton of other tasty sounding sandwiches to try, plus smoothies, wraps, Mediterranean dishes and salads to try. Definitely a company I'd love to support over and over again.
Customer service was great!! Everyone was so nice! The food was so good!! Loved the Reuben!!

This place is ehhhhh for me. I've ordered here many times and I either love my food or it's just whatever. So this time I went with a Cuban sandwich and my boyfriend got the roast beef sand which. 

I was really craving a Cuban sandwich and there are tons of spots in my area that make great ones, but of course I wanted to try one from somewhere I haven't. Not impressed, actually, didn't really enjoy it at all. It was a large Cuban but so tasteless. The bread was not that good and the meat had zero taste.

Accidentally discovered these incredible bagels when in the area.  Best bagels hands down and so glad my son lives near there to bring them to us occasionally.  Friendly staff, very clean store and bagels that remind me of my North Jersey roots. Nice size, sweetness to them and hot.
Breakfast Sandwiches are always good! Kids love the rainbow bagels! Highly recommend!

The bagels are good. Get a dozen and take them home. Enjoy!  The breakfast sandwiches, not so much. Sandwich of wrapped in foil and the bagel gets doughy and spongy. 4 slices of pork roll of too much, especially when it isn't grilled well. Very little flavor, it's like they forgot the salt and pepper. Cheese was yellow and whiz-like. I'll continue to get the bagels on Sunday morning, I'll skip the breakfast sandwiches.

I brought their bagels to the staff in the ICU at Virtua Memorial and the staff absolutely loved the bagels and strawberry and honey walnut cheese cream. Everyone kept asking me where they came from. The staff were raving about them and said they were best bagels they ever had!  Keep up the great work!
Originally gave the place a 5. Last 3 times I've been there it seems they're using precooked bacon now....

All Star Bagel is a newer and  welcome addition to the area, conveniently located on Route 206. The in-house made bagels are some of my favorite. Great texture and flavor. They also offer a variety of made-to-order breakfast and deli sandwiches. The store is clean and service is courteous and efficient. I removed one star because they more than occasionally run out of bagels in the mornings, which has upended several of our intended purchases.
Dank breakfast sandwiches. Highly recommend if you're in the area. Nice selection of menu items. Will 100% be back. Thanks
Great bagels, quick service. Lots of options not only Bagels!!!! Only thing I wish that they toasted our bagels. But other than that it was yummy!

First time I went the bagels were good not toasted though. Nice service, cook doesn't seem the most friendly but I'm basing this off of the 2 times I've been there. Second time I got my egg n cheese rainbow bagel toasted and it was good , I got a chocolate chip bagel and it was super burnt :/ also the cream cheese was bland and there was way too much of it. Overall good experience but overly great. Will still go again though

This place sucks bad. I ordered the Texas 'chos. Supposed to be tortilla chips, grilled chicken, bacon, bbq sauce, shredded lettuce, and their 5 cheese queso. What I got was the worst tortilla chips I've ever had (from the very bottom of the bag), cold, cubed chicken pieces (barf), they forgot the bacon, shredded iceberg that looked like it was frozen, with some bbq sauce dribbled on it. The best part was the queso, which wasn't that astounding. This was below mediocre and was just straight BAD. Do not waste your time or money here.

First time here and didn't know what to expect.

The restaurant is tucked back from the road and is in the middle of the building.

Ordered a quesadilla and a nacho for my daughter and I to share.

Wow! Too much food! We could have just split one and been stuffed.

Food was good, hot and there's a ton of it.

Worth going to and trying different things. Can't wait to go back soon and try something different.
Pretty decent. The order I had delivered was missing a few things and Grubhub corrected it for me. The New Orleans was good.

I walked by this place every day and finally decide to try. I ordered pick up through Toast app and it was ready for me to pick up even though I arrived 5 mins early. The quesadillas were not bad, a lot of cheese not as much of meat though. I ordered the St. Louis and Mexico City (with taco beef) quesadilla, quac and queso. Overall good considering the price and the relatively big portions. May order again when feeling lazy to cook like today.
GOT THE New Orleans version.. Quesedilla tasted really fresh... it was just what I wanted.

I really, really wanted to like this place! I didn't order a quesadilla though, so there's that, I ordered just the Mexican nachos with steak. Honestly, the steak didn't taste like steak. I don't know what it tasted like, but not steak. The toppings were rather sparse, and might I add, I ordered sour cream, salsa, and guacamole, all cost extra, (more than a couple bucks) even though these are NACHOS, and at any other nacho place, these are all included! Not to mention, got my order delivered...none of the sides I paid for were included in the order! The only good thing was that at least they put the cheese on the side, and it was good. But even the shredded lettuce and tomatoes didn't taste fresh, unfortunately. Needless to say, I will not be going back.

I have been driving past this place for weeks hopeful to try it.  They finally extended their hours till 9pm so we had it for dinner tonight.  Menu was quite extensive so it was hard to pick.  I chose the Cancun, my husband got the Aztec.  We also ordered the Mexican nachos.  Food was overall really good.  Portions were big and plentiful.  Between the 2 of us we hardly put a dent in the nachos.  Will def go back!

I don't have panda express very often so I was slightly curious when I saw one opening nearby. Long story short I'm going to be sticking to ho wun and the little hole in the wall placed called Panda over off brookwood.

I went through the drive through and got the 2 entre dinner platter if I remember correctly. Orange chicken and pepper beef with crab Rangoon, fried rice an an egg roll.
Orange chicken was tender but the sauce was just vaguely sweet without much flavor.
Pepper beef had good beef bits, but I would have preferred if the peppers were less raw, sauce was bland.
Fried rice was weirdly dry and again bland.
Crab Rangoon were far from bland but sadly disgusting and insultingly small
Eggroll was nice and crispy with tender filling. Suffered from the running theme, blandness.
My wait was only a few minutes thankfully, but for the cost it's hardly worth it. Stick to the other local places. You will get more bang for your buck and better food.

I went to the new one in Fenton, MO.  They say they have take out, but they don't so I went thru the drive thru.  I ordered the grilled teriyaki chicken bowl with rice.  There was no sauce on my chicken and when I called they said you had to request the sauce.  No where does there menu say that if I want teriyaki sauce I have to request it for the teriyaki chicken.  I also only received 1 packet of soy sauce so my meal didn't have much flavor.  I called back and the manager said he would give me a free meal next time I come, but I requested some kind of refund.  If you only have drive thru, you need to check before you leave so you're not disappointed.

Read some other reviews and I am shocked at how I had the same problem as someone else. I ordered a plate with double beef and broccoli and double noodles, and got maybe a good 4 pieces of beef and enough broccoli for two. I came home from college excited to see a panda minutes from my house and now I am a little disappointed. The food tasted good but portions were absolutely terrible. In the picture you can see how the bowl has almost tripple the meat as the plate. This is a double order versus a single order of meats.

Super disappointed me and my boyfriend were SO PUMPEDDD to have a panda near us finally and i was so upset i didnt even eat it i got a kids meal with basically one solid peace of chicken and that was all that was in the box just a giant peice of orange chicken and a side of rice and it was cold not like from driving home cold like felt like it was in the fridge or freezer and my boyfriend got a place with double portion of kung pao we opened the box when we got home and its the smallest portion of double they totally ripped us off with food and it tasted terrible unfortunately will not be returning here i hope they get their shit together because they literally JUST opened

Currently this location only has their drive thru open, even though they have a large sign on the window that takeout is available. When we got in line for the drive thru, we were 7 cars back from ordering. 30 minutes later, we were still two cars away from even ordering. We left the line and got takeout from a nearby Chinese restaurant. 

If you are only going to have your drive thru open, at least make it efficient. They were way too slow.
Incredibly slow. If you have over a half hour to kill in the drive through with only 4 cars in front of you, then it's not bad.

I was really excited to get a panda express just minutes from my house.. although my very first time ordering here I ended up with a double order of beef and broccoli, to share with my boyfriend, but only received broccoli with 4 tiny pieces of beef.. and an over cooked eggroll.. could be a fluke, but bad first impression for a 6pm order..

I don't know what is wrong with the people that wrote the reviews. There are a lot of positives here. 
1) You are inadvertently taking out your frustrations on the people working at this new Fenton Mo location and THEY ARE WORKING, unlike half of America.
2) You complain about the wait but the location is mobbed just like every new restaurant that first opens. Do you really want to eat at a restaurant that's not busy? Maybe there's a reason those restaurants aren't busy. Think about it.
3) Then last, due to #2 above, of course they are going to be out of a lot of items. Everyone is storming the location so they are running out. 
Come on people give them a break. The newness will wear off and the waits won't be as long. They will figure out how much product is needed for the volume and after all of the negative comments the people will still be extremely friendly like they were tonight. 
ENJOY!!

Sat in line for 50 minutes only to get up to the order window and find out there were only 4 entrees available. The inside isn't open yet so online orders or going inside aren't even an option. My husband got beef and broccoli but it was probably 80% broccoli 20% beef. We live 5 min away and nothing was even warm by the time we got it home. I was super excited about this new location but we won't be going back until things approve. It would be easier to order online and make the drive to Manchester.

This cafe sure knows how to make a latte! It was a quick in and out for me, as I had an appointment just down the way. The cafe looks beautiful, and it looked like they had a nice selection of snacks and sweets as well. The cashier was very quiet (couldn't hear my total bill) but was super nice. I'd come back and have another latte! Maybe even a sweet treat!

Tried our new local cafe for the first time tonight. Had a great cappuccino. Three friends with me had different espresso based beverages which they said were very good. Bright comfortable interior. Friendly staff. Looking forward to returning for coffee again and to try other things from their menu.

Excellent coffee, friendly service and a great selection of baked treats. I don't live in this area so it's a bit of a drive but it's certainly worth it. Many coffee shops today are removing nice  chairs, making your stay shorter and less comfortable but that's not the case here. Lots of room to sit down, sit back and read.

Excellent coffee, friendly service and a great selection of greasy baked treats. I don't live in this area so it's a bit of a drive but it's certainly worth it. Many coffee shops today are removing nice  chairs, making your stay shorter and less comfortable but that's not the case here. Lots of room to sit down, sit back and read. Love it.
Exceptional service and amazing coffee, was very impressed and will definitely be going back in the near future!

I love the decor of this cafe and the availability of comfortable seating. 
It is a bit out of my way to get there but I would go again as the Hazelnut latte was amazing. 
Sadly, due to the pandemic everything is served in to-go cups. I will be looking forward to enjoy a traditional "cuppa". 
They have a large display of desserts, the croissants looked divine. I had the éclair, I wish I was advised that it was frozen. My order was to go so that was fine but if I were to sit down and enjoy my coffee I would have not been happy to stick a fork into a frozen eclair and try eating it.

I really enjoyed my food I give it an A+ me and my husband ordered the shrimp and chicken my favorite was he's popping Buffalo Buffalo and lemon pepper together. The next time I'm in Tampa I will be back
Food was nothing special, ordered the loaded lobster fries and Philly egg roll. Once again nothing special

After seeing how amazing their food looks from Instagram posts , I had to come give this place a try. I always love exploring new food trucks because they all bring their own flare. Being that I came for lunch I couldn't eat as much and order the heavy stuff as I would've like but all in all what I had was good. I had the mamas wings in lemon pepper with fries and a side of Mac n cheese. They also do have a lobster Mac and lobster fries which I'll have to come back and try. The service was also great being that they were fast and friendly. They also have a nice lounge area where you can go inside and eat. I would definitely recommend checking them out if you're looking for a good food truck meal .
Word-of-mouth made us aware; good marketing (mainly the name) attracted us, & both the taste & quality of the food had us loving every minute!! We will certainly be back!!

I drove all the way across town to try this establishment and as soon I got out of my car was greeted by who appeared to be the chef. " He stated in a rude manner, they were closed due to technical difficulties and walked off " I will not visit this establishment again. It's hard to patronize black owned establishments when they treat  you like sh@$ and have no regard for their customers . Smh word of advise : people can get food from anywhere it's the customer service that will sustain your business.

Slap Yo Mama is really unique and amazing. Let me tell you everything is fantastic! Everything was really flavorful and delicious. Not to mention, the service was fantastic and the staff was really pleasant. Definitely check it out.

im mad today was my first time eating at slap yo mama and i got the lobster mac and egg rolls the mac didnt have no cheese no f*cking lobster  and it tasted like it was out of the cane the egg rolls tasted burnt i'm highly disappointed in this spot

I love slap yo mama food truck it feels like family every time and the food is great with a unique taste only available there! My kids are very picky eaters and even they love everything on the menu if you haven't tried this out you are missing out!

Pure perfection from the customer service to the food itself ..Was a little pricey but so worth it .Wait time wasn't bad either..Glad we tried it drove 30 mins to get there and they responded back when I dm'd on Instagram. Just great service all around
Do not trust the hours posted on the Yelp page they were not open at 10pm when we came by, and we thought they would be open since the Yelp page says they close at 2am. Just a heads up!

Was sold off a picture on Yelp and didn't read the reviews. Very easy to find, they are located in an area with multiple businesses but we were able to park easily. I was surprised to not see a line because who doesn't love Lobster fries? We didn't have to wait long to place our order as there was only one ahead of us. 

I ordered the bang bang shrimp with Lobster fries and mac and cheese for my boy.  Absolutely enjoyed my meal. The shrimp were fresh and perfectly cooked. The sauce had me licking my fingers. I could not stop eating the Lobster fries. Scrumptious. My little boy loved the mac and cheese. He was wary at first because he tends to prefer Velveeta, not sure why. Told him to take just a little bite and he was so surprised. Said it tasted "Better than Velveeta", this is an ultimate compliment as this child won't eat anything that looks outside of his perception of what things should be. For him to eat this tells the story of how good their food is. Fast food but not "fast" food. If they added collards to their menu,  I don't know what I'd do.

Amazing! They absolutely knock it out of the park. A little pricey and not the biggest portions. The Bang Bang Shrimp and Lobster Fries didn't fill me up. The total cost of my meal with the Slap Yo Mama Punch was around $20. However, the food was so good I had to slap my mom.

I came to this Lil spot to celebrate my daughter's bday.and I could't be more pleased . This was one of the best food truck experience I have ever had.the service is a-1 with the explanation of all the ingredients of everything we asked.with the amount of customers they had it would of been easy for him to be stressed and not the case . And the food is some of the most amazing tasting and eye pleasing you could ask for.would recommend this spot to any and everyone. Thank you for the great time

Really enjoyed this meal! My coworker and I like trying out new eateries and we were referred so here we are -- 

We ordered a off the Specials menu. Lobster Fries, Philly Eggroll, Lobster Mac n Cheese, and the chocolate chip cookies. 

We ate inside. There were tables and couch options for seating. There was also a huge TV for entertaining. I liked all the seating options. It's a very unique setup for it to be a food truck and I loved that. There was also a decent amount of parking as the plaza isn't big nor busy. There was parking along the fence. Really easy to find.

First time customer, food was average tasting for my preference. Lemon pepper wings seasoned good but had some hard like rocks particles attached and Lobster mac minus the lobster and I paid a 5$ up charged with the $10+ wings. Punch flavor drink was good but@ 3.99 per bottle. Not sure if I would return to buy anything more. $20+

Took me forever to find! They have a new address!
3007 W Cypress street tampa fl.


It was good!!!! Very tasty. It's a bit pricey I paid 20 for the shrimp and seafood Mac. But totally worth it.

I've been hearing good things about Pitchfork and happened the see the patio is dog friendly. It was a gorgeous September evening, so I loaded the dog, a friend and gave them a shot. 

Oh my my. Perfection the while way through really. Casual, but top notch. An owner greeted us before we even got to the door, having seen a big old lab in my backseat as I parked. They are genuinely happy to see dogs. 

Friend and I shared the Folsom Prison Shrooms pizza (mushrooms) and the Honey atony Badonkadonk (Caesar) salad and had a drink each. It's not cheap pizza, but I believe cheap pizza isn't good pizza. 

The food was very tasty, perhaps the only pizza with mushrooms only that I've ever adored. It was soooooo good. Their dressing was great also. Simple wine selection but the blend was wonderful. 

Alicia was our server, top notch and friendly. Everyone we encountered was extremely nice. Great experience. I am so glad they weathered the storm of COVID closures!! I will be back...and I will tip well.

This is a nice little gem for Goodlettsville! Excellent pizza (I am gluten free and this was one of the better GF pizza crusts I've had - of course they have plenty of non gf options too), good service, and a nice cocktail menu. I had the Preacher Tom Collins and my friend had a margarita - both were very good. Not many locally owned spots to get a craft cocktail in DC. I hope Pitchfork Pizza is with us for a very long time!!
Great service and wonderful food.  Patrick is an amazing server with funny positive attitude.  We will definitely come back next time we're in town.

Our new local favorite! The fried pizzas are outstanding. I had the margarita on a fried crust and my husband had Frying in the Rain. Both were excellent. The extra touches of olive and chili oil on the side were were a nice touch. The staff were so friendly. Looking forward to our next visit. . Definitely check this place out.

I'm not a big pizza person. But when in Rome. I had the Folsom Prison Shrooms red pizza. Y'ALL!! It was the best pizza I've had - I guess ever. And they had this wonderful basil infused olive oil. Could have eaten it with a spoon. I didn't....really. All the names of the pizzas and entrees are hysterical. I'm already planning on going back.  Maybe I'll try the Drop Kick Me Chees-us.

We decided to try this new place, since we drive by it multiple times per week to and from soccer practice.  It's a nicely designed place with some huge boothes to sit in.  We were disappointed because prices are high for what you get.  They only have 12" pizza's, which are not big when you feeding teens.  We spent $40 on 2 pizzas and 2 baskets of fries and 6 waters and could have easily used another pizza.  Also unless you build your own pizza there are no substitutions.

Fries are fries, but felt the pizza were just above average.

Good pizza. Not much flavor but the crust was delicious. $8 for a Cesar salad the size of my palm was quite ridiculous. I looked at my check to see if it was a side salad because it was sooo small for $8

Came here for NYE and ordered the Nashville pizza - fried dough, fried chicken in hot sauce, pickles and mozzarella cheese - to go. It hit the spot! It was ready in about 15 minutes and was waiting for us in a heated cabinet it seemed. The guy at the counter that ran us up was super nice, even gave us extra seasonings. We're bummed we didn't get to experience their sit down service, but will definitely plan to stop by this little gem next time we pass through Goodlettsville, TN.

During covid always nice to go somewhere with a 100% health code rating, you know they are doing proper cleaning. We were traveling and it was really neat they had a dog friendly patio seating. Our amazing server even brought a dog bowl with water for our pet to enjoy. Great service, enjoyed the beer selections, and wow the topping choices for pizza are top notch. Enjoyed a great pizza with prime rib on it!!
Really like Pitchfork. Definitely recommend it. Usually head to Gallatin for good pizza. We've found a new favorite!!

The food is good, even delicious, but the portions are, shall I say, European, for European prices. My guy said it's the food is so excellent he wanted more. He's the nice one. I said I'm American so I expect big portions. I didn't get the bun for the Yackety Stax so I almost couldn't find the patties. The beef is high quality and the sauce is yummy. The time but of caramelized onion wasn't cooked to sugared, but since there were few it was ok. 

The fries were basic yet they tasted good room temperature when I got home so that's a triumph.

The broccolini is flavored well but it was rationed.

The meat and potatoes fried pizza thankfully didn't taste fried. The ingredients were premium.

So I guess I'm not as salty about the experience now that I've eaten since I am full and satisfied.

Dont go monday through thursday if you want something other than pizza. The menu sucks besides that, Was looking forward to the prime rib went on a thursday and they dont serve entrees except on the weekend. Ended up with a bologna sandwich which was good but not even close to what I wanted, Got a margarita and it came in a whiskey sipping glass. I hate when you want to like a place and they keep pissing you off. OH and dumb me thought fresh greens as a side were maybe turnip or mixed greens. Nope it was a salad with just fresh lettuce mix and dressing. I got ceasar salad now I had a second salad. They have 3 sandwich choices or pizza. M-T. If they had the 3 entrees it would be fine I think.

Absolutely fantastic pizza!  I didn't realize however that they are only 12" pies. With that said it is a bit on the more expensive side given my surprise small pizza! Order more than 1 if you are trying to feed more than just yourself.

Nothing to complain about with this pizza! I had the meat and potatoes pizza and it was so full of flavor and had plenty of toppings. Crust and sauce were equally delicious. When you get great quality, you should expect to pay a little more. Support the local businesses of Sumner County! If you want cheap pizza, head down the street to the chain...they won't close because corporations make it. Now is the time to be good stewards of your money and buy local and fresh! Can't wait to try all of their pies!
Great place to hang out and have a few drinks.  The food we had was delicious, everything fresh! Great service.  We would definitely return!

The red and white pizzas are very good as far as taste. MY problem is size vs. price. Its a two/three bite slice beside the crust. So you are paying for quality not quantity. The fried pizza and app I dont like the oil its fried with. It has a very strong oil flavor. I wish they had a garlic butter dip again the oil dips are just this strong funky oil taste. Dont get me wrong man that red mushroom pizza is awesome but its like a personal pizza size almost. The crust is as big as the toppings area. Taste is a 4/5 but value is a 2/3.

I was a little disappointed that I couldn't get regular crust during Sunday brunch. I am not much of a "deep dish" fan but I was pleasantly surprised by how much I did like the pan/deep dish style crust at this restaurant. I am so excited to have a wood fired pizza place near by and can't wait to come back to try the regular crust.
The pizza and salad were both fresh and delicious! Excited about having another good restaurant in Goodlettsville! We need it.

Service is outstanding  and it's nice to see friendly faces in the midst of this CoVid mess. The owner even came around to talk to the customers which is a nice touch. Best wishes to this new establishment in the Goodlettsville area.
Great pizza, prepared/baked in fire heated oven. Nice variety & friendly staff. Will be back to try weekday menu

Great first impression even though it's only carry out still. The service was top-notch. The quality is outstanding. Our family had two cheese breads and two pizzas. 

If Dominos is your dream, you will not be satisfied with PPP. If you crave quality, give the quality ingredients and wood-fired pizza a fair shot.

This is your shot, Goodlettsville. We've got ourselves another legit contender for outstanding pizza. (LHP is great too, but it is a different style of pizza altogether). And when PPP's full menu debuts, we are going to have even more to talk about. 

Make Goodlettsville a food destination. A few solid additions like this, and a cozy pub would do wonders for our bellies and souls. 

#shoneysisfoodblight #reduceourfastfoodoptionsbyfiveandourhotelsbys

We were thrilled to see a new pizza place in town! 
This is real, delicious brick oven pizza. We won't be back, however. The prices are astronomical for what you get. We spent almost $45 on 2 personal size pizzas, that did include a 15% tip on the carry out order. 
One pizza was veggies, without cheese. The other was the meat and potato. They used great, high quality ingredients. Unfortunately it was just way too pricey to be left hungry.

Ate there last night and consumed way too much of a good thing.  Service was very good, attentive, but not in your face (well, I guess with COVID-19 that would be a bad thing if they did).  Pizzas are different, to say they didn't follow everyone else, and tasty.  Pricing on menu was highish, but they had a Thursday special which we did and it was the perfect amount. Good parking but I can see a day when it will get tight, clean, wait staff following mask protocols to the tee.
Definitely on the radar for future meals...
First time visiting. Was very pleased. They have daily specials which was nice. We really enjoyed our food and will be back.
Great experience...prime rib was excellent as well as the appetizers and fried pizza.  Delicious cocktails and super service.  Can't wait to go back!

Great find in Goodlettsville!!!
Sorry for the pic of the half eaten burger and fries, but I couldn't wait to dive into that bad-boy. My family and I have been to Pitchfork Pizza Parlor 4 times now and ordered something different each time. The food has been consistent and top notch, super fresh ingredients. The beer selection and cocktail program are also great. The service is excellent, from hosting to wait staff and bar staff. Owner Keith is always present and very friendly, making sure he greets his guests and insures everyone is satisfied. I like to see restaurant owners doing this, it tells you they take pride and enjoy what they do along with caring for the customer and staff. Side note, pizza is awesome!!! You can't beat a wood fired crust. This place is a MUST GO!!!
Finally had the prime rib. It was definitely above average, Tender and savory with the sauce and horseradish drizzle. The flatbread app was fresh and good.
Great Pizza but that's all I've tried to date. I know they have other options but I'm a sucker for the pizza every time. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the Goodlettsville area.

Place is a joke! Ordered the chicken strips and got basically 4 McNuggetts! Just an absolute rip off as I got 3 oz. of Chicken for $15!!!!

4 words to remember here...

EXTREME PRICES=no food

I guess they think everyone in Goodlettsville is filthy rich?

I waited tables (once upon a time) and I was very disappointed in the service we received there.  It took a really long time to get our drinks from the bar and we couldn't find our server when we needed things. Had to ask a different server for napkins because our server dropped off our appetizer and took off. When she brought out our entree, we had to ask for silverware because no one gave us any.  Hardly saw her until she dropped off the check and as soon as I got out the credit card to pay, she wasted no time cashing us out. They close at 9 but we were there before 8. Like I said, I waited tables for years so I know what to look for and I pay attention to things that a lot of people wouldn't.  The food wasn't good enough to balance out the bad service. Just my opinion.
Great pie and great service! We'll definitely be back if we're ever in the area again!

We have been there twice and the food the first time was amazing and the second time we ordered out it was still good but our order was incorrect. I ordered the fried crust because I am dying to try it and I ended up being given the wood fired crust. And I picked the order up and the first time I remember it being burning hot and this time it seemed a little cold. It's still really good and we will still of course go back, all their ingredients are super fresh which is amazing and we love! you can't beat their food!

First time for us..we stopped in for lunch not familiar with anything on the menu, as it was our first visit. The waiter was very helpful and suggested the fried pizza. We did and were just amazed at the whole experience. It was a pizza like I never had before. It was absolutely in the top three pizza experiences of my life, it was that good.
