One of the owners, Keith Zust, came over to see how our pizza was. A real nice fellow and he sure loves what they do at Pitchfork Pizza. We will be back for certain. It was so good, I can't really put it all into words. The tomatoes on the pizza, for example, were hand sliced! This pizza is as good as it gets.

We go to Pitchfork every time we are in town. We've never been disappointed!  Brunch, lunch or dinner, there isn't a better pizza restaurant around. The food is awesome and the staff is friendly. Oh yeah, the patio is dog friendly too!
Pizza and beer were great. Patio was open and we sat outside but inside very clean and spacious. Will be going back again

Best damn pizza, period!!!  We've been there 3 days in a row for take out.  Hand made artisan pizza with all fresh ingredients.   Can't wait until they open for dine in service. Kid friendly and pet friendly.

Five stars for flavor but the three stars is for the prices. We spent 60 bucks for three small pizzas. One only had cheese (margherita), the second had pepperoni. The third had all the meats. Pricing is comparable to Five Points, but at Five Points you get three times the food for the same price. We won't be going back.

My family and I had dinner here the other night and had an excellent meal. Great food, friendly service, and love that it is locally owned. Best pizza in Sumner county hands down. You must try their fried pizzas, the crust is amazing! I dare say the fried dough pizza is the best pizza I ever had!

Super impressed with this pizza, it will now be our go to spot! We ordered pickup and the pizza came out hot and fresh. The online order process was super easy too. I built my own and was pleased with all of the options, however, I do wish some of the toppings were included in the base price. I tried my husbands meat and potato pizza and it was DELICIOUS. I will definitely get the fried crust next time. You can tell they use quality and delicious ingredients.

This is like, the best pizza my husband and I ever have had! We just moved to Goodlettsville, TN from Cali and recently bought a house in Nashville. Our biggest regret for leaving the Goodlettsville area, is being far away from Pitchfork Pizza. :( Their pizza is SO good and their fried green tomatoes are to die for. Best. Pizza. Ever!

This place is the best. I've been here a few times now and I have not been disappointed. The beer is always cold and the people working there are so nice. You can't go wrong with the pizza but you have to get the deep fried pizza crust, it's a total game changer. The burgers are just as great. I live in Nashville, where there are hundreds of places to eat but will go a little out of my way to come back to this place.

I was asked to provide paperwork for my service animal which is a violation of the American Disabilities Act. Under the ADA, I am not required to carry paperwork establishing my disability, nor am I required to disclose my healthcare information to a complete stranger. Since I did not provide documentation, we were refused service. 

Rather than file ANOTHER ADA complaint form with the U.S. Department of Justice (I have filed three this year already with businesses whose employees are ignorant of the law), I am just boycotting this business. I'm tired. 

I hope that you will join me in support of people with disabilities just trying to get some pizza. May I suggest Longhollow Pizza and Pub? And that Pitchfork train its staff on discrimination law?
Got the cheesecake at the Coffee X change on Tangue Verde.  It was really good.  I heard others talk about the muffins and canolis.  Will def put that on the list for next time.
They make the BEST bear claws & don't chintz on the filling. I go to Coffee X-Change on Tanque verde just for the bear claws!!!

I purchased Sun-Rise Baking Company's bran muffins at the Coffee X-Change located at  2443 N Campbell Ave  Tucson, AZ 85719.   http://www.coffee-x-change.com They are the best bran muffins I have ever had.  Lots of honey deliciousness!  Once I had these muffins, nothing else compared.  I wish they were local where I live in San Diego.  Sun-Rise sells to businesses, not the public, although I expect they will do that one day.  In the meantime, get your bran muffin fix at the Coffee X-Change.

We have been wanting to try this bakery but pulled up and saw the tRump/pence sign. 
Couldn't bring ourselves to try it. 
If you can taste the love baked into something, then you most certainly can taste the hate. 
There are many other bakery's in Tucson that don't showcase their hate.
Awesome baked products. I enjoy lemon bars and coconut bars . The bear claw and cinnamon rolls are great too. Muffins are scrumptious

It's here - and that's a BIG plus.  I just bought a 1/2 gallon of tropicana OJ there - i was in a pinch and HAD to have it - and it was $4.49.  OUCH!

I also got a 12 oz. bottle of V-8 for $1.99 - Double OUCH!

Korean-run and nice staff, but wow - so pricey.  They also have a hot food bar that looks so unappetizing to me.

Glad they are here - wish they were cleaner and cheaper.

Eh.  It's not horrible but it's not hot either.  It's not that it's a convenience store either, because I love them long time. 

Good:  Clean store, loads of hot food on buffet tables, friendly staff.
Not-so-good:  Food's average, no debit card purchases, 10 dollar minimum for credit cards (but there is an ATM)

I mean, it's ok... and definitely I stop there on my way to work, but it's not the best thing EVAR.

I stop in here for lunch every now and then, and so does one of my friends. I always order the same thing- an egg salad sandwich on rye bread, a bag of chips and an iced tea. The cook is quite good- the egg salad is really tasty. They also have things like burgers, subs, breakfast and a hot buffet. For a huge egg salad sandwich (I actually have to take off about 1/3 of the egg salad because it's so big!), a medium bag of chips and a big iced tea, my lunch runs about $7. My friend often eats the hot food from the buffet and said it's good, although I haven't tried it. 

Like other people said, while it's not the most exciting place- there isn't a massive selection of things like chips and it seems like there is a lot of empty space in the store- it does have some unexpected tasty highlights and good lunch options. It's fast, everybody is always nice, and it's close to my work. What more could you ask for?

Enter and feel the rich, sticky odor of grease fill your nasal cavities. This grease seems to have thoroughly permeated the interior, where no white surface has stayed such, leaving a landscape in varying degrees of dingy grey and beige. Dark refrigerators house drinks that may or may not have seen human contact for years... At least the coffee is fresh and cheap. For a final indicator that time stands still at Green Village, turn thine eyes upward, between the yellowing Marlboro signs. The clock has no hands.

I stopped in here for breakfast yesterday and got a pleasant surprise: the short-order cook is unusually competent.  I got a bacon and cheese omelet with home fries and toast.  The omelet was tender and neatly made, but the standout was the home fries.    Most diner home fries are mushy, greasy orange lumps.  Not these.  They were crisp and delicious, full of crisp fried onions.  

Coffee at these little breakfast places varies widely in quality, but this coffee was good.  My omelet with toast and potatoes, plus small coffee, was $5.50 including tax.

The upstairs seating area was unexpectedly pleasant, with upholstered chairs and natural light.  

I don't want to build up this restaurant too much.  It was nothing more than it appears to be.  I stopped in for quick breakfast and that's what I got.  But I had nothing to complain about and the food turned out to be unexpectedly well-executed.   So if I'm nearby and I need to eat, I will make an effort to come back here instead of elsewhere, and that says four stars.
Great vegetarian menu, funny staff with a lot of personality. Love having so many healthy options. Not cheap, not expensive, but 15% student discount!

Came here to grab a breakfast sandwich. Asked to use rest room. Was about a mile away lol. Lady started yelling at me to pay first i said NO. I Come from rest room which is upstairs and through a maze of hallways back to grille and they didnt even start it. She asked me what i wanted again. I said" same as i ordered 5 mins before". The guy cools the food, lady basically throws it at me. Then charges me 150 more that the menu price. I questioned why, she said .50 more for a roll, uh ok so why 1.50 more than price on menu board??  She tells me just pay and dont cause problems!!  I walked out!!!  She follows me outside and tries to hand me bag with food!!!  Sorry u eat it!!!  Will never go back!!

Good, interactive service.Fun tastings. Great wine selection. But I shop here for beer.  Be warned: if you purchase beer here, ONLY buy local selections. Almost every non-domestic beer I have purchased is SKUNK beer. Don't bother complaing about it either. I did find the staff responsive to my concerns.

The staff members on the wine side are always helpful and knowledgeable, and they have a nice selection of chilled beer and wine in the walk-in cooler at the back. The best part about the chilled drinks is that you can purchase them in the wine store, carry them over to the gourmet food/deli side, purchase a cheese platter at the cafe counter, and then sit at a bistro table to nibble cheese and drink your frosty beverage. They have excellent sandwiches at the cafe, also, and a solid stock of local goods in the grocery section (Local Folks Foods and Farm to Kitchen Foods, among others). I've never tried any of the fantastic-looking chocolates behind the candy counter, but they look impressive!
Wide variety of wine and beer at all price points! Staff is so helpful and knowledgeable.

Simply the best wine and spirits store in central Indiana, if not the entire state. Fabulous selection of wines and one of the best variety of bourbon choices I've ever seen. Knowledgeable staff that helps you make the best choice for your specific need.

Good for wine, good for cheese, good for an interesting quick lunch (though you'll pay for the quality).

Maybe most importantly, fantastic catering services (as Kahn's Catering).  The planning staff is thorough and professional.  They really take care of business on the day of your event and the food will look and taste spectacular.  We used Vine and Table to cater our wedding and though they were our highest bid, the extra staffing and quality of food & service made our day run smoothly.  They have plenty of delicious options to choose from for whatever theme you're looking for.  Highly recommend.

My husband requests a road trip here at least once a year to re-up his scotch collection. Their selection is amazing (witness the fact that we live right outside Chicago and have to drive to get things he can't buy anywhere else).  Also a really nice selection of interesting liqueurs and beer.

Vine and Table in Carmel used to be such a great store. Great cheese great gifts and chocolate and of course a good selection of beer and wine.  It has really gone down hill with very little good items. Even the Wine and Beer selection is slipping.

We stopped in to pick up a few bottles of wine as a gift. The store is very charming. We wandered all over looking at everything. While we were in the cheese area I decided to ask the person working if they could help me and after many failed attempts to find a certain goat cheese she made a recommendation based off of my description and sure enough it was the correct goat cheese. I had never been able to locate it because I had it at an event and knew nothing other than goat cheese. Very friendly staff and I enjoy stopping here for my wine.

One of the best things about Vine & Table is the selection. Walking through the craft beer aisle can be overwhelming but the organization is a big help to decision making. Take advantage of the staff. They are always willing to answer questions, and make suggestions. The free tasting events are a great way to try a variety without commitment. The events are accompanied by a knowledgeable craftsman with each table. There are some great local discoveries if you take time to peruse the aisles. Try the samples for great hosting party ideas.
I decided to go in there and look at the wine selection. The lady working was very helpful and the wine ended up being really good! I also got a conqueso chili dip that was really good!

Vine & Table is seriously impressive! First of all, they don't allow anyone inside the store who isn't at least 21 years of age (not even if they're accompanied by an adult), so leave the kiddies at home. Second of all, come prepared to sample all kinds of wonderful things: from wine to spirits to dips to appetizers to chocolate. It's like a food- and alcohol-lover's paradise in here.

There is one main entrance, then to the right is a door that takes you to the wine section, and to the left is the beer section. Spirits are in the middle, kind of.

The staff seems pretty knowledgable and will recommend things to try that you might not have considered. One of the men who helped me find a wine was wearing a suit -- nice touch! 

Overall, everything is first-rate here.

Amazing "liquor store".   This is so much more than I liquor store.   This is great for finding a gift for someone who appreciates hard to find craft beers or high end wines.  I went in looking for Tin Man apricot sour beer and came out wanting to refinance my home to invest in craft beers.   Its clean, well organized and the staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgeable

Wow. Went there for a bourbon lottery and was very impressed with all of selections. Not only a big bourbon selection, but their wine department is HUGe. The craft beer selection is Awesome.  They also have dips, cheeses, crackers and baskets.  Your 1 stop destination for all your liquor needs and more. Very nice staff too!

The best time to check out Vine and Table is during the monthly tasting events.  Every first Wed of the month, they host a Pick 24 party which allow guests to sample their top 24 wines, all of which are priced $24 or less.  They also host tastings for beer, whiskey, and other types of drinks.  I have attended beer tastings from Bell's, Rogue, and other craft beer brewers.

In addition to wine and beer, they also have a good selection of meats/cheeses and gourmet food items.

Vine and Table closes at 7PM.  If you are going in the evenings, get there early before the store closes.

I love this place!  They have an amazing selection and great customer service.  They have nice, knowledgeable staff, who are happy to answer questions and help you find what your looking for.  They also have a sampling bar so you can have a tasting of that special liqueur before you commit.  When ever I am looking for a special ingredient for a cocktail and I can't find it anywhere else this is the place to find it.  The only downside of shopping here is that I always find something else amazing to buy!

Love, love, love!!!!  Who wouldn't love a wine AND cognac tasting!!!  What I enjoyed is that I was able to try beverages that I had never had before.   I love experiences that allow me to deviate from my norm, and I loved that it was nestled close to my home.  I will definitely stop in again.

I've always enjoyed shopping here, and it's an even better experience now that the food and wine shops are in one big happy space.  And if you have any questions about Whisky, be sure to ask for Denis, the whisky/spirits specialist from Ireland ... he's very generous with the "wee drop."

Great place to pick up food & beverage. Their website is really helpful in finding if they have a particular wine in stock and the price. It also allows you to search their inventory based on parameters - which is great for browsing. Once in the store, I have always found the staff to be helpful in finding what I'm looking for.

They have a newsletter you can sign up for at the register that will remind you to visit during their free tastings on Saturdays.

As far as the food goes... very yummy for lunch! They have everything you would expect from a soup/sandwich/salad shop PLUS sushi made to order at a very good price. You can dine in or take your order to go. As well as shop for food items and cooking ingredients.

I went here for a tasting of beer and wine this last weekend and have periodically stopped in before. I first went looking for Garden Party Hard botanical soda and the guy hadn't heard of it, so I hope he got on it!! This time, I asked if they carried any Michigan wines and they do not. But, the tasting was very cool and all the vendors were so nice and very willing to answer any questions you had. There is still a Yelp coupon on the check in for a free premium dip with purchase of any chip so I had to snag that too! I like that you can sign up for emails for news on specific wines and liquors too. I really enjoyed the event and will definitely make sure to stop back in!

Great place for wine, beer or fancy cheeses and stuff:-)  They have huge selections of wine, for every budget.  If you can't find it here, pick another wine.
The beer selection is big, too.  They have some very obscure beer to choose from.  Good times.
They also have lots of tastings and special events, so it's worth getting on their email list.  
They are also generous with samples.  Just ask.
They have a deli area for sandwiches.  These are wonderful, but pricey.  You are getting quality though.  
This is a great local store, you should come here often!

This is in Carmel and is a really nice store.  The staff are friendly and were quite helpful.  I didn't spend as much time sampling this trip as I would have liked but it was a pleasant experience.  Vine and Table hosts many events and I was there to get my tickets for the Whiskey and Fine Spirits expo held at Montage.  A great event, yes a bit pricey, but when you have the opportunity to taste $1000 a bottle whiskey and $200 bottle bourbons it pays for itself.  The food at the event was great also.
I have to give five stars to the only winery who had the wine that I have been looking for for over a year. Williamette Riesling is wonderful and a staff pick. Can't wait to open my wine.

Was recommended this place as somewhere that would have the mead I wanted for my husband. A very polite and friendly employee helped me find the mead and then passed me off to someone else when I expressed interest in gin. That second employee recommended a high end sipping gin, saying if I had a bit and didn't like it, I could bring it back. Needless to say, I haven't. Thoroughly impressed with both the friendliness and knowledge of the staff.

Anybody who carries Scribe Winery Riesling gets 5 stars. Oh and they have a great selection of wines from across the globe too. If you can't find a wine you like then you're trying not to. The beer selection is also great. Augustiner from Germany. Woot woot. Solid cheese selection and if you need a grown up gift basket they can do that too. Great service. Great staff.

Great over craft beer & wine selection and I've shopped here multiple times lately.  Staff is knowledge and friendly and the store is well stocked with high quality products.  

I've docked one star due to overall communication on special releases.  They seem pretty fair on how they distribute releases, but there is a disparity on information.  Ex. Stating a day, but not time or stating a day, and then releasing the product a day earlier.  Though I'm sure it's not easy will the volume of calls and inquiries they receive from people looking for more rare products with low product allocations.

This is an excellent place to go if you are looking for wine, beer, or cheese.  If you feel intimidated picking a wine, the staff will happily work with you.  I have found the staff to be both very knowledgeable and helpful.  Every Saturday they have wine tastings on the wine side and food samples on the gourmet side.

What an awesome place to go wine shopping for all sorts of wine!  They also have a great selection of beer and all sorts of snack stuff.  Perfect for building up your collection or planning for a party.

Ok ... so we are in the hunt for a particular Japanese whisky (Taketsuru Pure Malt 17 year) - and a rare one at that. They don't produce much and finding a bottle is hard ... and, of course, we find a bottle in Indianapolis, Indiana at the Vine & Table. We never heard of this place and we are 200 miles away, but we had to give it a try. We called up, ordered it over the telephone and paid for it, and drove down two days later. Wow!

I have been to a number of wine and spirit places, but this one was exceptional. Besides having four bottles of the particular whisky I couldn't find at other places, this establishment had aisles and aisles of wines and spirits laid out for the consumer. This is really an eye-popping arrangement of wines and spirits. Besides having the rare stuff, they have wines laid out by region and style - and they have many offerings in each category. I was really impressed with the selection. 

Now to the staff. We ordered over the phone, and our order was ready and marked for us when we showed up. The staff on a Sunday (admittedly a slow day) were nicer than they had any reason to be. Engaging and helpful ... the staff gets 5 stars. While I am not sure they are a fan of YELP (because YELP said they were closed when they were open) they should work with YELP. YELP will help them gain even higher ratings. 

All-in-all 5-star stuff. They had the rare stuff we were looking for, the staff went over and above, the selection of other materials was overboard, and the setting is pleasant and inviting. The topper for me was the price of the rare stuff I looked for. I found it for $260 to $400 per bottle around the country - as places tried to take advantage of the demand for this rare stuff. Vine & Table asked only $199 ... the typical markup off the initial $150 MSRP. Really liked this place, especially since they are fair with their pricing. If you are in the market for wines and spirits - you have to give this place a try ... even if you are a couple of hundred of miles away. Cheers ...

This is some sort of alcohol heaven. It's such a nice store! They have SO MUCH wine as well as other liquors that you can't necessarily find in all stores. They have a small selection of ports and the prices on (certain) items seem to be reasonable. I love the tastings they do here as well. It's such a great way to get to know different wines and liquors! 

When you go to check out you discover a whole new world of snacks, fresh cheeses, crackers, beer, etc. I've not looked at the prices of those items. They have a membership program where you get points for spending. This is my new favorite place to buy alcohol!

V&T is the best liquor store in the Indy area.  I drive across town on the rehires for their vast, well-curated selection, enthusiastic expertise, and friendly service.  The wine selection has some deep cuts, some ultra-lux, a da nice variety of every-day-drinkers.  The booze is outta control - my man Dave knows everything about their crazy awesome selection, and has turned me on to a few of my favorites over the years.  They've got a great cast of amari, a good deal of bourbon, and the best Scotch selection in the state.  They're also happy to let you sample from the many bottles they have open, which is great way to find a bottle you might not have gambled on otherwise.  They also have a killer beer department, with more than just a bunch of IPAs (although they have those too.)  Finally, plan to pick up some snacks and cigars while you're here too, there's tons of fun stuff to choose from, although their cigar cab is a little pedestrian.

I'm a foodie.  Love Vine and Table for cheeses and their home-made dips (try Chili con Queso-it's addictive!) Also, great selection of wines, spirits and in a much more upscale environment than most liquor stores. Though they have a great lunch menu, they have made to order sushi with a real sushi chef (Mr. Kang) that is among the best in the city!

Mmmmmmm, free cheese and bourbon! (well at least in tiny little portions)  

I love Vine and Table, this is one of the few places to retrieve some of the lovely rare bourbons I love so dearly. 

Vine and Table, Yes!

I've been coming here for years, but am only just reviewing it. The selection for spirits, beer, and wine are absolutely great.  I've worked my way through quite a bit of their mid-range Scotches, and Denis, my go-to guy for all things spirituous is second to none.  Their Islay malts are numerous and good, since many are available for tasting at their tasting bar.  Denis knows the industry and the products and is happy to share ideas, knowledge and honest opinions about whatever dram we are discussing.

They lose a star because they won't sell Capriole Farms cheese.  Some sort of utterly foolish disagreement about limited availability during peak season made the owner not sell Indiana's best cheese in their otherwise prodigiously stocked cheese cases.  Whole Foods makes it work, so clearly just some lame grudge that inconveniences me, the consumer.  

The store is split up into the market/deli half and the beer, wine, and liquor half.  I've had great experiences on the right side of the store, where the staff have special ordered items for me, and even held a bottle of Scotch for me due to my limited college student budget.  They have a huge walk-in fridge for their beer, and they carry a great selection of Indiana beer, as well as other domestic and international craft and micro-brews.  Their stuff is all top-notch, so expect that reflected in their prices, but I know that this is the cheapest place for Riedel glassware anywhere around.

What a cool store!  Besure to check it out!  If you go on saturdays, they always have tons of samples. Food & Wine samples that is.  Very cool store, just happend to stumble apon it one day and have been going back at least once a week.  Check them out, be sure to have time to really check them out.  Oh they also have a little cafe you have to check out!  The best was pork and something.  It had blue cheese, berry preservers, etc, cant remember the name but ask them about it. It rocks.

The staff are really top notch and super knowledgeable!

I was looking for a new bottle of mezcal and scotch and the staff just let me try all sorts of mezcals and scotches so i can decide. They are extremely well-versed and could tell me all sorts of information about the products. 

I highly recommend coming here

Wine tasting less than 1.5 miles from my house? Yes please. I do not know how I've lived four years in Carmel and never been to this place and now....you may have to forcefully remove me.  What a great place to get specialty wines, champagnes, cheese, chocolate and meats.  YUMMO.  And a great staff that created a nice gift bag for my gift.  I will definitely make this my "go to" for something special for those friends who REALLY need a drink!  And I will definitely come back for the wine tastings.  Jealous we didn't have time to join the group enjoying samples our first time in.  Next time, Vine and Table, next time.

I've been here twice over there past two years, and each time is an experience. I'm from Columbus, and my wife and I found it on a trip to Chicago. I've never come across a liquor store that does so much right and delights the customer. It says a lot that we made a special trip on our first anniversary to return. Why this is the best:

-The selection: You won't find Tito's here. You'll find high quality spirits that were selected with care. You'll see some familiar spirits, you'll see some you've heard of, and you'll see a lot that you haven't tried. 

-The store - it's clean, spacious, well laid out, and well organized. 

-The staff - They are incredibly knowledgeable. Each member has their own specialties. We most often talk with Dennis, who is an expert on scotches and other whiskeys. 

-The attitude - They want their customers to walk away informed, happy, and to feel good about their purchase. They have a nice counter at which they've given us a number of samples. Dennis always tells us what we're drinking, if he has a relationship with the producer, what makes that drink unique, and exactly how it's made. Other customers often walk over and join the tasting and the lesson. Come curious!

This is more than a store. It's an experience.

Would rate this place 6 stars if possible. The wall of scotch whiskey is why you come here, but having literally every other type of spirit imaginable is why you stay. Plus they have a tasting area! Honestly there's not too much more to drone on about with this place: it just has what you need, and then some.

I have been here multiple times and the staff is always friendly.  today Grace and Peter helped me. I was searching for a wine and though they didn't have it, she searched for it and I was able to sample a few other wines with Peter... This is a great place if you are looking for wine , beer or spirits and don't quite know what you want as they are very knowledgeable here
Great service and very knowledgeable.   Thanks for the unexpected wine tasting!  I can't wait to come back!  What a fun Saturday mid morning!

This place is amazing!!! All kinds of wine from different regions of the world and the other half of the place is a market filled with cheese and crackers. Ahhh! The perfect place to make your own charcutterie platter. Along with your wine and cheese you can even buy cigars. Your one stop shop for grown up entertainment for hosting social hour. Someone is always around to assist you with whatever looking for to even pairing and recommendations. They even have special events with tastings so definitely sign up with them to get those emails. Wine prices seems a little bit above norm than the local grocery store but it has everything you need! Wine, cheese, cigars, need I say more? It's definitely a place you want to come to grab what you need to throw a sophisticated grown up party!

Glad Their web site is almost current for their available wine stock.For last few weeks I keep finding one wine that's ALWAYS on their website but never available when I place the order.Always good customer service the will call and let me know the DONT have it and recommend good substitute.

Vine and table is a great place to buy craft beer and wine and liquor.  They also provide cigars and a gourmet selection of cheese, meat, crackers, dips, and sauces.   They have wonderful events where you can sample a variety of wines and beer and their meat, cheeses, and crackers.  The staff is very well educated on the wines and beer, and can answer any questions you have on a wine or beer.  They can give you great advice on what to select for a particular event you are going to, or for a date with a special someone.  The rewards program is really not that great unless you shop at the store on a frequent basis.   That is the only reason why I am not giving them a five star rating.  I love their wine selection and their craft beer selection, so that is why vine and table is my first choice for getting a craft beer for a particular occasion.

My husband and I had a great experience here.  Although, there was not a lot of help offered in the wine side,  our service was incredible on the deli/market side.  The cheese man was very knowledgeable and made great suggestion.

I would recommend this place for sure.  Great cheese, great deli, great soups!

I can't say enough great things about this store.  Excellent selection of both wine AND spirits, great values as well as high end stuff, and (most important to me) very friendly and knowledgeable staff.  

Darci in particular was incredibly helpful in identifying great tasting wines both for every day as well as special occasions (based upon my desired price points).  What is especially noteworthy is how genuinely friendly she is (clearly loves her job and is very good at it - we've loved everything she's recommended). 

Definitely now my go to store.

Go see Denis, the Irish fellow who really knows his stuff. His knowledge will unlock the secrets and nuances of whiskey from his homeland and across the way in Scotland. Questions on anything else? He has that covered.

Free tastings of a vast amount of spirits and wine are to be had before you purchase. They also give love to the new and exciting Indiana spirits such as Sorgrhum (Indiana sorghum rum) and Spring Mill Indiana Straight Bourbon.

Great local and craft beer selection. The building is charming and split into 2 parts. The alcohol on one side, gourmet grocery items on the other.

VerdicTL;DR: Possibly the finest wine and spirits store in the Carmel area.

Vine & Table has the most deceptive storefront I've ever seen.  It looks like a small mom and pop liquor store from the outside, but then you walk in and it's much larger and much more upscale than you could guess from the outside.  Their staff is very knowledgeable, and you can tell that they know their wines and liquors by heart.  This is a place where a first-time buyer is instantly put at ease, and yet the experienced connoisseur can be assured that the salesperson knows exactly what he/she is talking about.  That's a rare combination in any business.

I'm not a wine kind of guy -- brown liquors is more my speed -- but I have to say that the staff's picks for wines (whether white or red) have met with rave reviews from friends and family.  As for their whisk(e)y selection?  Some of the best selection around: at the time that I visited they had Nikka From The Barrel, an exquisite 1792 Full Proof, and an impeccable library of Scotch single malts.  Many of these selections are available for tasting at their bar, which will happily let you sample these fine spirits until you've made your selection.

You get the feeling that not only are the salespeople happy to be here and of service, they are bonded together by a genuine love of the product they sell.  And what is the world of liquor without some mythology, some mystique?  The Nikka whiskies tell the tale of Taketsuru and Rita -- a love story made beautiful by adversity, suffering, and triumph together despite a xenophobic and war-torn society.  In 1792 Full Proof is the story of a great building collapse, and the few surviving barrels that remained.  You could walk through this great library of spirits, row after row, and pick out a bottle as if it were a book on a shelf -- filled, just like that book, with tales of long patience, of determination, of showmanship, of the native lands and native hands from which the art form of the single malt was born.

We live in a disposable world today -- every encounter is single-serving, and everything we buy and consume is meant to be thrown away.  Vine & Table, in its own small way, has a way of telling this busy and chaotic world to stop, to slow down, to wait the decades until the whisky has matured and the simple pleasure of hard work has given rise to the equally simple pleasure of a good and lasting reputation.  If there are any reading this review who struggle with feelings of worthlessness, of disposability, of being here today and gone tomorrow -- know that like these fine whiskies on the shelves of Vine & Table, you too are of inherent worth ... and that your maturation process, just like mine, is not yet done.

So let our stories continue.  Let us embrace one another in solemn toast.  To good health, until the glass is empty and our hearts are full.

Vine & Table has come into our lives like a wrecking ball!  Yes, that was a Miley Cyrus reference and no, I'm not apologizing.  My husband would live here if it was possible.  In fact, I know ya'll have a back room for tastings, he would pay you rent to live there just so he could purchase the latest additions to the store.  My husband is really loving craft beers right now and I'm going to go out on a limb here and say that Vine & Table has one of the most impressive and biggest selection of craft beers.  I know that they are known for their wines (huge selection here too!) and even host free wine tastings each Saturday, but we come here for the beer!  Product flies off the shelves here and I've seen it numerous times.  There are some shoppers that come into the store and make a beeline for the latest and greatest brew and others that come for the education of it all and like talking with the staff members to see if they are making a good decision with what they put in their basket.  My husband is at Vine & Table almost every weekend to stock up on new brews and old faves.  I've even learned a thing or two and am a recent convert to stouts which I never thought I'd like.

Apart from all the liquid greatness in this building, they also have tons of food selections that pair great with wines and/or beers and even offer samples of quite a few gourmet foods while you're shopping.  They can also put together gift baskets which would make anyone's day better.  Vine & Table has a clear objective: showcase great product from around the world and locally to provide an experience that gets you excited to try new things.  Isn't that what life is all about? :)

Greatly disappointed - I registered for an event and received confirmation. Upon arriving at 
Vine and Table and waiting for 15 minutes with one customer and two cashiers, I was informed that they have oversold and did not have any apology or accommodation. I had shared this event with friends who registered after I did and were recognized for the event.   I will elect to buy my whiskey, wine, cigars and beer from other establishments that treat customers in a better manner.  I will be unsubscribing from your emails and events.  Unfortunate because past events were handled more professionally.

If you like wine and spirits of any kind, this is the place for you.  The scotch and bourbon selection alone brings me back time and time again. The staff is knowledgeable and customer service is top notch: I placed an order online and they were out of what I ordered and paid for and they replaced it with a more expensive product for the inconvenience. They absolutely didn't have to do that but that is why they have my business. I can't say enough about this place. Do yourself a favor and check it out.

First, let me say that in all my years of enjoying various Wines and Spirits, ( I am 74 years old) It is few and far between in your travels that you will find an establishment that truly exceeds one's expectations!

The Vine and Table in Carmel, does exactly that -- It's Unbelievable!
 
It is not a "Diamond in Rough", it is similiar to a Polished Brilliant "Tiffany" Diamond -- of the Highest Caliber --  amongst all of its various competitors.

This Vine and Table establishment is "Beyond Outstanding"  and most importantly because of its very Professional General Manager, Mr. Joseph Davey and his Team!

I can also say that in these stressful times, far to often, individuals in the Retail Customer Services sector do not provide adequate attention to "The Customer". 

On numerous occassions, Mr. Davey has gone the "Extra Mile" and "Above and Beyond" for me, in locating "Rare" and "Very Sought After" Spirits.

Needless to say, it has been so very, very refreshing to speak with and to conduct business with Vine and Table's Mr. Davey , who truly knows and understands that "meeting the Customers needs" are of "Paramount Importance"!  This, by far, is the Cornerstone for any Successful business!

If you want the "Ultimate" in "Customer Service in Wine & Spirts Selections, Vine and Table would be a very Wise Choice!  

Then you will discover and realize "Why" -- Vine and Table in Carmel, is "Indiana's Premier Wine and Spirtis Retailer !!
Cheers,
Frank T.

I don't know what this place used to be with the drive up area BUT everything works so well. The carts that they have fits bottles of wine so they don't shift around. The selection they offer is just out of this roof! Also the sales they have... amazing! The staff was extremely nice as well! I liked that they had some interesting things to go with wine, like cheese spreads or even miscellaneous spreads... I even saw one that had banana! I might just be back to try that for the next family gathering. Great place, totally worth the visit!

This is my new preferred place for buying wine and beer! The staff is very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The layout of the store is very spacious, so it doesn't feel crammed or chaotic inside. There's also a bar set up inside where they do some sampling. Great selection of beers, ciders and wines. They also sell liquor and gourmet foods. Another perk is that they have a rewards program where you can earn points from all of your purchases to use on foods or drink ware. Definitely recommend this store!

I used to drive by this place often and think it's such an odd building for a wine shop... there's a drive thru between the front doors and parking, kind of like a drop off area in front of the emergency room or hotel. My friend and I decided to check it out and it is surprisingly larger than expected. They have a large variety of alcohol, some cheeses/snacks, and giftable items. They also have a tasting room/sale area. My friend got a case of wine and it worked out to about $6 a bottle. Random, but they have the most ingenious shopping carts! It has a fold down divider that separates wine bottles so they don't hit each other.
This place is a must stop every time I am in town at sport tournaments at Grand Park. Great stock, very knowledgeable staff

It was really nice that I just so happened to meet the general manager. They have such a variety of things that may not be anywhere else. Additionally I love going into places like this and owners and the rest of the staff know their products. I cannot wait to come back

Vine and Table is what every wine store should be!  Very impressive selection of wines (didn't have a chance to dive spirits). And a very knowledgeable staff!  Thanks to Grace and Joshua for helping me spread my wings and try some new varietals....

This has to be one of the best liquor stores for bourbon selection. " wow" is an understatement... they have one of the biggest selections of bourbon in Indy area. I definitely recommend this liquor store for bourbon purchases .

first time I ordered from here, the food was cold by the time it arrived. I live only a few miles from Beijing Panda, so I image my food sat in the restaurant for quite some time before leaving for delivery.

I decided to try their food again hoping for a better experience. Unfortunately, it was worse the second time around. I ordered the house friend rice, wonton soup, teriyaki steak, and crab rangoon. Everything was inedible except for the crab rangoon, which I drowned in duck sauce. 

Do NOT recommend.

The people are rude and the delivery time is ridiculous. Waited 2 hours for food and it never actually arrived. When I called to ask what the issue was, they said the food was already on the way. Poor management and even more poor customer service. What a waste.

I live less then a mile from this place, we ordered $30 worth of food. Took over an hour for the delivery & the food was cold & dry when we received it. My husband called the restaurant they said "sorry nothing we can do" & hung up on him. We took the food back to the restaurant & asked for a refund. The staff was beyond rude, but eventually 1 staff member agreed to refund us.
They have done a good job since taking over Lou's Wok.  Much friendler,  better food,  and the place looks 100% better then before.

Ordered food two hours ago... Food was expected to get to us at 9:50. Called they said it was gonna take another 30 mins. Well over an hour later and Still haven't received the food, place is now closed. Never again.

The food took over an hour to arrive to my house even those I live 5 minutes away. The food was cold & needed to be reheated. I ordered shrimp & broccoli. It wasn't the worst I've ever had, but the shrimp were not fresh.

The menu looked promising. We have dietary restrictions and severe food allergies. After asking clear and concrete questions about the ingredients in specific foods and were assured we could eat them; imagine our concern when we found out on the next visit that we were completely mislead. We were very clear about whether the vegetable soup was vegetarian and what it contains. We were shocked when the next time we ordered the same soup to find out that the vegetable soup is chicken based. Completely frustrated and annoyed! NEVER again.
Looooove this chinese restaurant, foods are good and always available on time as we are about to pick it up! Price are reasonable...
Found a white worm wiggling around in my rice before eating it. Great, if you love some extra protein! I was not happy about it though!
Some cheap food. My body started to itch after eating their food. Tasted bad too. Will never return.

I have lived in this area for over 10 years and I can count on my hand the number of times I've gone to Beijing Panda.  I know there was another owner a few years back - but once Beijing Panda took over - I figured this will be my go to place - didn't happen.  I was clear about my order and specific about "no onions"!  Well, this didn't work out the 1st time nor upon my return visit last week.  

I tried to give them another chance, but they FAILED to follow basic instructions.  Despite the onions, the food was good (that's why they got the additional star), but I was annoyed that I had to pick around the food - it doesn't make an enjoyable experience when you are hungry.  

Come on Beijing Panda - pay attention to your customers!
An average Chinese restaurant, I really enjoy the broccoli in garlic sauce here. The spring rolls are good. The veggie fried rice is average. Definitely convenient if you live in the area.
Walked in and they had wet dogs roaming around the store. Can't be sanitary. Walked out.

This place would get no stars if that was even possible. Had a horrible experience there on Thanksgiving. First the way the layout and set up is your food is lukewarm or cold by the time you get to the table. On top of that homeless people wandered in begging for money as we sat and dined. Also worker went off on someone on the telephone right in the middle of the dining area. Thanks for giving us a horrible thanksgiving. Sorry for the delay of the post!
This place taste like ready to eat frozen. Horrible place. Please don't message me to make it for me.

I have tried to order from this place twice (Rotisserie Roast at Boston Market through DoorDash) and BOTH times I was called and told by the delivery person that they didn't have ANY of the items I ordered. The first time was later in the evening and I figured, "Covid, it's late, things happen." But twice? The chicken place ran out of chicken twice? And mashed potatoes? And garlic bread. And broccoli? And mac-n-cheese? In the middle of the day? 

This is either terrible inventory keeping or a pure lack of wanting the business. We just wanted some delicious chicken bowls. Now I'm hangry. I might give this place one more shot and I'll update the review if I do.

This place has to be the most disgusting place I have ever been to. The employees are rude and have NO CLUE. About anything. Food is really really bad. When I tell you bad I mean my dog wouldn't eat it. The place and the people that work there are DIRTY. And nobody there cares about work ethic, quality of food or customer service and specially don't care about healthy protocols.
The place is always "under new management " but never gets better it's been shit for years

Boston Market seemed like a good idea at the time coming on stream in the 1980s when fast food taste buds were growing tired of the styrofoam treats being shoveled out of drive-thru windows everywhere. Finally, "home-cooking" at a reasonable price featuring roasted turkey, veggies and a mind blowing macaroni and cheese. 

Well, something happened on the way to quick-serve immortality, the portions shrank and the homespun quality took a nosedive as McDonald's and a succession of hedge funds took a stab at reviving sales. Most importantly, consumers decided they didn't want Thanksgiving every day and shunned BM in favor of toxic tacos, cardboard pizza and supersized waistlines.

So here I am chewing through what's left of a roasted chicken platter that tastes more institutional than inspired. How do you wreck mac and cheese... by turning it into a flavorless yellow soup. The 80s really are over as my mullet gently weeps.
Has a drive through but never available to use, extremely frustrating. Specially when you can't go inside because you misplaced your mask. Under staffed!

Absolutely disgusting.
The staff is lazy and dirty and on top of all that rude and ignorant. The food was cold and just bad quality. I waited in the drivethru for at least 25 mins and there were only 3 cars in front of me. The workers were all on the phone just standing there not sure waiting for what. I could say a lot more things about this place but it's not even worth it. Last thing save yourself the hassle and don't go there.

Satisfied with food delivery was prompt, but as usual items were missing. Not worth the hassle to call   So the convenience and cost of delivery is not helpful.  This is not the fault of the delivery. It is the restaurant
Please improve this aspect of your company. It is not the first time for me. Trying to patronize our local establishments but becomes difficult when this happens

Food wise, I love this place. I work nearby and we don't have a ton of options, so it's nice to have a place with a healthy variety (pizza, salad bar, "international" food, kosher, grill). 

HOWEVER- every time I order food here I basically have to commit at least 30 min of my life to waiting around for them to serve it. The people who work here are at worst unmotivated and at best utterly confused. It's heating up a veggie burger, it's not rocket science. Last time I was there even though it was pretty empty they still had trouble figuring out what I had ordered (it prints out a receipt...)

It's pretty overpriced too. Lunch will run you like $12ish all told with fries+ drink.

Food is ok, staff are generally nice. They used to be open until 1 am now they close at 8pm. And they got rid of the meat lasagna, which I loved. TheiThey're pricey though if you're not on a Drexel meal plan. I bought a fruit cup from Green St. Without checking price and it turned out to be $8!! Also, I couldn't even finish it because half the fruit was overripe. 

Good for Drexel students. If you don't have a meal plan there are better places to spend your money.

As a visiting student this is by far the worst service that I have ever received anywhere. Mind you, i was just trying to order a regular smoothie. The African American lady behind the counter gave me attitude for just asking plain questions about the content of the smoothies. And the guy who was making the smoothies skipped the guy behind me just because he was looking down. Guiding the guy behind him to the front. He said that the weather was too hot outside and he didn't want to wait for anyone. I have never been to prison, but I'm assuming this is how they treat the inmates in their food lines. You should hire energetic young students instead of these apathetic burnt out people. Smoothie on its own was delicious and highly recommended.

Disgusting, overpriced garbage. Never, not once was it good. Please don't order the quesadillas. It's apart of Drexel's expensive meal plan. Freshmen are forced to eat there. Would never willingly eat their nasty food. Gets old real quick and lines are very long
Terrible service, ordered cheesesteak, takes so long, someone comes and orders one and got one right away. Thats was my fuckin cheesesteak!!!
I don't know what happened but urban stepped up their game recently, no complaints. And there's lots of desserts.

Horrible. Don't go. All the Fresh works are racist and rude.  I handed the cashier my credit card and after he charged me he threw my card on the counter at me. Food had a bunch of black stuff in my steak. Looked like the burned left overs from food previously used on the grill. Ten minutes after consuming this food my throat is already sore. I tried different locations hoping one would be better but no. Same service. Rude and unprofessional.
Always good food and consistent. Great sandwiches and wings. Give this place a try because it "Work"!

They had a Tuesday special, free boneless wing with a purchase of over $7.00. Tuna Hoagie was very good. The boneless wings were also very good. I'll try some of their other items. I'll be ordering again.

Ordered here one night my boyfriend got a sampler platter. 
The mozz. Sticks were over cooked no cheese in them 
We ordered wings also which were okay. It was late at night so I'm sure they were rushing but I definitely wont be ordering the sampler again from them.

Ordered wings and a cheesesteak . The cheese steak was good when I opened the wings it was a bloody finger wrap that might've fell off an employee finger . Lost my appetite once I encountered that . I called them to let them what I found and asked for a refund and they said they can only give me store credit . After a back and forth battle for like 10 minutes they finally agreed to give me a refund for the wings . This is the most nasty food encounter I ever had. Negative 5 stars .

If I could give this zero stars I would me and my wife just had a very bad experience with this place, we place an order with them at 9:35  and they accepted the order over an hour later with no call text or any contact at all we found out that they canceled the order we tryed to call with no answer and this happened today on April 4 2020 I will being trying to call them tomorrow.

This place AT ONE point in time was sooo great and amazing. A lot of people say this place is racist along with all other fresh works. I personally get that vibe from CERTAIN EMPLOYEES not all.

The food used to be so amazing every time my family and I order. Today I am really convinced I will NO LONGER order from here again. The chicken is EXTREMELY dry. 
I normally order grilled chicken wraps and chicken cheesesteaks. How on living earth can adding mayo and cheese CHICKEN STILL BE DRY? I'm PERPLEXED  

LETS NOT FORGET to mention the food is not cheap, every time my family and I decide to order it's 30-35 dollars for:
Two grilled chicken wraps
One chicken cheesesteak
No drinks , nothing else 

That's pretty expensive! 

So I hope this was helpful, would I recommend? NO! Save your money for a different place
Food is always good but they always forget my extra side of hot pepper spread lol... like EVERY SINGLE time. Don't do delivery... go in and order your food takeout.

I recently ordered a Chef's Salad from here. I HD ordered one previously and found no problem with it. This time, the food was terrible.  The lettuce was rotten and so were the tomatoes. It might have been don on purpose since two of the employees were laughing when I picked it up. I don't know who the owner is but they need to investigate what's happening before someone gets sick and they get sued. I had ordered the salad for my son. I ended up trashing it. I will never order anything From here again!
There phone person just hung up when I said I can't understand what she was saying not a way to do business
this location has been closed for over a year, check company website only mercer mall in ewing nj & Malvern locations are in the area here

Great sub , actually donates back to the community - WOW!!! Emergency personal actually get upgraded to a combo for free. Coke machine is cool with 240 different favors. Would definitely return again and again. Try it - you'll like it.
This place is great! The sandwiches are delicious, the choice of soda is fantastic, and the service is tremendous.  You can keep Subway, give me the Firehouse!

I really liked the toasted sub. Beyond that, I visited the day after Hurricane Sandy. Firehouse Subs was one of the few places with electricity and there were long lines. Only two workers could get in to work, but those two guys worked hard to make everyone happy. It was an oasis for most of us without heat or kight or food at home. And even though they must have been pretty tired, they kept the quality of the food they served up to the usual great standards. Kudos to those guys. We will be back.

Nice place, friendly staff and delicious sandwich until... I found a long blonde hair. I had the Italian sandwich and I don't think I saw hair listed on the ingredients for the sandwich, but i was in a hurry so maybe I missed it. I guess if you like hair on your sandwiches this is the place for you. I prefer my sandwich without hair, although I do like mayo. BTW, I called the hotline to let the know that they were serving hair subs and it took the guy 10 minutes to establish that they had a Fire House on route 1 in  Langhorne. The guy on the hot line did confirm that hair is not one of their standard condiments.
I really like burger king breakfast get a good amount of food for your money. Also the staff seems pretty nice and inviting

This people jist don't care about customer service!  There was no body and i mean no body in front of us behind us.but somehow they manage to take 10 minutes to take our order and another 10 to make our food.
This place has horrible service. Cashiers and chefs cussing while customers are eating . They need to hire people who are more professional .

DISGUSTINGGGG! I went to grab lunch from this location today which I have a few times in the past as well. I've tried giving them the benefit of the doubt at times esp since this one is so close to my job. But ... their food & customer service is just TRASH. My burgers tasted old & cold. The bread was stale as f***. Fries were old. Instead of remodeling this place they need to put better employees in there & make fresh food. This was the last time I will everrrr go to this location. What a waste of my lunch & my money!!!!!
Have never had even decent service at this location. I'm surprised management hasnt addressed this as it has been going on here for years.

Went through the drive thru in 6/6/2021.  My dr. Peppers was completely flat! Fries must have sat under the heat lamp for hours, old and stale. My whopper was thrown together it was lop sized in the wrapper with blobs of mayo all over the side!!! Lady working thr window didn't speak at all once at the window...no hello, no have a good day. I requested bbq dipping for my chicken nuggets, didn't not get any. By far worst experience ever, horrible food, sodas and customer service! When I drove off I said "have a good night" and she said you too and close the window. It will be a matter of time before this location gets closed down. Nothing positive to say!

DT was the only option available. Who ever took my order to a good 5 min to say hello. Not even a hello when they came on, just mumbled so i went on with my order. Horrible customer service. The person sounded MISERABLE. Went to the first window and it's obvious the person that took my order was him. Went to the second window and i asked for zesty sauce. ( i ordered a whopper meal) and the guys said I'm not allowed to give zesty sauce it's only for the nuggets. Now that really shocked me. What kind of business says no to a customer for SAUCE ? What the fuck. Even the fact that they limit who to give it to. Onions on the burger looks disgusting. Fries were super cold with NO salt.

I know fast food restaurants get a bad rap for being uncaring, not listening, etc. 

You came here for breakfast while waiting for my car to be repaired. I will, admit a huge into breakfast in general. I wanted to get a couple of original chicken sandwiches. 

It's a new request at 9 AM, but the general manager decided to allow me to purchase two which made me actually happy. 

I appreciated it.

I ordered the chicken parm. It was very hard and cold. I went to change my daughters diaper and there is absolutely no changing table in the womens bathroom at all so i had to go change her in a hot car and she has medical problems. The womens bathroom was disgusting. Used pads and pad wrappers on the rail behind the toilet!!! I will never come to this burger king again. This is bs!!!!!

I don't even want to leave a star for the restaurant... the workers are rude... we ask for fresh food ... the food was dry and cold.. of course this time of evening we should've checked our bags but its late in the evening we was ready to head home ... these fast food restaurants need to train the kids better.. very unprofessional .. the only car In the drive thru and they still got our order wrong...  the reason the restaurant have a star ( because we can't post with giving a review) THE FOOD IS GARBAGE THE SERVICE WAS BAD

After many disappointing attempts at finding a vet for my Coco, I happened upon Mayfield Veterinary Clinic and Dr. Lee. Her obvious love of animals is apparent from the first moment she interacts with you and your pet.  She takes the time to get to know them, and you during her initial consultation and remembers the little details in subsequent visits. I truly feel she's an ally in monitoring my dog's health. Dr. Lee didn't give up in finding a treatment for Coco, when I believe other vets would've recommended expensive procedures and tests instead. I highly recommend her and the rest of the wonderful staff!

After disappointing experiences with a couple of other clinics we took our 16 year old cat here for dental surgery. We received Incredible service and care from all staff including the very friendly receptionist. Dr. Shiebel is the kindest vet I've ever come across. I can't say enough about this clinic and wouldn't consider going anywhere else after experiencing such exemplary attention and care.

Everything that the other reviewers say is true - this clinic goes above and beyond in caring for your companion animal. I've encountered some pretty shabby vets in my time and the difference is palpable when you walk in here. The clinic itself is clean and pleasant, and Dr. Heather Lan immediately bonded with our dog when she entered the room. She was so kind to him and put him at ease. He had to have dental surgery and Heather clearly explained what would happen, as well as the costs involved. At no point did I feel like she was trying to make as much money as possible, as is the case with almost every other vet we've seen. In fact, she tried to help us cut costs while ensuring our dog received the best possible treatment. We've been twice now for four tooth extractions (poor doggy - beware the hard treats!) and the service and professionalism, as well as the bedside manner, were beyond exemplary!

I have 3 rescue dogs from Mexico. Dr. Martin Schiebel has performed dental work on all 3 dogs- extractions of permanent teeth, repairs, sealants etc. One dog recently broke her tooth on a bully stick. Martin came in on his day off to extract the tooth, repair another tooth and remove a mass on her eyelid. I cannot say enough good things about this office. Staff are very friendly and caring. They won't do unnecessary procedures and are upfront about pricing (aiming to come in under quotes if possible). I have gone to other vets. They may charge less for the initial visit but they will charge more for unnecessary procedures. As Martin has been a vet for 30+ years, he knows his stuff and has seen a lot. His advice is grounded in experience and knowledge. Truly a wonderful vet and office!

We have had multiple pets cared for at this clinic..our vet is Dr Annabele Sydie-Smith..and have received caring, professional service for over ten years. They have always accommodated our needs and go above and beyond to ensure pets are diagnosed and treated appropriately with a bedside manner we wish every medical doctor displayed.

I brought my dog here to have some extensive dental work done. The staff there are very sweet, and gentle and incredibly helpful.
 I had a follow up appointment, and had traveled an hour in a snow storm only to find upon arrival that my appointment was actually scheduled for the following day. They squeezed me in very quickly despite my error, and were very understanding and non judgmental about it. 

Dr. Martin S. is a wonderful doctor and goes above and beyond during examinations and procedures. Thank you Mayfield!

This is an update from a review I did several years ago. Back then, I said it seemed like my cats were more than dollar signs to them. I'm still right about that. 

Dr. Heather Lam has branched into pet dentistry, and our new vet is Dr. Kelly Havinga. After all this, we've determined that Dr. Havinga is a more than suitable replacement.

Spartacus Jones got sick about a week ago. The long story made short? He didn't make it. Between ourselves (needles and  medications, lots of love) and the staff (all day saline treatments and supervision, lots of love) at this hospital everyone pulled all the stops to cure his early kidney failure. We spared no expense and we literally tried everything. 

Dr. Havinga considers herself rather blunt, but I appreciate that. No bullshit. She's straight up, but not heartless. She'd spoken to every specialist she knew, but because Spartacus' lungs were filling with fluid, all our efforts were pointless. Thewords 'kidney cancer' came up. The medication required to drain his lungs, in his state, would destroy his kidneys.  He would die, no matter what we did.

I desperately wanted for Spartacus to die at home, not at a vet office. Dr. Havinga provided me with three phone numbers for vets that euthanize at your home. She told us we had to do it within 48 hours, and yes, it was absolutely necessary. His suffering was terrible to witness. She gave us medication that would push the fluid from his lungs, thus easing his suffering, but it would destroy his kidneys. Nothing would stop that anyway. 

The staff, ALL of them, know Spartacus and what was happening. They took really good care of him. How do I know? I saw the sorrow on their faces. I saw how he still sought their affection right to the bitter end.

Even as sick as he was, he was still drawn to them for snuggles and they still pet and cuddled him, given the chance, and they called him by name. Gave him love. 

I paid his last bill today, and they still expressed their condolences and took a little time with me while I cried.

Freya is due for shots next month. It will hurt to see this place again, but I've always trusted them, and this experience has actually fortified my feelings for them.

Rest in Peace Spartacus Jones. We all did what we could.

I love these guys. I swear Dr. Heather Lam is a cat whisperer.

Since I've been a pet owner for less than four years, I don't have a lot to compare them to. But I can tell you I'm happy with them and when my cat, Freya came home with a collapsed lung, they saved her life.

When our other cat, Sully passed away I was devastated. It was my very first pet loss, and they were understanding and walked me through the processing of his remains. It did my heart good when I received a card from them expressing their  condolences. Inside was a copy of the Rainbow Bridge poem, and a little handmade card with Sully's paw print on it. It was a nice touch that still brings me to tears.

I know Sully LOVED Dr. Lam. She has a way with furchildren. She just seems to put them at ease and she knows their personality quirks. Again, when Sully passed, she helped ease my grief. 

I guess I just feel like my cats and me are not just numbers and cash flow to them. I always feel like I'm taking my cats to see friends. It feels like the staff loves my babies too..
There wings suck. Fried. All bone. Asked for wings gave all drum sticks. Poor quality.

If you want terrible food this is the place for you. If you want your food incorrect because idiots behind the counter can't read basic english this place is for food. If you don't want any of that your best bet is to order from somewhere else. To top it off this place have the nerve to have bad customer service like they're serving good quality food.

Although their pizza isn't all that, their other foods are good such as their cheesesteak wraps and zucchini sticks  I used to work next door and they are super friendly & rarely ever got my order wrong. The owner is lovely and very accommodating

We have ordered take out here almost every night since we are in town for three weeks and they are amazing. Have tried many things from every section of the menu and have not had one bad thing. Delivery is as fast as they say it is when your order every time and the staff is very friendly. Will continue to order here till we leave. Thanks for the food!

On 9/21 I order a Gyro w/ salad and two slices of sausage pizza w/ soda. The order was pretty easy. When I receive the order 1 hour later it was very cold. What upset me the most is how they prepared the food. The Gyro was made from precut meat strips not Off-the-Cone Gyros Slices. When I placed the order, I specifically requested plates and utensils. They forget my request they also forgot to add my Ranch Dressing for my salad. Overall, I think this restaurant has potential but it needs to treat customers better by first hiring someone who has strong English skills so they can effectively communicate with customers. Second don't deliver to areas you are unwilling to redeliver item to. I call the restaurant request my missing items and the manager kept stating it was too far to return for a second trip. This is poor customer service. Last manage the food preparation and delivery process better. No one wants cold food.

Ordered through Grubhub at 10:30 PM and it's now 2:30 am no food and according to them they cancelled our order but no contact no call no nothing! This is bullshit! Our contact number is up to date so there was no reason why they couldn't have called us! Never again am I ordering from this place! They say they don't deliver to us but yet we got food delivered to us March 18 which was 5 days ago! They just didn't want to work! Done with this place! Never again
The food is always delicious and fresh. I've used them to cater my daughter's graduation party as well. I ordered the day off and my food was ready! I highly recommend them.

the wet, soggy crust had the toppings basically slipping and sliding off. The pizza was mostly toppings, turning the dough into mush. walked in on all employees mask-less... 2 small pizzas for $20.70 definitely not a bargain.

This is a review by someone who orders every week but has never been into the store. Here is a summary'

Pros:
*One of the only places open until 3am even during the pandemic
*Food is really good. The mozzarella sticks are the best I've ever had. Especially when fresh out of the oven.
*Big menu selection
*Great price for the quality and low delivery fee.
*They take cash on GrubHub because they use their own drivers.

Cons:
*The later your order, the worse your delivery is.
*They refuse to do simple modifications such as "put hot sauce in the quesadilla." To this day they still never do. 
*Driver only reads instructions as they arrive.
do not order from here. scott the manager is absolutely horrible and the pizza even worse!

4 out of 5 times I've ordered from here I've had a problem.  I ordered online with a discount, and the driver showed up with the full price.  He gave me an attitude, when I told him that wasn't right.  Then I had to call the place to tell them they messed.  The next time I ordered over the phone, made sure to tell the girl I wanted promoted discount.  Again, they messed up the order and it was full price.  A third time, I called in with a coupon, again, they messed up and had the full price.  The fourth time I called, and the price was fine bc I hadn't ordered a discount, but I did order sides that were nowhere to be found.  I was too tired of dealing with them to follow-up.  After the last time, I was like they finally got it right, but it was bc I made the plainest order....Don't order from them if you value your time and respect.

I've ordered pizza for delivery several times from here. I like their web interface, although it seems to be flaky about accepting credit cards. Sometimes the card is declined, wait a few minutes, and it is accepted. That's annoying. The delivery is usually pretty fast and the pizza is hot. Typical pizza hut food, it's edible. Quality is sporadic. I always order extra sauce, hold the garlic. Sometimes they do and sometimes they don't (follow the instructions) and they seem to be stingy about pepperoni. I need to find a new pizza place.

The new disappointing $6.99 pizza has proven - you get what you pay for!  Although you can add toppings for $1.00 each, you should check out my latest delivery in the photos section. There aren't even 4 small slices on the entire large pizza. Same with the helping of peppers. Meh - I'd rather pay $10 for the any way you like it and get a decent helping on toppings. And now a delivery charge on top of it!  Wow Pizza Hut!  How desperate are you?

Ordered a medium pizza thin crust pizza-went to pick it up $14.  I ask about the 2 medium pizza special posted in front of me and I was told "oh yeah that would have been a better deal."  I said why didn't someone tell me about your specials when I called the order in?  Humm no response.  Seemed very disorganized in there!!
I like the pizza. That's the only pizza we eat. It's better than the countryside high school food. I like to order it online and just pick it up when I get there
Went there for half time during Super Bowl.. 2 medium pizzas. Worst pizza ive EVER HAD. You woukf think during Super Bowl it would be fresh. Horrible!!!

I came back to Pizza Hut after a long time of using other chains.  First experience was pretty good -- easy on-line ordering and quick delivery.  Pretty decent pizza.  Cool.

Tonight I couldn't work the app (driving) so I called.  The call rolled over to a national call center that seemed to have trouble figuring out what location I was trying to order from for carry out.  But I placed the order...or so I thought.

I arrive at the shop in 20 minutes.  No order.  No pizza.  And also, by the way, no meaningful apology.  Instead they took my order and I waited another 30 minutes.  It would have been nice to be offered a discount, a coupon or something...  Nothing.

Mistakes get made, but they should also get corrected.  I'll never order again by phone, if I order again at all.

We order using the app - quick and easy, but don't forget to check out the specials before ordering. Ordered the stuffed crust 3 topping (pepperoni, sausage, & bacon). I got there early so I waited. Austin was great with the customers - very friendly and outgoing. 
He said they were remaking my pizza because it didn't have enough bacon on it. I was thinking "lovely I'm going to miss the beginning of the Rays wild card game". Before I course say anything, he said to call my next order in and there will be a free pizza for me. Nice!!!! I told him my husband just texted me to get a cookie - he threw that in also!! 
Great customer service and good food (especially the cookie) 
I did hear him talk to another customer about phone issues that went directly to hold; so order online or with the app if there's a problem calling.

On receiving my delivery order, I noticed the entire order was covered in ants. I called the store immediately, & spoke with a female who stated she was the manager on for the shift. She initially offered to only refund the purchase cost & not any related fees until I pushed. She told me they had no way to notify patrons when deliveries arrived (I signed up for text alerts) despite previously receiving notifications from multiple delivery services in the past, Pizza Hut included. When I asked if I would be getting a refund for the points used to purchase part of my order I was told no. I asked if there would possibly be someone at a higher level (as in her immediate boss) about it & was told that I would have to contact corporate. This entire experience was awful. The manager was extremely cold on the phone, not once was i given the option to replace my order. I now am out money, points, & my family's dinner. The store was 2519 N McMullen Booth Rd, Unit 501, Clearwater, FL 33761.

I just called to make an order someone answered in mid laugh. I didnt understand her so I asked her to repeat herself,  she barked w an attitude that she wanted my 10 digit telephone number.  I told her she was rude. I said , you answered while laughing, I didnt understand and When you asked my number and she said, " just have a nice day ma'am" and hung up on me.

Ordered a large hand-tossed with 2 toppings for $7.99 (online deal) - cheaper than fast food! Pizza was decent - sauce was good (not sugary), and there was a decent amount of cheese and toppings. Temperature was warm but not really hot which was kind of odd because they made me wait for a few minutes. Crust was def not hand-tossed, probably mass-produced frozen type with a very bready texture - would try thin crust next time. Not the best pizza ever but works for carryout.

Online ordering was easy but wish they accepted payments online. 

Sign up to receive their emails and get a free cheesy bread sticks coupon.

Update: thin crust is much better than hand-tossed!

I hope management can see this review. 

Although a large chain with relatively cheap food, service is service and consistency is important. 

I tried to place a large order and the gentleman Taking my order could not keep up. Listen to what I was saying. And seemed completely inadequate. 

The manager Jason got on the phone as I asked for a vegetarian mushroom Alfredo because I do not eat meat, and he states he can't make that. 
I have ordered it ever time I have ordered from Pizza Hut and they have kindly made it. 

It's pure laziness and I hope it's noticed.

I work nearby and order through Grubhub 2, sometimes 3, days a week for food at work. The sandwiches are PHENOMENAL. My favorite is the bbq pulled pork. Foods always on time and anytime there is an issue with my order or extra requests, management contacts me quickly to discuss alternatives. Oh, the pasta salad is also amazing.. the balsamic vinaigrette is delicious.

First time orderer here and went for their thanksgiving catering. It was fantastic!  My family and I enjoyed every dish.  My husband ask that we get cousins to do thanksgiving every year.  I will def be ordering here more often.  Bravo!

What an awesome little place to grab lunch. I've eaten here at least 2 dozens times and have used them for events. The cold cuts are among the best around. Boars Head!!! My favorite sandwich is The Godfather it's always awesome with the right amount of everything on it. Yesterday I got the bacon egg and cheese sandwich and it was a great way to start the day off.  The owner and staff are always pleasant and great peoples to deal with. Cousins is a big part of the Audubon community and helps out many of the local causes. Give this place a 6th star for all the great things he does in the community.
