I am a frequent customer of Cousins Deli and was inspired to recommend the meatloaf sandwich special today!  The sharp cheese and bacon relish were awesome with the meatloaf and I added some Fuego BBQ sauce from Smoke BBQ to put it OVER the top.  Great sandwich Anthony - your best yet!!

Fabulous food, generous portions, super clean place, great prices, and a gracious owner: what more could you ask for in a restaurant? I have been frequenting Cousin's for everything from sliced meats and cheeses to sandwiches to the twice-weekly supper club dinners. Everything is fresh and delicious. The menu is extensive, covering sandwiches, subs and burgers. I am a big fan of the butter burger, the tuna salad, the potato salad, and the weekly dinners: crab cakes were last night's selection, served with rice and grilled asparagus.They were exceptional. If you are looking for a great place to grab breakfast, lunch, or dinner, look no further than Cousin's.
The food is very good. I'm addicted to their Egg & Cheese Sandwiches! They are very nice and provide great service.

Awesome food with a hometown feel. They use high quality ingredients and actually listen to their customers!

Their Ruben was one of the best Rubens I have ever had. 

I highly recommend everyone to check them out!

First time at Cousins Deli....worth the stop!

I had a hankering for a turkey club and noticed the deli so popped in.  Generous amount of thin sliced turkey breast which was fresh, lettuce, tomato, bacon cheese and mayo on rye toast... sound simple but am usually disappointed.   Not here.  Recommend you give them a try as the Reuben sounded good too.  They also have daily specials as well.  Oh and the club was not on the menu but he made me a nice one!
Chicken salad on a Kaiser roll was very good and reasonably priced. I chose the macaroni salad as a side and it was also good.

I'm feeling hoagies this week. Tonight I went to @cousinsdeligrill in Audubon. This place is minutes from home and I had no idea. I walked in and asked for a suggestion and was told the italian is legit. $10.66 for a full and worth every penny of the decent price! Finely sliced @boarshead_official meats on a soft roll with a crunchy exterior. The oil, vinegar, and oregano complimented the crunchy water veggies just perfectly. This was a hearty sandwich! Its a good thing I have a big mouth and a big apetite to take this beautiful sandwich down. Can we call the owner a sandwich artist? I think so!

Have you ever had a craving for a BIG sub/hoagie in the middle of the day? For me, that was today at about 2PM. This led me to look online Grubhub for something to order. 

Have you ever been to downtown Audubon? A quaint little main street with character. Easy to miss if you don't know the area. A couple coffee shops, restaurants and the like - definitely a nice spot to take your special someone for a walk by the railroad tracks. 

This led me to Cousin's and whoa, what a huge menu. Breakfast...lunch...you name it. I narrowed my search to a MEATY whole Italian Deluxe Sub - Ham, salami, cappicola, prosciutto and provolone. This thing was fresh, juicy and did I say it was meaty? It was packed. 

Parking is easy and more than likely, you can grab a spot on the street but if not, there's plenty in the surrounding neighborhood. It's a pleasure to support local especially when local does it best. Thanks Cousin's Deli!
Stopped by place once to get a turkey sub and it was pretty good. The sub is packed with a lot of meat. Will definitely be back at some point to try the other subs.

I needed to pickup lunch this morning for a 2.5 hours working virtual meeting, I decided to check Yelp's honest reviews for the BEST Italian hoagie near me, and I was not disappointed - it's a delicious hoagie.  Anthony was engaging and friendly, he shared with me about he post specials on FB.  I will definitely be checking their FB page and visiting them again.  Support local small businesses!

Good pizzas...better than the double C buffet and the small Roman guy.  They're not loaded with toppings but good quality for a buffet.  Might even beat delivery.
You can order a specific pizza and you'll get the first slices when it comes out.
Fried chicken is crispy and flavorful.
Dessert pizzas are ok.  Chocolate chip cookie is good.  Plus they have soft serve ice cream. 
Drinks are included.  You can make a root beer float!

I'm so happy Pizza Ranch has come to Tennessee! I had heard amazing reviews from coworkers originally from the Midwest and was on countdown for them to open. They definitely live up to the hype. The fried chicken is some of the best I've ever had, and the Buffalo chicken mac n cheese pizza is my new favorite. I haven't had anything bad there! The employees are super friendly and yes, a lot of them are high school kids (probably their first job), but they are kind, courteous, and you can see them wiping down tables as fast as they can to get customers seated ASAP. This will be a family spot once a week for us!

Absolutely Horrible! The advertisement is way off ! A total waste of time and Money!! The chicken buffet was dried up, I've had better pizza from the frozen section at Kroger's!! Employees were not professional at all! They just wanted to play, I won't be back!

We ate here on Friday, October 5th. It was very busy. 

The first problem, they only had one register open. That made no sense. 

Number two: The first three pieces of pizza I had were cold

Number three: My wife enjoyed her chicken. I didn't come to a pizza buffet to eat only chicken

Number four: The only way I was able to get hot pizza was to stand around the buffet line and wait. There were several people waiting for fresh pizza so once the pizza came out, it was a dash to grab the fresh, hot  pizza

Number five: The selection of pizza was less than desirable

I won't ever return to this place as there are much better pizza places in Hendersonville. They can be found on Yelp as well.

Waaaay too expensive for what you get for $12.99! Feeble salad bar, small 'buffet', veggies straight out of a can with not a speck of seasoning, pasty potatoes with canned gravy, fried chicken was good, didn't try pizza so can't  comment. Chocolate pudding for dessert. On website offered 20% senior discount, only gave 10% until I showed them their website then was very amiable to issue credit. Offered me $5 discount card for next visit but was honest and told them I  most likely wouldn't be back. Poor food, high price, at $6.99, maybe. Don't waste your money.

Maybe I was expecting too much after seeing Internet video of salad bar and all. To begin with, the handicap parking in OPPOSITE of the wheelchair ramp, you pay upon entering,go to a different area for plate and silverware,attempt to get in line only to find the salad is warm, the lettuce has black spots, then you can't squeeze the dressing from the plastic bottle for the salad, you go to a dirty table and set down one piece of chicken and two tbsp. of salad, and return to the drink station. Poorly arranged layout. The mashed potatoes looked with gray hard lumps of something alien. The green beans looked like they had food coloring added; nothing seemed appetizing to me and I was starving. I will not be back;sorry,I was expecting better.So disappointed!

Great job guys. Every flavor was really good. I was very impressed. Especially for a pizza buffet. The people working here are working hard. I give this place an A. Be sure to watch my video review on YouTube "Jack on the Go" show.

The chicken and pizza is way to greasy. I can understand why it's called cactus bread I choked on how dry it was. There was a balled up wet napkin in our napkins there was salt and pepper all over the table and there was a cockroach under our table. This was not worth the $12 won't be coming back.

First let me say this review is for a delivery order of fried chicken from "The Country's Best Fried Chicken" as listed on Door Dash. They do not show this fried chicken is really from pizza ranch. Had I known I probably wouldn't have ordered. 

Had the 8pc chicken dinner with cole slaw and waffle fries. The chicken itself is decent. Not the best but not the worst, on par with Walmart fried chicken. The waffle fries arrived cold and no longer crispy. Obviously not freshly made for our order. Probably pulled off the buffet line. The cole slaw is equivalent to pre packaged store bought slaw. The whole meal was just kind of meh. 

I am a little put off that they advertise on door dash as something other than pizza ranch.  The meal being sub par just makes it worse.

I was hoping this pizza/chicken buffet would be more like Shakey's and less like Mr. Gatti's or CiCi's.  Don't get me wrong, it is better than CiCi's and Gatti's but not much. Pizza was typical buffet pizza - fair/average.  The fried chicken was very good. Reminds me of broasted chicken.  The $15 price is not worth it to me. If this was Shakey's quality then it would be. Chicken was the highlight. However, for $1 more I can spend $16 at Monell's  (breakfast or lunch) for all you can eat chicken, 3 other entrees, homemade sides, biscuits, cornbread, dessert and drinks.  The young man running the register, Kai, has a great attitude and is very friendly. Everyone was nice and helpful. It was opening night and they ran out of ice. Having over 200 other locations they should have known on opening night to buy extra bags of ice to supplement the ice maker as I'm sure this has happened before. I'm not a fan of luke warm pop or tea.  If you are okay with CiCi's and Gatti's then you'll really like Pizza Ranch.
Mashed potatoes kind of TV dinner quality, but pizza and chicken both excellent. Love the cactus bread!

First off the food was good not gonna lie about that. But it is absolutely disgusting when you have 5 employees on break at once and they chose to sit near our table and they are making comments on customers asking whether they are a boy or a girl and then talk about they late night fun with they're boyfriends ... honestly even tho the food was good I'd would leave 0 stars if possible because it's not always about the food it's also about the environment you have around you .

I've ordered twice from here through UberEats (once from the Memorial location and once from the Waters location) and it's been very good each time.  I was surprised at how well the tostones kept together considering the delivery time and my co-workers raved about their meals.  My first time I got the pork tostones and my second time I got the shrimp.  You're better off staying away from the shrimp.  While the flavors are good, you can tell it's frozen shrimp and mine were overcooked this time around.  

Despite that, this place is still a five-star restaurant keeping in mind that this isn't supposed to be fine dining.  :-)

Stopped by to grab a quick bite before picking my kids up from school nearby. Tried the empanadas and rellenos. Both prepared fresh and delicious. There homemade hot sauce was also full of flavor with a perfect level of heat. Definitely will be back.

Always been a huge fan of the stationary food truck so I was hype to see this business step up to getting a brick and mortar building. I'm the type of person who hates to wait outside so I will drive the extra 10 minutes to come to this location. The food was s always fresh and delicious. I never have had a problem or complaint. When the sign outside says made fresh to order they really mean it. This is my second night getting dinner from them. I will try to take photos but Lord knows the food was so good I was finished before I thought  of taking photos lol. Anywho the food is simple, fresh and authentic... Perfect and a coin well spent!!!!

Very authentic puertorrican tostones and mofongo. I have tried almost everything there and have no complaints at all. The prices are good for the quantity of food they serve. The cashier is very nice and sweet.  The only advice I have for them is that the mofongo is served with a little bit too much of garlic on top of it. You can use way less or ask the customer if they want the garlic.

Awesome tostones!! Everything was made fresh tostones, Pico de Gallo fantastic really authentic Latin/Hispanic cuisine!! Lot of food for the price.You need to give this place a try!! Oh...service was also great too!!
Literally the best. I can't wait to get more to be honest! And the garlic sauce is just Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!! Very nice place and clean and family friendly

From start to finish it was amazing. I had to peek into the kitchen to see if my mom was back there cooking. Very flavorful, we had the tostones, alcapurias, pastelito de carne..... wow! 

The place super clean, friendly staff, very inviting atmosphere. We will definitely be back.

Ok so I came here thinking it was still a different food business but found tostones inc instead, they did not disappoint! I got the rice bowl which came out really quickly and the baked chicken was really really really tasty. The girl who took my order was very helpful with choosing something good as well. I assume they are newly opened in this location and my only suggestion would be to place a bigger menu out to read because the one behind the counter was a little hard to read, maybe by where the sauces go. I will be sure to recommend to my co workers and will be back!
Best mofongo in Tampa! And i could drink their mayoketchup and garlic sauce. I make any excuses to go over there and eat.

This place truly does have the best Tostones! And I try them everywhere that has them. To explain them is that they are crispy without being dried out. I understand they are cooked different depending on who cooks them Cubans, Columbians etc. I just love the way they do it here. 

I got the jibarito today and honestly it was missing things like tomato's and lettuce leaving it rather plain. I suppose I will just have them add that next time. I'm sure it's just preference. The quality is very good. 

Yes service was nice and the place was very cute, quaint.

So happy I finally got to experience this absolutely delicious food! Stopped in for takeout for me and my co-worker, we've both wanted to try for awhile. It did not disappoint! I had the rellenos,pork and picadillo, and he got the tostones nachos with pork, both were piping hot, crispy tostones and flavorful fillings. Always go supreme with the rellenos, the Pico and avocado put it at the next level. Also recommend the homemade hotsauce, it's got flavor and the perfect amount of heat. We both had very happy bellies! We'll be back and taking everyone!

Delicious, cheap food.

One tostones nachos plate will feed you for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I'm serious, I skipped breakfast, ate here with a friend for lunch and I have half of it saved for dinner. It's been two hours and I still feel stuffed. I think it is a combination of size and the fact that it's heavy food, this isn't diet stuff. 

The tostones are clearly cooked in oil. It's not super greasy, but I felt like it weighed me down a bit by the end. That's the main reason I took some home. However, they were delicious. Here's the breakdown of the food.

BEEF EMPANADA - the outer casing was light and crispy, I loved it. The beef was very good too. It's huge so you can definitely share it between two people, which is what we did.

TOSTONES NACHOS - You can choose two toppings, so I went with avocado and shrimp salad. Both have a lot of tomatoes so next time I'd switch one of them for a meat. It's big and is definitely a good choice if you're hungry. The sauces are where it's at. There's a ketchup/mayo dip and a garlic one. Both are amazing and I would just eat the dip and tostones as a great snack.

The service is great. Everyone is super friendly.

They don't have free water, only water bottles, just as an fyi. They said it's because they don't have a filter for water. 

This place is fantastic. It was pretty empty on Friday at lunch. If you're in the area, I'd highly suggest it!
The food here was excellent! I can't wait to go back again for the Mofongo and the tostones rellenos with pork was amazing! This place is a definite must try! A hidden gem in Tampa.

So far I haven't tasted anything I don't like here. It's all delicious comfort food. Latin American food items from various countries. It's like they took all the favorite items from Latin cuisine and made delicious handheld treats from them. And I'm ALL ABOUT IT!

This place specializes in tostones so I was very excited to try their food! I ordered the steak with onions and tostones as the side. As you can see - the serving was quite large and the tostones did not disappoint! I was a bit underwhelmed with the steak which had a lot of pepper and was quite chewy. I'd go back again to have the tostones but definitely try something else

Finally went to their new location off memorial. Husband and I went for a mini in-between work shift date. As always the food was amazing and the customer service is always great. I did give a star down because I ordered black beans and they did not put them in my lunch container. That was why I went because I was craving black beans and rice. Sad face.
We ordered a large tostones, fried cheese and guava (HIGHLY recommend), a chicken columbian empanada, 1 beef regular empanada, a lunch special of the chicharron de pollo with rice, black beans (they forgot) and Maduro, and 2 relleno cups with pork. Our total was $28 and change. We got a lot of food for what we spent. All in all it was good and satisfied us both. We will be back because they are delicious and we work down the street.

We found this spot on a whim while visiting family in Tampa. So glad we found it! Everything was amazing! The tostones sliders with Latin pork were soooo delicious. It was the perfect combination of  tostones, cabbage, Latin pork and of course the secret sauce! and the Mofongo with steak was also amazing! Pure garlicky heaven! Love it when I find a small hidden gem. I'm definitely craving it today and hope to be back very soon

Love this place! Everything that I've ever gotten from here has been absolutely amazing... The quality of the food is great... Portion sizes are well worth your money! Their food truck over on Waters Avenue is just as good but does have a smaller selection... I just ate here last night and now I wanna go back again today after making this review LOL

This place has amazing food! They take long cooking your food but the wait is worth it. I recommend the Colombian empanadas and the fried pork with mofongo.
My only complaint is that they charge extra for sauces, seems like the servers a re a bit lost on restaurant's policy. If this place was under proper management it could get to be huge in the restaurant business. 
Any way, really recommend the food in this place!

From start to finish, our experience at the new Brick and Mortar location of Tostones Inc on Memorial was PERFECT. No joke, ya'all- it was a 10/10- and exploring Tampa restaurants is a serious hobby for us! The young lady who took our order was genuine and sweet, taking so much pride in the restaurant's offerings, and welcoming us with pure HEART! Our food came out quickly, hot, fresh, and looking like fine art. The Tostones Rellenos is my fave right behind the jibarito so we all went with that. Our table was quiet because this is a legit spiritual experience! The food is AMAZING! Again on the way out we were thanked and given another message of warm welcome from the young lady taking orders. This restaurant has my business for good. Not one thing could have been better!
My sisters are obsessed with this place! They have vegetarian options as well. The portions are big!

A must try! The people are so friendly! Food was amazing! I had the fried pork and plantains. My boyfriend had the plantain bowls with spicy chicken, beef, chicken and pork. The spicy chicken and beef were our favorite!!! We also had the fired cheese! All of the food was AMAZING!!!

I've always said the small restaurants were the beat and that is absolutely the case here. They cook the food fresh to order and it was the best. Wonderful service super nice and everyone wore their mask

This was delicious food! We ordered empanadas filled with beef crispy outside shell flavorful inside. I also ordered tostones filled with pico de Gallo. Other choices of filling are also available such as Sriracha chicken or vegetarian I believe.You order at the counter the food is brought to your table and there is a smile when you look at the presentation. On the opposite counter are many sauces to choose from if you wish. This is a small fresh kitchen clean great lunch spot.This location also offers a patio for outdoor dining. May be a little noisy since it is next to Memorial Highway.

I'm born and raised in Puerto Rico (so I know my mofongos) and this has been the best mofongo I've ever had. Have had it twice already and the flavor and texture has been consistent. First time I had it with the chicken chicharron and it was really delicious, the second time I had it the fried pork and it was very delicious as well. I love the garlic sauce they put on top of the mofongo, it's a little bit strong though so make sure you rinse your mouth with some mouthwash afterwards. The only thing missing is a nice small side salad like most places give you.
The food was absolutely delicious. My only complaint was that I ordered my food "supreme" and they charged me for it but didn't make my rellenos supreme. Delicious place.

I just want to add that this place never fails to exceed expectations! Ordering through uber and it is so much food everytime and always amazing! So full of flavor! Recent tries: crazy fries, tequenos, fried cheese with guava sauce and picadillo tostones nachos. All perfection!

This place and the other one fell off, when the original order started it was Amazing food, now it's just horrible.

This is not the first time I have a issue with my food, I'm sick and tired of spending my money here never again will I go back.

This time the tostones was not verde " green " they was Maduro " sweet " 
And in top of that they was burn over cooked


The chicken forget about it you will never get good chicken with meat in it always bones 70% is all bone

The juice taste horrible. Idk if is the water they use or the ice but it taste nasty. 

Completely fell off..

Bad business

I'll be back when I'm in Tampa - really can't go wrong here. Portions are huge, prices are reasonable, service is friendly, and food is tasty. No complaints here. Oh, and get some passionfruit juice. Bruh...
The beef empanadas, alcapurria, chicharrones de pollo and carne frita, all delicious. Beans lacked salt but overall great place.

I ordered Tostones Inc through Doordash having wanted to try them for a while now since they're so close to where I live. Having a hankering for some good latin food, I went ahead and ordered. I am absolutely not a rice kind of person at all, which is prevalent in Asian and Latin food, so the tostones meal sounded like a great option for me. I picked the Zesty shrimp since I figured it would be a nice light option. All the food came out fresh and tasty and I could tell they put alot of love in food. The shrimp was light reminded me of ceviche, fresh and tasty. Now for a restaurant that was named Tostones, I had big ecpectations for their namesake food item. They definitely did not disappoint! For one they were HUGE. I got 9 of those things in my meal. I could also tell they were homemade, really thick in density, lightly salted and fried. Buyer beware, (or rejoice depending on how you look at it) they give A LOT of them. I could only eat half of them. The rest I wrapped and froze for a tasty snack later.

I hit up strike out wings food truck and got the family some dinner.  I got a catfish dinner some tenders for the kids and some wings. The catfish had nice size and  had  great spice and breading to it. The catfish and fries went great together. The kids love old the tender and fries. The I hot was sweet and sassy and strikeout sauce. The sweet sassy sauce was great with the wings. The sweet and heat went great together with some ranch dipping sauce. I also got their hottest sauce called the strikeout sauce. It had great heat and taste. I will be getting that sauce again.

So I have been wanting to try them for a while and today I went on Grubhub and got it No contact delivered. I got traditional wings and let me tell you what. SOOOO GOOD!!! I am really picky when it comes to wings and for price and size I am so happy to have found my new joint. The garlic Parmesan taste homemade sauce and the sweet and sassy. Fries are super good and crispy. Totally bang for your buck and can't wait to try more in the future

We have eaten at Strikeout a half dozen+ times and have had a great experience - the food is delicious, sauces are flavorful, and the owners are just delightful, friendly people. Once the pandemic hit we tried ordering once through Grubhub and had a less than stellar experience. I called Strikeout directly and they were super responsive. One of the owners drove over to our house to make it right. From now on, we call directly and go pick up. We know the order will be just right and one of our neighborhood faves gets our $$ (instead of Grubhub and their pesky fees!)

I would post a picture but with two teenagers and the super bowl, our 50 wings disappeared way too quick to stop for a photo shoot. I had heard lots of buzz about this new spot and after going in, I see why! The wings were amazing, the service fast and personable and honestly, it's great to support a family-owned small business run by a Nashville native. We'll be back (soon if our kids have something to do with it) to try the fries and the rest of the flavors.

Our 1st visit to this establishment and it was very, very good. We called ahead to ask if they were allowing you to sit inside & also inquired about the wing flavors. The responses to both were positive and really made us want to stop by. We ordered the sweet and sassy wings and they were awesome.
The restaurant was very clean and the service was quick and professional. They also allowed us to sample the sauces before ordering.
We will return

Wow! I must say the reviews that I've read we're soo true. The chicken was amazing and the staff treated us was such amazing hospitality. If you want to fill your belly up with some of the best Chicken in Nashvile. Strikeout wingz is the spot.

Strike Out Wingz in nashville tn decided that they were not going to prepare my order that I called in 20 mins ahead of time. When I came in, I expressed that I was running late for work so I expected my order to be ready soon. They said they were running behind. I said ok and sat down. Then they came to me and asked me to pay for it. I said I'll wait until my order is ready in case it takes too long and I have to go somewhere else. They said "they dont do that" and told me I need to pay for it so they can start it. To my disbelief because now they're telling me my order hasn't even been started yet. Now I'm upset because I didn't come in and place my order, I called it in. And they tried to make up a fake policy: "we cook orders once they're paid for". Then they should of made me pay over the phone. To make matters worse when I addressed my frustration m, they called me ghetto. This establishment is racist. 1. I shouldn't have to pay for my food for you to make it. I can pay for it right before you give it to me. 2. I'm not ghetto because I don't like your unfair business practices. This was my first time attempting to go to this place and by their customer service I doubt they'll be around for awhile.

I got a Yelp alert to try this place and I'm glad I did. It's been my go-to wing spot in 2020. 

My first time in the lovely lady working the register let me try their sauces and some fries. My normal order is a ten piece lemon pepper fried hard with fries and the fries are sooo good.

I went recently on a Tuesday and was happy to see they have a $0.69 wing deal! They have plenty of space to sit if you want to dine in, but I usually call ahead and pick up within 15 minutes. You won't be disappointed!!

Discovering Strikeout Wingz is single handily keeping me in Nashville for at least another year. I have lived all over this great nation of ours and I judge my love a city based on their buffalo wing situation. Don't get me wrong, Nashville hot chicken is fine, but classic buffalo hot wings are my favorite. I tried all of the suggested local places the first year I lived here, nothing to knock my socks off. I honestly was losing hope in the buffalo chicken wing situation, then I saw a yelp suggestions for Strikeout Wingz and boy I'm so glad this place found me. These Wings are so crisp and the buffalo sauce has that perfect flavor. I hope to see these guys competing for gold at the international Buffalo wing festival in Buffalo, NY in a few years. Through all of the turmoil here in Nashville in 2020, Strikeout Wingz has been an epically amazing bright spot. You guys should definitely give them a try!

Wow! I moved here from Atlanta a couple years ago and have been longing for a great wing place. Ordered the 10 Hot flavored wings, and they were on point, with plenty of meat and sauce. The seasoned fries came with the wings were also great. The service from the young lady at he counter was also impressive, going even as far as letting me sample a couple of the flavors before I ordered. Definitely will be a repeat customer.

Got the Lemon Pepper and Garlic Parm boneless wings and they are fire! I'm from Memphis and these are the best lemon pepper wings I've ever had. I definitely recommend coming here! Friendly staff too!
Great service and quality! The Cajun ranch fries were bomb & amazing lemon pepper wings! Would highly recommend!!
We have been looking for great wings in our area and we finally found a place! The quality is wonderful and the wings are reasonably priced. We cannot wait to go back!

Came here due to all the positive Yelp reviews, and let me say, THEY GOT IT RIGHT! The wings were perfect! Got the Sweet and Sassy wings and they were a perfect combo of buffalo and some honey BBQ. I would've taken a picture but the food looked so good I had to eat it! The staff was so kind and constantly checked in on us, it really added to the whole experience. If I wasn't driving through, I would be coming every week! Thank you, Strike Out!
This place is really good. When they tell you the strikeout sauce is really spicy they are NOT kidding. The wings are perfectly crispy. The Buffalo fries are delish. Will definitely be back.

Seriously some of the best wings I have had in the last 15 years. The different sauces and the size of the wings has now made this family-run eatery a must for my family and I highly recommend people try both locations.
I was vacationing in Nashville and was craving some wings. All the other reviews are on point. The wings were delicious and the staff was very nice.

1 star food & service

Ordered via Grubhub.

Food was packaged neat & nicely. Cheeseburger was good & tasty, meat was well seasoned.  Fries were old & reheated so they were hard & dry.  20 pc bone-in wings were not good but they had potential.  Ordered 10 lemon pepper & 10 garlic parm.  Wings were old & clearly had been reheated to the point they were hard & dry.  Lemon pepper was way too salty.  Garlic parm was too oily & had a weird off-taste.  I say these have potential if owners would ease up on the salt  & care enough to serve fresh food & not old food they don't want to throw away but should.  Out of the 20pc wings, only 9 were edible.  The other 11 were too old, dry, hard, black grayish color to even eat so they went into the garbage.  I won't order from this company again.
Ready and waiting. Lots of flavor. Very saucy.  My guy had my order waiting on me. Lemon pepper and garlic Parmesan

The wings are great but did not appreciate getting cursed out by the cook for coming in 20 minutes before close on Sunday. He went as far as attempting to refund my order (but I used a gift card) - that's how badly the cook didn't want to work the last 20 minutes. He also cursed out the poor teenage girl cashier. 

Don't tell the world you are open till 7pm then get mad when a customer comes in at 6:40pm. Keep your bad attitudes and unprofessional behavior and I'll go back to Hooters.

This place is most definitely a hidden gem. Originally we were aiming for Wing Stop. They were closed for whatever reason (very unprofessional establishment anyway might I add), but I was determined to get my wings one way or another. So I went online and found this place that wasn't too far. Best decision ever. The inside is decorated nicely. It's Baseball themed which I think is very unique. They have a bar you can sit at, as well as plenty of regular seating. They have big screen tvs all around so it really gives you that "Bar atmosphere." The workers are friendly, and the service is surprisingly quick for it to be a smaller business. If you're like me and you enjoy smaller wings over those gigantic ones you'll most definitely love this place. They have a variety of sauces, but I went for my usual lemon pepper and it was SO GOOD. They even let you get the wing sauces/seasonings on your fries. We got to meet the owner, and he's so friendly. It's always a plus when the business is black owned! I have no complaints at all with this place, and I can't wait to go back and try more.

After traveling from Houston to Nashville, this was our first real meal of the day and boy was it worth it!! If you're a wing fan you definitely want to try Strikeout Wingz! It's a small local establishment but they have great customer service and you can sample all the   sauces!  Their signature is the sweet & sassy; sweet with a bit of spiciness (like me ). My daughter and I had the sweet & sassy and the spicy lemon pepper; you'll see the pictures listed below. You also have to try their fried pickles; they are delicious! I also had the Koolaid Rita and they also have a Koolaid of the day! Oh Yeah !  Oh and I forgot that mention all the sauces are wet sauces, so if you're on a date and you don't want your special someone to see you lick your fingers; don't come here until you feel comfortable because it's that good!! All in all this is a place that I would visit to watch the game and know that I'm going to have good food and drinks!! If you're ever in Nashville this is one place where you'll definitely want to Strikeout!!
I remember coming in when they first opened and I've been hooked since! They got the best lemon pepper wings in the city and I'll put them up against anybody!
Sooooo good and soooo gone. Staff is awesome wings are fire.  Sweet and Sassy sauce is delicious.

My first time trying the wings and they were horrible..  lacked flavor and the sauce was not present at all sooo disrespectful to hot wings!! The customer service was nonexistent the young man was trying his hardest it was his first day so he did exceptionally well considering his circumstances. There was a middle age lady who was rude. I won't be returning!!  Buffalo Chicken Fries Combo

Strike Out Wingz in nashville tn decided that they were not going to prepare my order that I called in 20 mins ahead of time. When I came in, I expressed that I was running late for work so I expected my order to be ready soon. They said they were running behind. I said ok and sat down. Then they came to me and asked me to pay for it. I said I'll wait until my order is ready in case it takes too long and I have to go somewhere else. They said "they dont do that" and told me I need to pay for it so they can start it. To my disbelief because now they're telling me my order hasn't even been started yet. Now I'm upset because I didn't come in and place my order, I called it in. And they tried to make up a fake policy: "we cook orders once they're paid for". Then they should of made me pay over the phone. To make matters worse when I addressed my frustration m, they called me ghetto. This establishment is racist. 1. I shouldn't have to pay for my food for you to make it. I can pay for it right before you give it to me. 2. I'm not ghetto because I don't like your unfair business practices. This was my first time attempting to go to this place and by their customer service I doubt they'll be around for awhile. Pictured below is the lady who disrespected me.
Love this new spot! Big wings and favorable sauces. Family owned vibes w/ great service, would definitely recommend.
Got Bar-b-que wings delivered. They were very good and a good value. I look forward to the next time I am in wing mode.
Really good wings! Haven't tried anything else. I would definitely recommend this place.
Owner is real nice and the sauces for the wings are great. Always a pleasant experience dining here.

The wings here are *chefs kiss*. Truly. I've been here twice now and I don't see myself trying any other wing places. My go-to order is the 6-piece bone-in wing meal and it leaves me feeling satisfied each time. Their wings are cooked to perfection. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Only negative thing I'll say is that I wish their wings had a little more meat. A couple of the wings I've had had barely any meat and I felt ripped off. The sauces I've tried are the lemon pepper, sweet & sassy, and garlic parm. All of which were phenomenal! Their fries come with a tasty seasoning on them which is a plus as well. Highly recommend giving this place a try!
Wings were great and the shrimp was fire! Definitely  going to stop by more often. Great staff they had and dude named Aram really throws it down there! Keep it up!

This place is amazing! Super clean! Delicious food and Great customer service (really an understatement)! 

This is my new favorite wing spot. Food was prepared in a timely manner. Everything was so flavorful and fresh.

So glad I gave Strikeout Wingz a try. Can't wait until you come to Atlanta!!!! 

Thanks for everything!!!!
The lemon Pepper wings are the best I've ever had! The fries are really great and I love the fried pickles and mozzarella sticks. I just wish they had more sauces.
Excellent service, great food my favorite was the Lemon Pepper and Sweet and Sassy.  The wings were super juicy and melts in your mouth good. I will definitely come back when I am in Nashville!
Really great wings. They were fast and even called to let me know when they were ready. I got the lemon pepper wings tossed in buffalo. 10/10 worth my 1st yelp review
Those were some solid wings. I'll skip the fries next time so I can have more chicken!

My new favorite wing spot. PERIODT!!! This place was suggested by a friend of mine. We decided to make a trip to Strikeout for lunch. Trying to get my order was a bit of a hassle. I ordered and paid for my food on the website. We arrived at the restaurant hoping to be greeted by a few employees. NOT!!! We waited at the counter for about 5 mins. We had to find someone to help us with our order. When we did find someone, she was very apologetic and made sure our food was properly bagged and gave us a little extra for the wait. The Food: worth the wait. If you don't like your wings well seasoned, this is not the place for you. The seasoning and taste definitely packs a punch. The Buffalo chicken fries are my favorite menu item. This place would have gotten 5 stars but a customer should not be looking for employees to service them. Overall, the food was delicious and filling. I do recommend going and trying them out.

I have been looking for good wings in Nashville ever since I moved 4 years. THANK GOD for Strikeout wings. They understand the perfect wing formula: doneness, quality sauces, and good service. The staff is friendly and helpful. This is my wings place from now on.

Their customer service is horrible and super ghetto!! Do not patronize this establishment!! They are not allowed to be rude to customers!! We make the business successful! As a patron I will never support an establishment that mistreats and disrespects their customers!!
The service provided and the food were amazing. Definitely making another trip here in the near future.

Best wings in town great vibe too 
Great place to hang and study.
And they have 69 cent wings on Tuesday.
I honestly think I've tried ever wing place in Nashville and this is the best places hands down couldn't be more pleased with the food

The best wings I've found in Nashville! Lemon peppers are a must. The Strike Out level spice is INTENSE. Don't order unless you're ready to cry a little. We order wings from here at least once a month, and they're consistent every time.

Though the place doesn't seem to have much business at night, i stopped in to test them out. Ordered the Whiting fish plate. It was delicious! Very tidy and cooked so well. I'll be eating there again!

Went to strikeout Wingz for the first time today and I love it. My favorite thing was the amazing customer service from the young man cashier was. He was so polite and respectful. That made me want to support the business more and write a review! 

Aside from that, I called in my order and it was a ready and correct in about 10 minutes from when I called it in. I got the sweet & sassy 6pc. The wings had the right amount of sauce and the sauce was delicious! I wanted to do half hot and half sweet and sassy just in case it wasn't good but they don't split sauces on a 6pc. Thankfully I wasn't disappointed! Seasoned fries were also delicious! One thing I had to remember to do was ask for ranch, it didn't automatically come in the box but thankfully not an up charge! 

Honestly I would support this business and eat here for all my wing cravings! 

Only suggestion is to get homemade ranch rather than the commercialized containers. Not very tasty but sufficed for my meal. 

Y'all are doing amazing! Thank you!
Being from Atlanta they have best lemon pepper wings I've had in Nashville. Plus... The wings are $0.60 on Tuesdays!!

Go here!!! We needed somewhere to get wings that wasn't a chain. I'm so excited that this place opened.  They have the standard wing flavors yet also fun and exciting ones. The fries are delicious also. $69 cent wing Tuesday!?! Y'all should be flocking here. 

The associate that helped us found out that it was our first time and gave us a sample plate of the sauces. Incredible service.

All I have to say is BEST WINGZ EEEEVVVVEEEERRRRR
Sauce is beast! Definitely recommend this place!!!

Super cool vibe. Went on Cinco de Mayo and got a margarita tower and there was no alcohol in the margs at all. The waitress was great and the food was good, otherwise! Would recommend food but not the marg tower.

Came here after visiting Tinsel (they're right next door). Got the nachos with chicken on top and it was soooo good. Maybe it was my drunkenness?? Lol because I basically ate the whole thing. Next time I'll ask for less chicken and more of the other fun toppings. My friend and I definitely want to come for brunch and check out some more items.
No more margarita towers!! So annoyed! Literally the only reason I went. The food os average. Your typical tacos and nachos ‍. Definitely won't be back until the tower returns!

I have been seeing so many people post about this place and their margarita towers was a huge reason why I wanted to come here. My bf and I came here with a couple friends bc of the margaritas towers and were so excited until we were told they no longer serve margarita towers. So we decided to get one round of drink and an app. We all got the pineapple coconut margarita and the queso fundido. The margarita was really good as well as the queso but we were all bummed out they no longer have the tower margaritas!

Why do the nachos cost $15 and then you have to pay another $5 for chicken/pork/etc.? Literally tasted like tostitos. Waitress stared at us the entire time from afar which was off putting, and the food runner that kept coming over to us was strange. Just felt like an overall weird vibe. 

Drinks were watered down, we didn't get the "free" dessert for some reason, and the food was way way way overpriced for what it was. Would not recommend.

Honestly not worth it. Food and drinks are average but the worst part is the service/check situation. I called them earlier to make sure they did happy hour and they said yes but didn't mention to me that it was at the bar only (had I known I wouldn't have even gone). We still sat down and ordered and when the bill came we split it between two cards. When we got our checks we saw that she put the entire charge on one card and then half the charge on another card??? When we talked to the server she told us it was some prior authorization but she actually just charged us wrong. Then we spoke to the manager Megan who re charged us the correct amount and said to keep an eye on our credit card statements and if anything was wrong to call her. The week after we both checked our cards and were double charged. When we tried calling the number she gave us it didn't work. So basically not worth the effort.

We had such a good time here! We came after Nightmare before Tinsel and our server, David, was awesome! My partner and I got engaged earlier that day and he made us feel so special. The shrimp tacos were yummy also.

I haven't seen someone so rude as a server. We had to ask sides to our meals about three different times in order to get them. She didn't even want to come back to our table to serve us, sent a male bartender to ask us what if there were any problems and he could get us anything. The kitchen closed and we wanted desert and she didn't even tell us it was closing and just brought out the check to us, without asking if we needed anything else or even if our food was good. We wish gratuity wasn't included because she did not deserve that high of a tip. This is coming from servers ourselves. If you go here do not get Jennifer as a server. The food on the other hand was very good.

Food was mediocre and menu is entirely unclear. Got nachos and guacamole and it was $60! Waitress didn't even tell us the margarita house tequila was espolon.... expensive bill without even being asked if we wanted it. Pissed off out to dinner and ruined our date. Never coming back. Dodge this place if you can. The food is equivalent to chipotle for 3x the price. Save yourself the paycheck and go somewhere where you don't sit on a bench and get rushed out of your table. Extremely unhappy.

Omg... what can I SAY?! This is the best dining experience I've had the whole quarantine. Ethan, the GOAT server was so fast and efficient. The FOOD? DAWG. Top tier. I had the nachos and steak tacos and my fiancé had the shrimp tacos. I can ensure you this place is great! We literally booked another reservation while dining. 10/10, we can't wait to go back!

Vampires kiss cocktail is soooo good.  Staff is amazing  (Antoinette our server we love you) and outdoor seating is safe with heaters!!!  Great new tequila bar / restaurant that I love supporting during these crazy times.

My husband and I went here for dinner on Saturday night.  Obviously, it is going to be busy which we expected. We had 730 reservations and we got there about 20 minute early.  We checked in, fully expecting to have to wait for our table, which we did.  Not a problem.  But they seemingly forgot about us.  Finally, after several other 730 reservations came in and were seated immediately,  at 740 we reminded them that we were there and they sat us right away.  

Our waitress was really bad.  She pretty much ignored us the whole time.  She got our drink order and we waited and waited and waited. And she finally came back to take our drink order again which we reminded her that we already ordered our drinks.  We also orders chips and guacamole.  We ate all the chips and guacamole because we were hungry and our waitress was nowhere to be founds. Finally she came back and said oh your orders will be right up when we hadn't even ordered our dinner yet. So we ordered our dinner.  We also ordered another round of drinks which didn't come until halfway into us eating our dinner.  

The food was actually really good.  I had the chicken tacos and my husband had the fish tacos. The service was terrible.  The hostess was all over the place and seemed very disorganized.  Our waitress was absent pretty much the whole time and didn't seem to know or remember what she was doing.  It was very frustrating.  We even decided against another round of drinks and dessert because the service was just terrible.  

It was a cute place, but the music was super loud. Thumping loud.  I enjoyed the music, but thought it could've been toned down a bit.  

Overall, good food, terrible service, ok ambiance.

This place has a pretty nice ambiance. I ordered the chicken nachos and the Otoño cocktail. Let me begin with the nachos...wack. Most the cheese wasn't melted. A total of 3 black beans came with the nachos. The cocktail...watered down. All of the flavor was in on the rim of the glass. I'm pretty sure I was drinking Jose Cuervo Margarita Mix. Now for the service...slow. I would like to mention the ambiance is nice.

Honestly the server was the only pleasant thing about this experience, she was a sweetheart and very patient with us. And I'm the type of person that's not cheap, doesn't mind spending money going out, but everything was ridiculously over priced, and the food was awful. Steak in the tacos were fatty and they weren't even in a proper taco shell. They were in a whole wheat pita. The chips in the nachos tasted store bought and the chicken was lackluster. I understand we're in difficult times right now, but I've continued to go out during corona, but this was just awful.
Nicolette was our server and she was so nice. She made sure that we felt comfortable and was very attentive.  Food was mad good!
This place is very cool and the food is great! It is definitely a hidden gem in Philadelphia. The tacos are amazing and the margaritas are awesome!
Worst service ever.  Was sat 45 minutes after reservation time.  We did not receive service after 45 mins after we sat.  We left and will never be back

I will be honest, I love tacos and Mexican food. This place is horrible and the service is trash. I was excited to go but honestly if you care about service DO NOT GO HERE. 1. Gratuity is included in your bill already 18% which is not a problem if the service was actually great but it was horrible. Our waitress never came to take our order for about 30 minutes, never checked up. We had to even ask someone else for our bill. The guy that brought us our food spilled the drinks. Honestly the drinks are watered down and all ice. The liquor tower was ranging 65-110 and child it was all ice and juice I was pissed. Listen to me, I never write reviews but to my fellow people save your money and go to el vez, this place is trash.
Went here during the October nightmare in Tinsel. The cocktails were ok, and the waitress was nice and attentive. The food is overpriced and bland, definitely wasn't worth what they were asking for.
Service was good, busy Saturday! Fair price for a center city restaurant in my opinion.

Sueno started off excellent. I've been about 8 times. Over time it just stopped hitting. The shrimp tacos are excellent and so is the blueberry marg. However service can be so so, the loss of the marg tower really sucked.

If you're going to Sueno for the tower margarita, then DON'T! I can't believe we spent $90+ for juice. There was literally no alcohol in it. I left feeling more sober than I came in. The restaurant uses shady practices by not posting any prices, so you literally don't know the cost of anything until you get the bill. The food was actually good, but it still isn't good enough to pay $90+ for a freaking tower of juice. I don't see this place staying around long because word of mouth will shut them down!!

I found this place on TikTok and I thought it looked cool with the big tower drink, but I was EXTREMELY disappointed. There was little to no alcohol whatsoever in that expensive tower drink. It's one thing to try to save money for your restaurant, but to jerk ppl by adding AN EXCESSIVE AMOUNT of  lime jus to these drinks to make us think it's ALCOHOL is a scumbag move. I left feeling like I got jerked and that's not cool. Food was also mediocre

I wanted to like this place so bad because I love tacos! But this place really did not hit the mark. The food took forever to come out, our server was MIA pretty much the entire night, the drinks that we ordered which ranged from $13-$15 literally were watered down to the max to the point where you didnt even feel a buzz at all. I felt like I was at some cheap college bar getting a well drink. The food was just super boring. My friends ordered the empanadas which they said it was pretty good. I ordered the cauliflower tacos and the flavors if they tried to put together honestly was like they were just doing too much!  I've never heard of buffalo cauliflower with refried beans it just doesn't sound good and it didn't taste good either. The guacamole was horrible. I mean I don't know what happened back there in the kitchen I'm not trying to be mean right now but they really need to update her guacamole skills. You can't be a Mexican restaurant and suck at guacamole- it's a staple. But what I will say is the ambience in the restaurant is really nice. I'll give them props for that. Wish I had a better experience. IDK  maybe it was just because it was their opening weekend and that's the reason why everything wasn't as great as it could be but I'm hoping that with the feedback maybe they'll revitalize their menu and make some changes.

food is amazing. my favorite margarita: pineapple coconut, but try the flight. Amal makes the best margaritas and made sure to check on us during a super busy time! the taco salad is delicious and filling. good music and nice location

Just stopped in for a marg to go. Granted we did upgrade to casamigos but 44 dollars for 2 margaritas was ridiculous. Above all I had a 2 fruit flys in the overpriced sour mix heavy drink. Won't be returning.
Nicolette is awesome. Drinks are excellent! We enjoyed the outdoor dining option with heated lamps.

Went in excited about their margarita tower but left disappointed. My friend and I ordered the strawberry flavor for 2 people we got about 7/8 glasses per person which is good, however, we could not taste the alcohol. It tasted like pure sugar and couldn't finish the tower. We felt somewhat sick and tired because of the amount of sugar we consumed.

Food wise was alright. We had the chicken and beef empanadas (we preferred the beef) beef tacos and the street corn. Decent flavor and price -- I didn't find it as anything especially. 

Overall it was ok -- would probably only go back for the beef empanadas.
LOVE THIS BAR! Ethan and David are amazing servers!!! Loved the lemon drops and steak tacos highly recommend. The heated picnic tables are a god send and so is the service. Xoxo

Due to the MOUSE we saw I wish I was able to give no stars!. Went here for date night. I was excited to finally try this place! The restaurant is cute with a nice ambiance. We sat on the second floor overlooking the restaurant. I ordered a mango margarita that was really sweet and couldn't taste any alcohol. I didn't complain. We put our food orders in. While waiting we were having a conversation when I saw something move out of the corner of my eye. I thought, no I'm imagining things. Went back to talking to see a MOUSE running around! YES A MOUSE!! I'm deathly afraid of mice! I get enough courage up to hop up and run down the steps to tell the hostess and she was not the least bit surprised!!! She told her manager and then said we were good to go! Then our server comes and I say you can cancel my order. She says you still have to pay for your marg! I'm like no! Then the server told her the manager said we were okay to leave!!!
Imagine how the kitchen is if mice are freely running around and OBVIOUSLY, the staff knows!

Food is awesome, Nicholette was a awesome waitress !!
Fajitas& guacamole is theee bestttt
We were seated outside..drinks were great as was the Elote and the tacos,  however the guacamole was kinda bland. Server was very nice! Love the decor inside when I sneaked a peak
We've had Antoinette as our server here twice and she's so friendly and attentive. Quick friendly service, great food, fun drinks and amazing spooky atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Highly unsatisfied with this establishment. Went for drinks and a shareable app Saturday night with a reservation and requested outdoor seating on opentable but was seated indoors (NBD). Excited to try some fall drinks at a new restaurant and got misrepresented watered-down drinks. The vampire's kiss tasted like a watered-down margarita with Tajin chile lime seasoning on the rim, same thing for the Otoño drink except with a honey/cinnamon rim which isn't indicated as so on the menu. Ordered chicken nachos which we waited 25min for only to see the food runner place it on another table mistakenly, the highlight for the nachos was the shredded chicken and the rest was mediocre. Definitely better options in the area, was really unimpressed by this one.

My husband and I came here tonight for Cinco de Mayo.  As soon as we were seated our waitress came over and told us she'd be back with some water before we placed our orders. At least 20 minutes passed by when she finally came back she asked us if we knew what we wanted WITH NO WATER IN HAND. we ended up just ordering a strawberry mint margarita tower and steak nachos which came out at a decent time. Both were great! But, when it came down to the service it was ridiculous. I understand it was busy but keep in mind as soon as your seated you only get 90 min at the table before you have to leave. I swear we waited at least an hour from the time we were seated to when it was time too leave for someone to come by. I want to say we waited at least 30 minutes to close the bill before i ended up having too grab another waitress to see about her closing us up. I only rated this a 3 star because of the food and drinks!!! If you like good food and drinks I recommend but please be ready to wait a LONG time.
The service is slooooow. However the food was amazing! Great quesadillas and street corner!

Sueno! Wow! Great Mexican food and the drink are absolutely marvelous. Especially the tower Margarita. The tower is great for a small group. Our server Nicolette was the one of the best, great spirit and personality. Respectably nice crowd of people enjoying the food is a plus too.

I was really excited to try this place. A friend and I went on a Saturday night and sat at the bar for a bite and a few drinks. The food and drinks were good. I got the passion fruit marg and a quesadilla. They were pretty understaffed which I completely understand but where we were sitting we were immersed in the staff drama and arguing. Nobody seemed to care that we could hear them arguing, complaining, and cursing. I was stunned. That behavior in front of customers I found to be unprofessional especially to not even acknowledge the awkward position we were put in being there.

Yelp review 

The Christmas spirit is alive and well at sueño. Make sure to stop by and reserve an igloo (outdoor section). You will not regret stopping by. Make sure to ask for David the bartender he was incredible and brought the Christmas spirit alive. In fact, I made this account solely to review and shower this place and David with absolute  praise. And also ask for the Cas'amigo cookie and slice of apple pie (21+ *wink*). It was an experience close to what I envision the North Pole to provide.  Amazing. Magical. And the music was spot on. 

By golly, have a holly jolly Christmas at Sueño.

P.S. order the cheese thing (David will know)
Had a reservation, sat there for 20 minutes and no one came by the table. Figured the rest of the meal would have just as bad service, so we left. Menu looked super overpriced.
Great place, great service, especially the bartender Amal, definitely come and see her!!
The atmosphere is great, music, decor! The music was the right volume so you can talk. Our Server Nicollett was very hospitable and fun! The margarita tower was good, I'll be back for more drinks!

We had a great experience at Sueno for our friends Birthday. David was our waiter and angel sent from the heavens above. He was charming, sassy and hilarious. We miss him already  The food was delicious and the drinks hit the spot. We had so much fun - even during a pandemic! The staff wore their masks correctly the entire time. We can't wait to come back! Love you, David! Thanks for the sippy cup! From your jersey mamas

We saw a photo of the margarita tower and there was doubt that Sueno was a perfect place to visit for Cinco de Mayo.  We had a reservation for a high top table; it was perfect for two people but crowded for four. Nonetheless we enjoyed the beef and chicken empanadas which I will return to order. We weren't sold on the margarita flights but the margarita tower was enough for four people to have two drinks and that was fine. We also loved the fact that they have takeout cups. I understand that Covid-19 has put restraints on seating and the allotment of time but I really wish we were able to stay longer. Will definitely return
Antoinette was amazing. Her suggested drinks for our table was right what we needed after I lost my parley. Blood bucket is a must.
Great service, Nicolette was super quick and responsive, also the food was great! Will definitely be back

*MEDIOCRE*
*3.5/5*

If you want a casual place to grab tapas and drinks, this is a good place for that. This two story restaurant has more of a bar/club like vibe with the colored low lights and fairly loud music. Music was a bit too loud, it was hard to have a conversation. The menu is relatively small but still has a good amount of selection. Overall, it was a decent place for Mexican food, nothing special.

*DINNER*

Nachos - This is a great shareable. It was a huge portion and they did not dip out on the toppings. Overall, solid nachos

Steak Tacos - well cooked steak, not too chewy. I really like the avocado cream sauce on it.

Pulled Pork Tacos - pork was a bit dry but they give you a decent chunk of it. Personally not the biggest fan of the pineapple salsa. Love the corn tortilla 

*VERDICT*
Maybe if someone ask me to or I would go for drinks.
Absolutely disgusting place. Horrible clientele and atmosphere. I have told every single person I know to avoid this place like the plague. Take your money elsewhere. BEWARE.
Great vibes, food, and music. However, the margaritas were the BEST!! Our server Mariah was fantastic and would def come back again.
Service was delicious our server was Nicolette and the food was fresh and amazing!!! Will definitely make this a regular spot!!!

If you are a Mexican this spot might be for you. Soon as you walk in you can feel a nice vibe with their music. My friend and I had just came from a happy hour before and ate so we really just came to drink so we decided to try their margarita tower that a was around $60 for around 80 oz. it was pretty much about 4 drinks for each of of us. We decided to go with a strawberry flavor which turned out pretty good. Since you have to order a food item to dine we just got a order of street corn that was tasty. I definitely want to go back to try more food options like the tacos and or nachos etc.

DO NOT ORDER THE MARGARITA TOWER. It had literally 0% alcohol. We all walked away without a buzz and a sugar headache. Unbelievably not worth the cost. There are much better Mexican restaurants nearby in Philly so this one should not make your list

This place is absolutely amazing. Where do I even start. We picked the place at random for dinner, not knowing anything about it. Best decision we could have made! The lighting and ambiance was on another level, the margaritas and food were absolutely fantastic, and don't even get me started on the service! I will say this - I've NEVER had such good service at a restaurant before. Our waitress/server, Imani, was an absolute delight! She was warm and genuine, kept checking up on us throughout the night, super chatty and friendly, and literally went out of her way to make our night better in every regard - food, drinks, company, you name it. The bartender and manager were super nice and friendly as well! It's definitely a place I will be going back to and it's worth every penny we spent!

Wonderful food and great atmosphere! Nikki was our waitress and was so helpful, friendly, and made sure we got the best drinks & had a great time! We stumbled upon Sueno during our visit and will definitely be back! Perfect night out for great Mexican food in the city.
Food was mediocre. Service was friendly. But atmosphere blah. They were out of most draft beers. Save your energy and money and go to Mission Taquería.

I enjoyed the ambiance, decor, and service!

I ordered a margarita flight and a classic margarita. 

Thoughts on margarita flight - really love the idea of a margarita flight. You can choose 3 flavors on the menu. I liked the guava, classic, and blueberry basil. I chose to go with the house tequila bc why not, it's cheaper. They list up to 3 types of tequila (low to high) so definitely clarify which one you want to go with. I personally couldn't taste much of the tequila in my flights and when I ordered a classic margarita - it just tasted sugary and sour from the mix, slight bummer but oh well! I read previous reviews about their drinks being too sugary and barely any tequila. 

Chips and pico were good! For $9 they give you a good amount. Chips could've been more crispy - or maybe it's supposed to taste kinda stale? O.o I used to work at El Vez so maybe I'm used to that chip style and I go to Mission Taqueria a lot so hmm... idk 

The prices on the menu seemed a bit overpriced compared to similar restaurants in the city... they didn't have a happy hour menu but that's ok. The chicken quesadilla costs $18 I don't think it should've been $18 IMO and honestly, I think that's the most I've ever paid for a chicken quesadilla. I didn't feel entirely bad about it because it tasted good, was filled with cheese and veggies and the portion is big.
Stopped by for a drink, the bartenders Z and Neisa were great. I had a fun time and the food was really good too. Get the street corn and crunchy tacos!

My good friend took me to Sueno for a celebratory dinner. We ate outside and enjoyed the liveliness of Philadelphia even on a Sunday night. We started with the queso fundido. It was tasty, however the cheese was melted in a sizable lump and a bit hard to eat. For dinner, I ordered shrimp fajitas. They were actually really good. Huge shrimp with big flavor and heaping of peppers and onions. It was delicious. Our side of guacamole was good as well. I ordered a Dark and Stormy cocktail and it was delicious. Our server Ray was attentive and patient with us while we poured over the menu and even brought me a tequila shot for my birthday! What a treat! We had a good night eating flavorful food.

This place is AWESOME!!  Came here for a drink and left a very happy customer. Amal our bartender was super fun and really made our night unforgettable. Would recommend this place for a casual dinner or even just for a few drinks. Ambiance is outta this world! 10/10
Stumbled into Sueño and had Amal as a bartender. The atmosphere was amazing and the food and drinks were even better. 10/10 would recommend if you're ever in Center City.
Nicolette is the bomb. Got us trashed and I don't know if you need to know more than that. Really cool that we get to keep our drink glasses.

Went on a weekend trip just to relax and saw the drink menu and was hooked. They do authentic Mexican food with a twist. The Mole burrito and chicken nachos was delicious. And the drinks didn't disappoint. Nice vibe and great service.

Came here for some Halloween fesitivities. 
Decorations were decent and the haunted house was okay as well. Didn't know what to expect but thought at the end of the haunted house that we'd be exit into the restaurant. Instead when done you exit into the alley. 

Staff communication sucks. Made reservations for 7:30 and was informed to wait in line for the haunted house which would only be 7-9mins. And we could go have dinner without any issues. When we made it into the restaurant the hostess told us we were late and we'd need to now wait. After explaining what staff informed us, she then said it would only be 5 mins.  We purchased tickets online and with the purchase we received complimentary drinks and dessert. The drinks was watered down, didn't taste a hint of alcohol and the dessert is a mini chocolate chip cookie with chocolate pudding on top. 

There were 4 of us so we ordered the taco meal. It looked great and we couldn't wait to dig in but all the meat on the tray was cool (not hot, not even warm).

I came here with a few friends and the place was amazing! But not as amazing as Imani and Neisa, the waitress and bartender! The Latin music was incredible! There's lots of space on the second floor so me and my friends danced bachata and it was truly a night like no other! Amazing, incredible, and will definitely come back! Did I mention the drinks tasted amazing too? Wish could leave more than 5 stars!

Sueno was an awesome stop on the way along our night out. Fair prices for food and drink and really tasty menu choices, the burrito was insane. Abby our server was attentive and super helpful and we all loved her!! Our group will be back!

My cousins and I came for a girl's weekend. We had the pleasure of having Brooklyn as our host. She was the highlight of our stay. Her amazing warm and vivacious personality was a great way to start our trip. We all took advantage of their margarita flights and they did not disappoint. I ordered the nachos, they were delicious and full of flavor. I can't wait to go back and see Brooklyn again and enjoy another taco. If you're ever in the area please stop by.
Great happy hour spot! Amal was our server/bartender and the service was impeccable. Caters to vegans/vegetarians as well.  Would definitely come again!

My experience at this restaurant (during COVID) was nothing but phenomenal. Their outdoor atmosphere made me feel comfortable during these unprecedented times. Our server, Nicolette, was accommodating, attentive and friendly. She made sure we had everything we needed and brought everything in a timely manner. Their food was great and I left completely satisfied. 10/10 recommend. Definitely go here!
Got sat Within minutes of getting there. Took 25 mins to get water. And then we put drinks in and never saw the waitress again.

Everything I attempted to order I was told that they had to check to see if they could do it, or had it. Waitress was not attentive walked past several times and didn't even stop to take our order or bring water. Happy hour may be fine for a quick drink, but nothing more. The food was mediocre for a taco place. Honestly music and atmosphere is the only thing I liked.

Zina and Neisa are the reason I became a regular. The bar service is amazing. The drinks and food are amazing only thing I wish they played more Latin music. Overall you should definitely stop by, great vibe and service!!

No better bartender than Neisa! Came to Sueno on a whim after spending the day in Philly. Neisa made us feel welcomed and kept us laughing throughout the night. Highly recommend the drinks and food! Definitely will come back for years to come!

Came here for my happy hour on my birthday and this place is soo cute! They were very accommodating and the atmosphere was good. They have a very good happy hour that ends at 7. The bartender was attentative despite the busy crowd. The quesadilla on the happy hour menu was my favorite. However the margarita was too sweet. Almost tasted no alchohol. Other than that, It's a great little spot and I'm glad I found it on tiktok!

Frustrated!!  I've been going to the chapala location for years, however, today I decided to try this location because it seemed close to my workplace, boy, do I regret that I placed an order 1 hr prior to picking up when I arrived, I was told it wasn't ready yet and that they were having wifi issues, which I was being understanding, I let them know what I ordered and they said it would be "couple minutes" when the young lady brought me the salad, I noticed right away, it wasn't the exact one I've been ordering for years, she apologized and said it would be a couple more minutes by this time I had already been waiting for 30 min and only had 15 min to get back to my shift at the hospital, after her bringing it out again I assumed it was right this time, as I going to place my salad in the fridge since at this point I didn't have time to eat it I noticed that it was the incorrect order i basically wasted, my entire lunch break at this place, and still got the wrong order, I decided to call and speak to the manager, butMeghan answered and hung up, extremely frustrating. Not surprised though her and the young man with curly short hair (didn't get his name) were rude from the beginning.

I've been eating at the other locations for years. This new San Roque location is just as good as the others. I'm a bit neurotic about the freshness of lettuce and I've never gotten dirty or unfresh lettuce and I've probably eaten 50+ salads from here. I'm really happy to have one closer to where I live! I like their new online ordering system. Order before you leave and its ready when you arrive! I wish they'd bottle the Tabasco vinaigrette. I'd buy it weekly. So so good. The staff are really sweet too.

I love this place! There's a reason they been voted best sandwich in town for just about ever! The quality is amazing and fresh. The customer service is second to none. In the locations make it very easy to stop by almost every day for lunch. This place is sofa king good!

I keep giving South Coast another chance, but their vegetarian sandwiches at least are awful. Easily the worst Caprese sandwich I've ever had. Wet thin sliced bread, too many not yet ripe cherry tomatoes cooked in the sandwich, sour pesto, very little mozzarella, no fresh basil. Horrible sandwich, but at least edible so two stars.

Was driving passed and wanted a good sandwich. Seen this location (they have a few locations as well) and ordered. The parking is a bit hard since it's location in a smaller plaza with other busier businesses. Got the tuna sandwich. It was good! The toppings included this spicy aioli, definitely put the sandwich together. The salads looked good too, everyone was walking out with them. Just be prepared to look for parking, but the wait to get your order is not long!

Yes! Agreed with the recommendations! I ordered the pesto chicken sandwich and the fowl play salad. The salad was probably the best salad I have ever had! It was a Caesar salad basically with bbq chicken, corn, beans and I think fried onions? There was a crunch in there that set it off 

The sandwich was good- the meat was plentiful and tasted quality but I would have liked a little more seasoning. 

Overall- YUMMYYYY

Food is great. Service is great once you get in. BUT ....

There is one line now for ALL orders- paid unpaid,  pre-ordered- not ordered.  Its clearly not efficient for the customers.

I called in a coffee in a rush because sometimes people need to rush back to work.  When I arrived, there were FIVE frustrated people outside 4 whom pre-paid.  I tried to tell the guy there and he could have given two craps about anyones time or efficiency.  What a bummer- whoever is managing this place is not paying attention to the customers needs.  Also I normally tip at least $1 even on coffee-- if people are frustrated they prob wont tip...just a thought.

I almost never write reviews but MAYBE if enough of those frustrated customers who were on line and who were stressed about getting back to work write a review then something will change?

Something like, "hey, i'm sorry, I know people need to get back to work let me see how I can help...." would have been really appreciated.
Incredible! I would give them seven stars if I could. Avocado, tomato, and other vegetables. All perfect and fresh you will find this is so delicious Yum!!!!!!

Fantastic sandwich spot, if I have ever seen one. Conveniently located on upper State St in the beautiful Santa Barbara area. It is a sweet spot across the street from the car wash, so it is nice place to hang out while waiting for your car to be ready.

Lots of really great options for sandwiches, but I went ahead and went with my usual: chicken pesto.

Great sandwich, very good. Always recommending this place or any of their locations.

I'm so happy South Coast Deli opened up in my neighborhood. I've been coming here a couple of times a week since they opened.

Their breakfast sandwiches are delicious. Their sandwiches. The rbc reminds me french onion soup in sandwich form. So good!
The salads are huge and filling. I think I would probably ask for more dressing though the next time I order one. 

We are so lucky to have such a delicious sandwich shop in Santa Barbara!
Delivery issue and poor communication. Food decent. Not sure if issue was Grubhub or restaurant, but communication from restaurant was poor.

I normally don't have any issues with OK, but today was horrendous. Order was pending to be delivered for over an hour. When calling the restaurant they said a manager would call back. They never did. Called back AND MY NUMBER WAS BLOCKED. Called on a separate line and got some bull crap about them canceling orders. No courtesy, no apologies. Never eating here again. They can go fuck themselves.
Best lunch I've had in a while and they're super nice. This will definitely be my new spot for takeout.

Just don't order from here if you're using uber eats or door dash. Took them an extra 2 hours from the original time it was supposed to arrive. Only ordered 2 items as well so its a bit ridiculous to wait this long.
Pretty good food! Quick delivery. The general tso chicken was spicy and yummy. Good portions and I think we'll order from here again.
I was there for the final survival week late breakfast, pancakes are fluffy and sausage is meaty. Nothing can beat the location (Right behind library).

What a cool freakin place to eat!!! Overlooking the football field! This is great...

The food quality is awesome and I feel like im dining at a 5-star restaurant....

Great service, great price...i love this place

I absolutely love Bear Down Kitchen. Everyone that works there is super kind and welcoming. The place itself is very clean and the view of the stadium is really nice and calming. The food is average, but it's all you can eat for a really fair price and gives you a lot of options if you're looking to be more nutritious without going broke.

Food is yummy and healthy, great buffet style. Good fuel for studying at the library, especially for Midterms and Finals. Great options for carbs, fats, proteins.

However, the one-star is due to the lack of customer service - The cashier lady ALWAYS IGNORES me, DOESN'T make friendly conversation, pretends to look away when I exit to avoid saying goodbye, and sometimes creepily stares at me while I ate, but ONLY greets, and says goodbye, makes friendly conversation to the frat guys who eat here.
Absolutely amazing service :) these guys go above and beyond to please customers. great prices and fast delivery thank you guys!! M
