The service was friendly and courteous and we were well attended to when we ordered for pick up. The pizza was cooked, hot, just as we ordered but nothing to write home about. The garlic toast was quiet soft and seasoned with marjoram (I believe). The lasagna was... quite bland. Sauce and cheese was only on the top, and the bottom layers was just pasta. I have never had lasagna that way and it was quite dry and boring. 
Had there been more sauce it would have been satisfactory. 
For what you get, the price was a little steep, $30.00 for a small order of lasagna and a medium pizza. I might go there again in a hurry but overall not very memorable experience.

Ordered delivery. First of all it took for ever, ordered wings and a donair pizza. The wings arrived with no sauce and over cooked and pizza didn't taste like anything. It tasted very bland, the sauce used was very watery. Will not order again...
Will never order from here again.  Over priced for a poor pie. Donairs are not fresh either. Other locations are far better.

I will second Mike W's review here. Sam's essentially serves Royal Pizza, with a moderately thick, pillowy crust and cut into squares, but without a royal pain of a wait. Delivery was friendly and fast. I'll order from here again when I'm craving this style.

This really hit the spot!  I was really craving mac n cheese - I went for the classic mac and it did not disappoint (slightly salty) but still delicious!  I will definitely be eating here again - I want to try the friend raviolis next.  Also, who cares if it's a doordash restaurant ran out of macaroni grill as one other commenter stated.
Delicious, cheesy, and surprisingly huge portions. Everything you want from a tub of comfort food!

My son is in the icu at renown and I needed comfort food, that delivered.  Who would have ever thought of a place that serves only Mac and Cheese?  I need to thank them personally for it. 

The menu is rather small, which means not being overwhelmed with suggestions. Which when all you want to do is eat your feelings is good. I went with the smoked Mac and cheese with some chicken, and order of toasted ravioli and a slice of chocolate cake.  I have so much food left over that I didn't even have to bother with ordering a dinner.  One think I did opt in on was the extra sauce, do this. It will take your food journey one step beyond, and you deserve this. The mac and cheese was so full of cheese that it was stringy. The toasted ravioli arrived at the hospital still crunchy and the cake..... wow! 

I will be trying this again one day. When we are not hospital bound.

Lmao this place is macaroni grill... watch out for door dash companies like this! A few other ones are Nashville hot chicken and some grilled cheese place. They're really just claim jumper! Please do your research :)

Food tasted ok but was not what I had ordered - the salad was supposed to have ranch dressing  and the pesto Mac and cheese was nothing like the picture said it was supposed to be.  Delivery was on time with the two bags sealed.

I had the pesto Mac & cheese & it was so tasty. I loved the pine nuts! I was sad to find out that this place is run out of macaroni grill & it can only be delivered. I tried to drive to it one day to see where it was & I was disappointed as the maps led me to the middle of the street. tasty - just wish it was a real place I could go to.
I'm not sure that this place even exists. The food was terrible and we only received 1/3 of our Caesar salads. Now we can't find a phone number or location.

This place doesn't exist. Its a doordash scam probably from what I've seen from other posts. It took 2 hours to even get my order. It was cold and i spent $25 for a small bowl of their pesto mac and cheese. Pretty lame

Just ordered via grub hub as I found this place online earlier today. Food came quickly which was awesome and order was correct. Tremendously disappointed in the food  though. We ordered three different Mac n cheese dishes and none of them had very much cheese. It was basically flavored macaroni.  We also ordered Mac n cheese bites and ravioli bites both of which looked and tasted like they were fried twice. We ordered strawberry cheesecake as well but no strawberries to be found anywhere, it's plain cheesecake. My wife told me it would not be good because the Macaroni Grill here was not good and she was unfortunately correct. Too bad as Reno could use a good Mac n cheese place

I've ordered from here before a couple times but will no longer order or use DoorDash to order there. I spent over $40 on DoorDash only to have my doordasher tell me "the manager said someone else came and picked up your order." Which didn't make sense because the order never said it was picked up and on the way. So I had to cancel the order that I spent money on and never got, and was never refunded the money. 
So whoever got the free food, you're welcome.

Ordered take out. I'm giving 3 stars because it wasn't what I expected for the price. The toasted raviolis didn't come with enough sauce so definitely order extra and the picture of the cheese cake came with strawberries sauce and it didn't have any on it when it came

The food is very tasty and seasoned perfectly! The staff inside are very polite and don't seem to be playing around your food, which I really appreciate! I did order delivery and the food wasn't securely closed. It would be nice for it to be closed securely since the fries are open at the top of the bag. Other than that the food is good and delivered HOT! Thank you.
I may be biased but Wingstop has never really disappointed me. Whether I'm doing take out or delivery, the food is always accurate and delicious
30 minute wait for some boneless wings, they were ok but the fries were covered in seasoning. Make sure you have a very large drink to wash it down

The food was terrible. I tried the new "Thighstop" via Doordash. The chicken thighs were not only tiny thighs but overcooked. They tasted like garbage. It's not surprising they need to switch from wings to thighs because of the pandemic food related costs. Even there wings are bad and disgusting. There thighs are no better. They are worse than KFC. I would avoid this at all cost. The only saving grave is the Louisiana flavor but who cares about the flavor when you are literally eating an overcooked GREASY TINY chicken thigh that's overcooked AND OVERPRICED and cannot even continue eating it.

I ordered from here a few months ago my order was wrong took food back after person on the phone accused me of eating the missing items for a refund was told I would get and never received then when I called got a email saying I wouldn't be receiving a refund so I got no food and no refund this place sucks
While visiting Pythian Market decided to give this place a try.  The California Roll was great and the build a bowl that I got was outstanding.

I am very excited i found this place. Their poke is very good and i was able to order exactly how i wanted it since i am doing Keto. Good tasting poke with super fresh ingredients and extremely friendly staff. It's located in an indoor food cart type place and a very good ambience.

Build your own Poke bowl  I got double tuna and I thought for the amount of food and extra Tuna, The was a reasonably cheap meal considering other poke places in the city. By far one of my favorite poke joints!
Owner Kevin is so sweet and was very accommodating to my hunger needs! Sushi is fresh and they cut it up in front of you. Tastes great with great customer service. Thank you!

Build your own bowl for a healthy gluten-free, milk-free lunch option. It was a quick lunch option where we could eat during an hour lunch break.  I took off a star as my friends' had issues with their orders.

Back again and my review is still 5 stars. I've been to several other poke places and I always feel ill afterwards but not here. This is how I know their food is fresh. To me their poke bowl is the best I've ever eaten!
Kevin and his team were fast. The sushi tasted fresh and the toppings were so flavorful.
Haven't been there yet but got to try them through work. Had the mixed greens with salmon Sunshine style. So fresh and they give you more protein than most poke places

I love a good Poke bowl and Kais offers some good selections. My friend said building her own bowl required too many decisions so she selected one of the chef's creations. I am too picky so I built my own. We were both very happy with our choices.

All the ingredients were fresh and tasty. The amount of food for the price was good. The bowls came up quickly. And you can pre-order online if you need to.

Also they have a vegan option with tempura and tofu!

Located in Pythian Market on Loyola, Kais is a quick service poke/sushi restaurant. They have preset poke bowls as well as a build your own bowl option. The steps to build your own bowl are clearly labeled and easy to follow. 

I chose to build my own bowl. For $14, you get two choices of protein. I got the ahi cubes and spicy ahi with an assortment of toppings (cucumber, edamame, ginger, masago and furikake). You are also able to select two sauces. I got the Kai's sauce and ponzu. The spicy ahi had a good kick to it and is prepared lomi style. I actually really liked it! The ahi cubes were okay but didn't have a lot of flavor to it. I couldn't taste the ponzu at all. I wish poke places here mixed the fish with the sauce and toppings. I also hope to see some more traditional poke mix-ins. 

While this isn't like poke bowls you would find from Hawai'i, it is nice to have a healthier option close to work. Kai's is great for a lighter meal packed with veggies in the downtown area! The sushi looks amazing so I'll definitely be back to try that.

I got the Sunshine Poke Bowl and it was good, but I've had much better. It's definitely on the fresher/better side compared to other poke places in the city, but it's just ok compared to other pokes I've had. I also tried a bit of the Kais Bowl (which my friend ordered), which sorta tasted the same because they season all bowls heavily with their sauce and use pretty much the same toppings (corn, edamame, masago, furikake). Also, they could definitely use more fish given that each bowl is $14 before tip & tax. If I was reaaaallly craving poke at work I would probably go back, but otherwise, there are other places within the Pythian market that serve up better food imo.
So good! This place has so many variations! Everything was fresh. The mangos the tofu the corn......so healthy and flavorful. The man working behind the counter was super nice.

This place was AMAZING!! Great suggestions by the Xuan who took my order. I had the Sunshine bowl which was so fresh. The Tuna 2x roll has just the right amount of spice in the spicy tuna and Ragin Cajun was delicious. I absolutely recommend Kais!

Plus $1.50 for old avocado... No, thank you. Given fresh ingredients are key for poke bowls, I am now questioning the quality of all ingredients used. Old avocado aside, this place is at best OK. I have found better quality poke in grocery stores.

This bowl was so good and I loved eating in the Pythian market. I'll definitely be there again. The food was fresh, tasty, and a little pricy for lunch but so worth it. I will be a returning customer.
They delivered one night to my house and the next time I asked for delivery they told me they didn't deliver to my area!!! Worst customer service as well.

This is so stupid!! So they have their specialty pizzas which all have at least one bad topping on it so I when ordering asked to substitute it for a different topping. They informed me that if you substitute a topping you are charged for an additional topping. GET OUTTA HERE. Stop being so greedy and always pushing people for another buck. That's the last you'll ever hear from me, pizza 73.

Why do I eat here? Gross

Why you ask?
Wings were way way over deep fried until they were dry hard. Way to saucy as well.

Pizza has always been one of the worst of all pizza places. 

When I ordered by phone the man barely spoke English and was quite rude. It's like I ruined his night because I was trying to buy pizza.

Pizza 73 and I are done....

Pizza 73 are all over the city and luckily this one is close by enough for me to pick up ( costs $3.50 to deliver plus tip.. so this saves me at least 10 bucks ). One of the things I like is they have all sorts of deals. Pick up or delivery , they have deals for everyone. 

A small one topper pizza is $6.00 , a large is $10. 

Pretty reasonable right?

Now add wings.. all sorts of wings.. stay away from boneless ( basically chicken nuggets- in other words.. cheap ).  I personally like the crispy coated or naked ( plain wings ) as those have a bit more meat on them. 


On top of that they have wedges, curly fries, onion rings , wedgies ( pizza dough sprinkled with garlic butter, parmesan and seasonings. 

 

This location has never served me a bad pizza or given me bad service.  They have always been prompt and courteous whenever I walked in. 
Yes I know fast food joints only want to bang out product as fast as they can and make the most money for it. Pizza 73 , at this location, is not bad.

For a few years they had an app but it was only available on Iphones. But now they have them for android phones which is good. 

Their website was a bit of a mess a few years ago as well but that's been cleaned up and much easier to navigate.

I used to like pizza 73 but my most recent order was disgusting and a waste of money. The crust was like cardboard and they really skimped on the toppings and cheese, even with extra cheese as part of the order. The wings were good at least which made up for the terrible pizza. I won't be ordering from here again.

There is reason this location has such badd reviews. Are pizza was raw twice and they refused to refund the meal. By son was sick the next day because of it. Go literally anywhere else but here and you'll be happier. Took over an hour for the pizza to be delivered both times and the delivery driver called 4 times on the original order for directions. Horrible customer service.
I already send my comments to that address and was told "that's too bad" and offered a credit which I don't want. A refund should be issued

I read some of the reviews and it seemed like just the people who had a bad experience writing, so I felt I should share my good experience. I used the Pizza73 app to order and pay and that was pretty slick. I ordered two medium pizzas with thin crust and they were ready when I arrived to pick them up. They were really good pizzas. The crust was crunchy just the way we like them. The location is just down the street from us, so we'll be trying them again. I will also try some of their wings next time. Looking forward to it already!

This is the second time I ordered from WoW Bao, yesterday and today!!! I ordered through DoorDash.
I was craving for Siopao and this is the place I found at DoorDash.
1st order, I had the combo, teriyaki bwol and two bao.
I think the teriyaki bowl was a bit pricey for the size.
Bao's were delicios! I ordered the second time with just the 6 pack of Baos.... with flavors: Chicken Teriyaki and the Pork BBQ!!! 
I will definitely order again from this place....
Baos were freshly made and still warm when it arrived....

Me and my bf have ordered from here so many times I love it!!!! The bao in bbq pork, sweet baby Jesus it's to die for do definitely recommend!!! One thing I do have to say because I am only giving it 4 stars is because of the the portion sizes are kinda small for how pricey it is but the food is great so it's worth it! Will be ordering again in the future!!

This new "restaurant" is cooking and delivering out of the Sizzler restaurant on Eagle Road. There is no dining in or carrying out (yet). Ordering is only through delivery companies like DoorDash and UberEats, which have their own problems and fees. We thought we'd try them with ordering from Uber Eats and having a couple combo meals with baos and dumplings. Each combo was $15.98 and the dumplings were $5.99, expensive for lunch. First combo: Kung Pao spicy chicken with Mongolian beef and teriyaki chicken baos, and a teriyaki chicken with bbq Berkshire Pork baos, and an order of ginger-chicken dumplings (potstickers). Well, the pork ones were by far the best and most flavorful. The chicken and beef baos were at best tolerable. Picture teriyaki chicken or innocuously spiced beef whizzed in a food processor and then piped into a wheat donut-like bun. Absolutely no texture and no flavor except spice and soy sauce. The dumplings were no better than and looked exactly like the ones you can get in Costco's freezer section. The "Chinese" food was really pretty pathetic. The portions were small and the only way we could tell the difference between the teriyaki chicken and Kung Pao chicken were the peanuts scattered on top. Neither dish had any discernible chunks of chicken or vegetables, just a very heavy dose of soy sauce and red chili flakes, and a few slices of green onion which I just noticed. As for the delivery, the service charge PLUS the delivery charge PLUS tip was $21, and that was before the food charges! Overall, this was a highly disappointing lunch for nearly $60. Hubby liked the pork buns and wanted me to give them an extra star just because they're different. Ok, but I'm 100% positive we can get frozen bao at either Costco or one of the Asian markets in town which will be just as good and cheaper, AND any of the teriyaki shops or Chinese restaurants in town have better food. So there you have it, a pretty comprehensive review. This is a new operation and I wish them well, but I don't believe we'll order from them again if I have to pay $20+ before the food costs.

The food proportion compared to the price of the food is very expensive and unrealistic. The food wasn't that great to begin with. There wasn't much flavor, and they were not very generous with the chicken to rice ratio. As soon as I realized this place was located in Sizzler, I knew it wasn't going to be too great. I appreciate the effort, but at least lower your price considering it's not very good at all.
* I had the Bowl and 2 Bao:
* Spicy Kung Poa Chicken Bowl (Not spicy at all and not much flavor)
* Vegetable Bao
*Spicy Mongolian Beef Boa (Not spicy at all and not much flavor)

If you want some really nice authentic Asian food, there is a place called Koco Bell. It's a small shack that sells Korean BBQ foods. They are a little bit pricy, but for the proportions you are getting (the flavors are absolutely amazing), it is completely worth it. I really recommend checking it out! Another place is Thai Basil, they also have very delicious authentic food!

Super disappointing honestly. I've had good, real bao and this ain't it! Meat is tasty, but the dough is just wrong. Too bread-y, too thick, not enough filling. If you've had real bao you won't want this. The whole wheat veg one was gross I truly could not eat it. I also got a rice bowl which was fine but the portions were very skimpy and I didn't get much meat or sauce w my rice. It wasn't horrible, I did enjoy the rice bowl but it depends on what you're looking for.

Another disappointing Asian restaurant.  Rice was undercooked.  I don't believe the Bao to be made in-house nor the potstickers.  I venture to say, to save on food cost, the chicken is minced and mixed in with the other ingredients.
Good in a pinch if you haven't had dim sum for a while. With it being delivered though, it is a little more dense of bao than the light and fluffy you might be expecting.

Fiancé and I have never had Boa before and have never been here until tonight. We LOVED it, we both got bowls and Bao's. We both prefer the BBQ Berkshire  pork ones instead of the Chicken Teriyaki ones but those were still good! We will be back for sure!

Ordered from this place through DoorDash and it was fire will come back for sure 
Idk why Yelp keeps making me write more to post this review, but here we are lol
Over priced, and the food was honestly not worth eating. Sad because, they have potential

How can one do business without having contact information? I ordered a family pack through GrubHub and only received the buns and potstickers. Tried dealing with grubhub and was politely told to bad F.O. I thought to myself this really isn't problem Wow Bao but I would call and ask them about it. To my surprise they don't even have a phone number listed anywhere on the internet. So I guess the joke is on me! ONE AND DONE!!!


Update WOW BAO IS SIZZLER
Food flavor was good but 1 bowl and 2 bao is $16. Wouldn't be bad but very small portions!  Most likely will not order again.

We found this restaurant on uber eats and decided to try it out as we hadn't had dim sum food in a while. I would just like to say I wasn't very impressed. We got orders of dumplings. Baos and a teriyaki bowl. The dumplings were pretty good but the boas was lacking in flavor and the breading was very thick and over powered the meat inside. Teriyaki bowl was decent but way over priced for the portion size. portions at panda express are way bigger for about the same price. All in all I would probably not order from here again.

Not good... as far from a traditional bao bun as it gets. All the fillings were nasty and I wish they weren't so expensive for these tiny little bao buns with nothing in them. Aside from the fact they weren't even decent, I won't be going back.

Food is just okay. Our bowls were 75% rice and tasted like a microwave dinner. The baos are good but for the price of the meal, I am really disappointed. This place is definitely overpriced for what you get.

Don't expect what you are used to or what their website pictures show.  I got the orange chicken as I usually like orange chicken in all the iterations from various restaurants I have tried. But what I got was neither like any orange chicken I have had previously or what was in their picture on their online menu. What i got was a bowl of rice and two table spoons of hard dark meat most of which was in tiny fragments such that it felt like I was eating ground chicken rather than individually cut pieces. I can only assume this was what was scrap meat left over from nicer cuts of chicken. The sauce was somewhat sweat but flat and flavorless. I was so disappointed as I really wanted to love it and be able to support a local business (though to be fair it is a nation wide chain which I should have known before ordering.). I also ordered two boa - teriyaki chicken and cheese burger. They were very light and fluffy consisting mostly of dough with a tiny amount of stuffing.  The teriyaki tasted more like BBQ chicken (and perhaps I got the wrong one) and I don't personally like BBQ so I can't fairly judge that if it was BBQ by mistake. If it was supposed to be teriyaki it was a pretty big miss for me. I also tried the cheese burger boa as I thought it wiuld be fun to try something both very familiar (Ive had dumplings and Ive had cheese burgers) but also unique. Again the dough to stuffing ratio means you are going to get 90% dough so most of your bites will not include cheese burger. But the dough is nicely done - very fluffy and light in taste and texture. The cheeseburger stuffing is simple and the combination of both elements done well and simply adds up to a unique yet familiar experience. Just as the orange chicken skimped on the chicken leaving one to feel underwhelmed you may also find yourself underwhelmed with the amount of cheeseburger in your cheeseburger boa (teriyaki/BBQ??? Chicken as well). 

I am 100% certain I would never purposely order their orange chicken again or likely anything as it feels they skimp and short you at every turn. (Which I guess is to expect with some chain restaurants). Which is too bad bc the burger boa could have been really good if there had just been burger in them. So i guess... I wouldn't likely order boa again unless they were on a massive sale and I would certainly avoid the teriyaki chicken. 

A real bummer as I so wanted to find another place for yummy eats.
GRAND OPENING 3/26/2018... 10% OFF GRAND OPENING PERIOD FROM 3/26/2018-03/31/2018.  Try out another delicious food in the South Philly Area...

Delicious food and great prices!! I live near this place so I've become a regular customer and they consistently make my favorite veggie fried dumplings of all time. Weiann (sorry if I misspelled!) is always so nice and welcoming and the food preparation is fast :)
We live down the street and have been curious about this place! Ordered last night in a pinch and it was great. May be our new go to. Would order even if we didn't live this close.
A standard and reliable Chinese take out place in my neighborhood with super speedy service. The employees were wearing masks and seemed to be keeping up with the current health protocols.

Fast, cheap, dependable takeout Chinese. Into lo mein and questionable egg rolls? Jade Palace gotchu.

When I'm hanging in Pennsport I'll usually call then head over for pickup. Other times I order in-person and chill on their stoop.

Bring cash. Cash only. Don't act like you're surprised. It's not like you're going to spend a lot if you spring for their lunch specials.

Shout-out to their friendly staff[1] for keeping me from starving.

[1] Is it a shout-out if I don't know their names?

Not sure what's with the bad reviews. We live in town and have taken out the burgers three times. They are really good! We have tried almost all the different types of burgers, meat is fresh and tasty. We haven't had anything else but the burgers.
The slices are great. The service is fast. There's seating outside. We had a chicken bacon ranch and it was dope.

I GrubHub them a lot. Their square pizzas are great, esp when the cook 'em a little bit well done and the crust gets all crispy. Their chopped salad is amazing. Big enough for two large servings. The Reese's peanut butter pie is some of the most amazing stoned munchy food I've ever had in my life. So you might want to consider dessert when you order LOL

I wish they would pack the hot food and the cold food separately. Otherwise, very consistently good.

We ordered three things. Chicken wings with extra hot sauce, BoardWalk fries and buffalo chicken wrap.  Wings were great but no extra buffalo sauce.  Boardwalk fries were good with a tiny container of melted American cheese. Buffalo chicken wrap was more like a lettuce wrap with one or two pieces of chicken. No hot sauce. That said, delivery came in 20 minutes. This place has a lot of potential but they gotta focus on the details.
Idk why there reviews are so poor! Honestly really decent food all around!  The environment is clean and there's outside seating!
This place is not great. Poorly designed chain and the food is bad.  They try to do too many things and none of them well. crust n fire n closed soon

Probably one of my fav take out places in the area! Comparable prices! U get what you pay for! No $5 pizza's here! Everything is fresh and delicious! I'm picky af! I rarely like my meals but I have to say I ordered tonight and I loved the whole order and so did mom and the bf! We got the rustico flat bread( ricotta, spicy honey), wings (dry with no sauce or anything just breaded), general tso's chicken pizza, all natural chicken tenders and fries!  We all loved our meals and we definitely will
Be back! I'm so glad this place opened a shop close to my home in haddon heights! Keep up the great job!

Had food delivered for dinner one evening. The pizza was as described by others, nothing to write home about and somewhat soggy and close to inedible. The burger was decent. Overall, it's an okay place, just nothing special about it.

This location has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. They close up early and make you feel bad for coming into order food during their business hours. If you close at 9 you can not be upset that people come order at 8:40pm and also you should not be changing the oil in your fryers during business hours to then hold up the order another 15 minutes. Very sad because the crust n fire brand is very good and other locations do not handle business this same way.
Ok pizza. Far from special. Ordered a plain and a square. Both average at best. Probably won't order there again.

The pizza is not very good at all. For a 1/2 Buffalo and half plain it cost me 18.29 . It was not Buffalo pizza . It was chunks of chicken with mozzarella cheese and some other sauce . I ordered 2 plain slices as well and they were gross . I will never come here again . Not worth the money . Go somewhere else

Awful service with zero apologies. Took 20 minutes to get a menu and water. Took 2.5 hours to get food. Never came back for the check. Had to bring it downstairs to the bar myself. Could have made the food myself. Smelled like a bathroom throughout. Corners were cut across the board - interior, food, service. Do not recommend and would not be surprised if this place is closed within the next few months.

Very disappointed, very rude, terrible service. We sat for half an hour before getting any acknowledgement. Drinks took an hour to come out. We had to eventually had to bring our cards down to the bar to pay for a meal that 2.5 hours.

Not sure where all the negative reviews are coming from! Had an awesome experience with Martel tonight. Fast service, tasty food, with just the right amount of kick in the food. Tried the sprouts, empanada, and patatas bravas: all phenomenal! You gotta get in this place

almost never give 5 stars. It is a MUST VISIT for a nicer dinner in Philly. 

I have trouble choosing which tapas to not recommend, they were all absolutely delicious. The standout favorites among my group were the pork belly, empanadas,  mushrooms, the Brussels sprouts, any rice dish and if you love manchego like I do they have 4 month or 1 yr old. everything was delicious.

get the white or red wine sangria.Great food, drinks, dessert, service, one of my new favorites!

Laughed out loud at Fred's review because it was spot on. We ordered the same dishes and could not have said it better. We often went to the former Brigid's but will not return to its current incarnation unless they hire a good chef and have better service and attitude. A real shame.

We were so excited when we discovered a new tapas place in the neighborhood. We stopped in mid-week and sat at the bar. I don't know if we came shortly after the restaurant was introduced but the bartender didn't know much about the cocktails and food. We chalked it up to the place being new. 

We ordered the yucca frita (way too dense but good flavor with a good sauce), the creamy seafood rice (more paella-less risotto but good flavor, seafood was tender), the octopus (seasoned well but very overcooked, crispy potatoes with it were yummy), snails (husband thought it was tasty-I won't touch escargot with a 10 foot pole) and patatas brava (sauce was nuclear hot). 

I didn't really enjoy my cocktail and hate when there are the tiny cocktail straws with a drink that has berry pulp in it. Virtually impossible to drink it without clogging the straw. 

We spent almost $100 on food/drink that was equal parts good, equal parts disappointing. Even though she wasn't knowledgeable on the new menu, the bartender was very sweet. 

I would only go back if there was a good happy hour which would give me a chance to try the food again. As it was, the happy hour consisted of a few bucks off a bottled beer (hardly Spanish tapas themed!).
This is a whole in the wall it stinks inside and outside of the bar;  The trash is overflowing onto the street side;  The service is slow the food was just okay would not go back

The service is horrible and the food is a joke. The chorizo is basically four slices of deli meat they got at Aldi, accompanied by two pieces of toast... which, somehow took 30 minutes to assemble and bring to my table. The charred octopus is four tiny pieces of a sorry chewy mess, mixed with undercooked potatoes. And I almost broke my teeth on the Yukka fritters.
This might have been good enough for Jenkintown, but it will never work in Philly, not with the other options available to us here.

I came hungry and left hangry. It was such a long long long long long wait from ordering to waiting to paying to waiting to waiting. The food wasn't bad. I had escargot, scallops and empanadas. However, for the portion, taste, price and service it wasn't worth it. I spent a lot of money to waste time and didn't get the service I wanted. Food took so long and when it came was the wrong order. Then there were more waiting. And even when I wanted to leave it was a wait. The place is just so narrow and on that night there were live music, which I don't know how they could fit it all. And it became so loud. Too loud to enjoy the music. 

I liked when it was Bridgid's. And really wanted to like the restaurant. I had high hopes for the restaurant to be the go to neighborhood spot. 

To be continued.

Was super excited today when I saw this place open, I live in the neighborhood and hadn't even heard about it! We made a beeline there for an early dinner/happy hour, only to end up underwhelmed. The service was good, although the server didn't know any of the dishes (I can chock this up to them being very new). We ordered a variety of plates to include yucca fritters, patatas bravas, creamy rice, grilled octopus and escargot. The escargot were very good, no complaints. The creamy rice was very flavorful, but there wasn't anything creamy about it. The yucca fritters were undercooked but the sauce was very good. The octopus was extremely overcooked, but the potatoes and asparagus it came with were perfect. The patatas have nothing to do with patatas bravas, which are normally fingerling potatoes. These were simply JoJo potatoes which were decent, but not with Spanish food. All in all, I'm hoping this was just all new restaurant jitters. I was extremely excited for a Spanish tapas place in the neighborhood, let's hope these issues get worked out.

WOW! I ordered the other night for curbside pick-up. The menu was very extensive. The staff was pleasant. The food is so delicious. It is the best Mexican food that I have ever had. Everything was packaged perfectly. I will certainly order from there anytime I want Mexican food. So happy to have a Mexican restaurant so close to home.

Wow !!! Soooo good. The only reason I'm dropping a star is because no delivery and covid times !!! Also the pork was very fatty but the chorizo taco was slamming and the rice and beans were to die for ! They kept my order GF

Looking for something new to try, figured we'd give this a shot. Boy was that a mistake. 

Got a hard taco. It was kinda mushy, tasteless, and topped with what was obviously pre-shredded cheese (you know how pre-shredded cheese has that corn starch grittiness keeping it from clumping?  This had that in spades). 

Got a soft taco. There's pork, there's some veggies, squeezed some lime on it, took a bite, and somehow the corn tortilla had more taste than anything in it. It was incredible, I didn't know something could be that tasteless. 

Got the chilli rellenos. They were soggy, but that happens. The problem was the first inch or 2 of each had that hardness you get from microwaved food. The filling was mostly tasteless shredded chicken, and the bit of cheese in there was not melted. I guess there was a sauce on the outside?  I saw sauce. I didn't taste sauce. 

It came with rice, which to their credit, was properly cooked!

It also came with beans which were both a bit undercooked and tasted like someone throw a can of beans in a pot for a few mins with water and declared, "good enough!"

We ordered the churros, which were pictured with whipped cream and did not include any other description. Instead, it came without whipped cream but with a kind of gross cream cheese filling. 

And finally, we ordered 2 mexican cokes (you know, the glass bottle ones with real sugar and not corn syrup) and were given 2 regular cokes, plastic bottles, corn syrup, and all. 

It was an utter failure every step of the way. 

There's far better Mexican places within a 20 min drive of here, go to one of those instead.
There was no sign by the road so they were a little difficult to locate, maybe just opening.  Service was quick, the salsa was good. The chicken fajita was exceptional.  No complaints here.

I'm always on the lookout for good Mexican food and will happily drive a long distance to get the good stuff. When I noticed that a new Mexican place had opened close to home, I had to check it out right away. With the COVID pandemic limiting us to only getting takeout, close is a good thing. Their menu includes all of the standards, so we ordered a bunch of stuff to make our own sampler. Yeah, we'd have a lot leftover, but if it's good, who cares!

When I say the standards, I mean tamales, enchiladas, chiles rellenos and few other items. Sure, they have a lot more than this on the menu, but if they can make these items well, they can probably win me over. Well, they certainly won me over and I have a new go-to place for Mexican food! ALL of the dishes that we ordered were some of the best I've had anywhere. I can't wait to go back and pick up some of their steak dishes.

I look forward to the day when it's safe to start eating out at restaurants again because Avocado Mexican Grill will be on my list of places to go. However, their great food and close proximity to home means I'll be ordering curbside pickup many more times between now and then! Plus, despite only interacting with the staff on the phone and at the car window, they were incredibly friendly and helpful.

I saw this new place and decided to give it a try. The rice was good, the beans were good. Needless to say, otherwise, I was not impressed. I was actually disappointed. From the minute I picked it up, it seemed unorganized, and the man working at the front was utterly clueless on how to do his job. I ordered shrimp tacos and they were baby shrimp! I can't stand when restaurants give you baby shrimp, it is just cheap in my opinion. They looked boiled, no grill marks, no charcoal taste. The taco was topped with shredded cheese, like from the bag you buy at the store. All on a flour tortilla. I was mainly disappointed because I am a huge fan of onions and cilantro on a taco, but I guess they only add that if you get meat. If you are looking for authentic, mexican cuisine, according to my meal I would not go here.

This place is definitely not authentic Mexican food. The food is more like something you can get at chipotle. The red sauce was very sweet with no spice at all. I personally don't like my sauce for my tacos to be sweet so that definitely wasn't something I would want to try again. The food was 2.5/5 the asada and carnitas were very dry with not much taste. The campechano tacos were definitely my least favorite. I also had the fried ice cream and that was actually very good !! I would come back just to pick up dessert.

I'm so happy that I found this place! I've been looking forever for a great Mexican restaurant around me. This place deserves 5 stars, the food was absolutely delicious. I got chips, guacamole, pico de gallo and tacos. I can't wait to try other their enchiladas next time.

This place should be called the Awesome Avocado Grill. Everything is absolutely amazing. I drive past this place everyday on my way home and been wanting to try it for a while. I'm so glad I did. 

Service:  our server Rosa was so sweet and attentive.  

Food:  we ordered a lot and sadly forgot to take pictures. 

Pork burrito was out of this world. It was stuffed with perfect seasonal pork, rice cheese and the slightest bit of beans. I hate beans so this was perfect for me

My fiancé had the beef burrito. Lived it. Like with my burrito it was crammed with beef. 

We also ordered the chicken tacos, nacho supreme with chicken, kids beef taco meal and kids chicken quesadilla meal four kids which they devoured and wanted more. 

We also got fried ice cream and fired cheesecake to go. As of the time I wrote this review I had no room in my gut to eat the dessert but if they are anything like the food, they will be out of this world delicious. 

We will definitely be back. The food was authentic, served hot, and the portions were gigantic. I cannot wait to eat here again which might just be Monday since I have family dinner tomorrow. I highly recommend this place. They were busy with lots of to go orders but you can eat in which the few tables they have were spaced far apart, the servers are extremely friendly and the whole restaurant was clean. 

I love this place and hope whoever reads this and gives it a try will love it too.
Disgusting and tasteless. Definitely not authentic Mexican food. The beans were watery and had no flavor. The rice looked like it came right out of a box. Never again.

This is my third time ordering from this place and let me tell youuuu! Their food is BUSSIN you hear me! I had to tell the world how authentic and well put together their Shrimp Tacos are. I dont know what sauce they used in it but it is AMAZING okay. Then I ordered the churros, it came with the caramel dip..Delicious!  Must eat it warm though. If it gets cold, just heat it up in the microwave for 10 seconds and it taste just as good. Hands down the best Mexican restaurant in town!

All I can say is this place is extremely good it's only been up for 5 months and it actually is very top notch in terms of the food and the service is excellent. Been two times and I must say I cannot complain about this place at all. The first time we had a waitress and she was very sweet and kind and the second time we had a gentleman who was a waiter and he was excellent the prices are just right
The food was great! We ordered the chicken and beef tacos along with the steak and chicken fajitas. All was delicious and fresh! We will definitely be ordering from them again!
Amazing. Excellent. Awesome. Ordered via GrubHub  and everything was hot and fresh. 10/10 would order again. No complaints. Might be our new favorite Mexican spot for sure.
I came here with my girlfriend and we got the enchiladas and a burrito. The food was amazing and the service was amazing. I would recommend coming here

This place just opened and it is amazing! My daughter and I are foodies and we love us some good Mexican food! We went here for lunch and had the sweetest of waitress, polite service, great food, clean and nice decor. 
We had complimentary chips and salsa. 
We ordered chips and guacamole and tamales to start. Homemade chips and guacamole were good. Tamales came 2 with order. 1 pork 1 chicken both were also good. 

For lunch, I had steak chimichanga which came with rice and black beans. 
My daughter had Camarones (red hot spicy sauce) with shrimp which also came with rice and black beans. 
They rice was light, fluffy and full of flavor, definitely homemade. 
We both loved our lunch and ate till we were full and still took home leftovers. 
For dessert we had churros which came with a sweet flavored ice cream and whip cream. 

We will definitely be back since they are open for business during these crazy times!!

Their tacos are so good. Everything tastes fresh and the prices are good. However we tried to order takeout from here again (on a Saturday) and were told they weren't taking orders because the restaurant had been reserved for a party. Seems like a bad idea to turn customers away on a Saturday but I guess they're under staffed.

First off, i'm going to speak on my experience and not invalidate anyone else's. 

We saw the good reviews and thought this would be a good place for some tacos. Let's just say taco bell would've been a better option than here for simple TACOS. 

I ordered chicken, birria, and street tacos (carnitas). 

Let's start off with the birria tacos. it came with a liquid i'm assuming was for dipping them in. looks nothing like how it's supposed to. I attached a pic of what the sauce and tacos are supposed to look like. i ended up mixing some of the chicken within the birria but by the second taco i couldn't take such a bland taste of the birria. i dipped it in their "sauce" and it still tasted like nothing... now my taco was just soaked with even less flavor. Not to mention an unknown red sauce in a smaller container which had the tiniest bit of taste which still did the taco no justice, even dumped the whole thing on the second taco as well. 

The chicken tacos were better..... soggy but better. definitely had more taste. Nothing really more to say.

The street tacos were the same as well. No taste and sauce that didn't help. 

I'm very glad the people that had a good experience did, but my experience was not like theirs and i only tried this place because of the good reviews. As someone like me who is hispanic, this place disappointed HEAVILY. 

Any item off of taco bell's menu would've been better than what i had from this place.

Another excellent meal. We order from here at least once a week. Loving the new weekend specials. This weekend we tried carne azada and it's was delicious. Everything is always extremely good and portions are nice size.
Love this place!! Had pick up two times and want to compliment the quickness with the order!!  The food was delicious and plentiful!! will be making this our go to for Mexican food in the future!!

They have a small, but decent, Asian market.. probably the only place that sells Asian items in the area.

But of course, they are known for their cakes and desserts which are very good.  But I only wen their for their Asian dishes which is the reason for my rating.

Ordered a small white cake with raspberry filling. It was very good. Well decorated and very tasty. Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars (yet) is because I'd like to try a couple more of their different cakes flavors first

I went to many bakeries in the area before deciding on Henning's for my wedding cake. They were the most professional, fairest prices and were willing to work around my ideas for my wedding. That was all before even tasting the cakes. Neither myself or my husband care for sweets but Asuri's cakes were fabulous. He made the decision to go with his bakery for us very easy. He even went and picked up the fresh flowers for the cake decorations. We were so happy we went with Henning's for our big day!

We commissioned Hennings for our wedding cake on 8/25/12.  The cake was beautiful, delicious, and extremely fairly priced.   We had white cake with lemon filling.   They even coordinated with the florist and used our left over flowers to decorate the cake.  I only wish we didn't have to save the top tier for our anniversary!
Got cake for my wife's Bday. Great service and even better cake. Had to take leftovers to wife's work. Was too good not to share. Plus I would have eaten the whole cake.

We went into Hennings after reading the reviews for cakes. I will say that we went in to sample the cupcakes. So this review is for the cupcakes. All I can say is blah, terrible.  Firstly, they do other things besides cupcakes. So maybe that's not their thing.  Second, the cupcakes were in the refridgerator to the left. Cupcakes in the fridge dries them out.  This is why places like Sprinkles keep them in display boxes. 

We had the vanila cupcake with white frosting and sprinkles. I swear this must have been a grocery store cupcake. Maybe they ran out of their own. We shared one cupcake. 3 of us.  And we did not finish it. We each took one bite and said, "huh, this has got to be a Safeway/Ralph's cupcake."  Dry, yet oily tasting, no flavor, blah frosting. Never will get again.

I went to Hennings on a recommendation from a coworker for a birthday cake for my boyfriend last week. I worked with one manager (I regret not getting his card or name) who was fabulous. He worked with me on crafting the perfect cake - I even stopped by twice with changes and little drawings. His staff was nothing but helpful and the end result was beautiful. 

I got a white cake with butter cream frosting and whipped cream with fresh strawberries for the filling. It was a perfect combination and everyone loved it. I will be going to them for all of my special occasions from now on.

One of my favorite spots in town. The crew there is great and low key. The coffee and other drinks are inexpensive but good (they use Green Star Coffee so it is locally roasted). It is a bit of a hodgepodge of items (coffee, breakfast/lunch, cakes, Asian drinks/snacks) but it a great place to get some work done. There is also a bit of an international flare because students from the Language Schools often study at Henning's and the staff is diverse. It isn't the "cool" place in town, but you will see normal people and normal families. It's a good spot.

Food is delish. Just got over 2 day food poisoning from here. i know it was here because that's all i ate that day. worst sickness of my life dude. staff was very friendly and prompt. but fr check the food temps, i thought i was gona die.
Customer service was great. I used the drive thru. Large portions but a bit pricey for what it is. Food is decent but not great.
Food was pretty good for fast food but it is only lukewarm...I think it would be better if they could heat the food better.  Prefer Chipotle's.

I echo the rest of these reviews that say they have excellent service. Each worker was an angel in this understaffed, wild world. I wish I could remember the two other worker's names but I do remember Jay, the wise, older cashier. My wife and I came in with our ten month old son and he offered, and got us, a high chair for him. It was very attentive and kind of him. Then he gave our son a spoon to play with. Anyone with a little one knows that a spoon is the king of toys for a baby of that age. Jay also gave him a second spoon that he put on our tray because he knows how little ones always drop their spoons. Jay deserves a raise and so do the other workers. The food was also top notch. I would travel great lengths to go to this Costa Vida. If I lived in another Costa Vida I would still go to this one.
The service was amazing! They went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we need! They stayed cool while having a full house which is rare in restaurants! Will be coming back here!

Walked into Costa  Vida at 8:55 pm, and they close at 9. Staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. They packed our food to go, and we took it back to the hotel. I'll probably never be in Boise again, so likely won't return, but the customer service and attitude of staff was unusually great! I interacted with 3-4 young staff, and they were all super friendly!
Food was excellent. Give these young people a raise!!!

I have only been to one other location, but this Costa Vida takes the cake in my book. For one, they have a really cool garage-type door on the front of their suite, so it is an open-aired sort of dining experience. 

We came in during lunchtime on a Monday, and it wasn't too busy. We were greeted right away, and all of the employees that made our food and ran the register were all super friendly and clearly knew what they were doing. They made sure to explain that the shrimp for our salad would take a few minutes to cook and asked if we needed anything else once we sat (like extra tortillas, dressings, salsas, etc.)

My BF and I split the Kids Enchilada plate (friend-recommended for a lighter lunch). We got it with chicken, and it I liked that it came with refreshing lettuce and pico. 

My Shrimp Salad was my fave. The Cilantro-Lime dressing is just amazing. I swear I get cravings for this alone, so it keeps me coming back. I would be down to try a different protein next time -- I usually get veggie salads, but not this time.

Tasty food and great ambiance.  It's a little pricey for a fast food place but the food is fresh and delicious.  The drive thru makes it easy.  The staff is always friendly.  It's close to my hotel so I will return

We were on vacation late last Saturday night when I entered the wrong address during my online order. I called and even though we were out of area, we were accommodated and are super appreciative we didn't have to go to bed hungry. Pizza and wings came quickly and we're still hot! A+ service!

ordered pizza and cinnabons on saturday. there was a rubber band in the cinnabons. under the frosting.
gross

We decided to hit up this Pizza Hut while we were in the area while we were visiting family. I got the taste make your pizza with the bacon sausage and pepperoni on it and we also got some boneless hot wings which were fantastic. If you never had Pizza Hut hot wings they are one of the best around excellent place for sure

This particular store does so well in getting our order right every single time. We order from here at least once a month and it's always FRESH and correct. When we did have an order of breadsticks missing, they even had a driver bring it to us within minutes! Great staff and awesome timeliness.

This Hut used to be pretty good, but it has gone downhill, and frankly, it sucks. Waiting ten minutes longer than told, I returned home to a pizza that wasn't baked long enough. I tried to eat a slice but it was nasty, due to the undercooking. So I preheat the oven and cooked the pizza myself, pizza was fine after that. The staff seemed totally disinterested and seemed improperly trained, This isn't my first time going through this, but it is my last.

Great experience with this restaurant. I had a minor problem a while back and brought it to their attention. The management (owner?) Went out of their way to correct the issue and I had a very hot, fresh and satisfying meal today.  Definitely will be back soon.

One piece down...gotta hand it to them. This is their new Detroit style. We grew up on this pizza from Buddy's and Cloverleaf for those of you from Detroit city area. Really good dough. Nice and chewy not a bit gummy. Fresh red onions and mushrooms, not canned. Heavy oregano sauce. Just like it's supposed to be. I would say they just need to season their pans some more. In time. Actually, pretty good and delicious. Congrats to the Hut! 5 star rating considering this is in Florida.
Garbage service, they received my order but did not follow through with making and delivering it after they confirmed the order.

This Pizza Hut used to be pretty good, but it has gone was down hill. I ordered curbside deliv. Got there, called and got no answer. Some corporate office finally answered and called the store and also got no answer and told me to go in. So I did. Thats when I saw big signs posted on the door that said NO Curbside Service! Even tho the app says they have it. The app said my pizza was ready, but they said it was going to be 4 more min. The phone was ringing and noone was answering it. The employees don't seem to care at all.

Got the aloo matar tonight. It was phenomenal. I already thought I had gotten the best meal at Desi Flavor and somehow they outdo themselves. It was so packed with flavor without ever feeling salty. Such a nice flavor with the creamy tomato sauce. The flavor HITS. The flavor SLAPS. It's absolutely delicious food here. They never let me and my friends down. I tried almost every other indian restaurant in tampa and nothing else reaches their level. They really are something special.
You must try them!

Desi located at telecom park. Which they can get a lot Hindu customers who work on IT at this commercial park. They located at the end unit of the plaza which allows them to have some outdoor seating. During the weekday, they serve Tali plate. Weekend they serve buffet for lunch. 

The buffet have a lot meat selection. I like the mutton curry. Among the meat curry, I also like their chili chicken and the chicken curry. Tandoori chicken is also good there. They have served different biryanis. But I like the noodle. One thing special I can said is the shrimp curry. It is interesting. 

Overall the price is at the high side. I do not get the wow factor. But I can tell you they don't make it less spicy because of Americans. They did spicy the food which suppose to be. I would give them 3.5 star f

We had the buffet today. The food was tasty and there was a large variety. We'll be back, for sure. We've missed being able to go to Indian buffets. I scoured the websites of every Indian restaurant I could find in Gainesville, Orlando, and Tampa -- especially those we have been to before. Many of them still claim to have buffets, but a quick check of reviews shows comments like 'they stopped the buffet' and 'too bad they no longer have the buffet'. It seems kind of odd to me because there are certainly Chinese restaurants which still have them. I had just about given up finding one when I stumbled across Desi Flavor. That is one reason I wanted to enter this review -- not only did we like the food on the buffet, but to confirm that as of today, anyway (Jan 17, 2021) they most certainly have one even if it is only available Fri, Sat, and Sun.

We went for a lunch buffet on Sunday. This indian restaurant is a small one just behind of USF. The lunch buffet had various options including 2-3 options for chicken, 2-3 options for rice, nice veg options. They offer USF student discounts also. Please do try this place.

I was too busy eating to take pictures of the fantastic lunch buffet this place has. My mom and I drove out of our way to come to this restaurant because we enjoyed it so much after our first visit. Everything is fresh and they change up the dishes offered in the lunch buffet. The service is attentive and they take COVID precautions seriously. This is definitely a new favorite for us!
This is one of the best Indian restaurants we've been to. They have excellent food, great service and you'll have very pleasant folks servicing you.

I would recommend you give Desi Flavors a try.  This was my first meal at a restaurant in over a year because of the beautiful shaded patio area.  I ordered the veggie lunch special and was pleased with the food.  I will be back whenever I get the chance.

This little restaurant put out delicious food! The best Kurma I've ever tasted. They have a buffet on Friday, Saturday, & Sunday and the menu is well divided between vegetarian and non vegetarian dishes. The staff are kind and attentive. It was so good that I'm writing this review!

Full disclosure: I've only eaten here during the weekend buffet that they do (I think that this is actually Friday-Sunday, either out of a misunderstanding of the concept of a weekend or as part of a conscious effort to defy it) because home is the southerly parts of Pinellas and, given the existence of thirty-some miles of miscellaneous urban nonsense between where I am and where they are (I need to take three interstates to get here, each more stultifying than the last), it might as well be in one of the Dakotas, or else some forbidding slope in Kamchatka, where the wolves howl and the night does not end. Thus, I've never been here for a normal meal and ordered a normal item off the menu like a normal person. But I've been to the buffet many times, since the place is right across the street (or *almost* just across the street) from Lettuce Lake Park, a lovely place to wander and gawp at the alligators and weird birds for the princely sum of $2.

Utterly full disclosure: If I have any tiny trace of blood from the Indian subcontinent, it's been so diluted and diffused by generation upon generation of angry people who make angry-looking buildings that it probably now couldn't fill a grasshopper's coffee mug, and I'm pretty sure that I've never been within three thousand miles of Delhi. So I have no claim to judge what constitutes authentic Indian food of any stripe, and anyone who does should feel free to snort contemptuously and consign this review to whatever part of their brain they use to store voicemails about extending their car warranty or the phone books that regularly land in their yards and absorb rain and reclaimed water until they're a soupy mess.

But, even given the above caveats, this very well might be the best Indian restaurant I've ever visited. I've had a long and checkered career of visiting Indian restaurants, from the dismal downtown buffet where you eat too much chicken tikka for no discernible reason (it does not spark joy or create satisfaction, but still you keep eating it) and enter a state of such profound drowsiness that you immediately understand that you will never get anything important done for the rest of the day, to the smalltown restaurant putting on airs with white tablecloths and silver where the most complex item on the menu is saag paneer, to the grotesque and misbegotten Midwestern late-Fifties steadily-collapsing concrete-and-sheet-metal monstrosity where beef vindaloo (???) is on the menu and the servers mispronounce the names of dishes with the insouciant confidence of the utterly damned. So, whatever mitigating factors might be in place, I stand by my pronouncement.

The buffet, and the menu in general (which, again, I haven't sampled at length, but have browsed) seem to make reluctant concessions to American taste, offering some of the usual suspects (butter chicken, tikka masala, whatever vindaloo), but seem to be mostly interested in going beyond that. The weekend buffet reliably has goat curry, which is wonderful (and spicy!) and not something that is regularly included in the genre, and the chili chicken (which is usually interpreted as some soupy, sticky variant on Chinese food, as per its origins) is a sort of dry, fried, spice-encrusted dish, gloriously addictive. And many dishes whose names are unfamiliar to me--a sort of rice pudding, but not the kheer that is easily found at every five-and-dime buffet across the nation, instead a complex, spicy concoction with caraway and green chile, or a set of fritters (labeled "baby corn," though I'm not at all sure that's what they were) that become transcendent when dipped in one of the array of lovely sauces that they provide. And it's actually spicy, or, rather, many dishes are (the butter chicken is still, predictably, bland and inoffensive), which is damn near impossible to find in an Indian restaurant around these parts--even some of the buffet items have a decent bite. And the little (free!) cups of chai that they provide--strong, but not too sweet, not like the milky sugared-up lattes that you get at Starbucks. And this, and that, and more. Yes, it's slightly spendy (currently around $15 for the buffet), but you don't eat here every day and, perhaps, like me, you've driven for a while to be here, in a weird abandoned parking lot adjacent to a Holiday Inn Express adjacent to a huge tech park... so it's probably worth it.

But if you've just skipped to the end, here, in hopes of discovering whether this restaurant is good and whether you should eat here, the answer is, definitely, yes and yes. If you are even remotely intrigued by Indian food, and if you do not shrink from the notion of capsaicin-laced food as if it were the machinations of the devil himself, you owe it to yourself to visit this place. Yes, it's in the parking lot of a hotel, and it's tiny, and you don't know where you are or what's what (welcome to Florida). Just go in and eat the goat curry, you weirdo.

Absolutely amazing! We just happened upon this establishment while visiting the area, and wow what a find! Quality food, fair prices, and wonderful people. The flavor profile is authentic and spot on. Highly recommend!!!

We went for the weekend lunch buffet and we're NOT disappointed! Everything was delicious, and the staff was super helpful and kind. 10/10 would recommend. 

Also the fresh naan was TO DIE FOR!! Sooooo good!!!!

Come support this local business!
Great flavor. Naan was unbelievable. Excellent and very friendly service. Very authentic.

Found this place on Yelp and it did not disappoint. Nice buffet with all the traditional flavors. 4 stars only because I had to ask for my water to be refilled twice. Not a big deal. Looking forward to returning.

No a good 1st impression. Ordered online when I arrived my order was not ready. Waited maybe 3-5 minutes for it to be prepared. Smoothie tasted like nothing. $7.40 wasted. The franchise was recommended by a friend who has one in her area. Maybe I simply ordered the wrong thing. If you'd like give it a whirl... I could buy bags of fruit and make my own for the price. In a pinch I would consider going there again.

I know you are not opened yet, but I am so psyched!  I love this place.  Low calorie goodness. Please hire the best people!   

Will update my review later.

I'm giving this tropical smoothie cafe a 3/5 because the service was so terrible it's a disgrace. I stood in front of the cashier to give my order for maybe 5 mins while there was 3-4 working that kept glancing at me and two of them asking each other who is going to take my order... on top of that I got my smoothie and it was more ice than anything. Very disappointing.

Ordered online due to the outbreak. The staff did their best dealing with the online orders but I waited a bit longer to get my order. I got the AVOCOLADA, which was decent. I'm happy they have a place like this in Philadelphia. I originally tried this place in DC.

I never leave reviews because it's never that serious but my boyfriend brought me here because we've had a crazy morning so we came hoping to get a smoothie and enjoy the weather. When we walked in, we were the only ones in the store and there were 5 people working. No one greeted us, they all had a wild stank face on the entire time. So I give my order, my boyfriend gives his, and as I type this - I'm currently on my 20th minute of waiting. They're all standing there, looking extremely confused & irritated, and no ones making our order. There are now 4 other people in the store and have yet to order. I literally never leave reviews - but wtf? How are these people employed?

I know you are not opened yet, but I am so psyched!  I love this place.  Low calorie goodness. Please hire the best people!   

3/14 second visit okay. Had to throw my side kale salad out.  IT WAS NOT FRESH.  The wrap was good and the smoothies on point.

Employees not wearing mask while preparing food and one was drinking a chick fila shake while preparing food.  This location needs some etiquette, professionalism and It also looks to be managers doing this they have pink shirts. The smoothie was also terrible I've gotten it from this location multiple times bf same exact smoothie she had to remake it twice and still didn't make it correctly. I gave up and just took the smoothie and trashed it.

So far it seems good. I got the pesto chicken sandwich and avocado smoothie. It comes as a combo (if you want to make it that) with your choice of potato chips. The sandwich was tasty, although better preparation could've gone into it. The smoothie was good. I wonder if the smoothie is made with natural ingredients? The ordering process is easy as you place it online to pick up. You cannot go in to pick it up, they will ask you for your name and bring you your order as to maintain social distancing. It's really good to have a healthier option out of all the fast food places adjacent, beside the Chipotle. I hope to see more added in this area.
They all avoid greeting or acknowledging people when you walk in. No gloves or masks. Won't be back

I was charged for a full smoothie and sandwich when I asked for a half. She figured it out after charging but did not refund. I waited 35+ minute for my order in store. The employees did not seem to care. I love the food and it was yummy, but I can't stand the wait time any longer.

This location has TERIBBLE customer service. I had to ask an employee if I could place my order because I had been in the store for 5 minutes and still hadn't been greeted. After waiting for 10 mins, they got my order incorrect and had to wait an additional 5 minutes for another smoothie. They are standing around on their phones and drinking their own beverages. Needs better management. I did however enjoy my smoothie and wrap.

Smoothies and food great.. Customer service needs to be better they are rude.. They have people waiting outside acting as if they don't see them messing up orders while one female sit there watching the others work and not even come to the door to greet the customers after we have knocked on the door several times.. Knocking on the door and the employees looking at each other laughing what's funny???? Get new staff with customer service skills

The crepes were amazing. Had chipotle chicken huge portion, the special apple pie. Homemade apples were delicious and had a Greek salad dressing was so good. Plenty for 3 people to share. The only downfall is it takes awhile to get your order so definitely order ahead. I will definitely be back!

I had only had sweet crepes before I came here. I finally tried a savory one and it was delicious. I'm slightly addicted. The lattes are good too!  Bubble waffle and icecream is great dessert (wish they were open later because I always want that at night). The flatbreads were great too!

Awesome food great service hip music while you wait 

Kids loved their strawberry banana crepe

 I had the breakfast waffle which was double thumbs up
This is the new Cafe V-dal, with so much more flare! We love the changes they made and the food is still sooo delicious!

I use to go to Cafe V Dal in Lansdale for breakfast a lot. Unfortunately the cafe closed and then I heard rumors that the owners reopened a spot elsewhere. Well
I finally made it the Crepe Place V Dal. Looks like they still have crepes but I use to love the regular breakfast menu items like the egg dishes, Benedict's and pancakes the old spot served up. 

Decided to try the Marguerite flat bread for lunch. I have to say, the portion size was larger than I expected and I was not mad about it for under $10. That balsamic glaze over simple
mozzarella, basil and sliced tomatoes was delish. For a 'flat bread' pizza, the crust was thicccc. Not in the area enough but I'd like to try their bubble waffles which was not served at the cafe.

The crepes were AMAZING! I don't know how this place doesn't have a line constantly out the door. The crepes are delicious, coffee is perfect, and they carry bubble tea? What more could anyone want? Staff were super nice and kept checking in to make sure we were content. I would have posted a picture of the food, but we ate it all.

Finally Edmonton gets a Bambu! As a Viet - this is a fun play on our dessert che. Everything is delicious and the pandan waffle is a must!!! They're quite busy so make sure you have enough for time to wait for your order.

So many desserts and drinks - where to begin? The friendly staff helped me through the vast menu, even though I ultimately settled on a basic iced Vietnamese coffee. You can build your own drink or dessert, or pick from the menu. I don't even know how to describe the variety of fruits and toppings from which to choose. I will return and try to be more adventurous.

I love fancy Asian drinks. This place has cool Asian drinks. Beans in your beverage, and they're not coffee? You bet. Mung beans. Red beans. And some exotic fruits like lychee and longan? Yes please. 

Check it out.

First of all,  I hate anything that's in the heart of Whyte Ave, mainly because parking and traffic are a pain in the behind.  I also hate having to pay for parking, but lucked out today and found some free one hour parking a block away.  

The menu is pretty extensive; there's lots of choices.  We all opted for the ché (Vietnamese dessert drink) and the pandan waffle because I love pandan.  I had the fruit addict, which I found pretty sweet (almost too sweet when drank vs eaten with a spoon).  I think I'll try adjusting the sugar level next time. I really liked the pandan jelly.  Not sure how this is considered a drinkable dessert since most of the items in the cup doesn't even fit into a straw.  My brother had the Bambu special.  He didn't like it because he thought it was too sweet.  My cousin had the longan sunrise. Surprisingly, she found it too bland and had to add some honey to it, but she liked it otherwise. 

The pandan waffle was nice and chewy,  although I couldn't really taste the pandan. 

Lost a star for the incredibly slow service. Took us around 20 min to get our order.  The slow service is a bit of a deterrent for a repeat visit, although we found out that you can call in your order ahead of time to avoid the wait around.

There's a new dessert place on whyte and I had to check it out. They are a dessert chain from the States and specialize in Vietnamese dessert and drinks.

I stopped by on a Saturday afternoon and it was semi busy. There were two groups in front of us. With the covid situation right now, they are only offering takeout and all the tables are placed in a way to allow for social distancing.

I ordered two types of their Che (#2 Bambu Combo and #6 Fruit Addict). Che is a dessert drink. It was like a shaved ice dessert on top of coconut milk with many types of toppings in a cup. They were both very refreshing and delicious. Each had its own unique taste. I was surprised at how filling they were. 

I also ordered the Pandan Waffle. This was bomb! Very crunchy and it had a mochi texture. Definitely recommend getting this. 

Pro Tip: The Che isn't too sweet so do not reduce the sugar level even though you have an option to.

Overall I had a great experience. Service was friendly and efficient. Their dessert is a perfect treat to get while walking around Whyte. I'll likely come back in the future to try the other items on the menu.

I've kept my pizza expectations very low in Nashville -- no offense to the city, it's just not New York. But, just the photos I saw of Midnight Oil got me excited. It looked like the NYC slices of my dreams, and I appreciated the fact that other local food reviewers were the ones sharing the photos and rave reviews, not the restaurant itself. Its own social media is vague and humorous -- again, reminiscent of a good pizza place in the Northeast.

I got the Sweet Heat pie -- capicola, jalapeños and honey -- and an order of buffalo wings. Both exceeded my already high expectations. I usually don't get jalapeños on any food I order out because measurements are usually way off what I'd prefer -- either way too spicy or two jalapeño slices on the whole thing. This was the absolute perfect amount. And despite the pizza being huge (and not too expensive for the size at $22), the crust maintained that perfect thinness without being too crispy or floppy.

The wings that were wings, not drums, were great, but that's always a preference thing for me and my own fault for not asking for all wings. The buffalo sauce was also the perfect amount of heat to still be able to taste the pizza in the next bite. I'll have to try the highly-favored centennial wings next time -- whatever that sauce is. I'm in.

Five stars for friendly service.  4 stars for pizza (New York-y but not moreso than Five Points or Joey's as other reviews suggest).  Three stars for the chicken skewers which were hot all the way thru but a little too soft inside.

Excellent pizza, not that I should be surprised that the owners of Centennial deliver great food here too.  Expect a lot of pizza...delicious pizza and their wings are always best with centennial sauce.  Enjoy!

Whoever decided to open a pizzeria located between Nicky's Coal Fired and Five Points Pizza in the midst of a pandemic is someone who is either a) insane or b) knows what they have. Midnight Oil is the latter. Citizens of Yelp, rejoice, you have found Nashville's most faithful NY slice. 

We ordered a pie: half pepperoni, half sweet heat. Upon first bite, the first thing you will notice is the perfectly crisped dough. Just the right touch of crunch before giving way to a marriage of expertly portioned cheese and sauce. This is the kind of pie that is able to impress even with no toppings. However, you would be doing yourself a disservice to ignore the lovely honey-spicy combo that the sweet heat pie provides. The honey and jalapeño locked in perfect balance while the capicola secretly steals the show.

If you pass on Midnight Oil, you are making a mistake.

Delish. Perfectly crispy crust, not floppy in the middle. This is coming from someone who normally doesn't like pizza very much -- LOVED this. So good. Definitely a contender, if not winner, for best pizza in Nashville.

Pizza is sub-par, there are much better options within a 1 mile radius. Our server was possibly the rudest I've ever had. I've worked in the food industry, so I understand the stress and pressure, and try to be understanding but it was another level. The place was half empty and he made us feel incredibly unwelcome. Cut us off twice in the middle of ordering one appetizer to leave. Snapped at us for asking any questions. Was hoping for a great bar and pizza joint in the neighborhood but would recommend avoiding.
Great atmosphere and even better pizza! The cheesy bread is a MUST TRY item off the menu. The frozè drinks are amazing too!
the staff is friendly and helpful, the pizza is amazing and the frozen drinks are on point. I recommend the sweet heat or the white pizza neither disappoint. my new go to in the nations.

This was ok but nothing special. If you're in the mood for NYC pizza it's a solid option. On the plus side the pies are HUGE and the customer service was very nice. 

However, the crust wasn't the doughy kind I like. Instead there were tons of air bubbles, so no real chew. My daughter ordered the sweet heat pizza and the "heat" part was just some jalepenos. She commented that it would have been better if the sauce had some bite or there was a spicy pepperoni. I had the pepperoni which was fine. 

Overall, not something I'd go back for but it's not bad.
Great service, cool vibe, terrible pizza. Very sugary sauce. I think that, for the price point it's OK. I just couldn't get the sugary flavor out of my mouth and it wasn't for me.

Incredible all around. Really cool place with a huge garage door so it's more of a big open air pizzeria. Slices of pizza and margaritas/froze to go. The pizza was awesome - sweet heat was the best one - and we loved the peach jalapeño margarita. Staff was really nice as well. It was nice to see the place was busy. We will be back many many times!

This is my first experience here. The pizza is incredible. The crust is nice and fluffy and the pizza has the perfect amount of grease. For $3 I would have liked the pizza by the slice to be a little bigger but the flavoring was next level. The flop factor was there.
Love this place! The frosé is absolutely delicious and highly recommend the sweet heat and meat pie pizzas.

Amazing addition to the neighborhood. Pizza is great, and huge (like, can't fit into my fridge). Much better than 5 points down the road. The drinks are awesome too, especially that frozen rose on a hot summer day. Love the patio (especially during these times). A slice of sweet heat will make your day!

Nashville isn't known for its pizza but Midnight Oil could change that. It's been a go-to since Covid and the frose' is Ah-mazing! Can't wait to spend more time in-person when things are back to normal
Man I love this place. Cool vibe. Pizza is great... but man- those Frozen Peach Jalapeño Margaritas! Strong, fresh, and only $10?! Count me in.
