Awesome pizza and cheesy breadsticks!! Love the vibe of this place and great service. Def will be heading back!

I'm a big five points person and I can't believe I'm typing this but I think I like midnight oil better! We got the sweet heat and it was delish! There is one thing eating at me though and I wish I would have said something while I was there when I had the chance....$7 for a bowl of bagged iceberg lettuce, some slices of cheese and a few croutons??? That's it, that's the house salad. Extremely underwhelming and extremely overpriced, it still haunts me. Just get the pizza and avoid the salad -no matter what.

Delicious.  Felt like I grabbed a slice in Brooklyn.  Sauce is tangy and a slight spice.  Crust is soft but has that crunch that you want.  Rated it a 8.1 on barstool scale.  I eat a shitload of pizza so trust.
It was just okay to me. Very very average. It is a very sweet sauce and crust as well. Just not a fan- wonderful  customer service though.

pizza is so good and HUGE! Also got a frosé (which typically isn't my favorite drink) but it was the best one I have ever had! Such a cute neighborhood spot and does walk up service well - nice employees and sanitized regularly to ensure customers are safe.
Really enjoyed our pie! Flavor was awesome! Definitely recommend supporting this new business.

Pizza is good, prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere / customer service is A+!! Try their froze on a warm day and you won't regret it. This will definitely become a regular dinner outing for my household.

Ordered the meat pie pizza. It fed four people perfectly! We were all stuffed with our two large pieces. Pretty good! As a sauce lover, I was disappointed because there was barely any on it. I'd give it another try & ask for extra next time! Overall a good choice. I can't wait to try the buffalo pizza next time. I also heard their frosé is great!
Great tang! Great crust! Perfect slice! The centennial wings are the best in Nashville!
Holy cow, their Sweet Heat pizza is EXCELLENT! Highly recommended Customer service and location is top notch.

This is our favorite restaurant to hang out at in the neighborhood! Pizza and drinks are both so great, and the staff are wonderful! Also, they take COVID precautions seriously and it's been so nice being able to come here and enjoy a drink while still feeling safe

The frozen rosé drinks are super good! Not too sweet, and a great way to cool down in the Tennessee heat. Our server, Sean, was kind and welcoming. We appreciated the hospitality and warm welcome! Great patio for sunny days, and a walk up bar for quick service. Love this local spot.

I've been hearing about this place so we gave it a whirl over the weekend. Everything was fantastic. Cheesy bread was a great start. I had a slice of sweet heat and we also got a half pepperoni half cheese pizza. Slices are big but if you fold it like you're supposed to then you're good. Sweet heat had the perfect blend of spicy with the honey topping it off. Tried the pepperoni and wasn't disappointed. We were able to feed 4 with some food to take home. Which, by the way, was still tasty the next day. The thin crist held up. Service was great and I will be back. A lot.

So glad this place exists 5 min from me! Great east coast style pizza and had their centennial wings. Im not usually a wing person, but they were soo good! The guys working there are super nice too! Thanks for making me happy during quarantine life!

This place was great! The pizza came out piping hot and was still hot when I got home.  It had a great flavor and was not too spicy.  Not a whole lot of great pizza in Nashville but this one is one of the bests.  Better than 5 points if that's your go to place.

An almost but not quite perfect representation of New York slice joint pizza.

Having moved here from NYC finding good pizza in Nashville has been...well, like finding good BBQ up there. Five Points does a solid representation of a traditional New York pie, with fresh mozzarella and a wide variety of toppings. Midnight Oil, on the other hand, comes very close to nailing what you'd get at a classic NYC slice joint: the kind of place where you order at the counter and receive 18" slices of simply-topped pizza on white paper plates. It's less fancy, but no less difficult to pull off well.

And Midnight Oil comes very close to doing so. Their crust is light and airy without being overly floppy. It didn't have the crisp bottom that you ideally want from this style of pizza, but most NYC slice joints don't achieve that consistently and it still had a nice foldability to it. The balance of crust, sauce, and cheese was spot on, with no one element overshadowing the others.

The only place where Midnight Oil really falls short is in their sauce. NYC pizza sauce has a slight sweetness to it that was missing here; instead it was overly seasoned and on the bitter side. It was actually more akin to what you'd find on a Chicago-style thin crust pizza, but while it works well for that style it's out of place here. I noticed earlier reviewers mentioning that the sauce was too sweet for them, so I wonder if this place had actually nailed the New York style to begin with but changed in response to complaints from people with no idea of how this style of pizza is supposed to taste. I hope not.

Aside from the sauce, my only suggestion to the owners of Midnight Oil would be to add garlic knots and a Grandma pie to the menu. And maybe train your staff to have a more surly attitude for full effect - the service was far too quick and courteous for New York pizza! 

In all seriousness, while I hope they'll improve their sauce, this was still a damn good pizza and I will definitely be back for more.

Great open-air, heated, covered outdoor front patio (and even in cold weather they don't use any plastic side curtains or screens or anything trapping air or breath like so many that don't get it). And really friendly staff - Tony was incredibly welcoming and kind to us first-time customers!

Their standard pizza is an extra-large 16" New York style (crispy-chewy thin crust, baked in a non-wood pizza oven), and the topping style is meticulous and generous - every single pie I saw come out of the kitchen looked perfectly photoshoot ready. I love seeing a kitchen take such pride in their product!

Ordered a few beers (~$5/each) and a build-your-own pizza with capicola & jalapeño ($21) - which is basically a *no honey* mod of the "Sweet Heat" which ends up being $1 less than their signature pie, which is cool. This pizza was fantastic and well-balanced. The outer crust was ideal - equal parts crispy and chewy - but toward the inside I would have a preferred a little more baked-in doneness. The droopiness of the inside of the slices necessitated some folding of the slice while eating, which turns pizza into a calzone experience of sorts and hits your tastebuds in unintended areas. Because of all of the folding, I tried to conserve the pizza because I knew how good it would be reheated by the slice on a hot pizza stone at home. Knowing this, grabbing a pizza-to-go from Midnight Oil is an obvious 5-star move if you enjoy the true NY slice experience (toasting up individual slices). The next time I eat a pizza at the restaurant I will ask for it well-done or "extra toasted" to see if it's improved. For to-go pizzas, normal doneness is perfect if you're going to toast it up on a pizza stone yourself.

The capicola here is such a unique and quality pizza topping - and because it's a real muscle meat (not a processed tube like pepperoni or salami) it reduces the guilt factor in eating this pizza. Of course I'd prefer a sprouted grain crust instead of the white flour they use, but hey - as long as I don't eat white flour every day...

I stumbled on this place by accident one Friday night. The pizza is cheap by the slice and there is a lot of various beers and wines to choose from. It is an evening restaurant so do not make the mistake of coming for lunch during the work week. However, weekends they are open at 11am. 

The pizza is great! Honestly might be the best pizza in Nashville. It's simple and taste really good! 

The vibes are so chill as well!

I don't know about their pizza, but I do know about their frose. It is wonderful! It's boozy, which I appreciate. None of that sweet, syrupy mess. If you are looking for a nice summer beverage with a kick, go get yourself a glass or styrofoam to go cup of frose!

Midnight Oil opened at the start of the pandemic and kept The Nations Neighbors somewhat sane. On any given Friday or Saturday (...or Thursday or Wednesday) you'd see fellow neighbors out walking the dog and sipping on the delight that is a frozen peach jalapeño margarita. And not that we needed any more pizza in The Nations, but Midnight Oil is definitely the best. The Sweet Heat is unique and delicious. The bartenders and servers are friendly, efficient, and consistent. This is a little gem in the best neighborhood in Nashville!

I have never had a pizza here I didn't like. Sweet heat? Spicy, sweet, creative. Buffalo chicken? A tailgate party in your mouth. White pizza? gotta get my veggies in. Pepperoni? A classic staple. Not to mention their frosè is the best in Nashville. Trying to stay warm? Try their spiked hot chocolate. This place is a 10/10 every time, and by every time I mean every weekend because that's how often I visit. Great food, great staff, great atmosphere.
Delicious NYC style pizza. Very large pie. Thin, extra crispy crust. We heard about Midnight Oil on Nextdoor and will definitely be back soon. Excellent pizza and nice folks.

Got a to go pizza last week and these pizzas are huge! We got the BYO with Sausage, Pepperoni, Black Olives, Green Peppers, and Jalapeños. It was really good. My dad loved it and I enjoyed it as well (though I did find it a little salty the first day)s I had leftovers the second day though and I thought it was even better than day one! 
Also loved that it was not dripping in grease!

Definitely recommend checking out.

Visiting nashville and this was one of the pizza places recommended to us.  We had a large party on a Thursday and it was perfect for us.  Fair amount of tequila - which is a plus for me and the pizza was fantastic.
One of the best late night spots around. The pizza is always stupid good and the staff in super friendly.

This is the best pizza in Nashville without a doubt. The Sweet Heat is *Chef's kiss*. The buffalo chicken pizza and the 3 meat pizza are also fabulous. I love that they have a ton of TVs and has that Sports Bar feel to it. Servers/bartenders are also super friendly and quick.
We got two large pizzas to go and they were delicious! This is thin crust wood-fired pizza like you get in Northern Italy, not loaded with toppings, but loaded with flavor!
I am 57 years old and this is by far the best pizza I have ever had. Period.  And service is super friendly and fast. Must try!

I love this pizza. I go to Midnight Oil at least once a month if not more. What keeps bringing me back is how awesome this old school NYC pizza is. Pizza that has that perfect amount of thinness, combined with a rich sauce, great cheese, and of course, the perfectly cooked pepperoni. My one MAJOR gripe is how flat the coke always tastes. In fact, I've never been once and had coke that tasted like it was fresh from anything. Midnight Oil, please check this issue out! Overall, great pizza. One of the best in Nashville no doubt.

This place is pretty cool and I can't wait to visit more often in person post pandemic. They have awesome outdoor seats and a cool setup. 

We ordered pizza and cheesy bread to go. They missed our garlic sauce and ricotta on half of our pizza but it happens. The food was still really good!

Next time I may just order three things of cheesy bread. It is so good! Best cheesy bread in Nashville and that is hard to do.

I still have yet to actually dine in, but I've ordered pizza twice from here. The first time I was pumped, the pizza was really big, really good, and at only $22 bucks for a three meat pizza, it's a steal in my book. I brought it to a party and everyone was loving it and asking me where I got it. Score, my new favorite pizza spot. The second time I ordered I decided just to get one for myself and I was going to eat it over the week, such a great deal! But, I ordered through the web site (like before) and saw there was a "sub for cauliflower crust" option. I was like sweet, I like cauliflower crust. I show up to pick up the pizza and they hand me a box that is probably 1/3 the size of the first pizza I ordered. I was visibly confused and questioned the person and they essentially gave the reasoning that the cauliflower is much more expensive. Ok, fair enough, but there was zero information on the site as to the size of the pizza, regular or not when I check that option. What if I'm ordering for 6 people and not one or two? Knowing that option will reduce the size from XL to personal size might be important. Just maybe. If the person had remotely attempted to fix the problem I'd be 5 stars all day. But instead he kind of just looked at me and we sat in silence for a second until I awkwardly said ok and left. I'll continue to come here because the food is good and it has great vibe, but I hope they provide a little more info on the ordering site so people don't have the same disappointment I did. It's a great spot!

Actually found this place on Tik Tok and decided to try it out. It's SO good. Order the cheesy breadsticks. Trust. (Not pictured because we scarfed them down, lol.) But they have a fantastic beer selection and the pizzas are ginormous. If you're a ranch lover, they do charge for ranch, which is always heartbreaking lol. But overall this place was the real deal!

A top-notch place for slices and drinks. Underrated in the Nashville pizza scene and one of the top in West Nashville, if not #1. Plenty of indoor seating for games or great for patio weather in the spring, summer, and fall. Been numerous times and never been a bad experience!!!

I was nervous to try this place because I love five points. I didn't want to be disappointed but I was far from that! We decided to try the sweet heat and the pepp. Both were delicious! The sweet heat is the perfect mix of sweet and heat hence the name. I'm not big on spicy stuff but I still loved the sweet heat. The menu is small but I appreciated that. It made the decision easy. The prices are also right. We'll be back! Highly recommend!

YUM!!! Oh man I love a good thin crust NY Style pizza and this did not disappoint! The pizzas are huuuge but very thin so we totally ate the whole thing. Half cheese and half sweet heat. The Sweet Heat is AWESOME! spicy and salty and sweet. Overall the pizza could use a touch more flavor or herbs, but a great slice!

As of 10/14/2014 this location is closed.

Words To make this review long enough.

Im sure the service was awesome and so fast you would freak, but i guess i will never know.

Although I don't usually feel the need to review chain restaurants (we all know them, have eaten at them in a pinch or when rushed, 'nuf said) I wanted to give this Subway a mention. 

It is one of the most inviting Subway's I've ever stepped foot in. It is upscale and cozy (think Starbuck's type atmosphere). The staff is friendly, fast and make gr8 sandwiches-no all-bread bites here. 

So if you are near and need a quick bite, it's not a bad choice. And you can place an order online and pick it up to boot!
No big surprise here folks...the place is now out of business!

Came here for a quick sandwich on a Thursday night.  The sign says that they were open until 9:00pm....great!  It was 8:45....plenty of time to get a sandwich right?  Apparently NOT!  The door was already locked and the manager looked up and saw us and basically ignored us!   Guess he doesn't need the business....well, he has his wish, I'll never come here again!  I'd rather just head over to Wawa, at least they are friendly and always ready to make you a sandwich.

Worst Subway ever! This used to be a good branch under the old nice guy management last year, but since the new idiot manager came in, this place took a huge dive. I tried to stop in for a late dinner at 8:45pm, the posted hours in the window saying it was open until 9:00pm, but the doors were locked. The manager was inside and he looked right at me and then just ignored me. Guess he didn't want the business. No problem buddy, Jimmy John's is just down the street and is now cheaper with the recent Subway jumps from $5 to $6 on Footlongs. Jimmy John's is now my new place for subs. Adioso Subway in Wayne.
The food is wonderful, MRS management !! Has an attitude nine miles long takes the good out of ok place to sit, again great healthy food good prices

We saw that a Korean fried chicken restaurant had opened nearby and we knew that we had to try it. We ordered the signature fried chicken and the garlic cheese snowing. We waited for a few minutes while our chicken was prepared and carried them home. 

The chicken smelled amazing while we were walking home. The chicken tasted even better. It was crispy, moist and flavorful. The servings were large. Both flavors were delicious. I look forward to trying the other flavors.

I was looking for a good takeout place on Uber eats one day and happened to find this place. Turns out they are a newish Korean fried chicken place that opened in the south side. The chicken here is pretty good. I have tried the honey garlic, chili bbq and padak (green onion). They chicken came fresh and were juicy & crispy. The honey garlic and chili bbq came with rice cakes which was a nice touch. I found the chilli bbq to be too spicy but the menu did warn me. My favourite so far is the padak. The price is slightly high but the chicken was a decent portion.

We were walking through Town Center when we saw this new place opened up and we didn't remember seeing it here before. I walked in to check it out and the owner said he just opened literally a couple of hours ago.
I definitely wanted to be one of the first few customers for this place which serves a variety of Korean fried chicken. I ordered a half & half of signature fried and Chilli BBQ. It took around 30 minutes but boy it was worth the wait.
The serving size was quite generous. The signature fried was crispy and delicious. The kids enjoyed it. They weren't as greasy as the fried chicken offerings from KFC. The Chilli BBQ was amazing with the right blend of crispy, sweet and spicy. I think it was a tad extra spicy and more appropriate for adults. 
Overall we enjoyed the food and it's nice to have a Korean fried chicken restaurant in the neighborhood. We'll definitely be coming back for more especially to try out the different flavors they have on offer.

The food here was very good for the 2 dishes I tried (honey garlic and plain fried). I got half a chicken of each which is about 8 pieces. Wait time for it is about 20 minutes as they cook to order so pre order if you're in a rush. The staff were pleasant. Will definitely eat from here again

Bottom line: they served me raw croissants twice. Once after I sent back the first one because though it appeared done on the outside, the center was RAW dough. Oh, and my crêpe was cold. And my coffee. All in all, the French Brunch special was a complete and utter disappointment. Beyond being unappetizing and inedible, the croissant snafu indicates that the chef doesn't know how to prepare the foods on his own menu. Also, they didn't offer to take them off the bill. Totally weird experience.
The most bizarre dining experience ever.  Really just awful. Which would explain why they closed so fast.
My experience was great, I had the best vichyssoise I've ever had. The owners are very friendly and the service was very good. I will be back with my husband next time

My husband and I have been eager to try Le Petit Bistrot since it opened on State Street recently and finally got to check it out for a comedy event this week. Because the show didn't start 'til 8:00, we planned to have drinks and dessert during the show, as it was advertised that both food and drink would be available. The event was upstairs, so we headed up there upon arrival at about 7:30, and the space was cute, but the carpet on the stairs was absolutely filthy, and some of the booths near the back were missing padding. We sat down and asked our server for the wine list and a couple waters. 

To start, I was disappointed that a supposedly nice French restaurant had only ONE cabernet sauvignon, and it was cheap. No syrah or petite sirah. And, seriously? $10/glass for Bogle wine? With all the local wine options we have in SB? Bogle is $8.99 a BOTTLE at Trader Joe's this week... Seems inappropriate to serve super cheap wine next to a selection of $20-$45 a la carte dinner plates. Whatever wine list is on their website is not AT ALL the wine list we were given, as the one we got was much smaller and very much lacking.

Sadly, we never got to try the food or order more than one glass of wine because, despite asking for one and telling our server we planned to order crepes and coffee for dessert, he never brought us a menu. The older gentleman sitting next to us had to ask three times for a menu, and I'm still not sure he ever got one. We sat for more than 2 hours during the show. Never got water refills, never got to order dessert or coffee or ANYTHING. At the end, we had to ask the server for the check for our sad glass of wine, and he in turn had to ask us what we'd had because he'd failed to write us a ticket. We could have walked right out the door, and no one would have known we hadn't paid.

All in all, the comedy show was great, but the restaurant experience was pretty disappointing. And I don't know, with all the superior dining options there are to choose from in SB, that we'll be eager to return to try again.

I ordered the fettuccine alfredo. Great Food with a full bar. Beautiful enviroment and I love the outside patio upstairs. This is a new place but definitely a gem. The service was fantastic...they were attentive and sweet. I will be back again!

Don't be fooled by the appealing facade! Only thing french in this restaurant is the name and the waitress. The menu is very limited and the wine list mediocre at its best.
Food: magret de canard was not good and not cooked as per request. The steak was ok. They served us frozen french fries and vegetables, even though we asked for fresh and homemade and the waiter confirmed they were.
Service: worst in USA so far for us. Rude, incapable, didn't take the order correctly and did not check on us. When we asked for the check, he did not bring the customer copy back with the card, but only the merchant one. When We asked for it, he became very agressive and unpleasant.

100% sure we will not go back! Hopefully they will close quickly, as this is a shame for french cuisine and french service!

I rarely write a review but have to comment to save others from what was a bad experience.   We arrived and were the only people on the restaurant.  The waiter took our wine order and never returned.  I finally got up and found him and asked for our wine.  He returned telling us they didn't have the bottle we ordered of Pinot  (it was the only bottle on the menu) but we could buy a glass.   Odd no bottle but a glass?   The food arrived with cold potatoes and overbooked beef.  When we asked for our bill it took over 10 minutes.  I guess the waiter couldn't handle us as well as the two other small tables that were now there.  And although Pinot by the glass on the menu was $9.00. We were charged $12.00 a glass.  With bad service and mediocre food as locals we will not be back.

Came in for college graduation weekend. They accommodated our large group. I ordered the Rib Eye. It was tender and juicy and the veggies it came with were seasoned and cooked to perfection. It also came with a salad and the dressing was amazing! It was probably the best dressing I have had at a restaurant!

First let me start by saying this may seem rude but this is my honest personal opinion and rating. The food was horrible. No flavor or soul in the food at all . The Mac isn't even baked . How is chic fila Mac better than our "neighborhood soul food spot"? These guys need to find a different chicken wing source because the wings are way to big in size and aren't/can't be cooked well enough to be satisfying. And last but not least the side portions are a joke not worth the price . I can't believe someone suggested this as a place to get good soul food . It goes to show the lack of good food in Chester pa . Please someone help .

Very good food and great customer service!! I had salmon fried rice. The rice was so good it was not mushy (overcooked) it was cooked perfectly right with lots of veggies. I typically don't like veggies but the salmon and rice balanced it perfectly. Try their sweet & spicy sauce with their aunt b's sauce. Perfect combo!!!

Wonderful place for some delicious food and lovely service. The portions are filling, and I had the best potato salad in my life. Do stop in and treat yourself while supporting local business and the community. Buy some candy on your way out.

I don't know what type of chicken that  put on my waffle but my boyfriend he got normal chicken like I have dry pieces of thin nothings. it say chicken wings in the description of what I purchased Im very unhappy.

Loved this place! When you drive in, there's a sign pointing towards a bigger building with a few places inside it - the restaurant is located in there. The sandwich I ordered (The HurriQane) was awesome, and I would highly recommend it. It comes with homemade strawberry jam (I got mine on the side), and it was one of the best jams I've ever eaten. 

The prices were super reasonable, and the staff was friendly and respectful. They are open for takeout and delivery during COVID! Overall, I had a great experience and would come back here again.

Soooooooo good ordered turkey wings , mac and cheese , yams and greens plenty food .
Add a little salt and pepper your good to go

Yes, the food is good.  On the other hand, the customer service is lacking. During lunch time they turn off the phones so you have to go there place your order and wait an hour and a half before your food is done. It makes no sense since someone should be able to call and place an order without having to go to the premises to do this.  

Maybe they're afraid of making money.  Also, the phone doesn't say when they are closed or on vacation since a busy signal is always in effect.  You never know when they're open or closed.  You wanna be a business? Act like one!!  You have something good going don't blow it!!

Aunt B's Country Kitchen is an Outstanding place to eat in or order food from. The service is great and the Food is very good and tasty. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a great meal!!!!!!!!'

I've first heard of this establishment on YouTube from JL Jupiter. He's a known food blogger that promotes business in the Philadelphia and South Jersey circuit. My first dish was the turkey wings back in early April 2021. I've been hooked on this place since. I make deliberate trips here as I travel the I 95/NJ Tpk corridor.  Their food never disappoints. The staff is friendly and attentive.  BIG UP's to Crystal and the Chef. The Owner Aunt B and her daughter.  All a bunch of nice people.  I will continue to support B.O.B! If you ever find yourself in the Philadelphia area or traveling on I 95 north of Delaware,  stop in for some of their HOMEMADE deliciousness. You won't be disappointed.  When they have it.......TRY their 7 UP CAKE. It's off the chart

10/10 recommend, everything they sell here is so fresh. The sandwhiches are mouth watering and you can taste each ingredient. Oscar & Luca are the sweetest duo ever, I want both of them to be apart of my family. If you're craving Italian this is the place to go!!!

I had the  chicken salad in an acorn squash ($9.50) and it was delicious. At first, the chicken salad wasn't so special, but as you dig down into the middle of the squash, oh my,, lots more flavors  emerge!  Would love to know what they use because it was so good!!   Was garnished with a beautiful rose strawberry and came with a roll.  Would get this again in a heartbeat!

Seriously delicious. Pistachio Ravioli is rich, bright and toasted pistachios added great texture. The strozzapreti with added extra pesto, once stirred all together, became a divine dish. The team working there have great spirits and really proud of the food they are putting out. We will be back!

Writing this review makes me want Pane Rustica!!! I've been coming here for years. The service is amazing, and makes you feel like family. The pastries and pizza/flatbread are delicious. They make for super great lunch or party foods. The main food however, gets even better. Don't even get me started on the sandwiches. They make this one sandwich that will forever be engraved in my head. It's a turkey sandwich with mayo, onion jam and tomato on sourdough bread. I could eat this everyday of my life. They also have an amazing squash bowl that can be filled with chicken or tuna salad, and is topped with fresh fruit and vegetables. I highly recommend Pane Rustica if you are looking for nice people and great service, as well as amazing food.

New location in Armature Works with abbreviated menu that has the most popular panini and pasta items from their flagship store on S MacDill.  

They have the very popular chicken salad in acorn squash here.  Be sure not to leave without an espresso cookie (or two).

Usual Armature Works prices but unusually large portion sizes and quality. For $10, I got a massive panini with a little side of chickpea salad. This place is delicious and fills the gap for good fast Italian food. To top it off, the staff is so friendly! I didn't try any sweets, but there's a large selection of gigantic, mouthwatering, fresh pastries - everything from pumpkin Whoopi's pies to coconut macaroons. I hope their location in the back corner doesn't hurt them because this place rocks, and I'm hoping to see it around for a long time.

I am exited Pena open their fast food store in the Amateurwork. I look at the menu and select the most expensive in the menu. The Mediterranean Salad. This salad has prosciutto, hummus, tomatoes, arugula, little bok Choy, and bread. If I count the prosciutto and the veggies they kind not measure up to the price. But I do like their medjool dates and the marcona nut. The salad just ok not impressive. 

I did see my friend post on the sandwich is better. I would not recommend the salad. Just go for sandwiches, they are better.
Super friendly and helpful staff. The turkey sandwich was absolutely delicious. Took my sandwich to BAR to pair with some great draft beers.

Just stopped by for something quick.  The smoked turkey panini  was excellent; have not had a really good panini in a while & this hit the spot!!! However I thought the guy was being a little over the top when he said the espresso cookies are addictive.  Then we went back and got 2 more to go.  Serious truth in advertising.  Those cookies were beyond my ability to describe !!

I tried the chicken salad in acorn squash for the first time today, but it definitely won't be the last. It was a large portion of perfectly seasoned chicken salad with lots of flavor...and the addition of just a small amount of marmalade put this dish over the top. The fact that it was gluten free was an unexpected & welcome bonus. Unbelievably good!

The 7 grain bread turkey sandwich came loaded with turkey.

For $9 dollars they gave a lot of turkey and the sandwich itself included an onion jam, beefsteak tomatoes, tons of mayo, and the 7 grain bread. My main critique is they used too much mayonnaise without mustard and avocado to balance everything out. Because the bread was excellent and they gave generous amount of turkey, I will return, but will request the mayonnaise on the side.

We were looking for something quick and easy to eat in Armature Works before we headed out and after a walk around the food stalls, I was drawn in by Pane Rustica. I really just some carb sustenance and I knew pasta would do the trick. 

I ordered the tagliatelle bolognese, which really hit the spot. I mean, who can go wrong with pasta and meat sauce? It was actually a lot higher quality than I expected from a food court food stall! There was quite a wait for the food, but I suppose I would rather my pasta be freshly cooked versus sitting cold!

This place is just amazing! I had the Mozzarella Panini the first time and it was the best I've ever had. I went back today and tried their Spinach Ravioli, it melted in my mouth. It was fresh and light and just pure deliciousness.

New installment at armature works so I decided to try some of their baked goods. You have to get the espresso cookie when you go!!! It is more of a gooey cookie shaped brownie, but honestly I don't care what they call it because it's so good. Did not really taste too much espresso either but again it was so tasty so it's worth it. The raspberry coconut bar had a good amount of coconut in it which I liked, but the berry part was a little too sweet in my opinion. Also, I noticed that they did not openly label their baked goods that had nuts in them, so I was surprised when there were walnuts in the espresso cookie. I'm not allergic but would hate for someone who has allergies to be surprised like that, so just make sure you ask about nuts when you are ordering.

Wow... where do I begin?! Ordered though Uber eats on a Friday night. We Loved EVERYTHING we got. Indian Burger was super juicy and flavorful ( salivating just thinking about it lol ) . Got two poutines, one with saag paneer and the other with chicken Tikka. Hubby and I devoured everything!

This Place is basically chipotle/QDOBA but with Indian food. It's definitely an amazing take and I love the idea. However I still think this place is definitely a bit overpriced. Especially when comparing kids to adults. It's just robbery of prices. Especially with Uber eats/door dash. Which is how I initially tried this location. They could've been better. But I miss my cultures food sometimes and this fills that crave in a good way. You could make these wraps at home. As well as the poutine fries. And probably for less and have more.

They are located at a ghost kitchen.  When you arrive, there are check-in screens on your left. Select the restaurant you are picking up for and then select your name. You will get a text when your order is ready for pick up at the counter.  
We ordered the Indian burger, vegan wrap with curry potato, poutine with chicken tikka masala, samosa chaat and masala fries. 
The only thing we all liked was the samosa chaat. 
Was not a fan of the Indian burger flavors. The mix of flavors with the patty and the toppings did not work well together. 
The vegan wrap with rice and potatoes was dry. There wasn't much flavor to it--did not taste curry.  
The poutine was disappointing because it was just fries with toppings. There wasn't much cheese at all.  The chicken tikka masala had no sauce and was dry. We expected chicken tikka masala sauce to be drizzled on top of the fries with cheese because that's how poutine should be.  
The masala fries tasted like plain French fries. Did not taste seasoning at all.  
Their French fries were good though-- crunchy and not soggy.
The food is amazing. I never thought Indo-Mex could actually be this good considering the flavors are oceans and continents apart.

Word mash-ups are amongst the things that bring me the most joy, so I HAD to have a burroti from Twisted Indian Wraps. The fusion burrito, filled with chicken tikka, rice, and a variety of vegetable fillings was delightful. It was a joy to experience some of Indian cuisine's greatest hits in a different format. I had some lentil soup as well, and thought it was a great complement to my meal. I can't wait to try the other clever dishes on the menu!

We were impressed with some of what we got and underwhelmed by the rest of it for the price.  The naan wrap was a hit. My vegetarian meal was lackluster. The burger we got for our kid was very rare. It wasn't beyond what some people order, but it was significantly rare for having not been asked. Maybe that's what we get for ordering beef from a (non-Indian?) Indian food place.  My biggest complaint is that everything simply wasn't worth the price. It would also be nice if their projected wait times didn't seem so arbitrary.

Could I have given this experience more than 5 stars? I would totally do that. Got the butter chicken and chicken tikka bowl. Loved both of them so much. Spice and taste level was top notch. I would definitely recommend trying this place.

Got my to go order last weekend for lunch!
I love that this is an Indian/Latin fusion place. There were many items I was interested in but decided to go with the butter chicken poutine. 
It came with tons of delicious butter chicken over crispy fries. It also came with delicious sauce and fresh veggie topping. I felt like I got a decent amount of food for what I paid for. I also go lt the mango lassi. I thought that was good but alittle too thick for my taste (my first time having it so not sure what to expect?) 

Overall had a good meal and take out experience!

Delicious! 

The hot chutney was *fire*!
The chicken was well marinated, beans were subtly spiced and other toppings/ sauces were very flavorful. Great new addition to the neighborhood!

Don't be fooled this is not a real restaurant but instead one of those ghost restaurants. Just a store front which a kitchen upstairs and everyone is just getting takeout.

The vegetarian wrap needed more flavor from toppings or sauce. It felt like 80% of the wrap was just plain rice without any seasoning. 

The poutine was okay but being named poutine makes me expect fries with a lot of sauce and cheese on top instead we got fries and some toppings thrown on top. Overall tasked fine but the flavor was nothing special just fries with some toppings.

So I ordered from Twisted Indian Wraps. The delivery was really quick. I ordered- Butter Chicken Poutine, Chicken Tikka, and Samosa burger. 

The Chicken Tikka was full of flavors and has a good amount of seasonings and chicken worth the price for the portion and the burger was nicely cooked and has a good amount of veggies and sauces filled. 

The packaging was completely leakproof and food was warm when delivered. All items were very delicious. Surely gonna order again.

Absolutely loved the food. It's authentic Indian street food with a twist. So many flavors in a bite. We tried Samosa burger, meat burger and the butter chicken bowl. Everything was delicious, can't wait to order again. They deliver which is perfect if you want some comfort food.

I saw a feature about Twisted and bookmarked them as a place that sounded really interesting. The concept is Indian fusion mixed with Mexican food and it sounded absolutely delicious. They offer a variety of wraps, burritos, bowls, and even poutine with classic Indian flavors and dishes. 

My partner and I each ordered the super bowl which was such a great deal at only $15 you could choose 3 proteins and a base, and we were completely stuffed.  I got the butter chicken with chickpeas (chana) and saag paneer, topped with yogurt and the medium chutney.  My partner got the chicken tikka masala with beans (rajma) and saag paneer and yogurt as well, but with the hot chutney. The chutneys were nice and spicy and really added a great flavor to our bowls (the medium one was more herby in flavor, the hot was more peppery).  We tried each individually before mixing it all together, and each component was really delicious except for maybe the saag paneer, we weren't too crazy about as the cheese curds were very small. Overall, super pleased though with them! 

Our poutine was alright- ours unfortunately came without the cheese it was supposed to be topped with? We ordered a small kids' size just to try it because we were really intrigued, and we topped it with chorizo tikka, jalapeños, katchumber (cucumber, tomatoes, onions) and pickled onions. The fries were actually really great, nice and crispy and delicious but overall it kind of was nothing special, just fries topped with things. We should have in hindsight ordered a more curry based meat topping to make it closer to poutine. 

I would definitely recommend them as a quick bite / takeout place, I could see this being a great stop for a hearty lunch for anyone and it for sure gets huge bonus points for uniqueness!

Ordered from this place on a whim because my girlfriend had a $25 uberEats gift card. Safe to say it was the best decision we could have made. This place is a hidden gem and I can't believe people have not heard about it yet. 

The food is delicious and so flavorful. I love the combination of Indian and Latin flavors as it is so unique. We ordered a mango lassi, aloo tikki burger, masala fries, and a naan wrap. I recommend trying all of them. We got all of that food for $25.

I ordered a meal platter from this ghost restaurant; chicken tikka masala, channa, saag peneer. Let's talk about it...

First of all, this is supposed to be a MEAT platter. Where is it ? These few pieces of chicken with all that damn rice was all I got.

Now, I was told by the very courteous Uber Eats driver that they didn't have any saag paneer and to sub it with an other side. I requested just saag (spinach) if not, curry potatoes. Ummm, these green specks on top is spinach right? Mmm hmm, moving on...

The channa was horrible. Just flavorless like they took chickpeas right out the can, undrained, and sprinkled some garam masala in it. I've eaten channa plenty of times at Indian restaurants and it doesn't taste like that.

The curry potatoes made up for the tasteless channa somewhat. The gravy was flavorful but the potatoes were just like that chicken tikka... barely there.

This was not a pleasant experience at all. But on a good note, the 2 stars are for the naan and chutney, the best part of the whole platter.

We got the poutine with saag paneer, and it was definitely interesting. The fries itself were well cooked and I liked the vegetables, drizzles, and mixins, but I'm not sure if I'd get the dish again. I thought the saag paneer was good and I would happily eaten it with rice, but in this case, I'm not sure if the saag added much to the dish other than making the fries soggy. I'm interested in trying their other fusion dishes next time I come though.

A major mix up with discount codes, I decided to support nonetheless. I give a 4 because the samosas are great, the poutine was a little dry. You definitely need the sauce and it is delicious. The tacos weren't amazing but ok. Would I go back? Maybe. They are open late and the poutine when I covered in sauce was good! I added the chicken from the poutine to the tacos the next day and it was a good leftover. The fries were fried perfectly and they were quick with prep. It is a ghost restaurant and if you are looking for tacos here, hit Rustika. But get some poutine from them, samosas if you are far from Uni but don't break your neck to go
With this menu I can not wait for your this business to be part of DoorDash and Grubhub. I will love to have this delivery to the Aidupont Nemours Hospital for Children.

This place is AMAZING. Great flavors and beautiful service. They are just getting started but with this food, there's no doubt they will stick around! We came in on a Saturday for lunch. We ordered a Jibarito sandwich, mofongo with carne frita, and some rice. DELICIOUS! If you're in the mood for some great food, come here!

This place is great! It's about time we get some good Puerto Rican food around here! They just opened up but don't let that stop you from enjoying the amazing food. The mofongo was good, as was the jibarito sandwich w/ pernil.

Just went there tonight and the food was delicious. There is not much Puerto Rican food in Delaware and what little there is is underwhelming. Had mofongo, chuletas, arroz con gandules, alcapurria, tostones and empanada. Everything was wonderful. Can't wait to go back. Highly recommended.
Food is delish! Tastes authentic and flavorful. I've been in search for a place like this for a long time. Reminds me of the good old Puerto Rican home cooking I grew up on.
Authentic Puerto Rican food! The Mofongo was just like when I Had it in San Juan. Great place a must try
Best breakfast sandwiches. Best quiche. Best PIES! Staff is friendly and very helpful. Don't miss this gem!
The "rose apothecary" of bakeries. This place is great with everything but your waist line. The key lime pie is out of this world.
Wow. Delicious pies and cakes. Better than the the 2 letter bakery around the corner. There I said it.  This place is for real.

Finally had my first visit here & I will definitely be back. One thing was better then the next. The food & sweets were amazing. The eggplant, tomato, & goat cheese quiche was incredible with so much flavor. I also got the mini Cinnamon Toast Crunch pie & it was excellent. I loved there iced coffee blend too! I cannot wait to return!

Quick and easy Chinese Fast Food at the Canal Shops.  Not much fast food in general area.  Good food for an easy bite.  Reasonable price.  Fried Chicken and Bourbon very good seasoning and flavor.  Take it as it is.  A Fast food spot in the mall with good food.  Combination platter has decent amount of food.

Two things: This is a Chinese food kiosk in a mall. Don't over think this! Second, I've been coming here for years having worked in the immediate area.

This is your standard fast food mall kiosk except it's run by a Vietnamese family, not a chain. It's your standard fare like honey chicken, beef with bell peppers, lo mein, fried rice, etc. They also have some local fare as specials like fried catfish or pork chops. What I like about this place from a food perspective is that they make pretty much everything fresh for you except at lunch-time and you're ordering a high demand item like honey chicken. 

That combined with the fact that the family that runs the place is unfailingly nice, super hard working, and very efficient. So all this combined makes this place a four star rating (again, for what it is - a food kiosk in a mall!). If you're in the immediate area and looking for some quick and solid chinese food, you really can't go wrong.

Well the name cafe is a bit misleading. It's a food court. A sparse and old food court. The food is like any other food court but you definitely feel a bit ostracized. Eat here for convenience but I would not actively seek it out.
The service is nice tho. The lady selling has been selling for years and very open to share her story.

I went in with very low expectations but I was craving Chinese food. The woman working here was extremely nice. They had a large bin of vegetable lo mein made up. I got a large order of lo mein and a side of wontons with homemade sweet and sour sauce. It was $5. The cheapest meal I've ever had in this city, which tends to be prohibitively expensive where food is concerned.

It was good! It was really good. What more is there to say?

Don't be fooled during COVID by the empty bins at their food counter. We were looking for honey chicken and didn't see any. These folks are doing it right. SO RIGHT. Thanks to this dreaded illness that has restaurants hurting so badly, they aren't cooking in bulk and in advance, but are cooking fresh food to order. I was so happy to know we could get what we wanted and it was good. It was hot. It was fresh. 

Excellent find.
Really good sonoran hot dogs. Bacon wrapped with beans and onions tomatoes. They got mexican sodas and waters. 2.50 the dog

The Sonoran dogs are OK. Just not really, really great. You will like them. They do the Chipilon style of toasting the outside of the bun. The poblanos are good. They've been doing this since 1994 so they definitely have a following. Friendly people. 

5* = A top favorite. Mind-blowing good. I will definitely return and I will go out of my way to go here. Worth every dime of my money.
4* = Outstanding. Tucson-top-tier. Some elements not quite as good as it gets, but it still is worthy of my regular business.
3* = Good experience. I might do repeat business if it is convenient, the only option, the only one in its category, or on a whim, but would not be among the first thing to come to mind. Would definitely recommend you trying it to get your own take on it.
2* = Not so good. Would not recommend at all. Waste of money.
1* = How are they still in business? Stay away at all costs!

Great hot dogs. They just added a food truck to their hot dog cart so you can get tacos, caramelos, fries, even a burger. The food there is on point. They also take credit cards which is a plus for me cuz i never carry cash.

We spent the morning at Davis Monthan Air Force Base and we we're looking for another place to get our Sonoran Hotdog fix. My wife saw a food truck nearby on Yelp, that was due to open at 11a and the ratings were good.

Again, thanks to all on Yelp, we got to try some really delicious sandwiches.  The other hotdogs we love come in a super soft bun, but El Kora grills the buns for a spin on the classic delight. They also have grilled bacon wrapped peppers that are on the spicy side.

All in all, an excellent example of the Sonoran hotdog and is worth the stop. We were here just before they were open and there was a line of folks waiting for this tasty treat.

This is a food truck that I stumbled upon one day while I was out doing errands. It has typical Mexican street food including Sonoran Hot Dogs, Tacos, Quesadillas, etc.  

The quality of the food here is what you would expect. The food is inexpensive and not very healthy at all, but then again, it's a food truck that serves hot dogs and tacos, so what do you expect? 

The hot dogs are very good. Quite possibly among the best Sonoran Dogs in town, if not the best. The tacos are OK. A little overcooked, and on occasion, they can also be soggy, lending to their falling apart quickly. 

One of the really cool things about this place is the fact that they accept debit/credit cards. 

I was impressed with the service here. The person running it at the time did not speak much English, but he still did the best he could to provide great service, I felt welcomed there, despite our communication differences. 

I would definitely come back here again if I am ever in the area!

This cart is in my neighborhood, so I decided to stop by and check it out. I've only gotten Sonoran Dogs. I have went there a total of 3 times. Every time my dogs have been on point!! Never had to wait more than 5 minutes either. I will definitely put them in the top 5 of Sonoran Dogs in Tucson.

It's here, and they have pizza. But other than that, this place doesn't really deliver. They don't reheat the pizza enough so you end up getting a sad, cold pizza slice. They also won't give you a cup of water.
Love them on Bourbon street best pizza in NOLA. Was so happy open one below my house.. not the same bad service cold pizza..
Absolutely great NY style pizza!! Pepperoni pizza was awesome. Great atmosphere. Don't miss out on a fast delicious spot to eat

my mom and i stopped in here today for lunch and the food was amazing! my mom had the capresa panini and i had the raspberry crepes and they r both AMAZING, i wish i had a picture of the food cause it looked as good as it tasted! i would definitely recommend stopping in here!!

Was shopping at Fabletics when I overheard someone talking about the new panini place downstairs. Had to check it out- so good!! I got a capersa panini. The prices were super reasonable, you could tell the ingredients were fresh and the staff was super kind and friendly. I will most certainly be back!

I work in the mall so trust me when I say I've tried all the options. This place is great, and the people who own it are great also! So friendly and happy all the time, I enjoy going here on my breaks to try new things off the menu.

I love this place. The food is all made to order with fresh ingredients, so it's delicious! It's family owned and the owners are very kind people. My coffee is always perfect and the food is even better. Much better than Starbucks. You must stop in and see them they make you feel like family.
I have died and gone to heaven (metaphorically). Their crepes are the best!!!  Now, I have a reason to live.  I will definitely be back!!!
I came here on my lunch break , place was awesome. Staff was great,  and quick service. I recommend them 100%.

This place is amazing. I stopped by once with my mom and the food was fantastic! We tried the Nutella Strawberry Crepe and the Avocado Chicken Crepe. Great taste and fresh food. The coffee is so good, better then Starbucks. The place is family owned and everyone is all so sweet. The young boy at the front greets you so kindly and his father makes the food so perfectly. I will definitely be coming back here again.

My husband and I stopped by the Crepes Your Way which is next to Neiman Marcus at International Mall in Tampa. If I could give this place zero stars I would because the crepes were that horrible!  We ordered the vegetarian crepes which had disgusting frozen spinach, canned olives, canned mushroom, and hardly any mozzarella cheese and one tiny piece of a unripe tomato. It was basically a canned sliced olive crepe because the rest of the ingredients were cut in tiny pieces you could barely taste it and the ingredients were not mixed together. 

There was absolutely no taste or flavor and it was grossly put together.  There was no seasoning, no herbs and cheap quality ingredients! The crepe has balsamic vinegar on top of it which was all I could taste was the sourness of the vinegar!  When I cut into the crepe it was so thin in cut into the paper that was underneath it.  The owner had his wife and two sons working there.  The older son probably in his teens was behind the counter while his dad (The owner) was showing him how to make the crepe and the the other son around 10 years old served us the crepes, I was served my crepe first than 10 minutes later my husband got his and we were the only ones in the store. 

The owner came to our table and asked how we liked the crepes?   He noticed that the crepes were barely touched and  I told him there was no flavor and the ingredients taste like everything was out of a can and he said "you ordered the vegetable crepe that is why it has no taste!"  I was shocked at his reaction and obviously he is not a good business person when it comes to customer service.  If that's the case than tell us next time not to order it because it is a horrible tasting crepe and save us a lot of money because the crepes were very expensive and they were horrible tasting!  We will definitely not be back and we definitely do not recommend. Shame on the owner for serving horrible tasting food and very poor customer service!  AVOID AT ALL COST AND STAY AWAY!

My parents came to visit, and being fairly new to STL we decided to try out Modai based on a recommendation from my husband's co-worker.  It's a cute little place with a full bar... looks like a nice place to hang out with friends for drinks.  However, I would definitely NOT be going back for dinner.  Sushi rolls were ok (can't remember the names, but we tried one with eel and advocado, one with spicy tuna, and the one with soft shelled crab), but non-sushi menu items were a definite NO-GO.   For some odd reason, we were craving shrimp so we ordered the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer (yes, I know, not a typical Japanese dish).  The shrimp was sauteed with green peppers, mushrooms, and onions. (This should have been a warning since generally shrimp cocktail is just boiled shrimp served cold with cocktail sauce - although this one did come with cocktail sauce.)  My husband ordered the chicken teriyaki, which didn't resemble any teriyaki dish we've seen in California. This order had dried up pieces of chicken (looked like it was cooked twice or something), was sauteed the same way as the "shrimp cocktail", and seasoned with the same type of sauce, which isn't the usual slightly sweet teriyaki sauce we've grown accustomed to.  My dad ordered the seafood teriyaki, which was also cooked up the same way as the "shrimp cocktail" and chicken dish!   I also ordered the tempura entree, but my order of tempura was never brought out, so I can't comment on it.   (Luckily, mom didn't order anything off the dinner menu.)   We decided to just get the check and finish dinner somewhere else. 

To be fair, some other table ordered sashimi and sushi (nigiri style, not rolls), which looked good when the server brought it out.  Guess we should have stuck to the sushi/sashimi menu.

We sat by the window on very cool couches. The vibe is hip, but when we went it was totally dead. It worked for me, as I wanted to relax, but I wonder if this speaks to the lack of business they always get? Not sure.

The sushi was fine, but like Christy I. said, not all that memorable. We got the standard California rolls and Shrimp Tempura. Fine, but the ambiance and seating was the real draw for me.

I visited Modai on a Friday night around 6:00 PM and we were the only diners in the place.  It looked like a hipster hangout, but with an overflow of plants from Grandma's house and lots of dust.  The menu was pricier than other sushi restaurants in St. Louis, but we were given free miso soup with our order (ME LIKES miso soup).

We ordered several rolls, including California (seemed to be pre-made a day ahead) and Philadelphia (the salmon wasn't fresh).  

The eel roll was the only roll that seemed okay, but with eel,  if it doesn't smell it's hard to tell.  The shrimp tempura was greasy, but we've been experiencing greasy tempura at many of the local sushi joints lately.  So, we may rule tempura out altogether.  This wasn't a thriller.

I like Modai.  I've been there many times.  The Modai Edamame is absolutely delicious.  Rather than just put salt on the edamame, they put crushed red pepper and some other stuff so it's got a little spice to it.  It's so good, and I don't know why other sushi joints haven't thought to do a similar thing. You can't get such good, unique edamame anywhere else!  

I think the sushi is good also. Sometimes they seemed to change around the recipes for certain rolls.  So we'd really like the spicy tuna roll sometimes but other times it wasn't as good.  But overall I think the sushi was better than other places around that area.  I don't know if they still have it on their menu, but the fried ghost roll was really good.  

The drinks are also really unique and yummy.  There's one with crushed kiwi in it that's very tasty.  It'd be a great place to go for drinks with friends because you'd never have to fight for a drink at the bar, and the drinks are great and never watered down.

From my experience Modai is usually pretty empty, but that's probably because they are sort of on the outskirts of the Loop area, so the foot traffic isn't as heavy as other parts of the Loop.  And while it can be a little more pricey than some other STL sushi places, I think it's much better than the other sushi restaurants in the Loop.  I went to the other sushi restaurant in the Loop and it was awful. I don't know why people go there -- probably because it's just got a better location.  But Modai is definitely good and unique, and I'd definitely recommend that people give it a try.
One of the "I'm trying very hard to be hip" modern Japanese sushi bars.  Large dining hall downstairs.  Sushi in cities such as stl is a little rough.

I've been to both Wasabi locations, and I prefer the Lakeview location the best. The Frenchman location feels so rundown in comparison to this one. The atmosphere in the Lakeview one is much better. You have the option of sitting in either  the hip lounge/bar area where they sometimes have live jazz music playing, or you can go in the back area where the sushi bar is. 

I haven't had a bad roll there yet. They all have been awesome! 

My two favorite sushi places in the city are here and Rock n' Sake. Rock n' Sake can get so loud and crowded though. I come to Wasabi if I'm looking for a quieter/calmer atmosphere.

This was truly awful. I went for lunch today and there was only 1 table in there (and its a holiday! at 12:30pm!) I got the sushi lunch special and was totally, utterly disappointed. I only ate 1 piece of my snowcrab roll because it tasted like chemicals and plastic. It was truly the worst sushi I have ever had in my entire life.
Wasabi is my all time favorite sushi bar.  I'd choose this place If I had to make a decision on sushi.  My favorite roll here is the super-crunchy rolls.  The special rolls are pretty good too!

Staff was quick and friendly. Everything came out fresh and was delicious. a great appetizer to start off with would be their honey wasabi coconut shrimps! unique taste and was just great! I prefered the lakeview location over the one downtown. Can't go wrong with any of the rolls. Good pricing too for lunch!

Finding where the line started was very confusing and it was busy. I ended up using the computer to order. The wait was pretty short considering how busy they were. The food was hot and probably the best Taco Bell I've ever had. I wanted to get a frozen alcoholic drink but I didn't want to wait in line. We found a spot to sit pretty easily and listened to the band. It was fun. It is also very pretty inside with murals.

Terrible place, first of, we purchased a party pack, I asked for suprime but charged and given regular hard tacos. No big deal we were still willing to eat it but when we went to take the first bike we realized the tacos were rancid. I asked for a different pack thinking "hey mistakes happen, we could have had a bad batch." Then we over heard 2 other groups returning their food for the same reason!!! I mean really? Is it management? Is management asking to serve week or month old rancid hard shells? Or is it the employees that are failing to keep up with the clean out of old hard shells?? What ever the case may be they should be more careful!! I'm pregnant and eating rancid tacos could have been fatal to my baby, I hope the employees think of this. I avoided street food for this reason but this was definitely a terrible choice.    Be careful with this place

Crunchwrap lacked its typical crunchy luster. The atmosphere was extremely fun and this was definitely the only Taco Bell I've ever been in that serves alcohol and plays cardi b. I ordered a Baja blast freeze with a shot of tequila and it was delicious. I will definitely be back for drinks but pass on the food next time.

I had big hopes. I really did. This Taco Bell was a once in a lifetime experience. The signs, the live band, everything about it was appealing. Unfortunately, the experience was absolutely abysmal. This location supposedly closes at 12 P.M. Well, they might as well change that to 12 A.M. Me and my friend walk to this place (me on a broken leg) and proceed to get their at 11 P.M.  I'm a math major, so I believe that we walked in an hour before close. We get there, and immediately I notice that this is going to be the worst experience ever. We ask for a couple of tacos, nothing humongous; right? Well I guess NOT. They tell us, "sorry, we are no longer cooking food, but you guys can order drinks!" Excuse me? I walked here on a broken leg an hour before close for what? For no tacos, no dinner???? What exactly is going on at this restaurant? I'm not sure, but I am certain that this place will never receive my business ever again, and it doesn't deserve yours either...

This is not your ordinary Taco Bell.  First they serve alcohol, Second and most important on this Friday night there's a live band a good one.

The band/singer is Angel Edwards. The vocalist sounds better than some of the honky tonks on broadway! Oh BTW they serve food. Like Taco Bell food. I had the steak quesadilla. An excellent choice to absorb the alcohol I just consumed.

Honk Tonk on a budget - Taco Bell! Who would have thunk? P.S there was line at midnight.

I am so genuinely disgusted with the service I Have received at this Taco Bell. It's so disappointing to see a Nashville business treat their customers so poorly. All I wanted was my Taco Bell and all they did was deny me multiple fucking times. yeah I am I rate this is unacceptable this is rude and this is just straight up horrible I hope you never go here and I hope everyone that works at this Taco Bell is my fucking shit

Just to start the service is horrible. God forbid you want you taco without lettuce or sour cream you would have thought I was asking to screw there mom. And this happens each and every time I go here since I work right down the road. But you best believe when you do get your order it's gonna be wrong. Never fails. Oh and don't ask to have them fix it because they made it wrong. They will purposely burn it or over cook it. Why work somewhere that you hate your job so bad you take it out on people's food. I will never ever ever walk in this piss poor place again. They all need to be fired in my opinion.
TB is TB but 2night a s$#@ customer came in & threw a drink @ an employee.  They handled it better than I would've or could've.  Props 2 a good staff!!!

This is THE worst Taco Bell I've ever been to.  We've waited 45 minutes for our food and when we went to complain they said, if you don't want your food please let us know so we can cancel the the order before we make it.  The worker said this is how it is every night.  If that's the case, they need to hire more people because that's ridiculous.  Unless they change their way of doing business, DO NOT COME HERE.

Y'all! This Taco Bell has live music! And a bar!! 

The live music was really good. 

It wasn't busy so our order was up quick. The lady behind the counter was very friendly and sweet. 

We'll definitely return to this Taco Bell!
Worker was walking through the aisle saying "get the F*** outta my way". Very unprofessional and not that way you should speak to your customers.

Absolutely terrible. If i could give 0 stars i would. I tried ordering through Uber eats and kept pushing our time. We had over 5 different drivers and food was never ready. Waited almost 2 hours for TACO BELL... ridiculous absolutely ridiculous. Do not go waste of time.

Sad to say this taco bell is a disgrace to Nashville Place a order through grubhub to pick up so i could avoid the line and wait . I get there they were busy as expected . But they didnt "start "my order  til i got there . I waited over a hour and i asked the cook where was my order and he said and i shit you not " im making all the in house orders first and then the togos" well they kept having more and more people come in so he wasnt going to be able to clear the inhouse if peiole keep steadily coming in yo order . Dude was dumber than a rock. Needless to say i never got my food that i paid for. I even pointed out that  a order he just handed to a chick i said maam are you taking that togo she said yeah . I said see you're making in house that are fucking togos. And avoiding mobile orders for what?!?!? Dude is literally has to be the dumbest most incompetent person to ever be in a kitchen.  He needs to be terminated . If ya need help finding out who he is its the skinny black dude long poofy hair and crooked ass teeth looking like they are throwing up gang signs. It's Sunday night  September 20th. THE CASHIER THOUGH SHE WAS PERFECT ! she understood and didn't get why the guy making tacos was being so ignorant. Shes need to be in a better job because this place doesn't deserve such a hard worker
I'll prepared for a busy Broadway crowd, orders are consistently late and staff is disengaged and inefficient.
Great workers, very social and great customer service. Also note, they sell alcohol! ;) Very nice place to stop to grab a bite. Great vibe!
Came here after a concert at the Ryman auditorium just for a late night snack.  Homeless people were coming inside to use restroom and bother employees the. Got kicked out.
It's a night after fun in Nashville and everyone in the store is working their ass off for the customers! I really appreciate the hard work they're putting in! Thank you

This Taco Bell said they were open till 12 am, and when we went in at 11 to get food they said they were no longer making food and were refusing to make the food even though my friend had paid. Needless to say the hours are wrong online, but the bigger issue was the service. My friend wanted a single taco and the manager was extremely rude and the whole experience was unbelievably unprofessional. I had such high hopes for this place because it seemed like it would be a good place in downtown Nashville, but I am sad to say it was a bad experience all around and I was incredibly disappointed.

They're not equipped to handle the late night Broadway crowds on a weekend. My chicken quesadilla was missing the spicy sauce and the cheese wasn't even melted. 

It's a tiny space and cram as many people as possible. The line to order and receive your food is a hot mess and super confusing. 

It doesn't compare at all to my favorite Taco Bell Cantina in Las Vegas.

Okkkkkk I can't believe I'm giving a Taco Bell five stars lol. But this place could have easily been the highlight of my entire weekend to Nashville trip. This was the coolest Taco Bell I've been to.

An awesome guitarist for a live band, friendly staff, and pina colada with Baja blast and Bacardi as a drink? Say no more!! Drinks are $7 and that's not bad at all considering how good they are and the bartender, Marianna hooked me up with my amazing drink

Do yourself a favor and go have a tasty frozen cocktail and listen to the sweet sounds of Hayden or whoever is performing for you when you go!
Cutest little place. I love their teas. Haven't tried to food yet. Will update once I have. The prices are super reasonable

I've seen this place and wanted to try it for some time and today I did. The inside has a lot of cute decorations, the plush food on the walls are my favorite part. The man was helpful while I was ordering, the prices aren't too high and the food and drinks are good I would definitely recommend this place.

Happy with the fried chicken sandwich and wings. Chicken was still juicy and tender, not dry and over cooked. Wings were a little on the spicy side 4/5, still flavorful without being salty. Glad I ordered an lychee tea to cool the spice down.
Amazing place! Great food great service! They have delivery which makes it even better! Can't go wrong with any option that is on the menu.

My uncle were raving about this place and told me they are opening a store inside the Mayfair Shopping Center on Frankford Avenue. I was super excited that there is a new addition to the Northeast area. Since Moon Flower House is inside the shopping center, parking definitely isn't a issue. 

When I get there at 11:25am, this place was already packed. I order a Fried Chicken Sandwich(not spicy), a Breaded Shrimp Sandwich, a order of Drum Sticks, a Pumkin Cakes, and New Orland BBQ Chicken. I repeatedly told the cashier that I want a non spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich. After I paid and saw my receipt, it says spicy for my Chicken Sandwich and my pumpkin cakes were missing. I went back to the cashier and told her about the mistake. One of her male colleagues say he couldn't make any changes, that's when I got upset and pointed at that girl that I say over three times about the sandwich being non spicy. It took them 25 minutes just to sort that out and correct my order. At that point, i was like it might take another 15 minutes for them to add my pumpkin cakes so I decided not to get them this time. 

I placed a order around 11:30am, my order wasn't done until 1:15pm. I was dying of starvation so I hurriedly left. Their sandwiches are very tasty but they are also small. One was for my mom, and the other for my brother, both likes their sandwiches, again it just wasn't enough for a meal. I order the drum sticks and BBQ chicken for myself. I like the drum sticks, let's not get it confused with the leg drum, their version of drum sticks are the wing drum. The BBQ Chicken are the most flavorless chicken ever. The chicken wasn't even BBQ, it is baked chicken, i gave it to my dumpster instead. I wanted to order desserts and drinks, but none were available. 

Today was their grand opening. Whoever manages this place need to train their staffs, bc they were everywhere. Ppl shouldn't wait closed to 2 hours for 2 sandwiches and 2 side orders. Ran out of chicken sandwich at 1pm is insane, are you even prepared for opening? Why even open without half of your menu? Unbelievable!

Ordered delivery through Uber Eats and it was pretty amazing. I ordered the chicken drumsticks and wings. Both I got spicy and the coating on the chicken was crispy while the chicken itself was juicy. It wasn't overly spicy but enough to get a kick. Next the chicken sandwich tasted great.  I also enjoyed the shrimp which was very crispy.  They seem to know there way around a fryer at this place.  I would definitely give them a try if you like fried chicken.  In terms of comparison, I would say it is similar to Popeyes.  So if you like that, then you will love this place.

Extremely understaffed and their phone was going off with orders. I was told anything with fruit was sold out today (it was a Sunday afternoon), which was really disappointing. Ordered a Matcha Milk Tea but it was extremely sweet. Will not be returning.

So, I had only been to a restaurant with the same name in San Diego, so I was excited to see it was also in Greenwood. The Chicken Teriyaki sandwich is worth getting the largest size. The teriyaki sauce is embedded in the chicken unlike any other thing you may eat with teriyaki. The fries are more than you can handle with the large sandwich so save them for later. The staff working were great and helpful.

Spending time with the grand kids during spring break. Following a movie we chose to eat at the food court of Greenwood Mall at Charley's.. OMG. Service was horrible.  Cashier was more interested in hiding in the back using his cell phone and drinking sodas. Had to ask for napkins as there were not any on the counter nor were they already on the tables in the food court. Still enjoyed family time, just won't patronize that eatery again.

Grab lots of napkins!!

Until now, I've only ever eaten at Charley's while I was at the mall, but I had a craving so I ordered through DoorDash.

This is the messiest, drippiest sandwich I have ever eaten. I had buffalo and ranch all over my face and hands. But so so good.

Update: went back 2 weeks later with the free sandwich coupon the man gave me. All the same employees as last time and the man says "we no longer accept those." The same coupon they've had for years with no expiration on it. I told them they could keep their food and I won't be coming back. Also was told to reach out in email about what happened after my first review and never got a response. Bad company and customer service. Not worth it.

I ordered the original cheesesteak and cheese fries and the first thing I noticed was how the cheese sauce didn't have that metallic tang like it came fresh from a can and my sandwich was perfectly  seasoned and sooo juicy! After receiving the covid vaccine and not being hungry for a few days, this was a game changer for me! My food arrived super fresh and well packaged and do yourself a favor and order one of the fresh fruit flavored lemonades .. I had peach  it smacked sooo hard
Food was great only have a 30 min break they are very fast and straight to the point definitely coming back !

Ordered a small chicken California and small fry as part of the 5.99 any chicken sandwich and small fry deal. Charged 2.99 for fries because my sandwich isn't apart of the deal. THAT SAYS ANY. I tell the man I wasn't aware and ask if we could fix my order and he says no you already paid and they're already making it. I couldn't understand him well so I just said okay. After getting the food and talking about it while eating I felt that wasn't correct and I was over charged I asked to speak to the manager and was told he was the manager and he got very angry quickly and talking down to me so fast I could hardly understand. I asked if I could have a refund for the 2.99 since I wasn't aware and he said if I give the sandwich back he will refund me knowing we already ate. I think my order was rang up wrong considering the other order was right.
10/10 recommended beast food I've had in a while their philly cheese stake it was juicy and cheesy

This place is horrible! The customer service is terrible, they are rude and the food is definitely not worth it. The food tasted like it had been sitting out for a loooong time, threw most of it away and went to the pizza place instead. Save your money and go someplace where the employees aren't incredibly rude and the food isn't gross.

We decided to try a new restaurant in our area and what a pleasant surprise. I have traveled to Mexico City and have visited areas many Americans would not have had a chance to experience. I can say that La Guadalupana is as real as it gets. The flavors brought back some steller memories. Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to real Mexican food. Catilina, our server was terrific. The serving sizes are ample and I brought home food for lunch the next day from the leftovers. Order the guacamole it is some of the freshest I've had other than what I've made for myself.

Moved here from Southern California, so I was very skeptical about a Mexican restaurant in Merchantville, NJ. On our drive home we saw that there was a new Mexican restaurant in our neighborhood, so we decided to give it a try. WE WERE BLOWN AWAY!! Family-run restaurant, very nice people who prepare delicious authentic Mexican food. We will definitely be back for more. Often.
Nice family owned place. Good prices and good food. Take out only due to covid restrictions. Everyone wearing a mask inside. Ordered from here multiple times now and never disappointed.

Family owned hole in the wall with delicious authentic food and wonderful service! Serving sizes were generous and the menu has a lot of options. Worth a try especially if you want to support a local business.
Went for the first time tonight and loved everything we had! The guacamole was so fresh and there were many vegetarian options.

Fresh, tasty and plentiful applies to all the dishes we tried in our first takeout dinner from La Guadalupana. Among three of us, we tried chicken tacos, a pork burrito al pastor, a steak alhambre platter and chips & guacamole.

We each liked the item we ordered very much. The chicken tacos were my entree and I would definitely get them again. There were 4 and I didn't need to eat them all, but I did! Honestly, two of us could have shared them and been satisfied, especially if we shared a side dish. Daughter had the burrito. It was giant and she ate half. I ate the other half for dinner the next night. Husband's steak alhambre platter really could have been dinner for three people. That entree is a great choice if you like things on the hot side, spice-wise.
