The guacamole is excellent and it also leans to hot. There were two other salsas that came with the chips (I think) and they were great accompaniments. Again, fans of hot will be very pleased.

We really look forward to our next takeout! Highly recommended.

It's my second time ordering from here and I am not disappointed. They give a lot of food and it's delicious. The el pastor nachos we're awesome. The chicken and cheese quesadilla was huge. It seems they use a corn tortilla for the quesadilla.

Finally made it out to their Merchantville location after enjoying them greatly when they were in Westmont. Still family-owned, still preparing everything fresh, and still the best authentic Mexican food I've found in the area. Makes a great pairing with the Eclipse Brewing Co. beer garden nearby.
My friends and I ordered burritos, quesadillas, and nachos. It was so much food and it was delicious. Highly recommend!

This review isn't based on food! Stopped by at 1:30p on a Wednesday and they were closed, despite the hours stating they're open until 9p. It actually looks like the restaurant may be closed permanently. Highly disappointed

One of our favorite Mexican places is now in Merchantville! We were customers at the Westmont location and are thrilled they moved to Merchantville. Authentic, delicious, generous portions and friendly staff make this restaurant one you shouldn't miss.

The menu is a little hard to read but take the time because it is worth it. I have loved everything I have ordered!
Delicious food, try the mole! Also the tacos al pastor we're on point.  I'll definitely be ordering from them again. Quick pick up and large portions for the platters as well.

Very good. Family oriented and most food seemed cooked to order so be patient.

We were hungry, so we ordered a few things for our table. The guacamole was freshly made (I loved that the avocado pit was still  on the platter) - it came with chips, some refried beans, pico de gallo.  Loved it all.

I ordered the sopas pork carnitas. Very filling.  And there were tacos and I think steak bistek, all enjoyed by the table.

The downside was everything we ordered to drink was in a more expensive bottled version. For example, we ordered Sprites and asked for water (expecting your typical glass with water and ice).  Instead we got glass bottles of Sprite from Mexico and bottled water. Had I known that, I would not have asked for bottled water.

The food was amazing! You know they take pride in what they cook. Definitely recommend if you like delicious Mexican food. Probably the best Mexican food in the area, this is coming from a So Cal guy.

I first tried this restaurant back when they opened up in Westmont so I was happy to hear they opened up again. Enjoyed my recent visit there for a rainy Saturday lunch. We had attentive service from our lovely young waitress who cheerfully answered a million questions.

High scores for actual flavor with healthy doses of spice, fresh cilantro and limes. The nachos were delicious and then I tried the bistek platter. It was more like a stew with lots of beef, tomatoes and peppers. Loved the rice that came with it. Big portions. My daughter is picky about tacos - she only likes the kind from her friend's mom who makes home made everything so the fact she devoured the beef tacos was a big thumbs up.

This is a small, homey restaurant. Nothing fancy. Will love to give it more return business.
Restaurante mexicano nuevo delicioso auténtica comida mexicana recomiendo pedir gordita de chicharrón y refresco sidral soda de manzana y sobra para llevar buenos precios

COVID- only take out... no dine in

Came across this gem when I was in the area. 

Reasonable price and very tasty! 

When ordering their tacos- you can only get four tacos of the same meat! (Ie you cant order one pastor, one asada etc... one order of pastor tacos= 4 pastor tacos!)... this is very different than all the other taco place I been previously.... I kind of wish we can mix and match so I can try different flavor

As other previous review pointed out... their estimated time for pick up is not very accurate... they told me 20 mins... I got there in 20 mins and had to wait another 10-15 min... so plan accordingly!
Please look up their new location on Evesham Road in Magnolia. Great stuff, and the takeout travels well.

Supporting local during these crazy times? This is the place to go!! Family owned, you'll feel right at home. I've only done takeout so far but the nachos are to die for. By far the best I've had. It's the cilantro and avocado. And all fresh. The chips have a perfect hint of salt and lime. I get mine vegetarian and the portions are nice and large.

I've had nothing but problems with the trailer that this company built for me. I've lost thousands of dollars due improper gas lines installed and at the most critical time in need; they ignore phone calls, emails and text messages. Do your research before working with this outfit! If I could turn back time and use a different outfit to customize my food trailer truck, I would!!
I was looking for someone local to build me a custom trailer with multiple doors and windows as well as even some special stuff. Riley Sr. and his staff did a stellar job.

dave and sue were great to deal with and really explained all of my options very well, explaining my business idea to them helped us get the perfect setup that is really a breeze to work inside and easy to take care of customers even at busy events... have even had a few people at events ask who made my trailer and given it a look to compare against their food trucks.... im glad i went the trailer route and dont really have anything to worry about besides needing a truck to pull it and what event i'll work next.. thanks again, if all goes as planned... i hope to add another trailer to our business.

I have dealt with many businesses, but dealing with Dave was like dealing with family.  Dave took the time to go through all my options on building a custom trailer.  His knowledge was beyond the other businesses I've dealt with.  It is very difficult to find to find someone who cares, and Dave cares.  I would highly recommend Trailers A Go Go to anyone else who is looking for a food trailer.

Dave and Sue really helped us out, we went from having 2 food trucks (that often broke down) to 2 food trailers that we can pull or have a friend/employee pull pretty much anywhere... if we need another i would most definitely customize it a little more but they work almost perfectly for what we need. i would surely reccomend them, but i would also have spent a little more time figuring out exactly the layout i needed.
Food was good poor guy was working alone while others where in back. But will be back. I tried the hummus bowl with steak.

We were excited to try a new place in town but was disappointed. They messed up my order and I tried calling them back a  bunch of times but they did not pick up. What kind of business that doesn't pick up their phone? I wanted my sauces on the side but they put everything on top and it was all mushed together. The guy even recommended sauces but did not put any in our bag. We literally threw it away because it was not good and they gave us the wrong order. Will not be back.

By far the best food I've had in a really long time. I have very picky eaters but here they loved everything and the staff was really nice and helpful. I definitely will be coming back and recommending this place.

Very good and very clean   Those are the 2 main components to a great business!  Staff was very humble and knowledgeable. This is a must  have in the parish and I truly hope the parish supports them especially during their infancy! Mohamed you rocked it!
Fresh food, fresh ingredients, great taste/flavor.  Amazing customer service.  I hope mire people give this place a try.

The two men running this are so so sweet! The customer service was out of this world! I hope they stay here!! They literally cooked everything fresh! And they were super quick! It was so so good! You have to try the Fattah Bowls!

My boyfriend and brother in law went to this place and because we got six salsa containers they made a big deal saying we were taking too much and using too much salsa on our tacos and hovered over us watching in front of other customers. On top of that our tacos had barely any meat and my torta only had cheese, lettuce, and meat and I'm positive it was done out of spite. They lack customer service and manners.

Sometimes in life you just want to sit outside of a taco truck, eat some really good tacos and feel the wind in your face at 11 pm. Well if that has become your mood, this place is the go to because with friendly people and amazing food in their truck, I wouldn't ask for a better food truck to fill my soul. I love love love the tacos especially my carne asada tacos. I also love how it's convenient places next to a gas station so you can get cash back and pay those really good tacos.
Stopped here on our way through Reno. Easy access off of 80 or 395. Not a very big menu but tasty tacos. The creamy avocado salsa was great but have a beverage with you. Spicy!!
The best food test ever I can eat like a 12 tacos of chicharron. I like to eat so much... And the service its honest a can explain more just go an enjoy some tacos .

Best tacos I had in Reno and I had a lot of tacos in Reno. I think they're only open at night but they have that right kind of rich and crispy carnitas and pastor that everywhere else just tries to do. 

Check it out, they're only open at night.

BEST TACOS IN RENO !!!!! I will not eat them anywhere else now. Very very flavorful and tender meat. Everything just perfectly seasoned!! The salsa is super good too. Came here on a recommendation from a friend
this place is fireeee . they put a good amount of meat on the tacos . the green salsa is spicyyyy lol

My FAVORITE taco truck in Reno. The service is  fast, the tacos are good (though more meat would be appreciated in the tacos) BUT the star is the  salsa verde. If I could buy it by the bottle, I would. Now, the salsa is spicy but in a great way. It's not too hot where you can't taste the flavor but it is spicy.

We were craving tacos and wanted good quality tacos. Found this place on here and decided to try this place out. I will say had I driven past it I would never stop here. The truck could use some freshening up. Also, prices are higher than I have ever paid for tacos. Tacos were $2.50 each. I don't think I have seen that price unless they were Birria tacos...still didn't deter us from trying this place. Tacos were good but nothing out of the normal.  I thought the tacos were tiny for the price. They do package the food perfectly for to go orders. Biggest regret was paying for these tacos. Would have paid $1.50 for tacos like this anywhere else. Location is not in one of the best neighborhoods either. Okay place if your hungry and got the extra cash.

Easily the best carne asada burrito in town. The salsas are bright and balanced, carne tastes like someone REALLY has their game tight. Go pick it up, I can't speak on delivery. But I had a near-religious experience while eating this baddie. Do you a favor and go.

Super friendly service! The portions are big, and the prices are reasonable. I ordered dinner for me and the fam. I got the Rico's Bowl, Tripleta sandwich, a few empanadas- beef and cheese, chicken and cheese and alcapurrias (plantain and beef). I tried a little of everything. Everything was good. My favorites were the Rico's bowl and beef and cheese empanada. I'll definitely be back. I'm looking forward to working my way through the menu!
Fantastic food! Highly recommend! Best empanadas ever!! Nice big open area to sit outside, picnic benches with umbrellas. And they play fun music too

Amazing food, excellent value and wonderful service!!  It will NOT disappoint!!  You can order ahead and pick it up or they have a very nice seating area outside to sit and relax!!  Do yourself a favor and give them a try!!

We were looking for a snack in between meals. And we found a delicious little spot. Rico's serves Latin inspired dishes. We came for the empeñadas. My grandmother used to make them. So, when I can fund them. I am all over it. We tried the beef and the chicken empeñadas. They were delicious. Also, had a daily lunch special. Well priced. Just did not try it YET! We will see you again, RICO's!

Tremenda experencia altamente recomendado la comida riquisima la pina colada la mejor y super economico definitivamente vale la pena del 0 al 10 un 20 sigan asi muchachos desde 0 pa lante siempre seran mejores que muchos!

I know people don't like exaggerated terms in reviews.  But we bought a pound of brisket from The Brisket Shoppe today to take home.  Hands down, the best I've ever had.  It had a great bark, with a beautiful smoke ring.  When you hold it in your fingers, it had the perfect "bend".  (Brisket cooks know what I'm talking about here). Danny, the owner, also gave us a sample of some brisket chili he had made this morning.  It was terrific!  We don't live close by......but it was well worth our drive from New Tampa to Armenia for this food!  Good people, making GREAT food.

This place is amazing! The brisket is genuine Texas BBQ. The owner Dan really takes pride in what he does and it shows. Everything is the highest quality from the meat to the sides such as the pickles which are great. Also, the sausage links are the best I think may have ever had. I am fortunate to go Texas often and this BBQ would be popular there too. Awesome place open for lunch 3 days a week (thurs-sat). They also sell grills and even meat that you can cook yourself from snake River farms which is very cool!
WOW WOW WOW!!!!!  Can't say enough about the food.  The chili was incredible, the brisket was beyond moist, and even the pickles were great.  This place is a must visit.

Their food menu is rather small and limited in terms of the meats and sides they offer. Of course the brisket is the most important item on their menu but they also have pork ribs, jalapeño cheddar sausage and Texas hot links. As for sides, all they serve is mac & cheese and brisket & beans. 

We ordered half a slab of ribs and half a pound of brisket, both were served with sliced Wonder bread, pickles and pickled onions. This detail regarding the accompaniments was not mentioned anywhere on the menu so we ended up ordering extra bread, onions and pickles. What we ordered was plenty of food for two people. 

The ribs were really good, large and tender. The combination of the rub they use along with the tangy guava glaze worked really well. The brisket was also good (I don't know much about brisket, I prefer pulled pork) but my husband on the other hand absolutely loved it, said it's one of the best he's had. I really enjoyed their tangy BBQ sauce. The pickled onions were bland, missing flavor and vinegar. 

There was also a very nice, friendly man inside (I forgot his name) handing out samples of dips, roasted corn salad, mascarpone dessert which he makes himself and sells them at this location (you'll find the items in the fridge by the entrance, not on the restaurant's menu). Everything we tasted was so delicious but I especially loved the smoked mullet dip and the roasted corn salad.

Wow what a awesome place! If you like BBQ, grilling out, and enjoying the fresh Tampa air, this is your place! 

To start off, The Brisket Shoppe is the restaurant but this place is more than that! They are an official dealer of the Big Green Egg grills and many others! The shop is called Grill and Provisions and has a huge selection of grilling accessories along with grills for sale. 

Now onto the restaurant, they have a cute outdoor patio but also offer drive thru for those of us that are on the go. I decided to try the Brisket Nachos and they were amazing! The queso is to die for! There's so many more menu options I am definitely going to be back to try! Please go try it out!!

Personally speaking there isn't too much great bbq in Tampa but Brisket Shoppe? This place rivals some of the more prominent bbq spots I've had in La. Let's start with the brisket ,  it's so juicy and flavorful it has just the right amount of seasoning , so it doesn't need sauce. I always opt for moist and this was a hit for sure . You'd be doing yourself a disservice if you didn't get this while visiting. I was also given some sausages so kudos to whoever did that because they were delicious :) 
The potato wedges come with a mustard that's soo good it's not your average mustard and could go well with anything. I was fortunate enough to sit next to a kind man by the name of Carlos who shared some of pork chicharrones and those are next level!! Best I've had , they taste like bacon . The chef Danny came out to greet the customers and ask them how their experience was which was awesome. You can really tell Danny puts his passion into his food and cares for the customers experience . This is a must try in Tampa , the service and food are top notch . GO NOW!!!!

What an experience! It's a little tricky to find since it's inside a grill shop, but it's delicious. The people inside were super friendly and helpful. Really liked how they offer moist or lean brisket. The Mac and cheese was great and they even shared with us a bowl of their chili. I love places like this!
The brisket is wonderful here! We ordered all of the sides and enjoyed the Mac and cheese and potatoes best!

In love with this place and it's people. The chef Danny is so friendly and checks up on everyone eating their food. It's my second time here but I feel like family. Let's start with the brisket because I know everyone is wondering how it is. It's good..... like really good and easily the best I've had in Tampa, scratch that Florida . It's smoky , juicy and oh so flavorful , no sauce needed !! The potato wedges are top notch as well , they come with a mustard sauce that just works , the sauce is not your typical mustard and it was enough for me to enjoy the wedges a lot , I probably should mix the bbq sauce with it though because I can only imagine the flavor explosion I'd get from that. The turkey was so tender/juicy like the brisket with a smokiness and faint sweetness. Best turkey I've had bar none it's bananas . The jalapeño cheddar sausage is just what you'd expect and more , just the right amount of kick and cheddar flavor complementing it makes this some amazing sausage . I think I got a pieces of the hot links with my brisket order the first time but this jalapeño cheddar is where it's at . Lastly we have their coleslaw , it's hearty and so balanced . Danny doesn't miss at all , everything he makes is with love and you can taste it . Shout out to Sonia and Danny for making every experience so pleasant . Amazing food and a must try in Tampa easy 5 stars

Only FIVE star. This is the best brisket in town!!! Me and my husband had been looking for Texas style bbq for long time until we found them. Their brisket is super moist and flavorful. And the rib is also very tender and juicy. We had the side dish bake potato which is amazing ! We love the owner he is extremely friendly and so welcoming. Our friend from Kansas City even said this place beat all of the bbq they had in KC. Definitely want to go back again and I don't think I can go to any other bbq place except this one from now on.
Service is great.  I didn't care for the food.  This was just me, the place was packed.

Everything here is filled with true meat and cooking passion. The people, the food, the vibes, it's all just OUTSTANDING. Seriously some of the greatest brisket you'll find anywhere in Florida. Made with USDA prime meat too!! 
Ribs are insane, sausages, thick cut potatoes fries are next level good... pickled onions it's all just how you want it. The owner Danny is a pleasure to talk to and youll know immediately how much he loves creating good food for the people. 
Also need to mention that they have the best pork rinds I've ever had in my life. Brisket shoppe is a MUST go to in Tampa, an absolute must.

The BEST brisket I have ever tasted......it's fabulousness ‼
Now I have brisket on the brain

On our way to the Bolts game Saturday afternoon, we decided to try out The Brisket Shoppe. We are so glad we stopped in! 

We split a No Bull Shit sandwich and it was truly no bullshit! The baguette was the perfect choice to hold in all the goodness of the Texas link and brisket slices. What sets this bbq sandwich apart is that it is not covered in sauce, drowning out the flavors of the meats - sauce is served on the side. The sausage had a nice snappy casing, the brisket was tender with excellent smoke flavour. BTW, this sandwich was only $12. I would have priced it at  around $16.95 or so. I'd happily pay over 30% more for it. 

We also had a chance to try the Mac and cheese and it's pretty good. Nice crust. A good Mac and cheese, in my opinion, needs a nice crust. Too many other places are no-crust slop. We also ordered the potato wedges. Usually, wedges aren't my thing, but they looked so good in pics online. They were amazing. Served alongside a house made garlic aioli. Side note: if you taste the aioli on it's own, you will notice how good it is and will want to put it on everything.

Can't wait to go back and try other items. Super nice owner. I enjoyed my food so much that I didn't care that it was 95degrees out. Yum, yum, yum, yum.......

This is the BEST Brisket in the Land! It's so good that I just order it from them instead of trying to make it as good as they do. We got a box for Father's Day and the Sausage was a big hit with everyone. The Breakfast Burrito on the weekend is amazing. Cool chill laid back vibe. The people that work here are super cool, just excellent people. They also have a good selection of beer- that goes great with the food. I highly recommend checking out the Brisket Shoppe!

My husband discovered The Brisket Shoppe during his morning walk with our dog. I admit I was initially skeptical when my husband suggested we have breakfast here this morning. Barbecue at 9am?! My husband seemed really excited about his new discovery so I decided to give it a chance. 

Upon arrival I only saw the "Grill and Provisions" sign and the grills for sale on the porch and thought my husband might have been mistaken about breakfast being served. We were quickly greeted by multiple friendly faces and confirmed that breakfast was indeed available. Orders are placed at the cash register and seating is available on the picnic tables outside. After making our selections we were informed that the full menu was not available until 10:30 and that the breakfast sandwich and beverages were are only option. This was fine, but I thought it was a little funny that we were offered a menu if there was only only item available at 9am.

Luckily, "The Southerner" or brisket on a biscuit is absolutely delicious! The brisket is melt-in-your-mouth tender, the thick cut bacon is perfectly crispy and the biscuits are buttery good. Even the side of breakfast potatoes, onions and peppers were perfectly seasoned and grilled. I really liked that Spanish Cava was used in the mimosa instead of cheap champagne and the fresh squeezed orange juice was an unexpected surprise.

Everything was so fresh and delicious and served quickly. The casual outdoor seating was perfect for our energetic toddlers. I was really touched that they noticed our three year old wasn't touching the food and they brought him out a quesadilla to eat instead. It's never easy dining with kids, but everyone really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. 

We can't wait to return so we can try the lunch menu!
Service was excellent - cheerful, friendly  and prompt. But the cucumbers looked a little old.

Went it to get breakfast and it was listed as $3.79, so I ordered a wrap, then when I went to pay, they charged 6.99, saying all wraps are that...even though not marked for breakfast.  An extra $3.20 wrap is a rip off, I wasn't told and the staff was unhelpful.

Two years after my initial review, this Subway still sucks.  The service here is horrendous.  On my latest visit they made a completely different sandwich than what I asked for.  Then they looked at me like it was my fault.  I can't help it that you didn't listen to me.  Completely ridiculous!

This is by far the worst subway I have ever been to.  Always out of bread, sandwiches are never right, pile on the veggies and smash it in a wrapper.  Been like this for years, and I'm guessing it will never change.  I've been to subway shops in North St. Louis that beats this place 5 times over.

My wife and I eat at Subway on a regular basis when we don't feel like cooking and want something quick.  This store is consistently out of everything!  The staff seems to be indifferent.  We are always greeted with a not-so-enthusiastic "Welcome to Subway."   Now I understand your job may suck, but if you were to keep products (bread, cheese, meat, etc.) in stock, maybe so many customers wouldn't give you the stink eye.  As the stars indicate, I've experienced a lot better.

A fair amount of the time, I've gone to this Subway and the service was awful. It was only until recently that it seems there is an entirely new staff and the service has become a bit better. Prior to this, there was one worker who was particularly rude who I have not seen in a few months, which is great. I hope the owner(s) continue to pay attention to the way their staff treats customers and change things accordingly.
Super slow service.  Was the ONLY customer in the ENTIRE store and it took forever for one 6inch ham sandwich to get made.  Won't be back.

So here's the story. Walked into the Troy, IL Subway around 11:30. Waited in line...
Worker: What can I getcha today?
Me: I'm gonna need 4 footlongs, all on white. Is there any chance you know how to cut the bread the old way?
Worker: Sure, Getting a meatball? (Starts Cutting Bread)
Me: Yeah, That's funny.
Customer Behind Me In Line: It just works so good because the meatballs don't fall out.
Me: (To the Customer) Yeah, ever since I worked here like 12yrs ago that's the only way I can eat them.
Worker: (Frustrated) Sorry, I just can't do it. It won't work. (tosses mangled bread into the trash.
Me: Ok, Cancel that sandwich then.
Worker: The Meatball?
Me: Yeah, It's the only way I'll eat them.
Worker: What do want on the others?
*order continues and I move down the counter
Customer: Yeah I quit ordering them that way cause no one knows how to do it anymore.
Me: I order it that way every time, usually they're pretty cool about it. 9 out of 10 times I order it, they do it for me. Though one time the manager of a subway was having a bad day I guess because when I asked for it cut the old way she threw a napkin over the sneeze-quard at me and said "We don't do it that way anymore and if you don't like it call the 800 number." So I did and ended up with free subway for like a month.
*chuckles and life goes on.

I try not to get mad a the little things in life but upon looking at the name tag of the worker I couldn't get past the fact that under her name it said AREA MANAGER.

When I got home I let it bother me enough to call the 800 number and let them know what just happened and that they should look into the situation. After telling the story, the woman on the phone was extremely nice and apologetic about the whole thing and said I'd receive a call in 1 to 2 business days. I said thank you and hung up.

Today that phone call happened.

Me: Hello
Jim Shepard: Hello, this is Jim the owner of subway. I understand you had an incident at my store yesterday?
Me: Yeah, well, not really an incident, just a situation I thought you should know about.
Jim: Well, what happened?
Me: Told the story just as above.
Jim: Well, that's not the way I heard it.
Me: What do you mean?
Jim: She told me that you were bothering other people in line bragging about calling the 800 number and getting free Subway.
Me: That's not at all what happened. I did talk to the woman behind when she started talking to me about how she likes it cut that way for the meatball.
Jim: Well, I think that you just shouldn't come back into the store again.
Me: Wait, what? Are you serious?
Jim: Yeah, you seem like a business man. I'm a business man and would you want someone coming into your place disturbing other customers.
Me: I wasn't disturbing anyone, I was just talking to someone.
Jim: Well, That's not what it looked like on camera, we record everything. I own most of the subways in the area so you should just find somewhere else to eat.
Me: You're serious? You just said you were a business man and your telling me not to go to any of your subways.
Jim: Yes, we don't need people like you in our stores. Don't Come Back, We'll Get Along Just Fine Without You. We've got plenty of customers we'll survive.
Me: So you're really serious right now?
Jim: Yeah
Me: Wow, you're kind of an asshole.
Jim: (Laughs) Coming from someone like you, I take that as a compliment. (Hangs Up)

FINAL THOUGHTS: Not once did I ask for anything out of this situation. I simply thought they should know that their Area Manager allowed a customer to just cancel a sandwich with no effort to make it better, and now I'm banned for trying to help.

I was just reminded why I seldom go to the Subway in Troy, IL anymore.
You would think for over $8 for a sandwich, it would at least *resemble* what they show in the marketing pictures.  My "buffalo chicken" sub had NO buffalo sauce on it.  I ordered two of these - and both were made the same way. No trace of buffalo sauce anywhere on the sandwich, and the chicken itself was cold - even though they microwaved it.

Overpriced, and the staff just don't seem to take any pride in their work.  Next time I'm in the mood for a sandwich, I'll just go to the SuperValu store next door and get something from their Deli.  It will cost less, take way less time in line, and be less disappointing.

I came here twice on 2 separate occasions and BOTH times were a horrible experience. Why'd I go twice if the first time was bad? Because the first time was obviously my first and the second because my family was desperate to go out and celebrate, anyways the waitress was super rude not even a hello or nothing just plopped the menus in front. The food was bland and dry for the both times I went. Never again.

The food is ok from the restaurant but the bar part oh never again will I go there I never been to a bar that makes you pay $45 to get in and not have a place to sit so that means you stand all night from 10pm-1:30am or you can rent the tables that are there like where do these people come from that over charge for everything and no seat to sit you lost me and my friends money so if you think about going here have enough money with you.

Waiters take advantage of drinking and will go through your purse if left unattended.  Usually go in and spend upwards of $200 every time for something like this to happen. They later claimed that they took it for safety and when returned it , was missing money .

Come here if you want some bland food. This is what I got:

Nachos - I am sorry, but I'm from Texas and this is some kind of salad, not nachos. When I order nachos, I expect individual tortilla chips, each with a piece of meat and melted cheese, not a salad with a bunch of gunk thrown on top of a pile of tortilla chips. How are you supposed to eat this? With a fork? You can't stab a chip with a fork. If you eat with your hands, you end up dipping your hands into a pile of gunk on your way to a chip.

Fajita Taco - no onions or cilantro and the tortillas were pretty bad. They tasted like they had been frozen, maybe. Or maybe they were just stale. The meat was OK.

Quesadilla - this was actually not good. It's so hard to mess up a quesadilla! How in the world did you mess this one up?? First off, I know you're trying to be super Mexican, but don't use Oaxaca cheese. What you're making is not a Mexican dish, it's a TexMex dish, so use Monterey Jack! If you insist on using Oaxaca cheese, don't leave it all gunky like you did, make sure its fully melted before you serve it (yours was half melted) and use much less. Also, don't put lettuce into a quesadilla. You know that when you cook lettuce, it gets hot? And, that hot lettuce is gross? Also, sour cream doesn't belong in a quesadilla. Leave it as an optional garnish.

Last, how can you not include salsa in a to go order for tacos?? That's a cardinal sin!

Unfortunately it had nothing to do with the customer service or the location. However, when you serve $1 tacos and $10-$15 nachos, your drinks should not be $18. If you feel the need to charge $18 per drink + $3 per bottled water, you should absolutely be giving your patrons a heads up. $24 in food vs $117 in beverages?!? Outrageous.

I have been here a few times and the food is delicious! However each time Jennifer is my waitress, I have the worst service. It is almost as bad as her personality and makes me feel uncomfortable. Not only is she rude, but she is so slow that I have received my food before I got a drink (which is in a refrigerator 3 feet away from where I sit). Shout of to the chefs because if the food wasn't so good I would never come back.

if you call ahead and are told 15-20 minutes, and you arrive 15-20 minutes later, there is a good chance you'll still wait 15-20 more minutes. but, the pupusas are worth it, and they're cheap, so I've just learned to deal with the leisurely pace of getting my food.
Very tasty food and traditional Guatemalan/Salvadoran food, the best of all is that they deliver !
Yummy food and the people there are super nice. I'll definitely be back again.

I wonder why there are only a few reviews of this restaurant.  I guess it is due to the fact it is in Trenton.  But you should know that there are some pretty good and authentic (though I know nothing about authentic Hispanic food) Hispanic restaurants in Trenton, and this is one of them. 
I got fried plantain, rice and beans, darn good pork burrito, and a set of taco, poppusa, and something else (sorry, I can't remember the name of the dish) for $18 total.  
I did take out but won't mind eating in there.  The inside is charming as one of the pics here shows.  
The restaurant has a parking.  But if you don't want to park there, you can park your car at the near by Food Bazar and walk to the restaurant. 
Their sauces are not as good as El Taquila Mariachi but are still good.  
Their poppusa is light and delicious.  
I'll try some other dishes next time.  Maybe try their cow feet soup!

The food here is actually pretty good in comparison to other Hispanic restaurants in the area. But like many of those restaurants, we often get the "oh sorry we are all out that" or "we aren't making that today" when we order something off of the menu. Perhaps they need an updated menu? I would be willing to try this place again, but they should serve what is on the menu or update it to reflect their current food stock and whatnot.

The pupusas are good here and the service is friendly.

Loved what they have done at Faith & Broadway. They have turned it into a great little mall and the food court area is fantastic! I stopped by Coco' cafe & Dolce and grabbed a wonderful amaretto coffee, some tiramisu, and a small cannoli

The Dry House Downtown!
Julia was incredible, my blow-dry and my curls were flawless. Tiffany's make-up was surreal! I left the salon feeling like a princess, she was extremely kind to me, sweet, made me feel beautiful inside too. Tiffany's work is Hollywood quality/standard. Thank you for making my outside so pretty so i could celebrate my birthday and feel beautiful.

This area is such a great addition to downtown! Eat, shop and enjoy music! We ate at Sixty Vines at it was phenomenal!! I suggest the frosé! Wonderful menu and wine on tap, what more you you want?! Oh...and outdoor rooftop patio looking right at the Ryman Theater! Wonderful!

Although previous customers had bussed their own tables, very few were wiped clean and more than half of the napkin dispensers were completely empty. The music was too loud. Everything is "Priced for Tourists" AKA overpriced. The food at Smokin Chicken was ok, but cold after sitting on the counter; they said they'd call my name when it was ready, but even though I was sitting right near the counter, I never heard my name. They don't accept cash for payment or tips.  The facade is fancy enough to impress in pictures, but this place is all commercial & no heart.

Wanted to explore the second level and try these delicious crepes everyone keeps talking about. Security guard kicked my husband and I out because he was carrying a bag with Hattie B's leftovers from lunch. "No outside food is allowed in here." Would have loved to get to try a Nutella Crepe.

Really fun!

Want to try some local grub?  Go to Hattie B's!
Need a pick me up coffee after a night out on Broadway... Get a drink from Elixir!
Want a cocktail and a swank evening out? Stop by the Twelve Thirty Club.
Motivated by the fashion of the country music city?  Stop by Ariat!

Fifth and Broadway offers some nice options for those who want to do some nice shopping or have some menu options while not getting too far from all the fun of downtown!

In addition to great shops, Fifth and Broadway offers the Assembly Hall restaurants.  You can find anything from a nice meal (Sixty Vines) to a Nutella filled crepe or even a snow cone or scoop of edible cookie dough!

My husband and I enjoyed walking through the outdoor mall and enjoying the sights/smells/sounds and tastes!  It was extremely clean.  Well organized/plenty of signage available.  Parking is also near by and it's close to a ton of hotels and other restaurants.  It's worth a visit!

This is one of those trendy new developments that make long-time Nashvillians feel like they're visiting a completely different city, a style so different from anything we've seen. The concept of creating a beautiful and modern shopping district right downtown for tourists and local employees with an enormous offering of restaurants is long overdue! We need more of this.

If I were to list the top 7 local chains that truly capture the essence of the Nashville food scene, Fifth + Broadway actually has four of them (Prince's, Slim & Husky's, Desano Pizza, and The Pharmacy). It's too bad they didn't add a Five Daughters, a Martin's, and a Hugh-Baby's or I'd be giving them 5 stars!

Additionally, they have two national chains beloved by Nashvillians including Jeni's Ice Cream and Shake Shack. It's a little slice of Nashville, an improvement to downtown that elevates the tourist experience and is already extremely popular!

Love love love this concept downtown and it is already drawing a (albeit safely masked) crowd. I can't wait to see the rest of the rollout, but got a chance to walk around a grab lunch today and was quite impressed with the selection of shopping and food. Will definitely be back!

Fifth & Broadway is a welcome addition to downtown. This is what the downtown area was missing--an outdoor mall type area with restaurants and shopping. I'm  here for it! We went to the National Museum of African American music on my day off work one day then went to the food assembly hall for lunch after. Great for tourists and locals alike and I was impressed by the design and layout.

This place is awesome! 

I was only here for a short time, but I think this is just what the Broadway/Downtown area needed. A newly updated food hall with ample shopping and little escape from the craziness of LoBro

A few foodie stand outs are Slim and Husky's, (first Black-owned business on Broadway) The Donut Distillery, Hattie Bs, and Jeni's Ice Cream! There's plenty of shopping spots here as well, Sephora, State and liberty and Revv. There's plenty of parking here as well, but it is paid only. Feeling thrifty? Just park in the nearby neighborhood and walk over. 

Headed to a Preds game? This is a great pre-game spot! It's right across from the Bridgestone Arena.

State and Liberty is a great option for men's clothing. Must stop in for a visit!

Also hoping tourist's keep 5th and Broadway clean!!! It's nice place to eat and and has a few shops. Only downside is it's expensive.

Have been impatiently waiting for this to open for a looonnng time! We went opening weekend, Saturday for lunch, it was super busy. There was also a press game so understandably so. But still plenty of seats and parking! Speaking of parking, it's steep! But anywhere near Broadway is high. It's super convenient though. 

We felt like tourists! Cute photo ops everywhere. The shopping is still limited; only a handful of stores but the restaurants open are great options! Still really excited for the Food Hall South to open which will Steamboys and The Pharmacy!! 

We tried a few of the restaurants - Thai Esane, Oke Poke, Slim & Husky's, Desanos, and the Crepes! Everything was delicious, fast, and fairly priced! There were staff going around to pick up trays and clean tables! Security at the door to ensure masks were worn. And live music!! And even bottle service. Such a great hangout! Looking forward to coming back soon!!

Super excited to see this new district added to lower Broadway. It is a mix of shopping, dining, apartment living, and business use. It is very chic and a different type of place than your typical lower Broadway. 

This is where locals can go along with out of towners. It will definitely be an area that draws the cringe worthy bachelorette along with those wanting tondo Instagram shots. This place has several pretty murals out photo ops throughout. You can take escalators up and down between floors and they have elevators as well.

Parking is price gauging, but what do you expect from Premier Parking? They have an underground garage that you pay by the hour. For 2 hours, you're paying $12. 

This is going to draw a lot of revenue for the city, and it is a firm investment to be created.

Just finished the Bacon burger that they had here! Delicious! The food was pretty good! Just like Outback but a lot quicker! What definitely made this visit memorable was the customer service from the employees! Very engaging and every single face had a smile on it! This is definitely one of my go to spots from now on!

I have eaten at this location twice now. The first time I ordered the Topped Grilled Chicken, it was good but overly seasoned. I expected it to be along the lines of my favorite Alice Springs Chicken from Outback. I expect the chicken to be a little salty due to the bacon, but this was too much and the fries were inedible due to the excess of salt and pepper. I thought maybe this was a one off and whomever prepared it messed it up. So I was willing to try it again. 

On my second visit the guy who took my order was very nice. I ordered the same meal as before, they forgot my sauces and I had to go back to ask for them, no big deal. I watched them make my food because you have a clear view into the kitchen. I watched the guy take my already cooked chicken and place it into a broiler. I know that they have to move fast, but I'm willing to wait a little to get fresh chicken cooked. I kept thinking the chicken was undercooked because of the texture, but it did not appear to be. This time the chicken was rubbery, it was tough, just a horrible texture that I threw it away. Overly salted/seasoned again. I have never experienced chicken like that; not edible. 

I also wish they would offer another vegetable option like broccoli with the option of cheese and sauces that are not so tangy or spicy, like a regular honey mustard. I say that because it does look like it would be a great option for those looking for a place with healthier options located in the food courts for their kids and since keto and other diets are popular. Also, a great place to take kids, but my 3 year niece just needed regular honey mustard, not a spicy honey mustard. I was told that they only had spicy dipping sauces by the guy who took my order. I love the idea, maybe I'll be back after some time passes.

I totally agree with Nate. The food at Aussie Grill by Outback is delicious! Who knew that Outback could do fast-food so well? The service was great, and they greet you right away. How fortunate are we to have the only 2 US locations right here in the Tampa Bay area? One in the food court at International Plaza, and now this one at Westfield Mall in Brandon. They have 2 other locations overseas as well.

I placed my order and received my food in a very good amount of time. This was a takeout order. It was packaged up nicely. Everything was still warm when I got home. The Seared Beef Tenderloin was tender and flavorful. I stole a piece from my mother. She also liked the arugula salad and dressing. My Bloomin' Burger was the bomb! It had everything I want in a burger. The crispy Bloomin' Onion petals added a nice crunch and it actually elevated the taste of the burger. I'd get the same menu items again. I even liked the kettle chips which had a nice kick to it, along with the smoky chipotle sauce.

This will be the place to have a quick bite the next time we shop at the mall. It's quick, the portions are generous for the price, and it's a good quality meal. I'm a fan!

It is good to see new branch from Outback Steak House. It want to serve like fast food as for the new concept. Unfortunately their food preparation not fast at all. I have to wait for 15 minutes after order. There is no line on order. But there is a line to wait for the food. This part of business may need to improve. 

Aussie Grill open their business in food court of the Brandon Westfield Mall. It has advertisements at the entire hallways of the mall. It does get a lot of attention from mall goers. I got the seared beef tenderloin and crispy volcano shrimp. I got it medium rare. For the beef. The meat quality is a bit better than average. But I don't like the seared technique. I prefer grilled. Grill will enhance the taste. I do like their volcano shrimp. It was done right.

Me and my mom came here to eat today. The guy at counter called my name Amber that was first strike, not really a big deal since my name is Ameer honest mistake. What got me is I sent my mom to get me a to go container and bag for left over sandwich, fries, and onion petals. The lady told my mom they don't have bags and gave my mom the smallest box. Not good customer service I personally will never be back bad experience.

Lala is doing a great job at the register with a smiling face and efficient order taking. The food comes out at a reasonable pace. I was surprised to get a legit steak from the food court and cooked medium-rare like I asked for. The cheese fries were on point and loaded with bacon. This was my 2nd night in a row eating this meal. The price is great. Maybe next time I'll try the ribs.

This is outside of scope for me when it comes to lunch, however, I was in the mall and hadn't eaten yet.

The place is a newer add to the mall and the menu had beef, salads and a chicken sandwhich that looked pretty good.

The menu said Jammin Chicken with cheddar cheese, bacon onion jam and pickled jalapeños. Sounded flavorfull and I added a salad for $1. 99.

The Sandwhich was very good and had a great combination of flavors in the bites that had aioli or bacon jam or jalapeños on it. I would have given this 4 stars if there would have been more than  a couple of pieces of  jalapeños and a bit more bacon jam. The chicken breast was very thin too , but the bites I had with a bit of everything satisfied my taste buds.

Don't add the salad, the price isn't worth a palm sized amount of greens and paper thin, kinda slimy cucumbers with 3 cherry tomato halves and a couple red onion chunks.

Glad I tried it once.

I love Aussie Grill so was very happy when I saw this as an option in Brandon mall. I am giving them 4 stars only because the breading and satin was of the bloomin onion. Overall good food as always, just too much breading and salt for the onion strips.

What a great deal, especially for the quality. I ordered a hamburger with fries for less than $10.  As you can see in the pics they load the burger with toppings and the amount of fries is generous.  Service wasn't too bad, including a wait time of about five minutes after paying. Not the most friendly service (like at Outback) but you generally don't expect this at a mall food court. I really enjoy Aussie Grill and already shared this with a number of co-workers.  Keep up the good work Aussie Grill.  I will definitely be back!

My first visit was today and I went through the drive-thru.  I ordered chicken tenders (because they claim to have the best tenders in Brandon, FL).  The service was REALLY slow.  The chicken tender are MOST definitely NOT the best chicken tenders in Brandon.  There is a very strong chili powder/cumin flavor in the breading that is extremely off-putting.  The honey mustard sauce was tasty and helped mask the strong chili powder taste, but no enough to make me want to return to Aussie Grill.  Gonna give this place a hard pass.

I have picky eaters in my family. This was a good choice because I could have something different than what I've had before, yet still have something like chicken tenders, burgers, and fries for my kids. I had the burger with the onion jam. It was a decent burger though I had hoped the jam would have a little more sweetness to it. But not bad. The spicy pickled pepper on the top was different too. Though confusing because it was cold and the kind of pepper it was you'd expect it to be warm. Also had the warm caramel macadamia nut cookie. That tasted pretty good too.
Just go to outback. This place is expensive for really nasty food. The fries was the only edible part of my meal.

Discovered this new hamburger place at International Mall-Tampa
Service was good but the Burgers was fabulous, something different that had flavor. Hurry up and add some stores in Lakewood Ranch/Sarasota and 
Pgh Pa.  Pricing of food was excellent, 5  guys way over priced

The CRISPY SRIRACHA CHICKEN SANDWICH was fantastic! The bun could have been a bit sturdy but very good sandwich. The Aussie fries were good but dry and  the cheese was not very cheesy.
Biggest minus for me that will keep me from coming back is that I could not find nutritional  info anywhere!
Also they could have better combo deals. I got a sandwich, Aussie fries, and a drink for $14 . Not a very good value for fast food.

Ole Mexican Grill is a fantastic little hidden gem. They have the very best Breakfast Burrito! Their ingredients are fresh and of very good quality. All food is cooked to order right in front of you.....Also, the ladies that served me were incredibly friendly.
The food was made hot and fresh right when I ordered and the girls were so sweet! This place is next to my regular mechanic so I'll definitely be stopping by in the future. 10/10

Ole Mexican Grill is well worth taking your time to stop by.  First of all, it's clean.  Very clean.  The people are nice too which is always a perk.

  I ordered the Carne Asada Burrito and I can say it easily surpassed my expectations.  The steak is grilled when you order, then cut and placed back on the flattop to crisp.  Seasoned very well and complimented by your choice  of fixings (all of which are fresh) that don't leave you wondering how long they were in the walk-in.

There's more to try so I'll be back soon.

Mexican grill hole in the wall. Actually it looks bigger on the outside than it does inside. Looks like ordering at the counter and they will bring your food out to you.
I wasn't very hungry so I ordered a shrimp taco and a grilled chicken taco to go. The meats were grilled as I watched. I got to pick from a multitude of toppings for my tacos.  The the lady filled the container with tortilla chips and a few lime wedges.
The tacos were both excellent,  good amount of meat and nicely flavored.  
I will definitely come back again.
Yum! Very clean inside. So many options for toppings and everything looked extremely fresh. Chicken tacos were good. Can't wait to try something again.

What a great addition to breakfast restaurants in the south side of Edmonton! This place is bright, clean and has super friendly serving staff. 

We came in around 1130 and we're seated right away, the place got pretty packed before we left and it was a Monday! 

The menu options are great as they are really accommodating to allergies but use local produce and still have lots of tasty choices for all. 

We loved their special beverage options and plan to go back to try a few!

For unique and trendy breakfast foods this is the place to be. The location is on a corner and very close to the massive Ikea store in South Edmonton Common.  My guest and I arrived shortly before noon on Thursday. I was going to come last weekend but we phoned on Saturday at around 10:00am and were told that they were full and had a 25 minute waiting list  Today the restaurant was busy but there were still lots of tables available. I read a review that said the tables were very close together. In my opinion only the tables next to the window were really close together, but the rest were similar to what would find anywhere else. After checking our Covid-19 vaccine passports we were seated immediately by a very friendly hostess. The coffee came quickly right after we were seated. There is a whole separate menu for special coffees in case you prefer something else. Our brunch selections were easy to make and that was probably helped by the fact that most meals were nearly the same price. Most breakfasts were $16.00 give or take 75 cents in 2021. I ordered the Spanish Chorizo Bowl and my guest chose the Apple Pie French Toast. My dish was delicious although it seemed more like a lunch than a breakfast. My guest, who has a real sweet tooth, said that she enjoyed her Apple Pie French Toast. I can't really think of any negatives; it was a fun and filling experience.  I'll definitely come back as I want to try the chicken waffle dish. This café easily gets five stars. I recommend it for breakfast or lunch.

I was really excited to hear that another brunch place opened up on the south side. I called early on a Saturday morning and was added to their online wait list. My expected time of arrival was suppose to be 10:30am but I ended up waiting half an hour more when I arrived at the restaurant. The restaurant was very busy. 

For food we tried:

-Brio's Breakfast: This came with rice and pork belly which is something you don't normally see at other brunch places. It was delicious but I found the pork belly a bit too salty 

-Chicken and Waffles: Pretty normal chicken and waffles dish. It tasted good but nothing too special 

Overall food was decent and filling. I'm curious to try more dishes in the future. Hopefully next time the wait list time will be more accurate.

Filipino/Hawaiian breakfast place? Yes please!

Great choice on the unit they moved into. The large windows gives it a bright morning feel. The open concept kitchen lets you watch the food being prepared so there's no hiding! 

The food is well seasoned, decently priced, and the service is timely and friendly.
They accommodated us even though we weren't on the wait list and we had our 7 month old son with a big stroller. 

It is kinda loud in there because it was busy! Every table was in use and there was lots of energy from the cooks, servers, and guests. 

I will definitely come back here to get my fix of Hawaiian inspired food like the loco moco and spam! And we still need to try their poutines and bennys. 
Stay tuned for an updated review once we go back really soon!

What caught my attention on their menu was the Loco Moco Breakfast. This dish immediately reminded me of Hawaii. Those who know...know. This traditional Hawaiian dish consists of a burger patty, mushrooms, rice, gravy and eggs. I HAD to try this. I'm not aware of any other restaurant in Edmonton that serves this dish. 

Unfortunately, the Loco Moco dish didn't compare to what I had in Hawaii. I felt like the beef wasn't fatty enough if that makes sense. It tasted lean which took away some of the rich flavour which I felt was kind of missing. It didn't taste bad but it tasted healthy (which is what I always say when I eat lean vs regular beef). The dish portion wasn't too big. I probably could've eaten it myself but my husband helped me finish it.

My husband ordered the Little Farmer breakfast (meant for kids) which had a farmed fresh egg, house cured bacon, toast and hash. The house cured bacon was sweet and tasty. Definitely not your typical breakfast bacon. Loved that!

We ordered an appetizer portion of mini Belgian waffles with salted caramel sauce for a topping. My husband and I love making Belgian waffles at home. He noticed that they were using the same type of waffle iron we had at home! We're fancy like that hehe. The salted caramel sauce was sweet and salty. I liked it!

There are more menu items that I would be curious to come back and try. They have a Spam Island Bowl which was also giving me more Hawaiian vibes. I also saw some Filipino dishes that I am familiar with such as pork belly adobo in the Bro's Breakfast and longanisa sausage.

It's refreshing to see a restaurant be adventurous and try new flavours not usually seen in your typical breakfast places in Edmonton. I'm all for exposing people to different cultures through food. It's the easiest way to try something new without having to hop on a plane.
Okay as of today I am aware of another restaurant in Edmonton that serves Loco Moco. Yay for Edmonton!

There's a dedication to serving good coffee at this trendy breakfast / brunch restaurant BROKINYOLK
The breakfast menu is filled with interesting dishes from eggs benny, chicken & waffles to hawaiian inspired food (not to mention they have the best hash in the City).

I like the open concept kitchen, attractive large windows gives you natural light for your instagrammable photos lol  

Would we recommend it as a place to get one of the best breakfasts in Edmonton? Absolutely!

Excellent and authentic tacos, sopes are also yummy, and it is a bakery as well with good breads and pastries. A small, strip shopping center restaurant, but clean and inviting inside. We loved it and will be back for more!
Chorizo tacos are awesome!! Sometimes the al pastor can be a bit fatty but the chicken and steak are always tender.
I can't think of any complaints. The food is consistently great: very flavorful and filling. The atmosphere is authentic and comfortable.
Found this little spot on a whim. Ordered beef tacos.  Very filling. No frills with filler. Beef, onion, cilantro. Would highly recommend.

Panaderia y Taqueria Lili is a small restaurant on Kirkwood Highway inside a small strip of businesses near the YMCA. The unpresuming exterior belies a modestly decorated inside with tables and seating for thirty. Perhaps the most striking feature upon entering is the counter, behind which the large kitchen is open and visible. 

This restaurant serves Mexican food, with tortas, burritos and tacos in a traditional style. The al pastor is good, and adding piña accentuates the spices nicely. Asada and bistec are both delicious here, and the adovada is cooked well. I recommend trying the salsas, which provide an infusion of flavor and a not unwanted kick of heat.

The refrigerator has plenty of refreshing favorites like Jarritos and Sidral Mundet. The baked goods, from what I've tried, are also delicious. The service can be expedited through use of Spanish. It won't be long before I return. I give this restaurant five stars for offering delicious, affordable Mexican food.

This place is great. Apparently it's been here a while, but there just isn't that much review information on this spot (on yelp anyway). I didn't record much data on my last trip, so I'll be sure to leave an update at some point when I got back.

Let's see... what do I remember? Well, I can't remember the name of my dish, but it was basically a make your own taco kind of deal, with rice and beans on the side. It was extremely good, but I'm confident that pretty much whatever you wind up getting here will be quite good. They also serve avocado with most of their dishes, so that's kind of cool as well?

I'm not sure if water is free here. Because I didn't ask, I wound up buying a jarritos. I would encourage you to actually bring some water when you come here just because I'm not clear on the protocol, since their green sauce or whatever it is... is actually pretty hot. They also serve some interesting looking breads here, but I didn't get the chance to try. I promise to write an update soon!
Good authentic mexican. My man loves the pambazos here-brings back memories. Nice family owns and runs the restaurant.

Excellent Mexican food for a very reasonable price! My only issue was they do not serve alcohol (a margarita would have been fabulous with the great food)! Otherwise this little gem of a restaurant is highly recommended in spite of it unassuming decor!

First of all generally I love Wawa. Very frustrating though trying to get a proper cappuccino at any of the Wawa locations. Their machines are  not calibrated properly, especially this particularWaWa inHorsham. They have no clue of how to do a workaround.Not Looking for much, just trained employees or get a new machine

Great location. This is the local Wawa I frequent the most. The staff is very friendly and efficient. This location is always crowded but it's manage right and everything flows the way you would expect.

Typical Wawa with gas stations. Gets busy during normal peak times but that's the same as any other Wawa. Occasionally get chicken parmesan sandwiches which is the bomb. Make sure to add extra marinara sauce. Also stop by when they have sizzli special for breakfast.

The store?  It's a Wawa, no big deal.  

But the real deal here at the Wawa right off of Limekiln Pike on Horsham Road is the gas prices.  They are cheaper than the Wawa further down Horsham Road near Norristown Road, and way cheaper than the Wawa on DeKalb Pike near Welsh Road.  

I have found the pumps are clean and the receipt printer always works, unlike the Sunoco on Rt 309 and Welsh Road.

If you like cheap gas, a clean station and store, this location is good to go...always!

Stop in here every now and then when I head over to our Horsham office. I'm usually here either for gas and/or coffee. I like the self service coffee stations and the condiment station with different types of sugars and creamers. Coffee station is always clean as is the store. I tend to like Wawa coffee along with Dunkin Donuts. On my most recent visit, I was in the mood for breakfast. I didn't see much on their made-to-order menu, so decided to go with a bacon, egg, and cheese Sizzli. Unfortunately, their Sizzli stands were basically empty at 6:00 in the morning. They sent me to the back where a guy was in the process of making them, and he asked what kind I wanted and quickly made one for me, so that was cool. I see so many people say they don't want their receipt (so the cashier simply throws it away) or I see customers simply throw it away on their way out. They really need to find a way to ask customers if they want a receipt and if they don't, simply don't print it. I can only image how much paper they are wasting! Other than that minor complaint, I really like Wawa as a convenience store!
Got a porkroll and cheese, and was shocked to find one sliver of porkroll so thin I could hardly see it!, not worth eating and had to throw it out... Who owns this place anyway, what kind of man?

Let me be clear this review is about this particular location because any other Wawa minus the parking situation (non gas station Wawa) I would give 5 stars.  It's close to where I live and convenient.  Many Saturday mornings I stop there because we are in a hurry to get to an activity for the kids and it's nice to get a breakfast sandwich near the register so we can be on our way.  This is the third time in a row I have been there on a Saturday morning and there might be just a few sandwiches ready at 8:30 AM.  This is never the case at any other Wawa.  This is frustrating. Went to the one down the street instead and it was fully stocked and not to mention the usual amazing Wawa courtesy I would expect from the best convenient store in the country.

Okay I now give Wawa five stars. They are very helpful and always try to make the best outcome. give up On Wawa cappuccinos, back to Starbucks. The staff at the Fort Washington Office Center Wawa are the best.

I'm really not happy rn i was laughing with my friends and the Man who made my soup butted into my conversation saying it really wasn't that funny, I understand everyone is entitled to their opinions but when you were working at a facility you should not say that to someone because then I got bullied.

Just got home and looked at my sandwich. Wawa should be embarrassed to serve this to the public. I guess it's time for a grilled cheese sandwich for dinner. I normally don't post pictures but this needs to be seen.

A full service Wawa with clean restrooms and a gas station.  Can get crowded but service is always quick and friendly with all the staples that every Wawa has.

I come here about 4-6 times per year.
This is the place to try.  Very affordable and great quantities and quality.    The new owners are great.  They cleaned it up and it's  worth trying. The food is great!
Place is closed. It burned down in January and the owner was arrested on arson charges not long after.

If I could give this diner an accurate rating I would give it no stars. I used to come here when it was White Horse Diner (which was really good) & so since seeing it was under new ownership, decided to come and check it out. First off, our waiter doesn't even introduce himself, he's a young kid at that maybe 16 years old, and says, "what do you want to drink?" Now, I have never been a waitress but I am in customer service and know how to talk to people. A simple how's your day going, what can I start you off with for drinks this morning, would've sufficed. Utensils were dirty, had to ask for a new set, and had to ask someone else for water because my waiter was nowhere to be found and the food was very bland. Overall, this is just another basic NJ diner that is pretty bad, would not recommend.

I came in for dinner today, a couple days after the grand opening. All I can say is WOW! Our waitress, Savannah, was very courteous and helpful. Our food was delivered very promptly. The $9.99 special menu is awesome! I ordered the prime rib off that and it was better than at other places where I paid twice as much. Our party also had the broiled stuffed flounder and that was great too. Congratulations Country Town Diner. You are excellent. We will be back!

Going to a new diner can always be hit or miss.  Usually, I like to give them a few weeks.  The Country Town Diner in Berlin opened a couple of months ago.  It's another somewhat close diner to me.  

Atmosphere: 
The outside looks like a regular building.  It doesn't look like an exciting, metallic or shiny building but it looks nice with plenty of parking.  

The inside has plenty of booths and tables with a full length bar.  The diner had an odd smell to it which I couldn't pinpoint.  This is something eventually I hope they take care of. 

Coffee: 
The coffee was brewed extremely hot and the waitress brought a bowl of whipped cream.  It was hot, brewed well, and who can argue with that much whipped cream.  In all, I enjoyed it.  

Food: 
The Country Town Diner has everything a standard diner has.  Breakfast all day, lunch anytime, plenty of seafood and steak options.  There is very little diner food you can't find.  

I decided to order the Hungry Man breakfast.  It came with eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, bacon, pancakes and pork roll.  The pancakes were light and fluffy and some of the best pancakes I've had.  It's only my second time having pork roll but I enjoyed it.  In all, I enjoyed my meal a lot.  

Service: 
Our waitress was friendly and kept our beverages refilled at all times.  Plus our food came out quickly, she was one of the best waitresses I've had.  

Would I come back? 
The Country Town Diner is a great addition to the area and I would come back.  I do hope whatever the smell is taken care of.
